29.description: I think that this place is overpriced. I don't think that their lettuce should be $2.50 seriously.  I have seen places for $.69 or $.99.  This is the closest store to me and I will not go to Dominicks for my meat, (I've had spoiled meat from them).

42.description: Yay!  A close mostly inclusive produce mart!  I was able to get all my veggies for the week, plus the a couple other things for under $10!    I'll be making the trip here more often!!!

23.description: I always go here for cheap produce.  Limes are often 15 for a dollar.  Peppers are always cheap, as are all varieties of onions.  The produce is also better quality than what can be found at Dominicks.  Smoked pork chops are excellent and reasonably priced.

47.description: I live around the corner from this place, so I go here quite a bit.The produce is 100 times better than the crap you find at Jewel or Dominick's and by going here, you're supporting a small local business instead of a stupid national corporation (I used to work at Jewel and it really is a big stupid corporation).If you're driving here, parking gets really really harry on the weekends, so if walking or biking is an option, that would be the wise choice.  Best part about this place?  You run into people who live in your neighborhood.  It's small, so you're almost forced to interact with your neighbors, which really makes you feel like you're part of the community.  You might want to even pause your Ipod and say "hi" to that dude who lives in your building.

8.description: The place is VERY clean these days, and I can't say enough about the excellent service. Great quality produce at reasonable prices too, along with a lot of interesting spices and "international" foods.I was looking for an unusual African medicinal herb once, and the manager went out of his way to try to get it for me, and even called me at home to tell me the results of his search. I'd say that's excellent service.

31.description: I enjoy how every produce market seems to be an intersection of two or more nationalities--you have the Mexican/Polish places, the Middle Eastern/Russian places, etc. Rogers Park Fruit Market does a very decent job of carrying Caribbean and Mexican staples, with a smattering of Krinos products to round things out.  Things you won't find in every market: tropical reef fish (to eat), meat pies (pretty tasty), Jamaican hot sauces, and a plethora of  root vegetables. Sometimes their green vegetables seem a little limper and more expensive than at my favored produce markets, so it's not my stock-up place, but its location makes it convenient  when I need to just grab a thing or three. Also, their pre-packed deli guacamole is quite good, and reasonably priced. Parking and traffic around there can be a tad chaotic, but they have a lot these days, and that's a real help.

34.description: Why do I go here?  - It's close - The produce is cheaper than DominicksIt's not AS nice as other Fruit Markets around the city and not AS cheap, but it serves us well in our community.  You can find fruits and vegetables here that are harder to find in your local Dominicks or Jewel.  It could be cleaner and the canned goods could be cheaper (go to Dominick's for those).

16.description: Can't believe I've walked past this place for weeks to go to Dominick's. Way cheaper, the fruit and veggies are FRESH (haven't bought any meat yet), and the variety is incredible. A lot of the produce here I've never seen anywhere else.If you don't like cooking try somewhere else though, not much packaged food. Also they don't have grapefruit juice... which is the best juice in the world

13.description: I used to shop here frequently and thought I would head over to compare it to MFM.Some items were much cheaper (Kale -- 1.29 a bunch vs. 1.99 as MFM), others moderately more pricey (ready to cook chicken fajita mix from the butcher 3.99 at RPFM vs. 2.99 at MFM).  MFM is much cleaner than FPFM and the staff don't seem stoned.  W/out a doubt, the guys back in the butcher shop were as high as ten hippies.  They were older guys and were laughing about my request not to use the beef scooper thingy to scoop up the chicken.That's when I noticed the dude did not have those little plastic gloves on and had hairy knuckles.  Normally, I don't much like my chicken with knuckle hairs -- so I passed.  I did hold onto the kale.  Cooked it today w/apple cider vin. and cumin.  Yum.

11.description: One of the (many) reasons I love Chicago is the abundance of small fruit, vegetable and meat markets like Rogers Park Fruit Market. Tons of cheap and fresh fruit, veggies, herbs, etc. at prices that are often half of what you'd pay at Dominick's or da Jewels. While it's a pretty tight little space they had everything I needed for my chili recipe. As is expected of  these places the grocery 'convenience' items (dishsoap, etc.) are heavily marked up, but those are the things you should hit the big box markets for anyway. For anything perishable, this is the spot. Haven't tried any of their meats, but the selection looked great.Seeing that this is Chicago, parking is all paid, but your savings will negate the cost.They only lose a star for having sub-par guacamole. It jwas too smooth and just tasted a little 'off'. My wife and I were a little concerned that it retained its bright green color even several days after opening. I'll stick to the top-notch guac over at Morelia on Western, but would still come here for anything else.

39.description: This little produce market is a gem. If I can avoid shopping chain grocery places at any point I will. Damn the man! This place makes damning the man easy....and cheap. I find myself planning meals around what I can get here so I can skip Dominicks. The produce is always fresh and extremely cheap. Sometimes I try to pile as much as I can in my basket just to see if I can break $20, which I've only done twice.I have mixed reviews of the meat counter here. Sometimes the meat is really fresh but I've come across kinda smelly stuff. Mostly the fish is what I worry about. The beef has always been tasty and the chicken breasts in the case are HUGE and super cheap, if you see stuffed chicken breasts in your near future grab them here. I've also decided the taco meat deserves regular ingestion or indigestion depending on how spicy the serranos I add to the tacos/burritos are. One other must have thing from here is the cheese. They get their selection from a place in Wisconsin and it's always priced much lower than the taste suggests. Also if you go all the way to the back of the store you will find a huge stock of spices and dried peppers. Compare the prices to chain groceries and you will never spend $5 on 3 cinnamon sticks again.So summing up. Why shop elsewhere when you can get quality food for less and support local business? If they sold alcohol I would literally live in the store, right between the dried fish and the Red Pop.

37.description: I live right down the street and always come here first for my groceries.  I only go to Dominick's (conveniently located just a few steps north on Clark) for things the market doesn't carry.Excellent prices, top-quality produce - and the cherry on top is that it's a fun shopping experience.  I truly enjoy getting groceries here, which is much more than I can say for the big boys, Dominick's and Jewel.

0.description: My mother & father were born and raised on the island of Dominica in the West Indies. Born & raised in NY, they/I never wanted for the foods of our culture. When I moved here to Chicago, I felt as if I was in a desert. No more. WEST INDIAN PARADISE! Small parking lot, can be difficult to find parking on the street/side streets.

38.description: Everybody has done a lovely job of singing this place's praises in broad strokes (I love egregiously mixing metaphors), so I'll just give a few examples of their varied offerings:  You can choose between bags of beautiful, colorful dried corn kernels (yellow or deep red).  They have a canned Irish moss/peanut drink in case you want to consume your daily requirement of saturated fat at one sitting.  (It's probably GOOD but I'm too old for that kind of stuff!)I came home with a herring-mackerel-Scotch-bonnet pepper spread that I cannot wait to try.

51.description: Stopped in here the other night on my way home and wasn't all that impressed.  There was a nice selection of fruits and veggies, but I think that the prices are better at Devon Market.  I'm not sure about their other food items, but it didn't look like a huge selection.

27.description: I'm really a fan of this market. I come here for almost all of my produce because the prices are really hard to beat. I do tend to shop both at this market and at Dominicks because they seem to carry very different items.

32.description: I used to think that nearby Dominick's would be the place to go if I needed a wide variety of things.  But I cook a lot of ethnic (middle eastern, Hispanic, Asian, African) food.  Invariably I would end up at this market.  they always had everything i needed- at half the price of Dominick's.  They might not have 45 different types of cereal or potato chips, but they will have all of the ingredients you need to cook a wonderful meal.  Moreover, the staff is friendly and helpful. I cannot tell you how many times i have wandered around Dominick's looking for an employee to help me find a product (only to find that they don't have it.)  In the R.P Fruit Market, the staff is EVERYWHERE and they are happy to help.

48.description: The produce was alright...nothing spectacular (the bannanas were kind icky). Also bread and things like that were kinda overpriced (dominicks was cheaper and that doesn't say much in my book).

44.description: Great produce, lasts forever! Very fresh. Great meats. Great selection of different products. Not the best prices I've seen but the best in the immediate area.

24.description: Has some great deals on produce. Not sure I'd buy anything else here, though. Think I can get better prices at Devon Market. Glad I stopped in, and will be back!

7.description: This place is great! I just moved to the neighborhood a few months ago and I am excited I found a cute local grocery with really low prices! They offer many different kinds of produce and most of it is ready to eat (which I like). Also, they have a ton of raw ingredients and bulk non-perishables, not to mention a wide array of ethnic food stuffs and spices for SUPER CHEAP. RPFM is perfect for singles who like to cook from scratch; not a whole lot of junk food or frozen dinners. This is a really great local business to support and the staff members are so friendly and helpful. Kudos to this place and the staff for being really great at what they do. Thank you for serving the community!

49.description: I'm a big fan of the selection as far as the produce, and the pricing makes it a no-brainer for people who live within walking distance. Cilantro for less than a quarter of what it costs at Whole Foods? Solid meats, excellent spices (for both Caribbean and Mexican cuisines), good produce.

40.description: This is the only place outside of a cattle ranch where you can get Rib Eye streaks for less than $4lb! You can either get them precut and packaged from their tiny refrigerated section of you can ask one of the guys behind the counter to custom cut a slice for you. A 2 inch steak is a staple for summertime grilling!

30.description: What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said?Perhaps... CHORIZO?!? Yes, they make their own chorizo. And because it is so very, very tasty, I buy it.  At least twice a month. And chicken - FRESH DAILY, and about 1/2 the price of Dominick's/Jewel ! AND they'll cut it up for you any way you'd like.Their prices for fruit, vegetables, rice and meat are SIGNIFICANTLY lower than the Dominick's half a block away (e.g. bananas: RPFM, 49¢ / lb. DOM, 99¢ / lb.). Staple items are fairly priced, but I do need to go to both places to get my whole list completed.The staff, especially the guys in the meat dept., are SUPER.HIGHLY recommended.

46.description: We've lived in Rogers Park for three years, yet today was our first visit to Rogers Park Fruit Market.  I was like a kid in a candy store!  So many different kinds of fresh fruits and vegetables!  Every kind of Mexican or Caribbean item I could want!  My husband was enamored with the butcher shop selection.  Today, we just bought the items we eat on a regular basis, but I'll be back again to try some new stuff.

1.description: True Local  Store -  Good Prices and friendly people.

9.description: I have been coming here for years, a few months ago I bought some strawberries and a few packages had mold on it. I notified the clerk and she brushed it off like it was nothing. I was disgusted!! I bought a few packages of shortcakes and took them home and opened them, only to find they were not fresh and had mold on them. I'm going to notify the health department because they shouldn't be selling moldy food.

26.description: I would LOVE to pretend I'm super high society and can buy fancy organic produce at Whole Foods. Actually, let's be real. Not only am I ok with not being able to buy everything at Whole Foods, I'm GLAD I can't! Roger's Park Fruit Market is AMAZING. The prices are fantastic and I can regularly buy a hand basket full of produce for $15-20. Not to mention, they have an amazing selection of hot sauces from all over the place! As much as I love this place, I will say, I'm giving it 4.75 stars as opposed to 5 because their guacamole needs some work. It's super bland (I suggest maybe someone take a little trip to the hot sauce aisle and make it rain...).

25.description: Ok, maybe they were just having a few off days.  I stopped by last week and everything was nearly as amazing as it had been.  Although I no longer pass Rogers Park Fruit Market on a regular basis, I'm going to make a point to visit it more often.

12.description: With Dominicks closed I do buy produce and some dairy here.  I would NEVER buy anything behind the meat counter here - it all just creeps me out way too much.  The produce seems to have a very limited shelf life and I try to use it within a couple of days.

21.description: i like to support my local grocery stores and this one has wonderful veggies, fruits and meats- it could easily have a five rating with most customers but for an exception...the meat section-if you want meat from this store you have to wait an unusually long time in a line that may or may not have someone that arrived before you getting waited on in order they dont use the system they have in place..imagine my surprise when on a sunday there were about 9 or 10 butchers in the section but ony 2 waiting on customers an elderly man and a young man..this should be the busiest time for meats on a sunday but one lady had watched as 2 men were waited on before her and when they finally got to her she advised them about it but they acted like they didnt care..the other women waited for a while and finally left..in this economic time it is all about job security and good customer service..perhaps the owners should take notice..they are letting their business walk out the door..hopefully they will

17.description: I was not impressed.  My fellow Yelpers gave this place 4 stars!?  The place had a hint of spoiled food smell, the produce selection was poor and not fresh. If I still lived here I would demand better.

10.description: Love Love Love.  Great produce selection, great prices.  Nice selection of canned goods (not the usual stuff you'll find at big chains, lots of caribbean and latin american stuff).  I haven't worked up the nerve to use the butcher counter at the back of the shop, but it always looks busy.  The customers reflect all aspects of the RP neighborhood, and everyone seems welcome there.What I love best is that I can walk into this place with just the spare change in my pocket, and still afford enough produce to make a nice, fresh meal at home.  This place is an awesome part of the neighborhood, and I think lots of folks depend on this place to feed big families good food on a small budget.Extra bonus points - the check-out clerks are super fast and very friendly.  If you're sick of standing in long, slow lines only to get "Chicago-style customer service," this place is worth the trip.

5.description: Wow! I was looking for a really good Caribbean store and I think I found it! I found so many things that I was looking for since I moved here from New York and now I'm so happy. Now I don't have to take a trip back to New York to get these items anymore. This store definitely remind me of the Caribbean grocery stores back home. I definitely would recommend them to all my family and friends.

3.description: This is my favorite place to shop for fresh produce! This market carries specialty foods (specifically Caribbean and Mexican/South American) at reasonable prices (particularly things like chia and hemp seeds, shredded coconut and nuts). The produce is always fresh (better than the nearby chain grocery store). In addition to the products, the best part of visiting Rogers Park Fruit Market is that everyone who works here is incredibly kind, friendly and helpful!

35.description: Great Local spot for fresh produce and fruits also nice to Mexican meat treats.....I go here for my Arancheraand Cecina.Also they make my favorite salsa in the world fresh"Salsa Roja".If you visit here you get a nice idea of the diversity or Rogers Park there are Caribbean and Latin people in every isle.It's a better deal then going to Dominick's or Jewel's ...check it out

19.description: I would LOVE to pretend I'm super high society and can buy fancy organic produce at Whole Foods. Actually, let's be real. Not only am I ok with not being able to buy everything at Whole Foods, I'm GLAD I can't! Roger's Park Fruit Market is AMAZING. The prices are fantastic and I can regularly buy a hand basket full of produce for $15-20. Not to mention, they have an amazing selection of hot sauces from all over the place! As much as I love this place, I will say, I'm giving it 4.75 stars as opposed to 5 because their guacamole needs some work. It's super bland (I suggest maybe someone take a little trip to the hot sauce aisle and make it rain...).

28.description: This place has great produce and best of all they have Jamaican patties in the freezer section! I have been jonsing for a curry chicken patty for about 4 years!

45.description: Great for produce and staples.  Fresher and cheaper.  Especially good for avocados, mangoes, and limes.  Usually much shorter lines than dominicks.And the staff and other shoppers are really friendly.  I can't even count the number of times I wasn't sure about a Caribbean or Mexican product and someone taught me something new.  Good location too.  Close to the bus, plenty of parking, fence to lock your bike up.

33.description: I LOVE the Rogers Park Fruit Market. I regularly trek from Evanston to stock up on fruits and veggies. Yes, it's a little silly to rafter adding in CTA fare, this place is still way cheaper than Jewel. Today I bought a week's worth of produce The only problem with the Rogers Park Fruit Market is that it's a little far from my apartment, but that's not their fault.

43.description: If you live in RoPa (Rogers Park) then you need to shop here for your produce. WHY?1. It will at least be somewhat fresher than Dominicks2. It will be a lot cheaper than Dominicks3. You can get in and  out a lot faster than Dominicks.Seriously, ROPA FM has much better quality selection of produce than that big chain store. Check it out! xoxoxox

2.description: Now,  I realize that Rogers Park Fruit Market is the one closestto me now that I am residing in East Rogers Park..However, I don't like this place very much at all...Reasons being...This place just doesn't look very clean/sanitary, and I have been makingthe rounds to various produce type stores lately and this one is my leastfavorite..The lighting is low and the store just looks kind of ..grey...There definitely seems to be a better selection of vegetables as opposedto fruits which really bummed me out because I was hoping to find myvery favorite Mount Ranier Cherries and I didn't so that left me feelingkind of crabby and irritable.However, their one saving grace was that I found some Marshmallowsin some funky generic strawberry/vanilla flavor and I did consider buyingthose but then thought twice..It's Campfire Marshmallows or nothing for this girl...And, this store has a meat counter in the back where you just knowsomething is dying back there because it smells pretty funky..Needless to say, I shall avoid the meat counter at any cost...But, in all fairness to this place I did leave with some plums and nectarines,but that's pretty much it....And, even though it's in my neighborhood I won't be in a hurry to return..Because there are much better produce stores out there..And, for the record one of them is out in Skokie right across from whereI work, so I'll definitely be doing my shopping there..So disappointed in this place, truly I am...

18.description: Love this place - great produce that's CHEAP, lots of cheap spices from all over the world - also their chips are amazing!only shopping I do at dominicks & whole foods now is for what little vegan stuff they carry (vegan ice cream, cream cheese etc) that rogers park fruit market doesn't carry

41.description: A great little produce place.  While the selection isn't always the best, it is priced well and it'll be good quality.  The meat counter is also not the best stocked but what they have, it's good quality and priced right.  The pre-made taco meat is fantastic and perfect for home burrito or enchiladas.I'd rather go here than Dominicks for my produce and meats and you'll be in and out a lot faster too...

52.description: this is a pretty good market.. its best to go first thing in the morning when they stock the fresh stuff because otherwise it gets pretty picked over and touched throughout the day... the prices are reasonable which is always a plus

50.description: This market caters to Jamaican/Caribbean clientele. Here we learned about some of the different types of white breads. They were half-leaven bread since when the bread and yeast was first introduced to the Caribbean the yeast did not do so well in the hot and humid conditions. The bread was pretty heavy and dense. The butcher had different cuts of goat for the locals. We tasted some epizote as well as saw some yucca and cactus pears that seemed to be common theme of all the markets. Two things we bought were a sweet lemon and a sour orange to try later at La Unica

4.description: This place has been going downhill since the last time I've visited there in June 2013.  Yeah, I know it was awhile ago.  Obviously it was enough time for them to deteriorate.  I was in the area and wanted to grab some groceries before heading home.  I suggested the Rogers Park Fruit Market to my hubby, even though we both sensed the "shadiness" in this part of town.  The prices were inexpensive for most fresh veggies and fruit, but some of the items were slightly old-looking and have passed the fresh threshold.  We were about to get some green peppers, but they were wrinkled and disgusting-looking.  We picked out a eight (8)-lb. bag potatoes, some spinach, some spring mix, some red delicious apples, and a tray of tomatoes.  For a little over $6, they were not that bad at all.  They do take credit cards, but I doubt I will be there again.  It's first time I will ever say this: maybe you should check out the Jewel nearby and compare the qualities of items between the two (2) locations.  Remember, it takes courage for me to say that Jewel "may be" a better choice for groceries.  Rosa J. still supports the local businesses, but she also concerns on personal safety, just saying.

6.description: This is a terrible establishment I went there for the first time and I was getting some cooking supplies. But I felt like I was being followed because every isle I went to there was the same person right behind me with a basket of groceries. Then it clicked to me maybe this person worked here and was watching me. I was right as soon as I went to the cashier she was the bagger. I imeadiatly pointed her out and that it was disrespectful. I left my shit all over the cashiers table and got the f outta there. This fruit market is a joke. Also they have terrible butchers for service they are disrespectful and need to learn better english. It's not my fault if u don't probably understand what I'm saying.

22.description: this place and so many others like it that are devoted to the common consumer clearly demonstrates what a rip off Jewel, Dominicks, and Whole Foods truly are. This place has a great range of foods with which to cook meals of all types, great produce and such. A serious gem in Rogers Park.

15.description: Places like this are the reason that I love Rogers Park.  We just relocated to the neighborhood, moving a whole .6 miles North.  I was worried that Dominick's would be my only option.  I cannot express how happy I am to have this just a few short blocks away.Great selection of fresh produce that is significantly cheaper than Dominick's or Jewel (and unlike those stores this is food you actually want to eat).  I am reserving that elusive 5th star until I go a few more times.  However, since I tend to shop daily, because I never know what I am going to cook until the mood strikes me, this shouldn't take long.

20.description: Places like this are the reason that I love Rogers Park.  We just relocated to the neighborhood, moving a whole .6 miles North.  I was worried that Dominick's would be my only option.  I cannot express how happy I am to have this just a few short blocks away.Great selection of fresh produce that is significantly cheaper than Dominick's or Jewel (and unlike those stores this is food you actually want to eat).  I am reserving that elusive 5th star until I go a few more times.  However, since I tend to shop daily, because I never know what I am going to cook until the mood strikes me, this shouldn't take long.

36.description: First place I've ever seen Guarana Antarctica in the states.... automatic 5 stars. Also, pretty awesome stop along the general tour of Chicago grocery stores I've been getting lately.

14.description: Great location (for me) and free parking. Just part of the choir here, by saying that it's a great little market with fresh, cheap produce and interesting Caribbean/Jamaican stuff, a good selection of Mexican items, and some interesting Brit items. I love that they have digestives, both McVities and an amazing Spanish version (Gullon) with chocolate chips. The guac isn't the greatest, I'd pass on that. But, I can walk out with bags of groceries for $20.00, so you can't beat that.

58.description: We live and the neighborhood and this place has been recommended to us for years and years.  Frankly we were disappointed.  There are many other places a short drive away that offer the same food, same service (complete with old time waitresses) and for a little less money.  We won't be back.

56.description: This is our favorite place when we want an omelette.  For a few cents extra they make it in fresh, pure olive oil.  It's too much food for me but I like having some for a snack later.

29.description: Yeesh. I'd been wanting to go here for a while since I've passed by it so many times with my mouth watering for anytime breakfast. But once inside...The food (quality and quantity) and service could be described as "bare minimum." The cleanliness is definitely subpar. Those mysterious little bits of yellow goo on my tea plate and honey packets didn't exactly whet my appetite either. And I got some weird vibe from the staff, as if I had something to be worried about, or as if they wanted to get rid of me in a hurry...

42.description: I really,  really, really wanted to like The A& T, it is only a few blocks from my house. I have been there numerous times this past year hoping it would get better, but it has only gotten worse. The first is the decor, it is unbelievable bad (1980's South Beach worn out wicker chairs, the coffee cups are about 2 inches thick, the ladies room is pepto bismal pink and looks like it saw better days 20 years ago. The blinds are old and broken, but I was hoping the food would make up for the eyesores. The reason I kept coming back is they have delicious salmon patties (you can get them broiled or fried) they are very tasty and since I do not eat pork, it is nice to have the salmon patties as an option for breakfast; which is why I gave the A &T two stars instead of one star.  The salmon patties is were the goodness ends, the eggs are disappointing, the last time I was there I ordered scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese. I got slightly over cooked eggs with a congealed slice of cheddar cheese on top. The pancakes are nothing to write home about and the coffee. I don't know were they get their coffee from, but the coffee is horrible. I am not a coffee snob by any means, most coffee is descent to me. It really sad that the owners of the A&T do reinvest in their business and hire a professional chief to update their menu, hire professional chiefs/cooks who know about food and the chemistry of food to cook the food, update the decor, get ride of those awful blinds, the sign outside of the restaurant that only lights up halfway. And for gods sake get ride of the horrible dishes and that terrible coffee! They would make more money and have more customers because instead of all of the Rogers Parkers going to Andersonville for brunch we could have an awesome place for brunch in our neighborhood.

23.description: Just when I thought they were on the right track, they disappoint with  terrible bacon that was fried in the deep fryer, in what tasted like year-old fryer oil.  The salad I ordered was good for what it was, but previously it was much larger, served in a huge bowl.. The salad dressing (garlic) was very good.  The hash-browns sub par.

47.description: Food ruined my appetite.That doesn't even make any sense, does it? I know. But that's what happened. The food at A & T Grill ruined my appetite.I just wanted a quick tasty breakfast. I didn't care about the dated decor, the misspelled signs on the door/in the window, or ambiance of any kind. I could only see the tasty breakfast I was sure was coming my way.The place wasn't packed, but it took about 25 minutes for us to get our food. There were a few other tables of people who were seated after us that got their food before we did.  We waited patiently, but 25 minutes? Really? For 2 omelettes with toast? The waitress didn't come to volunteer an explanation, & only stopped to say anything to us because my friend interrupted her hasty walk past our table.  She quickly snorted, "It's coming."When it finally came, I noticed that the toast we ordered didn't come with it. The toast sat on the front counter in front of a man I presume to be the manager of the place. He didn't bother to mention it to her as she walked past him to & from the kitchen/counter area. When she finally remembered & brought it to us, it was cold. I didn't even bother trying to eat it.The omelette I ordered came hot & loaded with melted cheddar cheese. I ate a few bites & thought I liked it....until I noticed that it also had a stray piece of some kind of mystery poultry and lots of broccoli in it. Gross. My appetite died in that moment. As we got ready to leave, the waitress (who offered a lame "I'm sorry" as her explanation for the crappy service we were getting) asked me if I wanted a to-go box. I looked at that plate with disdain. Hell no I didn't want to take that mess with me. My appetite was GONE.As I write this, it's about 7:30pm. I haven't eaten anything since. Ugh.I won't eat there again.

8.description: Wonderful! just the little corner diner you expect. Decent food, super cheap, and ok service. I don't try to expect too much from an old diner and this place consistently pleases me. Also, I would like to note that the "guy in a doorag," that served us was incredibly pleasant, attentive and sweet. It seems to me that "JESS. M" didn't really need to mention his hair piece or call him any kind of names, he has always been pleasant and gracious with me and anyone I have brought here, but I know how badly some white woman can be subconsciously racist towards men of color. Don't judge this place on an uppity white woman's view, its really awesome. Its not trendy or fine dining, its exactly what it promises to be, well cooked food, big portions, slow but good service, outdated decor, and a nice place to come nurse a hangover.

31.description: New Owner.  Great Pancakes, finally.  New recipe, So much better.   Good food. Slowly changing look and food.  If you have not been in a while, give it another try.

34.description: Omelettes bigger than your head. We live very close to this restaurant, but always thought it looked a bit sketchy. Waitresses couldn't have been nicer and the food was excellent.

16.description: I've never actually been to the location, so this a delivery only review.I'm a pancake enthusiast and I can't get enough of these pancakes. Delivered to my front door. At seemingly light speed. Delicious. The way I want them. And pretty cheap. You spoil me and my dreams of breakfast in bed everyday.

13.description: Wonderful staff super prompt delivery option and arrives hot as well. Option for making omelettes only egg whites ($2.00 extra) is a little steep otherwise I totally would recommend this place for breakfast delivery. I have not eaten at the physical location yet so my review is solely on ease of online ordering and promptness of delivery.

11.description: This place is not actually bad FOOD wise but SERVER wise it's pretty terrible. Every time we've gone we've had this guy with a du-rag serve us, the first time he LITERALLY cussed out a women at the table and said "I don't expect a tip from yo ass"... He was obviously having a bad day so I left him $10. The next time we went (thinking he would remember us since I probably gave him the biggest tip of his A&T diner career, my boyfriend went a grabbed a Togo cup for my tea since he never came back to check on us, and he says "oh you're just getting that yourself"?... As he stands behind the counter and makes moves on the other waitress there. Smh. Too bad for the service because the food isn't half bad.

39.description: Banana and nutella crepes!!!

37.description: Great Greek diner. Been here over 50 years. There must be a reason for that.

0.description: Finally! A true breakfast diner - all traditional items you expect from a diner. Eggs, toast, bacon, sausage and coffee! While beyond traditional they offer unexpected items like organic eggs, challah french toast (amazing), and a full menu of other items like hamburgers, sandwich's, dinner entree's and a full dessert menu. Prices - like 1990 prices. 2 people full breakfast of eggs, pancakes, toast, bacon and drink $17 with tax! For the mathematically challenged that's $8.50 a person. Unheard of for breakfast in this area or the surrounding area - what can you get in Andersonville for $8.50? I love my Andersonville, but lets face it eggs are eggs - they should not cost $8! Service was fast, meal exactly as ordered, and so good - not greasy and HUGE portions! We visited in the evening but decided on breakfast instead. We ordered the following: Pancakes (2) took up the whole plate, well done and a little thinned out made them a little crispy around the edges (this is a good thing), bacon well done, not greasy (best bacon ever), hash browns instead of eggs (no up charge), juice $8.50 (this was ordered for dinner) Challah French Toast thick but not texas toast thick great flavor and browned just right but not hard at all, 2 eggs scrambled cooked to perfection not brown not runny - perfect, bacon well done and so good, soda $8.50 Huge container of syrup to share, lots of cream and sugar on the table (my biggest pet peeve is to keep tracking down the server for condiments)Service she was fast, friendly all while they were about to close. She still seated us and said not to worry. (Yelp said they were open until 8:30, but really it was only until 7). She still gave good service and food was excellent. Restaurant itself, old what can you expect. However it was clean from what we would could tell, it has a real diner counter in the back, booths and regular tables. Its not the Ritz, but not a dive either. You will visit for the food, not the ambiance. Street Parking only - meter / paybox. Location is Roger's Park but NOT "that part of Rogers Park" - usually pretty ok to walk around freely. Lots of established business in the area that care about patrons and their community.

38.description: this is diner-style breakfast and other fare. with that in mind, i would dare say that A & T is perfect at what they do. I think the ambivalence in the ratings it receives on Yelp has more to do with what expectations people have when they visit. Two of us can eat for $20 easy, and the portion sizes are enormous. i have had a couple of omelette dishes, with the most recent being a corned beef hash omelette. my dining companion had a gyros omelette and it was one of the best things i've had recently (A & T has greek roots that show up here and there on the menu). their eggs are never over cooked, and while the food is really basic breakfast options, it has never been greasy.we have been five or six times now, and the waitstaff is consistently pleasant and attentive. the decor is a little worn, but cared for, such as the addition of kitschy christmas decorations on our most recent visit. if you are in the mood for a pleasant, slightly dive-y breakfast spot in rogers park, A & T will fit the bill nicely.

51.description: I have been going here since I was a 10 or so. I haven't been there in a while because I do not live in Chi-Town anymore, but I love this place and I love the family who owns it. They have always been great people. I forgot about the food. The Food is excellent. I have never had a bad experience here. I can't wait to go there Winter 2010!

27.description: Downgrading from 5 stars. The place is still a dynamite greasy spoon diner, but it seems to have lost a certain I-know-not-what when the management changed a while back. The food is a bit more uneven than it used to be even though you can tell they are making attempts to fancy it up. In most cases the attempt just breaks even.

32.description: We used to come here pretty often when I was a kid, but the last time we visited was probably about 25 years ago.  The restaurant is much bigger now and is definitley a lot cleaner than I remember it!  The staff are still as friendly and attentive as ever.I had a waffle, which was just ok, but I made the mistake of ordering it with bluberry compote.  That was my bad, I should have known I would not be getting fresh bluberries at a greasy spoon and just had it plain.  My mom had an asparagus omelette, which was pretty good.  My sister in law also had an omlette which was average. The sausage links were just right.  We all had coffee, but it wasn't great.I will definitley be back to try out an omlette or pancakes, skip the coffee.  I have just had so much better meals at other greasy spoons recently.

54.description: So I am working on a holiday.. and of course damn near everything is closed... EVEN MCD's.. so I pop by my local Greek diner for a turkey club..   Heaven on a plate from the chicken soup, coleslaw and the 4 clubs and fries.. the crispy bacon and crisp lettuce...Thank you for killing the hunger monster and giving him the ITIS

48.description: I was REALLY looking forward to going here, liking it alot and making it one of my regular spots. I love greasy spoons. IMO, they have the most satisfying food.Oh well.The service was TERRIBLE. went there on 4th of July Monday. It wasnt crowded. A bunch of cops walked in with us. Another group of abt 6 ppl and some couples came in after us. ALL of them got their food before we did.We didnt order anything fancy, just omelettes.While we waited, the waitress never returned to refill our water or ask if we wanted more juice or even to explain why our food was taking so long. I finally stopped her as she was walking by us again to ask what was going on.She gave me a pout like I was hassling her and just said tensely "its coming" and shuffled away.My friend ordered an omelet with bacon, spinach and mushroom. There was broccoli and chicken in it besides the ingredients she ordered.The waitress offered a quick "Im sorry" and that was the end of that. Again she didnt ask if we needed water or more OJ. She didnt give us any condiments. (I had to ask her for ketchup).To top it all off, our order came with toast. She left our toast on the diner counter for abt 20 mins. As we ate, we wondered how long it would take her to realize that our toast was sitting on the diner counter. Once she finally realized it, she simply brought it over and said "sorry" again. Didnt offer new toast, just gave us the cold toast.As an ex restaurant mgr, Im pretty forgiving and usually good ass food will wash away the memory of bad service in my mind. The food was mediocre at best. How you make bland breakfast food?The only thing that gives me any comfort is that two other groups of diners had long waits for food, and one couple got a screwed up order as well. At least it wasnt just us.No one offered an apology or a discount. The woman ringing us didnt ask us how our meal was. Nothing.This was just a comedy of errors. Im hoping this was an isolated incident. But I wont be back to find out.

44.description: This greasy spoon has been a Rogers Park staple since forever and it's easy to see why: huge menu, great specials and bottomless coffee, all at reasonable prices.  There's something on the menu for everyone and for those of us on a diet it's easy to find something fitting our needs.  The staff is wonderful and once you've become a regular you've pretty much become family.  And what a family you'll belong to!  The clientele is as diverse as the menu, just like the neighborhood.  A&T IS Rogers Park in a nutshell.Only two things drop my rating to four stars and they are minor.  For starters, the place looks like it hasn't had a makeover since 1984.  It's diner-chic, but a little sprucing up might be nice.  Also, if you go on Sunday in the early afternoon expect the owners' extended family to be there and the kids can sometimes get a bit rowdy when they get bored with adult conversation as kids are want to do.

24.description: A long-time neighborhood staple, A&T is an okay choice for breakfast. Omelets are gigantic enough to split. Coffee is fresh. Restaurant itself is a bit shabby and in need of a remodel, but they have convenient parking in the back. Service was prompt, but waitress was significantly stressed and unhappy, although she tried to hide it by being overly gregarious to us.

7.description: It's a diner! It is abundant, uncomplicated and tasty. This is my go-to place to eat when I can't figure out what I want. Or when I want an omelette. Or when I want a sandwich. Or anything really. Go eat here!

49.description: So I dined at the A & T Grill last night, and thoroughly enjoyed myself. There were approximately 5 other customers in the restaurant 2 of which were my friends so service was impeccable. The menu was big and diner-licious.  Only short coming that I could readily identify was each customer only gets one free refill on soda, which is annoying for the avid diet coke drinker.  But, alas I got over it.  Food was just as expected: hot, greasy diner food in huge portions. Price wasn't bad either.  All in all it was a great diner experience and I will return to try breakfast.

40.description: Stopped in for a late breakfast while on vacation and wandering Rogers Park.We concurred almost exactly with Caroline's review:-fresh ingredients (we saw someone bring in fresh herbs and tomatoes)-huge portions (which the waitress helpfully warned us about)-friendly service-food was basically unseasoned so you need your salt and pepper

53.description: I decided to drop in this place on a whim for lunch on a Monday.  They had a sign up front offering a free bowl of soup w/ any sandwich(most around $5), but that includes burgers also.I have to say, this place is 50 yrs old, (1961, but not in a bad way.   So, please don't walk in expecting something shiny and new.  Its clean, very clean, and has very friendly and above average service.  Bathrooms are super clean also, but could use a remodel like the rest of the place.  But, I expect that's why they haven't had to raise prices.Its a typical diner menu, but expect good size portions.I would definitely recommend this as a very good down to earth diner.  Good portion sizes and friendly service.One caveat, not much in the way of choices for a dessert, coffee is hot and plentiful.

30.description: Really, really disappointed in the changes made since the place has changed hands.Things to look for:Table and seats dirty -- crumbs on seats and former patron's food 'goo' on salt and pepper shakers, hot sauce bottle lid encrusted with dried gunk.Insane weekend hostess who used to be eccentric, controlled waitress -- very bad choice here -- she's a nonsensical yammerer.  But the worst thing of all. . . they have ruuuiiiiiinnnned the "Abundant and Tasty" factor.The prices have gone up 10-20%The omelets are nothing like they were for over 4 decades.The corned beef sandwich is sucko -- woulda been better out of a 1970s vending machine.And I am so,so sad about the turkey club - cruddy Bilmar processed lunchmeat? WTF?!  How dare you.A&T is now "Apathetic & Terrible"If you have been a fan for a long time, you are going to be really bummed.

46.description: Delicious, diverse menu, waitresses and management with great personality, quick service, huge portions, and a bowl of delicious soup with each lunch/dinner meal! This traditional Greek neighborhood diner is a favorite in our household. It's not the Best Food Ever in all the World, but it's reliable, and tastes home-cooked. The omelettes are huge (maybe a little too huge) and filled with tasty ingredients. The chicken noodle and vegetable soups are favorites. I love the grilled cheese with tomato and the tuna melt, and the fries are always perfect.

1.description: Wish I could give this place no stars. I just ordered from here for the first time today from Grubhub. I ordered banana crepe & a reuben sandwich. Crepe: Omg the worst! I chose the selection to have powdered sugar on them. Also, for $7.95 it didn't specify how many you get. I got 3, wet, soggy, bland, sugarless crepes. They didn't put the powder sugar, they tasted like soggy eggs with sliced bananas on the inside. Crepes should be a bit crispy. These were awful. Also dry, no nutella sauce or anything. Rueben Sandwich: This was actually good. Came with a pickle, I coulda did without the big pieces of lettuce & tomato on the side, but nonetheless the sandwich was great. Even though they didn't put thousand island dressing like most Reubens come with. Also, it came with a cup of soup..............this was such a heartbreaker as well. It was cream of chicken aka cream of crap. Straight outta a can, bland, hardly any flavor, thick gooey mush!! I will definitely NOT be reordering from here again.

55.description: Excellent breakfast.  EXCELLENT.  I would give this place more stars but the lunch/dinner is just ok.  The chicken noodle soup doesn't have much chicken in it ... very brothy.  And some of the other items are just lacking in taste - just kind of plain.  But the breakfast is unbelievable.  And the price is right.  Service is always prompt and friendly.

9.description: Two words: FOOD POISON!! 24 hours later and my poor elderly mom still can't get out of bed. Disgusting.

26.description: There is a reason this place is on a busy corner like Clark street and always empty. It's the food. I ordered biscuits and gravy and they were the worse I've ever had.  News flash. If your place is always empty, usually its the cook. I'll never go there again.

25.description: I love coffee shops that can do breakfast well. A & T wouldn't be one of those ! The worst omelette and hash browns I've ever had ( ok ..... Maybe not)  Everything  cooked on the flat top had that taste of rancid cooking medium. ( it wasn't bulter , I can assure you),  Take a pass on this place.

12.description: Absolutely love this place! Every time I go in, either sit down or carry out, the wait staff is always very nice and patient with my orders. And the omelets are really good! Very big portions and super hot when it comes out the kitchen. I have never been disappointed

59.description: It's nothing to write home about. The service is good. The food so-so but that's offset by the gigantic portions you receive. I wish they had better coffee. There just aren't many restaurants like this in the neighborhood, so the place thrives. We go there for breakfast on the weekends occasionally.

21.description: Terrible. I ordered from this place for the first time yesterday, and will never order again. This was a take out order for delivery, and the only positive thing I can say is that it was delivered on time. I ordered the hot turkey sandwich with mashed potatoes and gravy, an order of the potato pancakes with hot apples, and rice pudding. Let's start with the turkey sandwich. The turkey was dry, and the slices were clearly cut close to the bone as they had big knots of gristle and connective tissue in them. And when I say dry, I mean DRY. The potatoes were flavorless paste that were also dry, and the gravy was as thin as water, and some strange dark reddish color I've never seen before. The bread this was all piled on was stale. As for flavor? It all tasted the same, which is to say none of it had any seasoning or flavor at all. The sandwich was supposed to be accompanied by soup of the day, which was not included, so as an added insult, I didn't get everything I paid for. The potato pancakes seem like they may have been okay if they hadn't arrived stone cold, and the hot apples were tasty, but full of pieces of the core, a few seeds, and large pieces of skin. The rice pudding? To call it pudding is stretching the boundaries of reality. I received a large styrofoam cup filled with a substance that resembled a cup of milk with rice stirred in. Thin enough that you could run it through a strainer. I don't like to post negative reviews. In fact, the few reviews I do write are only when I have had an outstanding experience, and I tend not to complain about the negative ones, but I'm making an exception in this case because of the terrible quality of this food. I had a short stay in the hospital recently, and when I tell you that this meal was worse than hospital food, I am telling you this from a very recent experience, so you know I'm not exaggerating. Do yourself a favor: walk right past this place.

17.description: Terrible. I ordered from this place for the first time yesterday, and will never order again. This was a take out order for delivery, and the only positive thing I can say is that it was delivered on time. I ordered the hot turkey sandwich with mashed potatoes and gravy, an order of the potato pancakes with hot apples, and rice pudding. Let's start with the turkey sandwich. The turkey was dry, and the slices were clearly cut close to the bone as they had big knots of gristle and connective tissue in them. And when I say dry, I mean DRY. The potatoes were flavorless paste that were also dry, and the gravy was as thin as water, and some strange dark reddish color I've never seen before. The bread this was all piled on was stale. As for flavor? It all tasted the same, which is to say none of it had any seasoning or flavor at all. The sandwich was supposed to be accompanied by soup of the day, which was not included, so as an added insult, I didn't get everything I paid for. The potato pancakes seem like they may have been okay if they hadn't arrived stone cold, and the hot apples were tasty, but full of pieces of the core, a few seeds, and large pieces of skin. The rice pudding? To call it pudding is stretching the boundaries of reality. I received a large styrofoam cup filled with a substance that resembled a cup of milk with rice stirred in. Thin enough that you could run it through a strainer. I don't like to post negative reviews. In fact, the few reviews I do write are only when I have had an outstanding experience, and I tend not to complain about the negative ones, but I'm making an exception in this case because of the terrible quality of this food. I had a short stay in the hospital recently, and when I tell you that this meal was worse than hospital food, I am telling you this from a very recent experience, so you know I'm not exaggerating. Do yourself a favor: walk right past this place.

10.description: Stayed in Chicago and did not regret going here. Straight forward breakfast diner with plenty of seating and polite staff. Came here on a Saturday morning and left satisfied. The server took some time to get to us, but afterwards everything was ok. I would and will eat here again.Good:-Strawberry milkshake-Denver Omelette-Omelette with choice of 4 vegetables-Corn beef hash-Pancakes on the sideBad:-none

5.description: Food was greasy, and some what cold just like some of the waitress here. No Thanks I rather drive the extra 30 minutes to Hollywood grill.

3.description: Neighborhood diner with kitschy floral booths, constant coffee refills, and a perfect amount of grease. Equal amounts of Spanish and English make this a great reflection of the non-hipster part of Rogers Park: union guys, older latino couples, families with kids, ball caps. No mimosa-brunch specials here--this menu has misspellings and hand-written prices in blue pen and you're guaranteed a pile of buttery eggs and whatever you decided to mix in (Gyro meat, polish sausage or chorizo hold equal billing to the traditional bacon or sausage.)Big windows on the corner and lots of available booths means I like the atmosphere of this place. Service is friendly and fast (if not overly attentive) with no niceities like "I'll be taking care of you today and litany of specials. The host greets some folks with loud good mornings and some folks by name and she points out table options and asks what you want.Coffee isn't the quality you'd get from an upscale brunch place, but not as thin or stale as you'd get a lot of other greasy spoons, and they won't let you hit the bottom of your mug.$10 minimum on credit cards is my only complaint, and high minimums (as much as I know credit card fees probably suck for local businesses) force a loss of a star in my book. But great diner nonetheless.

35.description: The A & T is perfect for what it is: a friendly diner that serves the neighborhood it is in. The staff is gracious and personality-filled, the food is overwhelmingly delightful. Nothing fancy, but filling and, yes, tasty. Plates of pancakes, hashbrowns (I like mine with cheese) and bacon--always with fruit added! They serve real (not Ruby Red) grapefruit juice here, which is a gift. You get the whole swath of the denizens of Rogers Park here, which is a good thing. While breakfast is the big draw, there are a number of good things on the dinner menu (in addition to the legendary chicken noodle soup, I recommend the pork kebab), so you should try and swing by later too. I'm not really sure I can think of a higher compliment than to say that I come here every Christmas, and I'm always glad I did.

19.description: I love coffee shops that can do breakfast well. A & T wouldn't be one of those ! The worst omelette and hash browns I've ever had ( ok ..... Maybe not)  Everything  cooked on the flat top had that taste of rancid cooking medium. ( it wasn't bulter , I can assure you),  Take a pass on this place.

28.description: Supposedly A & T stands for abundant and tasty, and is it correct! It's a pretty classic looking diner, so take it for what it is.Unfortunately the details of what I had there has blurred as it was my last meal in Illinois before a week-long road trip back to CA... but we all definitely left food on our plate because we were so full.

45.description: I had to be in Evanston well before the sun came up one day and asked where I could find a great diner meal afterwards.  A&T was recommended and I was in the mood to try a new place.  We passed it quickly while riding the southbound CTA 22 Clark bus from Howard, but I leapt off at the next stop and snapped a few pics walking back toward the restaurant.Situated in the heart of the working class part of Rogers Park, A&T is a great breakfast place option with what must be some of the largest pancakes known to man.  The food is ok and the service is so friendly it reminds me of the nice people who live in the deep south. Take a look at the pics.

33.description: The owner has freshened up the decor a bit with new light fixtures and some Lynette Jennings era sponge painting. All of the staff is still super friendly and the portions huge. However, the food always tends towards the greasy side and straying from the breakfast items on the menu has always left me disappointed by lack of flavor and/or greasiness. Go for the breakfast! It is served anytime, the hash browns are great and it usually (but not always) comes with a generous fresh fruit garnish.

43.description: Ick! My sister was visiting and I thought we'd go out for brunch here. Ugh - I'm embarrassed that I took her there. Everything is old, but not the quaint "lived in" kind of old - more just run down. The waitress' apron and shirt were filthy. Not exactly a good sign for a restaurant. The food was typical diner food. Fine. But somehow the bill came to over $30 for two people having eggs, toast and coffee???I live in Rogers Park and that was my first and last time eating here.

2.description: Grub hub delivery review:Do not order from here. Awful customer service. We were delivered someone else's order and they offered to 'switch it back' talk about unsanitary. Got hung up on and snapped at. 30 minutes later still have the wrong food and refusing to refund us. I asked for a manager and the lady on the phone said no and that I could just talk to her. It's below average diner food anyways, there are so many better restaurants in Chicago.

18.description: Always met my expectations and left me satisfied.  It's a bit of a greasy spoon diner, but you need one every once in a while.

41.description: Not the worst in the world, but not great. No problem getting a seat right away, even at brunch time on a Saturday (maybe that should be a sign?) and the food comes quickly after you order but don't expect much attention after that, even if all you want is a refill on your water or drink.The food is standard diner quality. The pancakes are huge - dinner plate size. Corned beef hash is fine. Pretty much everything I've had is just okay, nothing special.$10 minimum for credit cards. The decor could really use an update. Including the Greek mythology paper placemats - they are informative but...unappetizing. I don't really want to read about where Aphrodite came from while I'm waiting for my food. Not a mealtime story.Unfortunately there aren't a whole lot of other options for diners in the area, so if you're in a pinch it'll do but it's probably worth venturing out of Rogers Park for diner fare.

52.description: This is your standard diner.  Full menu all day long, lots of things from breakfast to sandwiches to burgers to salads.  It's got LOTS of seating, unlike some similar diners.  The portions are generous, the prices are standard diner prices.  I did find the staff to be very friendly and attentive.  It's a comfortable place.

50.description: I have been coming here for years and it may not look all brand spanking new and have all the bells and whistles of a Down town restaurant. But I tell you it has the best service, eggs & coffee this side of Chicago! Hands down it's bang for your buck and quality food.

4.description: I went here after a place where we usually get weekend breakfast out was closed for renovations.  Some of us in the group were still under the influence and in desperate need of calories. This restaurant served us well.The food is tasty and plentiful.  We ordered Greek omelet, pancakes and challah French toast.  All were good.  The eggs and bacon were perfectly cooked.  No limp chewy bacon.  My wife reported that the coffee was the best she has had at a Chicago diner.  The Greek omelet, while good, was a little bland in places. The feta cheese and potatoes needed to be better distributed.  The wife loved the French toast.

6.description: Thinking back on the experience, it was 4 star worthy for the food and service. But there was a funk in there that could not be explained without delving into thinking about the nether regions of old ladies. Sorry. My lunch date agreed. Something "muy raro" about it all, but once the bread basket came by, it was up and away for my gustatorial foray into the greasy spoon diner recommended to me by an Uber driver/lawyer. Something about that last description should have told me something was up. He's forgiven.The croque monsieur was awesome. Ham off the bone on a perfectly toasted sandwich of french toast. Syrup and hotsauce were added: yum? Yes.Have to be back for some of the crazy omelettes at this joint.Overall, I left content and full beyond measure; even a little bit sleepy by the time the check came around. Give this place a whirl if you're meandering the far North Side between daytime activities.

22.description: I decided to eat here originally because it was close to the apartment that I stayed as of now and my friends wanted to meet up to have some breakfast. They have a good set of meals you can order. There is a waiting time but its all good. The quality of the food is great and the price for them is reasonable. Breakfast is always great here.

15.description: Food poisoning!!!  The worst I have ever had in my life!!  Beware!!  This is the second time I ordered delivery from here.  The first time the food was ok nothing to go on about.  After this time never again will I order from here!!  Seriously stay away!

57.description: My dad took my brother here when he was younger. Then took my mom with. Then my sister. Then me. Now my sister and brothers kinds. Now we have 3 generations of our family who come here. My parents used to live around the area when they started going there. It is the most amazing food for cheap prices. The owners know us from just going there all the time and they always ask everyone how their day is going no matter who you are. We always sit in the corner at our booth, the round one. Their soup of the day is what saves me when I'm sick and need some good home cooked soup! Their BLT with Turkey is AMAZING and if you want breakfast it is even better. It is a nice place to get away from the typical resturants that have taken over small owner resturants (Cheesecake Factory, Red Robin, etc.) It gives you a home feeling everytime you walk in. I cant wait to take my kids there, and theres, so that we can have 4 generations sitting at our booth.

20.description: I've never actually been to the location, so this a delivery only review.I'm a pancake enthusiast and I can't get enough of these pancakes. Delivered to my front door. At seemingly light speed. Delicious. The way I want them. And pretty cheap. You spoil me and my dreams of breakfast in bed everyday.

36.description: The boyfriend has ceased dining at A&T ever since he found a hair in his food.  This is not a place we will ever go to again.

14.description: I've been coming here for over 20 years this is a great spot for breakfast lunch and dinner a diner menu with Greek flair. Everything is huge and delicious. Heavenly Pancakes, sandwiches, Turkey Dinner, the list goes on go try this place.

1.description: This was a much needed quick stop for drink mixers today (Christmas day), I believe it's own or at least run by Muslims, so thank goodness for that aspect.   Decent selection of mixers for what we needed and at a reasonable price.  For some odd reason, it smells like chili in here.  When my cousin asked the counter guy where the scent was coming from and whether they sold chili or soup mixes, the guy merely laughed it off.

2.description: This is up the block from me and I've stopped in a few time for a few items. It's a typical neighborhood quick-stop mart, nothing fancy, but the operators are always friendly and I have always found what I needed. Another plus is they are open until 11, and they don't serve alcohol (as far as I know) so the people in there are usually not obnoxious, even late at night.

0.description: Eddys is the best!!!! I go in there everyday to buy blunts, cigarettes, water bottle with the squirty top and sour patch kids! All right there and conveniently located less then a block away from my apartment! :)

1.description: Super delicious, hole-in-the-wall place for Belizean food! I get the cup of chicken with beans and rice every time and it does not get old. 4 stars, not 5, because my plantains were a little burnt last time. Service is nice but you may have to wave them down since it is a small staff. Get the hot slaw sauce; it's really good. Very affordable prices, too.

9.description: Great neighborhood spot! The staff was friendly and the food came out REALLY fast. We went with a large group from class, our teacher recommended it. The food was very tasty! Loved the chicken and rice.

23.description: Great food!! Light but filling. I'm hooked to Belizean, the fusion of so many cultures is amazing.

5.description: Formerly (Tickies Belizean Restaurant)excellent cuisine , family friendly , great food your taste buds will thank you !!!

25.description: We've been meaning to check out Belizean food here for a long time, especially since we live in the area and when we finally got a chance, it turned out that the place changed owners and was remodeled.  Overall the experience was not bad, but I hope the new owner continues to make improvements.The good part:-  The food itself is really great.  Very authentic Caribbean cuisine, as good as anything we've tried in Jamaica.  Plantain, rice with beans, ox tail, all very good.  The portions are generous for the price.  Lots of good different sides to add at cheap prices (corn bread was excellent)-  Caribbean/Reggae music playing in the background.  A nice touch, nothing better on a chilly rainy/snowy Chicago February night.-  People that work here are friendly. The less good part:-  They must be on Island Time.  Or short-staffed.  It took a long time for someone to appear at the register and take our order.  It also took a long time for the food to come.  -  It was not really clean.  The place is very small and there was not a clean spot for us.  The owner came out and was nice enough to wipe down a booth for us (without us complaining, so he understands, which is great), but we still needed to kind of wipe our table.   The neighborhood is a bit rough here, so partially I understand, and maybe it's just better to get take-out from here, but still...The food is really good and hopefully we'll be back to try other menu items.

12.description: The food is very good here. Just the service is not as great. You should treat your people better and with thanks. No matter what color we are. I'm sure if the customer service was better , your business would strive. Smile more too. The energy in here feels very negative.

21.description: Well, I've been here a few times now and I find myself confused why I only rated this place 3 stars in the first place.  After trying more items on the menu I can't help feeling they deserve 4 stars for the really good flavors served up here and if I was only rating on customer service with a smile they'd definitely get 5 stars.  The customer service isn't just good they actually appear to be happy you're patronizing their establishment.  Not in a sickening way, but in a genuine manner that combined with the flavors will put a smile on your face.   Hmm, after typing that last sentence I can't help feeling they deserve the 5 stars so that's what I'm going with even though my initial thoughts were to lean towards 4 stars.  So far I've liked everything I've tried, but if I could only recommend one thing I'd have to go with the Conch Fritter.  It is yummy!!!!  Stop in and try this place out and I'm sure you'll walk away a happy camper.

16.description: Great & authentic Belizean food!!! I had their rice & beans with stewed chicken & beef, conch flitters, meat pie, & tamales. Great flavor in everything & good service.

17.description: Redz was recommended by staff at Howard Area Community Center, and I'm glad I followed their advice.  Great food, great staff, and all at an unbeatable price (as others have mentioned, it DOES get busy!)  Eating here makes me want to visit Belize!

10.description: The food here is perfect. Their oxtail is the best I've had in the city, and their sweet plantains are almost always perfectly ripe. I'm so sad I moved away! Gave it 4 out of 5 only because the service is pretty darn bad.

11.description: My husband and I were in the northern end of Chicago during a weekday evening. We were starving but it was 4 in the afternoon, so our choices were limited. I found Redz Belizean on Yelp, read through a few of the reviews, decided that it sounded good, and we walked the few blocks over from our B&B.Our arrival into the restaurant was a little chaotic. There were quite a few people milling around the front counter. We stood around a bit until a man (a waiter, I suppose) leaning against the counter came over, asked if we wanted a table, moved some things off the closest table, wiped it down, and motioned for us to take a seat. Just as we sat down, a woman who had been sitting on a stool at the front counter rushed over and told us that we were sitting in her seat. The waiter had disappeared at this point, so we had to get up and wait for somebody else to leave (there are only 4 booths) so we could sit down.The ordering experience was a little chaotic too. We wanted to try the conch fritter, but were told that they were out. We ended up ordering the panades appetizer, the small oxtail dinner, and the small chicken dinner, which came with rice and beans, potato salad, and fried plantains. The waiter brought out this incredible onion-y, garlic-y sauce for the panades. The oxtail and chicken dinners were perfectly sized, and the gravy over the rice and beans was delicious. The plantains were the absolute best part, though. Fried and caramelized and kind of gooey in the perfect way.I would recommend: streamlining the ordering process at Redz, adding additional seating, and improving customer services. The food was great, though. If I'm ever back in the area, I'll probably get take-out over dine-in, for sure.

26.description: New owner took over the old Tickie's and kept the menu and the chef. Inside is renovated with nicer booths and counter. Got the cow foot stew, conch fritters, and dukunno. Some of their more involved dishes are now listed as specials available on weekends only (Friday/Saturday). Glad it's there...thought it was closing last time I walked by and saw the renovations. Will give it 4 stars for now until I get a few more visits in.

22.description: I've been going here for years, since it was Tickie's. New owners kept the same menu....BUT, it is more delicious than ever and the meat is a better quality. I always get stewed beef, rice and beans which comes with the tastiest, seasoned potato salad and plantains. The small which is a big portion is under $8.

0.description: I've been very happy with the food I've had in Redz. I've tried the oxtail and the chicken dinner and both were great. The oxtail was tender and the chicken was very flavorful. The dinners come with rice and stewed beans and rice tastes amazing. This is just plain white rice but somehow it tastes  much better than the white rice I make at home! I also had the pork tamale and it actually has a large chunk of pork inside! For drinks, the place makes its own eggnog! It tasted creamy and delicious.

20.description: You MUST come here, if you live within a 50-mile radius.If you love Central American flavors... plantains, stewed oxtail, seasoned rice & beans this place will knock your socks off. Or for those who've never tried Belizean food before, brace yourselves because you might fall in love. I just did.Came here for lunch, and I ordered the Oxtail dinner (that's right, haha) which comes with a generous helping of stewed oxtail, rice and beans, potato salad and a fried plantain ($8.00).The meat was tender and melted right off the bone, the sauce was amazing like it has been stewing for days... All the flavors were a punch and a kick.  If I were any closer, I'd order carry out more often.It's a very small establishment, tucked behind the Howard station on Paulina, between an empty storefront and... I think a beauty supply store. I would have missed this place completely, if the staff at the Howard Area Community Center (across the street) didn't recommend it.  I don't frequent this area often but now I would come back for another round. (And I'd also try to find that woman who walks around and sells home-made tamales!)Redz has chicken/fish dishes and breakfast plates (the breakfast plate came with some sliced avocado) and the food here is FAB. I don't know how people can make oxtail so good.There is seating (a bunch of booths on both sides of the restaurant) and it's a pretty small/simple dining area.  After I finished eating, my plate was scraped clean: yum.  Overall, it's a hole-in-the-wall place with unique, crave-inducing and cooked-with-a-lotta-love Belizean food.

19.description: We've been meaning to check out Belizean food here for a long time, especially since we live in the area and when we finally got a chance, it turned out that the place changed owners and was remodeled.  Overall the experience was not bad, but I hope the new owner continues to make improvements.The good part:-  The food itself is really great.  Very authentic Caribbean cuisine, as good as anything we've tried in Jamaica.  Plantain, rice with beans, ox tail, all very good.  The portions are generous for the price.  Lots of good different sides to add at cheap prices (corn bread was excellent)-  Caribbean/Reggae music playing in the background.  A nice touch, nothing better on a chilly rainy/snowy Chicago February night.-  People that work here are friendly. The less good part:-  They must be on Island Time.  Or short-staffed.  It took a long time for someone to appear at the register and take our order.  It also took a long time for the food to come.  -  It was not really clean.  The place is very small and there was not a clean spot for us.  The owner came out and was nice enough to wipe down a booth for us (without us complaining, so he understands, which is great), but we still needed to kind of wipe our table.   The neighborhood is a bit rough here, so partially I understand, and maybe it's just better to get take-out from here, but still...The food is really good and hopefully we'll be back to try other menu items.

2.description: This restaurant has the WORSE customer I have ever experienced in my life!!!!!  I have visited Belize several times, it is a beautiful place to visit.  I had a taste of Belizean food, so I googled YELP for help, and found Redz Belizean Restaurant.  The restaurant had mixed reviews on YELP.  Me and a friend went to this restaurant Friday (10/16/15 about 2:00pm) when we walked in two people were waiting to order however, no one had taken their order, the two customers left because they mentioned no one approached them to take their order.  I should have left too.  Finally, a man took our order, HORRIBLE, AWFUL customer service!!!!  We were "welcomed" to the restaurant with "yah, what?"  I was shocked, my friend responded, "hi, how are you, we would like to order food to go"         We ordered food to go.  We ordered a chicken dinner, beef dinner, two chicken tamales, and one meat pie.  We were charged $42.08.  As we walked out of the restaurant, and drove away, I asked my friend how much was the order, they did NOT give us a receipt.  I looked at the menu and discovered they overcharged us.  I drove back and explained the situation to the man that took our order, he just said, "oh yah, we owe you money" They food should  have been $28 NOT $42.08.  They gave us the difference $14.08.  A woman was standing at the counter and gave us the money.  No apology, the man that waited on us, and the woman at the counter were so rude and mean.  I could NOT believe the disrespectful, rude, ignorant, ghetto, customer service we received!!!!The food was O.K. NOTHING special, the chicken was over-cooked, the beef was under cooked!!!!            WE WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS RESTAURANT due to rude, ignorant, ghetto, unprofessional, disrespectful customer service!!!!!!

18.description: This is good food on the cheap. I'm pretty sure they got a few abuelas in the back slinging this stuff.

13.description: Just the best I loved my oxtail.

4.description: This place has the worst customer service ever! Never will go here again and spreading the word about how I was treated here. This is the 3rd. time Ive been here. I went in and placed an order to go.My order: 1 small chicken dinner, 2 beef patties, small side of rice and beans, and 2 dukuno. Order came to 19 and some change took the order and left. Got on the train went home and got the food out to eat it. They gave me the wrong order of 1 small dinner. Instead of chicken it was Oxtail. So I tryed to call Redz 5 times with no anwser. It was the middle of the day and they were not busy. So I decided since they wouldnt anwser their phone Im taking it back and getting what I ordered.  The manager was walking out the door when we walked up. I explained to him that he gave us the wrong order...This was his response...Im sorry but you can just keep it..this was at the door..didnt even let us come in first...So again I explained how I want my order corrected and he said no Im not doing that. I said fine then since you dont know how to treat a paying customer I want my money back. Again he said no! So I said...You will give me my money back. You messed up the order. You need to fix this now. So instead of putting my money back to the card we used he opened the register and threw 10.00 at me and said take it. I put the food on the counter and left. Now to the crazy who doesnt know how to treat customers you got a pissed off client, lost money, a bad yelp review, and a client who also has a blog and is posting this experince their. I would highly recommend u rethink how you treat people. If you want to stay in bussiness!

24.description: The food here is very tasty and the portions are big. Conch fritters were good. I will go back to try the rest of their menu.

6.description: I can't rave enough about this place. It's a very short walk from the El, the food is DELICIOUS, staff are friendly, they serve generous portions, and it's very reasonably priced ($7-8 for the "small" plates, which are quite large). Seating is limited, so maybe don't expect to eat in.My big bro and I got the small oxtail and chicken dinners, $8 and $7.25 respectively.
