Along with the tender meat comes a big serving of beans and rice (other options available), a scoop of AMAZING potato salad (I got a large container for $3.25 to go, though you can get small $1 containers as well), and a fried plantain. It was out of this world. Next time I go back, I want to try their tamales.We went around dinner time, and there were a ton of people coming through picking up orders. It's got to be a popular place, and it's no surprise why! FRIGGIN DELISH!

15.description: I love this place.  Food is always fantastic. I made the 1 hr commute when it was Tickie's and I still make it for Redz. My favorite dish is the Tilapia stewed in coconut milk, but it takes 30 min so I usually call it in ahead.  My only complaint is the service. Don't ever go during a typical rush hour for dining or carry out because the staff of easily overwhelmed. You might have to remind them to bring out your order/drink/or even silverware.  Many a time I had to take it upon myself to grab my own drink or walk in the back for some silverware. I actually got a job near by and was excited to be able to pick up carry out for lunch. I called in my order 1 hr ahead and told them I would be on lunch break so it was important to be ready on time. When I showed up there was a line to the door &they hadn't even begun preparing my food. I had to wait 45 min and was late returning back to work. I should've just left but they kept saying almost ready. Learned my lesson &only go now when I'm not crunched for time.  I keep coming back because I love the food & its a great price. I would love to see them move to a bigger location & hire more staff. I would love to host a party there. I bring any friends who have never tried it before but with the limited seating it makes it difficult. Great place but try to go at an odd time to have a better chance at good service.

7.description: Red, u need to read these reviews bcuz ur snotty ass daughter is gonna kill ur business. And u all need to expand ur kitchen or get some more cooks back there bcuz u all are RIDICULOUSLY SLOW. 10MINS FOR FRY JACK! THEY SUCK AT TAKING YOUR ORDERS.  You shouldn't have to stand there almost 10 minutes before someone decides to come from the back and take your damn order! Unacceptable. And then when they write down the Orders somehow they still manage to get the damn order wrong! How the hell does that happen with something you wrote down verbatim coming from the customer! They then fill up your entire meal with rice and beans give you one measly damn plantain and short change you with the damn oxtails. We are aware of how expensive oxtails can be but come on if you have customers coming there in time for that shit then you give them what they pay for. I liked the chicken dinner and loved the fry jack but will forego it b4 dealing with their snotty asses. Red is too busy talking w everyone that comes in instead of running his restaurant properly.  Won't waste my gas going there anytime soon, u shouldn't either

8.description: You MUST come here, if you live within a 50-mile radius.If you love Central American flavors... plantains, stewed oxtail, seasoned rice & beans this place will knock your socks off. Or for those who've never tried Belizean food before, brace yourselves because you might fall in love. I just did.Came here for lunch, and I ordered the Oxtail dinner (that's right, haha) which comes with a generous helping of stewed oxtail, rice and beans, potato salad and a fried plantain ($8.00).The meat was tender and melted right off the bone, the sauce was amazing like it has been stewing for days... All the flavors were a punch and a kick.  If I were any closer, I'd order carry out more often.It's a very small establishment, tucked behind the Howard station on Paulina, between an empty storefront and... I think a beauty supply store. I would have missed this place completely, if the staff at the Howard Area Community Center (across the street) didn't recommend it.  I don't frequent this area often but now I would come back for another round. (And I'd also try to find that woman who walks around and sells home-made tamales!)Redz has chicken/fish dishes and breakfast plates (the breakfast plate came with some sliced avocado) and the food here is FAB. I don't know how people can make oxtail so good.There is seating (a bunch of booths on both sides of the restaurant) and it's a pretty small/simple dining area.  After I finished eating, my plate was scraped clean: yum.  Overall, it's a hole-in-the-wall place with unique, crave-inducing and cooked-with-a-lotta-love Belizean food.

3.description: Very good and authentic Belizean food! I love their chicken dinners and potato salad the most. They also have rice/chicken bowls that are pretty good and cheap. Be sure to try their special hot pepper sauce if you prefer/enjoy spicy.

14.description: this is honestly the best belizean food ive ever tasted . I've had so many other belizean food since I'm belizean and this is by far the best I have had !!! The oxtail dinner is my favorite but everything else is good as well

58.description: I live around the corner and was excited to see this new pizza place. My experience is similar to others - super friendly service and good pizza. We got a deep dish with pepperoni, and I was impressed most by the crispiness of the outside of the crust, without being burnt, while the inside was nice and cushy. When I originally went I had beer and they apologized for not being BYOB, glad to see that has changed! I certainly think they are worth a try, and I know I'll being going back.

56.description: We have ordered several times and have never had a bad pizza.  Deep dish or thin crust are excellent.  Add the butter crust, well worth it.  2nd best pizza joint in Chicago.

29.description: Ordered a deep dish pizza delivery and was very disappointed. The pizza had rested at an incline for probably the duration of its travel, and arrived lopsided with all the cheese and toppings slid to one very soggy side (it had even begun to soak through the box). This was unfortunate because the flavor was very good, and the nonsoggy side had a lovely crispy crust. Also, unlike traditional Chicago deep dish (layered crust, cheese, crust, sauce) this pizza lacked the 2nd later of crust, which may have contributed to its misshapen sogginess.

42.description: Moved in to a new apartment in the neighborhood and needs something effortless to follow a busy day of moving and unpacking.  Ordered a large thin crust cheese, a personal pan pepperoni deep dish, with an order of mozzarella sticks.  Thin crust was delicious, deep dish could have been better.  Delivery guy was friendly.  More, please!

23.description: Go for the butter crust!!  Sausage deep dish was great, would 100% get from these guys again!

47.description: Absolutely the best place to get deep dish!!! I've ordered online and in person and have had it delivered several times- never had any issues whatsoever. The delivery drivers are all super friendly and sociable even engaging in small chat while delivering, which is I think is a bonus!The deep dish pizza is the best I've ever had. The staff when we go to pick it up is absolutely wonderful and friendly. They have even offered us drinks on the house as we waited and are full of smiles and small chat.I would highly recommend you try it out, you will not be disappointed. It will become our favorite go to place for pizza and great service.

8.description: Seriously amazing and surprising find!! A group of us ordered and loved the thin crust supreme, the cheeseburgers, the fries and their deep dish pizza *with buttercrust* (make sure to ask for it!) is comparable to Lou Malnati's!! It might even be better???!! I had a deep dish with garlic and green pepper and it was divine. We have since ordered from them on grubhub about 20 million times. Amazing every time! If I can suggest an improvement, the only possible even better thing would be fresh made desserts.

31.description: This is hands down my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago, maybe a tie with Pequods. I was raised on deep dish, and my wife and I decided to try out all of the pizza places on those lists of "best pizza in Chicago", and I gotta say this place wins out over every place we've tried for deep dish pizza. I've never been there, but we order delivery at least once every week or two, and it's always super fresh and super fast. They usually beat the grubhub text updates when delivering. I did have an issue at one point where they must have had a new driver, and he delivered a couple pizzas that had been tilted and all the ingredients had slid over, but I called, and they couldn't have handled it better. They offered to get us another pizza right away, or cover our next one, and they spoke to the driver so I haven't had that issue since. It's similar to Lou Malnati's in style, but it's so much better. Love the butter crust with extra sauce. It's so good. Thin crust is good too, probably in my top three for the neighborhood. Now I feel like ordering a pizza tonight lol!

34.description: Their pizza was suprisingly good.  A nice change from JB Albertos and closer in walking distance to me than JB's.  I always order a buttercrust pizza.

16.description: Located on clark and touhy, this small pizza place has the best thin crust pizza. 20$ covers a pizza for two and fries. I honestly love this place and have been a proud customer since 2013 of December. :) if youre looking for a friday night meal this is the place. Befriend the delivery guy theyre the best! I also ordered during the polar vortex and the delivary guy was so nice to walk out in the darn cold and hand over my order. Humble hard working people. :D

13.description: Ordered a deep dish pizza delivery and was very disappointed. The pizza had rested at an incline for probably the duration of its travel, and arrived lopsided with all the cheese and toppings slid to one very soggy side (it had even begun to soak through the box). This was unfortunate because the flavor was very good, and the nonsoggy side had a lovely crispy crust. Also, unlike traditional Chicago deep dish (layered crust, cheese, crust, sauce) this pizza lacked the 2nd later of crust, which may have contributed to its misshapen sogginess.

11.description: In town for the evening...delivery was quicker than they told us when we ordered. Deep dish butter crust was delicious...there was something missing in the flavor somewhere though...definitely not bland but not complete...the sauce is yummy...Would probably opt for another choice the next round.

39.description: I really like this place.  It's definitely a contender to Lou Malnati's and the service is always fast and friendly.  My only complaint is they seem to be really loading on the cheese lately.  I love cheese, don't get me wrong ... but this is tipping the scales a bit.  Way too  much and its taking over everything else.  Its not always like that either.  Most of the time its just right ... but other times its this big gooey blob that slides down the sides of the slices.  Other than that, great pan pizza ... just needs a little consistency with the cheese.

37.description: Delivery 101: Keep the food warmWe ordered a thin crust pizza from here recently, based largely on the overwhelmingly positive reviews posted on Yelp. Went with the butter crust because it sounded delicious. Unfortunately, the pizza we got was lukewarm at best, and the cheese had already started to harden. It looked like it had been sitting out for a while before anyone stuck it in a pizza bag to keep it warm. Quickly zapping it in the microwave helped a bit, but that's going to some pretty extreme lengths. Considering we paid around $30 (tip + delivery included) for a thin crust pizza, I would have hoped it'd at least be warm. The butter crust was pretty good, I'll give them that. I was interested in trying their deep dish at some point, but based on this experience, I don't think I would order from here again.

0.description: Three years ago my favorite pizza delivery placed closed.  After ordering from them for 15 years, I had to begin the hunt for a replacement that would satisfy my thin crust cravings.  After maaaaaaaaaaany different pizzas, I finally found THE ONE!  THE ONE with a delectably crispy and buttery crust that crunches and then melts in your mouth.  THE ONE with fresh ingredients and ample sausage.  THE ONE with a perfectly tangy, seasoned and slightly rich sauce.THE ONE that my heart, soul and stomach yearned for! It took over three years, but..Yes! Yes! Yes!!! I found it!!!And to top it off, one day they accidentally sent me a deep dish pizza.  I've lived my whole life in Chicago and the ONLY deep dish I ever really enjoyed was Uno/Due/Malnati's/Gino's East. BUT now I can add one more pizzeria to that list.  Their deep dish is AMAZING!!!Also, the woman who answers the phone is amazingly sweet, friendly and helpful.  She makes ordering a pizza a delight!  (wait is that possible?  Umm, yeah I guess so).DEFINITELY try this pizza.  You too many find that it is THE ONE for you!

38.description: Very Very Very good pizza!    If you like Lou Malnati's, then you will like this.   I ordered the medium thin, butter crust pizza with mushroom and sausage.  There was the perfect amount of cheese and the crust was crispy and tasty.  The crust tastes similar to Lou's.  I ordered on the phone and they were offering a buy one get one half off special, so I ordered a second with wheat crust with veggie toppings.  The delivery guy was friendly and the delivery took about 45 minutes - not bad for a Saturday night.   I will definitely order from Nueva Italy Pizzeria again!

51.description: Ordered  from here after great reviews. I agree the pizza is very good, especially the sauce. Two things stop me from giving a higher rating.....I ordered pepperoni pizza and received plain cheese, and the pizza was ice cold on arrival. I will give this place another try at some point.

27.description: The food here is great. But the people are better. Had an issue with an order and they called me back to make sure I was happy. They made it right. Highly recommended.

32.description: Currently my favorite pizza place. There's steep competition in Chicago and this is probably the best place you haven't tried. Reminds me a little of Lou Malnatis. I recommend thin crust sausage. Ask for the buy one pizza get one half off deal and thank me later.

54.description: I've had their deep dish three times and it is *stellar.* I usually order from Lou's but they were closed one night so I tried this place since Yelp had great reviews. So glad I did. It's a find. Definitely get the butter crust. And the tomato sauce is amazing. I also like that they have a "personal size" option. I ordered one of the pizzas half-baked and it was perfect. They just ask you if you know how to bake it because they do not advertised half-baked pizzas and they do not put directions on it. If you're not sure, google Lou's instructions. Same thing. And that pizza turned out perfectly as well. My new favorite pizza place!

48.description: For those of you who want to stretch your dollar...get a second pie for half off. We've been back quite a few times...and we've just gone back to their regular crust and last time...got one deep dish and one thin crust after initially favoring only their thin crust.One note though...the deep dish was taken home and heated up in a pan (crisped to our liking). To judge fairly, we'd have to get the deep dish to dine in. Thanks to all the fans that gave Nueva a try.

44.description: This is great pizza especially with the butter crust.  I miss the free delivery through grubhub, but the pizza is fairly priced for the quality you receive.  Think Gino's east but with a slightly healthier feel.  (I"m not sure it's actually healthier, but it feels that way, and I'd argue it is significantly better tasting.)   The delivery is quickly very quick and the drivers are always very kind.

24.description: Pizza is an art... you have to have the right sauce, the right crust, and it has to be cooked just right (not over and not under). It's tough to find a good pizza place, despite the fact that most every place claims they're "world famous."Nueva Italy is actually pretty awesome. It's not the best you'll ever have, but it's pretty damn good. It's delicious upon delivery, it's great reheated, and best of all - they always beat their delivery estimate.Is it the best pizza I've ever had? No. Will I order it again and again and again? Definitely.

7.description: I wasn't super impressed with Nueva Italy. I moved further north so I was giving everywhere a shot to find my new regular place. I didn't get the butter crust - full disclosure. The pizza wasn't really that flavorful. I was really let down by the regular crust and the lack of flavor in the cheese. Delivery wasn't fast either; my pizza wasn't hot (warm, just not fresh-hot).

49.description: The deep dish cheese here immediately became a favorite.  We get it without butter crust and it's excellent.  It reminds me a little of the original Gino's East.  The sauce is a little less sweet than Lou Malnati's, which is neither better, nor worse.  Just a difference. The crust is really great- more like a pie crust.  Love it.  We live in South Evanston and they deliver with no problem. Also, they have always arrived about 15 minutes before they say they will!

40.description: Yum. Yum. Yum. One of the best pizzas I have had since moving to Chicago. I'm not a big deep dish fan, but I love thin crust. I got a plain pepperoni and extra cheese and it was great. I loved the pizza sauce, too. Delivery was 20 minutes faster than the expected time, which is always great!

53.description: The deep dish pizza is good, but the breadsticks are awesome. Order them immediately. It was super easy to order online and even when I couldn't hear my phone, the delivery man didn't leave and made sure I got my order.

30.description: Their deep dish pizza in the pan with butter crust ROCKS!!!!  It hard to find better pizza in the pan!!  I order mine with extra cheese and extra sausage.....

46.description: Located on clark and touhy, this small pizza place has the best thin crust pizza. 20$ covers a pizza for two and fries. I honestly love this place and have been a proud customer since 2013 of December. :) if youre looking for a friday night meal this is the place. Befriend the delivery guy theyre the best! I also ordered during the polar vortex and the delivary guy was so nice to walk out in the darn cold and hand over my order. Humble hard working people. :D

1.description: I ordered via grubhub. I got a notification that the pizza was out for delivery, 45 min later still no pizza. After an hour went by, I called and they were very apologetic, saying they think my order was just skipped by mistake. They told me they would send out the pizza right away and I should call grubhub to cancel the order and refund my money. It has now been over 5 hours since I placed the initial order and i JUST received an ice cold pizza! I have ordered from here in the past and it is delicious pizza so I am disappointed but will not order from here again.

55.description: We ordered a medium deep dish pizza with mushrooms, onions, and sausage on a cold winter night.  It took the usual hour, and arrived right on time.  I want to give this pie at least 4 stars-- the sausage was delicious, and the sauce and mozzarella were high quality.  But unfortunately, this pizza just does not travel well.  The whole bottom of the pizza was soggy and even the crust was soft and chewy (not in a good way).  After the first few disappointing bites, we popped a few slices in the toaster and the outside crust was amazing, but we still couldn't dry out the bottom of the pie.  It might be happening because of the foil lined cardboard underneath the pizza, but I can't tell.  Maybe I'll try their pizza in house next time, but the delivery needs some work!

9.description: I wish the prices were a little lower buy the food is very good. We ordered butter-crust deep dish for when a group of friends came over and when ever we invite them again they ask if we're going to order it again. (The buttercrust is really what makes their pizza stick out). We plan to go back again for sure.

26.description: Not sure what all the hype is about.  I ordered an x-tra large thin butter crust pizza with an order of fries and some drinks and had it delivered.  The delivery guy was pleasant and delivered our order before the 45 minutes to an hour window.  Pizza was subpar.  Crust ok.  Cheese ok.  Pepperoni ok.  I've made homemade pizzas better than this.  I doubt if I order here again.  Matter fact, I'll just stick with Leona's and Giordano's.  The two stars are for the quick service and delivery guy.

25.description: I love the bbq pizza here. If I want thin crust pizza this is the place I always order from. I usually do delivery and they come pretty fast ( I live close though). The delivery guy is always friendly. I also ate in a few times and the staff is really nice. I have no complaints :)

12.description: There pizza is actually pretty good I haven't tried anything else but when I do I will edit thus review based on their quality. They are affordable and delivery is alright. For a small newly established pizzeria it clinging on against other well known pizzerias.

59.description: Pizza is good, but $33 worth for xl thin crust? The buttery crust is phenomenal. I'm not sure what cheeses they use but it had a tangy flavor. I was pleased with the taste but very unhappy with the price.

21.description: This pizzeria is a hidden gem.  The deep dish pizza is delicious--has a perfect balance of crust thickness, sauce, cheese.  The giardiniera they use is perfect.  And delivery time is very quick! Three thumbs up.

17.description: It's been said that there really is no such thing as bad pizza. Wrong! The deep dish pizza we ordered had all the qualities of a good pizza except flavor. Had I been blindfolded & fed a bite of it, I don't believe I would have been able to guess what it was.

10.description: Decided to try them for delivery the other day. And boy am I glad I did. Their butter crust thin crust is amazing and I'm *that* guy who has had like 100 different kinds of pizza in this area.Light, buttery, delicious, reheats well AND they beat the delivery estimate significantly and the delivery guy was friendly. Pizza arrived hot and I was offered extra parm and peppers at my door.This will be a staple. But get the butter crust. And cheaper and better than Lou's. Can't wait to try a deep dish after I gym off the holiday...

5.description: Just had a delivery & these guys were quickI ordered a personal sized deep dish and my fiancé ordered the Gyro sandwich.  The pizza was cute & Delish  Had a yummy butter crust.  While the Gyro was a little skimpy on meat & fries it was delicious as well We will order from here again

3.description: Love their butter crust pizza. Fast delivery,  order is always hot. Definitely my new go-to neighborhood pizza place!

35.description: Just ordered pizza salad and fried mushrooms. Delivery order said 45-1hour. Hour and half later, pizza arrived cold mushrooms bland and cold. Defiantly won't order from here again.

19.description: I've ordered pizza a couple of times now from them. I've only had the thin crust.  It is a solid "good". It is worth it to pay extra for the butter crust, it really does give more flavor.  I would probably rate this a star higher if the sauce had a bit more flavor.  It is a little bland, but I would pick this place any day over a large chain pizza place, you know who I mean.

28.description: Decided to try them for delivery the other day. And boy am I glad I did. Their butter crust thin crust is amazing and I'm *that* guy who has had like 100 different kinds of pizza in this area.Light, buttery, delicious, reheats well AND they beat the delivery estimate significantly and the delivery guy was friendly. Pizza arrived hot and I was offered extra parm and peppers at my door.This will be a staple. But get the butter crust. And cheaper and better than Lou's. Can't wait to try a deep dish after I gym off the holiday...

45.description: Ordered the deep dish and was pretty disappointed. The butter crust was pretty good, a good amount of cheese, but it was really runny. We cut into it and the sauce ran all over the place. It looks like someone dumped a can of tomatoes on it with all the juice. The sauce was also very bland and tasteless and wasn't helped by the small amount of parmesan that came with it. I don't think I'll be ordering from them with all the other great places in Chicago. The great reviews are probably written by relatives because all true Chicagoans know better.

33.description: Just discovered this place and I'm glad I did! Very good thin crust pizza, butter crust as well. The pizza reminded me very much of some of my favorite places as a kid, and the crust was perfect, nice and crisp. The delivery was right on time, only an hour, and the delivery guy was super friendly. Great pizza, great quality, great price.

43.description: Great pizza~ Seriously excellent! It was a nice change from Lou Malnati's and the usual Chicago suspects. Don't get me wrong - I love the other deep dish pizzas out there. But there's something different about the crust here. And the service (yes, this is HUGE for me) was great. The owner really cares about his (and his restaurant's) reputation. He goes the extra mile.

2.description: Chicago Deep Dish open late  fountain drinks and cans

18.description: The pizza had absolutely no flavor. Had to add salt and garlic powder just to taste something, anything. Really surprising considering the yelp reviews were mostly good.

41.description: I ordered from here because the famous pizza place who's name starts with and "L" refused to deliver to my house even though I live 2 miles away. Time and Time again this joint puts out an amazing product. Their deep dish buttercrust is amazing and affordable. Their thin crust with fermented dough... OUTSTANDING, better than Home Run Inn. tonight I will be watching a WWE PPV and enjoying a wonderfully tasting and piping hot pizza from Nueva, and I will be using *Yelp to order it again. Thanks know you for serving up one of the best pies on the north side of Chicago!

52.description: I've only ordered from Nueva once, but it has instantly become my favorite pizza place. I absolutely love their butter crust, as well as everything else about this incredible pizza. That said, I will admit to those of you that aren't sure about butter crust that some of the folks that shared this pizza with me were not impressed. I personally think they might be a few screws loose, but I thought it would only be fair to share the whole story. I can't wait for my next pizza night!

50.description: I have never posted a bad review and don't like to do so. It should be noted I have had pizza for 13 straight meals. Besides the Australian "No Frills" frozen brand this was my least pizza of all time.

4.description: First time ordering was today.  New FAVORITE place for thin crust pizza.  Butter crust is very tasty.  Order delivered hot and the delivery person was very polite.  Even held a short conversation other than just asking for money (always a nice touch).  Kudos folks!  You have earned a customer.

6.description: First time ordering from here. I ordered a 6" personal veggie deep dish pizza (with butter crust) and a pre packaged slice of original cheesecake. The delivery was faster than most places that make deep dishes and the delivery guy was super nice! I mixed up the delivery address but he still came through without any complaints! Thank you for that. As for the taste. It looks and smells like a delicious veggie pizza topped with spinach, mushrooms, green peppers, and tomatoes. The ingredients taste very fresh. The pizza was not soggy at all considering all the other places that I've ordered from. They nicely wrap the pizza in some type of wax paper and put inside the box! Sure this place isn't like any of the fancier end deep dished places but there is something about the pizza that was both satisfying but also lacking some flavor.Nonetheless! The prices are unbeatable and I'm sure I'll be back to try their thin crust cheese pizza and perhaps even pasta. Super adorable and I ordered through eat24.

22.description: Love this pizza! Every time I order I eat at least half of an extra large. I've had the regular thin crust and whole wheat thin crust. Both are excellent; crispy, robust, flavorful. This is a small business where the owners obviously work hard and care about their product. I'm moving out of Rogers Park, but I know I will be frequently making excuses to go through and pick up a pizza. Sidebar to the lazy shut ins who order delivery for every meal: stop crying so much about how long delivery takes and put your shoes on. Half of the content on Yelp is suddenly a bunch of whiners sniveling about how the $2 order of fries they had delivered showed up late and soggy.

15.description: OMG, The Best Pizza Ever. We always get the thin crust with the BUTTER CRUST. Fabulous!!! They have amazing sausage, We also love the garden salad with their homemade dressing.I will not get pizza anywhere else, except here. We just get delivery, though they have  place to sit don.

57.description: The deep dish small personal pizza is super awesome! Also, the price for a six pack of soda shows you that they make money off their food and not the sides. I also like the Caesar salad. Very very good. My old criticism is that they open on weekdays at 3. Lunch hours??

20.description: OMG, The Best Pizza Ever. We always get the thin crust with the BUTTER CRUST. Fabulous!!! They have amazing sausage, We also love the garden salad with their homemade dressing.I will not get pizza anywhere else, except here. We just get delivery, though they have  place to sit don.

36.description: Have ordered this pizza before using the GRUB hub service. It is a good pizza. However, tonight is like no other night. Here is the order of events646 - Order placed on grubhub647 - recieved confim email. Initial time 800 - 810 752 - Update to delivery time moved to 825 - 835825 - called in to store and the person on the phone looked up my info and pizza and determined that the "pizza was not in the store, SORRY".  I said ill wait longer.850 - Called again, spoke with same lady, said the "pizza was not in store" again.I asked to speak with the manager. When speaking to the manager I first got the "its backed up" excuse. I understand. Then when she asked if i ordered from grub hub after looking it up in the system. She told me that grub hub made an error and was sending out wrong times. Then I was told that the drivers were taking 3 orders at a time and only to certin areas.Here is the kicker. When asked her if she likes cold pizza and informed her that i dont like cold pizza she said I would only be able to get 10% off the price. Then with a little more emphasis about my concern of cold pizza I was told the best i could get would be a 52% discount once the pizza arrived.1025 - STILL NO PIZZA!I just looked the place up and according to googlemaps it is 1.5 miles away. Had I Only known.Update1030 called again. Talked with lady, she looked up my order again and said it was no longer in the store and she didnt know where it was. I asked her "isthe driver hitting the bong on the side of the road" "I paced my order at 646 and it is going on 4 hours" I am trying to keep my cool at this point and I ask to speak with the manger who i spoke with before and was told "she is out doing delivery". Then I asked "who is in charge" She said she is the "only one". I said think about it "waiting 4 Hours"Then some guy in the background was talking to her and she asked what pizza i orderd. The guy said that he "never made one with BBQ sauce"So after being LIED to over and over. They are going to make it right now and deliver it for free.I am reasonable to a point. That way I dont look like an ass for flipping out over nothing. If i was told that they didnt make the order from the get go and they would get it done right away I would have been fine with that. It is the LIES, LIES, LIES.

14.description: Pizza is an art... you have to have the right sauce, the right crust, and it has to be cooked just right (not over and not under). It's tough to find a good pizza place, despite the fact that most every place claims they're "world famous."Nueva Italy is actually pretty awesome. It's not the best you'll ever have, but it's pretty damn good. It's delicious upon delivery, it's great reheated, and best of all - they always beat their delivery estimate.Is it the best pizza I've ever had? No. Will I order it again and again and again? Definitely.

28.description: You are at the mercy of the kitchen, which is a good thing.  I will admit that you might define it as inconsistent because the guac or salsa tastes a little different depending on who makes it, but it's never been anything less than delickious. I could bathe in the salsa verde and their coffee is perfect in my book. Al Pastor burritto or taco never dissapoint nor does the Chicken fajita and Carne Asada. One of these day's I'll try the ceviche and the soup that looks amazing but I haven't ordered because I almost always get the fajita served with rice and beans (I have the hold the beans on my order - I'd rather not have them served since I shouldn't eat them and I do NOT want to waste them). Did I mention I can be full on half the dinner plate, and take the leftovers for lunch? I moved to Rogers Park last fall and every time I walked past it was packed with families at all hours of the day or evening so I knew it had to be good. What makes it dangerous for me is that the prices are so affordable.

1.description: Gave this another try because my go to place was inexplicably closed. The staff was all hanging around the jukebox and goofing around. The girl who took my order could not have cared less that I was there. I ordered a beef burrito and in a world it was TERRIBLE. I didn't even finish it. The beef was like a paste. At first I thought there were potatoes in my burrito, but it was the tomatoes. They had the consistency of potatoes.  of it was earlier I would have gone back and asked for a refund, but if just rather starve than ever go back there.

9.description: Side note: Yelp has this place under two different addresses, it's the same place but this is its current location.This place was authentic and affordable although a bit light on the vegetarian options. I loved the chips and three types of salsa plus beans that they give you. My boyfriend had the vegetarian burrito, a little greasy but full of veggies. I had lengua, al pastor and carne asana tacos, all of which were good. The food was ready quickly. The horchata was especially cinnamony and good. Everything was solid, including the service, and I would recommend this place if you're in Evanston.

29.description: Having just moved to Rogers Park, I was eager find the best Mexican food among the many taquerias that line Clark St. near our condo. I decided to try El Pueblito first since it is closest to us... I may not need to look any further.First, let me say that I judge all Mexican food by the "La Juanita's Standard". La Juanita's was the sole authentic Mexican restaurant in my hometown in IA. There may or may not have been illegal drug trade going on in the basement, but I can always put my morals aside for some shrimp cocktail with avocado! Everything on their handwritten menu board was perfect and I have been hard pressed to anything that lives up to the "La Jua's Standard" since... until now.Let's start with the chips. I hate hard, thick and burnt tasting tortilla chips... which I sometimes feel is the industry standard at these type of places. However, El Pueblito's chips were a) fresh out of the fryer and still piping hot, b) thin and delicate, and c) perfectly salted; everything that one could ask for in a tortilla chip. Next, the guacamole, which! I am pretty picky about because I can make a mean guac myself, however!, this guac sent me to the 10th level of heaven. It was perfectly, salted, limed, spiced and went amazingly well with the chips. Tacos: I had al pastor, barbacoa, beef and chorizo, all amazing, though the barbacoa is what I would revisit first. Each taco filling was grilled with onion and topped with cilantro. Everything was made fresh and the tacos weren't too soggy or greasy, which is a common problem at some taquerias. El, Pueblito, you are batting 1000.I also tried a few bites of Sope, which included fresh lettuce, tomato, sour cream and cheese and I was not let down; just as tasty as the tacos.Additionally, the salsas were wonderful (we were given more than enough red and green salsa with our order) and a side order of rice and beans is more than enough for two to three people (and also yummy).The decor inside the restaurant is decent, your typical storefront Mexican fare, but they do feature some amazingly tacky but wonderful artwork. My favorite features an Aztec warrior (Montezuma?) carrying a nude (unconscious?) female to the top of a mountainside. Evidently, he means business.To wrap this long winded review up (my longest to date), I will definitely try other taqueria's in Rogers Park, but El Pueblito will always be my first love.

23.description: We took a VIP guest here, because 20 years ago he remembered eating at a Rogers Park Mexican restaurant with paintings of an Aztec rape scene in the foyer. We found this place, which looks like a hole in the wall, but had two rape paintings! It turned out to not be the same restaurant, but had inherited (or something?) the paintings.They didn't serve alcohol, but allowed us to bring in wine. The food was authentic and amazing! The salsas were delicious, aside from a queso dip that tasted odd. The bean dip was great, too.We ordered carne asada, chicken taquitos, and chicken with mole sauce. Very, very highly recommended. Even the picky eaters among us were pleased.

5.description: This place is horrible!! The service is horrible. Our server was a young girl with glasses and she never checked on us, never refilled our water and took forever to give us our check. The food was dry. My girlfriend specifically said no lettuce in her tacos and I wanted cheese and sour cream in my burrito. It had maybe a drop of sour cream. Definitely never come back here. Hidalgos down the street is so much better.

31.description: [[I initially posted this review under the wrong restaurant name... and lost all my FUCs!]]This review is for one incredibly delicious burrito with salsa verde.It was the most fully-loaded veg burrito I've ever squeezed. I didn't expect mushrooms and roasted peppers. I was so pleased.

25.description: The first thing I will say about this place is that you should NOT park in the adjacent lot...your car will be booted.  Easy enough parking is possible on Clark Ave. at the meters.  You have been warned.  Another warning I will post here is that the salsas are super hot... flavorful, but hot...so gringo's you have been warned!  Now, on to my review:   Certified real Mexican here (yes, I came with a stamp), certifying that yes, this place does have real/authentic Mexican food.  Not the best Mexican food around, but pretty good for this side of town and good enough to keep me coming back more than once.  The typical Mexican fare is offered here...tacos, burritos, etc.  However, this place also offers some more off the beaten path items that cater more towards the Mexican clientele.  They do have seafood and coctel de camarones (shrimp cocktails), and will even make you sopes and other items even if they're not on the menu.  The waitresses are nice, and yes, they also speak English.  The portions are generous, and the food comes out quick for the most part.  This is a good hole in the wall place to come to if you're in the area.  Though, I will say you should try more off the beaten path items if you're here and explore a little.  Dulcelandia is conveniently located next door for your sweet tooth needs.  Mmm..candy.

12.description: Worst place I've visited by far. First of the last two times I visited them I found a hair in my food. The first time, when I told the lady she didn't even apologize nor mention anything about exchanging it! When I got fully charged for it...Second time same thing a hair and my food and to add a plus it was darn cold. Never visited this place after that and never will. Staff is terribly bad, not friendly at all, and let's not mention the way they dress...I mean it is a family place to eat so they should be dressed appropriate at least!!!!!

21.description: Service:  GoodFood:  V. GoodPrice:  ReasonableDecor:  Just the way I like itBYOBC asked for vegetarian tacos, which were not on the menu, but the cook whipped together a nice pair using beans, rice, tomatoes, cilantro, etc.  I had the Tacos al pastor.  Very tasty.  The restaurant has a home spun atmosphere.  We'll be back.  And I'm having the pineapple juice again.

16.description: I am a big GrubHub person and used to order from here all the time. It seems that over the past year their food quality has dropped and that they have acquired some rather lazy delivery people that take advantage of tip being prepaid. Whoever has been taking the GrubHub orders is not reading the specifics. My last 3 orders have been screwed up ..and since I am too lazy or hungry to complain, I pick around and eat it. If it wasnt so cheap I would stop ordering. If you want delivery, do it around dinner time, it seems that is the best time of day for food and delivery service!

17.description: Food was ok, I've had better Mexican. Service was poor, server was new and the only person to serve & ring up the whole place. Young Lady didn't know the menu or the style of drinks they served. I asked for apple soda and she said they didn't have it. When I walked to the restroom I saw it.

10.description: The salsas are some if the best I've had and the tongue taco has been my favorite dish so far. Excellent authentic Mexican food. It's overall a pretty tasty place and open late. Not spectacular, and not as good as my favorite place in Pilsen, but it's close to home.

11.description: Decent, but not the quality one can find elsewhere very close by. The tacos and enchiladas were ok, the enchiladas being a bit greasy perhaps. My wife had carnitas once that were incredible, but this seemed to be a fluke, as two further tries yielded disappointing results. The girl at the register is always frumpy, too.Look, I can throw a stone from the doorway of El Pueblito and hit 9 other taquerias. When there is this much competition, you had better be amazing, or at least do one dish amazingly, to garner repeat business. I think they've seen the last of my taco money.

26.description: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago right now (though I want to try a lot more of the ones lined up on Clark north of Andersonville), I want to come here all the time.Love the salsas and bean dip, the tortas and tacos, everything I've had here. I'm vegetarian and always ask for a meat-free version of everything, with veggies and avocados, and every time it comes out amazing, filling, delicious, and so cheap.It feels like later at night this place turns into a surprising date place, where couples stop by on their way home from somewhere for yummy food. At least that's what we were doing the other day at 10:30pm or so, and every table was taken up by couples having late dinner for a few bucks. I guess it's romantic in its very own way.

27.description: The burritos from this place almost surely would taste better after a few beers--that's the type of place this is.  The meat in the steak burrito inevitably contains more than a few chewy, inedible pieces.  That's never a good thing.However, this place scores points for authenticity:  it's real Mexican food, prepared by Mexicans for a largely Hispanic clientele.  Plus the prices are right, and if you're hungry late at night, or need to grab a quick dinner in Rogers Park, this place satisfies.

0.description: This place is solid, and has become my default to-go Mexican. There are a ton of places on N Clark here in Rogers Park, so I started down the row and tried several. I stopped the search with El Pueblito because the el pastor (spicy pork) burrito is flavorful and huge and $6. The guac and chips is fresh and just right. And I can't get enough of the habanero orange sauce stuff. Service here is quick and helpful. I called the other day and a friend on a gluten thing needed only steak, avocado and cheese, and I just explained they had no problem just making something up.They've struggled to get their menu online - the one posted here at Yelp and linked via Google is generic and wrong. I finally posted some photos of the menu here. Not great photos, but better than what Yelp has. I'm definitely supporting this place.

20.description: Just not a fan. Nothing about this place is stellar. We walked in on a random Friday night. There might have been 1 family sitting at a table, but otherwise the place was pretty empty. Especially knowing this, the service was not great. It took a while for anyone to acknowledge us and, subsequently, to serve us. Really?Like other Mexican restaurants, they provide complimentary chips and salsa before the meal. Here, they have 3 different salsas: orange, green and red. WARNING!! THE ORANGE IS PURE HABANERO. There was no explanation what anything was when it was placed before us (which is normally fine bc we're adventurous eaters), but with something as dangerously hot as that orange salsa, there needs to be a warning. LET THIS BE YOUR WARNING!!!! Especially since you likely won't get water (or any other bebida) for 5-10 minutes to try to put those flames out.All this aside, I looked forward to the simple tacos and ceviche we ordered. Once our taste buds came back online, we tasted our food. Nothing to write home about. Maybe we didn't order the item off the menu, but tacos are simple and classic and a staple. These should be some of the best things on the menu, in my opinion, but it was all lackluster.My suggestion: try one of the numerous other Mexican places on Clark.

19.description: Just not a fan. Nothing about this place is stellar. We walked in on a random Friday night. There might have been 1 family sitting at a table, but otherwise the place was pretty empty. Especially knowing this, the service was not great. It took a while for anyone to acknowledge us and, subsequently, to serve us. Really?Like other Mexican restaurants, they provide complimentary chips and salsa before the meal. Here, they have 3 different salsas: orange, green and red. WARNING!! THE ORANGE IS PURE HABANERO. There was no explanation what anything was when it was placed before us (which is normally fine bc we're adventurous eaters), but with something as dangerously hot as that orange salsa, there needs to be a warning. LET THIS BE YOUR WARNING!!!! Especially since you likely won't get water (or any other bebida) for 5-10 minutes to try to put those flames out.All this aside, I looked forward to the simple tacos and ceviche we ordered. Once our taste buds came back online, we tasted our food. Nothing to write home about. Maybe we didn't order the item off the menu, but tacos are simple and classic and a staple. These should be some of the best things on the menu, in my opinion, but it was all lackluster.My suggestion: try one of the numerous other Mexican places on Clark.

2.description: One of the most consistently terrific Mexican restaurants in the neighborhood. Delicious salsas, top notch al pastor... And I salivate uncontrollably just thinking of their huevos rancheros. A *million* thumbs up.

32.description: we stopped here on our way to visit friends up north and i must say i was surprised, its actually not bad!

18.description: We took a VIP guest here, because 20 years ago he remembered eating at a Rogers Park Mexican restaurant with paintings of an Aztec rape scene in the foyer. We found this place, which looks like a hole in the wall, but had two rape paintings! It turned out to not be the same restaurant, but had inherited (or something?) the paintings.They didn't serve alcohol, but allowed us to bring in wine. The food was authentic and amazing! The salsas were delicious, aside from a queso dip that tasted odd. The bean dip was great, too.We ordered carne asada, chicken taquitos, and chicken with mole sauce. Very, very highly recommended. Even the picky eaters among us were pleased.

13.description: Stopped in after a late shift at work for the first time a few nights ago on a whim. Glad I did! I ordered my food to go and traveled about 2 miles on a scooter and my food held up and stayed warm. Ordered a steak burrito, steak gordita, and treated myself to flan. The food was pretty tasty and filling. Although, I wasn't a fan of how rich the flan was, but some people might like that. I noticed that they had all of my favorite hot sauces on every single table. I always gauge a restaurant based on their chili/hot sauces and if I see Cholula (which I did), then I know the place is usually going to be good. I don't really recommend coming to this place as late as I did because when I left there were about 5 police cars and 8 officers across the street. Maybe it was a good thing? Since they didn't seem to have anyone under custody, but they might have also been waiting for something to go down (it is in the heart of Rogers park). All in all, don't let that detour you, I can't wait to go back and try the other items and the Horchata. This place is very clean, reasonable with pricing and the woman who took my order was kind. I'll be back with friends!

4.description: Barbecue tacos are good.  Burritos are rather bland and a bit on the small side.  Chorizo was overcooked.  They have 3 salsas.  Red is smoky and delicious.  Green is ok.  Orange has some good kick, but is nasty like fake nacho cheese.  Service is marginal.  They have kids working in every facet of the business.  Some high schooler was working on the grill and the girl serving us had braces and couldn't have been more than 13-14.

24.description: I'm sorry, I just can't agree with the rest of the reviewers.  This place is not horrible, but in this massive city full of taquerias, I have to be fair, and there are so many better ones out there.  I really just wasn't happy with most of my meal.  The three salsas were just so so, and had a really weird consistency.  I've had blended salsas before, but something about these just wasn't right, and there wasn't a lot of flavor.  The chips were bland.   (I did like that they served a plate of beans with the salsas though, you don't see that often and I love beans...) I ordered flautas, which may not have been the best idea, but they came out swimming in sour cream, it was really kind of gross how much there was.  Inside the filling wasn't great either, it had no flavor.  The rice and beans were the best part of my meal.  But I will say, it was cheap and I still cleaned my plate.  Our waitress was really nice, and the food came out fast.  If a friend wanted to eat here I'd go with to try something else.  It seems like they specialize in seafood, so I'd want to give it a try sometime.  But I probably won't be going back here on my own...

6.description: when I die bury me with the habanero salsa

22.description: Really, really good food. Like, really good. It's kind of dingy-looking, and they don't serve alcohol, but holy hell. It's delicious.

15.description: This place is exactly what you think it is. Great food, fast, cheap, nice people. The gorditas are ridiculous: $3.50 for a freaking full belly! Salsas are great. Kinda weird cafeteria ambience but I usually order take out anyway.

7.description: 5 stars for their Horchata, good stuff!

8.description: This place has been hit or miss for me, so I stick to my favorite dishes: enchiladas or fajitas mixtas. The restaurant is always clean, parking can be difficult, service can be spotty. But the portions are generous so there is always leftovers!

30.description: husband and i are eating the taquerias on clark, devon north.el pueblito is the 3rd we've hit so far. this time we took anne and owens.Our first sit down taqueria. with menu and waitress.Served chips with red and green salsa (per usual) but this time with beans. The salsas were creamy. And spicy.the beans were pretty dull, but a nice coolant after the salsa.The waitress spoke english well and was very friendly and helpful.Ordered guacamole and got a giant plate of very fresh guac. Could've had more flavor (onion, lime, garlic, etc.) but it was good, obviously fresh, warm, both creamy and chunky.Loud Mexican music sporatically.Dcor gaudy, but fun. Titty. Eclectic. Clean.Owens had the chicken enchilada suiza. No gristle. Good sauce. Said he'd eat it again.Anne had the 3 taco plate with pollo, asada and pastor. Liked it. Asada chopped up small again. Said she felt it was even parent friendly. Good enough for that.Husband had a lengua gordita, pastor taco and queso fundido with chorizo.He'd never had lengua. Wouldn't have it again. not el pueblito's fault.Pastor amazing. Chorizo lovely. Not spicy. Could be a little more spicy. But flavorful. Cinnamon. And he was served a lot. Took some home.I had a pastor taco. Again, lovely. A conchinita taco. The pork was beautiful, but sooooo spicy. waitress warned me beforehand. But the pork itself very flavorful and pulled, not chopped like at el chorrito. And I had a picadillo gordita. It's presented kinda like a sandwich, but with knife and fork. 2 thick masa rounds (sweet almost) and in between is sour cream, beans, lettuce and ground beef. Too much lettuce. I'd ask for no lettuce next time, but the beef was really good. salty. grilled. You could taste the char on it. Onions in there. Very nice. Best picadillo I've had so far. Good quality meat. Would definitely eat here again.

3.description: The most dope fajitas I've ever had, even the vegetables were tasting as good as the meat. Open late, juke box and good service. Loved it.

14.description: Awesome Mexican food.... Really Mexican!   Not like Don Pablo's or Taco Bell.   They make homemade tortilla and corn.  Highly recommended!  I had mole bone chicken.  Really good!!!!

29.description: This place rocks!! Its a great late night spot.  They have plenty of dart boards and a pool table.   Gigi is solid behind the bar and runs a tight ship so you'll find none of the normal riffraff common in late night spots.  Plus they sell booze to go til 4am sun-fri...5am Sat.  Stop by for a 3.50 becks tallboy next time youre in Rogers Park.

42.description: Kinda yucky but hey it is cheap and they have lots of stuff to keep you entertained: pool (pricy), darts, video bowling and a pretty good jukebox.Oh my husband is always raving about the ice in the urinals.

23.description: Oasis reminds me of a bar in the movies where the blue collar lead actor goes to drink his sorrows away after a breakup or career disaster - no music or TVs, just a stool, bar tender, and the drink.  I walked down to this place on a whim to grab a quick drink and was pleasantly surprised. While this is VERY much a local dive bar, the staff was friendly and there are a couple of pool tables.  There is almost a depressing atmosphere at times but you can't get a better price for a drink. Note: while they don't have food, you can order delivery to the bar.

47.description: It's THE Rogers Park 4am bar.I'll see you there.

8.description: It's the place you go to meet and hang out with your neighbors. And Sunday night Karaoke is a blast.

31.description: I hate to admit this, but 13 years ago I walked into this bar and after a few drinks I thought, "I hope I never become a sad pathetic regular like these sacks of flesh who have lost all hope, drinking away the reality of their useless existence until the florescent lighting becomes the sun they shield their eyes from."*sigh*13 years later...This is a neighborhood bar. It's a dive. Either you get it or you don't. You don't go here on dates. You don't go here for pleasantries or a spot of tea. It's a 4 o'clock bar with cheap beer. Gigi is absolutely outstanding and if you are a decent human being, you'll be treated as such. If you're an obnoxious a-hole, she'll tell you where you can go. Nicely and politely, of course - in a loud, shrill Cuban kind of way.I have met a variety of people in this bar. I met my first dysfunctional relationship. I met three of my very best friends still to this day. The women's bathroom is only one stall and god forbid a gaggle of sorostitutes manage to shove themselves in before you can empty your bladder. The men's room is scary - it just is. But there's a pool table, dart boards, a juke box and 4 out of 5 good, funny, and decent bartenders. Sometimes, they even have LIVE entertainment! Crackhead Tuesdays are always a blast when you're trying to have a cigarette outside and then you get to watch the door guy yelling at a hobo/prostitute/crackhead/all of the above to leave you alone to finish said smoke. Honestly, it's got its own strange Twilight Zone kind of ambiance. Either you get it or you don't. If you want something pretty, go downtown. ps - In regard to other reviews - sadly, I believe I know who is responsible for previous mention of gay-bashing. Not trying to be ambassador or diplomat, but that is only one person. I guarantee that other bartenders or patrons do not feel the same way nor would they approve of or tolerate that behavior.

34.description: If you live in the neighborhood and need a bar that is open till 4am most nights....then here it is.....but don't be impressed when you walk in...it totally defines a "hole in the wall" bar....dark dingy with an old musty smell...be fore wared about their beers on tap....depending on which line is hooked up to what tap you just might get something that tastes like moss beer....your better off spending a few extra dollars on bottles and saving your taste buds....darts are free but pool isn't....you might have to wait several hours for the table as there are no time limmits to who has the table....but don't be afraid to ask to jump in on the rotation....9 times out of 10 you'll get in.....overall I really would rather go home and sit my ass on the couch to drink some beers....I find that the only times I do go are when friends are already there....

16.description: Oasis is as close to the very best of old-school Chicago neighborhood dives as you'll find anymore. Please, let me tell you a story.My housemate and I had just moved into town turn of the millennium, and we were still partying something awful. We had a directory of places to hit between the Gold Coast and Rogers Park even before getting here, and we'd have probably missed this place, only a few blocks away from home, were it not for the neon beer signs in the window and the line to the carry-out booth at the front of the bar.In contrast to the fancy bars and clubs we'd been hitting up, this place was a dive, and a lively one. Sports played on the small screen TVs over the rectangle bar island in the middle of a smoky room, with three or four hardcore bartenders, in particular Gigi, who could project her voice across the noisiest crowd. If you acted like a halfway decent human being, she'd treat you with class; if you were a jerk, she let you know. Even crowded, if you sat at the bar and your glass or bottle was almost empty, one of the tenders, especially Gigi, checked if you were ready for another one.Drunks pelted darts at the boards, pinball machines pinged in the corner, the pool table held its own court, and after dark the place was standing-room stumbling until 4AM (5AM on Saturdays). Though clearly Bears and Cubs biased, this was a hockey bar in the Bill Wirtz era; there were as many Red Wings fans here as Blackhawks fans, and a Wings game could be caught consistently. They sold cheap beer buckets, inexpensive highballs and shots, basic smokes and fancy flavored tins of Camels; some of the regulars created clouds with cigars.That first night, my buddy and I had been at it the whole evening and were louder and wobblier than we probably should have been; before the evening was up, we found a large bouncer with thick glasses and a goatee standing behind us, and he let us know it was time for us to go. "What?" I slurred back. "You guys have had enough," he said, non-judgementally but with finality. "You're welcome back tomorrow night, but you gotta go tonight." His cool delivery inspired us to cooperate without hard feelings, and we did go back. Many times, for many years. I took friends, co-workers up to this place. It lived up to its late-night dive legend and everyone loved it as much as I did.Flash forward, right past 9/11, right past a recession, and the Illinois smoking ban.My housemate and myself pretty much got it all out of our system. We almost never go to bars anymore; no time, no inclination. On the rare occasion when we had the next day off and felt like getting out for the house, the last watering hole standing in our book was Oasis. Our most recent visit, the pool table was unmanned, one of the well-worn dartboards was subject to some aiming under the influence, and only about eight seats at the bar were populated. The smoky haze is gone, giving the place a cleaner feel, enhanced by replacement of the old TV tubes with brightly colored flat screens, still playing ESPN. Gigi's still there, manning the bar solo that night; she greeted us as we pushed through the swing doors and had our chilled glasses and tall boys on the bar before we settled into our stools (drinks are still cheap here; the tall cans are a deal).Joint thinly crowded, the jukebox, replaced by a digital player, still pumped out the same analog electric classic rock (which, by now, are probably golden oldies). We were still welcome to puff on our e-cigarettes (vapor, no smoke) while enjoying cold suds. Gigi held court, holding conversation from the center of the bar, and before long everyone sitting there were all talking across the place about everything from the Mayors Daley (Jr. and Sr.) to development around the Loyola campus (she literally introduced everyone at the bar to each other by name). I think she caught me eyeing the cylinder of pretzels by the register; before I even said anything, she scooped up a handful of sticks and served them in a cup between our glasses (alas, the bar pizzas are no more, but the pretzels are free).Then around two o'clock, things picked up with the younger crowd filing in, looking to continue their buzzes from the closing bars about the neighborhood (particularly Hamilton's down the street). Somehow, though the Loyola University kids have the normal personality disorders to get out of their youthful systems, they're not as obnoxious as your typical college crowd. I enjoyed watching the activity build, the dartboards feeling some love, the pool table finally being played, but finally it was time to go."Good night, gentlemen," Gigi's voice projected over the noisy rejuvenation of the bar. "Don't wait so long before coming back!"I would rate a good dive bar a three, with a smile. Oasis is special enough to rate four stars, just by virtue of the longevity of its unique personality. That fifth star is for Gigi. Some Chicago traditions die hard; thank God she lives on.

13.description: I give one star for cheap beer. Otherwise, yikes just yikes. Sketchy escapees from the local mental institution wander around asking for beer. Some guy was bothering our table and the "bouncer" moved him two stools away from us, where he continued to bother us. One of the rudest bartenders I have ever met. She should go back under her bridge if she doesnt like people. Pool is expensive. No music playing. Oddly lit. Rude service. Realllllly sketchy crowd. This was the only bar we could find open in Rogers Park and the visit was still regrettable.

11.description: Here's how I remember the Oasis:#1 Gigi#2 Wayne (at the door with the cheap sportcoat)#3 Carry-outs too late for anyone's good#4 A jukebox that played the entire side 1 of RUSH's 2112 for a quarter (sorry Gigi)#5 Huge Jagermeister and Jack Daniels shots#6 Smoke thick like paste Back in the late 1980s the Oasis was one place to be after 2AM for Loyolans.  And, seems it still is.Back then most of us were normal college kids by day, doing what college kids did.  At night, we were vampires of East Rogers Park.  We toggled deftly between the college bars (Pumping Company, Hamiltons, Loyola Sports Bar, etc) and the local dives (Oasis, Bruno's, Lighthouse, etc), as comfortable in the latter set as the former. After graduation Rogers Park remained my "home" for some years, as it did (and, does, I imagine) for many Loyolans drawn  in by the weirdly eclectic city neighborhood.  And the Oasis remained a part of my routine for those years.  Those were great days indeed.  We carried on without a care, as if the clock's hands would never catch up with us.  Alas.Fast forward almost twenty years.  The old LU crew splintered long ago.  Life's paths has carried us to distant places, geographic and otherwise.  I don't even drink any more.  That may beg the question, "why would I write a review of a bar when I no longer drink?"  To that I would say, because the Oasis is the "O"  tab in the rolodex of my life.  That may beg the next question, "where's the actual review?"  Hell if I know.  I'm just rambling.

39.description: Update: You've lost.

37.description: If you like:-Dive bars-Strange characters-Free darts-Bloody Marys at 4:59amThis place is for you.If you don't like all of the above.Go somewhere else.

0.description: It's been a few years since I've been here, but I loved it when I was in Chicago. Of course it's a dive bar, but that's why it's awesome. I remember multiple nights hanging out here playing pool. I don't remember it ever getting crowded. Bartender was very cool.It's the type of place that fosters friendly bar relationships, rather than dodging sweaty armpits in a sea of frat boys. I played many a game with random people during the transition period before relinquishing the pool table.And thus ends my review.

38.description: Quicktake: Part liquor store, part dive.  Lumpy dartboard and degenerate safehaven.After more popular Loyola bars such as Hamilton's close down, well then it's time for a drunken stumble off to Oasis.  When you walk in you will see their liquor store/bars and 40's and hard liquor bottled all shelved up.  The place has tile dirtier than an old tripped out Chinese restaurant.  You know it's crazy when the dartboards are lumpy.  Fortunately, there are about four or five dartboards if my drunken memory serves me correctly.  There is a radiator in the room to keep you warm during cold winters and the place is usually packed with neighborhood Loyola kids who are not very good at darts.As 4am bars go, this is one of the better ones, but nothing I'd go far out of my way for unless I had a hankering for some 4am darts.  Good luck finding parking, it is ridonk.

51.description: I've heard the phrase "...and I ended up at Oasis" so frequently that I can only assume that most people go here because "The O" is the few local bars open until 4am. This is the kind of neighborhood bar you visit after a night of partying in order to finish yourself off. Their pool table is rented by the hour, so it is almost impossible to get a game in the evening. Their urinals are exceptionally large, but the bathroom still smells like urine. Sorry, I like my dive bars, but this place makes my skin crawl.

27.description: Best 4 o'clock bar in East Rogers Park! A bit of a dive, but doesn't pretend that it's not. Great jukebox, darts, pool, supports local amateur sports teams, etc. Package sales too. And, did I say, open 'til 4AM (5AM on Sat.)? Full disclosure, I know the owners, but, I had these opinions even before I did. Say "Hi" to Gigi, the bartender!

32.description: Oasis is a bar in the Loyola/Rogers Park area on Sheridan. I would not call it a great destination, but if you are in the area you can have a cheap drink, play darts or shoot pool. The drinks are so cheap that I did not have to pay for one. One random dude even tried to buy me a drink but I declined (I'm not used to dudes buying me drinks) and I may have inadvertently insulted him for this action. Perhaps he was a regular who likes to buy cheap drinks for strangers. The juke box works and the men's room is fairly clean, so kudos for these amenities.

48.description: Ahh, the Oasis. The best dive bar in Rogers Park. I've been there when it's been jammed to the gills with Loyola students to quiet afternoons drinking cheap beer while editing a paper. It's a dive bar with dirty floors, great jukebox, and pool. The drinks are cheap and the tap is tapped well enough so the cheap beer doesn't suck. I used to go here late night after the regular downtown partying and for afternoons with a friend correcting my Master's Essay. Nothing like going over a paper and drinking down some good cheap beer to make graduate school a little more relaxed and laidback. It's a kickass dive bar and was only a few blocks away from where I lived. I went here the night before I moved with my dad, the connisseur of dive bars. It was my last hurrah for living in Rogers Park. It holds a special place in my heart.

44.description: To quote an eariler poster. . . "And I ended up at the Oasis"And, it was not as horrifying as I would have expected.  Only a few folks were present, the bartender was relatively attentive and I believe I have change from a $20.00I'll check after I dose myself with tylenol and a bucket on ice water.

24.description: Ok, so I have changed my mind about this place.  I've been coming here more often on Monday nights just to relax and knock back a few cheap ones while catching up on some reading or chit chatting with a few other local patrons on my night off.  The staff is as friendly as can be and are always fun to talk to.   Drink prices are right on compared to some of the other spots in the area and there are always good specials.Yeah the Oasis is a super mega dive and can be a bit of weird spot, but its grown on me.  I'll be coming back more often.

7.description: I came here a few months ago with two of my lady friends!! It was a disaster!!! We waited to play pool and asked the guys playing if they would let us play next. They told us sure the next game. Well after waiting two and a half hours they finally left and we went to play and I set my drink on the table for a second to rack the balls. One of the workers got rude with me telling me he told me not to put my drink on the table that I just got on. He then started to take the balls of the table being rude during the process!!! They do have really cheap drinks but the crowd is on the older side. Also if your looking just to get drunk and not enjoy your drink go here. The bartender over pours on the drinks extremely!! Also had no music playing during my stay there. This bar is right in the area that I live and I haven't been back since living here for almost a year!!!

49.description: Oh, the O.  Good "after bar" bar or if you want a drink without all the hassle of Hamilton's.  Yes, the crowd is sketch.  Yes, the bathrooms are gross.  But damn, it's cheap, good and has a jukebox.

40.description: I should be embarrassed to admit how many times I've closed this place down over the last year and a half.  There was a loyal crew of people that you KNEW you would see every Friday or Saturday night.  Hell, I have friends that I have honestly never seen sober because I always met them at the O.I should be more embarrassed to admit how many times I've walked in there with a book bag full of my own beer, got a glass from the bar to "split a pitcher" then proceeded to walk into the bathroom to crack open my illicit "book bag beer," take a few swigs and then pour it into the glass, magically leaving the bathroom with a full glass.  Truth is, I'm not embarrassed in the least.  I'm an asshole (who at the time had no job, so it was kind of excused) and The Oasis rules.  It's probably the place I miss most from Rogers Park.

53.description: I have dubbed this bar the sixth circle of hell. But my friends and I keep coming back. Possibly because it's open until 4-5am, drinks are cheap, and there is the potential of doing horrible damage to one's liver and future here."The O" is the kind of place that if you picked up a girl here, you wouldn't tell your friends about it as they wouldn't be able to look past the fact that you met in a dirty hole.The only saving grace about The O (apart from those mentioned above), is that the regulars are REALLY regular. It's like everyone within four blocks of the joint share the same living room and they meet there every day. Oh, and don't mess around with Gigi the bartender... she will win, you will lose.

30.description: This place is a decent dive bar. Gigi is cool and they have the biggest urinals in the city!

46.description: Are my eyes bleeding? No, I'm just in the Oasis. I would know this if I could see anything in this bar that so smokey it makes my high school art teacher smell clean. The drinks were cheap, but come on, Toto isn't in New York anymore. They weren't that much of a bargain. But the Oasis is open 'til 5 on Saturday night and there is plenty of room for you to finish out your pre-vomit drinking in fashionable un-style. Oh, don't forget the darts. You might end up with more than bleeding eyes.

1.description: Wish there was a way to provide negative stars!!-I think the bartender and one  of the patrons was in on this:I went to the washroom and upon returning to my seat,my money was missing,drink was gone,and they denied any knowledge  of this.No one else but these two scumbag regulars were here.Needless to say,I made my opinion known and was leaving,when the patron threatened me ,and said "His gang would handle this",and made a phonecall after throwing some hand-signal in the air.As I got outside,his gang friends pulled up and attacked me.Goodthing I know TaeKwonDo,because I beat them off of me,and fled.All of this because I wasn't  a regular crack-smokin scumbag.Stay Out!

9.description: Ah, the "O".   I can't tell you how many times I've found myself there playing darts at 4 AM on a Saturday night.    And not wussy electronic, I-don't-know-how-to-keep-score-so-I-pay-the-machine-to-do-it, boards.   Real bristle boards for real players.Staff is friendly and the beer is reasonably priced.

26.description: I'm a dive bar guy and Oasis is my favorite spot in the neighborhood. A real Cheers type place for regulars, and a fun stomping grounds if you're just passing through. Bar staff is solid. Free darts, plus a pool table, jukebox, karaoke once per week. Nothing fancy going on here, just a comfortable place. Open late. Watch out for the 2-4am crowd -- it gets crowded/sloppy quick because it's the last & latest bar open in the neighborhood.

25.description: During my recent search for a place here in RP, I ended up doing some day drinking at Oasis waiting to look at places. After a bit of skepticism when the bartender was scanning my ID and putting it on video, she opened up and we talked through 2 beers. Through my next two visits I got to know Michelle, the weekday bartender better and she is a sweetheart of a woman. I will definitely make it my late-night spot for that last drink.Why it gets 4:* Open late - 4 and 5 am* Nice owner (bought me a beer! and bartenders)* the 2nd biggest urinal I have ever pee'd in* Cheap 6-packs wrapped up (in ice, from Michelle) to go to the beach... but you didn't hear that from me...

12.description: God bless townie bars. Now, for those of you who don't know (which is... all of you), I grew up in a small town in Missouri. Everything closed at 9 p.m.--Except for you, Wal-Mart--and entertainment was slim for those of us who were old enough to drink, but young enough to manage multiple days of hangovers in a row. All we had were old fashioned townie bars and dives that dotted the spurs and side streets of our back-country roads. This bar is like a transplant of one of those nostalgia-triggering watering holes of my youth. I found this bar on accident late one Sunday night when I was out with me chums shredding some sweet riffs at a karaoke bar. Their night ended early (11:30, what??) and we scoured the internet looking for another place that did karaoke on a Sunday night. Oasis was the only one in RP that pulled a karaoke all-nighter, so off we went. Ladies and Gents, this place is divey as hell. Old school wrap-around bar setup, separate pool/dart area, classic arcade games, juke box, sports blaring from reitna-searing flatscreens above the bar, and absolutely zero pretension. My friends were put off by how townie and, yes, slightly grungy this place was, but my darling readers: THAT'S THE CHARM. This place is just a blue-collar-working-stiff-Norm-and-Jack-shootin-the-shit kind of bar. Not every place can--or should--be a Luxbar or a Sidetracks or any number of the other Gold Coast or Boystown shiny toy bars. The bartenders are attentive and kind, the drinks are affordable, even the karaoke isn't as invasive and watch-me-and-shut-up as most other places are. I applaud this joint. Is it slightly creepy? Sure. Has there most likely been a stabbing here at some point? Why not. Is there a really good chance that someone has shot up in the bathroom? Absolutely. But it's Rogers Park. The same can be said of the grocery store or a church.

21.description: First off, this place is what it is: a divey neighborhood bar with a package liquor stand. So long as that is what you are down for, you won't be disappointed. Went with a friend. Regulars were friendly enough, and the bartender was nice. Had some decent mid-range draft beers. Prices are a little on the steep side, but not so bad as to make you stop drinking. Dartboard, jukebox, all the standards. Nice place to see a friend and chat.

17.description: Ok, so I have changed my mind about this place.  I've been coming here more often on Monday nights just to relax and knock back a few cheap ones while catching up on some reading or chit chatting with a few other local patrons on my night off.  The staff is as friendly as can be and are always fun to talk to.   Drink prices are right on compared to some of the other spots in the area and there are always good specials.Yeah the Oasis is a super mega dive and can be a bit of weird spot, but its grown on me.  I'll be coming back more often.

10.description: Being new to Chicago, my wife and I couldn't have found a better neighborhood hangout.  No hipsters whatsoever !  Instead you are treated to a wide array of people from virtually every country you can think of. Some friends tried to steer me away because they claimed it can get shady at times but so far I haven't seen a problem.

5.description: Typical dive bar, with college kids playing pool and a jukebox. It's not a bad place but parking is horrible.
