3.description: A nicer of nice dive bars of Rogers Park.  Seated from my bar stool I inquired if they'd recently renovated or cleaned the place.  It was spic and span from top to bottom of the bar area.  Newly painted, cleaned venting and they spent an arm and a leg on their pool tables.  Which now require a deposit for play.  The reason being that they host pool tournaments for legit groups, so they have a professionally built table with custom balls and cues.Other offerings:  Big Buck Hunter World, Touchtunes, open till 4 am nightly & 5 am on Saturday nights.  "Packaged" bottles & beers for sale till close( youngins' this means you can take it to go).  They also offer free Wi-Fi & charging for your smart phones.  Either bring your own or hope they might have the right charger for you.The crowd is mixed depending on the time of day.  Sometimes random transient types or when school is in session Loyola students on the prowl.  Most weeks they offer karaoke and a DJ spinning on some certain day.  Call or stop in for details.  Most often they have daily specials on booze, beer and shots.  Their shots are huge, see the photos I've posted.  A decent selection of beers as well.  Oh and if you see Michelle one of the many nice bartenders, she's a sweetie, so be nice and say you heard about her on Yelp.  I think she might like the popularity.

35.description: That's right I'm bring up some "O" memories for the Loyolans. The Oasis was the dive of all dives and back in the day. It is where almost all of Loyola University and a few other like myself used to hang out... why you ask, because back in the day a little underage drinking couldn't hurt anybody. From the very few brain cells I left with every time, I recall they had 3 dart boards, a pool table, old/young degenerates everywhere, and a very small bar. Plus sides... open late and drinks are cheap. Lot's O memories!!

19.description: I shoot pool out of here for the APA, I know most of the bartenders, and it's cheap.  So, biased?  Perhaps, but you'll get that.It's a 4am bar, so after 2 it's a madhouse full of the drunk college students that just got kicked out of Hamilton's.  Before that though it's usually very chill.  4 dart boards, and a 7 1/2 foot pool table.  A bit of warning, lot of pool players there, so the table can get busy.  But if you want to play come on by, we like a challenge.Keep in mind Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday there is a pool league that plays out of there.  They are there every week, but if they are please don't ask to get on the table and then hover around like you're going to get next game, we don't usually end until 11 or later.It's a weird combination of locals bar and college bar - again, largely dependent on time of night.  I've been in there several times and you see some Loyola senior that just got dumped who's pouring over his Old Style - and right next to him is some old guy doing the same thing.  Weird, but usually a fun time.Just don't lock your bike up outside the bar, it will get stolen.

28.description: This place is great. Those who work here make it worthwhile. Perhaps it's just the self-entitled upper middle class types around the internet, but It's hard to believe a lot of the reviewers of Oasis actually live in a large metropolis and not, say, in an immaculate mall lobby somewhere in Palm Springs.Get a grip.It's a late night bar, so it's annoying as all get-out when drunk students flood in with all the grace and self-awareness of expiring mole crickets... but that's probably true of any place at 4:30am filled with people who think they need just one more before heading home.

45.description: Last night I was hit on by a very drunk women who charmed with her tales of time in prison.  She was later kicked out of the bar for reaching over the bar to get a glass.I love the Oasis.  $7 pitchers of Pabst, need I say more?

33.description: This place is open til 4am... that is about all I can say positive. After work and after the other bars we frequent close we come here. Drinks are pretty cheap and they have specials.. no food, but a juke box with lots of OLDIES... and a pool table. They get a little irritating with th wrong people.. I threw an ice cube at a friend (in the room by ourselves) and almost got kicked out and the dude that slapped my ass by the juke box didn't get anything (well he got a gift from me, but thats another review). Women don't go alone.. you will be sorry. Still smells of smoke and looks like a dive.. so YAY!!  Restrooms are surprisingly clean, but that may be cause no women frequent this place. Its always a blast and I never leave without a new story to tell..

43.description: Sad to say, I've been here too many times.  And once is already too many.Here's the scene: regulars that have been planted at the bar for almost 8 hours.  Sloppy drunk undergrads. And a weird mix of others that don't fit into those two categories--I always fit into the 3rd group and I'm usually happy to leave.But, it is the most convenient (possibly only) 4am bar in Rogers Park...and once you've made it to 2am at other places and you've still got energy to carry on that conversation, this is the place you go.  Like Meghan said, ending up at the "O" is both a win and a loss.  It's surely the symbol that your bed will be showing up in the immediate future.

2.description: The bartender's nice and the drinks are cheap. They have plenty of TVs. Some of the patrons, including ones who seemed like regulars (gleaned from my 4ish times there) are kind of strange. Just a dive bar that's good to get cheap alcohol and watch the game. Oh and the urinals are huge (guess it helps those with bad aim??)

18.description: Oasis reminds me of a bar in the movies where the blue collar lead actor goes to drink his sorrows away after a breakup or career disaster - no music or TVs, just a stool, bar tender, and the drink.  I walked down to this place on a whim to grab a quick drink and was pleasantly surprised. While this is VERY much a local dive bar, the staff was friendly and there are a couple of pool tables.  There is almost a depressing atmosphere at times but you can't get a better price for a drink. Note: while they don't have food, you can order delivery to the bar.

41.description: It's not the worst place in the world.

52.description: What to say about this place? I guess the best advice I can give is to not go unless you are very very drunk. It is open late and the drinks are cheap but the place is dirty and gives off a unique odor. The pizza does taste amazing at 3 am but beware it is a Jacks frozen pizza- something you can make at home. There are some dart boards and billiards tables which can be fun but I would suggest to stay away from this place.

50.description: Simply known as "The O" to anyone who lives in Rogers Park or went to Loyola. I once saw a guy from my home town there one night and when I asked him what he was doing at "The O", he said that he asked his friend whom he was visiting to take him to the biggest dive bar in the city and this is where they ended up. On seeing me there, he then asked what that said about me.Anyway, this is a 4/5am bar so if you want to drink late this is the place to go. There is also a significant amount of dart players and dart boards available with several leagues to join. They also have a pool table and a pool league.The lighting and ambience is terrible and you may need an oxygen mask to enter the restrooms but there is plenty of room and plenty of beers to choose from and a very diverse crowd. After about 1am on the weekends this place fills up with Loyola students after Hamilton's and the Pumping Company closes.Say hi to uncle Pauly. He will be the one of the first guys you see sitting at the end of the bar.UPDATE 6/13: Uncle Pauly died last week.

4.description: Pretty good neighborhood dive bar on an underserved stretch of Sheridan Rd.  Nice mix of folks from Loyola kids to Rastafarians.  Things got a little surreal (for me) when a thin balding guy who was the spitting image of William Burroughs walked in.  Isn't he supposed to be dead?It was early Saturday afternoon on Derby Day and the Kentucky Derby was about to run.  Pretty much everyone was involved in watching the pageantry on the big screen tvs--for about a minute.  Then it was back to the business at hand--booze.I actually ordered a top shelf martini and it was well made and not costly.  Can't ask for more.  The service was not unfriendly but hey, I'm not a regular, probably just a one-timer with half an hour to kill in Rogers Park.  It's probably not the same at 4 AM as it was at 4PM.  But i was satisfied with my visit, and looking back at that particular Saturday, this was probably (sad to say) the highlight of my day.

6.description: Best bar eva! The regulars are a hoot and down to earth. Drinks are phenomenally priced. Bartenders are attentive and great.

22.description: I've read the reviews and don't agree this is a "totally local dive bar."  It's "totally local" if you're young and white.  A few months ago, my good friend and I stopped in for a few drinks.  He's black and I'm white.  I felt like my friend was treated completely different than I was.  For example, we are the same age and he was carded and I was not carded.  He was also carded again when he showed a credit card for payment.  Later on, a few attractive ladies walked in and my friend wanted to offer them a drink.  When he asked to bartender to send over a drink on his tab, the bartender (Darren) said "I don't think so.  It would be confrontational to do that."  I wonder if I offered the drinks, would the bartender have the same response?  The girls, of course, happened to also be white.  Seeing a recurring theme here?Here's the skinny:  Gigi is cool. The bushy-haired mixed race bartender who plays on a pool league with his skinny girlfriend is barely OK, but ironically suspect.  Darren (the aforementioned bartender) is a complete douche and should be fired from Oasis. I don't know about the other bartenders.In short, it's obvious that the majority of bartenders who work at this bar are not qualified or are scared to deal with people who do not look like them.  What makes this so ridiculous is that the neighborhood in which the bar is located is extremely diverse...yet, they treat most non-whites like second-class citizens.  I've told everyone to avoid this racist armpit of a bar.  You decide for yourself.

15.description: Place is awesome.  Great specials. You can bring in or order food.  Pool darts. Arcades. Service is great too---- vintage urinals in the men's bathroom makes it all worth it.

20.description: I shoot pool out of here for the APA, I know most of the bartenders, and it's cheap.  So, biased?  Perhaps, but you'll get that.It's a 4am bar, so after 2 it's a madhouse full of the drunk college students that just got kicked out of Hamilton's.  Before that though it's usually very chill.  4 dart boards, and a 7 1/2 foot pool table.  A bit of warning, lot of pool players there, so the table can get busy.  But if you want to play come on by, we like a challenge.Keep in mind Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday there is a pool league that plays out of there.  They are there every week, but if they are please don't ask to get on the table and then hover around like you're going to get next game, we don't usually end until 11 or later.It's a weird combination of locals bar and college bar - again, largely dependent on time of night.  I've been in there several times and you see some Loyola senior that just got dumped who's pouring over his Old Style - and right next to him is some old guy doing the same thing.  Weird, but usually a fun time.Just don't lock your bike up outside the bar, it will get stolen.

36.description: I can't pretend this place is anything more than what it is: awesome.No, that is not true.  It's just so much less depressing to pretend the watering hole, steps from my door, is more than a mediocre, townie bar with lousy mixed drinks and shots pre-made, consisting of nothing more than bar mix.  the bartenders are not particularly friendly to me, but still, it's quite comfortable.  It's like that shitty couch from college that you just don't ever get rid of.  That was not a good analogy. Anyways, few beers on tap, a mediocre hard liquor assortment, and I swear their call drinks and top shelf drinks switch everytime I'm there.  Also, most of their drinks are like 6.50 or 4.75, which is kind of annoying.  It is open alarmingly late, so the oasis-hypnosis will lure you in till dawn, when you finally realize you've been watching a bad kevin bacon tv movie and listening to 80's music at the oasis all night, only to crawl alone back to bed.  or maybe that's just me. No, but really, free darts, filthy surroundings, metallic blue chair cushions, does it get any better? yes, yes it does, but you know, maybe i don't want anything better.

14.description: This bar is awful.  It's so terrible, they don't even play music. They don't have a "radio license", if you can believe it.  Sure, you're free to play the jukebox, which is fine, but when it stops, doesn't matter if it's 1 in the morning, silence. The overweight bartender tonight wasn't even busy and I still waited 15 minutes for a beer. About 10-15 people in the bar at midnight on a Saturday night, gee ya think ya might be doing something wrong?  The clientele isn't even cool enough to be labeled hipsters- they're wannabe even more annoying hipsters.  Avoid this dump at all costs and do yourself a favor.  Very pissed at myself that I went here.  One stoner "bouncer" working the door, one dude selling six packs of natty ice, and one absolutely crappy bartender.  3 employees for 15 patrons and you still have to wave your money to get served.  Pitiful.

29.description: I almost don't want to write my raving review because I want to keep this hidden gem to myself...but the owner and all the staff are too amazing not to share! This place is wonderful. Clean, welcoming, relaxing and wonderful services! I get pedicures, and waxing/threading and every time I walk out 100% satisfied!Amazing place :)

42.description: Wonderful experience here at Pure Salon when I got a pedicure.  Totally affordable and relaxing.  They were super clean, super professional, and I got more than my money's worth.

23.description: I received a gift certificate for a mani / pedi and I honestly expected it to be just standard treatment but the staff at this salon are amazing. Everything was perfect! I've paid more for mediocre service elsewhere and thanks to this salon I never will again.

47.description: For a girls afternoon out, my daughter, soon-to-be daughter in law and I went to the Pure salon and were we ever pampered!  We had manicures, pedicures, brow threading and a mini facial between us.  The facility is beautiful, the staff wonderful and our whole experience was noteworthy.  We will return for more pampering when my daughter and I return to Chicago to visit my son and his wife.  I recommend this salon to anyone interested in professional salon services.

8.description: So happy I found this place. Its clean, relaxing, and services were well done.

31.description: I found The Pure Salon and Spa while searching online to get a Brazilian Treatment done locally, instead of my usual location in the downtime area.I was recommended to see Shah perform the service for me @ 1600 hrs., which she was there 10/mins. sooner then my appt. time.The service & courtesy that  I received  from Shah & Natashka (sp) was beyond my expectations. Not only did I get the Brazilian Wax Treatment, but, I went ahead and had an Eyelash Extension; also,The location, cleanness & decor, including their professionalism & care of my service's were impeccable & warranted me making another appointment before I left the establishment.I highly recommend this place!!!

34.description: Great and affordable experience.  First time here and not only was it an excellent pedi, but also very clean and professional.  Good deal on Morse!

16.description: Went back again today for regular maintenance which consists of eyebrow threading and a mani/pedi. This has become a twice monthly routine that I completely enjoy. I cannot speak to another review of a "cuticle butcher" as I have had almost everyone in the spa provide various services at one time or another and have never left with punctures or any discomfort. This time the owner took care of me herself and I could not have been treated with more attention and a very friendly approach.

13.description: I came here for a mani, pedi, and eyebrow waxing. The mani and pedi was VERY thorough and my eyebrows came out gorgeous. My only complaint (and reason for not giving 5 stars) is that I was here for 2.5 hours. If you're in a rush, I wouldnt stop at this one. However if you're looking for a relaxing, quiet, and thorough experience, The Pure Salon is the way to go.

11.description: So happy to have this lovely, clean nail salon in the neighborhood! What sets this place apart from the other $35 mani-pedi places is that it's clean and quiet, without loud reruns of fill-in-the-blank blasting, and without the nail technicians jabbering back and forth to each other, and it's relatively fume-free since they don't do artificial nails.  They take their time and do a great job on my nails.  But don't come here if you're in a hurry.  It will take at least an hour and a half for a mani-pedi. Sometimes longer.  Also, there's free parking!

39.description: An updated review:I've since had my eyebrows threaded and both mini and full facials, as well as returning every two weeks to have my nails done.Every experience has been 5 stars.  The woman who threads and waxes, Sana (I think) is extremely kind and interested in serving the customers.  She is patient and listens -- and even does a forehead, temple, neck and short shoulder massage after the threading.  Anyone with complaints isn't taking the time to explain what they want done.The mini and full facials were nirvana on earth -- talk about a deep meditative state of relaxation.  Sana did one and Moonga (sp?) did the other.  I preferred the latter's style and method, both were great.  And my nails continue to be perfect with great attention to detail.  I am so glad they don't do fake nails as there's none of that toxic dust flying all over the shop and getting into every nook and cranny, including my lungs.  To the woman who complained about this and gave low stars -- get over yourself and find another place -- it;s pretty sh*tty of you to lower a new biz's rating because you did not get what you wanted before even trying the service.   Also, its a load of malarkey that any of the staff was purposefully of pointedly rude to you by clarifying what you wanted in in their native tongue of Mongolian.  It's actually rude, quite frankly, a form of racism of you to expect that everyone providing potential service to you must speak in a language you understand.  We live in the United States of America -- your people, generations ago or more recently, likely clarified information with one another to make meaning and to translate.  Your comments are offensive and make me wonder if you are affiliated with the nail place that used to reside in this space and your negative comments are simply and example of sour grapes.To everyone else -- this is a wonderful new Rogers Park business.  As someone whose lived hear all of my life, I can tell you we need more folks like those at Pure Salon who are willing to take a chance and build up our community.  So glad they are here and I hope they stay put!

37.description: I love this place way too much! It's possibly the best manicure and pedicure I've ever had. I go here at least every other week to get a manicure, because they are so affordable and do the most thorough job. They always offer water and green tea when you come in and have an excellent selection of different colors. All the people who work there are so kind and helpful. They do a full pedicure and manicure that includes the best massage on your arms and calves. Going every other week is my treat to myself and I look forward to it so much. I recommend this place to everyone in Rogers Park that wants to treat themselves without having to break the bank!

0.description: I still love this place.  Both threading and waxing of eyebrows are phenomenal.  They always ensure that the service is done right.  I wouldn't go anywhere else!

38.description: I found out about this place via flyers left at the Broadway Animal Hospital. I checked Pure out due to their low prices for a brow wax. I was used to paying $18 a month and I was happy with the services BUT if I could get it done for cheaper, why the heck not? So, I did. I had my brows waxed and threaded. When I went in I was expecting only the wax. I compare eyebrow threading to childbirth even though I am a child free woman. I'd rather take a few hours of menstrual cramps on a scale of 7-8 or a day or two of fibro pain than have my eyebrows threaded. I stuck in there though and I was satisfied with the results. I scheduled an appointment for a mani/pedi special ($32 for month of August/Tuesday-Thursday, I was informed it's normally $35 which isn't bad either) for two weeks later-8/21. I arrived a bit early and I was encouraged to pick out a color. I brought a bottle from home for my toes and they had no problem using it. I am highly satisfied with the results of the mani/pedi. I loved getting a hot neck pillow-it smelled of cinnamon-as I got my manicure. I loved the quick massage I received while waiting for my nails to dry. During my two experiences here it seems like Pure is building up a small but loyal group of regulars. I will now count myself as one of them. My budget doesn't exactly allow for a mani/pedi every month BUT I will come here for my pedicure services. I also love that the $8 a month I pocket means one extra veggie burrito from Chipotle every month. ;)   Hey, everyone has their thing.I knocked off one star because the water for my pedicure wasn't as hot as I would have liked and due to the air conditioning ( a great thing to have) made the water cool even faster.

27.description: I have lived in the neighborhood for 3 years and have been waiting for a nail salon to come to the area.  It finally did, and I couldn't imagine a better place!  Pure provides the best customer service I have seen in Chicago.  They take walk ins, but squeeze you in for appointments if you call same day, and tonight they even stayed late for me.  Best main and pedi I have received in Chicago in 15 years plus the best massage with a manicure I've ever had.  Wish these guys all the success in the world so I can keep reaping the benefits!!

32.description: What a little gem! I was greeted warmly, offered tea, and seated in a quiet area while my purse and shoes were stored in their own basket. The pedicure was well executed and included lots of leg/foot massage. I'll be back!!!

48.description: Love my nails!  This place is amazing. They treat each person like family. I can't remember the last time I felt so pampered.  I came in on Sunday and they were too busy but they take appointments.  The price was affordable and they take such great care of each individual.  Highly recommend.  I can't wait to go back again and again!

44.description: I was literally thrilled when I saw this place.  I was so pleased as the space seemed clean, the staff friendly and my initial services were great.  Our neighborhood has REALLY needed a place like this.Until, I received second degree burn on a portion of my face that I didn't even ask to be waxed.  And instead of putting cooling agent on it?  She put lotion.  Making the problem even worse.  I noticed it right away, as it was painful.  They kept saying my skin was sensitive - which is definitely NOT the case.   Unfortunately, I had huge red splotches on my face for days that turned into Red Flakey spotches as it healed.  (Luckily, I diligently put scar cream my doctor gave me on it or I might have been left with something permanent.)I was so disappointed since I felt this place had promise and felt that I had developed a bit of a repetoire with the family that owns it - I stopped back by to show them again what it looked like 4 days later.  The woman at the front desk kept making excuses and only said they'd talk with the girl who did this to me.  When I explained the girl wasn't even following my instructions and waxed a portion of my face I didn't ask for - they said I should have spoken up more loudly. (Once the wax is on?! What am I supposed to do?! No going back then!)  They didn't even offer me any future comped services, etc.  A free mani or pedi or SOMETHING would have shown they actually cared. She even went so far as to suggest that it was a "little burn" ( A red flakey face 4 days after the waxing?!  Even after I explained I'd been putting scar cream on it?!)I hate to write a negative post about this place but feel like I should warn others.  To be clear: my mani/pedi was AMAZING and the wax I had done by the Indian woman who works on Fridays was also really great.  To me, this was a rather serious mistake and their customer service regarding this was just awful.  Unfortunately, I don't believe I'll be back.

24.description: Just got an incredible manicure for a measly $12. I'll definitely be back. I really appreciated the lack of blaring television and the thoughtful kind service! This place is great.

7.description: I get my underarms waxed at this spa and it's always great! They use only the cleanest items and the middle eastern women who does the waxing is a master! Always gets every bit of hair and always fast. I never breakout like other places and she knows what she is doing. I have very sensitive skin and the wax irritates it very bad. I started going to this place, right around the corner from me and now I wax once a month and no more ingrown hairs and no more pain. The waxing is only $13 for both arms and some places charges like 20-25 for that. The staff is great and it's real clean and nice. Must try place

49.description: I've been waiting for a relaxing and inviting nail salon to open in Rogers Park and this place is it! I stopped here on my way home from work unexpectedly and was extremely happy with my visit! The interior is so relaxing and everything is extremely clean and inviting. It actually beats my regular salon all the way in Lakeview! I had a basic manicure and they gave me the most upscale treatment including an herbal/heated neck towel, shoulder massage and a great arm and hand massage. Green tea too! They have a grand opening special currently and I just paid $10. This will probably go up over time. A girl came in for eyebrow threading while I was there and they had a separate room for waxing and facials. LOVE this new place!! I cannot wait to go back for a pedicure.  Heads up, I saw a sign for debit/credit cards only for services above $15.00. I asked and they do BYOB for groups.

40.description: Aletha K.The Pure Salon and Spa lives up to its name! Owner and operator! Niya. is just wonderful, calm and very pleasant. The spa is clean and tranquil. The way they perform services are like being transported to a 5 star resort. I was there yesterday with my daughter. I had a no chip with a pedicure my daughter had the same. very helpful picking colors extremely patient. herbal tea, water. hot or cold towels. just very nice. this was my third time there. The services are very consistently perfect.

30.description: Loved it!  I felt welcome from the minute we walked in the door.   The personnel were warm and friendly.  Services were great.  I will go again.

46.description: Disappointing. I went in today for the first time to have someone help me remove the gel nails I had done and get a fresh manicure. The place looked very clean and new. After picking out a color, the lady looked at my nails like they were the most horrifying thing ever and said we don't do fake nails here. I explained that I just wanted them removed and a regular manicure done. She called another woman over to look at them, they talked in another language in front of me and then the other lady looked at them strangely and said "ohh we don't do that here" and I was dismissed. Why did you get another woman if you couldn't help me? It's strange to because all they needed to do was soak them in acetone... I felt they were really rude and judgmental. I also don't like when people talk to each other and not the customer. Waste of time. I can't judge their quality of work because they dismissed my business.

1.description: This little place is a gem hidden in plain sight. Located across from the Morse Market, one wouldn't think that this little, unassuming spa offers the quality and service you'd expect from a high end salon on Michigan Ave. However, that's what my mother and I recieved when we visited for mani/pedis. Though it may be tiny, it boasts a massage/waxing room, mainucure stations, pedicure stations,  a makeup/threading station, and then some. The decor is pleasing to the eye. Its modern and simple and when you walk through the door, there is a faint (but not overwhelming) scent of tea tree oil. The color palette is calming, inviting, and hip. The cleanliness of this spa also is something to mention. There is always someone cleaning and tidying up. During our treatments, we were offered massage, warm rice heating pads for our neck and shoulders, and our choice of hot or cold drinks. They took their time buffing and painting our nails. Which btw, this is not the place you go to if you're looking for an express ANYTHING. They take their time and they do their job to perfection. Anyway, when it came to our pedicures we were treated to hot towels, sea salt scrubs, and all the trimmings. Come to find out, thats just their BASIC pedicure. All in all, I had an AMAZING experience and cant wait to come back. I mean, my nails look photoshopped! Our mani/pedis were $35 which is an awesome, afforable price. Also, they give you a punch card so that after so many visits, you can get a free treatment. Give this place a try. You won't regret it.

9.description: My favorite nail salon! The atmosphere is calming. The facility is immaculate. The service is very friendly. And they do a terrific job with nails and threading. I appreciate their punch card loyalty program. I won't go anywhere else!

26.description: Great nail salon! I had an early morning appointment so I didn't have to wait at all. I had a no-chip manicure done and got a special design for NYE. I showed them a picture and they worked to get it as close as possible. I was more than thrilled with the result and the cost was very reasonable. I'll keep coming back here for sure.

25.description: I really appreciated this salon's patience. They close at 8pm however still did my manicure and pedicure with the finest details combed over and I was out at 8:45pm. Very friendly, accommodating and great prices. I will for sure come back soon, was my first visit.

12.description: Came for a mani/pedi and was very impressed. There were lots of little extras that made the experience wonderful...massage chair for the pedicure, hot towel on the shoulders for the mani, and a shoulder massage during drying. The customer service is amazing...they asked if I wanted to pay before the mani to protect my nails, and when they saw I'd worn close-toed shoes, they carefully sprayed and wrapped my feet in saran wrap to protect them on the way home.The place is a little hard to find. You can park in the big lot with the laundromat and dollar store and then walk east until you see it.

21.description: I love this place! I live nearby so stopped in one day and I've been hooked since. The employees are very pleasant and the atmosphere is beyond relaxing. I almost fall asleep every time I am there. They do great work and I recommend them to everyone I know!

17.description: Best eyebrow threading I've had. They are really pollite, and she even gave me a 5 minutes face massage when she put the lotion on my eyebrows. I will definitely return.

10.description: Wonderful service each time I go. I get my nails and eyebrows done here regularly. Recently, I started getting pedicures and they are equally thorough and well worth the price. Excellent salon. Call and make a reservation first.

5.description: I came here for mani/pedi and eye brow thread. The staff are always friendly and very welcoming.The place is calm you won't hear the staff arquing or gossiping like in many other nail salon. they always did a great job and accommodating and very detail about their work and worth what you paying for and they give you punch card too.

3.description: Great service. Small and clean place. They give you these warm neck pillows and short massages throughout the process. $12 regular manicure, but I paid $6 extra for OPI infinite shine... Supposedly is going to last longer than normal nail polish (we'll see). I will definitely visit again.

35.description: In the two hours I was here receiving different treatments I was attended by three staff members, each being attentive and friendly with a through care for every task at hand.  The basic pedicure and facial I received were better than some deluxe ones I've had at other salons.  This is a staff committed to pampering, which I didn't realize was so neglected by many other places that try to rush you out the door before your nails even dry. I'm seriously glad I walked in and plan to return soon.

19.description: A little treasure in Rogers Park.  I felt so pampered.  At the end of our visit for a manicure and pedicure, I felt so relaxed!  They have all the little touches that you would find in a high end spa!  Just wonderful!!!!

28.description: I just moved to the area and decided to try it out. What a great place! It's really clean and the people who work here are so nice. I got a great pedi and no chip mani with excellent massages at reasonable prices. The nail techs were meticulous with cuticles and made sure nail length and shape were okay before polishing; exactly what I wanted. And they have a punch card! I'll definitely be returning.

45.description: Great new nail spot in east Rogers Park. Super friendly, very clean, professional job. I will happily go back for another mani/pedi. I think they do waxing too.

33.description: I had been to Pure once before and had a nice experience for a mani/pedi. Unfortunately I had an appointment scheduled for today, and after arriving on time had no choice but to leave after I waited for half an hour.  I was only given a weak apology as I left. I would have considered rescheduling or going back if I had been offered a discount for the poor service.

43.description: This place has great service and pricing.  I've been very happy with my eyebrow waxing and threading as well as my mani/pedi.

2.description: Cute well maintained little place on morse Ave. There is parking in the family dollar lot. The staff pays attention to detail I have perfect looking nails when I leave. I think they tend to go the extra mile with the message and the customer service. It's relaxing non rushed atmosphere. I highly recommend an apt as it is smaller size place appointments are recommended.  They offer eyebrow threading and waxing,facials that are amazing as well. This place is great easy to find!!

18.description: I found The Pure Salon and Spa while searching online to get a Brazilian Treatment done locally, instead of my usual location in the downtime area.I was recommended to see Shah perform the service for me @ 1600 hrs., which she was there 10/mins. sooner then my appt. time.The service & courtesy that  I received  from Shah & Natashka (sp) was beyond my expectations. Not only did I get the Brazilian Wax Treatment, but, I went ahead and had an Eyelash Extension; also,The location, cleanness & decor, including their professionalism & care of my service's were impeccable & warranted me making another appointment before I left the establishment.I highly recommend this place!!!

41.description: Friendly and no nonsense, this place is a great stop for a bit of well-deserved pampering on a day off. I received a facial--all lovely products, steam, and no extractions--perfect for anyone with sensitive skin looking to relax more than to fight their face. Plus, it comes with a free eyebrow threading. As to the pedicure, it was thorough with well-temped water, and a truly excellent massage.

4.description: This was one of the best manicures I've ever had! Towel and hot compress on your shoulders as soon as you sit down and a shoulder massage at the end while your nails are drying. I got the no-chip and they look great! They really take their time to make your nails look great. The staff is very friendly and they have a punch card system for pedicures, manicures and no-chip. Buy 10, get one free! And they keep them there, so no need to worry about carrying it around! It's a very clean spot. It's definitely my new nail spot, and hopefully waxing, too!Update: one of my no-chip nails chipped the next day. I had planned to go back for a pedicure the next day (because I didn't have time the day I got my nails done) so it was an easy fix and they happily fixed it. The pedicure was not the best. I had to ask her twice to dig out my ingrown toenail (gross, I know) and she still didn't do it. I need someone to really get in there and she did not. Took off one star for this. It's still the nicest place I've been, but I wish they would do a better job. Still got the massage as my chipped nail was being fixed.

6.description: Perfect in all aspects.Clean.Sanitary. Elegant, tasteful, soothing decor.Calm, quiet, delicately scented vibe.No traces anywhere of the previous customer.  None. Quiet, graceful, friendly staff.  No gum crackin or loud guffaws in this place.Lots of oils, lotions, massaging during the mani and pedi process.Perfect application of the polish.A fabulous experience that I will make sure I treat myself to regularly.  Give yourself this little break from the grittiness of Rogers Park.  You're welcome.

22.description: Amazing service!! Today was my first time there, but the best mani I have gotten in this city and you can't beat the price--$12! Includes arm massage and back rub, lovely people, and wonderful results. My out-of-town pal went with me, and this salon is the 2nd reason she's sad to leave. (I'm #1, obvs.)

15.description: Pure Salon is the best! So clean & the lady's there are so nice! It's so worth it! Highly recommend it, definitely coming back

20.description: This little place is a gem hidden in plain sight. Located across from the Morse Market, one wouldn't think that this little, unassuming spa offers the quality and service you'd expect from a high end salon on Michigan Ave. However, that's what my mother and I recieved when we visited for mani/pedis. Though it may be tiny, it boasts a massage/waxing room, mainucure stations, pedicure stations,  a makeup/threading station, and then some. The decor is pleasing to the eye. Its modern and simple and when you walk through the door, there is a faint (but not overwhelming) scent of tea tree oil. The color palette is calming, inviting, and hip. The cleanliness of this spa also is something to mention. There is always someone cleaning and tidying up. During our treatments, we were offered massage, warm rice heating pads for our neck and shoulders, and our choice of hot or cold drinks. They took their time buffing and painting our nails. Which btw, this is not the place you go to if you're looking for an express ANYTHING. They take their time and they do their job to perfection. Anyway, when it came to our pedicures we were treated to hot towels, sea salt scrubs, and all the trimmings. Come to find out, thats just their BASIC pedicure. All in all, I had an AMAZING experience and cant wait to come back. I mean, my nails look photoshopped! Our mani/pedis were $35 which is an awesome, afforable price. Also, they give you a punch card so that after so many visits, you can get a free treatment. Give this place a try. You won't regret it.

36.description: Updated: larger selection of magazines to catch up on celeb gossip now available!  Also, it only costs $5 to remove no-chip manis...what a steal!

14.description: Pure Salon is the best!  In addition to a perfect manicure and pedicure you also get a lovely neck massage. I'm a regular and know no better place. It's calm and relaxing. Highest recommendation!

58.description: After trying Jamaica Jerk which is 2 miles away, I wanted to give Good to GO a GO.  I ordered the the Jerk Chicken w/ Fries ($10.50) to GO.  While I was waiting for my order, I snacked on their beef patty.  I've had better, although it was in Montego Bay.  10 minutes had GOne by,  I retrieved my order and I was good to GO.  Are you annoyed by my use of GO yet? You can have a GO at me, but that's how I felt when I was eating my jerk chicken. The chicken was too rubbery.  I felt the sauce was overpowered by allspice and had  a strong clove aroma to it, which I personally don't like.  I still prefer the Jerk Trio at Jamaica Jerk.  More Food, Cheaper, Better Taste!

56.description: I understand the frustration with this place because the service is not wonderful. If I was rating their service it would be one star. Some people just don't know what it takes to work in a restaurant.That being said, I loved the food. I am not the most familiar person in the world with Jamaican food. I do know that Jerk seasoning and sauce is a very complex, spicy and yes, overpowering, taste but sometimes you are in the mood for that. I had both the chicken and pork. You can pass on the pork but the chicken is delicious and so are the beans and rice. If you like your meat extra spicy, which I do, get extra sauce on the side and dip every piece for a true flavor explosion. Also, be sure to try one of their drinks, I had a pineapple juice with lime and ginger and it was so unique and tasty that I would go back to get it mixed with rum (they have a bar in the seating area of the restaurant. Prices are steep for the area but the quality of food (though not the service) and the huge portions are worth it.

29.description: All four stars are for the food.  A few years ago, I lived within walking distance of this restaurant and would get take out all the time.  Today, I happened to be in the neighborhood, so I got my regular order (the oxtail dinner) and it was so good I wanted to lick the Styrofoam.  The food has been consistantly good over the years and the service has been bad at times and indifferent at others.  The owner really needs to discuss customer service with the cashiers.  They also have gone up on their prices which makes it a bit expensive for takout.  Despite all that, I'm sure I'll go back.

42.description: I was really impressed!  We stopped here because the restaurant we originally planned to go to was closed (it was a Sunday).  I was a little skeptical by the name (Good to Go), but I was pleasantly surprised!  The place is charming....reminded me of some of the best places I've been in in the V.I., Kenya, Colombia, India...Very basic decor, but very authentic.  They were out of quite a few things on the menu, which became a laughing joke with us and our server after awhile because it seemed I kept ordering what they didn't have.  But, the food was AMAZING!  Drinks were fun, prices very reasonable.

23.description: The Best! In comparison to Mr. Brown's Lounge (in Wicker Park) & Jamaica Jerk (used to be down the street until they were forced to close), the food here is BETTER! There have been other jamaican restaurants in the area but to my knowledge, they haven't been around as long as Good To Go.  I always order Brown Stew chicken with rice, plantains and cabbage.  Thier ginger juice (not bottle) is very tasty and refreshing.  I love that it's only a 5-min drive from me.

47.description: I ordered the brown stew chicken with rice and beans which was one of the most taasteless and dry jamaiican dishes I have had in my entire life. They threw a piece of thickly cut plaintain on top which was also tasteless and dry. OMG!Upon going up to the counter to order, I was not greeted even after speaking to the girl behind the counter first. It is one thing to say that this is the culture but let's remember this is a business first! You are in the US. Let's be courteous to one another. Word of mouth and repeat customers help make the business a successful one.Apart from the tasteless dish I ordered, I might have considered going back to try another dish if the service was friendly.You can not have tasteless food and service, that does not do it for meI did also order a fruit juice drink that had mango, pineapple and papaya blended with honey and ice. That was the best thing I did at this place. For the $15+ I spent on that tasteless dish, needless to say, I will not go back.With there being some pretty good jamaiican restaurants around Chicago, I will travel farther if I have to for better service and food.

8.description: I am sitting here eating this food and trying to enjoy it. What can I say? How should I say it? Well, I ordered the following: jerk chicken dinner with festival. The jerk chicken was good but the sauce (thank god I called back and changed it) had too much lime flavor. It was so much lime that I couldn't even put it on the chicken. I as sad I didn't get the jerk and fries like my friend. The rice was good but the gravy on the rice was low. Now in to the festival. Not good. It was still uncooked when I broke it open. Ate only the tips. This place is good no lie, but I never remembered my mom putting lime in her jerk sauce. I can't say I'm happy about this meal. Everything was just lime. The plantain also was a bit raw. I wouldn't have minded waiting a little extra. Idk I'm just not a happy camper right now.

31.description: I swear I smelled the chicken from my car as I drove by. I swerved into an open parking spot on the west side of the street then scurried thru traffic into Good to Go. As one person put it, the food is finger licking good NO LIE. I ordered a meat pie, a small brown stew chicken meal and a hedonism fresh juice. The meat pie was spicy and delicious, the smoothie was tangy and refreshing but the brown stew chicken tasted like joy and happiness. By the time I came to my senses, all my food was gone and my stomach was so full I couldn't sit up straight :-/Thankfully I'm moving into the area and will get the privilege of becoming a regular :-)Highly recommend!!

34.description: Fan- friggin-tastic!  Jerk rib tips were great, as was the curry goat.  I am a cornbread snob, and theirs was a cut above par.  Also, the caramel pound cake was deelish.

16.description: This food was so good. It's grilled (which is my favorite.) Parking in front but very tight. The mac and cheese was not too much and not too cheesy but really good. The seasoning was perfection and they put this bomb jerk sauce (which was just right, not too spicy.) Plantains came with it. So good.

13.description: I don't like Jerk sauce (or so I thought) so, I was NOT thrilled to be going here for dinner, but the place we were going to had an hour wait and we had already paid for parking, so here we were. Talk about a pleasant surprise! This place is delicious, reasonably priced, and had a really lovely dinning area! The service was little slow, but was made up for in friendliness and the fact that after I told our server that I wasn't sure about the jerk pork, she got me a sample without even being asked! And when we asked about menu items, she was very knowledgeable and helpful. I ended up having the Jerk Pork dinner (large) and it was easily 2 complete dinners! My friend had the Combo dinner of Jerk Pork and Curried Goat and again, it was a large serving and could have been 2 dinners, but he's a guy so... We split a Festival, which was yummy, and it really worked well to take away some of the spiciness (not hot, just flavorful) of the jerk. I would also recommend ordering a side of the Oxtail gravy as it adds a really nice moistness to the rice & beans. We both had the Ginger Beer soda and it too was nice and went well with dinner (FYI: they have a liquor license and have cocktails and beer and we were going to have real beer, but as it was snowy, we thought better of the idea).I would definitely go back and I highly recommend you try it too!

11.description: OMG. Just OMG...I got the combo plate with the oxtails and the brown stew chicken... So good... So amazing... The cabbage needs to be cooked a little longer but the rest...! Why did I wait so longgg... Will be back!!!

39.description: Agree with a lot of the reviews here - pretty good food, but often unfriendly service.

37.description: I ordered the Jerk chicken dinner, which came with beans and rice. I had it delivered, so it totaled almost $18 bucks. I thought that this was a lot for just chicken and rice, but when it was delivered, I knew it was a good value. My first clue was that the bag was really heavy. They also included sautéed carrots and cabbage and three pieces of fried plantains. The chicken was really meaty, and there was a huge pile of rice and beans. Plenty for a second meal. The chicken was good. Good spices and a nice smoked flavor.

0.description: 10 STARS OUT OF 5!!!  Jerk chicken was perfect.  Next time, I'm trying the ox tail. The staff: friendly, helpful and funny!!The food:  perfect blend of spice without the unnecessary "heat", which is so prevalent in my dad's chili.The price: plenty of food for your buck!Time to prepare: fast, but not too fast. Food like this takes time to get it this good!  I'm no foodie, because foodies are morons.  I eat food, and quality trumps presentation and posting photos of it to a social network.  So pick up your phone to order from here, then put it down and eat.

38.description: Jerk rib tips, jerk chicken wings and a smoothie I wasn't feeling it but I wish them the best

51.description: The food was great! I had the king fish dinner..the portion was big so ofcourse I didn't eat anything else for the day because I was stuffed! The service could of been much better but overall I would go again.

27.description: O. M. G. SERIOUSLY? Horrible, HORRIBLE.Picked up lunch today around 1:30EVERYTHING was reheated. I was wondering why the food was ready so fast? I should have checked it. The chicken was OLD and soft and cold and laying in some red juice, the rice was reheated (who reheats rice?). The ENTIRE meal is going in the trash. Not even giving my dog a bite.HORRIBLE! I thought this was going to be the spot.HORRIBLE!And the festival? Was FLAT and hard like a rock!HORRIBLE!

32.description: Let's start with the pros. The food is down right tasty. I mean finger lick'n good. The decor is so ambient and delightful you'd think you were at a fine dining restaurant. Now for the bad. The customer service is horrible. Everytime I come here the cashier is always texting on her phone or talking to someone in the restaurant, customer or friend. And I have to wait, because she doesn't stop until she feels like it.

54.description: Went last night and the service was good but we were the  only ones dining in so it should have been good!The patties were good but not great. The jerk chicken was excellent though the sauce itself wasn't great. My wife got the curry chicken which she liked though she would have liked more white meat but that is a personal preference.The rice was very tasty. Plantains were good and not greasy. All in all it was good, just not great.

48.description: Jerk chicken and brown stew - pork were great.  Red Stripes for only $3.  Lose a point for charging $8 for a vodka soda... $16 for a double.

44.description: Not impressed. Delivery guy was great, wish the food was the same! Jerk chicken was very dry an cabbage was tasteless.

24.description: Delicious Jerk wings. Even with delivery, food is still hot, as it should be.

7.description: I'm from Miami & I love Jamaican food! nothing ever seems to compare to what's in Miami but this place comes close! fresh & tasty..I've only ordered delivery but each time I've ordered its always hot! my roommate is obsessed as well..keep it up guys!

49.description: Ordered the jerk chicken. Delicious! I can't believe this place has an average rating. The chicken had a wonderful smokey taste and the sauce that accompanied it was pleasantly spicy. Oh and they deliver!!! Love it! I'll definitely  be returning.

40.description: I fully enjoyed the meal. (Good for delivery) I can't wait to visit the location experience the atmosphere.

53.description: Ok I am the first to review this.  Yes!This spot was chosen with my niece for an assignment for school, so I tagged along so I may do a review.Finding the place was easy as was the parking (street) on a sunday night.  On walking in, place was like half a restaurant half a fast food place, and the lady behind the counter disappeared for a few mins, which was kinda odd; upon appraching the counter we got her atttention and ordered.  That was the only thing about this place.Everything else...was pretty damn awesome.My niece got the jerk pork, delectable with the additional sauce..I ordered a Kingfish appetiser (not expecting it to be a big piece) but it was a small meal to its own.  Then MY dish came out of jerk goat (i have to double check as I left the menu at home but really wanted to post this) with cabbage and rice.  Also, the ginger beer was pretty damn awesome, tasty and addicting.  (I actually ordered an additional dish of the jerk pork for work today)  Also getting the caramel cake, I agree with the lady whom I asked 'how is the cake?'  To which she replied, 'addicting.'  So we wont be seeing to much of that next year as one of my goals is to lose alittle (who isn't doing this? lol)My niece was full with her order (which was 2 options, large or small.  She got small, I got large.)  Wasn't expecting such portions and I was in a food coman after I got home.  Also in my bag of my order and my nieces doggy bag was 2 cards, They also have nights where they have live music.  The music they were pumping thru there (jamaican, mon) was great.  Now let me talk to you about the inside (to which my pics will also give credence to)You walk in and there is a counter right there with a door and windo to the kitchen.  This is the side I said looks like a fast food place.  Once you look left, you see the rest of the place where there is a restaurant/bar section which was lit well and clean and nice, really relaxing.  Here is where they have the entertainment, and quite roomy.  The bathrooms were clean and decoratvie alittle, and after the initial 5 minutes of silence the staff was really friendly.  Owned by a family, I am glad the 'feel' of such and the pride behind the service was there.And yes I am verbose.As far as the question do they take reservation?  I am sure they do as they had tables with 'reserved' on them, but double check.

30.description: Service was good for one waiter. We liked the food. Had jerk ribs. Oxtail dish was good.

46.description: This is the second time I've been here and I really want to like this place but its hard. First off we went on a Tuesday afternoon and they were out of wings (??) we ordered curry goat and brown stew chicken which was quite delicious. But the service was bad, the waitress kept dancing and singing and taking her time getting to us. Now I see why it's called good to go and that's how I'll get it next time

1.description: They have great food and atmosphere.   The Jerk wings and ox tails are addictive.  Definitely try their soup, especially the chicken soup.  All kinds of fresh squeezed juice and smoothies. Always pleasant servers.

55.description: The service appears to have improved.  Ours was excellent.Nice place, nice people.  Extensive menu, which means you have to ask what they actually have today, but that's OK cuz...The plantains were perfectly carmelized.  I had the fresh pineapple/lime/ginger drink and it couldn't have been a better blend.  I then had two lovely little grilled butterfish (actually, I took one home cuz we'd just had a sandwich at Romanian Kosher).  I've never had a fish with flesh that came so easily off the bones.  They were served with a very light vinegar (with onions and Scotch bonnet peppers) that was tasty and hot! My buddy said the jerk chicken was good, but that they needed to find a better chicken picker -- he said there were bits of feather or tendril or something in it -- sounds like good 'ol country yardbird to me!  Anyway, it did not stop him from enjoying his chicken.

9.description: The Mac and cheese is from a box... I was expecting a true Caribbean experience and cuisine. The portion was a lot... The best part of the meal was the music!Never coming back though

26.description: If you were to check my Grubhub previous order list you would think I had an addiction. Actually I probably do, the oxtail dinner and curry goat dinner are my favs. I usually order extra cabbage with sweet potatoes. My husband to be usually orders the curry shrimp with extra plantains.  I haven't been adventurous to try anything else on the menu but honestly the food is great! Absolutely love Good to Go!

25.description: Delicious food! Friendly service. Try the oxtail and curry goat. The jerk chicken is also good. I'm a fan of the collared greens and rice and beans as well. It's my favorite place in town!

12.description: O. M. G. SERIOUSLY? Horrible, HORRIBLE.Picked up lunch today around 1:30EVERYTHING was reheated. I was wondering why the food was ready so fast? I should have checked it. The chicken was OLD and soft and cold and laying in some red juice, the rice was reheated (who reheats rice?). The ENTIRE meal is going in the trash. Not even giving my dog a bite.HORRIBLE! I thought this was going to be the spot.HORRIBLE!And the festival? Was FLAT and hard like a rock!HORRIBLE!

59.description: What a gem, I am so happy I found this place!  On the quest for unique dining experiences in Chicago, I stumbled upon this amazing restaurant while finishing up with a client in the area.  The food did not miss a beat!  A personal favorite; Curry Chicken, and having lived in the U.K. I've had my fare share of Jamaican Cuisine and Good To Go, failed to disappoint.  It's my new favorite date spot, the upscale meets bistro look is definitely a plus.  And the drinks were so delicious, not watered down in the least.  Overall, it's refreshing selection of Jamaican favorites.

21.description: I give this restaurant 2 stars only.  Maybe if I would have eaten in, instead of ordering, the rating would be higher.  DELIVERY TIME WAS UNBELIEVABLE!!!  I placed my order on the phone at 4:30 pm and it did not arrive until 6:15 pm, ALMOST 2 HOURS OF WAITING!  Between 45 minutes to 1 hour is an appropriate time.  I had to call the restaurant and ask what was taking so long! I was maybe even expecting a possible discount for the inconvenience.  Ordering food is supposed to be quick and convenient.  I could have defrosted my own meat, made my own meal, eaten dinner, and washed the dishes for the time it took for this order to arrive at my house.  The food was mediocre.  A little pricey though -- a half chicken meal for almost $15, when I could get a great WHOLE rotisserie chicken at the local market for half the price.  The rice and beans were very dry.  The cabbage and plantains were good.  I will not order from this restaurant again, but might possibly dine in.

17.description: Really wanted to like this a lot, but didn't work for me.  Had the jerked chicken which was perfection.  The corn bread tasted like it was a month old and had that bad old refrigerator taste. Yuck.  The Jungle Juice was great.  The candied yams were blah. The mac and cheese.  c'mon !  how can you make it boring and super blah ?.  Ok, I'm jaded but C'MON !   Get somebody's grandmother's recipe and you're done !

10.description: Amazing!!! I cannot wait to go back! I wish I lived closer but definitely  worth the drive! We had the combination of jerk chicken and curry chicken. It was the best tasting chicken I have ever had! It fell right off the bones ... The cabbage was perfect ... Plantains were sweet and the Rice and peas are to die for!The staff was great ... Early evening and it was not busy in the dinning area however a constant flow of people picking up to go orders. Loved it!The ladies and the one gentleman at the counter were so helpful and pleasant. Felt so welcome as soon as we walked into the door.Get the Carmel cake to go! You will be thankful once you get home that you did. Grabbed some beef patties for friends to try! They were perfect! I will be back there soon! And hopefully the next experience is just as good!!

5.description: Wasn't even fit to eat gave it to the dog!!!! Disappointed and gross. Both orders tasted gross and seemed to have been recooked they were lacking flavor but full of grease.

3.description: Food was great and the portions were plentiful, u just can't go wrong for your money. The jerk chicken is that authentic taste u been looking for with that tasty hotness  the ambiance is very nice n cool with comfortable seating and our server was extremely attentive and sweet. Try that oxtail and jerk pork it was tha bomb

35.description: I tried the oxtails because I am on oxtail fiend. It wasn't bad at all. The cabbage that came with it was very flavorful. The rice and beans were rice and beans. Nothing special.

19.description: Curried Goat was good.   Beware; management seems dishonest! We bought a $15 "restaurant.com" coupon 3 days ago. Management refused to honor the coupon! Prices charged on your bill are one dollar higher than prices printed on the menu!   Jerk Chicken was a little under-cooked but I didn't get sick from it. Waitress delivered our dinners; we ate those then I went to ask about the side dishes we ordered.  Those came right out after I asked.

28.description: I have been a customer of Good To Go for the past 8 years. I even order the same thing every single time, 8 Jerk Chicken Wings with Fries, but that will soon change. I ordered the wings on Saturday and was very shocked when I heard the lady say my total was $18. For some wings?!?!?!?! She informed me that the price recently went up (even though their website list a different price) the day before. I can go to a 5 star restaurant and not pay $18 for 8 wings. Also, since I have been ordering the wings for some time now they have not changed one thing about it. No extra wing, extra fries,  or even extra sauce to warrant a 100% price inflation. So, while the food is tasty, I will not be returning. Too much $$$$.

45.description: I love the goat and the jerk chicken. The milk shakes are great

33.description: I ordered the Jerk Chicken Meal (paid additional to make it a large size), southern cornbread, 1 beef patty and paid 1.00 additional to add a side of the mac and cheese.  Ordered arrived within an hour and lukewarm at best.  Rice dry, jerk chicken just tasted like a mediocre rotisserie chicken, mac and cheese was simply awful no love in it at all.  Beef patty was ok but tasted like the ones out of the box in the freezer isle.  The only thing we actually could qualify as "good" was the southern cornbread with bits of corn in it.  While it was dry it did have a decent flavor.  Yes they serve large portions and even throw in a few plantains but large portions do not matter when the food is simply not good.  Total disappointment.  Even my child who eats everything rejected this food, couldn't blame him once I tasted it myself.

43.description: I would like to first say that I enjoy the jerk chicken here.  Especially compared to one place not too far from here.  I have only two criticisms:1. It is pricey compared to some of the Caribbean/jerk/Jamaican restaurants in the area.2. Customer service - sometimes the cashiers do not greet you when you enter the restaurant.  They don't smile or say thank you.  Good food, but service could be better.

2.description: Some of the best Jamaican cuisine I've ever experienced in Chicago. I typically go with the Oxtails and brown stew chicken, but I've also had curry goat, jerk chicken and ackee and saltfish. Everything is great!!! From the plaintains to the rice and peas (w/gravy). You will not be disappointed!!!!

18.description: Authentic Jamaican Food .. Great service . I had the curry goat with rice and peas , it was excellent . My husband had the jerk pork and he really enjoyed it , had great flavor! Drinks were great !! Try the cool runnings or hedonism!! Would definitely return to Rogers Park for an authentic Jamaican meal

41.description: After having some pretty solid delivery from here a la GrubHub, my friends and I decided to pick up some catering trays for our Jamaican-themed birthday party. They did not disappoint! It was fun introducing friends to patties, festival, callaloo and Ting, plus the jerk chicken was spot-on, too.  I'd love to see some pumpkin soup available. That may have been my favorite dish while I was in Negril.It's nowhere close to where I live, but somehow I'll continue to find an excuse to order from there when I'm up at work. :)

52.description: Definitely a fan!  Jerk Chicken and Ting is what it's all about.  Decent serving size, nice people,  but sadly not a Jamaican accent around.

50.description: We ordered from Good to Go through Grub Hub. My veggie lady got the vegetarian special, with cabbage and mac n' cheese. It was basically cabbage, more cabbage,  (tasty cabbage, though), plus lots of starch. She said the mac wasn't terribly impressive, but liked the cabbage and the rice. I got the curry chicken, which was very good, although I suffered from a bit of indigestion the next day. My sides were cabbage and collard greens. All told a good meal, with huge portions, although the description of the vegetarian dinner special on the menu wasn't clear (which is how we wound up with so much cabbage).

4.description: Definitely one of my favorite Jamaican restaurant in Chicago! Very nice people and great food. When busy, customer service can suck. I would recommend that if you're getting pick up to place your order over the phone so that it could be ready.

6.description: Been coming here for years. Love this place. Oxtails, jerk wings, chicken and rib tips are my regular dishes. I've had the jerk chicken salad which was honestly a waste of money. I could just take the jerk and make a salad at home (which I do). Caramel cake is rich and amazing. You don't want to eat the whole thing but you do anyway! It's ok, just go to the gym and work it off. Defiantly worth it.

22.description: I tried the oxtail and Jerk chicken was pretty good here and service pretty good too. I like that it's not that far away from my neighborhood.

15.description: I tried the oxtail and Jerk chicken was pretty good here and service pretty good too. I like that it's not that far away from my neighborhood.

57.description: Why does it take 40 mins. to get my order of jerk chicken?  Oh, that's because the cook is chit chatting with the girl at the register!!  AND, the 4 pieces of festival I ordered at $2.50 each came to me looking like one piece cut into four smaller portions (think the size of a pen top).  The sauce is okay, but for Rogers Park, there definitely needs to be more of a competitive spirit if we're talking Jamaican cuisine.

20.description: Authentic Jamaican Food .. Great service . I had the curry goat with rice and peas , it was excellent . My husband had the jerk pork and he really enjoyed it , had great flavor! Drinks were great !! Try the cool runnings or hedonism!! Would definitely return to Rogers Park for an authentic Jamaican meal

36.description: We like this spot because its authentic, good jerk spices, beef patty, collard greens. Food is good, the service is a little bit on the slow side, we noticed a lot of people do take out. Today was okay....the rice was a bit dry.B&R

14.description: Great food,  however,  bring your tablet and catch a movie. The wait is exceptionally long. Or you could maybe take a nap

29.description: If I could give this place 10 stars I would. I found this place by "accident," even though I go by it everyday on my way home. First off, the staff is friendly and courteous. Second, they have always been accommodating and try to get me in as soon as they can. (my schedule is slightly hectic at best) However it is the third point that really makes this place stand high above the rest: the haircut.I have had sooooooooo many bad hair cuts in the last year that it's become a joke  of sorts amongst my friends (bastards). John has changed all that for me. He's a real, honest to God barber and he intuitively understands a man's hair. He listens, confirms that he understands and that you agree, and then gets to work. There is no idle chit-chat, no nonsense, he focuses on what he's doing and goes at it like the professional he is. I have a couple of areas where I'm "light on hair" and he has helped me contend with that. He shaves the areas around the base and sides of your hairline with an actual straight razor and then you're done. I cannot possibly give adequate feedback to suffice the way I feel about these folks. However, their prices are more than fair and you'll be happy with the results.

42.description: The salon is open and clean, and I only waited ten minutes. It was around 2:30, so it was nice and quiet. Claudia did a great job on my nails. Four starts instead of five because for the price I could have gotten a foot spa and massage chair elsewhere. I did get a little shoulder rub though and was accomodated in my request to do my hands first...something that's frowned upon at the busier salons.

23.description: waxing, threading, haircuts,manis, pedis, THEY DO IT ALL!!very friendly staff can get appointments pretty easilyvery clean atomsphereA++++

47.description: They have great specials! During the month of march an OPI no-chip manicure and pedicure is only 40 dollars.I am extremely pleased with the OPI no-chip manicure. Claudia took her time on my hands and made sure it looked perfect.  My pedicure was done by Lily who made my toes look just as perfect as my fingers. The chairs were comfortable as well. No magazines to read--so bring your own reading material if you like to read through a pedicures. Both women spent more than enough time helping me pick out a color that matched my bridesmaids dress. I appreciated how much time they spent on me. This was my first time to this salon, but I will definitely continue to come here for my mani/pedi's.

8.description: I've been going to Johnny for haircuts and shaves/line ups for 12 years. Since the original Devon and Western location. He's one of the best barbers in the city. I've never had a single complaint.Gents, I highly recommend getting a hot lather/towel shave! You will look and feel like a new man. I get my beard trimmed and then get hot lather shave/line up, and a lot of people compliment me.This is a nice spot for both ladies and gents. i recommended couples try out their services.I will continue to be loyal to Johnny and this salon as long as it's around!

31.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for years and never knew about this place, thanks Groupon!  I had no problem getting a Saturday afternoon appointment and I believe I called the Wednesday before to set it up.  The place isn't huge but it had a nice neighborhood feel.  There are certainly clients that come in often and the staff knew them by name, nice touch.My mani/pedi was great.  Certainly not the $60 spa pedicure I used to get but for the price, it was great.  My nail tech was friendly, gentle and clearly took her time.  She did a great job shaping my nails too!   The polish lasted for 4 days before the first chip happened, which is amazing.  I usually have a chip the next day!  My eyebrow threading was amazing!  She asked a few times along the way, did I like the shape, was I ok, etc.  She was quick and I swear, there wasn't a hair left where it shouldn't be!  Overall, I can't wait to go back, this is a neighborhood gem.  If you want a high end,chic, over priced salon experience, don't come here, if you want friendly service, techs that care about what they are doing and a reasonable price, give this place a shot!

34.description: I got the Groupon Mani/Pedi and unfortunately my mani peeled off on the 2nd day and I get mani/pedis every month.  I was not in a pool or anything either, it must be the base coat that they use? Too bad.... it is cheap, but I guess you get what you pay for!

16.description: Years ago when I lived downtown I was a regular at an old European Salon that provided great haircuts despite bad service. After I moved to the northside I wanted to see if I could find something more convenient. I ended up finding the best place I've ever gotten my hair cut.Make an appointment first, and be early, and bring cash, and you're golden. John remembers me every time, is nice and conversational but gets the hint I don't really like talking too much- my last place felt like an interrogation every time, but here I think he'd be great if you are talkative, but he doesn't mind that I'm not. He's fast, thorough, and my hair always looks and feels amazing. I've since moved to a corner of the city about an hour away, but I still make the commute every time I need a trim. I've never gotten a bad cut from him and as long as I'm in Chicago I'll never go anywhere else.I've never gotten my nails done here or anything else, but I probably should one of these days. But you should definitely enjoy one of his cuts!

13.description: Amazing nail service. I got a gel manicure and regular pedicure and it was amazing. I called the morning that I needed it and they were able to fit me right in. If you go to get your nails done- request Marianna! She helped me pick out coordinating colors and did a fantastic job. I will for sure be back!

11.description: Came in for last-minute manicures with my best friend on NYE. Angela did a great job on both... She took a little longer than some techs do but the results were super worth it, and she was friendly and nice to hang out with. :)  We really appreciated her fitting both of us in late in the day.  I live in Brooklyn but when I next visit Chicago we'll go back for another nail date.  :)

39.description: I've had the hardest time finding a place to get a trim that doesn't cost $50, doesn't leave me with an uneven cut and doesn't take 2 trains and a bus to get to. I can walk to this place and the reviews aren't terrible so I thought I'd give it a shot. I don't have difficult hair, straight, not to thick, not a complicated cut, so I didn't think a trim would be difficult. To be fair the haircut itself isn't bad, it's just not what I asked for or wanted. The major issue I had is that the woman who cut my hair didn't speak enough English to understand what I was asking for. It took some pantomiming to communicate texturize? Thinning? You use those scissors that only cut out some pieces? We settled on layers just at the end. "not too short" was a phrase I repeated often, and she still took off double what she showed me she was going to take off and put too-short layers in my bangs. Yes my straight across bangs now have short layers in them. This is not just nice texture, they're full on layers. So I'm not so happy, but I can't say she doesn't know how to cut hair, you just have to speak her language. Which I don't. So I won't be back. Too bad because a $25 haircut is a pretty good deal.

37.description: I was a walk in here the day before leaving for a wedding. Got a haircut, manicure, and eyebrow threading with no wait!  I was really happy with the haircut and style, although of course i can never manage to look as cute the next day left to my own devices... Anyhow, I had the same lady for the haircut and eyebrow threading. She did a great job and asked several times along the way if I liked what she had done so far. Same thing with the manicure, I got a French and the woman asked if i wanted curved or straight then asked me to check before she filled in the nail.It seemed like they had lots of regulars come in, the front counter lady was referring to everyone by name. She also came over twice and asked how I was doing, did I live in the neighborhood, etc.  Very friendly staff and not crazy prices! My new salon :)

0.description: Finally I found nice salon for eyebrow threading. Jessie did awesome job..she didn't hurt me while doing it.she was friendly, polite , sweet and super fast. She finished the job of eyebrow threading ,upper lips and chin within 10 minutes. I am super happy and would definitely visit this salon again for eyebrow threading and for other services too.. I hope the stupid lady who made my eyebrows shapeless and weird looking then argued a lot with me when I wrote negative review on yelp and finally kept quiet when I told I have forwarded all the conversation of director of spa chain would read this review.

38.description: I am always nervous about trying out a new barber so after I dumped my old barber it took a while before I could find a replacement. I was waiting for the train one day & decided to check out International. Since then I have been getting my hair cut there for about 3 years now (maybe longer) and I always walk away satisfied with my cut or shave. John knows what he's doing simple as that. I can relax in the chair because I don't have to watch every move he makes because I know I can trust him to have it how I like it. Also I don't trust a lot of people with my lining but John is definetely one of them. I swear I don't think he's cut or knicked me once, one of my main complaints anywhere else. Its always even and on point and if you ever want to adjust anything John is always more than willing and capable. He cuts good hair simple as that. Whether I need a scissor trim, a blowout, a fade, a shave, a lining I can trust I wont come out looking jacked up going to John. I've only really been there for a haircut or a shave so I can't really comment on the other services, but everyone in there is super nice and after a while greet you by name which I think is awesome customer service. Great neighborhood spot.

51.description: I am recommending this salon to everyone I know.  I had a pedicure and my eyebrows waxed - both by Claudia.  She did an excellent job. I like the salon atmosphere - very open and airy.  They pride themselves on using big tubs for pedicures that can be sanitized easily.  They're not pushy or condescending, and I felt like Claudia took her time with me.  Very good customer relations. I will go back.

27.description: I am so glad I found this place.  Every time, I leave with a terrific haircut for a very reasonable price.  I have fine hair, and I wear it in a bob.  If you have fine hair too, you know that if your cut is not precise, you're going to be snipping off stray strands of hair for weeks, and your hair will never look right.   At International Hair Salon, you'll get a precision cut.  The angles and lines will be perfect, and they'll still be perfect after you wash and dry your hair the next day.The salon is spacious, clean, and spare.  No clutter anywhere.  This gives the place a very upscale and modern look.  Both Sara and John are very skilled professionals.
