I've had more expensive haircuts elsewhere that were not nearly as good.  And you're not going to believe this part: As good as these stylists are, they are friendly, open, and approachable.  There is no off-putting snobbiness or intimidation here.  Seriously, you just can't beat this salon.Make your appointment ahead of time, and block out some time for the appointment, because this is not a rush-job kind of place.  A really good cut can take some time.  When you call to make your appointment, the receptionist will even tell you how much you will be charged for the services you're requesting, so you will know how much cash to bring with you.    Make sure you bring extra cash to cover that hefty tip you are really going to want to leave.

32.description: John is the first guy who consistently does a good job on my hair. As long as I am in Chicago, I am coming here.

54.description: This place is a rare find. They guy who runs the place cuts short hair with precision. I went back the second time to have my long hair cut off, and this new woman working there interfered, she told me to keep my hair long, and let her cut it. It's been two months, my hair looks awesome every day. That stylist ROCKS. Her craft was flawless. I was put off a bit by her personal demeanor. But who cares when she has mad skills. And it's cheap enough to go back on a regular basis. If you want easy, unpretentious, inexpensive, and quality, this is the place.

48.description: John has been cutting my hair since he opened his shop and I've never had a bad cut.  He is always professional and does a very thorough job. Angela is always cheerful and helpful.  Its a great business!

44.description: I have been going to this salon for the past 5 years, it was located by Western & Devon then. john is absolutely amazing, exceptional customer service. I always let him decide what hairstyle is should sport, and this decision has never backfiredThey have parking in the back, John engages in small talk & does a excellent job all along. THUMBS UP. He should offer a Groupon deal in order to get in more customers.

24.description: I went here for a haircut and a manicure and pedicure and will be back.  I had John for the haircut.  He's not chatty (which I prefer), listened to what I wanted, and gave it to me.  I'm growing out the top of my super-thick and wavy hair, and he cut it so it lays perfectly.  Didn't catch the name of the nail tech, but she was very gentle and didn't try to hack off any of my calluses from walking.  All the products used were quality, Redken & OPI.  Finally, the atmosphere was relaxing and the prices were extremely reasonable.

7.description: I've had my hair cut by Sarah in the past and today by Manuel (sp?). They are both amazing! I adore Sarah but my new work schedule forced me to try someone new. Luckily this new guy is great too! The price is so absolutely stellar. $25 for an amazing, professional cut and style. And Sarah is the best with eyebrow threading too. She's quick, doesn't miss anything and gets a great shape out of my beastly brows.

49.description: Ok, so I'm a loyola student and today my friend and I went in for a mani pedi. I was kind of skeptic because I have really short nails and sometimes they can't do my nails very well. Today I had Lily and my friend had Claudia. They were both wonderful. Lily didn't speak much English but they were so kind and we were in and out within an hour! The special price was great too. We walked out of there feeling like a million bucks and would definitely go again. The chairs for the pedicures were so comfortable!!! I really want one in my house. But anyway, fabulous service, wonderful people, will definitely be going back!!

40.description: You will get compliments. Friendly & quick.

53.description: I ride the ol' Red Line everyday to and/from the Loop. I have often seen the sign off the Loyola Stop for the $5 eyebrow threading. I have always gone to Carmen's (also off the Loyola shop on N. Sheridan). Yesterday I decided to make a change and try International Salon Spa. You have to walk up to a non-descript building, open the door, and head up the stairs. It seems a little scary at first. Then you see the sign for the International Salon Spa. The space is large, with nice wooden floors. There are three work stations and a manicure, pedicure station. I walked in and asked for an eyebrow threading. Here is where it gets interesting...the person (who's name I can't remember) was the most gentle eyebrow threader I've every been too-and I've been to probably 10 different places throughout the city. She did a very, very thorough job. She threaded, plucked, and trimmed. Here is the best part-she then gave a great, relaxing, aloe forehead massage for about 5 minutes. My eyebrows look better than ever, and all for $7 plus tip.

30.description: I bought a Groupon from there and waited until the absolute last week it was valid to make an appointment. They didn't have any appointments until after it expired, but they said they would still honor the Groupon.  I thought, 'Yay, what great customer service and if my nails turn out well, I'll be back'.  Unfortunately they didn't.  The nail technician was very nice (as was everyone else there) and my nails looked great immediately after.  I type a lot for my job and the manicure lasted 3 days, which is impressive.  However, the pedicure chipped in less than a week.  And not just in one spot.  On half the nails. On my feet.  In the fall.  I wasn't in sand or wearing flip flops or anything else that would cause them to chip.   I can give myself a pedicure that will last weeks. Unfortunately this salon just isn't up to par.

46.description: FINALLY! Somewhere to get my eyebrows done!!! I've been to so many different places around Rogers Park where the service started off great, but then, declined over time. People stop being polite, stop doing as good of a job on you, or just stop caring about the customer (like not brushing the hair off your face when they are done threading--YUK!) I've been going to this place for a year now and it is wonderful! Claudia does a great job every single time. She really pays attention to what you want done and offers helpful suggestions to keep you looking great! She also does a great, attentive mani-pedi. She is so kind and patient it's almost unreal.  It's $7 for eyebrows but I always give her $10! They have new rules as of a couple of months ago about what services and amounts they are willing to accept credit cards for, so check out their website for info and you are good to go!Hello bombshell!

1.description: For men's haircuts- I've been going here for 8 years- John is a great Barber ( Not simply a stylist- a licensed straight razor-on-the-neck Barber) and gives a consistently great haircut time after time. He's personable, professional and works a long day. The shop is always clean, and the appointment system is efficient. Its great to be treated well with a quick and precise haircut at a great value. Highly recommended!

55.description: Have you ever seen the commercial where the stylist is cackling on the phone while working on a client; she motions for the client to give her her hand, and has the client hold the curling iron so the stylist can free herself to cackle some more on the phone??? This was a similar experience! While washing my hair, (she answered phone calls) she pulled my hair--hard, getting it caught in the the spray nozzle and not even noticing!! That was after shampooing my hair while it was half dry.... THEN, she put the 'cape' on me with no towel underneath, where I realized about 10 minutes later my shirt was soaked! While cutting my hair, she took my eye out with a flip of my own wet locks, she didn't realize she did that, either. Then while drying my hair, the diffuser she used fell off the hair dryer and knocked me in the head!! I told her to stop drying my hair at that point and headed for the pay counter. This beating cost me $30 and I was still unhappy with my hair upon leaving. I am not going back there, I suggest you skip this one too!

9.description: I tried to stop in to get a haircut based on reviews. The sign was out on the street so I went up to the shop but it was locked. No message on the door. No explanation. So I called the number and got the answering machine. I didn't leave a message but they called back about 30 minutes after I had been there.  When I explained my experience and that I had moved on, they simply hung up. Not cool. I won't  go back even though I would love to support a salon in my neighborhood.

26.description: This was probably the 2nd WORST haircut I have ever received in my life! When I walked in, the receptionist was friendly and professional, but after that it went downhill. A woman, I assumed was my stylist directed me to the washing station and began washing my hair. She NEVER introduced herself, so I asked if she would be cutting my hair today and what her name was, which I believe is "Mary". When we sat in the chair she asked me what cut I wanted and I asked her if she took notice of my current hair prior to washing and she said "no". NEVER have I ever received a consultation AFTER washing my hair. Next, I showed her a picture of my last cut from 2 months ago, which is an asymmetrical bob where the front was below shoulder length, and explained to her I was trying to grow my hair out and just wanted a touch up for an upcoming job interview. I explained I wanted it longer in the front and like my cuts to be more edgy and alternative. We agreed on 1 inch overall. Let' just say I ended up with a face framing bob and about 3 inches gone. I was shocked and mortified as I look like a combination between a soccer mom and a friar. I wanted to cry, which I did when I got home and looked in the mirror. SHE RUINED MY HAIR!Afterwards as I walked back to the reception area, the receptionist asked me if I liked it and I said NO and started explaining why. I showed her the picture of my last cut and explained I was trying to grow it out and that the stylist obviously did not listen. The receptionist offered to have the stylist fix it, but at that point I wasn't willing to have any more of my hair cut off. She also offered me to come back for free next time which I told her that it didn't help me now. She also stated "well, does your hair grow fast?". I stated that the stylist seemed to know how to cut hair and was fast, however, the problem was her consultation, listening skills and lack of interest in her client. She was aloof and had NO personality. Then the stylist came over and said "well that is what she asked for" and then started speaking in another language right in front of me! VERY RUDE! I was so offended that I paid the $25 and walked out. I plan to call the owner today and ask for a refund.

25.description: I let 1 person touch my head and its JOHN! This saloon has none of the uptight ego so many hair places have in this city. Plenty of neighborhood charm, a/c, and great customer service. These folks always remember me and are always friendly and charming. If you are in the Rogers park hood, you cant get any better than INTERNATIONAL SALON!!!

12.description: So I noticed that they had a new nail technician. And oh my god do I love her! Her name is Marina. I came to do a no chip and she did such an amazing fast and clean job. It's been a week and my nails still look gorgeous. She seems to know a lot about what she does. I'm definitely coming back to her.

21.description: Just moved to the area and was looking for a reliable place to become my go to salon for my brows, haircuts, and mani pedis. This place is now it! So far I've only had my eyebrows threaded and my bangs cut here but they did an awesome job!The best thing is that they have great customer service!I called to make an appointment, no one answered, so I left a message. They actually called back, and in a timely manner too!At the salon everyone is super nice and makes sure that you're comfy throughout your whole stay at the salon!I'll be back at this place soon!

17.description: Just moved to the area and was looking for a reliable place to become my go to salon for my brows, haircuts, and mani pedis. This place is now it! So far I've only had my eyebrows threaded and my bangs cut here but they did an awesome job!The best thing is that they have great customer service!I called to make an appointment, no one answered, so I left a message. They actually called back, and in a timely manner too!At the salon everyone is super nice and makes sure that you're comfy throughout your whole stay at the salon!I'll be back at this place soon!

10.description: A neighbor had recently had her hair cut and colored and was very happy with the salon, so on a day when I was too lazy to drive a mile to my usual nail salon (which, by the way, changed management recently), I called on a whim and they had an appointment available 10 minutes later. Since it's literally a block away from my house, I was really in luck. Mariana was sweet, professional and gave me a great pedicure. My regular shop had been shaving my callouses for years (which I've been told by others isn't recommended), so it was a real change of pace for me not to have that done. I'll definitely return!

5.description: I have been going to International Salon for a couple of years now since I moved to Rogers park and every time I leave happy with results. Sara is a great stylist, she always does an excellent job. My hair was long and short, dark and light depending on my mood, and every time my expectations were exceeded. I now have a combo of low lights and high lights and get a lot of compliments on my hair. Prices are affordable ($25 women's hair cut - you can't beat that!). I always value customer service and everyone is professional, respectful and helpful at International. I would recommend the salon to everyone. They say you need to have one hair stylist and mine is definitely Sara. If I relocate I will be driving an hour to get my hair done the way I want it.

3.description: There's no better barber in Chicago. John is friendly, fast, and precise. He's he kind of guy that somehow remembers you after only one visit. Plus, the price is great.I've been getting my hair cut here for four years, and even after moving a bit south out of Rogers Park still make the trek back up.

35.description: I used a Groupon here. I was taken aback by the fact I HAD to make an appointment - and they were booked a week out. Ok. However, when I got there, I have no idea why they were so "booked" because it was empty. My mani/pedi was unlike any other. The mani was done first, which actually makes sense. No complaints (although the polish chipped the next day). The pedi was another issue. PAINFUL!!! Why do nail tech believe they MUST torture you to do a pedi? I kept flinching and finally told the girl to be gentle. That reminder was repeated about every 60 seconds. There's no reason to go back, unless I wanted to wait over a week for a so-so mani/pedi appointment.

19.description: My services of choice? Threading and nails.Threading is cheap and efficient. $7 for a good eyebrow cleanup? Yes, please!The nail techs are also fast. Expect a clean mani/pedi. Many OPI shades to choose from.They will take walk-ins but better to have an appointment. They can get busy and don't always have available staff for all services.

28.description: My services of choice? Threading and nails.Threading is cheap and efficient. $7 for a good eyebrow cleanup? Yes, please!The nail techs are also fast. Expect a clean mani/pedi. Many OPI shades to choose from.They will take walk-ins but better to have an appointment. They can get busy and don't always have available staff for all services.

45.description: This is the place to go for your next hair cut! The staff has a lot of experience and the wait is always minimum. Most importantly they do a great job. I have had John cut my hair twice now and both times I have been amazed at how fast and precise he is at his job. Trust me this place it Great!

33.description: I got a groupon for a mani/pedi and have tried 3 times to get into this place and use it. I have been told they are making "standing" appointments only because they currently only have a part time nail person.My thought was.. then WHY offer all those groupons??? They told me they would call me 15 minutes ahead of time if I could get in; never heard anything. So I called back yet again and they have nothing available for the next 3 days.. I've been waiting 3 weeks and my patience has run out. Not worth the aggravation!!  Am asking groupon for a refund and will definitely NOT be going here!!!

43.description: Awesome.This salon is easy to overlook because it's hiding on the second floor, but thanks to yelp...I found it!  I'm glad.  I was looking for a place to get my hair cut that wasn't going to cost $400000000 dollars or take 3 months to get an appointment (they take walk-ins) and this place had a $25 shampoo, cut and blow-dry package.  Each month they change their specials so check their website or the sign out front.I got my hair done with Miriam, she did a nice shampoo, took her time cutting my hair, blow-dried and flat ironed my hair.  I LOVE IT.  I was so surprised after she finished at how exact she was in what I requested.  She was very nice but didn't say much.  I kind of prefer just relaxing rather than making small talk while at the salon so that worked for me.  I decided last minute to get my eyebrows threaded (I've never done it before), and they were very accommodating.  Claudia is amazing!  It hardly hurt (far less than waxing), and she gave my brows great shape.  She was also very nice.   Before tip I spent $32.  For a complicated, well-done hair cut and a painless eyebrow threading, you can't beat that cost.  FYI: They only take credit card with charges $30+.  Tips are only in cash.  This salon isn't all foofy and girly with wine and massages and scented candles but it gets the job done for a decent cost, it's clean and the people are nice.

2.description: This review goes out to the foreign hair stylist they have there -- who needs to be fired.I came this morning, the morning of my graduation, to get my hair thinned and split ends cut. I specifically said not to cut my hair too short, and made this very clear, because I want it long enough to curl. Completely disregarded what I wanted, AND didn't know how to thin out hair. If someone can't speak enough english to clearly communicate with customers, then why work in an environment where that's crucial?It's unfortunate that I've had a bad hair cutting experience, because the lady who threads my eye brows there was amazing. Just do not go there for a hair cut.

18.description: My favorite place for eyebrow shaping.  Waxing is relatively painless; threading is efficient and perfect.  Always satisfied with my eyebrows when they're done.  I have thick Egyptian eyebrows and am so glad to look natural but professionally put together after I see them.

41.description: I had a Groupon for a mani/pedi which I used yesterday.  First of all, I was amazed they were able to take me a week after the Groupon deal -I really appreciate how this salon only sold enough Groupons for what they could handle.Lilly did an awesome job on my mani/pedi. She explained what she was doing (like how she had to push my cuticles back quite a bit and so it would be a little more pressure) and my nails look fabulous - great shape too. Angela was very helpful and patient helping me to pick out colors. I'm always indecisive with polish, and I absolutely love the one she helped me choose. Customer Service was definitely a 10!  The stafff really makes you feel welcome, remembering your name and engaging in friendly conversation. The salon was on the second level of a buliding above a pizza shop in the Loyola area - once I got up to the salon, it very clean and I was thoroughly impressed. I will be back! There was a mother/daughter duo each having a mani/pedi as well and they were also very pleased. The only thing I wish I had known was that there is a free lot to park in in the back. Hope this helps people avoid paying for parking like me!

52.description: My husband and I had our hair cut here and we liked the service, the people and what they did to our hair. I also had my hair colored and I am very pleased with it. And they aren't expensive. We plan to go back again next month.

50.description: The ONLY place in Chicago to get your eyebrows threaded. I make trips here from the suburbs just because I know my eyebrows will look great - they actually listen to what you say regarding shape/thickness - and somehow it never hurts as much as I think it's going to! I've had way too many botched experiences elsewhere. And that aloe head massage is great!

4.description: Came here for a gel manicure and a pedicure before spring break. Super nice and clean inside, very friendly and welcoming staff. My pedicure was relaxing--soak, scrub, and even a hot wax heel treatment! My manicure was lovely as well--she shaped my nails perfectly, the tools were new and clean, and the owner's adorable little son came over to offer me some candy (so cute!). Student discount made it super affordable. I'd definitely come back!

6.description: John is great. I have gone to him for a few years now and don't like going anywhere else. The place is a family run joint, he and Angela are both very kind and gentle people, and they are just chill and give great services. I am a "guys guy" and would not have thought to hit this place up if not for a recommendation of a colleague, but trust me (random guy on the internet), this place is really a hidden gem.

22.description: Okay...I'm back with another review!! I've been coming here for 6 years. It's the best barber/salon I have been to in Chicago. It's location is further north and if you live in the city well jump on the train, take a bus or just hop in a cab.John is the only barber at this location and he is fabulous. Talk about skills. His technique is amazing and I love that he uses a straight razor. I have been to many barbers in the city and they only use clippers for a clean up. Talk about remedial. Once you get a cut here you will want to keep coming back. He remembers you every time you come in. Let's just say my fade is always on point!Sarah is my eyebrow threader. I love that her technique is strong and my eyebrows are the best I have ever seen. Manicure/pedicures are done by Suzie. She is so clean and consistent that I recommend her all the time and she is so friendly!! I LOVE THAT!!The salon has grown by leaps and bounds and I always want to try new service and over the past few years they have started to introduce more services. I have done a fruit acid manicure and most recently had a 20 minute lip plumping service.  It was great!! So far I am very happy!! My lips still look plumped, hydrated and smooth. I recommend this treatment if you are going to a party or special event. It's great for instant gratification lip plumping!!Thanks International Salon!!

15.description: Okay...I'm back with another review!! I've been coming here for 6 years. It's the best barber/salon I have been to in Chicago. It's location is further north and if you live in the city well jump on the train, take a bus or just hop in a cab.John is the only barber at this location and he is fabulous. Talk about skills. His technique is amazing and I love that he uses a straight razor. I have been to many barbers in the city and they only use clippers for a clean up. Talk about remedial. Once you get a cut here you will want to keep coming back. He remembers you every time you come in. Let's just say my fade is always on point!Sarah is my eyebrow threader. I love that her technique is strong and my eyebrows are the best I have ever seen. Manicure/pedicures are done by Suzie. She is so clean and consistent that I recommend her all the time and she is so friendly!! I LOVE THAT!!The salon has grown by leaps and bounds and I always want to try new service and over the past few years they have started to introduce more services. I have done a fruit acid manicure and most recently had a 20 minute lip plumping service.  It was great!! So far I am very happy!! My lips still look plumped, hydrated and smooth. I recommend this treatment if you are going to a party or special event. It's great for instant gratification lip plumping!!Thanks International Salon!!

20.description: Years ago when I lived downtown I was a regular at an old European Salon that provided great haircuts despite bad service. After I moved to the northside I wanted to see if I could find something more convenient. I ended up finding the best place I've ever gotten my hair cut.Make an appointment first, and be early, and bring cash, and you're golden. John remembers me every time, is nice and conversational but gets the hint I don't really like talking too much- my last place felt like an interrogation every time, but here I think he'd be great if you are talkative, but he doesn't mind that I'm not. He's fast, thorough, and my hair always looks and feels amazing. I've since moved to a corner of the city about an hour away, but I still make the commute every time I need a trim. I've never gotten a bad cut from him and as long as I'm in Chicago I'll never go anywhere else.I've never gotten my nails done here or anything else, but I probably should one of these days. But you should definitely enjoy one of his cuts!

36.description: I bought a groupon for a mani/pedi and was very excited to find a new place to go. The staff was very friendly and the place was clean and quiet. Unlike other nail salons, this place doesn't use the massage chairs with the foot spa, which I was really happy about. I've heard so many horror stories about women who've gotten horrible infections from dirty foot spas, and I've never seen a nail technician do a thorough cleaning of a spa before I use it. Instead, this salon uses resin basins which are cleaned after every use. It made me feel safe, and just the foot soak was very relaxing.The manager was incredibly knowledgeable about all the products they carry and made good recommendations for me. The hand and foot massages weren't very long, but I enjoyed what I did get. Also, even though the nail tech, Claudia, was gentle and took good care of my cuticles and nails, the polish on my fingers is starting to peel on the edges already. I don't normally get finger polish, so I'm not sure why this is happening. Claudia did give me tips for keeping up my cuticles and nails at home though without having to buy special products, so that was really nice.I decided while I was there to get my eyebrows threaded too, and they accommodated me no problem. Claudia also did the threading and gave me the best looking eyebrows I've ever had. For $7, I will definitely be going back for that service.I think the regular price for a mani/pedi is $39, which is a lot considering they don't have a lot of extras as part of the service. I certainly won't be able to go regularly at that price. But, it's conveniently located and I know I won't find a friendlier staff that treats me so well somewhere else. Overall, I think this is a hidden gem in Rogers Park and hope it gets more business.

14.description: It can be hard to find a great a great salon in the city, especially a barber who understands your hair and gives you the type of haircut you want, but John is the best man for the job. Living on the northside, I have tried my share of salons and I kept going from one to another because I was never satisfied with my previous haircuts. I have been going to John since their salon first opened and will continue to do so, because I know I will walk out feeling good with the haircut he gives me. He takes his time, makes sure that your hair looks right all around, and even uses a straight razor to take care of your sideburns. Not only John, but his staff is always friendly and welcoming. As a man who tries to get his eyebrows cleaned every few weeks, this is also my place for that and I leave feeling and looking like a man. Go check out this place and I know you will not be disappointed. Be sure to schedule an appointment before going.

58.description: I absolutely love this place and eat here as often as I can. It is a gem for Chicago and more so for Rogers Park and oneof the 18 distinct ethnic restaurants within 3 miles of my house. Honestly I do not know whoch to rate higher - the food or the people. The staff is always soooooo nice and attentive and friendly. They try to give a bit of themeselves in their service and the only time I have EVER been recognized and greeted in such a great way was at Les Nomades. Fortunately you won't spend 400$ to eat at Den Den and you'll be a welcome guest and friend from the moement you step into the place. The food  - to me - seems to have some italian influence with its furtada and spaghetti. They cook with herb infused oils and butter. They keep the teft bread plentiful and everyting is made and prepped with great care. My favorites are a giant vegetarian get up with Lamb or spicy chicken on the side. Of course their greens are awesome and their lentils are fantastic. My only word of caution is tothe coffee. It is an experience when they cook the beans and smoke them in the brass pot and bring you out a jug of coffee and the popcorn is just so cool. BUT careful how much you drink unless you plan on being up all night driving coast to coast. Delicious but powerful. I have often driven past this place and regretted having eaten at work when I could have stopped here and been treated like family and served wickedly good food. Parking can be a hassle but usually within an easy walk. I hope this place stays open a long long time.

56.description: not as good as ras dashen, but an interesting change.  this is eritrean food, which is a little different than ethiopian food.  main difference is the spices.  eritrean usually has more of a curry & cardamom influence. i prefer ethiopian.  however, i had the best coffee in my life here!  so maybe it's worth it just for that.  they smoked the beans by hand, then carried them around the restaurant waving smoke around for all to smell.  then they took the beans back and brewed them.  served in a giant gourd.  was yummy!  parking is easy.

29.description: Den Den is delicious. I've sampled all of their veggie dishes, and I think the shiro is stand-out good. They are really generous with the injera, and I always leave way too stuffed.

42.description: Den Den is a really great neighborhood find. I've been there twice recently and am looking forward to introducing others to the pleasure of their food.  I particularly like the spicy fish.  Among the vegetables, I especially enjoy the okra and the spinach. The spicy red lentils (kind of like an Indian dal) are also very tasty.  The young woman who served us the first time about a month ago remembered us and was very friendly again last night.  The owner came by and chatted briefly as well. All in all, I'd highly recommend Den Den.  review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

23.description: My wife, mother and son ate at Den Den yesterday afternoon. We were immediately greeted upon sitting down, water and menus were placed on our table, and the kind waiter gave us sufficient time to figure out what we wanted. We placed our order and our food was out in about 15-minutes. Our food looked and tasted incredibly fresh, albeit the potatoes (russet and sweet) were not soft or fully cooked and the tibs were tougher than a well done steak vs. tender. The chef was kind enough to make us another round of tender tibs, but first impressions are oftentimes last impressions. From now on, I'll stick to the best: Ethiopian Diamond.

47.description: WOW!!!Just went here for the first time very late last night and had to leave a review. BTW, thanks to the restaurant for staying open for us - we were the last people in, showing up past 10:00 on a Fri night, and they happily served and clearly cooked fresh food for us! If you like Ethiopian food, you owe it to yourself to go here! It's the best I've ever had and beats the places on Broadway (not so much a knock on them as a compliment to this place!). I know, I know, this is Eritrean food technically, not Ethiopian. But the culinary traditions are very similar (they were one country at one time) - and to my mind the food had much the same flavor but was so much better prepared.For three of us, we ordered tibsi lamb, tibsi chicken and a fish dish (can't remember the exact name of that one). Everything was prepared to perfection! What I loved most about this place, unlike many of the ethnic food restaurants I've tried in the city, including very much the Ethiopian, is that they didn't substitute oil/fat in place of flavor. Sure, everything was cooked in oil, but there wasn't puddles of it saturating the Injera (bread) like I remember from the other places. The dishes themselves were a bit spicy, but it wasn't overpowering - again, not overdoing it here and relying more on the underlying, and awesome! flavors of the dishes themselves. Well prepared food should not be about masking/overpowering flavors, but about bringing out the true subtleties of the dish. On spiciness, my wife, who can't handle heat at all, was able to get through the meal and was very satisfied!So overall, amazing food! Price wise, it felt slightly above the other places, but given how large the portions were and the superior quality of the food, I would say very reasonable - $13 - $15 per entree which includes a number of tasty sides. On the portions, the three dishes were enough for two meals each for the three of us, but the food was so incredibly tasty, we devoured it all - yes, including every last bit of Injera on the tray!If you like Ethiopian food, or maybe had a bad experience before, and want to try something that's done how it should be, go here!

8.description: First time coming here and the food was absolutely delicious we got the number 4 the alisha siga with medium spice. Service was nice and helpful when it came to giving more explanations on the meals. Couldn't snap a pic because the food was just to good to wait to take the picture. Will definitely be coming here again.

31.description: Great authentic Ethiopian food. Food that finally tasted like the real dishes back in Addis Ababa! I would recommend it for anyone that would be interested in trying it out.

34.description: Happened to see this place walking by so I tried it. First time eating Ethiopian and loved it.  Had the vegetarian, lamb, and chicken.  Watch out with lamb or beef. Found hard bones in some of the meat.  Ordered the honey wine which was very tasty. Ended the meal with their Ethiopian coffee which was delicious.  Highly recommend dining here!

16.description: Yum yum and yum!! I cant write enough yums for this place. This place is one of those places where you go if you want real home cooked food! I dont have any ethiopian friends here in the city but if I did and I would imagine they eat this kind of food and I would basically be their adopted family member. The service definitely is little on the slow side. There is a bit of a language barrier which sometimes makes it difficult to communicate with the one and only waitress, but shes soo cute that I can forgive any lapse on her part. The food is just something that I cant even describe. Its just one of THE best places I have had Ethiopian/Eritrean food. I use these two words together because concept and flavor wise they both are pretty close. I believe due to the growing popularity of Ethiopian food there are some establishments that are maybe slipping on the authenticity and flavor side but this place is about as authentic as you get. This place is an absolute must not just for the fantabulous food but also for the real authentic experience that you will be hard pressed to find anywhere else. For those who expect top notch service this isnt for you. It requires patience but its all worth it.

13.description: I honestly think I can attach physical qualities to love. They would come in the form of some wot, tibs, and vegetables on some injera bread. The first visit to Den Den wasn't enough, so I went back and then for a few more return visits.The service is out of this world, but that seems to be the case at all of the Ethiopian restaurants, so this gem of an Eritrean restaurant was no exception. What makes Den Den my favourite of all the Ethiopian restaurants is the food. I don't know if it's because the food doesn't drip with butter. Or perhaps there is some "enhancing" ingredients added to the food. It is just "that" good and I mean that in all caps.

11.description: Simply the best Eritrean food in the city. The food is flavorful, perfectly seasoned and most importantly, the engera is always fresh. The staff is friendly and the restaurant has a cultural and quiet ambiance. Den Den is my go-to restaurant for a piece of home.

39.description: Where do I start? The moment I walked in this restaurant, I was greeted as though I was family. The waiter was very friendly. He quickly took my order and shortly after my food was ready. I ordered the eggs and beans combo which was the best breakfast that I've had in a very long time. Everything was cooked perfectly and was tasty as well. I was also given the best tea I've ever drank in my life. It had a cinnamon flavor to it which made it so good. Not only was the food great, but the service was top notch. The waiter whose name was Seeair provided tremendous service throughout my visit. I was also fortunate enough to meet the owner of  the restaurant who was a very nice woman. This is a family owned restaurant and the food and service is a reflection of that. I would recommend this place to anyone. I'll be back in my Arnold Schwarzenegger voice.

37.description: I didn't know the distinctions btw Ethiopian and Eritrean food, but I now can say that I like the subtle seasoning differences with Eritrean. The flavors weren't as decadent or rich, but they were light and tasty. The ambience is really friendly and casual. I wish I'd tried this spot a long time ago! Hidden gem in Rogers park! Just don't come here expecting world class service, it's not the Ritz, but it's delicious!

0.description: I've had the opportunity to enjoy various Ethiopian restaurants all around the states, we were excited to try one in Chicago.  The food was great, fresh, flavourful, and absolutely no "grit" that we've gotten in the past (perhaps spices weren't fully absorbed into the food?). The Injera was just the right strength and tartness, but very subtle and soft. If you're looking for a down to earth Ethiopian restaurant, I recommend Den Den.  Our experience may have been a little different, but in all good ways. We showed up on a cold winter night, and unknown to us, they were preparing for a family wedding celebration, the entire restaurant was prepared for an event,  but they insisted we sit and enjoy a meal.  We got to watch as (what we assume) family showed up and we're social, whole we were obviously the outsiders, we felt welcomed and we're served a wonderful meal.  So the food was fantastic, as was the atmosphere, our only complaint is that we would have loved to have been a fly on the wall to simply observe the gathering that was happening. We typically want to try different restaurants on different trips, but I feel we'll be returning here again!

38.description: Amazing service and amazing food, and you don't have to wait 5 hours to eat like some other places in Chicago. The food is so good, not as creamy and heavy as Ethiopian food and you don't leave feeling gross.

51.description: Food - 5DELICIOUS! I think I  now enjoy Eritrean Food more than Ethiopian.  There were plenty of vegetarian and vegan options.  My favorite were the green beans. Soooo good!Ambiance - 4Very low lighting.  I could have a used a little more.  But the decor was lovely, well decorated, beautiful colors, and I loved how it mirrored their culture.Price - 3It is not too expensive.  The problem I had was that I ordered off of the takeout menu.  When I arrived to pay they said that the prices had changed and showed me the restaurant menu which was more now.  Fortunately the owner was very nice and gave me his card and told me that next time I came he would give me something additional for the trouble.Service - 5They were nice and were accurate with the time of my order.Overall - 4I'd definitely go back again.  The food was delicious and left me wishing to know how to make it.

27.description: I happened to pass this place a few weeks ago and it piqued my curiosity. So when a friend wanted to grab dinner this week , I suggested we leave Logan square and venture to parts unknown. Well worth the trip. Neither of us are very familiar with east/south African cuisine so we asked our server (also one of the owners Micheal) to guide us. Even though they do not have any sampler platters with meat, they prepared one for us. The food was balanced, spiced perfectly and the injera? Was sooo tasty and fresh. Its a small family run business so the service can be a little spotty but they make up for that in friendliness. My friend tried an Eritrean beer that complimented the food perfectly. I look forward to going back with a larger group.

32.description: Amazing! Simply amazing. This food is off the chain & truly authentic. Get to this spot. Get to it now!!

54.description: I wasn't a fan of East African food until my neighbors brought me to Den Den. Wow. What an experience and such tasty food! We were happily greeted by the waitress and seated to a table for the 6 of us. We got two large plates: one filled with meat dishes and one that was vegetarian. Both spectacular. The waitstaff is helpful in deciding what dishes you may like - although I think it'd be difficult to find one that isn't likeable. I want this business to do well as it is local and family owned. I think it is a quality place. The honey wine is a fun accompaniment. At some point I need to order the coffee service.

48.description: Was expecting more because I read reviews here. It was ok. It sure is probably authentic. But its in a not so great neighborhood. I have been to other so-so neighborhoods but have had better food. I have had ethiopian before, but in San Francisco. Was the best I have ha so far. Disappointed.

44.description: I went with my girlfriend on a cold Friday night.  We were greeted with a friendly Eritrean man who promptly served us Denden Mass (the honey wine).  It was tart and tangy with a hint of sweet.  I've been looking to buy it in bottles ever since.We ordered fish and chicken.  It came with a lot of side dishes, unlike the other Ethiopian restaurants I'd been to.  The fish was fresh and perfectly cooked.  The chicken fell off of the bone.  The sides were great.  The fermented cabbage was just the right level of spicy, and the salads were exquisite.One of the best restaurants in Chicago!

24.description: awesome sauce!  completely fantastic!  can not believe this place was not packed! a must  for excellent food!!!

7.description: Very friendly staff and incredible food. Got the #4 and was not disappointed. Will definitely seek this place out next time I'm in town.

49.description: I'm one happy camper right now!  I just got home from having a very late lunch at Den Den and I'm happy to report that it lived up to the high expectations that I'd developed based on the reviews here on Yelp.  I walked in at 4 pm and not surprisingly at that time of day I was the only diner in the restaurant.My server was a very friendly man who was happy to chat with me to find out what type of meat I'd like to eat and the level of spiciness I desired.  Based on my answers he suggested a particular type of chicken dish and I'm very glad I took his recommendation. Although this is not an Ethiopian restaurant I'd read the reviews on Yelp earlier in the day so I expected fairly slow service like at Ethiopian restaurants I've eaten at in the past.  I literally got my food faster than I've gotten burgers at some McDonald's in the past (I didn't think to time it but I'd say no more than 7 minutes max).  All of the components of my meal were served hot and tasted freshly made and not like it was just left overs from regular lunch hours which had been about 3 hours before I arrived.The platter of food I was served really was enough for 2 people, but the food tasted so good instead of eating half and taking home half like I planned when I first saw the platter, I ended up eating ever bite of it and walked out feeling like one very stuffed and satisfied pig.  My entrée came with about 5 sides of vegetables and salad.  All I can say is they were all excellent.  The flavors were almost identical to flavors I've grown to love in Ethiopian restaurants. After I finished eating I spent a few minutes chatting with the gentleman serving me and asked him about the country this type of food comes from.  He seemed happy to answer my questions and was forgiving of my slaughtering of the pronunciation of the country's name and shared with me a bit of the history of how and when the country won it's independence.  It's always a nice bonus when I can not only eat some great food, but also learn a little about the part of the world where the flavors were generated.The interior of the restaurant while nothing fancy was nothing that would discourage a person from eating there.  It was very clean and I felt very at ease eating there.  The prices at first glance appeared just a little higher than what I'm used to paying at other restaurants that serve similar type cuisines.  The good news though is after tasting the flavors I can assure you that it was worth every penny and then some.  Personally I'd gladly pay considerably more if necessary to enjoy the flavors I had today.Overall a very enjoyable meal and I'm looking forward to many more at Den Den.  If you like Ethiopian food you'll really appreciate the food here since it is very similar.

40.description: I went on January 15, 2014 for lunch with a friend. We are both adventuresome and were looking forward to the meal. The first good thing: there is free parking on the side streets, but usually paid parking along Clark St. The second good thing: the pictures on the menu really helped! The third good thing: the ladies who checked on us immediately brought water, a delicious tea when we asked for hot tea, and threw in a roasted coffee bean and spices cup of the most delicious brew I've ever had! And the smoke from the beans roasting in the little pot added another, unique level to our food - unbelievable! They helped us decide on spice levels, brought the wonderful meal and then checked on us regularly, but not intrusively. The last good thing? I could write a million words on how wonderful the food was! We had never tried Eritrean food before. I'm going back tomorrow for dinner with another friend, but the selections seem pretty consistent between lunch and dinner. The flavors, the presentation, the care taken with preparation, were all unbelievably excellent. I cannot recommend DenDen enough! Try it, you'll like it! Mary Harris

53.description: The food is EXCELLENT.  Very veggie friendly, very nice employees!!

30.description: We walked in right before 7pm on a Saturday and it was dead except for the man playing the keyboard.  I dread empty restaurants and unexpected live entertainment so I was afraid the rest of my experience would  be negative.  I am glad to say nothing else was negative!  The gentleman running the place was helpful in our ordering.  We tend to over order since the boy is a big eater and this man assured us that the veggie combo and a lamb dish would be plenty.  The food was not only plentiful but delicious and on par with the Ethiopian placed near by.  And the keyboard guy - he was really talented and could play all genres of music and I was surprised how much I enjoyed him

46.description: My new go to spot for Ethiopian/Eritrean cuisine. I went at 7 on a Saturday. It was not very busy. They do not overwhelm you with 50 different selections. They do not have combination platters because many of the items are included with the dish. You are served on a platter with your choices. I had the spicy fish of the day and my daughter had beef zighni I believe. It was delicious. The injera was the best I'ver ever had. None of that baking soda after taste like some restaurants. The ambience is low key. If you want bands and music and more of a formal look hit up Ethiopian Diamond, although the food doesn't compare. If you want more of a trendy feel, hit up Demera, but wait for your seat. If you want to be overcharged because they have been around forever, go to Ras Dashen. If you want to go back to down home cooking, where the cook is coming out and has a look of joy as you're enjoying her food, and get offered more injera without being charged like some restaurants, and have some of the best food from this region I've had in a long time, then come here. And the tea is excellent.

1.description: Simply unbelievable food! I don't want to write a long review but suffice to say, this place has incredible, communal food. The injera is nice and spongy. The lamb in the berebere peppers is outstanding and the vegetables... Superb.The honey wine is good and tangy, if a touch sweet. Not fatally flawed by any stretch just a warning for those who like drier fermented beverages. The best part is the place is quiet and relaxing. Not hectic, not overwhelming. Show up, wait 2 mins, pick a table, order and enjoy!!

55.description: I was visiting Chicago last weekend and staying in the Roger's Park area. So glad I found Den Den for dinner. I ordered the veggie combo and it was delicious. The shiro was spicy, the lentils were rich in flavor, and the injera was fresh. The service was great, the portion of food was perfect, and the interior was decorated nicely. This was a true Ethiopian experience and I would recommend Den Den to anyone. Thank you from Nashville!

9.description: This is such a fun saturday night restaurant. It was literally empty-- EMPTY-- so a great choice if you want an interesting meal on short notice. No reservations needed!We had never had Eritrean (or the very closely related Ethiopian) food before, so we came in blind. We got a lamb dish and a vegetarian sampler, and it was heaven. Just heaven. There were delicious lentils, a couple of cabbage dishes, and a few items that were like curried veggies. A lot of the flavors seemed similar to Indian food (the mild curry), and also Middle Eastern (sumac, perhaps?) but ... TANGY-ER. I think there was a healthy dose of vinegar in each dish that was unexpected and delightful. Our waitress was friendly and adorable (though she did forget our injera, leaving us to try to scoop up the dishes with our fingers or the injera under the food, which was a mess. we were newbies, remember! so if you don't get large plates of injera, ask for it!). We lingered for a while, trying to stuff one more bite in despite being full. I want to go back soon, as in, right away. Tiny places like this make me so glad to live in a city like Chicago, you know? This place should be packed every night but there it was, just waiting for us!

26.description: We have three good Ethiopian restaurants within walking distance of us here in Edgewater, but we still drive over to this excellent Eritrean restaurant more often than not.  What draws us is the cooking.  They get the spices for the shiro directly from East Africa.  Unbelievably good pan sauteed fish.  Juicy lamb at half the price of what you get on Broadway.   Seasonings are adjusted to your specifications.  In addition to this, the restaurant has a roomy, comfortable atmosphere and terrific service, but what keeps us coming back is the food.  I can't believe they aren't packed every night.

25.description: OMG!!! Such an AUTHENTIC place! THe food is spiced PERFECTLY. THe owner, MIKE is really awesome. I loved the Vegetarian Plate. IT's enough for 2 people that aren't SUPER hungry. I like to add lamb. MMmmmmm, my favorite Rogers Park Restaurant by FAR. Nice change from all the taco joints here. Geez. But i would pass up 20 Ethiopian restaurants to eat this food. IT's better, Eritrean food..mmm mmm. ANd try the beer from Ethiopia.

12.description: I had the veggie combination on injera bread. The food was increidible, so delicious, flavorfull and also seems very healthy. Come hungry, the injera bread will fill you up quick!

59.description: This is by far one of the best restaurants in Rogers Park, not to mention the best African-food restaurant on the North side of Chicago. Eritrean food is similar (but not identical) to Ethiopian food, so I cannot claim this as my favorite Ethiopian restaurant, but it is much better than all Ethiopian restaurants in the vicinity, including "Ethiopian Diamond" (which used to be my favorite, but no longer!!).The food takes a while to be prepared, but it tastes fresh, hot, and diversely seasoned. The injera bread is light, the meat is very well-seasoned, the vegetable dishes diverse and delicious. I haven't tried all of the items, but all of the beef, chicken, seafood, and vegetable items I've tried were fantastic. Some dishes are spicy, but to my joy I detected no jalapeno peppers, unlike many other places, which add jalapenos instead of chili spices that are more endemic to African cuisine.They recently raised their prices, but they are still cheaper and better than their competition.My friends and I are always anxious about the empty tables in this restaurant. We like the quiet atmosphere and having the staff's attention, but we want this place to thrive. I live in walking distance, but I would drive here if I didn't.Definitely give this place a shot!

21.description: Den Den is fantastic. From the moment you walk in the door and smell the cooking, you know you're in for a fantastic treat.

17.description: Enjoy the food, but DO NOT LOOK AROUND THE RESTAURANT FLOOR & PERIMETER WHILE DINING. why? I'm remiss to report there were mice in the restaurant last time i was there. yes, not one, not two, but three (at least). our group spotted them over the course of the evening, mentioned it to our server, who promptly went over to the area to check on what we saw, and out scurried another one right out from under the table. she apologized profusely. so please beware. i live near the restaurant, so the next time i walked past i noticed this: the front exterior wall of the restaurant has 2 sizable openings in the brick a few inches above the pavement. these are wide open wall vents/drainage holes and are easy entry points for rodents. none of the neighboring businesses have this type of opening in their storefronts. food was delicious, but this last visit was most unfortunate.

10.description: We were in the area because we went on the CTA Santra Express (duh) so we decided to find something nearby and different. My wife had never had Ethiopian food, so I told her let's get Eritrean instead! Very similar, I guess I still don't even know the difference. Next to a couple of dudes who were really into the Illinois-Missouri BORDER BATTLE for college bball, we were the only people here. I guess Yelp doesn't lie on that front! We didn't care though. We ordered two picks, and let me tell you: THAT IS ENOUGH. We went home with leftovers. We considered getting three and am glad we didn't. We ordered a lamb dish and the veggie combo, which includes ALL of the veggie options. Quite the deal and quite delicious. All the lentils were delicious, my favorite being the orange ones, whatever the heck that was. Potatoes and spinach were also keepers. Not that spicy, so good for mild palettes. I hope to be back soon with some friends and show them some different STUFF. Hope this place does well money wise, very good. Star off for ambiance, but whatever, I guess.

5.description: Food came out fast and hot!  Server was a sweetie and owners came by to let us sniff roasting coffee beans and ask if everything was ok.   There was a slight language barrier and I thought I was ordering something else...regardless, what they brought was good too and they gave us lots of other stuff to try aside from our order so that was super nice.  I was wanting to pay for my meal but the server insisted on comping it.  I felt a little bad since we'd eaten a lot and there were only 2 other tables in there while we were there from 7 - 9:30 on a cold Monday night.  Great experience and the lentils, both yellow and red, are delicious!  Would definitely go back.

3.description: Fantastic!  I've tried a number of the Ethiopian restaurants in Chicago (Demera, Awash, Lalibela, etc.) but Den Den's Eritrean influence elevates it above the rest.  I'll admit, when it comes to Ethiopian fare, I'm a pretty standard veggie combination kind of girl.  So I can't speak to the lamb, beef, chicken, and seafood dishes.  But what I do know well, are the vegetarian items and Den Den offers the best version of these in Chicago.  First of all, their veggie combo is very reasonably priced at $14 and unlike other restaurants where you have to pick only 4 items, Den Den includes ALL their veggie items in their combo.  The result is a beautifully presented and PACKED combo platter that could feed 2 with an appetizer and was more than enough food for 1.  The food is very light on oil, which I appreciate.  The alicha lentils and shiro are practically oil-free (which I can't say the same for other places) and full of flavor.  There is a noticeably higher use of seasoning adding more flavor and more spice to each item making it one of the best tasting Ethiopian/Eritrean experiences I've ever had, and certainly the best in Chicago.Service was a bit slow but extremely friendly.  And considering I went randomly at 3:30 on a Thursday, I assume staffing wasn't exactly at its peak.  Everything was made fresh to order, and when I saw how piping hot my plate was I didn't mind the wait after ordering.Den Den will be my new go-to for Ethiopian/Eritrean cuisine in Chicago and it's worth the 30 minute drive to get out there.

35.description: Den Den prepared catered food for an International Night at my school.  The food was wonderful, ready when promised, and delicious.  I would definitely recommend them for their attentive service and tasty Eritrean dishes.

19.description: I've only had it for take out, a few times now.  I've ordered the Vegetarian Sampler each time.  It's really, really good.  It comes with two different cabbage dishes, one of which has a nice kick to it.  Standard - but yummy - lentils of two varieties, one in the berbere sauce and the other yellow and somewhat plain (no plainer than at any Ethiopian spot, it's just not my favorite dish).  There are plentiful potatoes and carrots to nib on, as well as the collard greens which are superb.  The first time I ordered it there was no salad involved, but the latter two times there was a little cold salad in a great vinaigrette included.  That really made it for me.  The injera is delicious and plentiful.  I won't say this is the best Ethiopian food for vegetarians in the area (that honor has to go to Lalibela), but I'm still very happy to have found this place.  I cleaned the entire plate each time.  The food really hits the spot and fills you up without feeling gross or greasy or heavy.  It's open later than the other local Ethiopian places, and the interior is inviting enough.  I hope to go for the dine in experience soon.  Friendly service for take out, and usually a crowd of young men drinking beer and watching soccer.

28.description: This is such a fun saturday night restaurant. It was literally empty-- EMPTY-- so a great choice if you want an interesting meal on short notice. No reservations needed!We had never had Eritrean (or the very closely related Ethiopian) food before, so we came in blind. We got a lamb dish and a vegetarian sampler, and it was heaven. Just heaven. There were delicious lentils, a couple of cabbage dishes, and a few items that were like curried veggies. A lot of the flavors seemed similar to Indian food (the mild curry), and also Middle Eastern (sumac, perhaps?) but ... TANGY-ER. I think there was a healthy dose of vinegar in each dish that was unexpected and delightful. Our waitress was friendly and adorable (though she did forget our injera, leaving us to try to scoop up the dishes with our fingers or the injera under the food, which was a mess. we were newbies, remember! so if you don't get large plates of injera, ask for it!). We lingered for a while, trying to stuff one more bite in despite being full. I want to go back soon, as in, right away. Tiny places like this make me so glad to live in a city like Chicago, you know? This place should be packed every night but there it was, just waiting for us!

45.description: Yargh! On my many travels, I can state here and now that I've never had true African cuisine of any sort. My wife has been trying to drag me up to the far north side for years, but I've always figuratively dragged my feet and something had come up to serve as a distraction. But last night was different! We had a plan, and put the pedal to the metal! Arriving at around 7 p.m on a Saturday night, I was happy to see that this establishment was not packed like a can of sardines. There were a few other parties inside this cozy place. It is humbly decorated with African art on the wall. Our server was a young man who was very nice. When we had a question that he didn't know, he went and got the cook (who might be the owner, I'm not sure...she was super nice and helpful) who treated us like we were her children. No, not in a condescending way...in a "more food, eat up, I'll bring you a little more!" kind of way.  We ordered two entrees that were vegetarian, and it came out on a huge platter with plenty of injera. The flavors were effing awesome, very well developed. It also had a bit of a kick on certain dishes that tickled my fancy something hardcore. Throw in a little house-made honey wine to boot, and BAM, I'm hooked!

33.description: Such a great Rogers Park gem!!! Has the feel of a local restaurant with amazing food. Everything had such great flavor. It's a unique spot in that it has Eritrean nuisances. The service was great. Not being an expert on Ethopian/Eritrean cuisine she gave us some great recommendations to enjoy a family style meal.

43.description: This is an amazing restaurant.  Two hungry guys finished the veggie combo with a side of spicy beef--barely. The coffee is also worth trying. Highly recommend this restaurant.

2.description: Excellent! Decided to try something different and was not disappointed in the least! Went here with my cousin, she was a little skeptical, but we were both so happy and full when we left. Very flavorful! We went without the heat, but they brought us their spicy sauce on the side which we ended up using because it was delicious. Very friendly service too. Would definitely come back and highly recommend!

18.description: SO good. actually I just got carry out here on a whim. it's delicious, good portion sizes, and it comes with some sweet cabbage or something which is really really good. plus the people are friendly. I'll be coming back for sure.

41.description: I honestly think I can attach physical qualities to love. They would come in the form of some wot, tibs, and vegetables on some injera bread. The first visit to Den Den wasn't enough, so I went back and then for a few more return visits.The service is out of this world, but that seems to be the case at all of the Ethiopian restaurants, so this gem of an Eritrean restaurant was no exception. What makes Den Den my favourite of all the Ethiopian restaurants is the food. I don't know if it's because the food doesn't drip with butter. Or perhaps there is some "enhancing" ingredients added to the food. It is just "that" good and I mean that in all caps.

52.description: Honestly the best meal I've eaten in memory. The waitress was beautiful, funny and great at her job and the food was incredible. If someone took me here on a date I would marry them. I went with 8 of my friends and we are all totally awe-struck by how good (and easy to share!) the food was.

50.description: Excellent food and friendly service.Den Den is an Eritrean restaurant, and if you've ever had Ethiopian it'll be a similar experience.  However I think Den Den's Eritrean food is a bit less saucy/stewy than Ethiopian (in a good way), and the injera bread and some of the sides were more flavorful.  Each meal that my friends and I got had a little salad with Italian dressing in the center (Eritrean food has Italian influences), a lentil dish on one side, a collared greens dish on another, a cabbage dish on the third side, and your main meal (meat or veggie) on the last portion.You can also get some of their coffee, where they will roast the beans right there and serve the coffee to you from a clay pot.  It's super strong and flavorful, with a hint of what I think was ginger.Great restaurant owned by a very friendly family man named Michael.  Check it out.

4.description: Absolutely love this restaurant!  Very cozy environment and excellent food! The veggie dishes are awesome and the owner comes out and greets you!

6.description: This is one of my favorite places to eat at in rogers park. It's a lot a fun going with a small group of people, as long as you don't mind throwing the western ways for a bit. Instead of forks and individual dishes, you use injera, a light spongy flatbread, to grab whatever desired meat or veggie from the table. Waitress was voice. I liked the atmosphere-- clean and well-decorated, but not too busy. Dinner entrees were $12-15. I just took my family of 5 there, and we got 4 entrees including the veggie combo, and it was the perfect amount. Enjoy!!

22.description: Amazingly good food! Too bad this place is empty, but on the other hand you basically get a private dinner!

15.description: Food was great, the ambience was appropriate and welcoming, and the service was decent. I want to go back sometime!

57.description: Just cane back from dinner with two friends after being lazy on a damp, rainy Sunday.  One of the friends passed Den Den and was not familiar with the cuisine but found out it was similar to Ethiopian food so  we decided to try it out.I am a huge fan of Ethiopian Diamond on Broadway, but Den Den was a bi better.  The food was less oily and plentiful, we were the only patrons in there so the service was excellent.  We asked questions and recommendations and they were quite helpful and informative!The spices were very nice, the tea was amazing and we ended it with the most flavorful coffee.  For the amount if food we had the bill was less than we thought.  If you are a fan of Ethiopian food then  you must try Den Den...

20.description: SO good. actually I just got carry out here on a whim. it's delicious, good portion sizes, and it comes with some sweet cabbage or something which is really really good. plus the people are friendly. I'll be coming back for sure.

36.description: I truly enjoyed the food. Not as spicy as Ethiopian food but very similar concept (eating with the hand using enjera). The service was not the greatest but the waitress was nice and trying to be helpful.

14.description: Second time to Den Den and it was just as good as the first time. It was empty and quiet, but you know what, that made it all the better for date night with my husband. We get tired of crazy busy loud places. Here we could sit and talk as long as we wanted and actually hear each other. Den Den definitely makes us feel like we are not in Chicago anymore. We had  chicken, beef, lentils, and some cabbage sides - don't remember which ones, but all were delicious. Don't forget to eat the injera that's soaked up the sauces under the dishes.

3.description: The big misconception about Funk Trunk is that they only deal in Funk , Soul and/or Rap. Not so. While hardcore Soul and Funk collectors should make it a regular stop , they also deal in Jazz , Rock , Comedy , Blues , International , and more. It's not a huge store , and you won't be tripping over records....Or won't you ? The 45 section is always well - stocked , with Owner , Quinn , focusing more on Soul and R'n'B 45s from the 60's and 70's ,  though you can still find the stray Rock 'n'Roll , Proto Punk and Indie Rock singles. As noted elsewhere , the budget section is  pretty interesting , but Funk Trunk also carries a good selection of new vinyl reissues and hard to find LPs from the 50's to the present. The fact that there is a Funk Trunk in Rogers Park is cause to celebrate . Record stores in Rogers Park pretty much died the death around the time Kurt Cobain did. Funk Trunk brings back some of the vibe of the late , great Round Records , in that the atmosphere is relaxed , and you can almost always find yourself getting into an intelligent conversation about music , while having some laughs in the process. It'll be interesting to see what happens in the new year....which I hope will be a prosperous one for Quinn and Rogers Park's first real record store in 20+ years.

1.description: Stopped in here a few weeks ago after seeing a spot in the Reader about a new record shop opening. Funk Trunk delivered the goods!It's a tiny shop, but chock full of affordable vinyl, specializing in funk, soul, disco, jazz, house, punk, and more. Great dollar bin, not the same old stuff and definitely no show tunes or classical. There was a turntable available to play selections, which was in use the whole time I was there.The owner was knowledgeable and gave great recommendations. Prices were extremely fair, and it was easy to load up on good stuff for cheap here. Overall a great experience and I hope to be back many times.

2.description: Quinn the owner is top notch. His selection is on point and always works to get a record in stock. I can talk for hours with this guy about records.Glad to see a local spot in Rogers Park for records.

0.description: Great shop run by a great guy who knows his stuff. I love smaller shops like this that are actually curated.Filling a shop full of vinyl is not hard. Filling it with interesting awesome records is.Fair prices, great selection. Best shop on the north side if you're into black music.

4.description: Met the owners Quinn and his wife @ a recent South Bend record show convention where I was a vendor as well.  Nice peoples!  Quite sure their 'digs' has some nice stuff as well!  Support 'indie' businesses esp record stores who do just that!!!  I myself sell at shows and understand what goes into such an endeavor (profit over expenses) to keep it gping!!!!!  Hope to see em at a convention in Indy or Louisville...Peace Out

36.description: My sister and I wanted to meet up to get our nails done, so on my search for somewhere reasonably priced with good reviews I stumbled upon this gem. I've never been so pleased with a nail service. We both got the mani-pedis for $35 which is an excellent deal considering they did a great job and finished it off with a neck rub. Yen was so attentive and was great to talk to. My sister is almost 9 months pregnant so when Yen got down to roll her pants up for her before she got into the pedicure chair I knew this was going to be a good experience. I never believed in spending money to get my nails done before but I will definitely be back. Also on Thursdays they have the mani-pedis for $30!

29.description: I'm so happy with my experience at XY! Everyone was super professional and friendly. It didn't take long, it was very affordable and I left looking like a guy who takes care of himself. Ask for Yen!

42.description: Rose has been my nail person for years and there is nobody more deserving of having her own shop. She and Yin are turning this space into a lovely, peaceful and happy place. Sadly, I am moving out of state soon and I don't know how I will ever find another Rose - she could not be a sweeter and more conscientious person. She is the perfect nail technician.

23.description: This place deserves way more than 5 stars.  Like everyone else has said, Yen and Rose are just absolutely amazing.  Not only are they incredibly friendly and kind, but they do an impeccable job every time. Street Parking is available just outside the salon, otherwise the neighborhood is permit 56.

31.description: I came here based on the Yelp reviews and wasn't disappointed. Yen was great. Her positive attitude, attention to detail, and customer service was top notch. On top of being a really lovely person, she does great nails and eyebrows. Plus, I got an awesome neck rub as part of the services! Score!

34.description: XY is a fantastic neighborhood nail spot. They are clean, thorough and very pleasant. Prices are reasonable ($35 for mani/pedi). It's not super fancy with all the bells and whistles like some other high end places, but it's perfect and has all you need! I will 100% return and recommend this place!!

16.description: Yen was fantastic! Even though it's a small salon, she gave me the best mani pedi ever! Her attention to detail was impeccable even when the people working were overwhelmed with people coming in, they made no short cuts! Also got my eye brows waxed, even though I am partial to threading, I went ahead because it needed to be done! Amazing, and these bushes come on cray! Personal attention and reasonable prices. With a $10 tip, totaled $55. Thank you Yen! I will be back when I need to treat myself again!

11.description: I had never been in need of having manicure every week. At least they last more than 2 weeks for me. I tried this place and after mani pedi everything looked nice but few days after I took the nail polish off and recognized that actually my cuticles are still there and not cleaned. Now my hands look terrible after 1 week. First of all, if that's their strategy to have customers come back every week, it's wrong. Do your job good and so expect customer return. Second, the Thursday deal mani&pedi $30 is not the best deal. I can find this deal even in the loop! I even didn't try groupon because I wanted to support neighborhood store. They are nice people but it's not enough for business. I wouldn't go there again because to me it's not ethical.

39.description: Nail salons are a dime a dozen. That being said, I was picky when trying to find a salon for a basic pedicure. I don't get them very often, only when I'm in a "treat yo'self" mood (as Donna and Tom would say on "Parks and Rec"). I'm more likely to get pedicures because I'm awful at painting my toes.The 5-star reviews were very convincing. I called on Friday inquiring about a pedicure ($25) and I made an appointment the next day. They have a $30 mani-pedi special on Thursdays.The 151 and 147 buses stop right in front of the nail salon. It's also just a stone's throw away from Loyola CTA. I'd say the location is convenient.The salon itself is small, but very clean and simply decorated. The windows bring in a lot of light, illuminating much of the salon. It feels nice being there. They have a good selection of OPI and Essie nail colors. I chose a shimmery red orange. Yen was my nail technician and she did a thorough job. She massaged my legs with a minty scrub. Ahhh, so nice. There were People magazines to read and the massage chair to rub your back. Yen is very sweet. I highly recommend her. She spent almost an hour on my feet. I'm glad because I don't like to feel rushed.I'm happy to find a nail salon. I might just become a regular. These ladies are super and the prices are quite fair. Treat yo'self!

37.description: Yen and Rose give great manicures, pedicures, and no chip manicures. They are gentle and very exacting. The place is sparkling clean, with sanitized instruments sealed in medical packaging coming out for every nail treatment.  They have many colors to choose from, and give AMAZING massages as part of their treatments! Prices are reasonable. Today, Yen waxed my eyebrows, and it was pain free, natural, and beautifully arched! Rogers parks needs a place like this, and this family deserves our business! Neighbors and Loyola students, run don't walk to this wonderful nail spa!

0.description: As a  male walk-in client I was greeted warmly. I received the best manicure ever. The ladies were friendly and warm, and we chatted like new friends do as we got to know a bit about each other and our mutual interests.I will definitely be going back as XY Nail Spa is clean, offers excellent, prompt service and the price is right!I paid cash and tipped well because these girls made my comfort and satisfaction their priority. A job very well done!

38.description: New to the neighborhood needed a new nail spa. LOVE THIS PLACE! It's small and quaint nice boutique nail salon! The girls are super sweet and professional. Establishment is very clean and they really cater to you and your wants! My two favs are Yen and Rose! Oh and if you are looking for fabulous eyebrows go visit Yen! Ive never had a better eyebrow shaping! So if you looking for a new spot or somewhere in Rogers Park, this is the place!

27.description: Yen was fantastic! Even though it's a small salon, she gave me the best mani pedi ever! Her attention to detail was impeccable even when the people working were overwhelmed with people coming in, they made no short cuts! Also got my eye brows waxed, even though I am partial to threading, I went ahead because it needed to be done! Amazing, and these bushes come on cray! Personal attention and reasonable prices. With a $10 tip, totaled $55. Thank you Yen! I will be back when I need to treat myself again!

32.description: Rose did a full set for me. They're gorgeous and exactly the almond shape I asked for (it's worth noting that several other nail techs have totally screwed up this shape in the past). Yen waxed my eyebrows with minimal pain. This place isn't especially fancy but these are the sweetest, most fantastic nail ladies you could ask for. They were so gentle and polite and had great customer service - plus the prices are great! $35 for the full set / $10 for eyebrows (easily as good as the $20+ waxes I've gotten.) I will be back again. :)

13.description: Both times I have been in here there has been no wait. The women working here are extremely polite and talented. I have never had pointy/almond shaped nails look as good as when I come here. I highly recommend XY Nails!

24.description: I walked in at 7:30pm for a pedicure. They were really nice to let me in so close to closing (8 pm). I did call in advance to make sure they would be able to take me.Rose did my nails. She did a fantastic job! She took 30 minutes on the pedicure. She took her time, but wasn't slow, which is what I really appreciated. I will definitely be going back to see Rose! They do use hot towels as well, which was nice. My pedicure was completed at 7:55 pm, but I was not rushed out. She let me stay longer so I wouldn't damage my toes. SHE'S SO NICE!! It hurts.It is so hard to find a legit nail salon. I have gone to so many nail salons that spend more time on lotioning your legs and feet then actually cleaning your nails and heels. No nail salon has gotten higher than 2 stars from me.Also, it is nice to see the technicians have their nails done!
