I understand that being in this work your nails can get messy or chipped, but you need to show clients/customers how well you do your own nails. All the technicians had their nails done. It might not seem like a big deal to most ppl, but that really stood out to me (in a good way).Overall Impression: The place is really small. Its half the size of normal salons, but I actually liked that. They are on the bottom level of a condo complex. It took me a minute to try to figure out how to get in. I just called them and she buzzed me in. I am not sure if they are listed on the buzzer. So don't panic if you can't find the front door lolParking: There is street parking. It can be hard to find since it is so close to Loyola. Payments: They do accept CC's but Cash is preferred. You can tip via CC, but the charge it towards the full amount instead of separating it.Prices: They have standard nail salon prices. $15 for mani, $25 for pedi, $25 gel nailsGood to Know: Thursdays is mani+pedi for $30

7.description: I've always hating going to nail salons cause every single one I've been to in the city, there's just something always meticulously wrong with it and/ or the service. However, this place is a small gem located in Rogers Park. I've been going to XY Nails for a few months now and they are incredibly awesome! Yen and Rose are the only two employees but they are the sweetest ladies. They are careful, precise and importantly clean!! I usually get the no chip which is $35 and on Thursday's mani/pedi's are $30 otherwise it's $35. They accept CC but cash is appreciated. Walk-in's are accepted but I recommend making an appointment beforehand. The service is amazing! Give them a try!

40.description: This place is amazing! Mani pedi is only $35 and they do an amazing job. Super in depth, give a back rub with mani. They have a lot of colors (including Essie and OPI) and they have a huge selection of gel colors too. Everyone who works there is super nice, and they really do a great job! If you call ahead of time there is no wait when you get there.

30.description: I have to rave about my experience here! I just moved to Rogers Park a few months ago and walked by XY and didn't think much about it. But one day I decided to go in. The place is very clean. They were so friendly I decided to give it a try. I've been here twice now. (Mani/Pedi). The quality is excellent. Nail polish is up to date and clean. The technician spent a good amount of time with the pampering part :) This is my new favorite spot! I highly recommend coming here.

1.description: Prices are higher than many of the places around in the area. They're a small place and usually busy most of the time. The acrylic and gel services are not offered everyday, only when Yen is here so make sure to call ahead. Other than that, they are good at what they do but should offer discounts for Loyola students and lower their prices for services.

9.description: Hands down (ha) the best mani/pedi I've ever gotten. They are so precise and gentle--usually I feel like I'm being jabbed, nails filed too rough, and super hard massages, but not the case here. Prices are extremely reasonable, the shop is very clean despite, though it is definitely an old storefront. This is absolutely my new nail place and I understand how people come from the Loop for appointments with these fantastic women.

26.description: These ladies were wonderful!  Chatty and friendly with gentle hands as a relaxing pace. Worth a visit for some smiles and a nice pedicure!

25.description: I have been going to the same nail place for years and they are so sloppy. I passed by X.Y. Nails all the time because I live around the corner, but never went in. So glad I finally did! They are amazing! It's three women but usually two at once. The owner is really sweet and kind, they all are! In Thursdays there is a $40 Mani-Pedi. Done perfectly! They take time to do your nails, its always better to make an appointment (as a note). When it does come time to do your nails they give you a back massage! Yes! The girls there are very friendly and they are talkative which helps to take your mind off the tickles. There is Yen, Rose and Kate. Ill continue to so my nails here, my hands and feet feel great. They also sell flip flops for $2.  Its in a decent price range and the work they do is very good and worth the money you spend. This is a place to try and most likely keep. Its close by the train and busses with some parking, it is Rogers No Park.

12.description: This place deserves way more than 5 stars.  Like everyone else has said, Yen and Rose are just absolutely amazing.  Not only are they incredibly friendly and kind, but they do an impeccable job every time. Street Parking is available just outside the salon, otherwise the neighborhood is permit 56.

21.description: I've always hating going to nail salons cause every single one I've been to in the city, there's just something always meticulously wrong with it and/ or the service. However, this place is a small gem located in Rogers Park. I've been going to XY Nails for a few months now and they are incredibly awesome! Yen and Rose are the only two employees but they are the sweetest ladies. They are careful, precise and importantly clean!! I usually get the no chip which is $35 and on Thursday's mani/pedi's are $30 otherwise it's $35. They accept CC but cash is appreciated. Walk-in's are accepted but I recommend making an appointment beforehand. The service is amazing! Give them a try!

17.description: I wont ever go here again. Its taken me months to grow my nails and I went in for a basic no-chip manicure. First off she made me wait while she ate her lunch( bad customer service), then she cut all my nails off now I have short little stubs.I'm not happy.

10.description: Came here as a group of three to get a mani and a pedi. The ladies here are friendly; they smile when they provide service. Yen paid great attention to my nails and took the time to make sure they look good before I left. They also gifted us with lotions. Will definitely be stopping by again!

5.description: Very small/cozy nail salon... But the ladies make you feel very welcome. Yen, who did my nails took her time and did a really nice job. My first time trying out the almond-shaped acrylic nail turned out great. Will definitely go back soon.

35.description: I will start by saying that absolutely LOVE Rose and Yen. They are the sweetest most humble women I have ever met. I created a Yelp account just so I could leave them a truly deserving review.Now on to my review, I have been going to XY nails for about a year now and I will never leave. I have considered going else where for a cheaper price (not to say they are crazy expensive) but I just cannot. The service is amazing. Both women really take their time with your nails. If you are looking for a quick 15-20 min paint job, this is not the place for you. Be preaped to relax and have a great nail experiance.  I highly recommend XY nails to anyone (men and women). I have even dragged my boyfriend to get his feet done and recommended this place to a friend (who now travels an hr by train to see them). The technicians here are highly skilled and know what they are doing. Not only is the look important to them, but the overall health and care of your nails is on their mind. Be careful stopping by, you may never want to leave!

19.description: My friend came in here the other day to get a no chip manicure (I am only writing on her behalf because she does not have a Yelp account). When the woman removed her nail polish she did not do the process correctly which resulted in 4 of her nails breaking. She called them to talk to them about it but no one answered the phone. When she went back to ask them for a refund they were very rude and unwilling to work something out. The only thing they would tell her is that it is her fault, but they clearly did not remove the polish correctly.

28.description: LOVE this place for pedicures! Not only is it so convenient because it's around the corner from my apartment, and very affordable,  but I always get excellent service. Yen and Rose are amazing women who do great work and are also considerate as far as what your personal performances are (i.e. water temp, chair adjustment, etc.)  Looking forward to my next pedi at XY! :)

3.description: Read this before you go!!Usually the girls in there are very nice, I like Rose a lot. But today I went in and there were 2 other girls who were very rude and judgmental. The way they treated me made it so I do not want to come back even though I did like the other girls and I've been coming there for years, even before the new owners came and took over. 35 dollars for a no-chip manicure? It's not downtown... It's in the lower floor of an apartment complex in Rogers park lol. They laughed at me after I left when I was walking out, and we're very sarcastic and rude on the phone. Save your money, other places do just as good for much cheaper.

33.description: XY Nails is great! Me and my sister decided the day of that we would like to get manis and they were able to get us a reservation the same day. When we got there the two ladies were very friendly! The shop is small (2 pedi stations and 2 mani stations) but very clean. The mani looks great and the massage they give felt so, so good!I would definitely recommend this spot and I will go again!$15 mani, $25 pedi, $35 for both

43.description: New owners remodeled this cozy spot and upgraded the experience. The family that took over is charming, excellent service, a nice getaway in an off the beaten path spot. A new sound system is on the way, and they have plans to expand services in the coming months. I'm a big fan of independently owned small businesses, they are an engendered species. Rooting for them!

2.description: I have avoided nail salons since an experienced nail tech sliced my skin when cutting my cuticle, then proceeded to give me the worst manicure of all time, and was a jerk when I had a problem with pain and bleeding. I still cringe remembering it, and it was probably 8 years ago. So when I needed a manicure for a hand modeling job, I read pretty much every review on yelp, as I don't know much about the craft and needed to feel safe. I settled on this salon, even though it's further away from me than others. I told Yen I needed a no-chip, and showed her a pic of what the client wanted. She told me I would be better off with a regular manicure and explained why. It's not common for a shop owner to down-sell you for your greater good. Yen is an angel. As for the manicure, she worked magic and I no longer have the hands of a teenage boy. She buffed a natural shine into my nails instead of using polish and gave me a lesson in nail care. All of that, plus a neck and hand massage for $15. Are you kidding me? I would have paid double. The client, who was nitpicky about every element of the shoot, loved my manicure. I'll be only coming here from now on for all things nails. Bonus tip: Both Yen and Rose are so beloved that they have clients who live downtown and travel all the way up here to see them. They prefer cash.

18.description: Yen is fabulous! She took more time with me than I have ever experienced at other salons. I just recently moved to Chicago from Tennessee and my nails were a mess after waiting almost 4 weeks. to get a no chip fill. She took great care of me and I left feeling refreshed and beautiful! I will definitely be going back.

41.description: It's too bad that Yelp's highest rating is only five stars. I'd give this place TEN! XY Nail Spa is by far one of the best nail salons in the city. Yen is extremely sweet, welcoming, and amazing at what she does. They have a wide range of funky acrylic nails, and the manicures come with a mini massage. The place is very very relaxing--I always feel very tranquil after I leave.  It's like a mini vacation in the winter, and a great place to swing by pre/post beach. (Very close to lake!) I highly recommend XY!

4.description: -Credit card accepted, cash appreciated.-The salon is not a stand alone shop, but on the first floor of a bigger building.You have to ring the buzzer at the main entrance (which is clearly marked), the way you would to enter an apartment building. When you enter the building they are on your right.-Small with two talented staff, Rose and Yen, who are quiet but friendly.-Good selection of colors.-Clean!I opted for a gel mani and it lasted for literally three weeks without any chips. I was unable to get the polish properly removed for so long because I was traveling abroad, but had my nails not grown out I could have kept the color on for even longer! I waited only 5min after my appointment time and was in and out. I'll definitely be coming back!

6.description: Best salon I have been to since I moved to Chicago. So much attention to detail, skilled and sweet staff, clean and pleasant environs. Excited to have found my salon!!

22.description: I live right around the corner from this place, and it's awesome! It's TINY, but I quite enjoy the quiet, calm and cozy vibe. I've gone in several times and have always been pleased. I usually call ahead just to be sure they're not super busy, but they always fit me right in. Yen and Rose are fabulous and very sweet. They really take their time to make sure everything looks perfect. Prices are good too! I got a gel manicure and pedicure for $55 dollars. It's a Rogers Park gem, and I'd recommend it to anyone!

15.description: I had an absolutely wonderful experience! They were so kind and took their time. My nails were in really poor shape, and they honestly did such a great job! Also, fairly reasonably priced! $15.00 for a manicure!

20.description: This place is wonderful. Rose was very friendly and accommodating. The shop is clean and prices are reasonable. She did a beautiful job on my pedicure and gave me a pretty design on my toes. I will most definitely be back!

8.description: Came here for the $30 mani pedi deal on Thursdays. Let's keep in mind that I'm pretty 'frugal' and have not had anyone do my nails in YEARS! But this place was right up the street from my house and thought I could treat my stepdaughter. We both left happy! It took about an hour and a half for us both, from sitting and waiting for a few mins, to us being out the door. I am very satisfied with how great my hands look! Rose was very sweet and helpful, and I was not expecting a neck massage! I will be back for sure to try out gel nails soon....

14.description: I walked in at 7:30pm for a pedicure. They were really nice to let me in so close to closing (8 pm). I did call in advance to make sure they would be able to take me.Rose did my nails. She did a fantastic job! She took 30 minutes on the pedicure. She took her time, but wasn't slow, which is what I really appreciated. I will definitely be going back to see Rose! They do use hot towels as well, which was nice. My pedicure was completed at 7:55 pm, but I was not rushed out. She let me stay longer so I wouldn't damage my toes. SHE'S SO NICE!! It hurts.It is so hard to find a legit nail salon. I have gone to so many nail salons that spend more time on lotioning your legs and feet then actually cleaning your nails and heels. No nail salon has gotten higher than 2 stars from me.Also, it is nice to see the technicians have their nails done! I understand that being in this work your nails can get messy or chipped, but you need to show clients/customers how well you do your own nails. All the technicians had their nails done. It might not seem like a big deal to most ppl, but that really stood out to me (in a good way).Overall Impression: The place is really small. Its half the size of normal salons, but I actually liked that. They are on the bottom level of a condo complex. It took me a minute to try to figure out how to get in. I just called them and she buzzed me in. I am not sure if they are listed on the buzzer. So don't panic if you can't find the front door lolParking: There is street parking. It can be hard to find since it is so close to Loyola. Payments: They do accept CC's but Cash is preferred. You can tip via CC, but the charge it towards the full amount instead of separating it.Prices: They have standard nail salon prices. $15 for mani, $25 for pedi, $25 gel nailsGood to Know: Thursdays is mani+pedi for $30

58.description: Excellent umami burger! And the egg roll?  No words but deelish!

56.description: Kimchi anything all day everyday! Ask for a taste first, to see if you like it! I did, and I did.The food is amazing, the (new?) management is even better. This is an easy 5star. However, please note that the food is really good so there was a wait when I did go in. People that don't expect to wait should probably go get some drive-thru.

29.description: Had the kimchi burger, the kimchi fries and the bulgogi.  My husband liked the kimchi burger and my bite was juicy and delicious.  The bulgogi was alright - lots of meat, so it was a good value, but I thought the flavor of the onion was a bit strong for me.  The highlight was absolutely the fries - battered fries are my nirvana and these were fantastic, plus the kimchi and sauce and bacon bits had tons of flavor.

42.description: The Loco moco and the bng are amazing. The gravy sauce with the 2 patties on rice is awesome. The fried eggs is a nice touch too. The bng is a classic burger but more than you expect. I would seriously recommend this place to someone who loves Korean food but wants a buger too.

23.description: DELICIOUS! This place knows what they're doing with a fusion on classic American burgers with a Korean twist. Quick, clean, fresh, and tasty choice if you're in the area. Hint: B n G burger steals my heart everytime.

47.description: I had the Umami burger.  Good burger, not great.  I was honestly expecting more.  My daughter is picky and just had a plain cheeseburger but it was a dollar more than the Umami? Doesn't make much sense if you ask me.  We also had the bibimbap, but I've never seen it served with lettuce.  The philly egg rolls were pretty good but didn't have as much cheese as I saw on DDD and at $4.50 each, I'll probably leave that off next time.  Total bill came to about $43 for two grown ups and a 12 year old.

8.description: Bad service, no prices on the menu, it's a Korean restaurant with no Koreans that are actually employed lol. They don't even have WiFi like wtf.. the food was okay, I'm alergic to fish and some of the salad vegetable stuff has fish sauce and I had to take a mean potty break. Thank god I used their washroom, they have too much chicken and not enough rice my girlfriend said so yeahhhh.. I'd prefer Popeyes.

31.description: Silly name for a restaurant, even a burger joint as casual as this one is.  And an even sillier Guy has visited here.  But a few months back, I challenged myself not to mention him until at least 2019.  (I just now failed that challenge.)Nonetheless, bopNGrill is worthy.  For us, this rather spartan and non-descript-looking Korean-fusion fast-food place was the terminus of an out-and-back bike ride from Bobby's Bike Hike downtown--I need to write a (favorable) review for that outfit.  If Bopngrill's kimchi burger isn't exactly the best fuel for the midpoint of a 17-or-18-mile ride, it was good sloppy eating for damn sure.  In fact, it was sloppy enough that I knew I wasn't going to be able to eat it with my hands as soon as I tried to pick it up.  And it was good enough that it was one of the better burgers I'd had in quite awhile--burger itself was cooked a nice even medium with a decent sear, and came with legit kimchi, a properly fried egg, crisp bacon, and a house-made chili mayo.  Overall, these flavors and textures worked surprisingly well together.  Price tag was like $8.50, which sounded high for a place this casual, but given the size and quality, well worth it. Wife got the umami burger, which was featured on the TV show--that one aims for gourmet with "truffled mushroom duxelle" and "sundried tomato confit," along with bacon and smoked gouda, but I thought its flavor profile was somewhat one-dimensional compared to the kimchi one.  (But it was a damn good dimension.)Very good food, for what it was.

34.description: I had a bad experience with this place via postmates. Food was dry and not the quality of Korean food Im used to from other places up North. It was also more expensive than it should have been considering the quality.

16.description: The low stars comment are usually come from the service. The food is ok. it's good, but not worth that money. The portion of the meat is far less than the price suggest. I'd give the taste 4 stars. But the cashier that day we have was kinda rude. My friend was not familiar with Korean style so he asked some "freshman questions" but I don't think that could be the reason that the cashier be impatient and not explain it properly. Also we asked for the free egg roll (I think it's free on certain day), but just because we didn't "order" it, so she didn't put it in order, so they can't give us after we paid and got our food. It's ridiculous...  I wouldn't go back anyway.

13.description: BopNGrill @ 6604 N Sheridan delicious heart stopping food.  5 Stars - The Umami Burger w/truffled  mushroom dexelle, sun dried tomato confit, togarashi mayo., bacon, & smoked Gouda no wonder Guy Fieri was drooling in himself and rated this in of the best 5 burgers.The kimchi fries are delicious, w/caramelized kimchi, cheese sauce, bacon, scallions & sesame seeds (yummy)My wife got the tofu & kimchi plate - Krispy tofu, caramelized kimchi & nori slivers.  It was ok. She liked it, but I came her for a burger.  Definitely worth checking out

11.description: BopNgrill is a hidden gem up on the far north side by Loyola. Living in the area I had heard about how ridiculous the "Father" burger was and had to try it out myself. Soft bun, two patties, three onion rings and an egg stacked a mile high. That thing was a BEAST. I might still be full a few days from now, which makes it a great value too!Burgers in general are delicious here! The Korean entrees look really good as well. I'd suggest trying either a kimchi burger or kimchi fries as it seems that's what most people order ( I personally don't like Kimchi). If you find yourself up by Loyola and are hankering for a big meal come check out BopNgrill, it won't disappoint!

39.description: Yum! Fusion places are my favorite. I got the bulgogi bop and it was good. I would say above average for bibimbap but not the best I've had. Ps. I only heard that they were known for their BURGERS after I ordered the bop. So next time, I'll come in a bit hungrier and try the burger. Their kimchi fries, however, were the best kimchi fries I've had. The fries were LOADED. Mmm bacon...definitely not your average fries. We missed the egg rolls because we came too late...next time!

37.description: AMAZING! The Umami burger is one of the burgers that I have ever had. I would put it in the patheon of best burgers along with Paradise Pup. The kimchi fries are on point as well. These guys care about what they do an it shows.

0.description: The onky downside of the food is the size of the burger. Oh, I wish It was a larger portion so I can go home and regret what I have put myself through.My boyfriend and I comes here on occasion when we are in the mood for kimchi fries. I got the Kimchi burger and he got the Loco ( I believe that is what it is called) burger with a side of Kimchi fries.Again, wished the portion was larger so I can hate myself after but... haha. With the amount of flavor from that small burger, it is well worth it. Its super greasy and the yolk will run througg your fingers.The fries were great as well. They were season and super crispy. (Top with yummy Kimchi too, can't forget that).

38.description: Stopped by here while visiting Loyola. Definitely the definition of Korean fusion. My friend and i got the Kimchi fries, bulgogi rice plate, and the unami burger. All of which were delicious! I thought the burger was super flavorful and would get again! The Bulgogi was tasty but definitely not what I would call good Korean food nor an accurate representation. Bop, kimchi, and bulgogi is something I use to put together when I was in college. So not sure it be something I'd pay money for. I guess I was expecting it to have a wow factor like the burgers. Id definitely recommend this place but more for the fusion food and the burgers.

51.description: Food is good, but the cafeteria style seating area is dirty and gross. I suggest take out or delivery from this place.

27.description: Finally made it in for the Philly cheesesteak egg rolls - amazing! Another Umami burger as well, couldn't resist... add the pretzel roll, it's a nice change.

32.description: If I could only eat at one burger place, this would be it; anything you order will be great.

54.description: Umami burger: I didn't like this much at all. For the price, it was bland and somewhat boring. Tried the kimchi fries and hated it. Just not feeling the kimchi with fries.Fairly expensive. The place was also dirty. Floors were messy and table not clean. Very friendly and helpful staff though. I might try again. Not sure.

48.description: My husband and I really wanted to try this place after seeing it on triple D's. The anticipation to try the kimchi fries and the umami burger were killing me! And it did not disappoint :) my husband had the fire chicken with extra rice. All in all it was very tasty and I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the mood for burgers and fries with an Korean/asian twist!

44.description: Best hamburgers in the city.  Kimchee fries are a must.  Rice plates are good, too.  Need a location in the north suburbs.

24.description: It's a little bit of a drive from my place, but so worth it. Everything is good, I'd highly recommended.

7.description: Ive been here before when they still offered the Father burger which at the time i thought was  good! In all of my visits here ive never tried the infamous egg roll they offer only on weekends...The food is phenomenal and service here is amazing! I highly recommend geting the Umami burger add egg, BNG burger, kimchi fries, and bi bim bop add bulkogi! Depending on the time of day you may find it to be crowded but i find going on cold days to be worth the visit minus all the lines! Prices were reasonable for portion!

49.description: You must try the umami burger with bacon cheese fries...the food is a little on the pricey side but it's so worth it!

40.description: You can never go wrong!The kimchi fries are AMAZING!!! If you haven't tried it you are MISSING OUT!My wife and I now consistently get the Bulkogi, it is delicious. The egg rolls are talked up as amazing, but I wasn't crazy about them. Either way, it doesn't at all take away from how good the Bulkogi is. You should definitely check out this Rogers Park jem.

53.description: Saw this on drivers dine ins and dives and had to come! I ordered the Bavarian which was amazing! Also had a side of fries which were perfectly crunchy..definitely going back!

30.description: Based on the reviews I was sure I was in for a great burger.  What a disappointment.  First off I wanted the cheese steak egg rolls but they weren't serving that day so I was bummed.  I will blame myself however because I'm sure if I checked the website first I would've seen that.  It's just a little weird that they wouldn't have something like that on the menu all day.Anyway, where I was really disappointed, and very surprised nobody has mentioned this, is with the truffle oil in the mushroom duxelle on the Umami burger.  There was just way too much of it and it overpowered the entire burger.  I'm no truffle oil snob either, it just has to be used sparingly.  I cook with it from time to time but again, just way way too much.  The burger was a greasy mess with not nearly enough acidity to cut the richness of the duxelle and beef and I had to scrape a lot of the duxelle off.  Perhaps add a little of that Kimchi?  Oh well.  Just be fore warmed that if you are not a fan of truffle oil, this burger will not sit right with you.

46.description: The umami burger and the kimchi fries are sooooo good but be prepared to spend a lot of money & wait a while during peak hours.  Better than Kuma's Corner & Umami Burger.  But those are the only 2 gourmet burger places I've been too in Chicago so far besides fast food burger chains Shake Shack, M Burger, McDonald's, etc. I LOVE bopNGrill.

1.description: Super tasty! I had the Umami burger and some Kimchi fries.The Umami burger was nice and juicy, and the fries were not bad.I will go back, but I would warn that the things I ordered were really greasy and a tiny bit salty. So I would not advise anyone who needs to watch their salt or grease intake more than the average person to be aware

55.description: This place is amazing!! The first night we tried it, I have to admit it was because the line was so long at Chipotle, but I was in love from the start. The food is delicious and plentiful and reasonable.  It's enough that my husband and I can share a sandwich. Please try this place, I promise you it is great!

9.description: KIMCHI BURGER IS LEGIT. I was afraid that the a strong kimchi taste was going to cover up the subpar burger but that was not the case! The burger alone would have been good without the kimchi/egg but it took it to another level. One modification that I should have asked for was an over-easy egg as opposed to sunny side up (as you can imagine things got messy; think hands covered in yolk & spicy kimchi juice).FRIES ARE SOME OF THE BEST that I've had. They're double fried french fries which make the consistency amazing. Just the right amount of crispy & soft in the center. I had them plain but would be open to trying them in different styles.The restaurant itself is small but for whatever strange reason, not busy at all (went at noon on a Monday). The employee who took my order was sweet & although she said the Umami burger was her favorite it is very heavy. I opted to go the Kimchi route and I'm not upset with my decision =)

26.description: KIMCHI BURGER IS LEGIT. I was afraid that the a strong kimchi taste was going to cover up the subpar burger but that was not the case! The burger alone would have been good without the kimchi/egg but it took it to another level. One modification that I should have asked for was an over-easy egg as opposed to sunny side up (as you can imagine things got messy; think hands covered in yolk & spicy kimchi juice).FRIES ARE SOME OF THE BEST that I've had. They're double fried french fries which make the consistency amazing. Just the right amount of crispy & soft in the center. I had them plain but would be open to trying them in different styles.The restaurant itself is small but for whatever strange reason, not busy at all (went at noon on a Monday). The employee who took my order was sweet & although she said the Umami burger was her favorite it is very heavy. I opted to go the Kimchi route and I'm not upset with my decision =)

25.description: Umami burger with kimchi fries was the lunch selection.   It's by far a top 5 burger of all time. The smoked gouda, mushroom tapenade and bun are undeniably a great combo. Burger is smash grilled to perfection. Great, great spot. The fries were so rich with cheese, onions, bacon and then they top them with kimchi. Couldn't even finish them.  Thanks Triple D!

12.description: Okay here's the rub, this is one of those all time awesome college town gems. I had the umami burger and it was a treasure trove of terrific-ness! Now the food delivery time from order to pick up was a tad long that just means it's cooked fresh from the ground up! Kimchee fries are the bomb! The counter girl was sweet and very helpful the kitchen staff are also super cool returning smiles and thumbs up when I saluted them as a left. I had to for only one triple D treat this trip and I'm so glad I chose BopNGrill! Go get you some deliciousness. FoodDude!

59.description: The kimchi fries are absolutely the best thing in Rogers Park. They are easily the greatest fries in Chicago. Their burgers are outstanding and I am always so full and so happy after eating here.

21.description: Average all around. Egg roll special on the weekends is not worth it at all. Guy Fieri endorsed this place. All you need to know.

17.description: The food is good the service staff is nice but the kitchen is slow. The eggroll they advertise are never in stock they are always sold out. This is a very busy place.

10.description: Bopngrill is kinda neat! I honestly avoid fusion since the crowd it attracts is typically pretentious, but this was kinda good. Since its by a college, the crowd is mixed and the music is decent. I ended up ordering some Korean chicken. I was expecting winggggsssss but it was still good nonetheless. The portions are decent as well, though the food can feel pricey at times (its next to a chipotle so...) but overall, I'd go again.

5.description: Not sure if I just ordered the wrong menu items or if my expectations were too high because of all the hype.I've eaten here twice now and my feelings towards the food are eh. I like the atmosphere but I think the prices are a little too high for the kind of restaurant this is and the food has underwhelmed me both times. First time I was here I ordered a loco moco and was kind of disappointed. Nothing was wrong with it, but I feel like I would have been better off eating at Aloha Eats if I wanted a loco moco. Second time I had an actual burger and that was better but I'm still not sure if it was worth the price. Definitely recommend ordering burgers here as a lot of my friends have the same "eh" feelings towards a lot of the other menu items.Also, kimchi fries. These things get SO MUCH HYPE. Once again I'm not sure if it's just me, but I thought the kimchi fries were just a huge sloppy soggy (emphasis on soggy) mess. I think I prefer the kimchi fries at Del Seoul and maybe even the ones at Yeowoosai over the ones here. All in all, bopNGrill isn't bad and if you're into the whole Korean-fusion trend, you might really enjoy it.

3.description: I had a nice time eating at bopNGrill. I got a kimchi burger and a loco moco plate. The burger was well-made and tasted very savory. The kimchi doesn't overpower the dish. My only complaint is that the egg dripped a lot when I was eating the burger. The loco moco plate is what I'm going to keep ordering in the future. It's essentially a rice plate with two burger patties, an egg, topped with gravy. I was surprised that something so simple tasted that great! Definitely recommend trying the loco moco at bopNGrill.

35.description: Not sure if I just ordered the wrong menu items or if my expectations were too high because of all the hype.I've eaten here twice now and my feelings towards the food are eh. I like the atmosphere but I think the prices are a little too high for the kind of restaurant this is and the food has underwhelmed me both times. First time I was here I ordered a loco moco and was kind of disappointed. Nothing was wrong with it, but I feel like I would have been better off eating at Aloha Eats if I wanted a loco moco. Second time I had an actual burger and that was better but I'm still not sure if it was worth the price. Definitely recommend ordering burgers here as a lot of my friends have the same "eh" feelings towards a lot of the other menu items.Also, kimchi fries. These things get SO MUCH HYPE. Once again I'm not sure if it's just me, but I thought the kimchi fries were just a huge sloppy soggy (emphasis on soggy) mess. I think I prefer the kimchi fries at Del Seoul and maybe even the ones at Yeowoosai over the ones here. All in all, bopNGrill isn't bad and if you're into the whole Korean-fusion trend, you might really enjoy it.

19.description: OMG you have not lived until you have had Kim chi fries !!!! The bulgogi is extremely  good best I ever had ... I now know what all the hype was about I will become a regular here .

28.description: Somehow I don't get it...   There's nothing "bad" about this place but it just isn't all that special.  If you're near it and need to eat right at that moment, go.  But if you can wait 5 minutes, you can find other spots much more interesting within a very short walking distance.

45.description: I went in after my friends and a few other people had suggested it as a good place to eat. I tried the burger. Chicken and the egg roles. Over all the food was ok. The burger patties are small so you have to get a double. The kimchee is not my favorite thing so I might have missed the quality of there fries and sides that had it included. The philly egg roles where extremely salty and did not taste very good. I have had Irish egg roles with corn beef that where a lot more balanced and not as salty. Over all the place was also expensive for what you get. I spent almost $20 and did not have much food for that amount of money. The burger you get at 5 guys down the street was superior in size and taste and also cheaper. Over all unless this is exactly what you are looking for I would not trust the diners drive ins and dives gimmick and go some place else like star grill down the street where your dollar gets you more and the quality is better.

33.description: Bopngrill is kinda neat! I honestly avoid fusion since the crowd it attracts is typically pretentious, but this was kinda good. Since its by a college, the crowd is mixed and the music is decent. I ended up ordering some Korean chicken. I was expecting winggggsssss but it was still good nonetheless. The portions are decent as well, though the food can feel pricey at times (its next to a chipotle so...) but overall, I'd go again.

43.description: This is the first place I ate when I moved to Rogers Park and I can't wait to go back. The kimchi burger, topped with caramelized kimchi, bacon, and a fried egg, is delicious!

2.description: So I checked this joint out after seeing them on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.  My cousins are Korean so I'm always looking for a good Kimchi spot.  BopNgrill did not disappoint.  Parking is tricky so look around to find a street spot.  It's small but we were lucky to grab a table outside, (summertime)  I didn't make it there in time to snag a Philly cheese-steak egg roll so :(We waited about 15-20 minutes for our food because they stay busy.  But it was worth the wait.  Flavor Town all around.  I had the signature Umami burger and Kimchi fries.  We ordered some more stuff but I forget.  The point is that everything was as delicious as they promised on the show.I can't really speak to the service.  It's fast food, pretty much "what do you want?"  Not rude or anything, just very matter of fact and let's keep the party going.  I had to drive about an hour to get there so I can't visit that often but if I lived in the neighborhood, I would frequent this joint.

18.description: Geez... how to review, if I was reviewing for this particular trip I would have given like 2 stars, but the food was 5 as far as greasy burgers go.I got the loco burger with no onion or mayo... yeah, I dont like Onion, I know, I am completely weird and all.  I am used to people not listening to my quick talking, high paced vernacular and all, but the register girl was right with me on this, and got my order, repeated it back to me, put up with my first time there, no idea what I wantedness... and was super nice.  Got the burger and after I had a few bites noticed it had the onions.  They were super nice about it though and gave me a new one, and it was delicious ... like really really good.  And the fries were actually very good as well, not the normal fast foodish type fries.The other thing that was less than stellar... the before mentioned really awesome front counter girl was diligently doing her job clearing and cleaning the tables after a family left, and did something I dont really like, and that is spraying cleaning fluid from about 3 feet above the table for like a minute, which brought the cloud of chemicals my way and most likely all over my food and me.  Sure... I appreciate her desire to rid my food of harmful bacteria, but alittle bacteria builds character I say (actually all bacteria is rather little... but I digress).Anyways, even though that happened, and the fact I consumed really bad for me food, it was a really good burger joint and I recommend it.

41.description: Grabbed dinner with a bunch of friends here and since I wasn't too familiar with Korean cooking I didn't really know what to expect. I figured a Korean burger spot would be a good introduction though. Unfortunately, by the time we got to the counter they had run out of the Philly bulkogi egg rolls. We had to settle for the Kimchi fries which were a whole lot better than I thought, considering it's fermented cabbage.  I got one of the plates, the loco moco, and it was super savory. Just two burger patties with rice and gravy topped with a fried egg. It was good but I just kept looking at my wife's umami burger with truffle and mayo and smoked gouda. If I went again, I already know I'm getting that.  Be prepared to wait a few minutes as well. I think it took about 20 from the time we ordered to get our food. Totally understandable as it seemed like a popular spot, but just a fair warning in case you're looking for something quick.

52.description: As a fan of Korean/Asian food, I had lots of expectations.  In addition, I had large expectations because it's been renown from Diners, Drive-in's, and Dive's, and local Chicago food folk.  bopNGrill did not disappoint.  I had their bi-bim-bop with chicken katsu and it was amazing!  Their gochujang they add to the flavor is amazing.  I can't wait to try the other items like their burgers and fries.  So for those looking for a lighter fare, bopNGrill also delivers.  Next time I go the full monty, I'm going all out.

50.description: I absolutely love the Umami burger and bacon cheese fries! It is hidden little restaurant and far from home but it's worth the trip! If u are in Chicago you must try it!

4.description: Just ate here for lunch for the first time today. This place is awesome! I ordered the Bavarian burger with cheese fries and my husband got the bNg burger with kimchi fries. Both were super good. No problems at all. I was a little scared to try the kimchi fries, but they are amazing! I will definitely be ordering those next time. The restaurant overall is very clean and the staff is very attentive and friendly. So happy we are within walking distance of this place. It's a must try!

6.description: Oh. My. God.That's all I really feel I need to say. My boyfriend moved a block away from this place, and, well, we are going to get so fat. Everything is amazing, even if you ask them to leave off the bacon. And the people there are nice! We even overheard a manager (or owner?) asking his employees what they wanted to eat that day. Just a nice place!

22.description: Love the concept. So excited every time I come here... then I get my food.I understand that it's going to be an extremely flavorful burger, but it's just too much. Everything is over seasoned, including the fries. With such strong flavors, you can afford to go a little easy on all the seasoning. I want to love this place, and if this issue gets fixed, I'll definitely be changing my rating to 5 stars.

15.description: This place has become one of my new favorites for a delicious, but also quick and inexpensive meal. Everything I've had here is really good. My favorite is probably the bibimbap - bulgogi, BBQ chicken and tofu are all amazing! I definitely recommend the fries here also. Absolutely love this place!

57.description: The food is pretty quick here.  The pricing is slightly expensive for what you get but it wasn't a biggie.  The burger I had was decent maybe a 7.5/10.  They messed up the order but at the time I was so hungry I didn't bother to get them to make me a new burger, I just took the bacon off and ate the burger.  The cheese fries were slightly okay as well (6.5/10).  It is on par with 5guys type of hamburger spot.  I didn't try the korean part of the menu.  I assume the korean part is better as I saw someones plate and their food looked interesting.  If you want good burgers there are plenty of other burger spots in town.  This is an okay spot to test your palette on. I wouldn't recommend it to someone from out of town but if I was in the neighborhood and someone I knew wanted to go there then I would go.  The patio is cool during the summer.

20.description: umami burger and kimchi fries are a must! definitely going back to explore the rest of the menu.

36.description: My husband and I just happened to drive by coming back to the city from Evanston. This place is good! I ordered the bulgogi and my husband ordered the Katsu. Everything was cooked perfectly. A tad bit on the pricey side, but not too much. Plus you get a lot of food. Mine could have lasted two meals. They have a patio with tables and picnic tables and ample seating inside. We went on a random weeknight, but I would imagine this place gets packed on weekends. Since its close to Loyola and the red line. We will definitely go again. I want to try other things on the menu.

14.description: Grabbed dinner with a bunch of friends here and since I wasn't too familiar with Korean cooking I didn't really know what to expect. I figured a Korean burger spot would be a good introduction though. Unfortunately, by the time we got to the counter they had run out of the Philly bulkogi egg rolls. We had to settle for the Kimchi fries which were a whole lot better than I thought, considering it's fermented cabbage.  I got one of the plates, the loco moco, and it was super savory. Just two burger patties with rice and gravy topped with a fried egg. It was good but I just kept looking at my wife's umami burger with truffle and mayo and smoked gouda. If I went again, I already know I'm getting that.  Be prepared to wait a few minutes as well. I think it took about 20 from the time we ordered to get our food. Totally understandable as it seemed like a popular spot, but just a fair warning in case you're looking for something quick.

58.description: I met a group of people at a Rogers Park social event at the Glenwood on Saturday night.  It's definitely what you would call a neighborhood bar - small and friendly.  The bartenders were all friendly and attentive - can't ask for more than to have another cold one ready when I'm finishing one off.  It's also a dog-friendly bar, which is very cool.  They even have a box of dog treats behind the bar.My only quibble with the Glenwood is that when I drink beer, I'm a Bud Light fella (don't judge me!) and they don't carry Bud products.  No biggie, but damn that Miller Light tastes like swill when you're used to Bud!Overall, great atmosphere, fun crowd - I'll be going back.

56.description: Yep...I'm a fan. I have been here a handful of times and is a place I would come back to if I lived a little closer. Similar concept as T's and SoFo. Good beer selection which is a nice change from the typical BL,ML type beers. Different crowd...but also in a different area. You will get all kinds and that adds to the charm. I spent a long Sunday afternoon there watching the Cubs game, had drinks and conversation. Music was at a reasonable level where you could hear it but did not drowned out the conversation you were having.

29.description: When I first moved to Chicago, The Glenwood was the nearest bar to my apartment. Naturally, I started going quite regularly and I could not have asked for a better place to find in an unfamiliar city! The bartenders are just as nice as you could ever ask for. The atmosphere is relaxed and without pretense. The clientele are diverse and usually very nice. There's a pool table and darts for those who want bar games. No food, but they allow you to bring your own. There's a Beer of the Month with $6.00 double-pints (in a huge, frosty mug) daily and specials on Tuesday for double-pint drafts. Wednesday night is Karaoke Night, so come out and sing until you drop. Thursday they have Trivia Night and there's a monthly Bear Night as well for us hirsute gentlemen. Excellent job, guys. Keep being the excellent neighborhood bar you are!

42.description: Great local bar, double pints for $7, darts and pool, drink specials.

23.description: A great local bar! The bartenders are super nice, they are always having great beer specials and karaoke on Wednesday's and trivia on Thursday's are really fun! Check it out sometime and you won't be disappointed!

47.description: Love it here!  Me and my friend usually do a girls night out at some point during the week, and after feeling pretty blah about most of the options in RP after awhile, we decided The Glenwood would be the new spot.  Love the music and the staff, and the patrons are always nice and friendly.  I've seen it packed and I've seen it dead, so it's kinda a mix that way.  Pool, darts, Wii, etc if that's your bag, and they have some really good drink specials.

8.description: This bar has been my #1 after work choice for a while now. While there are other options in the area, this place is one of the best. The bartenders are always friendly and attentive, and they always have some kind of $6 double pint special (sometimes it's even Crispin!) This place has pool tables and lots of space to spread out and hangout. And sometimes they have chex mix!

31.description: Love. This. Bar.  I live in the neighborhood and I absolutely love coming to The Glenwood.  While it definitely caters more to the gay community of Rogers Park, The Glenwood is ultimately a neighborhood bar.  Never really too crowded either... Just a great place to get a drink with friends.

34.description: Fun, fun, fun! If I lived close to the Glenwood it may become my go to bar. Went on a Friday night and it wasn't packed, but there were enough people to keep it lively - like the wa-wa-wasted girl dancing and flailing about while showing of her stomach tattoo. HOT.The drinks were relatively cheap (Blue Moon, Stella and Smithwicks for $13.) Maybe I'm used to downtown prices, haha.Also, two thumbs up on the music selection. I couldn't help but sing to practically every tune that played.

16.description: I had the opportunity to visit The Glenwood this past weekend for a charity event with Fred Says.  It's a great neighborhood spot and if I lived in Rogers Park this would be my hangout.  The people were nice, unpretentious and they had a great beer list.  I'll definitely be back at some point.

13.description: October 16Karaoke Night!  I definitely have fun!  Great size drinks for great price!  If you are nervous to sing, have few drinks or maybe some more to loosen up.  I'm not a singer, but a few drinks will help me pick one song.Making this a regular Wednesday routine!

11.description: A friend had been talking up Wednesday Karaoke so I made a cross-town trip (2 trains/80 minutes) to meet him there, and Karaoke was cancelled. My first and last visit to The Glenwood.If it was in my neighborhood I might pop in now and then.

39.description: Great bar great drink specials.  Even though this a gay and lesbian bar and I am and a straight male I still love hanging out at this bar.

37.description: The Glenwood is a great neighborhood watering hole.  It's clean, the staff is awesome and they make a great drink.  The mix of people is eclectic and fun.  You can have food delivered from any local restaurant, shoot pool, throw darts or just hang out and chat about good old Rogers Park.

0.description: I am waking up from an evening at the Glenweod and I just need to say Im still drunk so I am putting a formal complaint to my bartender.  Job well done!!! You know who you are.....

38.description: Always a favorite.Great neighborhood bar and a friendly crowd. Lots of regular drink specials, too.

51.description: THe glenwood alley is soo sick...Something about it is just too cool for school. Anyway this bar looked quiet enough to drop in for a drink over conversation with a friend.  Walking in the vibe felt different for sure, but I couldnt put my finger on it.  The place is clean, sophisticated, pool table for fun, and dog-friendly!  The crowd was unique too, I felt it inadvertently in between conversation.  Come to find out here on yelp, its a gay bar, no wonder.  I guess nothing wrong with that, I just didn't know where I was at but now I know wut's up.  I'd come back cus it's a cool place

27.description: Once again the Glenwood proves to be worthless.  The last time I tried this place, is the last time.  Nothing has changed with this dump.  Same snotty holier-than-thou bartenders, same owner that could care less about the customers that ultimately pay her bills.  I decided to try and give this place a fair shot and try it again but once again the place lived up to expectations.  Perhaps one day, Renee and her staff of moron bartenders will realize that word gets around in the community about how customers are treated there at the Glenwood.  Perhaps one day they will realize that poorly treated customers take their business elsewhere, happily.  Seriously, go elsewhere.  Its not worth your time to visit this place at all.

32.description: I was truly surprised by the quality of the martinis here! Not only do they have blue cheese stuffed olives, but they are hand stuffed (opposed to brine soaked grossness) and the blue cheese was wonderful. Great deal for $8. Think about it...$5 wine special or you can upgrade to a martini for $3 more and have a jolly good night ;-)It was a bit weird to walk into a bar with dogs roaming around, but they have to be out by 8pm, fyi.

54.description: A nice bar with a nice staff.   It's predominantly gay, right here in east Rogers Park.  They expanded and there is plenty of seating, so you can talk with your friends.  It's got a laid back feel you generally won't find in Boystown.

48.description: Great local bar...they have dart boards, pool, Wii, and board games (Jenga).  The people are always friendly and lots of cool promos like free lotto ticket give aways.  Also, be sure to roll the dice for $1.00 at a chance to win the big money pot or a free drink or shot!

44.description: Steps from the Morse El Stop, Glenwood is a great neighborhood bar. There is lots of space so you don't feel to crowded when it gets busy at night. Karaoke Wednesdays are tons of fun especially when you have people who can actually sing. There is also a great chance to try new beers with the beer choice of the month, normally around $5.00 for a pint. If you are looking for somewhere that is LGBT friendly and not a total dive, Glenwood is the place to be

24.description: I had the opportunity to visit The Glenwood this past weekend for a charity event with Fred Says.  It's a great neighborhood spot and if I lived in Rogers Park this would be my hangout.  The people were nice, unpretentious and they had a great beer list.  I'll definitely be back at some point.

7.description: When I need a beer and a shot, but there's a doorman at the Red Line Tap demanding a cover charge for a lousy band that's still an hour or two away from starting, this place suits me just fine.

49.description: My friend said, "Let's go to the gayest straight bar." Or, did he called it the straightest gay bar? I don't remember. Either way, The Glenwood looks like it's owned by the same people who opened T's and Sofo's. Right when you walk it, it definitely looked like a straight bar but once you hear Britney Spears and talk to the patrons there, you know you've landed in a gay or gay-friendly bar. I got a martini and my friend got a double pint beer. The total was around $15.00 including tax and tip. The bartender asked me a lot of questions -- vodka or gin? what kind of vodka? twist or olives? bleu cheese? UH. Geez. It was pretty damn strong though. I couldn't finish it on an empty stomach. The patrons are nice and friendly. I talked to a guy about comic books (there was a store down the street). I'll definitely be back if I'm ever in the neighborhood again.P.S. Unlike T's, they don't have a food menu. But they have takeout menus where you can order in from other restaurants.

40.description: Convenient.  Reasonable drink prices. Clean.  They'll put out free food randomly since they dont have a kithchen.  Went to try and watch a Bulls playoff game there, they had Dancing with the Stars on instead.  I guess they don't have cable? Haha

53.description: I am so happy the Glenwood expaned! I was there for the (2010)Oscars and the crowd was quite large, friendly and fun. They offer good drink specials and have super friendly staff. (You go there a few times and you'll be BFFs of the staff on Facebook). It's a nice place to meet someone for a date or take friends after dinner. You may even find a hook-up. Oh and ladies who like ladies, you will be very comfortable too. I love this place and give it 6 stars in my heart, but 5 on Yelp.

30.description: I live half a block away and I don't come by nearly as often as I should. The bartenders are always nice and attentive and competent. The drink specials can't rival Heartland's but this place is so huge there's always somewhere to sit and there might be a friendly gay guy who chats you up. I have no complaints. Just a straightforward, normal bar.

46.description: A note to bars on team flags: If you are a bar that hangs a sports team flag outside, THEN PLAY THE GAMES OF THAT TEAM! Patrons should NOT have to ask for you to turn on a game if you fly that flag outside! DON'T fly a current championship team flag outside, if you are not that team's bar! It's insulting to customers and to fans of that team.*ahem*...I digress...Being new to the neighborhood, I've been into The Glenwood a handful of times. It's a nice little generic bar, certainly an improvement over many of the dive bars that have generally inhabited the area. My problem with The Glenwood is two-fold. First, it really is just a generic bar. There's really nothing here to make it stand out from any number of other bars, other than it's location. If it were in, say, Lincoln park or Boystown, it would quickly be lost in the crowd.Second (and most frustrating) are the 6 widescreen TVs that would be wonderful to watch a game on. Unfortunately, this is not entirely possible. If you ask, the bartender will change the channel from America's Funniest Home Videos (literally, everytime I'm here they're watching AFV! Lame!). Can you get some audio? Oh no, sorry. You have to listen to the terrible music instead. What's the point of having 6 TVs if you can't listen to the audio!? I don't expect it to be loud, just high enough so that I can hear the announcers talk or the calls of the game! Can I get some Closed Captioning at least? Oh sorry, we can't figure out how to do that...Until the owners get a clue, I won't be coming back...

1.description: Cute small spot.. Ordered a Bloody Mary and miller light.. Disappointed they had no celery with it but they were only 5 bucks each!

55.description: After a rather interesting audition, I met up with some friends in the Ro Po.  I arrived to The Glenwood first, and wasn't yet ready to order - the bartender didn't seem to mind my sitting at the bar, semi-loitering.  I ended up ordering a Negroni a few minutes later, and it was pretty tasty.  Once my friends showed up, we all had Bloody Marys.  $6.  Six dollars.  And, too, pretty tasty.There was some good pop music on, some dude playing a Wii bowling game, and the Cowboys/Panthers game was on all the screens.  It was a pretty laid back atmosphere, certainly gay-friendly.  It's right next to the train, right price range, and was just right for meeting dear, old friends in the 'hood.

9.description: Glenwood if you are going to charge $8 for a glass of wine I expect the wine to taste at least decent. You poured me old, bottom of the bottle wine that tasted like mouthwash and walked away never asking how is it. Shame on you.  You should drink it and see how you like!They do have nice beers on tap.....Pumpkin and revolution IPA but please do not serve old wine!

26.description: I started going to The Glenwood a year or so before moving to Rogers Park, as my girlfriend's cousin and his wife lived around the corner down Pratt. At first, I thought I knew what to expect when going to a gay bar, having lived in Lakeview on the cusp of Boystown, but after arriving at The Glenwood, my thoughts were turned absolutely around.First off, the staff are all really nice and approachable, from the nice doorman to the attentive bartenders. The drink specials are usually really good, the menu is fairly extensive for the area of the city it is in, and you can never go wrong with $6 double-pints. A well-worn billiards table is in the back of the main room, which is surprisingly spacious, as is two dart machines. Usually, the bar will provide patrons with pizza as well, which is a mighty fine gesture if you ask me. The TVs are usually playing the big sports games or Cartoon Network's [Adult Swim], which always goes over well with my group of friends, and the music selection is pretty good. Once, we were there when the bar had a DJ, and he played a great selection of Top 40 and classic dance, and it was a pretty good unexpected night of dancing.Everyone who frequents the bar all seem to either know each other or, at the very least, those on staff, which lends an air of community to the bar, which is always nice to see. The bar also lends alot of support to the community itself, which you can't argue with.The two one-person bathrooms are a little iffy at times on cleanliness, and the locks don't always work. There have been times when I will catch a glance of someone unknowingly (I cant only hope) walk in on someone already in a bathroom. Other than that drawback, the only thing I can think of that holds back the fifth star for The Glenwood is it's at-times overly-aggressive clientele. However, I feel that this bar is a solid 4.5, and only wish I could award it that extra half-star here in my review.All-in-all, I would absolutely recommend The Glenwood as a place to drink. It has somewhat become my "local bar", and would be happy to bring any of my out of town, or out of neighbourhood friends.

25.description: The Glenwood is a wonderful, laid-back bar. The bartenders are always incredibly friendly and accommodating. The beer list well-rounded. I highly recommend the team trivia that they host on Thursday nights; the prize list is awesome and it is always a lot of fun. If it were closer to home, I could see myself being there a lot more often.

12.description: One of my favorite places in the city and right in my own backyard! A friendly neighborhood straight-friendly gay bar. The bar staff is always congenial. Love the free wifi. The Thursday night trivia is the best!

59.description: I went to the Glenwood with a friend who lives in Rogers Park and will not go again.  The people on the streets in the immediate vacinity were intimidating and the Glenwood is on a poorly lit alley.  Someone took my seat when I went to the restroom (despite the fact that my cell phone, keys and drink were still there) and the bartender didn't care.  The clientele is cliquey and insipid.

21.description: This was my favorite watering hole.  It's the "Modern Family" version of "Cheers".  A very friendly mixed crowd.  It's not pretentious and is as diverse as it gets, from 21 to 91, straight, gay, and other. Depending on the night of the week it leans a little more one way or the other, younger/older straight/or gay, and always friendly.  A perfect to place to take your any of your friends or your parents.  It's also a good venue for a party. Well mannered pets welcome earlier in the evening.

17.description: A hidden bar in a gar bar area n ear the Loyola campus. Nothing special about this place and it is looking a bit old and run down. It is at the right spacial level and has a pool table and darts away from the bar.

10.description: I LOVE THIS BAR.Now that we've established this, the serving staff is always amazing and super helpful when it comes to ordering drinks. I lived right down the street and went to Loyola, and I loved getting a cheap drink right after class before toddling home.A couple times we were there, they ordered food for the late night barflies. Pizza! Burgers! It was ah-MAY-zing. They really care about their customers and it shows!It's never super busy there and pretty quiet, so it's also a nice place to unwind after a long work day. Absolutely wonderful.

5.description: This was a pretty swell place, and larger than I expected.  I was there for a fundraiser type event for a band I am in.  I wasn't involved at all in the planning, but I hear they were very great to work with and very good to us.  I think my group must have hosted events there in the past.The place is very clean, on an adorable and quiet side street parallel to the red line tracks, and looked very "new" to me.  Maybe it's recently been redone?  You walk in, and there's the bar area with two or three tables by the window.  Then there's a whole other room (which we used to stage our drag queen show) with many more tables.  I think there was a billiard table but we had it covered with a table cloth and were using it to serve food.  The staff was very friendly and they had many good beers available.  The special of the night was a champagne slushy but unfortunately, I never had one because I was too busy drinking Abita strawberry harvest beer.  First time I'd ever had it, so good.  I believe there were three bathrooms, they were back to back with one on the bar side with the other two on the other side.  Those were super clean as well.Seeing as I don't live anywhere near it, I doubt it's a place I will often frequent, but if I did live in the neighborhood, I totally would.  The regular crowd that was there hanging out before our special event started seemed like a cool bunch of folk.

3.description: My favorite neighborhood joint. Each bartender is personable and a pleasure to speak with. They make their drinks stiff and run generous specials. They even let you bring outside food, so you don't feel like you're eating alone and feel less guilty (haha, that makes me sound pathetic). I generally go when the business is slow, but it's a fun place to be at any time!

35.description: Best bar in Rogers Park! Great staff, dog friendly, nightly specials, trivia & karaoke nights.

19.description: When I first moved to Chicago, The Glenwood was the nearest bar to my apartment. Naturally, I started going quite regularly and I could not have asked for a better place to find in an unfamiliar city! The bartenders are just as nice as you could ever ask for. The atmosphere is relaxed and without pretense. The clientele are diverse and usually very nice. There's a pool table and darts for those who want bar games. No food, but they allow you to bring your own. There's a Beer of the Month with $6.00 double-pints (in a huge, frosty mug) daily and specials on Tuesday for double-pint drafts. Wednesday night is Karaoke Night, so come out and sing until you drop. Thursday they have Trivia Night and there's a monthly Bear Night as well for us hirsute gentlemen. Excellent job, guys. Keep being the excellent neighborhood bar you are!

28.description: I've played darts here a couple of times; Partner and I attended a benefit here recently. It's a large space with friendly staff and patrons. It's a tad far from our normal area so it won't become a regular hang out for us but for those of you more in the neighborhood, it's a fine option for drink and relaxation.

45.description: A basic, non-flashy bar with plenty of tables but not a lot of character. The music can be a little loud on the weekends, hindering conversation, but weeknights are pretty chill.Great beer selection! And the patrons are always nice (and mostly gay).

33.description: Not only does this place have a friendly staff, they are dog friendly too? I am from Miami and they do not, I repeat, DO NOT allow you to bring a dog into a bar. So I loveee this! The drinks were cheap and they have plenty of space to hang out and a pool table? Can you say fun?!

43.description: A good bar in East Rogers Park. Friendly staff, friendly patrons and a good beer selection. I alway have a good time at the Glenwood. Even better, the bar does a lot to support the community during street fairs and especially for the farmers market. It's nice to know that the places you spend your money are putting it to work in your community.

2.description: Wow...this last time in was devastating. The alcohol is so watered down its embarrassing. I drink good Gin OTR's and know damn well when it's cut. After my cohort and I dived into three vodka/redbulls and STILL didn't feel a tinge of days relief wear off, we pretty much suspected we were being screwed. So I then ordered a Hendricks rocks and him a bourbon neat, so I could be certain it wasn't just our imagination. Well alas..The watered booze was so obvious. Never again shall we go or ever again recommend this establishment. We used to enjoy the Glenwood. What a shame now.

18.description: My mission: To get to East Rogers Park and get to my friend's birthday party. After going the wrong way two times, I made my way into the Glenwood and found my friends lined up along a few tables by the window. Inside the bar was a pool table, electronic darts that didn't seem turned on and quite a few TVs. I noticed there were lots of guys in the bar and not  very girls in the bar at all. My friend (who is straight) told me that the Glenwood is a gay bar, but the best mixed bar in the city. Everyone minded their own business and the Glenwood is the same as any other sports bar I've been in.The Glenwood is a nice spot especially since they knocked down a wall and tookover the place next to them. I had always passed by and it looked like a total dive, but with the new backroom they put in some ambient lights above and there are nice floors and everything looks new. The bar gave away free pizza and there was a mini-frenzy which amused me.

41.description: Great drink specials and great people! They have a pool table and darts.

52.description: My mission: To get to East Rogers Park and get to my friend's birthday party. After going the wrong way two times, I made my way into the Glenwood and found my friends lined up along a few tables by the window. Inside the bar was a pool table, electronic darts that didn't seem turned on and quite a few TVs. I noticed there were lots of guys in the bar and not  very girls in the bar at all. My friend (who is straight) told me that the Glenwood is a gay bar, but the best mixed bar in the city. Everyone minded their own business and the Glenwood is the same as any other sports bar I've been in.The Glenwood is a nice spot especially since they knocked down a wall and tookover the place next to them. I had always passed by and it looked like a total dive, but with the new backroom they put in some ambient lights above and there are nice floors and everything looks new. The bar gave away free pizza and there was a mini-frenzy which amused me.

50.description: Checked out this bar last week. Aside from the $5 cover because it was some karaoke idol contest night, I thought it was pretty cool. Had a few martinis there --- drinks were reasonably priced and the bartender was really cool. Definitely different than the Sidetrash type crowds.ETA: Just stopped in on a Tuesday night and I'm surprised it wasn't packed! HELLO 2-FOR-1 DRINK TUESDAYS!!! MARRY ME!?

4.description: This place is super lame and expensive. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. You'll wait forever and pay a fortune for your drinks. The owner owns the crappy Pub 626 next door. They also charge a fortune but they'll screw up your order every time. You've been warned.

6.description: The beer prices here are okay, not great -- but we came here with some friends to watch the Blackhawks game and the bartender randomly shut the game off in favor of some random reality show -- while the game was in double overtime.

22.description: Came here for the RP Winter Farmers Market and stayed the day!   Had a great bloody mary and a few cold beers.  Was there about two hours before I realized it was a gay bar.  Which in my opinion made it even better!  I have no idea how I have lived in the RP for 9 years and never stumbled upon this place.  The service was great and liked the corner bar atmosphere.  I have been looking for a local and think I have found it,  hope that a straight girl is welcome!  Also looking forward to trying the new restaurant next door!

15.description: I came here after an audition to celebrate with my boyfriend and was pleasantly surprised because not only did they have cheap and delicious beer, they were doing a showing of the American Horror Story season 3 finale! How fun!

57.description: The Glenwood was great! I went on Tuesday night (where your second drink is free) and was quite impressed.  The bartender was very nice and he made a great cocktail (they have a cocktail menu).  They take cards and cash, there's a good jukebox, the crowd is very friendly and they have specials all the time.  It's just great! Finally, a gay bar in Chicago that's low key and laid back!  It's also a dog friendly bar and even though I don't own a dog, I'm a dog lover.  So, I didn't mind the four or five pups that were there.  Plus, it's a perfectly mixed crowd, guys and girls, which is a plus!  The neighborhood can be a tad sketchy, but you'll have that.  It's in a very cool part of Rogers Park (The Glenwood Arts District) and the block has a very cool vibe.  I will be back and I am a fan.  Love The Glenwood.

20.description: Nice chill bar with very friendly staff.

36.description: Really great atmosphere and tons of space.

14.description: It's a little small in an almost cozy sort of way. Unfortunately the door does not keep out any of the sound so you have to stay on the quiet side lest people learn too much about your activity. Otherwise, the style is okay. The paint is well matched with the tile and the strip of multicolored glass is pleasantly at eye level (sitting down). The decor leaves much to be desired, however, as all the nice art space is filled with their various weekly promotions (which are a good deal, but that's not the point). Unfortunately in winter now the tile makes it a little cold in here. The sink and toilet are standard. The toilet paper is low quality but a step up from  the standard as its texture delivers a better wipe. Minus points for not having the option of paper towels. All in all, it was not an unpleasant experience, but it definitely lacked a je ne sais quoi to distinguish it from others. Extra points for free condoms. C+/B- on a good day.

29.description: I was working in the Field when I noticed this place...I was extra hungry!! So i decided to go on in and check it out. Probably one of the best Food choices I had made in a very long time...I had the Chicken...I had the Greek Salad...I had the Mac and cheese bites...Gyro was amazing!!!! When I looked down at my watch, I noticed I had been sitting there trying everything on the menu for 2HRS!!!!!  Great ownership and staff...I think I am heading there today for lunch....try it out!

42.description: The food is great for a gyros. I'm a huge fan of the gyro burger, which is a cheeseburger with gyro meat and gyro sauce on it. The prices are cheap, the place is clean.The owner is great! The food is good but the owner is what keeps me coming back. Such a great guy I want to support his business.

23.description: I got a very nice call of apology from the owner. I like that, so I am adding a star. I appreciate when business owners really care. We will give them another shot sometime soon.

47.description: Service is kind of slow, but the owner seems to know everyone who walks in and appears to enjoy chatting.I was starving to death and didn't want to spend more than $5.55.Luckily that was the exact cost of the chicken sandwich meal. The food wasn't exciting or unlike anything you can find at the next neighborhood joint but it tasted good so kudos for not burning my chicken.Good and cheap but not super fast so consider that when trying to dash inside before trying to make the el.

8.description: great food, especially burgers and broast chicken! The gyros burger is my favorite, you have to try it!!

31.description: I was wrong before; this place is indeed special. Great gyros, they do it up right. They know what they're doing; the cook was juggling about eight orders at once and didn't miss a beat, nor did he mess up our special order. I love this place, it's a neighborhood gem, my go-to place for gyros or a fast food burger. Also, thanks to the owner for putting up cameras and signs to help keep the bad guys from hanging out in front.

34.description: Ordered two gyros, two small Greek salads, and two sodas as takeout. The gyros were great. Heaping piles of meat with just the right amount of sauce enclosed in a toasted pita. The salads were okay. Large chunk of cheese topped some shredded lettuce, raw onions, and olives. Our salads had the dressing applied and not on the side causing the salad to be a bit limp when we got it home.  The dressing itself was fairly flavorless. The guy who took our order was super nice. But did forget to put our drinks in the bag.

16.description: I got a very nice call of apology from the owner. I like that, so I am adding a star. I appreciate when business owners really care. We will give them another shot sometime soon.

13.description: A good value for a quick meal or snack. Pretty standard fare, you can tell the good isn't always the freshest. Friendly staff.

11.description: Gyro's, Gyro Sandwich are great.  The "Greek Salad" is kind of a joke.  Shredded iceberg lettuce from a bag? Really? Reminds me of the lettuce I get on my Subway Sub.  Also, what Greek Salad comes without beets?  This one.The Spinach Pie, avoid!  Greasy, falls apart. They just drop it in a fryer, and when you go to eat it, all the pastry just falls right off, and the taste is as bland as can be. Terrible.

39.description: The broasted chicken is awesome!!!  It is so juicy and not too greasy.  You get 1/2 chicken, fries, and slaw for under $7!!!  Very good food and good price.   An update...Morse Gyros is now OPEN ON SUNDAY!!  Thank you Morse Gyros.

37.description: It seems I always end up here when I'm famished. And they never disappoint. In fact, one gyro is generally too much for me. (Which I'm okay with, on the occasion I have eggs at home, the gyro meat makes a great omelet.)I get the same thing every time. Gyro and cheese fries. I've learned to order just a side of cheese for my fries rather than asking for "cheese fries" specifically... because when you order a gyro, it comes with fries... So ordering a "gyro and cheese fries" means a gyro, small fries, and another larger order of fries with cheese sauce on the side. (Although, sometimes, that's not a bad thing.)One of these days I want to try their wings or a Greek salad... but that gyro gets me every time. Love it.Oh, and they do indeed take credit cards--as far as I know, there's no minimum, but I've never ordered anything less than $5.

0.description: This place touts itself as having the best gyros in Chicago. I've been to four or five other places and this one still hangs on to the top spot.
