They have just the right balance of meat, veggies and sauce so that you are getting a full sandwich without a huge mess. The fries are a little mushy for my taste, but otherwise this place is aces.

38.description: Great gyro. So so fries/burgers. Chicken is very good, if it's fresh out of the fryer.

51.description: Hey, it's a gyro stand.  This place, however, is a neighborhood standard.  It's clean. The food is fresh and prepared just right.  The guy who runs the place is friendly, takes no guff from the punks who test him now and then and works his tail off six days a week to keep a nice business going despite the challenges of being on Morse Ave.If I'm in the mood for gyros, I'm coming here.

27.description: I must be missing something...At first I was feelin' Morse Gyros but after a few other tries I'm not seein' eye to eye with the place.  The gyro meat and the pita is really good, but the tzatziki is really bland and it ruins the sandwich for me.  If I had tzatziki that I liked at home then I could possibly continue to order a gyro.  I am willing to try some other things as I've heard good things.I will also stay away from the fries as they are awful and bland.The owner is real nice guy and delivery with GrubHub is super fast. So that is a plus.And, I do agree with McStrokin'. This is not an unsafe neighborhood. If you feel unsafe then you should reevaluate what's so scary.

32.description: First of all I want to say that the neighborhood this joint is located in is not all that bad.Like if you seriously feel unsafe by Morse Gyros,you're probably just a P*SSY excuse my french.Now on to the food fair.I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and tastiness of their food.I ordered the Chicken Gyro sandwich and my girlfriend ordered a plain ol' Gyro.Both sandwiches were succulent and juicy.It was unreal how juicy my Chicken breast was!The fries were a waste of time imo but i'd say that for most fast food establishments out there.I heard their fried Chicken is good so maybe i'll try that next time.If you live close by and you're into regular fast food fare,Morse Gyros is a great place too visit for some quick delicious cheap eats.

54.description: Under new ownership (since my earlier 2008 review), Morse Gyros is a great place for burgers, hotdogs and sandwiches.  Broasted chicken, Italian beef, salads and their specialty gyros are also wonderful.Did I mention that they have Red Cream Soda?!Best of all, they now deliver all over Rogers Park.

48.description: I come here to do a character study of the owner.  He has these really serious, thoughtful eyes, and could not care less about making friends.  Every move he makes is meticulous; when he slices gyro meat it is like a sculptor; his movements have such precision.  The other employee and he work in a silent rhythm, taking great care in every movement.  I guess I don't really know he's the owner.  But he's the owner.  Only the owner could have that much pride and care invested in making me a very precise 4.95 giant salad of fresh cucumber, tomato, and sweet onion piled high with fresh, spicy gyro shavings and the most delicious dressing.  Plus, they grill the pita for a minute before you get it--genius.  He won't make friends with you, but if you tip your bag after he carefully places all the necessities in it just so, he will scold you.  How can that not be the best gyro salad you've ever gotten?  Man, I wish I had that much precision and care in anything I did.  I also secretly hope I one day spot Wallace and Poot chatting in the corner, because this place is exactly like the spots the hoppers hang out in on The Wire (yes, sounds intriguing, doesn't it?  It is actually the greatest show on earth.  Get off yelp and go watch it now.  Oh, not on hulu?  The Wire is better than that.  It deserves more than the internet.  go buy it.)Closed Sunday and Cash Only.

44.description: Morse Gyros is sooo much more than Gyros. At any time you could be sitting next to gang foot soldiers scrounging up change for a cheeseburger, or next to a Chicago Cop who should have retired about 15 years ago. The food...again more than just Gyros. We are talking some of the best fried chicken in the neighborhood, great bacon cheese burger and best part.....everything is made to order. Nino and his grill mate have been working this joint for over 8 years (that is how long I have been going). I used to make trips all the way from Oak Park (when I used to live there) for a fried chicken meal or bacon cheeseburger. Side note: their Greek salad is a menu surprise....cucumbers, BIG chunks of feta and other fix'ins. Great for less "fried" types.

24.description: I just don't get the hype, it's very mediocre here.  My roommate and I have ordered a few times from them, since it's so close to us, and full disclaimer, we love greasy food.  All that said, nothing we've had here has made us want to come back.We tried the gyros plate, it was good but nothing special.  The hamburgers are very mediocre, the hot dogs are actually pretty bad (not sure how they can mess them up, but the bun was dry and the dog itself wasn't cooked well), their chicken sandwich (fried) was probably my favorite order.Their localness and decent prices may warrant another order when desperate in the future, but for now I'm going elsewhere.

7.description: The Gryo was AAAAMAZZZING!!!! I'd drive across town for that thing!!!

49.description: Cheap, greasy, delicious gyros in a friendly neighborhood.  Nuff sed.

40.description: Stopped in here after six months of living in the neighborhood.  The food, a cheeseburger and a gyros were very good.  The food was very fresh and the meat on the gyros was not dried out and was also very plentiful.  The owner looked a little grumpt but was very friendly after a few moments.  I did take out.  The inside is clean but can be kind of put offish due to the gang-members that seem to hang out on that corner (sometimes inside).  Anyway, I recommend the food.  They also have lots of special combos to choose from, which saves a good bit of cash.-

53.description: When I lived in RP, this place had the BEST Gyros I'd ever tasted. And the Type A short order cook/owner was fun to watch - so efficient, moving at the speed of light with not one extra movement. Even if there's no one in the place, he's all Type A. I still occasionally make pilgrimages to this place for their Gyros. The rest of the menu is the standard short-order stuff, and the place is pretty nice and clean.

30.description: The reviews don't lie.  This probably is the best gyro sandwich in Chicago, and the burgers are close behind it.  The chef is a master of short order cooking and handles a crowd without breaking a sweat.  This is a restaurant for your bucket list.

46.description: This is the best broasted, fried, whatever chicken I have ever had and I am from Atlanta. The owner is kind and though quiet, both he and the other employee are kind and thoughtful. This place is super clean. I love it!!!!

1.description: I ordered here 3 days in a row. Twice great food. Tonight though the bag was soaking wet, the food soggy and after speaking with the restaurant numerous times they did nothing to compensate the inconvenience. 2 hours and 20 minutes later the food got here! A wrap mind you and all they did was come back to get the food? What kind of establishment does that! No fresh food sent or anything!Don't order here.

9.description: Gyros here are indeed as good as a gyros can get -- nicely charred on the rotisserie, moist and flavorful, liberally packed onto perfect pita bread. I have to ration my visits here or I would enjoy these gyros every day.

26.description: Not sure if the night shift hates their jobs or what, I absolutely am not doing business with this place again. My food arrived 20+ minutes late, cold, and with no regard to my requests (i.e. no onions does not equal load with obnoxious amounts of onions). Also, my doorbell doesn't work, so rather than leave the delivery driver, wait, I mean the man on his bike,  waiting outside in the cold, I went downstairs let him in and asked if he'd wait while I went to get cash for his tip (paid with debit card). Whether the man heard me or not, I'm unsure, but I do know his 2 minute TIRADE about how hard he works and even threatened me by saying my address along with 'we'll remember this'. I was in such shock, I didn't even get to give the guy a piece of my mind. I thought the only thing worst than not tipping was asking for a tip? Here's one, hire a new delivery guy!

25.description: My gyro was pretty good. I've never had one before, so I don't have anything to compare it to. The service was great and everyone who works there is very nice and accomodating. I'll stop by again, i'm sure.

12.description: Went here with my roommate for gyros.  I had lamb and she had the chicken, both with fries.  We were told that they had the best gyros, but it's hard to say that when one of the main ingredients within a gyro, the taziki sauce, was not good.  The meat in the gyros was well seasoned, moist and really good (both the lamb and chicken.  Fries were ehhhh.... they could of stayed in the fryer a bit longer so that they were crispy. The price was not bad, but good taziki sauce is a must in a gyro. If they fixed the sauce, I would definitely give it a higher rating and go back.

21.description: Gotta try the Buffalo Chicken Gyro... Amazing! Great service too, super friendly

17.description: I must be missing something...At first I was feelin' Morse Gyros but after a few other tries I'm not seein' eye to eye with the place.  The gyro meat and the pita is really good, but the tzatziki is really bland and it ruins the sandwich for me.  If I had tzatziki that I liked at home then I could possibly continue to order a gyro.  I am willing to try some other things as I've heard good things.I will also stay away from the fries as they are awful and bland.The owner is real nice guy and delivery with GrubHub is super fast. So that is a plus.And, I do agree with McStrokin'. This is not an unsafe neighborhood. If you feel unsafe then you should reevaluate what's so scary.

10.description: I can't say that I enjoyed the food I had from here but the service was pretty nice-hence the 3 stars

5.description: The food is good, especially the gyros and chardogs! I love that they other options besides just regular fries. The milkshakes are delicious!!!! They even delivered in under an hour during the hawks game.

3.description: I had a simple order of cheese fries and a piece of carrot cake. Not only did it take over an hour to get to get to my house (from .5 miles away) but the fries were freezing cold and soggy and the cheese was cold as well. Two weeks prior I ordered a hot dog and fries and had a very similar experience. Needless to say, it was two times too many.

35.description: I'm not going to type a lot in this review because I don't have to.This is probably the best gyro in Chicago.  The man who runs this place is brilliant.  The hamburgers are delicious, as is the fried chicken.Looks like a hole in the wall dump, but actually is a life time eating experience.MUST TRY.

19.description: Ordered take out last night. Had the fried chicken sandwich. It was pretty yummy. My boyfriend got the fish & he liked it a lot.

28.description: Good gyros, love their fresh tasting cucumber sauce. Atmosphere lacks and parking sucks, but the gyros are solid. Can't wait to try their broasted chicken, it looks wonderful. However, its not in the best neighborhood.

45.description: This place is pretty good for a neighborhood joint. The food is tasty; the gyros is good, but a tad dry. For the patron who's not into gyros, they have your average American fare on the menu, too. The cheeseburger is pretty good, but I have a suspicion the patty is a frozen one.I am by no means a salad person, but this place has the most delicious grilled chicken salad. The chicken is quality and juicy, although sometimes it gets a bit toasty on the outside. My favorite part is the pita bread they include; they dip it in oil and toast it on the grill for you. Absolutely delicious. I'd recommend getting the dressing on the side; it's delish, but oily and this way you can decide how much you want on the salad.The area's not so fabulous, although its really just that stretch of Morse. It's right off the red line stop, which probably significantly ups the weirdo quotient by itself. It would be sweet if there was more seating. Not a ton of parking available; some street parking, although there's a small shopping center with a parknig lot right across the street.The owner looks gruff, but he's really nice. If you work in the area or live close and stop by every so often, he'll remember you.A few tips: service can be a tad slow, so call ahead if you know what you want to order. Bring cash, too, as they don't accept credit cards.Overall, I'm a fan. :)

33.description: Man....  Let me break this down for you.1.  Delicious2.  They remember you.3.  They remember your order if you frequent often.My boyfriend (who eats a TON and is incredibly picky when it comes to good food) freaking loves this place.  Is always talking about Manny like they go wayyyy back lol.  But it's because they remember you, they smile, and they serve up the goods at a decent pace.  Not much for conversation, but hey! it's not a bar people.  And they have a TV, so while I wait, I am entertained.  I dig Morse Gyros! (also, affectionately known in my famnily as "the turkey burger place")- Ra

43.description: Kind of slow on the service and the burger I had here wasn't anything I would go back for.

2.description: I always wonder when I venture into a new city what food I will discover. When it comes to travel you may as well transport my stomache. Parks? Recreation? The sights? Nah, I'm just here for the food usually. I love culture, good coffee and conversation but nothing goes quite as far into a culture as its cuisine.Looking at reviews this seemed to be the neighborhood spot. I was happy to grab a gyros sandwich, fries and a coke. I didn't find anything stellar about my meal. The gyros was neither the tastiest, the tzatziki (how is that spelled exactly? Transliteration fails me) the tangiest or the fries the starch of the gods. Service was authentic. Guys working hard dishing out food to hungry patrons who are obviously locals grabbing a snack at the local spot. I'd eat here at least once a week if I lived here. The cultural melting pot of Chicago adequately displayed in a sandwich. What a country!

18.description: The cheeseburger and gyro sandwiches are very good for the price. You can get a double cheeseburger with French fries for under $6 and a gyro sandwich with French fries for under $7. The reason I gave the three stars is because the workers need to do a better job washing their hands. I have seen the workers take a customers money and then go back to making the food without properly washing their hands (at least 15 seconds with soap). This has to be a health violation or at the very least very unsanitary conditions. I have seen the workers wash their hands more but this can be a turn off for most people. To sum up, Morse Gyros and Chicken is a "blue collar" type of place.Update:05/29/13Someone from Morse Gyros & Chicken contacted me about the matter (handwashing) and he or she is going to look into the matter.

41.description: Not pretty enough for those who frequent Grill Inn but just as good. And a lot cheaper.Standard Chicago burger/hot dog/gyros place for the most part. But it's made well and right in front of you. Really good fried chicken though. The 5 wing deal (smother them in hot sauce) is to die for.Not really the place you want to hang out around. It's at an intersection that seems to attract a lot of loitering. I've seen the owner go off a few times at a few of them. He never seems very happy. But once he see's you come in a few times he loves you.I just noticed they started taking plastic.

52.description: They have standard diner fare, but also broasted chicken. As a former chessehead, I've never seen broasted chicken outside of wisconsin. Broasted is deep fried under pressure, creating moist fried chicken. They also have awesome gyros, they grill the meat as it comes off the spit for that crunch. Excelent prices, like 1/2 chix dinner for under$6. The owner is quiet, but always moving, and the place is clean, though a little worn around the edges. Great carryout situation, as it is right across the street from the Morse El stop.

50.description: Typically delicious, if somewhat greasy gyros, with all the fixings (which were fresh the night I was there), but what distinguishes Morse Gyros from the pack is the tzatziki, which is rich and thick and won't dribble down your arm.  Gyros come with a nice portion of unusually crisp crinkle cut fries, and for under $5.00, it's slightly below the market rate.  For a lighter (and cheaper) option, try the veggie pita:  it's a gyro minus the meat, plus cucumber slices and a healthy slice of feta, dressed with olive oil and oregano - all very fresh, and topped off with tzatiki.

4.description: I've been coming to this location since 1970 - even when we still had Mike's Gyros, which was hand-made daily. Andy had two hard-working kids then and they eventually bought it from him when he started another business on Sheridan and Pratt in Rogers Park- but most importantly, he left his Broaster.There really isn't another place in Rogers Park that offers Broasted Chicken-  except for this little corner restaurant. For so many years, it was worth the 8-minute wait to get a 4-piece chicken dinner with four quarters of broasted potatoes, a cup of cole-slaw and bread and butter. It was crispy on the outside and so moist and tender on the inside. So often when I walked in the door, I could never decide on the Chicken Dinner or the Gyros, so I usually got both.   When Andy left, those two hard workers bought the place and continued the tradition. Though the Kronos Gyros could be had anywhere (and still can), nowhere could you get Broasted Chicken this good, or for such a good price (for years up until the mid-2000;s, it was less than $6.) Finally, Nino bought the others' half and ran it with his line cook, sometimes his wife, and himself, every day save Sunday. Even when the neighborhood soured and went south, the crime rate in the area grew, he stayed with it and finally, Rogers Park came back. Through it all, the chicken remained fantastic. I moved to Streamwood in 1991 and Carpentersville in 1999; I STILL drove into the city 8-10 times a year JUST to get a Broasted Chicken dinner, sometimes as many as 4, put in a Styrofoam container, wrap in a blanket and drive back and still eat a hot, juicy meal. My kids loved it. My wife loved it. Neighbors came to love it. I would park my car nearby, eat a chicken dinner, and take the Red Line to Wrigley Field for a Cub's game. Except for almost always losing the game, it was always a great time.I write this elongated description so you'll understand HOW and WHY I am so disappointed in what has happened to this Rogers Park icon. Nino has retired and sold the "joint"; the new owner: while innovative with some of the new menu choices, use of social media and other option like Grub Hub, physical menus and delivery service, he has destroyed this once proud, beautiful, moist, tender and delicious staple. The chickens he uses are smaller, never fresh, and perhaps for that reason, are overcooked to eradicate any bacteria or to get rid of that "old" taste. (Good chicken should never have an odor).All this means that when we now pay for the $7+ dinner, each piece is hard, the interior is DRY and CHEWEY and some pieces, inedible. In the past 4 years, I've returned dozens of times, hoping to once again find it done right. And I have been disappointed each and every time. The same recipe is used that made it taste so good, but it's like putting lipstick on a pig- or rather a chicken beak. The Gyros is good, but it's the pre-made and frozen Kronos, so as long as it's not overcooked, it's a no-brainer and cookie-cutter food.There isn't a good Broasted Chicken place around Rogers Park- nor is there a good restaurant that sells a good chicken dinner. The least-bad alternative is KFC up on Western & Pratt, but the employees and service are so, so bad and poor there, and the chicken so grease-soaked and un-cared for, I don't recommend going there- ever.If the new owner wants to return this meal back to its previous delicious and high standard, he needs to stop thinking that buying old, cheap, small chicken parts will help him increase his profits; if you sell less of a bad thing, it won't make it profitable. Put the effort back into your place and reap the rewards; you've already lost myself and countless others as customers. Remember you have Mayne Stage just across the street, the Art community on the other side of the EL, and many festivals in the area that would give you a chance to make a positive impact and a memorable meal rather than the stuff you're serving now.Was it, or IS it worth it? And for Gods' sake, Man- you still have that stalwart, perfectly seasoned original Broaster- please sell it to someone that will use it properly instead of letting it produce inferior chunks of dried white wood-like chicken. Please.I miss the good, the REAL stuff so much.Bradley Honig

6.description: I live really close so I don't have an issue going here food is what I expect had the chicken wings and mild sauce with fries. Fired chicken is my weakness so I won't give them a 5 star for it their burger was average

22.description: The cheeseburger and gyro sandwiches are very good for the price. You can get a double cheeseburger with French fries for under $6 and a gyro sandwich with French fries for under $7. The reason I gave the three stars is because the workers need to do a better job washing their hands. I have seen the workers take a customers money and then go back to making the food without properly washing their hands (at least 15 seconds with soap). This has to be a health violation or at the very least very unsanitary conditions. I have seen the workers wash their hands more but this can be a turn off for most people. To sum up, Morse Gyros and Chicken is a "blue collar" type of place.Update:05/29/13Someone from Morse Gyros & Chicken contacted me about the matter (handwashing) and he or she is going to look into the matter.

15.description: We ordered through grub hub for the first time at this place tonight. Normally, there wouldn't be a second time since the tzatziki sauce for the gyro platter was forgotten entirely and the fries that came with my sandwich also did not make an appearance. However...I'm not sure if it was my chicken soup diet from being sick all week, or if my taste buds were catapulted straight into the cosmic heavens by the glorious Italian beef sandwich I received. Can't say much for the gyro because there isn't any more room in my body for food. Husband claims to have enjoyed it sans sauce. Damn you, Morse Gyros. You're like all of the bad decisions I made in my early 20's-knowing I might get screwed but did it again anyway. See you at our next weekend night fat fest...Oh yeah! Free delivery is the bees knees for the folks in your neighborhood!

20.description: I have ordered from here many times for lunch and dinner. The food has always been awesome. I've never had any issues. I ordered a gyro sandwich today, which came with fries, I also ordered a polish and steak tacos. The fries were crispy, and the food came piping hot was very tasty! Would definitely order again! Always very filling. Thanks Guys!

36.description: I'm sort of a gyros connoisseur, been eating them for 25+ years.  And without doubt this is the best in town.  So good that I've never even tried anything else on the menu.  Fries are so-so but come with the gyros, so why not?  The broasted chicken looks sooo good and I hope to try it someday, but I can't stay away from the gyros!!

14.description: Not sure what people are talking about. I love places like this...but when I ate the gyros, it was not good! The sauce tasted a little sour too:( I usually go to Dengeo's and also Hubs for Gyros.

58.description: There's a Starbucks right across the street from and it's immensely pleasurable to treat yourself to a big expensive fancy coffee and go to Armadillo's Pillow and get lost in books. Everything is pretty reasonably priced and the store's interior smells like Nag Champa incense. The sales staff there has always been helpful and friendly, always ready to assist.

56.description: I've always loved this bookshop, and even more now that they doubled their size a few years ago.  The decor is eccentric and interesting.  I think the owners did all the design work themselves, too.  Any time I go there, I find what I'm looking for.  I've even bought baby shower books here.  There's a good selection of everything, and you can always get a question answered.  Drop in and support your neighborhood businesspeople.

29.description: Beautiful, funky store. I didn't buy a book; instead I bought art made by the owner's wife--great collection for sale there.

42.description: Armadillo's Pillow smells a little like incense. But mostly it smells like books. And I'm into that.This place is adorable. It's crowded (as a good bookstore should be). Books on the wall, books on the ceiling, an elevated platform rises from the sea of paperbacks... climb the steps to thumb through fiction titles.The prices are decent. You know those places that sell grimey old books that aren't rare or valuable but the staff tries to pass them off as such? Yeah, that's not what the Armadillo is trying to sell you. The most I've paid for a book here is $6.50 for a hardcover collection of essays. The staff is friendly. (I'm into that too). Down-to-earth friendly, not that Borders-I-hate-this-name-badge-I'm-wearing-hi-how-are-you friendly. I have never left this store empty-handed. Whether I'm in the market for David Sedaris or Gabriel García Márquez, lit mags or feminist rants, religion or nihilism, the Pillow has got my back.

23.description: There's an awesome selection of records here, just so you guys know. I came in looking for light books to read on the train (and I found the same 70s copy of The Bell Jar that got me through high school and beyond), and I left with five or six records. They're not organized, and I personally don't think they're priced very accurately (I paid the same price for singles and full-lengths, regardless of condition/rarity), but it was a lot of fun finding the buried stuff.Also it smells so good. I walk past this place every day on my way home and it definitely draws you in.The staff I've talked to aren't totally "into your needs" or anything. They're sort of distant, but I kind of like the idea that you have to earn their respect.It would be cool if they got more alternative comic books like Daniel Clowes/Craig Thompson stuff.

47.description: I can spend just a few minutes in here browsing a section for something that catches my eye, or I can lose an hour or more taking it slow and enjoying the hunt, looking over each section.  I haven't ever come in looking for something in particular, but I have yet to stop in without coming out with something I didn't know I needed.  Helpful staff that never discourages you from grabbing a seat and relaxing a while.

8.description: The place is neat, which is appreciated by me (most used bookstores, unfortunately, are not).  I stop in once in awhile, but there doesn't seem to be much rotation in the variety of books offered.  It's fine if one just wants a general paperback to read, or some scholarly works.  I like that the place is quiet, and the salespeople don't hound customers.

31.description: I love this place. It's been around since as long as I can remember and I've been living in Rogers Park on and off since I was a kid (I'm 36 now). Just a really cool book store that does a lot with a little space. Cozy, nook-ish (a word?) atmosphere and the owners are great. If you're in the area, check it out!

34.description: This is one of those places book lovers dream about finding!  Its like something out of a story or on a movie...just as you would imagine a bookshop in "The Neverending Story" or somewhere in Diagon Alley from the world of "Harry Potter."  As cheesy as it sounds...this place is magical :)There are books everywhere. From the floor to the cieling, organized but still pleasently dishevled.  There are chairs, sofas, etc for the customer to sit and sample their possible purchases.  The many interesting nicknack and faint smell of insense add charm.The prices can't be beat.  Some books are as low as 50 cents, most seem to be around 5 or 6 dollars....ranging from classics to recent and popular titles!  The doors were left open when I visited, and the owner was ouside gardening.  One of the most refreshing things about Armadillo's Pillow is that the owner/staff allow you to browse as long as you want without interuption or constantly asking "How may I help you?" This is not to say they won't help you if you ask, in fact the owner seemed very frienly!Armadillo's pillow is a little piece of heaven!

16.description: I love this store. It's a shame I don't get up here as often as I did before, but when I lived nearby I was in a ton and took friends- and even a date or two- here. You find so many hidden treasures here it's simply remarkable. Don't go in mind with any expectations on what books you want, but maybe just a type of book- and leave yourself plenty of time.I usually tell my friends that this place is essentially a wizard's home. If there were stairs up in the back to a cauldron and a crystal ball you would find them perfectly in place.

13.description: I love the smell of books and you get a waft of it as you walk by Armadillo's Pillow! No, I didn't walk past it, I went in. The lure of books lining every wall and table is too much to bear!The shelves are sectioned off very nicely and are filled/overflowing with books of all titles, shapes, sizes and authors. It is FANTASTIC! You are certain to find leather bound copies of all your favorite books. I found mine! Look for old and odd titles, speak with the guys that run the place if you can't.Odd looking arm chairs, the sort you see by an old fireplace are placed in convenient locations in the shelves.It is a beautiful little bookstore and they are open every single day of the week. I'll be going back there to scoop up some leather bounds soon!

11.description: I stumbled upon this place in a book, literally. I visited Downtown Books Bought & Sold in Milwaukee and lo and behold there was a bookmark for Armadillo's Pillow!I've been to a few used bookstores in Chicago, but I hadn't heard of this one so  figured this must be an old book shop from bygones. To my surprise the shop was open and open late. We went around 6:30-7 on Saturday and enjoyed exploring the neatly arranged vast array. It's a charming place and a visit can easily be paired with a nice Ethopian dinner at the Diamond down the street. Sounds like the perfect date night to me!

39.description: Stinky incense smelling book store you can get lost in for an hour or so. Feel a little like you're entering a wizard's cave here. Definitely a place to find unusual books and unfashionable authors (but not with any consistency), and its got lots of pokey places to chill- literature up on a  raised dais,  occult feeling front room, and stacks of genre books in the back.  I almost want to give it three stars-the selection could be a little better, and the young owners are never chatty- why is the grumpy condition so endemic to used book store owners?- and they're stacks are frequently all mixed up with piles on the floor and editions sometimes quite ragged. Which is fine, right?  It's what you want int he used bookstore experience. May this place, live on 4EVA!  Why isn't there one of these in every neighborhood?

37.description: Perfection. The staff leaves you alone to browse for as long as you want. The book selection is wonderful, and rotates fairly often. The tchotchkes and knick knacks are super cool, too, so give those a browse after you're done buying the entire bookstore.

0.description: Hidden Treasure.Great place for workshops and small classes.They help you get a book if they don't have it.You can trade in your older books for credit.Owned and operated by a great special couple.

38.description: This is a great neighborhood book store. The staff is helpful, and the place has a quirky, fun vibe to it. They do very fast special orders- and I just love stopping in to browse (they aren't pushy and they make you feel welcome) because the selection on the shelves is so much more unique and interesting than the selection offered at the big-box stores. No big magazine collection here, and no coffee shop... but if you like to read, its worth a trip to RP to check out this great little bookstore!

51.description: This is probably my favorite shop in the city. I love everything about it, from the smell (old paperbacks and Nag Champa) to the prices (cheap!). There's comfy seating, and a large selection considering the size of the store. Near the front, they sell handmade jewelry and knick-knacks as well... I admit to having bought a tiny plastic dinosaur last time I was there.As for the prices, most of the things I've bought have been in the $1 - $4 range, though I have an overwhelming love of paperbacks, so I can't comment on what a hardcover book would cost.If you want some laid-back book browsing in a cozy environment, the Armadillo's Pillow is perfect.

27.description: This place works with what it's author-mama's gave it. I have had nothing but pleasant experiences with the owner, even if  they are unable to find what I am looking for. I recently discovered they do even exchanges here if you're looking to trade for a different book = awesome. This is the best place for cheap books(new and old), and a quiet, intimate, well-organized search for your next read.  I will miss this must-have when I remove myself from Roger's Park at the end of this month for commuting reasons. But as I said before..this place is a must-love, and a must-have. they accept credit card purchases with 10 $ or more, and they are more than willing to email you when they snag something in particular that you are looking for.

32.description: A funky little bookstore. Don't go here looking for a specific book, but go with an open mind and a willingness to look for something that might interest you. The staff are always good for a conversation and there are some odd and interesting finds on the shelves.

54.description: This little bookstore is packed with books and has a lil of everything.  Usually, I came in with the expectation to buy a book or two and came out with several...lol.   There's always well rounded selection in every genre.  The clerk is nice and knowledgeable about books and their authors and has made a great recommendations for me.  :)

48.description: You can find any classic book here for super cheap. I love their selection of used postcards, usually with hysterical messages from people's past- I used to collect them!The staff is super nice, and it's located right by a Starbucks, helping me mix my corporate feelings with my indie roots.

44.description: Reasonably priced books in a unique and petite shop served up by a kind staff. Buy a book and head over to the nearby Starbucks for a rainy day!

24.description: Great bookstore for those who go in there unexpecting a book , I like the mystery in what you will find. They even have some comic books by the window ! Definitely some cool points in my book.

7.description: Ahhhhh I'm super stoked to have found this neighborhood bookstore near my job!! I could literally spend hours browsing and reading in here! Book prices are like 80% lower than the retail value! My 1st visit I got a brand new best seller for $1. The customer service is great!! The place has a bohemian feel! Ample seating that are plush & relaxing! I love it! I donated my change from my first purchase! I'm a life member!

49.description: When you buy a book from Armadillo's Pillow it smells like Nag Champa for the rest of the time you'll have it as noted by everyone else.  They give book marks; they usually have free bin.  Most of their books aren't very expensive, but you'll find some rarities in their stacks that will cost more.  I typically will find a stack of books I never knew about and spend less than $20.  Great First Peoples section.  Interesting sub-genres; usually a dog.  Skulls and knick-nacks by the register.  Armadillo's Pillow always has cool books in the window that will suck you in.  Very quiet and cozy.  You might not find what you are looking for but you are sure to find something great.

40.description: Went on Tuesday night to watch open mic, vey nice little independent bookstore, lots of art and jewelry in the store, much of it made by the owner I think. Their selection of books is impressive and prices super reasonable. The music was good, but some of it was a bit too depressing. I will return to browse book and hear more tunes.

53.description: Luckily, books don't retain incense smell the same way they retain cigar smoke, otherwise I couldn't recommend this place.Pretty good collection of books, especially for a somewhat neglected neighborhood. Prices are fair; I wish they were more negotiable, because it's hard for me to imagine some of those books selling in that location.

30.description: One of my favorite places to spend an hour on an otherwise boring afternoon. Wide selection of books in just about all topics; you never know what you'll find just wandering around. Very well organized, which can be a problem at many used book stores. And the prices are sub-Amazonian. Only problem: parking in the neighborhood can be a hassle depending on the time of day, so be prepared to look around a bit for a spot.

46.description: The cozy atmosphere will reel you in, the prices are reasonable, the staff - all friendly. There's not a whole lot to dislike about this place. I could probably hang out for a couple hours in a cubby reading and potentially buying. It's a small store, but the interior is so unique, you'll feel right at home.

1.description: I bought my first Star Wars book from them, Shadows of the Empire. If you love incense and books, little collectibles, charms.... Please visit!!This place is a rare Gem in the neighborhood of Rogers Park. A perfect place to take a date. Perfect place to plan a day.Buy a book, go grab a bite to eat close by and head to the beach for a nice read.No money? Sometimes a freebie box is in front :)

55.description: If given the choice between any Border's or Barnes and Nobel and Armadillo's Pillow, I'd choose the latter every time! A fantastic selection of low priced used books, paired with a cozy, almost bohemian atmosphere and, of course, lots of big comfy seating, make this hole in the wall a wonderful place to hang out.

9.description: I felt like I was in the library at  Sunnydale High, with the addition of incense and cushy ottomans. Which is a huge compliment. Every wall is lined with shelves overflowing with books. Books stacked on the floor because there's no more room anywhere else. Books stacked on books stacked on books. So awesome. There's interesting art all over the place.... paintings, posters, sculptures, masks...All sections are clearly marked and pretty much arranged by author. I came in to aimlessly browse and was very pleased; however I could understand coming in for a specific title and being confused or irritated at the chaos. It's not Borders. On the plus side of "not being Borders"...every book I looked at was between $4 and $9. I even spotted a few autographed copies so if you see an old favorite, check inside just in case. :)

26.description: They've got little clay face sculptures all over the place in here.  It's convenient how they've put old wooden furniture all around the store so that you can take a load off while you're browsing.  Their prices are really reasonable - I found some James Joyce for only $2.  The store has a good amount of breathing room, in case you're claustrophobic, and it's pretty well organized.

25.description: Unique, antique, boutique of used books. Very cool place to grab a book or couple on your way to the beach or to save yourself from a boring day :)

12.description: I wanted to get a good beach read and remembered passing Armadillo's Pillow a few times before.  I rode my bike and survived the combat zone traffic on Sheridan and finally arrived.  Instant Ahhhhh.  This place is so groovy/hippie/60's/70's relaxed.  The owner couldn't have been nicer and didn't even laugh at me when I said I wanted a beachy chick book for the afternoon.  Although there isn't a specific section for beachy chick books, he asked me about some of my favorite fiction authors and sent me in the right direction.  The books are very well organized and the selection is great.  The books also seem to be in really good condition.  The place feels kind of magical with it's velvet curtains, funky colors and beaded chimes hanging about.  It's the kind of place you could curl up in for hours on a rainy afternoon, or just run in for the right book on a sunny one.    Either way, I'll be back.

59.description: Armadillow's Pillow is a 2nd hand book shop which has a cozy style and charm.  I have a new appreciation for this place, having just visited a much much bigger 2nd hand book place that felt like some guy's organized attic, in a really distracting way.  In Armadillow's Pillow I felt comfortable enough to really think about the various books, to read a paragraph or two, and make some choices.  I was usually very pleased with the book prices too.  I'll be back.  Parking in this area is an issue, so ideally you could try the train or coming during non-peak hrs.

21.description: I love this book store.  Very comfortable and groovy.

17.description: This is where you should go for the ultimate used bookstore experience.From the outside it's a small, unassuming storefront on sunny Sheridan, beside a legendary music store (Flatts and Sharpe), across from the old 400 theater that is now the New 400 Theater.It's Roger's Park and it's rockin' out.The Armadillo's Pillow has some distinct advantages over classic used bookstores.1. Air flow!! They keep the front door open and the back door open to keep the air fresh and the patrons breathing. No oppressive miasma here.2. A lack of funk / dust / animal spoors. The air flow I mentioned above helps disperse the natural musty odor of older books. While I'm sure it also helps with dust accumulation, there must someone taking time to wipe down shelves and dust off stacks, because this place is well-kept. Also, no 40 cats lounging around, turning the shelves into their own private scratching post/bathroom nor driving me away with their hateful histamine-enraging dander.3. The shelves/stacks are clearly marked and almost completely alphabetical. This almost never happens in used bookstores. It's inevitable that you get one or the other. You either get clearly-demarcated areas of interest and the books are a crazy mishmash, or you get an alphabetical line-up but no indication of what genre you are looking at.4. Staff interaction by request, not by force. After a greeting, the staff will let you browse and wander the stacks to your heart's content. They don't follow you around demanding to know exactly what you are looking for or offering you random books they want to get rid of. No pestering, but plenty of knowledge on hand should you need them.5. Low prices, high satisfaction. Ok, I get that the used book market is a wildly variable one and that profit is never guaranteed. But that being said, if I'm finding books that are 1) more expensive than their original prices and 2) not rare in any sense, I think the used bookstore concept is failing. The Armadillo's Pillow has pricing down pat. The books were approximately 1/8th to 1/2 the list price on average. Though I left with a mighty stack of books ranging from "Algebra For Idiots!" to an obscure Robert Heinlein pulp novel from the 1960s, I did not feel overcharged in the slightest.6. There are chairs, couches, benches and spots to sit all over the place. You + your curiosity about a book + abundant furniture = a likely sale! They get this. They get what the whole experience of being a bibliophile is about and try to create a comfortable nest for us.And that's why they're my favorite used bookstore in Chicago.

10.description: Very cute bookstore with great selection. Love the vibe. Sometimes smells too strongly of incense.

5.description: I am in here often, buying sci fi paperbacks for around two bucks a pop. The place is always getting new stuff, which makes it easy to keep coming in. The owners are super cool, and they make these awesome framed faces that hang on the walls--you can buy them, which I have (I think we have about eight now, and, considering those and the amount of paper my gal and I have hauled to our place across the street from this joint, I have christened our apartment the Armadillo's Pillow Northwest Annex). The incense smell is pleasant. It's not overpowering, as other reviews may lead you to believe. This is by far the best bookstore I've been to in Chicago, and I've been to a good many. Spend twenty bucks and read for a month.

3.description: I don't get the chance to visit this place as often as I would like to but whenever I'm in the area I almost always demand that my friends and I stop in there because the place feels absolutely magical.  Love the friendly staff, love how home-y the store feels, and I love their selection of books which seems to rotate on a pretty ergular basis.

35.description: Cheap books. I will be a frequent visitor.

19.description: There's an awesome selection of records here, just so you guys know. I came in looking for light books to read on the train (and I found the same 70s copy of The Bell Jar that got me through high school and beyond), and I left with five or six records. They're not organized, and I personally don't think they're priced very accurately (I paid the same price for singles and full-lengths, regardless of condition/rarity), but it was a lot of fun finding the buried stuff.Also it smells so good. I walk past this place every day on my way home and it definitely draws you in.The staff I've talked to aren't totally "into your needs" or anything. They're sort of distant, but I kind of like the idea that you have to earn their respect.It would be cool if they got more alternative comic books like Daniel Clowes/Craig Thompson stuff.

28.description: This is a great neighborhood used bookstore, and one I go to as often as possible.  The decor is funky eclectic and works for me.  The store itself is moderately spacious, consisting of three separate reading rooms.  The selection is very good, although the fiction/literature section is probably the most developed, along with the sci-fi section.  Still, I have made some great finds in the anthropology and history sections, and the Armadillo's Pillow's collection overall seems pretty well-rounded.  Comfortable seating and a cozy setting encourage you to sit, read, and take your time in making a sound book purchase.  The store's prices are definitely good and definitely worth the visit.  This is a great independent bookstore.

45.description: This is one of those places that you can wander into and lose an hour if you're not careful. It smells of light incense and old books, there are so many things to stare at it's hard to get bored. You can sit, relax and time travel via old books. The prices are reasonable and the people are too. This is the type of place that makes Rogers Park, Rogers Park.

33.description: You REALLY have to want to go to this store to go here. Unless you go to Loyola, you are making quite a pilgrimage north in the city to this little bookstore. And it's a cool little shop...but very much like many used bookstores I have been in my life. A lot of them tend to blend after a while. There's the incense! The weird art on the walls! The strange global music! The uncommunicative clerk!The collection does seem to be chosen with a good eye. Overall, if you're in the area this may be a good spot for you to frequent, but I don't think it will warrant me making frequent trips from my home.

43.description: I have never walked out of this store without buying a book.  They have a great selection of books in great condition with really reasonable prices.  You instantly feel relaxed walking in, it feels very homey and welcoming, plus, they sell plastic dinos at the register for .25 cents!They also have some pretty cool artwork.  We have one the Gathering Crowd faces in our house it's great, very quirky and slightly disapproving.  This place is a true gem and perfect for browsing before catching a movie at the New 400

2.description: Very nice, independent bookstore filled with many used and hard to find books. Located 5 minute walk off the Loyola stop, this is a great place to spend a lot of time browsing for your next good read!  There are a few small rooms that each contain different types of books from fiction, non fiction, classics, sci-fi, you name it! It's best to come here without a title or author in mind as this place allows you to further explore your interests when it comes to reading. You can test drive any book you want as there is a good amount of comfortable seating to relax in.  The prices are fairly reasonable as the books are used, although some books I found in the non fiction area were very outdated and some weren't in the best condition. If you have an open mind and enjoy browsing without being bothered, this is a great local business to support. This is truly a 'book purists' paradise.

18.description: Felt kinda of dumb being at this store...lots of books for "smart" people.  It's small but is jampacked with stuff.  Great place to browse.  Great decor and atmosphere.

41.description: Its a decent book store and worth exploring.  Try and stop in before a movie at the 400 theater.

52.description: I moved into the area back in June and have been less than impressed with the number businesses around us. Sure, we have a Starbucks, Chipotle, and CVS but that's about it. No real stores. Honestly, the area is a bit weird.Anyway, I'd seen this place from across the street a few times when taking my little one out on a walk by the lake, but I'd never ventured down to check it out.Yesterday my friend and I taking my son on a walk to the lake when we decided to check it out. It sure doesn't look like much from across the street, but when we walked by and looked in the door...WOW! It was my kind of place!Books from floor to ceiling..knick knacks, incense. I'm in love. =) Hard to navigate w/ a huge stroller so I'll be going back sometime soon w/o my little guy, but I will definitely be back!Also, I'm wondering if they buy used books...I would assume so, but forgot to ask. Anyone know?

50.description: I sat here for a few minutes, trying to think of why I should only give this place 4 stars... and I couldn't really find one. Sure, it's not as big as someplace like Myopic, but it's not in Hipster Park. So I'll call that a tossup. Yeah, it smells like incense, but it also smells like a bookstore. Good selection, broken up by genre and pretty well alphabetized. Prices, while not "cheap," necessarily, are pretty reasonable. I see a lot of paperbacks in the $2-8 range, and I can always find at least a couple I'm willing to drop a few bucks on. Plus, they have assorted trinkets and gewgaws, and if you're lucky a big ol dog wanting to say hello.I seem to remember hearing the lady tell a girl coming up to check out that they do take cards, but a $10 minimum...

4.description: The employees here are great, the selection is great, has a very quaint and comfy feel to it. I've been here a few times and have found great hardcover classics for no more than $7.50! This is definitely my go to spot for used books!

6.description: The perfect piled high kind of bookstore.My favorite place to drop off books, get a store credit and pick out some new ones.

22.description: This place is a bit too hippy-ish for me. However, this is a nice bookstore. I didn't have much time to peruse when I was there, but one thing I noticed is that it didn't smell musty at all.

15.description: You REALLY have to want to go to this store to go here. Unless you go to Loyola, you are making quite a pilgrimage north in the city to this little bookstore. And it's a cool little shop...but very much like many used bookstores I have been in my life. A lot of them tend to blend after a while. There's the incense! The weird art on the walls! The strange global music! The uncommunicative clerk!The collection does seem to be chosen with a good eye. Overall, if you're in the area this may be a good spot for you to frequent, but I don't think it will warrant me making frequent trips from my home.

57.description: Probably one of my favorite places in RP. They don't have a lot of books but they make up for it with a little bit of everything and cheap prices. The staff is super friendly. I don't know if they still do this but they used to have a book buying program and you could bring in second hand books for store credit. I love that! You might want to call them first to make sure because you could only do that on certain days when the manager was in.

20.description: Great prices and atmosphere.

36.description: This is where you should go for the ultimate used bookstore experience.From the outside it's a small, unassuming storefront on sunny Sheridan, beside a legendary music store (Flatts and Sharpe), across from the old 400 theater that is now the New 400 Theater.It's Roger's Park and it's rockin' out.The Armadillo's Pillow has some distinct advantages over classic used bookstores.1. Air flow!! They keep the front door open and the back door open to keep the air fresh and the patrons breathing. No oppressive miasma here.2. A lack of funk / dust / animal spoors. The air flow I mentioned above helps disperse the natural musty odor of older books. While I'm sure it also helps with dust accumulation, there must someone taking time to wipe down shelves and dust off stacks, because this place is well-kept. Also, no 40 cats lounging around, turning the shelves into their own private scratching post/bathroom nor driving me away with their hateful histamine-enraging dander.3. The shelves/stacks are clearly marked and almost completely alphabetical. This almost never happens in used bookstores. It's inevitable that you get one or the other. You either get clearly-demarcated areas of interest and the books are a crazy mishmash, or you get an alphabetical line-up but no indication of what genre you are looking at.4. Staff interaction by request, not by force. After a greeting, the staff will let you browse and wander the stacks to your heart's content. They don't follow you around demanding to know exactly what you are looking for or offering you random books they want to get rid of. No pestering, but plenty of knowledge on hand should you need them.5. Low prices, high satisfaction. Ok, I get that the used book market is a wildly variable one and that profit is never guaranteed. But that being said, if I'm finding books that are 1) more expensive than their original prices and 2) not rare in any sense, I think the used bookstore concept is failing. The Armadillo's Pillow has pricing down pat. The books were approximately 1/8th to 1/2 the list price on average. Though I left with a mighty stack of books ranging from "Algebra For Idiots!" to an obscure Robert Heinlein pulp novel from the 1960s, I did not feel overcharged in the slightest.6. There are chairs, couches, benches and spots to sit all over the place. You + your curiosity about a book + abundant furniture = a likely sale! They get this. They get what the whole experience of being a bibliophile is about and try to create a comfortable nest for us.And that's why they're my favorite used bookstore in Chicago.

14.description: I got all hyped up to go, because the hype on the internet over this place, and it fell short. My biggest turn off, the fact that every book is covered in a layer of nasty stickiness. Like the incense has solidified onto the books in the store and gets all over your fingers and clothes. It was so stuffy and nasty in there I actually wheezed and my eyes were irritated. I am asthmatic, but not sensitive or allergic to anything but humidity and hay! It was a surprise to say the least.The book selection was also disappointing. Yes, there are tons of books, but alot of the same books serve as filler. I am really happy for all the people who have found something magical in this local place but it just didn't happen for me.

58.description: After hearing good about this place from a friend in the city.I figured I give them a try. The store is kind of walking into a place my parents would go to back in the 60's  retro vintage but with the latest styles the big places have. You can tell they been there for yearsThey have a wide selection and I was looking for a living room set and bedroom set.Terry a well season sale guy took care of me and I let him know I only had $2000 to work with, so if you want my money, cut me a dealSo after looking at the selections and some good ole bartering I got me a 5 piece leather sectional, a bed, Mattress and chest of drawers with delivery for my 2G'sDelivery worked out well and they assembled what needed to be all within a hr.All worked out fine and I would highly recommend them.Kinda confused about the bad reviews but you have to remember most people with good experiences don't write reviews, So I have to give them some justice.

56.description: I felt like I was walking into a boys' club here. I thought the sales people were condescending and felt like I was treated very differently than the men in the store. At one point the sale person asked, 'how are you doing, do you have any questions?' and which he then turned to me and said, 'not you, honey, this guy, i'm talking to this guy'. I felt powerless because the furniture was cheap and I need furniture ASAP so I had to deal with them. So I put up with their sh*t and when I asked if the delivery guys could call me w/ a 30 min heads up they just said 'no' and hung up on me....wtf.

29.description: So after looking at *many* sofas and sectionals on their website that were under $500, we decided to go there to purchase one for my son's new apartment.  Get there and the only sectional under $500 was a very poorly made piece with terrible upholstery.  Realizing that organizing my son, his girlfriend and myself at the same place at the same time was tricky, I decided to up our budget and get the best least expensive sectional they had.  Deliver was an additional $75 so out the door we were over $700.  Delivery day arrives, and somehow this very modest sized sectional (smallest one on the sales floor) "doesn't fit" up the stairwell to the 2nd floor.  Really?  But!  Never fear! For an additional $100 they will move it in through the window. When we wanted them to return it to the store to figure out what our next best step was, we were told; a) there would be another fee to return it to the store, and b) there would be a 20% stocking fee for a return.  WTH??  So our "discount" sofa ended up costing my kids nearly $800.  My advice is to forget the "discount" store and go to IKEA or Dania for a quality made sofa at an HONEST price.

42.description: Do NOT purchase furniture from this place.  I purchased a dining set, and a piece from one of the chairs was defective.  I called and requested a new piece be sent to me and was told to email them pictures of the receipt and the chair because, according to Mike, "He is not a mind reader, and how is he supposed to know that I really bought it."  I emailed him this information, twice, and finally heard from him that the part came in.  He said I should pick it up.  I explained to him that I live an hour away and the next few weeks were going to be extremely busy.  I honestly had no time to drive out there. I asked if he could ship it to me.  Mike said he didn't have a Fedex or UPS account and just because I didn't have time, shouldn't mean he should have to go out of his way.  He also suggested that I was lying about not having time to come in.  I wasn't lying but shouldn't have to explain this to him. Even if I did have the time, it would have been nice for them to just ship it to me anyway.  He also suggested that I broke it when putting the chair together, but it's clear from the pictures that I sent him, that was not the case. Their furniture is just cheap.  We ended the conversation with him hanging up on me and telling me that has the part there.  He'll see what he can do.  Not really sure how this place stays in business.  I'm really regretting that I didn't read these reviews earlier.  Also, Mike, don't call women over the age of 12 a "sweetheart."  It just makes you sound like even more of a d-bag towards women.

23.description: These guys define the word shysters.  I had gone to them off and on for many years - buying various items from bed frames to inexpensive couches - always with the full understanding that what might come in the box may have a ding here and there.  But in general, they were reliable and inexpensive and I knew I was getting what I paid for. However, over the years, perhaps as their business has gotten worse, so did they.  The last straw was them selling us something different than what we ordered and when they delivered it and we realized this item did not fit - they would not take it back (after a verbal commitment of doing so when we purchased the item).  The manager - always the biggest schmoozer when I was in the store - suddenly turned on me and swore at me on the phone.  It was bad enough for me to call the Better Business Bureau where I found out I was far from the first person to do so.  Buyer beware.

47.description: I had been in the market to replace some furniture that my dogs totally trashed.  I needed a couch and love seat or a couch and an oversized chair or a sectional...you get the idea.  I did not want to spend a lot of money.  Biggest mistake I made was allowing my dogs on my furiture in the first place and now trying to backtrack is proving very difficult.  So on to my task of finding affordable furniture, that if the dogs scuff up, I am not going to be too upset.  I have lived about a mile from Marjen pretty much my whole life.  I had never been there before but thought given the issue with the dogs I would give it a try.  I looked on their website  and saw a few things that I liked and decided to go in to their shop see them for myself.  The salesman that helped me was very nice and very helpful.  One of the pieces that I had seen on the website was a special order and they didnt have a sample on the floor.  Oddly enough, they quoted me a higher price on it than was on their website.  Whatever, I wasnt going to go with something I could not actaully see a sample of anyway.  So I saw a sectional that I really liked and it was a really great price.  It was made of a leather blend which is what kept the price down.  Perfect for my lifestyle with the dogs.  I also chose an area rug that they had displayed, too.   The prices are really good.  The salesman asked if I even wanted my delivery that day.  I said no can do, needed to take care of a few things in the house still and we decided on delivery the following day between noon and three pm.  Fast forward to the next day.  I was still doing some spring cleaning and deep cleaning the hardwood floors was one of those long overdue tasks that needed to be done before my delivery.  In the morning someone from store called to confirm my delivery for between noon and three.  I said perfect and confirmed that I  would be here.  Well, around 10:30am the delivery guys arrive at my house.  I was right in the middle of washing the floors and this needed to be done prior to my deliver.  The drivers showed me the paperwork that even said delivery from noon-three.  So I call over at the store and the rudest guy answered the phone.  His voice totally sounded like one of the guys that I was speaking with the day before when I went in to make my purchase.  He could not seem to get it into his head that I was specifically promised that window of time for delivery.  Just really rude.  I get the picture.  When you are in the store planning to spend money, then the level of customer service is expected to be different than after you have made a FINAL sale.  Then who cares, they got your money already.Whatever, they came back later in the day, I got the sectional that I purchased and am very happy with it.  I just would suggest people use caution when purchasing from here.  From the rest of the reviews I think that if you are not careful you can get burned by them.  But their prices are VERY reasonable and as the saying goes,  you get what you pay for, right?

8.description: Happy that our order arrived today without issue and the furniture was set up efficiently by the crew.  Sales team communicated well with us.  Order was a few days late which is was the only minor complaint,.

31.description: Great prices, good selection. Salesman was friendly and not too pushy. The furniture was delivered and assembled as promised by polite guys.

34.description: I've bought furniture from Marjen on two occasions.  They discounted their already very reasonable prices for me.  They were friendly courteous and helpful.  I don't understand some of the bad reviews... I'm pretty laid back... I think if you are an uptight ahole, they'll treat you like one, clearly because you deserve it.  If that's how you operate, then shop elsewhere.  I highly recommend them.   The guys who delivered my furniture both times were awesome, friendly and appreciative.  They went above and beyond what I would expect.

16.description: Very poor customer service. I spent $600 on a bed frame and was told it would take 3 weeks to get in (which is already insane). around the three week mark I called to find out what was going on, the man said "idk I'm not taking care of that order, call back Saturday and ask for so and so" ....it was a Wednesday. How ridiculous! I called again a little over a week later  trying to figure out why my bedframe is taking so long and the guy tells me that he "forgot his crystal ball at home" was out of stock so its taking . If  somethings out of stock wouldn't you ask the customer if they want to reselect or wait for the bed to come back in stock?? Or if its taking a lot  longer than expected wouldn't a courtesy call be appropriate? I hate to be treated like I don't matter after I have given  them my money.

13.description: Quick notes on furniture shopping: Very bulky and old-school style of sofas and beds. As everyone else has shared, it's hard to even walk around the small store with how much they have packed in there.

11.description: Although the price is somewhat on the lower side of what you will find in Chicago, I would advise for everyone to avoid ordering from this place. The small savings in $$ is not worth the compromise in quality and having to deal with stubborn owners, who run it like a pawn shop. After initially getting paid, they are tough to chase around in order to get your order complete.I was looking to purchase a bedroom set for my second bedroom as well as an entertainment unit. After initially promising us a deliver within 2 weeks, the final delivery took over 23 days. And that too after repeated phone call reminders. After all that the arrogant attitude of the owners put me off as well. The furniture itself is of sub par quality. If you are tight on the budget, you have equivalent options with much better experience in Ashley, the Dump and Value City.

39.description: Marjen of Chicago was recently featured on WGN Television in their "Bring It Home" Series. Marjen of Chicago was honored to be chosen over all other Chicago furniture stores due to our commitment of customer service, low prices, and top quality discount factory direct furniture.I almost choked with laughter when I read this "quote" on their webpage.  This is the most horrible company to deal with as to customer service!  I purchased a matress last September 2nd.  When the mattress was delivered, there was only 1 person shifting the full-sized mattress through my condo and up my stairs to the bedroom.  He was very nice, but he damaged the weatherstrip on my inside front door.  When I complained about it, they told me to take a picture of it and "submit it" so they could see it.  I took almost 7 pictures, e-mailed it to them, followed up and they kept putting me off.  I assume that they think I will just give up!  What a bunch of hustlers.  Yes, their prices are good, but they do not understand the concept of customer service.  My advice is to stay clear of this company - I certainly will!

37.description: Pros: The guys who work here let you roam freely until you make it clear that you want help or are ready to purchase ( though they must have been keeping and eye on us bc they knew what furniture we wanted).  Delivered within stated time frame (this is important bc we'd ordered a month prior and had minimal interaction otherwise...just a phone call the week of).Saved hundreds on the Ashley furniture we'd been eyeing elsewhere. ($2400 for a headboard, 5 piece dining set, couch, coffee/end table set, large tv stand, entry table).On delivery day, they set everything up as promised.Cons: Small dent and a few scratches in our wood floors after they set-up. The dent def came from the tv stand.The coffee table and end table had tiny scratches that were obvious in bright sunlight later in the day (weren't obvious right after set-up or I would have said something). nothing obvious unless you are looking for it and would have happened eventually anyway with use, but I prefer new furniture look brand new.Overall I highly recommend them. They won't coddle you, but you get pretty decent furniture for the price!!

0.description: QUALITY FURNITURE & GREAT PRICING!!! Here's my story. I'm new to the area and was looking for a red leather sofa. I'd driven past this place many, many times & dismissed it as just a junky neighborhood store ... that is, until I saw them on Check Please! I figured if this place is good enough to make it on that show, then it certainly deserved a look-see! Went in ... nearly lost my mind...  and two months later ... I'm in love with my beautiful red leather Ashley sofa (which I got at a non-Ashley price! :-). Very pleased, and now I'm going back for other accessories. Stop in. Ask for Ron. You won't be sorry - this place is worth the trip!

38.description: Unfortunately, I wanted to like this place, but my experience here could have been much better.I bought a brody couch here,   they told me oh we don't have that color, but we can order it and it should be here in 10 days...  now this was december 21,  so i wanted to get this before new years as we were having guests..   which was like fine cause 10 days it would make it...after a week, no response from them (remember i paid full price with shipping)  then they tell me it wont make it on time for shipping as it seems they go south once a week, so you have to make it before the day they ship otherwise it will have to wait another week. anyways,  before new years they finally received it, and since they refused to ship it i had to go and get it so i can get it before the new year.    however its missing the chase...(missing a part of the furniture, which makes you wonder why would they only have part of the couch?!?!?!)    and they said it should be coming next week...   (Jan 4 comes around and still no calls...  i had to call them back and ask where is my chase,  they said oh its coming, 3 more days...   this happens from Dec 21 all the way to Jan 16th yesterday)  here i am furious that I am still missing part of the couch, and all i ask was for them to ship me the last piece and give me a refund on shipping since they are so late, (and them not being forth right on when i should be expecting the couch,  had they told me it wont show up for 4 weeks, then i wouldnt have to call every week.  but at the end,  they refused to help me out.   On top of not helping me out,  I have worked with them for like 3 weeks trying to get my last piece, i come in and didn't have my receipt, and then the manager started muddering on how I should have my receipt, and how I should have this, and how I'm not responsible, and all this crap, essentially telling me that I screwed up for not having a receipt...  really?  like....  considering in our new world of internet and computers, most places can look up my receipt by credit card/name, etc.  he almost didnt want to give me a refund on shipping, even though I was the one who picked up my couch, and on top of that they didnt even give it to me on time.   Essentially forcing me to write this review...    the prices here are not that great,   its better than most,  so definitely use their advertisement to talk price with other locations..,  i would use these guys price and go to DAZ furniture direct and see if you can get them to match the price and maybe get a better deal,  or vice versa,     I am essentially going to be using these guys prices, and going any where else to see if they will match...  cause these guys dont want my money, and also if you buy from them,  please get them to give you a delivery date  on the receipt so that if it passes that delivery date, ask for a refund.   this way,  you dont wait a month to get your furniture and you have an out clause.i hope this helps!PS,  I went to another place called Furniture Outlet Inc. located at Bucktown,  I recommend getting it from them,  they told me they will have it sent on tuesday, and guess what, they sent it by tuesday.    and their driver scratched a chair, and they plan on replacing it without an issue.   now that is what I call better service.   please avoid Marjen,   and go to Furniture Outlet,  its much better and the price is just as good.

51.description: First I'd like to start out by saying that I was a repeat customer.  Emphasis on the word "was."  After Monday, never again.I bought a desk from Marjen and unfortunately there were issues in regards to if I even received the right desk.  I was told by the initial salesmen who sold me the desk to take "pictures" of the desk and bring them in so we could work towards a possible exchange.  Since I hadn't assembled the desk I took pictures of the desk that was on the front of the box.  Upon bringing the pictures, I was then told by the owner that they needed pictures of the PARTS.  Then I was berated about not bringing in the desk.  I explained to him that when I picked up the boxed desk I had a rental car and his response was that he could "care less" if I didn't have a car, that I should have brought it back in.  I was under the impression by the initial salesman that when my replacement desk was delivered that the boxed desk would be retrieved.  Begin the broken record of "Why didn't you bring it in?" "I don't have a car." "Why didn't you bring it in?" "I don't have a car." for about five minutes with the volume escalating until he threw me out of the store stating that he "does not deal with nutcases."  The initial salesman was trying to keep everything together and the situation calm but to no avail.  He was still trying to work with me as I was being mocked by the owner and tossed out the door, so kudos to him.The verbal abuse seems to be this place's modus operandi.  Name calling, obscenities and intimidation is how business is done after they have your money due to their "no exchanges/no refund" policy.  Do yourself a favor, dear Yelper, and read the filtered reviews.  I have already filed a complaint with both the Better Business Bureau and the City of Chicago.  I don't even care about getting the right desk or even my money back anymore; the unassembled desk is still boxed up and sitting in my storage unit as I decide what I to do with it.  I just want to save shoppers and the community from dealing with this business.  As a very active supporter of small businesses and someone who tends to avoid most big box retailers and national corporate chains in favor of supporting her local economy, it is very disappointing to see this wretched excuse of a store on the same street as the many wonderful small businesses along Devon.  I also intend to write letters to the alderman and local chamber of commerce in regards to these business practices and how they hurt the community.  They need be made aware of these abusive members in their community.  Spread the word: I certainly intend to.  Marjen has messed with the wrong "nutcase."

27.description: They overcharged me for my couch. I called several times to ask why the internet price was not the same as in store. No one would answer and never refunded me the difference. Couch delivered on time though. Delivery charges vary depending on when you call. I called 3 times for a quote for Lincoln park and received 3 different quotes ( 75, 85, 80) all lower than the $100 they charged me. Will be my last time dealing with them.

32.description: Could have been that I'm female.   Or that the new sales guy, Mike K. was mouthy and annoying.  Or that the first table set I bought was defective. But we have had good experiences with Marjen over the years, and I understand such things, so  I brought the defective table set back to the shop.  At first, Mike told me I damaged it putting it together.  Then he told me there are no refunds at that store.  Incredulous, I said I just bought it an hour ago!  He was giving me a hard time so I found another set and paid more for it.  Mike told me for all my trouble he was giving me a big discount for the store model and not charging me the normal $5 assembly charge for each piece equaling $25.  When I got home, I went online to the Marjen site and found that Mike charged me $25 more than their normal price!   When I called him back he first denied knowing who I was.  When I asked him about the price, he told me he had no idea what the price was, even though I watched him go online at the store for it.   He refused to tell me who the owner was, and when I told him this was bad business, he told me I knew nothing about the furniture business and was being abusive to him.  I think Marjen is a good store but a dishonest sales person is going to run off good customers.

54.description: Horrible place.  I needed a mattress quickly, bought it and when I got it home noticed that there was a label saying "This is a refurbished mattress".  Yuck - haven't they heard of bedbugs?!  I took it right back , told them I wanted to return it, and they said  "Oh, the guy made a mistake.  We'll get you a new one".  No thanks!

48.description: I have ALWAYS bought furniture from here as it is ggod quality and its well priced. However that being said customer service counts for a lot and that is where this business suffers. I put a deposit down on a sofa that I was assurred was on sale for the lowest price they have ever had. A week later I saw it on their website for 100.00 less.
