I called in and the sales person (paul) tried to offer me  50.. store credit, and that was after some negotiating. I asked him could I at least get the full 100.oo store credit and I would buy the matching ottoman. He refused and when I asked for the owners information he claimed the owners hadnt been in the store for 20 years and he didnt have their information. He also claimed that the manager had to make the call on the 100.00 credit and that i'd have to call back as managers are only in the store on saturdays.... I couldnbt understand how he was authorized to offer me 50.00 but not 100.00. In the scheme of things and from a customer standpoint 100.00 sc is nothing compared to the business they do and have done with me. Paul also hung up on me and I ended up speaking with another Paul as the first one would not get back on the phone. I am appauled at the rude treatment and my next stop is bbb.org!

44.description: Before entering Marjen's I was made aware of the less-than-stellar reviews by my boyfriend.  He and I made the trip in search of furniture for multiple rooms, and could not have been more pleased with the experience.  We took our time deciding what we wanted, and with the low prices a majority of it was in our price range.  We found Grant both helpful and willing to work with us on the price because we were buying so much.  All of our purchases were in the warehouse and therefore available to be delivered as soon as possible.  They were delivered the next day and assembled relatively quickly.  No complaints from us with the entire transaction.What I will say, however, is that as previously mentioned, I was shopping with my boyfriend, who happens to be a former college football player.  Because of the fact that a majority of the poor reviews were written by women, I cannot help but think that there is a chance his presence may have had something to do with my pleasurable experience.

24.description: Needed to replace furniture after my daughter moved out and my old furniture went with her! Found the website when looking for bedroom furniture online. When I got to the store I was hesitant about going in because it doesn't look like much from the outside, but I'm really glad I did!  They had the nightstand on display so I could see the finish and the quality and I fell in love with it! It was exactly what I was looking for and even nicer looking in person.  The quality was very good and the price was even better!I was assisted by Grant Messer who turned out to be a wonderful help with my purchase and when I decided to look at more furniture, he was extremely helpful.  They carry a variety of manufactures and have catalogues with lots of choices which made my shopping experience a great one.  I ended up with living and dining room furniture as well and am totally happy with my purchases.The delivery guys are just awesome.  Very careful not to make a mess or scratch my floors and handled my furniture with care while they assembled it.  I have and will continue to refer friends and family looking for good furniture at a good price!

7.description: Old school furniture, but it's quite cheap and gets the job done if you're on a budget! I managed to furnish my entire place with the following:-Dresser with attached mirror-Stand alone mirror-Bed frame with headboard-Mattress -Two nightstands-Coffee table-Love seat, sofa, recliner-Real marble dining table with four chairsEverything included (taxes, shipping, assembly, etc.)...it was just around five thousand dollars. If you go to places like Art Van, The RoomPlace, etc., just getting an entire bedroom set can set you back about four grand. Prices are low because most of their furniture is not on display and they don't offer financing. The delivery can take a while sometimes, but they do keep their word. So far all the furniture is holding up well and I've saved thousands of dollars by shopping here!

49.description: After reading such bad reviews of this place, I was ready. I had my lawyer face on, the BBB on speed dial, and Katie Couric in the van ready to give me a tear-filled exclusive interview. You know what happened? I bought a desk. The thing with this place is that you just need to know your price point, and what you're coming in there to buy. There is nothing else to negotiate or hard sell. The sales guys are not your average run up behind you and tell you your farts smell like roses kind of guys. They are simply there to sell furniture. If you want a discussion about the nuclear consequences of Chernobyl, you're in the wrong place. The desk was of nice quality, within my price range, and I walked right out of there with it. The assembly instructions were clear and to the point. Star taken off because I wanted to haggle--they weren't having it. Eh...I'll be back.

40.description: Purchased a couch and dining table from here a few months ago, and loved their great prices and great customer service. They delivered on time, and the delivery guys were awesome. Put it together fast and even cleaned up after themselves. Definitely will continue to buy furniture here in the future.

53.description: After stopping by a mattress place in my neighborhood, I biked on up Devon toward another outlet place.  I was looking for a decent but not outrageously priced mattress.  Since I didn't care for sleeping on the air mattress another night, I went for the hard sell, the "Expired coupon from some sale but i'll let you use it" and next day delivery.  After sleeping on the mattress for a week it started to droop.  They'll tout their 30-day mattress exchange, but since it's an outlet store and you never pay the list price initially, you have no leverage and will have to pay a lot more for a new mattress.  I'm still sleeping on it and my back hurts.I also looked up the mattress company.  They only sell to outlet stores and are very very cheap.  Save a few bucks and go somewhere else.

30.description: Don't let the "showroom" fool you.  It looks like a hodge-podge mix of junk, and while that certainly is part of the mix, they can get just about anything for you.  We shopped at a much larger national store out of state, but they would not ship to one of their Chicago stores for us.  Their loss.We just happened to look at Marjen's website and found the same stuff as the large store for much cheaper.  Just to be sure, we went back to the large store  and noted the stock numbers of the stuff we wanted and verified with a Marjen rep that it was the same stuff.  Money in our pockets!We had a couple glitches:  a piece damaged in delivery, the wrong color of something else, and someting that we were told was out of stock, but was really discontinued and no longer available.  It took a long time to finally get what we ordered, but the cost saving was worth it.

46.description: THIS IS THE WORST FURNITURE PLACE YOU COULD EVER POSSIBLY IMAGINE! At first, my roommate and I were really excited to find our dream couch for so cheap. Grant seemed really nice and helpful and said they would deliver it the next day. The next day came and we agreed on a time of 6-7ish pm. They called and asked if we could be at home at 5:30, they called at 5 -_-. We had to reschedule since we couldn't be home for the early unexpected delivery. We waited till Saturday and finally when Saturday came we got a call from of course Grant. He was really nice but explained that "Ashley had delivered the wrong color, is that okay?" So it wasn't okay, clearly. We were trying to work something out and my roommate and I just didn't want to wait any longer so we just agreed to get the right couch on the same day but the only thing was the chaise was going to be on the opposite side from what we had originally ordered. Once the couch came, we realized the chaise on the left side actually didn't work. Since Grant was so nice, we called back asking if it was possible to swap pieces, he said "yes sure no problem." Both me and my roommate were relieved. Next week came, Grant was off for majority of the week, we couldn't get in touch with anyone except this A-hole Paul. He started screaming at me saying it wasn't their fault and it was our fault for accepting the couch the way it was. The thing that rang a bell in our minds was what happened to that correct couch that was suppose to be delivered that one Monday. Grant called back eventually denying everything completely changing his attitude and becoming rude. He said that we were putting words in his mouth, never agreed to swapping pieces and we shouldn't have taken it the wrong way. He also said he didn't appreciate being lied to about us not having any furniture when the delivery guys came and saw our old couch. Talk about hypocrisy, okay so we had a temporary couch and wanted the new one asap, but hello he was lying to us about the couch that just magically disappeared that was suppose to be delivered that monday. Granted we should have just waited, but the unprofessionalism, the yelling, the hanging up on us, the no returning calls-completely shitty service. i don't recommend them at all-yes they re cheap but remember you get what you pay for! I would give this a 0 star if I could!

1.description: This is a tough review to write given I had a really good experience the first time I visited and a really bad experience with one of the sales people (Ron) today. It's also unfortunate to provide a low star rating that is the result of one person, when the other staff members - Danny, Mark, and Grant were all really good. Based on my first experience with the store-I would have given them five stars...after the ordeal with Ron today, I can only give two stars! I'll provide an update after my furniture is delivered though.So....I first went to this furniture store a few weeks ago based on the recommendation of a trusted colleague. The sales persons were all very personable and helpful, without being overly aggressive. While they didn't have the items I wanted, they were more than happy to order them. I was purchasing a dining room table, six chairs, console table, two end tables, and a coffee table. The total was over $1600. I expressed my concern about the chairs being vinyl (since who wants to spend $1600+ on furniture and it look cheap!) but one of the associates indicated that the chairs didn't come in a fabric option and if I didn't like the vinyl chairs upon arrival - it was easy to select another option. Sounded like a good deal, especially since they included free delivery and assembly. Great. Fast forward...while searching online, I found the dining room chairs in a fabric option from the same company. They look almost exactly like the vinyl chairs, but are fabric. I sent an email to Marjens with the link and indicated that I wanted those chairs instead. Received a response today saying it wasn't possible to obtain the fabric chairs because this was a special order. I responded indicating that I was coming into the store to discuss in-person.When I arrived, initially I started with Mark, who stated that this was a special order and it wasn't possible to change chairs. I responded saying this wasn't the message I received a few weeks ago. We talk for a few minutes and the the real problem starts when Ron decides to enter the discussion. He reiterates Mark's points, then begins raising his voice because of his frustration that I am not simply accepting that I can't switch the chairs. Suddenly, we are both yelling and he says "just because you have a Ph.D. doesn't mean you're smarter than me!" Wait - how does my degree have anything to do with exchanging some chairs?!?! The only reason he even knows I have a doctorate is because I use my work email which includes my professional signature. I hadn't mentioned anything related to his intellect or insulted him in any way, but I guess he was offended because I had the nerve to not simply accept purchasing vinyl chairs that I was told could be easily exchanged! I mentioned that I reviewed the Yelp comments (unfortunately after I'd made my purchase) and see why many of the reviews are so bad. I stated that wasn't my initial experience, but given this exchange I too would be writing a review. Ron yelled that he would be writing a rebuttal...as if I should feel concerned!Ultimately, I had to inform Ron that I would NOT engage in any additional dialogue with him. He continued ranting and I stopped responding. Fortunately, Danny finally jumped in and said it would be easy to order the fabric chairs and not a problem at all. Of course, Ron is still trying to jump in the conversation talking about the special order business, but Danny assures me that it's possible and fine. Mark proceeds to find the fabric chairs among their books and I pay $60+ more since these chairs are supposedly $10 more each (although when I made it home, I looked them up again and they are only $5 more). In summary, the pros are that you really can find good deals and most of the sales people are very nice and helpful. Danny is fantastic. The major con is Ron and that all the sales people aren't on the same page.

55.description: The absolute worst in every aspect of the purchasing process. Lied to? YepWas treated rudely? Yep Had to go through my credit card (thanks discover) and get a refund because they could not deliver when promised and refused to issue a refund? YepThat's fine though, I got the last laugh, a full refund and better furniture to and better quality furniture at Harlem Furniture.

9.description: I read reviews before hand so I had an idea of what I was in for.  It's not the nicest furniture, but they seemed to be the only place in town that could get the style/size/color of an Ashley piece that I wanted to complete my living room.  I worked with Grant and he was very friendly and helpful.I had to deduct a star for delivery.  I didn't receive a call ahead of time.  I learned that they had arrived when one of them just walked right in to my home.  Another guy set his grimy bag of tools upon my existing light colored, well-made upholstered furniture and I had to ask him to place it elsewhere.  Then they refused to remove the garbage, despite my invoice stating quite clearly "remove all garbage."  An argument ensued and they eventually removed it.  The whole delivery process was just full of unnecessary hassle.

26.description: AVOIDAVOID this place at all costs. I bought a click clack sofa bed from here that broke after 6 months. I called them 4 times in the last 6 weeks about getting it replaced under the warranty it's under and they HAVENT RESPONDED. Every single time I called they're like oh? Really? A click clack? Name and number well call you back. NOTHING. Absolutely NO response. I'll keep on trying though I mean 6 months?? How does a SOFA break after 6 months?! And it's not like a ton of ppl sit on it I don't ever have a bunch of ppl over at a time. SO frustrating...

25.description: great furniture at a great price.

12.description: Worst experience ever. Don't come here. Ron is a complete disgrace to business. They took literally 4 months to deliver my bed. I will spread the word about this to anyone I hear considering buying new furniture. I got hung up on and told "too bad we don't do that" when I said I would like a refund. I was given the runaround and told that it would be here "this Tuesday" for literally 4 months. That's 16 Tuesday's of bullshit. Please do yourself a favor. Don't shop here and give them a shitty review so perhaps you can save the next unknowing person who may end up getting into business with these crooks.

59.description: I have to admit I was wary of checking this place out based on these reviews, but they had the best price I'd seen for the couch I wanted, so I tried it. Not too bad. I got what I wanted, at the price I wanted, and very quickly, so I can't complain at all!I can see how their customer service might be lacking, as when they called me to confirm delivery - THEY called ME - the guy on the phone kept talking to someone in the background! But whatever. If you know what you want and don't need your hand held, go here and you'll get a good deal.I had been looking for a sectional for months, after visiting several other places and getting quoted the same price for the one I decided I liked, I found a craigslist ad for Marjen offering the same sectional for over $100 less. Luckily I printed out that part of the ad, because a few weeks later when I was ready to buy, the ad was no longer up! I went in and when the guys asked if I needed help, I said I was just looking for now and they didn't seem to have any problem with that. I found the 2 sectionals I was looking for (to compare), and the one I decided I wanted had the same pricetag on it as the 4 other places I had been to. I asked the guy about the couch, pulled out my ad and confirmed it was the same, and asked if I could get that sale price. His response? "Sure, why not". Sold. I asked how soon I could get it - having been told at least 10 days everywhere else - and he said "How about tomorrow?". Double sold.Delivery was scheduled for the next day between 1pm and 4pm, they showed up at 2pm, quickly unwrapped and assembled my couch and it was done. After months of searching, I expected the process to be a little more dragged out and painful, but this was great! Even for me, a first-time buyer of furniture.Bottom line, if you know what you want and don't need to be walked through the process or coddled, there is nothing wrong with this place. Well, okay, the customer service on the phone could be better, but in store was fine. It may have helped that I had a ridiculously adorable 8-month-old with me (the guy who helped me seemed to really like talking to her), but either way, if I needed another piece of furniture and knew what I wanted, I'd definitely check here.

21.description: Sales person was Grant fantastic - I think he would do extremely well working at a high end store.  The "boss/manager/owner?" however is horrible.  I purchased a bed, box spring, and two side tables for delivery on a specific day.  I live in a high rise building and needed to guarantee all would be delivered at the same time since I needed to reserve the elevator. They guaranteed this would be no problem -- I even picked certain side tables that we in stock to make sure this wouldn't be a problem.  An hour before delivery I was told that only one of two tables would be available. The other was no longer in stock and it would come at a later date.  Frustrated -- and not wanting to sit at home for another time frame, and also reserve an elevator, I asked to return it.  They firmly told me this was not an option and basically I was stuck with them.  This is quite ridiculous in my opinion...they could easily re-sell this.  I will never shop here again..I strongly caution it.

17.description: So I went here about a month ago initially and Grant helped with explaining to me the prices of mattresses etc... My friend placed an order for living room furniture on that day and I returned a month later (Sept 12) to place my order.. I ordered mattresses, headboard and frame along with another headboard and a chest... I was charged for delivery and assembly however it is all a SCAM!!! There was no freaking assembly besides screwing two pieces on my headboard which I could have done... When I asked the guys to attach the frame to the headboard they told me I had to have my own bolts!!! WTH! I called the store and Ron was rude as other ppl has experienced!!! Letting me know someone will come tomorrow to finish the set up... As for the other headboard Grant explained to me that I was being charged assembly because it was in all these little pieces etc however when delivered the headboard was already assembled!! When I went to the store demanding answers NO ONE had any!!! They tried to tell me that the headboard was assembled in store however I noticed that the showroom model which was just there Saturday and Sunday was not there on Monday after my delivery!! They tried to convince me that they didn't deliver me the show room model however when I asked where it was mysteriously no one knew!!!! I don't like when ppl try to get over I me and LIE!!! I was going to recommend ppl use Grant however this completely turned me off from this store and I would much rather give my money to a business that is honest and appreciates my business!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!

10.description: We worked with Grant in August and couldn't be happier with the customer service and our purchase! We love our couch and the bed he helped up find as well. Delivery went smoothly as well. We will definitely go back to Marjen.

5.description: AVOID THIS PLACE BY ANY MEANS.I have never dealt with a more unprofessional business. Not only did they fail to deliver the dresser I ordered when they said, they kept me waiting all day without any updates as to when they would be delivering the piece. The next day, my mother called the store to inquire about the delivery. The man she spoke with claimed to be the owner. He not only couldn't find the order in the system, he interrupted, yelled and cursed at her saying, "I don't take F*****ng orders over a $99 dollar order". She proceeded to call me distressed and in tears. I then called the store myself and he spoke to me the same way. This place is a sham and completely unacceptable. I don't even understand how this place is in business. The owner should rot in hell for his behavior. Worst. Place. Ever. They're lucky I can't give zero stars.

3.description: Worst customer service ever, took 10 seconds to take my payments but 10 weeks to deliver my couch, The reason they're called Marjen Furniture is because they provide "Marginal" service. If you get Grant on the phone you're better off hanging up you get nowhere with this guy.

35.description: Just bought furniture from here and I have to say that with some of the reviews I was expecting the worst. The man who took care of me was polite and thorough. They called day before the delivery and scheduled a time window with us. All went smooth and I am so happy got a great deal!

19.description: Do not buy a couch here! I bought a couch that broke after a year and half of normal use, but was under warrantee. It took two months of calling Marjen on an almost weekly basis for them to send out a repairman. The repairman did not show up twice for his appointments, and when he finally came he looked at the couch for five seconds and said it could not be fixed and would need to be replaced. I asked him why it took two months to make that assessment and he said I should've sent photos. I had actually sent photos of the damage to Marjen months prior.Finally they agreed to replace the couch. Again, had to call them almost everyday to make sure it would arrive. When it didn't come on the day of arrival, they claimed that it had been scheduled for the next day. This was a complete and total lie. They also told me I would need to pay a delivery fee. When I contested this because of the poor service I had received, Grant yelled at me and threatened not to deliver the couch at all. Talk about horrible customer service. The prices are cheap, but it's not worth the horrible experience.

28.description: Quick notes on furniture shopping: Very bulky and old-school style of sofas and beds. As everyone else has shared, it's hard to even walk around the small store with how much they have packed in there.

45.description: If you are looking for furniture at a decent price, this is the place to go'. If you're in the market for something more upscale or a delightful in store experience, you will be disappointed here. I bought a dining table table set (came with 4 chairs) and a bed, all very reasonably priced. The delivery was as promised and the guys who delivered it did a great job assembling it.The showroom is not well organized and furniture is crammed all over the place. If you are brave enough to venture to the upper level, watch your head! My husband and I literally had to bend at the waist to avoid hitting the low ceiling as we surveyed the numerous coffee tables and night stands strewn around. We were lucky to be served by a very laid back and attentive salesman (Tom), and were happy to let him have our business. Some of the customers in the store at the time weren't as fortunate, since we literally witnessed other salesmen using the pushy sales tactics, we're all wary of. My husband was a little disappointed by his inability to haggle on price (as much as he would've liked).Bottom Line - Fair prices, reasonable selection, great place to shop for starter furniture (step up from Ikea). There are places like FV that offer very similar quality, selection and pricing, but with freebies such as white gloves delivery.

33.description: We ordered our couch and love seat set and it was delivered about 3 weeks later. I was hoping for a bit sooner and was promised it'd be on a shipment one week earlier than it was but hey, for the price I can't complain!  We ordered it (Less than $600 for the set), paid $75 for delivery which was a must after my husband had to stand on top of a U-Haul to get our old couch into our apartment, and it was delivered safe and sound and nicely wrapped. The delivery guys ROCKED! They were done in no time and their tip was well deserved. The couch and love seat are both very comfy and we are happy.  Even with the delay in shipping, I would still use them again in a heartbeat. We love our couch set and it's very modern and soft and cushy. Happy customer!

43.description: Ok, yes  as far as the sales staff and the setup of the store you do have to go in with the mindset that this is not an upscale store, but the staff is still pretty nice and helpful.  I needed a sleeper sofa that they did not carry in the store but had to order.  They said it would take about a week, but it wound up being a few days longer than that.  The sofa was exactly what I expected, nice quality and a decent price.  When it was finally in, I got a call on the day they wanted to deliver it at 1:30pm asking if they could bring it that day.  Having to leave at 3pm that same afternoon I was not expecting miracles but explained that I had to leave by that time to go to work and if it was not possible for them to do it, if they could schedule it for the next day.  The man put me on hold for a couple of minutes and came back and told me that they could definitely do it that same day and in about a half an hour my new sofa arrived.  I give them props on that and my rating which was based on the price, quality and flexibility on getting me my sofa ASAP.  I will definitely be going back there when I buy the matching chair and ottoman!

2.description: We love our couch and the price, but the service was horrendous. Be prepared to follow up with Marjen on your own and fight for the things they originally promised you. Selection is fairly small, but they have many nice pieces. I would consider giving them another try in the future, but I would hope to be treated with more respect.

18.description: AVOIDAVOID this place at all costs. I bought a click clack sofa bed from here that broke after 6 months. I called them 4 times in the last 6 weeks about getting it replaced under the warranty it's under and they HAVENT RESPONDED. Every single time I called they're like oh? Really? A click clack? Name and number well call you back. NOTHING. Absolutely NO response. I'll keep on trying though I mean 6 months?? How does a SOFA break after 6 months?! And it's not like a ton of ppl sit on it I don't ever have a bunch of ppl over at a time. SO frustrating...

41.description: Do not buy from here. Worst customer service ever! Was given the run around after an issue with my couch I bought. Never returned calls. Lied about ways they were going to fix the issue. Besides the cost, it is awful! Not worth the low cost!

52.description: This place is constantly spamming the furniture section of craigslist ruining it for other people.That type of behavior is selfish and unprofessional. Wouldn't ever shop here.

50.description: Loved the no pressure sales staff. My partner and I went in for a bookcase, and left with a bookcase and a couch. The President's day sale was amazing, and we were able to get assembly and same day delivery. We will go back to Marjen for our furniture needs.

4.description: The place is packed with all kinds of furniture. I don't mind it though as I like to see what I'm buying. Their website is easy to browse too. I bought my sofa and my favorite coffee table from here. Delivery is a bit hard to schedule. If you live in a high rise with set rules, it's challenging since the delivery is based on what is convenient for them on that day...so timing may be unpredictable.

6.description: Terrible service, especially ron. Incredibly rude. Waited months for my order, & no one seemed to care. Will never use this store again.

22.description: Outstanding service and great prices.  My wife and I have purchased furniture from them on two separate occasions, and we've been very happy both times.  Grant helped us out and made sure everything went smoothly.  I highly recommend using this family business for your next furniture purchase.  (Note: they have a lot of high-quality Ashley products as well).

15.description: This place is terrible. I would have rated no stars if possible. During the summer I put a down payment on a new couch $400. I went on vacation and my apt caught on fire while away. when i returned I had to move to a different apartment, which was smaller. When I went to Marjen to chose a different couch they told me I had to spend the same amount of the couch I was originally going to purchase. I didn't see $1400 dollars worth of furniture. I only wanted to buy a smaller couch. They refused to let me buy anything with my $400 credit, or give me my money back. Basically they stole $400 from me. This place is filled with crooks, liars, and thieves! stay far far away!!!!!

57.description: As a student on a budget but not wanting her apartment to look like it, I spent weeks trying to find a decently priced bed frame in my price range. Though I was scared away from this place from some of the reviews, I ended up finding an ad posted by Marjen on Craigslist advertising a leather platform bed with headboard on sale at $199.I called ahead and made sure they had it, and went in to check it out. Terry showed me the bed I was looking for, and was able to schedule delivery and set-up for me a week in advance just like I wanted. Easy-peesy. Delivery was the standard large window timeframe of something like 12-4pm. The delivery guys made it closer to almost 4 and were able to complete set-up of the bed in under 30 minutes. Put my mattress on top and voila! I've had it for about a month, and so far so good.Granted like some have mentioned I'm not sure how long the bed will last, as I can tell it's not Ethan Allen or some other top of the line furniture brand, but I don't need furniture that will stand the test of time quite yet. It looks great and the price was too!

20.description: I Purchased a dresser and a new bed frame from Marjen just over a month ago. My bed frame has already broke. I am in the middle of dealing with them to see what they can do to compensate me for such an inconvenience. I do like their prices and selection. But quality might be their down fall. I ordered the platform bedframe that doesn't require a box spring. My bed is now lopsided because the support beam has broke. I'm very irritated because I can't sleep at night. Be careful what you purchase here...

36.description: I swung by Marjen after checking out their website and deciding I needed some 'grown up' furniture without paying ridiculous prices.There is a good selection of quality furniture at the store. The guys are laid back and pretty much leave you alone unless you need something. Don't expect someone to follow you around and kiss your ass here (which is good - I needed a couch, not someone to build my self esteem).  I asked questions - they answered.  They didn't pressure me, just offered suggestions until I found something that worked with my budget and my needs.Delivery was set up for the Saturday after I purchased my couch.  With the 3 hour window they gave me, the delivery guys were actually early!  That was great.  The delivery guys were friendly, professional, and took care of everything quickly (which was a huge weight off my shoulders anyway since my apartment building isn't the most easy to access in Chicago). They made sure I inspected my couch and put it exactly where I wanted.  I think the only things that kept me from giving the review 5 stars is the $75 delivery fee (I was seriously less than a mile away from this place), the fact that some of the furniture was up on a rack so I couldn't sit on it or test it out, the guy taking my order seemed a little scatterbrained at times, and the showroom was so crammed with stuff I was a little overwhelmed at first.But I would recommend anyone looking to for new furniture to check this place out.  I'll go back again when I'm in the market for new pieces.

14.description: My roommate and I ordered a sofa, love seat, coffee table, as well as a bedroom set for him including mattress, box spring and frame. This order was placed on a Monday, and the delivery was set to be Thursday. The store called to reschedule to Saturday, which I didn't mind since it was a weekend, and still before super bowl Sunday. The manager calls us Saturday MORNING of the delivery and says that he can't fit it all into one truck so he'll have to split up the deliveries, and delay the second delivery until the coming Tuesday. The truck arrives on Saturday with a mattress box spring and frame. The delivery guys try to set up the frame, only to tell us that there's a manufacturer defect and that they have to go back and get another one. They promised to be back in two hours. Four hours later they show up and assemble it all. They were rude, unprofessional, and left the water running full blast in our bathroom.What I do not understand is how the store owner plans to deliver a sofa set and a bedroom set in a truck that can barely carry a mattress and box spring.Will not order from here again. I wanted to support a local business but from now on I will get furniture from reputable stores only.Giving this two stars only because he worked with me on the price in the beginning, and also refunded me some money (very reluctantly) after messing up the delivery.

56.description: THIS STORE HAS ALL THINGS ORGANIC AND BEAUTIFUL. GREAT HANDMADE SOAPS, MAUDE'S CARROT CAKE(THE ABSOLUTE BEST) AND FUN MUSIC .

29.description: We're still looking for a reasonably priced organic food delivery service.  The problem is, the costs to get this stuff to Loyola start to add up to the point where you might as well just give your cash to the front for conservative mind control - Whole Foods.Don't get me wrong, they're doing good work here, but I was very disappointed with an introductory fruits and vegetables box we ordered and picked up at the store.  Might have been an off week, but we were given lots of things that make it hard to make a meal or two with.   And the quality just wasn't there.  It was summer so no excuses please.  They also gave us a little attitude about the box we were taking home because we had forgotten to bring our own shopping bag.  Don't worry dude, we'll recycle it.  Gahd.

42.description: I found Newleaf when I was looking to join a CSA. It worked out perfectly when I lived up north, and I had many happy months with fresh veggies. They even let you specify if you don't want a certain product in your box, in my case, this was onions. Its a cute store with a little bit of everything organic.

23.description: Overall I like this store. I'm glad there's a place to buy good organic and healthy groceries in Rogers Park and I want to support local businesses when I can. However...hey staff, would it kill you to help throw some groceries in my bag now and then? I'm fine doing most of it but, after money has changed hands, instead of staring at me while I fumble with my wallet and purse or immediately resuming your texting/internet surfing you could maybe lend a hand and I'll be out of your hair that much faster. I don't expect a warm hug and cocoa but something between that and overwhelming indifference would be ok

47.description: I wish I could afford to shop here. The seeds and nuts in their bulk containers said that they want to come home with me.

8.description: Could this store be any smaller? I walked in and practically knocked over everything with my medium-sized purse. I didn't think a place could be more expensive than Trader Joe's, but I was wrong. The service here isn't that great. I don't expect a warm greeting and a smile every time I go into a store; I know people have bad days. I won't hold that against the store. But if the guy working behind the counter looks at me when I walk in and rolls his eyes at me, I'm not going to even think about coming back. I know I probably don't look like a typical 'organic foodie' but that doesn't give you the right to treat me like I'm a nuisance because of it.

31.description: I ordered a produce box from these guys last week, and was less-than-impressed.  The fruit was over-ripe and bruised.  I had to inhale it in the first couple of days or throw it out. And the tomatoes, while tasty, were from Mexico.  Way to support the local farmer...I only poked around the store a bit, and while they seem to have lots of great stuff in stock, the prices were insane.  I doubt I'll be going back.

34.description: I love you, Newleaf, even if I can't really afford most of your wares. Thanks for making hearty sandwiches for me and my work team for the last five years and for patiently taking our orders over the phone. Thanks for special ordering stuff I can't find anywhere else. Thanks for being friendly even after the lunch crowd of Waldorf kids has gotten on your last nerve. There's a $10 minimum for using a credit card...but it won't take you long to reach as the prices are steep.

16.description: So glad this store is close to my office.  Great, fresh choices with great service.  love the supplements, hummus, coffee, etc.  Try the Kettle Carmel corn they carry - super yummy!  Wish they served soup.

13.description: I'm not extremely familiar with this area, which is why I'd never known about this great little store.  I needed some non-factory farm eggs, so after a wedding we hit up this little beauty.  Boyfriend found some Kropotkin coffee, which cracked him up.  It can go with our Che Guevara wine.  We bought it, obviously.  He also stocked up on veggie jerky.  As a jerky hater, I cannot attest to its quality, but the boy likes that weird crap.  I only like fruit leather...  Anyway, this store has a great selection of organic and local goodies including meats, and they also do produce box delivery and have a little cafe.  If I lived around here, I'd so be blowing all my dough here.

11.description: Newleaf Natural Grocery is expensive, but I love it. I'm a big fan of their CSA program. I had tried other CSA's and always got the same fruits and veggies each week. Booooring! I have been getting the $15 CSA box from Newleaf for the last month and they always surprise me with fresh produce that is (for the most part) in season. I also love that the program is week-to-week with no membership fee and for an extra $5 you can get your box delivered to your door. They also send out an electronic newsletter each week with recipe ideas for the produce that will be included. I've purchased other items at Newleaf and like I said, they're expensive. I always pick up some of the hummus that they sell, but I get everything else that I need at Whole Foods or da' Jewelz.

39.description: This place works for us from dairy items to a bagel. The staff is friendly, ask about the box, which is a selection of veggies for a decent cost and it's organic.

37.description: In January I signed up to receive the $15 mixed fruit and veggie box.  I did this for a number of reasons, including a desire to eat better, i.e., more healthily, but also to help support organic and local farmers.  Many of the CSAs give you a big quantity of a limited selection each week and you have to commit to the whole growing season.  I thought the New Leaf program which offers variety each week would suit me well.  In addition, I appreciated the flexibility of ordering week to week and that  it was easy to substitute items, especially in the summer when I grow some of my own veggies.   I really enjoyed picking up my box each week and thinking about what I would make with the contents.  While I liked most of the items in the box, I had never purchased many of them before.  I've never eaten so much kale and chard!  I loved the garlic scapes!  And in the summer, I particularly enjoyed ensuring I got a serving of fruit by using all those mangos... in a daiquiri or two!While organic and local produce can be expensive, I thought the $15 box provided good value for my food dollar.  The food would last me through the week and sometimes even longer.  In addition, the store itself has a good variety of organic products and bulk items.  As time went on, I found that I seldom went to any of the major grocery stores because I could get most of what I wanted at the New Leaf.Soon I will be leaving Chicago and moving to California.  While there will be lots of fresh produce available, I will miss picking up my weekly box, seeing the fresh young faces behind the cash registers in the store, and thinking about what I will make with the kale, the chard, the chard, the watercress, etc.

0.description: I'm a regular customer and have recently noticed a decline in the customer service - in terms of attitude and general "vibe". this has not happen a few times, but is a pattern. I don't get the sense most of the staff here like to help me - which is frustrating because I am there so much. It makes me wonder if they don't appreciate my business. I also have noticed some prices go up, and some products i liked no longer sold. Much of this, as I've found out, is out of their control, so I can't really blame them. For example, Whole Foods apparently buys ALL the standard organic kiwis in the US! This leaves New Leaf to sell the smaller-produced kiwi berries or no kiwis. They can't do much about it. As a regular customer I like to know a business possibly recognizes me, and more importantly, does appreciate my contribution. As I have barely felt that for a while, I'm considering shopping her much less, despite its convenience to where I live. it's hard to write this about them because I have always appreciated their presence in the neighborhood, and been glad to recommend them for many reasons. But it's time to mention the lack of quality customer service. Other than this, i really like the store! But the atmosphere of the staff really effects the experience, perhaps largely because the space is very small and limited. What can i say? I like being friendly with a neighborhood business.**Update: I'm moving my review up to three stars because the service has improved and I really like this business! :)

38.description: Great little natural food store...but dayum! theys 'spensive! I mean, I understand that they have to be, it has to be nearly impossible to make a profit, but I'm poor...its my duty to complain.Regardless, very charming shop, they have a little bulk food bin section for nuts and dried fruits, grains, etc...they make sandwiches too, get the veggie sammich with hummus and Dijon mustard on sourdough, delish!Also great for hard to find items, like vegan sour cream and cream "cheese", nutritional yeast and so on and they carry Soul Veg entrees.Bonus for having cute granola type boys behind the counter! *rowr*

51.description: I must say, I love going into a New Leaf. I love the smell and the products and the fell of a conscious business, and I enjoy supporting small businesses. It reminds me of when I happily used to work at The Breadshop on Halsted and Foodworks on Diversey way before Whole Foods even was ever heard of in Chicago.(am I really that old?)However, having said that.. I can't afford it. In order to buy organic produce I go to the farmers markets and Wild Oats, or I buy local nonorganic. I try to support the shop, but am only able to do it by buying an item here or there as the prices are so much higher than other places. It stinks, I want to support them more, I want small businesses that warm my green, vegetarian heart to thrive, but I simply cannot afford it. The boxes worked out well for me in the past, and the prices on that is not unreasonable but I just can't pay for grocery stuff or individual pieces of produce.The staff is always helpful. I wish I could, I wish I could go there more.

27.description: This is a hidden gem in Rogers Park!I come here often when I don't have time to drive to Wholefoods.People are so nice and you can find fresh Organic produce at a reasonable price. Some are cheaper than Whole Foods while others are not. They also carry many different items ranging from frozen meat and fruits, snacks, bread, boxed meals, pasta, sauce, dairy products, and household products.

32.description: We were there last Sunday.  The store is cute and well organized for its size of a NY studio apt.  We bought a couple things so we weren't just lookieloos.  However, the sole employee acted like we had leprosy.  She could barely contain her distaste for the only two customers in the whole store; us.  She appeared to carry the world on her shoulders stocking her tiny produce selection.  Said nothing other than to tell us to bring cash the next time.  She should be happy these two customers will not darken her sad doorstop again.

54.description: Jam-packed with organic goods--hard to find grains and flour, brownie mixes, bulk oatmeal/nuts/coffee, vitamins/supplements, dairy and fresh fruits/veggies.  Newleaf's hook is local and sustainable so there are plenty of fresh in-season produce.  Starting at $15/box, you can pre-order a box of produce for pick-up or delivery.  You can get boxes with only veggies, only fruits, or a mix.  They also deliver to check points in other neighborhoods.They also have a small coffee bar and 1 table in the window.  Would be nice to see this place get some sidewalk seating, as there is room for it.Right off the red line, but wasn't very easy for me to get home from here as the EL cuts Loyola Ave. off from being a thru-road.

48.description: I recently signed up for the weekly fruit & veggie box for one. I opted to go pick it up myself because I didn't want to worry about it sitting in my apartment's lobby unattended all day. It's location is pretty convenient, off the red line Loyola stop. But it was sort of tricky to figure that street out. Exit the station at the back, that's my best advice. The store itself was smaller than I'd imagined but it had some great stuff in it. I got my box of stuff and enjoyed reading the little newsletter they put in it on my ride home. Thank GOD they include a couple of recipes for the ingredients or I wouldn't have known what to do with beets and jalapeno peppers. I love fruits and veggies of all kinds so I'm excited to see what new things I get each week. For $15, you sure do get a TON of produce. Way more then I could ever get for $15 at a grocery store.

44.description: We've been getting the weekly veg/fruit box for about 6  months and we LOVE IT! I've never been to the actual location we get it delivered weekly, $5.00 delivery charge is pretty decent considering we live in the S. Loop and this place is faaar North.Since getting New Leaf my bf and I have been eating so many delicious salads and making so many great recipes with fresh organic veggies.I love the fact that every week they send something different and a lot of times we get thing we wouldn't normally buy but are glad we got them. It forces us to create new recipes and expand our dinner menu.I LOVE new leaf and have since recommended them to many of my friends. I wish they were closer to us so I could just shop there.YUM for the delicious treats you send every week!

24.description: When I last got a produce box from them it was fine, but that was several years ago. Their main clientele are students/parents from the Waldorf school across the street, and NL could work a little harder on customer service to them. They've been known to kick people out. But if the Waldorf people quit giving them business, they'd be gone in a week.

7.description: Newleaf grocery is right around the corner from our home. It has been such a great addition to our neighborhood. We go there almost everyday for something. They have the best quality organic produce, and offer weekly produce boxes. Karen, the owner, is very knowledgeable. She used to be an organic farmer herself. The atmosphere is charming. It's always fun to look around and see what's new. They help support the community by providing a space for like minded businesses to put up flyers for events and services.Karen writes a weekly newsletter with community info, recipes and what's new in stock. They  have a small cafe offering sandwiches and fair trade coffee. They also have some pre-packed  foods to go, that include a lot of vegan and vegetarian options.  We feel so lucky to have such a good health food store here in Rogers Park. I want to encourage everyone to support this wonderful local business.

49.description: I've been enjoying New Leaf's produce subscription for about eight months now. What an economical way to eat very well, with always a great variety of very fresh and often local organic and IPM fruits and vegetables. Since it's a "grab bag" rather than customer choice, I've ended up trying new things that I might not have selected on my own.

40.description: We've been getting "the box" for a couple of months and really enjoy it. I really like that we don't have to pay any co-op fees or joining fees too. We do go to trader joes, whole foods, farmers markets, and a few other stores to round out our choices, but this has been a wonderful healthy, weekly pleasure.The selections are interesting and keep me on my cooking toes trying new recipes for new things I've never worked with before. Would have never tried dandelion pasta had we not gotten organic dandelion leaves but wow was that great! Arugula pesto was another good one when we just had too much arugula between the box and TJs.It's really been lovely and a good way to start eating healthier and choosing more conscientiously.We couldn't be happier.

53.description: i used to live right next door to this place while at loyola.  i never appreciated it when i had it--those meal plans are so tempting and so...free.  but i would kill for a place like this right next door to me now.great place to visit if you are in or of the neighborhood, or if you are just really into supporting small local business that supports other small local business.  it's good for the soul.  :-)

30.description: Newleaf grocery has one of the best organic food delivery services in Chicago! We haven't been to the actual store but have been utilizing their weekly delivery service for 6 months now and I must say I couldn't be happier. How it works: 1. Select either large or small box 2. Select fruit, vegetables, or mix 3. Receive an email a few days prior to your weekly delivery with contents of box and potential recipes 3. Receive a your box at home 4. Pay an extremely fair price for your product and delivery5. Feel good about supporting local businesses!Why it's better than traditional farmer co-op services: 1. Home Delivery. (Not pickup) 2. Pay By the Week. (No large sum upfront) 3. Diverse Product Mix. (Rather than only product the co-op is growing)Both the vegatable and fruit boxes are extremely fresh.  We generally get the small box and with home delievery and it costs around $20 a week.  There is NO way I could get the same amount of food at a store for the same price.  If you are looking for a local, fresh, fair priced, organic food delivery service, look no further.  Newleaf grocery is your place.  Do it. You know you'll feel better.

46.description: Boooooooooooo.  We were very excited to get our first mixed box delivery today.  We waited for it for hours and hours (they wouldn't give us a delivery window).  It showed up around 6pm - a box of wilted, mostly overripe vegetables and underripe fruits.  No newsletter to help us identify two mystery greens.  3 lemons.  2 of what I think are yams.  A plastic container of small sweet peppers from Mexico, several of which were rotten.  Not exactly worth the wait.

1.description: I really want to like this place.  It's cute.  It smells amazing.  It's a hint of West Coast-type goodness, and feels how a natural foods place might have felt a few precious decades past. The college-age staff behind the counter are always polite. Today, I was sitting drinking a coffee when a delivery box almost landed on me (instead loudly falling to the floor beside).  A woman who I believe may be the manager was right there, working with the boxes along with the delivery guy.  There was no acknowledgement of my presence or even light-hearted apology. They had a protracted back and forth convo right beside me.  The space is small but not that small. I asked the woman in charge if I should just move, and her response was that I could stay at the table until the Waldorf kids showed up in five minutes for morning break (10:30). 'because they get priority'.  No, 'sorry about the box, we're shipping stuff today' or 'hey, great to meet you- just so you know, the kids are coming in soon'. Delivery matters. As an adult customer who has bought an array of (higher-priced) groceries there, who actually cares about independent businesses, and who had been coming by regularly to get coffee: that bugs me. Reading other reviews on here, I see that variations of this have come up for other former customers.  I know from talking with Waldorf staff, the school has been seriously considering moving to a new site elsewhere in the neighborhood.  I wonder if adult customers who actually want to go a few extra blocks to help a higher-priced independent business... will be valued more then?  Whole Foods is a couple of minutes down Broadway.

55.description: I finally made the trip up to Rogers Park to visit New Leaf. I was impressed that they were able to squish such a good selection into such a tiny space.  They have a great selection of coffees, friendly staff, and a decent enough bulk section (considering the size of the store). It makes me wish I lived near enough to visit regularly.

9.description: I love this place and the people who work here!!  I work nearby and love a corner store to run too!!  They have amazing tuna sandwiches, bagels, coffee, a piece of fruit or something frozen to microwave for lunch!!Amazing place, but not affordable depending on your budget & definitely worth the convenience!!

26.description: Great location just off the Loyola Red Line, definitely a hidden gem. Plus they carry excellent fruit butters by the Southwestern Michigan Buttery, i'm partial to the peach :)

25.description: The staff was rude when I went in and the prices were quite high. Needless to say I won't be back.

12.description: VERY RARE GEM!!!!  Locally owned independent grocer with a focus on local, organic farmers? Newleaf is one of maybe 4-6 stores like this in the city. And they are pulling it off with splendor!!Produce is super fresh. Weekly boxes are great.They pack a lot of variety in their small space. Rice, beans, meat, pasta, coffee, dairy, nuts,  Staff are warm, knowledgeable and very informative.I forgive the prices because I know the extra cost they carry. I wish I could afford to shop there every week.

21.description: OH YES! OH YES!  thank you Newleaf Natural Grocer for having delicious Zasty Nacho Kale Chips!!!! and always begin friendly and on top of things. Take away that minimum credit card purchase and I will come in more often.

17.description: I have been going to New Leaf for close to six month.  I have loved the experience and have recommended countless friends, colleagues, and family members to buy their local and organic groceries there.  I support the CSA programs and spend additional money buying other organic items such as oats and honey there.  Yesterday we went to pick up our groceries only to be told we were taking advantage of the CSA program, we were making their employees work harder because we were asking them to exchange our CSA products, and while they apologized for being jerks we should really think about asking for a specialty box.  I pass three large stores, a Trader Joes, and Whole Foods to drive to Rogers Park to support this store.When I spoke with the owner today, I was told that we arrived at 3pm and was told to be extra sensitive since the staff have been working very hard, had low blood sugar because they hadn't had lunch and they were down one employee.  I've never been told to waive my customer service experience because of someone's busy schedule or low sugar levels.  In fact, I don't think it's an excuse I can use in any professional setting.Moreover, when I shared my concerns of their staff, I was told that at the time we went, 3pm, was their busiest time and it was a prime time for the Waldorf students.  In fact, they continued, we are welcome to come at any time beside the afternoon to receive quality service. At this time, they continued, the students and their parents are really the priority.  When I inquired about how one customer is prioritized over another, they re-confirmed that students/parents come first.  I followed-up and explained that this type of service is unheard of and I would prefer to go to another local store in my neighborhood, where I would happily spend my money, they encouraged me to do so and suggested it may be a better fit.I have never had such a rude customer service experience.  I am unsure what business philosophy they have, but my dollar is a good as any Waldorf student/parent's dollar.  It's a shame that this is the treatment we received from the owner.  While I really liked this store initially, I will not be going there again and will make sure my network of friends, colleagues, and family know that as well.

10.description: Fresh produce, local farmers, delicious vegan cookies(and im not even vegan...yet), super sweet and friendly owner...I LOVE Newleaf. It is a small store, but I find that appealing. Not a mass produced market, but more of an old school mom & pop kinda grocer. If you like organic and fresh...I would recommend giving it a try. I do mostly go for the vegan cookies though.

5.description: Great asset to the neighborhood. You can do all your grocery shopping here if need be. They are expensive though. But the quality is excellent.

3.description: I really wanted to love this place but I was disappointed by a few things. First of all, the website claims to have free range meat purchased from local farmers. Their meat selection consisted of some prepackaged chicken, burger patties, and brats in a small freezer. The produce selection was not impressive but I guess you can't expect a surplus of organic fruits and veggies in February. Vegetables that weren't leafy greens were pre-wrapped in plastic. I did not like being able to inspect the food first but figured it was a business tactic to avoid product waste. After two days in my fridge, I unwrapped the broccoli and it was moldy. The zucchini didn't make it 72 hours. If I lived within walking distance, I would probably stop by to pick up produce for a meal that same day. Otherwise I think its a waste of time.

35.description: This is a review for their produce delivery service.  By going online, you can set-up a continuous delivery of organic fruits, veggies or both for weekly, bi-weekly, etc.  I chose to do it bi-weekly and for the fruits and veggies for $20 a box including the delivery charge.  Every other Saturday a box would be delivered right to my doorstep quite full of produce.  Some weeks would be heavy on the chard, potatoes and onions.  Other weeks I'd get fresh blueberries and bananas.  It was always a toss up on what I would get.  I stopped doing it because you have to make a valid effort to use all the produce and many times I couldn't.  I do recommend trying their service if you are interested in a CSA type program but don't have the funds for it or just want to try something different.

19.description: A neighborhood gem, the staff are fantastic, and Pink Floyd while you're shopping is always great. AMAZING HUMMUS and sandwiches.

28.description: I'm not extremely familiar with this area, which is why I'd never known about this great little store.  I needed some non-factory farm eggs, so after a wedding we hit up this little beauty.  Boyfriend found some Kropotkin coffee, which cracked him up.  It can go with our Che Guevara wine.  We bought it, obviously.  He also stocked up on veggie jerky.  As a jerky hater, I cannot attest to its quality, but the boy likes that weird crap.  I only like fruit leather...  Anyway, this store has a great selection of organic and local goodies including meats, and they also do produce box delivery and have a little cafe.  If I lived around here, I'd so be blowing all my dough here.

45.description: Ok, I order $15 mixed boxes. There have been some tasty treats inside that were worth supplementing my other food items. I decided to start the boxes in order to get a variety of greens and fruits I would not normally buy.i.e. dandelion greens, grape fruit, watercress, red pearsSo far after about a month I realize there are a couple things I find inconsistent (but tolerable because I enjoy the convenience): 1) fruits normally don't ripen for about 1.5 weeks2) veggies normally alright however the heads of lettuce each time have been almost...slimey3) Pickup times vary4) boxes do not always seem equalGranted, I'm sure some fruits or veggies happen to be cheaper at different times of the year, but sometimes I feel like I have a full box, sometimes I feel its half empty. I'll continue to buy boxes from them after summer, likely upgrade to the large box in order to supply most of my meals.However....back to farmers markets this summer to save some cash

33.description: Yes, New Leaf is a tiny store, but they manage to pack quite a variety of quality organic foodstuffs in there without it feeling cramped or claustrophobic. Many reviewers have complained about New Leaf's prices, but frankly they're no higher than Whole Foods and other natural groceries I've been to in Chicago and elsewhere. The difference with New Leaf compared to the likes of Whole Foods is that when I shop there I know my money is going to support local businesses and keep natural and organic food accessible in Rogers Park. It's not just the owners and workers of the store we're supporting. New Leaf carries a variety of locally roasted coffee, locally grown eggs and produce in addition to yummy prepared food. My favorite is getting the BBQ Seitan and other goodies from Soul Vegetarian which would otherwise require a long trek to the south side.My wife and I have come to love their weekly produce box. Because there's just two of us we get the $15 box which is a good value containing a nice variety of in-season fruits and vegetables. You can also choose an all-veggie or all-fruit box instead, and change your order week to week. During the winter months the box tends to be heavy on the greens and root vegetables, because that's what's in season. What's great about that is it's given us a strong incentive to learn new ways to prepare these healthy staples. New Leaf helps us along in this endeavor because they send interesting recipes for their produce box contents each week to their email subscribers.I must admit that I wish there were a food co-op somewhere on the north side, and more co-ops in general in Chicago. But barring that, I'm glad New Leaf is here in Rogers Park. I'm happy to continue shopping there and glad to have the option just a short bike or El ride away.

43.description: If you need organic groceries and don't want to go to Whole Foods/Trader Joe's this is a decent place. The selection is decent, especially for it's size. However, it's [expletive] expensive. I always see parents picking up their kids from the Waldorf school shopping here but never see Loyola kids here. If you've got cash to burn, it would be an excellent place. If you are begging your parents for book money, I would not recommend this place.

2.description: I have never been to Newleaf's store, but I did participate in their produce delivery service for several months.  I really enjoyed the service of having a big box of produce delivered to my door every week, but I eventually decided to discontinue due to the cost.  It was not that expensive ($15 a week for the food and $5 a week for the delivery), it was what that cost covered.  My food would frequently be bruised from transit.  And not just peaches or bananas or foods with soft skin.  It would be apples or zucchini with big dents and bruises.  I would pick up my box an hour or so after delivery and the greens would frequently be wilted or a little browned already.  I know that organic produce doesn't keep quite as well as non-organic options so I tried to be understanding, but I just couldn't justify the cost anymore.  The customer service was also really good and Karen was really great.  However, they require you to have a credit card on file with them in order to charge you monthly for the delivery.  This seems like a reasonable request, except I was a customer for only 6 months and they charged me double on two separate occasions.  It's a good thing I monitor my credit card statements closely or I would have missed it.  I don't know if it's just an oversight on whoever runs the credit card numbers every month, but it made me uncomfortable to know that someone who made mistakes with my credit card had access to that number all the time.  I wonder if they could work with a service like PayPal or something.

18.description: I work across the street from Newleaf, so for the most part they are my coffee/muffin/sandwich shop, and for that I give them 100% A+. While the staff can be a little rough around the edges, they are always gracious and engaging. Overall it's a pretty no-nonsense shop so if you are looking for a warm conversation over the merits of organic versus local, you may be disappointed.I really enjoy the produce boxes as well, although I find I never get through the whole thing. Probably more of a testament to my cooking skills than the food that I don't know what to do with 3 oranges and a bunch of swiss chard.I'd shop here more but like any small organic shop it is pricey, so for the meantime I'll stick with my great organic cup of coffee, and weekly produce box.

41.description: A stone's throw away from my apt.  Small store, but has a decent selection of natural foods.My only complaint is the price.  I realize it can't compete with Trader Joe's but come on.  I paid close to $8 for a container of soup and 3 apples.

52.description: It's so good to have this teeny grocery store in the neighborhood. The focus is organic foods, and they have things I've never seen at Whole Foods, Wild Oats, or even Willy Street in Madison. The owner or owners like to bring in locally grown products in the produce, dairy, and meat sections. Whenever I ask for a product they're out of or that I just want, the staff has always encouraged me to make a request. I've never taken them up on the offer, but I think deliveries come in on Tuesdays and Fridays. They have a menu with tasty sandwiches and coffee too. Carrot cake by the register always looks tempting. Most recently I have fallen in love with some sort of raw food product in little packets that's by the door: "It's Alive Organic Cultured Foods" Raw Sprouted Sauerkraut Crackers. A friend looked at the label, raised an eyebrow, told me they smelled like cat food, tried a piece, and then wouldn't give them back. She said they were quite possibly the coolest food ever. That was the Sea Vegetable flavor, but they also have Dill Garlic and something called Thai Chi that is a ginger flavored one. They're pretty pricey at $4.95 for a 3 oz. packet of four, but I can't eat potato chips and these are way more healthful, so I'm happy to get them as a treat once in a while.Recently I've noticed that several of the products in here are actually cheaper than Whole Foods, Wild Oats, or Willy Street. An organic tea brand (Choice?), for example, was $3.29, and many of the veggies and fruits are comparably priced. Marantha nut butters too. Brands include Organic Valley (cheeses), Seven Stars (yogurt), Equal Exchange (coffee), Divine chocolate, Spectrum (oils and vinegar)...exactly the same sorts of products you'd have to travel to Evanston or Lakeview to get. Why not walk here instead? (Street parking is available at times, but it's not easy. The Loyola el stop and buses that run along Devon and Sheridan are within two blocks of the place.) You'll burn a few calories instead of fossil fuel. It's like a convenience store, only more socially aware.They've got some household products (soap, paper towels, lunch bags) and a small bulk selection with spices, dried fruits, nuts, and coffee. Gosh, I'm glad this place is so close to where I live.

50.description: It was hard to rate this place, but I give it a 4 for serving its purpose well. It is your neighborhood local produce shop and source for all things organic. Now I don't really care if my food is organic as a rule, but the produce they had seemed to be high quality in terms of taste (compared to my recent adventures in blandness at Dominicks or Foods 4 Less), so thumbs up on that. They also had some interesting sodas including smaller batch root beers (yum), so they found their hook for me. Lots of dry goods, including bulk grains, vitamins, even toilet paper and organic kitty litter. Now I just need an organic cat...If you're an organic food person this is very obviously your kind of place. For the rest of us, try to remember it as your neighborhood shop for grabbing some quick fruits, veggies, and interesting foods. Right by the Loyola L, so stop by after work, after class, or when you realize all you have in your kitchen is the usual meat and potatoes. Seriously, you need some vegetables with that. No, your cooking is not going to impress her unless there's some green on the plate. Trust me, I know these things.

4.description: Cute little store front health food joint with a friendly helpful staff. Most of the items I'm looking for are there, but they are limited to only so much shelf and floor space, so they cover the basics and a little more. Wish I was more of a coffee drinker, the grinder smells great. If you savor little window seats, they have one of those in the very front. You can dress up like a puppy, get taken home by some nice couple and never have to pay for food again. Aren't you glad you stopped in

6.description: Small shop. Unique aspect of it is the CSA pickup. I wanted to look into it, but I probably will try a few produce items first before committing.

22.description: I work across the street from Newleaf, so for the most part they are my coffee/muffin/sandwich shop, and for that I give them 100% A+. While the staff can be a little rough around the edges, they are always gracious and engaging. Overall it's a pretty no-nonsense shop so if you are looking for a warm conversation over the merits of organic versus local, you may be disappointed.I really enjoy the produce boxes as well, although I find I never get through the whole thing. Probably more of a testament to my cooking skills than the food that I don't know what to do with 3 oranges and a bunch of swiss chard.I'd shop here more but like any small organic shop it is pricey, so for the meantime I'll stick with my great organic cup of coffee, and weekly produce box.

15.description: OH YES! OH YES!  thank you Newleaf Natural Grocer for having delicious Zasty Nacho Kale Chips!!!! and always begin friendly and on top of things. Take away that minimum credit card purchase and I will come in more often.

57.description: a great place to buy organic products, plus they have a nice newsletter to on food as wel as an organic food buying program.  They have a variety of boxes that come with a newsletter with nice recipes using the items in the box!  You can also pick up a cup of joe there or tea!

20.description: This is a great organic, carefully stocked grocery, in a neighborhood that has few such options.  Where else could I get my kelp that could act as a sugar-substitute and soap that has 51 cleansing uses?  (I do use these items regularly.)If you are considering the produce box + five dollar delivery,  I highly recommend it.  They seem to use regional produce when possible, and the box is pretty packed.  Although not my type, some have said the delivery guy is hot.  So that could be considered a bonus for some people.The only downside to this grocery is that it is near the Waldorf School and the sound of pre-teens' changing, creaky voices fills the store at a deafening volume.  And, since they haven't mastered deodorant-use yet, the teens smell hormonal.  But, that's only around 3:00.  Otherwise, you are in the clear.  Lastly, Newleaf has great bagels!

36.description: We order the weekly portion of organic fruits and veggies. Always a nice variety and tastes so much better than the stuff from Jewel. And, so much CHEAPER. I also like their granola but tend not to buy other packaged food items unless I am in a pinch - because prices are a little steep. The staff is so nice and very helpful. I don't plan on getting produce anywhere else!

14.description: This is a great organic, carefully stocked grocery, in a neighborhood that has few such options.  Where else could I get my kelp that could act as a sugar-substitute and soap that has 51 cleansing uses?  (I do use these items regularly.)If you are considering the produce box + five dollar delivery,  I highly recommend it.  They seem to use regional produce when possible, and the box is pretty packed.  Although not my type, some have said the delivery guy is hot.  So that could be considered a bonus for some people.The only downside to this grocery is that it is near the Waldorf School and the sound of pre-teens' changing, creaky voices fills the store at a deafening volume.  And, since they haven't mastered deodorant-use yet, the teens smell hormonal.  But, that's only around 3:00.  Otherwise, you are in the clear.  Lastly, Newleaf has great bagels!

3.description: Went to Jae this past weekend for a massage to ease some nagging hip pain. Now I wish I would have gone weeks earlier! She really knows how muscles work together and how to come at pain from different angles to get to the root of the problem. I've known several people who've gone to her in the past and continue to recommend her (as will I).

1.description: The one time I visted Lumbar Lounge, it was a very comfortable, relaxing environment.I've got to go back soon.

2.description: I am so spoiled by going here.  I love these women.  Both Suzen and Liz are amazing masseuses and the environment is so low key, cozy and relaxing, with great smells and music.  I've never felt better in a better place.

0.description: As a massage whore, I had a lovely massage by Susan today.Her space is charming and relaxing and it smells so good. The room was dark, peaceful and her touch was perfect. I loved the facial massage and she worked well with my fibromyalgia. She did just enough for results but not too hard to hurt me. I always find massage therapists are either too much or too little. But she was "just right, baby bear"I plan to see her monthly or more for my fibro. I am planning on sleeping like a baby tonight.Her massages are $75 for an hour and I think $110 for 90 minutes. I am going for the 90 minutes next time.The space is only open by appointment only which is nice.

4.description: Not the best massage I have ever gotten, but definately a good one. The ladies are nice and the office is warm and cosy and just new-agey enough to make you feel relaxed and not enough to make you nauseous.I will go back for sure and check out the other massage therapist.

1.description: I pass by this place daily and finally decided to try it out for brunch. This is not the place to go for brunch!My boyfriend and I started with drinks. He got a spiked iced coffee that was basically watered down coffee with a splash of baileys. My "Michelada" was a Modelo beer with a glass of tomato juice-I had to build my own drink. We ordered a breakfast burrito and a turkey burger, that was to come with spicy olive tapenade. It took almost an hour for the food to arrive; we had to remind the server we hadn't gotten our food after 45 minutes. The breakfast burrito was just that-a mediocre burrito with egg, potato and chorizo. My turkey burger was clearly frozen and came with a fried egg and avocado, NOT spicy olive tapenade as per the menu. My sweet potato fries were the best part of the meal. Brunch menu is small and food isn't abundant, if they don't forget about your order.

9.description: I went here and ordered a burger and beers and it was all good.  The burger was very good sized and juicy and they have a variety of beers to choose from.  I didn't know exactly what to try and the very nice bartender lady offered me a selection of three for 12 bucks.  I liked the second the best (IPA) but all were of good quality.  The crowd was not much on that week night but was eclectic which made it more interesting and comforting.  It's brand new so go try it.  Life's too short :)

23.description: Pub 626 is a great new pub in Rogers Park!!  The owners, manager, and staff are extremely friendly.  They are supporting some local breweries and have a great beer selection.  The wings are as good as I have had in Chicago, crispy and very juicy. I have been a couple times and am looking forward to my next evening at Pub 626. Everyone needs to come check it out!!!

5.description: We got here halfway through the hawks playoff game and lucked out in getting what I'm sure was the last table in the place!  It was pretty busy, but I was surprised that the volume level wasn't terrible. Of course we were all really focused on the game.It was a Monday so the 626 burger was only $6.26!  A really good burger at a really good price. Yummy sweet potato fries made me happy, but I was a little jealous of how good my husband's fries were!This isn't a gourmet restaurant. It's a pub, with a good burger and friendly service.  I'm happy with that.Oh and that Smith Forge Hard Cider was lovely!

25.description: I didn't even know this was here. I went in expecting the old place and was pleasantly surprised to find this instead! The staff was amazing... So friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is great too. I was just there for drinks last night and I'm tempted to go again tonight. Love it!!

12.description: Wow is all I have to say about Pub 626!!! Went in and had the all you can eat fish and chips and was totally worth it!!! The service was totally great and was very polite. I recommend this place place anyone that is interested in a great environment  and great food!!!
