21.description: Great place to hang out, pub fare that is slightly better than average.  They're brand new and definitely still finding their legs, but I can see a lot of potential.  Looking forward to coming back soon and seeing how things may have changed.Was here with my permanent roommate, the TV was too loud, but assume that's because a Bulls game was on.  Service was excellent, super friendly, and knowledgeable from the step into the restaurant until the moment we left.  We got the mac and cheese, nachos, and chicken pasta dish.  All of them were good, but nothing necessarily to write home about.  But we will be back again to play pool, watch a game, and enjoy the local beer selection.

16.description: I was a regular since the first week this bar was open...and today I was asked never to return because I have honest feedback. Out of 7 servers, I had a complaint about one.  Out of an entire menu, I said the sweet potato fries could be a little more crunchy. This SOLICITED feedback from staff is why one owner said "don't spend your money here because you complain too much" and another asked (less than 90 seconds later) "why are you still here?"  I have never - in my personal or professional life as a corporate event planner that manages expectations all day long  - felt so attacked  and inappropriate then I did after this owner's response. Let me clarify that I was not drunk, per my bar tab. Unfortunately...management doesn't care about the customer's feedback. Just ask them.

17.description: I went to Pub 626 for the first time with a few friends last night and we were all pleasantly surprised! After a string a "meh" restaurants in this location, I hadn't been aching to try this new one, but after a suggestion from a friend, I'm glad we did. Food: My boyfriend and I each got a burger. I ordered mine medium with swiss & bleu cheese and grilled onions with a side of sweet potato fries. It also came with side of some sort of sweet aioli, I think, but whatever it was, I was happy to slather it on my burger and dip my fries in it. The burger was really tasty! And actually cooked a perfect medium. My only minor complaint was my fries got a little soggy as they cooled down, and I would recommend using pickle slices instead of the little half pickles that come on the side of the sandwiches and burgers, but overall a great burger & fries! My friends got fish & chips and the cubano sandwich. Everyone said their food was great and one friend said she'd definitely come back to Pub 626 again. Atmosphere/Service: The service was a bit slow, but not offensively so. It is a very large space, and our server was clearly training a new employee. He was very pleasant, just a little slow to refill water and check on us, but we were there to hang out and chat over dinner so this was not a bad thing in our case. We toyed with the idea of playing pool, and it's a nice option to have. I like that this place has struck a balance between a place to hang out and a solid restaurant. Hopefully they survive so we can go back for more. I love knowing there's another solid sit-down restaurant within walking distance to grab a bite to eat or hang out with friends. They have great daily deals (Thursday was $2 off burgers & sandwiches - yay!) We'll be back soon!

10.description: This place is super nice. I love Rogers Park but we lack a sports bar.  This place could be amazing. The staff is great and seem to have a commitment to local craft beer.

11.description: Great veggie options! Good location, just off the Morse red-line.

26.description: Great addition to the Rogers Park neighborhood. The food is good and the space is perfect for either a quick dinner after work or a large event with friends.  Great draught beer selection and friendly staff.  I'm excited to see where Pub 626 goes!

22.description: Had the I love meat burger.  It was delicious.   I love the steak fries.  Definitely eating here agsin!

0.description: Who'd think that a Pub, in the middle of Rogers Parkwould have so many GREAT, vegetarian options??!!!  Pub 626 most certainly does!626.Let's discuss if I may, The Amazing Kale Burger.  It might just be the BEST veggie burger, I've ever had.  At Pub 626, this amaze-balls kale burger is topped with kale chips, chipotle-cream cheese and a side of black bean spread.  Oh but wait, did I mention it also comes with fries.  You choose, sweet potato or regular...I always get mine with a side of garlic mayo for an added taste explosion.The next best Veggie Love option is The Veggie-Ca Do.  It's a nicely sized veggie quesadilla type deal with avocado, kale, pico de gallo, black bean spread and  pepper jack cheese. It's so damn good! There are also a few pasta choices I have yet to try because I can't stop eating the Amazing Kale Burger and The Veggie-Ca Do.   Mhhhmmm...Up next, The Sunday Brunch.  I would have never thought that a pub would even know what Quinoa or Kimchi is, let alone serve it on a Sunday for brunch, in a bowl... Pub 626 does it and does it well!  The Breakfast Bowl is served with spicy tofu, an over easy egg (or whatever way you desire), tomatoes, kimchi, sauteed onions and drizzled with tomatillo salsa.  Hot Damn!Other brunch options are: The Veggie Breakfast Burrito, Chilaquiles, Veggie Breakfast Burger, or you can always, build your own omelet....Side Note(s)... Pool Table, Photo Booth, Video Game(s) and Awesome Daily Specials!...Side Side Note... It's a stone's throw away from the Morse stop on the Red line.So when you've had a few, no worries... :)  *Eating Out With A Girl* #EOWAG #EatingOutWithAGirl

20.description: We went on burger night. It's 6.26$ for a burger and fries. I think that's about 2$ off the normal price.  I found it a bit over down for medium. Sweet potato fries were a bit salty but ok.I had chicken fingers. Can't really go wrong with those. They were crispy, I liked that! The honey mustard and BBQ sauce were good too. Would return but not sure what I'd get. Small menu. It was also 8$ double draft night. My boyfriend got 2 drafts that he was happy with.

19.description: New restaurant/ Bar and I crave there food daily! And very nicely priced.. Honestly THE BEST FOOD IVE HAD IN ROGERS PARK sense I've moved here  5 years ago.. And there staff is always there to help and quick to help..

2.description: Eh. It's nothing special. They have a good food and beer selection. Their roasted chicken quesadilla is pretty tasty. In the grand scheme of things, they are one of the better dining options on Morse, but the food isn't anything special compared to other similar spots outside of Rogers Park. This isn't to say it's a terrible place, just that there's really nothing that sets it apart from any other 'bar/grill'. As far as atmosphere goes, the exposed ceilings and concrete floors make it feel like I'm sitting in a Costco food court, not some place I'd want to spend any length of time at. Service was average for Rogers Park. I waited 5 mins at the bar (on a not so busy night) before a bartender came over for my order. Probably average given how not-so-busy the place was.So, all of this 'meh' is why I'm giving it a 3 star rating. Nothing was terrible, nothing was amazing, it was just an overall meh experience.For those of your coming for booze...they're slightly above other Rogers Park area bars, but that's to be expected.

18.description: Stopped in for brunch today after a trip to the Glenwood Farmer's Market. They have a somewhat limited brunch menu, but had enough options for us to choose from. My husband had the french toast, 4 thick wedges accompanied by a berry compote, butter and syrup. I had the market omelet, which included a few veggies and a bit of mushroom tapenade. It was quite large and tasty, and came with a piece of toasted baguette and butter. I would have liked the option for a side of fruit instead of toast -- and perhaps that would have been possible, though I didn't see it on the menu and didn't ask.My husband also had the spiked lemonade, which was on special for $5 during brunch, along with mimosas and bloody marys. The pub was pretty empty while we were there, but it was only 11AM on a Sunday, and I imagine it gets more crowded later in the day for brunch.All in all, a good experience. We'll definitely be back in the evening to try some of the regular menu items.

13.description: We went on burger night. It's 6.26$ for a burger and fries. I think that's about 2$ off the normal price.  I found it a bit over down for medium. Sweet potato fries were a bit salty but ok.I had chicken fingers. Can't really go wrong with those. They were crispy, I liked that! The honey mustard and BBQ sauce were good too. Would return but not sure what I'd get. Small menu. It was also 8$ double draft night. My boyfriend got 2 drafts that he was happy with.

4.description: First visit--626 replaced the previous "cantina" place and only open about five weeks. Good first impression: will be back.Guy that greeted us and waited our table was really friendly and quick and detailed the entire time. Better quality service than you get at a lot of other corner places.Had the pulled pork nachos. Expected very little from a pub grub place, and I'd say they were a step above what I expected: flavorful, meaty, and served with a homemade-tasting queso sauce and fresh cut avocado.Craft beer selection isn't extensive, but enough had enough solid standbys (Revolution IPA, Lagunitas IPA) and another local brown ale, that I was plenty happy for a neighborhood pub. Printed beer menu was out of date and only listed some brewery names instead of the actual beers.  Beer deal was $6 for a pint, or $9 for a 32oz. Marks down for place closing at 10p even though the website said midnight so we got pushed out a little earlier than expected. Ambiance still feels a little empty, but that was mostly cause they didn't have a ton of people yet and it's a big space. But food exceeded expectations, friendly service, and easy going and walking distance so I'll be back.

24.description: This is a solid place to go if you want some standard pub food, conveniently located in Rogers Park.  It didn't seem like there was a ton to write home about, but I will say that my fish sandwich was great.  The fries come in cute paper bags.  The waitstaff was friendly, even asking if I wanted ice in my water, which I didn't!  I think once 626 gets into the groove, it will be a great place to hang out in the neighborhood.

6.description: Super bad service...drinks watered down unless they were served from a can. Food was cold. Manager extremely uncaring. He only catered to his regulars seated towards the front area. Little Indian server was only attentive to one boy in our party of four. Everyone else was ignored. Sat without a drink for quite some time. By the time he asked me, I was not interested. This place had no substance , lacked any positive vibes or a feel-good atmosphere and in my opinion is not worthy of a Second visit. Do yourself a favor and do not even attempt a first. We spent well over 100 bucks, and it was a dismal disappointing experience. Sad because this place is only a block From my apartment and I was hoping to host my work bday party there. Not gonna happen now. I highly UN-recommend this place with my deepest regret and hope you make a Better choice. It's a definite no from me.

15.description: Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. WAY overpriced. If you're going to charge $12 for a salad, at least give me the dressing I ask for. The owner owns the crappy bar, The Glenwood, next door. That place is terrible as well.

7.description: I'm impressed... Especially for Rogers Park! Okay, that said I'm indeed going to be checking this pub out again this week as I have business up north and want to try some new and exciting restaurants! I'm excited for the other foods on the menu...

8.description: Awesome pub food! The fish tacos are excellent and great Tues. $2 off price!  Great Cosmorittas as well for $5! Must come back!

3.description: Stopped by here for a quick bite to eat. We were at another place around the corner that didn't serve food so we came here to get our fill. Pub 626 is a modern open floor plan sports bar. They have tall boys and bar seating as well as some lounge chair areas. The burger and fries I had were great and they had a good selection of beers on tap. This was like a bar you would find closer to the loop but without the large crowds. It is similar to Standard Bar, Fifty/50, or Benchmark. The bartender that served us was very friendly and joined us in some friendly conversation. I thought this was a great place and if we lived in the area this would be a regular place we would come to. There seemed to be a good amount of regulars who were coming in for a relaxing night at the bar. They weren't dressed to impress and simply wanted to throw a few back.

14.description: Great place to hang out, pub fare that is slightly better than average.  They're brand new and definitely still finding their legs, but I can see a lot of potential.  Looking forward to coming back soon and seeing how things may have changed.Was here with my permanent roommate, the TV was too loud, but assume that's because a Bulls game was on.  Service was excellent, super friendly, and knowledgeable from the step into the restaurant until the moment we left.  We got the mac and cheese, nachos, and chicken pasta dish.  All of them were good, but nothing necessarily to write home about.  But we will be back again to play pool, watch a game, and enjoy the local beer selection.

0.description: If you're looking for great massage at a reasonable price in a relaxing spa environment.  Stop by this conveniently located spa, across the street from the Howard train station in Rogers Park.  The massage therapy room wall designed with  a tropical theme, quiet and peaceful makes you feel like you are on a warm, sunny  beach .  The sounds of waterfalls, birds ... , the scents of organic oils and candles relieves you of all your worries.  A friendly atmosphere where you can enjoy some great snacks as you wait for a wonderful and relaxing therapeutic massage.

58.description: Chez Delisay's is amazing!!! Even as I write this review, I still have a smile on my face from the wonderful dinner my boyfriend and I had there. We love Michelle's friendliness, thoughtful, and attentive service. She's outstanding.Heidi is great in the kitchen, whipping up her delicious sauce for the shrimp and grits.And Victoria, she makes you feel like you're at home with her engaging conversation and warm smile. Her food is delicious, well executed, and one of a kind. We had the fried chicken (moist and crunchy), shrimp and grits (flavorful and perfectly spiced) peach cobbler (heaven), and sweet potato pie (better than my family's recipe). It was a perfect evening and we can't wait to go back.

56.description: While the food is delicious and merits a visit by itself, what really makes this place stand out is the service.I stopped in for dinner with a few people after hearing from a friend how good it was, and we were not disappointed in the slightest. The four of us were greeted courteously and got seated immediately--it's a fairly simple, quiet place with a few tables. I had the Cajun ribs, and through my companions tried the chicken gumbo, mashed potatoes, cornbread, collard greens and peach cobbler.The ribs are all you want in barbecue: fall-off-the-bone with the exact amount of spiciness to keep you fixated on it towards the end. The three side dishes were all very good: mashed potatoes were light and flavorful, the cornbread delicious, and the collard greens went well to balance out the sweet/spicy tang of the ribs. The peach cobbler was also great: the peaches were not formless fruit mush as you might find in lesser establishments and had a great texture.Service was attentive and respectful the entire time, and the manager came out herself to see how we were doing. Towards the end, they checked with us again to see if everything was alright and encouraged us to come back anytime. We'll definitely be back and will remember to bring a bottle of wine next time (it's BYOB and from what I understand there's no corkage fee). Great food, great prices, great service.

29.description: Delicious food - the salad was so good (I really appreciated the high quality ingredients), loved the crab balls & hush puppies, & we devoured the fried chicken & shrimp po'boy. And last but definitely not least, the personalized & warm service & delicious food made us feel like our meal was someone's labor of love!

42.description: Great food! Excellent service! Best shrimp po boy I have ever had, fresh shrimp with the perfect Cajun spices, just enough to be hot, but not enough to slow the pace at which I defeated the po boy, the french bread was fresh, but was not the best.   Also had the vegetable soup, which was delicious.  It had a good deal of vegetables and seasoning,  very similar to a chicken soup.  The ambiance was classy cajun.  I think the owner ws my waitress, and she was very courteous, and perfect with all of her timing.   I will be back.

23.description: I had the pleasure of dining with Kurt Z and his charming daughter.  The dinner was a fantastic tour of down home cooking.  Standouts were the Shrimp Po Boy sandwich, the Chunky Thigh sandwich and the FRIED CHICKEN!!  There was only one order of fried chicken left when we came in - that tells the whole story. It is delicious! The sides are solid. The gumbo is really good but it has a lot of tomato in it (which I like) and the roux is definitely a little different. So if you're looking for a typical gumbo this is not it.  The peach cobbler was excellent and the bread pudding is out of this world. Along with great food is really excellent service. Everyone at the restaurant is very friendly and really wants you to enjoy your experience. Definitely check this place out.

47.description: I took my partner out for dinner last night for his birthday. I chose Delisay's because we both enjoy Cajun and it's located nearby. What a delectable discovery! We entered the restaurant and were greeted by the owner and namesake. Both she and Michelle exude sincere warmth and  kindness. - Southern hospitality? The meal: My partner and I had the Cheesy Shrimp and Grits along with red beans and rice, garlic mashed potatoes, corn bread, green beans. Desert - sweet potato pie and lava cake. Amazing does not begin to describe the entire meal. Throughout the entire meal my partner and I talked about how mouth watering our meal was and when we would return and with whom, including another couple we know who have a cajun background. I am not a fan of grits but the cheesy shrimp and grits was out of this world. My taste buds danced! The garlic mashed potatoes (I make a damned good garlic mashed potatoes) were better than I thought  they could be made. The red beans and rice perfectly prepared with just the right spicing and texture. The sweet potato pie was yummy (when I go back I must ask if they sell entire pie to take home). And the lava cake was a chocoholic's delight. The food, hostesses' charm and kindness aided my making my partner's birthday extra special. Thank you Delisay and Michelle. We will be back, frequently! Big hugs!

8.description: Chez Delisay's is amazing!!! Even as I write this review, I still have a smile on my face from the wonderful dinner my boyfriend and I had there. We love Michelle's friendliness, thoughtful, and attentive service. She's outstanding.Heidi is great in the kitchen, whipping up her delicious sauce for the shrimp and grits.And Victoria, she makes you feel like you're at home with her engaging conversation and warm smile. Her food is delicious, well executed, and one of a kind. We had the fried chicken (moist and crunchy), shrimp and grits (flavorful and perfectly spiced) peach cobbler (heaven), and sweet potato pie (better than my family's recipe). It was a perfect evening and we can't wait to go back.

31.description: Warm, attentive, friendly service with amazing food. What more can you ask for? (PS...get the fried chicken and banana foster. Thank me later)

34.description: Discovered this place a couple weeks ago and was completely blown away. Upon walking in we were welcomed in by the owner like we were walking into her home. She was beyond friendly and attentive. I love the touch of asking what our names were and using our names. The food was spot on fantastic. We ordered the cajun friend chicken and it was to die for as were the sides. Everything was beyond flavorful and fresh. I would go as far as to say this was the best fried chicken I've ever had. Also, as someone who's spent a decent amount of time in New Orleans, this meal was far better than anything I've ever eaten in New Orleans.

16.description: The service and the food was fantastic! Had the fried chicken.  My favorite sides were the garlic mash potatoes, red beans and rice, and cabbage.  The bananas fosters cheesecake slice was amazing.

13.description: Went to this restaurant for the first time today. The shrimp poboy and fried chicken were delicious, and the desserts- bread pudding and peach cobbler- were excellent.  Can't wait to go back for the shrimp and grits.

11.description: Food. Is. Love. and this place LOVES so hard. The food was delectable and the women running the place are the sweetest, most attentive people. Here, you're home. Here, the food is served with heart and soul and you can taste the difference. Crab cakes = unreal. Fried chicken = heaven. Sweet potato pie? Yes. Go here, enjoy and support great local businesses.

39.description: Friday night 7:30pm, 5-minute wait. The corn and Andouille soup was perfect, 10/10. The shrimp poboy was great, plump shrimp and a tasty, spicy aioli. Cornbread with jalapeños was also terrific, almost too much food by that point. Service was outstanding and the owner/chef came out and greeted each table, a true pro.A unique and delicious addition to Rogers Park restaurant scene, and very affordable.BYOB

37.description: I absolutely loved this place! Everything tasted perfect and the service was fantastic! You should definitely give it a try. Thanks Victoria and Michelle!

0.description: First of all, let me say thank you to everybody who rated this place so high.  You were all 100% right with this place.My wife and I stopped in early on Saturday night and we were greeted by Michelle who took great care of us.We shared a slab of ribs, 1/2 fried cajun chicken, cup of gumbo, sides of cabbage, garlic mashed potatoes, red beans and rice, cabbage and cornbread.Half of the meats are going home with us, along with another side of cabbage and 2 more pieces of cornbread.Everything that we chose was delicious.  It was one of those meals where we took a bite and knowingly looked at each other and knew that we found a great place to dine. When we come back, it will be difficult to know if we should try something new or stick with these choices.  That's a good problem to have.Check this place out and tell me if you agree or not!

38.description: Food was so good, prices very reasonable, and the ladies who run the place are friendly. We had the hush puppies, Cajun fries, fried chicken, collard greens, cabbage, and mashed potatoes. Everything was wonderful.  At the end of the meal, they gave my 19 month old a Popsicle (after checking with us first), which made her whole day.  Highly recommend and really glad to have a good restaurant in the neighborhood.

51.description: Very friendly and attentive service and we are happy to support a new business in Rogers Park. My fiance had the half cajun fried chicken, which he reported was incredible. Some items were really good, while the sides were just ok and could be spiced up a lot more. We added our own hot sauce to the red beans/rice and seasoning to the mashed potatoes. I had the vegetarian poboy sandwich which was quite good. Thank you and keep up the good work!

27.description: I started with the crab balls that came with a mustard type sauce which were amazing. Which I followed with half chicken fried with red beans and rice, galic mashed potatoes and jalapeno cheese cornbread which was also amazing. I am very satisfied with the good and service I received from here. I hope to be back there very soon. I can't wait to try the ribs, and po' boys.

32.description: Could not have asked for better food or better service. Everything our group tried was absolutely delicious - catfish, red beans and rice, green beans, cornbread, and bread pudding and peach cobbler! Delisay and Michelle provide great service and stories that'll keep you laughing and make you feel at home. Will definitely be back and will recommend to everyone we know.

54.description: Wow! We decided to try this place. We live in west rogers park & it was close & we like Cuban food. It's a byob. Liquor store close. The service, the food, the cleanliness. Such a FIND. Go there! The owner is charming & incredibly talented. The hush puppies were amazing, the gumbo was best I've had in a long time, the fried chicken omg sooooo good. Had peach cobbler to go too. Will definitely go back. So glad they opened. Sweet people!

48.description: What a gem for the north side! The gals were great in accommodating our sometimes overwhelming BYOB Dinner club (yep it's BYOB - always a plus), they didn't seem at all phased by the large party or by our always slightly rambunctious group.We decided to eat tapas style so we could try as many things as possible - this turned out to be an EXCELLENT decision, every single thing I put in my mouth was delicious!On to the FOOD: The highlights for me included the loaded cajun fries, to which you might think, "loaded fries? how boring", and you'd be dead wrong.  They were crispy goodness topped with red onions, tomatoes, red beans and melted cheese - they're even better than they sound...the ribs that were the special that evening were also a star, so tender and just fell off the bone. But my favorite of the night was the battered Chunky Thighs Po'boy - just outstanding!  Stuffed to the gills we were presented with the night's dessert offerings, should we have passed? Oh probably.  But who turns down fresh-out-of-the-oven peach cobbler and bananas foster cheese cake? Answer: nobody. NOBODY.  I still dream about that cheese cake...mmmm amazing!Definitely check out this place as soon as you can, the sisters running it are so kind and really passionate about what they're putting on your plate.  Walk if you're close, make the trip north or south if you're not, it's worth it - trust me!

44.description: LOVE the service! LOVE the food! LOVE the prices! What a wonderful woman the owner is. She makes you feel at home as soon as you walk in the door. Turned out we grew up in the same south suburb, and on the same street. I had the half Cajun fried chicken, collard greens, red beans and rice, and their homemade cornbread, and it was DELISH! My friend got the blackened catfish, garlic mashed potatoes, and cornbread which was equally as good. I will definitely be going back soon, and often. Don't miss this gem!

24.description: Today I went to the Chez Delisay. When I arrived with my party of four, i was informed that they were out of ribs and only had one plate of chicken left. As you can imagine, we were worried we made a mistake coming to the Chez Delisay. However, we asked the server what they did have and we decided we would get a number of dishes and share them. As soon as the first bites of food hit our mouths we understood. This place was unique.  The crab balls were the first dish out. They tasted like hush puppies with little bits of crab. Great texture and flavor. Next they brought out the chicken gumbo. The chicken gumbo didn't have a normal gumbo flavor, but a new gumbo chili fused taste. It was served over rice. After that they brought out the corn bread, collar greens, and red beans and rice. The red beans and rice were good not great but very good. The collar greens were also very good. The corn bread was flavorful, but not the best I have ever had. The dinner plates were ordered were: the chicken, the chunky thighs poboy, the shrimp poboy, and the blackened catfish. WOW, the fried chicken was incredible, my daughter who usually doesn't have much fried food had two pieces of the chicken. It was excellent in flavor and great crunch. Not fatty at all. The chunky thighs poboy was great in flavor not to spicy, good portion and very tasty. I really liked the shrimp poboy. The breading on the shrimp was excellent, great sauce and all in all my favorite dish. The catfish was food and flavorful, but be mindful it was spicy for my mother. The deserts were top notch as well: I had the bread pudding and everyone else had the peach cobbler. Just incredible, good sweet soul food deserts. On top of the amazing food, the servers, cooks and just about everyone there was very social and a lot of fun. We learned a lot about our servers and the owner. The owner has a great back ground. She was a chef for Northwestern Greek Life (ask her about it!!!) Her faith has paid off, she has an incredible restaurant and she is an incredible person.

7.description: Perfect storefront New Orleans themed restaurant, plus  BYOB.Chez Delisay is a wonderful addition to the Roger's Park food scene.  The menu rotates through a list of daily specials for the entree, with a good selection of appetizers, po boys and deserts that are on the menu every day.  The staff are super-friendly and personable.  The chef/owner is welcoming and was very kind to our large group as we kept them open a bit after closing.  Go for a date night or take a half dozen friends out to lunch.  Great place.

49.description: The very first time we ordered food from here we ordered carry out. I was so impressed by the warm welcome when I walked in the front door that it put an immediate smile on my face. I waited a few minutes for them to finish prepping my order and was asked if I wanted anything at all while I waited. We ordered po boy sandwiches on our first trip there and they were amazing!!! Better than most around Chicago, if you can find them! We decided to go back one night and dine in. Everything was fresh, tasty and we were treated like family. The owners are super friendly and treat you like royalty from the minute you walk in the door. Very skilled in the dying art of customer service AND great food!!! Will definitely go back!!

40.description: You have to eat here if you want a Poor Boy sandwich and some New Orleans style cooking.We were hungry, but a group of 4 of us accidently arrived 45 minutes before the restaurant opened. The owner, Victoria saw us milling about and she graciously opened the door and asked us to please come on in. She was so nice, warm and friendly. She is a very nice woman. The restaurant itself is sparsely decorated, but very clean and comfortable. As we were early we enjoyed the place to ourselves and had great and attentive service, but it wasn't fast. To start we enjoyed the fried oyster balls - yum! And the Hush Puppies also yum!We each ordered a different Poor Boy Sandwich, but I think the winner was the Grilled Catfish. The bread was great, the price is right, the spice was delicious, and the presentation was good! Cooked cabbage on the side was also good and spicy - not bland and it retained some crunchiness and wasn't soggy. Finally, we had to try the Peach Cobbler. It was served warm and everyone agreed it was delicious. We ordered 2 servings for a table of four, and although everyone claimed to be full, it was gone in a minute. A very worthwhile place to try!

53.description: After I saw some people on Everyblock raving about this place, the wife and I went Friday night. Score!  I had the half Cajun fried chicken. Awesome, as was the corn & andouille soup, cabbage and red beans n rice.   Denice had the catfish and loved it (and she's not a catfish fan).  The owners are charming. Can't wait to go back for cheese grits n shrimp next week. And gumbo.  And.....Update: Had the Cheesy Shrimp & Grits.  Gawd. So good.

30.description: This is such an amazing place. I used to live in Louisiana and am used to good Cajun food. This place exceeded my expectations. The staff is small and treat you, and your family, like their family. The food is absolutely amazing and since it's BYOB, you can have whatever you want to drink. I would recommend this place to anyone. It is a smaller place capacity  wise so it's definitely  a good idea to call and let them know you're  coming.

46.description: I've dined and wined in Chicago for fourteen years and every restaurant pales in comparison to Chez Delisay's! I'm a big condiment and salt & pepper person and everything was so perfectly seasoned, I didn't touch the salt shaker or even need ketchup for my fries. The cook greeted us and had a lovely conversation, our waitress, Michelle was an angel. The blackened catfish was cooked to perfection. Best collard greens I have ever tasted. Chicken Po Boy was the best outside of New Orleans. AMAZING! Walk a half block down Clark and pick up a bottle of fine wine and treat yourself! This place will make you proud to live in Chicago!

1.description: First time trying Cajun cuisine and absolutely loved this place! The food was great! corn bread  and cabbage were my favorite! Delisay (chef and owner) personally came to us and spent time talking to us at our table, that made us feel really valued as a customer. Michelle was super friendly and kind. This is the reason why I prefer local food places vs chain restaurants, fantastic service, great food, and we paid $20 for a meal for 2!!!I definitely will be going back!

55.description: Great fried chicken , vegetable sides, sweet potato piecand professional service. I'll be back!

9.description: This place is amazing. Just happened upon it and was pleasantly surprised.  I had the fried chicken and two sides: collard greens and garlic mashed potatoes and a side of cornbread. OMG!!  It was delicious.  I can't wait to being others.

26.description: Great experience of NOLa food and energized personable service. A high-quality and affordable addition to the neighborhood. Try the greens if they're on offer! Mm mm. The fried chicken is a revelation. There are scratch-made desserts too, don't miss them. Haven't had anything disappointing in three tries so far.

25.description: EXCITED! I stop by for the first time; I left with menus and dessert (Banana Foster Cake), after a great conversation with the chef & staff. I will be back for some gumbo, shrimp & grits, dessert and more  conversation. A very warm and inviting place to enjoy a delicious meal! WOO-HOO!

12.description: Amazing food, amazing service. The food was so tastefully seasoned with a kick of spice in everything but not over done at all. The owners are absolute sweethearts and made you feel like you were having dinner in their home. I live in South Loop and it was worth the trip to Rogers Park. Please check them out, good people with beautiful souls who can COOOOOK!!! Ill be back :)

59.description: YayWe are definite fans!  Good food at more than fair prices with nice portions. Love love love the chef/owner Victoria  (I think she said).Yelp had the hours listed as opening at 11am. We got there just after noon to find the place closed with posted hours opening at 1pm.  We stood a minute trying to figure out what to do and she saw us to come say hello. We mentioned the mix up with yelp and she invited us in.  Wow - amazing. Everything was really delicious and she was super friendly and fun to talk to. Looking forward to going back for dinner and taking some wine.  BYOB? YES - THANK YOU!

21.description: We enjoyed our visit, and felt like we were dining in the home of new friends.  I found the cuisine to be more traditional Southern than Cajun/Creole, but I enjoyed most everything we ordered.  Fried chicken was excellent and I would go back just to order again.   Cajun ribs were solid, given the limitations of having to be cooked well in advance of service.  Greens were very good, beans just OK.Entree options are limited, service is a little slow, and the place is casually decorated.  We had a large group, and our chef called for reinforcements after our arrival!  But if you come with a fun and relaxed attitude, you will be rewarded with food that is loving made by people who care about the food and you.

17.description: Friday night 7:30pm, 5-minute wait. The corn and Andouille soup was perfect, 10/10. The shrimp poboy was great, plump shrimp and a tasty, spicy aioli. Cornbread with jalapeños was also terrific, almost too much food by that point. Service was outstanding and the owner/chef came out and greeted each table, a true pro.A unique and delicious addition to Rogers Park restaurant scene, and very affordable.BYOB

10.description: Yesterday I was looking on Yelp for places with peach cobbler and this restaurant showed up on the list. It's not too far from my house so I decided to go and have dinner. When I walked in I was greeted by Victoria the owner and she's also the cook. She is very nice and funny. She told me the specials for that day which was 1/2 cajun chicken. So I chose the half cajun chicken, red beans and rice, and cabbage. I also got a cup of gumbo as an appetizer. My goodness the chicken was really good and moist. The red beans and rice and cabbage had really good flavor. The gumbo had the right amount of heat to it. There were some desserts on the specials board but I got the peach cobbler. While I was eating, Victoria would occasionally come out the kitchen and talk to me. I could tell she really enjoys making the customers happy with her food. The food is really good. Best cajun food I've had. I guess it's a plus since she is from New Orleans. It's also a BYOB and no corkage fee. I definitely will be going back.

5.description: Ate food from Chez Delisay's last night for the second time, and definitely recommend the restaurant. Earlier in February I placed an order over the phone to bring Cajun fried chicken to a pot luck dinner, and every piece was eaten pretty quickly.This time eating at the restaurant, had the gumbo, shrimp poboy sandwich, hush puppies and crab cakes. Best crab cakes I've had in a long time. Ended the meal with the peach cobbler, and wanted to lick the bowl at the end.Enjoyed the conversations with Victoria (the chef) and her sister, Michelle. Looking forward to going back again soon!

3.description: We dined here for the first time last night and the food is fantastic. We had the smoked chicken,Cajun ribs, shrimp po boy sandwich, crab cakes, salmon croquettes, hush puppies, red beans and rice and corn bread. It's byob so we brought two bottles of wine for the three of us. Everything was delicious and the two sisters Victoria (delizay) and Michelle were so gracious and welcoming we felt like we knew them for years. Her son also works in the kitchen so it's truly a family run operation. The prices are so reasonable we ordered more than we would have normally. My bbq rib entree was so tender you didn't need a knife. We shared the peach cobbler for dessert and it was the perfect ending to a great meal. I hope everyone goes and experiences this great place run by nice people!

35.description: Great food, great staff, nice space with good music, BYO, and reasonably priced, what more could you ask for? Think great seasoning with fine quality ingredients. If you are someone who is dislikes hot or spicy food don't shy away. The food is not overpowered by spice but rather enhanced. Whet there for dinner last night and mentioned I was not a fan of Catfish which was the special so without me asking they offered to make the Fried Chicken for me. It was some of the best I have had. Would love to go on but they just opened and I am going back for lunch right now.

19.description: My husband and I were looking for a new place to try last weekend, and this place stood out on Yelp so we decided to give it a go!  We were no disappointed!  It is an unassuming restaurant on a quiet stretch of Clark.  The staff was incredibly nice and welcoming, but the food was the real winner.I had the Cajun fried chicken.  Being from Alabama, I know good fried chicken, and theirs is amazing.  The corn bread melts in your mouth and the cabbage savory.  My husband had the blackened catfish with red beans and rice.  I tried both, and they were to die for.  Now, for the dessert.  We had the homemade beignets.  I wish I could have taken them home with me!I've been talking about this place non-stop.  It's a must try!  You wont be disappointed.

28.description: Loved it!!  Took Pops out for his birthday dinner here as the "foodies" have been muttering about this place online.  The restaurant was cozy, maybe a little sterile, but comfortable.  The food was all fresh and made with the secret ingredient...love!!  I know as we had the owner sitting with us telling her story over a beer at closing time, delightful woman!Had the Chicken Etouffee, with red beans and rice and cornbread.  Outstanding!!  Wanted to take a loaf of cornbread home it was that good.  Finished with Banana Foster cheesecake  :)...Highly recommend getting here for the food and the Delisay staff!!

45.description: tl;dr: AMAZING. JUST GO EAT HERE. Wonderful food, and a fantastic chef - she's basically the sweetest person I've ever met, probably an actual angel. And the food tastes like it was cooked by an angel. I am not even exaggerating, try it for yourself asap!

33.description: This place is awesome! I was craving some good gumbo since I had some for the first time in New Orleans a few months ago with my sister. Best gumbo ever. I also got the fried chicken and it was seasoned perfectly! My boyfriend had the ribs they were very flavorful and fell right off the the bone. I will be returning next time my sister is in Chicago!

43.description: The food was delicious. We had the chicken gumbo expertly cajan spiced with cornbread to die for,  ribs where the juicy meat just feel from the bone, and the shrimp poboy. All just spiced perfectly. I wish I had room for the peach cobbler.... Not only was the food delicious, but Michelle and her sister were absolutely wonderful hosts. They treated us like family with their warm hearts and big smiles. I've already decided on what I want to taste the very next time that I return, which will be soon....great addition to Rogers Park. Thank you Ladies...

2.description: We enjoyed our visit, and felt like we were dining in the home of new friends.  I found the cuisine to be more traditional Southern than Cajun/Creole, but I enjoyed most everything we ordered.  Fried chicken was excellent and I would go back just to order again.   Cajun ribs were solid, given the limitations of having to be cooked well in advance of service.  Greens were very good, beans just OK.Entree options are limited, service is a little slow, and the place is casually decorated.  We had a large group, and our chef called for reinforcements after our arrival!  But if you come with a fun and relaxed attitude, you will be rewarded with food that is loving made by people who care about the food and you.

18.description: Loved it!!  Took Pops out for his birthday dinner here as the "foodies" have been muttering about this place online.  The restaurant was cozy, maybe a little sterile, but comfortable.  The food was all fresh and made with the secret ingredient...love!!  I know as we had the owner sitting with us telling her story over a beer at closing time, delightful woman!Had the Chicken Etouffee, with red beans and rice and cornbread.  Outstanding!!  Wanted to take a loaf of cornbread home it was that good.  Finished with Banana Foster cheesecake  :)...Highly recommend getting here for the food and the Delisay staff!!

41.description: Absolutely the best fried chicken I've ever had. I got the Cajun fried chicken with mashed potatoes and red beans and rice. My boyfriend got the smoked Cajun chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans. We also got corn bread and peach cobbler. Victoria (our server) was the nicest person ever. She made the whole experience even better. This place needs to get more publicity. Seriously the best place in Rogers Park that I've tried so far.

52.description: Food is great and the service is hands down! Staff treat you like family and their professionalism does not waiver! Very excited to have this business in Rogers Park/Edgewater! Wishing this new establishment much success. It nice to have a different option besides the abundant Chinese and Hispanic restaurants with a dash of Ethiopian mainly on Clark. The fried chicken is plentiful and fried to perfection, a must try!Prices are reasonable, portions are appropriate and it's BYOB.

50.description: All I can say is, I felt really loved after my experience here. The staff was super warm, joyful, and attentive and made me feel right at home - asking me how my day was, how I liked the neighborhood, how the food was, etc. The food....amaaaazing!! I ordered the gumbo, and oh man, I'd eat it everyday if I could..so hearty and just the perfect amount of spice. It was complemented well by the sweet (but not too sweet!) cornbread. The portions were super generous, but I still couldn't get enough and ordered the peach cobbler, which was divine! I came with several of my friends and we all loved what we (and each other) ordered. I was lucky enough to try their ribs and fried chicken, with sides of collard greens and mashed potatoes...I'd recommend it all!! I can't wait to come back and try more of their dishes. =)

4.description: Chez Delisay's serves up some amazing Cajun food. The menu is simple and small, but the food is incredibly delicious. They're only serving the best that they can serve, and since they are new, they're slowly adding more items to the menu. So far, I have eaten:Blackened catfish: really good flavours, but it was a bit more stronger tasting than what I'm used to. Fried Cajun chicken: better than Popeyes in the sense that it won't make you feel heavy. Juicy and flavourful, no ragretsGumbo: omg this was amazing and I'm so glad they happened to have it on a Friday! Nicely seasoned and has some kick to it! Garlic mashed potatoes: literally, GARLIC mashed potatoes. So creamy and garlicky, this side will not disappoint you.Corn bread: so moist. Much yum. Wow. Also has tiny bits of jalapeño in it, but it's not spicy so don't worry! Red beans and rice: this was filled to the brim and really good.Cabbage: pretty standard cabbage side dish but well seasoned. Hush puppies: cute tiny balls of delicious. The best hush puppies I've ever had.Crab cakes: plump and full of crab. Yum.Bread pudding: hnnngggggg my girlfriend doesn't like raisins BUT LOVED THE BREAD PUDDING FULL OF RAISINS. Peach cobbler: overkill. This was the "peach" on top. Perfect way to end the meal.But enough about the food, the service here is PHENOMENAL. Michelle made sure we were well taken care of and was very attentive whilst not being so intrusive. She took the time to explain things to us and ask for our feedback to better improve our experience. Delisay also came out to have a chat with us and already, I felt like family! I did not want to leave the restaurant... but it's okay, I will come back for sure.  So overall, this restaurant is a lovely addition to the Roger's Park neighbourhood. Do your taste buds a favour and come here.

6.description: Once again, other Yelpers helped me pick a winner.  Thanks to all who post reviews.  Run, don't walk, to Chez Delisay's.  The food was all delicious and forget the word service, we were cooked for, served and visited with by family we hadn't met before.  That's how inviting they were at the end of a Saturday night.  Others have talked about the food; it's a relatively small menu and it sounds like Delisay creates alternate theme menus for holidays.  She was describing what they served for Mardi Gras and we were all sorry to have missed it.  So go, enjoy and support these people who are throwing their souls into the restaurant.

22.description: Amazing food, amazing service. The food was so tastefully seasoned with a kick of spice in everything but not over done at all. The owners are absolute sweethearts and made you feel like you were having dinner in their home. I live in South Loop and it was worth the trip to Rogers Park. Please check them out, good people with beautiful souls who can COOOOOK!!! Ill be back :)

15.description: This place is absolutely AMAZING! Flavorful, great collards, chicken and fish, excellent and friendly service!

57.description: This place was absolutely amazing to go along with Victoria, Heidi and Michelle. We decided to go to this place on Thursday since they have a special entree of Cheesy grits and shrimp. We arrived around 8:20 and were worried that it would be gone for the day, they did not disappoint. Talk about service, they were out of grits but miraculously whipped up a batch specifically for us. Heidi made the sauce which was flavorful and had just the right amount of spice to it, literally perfection top chef worthy. We ordered that entree and the fried chicken which was so juicy and tender and had awesome flavor and the portion was huge as well. We also ordered the red beans and rice and mashed potatoes, and the corn bread which was amazing as well. We had to try the peach cobbler and sweet potato pie which would make you slap your mother. We will definitely be coming back and ordering one of those for Thanksgiving. The service was over the top and I am a picky person when it comes to that. They really take pride in the things they cook and that is rare these days. Its a secret ingredient in the peach cobbler but you will have to guess that. We will be back on a Saturday because we heard the Gumbo is out of this world. Did I mention this spot is BYOB? Blessings on Blessings and feel free to bring some Bacardi Silver, I think they would appreciate that and you wont be disappointed as well.

20.description: I dream about the fried chicken every single night. Seriously, nothing on this menu is anything short of mind bogglingly delicious. Lovely people, too. A million stars.

36.description: The sisters do an awesome job. The food is authentic, not over spiced; and oh-so tasty. Service is good, there are NO flat screen TV's. The servings are generous and prices modest. We'll be back.

14.description: This is such an amazing place. I used to live in Louisiana and am used to good Cajun food. This place exceeded my expectations. The staff is small and treat you, and your family, like their family. The food is absolutely amazing and since it's BYOB, you can have whatever you want to drink. I would recommend this place to anyone. It is a smaller place capacity  wise so it's definitely  a good idea to call and let them know you're  coming.

28.description: I only live two blocks away from here so it's nice to have a beer store on this part of Clark street that carries more besides Corona and Miller Light. They have a decent selection of Belgian beers (my favorite) but man the prices here are too high. If the owner would lower the prices a little bit I would be here all the time.  (And yes I am aware that Belgian beer can be more expensive but I've found cheaper places)

1.description: Great selection of craft beer. They also have the usual liquor and wine etc. If they don't have it in stock they can probably get it for you. They also have some nice obscure liquor and cordials. Nice people to do business with.

9.description: Henry has built quite a wine selection here over the last couple years, since remodeling.  This one man show, has the best full-bodied red wine selection in the area.  And the craft spirits collection is excellent.  You can find Masterson's Rye here, the top scoring whisky of the year!

29.description: Seeing Belgian Ales advertised on the awning was enough to grab my attention riding by. Not what you'd expect on this strech of North Clark. I'm not enough of a Belgian fan to judge those but their overall beer selection is great. Lots of local (Two Brothers, Half Acre, Goose Island) and regional (Bells, Great Lakes, New Holland) and national (Breckenridge, Anchor) selections. The wine offerings seem to have been selected with equal care. They also carry local coffee from Metropolis. And they are (or at least were in 2007) open on Christmas day.

23.description: Love this place!  Located a block away from my place - has a great (and varied) selection of wines and just added some exceptional wines from Maryhill Winery in WA.  Check out their Red Blend - fantastic and exceptional price!Owner is extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  I always stop here to see what's new.  Check it out for yourself! :)

5.description: Fantastic selection of craft beer, wine and spirits. Friendly staff to boot. I'm bummed I just moved out of the neighborhood but was turned on to some new breweries by these guys. I'll definitely return when I'm back in this hood!This place could use a bit more decorating and some music. It's eerily quiet in here and with the blank walls and exposed check out counter...something decor wise is missing.d

31.description: Great selection of moderately priced reds and an effing AMAZING selection of beers!They have wine tasting on Saturdays, I think from Noon to 4, but I'm not positive. Conveniently and well stocked, I'll definitely be back!

25.description: I'm so glad to have this place in my neighborhood. As a major beer enthusiast, their selection isn't the best around but it's phenomenal for a local establishment, and the owners are always eager to give recommendations. They're very friendly and willing to help out in any way possible. Their prices are around average. I still make the occasional excursion to the larger stores in the city if I'm making a really large purchse, but for regular beer buying these guys are my go-to.

12.description: This guy is great. You find here liquor that fits your budget. You want a nice bottle of red for your boss. You got it. You want a forty. They got that too. Want organic beer, Yup.  Wine tasting and beer tasting. Big variety of imports. Pet friendly too.

37.description: The owner is down to earth and friendly.  The Belgium beer and wine choices are excellent.  It is located on the northeast corner of Columbia and Clark.  He has some obscure single malt scotch and is the perfect alternative to wasting time for a run on Binny's in Skokie.  Phone first, if you are looking for something specific.

21.description: Stellar beer selection! We spend a silly amount of time just perusing the fridge and talking about the offerings. The store is clean, well-lit, and the owner is friendly.

16.description: This is a nice little liquor store that is exactly what the area needs...not a dirty little whole where selling 40's are the norm.  There is a massive beer selection...lots of microbrews and imports.  If you are a fan of Belgian beers (like I am) you will find all the Lambic products (Framboise, Peche, etc) as well as the different Chimay beers and Kwak.  Of course they carry the obligatory Bud Light and it's ilk but you don't come to a liquor store for industrially produced beer right?  Their liquor selection is good...I'm not really a liquor drinker so I can't comment too much but on the occasion I do buy a bottle I have been able to find it here.  Wine selection is decent, but I find that Taste up on Jarvis has a better wine section.In all, I would say come here for beer and go to Taste for wine if you are in Roger's Park.

17.description: Very impressed by this store. Extremely nice and clean on the inside, a great craft beer selection, aisles of wine and liquor, and all at very reasonable pries. I'm new to the neighborhood and I'm so glad I found a great spot for beer and wine.

10.description: After moving to the neighborhood a few months back I found myself disappointed in the beer selection this far north. As I was riding home from work one night I noticed a small corner store with a few well known craft beer neon signs glowing in the window and I had to check it out. I've been a loyal customer ever since and my matured palate owes it all to them. Some might say it's expensive and maybe but this isn't a store to pick up a sixer of bud diesel and regret your choice in the morning. If you enjoy the experience of a bitter crisp IPA cutting and cleaning your throat and or the post thanksgiving feeling of a oatmeal stout then you've found the right place. PS: 12 out of 13 coolers are craft beer.

11.description: Obviously everyone who writes a review on this place is a fan and so am I ! It is very close to where I live and I couldn't be happier. They just finished remodeling so it looks great! They have a whole other store front they took over and the owner said he was going to have about half the store dedicated to more beer selections and hard liquor selections, which is awesome if you like beer and hard liquor ( i don't know who doesn't?!) ! It's great to see this place do so well. The owner is very nice and very knowledgeable about his products. He knows exactly what brand and type of wine will go with dinner or dessert or even for cooking. I don't know about you, but I sure as hell do not know one thing about wine. It's nice to see someone do what they love here and is familiar with the products they offer. You can tell the owner takes pride in his business and I love and respect that. Other liquors stores, such as one right down the street will try to tell you patron and goose is best, which we all know but I guarantee they can't tell you what will go with a steak dinner or a roast chicken. So if you are in the search for a genuinely good liquor store with affordable priced bottles + good customer service+ FREE wine tasting( of course you got to be 21! ) well then this is your little gem on the corner of Clark. + cleanliness + customer service + selection + prices + free wine tasting: free anything is a plus + for the owner cause he rocks

26.description: Ridiculous selection of beer, wine, and hard alcohol. Don't bother taking a light weight because this place doesn't mess around. The owner and employees are always willing to give suggestions and have introduced a few great new imported beers.

27.description: Can I put into words how much I adore this place?  First of all, they take cards, which ain't happening under the Morse el.  Second of all, they sell Metropolis coffee.  3rd, they have awesome beer, including my fave Rogue Nectar.  The guys working are nice and helpful and courteous and I'm so glad this place exists.

35.description: This is one of the best beer stores on the North Side.  It's a small shop, and they don't have a large selection, but what they have is excellent.

8.description: Rogers Park Fine Wine and Spirits is at the top of my list of places to go for my craft beer addiction.  Henry, the owner, makes it a point to ensure that he stocks ALL of the highly sought after brews when they become available.  I went to Binny's to find Hopslam, they were out.  I go to Henry's spot, he has a case in the cooler.  I've been in there when he razzes his beer reps for not giving him certain things and the next time, he gets them.  He is an advocate for us local beer snobs when it comes to distribution.  He frequently has tastings for beer AND wine and if you're lucky you'll be able to try some of his famous hand made pizza or chili.  His events are not to be missed, because he will hold back reserves of some of the most highly sought after brews and raffle them off at this events ONLY.  I've tried to twist his arm into selling me some ahead of time but Henry makes sure that everyone has the opportunity to get the best of the best.  He recently redecorated and it looks fantastic!  Ornate ceiling fixtures, new floors, wood shelves, topped of with a cozy bar area in the back.  I noticed that they recently put up a facebook fan page and have been updating it with new arrivals and new events.  I suggest you search for it to stay in the loop!Henry knows what's good and makes sure that we get it.  I will continue to purchase from Rogers Park Fine Wine and Spirits as long as i am in the neighborhood.  And even if I happened to move I would still make a trip to come here.

0.description: Amazing selection, and great service!  The owner, Henry, is extremely helpful, accommodating, and knowledgeable.  I'm very picky when it comes to my drinks, but every recommendation Henry has give me has been a huge hit. I cannot recommend this place enough!  If you live in the area and haven't been, do yourself a favor and go.

38.description: For a neighborhood liquor store, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better collection of Belgian beers, and add in that they've also got a few interesting wine choices and some high-end tequilas, and they're a pretty nifty purveyor of a few favorite poisons of myself and friends.

20.description: This liquor store is absolutely wonderful.  Henry, the owner, is marvelously attentive, funny, and an all-around good guy.  If he doesn't carry something you want, he'll do his best to get it in for you.  If you come in at the right times, he'll share a taste of some wonderful new liquor he's picked up--heck, one time I got a bite of steak he'd cooked (delicious)!  The beer selection is excellent, just wonderful, and he changes it up frequently, too, so there is always something new to tempt you.  He has an excellent selection of American craft brews, and a nice selection of Belgians and other imports (The St Bernardus Abt 12 never seems to go out of rotation, thank heavens).  A good mix between 6-packs, 4-packs, bombers, and a few (mostly sampler) 12-packs.  He also carries a small but solid selection of glassware.The liquor selection, while limited, is extremely well-chosen (and mostly high end).  I'm a gin and bourbon person; his gin selections are exceptional, and he always has some delicious bourbon in stock.  His stock of scotches is quite impressive, too.  As with the beers, he mixes up what he carries, and you can almost always find something new to try, if you're in a mood to experiment.  I'm not much of a wine drinker; the selection seems good and varied, but I'll let others comment on that.  Bottom line: fantastic selection, wonderful owner, competitive pricing.  If you are in the neighborhood, you should definitely treat yourself and go here.  If you are swinging through the neighborhood, take a look too!  A perfect spot for the several BYOBs nearby.

19.description: Great selection of moderately priced reds and an effing AMAZING selection of beers!They have wine tasting on Saturdays, I think from Noon to 4, but I'm not positive. Conveniently and well stocked, I'll definitely be back!

33.description: It's not the most convenient  bottle shop to my commute home, but I'm happy to make the detour to support a local mom-and-pop.  I don't buy much wine (never have here, actually) but I can always find two or three beers to my liking and rarely repeat myself.  Today I was pleasantly surprised to find Wells Bombardier, which I can't recall ever seeing in the U.S. anywhere.  I also picked up a new (?) organic cider from Samuel Smith.  Apparently Ommegang makes six-packs now, so I'll be back for one or two of those (Hennepin, natch) and whatever else strikes my mood that day.Just two blocks down the street is a pretty good BYO restaurant, Grande Noodles and Sushi. Stop by this little shop before your dinner.

2.description: Haven't been here in awhile and I was pleasantly surprised to see the selection of new craft beers available in my hood.

34.description: fantastic selection, okay price. you can get almost anything you want, as long as it's booze.

32.description: This is my corner liquor store and I couldn't be happier!  They have a huge selection of wine, beer, and even good bourbons and such.  They're super nice and well-priced.  Thank god for them!  They keep me, my roomie, and my boyfriend soused!

18.description: Henry is the man. Great customer service and fantastic selection. Thanks for building a great wine, beer and sauce joint in my hood so I don't have to drive !  Friendliest store around. THANKS!

13.description: It's not the most convenient  bottle shop to my commute home, but I'm happy to make the detour to support a local mom-and-pop.  I don't buy much wine (never have here, actually) but I can always find two or three beers to my liking and rarely repeat myself.  Today I was pleasantly surprised to find Wells Bombardier, which I can't recall ever seeing in the U.S. anywhere.  I also picked up a new (?) organic cider from Samuel Smith.  Apparently Ommegang makes six-packs now, so I'll be back for one or two of those (Hennepin, natch) and whatever else strikes my mood that day.Just two blocks down the street is a pretty good BYO restaurant, Grande Noodles and Sushi. Stop by this little shop before your dinner.

4.description: Great selection of beers. Definitely my new go to!

24.description: They have a pretty freakin' good selection of Belgian/craft/import beers here, and the prices are not that bad either. My friend suggested stopping in, and I wasn't disappointed. They owners are very polite and friendly, the shop was well kept, clean and stocked, though deceptively small. This seems like the type of place to order something if you wanted it and it wasn't in stock.

6.description: Rogers Park Fine Wine and Sprits is a gem. The owner, Henry, has very good taste and stocks a great variety of craft beers, interesting wines and uncommon spirits, alongside more popular and typical options. Every wine recommendation I've received from Henry has been spot-on, and the majority of his selections are under $20, with plenty under $10. You're not taking a risk buying just about any wine from this store, they don't stock any losers.The selection of cold micro-brews is hard to match on the Far North Side. He has plenty of seasonal and limited release beers, too, including many that are hard to find anywhere else. If you're looking for something limited from a Great Lakes region brewery, like Founder's, New Holland, or one of the many new Chicago breweries, he probably has it. RP also stocks many great craft spirits from around the midwest and elsewhere. I constantly find interesting selections in other categories, like Cognac and brandy, Scotch and other imported liquors. RP Fine Wine and Spirits is definitely worth a trip to Rogers Park, or a stop if you're traveling through.

22.description: This is a nice little liquor store that is exactly what the area needs...not a dirty little whole where selling 40's are the norm.  There is a massive beer selection...lots of microbrews and imports.  If you are a fan of Belgian beers (like I am) you will find all the Lambic products (Framboise, Peche, etc) as well as the different Chimay beers and Kwak.  Of course they carry the obligatory Bud Light and it's ilk but you don't come to a liquor store for industrially produced beer right?  Their liquor selection is good...I'm not really a liquor drinker so I can't comment too much but on the occasion I do buy a bottle I have been able to find it here.  Wine selection is decent, but I find that Taste up on Jarvis has a better wine section.In all, I would say come here for beer and go to Taste for wine if you are in Roger's Park.

15.description: Owner Henry and his main employee have been buddies of mine since the second i walked in the door a few years back... they are friendly, know their products, and have reasonable prices.I am most happy about their selection of fine craft beers, including anything brewed by those geniuses at Lagunitas.Keep sourcing new and delicious domestic craft beers Henry!!! Rogers Park needs you!

7.description: Good craft beer selection at reasonable prices. Very close to my home, so that's a huge plus.

36.description: I'm happy this place is finally on Yelp; I looked for it a while ago and it wasn't here yet.  My wife and I call it "the magical beer store" -- it's the only place within walking distance of us in East Rogers Park that has a decent beer selection.  The other reviewers are dead on, it's completely unpretentious.  The only reason I'm knocking a star off is that the owners can occasionally be a bit "hard-sell" on some of their less interesting wines & beers.  That, and I think every beer I've ever brought to the counter has been the owner's favorite beer ever.  (Trying for good customer rapport, yes, but it's kind of annoying after a while.)

30.description: Last week I stopped in for a bottle of wine, and a speciality beer that my father in-law told me he loved.  Unfortunately the owners did not have it but were quick to ask me to write down the name and had me give them my card.  3 days later I got a phone call letting me know they got me in the beer I was looking for and if I liked it that they would make sure to always have it in stock.  Needless to say Rogers Park Fine Wine & Spirits has earned my business for good.  These owners have taken great service to a new level.

3.description: I'm really happy to have this place in my neighborhood to quench my craft beer craving, so I decided to write a review.  There really isn't any other store within walking distance that consistently carries a selection that competes with Rogers Park Fine Wine and Spirits.Huge slection of beers from local breweries like Pipeworks, Spiteful, Half Acre, Revolution, etc... they almost always have at least 3-4 different Three Floyds beers in stock too, which is becoming more and more uncommon.  They also stock a large selection of imports and other domestic craft breweries.  And if you're in the mood for a High Life or something... they've got six packs cold for around $3.  Highly recommended.

14.description: This liquor store is absolutely wonderful.  Henry, the owner, is marvelously attentive, funny, and an all-around good guy.  If he doesn't carry something you want, he'll do his best to get it in for you.  If you come in at the right times, he'll share a taste of some wonderful new liquor he's picked up--heck, one time I got a bite of steak he'd cooked (delicious)!  The beer selection is excellent, just wonderful, and he changes it up frequently, too, so there is always something new to tempt you.  He has an excellent selection of American craft brews, and a nice selection of Belgians and other imports (The St Bernardus Abt 12 never seems to go out of rotation, thank heavens).  A good mix between 6-packs, 4-packs, bombers, and a few (mostly sampler) 12-packs.  He also carries a small but solid selection of glassware.The liquor selection, while limited, is extremely well-chosen (and mostly high end).  I'm a gin and bourbon person; his gin selections are exceptional, and he always has some delicious bourbon in stock.  His stock of scotches is quite impressive, too.  As with the beers, he mixes up what he carries, and you can almost always find something new to try, if you're in a mood to experiment.  I'm not much of a wine drinker; the selection seems good and varied, but I'll let others comment on that.  Bottom line: fantastic selection, wonderful owner, competitive pricing.  If you are in the neighborhood, you should definitely treat yourself and go here.  If you are swinging through the neighborhood, take a look too!  A perfect spot for the several BYOBs nearby.

58.description: I really liked this place. It was fast, it was cheap, the service was great. The way I scarfed down those enchiladas and didn't get heart burn... yeah.. And I took a dozen warm churros to work. Win.

56.description: Service: amazing. Food: typical fast mexican food, a step above taco bell but not as good as sit down mexican.

29.description: Veggie Burrito with fries.  Green & Red salsa on everything. I have been here more than 100000 times in my life... probably some of the best Mexican food in Rogers Park. My only caution is that I mostly eat the vegetarian food so I don't have very much feedback on the meat quality which keeps coming up in different reviews...However, I am part Mexican and I know that the American palate has  different taste when it comes to meat (ie only white meat chicken) So some of the negative reviews on the meat could be because in Mexican culture they follow the waste not, want not principle. Ok now go eat some Guac!

42.description: Dollar tacos on Sunday and Tuesday! The pork tacos are kind of gristly and oily, but my favorite of all the options. Not the best steak tacos. Churros are great for dessert!Sometimes they give you free chips/salsa if you eat in. Sometimes they don't. Not sure what the rule is on that one.

23.description: I'm a regular customer and come mostly for the $1.00 taco Tuesday / Sunday. I can ALWAYS count on tasty food and friendly service.

47.description: Steak is hit or miss here, I've had a few tacos/burritos with too much gristle, but sometimes it's realllly good.Personally, I've learned to go with the pork, they spice it up really well and it's always tender.  The chicken is forgettable.If it isn't a $1 taco day (Tuesdays and Sundays I believe), stick with the burritos.

8.description: Not an amazing melange of unanticipated flavors or anything like that, but (coming from Texas) it seemed legit and very fairly priced - especially compared to many other North side Mexican spots. And it's not even cash only.The burrito is HUGE. The tacos are smaller and straightforward, with flavorful meat.

31.description: Good place for Mexican food. The staff is nice and friendly. The dollar taco days are the best. Tacos are really good and they are only a dollar which is nice. The parking is kind of a hassle because of it being on the streets and stuff. It is a good place to eat good food. Would recommend it to anyone.

34.description: i have been coming to El Famous for many years. the food is very reasonable priced and tasty. in the last year or so i have noticed that they have been putting less steak in my burrito but thats a little complaint. the wait staff is very nice and the place is always clean when i have been there.

16.description: I've loved this place since the 1990s. It's not upscale Mexican, and it's a little lacking in vegetables variety, but it's a special place to me and my family, and I don't think you can find a better value anywhere. I recently learned that two cooks come every morning (one of them since the 1990s) to prepare the homemade red enchilada sauce, the horchata, the beans, the rice, the salsa verde, etc. from fresh ingredients, and it's all simple and delicious. The chile relleno burrito is heavy duty and filling but incredibly tasty. Or the tacos! I'm a big guy and a single $2 chile relleno taco fill me up. The sopes are good too. Fast, homemade, delicious, and friendly staff!

13.description: Felt cheated guy didn't even suggest the special that came with fries and drink.  Had reg. steak burrito, chips and salsa (pricey) and a bottle water. The burrito was good but it was nothing special. Salsa looked like it came from a jar.

11.description: It was pretty good; nothing that rocked my world, but I'd definitely return for another veggie burrito! :-)

39.description: For the money, the best burrito is the steak dinner suiza style (a mild red sauce with melted cheese on top). Hard to beat this place for a cheap date. The nacho plate is very good too. In this case, 2 full satisfied customers for $15.

37.description: The BEST vegetarian burrito! Most places are so skimpy, but this place loads it with avocado, rice, beans and veggies. Friendliest service in Rogers park! Can't get enough of it. Oh yeah, their salsa is also the best anywhere! And my kids love stopping for churros outside.

0.description: I'm a regular here the food is very good. It's nice to come in have the employees recognize you. Always very nice guys!

38.description: I ate here for the first time after looking up "steak" in my area and seeing this come up as the first result.  I think it just so happened people were mentioning the steak tacos in the reviews, causing me to stumble upon this Mexican place.It's fast casual and I ate in.  I got 5 tacos for $1 each (I learned about the $1/taco deal being available Tuesdays and Sundays from other Yelp reviews) and my fiancee got the 3 enchiladas deal.  I tried every meat available for their tacos (chicken, beef, steak, and pork) and thought all were good except the steak, which I found flavorless.  The pork was the best.  The tacos were not big, but each was housed in two tortilla wraps, one of top of the other, and was packed to the extent that the contents spilled out upon picking it up.  They didn't skimp on the meat.  I tried some of the enchiladas and they were really good too.The food came out very fast after I ordered, in less than 5 minutes.Next time I go, I'm getting more pork and no steak.  Although I haven't been to many Mexican places, this is one of the best I've had.  One star is docked for the bland steak.  Usually, steak is my favorite meat in tacos and burritos, but it's simply not very good here.  I'm looking forward to trying some other things on their menu.

51.description: Good lord, how do I miss those huge Burritos and fresh tacos!!! I'm in Jackson, MS and all we have is tex-mex - where the mexican food is all like El Chico's - slathered in american cheese and paprika and they call it authentic mexican! Be grateful you have an El Famous close to you - because when you go to places like Alabama, Mississippi and Tennessee - you will miss it! Please open a location in Jackson, Mississippi!!!

27.description: Mmm love their food salsa could be a little more home style in my personal opinion but I still love it. No bad comments just constructive criticism  great daily deals !

32.description: Very clean, very fast, very polite and the Burrito was HUGE--just what I wanted!  Excellent cooking--I'm eager to go back.

54.description: Fresh tasty salsa, friendly prompt service, can't beat dollar taco night!

48.description: Don't get the beef here. SO greasy, and I felt sick after eating it. I've been here tons of times, and everything is usually pretty good. The food is cheap, portions are decent, and it comes out quickly. If you dine in they give you chips and salsa.

44.description: Last week, we were taco whores. My friend and I had 7 tacos each, 4 steak and 3 fish for me alone. I'm from the south side of Chicago and we travel up north for some $1.00 tacos on Sundays and Tuesdays. Where can you get anything for a buck that delicious? I also had a large horchata and I was a happy camper. They have steak, fish, choritzo, and pork tacos. I went to the one on Madison and it's was not as good as this one. The one on Madison has tacos for $1.50 on Sundays.

24.description: I went here on a Taco Tuesday, which was the best decision ever! I ordered the bistec, al pastor and pollo tacos, all with cilantro and onions, with chips and salsa and a side of guac. The tacos were all amazing, my favorite was the al pastor, it was juicy and very flavorful. They really do pack the tacos with meat so for just $1 each, it was a great deal. The chips and salsa were good too, the chips were salted nicely and the salsa had a good spicy kick to it. The guac is priced at market price so I don't really know how much I paid for it, but it was so delicious that I just wish I had gotten more. I will for sure be back here so Taco Sundays too!

7.description: If you're looking for a vegetarian burrito, they do have one but...There's really, no vegetables in it. Yes, it has the usual, tomato and lettuce but, that's it. Avocado, is extra $.
