It does come with some beans.  When you ask for rice and they say yes, there isn't any rice in it. So, it's a nice size, a nice price but, all it has in it is: Tomatoes, too much lettuce that's rather slimy, mealy tomatoes and a TON of beans.:(

49.description: $1 tacos on Tuesdays and Sundays! The quality depends on how busy they are. The service is good though. The cashiers brought me chips and salsa while I waited for my food.

40.description: went back to see if the cheap owner changed his policies. but no, still not smart about attracting & keeping customers. nickel & diming  for extra salsa & lettuce.like i said before....i do like their food, but refuse to be squeezed for little extras. with 10 other mexican joints up & down clark st. that don't treat their regulars like that.....this owner is clueless.

53.description: The service is good. The place looks clean and nice. The food tastes good,  but it is SUPER GREASY. I ordered a burrito and could not finish it. It was soaked in grease.

30.description: I used to go here regularly for the burritos and the steak nachos. But lately the food has been sub par. The quality of the meat has declined and the food is made like they are trying to cut cost. There are way too many Mexican restaurants in that area for this place to let the quality of their food slide like it has lately. No more El Famous for me.  I had to throw it away it was so bad.

46.description: $1 tacos (steak, pork, chicken, and beef) on Tuesdays and Sundays. Kenny O. and I came here on Superbowl Sunday, so we got a bunch of tacos to go.I didn't get any of the $1 tacos though. I got chorizo and lengua tacos. The chorizo was a little too dry for me. It also wasn't very flavorful. It was also as if they forgot to add salt. The lengua taco tasted a lot better. It was more flavorful, but I'm still not a fan of it.

1.description: Stopped in for Taco Tuesday and...*sighs* So disappointed. We dined in so we got complementary chips and two salsas. The chips were thick and hard, so maybe they were store-bought or old...or both. The green (possibly avocado-based) salsa was really good with just the right amount of spice but the red salsa was very BLAH. It reminded me of jarred salsa (which I despise) but tasted less of tomato juice and more of tomato paste.My boyfriend and I got two tacos apiece, his on flour tortillas and mine on corn tortillas. They were bigger than most and filling but what use is all of that when the food doesn't have much flavor? There was no spice, no savoriness...nothing. Even if I had thought to add salt, it wouldn't have enhanced anything. As far as the other tacos, I know that chicken tacos can be bland but when two type of salsas don't help the taste, you know it's over with.We finished everything because we were really hungry but we won't be going back, not even for $1.50 tacos. We'll just stick to Burrito House on Elston for our taco cravings.

55.description: This place is a totally unpretentious, solid neighborhood joint.  Service is far superior to my expectations; you order at the counter, but if you're staying, they sit you down w chips and salsa (and the salsa is not bad at all). The tacos and burritos are good, and a very good value. I've had an off experience or two here, but overall the service is what sets them apart from other hole-in-the-wall places.

9.description: I found this place from my work because this is where we take clients out to eat. They are amazingly friendly and very supportive of the client's needs.Apart from the exceptional service, this is your standard restaurant. There is a tv, restrooms are clean, and ample seating.The food is excellent and the deals are great. I would recommend getting the burrito special. I shall continue to dine here in the future.

26.description: I found this place from my work because this is where we take clients out to eat. They are amazingly friendly and very supportive of the client's needs.Apart from the exceptional service, this is your standard restaurant. There is a tv, restrooms are clean, and ample seating.The food is excellent and the deals are great. I would recommend getting the burrito special. I shall continue to dine here in the future.

25.description: Yuck

12.description: Veggie burrito with a whole chile relleño stuffed inside, and there's still room for cheese and beans and lettuce and tomato and rice and avocado and cilantro and onions in that huge shell. For like 50 cents more, pour some enchilada sauce on top with sour cream and more cheese. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Plus there are awesome taco options-carne asada, bistec, chile relleño, lengua and more. You can get fries with something. Or chips. Green and red salsa with everything. Cheap as hell. Great people working there-they take care of you! Plus they are always happy to see me. Maybe we're friends now.Summary: cheap, great Mexican food in Rogers park. Classic place, good people. And the torts bread is something to die for

59.description: I've had much, much better burritos at many other Mexican eateries in Chicago, but El Famous Burrito is cheap, friendly and fast. Also, the burrito was not as large as previous reviewers have described. I'll go back, but only for convenience, not quality.

21.description: Veggie burrito with a whole chile relleño stuffed inside, and there's still room for cheese and beans and lettuce and tomato and rice and avocado and cilantro and onions in that huge shell. For like 50 cents more, pour some enchilada sauce on top with sour cream and more cheese. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Plus there are awesome taco options-carne asada, bistec, chile relleño, lengua and more. You can get fries with something. Or chips. Green and red salsa with everything. Cheap as hell. Great people working there-they take care of you! Plus they are always happy to see me. Maybe we're friends now.Summary: cheap, great Mexican food in Rogers park. Classic place, good people. And the torts bread is something to die for

17.description: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant, that just so happens to be right down the street! Amazing burritos for a great price. The staff is always friendly and makes going there more enjoyable

10.description: My boyfriend went to pick up our to-go and they forgot our guac and chips and a large horchata, but luckily he didn't pay for it. He didn't ask about it because he didn't hear me place the order so he didn't know the items were missing. There were no limes in the bag. The al pastor taco was the worst and fattiest I've ever had the displeasure chewing in to, I literally threw it away. The steak tacos were tasteless. I was also told that the tacos come with cheese on them and none of our tacos had cheese. To top it off, they gave us flour tortillas. Seriously? We'll be heading to Rocky's tacos next time.

5.description: Soaks up all the alcohol from a night of drinking super well. So glad this place is within walking distance of me and open super late.

3.description: This place has consistently good, mediocre Mexican food.  The chicken enchilada was a little on the greasier than usual side.  Tacos are standard.

35.description: really great burritos and guacamole.  They don't put rice in their burritos which is great - less carbs and more protein.  This is a small family owned restaurant - a hidden gem. Their guacamole and salsa are both home made with chunks.  The burritos are huge and can be shared by at least two people.

19.description: I went here on a Taco Tuesday, which was the best decision ever! I ordered the bistec, al pastor and pollo tacos, all with cilantro and onions, with chips and salsa and a side of guac. The tacos were all amazing, my favorite was the al pastor, it was juicy and very flavorful. They really do pack the tacos with meat so for just $1 each, it was a great deal. The chips and salsa were good too, the chips were salted nicely and the salsa had a good spicy kick to it. The guac is priced at market price so I don't really know how much I paid for it, but it was so delicious that I just wish I had gotten more. I will for sure be back here so Taco Sundays too!

28.description: Their chicken tacos with the corn tortillas are delicious! They load them up with a ton of meat. Two-taco dinner with a drink for under $7: great deal! Consistent and delicious, affordable food... and you get your meal super quick, every time.

45.description: Taco Tuesday!  Always delicious and always quick. Great guacamole and fresh salsa. Yum.

33.description: This El Famous burrito has a great staff they're extremely friendly their food is always fresh and their prices are always very reasonable highly recommend

43.description: Crap lettuce and practically no tomato on 2 tacos....I GET IT, $1 tacos but don't lower yourselves.

2.description: It might be hard to tell that this branch of El Famous Burrito is open from the street, but it's worth going inside to enjoy a smooth and cool horchata paired with tacos and a filled churro. I got lengua and al pastor tacos - the lengua was solid but nothing special while I was pleased by the juiciness and flavor of the al pastor. I couldn't detect any pineapple though :(.The churros weren't exactly fresh waiting in the hot case but no worse than the churros at Costco. Service was very friendly.

18.description: I'm a regular customer and come mostly for the $1.00 taco Tuesday / Sunday. I can ALWAYS count on tasty food and friendly service.

41.description: Their tacos were crap, but I grabbed them on a Sunday, so they were $1. I understand that a lower price means lower quality, but I wouldn't take that deal again. They also got my order wrong (I got two steak tacos instead of the two chicken I ordered). Plus side: their salsa is good.

52.description: Love coming here on $1 taco nights!  My only concern is their lack of consistency.  Some nights they are right on the spot, other nights the meat is too greasy or lacking flavor.

50.description: Cute male cashier!! (Wife speaking, not the husband, haha) Drank up my horchata and ate my steak taco. For $1 per taco tonight, not bad! :)

4.description: Started off with a orange jarrito followed by a vegetarian burrito.There has always been a very laidback give to this place ever since I first started coming here, back in 2002. Prices are extremely reasonable and the server was very attentive.Will definitely return if the opportunity presents itself.

6.description: Okay tamales. The quality could be better but knowing the area in Chicago there's not really a great place. Also, the tamales are inconsistent. One of ours was really good but the other wasn't. They're not too pricey though which is a plus. Would probably come back given the lack of good tamales in Chicago.

22.description: The food is great, the prices low, and the staff is friendly. I rarely miss taco Tuesdays!

15.description: I got the fish taco, shrimp taco, veggie tostada, some horchata, and a churro. All tasty! My favorites were the fish taco and horchata. Veggie tostada is great for vegetarians, with big pieces of avocado and beans. Great service too.

57.description: love the tacos!!  quick, dependable, friendly.

20.description: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant, that just so happens to be right down the street! Amazing burritos for a great price. The staff is always friendly and makes going there more enjoyable

36.description: Huh? What the? Are you serious, Yelpers? Wow, you have failed me!!! What an epic let down of monumental proportions! OK, maybe I am being a bit dramatic, but for real, this  food was awful.  We ordered a bunch of tacos - beef, chicken and pork.  The pork was meh, but edible. Chicken was blah, but the beef was BARF CITY. I don't even think my dog would eat this taco, the quality was below Taco Bell.  Even the salsa was horrible. :/ So listen to me, do not go here, you are wasting your money and in a city of ours you can find so many BETTER Mexican restaurants.

14.description: we ordered the 3 taco dinner (fish , pork and chicken). the Chilean was so so . the fish pretty decent - good but not wow. The pork tacos however were AMAZING. The meat was well flavored and the tacos really fresh . Overall pretty decent place with really good pork tacos

1.description: Rogers Park keeps getting better and better.   This comfortable antique store has a wide variety of vintage paintings, furniture, jewelry, kitchenware and statues.   I especially like their selection of artwork.   The owners are friendly and helpful.   This place is a nice compliment to the good restaurants and bars located next door and across the street.    It's a relaxing part of Rogers Park.   Perfect for holiday gift shopping.

0.description: I never knew that this little Treasure Shop existed in Rogers Park. I came here for the Shop Jarvis Square Local Artisan Christmas Market. I was really impressed by this pretty large size antique shop with such reasonable prices. Everything here is beautiful and hand pick. It is not cluttered like other antique shops and you can easily stroll through the shop. Beautiful home goods pieces. I am a huge fan!

1.description: You won't find a better neighborhood spot for hair cuts. The staff is great and there is usually little to no wait. Cuts are $5 for men and you definitely get your money worth. One of my favorite places to get a quick trim as well, the staff uses a straight razor to make sure you get the perfect line up and leave looking your best. With other more expensive places offering less in the way of quality and satisfaction you really can't go wrong here.

2.description: Great place. Skilled barbers at an exceptionable price. I've never had a problem with their English. They also have more people on staff than in the past.

0.description: Wonderful old-fashioned haircutting experience, and it's $5 a head ... but do tip! It has an Eastern European vibe, Albanian I think -- very friendly to all, you feel like you're in a special place.  The owner is not chatty, but has a friendly face, and there is always a second chair in service, never had a long wait. The cut has always been nice, there's no rushing here;  If you're in Rogers Park, check it out.

58.description: Quick review: Great service. Terrible food. My wife said her taro bubble tea was really just a vanilla shake. The only thing that we enjoyed was the eggrolls.

56.description: I love their red curry and their egg rolls. The place is very small, and they remember you and are very friendly.

29.description: Love love love this place. Will for sure be back.

42.description: Was in search of some tasty fare in the area with one of my bffs (she's actually moving to the top of the list with my Christmas/Birthday awesomeness gift of signed copy of John Taylor's book! hehehe, I'm a little girl again!!!)oh yea, back to the review. This restaurant had three or four yelp stars so we had to try it since she's new to this area and hasn't ventured out. She's Chinese and really knows what's good and what isn't, and for Thai, she like it. I too enjoyed everything we had. We ordered the egg rolls which were crisp and not oily and very fresh tasting. I ordered the chicken curry rice and she ordered the chicken lad nar something or other. Both were prepared fresh and tasted very good. I wish I could of finished it all but had to take part of it home and have it as a morning snack and it was still good. Sorry to hear other people having a bad experience. Maybe it was a bad night? Don't know. Maybe my Asian food standards are low? Naw, I don't think so.

23.description: We ordered the spring rolls, shrimp maki and thai fried rice. All were made well but not anything special. It's a good place to have a low - key meal. The owners are very friendly and do their best to make you happy. Quick service too!

47.description: i love this place! ive now been there 3 times in 2 months and im not sure about the previous bad reviews, maybe they changed because everytime ive been there, its so yummy, good clean healthy thai food! we love it and plan to go there from now on!

8.description: This is our go to cheap takeout place!! Their Tom kha soup is my favorite, and if you ask they can make it vegetarian (veggie broth instead of chicken). The pad see ew is also really good. The portions are pretty big so you can split a dish and still feel extremely satisfied. I'd definitely recommend grabbing some takeout from them if you're in the rogers park area!

31.description: Despite the amalgam of Thai/Japanese fusion places littering Rogers Park, this place has been the most authentic Thai in my opinion. The Pad Thai and the Pad See Ew were both extremely flavorful and delicious. My friend got a beef and shrimp entree and the price was reasonable and they gave a good sized serving of rice. Also, the owners were very friendly and understanding when my friends and I waited a long time for the whole group to get there. My only gripe would be that the space inside is really small so everything and everyone is right night to every other person. Ps. The strawberry bubble tea is the bomb diggity

34.description: I am shocked to see bad reviews.  This place has awesome food! I could see people feeling a little awkward because the restaurant is so small, but you can always get take out or delivery.  The food is great and is prepared quickly!  I have had the red Thai basil dish with chicken and veggies and my fiance has had dishes with pork and all of them have been out of this world!  This place is one of rogers park's best kept secrets.

16.description: I come here pretty often. The food is great and the service is excellent. Would recommend.

13.description: If you're a fan of Thai curries, this is not the place to go. The flavors are sad, watered down, and leave much to be desired. I ordered the massaman and panang curry.Cons:- watery broth (seemed to be missing the coconut cream, the color was off)- lack of veggies- lack of flavor- overpriced for what you getPros:- fast deliveryThe crab rangoons were passable, but the sauce that came with them just tasted like high fructose corn syrup.Would not recommend.

11.description: This place has some great Thai fried rice and Pad Se Ewe.  I wasn't a fan of their Chicken Satay and their Panang, but the fried rice was pretty solid and satisfies any fried rice craving.  The Pad Se Ewe doesn't have the usual pungent scent nor taste but has thicker noodles, a better sauce, and fills your greasy lo-mein/stir- fried noodle cravings.  There is some parking found on the street (on Sheridan), but you might have to look around.  The staff are quite sweethearts.+Thai fried rice+Pad Se Ewe+limited street parking

39.description: Fantastic Thai food in Rogers Park!  Awesome customer service & absolutely wonderfully tasting full menu.  The crab rangoons are especially amazing.  Beautiful, intimate dining area as well.  Prices are very reasonable.

37.description: Byob+ next door to my fave theatre- the 400+ super nice staff who ask if you need to get to a movie on time= four startsSalmon was over cooked= minus one starI will go back and report on the second try!

0.description: It was.... Ok. Being from San Francisco I know GREAT and GOOD Thai food. This is more so a, "hey, it's open hella late, I am hungry and or drunk-hungry, let's do it!" Well, I had arrived in Chicago and haven't eaten since breakfast at SFO. I had done some sightseeing and was near my level of Hangry lolMy order was for take out. The Thai fried rice, Thai tea and Sushi (yes sushi rolls at a Thai spot) was edible. My order was sightly wrong- I didn't know until I got in and was able to thoroughly inspect the food. Well, I called, the woman apologized and told me to come back for my meal to be remade and for free. I explained I was already home and tired. She promised a free meal tomorrow- well, I got the free meal and some how free always taste better when the food is actually good lolAnyways, I won't run here Chicago has better places but I will come if I am in the area and Hangry.

38.description: Great biz, the owners are very nice, the food is flavorful and freshly made before your eyes :-) My one complaint is that the noodle dishes lack enough vegetables but at least they are fresh and not a frozen veggie mix like some places. The prices are reasonable as well. But don't expect to sit down and have a date here or anything it is better as a carryout place.

51.description: Not my first pick for a Thai restaurant in Chicago but if you're looking for some late night takeout within walking distance this is not a bad place to go. Anytime I've ever been to this restaurant the staff has been really inviting, especially the little Thai lady that runs the joint. While I waited for my food she offered me a glass of water and some newspapers to read! That's one of the reasons I like this place. The food is a little bland, I usually just order mixed veggies and rice, I always find myself adding extra spices to liven it up. Tiny interior so not the greatest place for more than a couple people to dine, I'd rather do take out than sit in because of the cramped dining area.

27.description: This place has some great Thai fried rice and Pad Se Ewe.  I wasn't a fan of their Chicken Satay and their Panang, but the fried rice was pretty solid and satisfies any fried rice craving.  The Pad Se Ewe doesn't have the usual pungent scent nor taste but has thicker noodles, a better sauce, and fills your greasy lo-mein/stir- fried noodle cravings.  There is some parking found on the street (on Sheridan), but you might have to look around.  The staff are quite sweethearts.+Thai fried rice+Pad Se Ewe+limited street parking

32.description: Best pad thai I've ever had. The owners are so nice and recognize you even if you've only been there once. The crab Rangoon are perfect and crispy but have actual flavor. I go here like once a week.

54.description: Although the menu isn't extensive, and their isn't a lot of room inside to sit down and eat with more than a couple of people, this is my favorite Thai restaurant in Rogers Park. A few months back, I think they changed chefs, which caused the quality of the food to go down, but I think they've switched back recently and everything is just as good as it was before. The food is affordable and delicious, and the staff is INCREDIBLE. They are always warm and accomadating.

48.description: I stopped by here for a quick bite to eat and it was alright. In a heavily populated Thai  and other Asian restaurants in the neighborhood, Rice Thai Cafe is near the top. Their prices are pretty fair. I had the Pad Thai, but it was missing a "wow factor." I was expecting more favor. I had an appetizer of California sushi rolls and they were pretty good. Being a Loyola Student on a cheap budget, I would go back. Definitely check out the lunch specials.

44.description: When I hear "Chinese food," my mind immediately associates it with "sodium," and I usually try to limit my Chinese food intake to a handful of times a year. Today happened to be one of those days where I gave in. I had planned on trying this Chinese restaurant two doors down called Great Wall, but the sign above Rice Thai Cafe said "sushi," and you can't beat that. I had just started recovering from a horrendous sushi experience at the dining halls--I am not sure what sort of cardboard I ate, but it was not sushi. Anyway, I was in the mood and ordered the crunchy roll and spring rolls. The cashier/host/waiter (it was a small place) was very nice, and offered me water while I waited for my order to-go. My crunch roll at first glance disappointed me. There was ample crab and tempura, but where were the veggies--the carrots, cucumber, and avocado? Nowhere to be found. Nevertheless, I tried a roll and was blown away! It was phenomenal--the sweet crab meat, fresh rice, salty and crunchy tempura all blended together to form the perfect yin and yang of sushi. The rolls were also the perfect eating size for one-biters. My spring rolls looked fantastic, but were overpoweringly sweet. The outside had a nice light and crispy texture, and there was really nothing wrong with them other than they lacked...something. I tried to remedy them with wasabi and soy sauce, which helped a bit. Overall, a great place, fast, reasonably priced, and pretty darn tasty.

24.description: They're fast and delicious and pretty cheap too. Just the sweetest owners ever! It makes my evening to call when I get off at Loyola station after a long day at work and walk straight there to pick up my hot and ready pad thai. Just perfect!

7.description: Very tasty food. The restaurant is very small, but the food is really good. They do delivery and we were very satisfied with what we ordered.

49.description: About four weeks ago I stopped by Thai Rice and Sushi. I tried the Pad Lard Nar (stir fried wide flat rice noodle with broccoli topped with special gravy). It was good for the price ($6.95 plus tax). The "special gravy" blended in very well with the other ingredients. The noodles were too soft for me but someone else might not mind. Just remember that the portions are small. If you have a large appetite then you will not get full from one dish.About three weeks ago I stopped by the Thai cafe after work. I purchased the Thai fried rice with chicken. It was delicious. The rice isn't too greasy or fried too much. The dish includes scrambled eggs, onion, tomato, and carrots for $6.95 plus tax. I was surprised the dish tasted so good because normally fried rice is no different than McDonald's. You ordered it because it is fast and it is difficult to mess up. Lol. They do have a minimum purchase with debit or credit card of $7 but I have read that restaurants are not allowed to set minimums. I believe you

40.description: I live down the street from Rice and I try to eat there every week.  After trying almost half of their menu, I can honestly say I have never been disappointed.  I am especially fond of the Pad See Eiw (make sure to ask for the crispy noodles!) and the Rama chicken.The restaurant itself is pretty tiny but a fun little place to sit down to eat.  There is a great patio for the summer time.  This place is BYOB which is always a plus (in my opinion).The price is right on and the service is some of the friendliest I have had at any restaurant in the city.  I highly recommend Rice to any Thai food lover.

53.description: I had spent the entire day on airplanes and sitting in airports as I made my way across the country to Chicago, and all I wanted was some tasty grub. Rice Thai Cafe was within easy walking distance to my new place, so I decided to try it. Eesh! I ordered fresh tofu spring rolls, tofu pad see ew, and the cucumber salad. Fresh spring rolls aren't. Supposed. To be made. With the same kind of spring roll wrapping used for fried spring rolls. Blech! Really gross. The sauce it was served with was also not quite right - tasted like hoisin straight out of a jar. Cucumber salad - nothing but sliced cucumbers. Served with sweet vinegar. Er... Usually there's at least a little bit of something in a cucumber salad to jazz it up. Not here. Pad see ew - Meh. Not horrible, but too sweet for my taste, and the noodle-to-other stuff ratio was too high to be worth the cost.I won't be going back here again :( Which is a bummer, because I would have been really excited to have great Thai food so close by.

30.description: I ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice. Let me just say this, the quality of their food is better if you sit down to eat there. I didn't have time for that, so against my better judgement, I took mines to go. It was terrible. First off, they charge you a $1 for one meat, when it should be included as your first choice of meat that's included with the dish. (They've been running that game for years. I won't even argue that point with them anymore.) Secondly, I paid the extra $2 for shrimp, and I got 2 shrimp in my dish. There was a little third one, but asides from being little, it looked like it had been recooked. Also, I ordered some egg rolls. You might as well just be eating wonton wrappers, as there is nothing in there. Anyway, I will find somewhere else to spend my $$$!

46.description: Been to numerous Thai  places, and this is pretty  delicious. So far I've had the pepper beef, the spicy chicken and one other thing I cant think of the name right now. Anyway they were very friendly and the place is clean. If you look they have passed all their health inspections. Good enough for me! Will make if my informal go to Thai place when I want something quick.

1.description: Absolutely terrible. Those who are giving them such high ratings clearly haven't had real Thai food in this city. My photos speak for themselves! I ordered delivery and it literally arrived 15 minutes after I placed my order. I know I live a couple blocks away, but jeez!A greasy, slapped together mess.

55.description: Surprised at the above average reviews on this place. I live across the street and know enough to avoid it unless I'm absolutely desperate for Thai food within walking distance. The food is uniformly awful. And they've figured out ways to screw up slam dunk standards like edamame & pad thai. The place also offers sushi, which sends a chill through my spine to think about -- if you can't handle edamame, I don't want you handling raw fish.Hole in the wall interior, bad food (but do the Loyola undergraduates know any better?), bad/odd service (they never pack to-go orders with napkins or utensils -- if you ask, they will grudgingly give you a fork & one cocktail napkin). With a great Thai community full of restaurants just a few L stops south, there is no reason to eat here, unless you're desperate. But be warned, you will be disappointed even by desperation standards.

9.description: Ordered the Spring Rolls and Panang Curry. The spring rolls were great and I would definitely order  again. I wish I could say the same about the curry, it was a smaller than average portion and came with no vegetables. I've never ordered curry from any restaurant and had it not come with veggies. So I was pretty unimpressed with it to say the least.

26.description: Can only speak to the delivery and food. We ordered out and delivery was quick and reasonable. Food was very good. Pad Thai!!!

25.description: I remember going here when I left The New 400. It was my first time trying nori and I thought it was awful. Problem is that I'm used to eating rolls made of rice (ex. Loving Hut) so it took some getting used to. The service is very friendly. I'd give the place five stars for customer service. However, I hadn't been there in a couple of years, couldn't remember why and ordered a delivery.I love Thai food and I enjoy the seasoning from other restaurants, but I was not into this particular meal at all. The edamame was slightly soggy, and they're usually a bit crunchier. The Thai fried rice didn't have the seasoning I'm used to at other restaurants. It just tasted like plain brown rice with vegetables and tofu. The avocado maki rolls were good, but I always feel like I can REALLY taste the nori. And I can't remember the last time I had maki rolls without cabbage. They just give you the wasabi. The vegetable maki rolls with avocado, carrots and cucumbers were pretty okay, but I've had better. The food isn't bad but I've had much better food at other Thai food locations. Something about it reminds me of leftovers or buffet style food. They're in a good location near The New 400 so I see why they always have customers but I'd rather drive somewhere else.

12.description: We ordered delivery based on the reviews and we were not disappointed! Excellent experience starting with the ordering and speed completed by the delivery lady was who was extra friendly. The food was great, the egg-rolls crisp and cook to perfection, one of the best cashew chicken we have had. I personally think the fried rice lacks a bit of soy sauce, but easily fixed by adding a little bit on your own.

59.description: The owners are super nice and the main reason for returning and for their 4-stars. Their appetizers were a miss but their entrees were tasty.My fiance ordered the California roll for an appetizer... yeah I know, a roll from a thai restaurant, not sure why he did but eh... it wasn't very good and wasn't expecting it to be so I didn't count it against them. Ordered the Tom Kha w/ Tofu... my favorite soup ever, but their version was TOO SWEET with coconut and there was not enough sour/lemongrass/kaffir lime leaves. I took two sips and left it. Very disappointed but then again, it's a hit-and-miss w/ Tom Kha.Fiance ordered the Chicken Teriyaki, which was delicious! I had the Massaman curry (asked for spicy) and it was really good too. Can't go wrong w/ Massaman! The portions were good for the price and it didn't take too long to make (15 mins).We tried their Thai Coffee........ FANTASTIC! We typically order the Thai Tea at Thai Restaurants but we found a new favorite.

21.description: Went here to get takeout  but was cheated. The owner suggested to spend at least $25 to get a free crab rangoon, but charged me half price for it instead! I questioned the extra charge after I paid and reviewed the prices listed on the menu and they were quite unapologetic. Said that I had to pay for tax for the free item, which I argued could not possibly be $2.50 since the vrab rangoon was only $4.99. Plus, if it's free, I shouldn't be taxed on it. Disgusting.

17.description: I love small dives w great owners. I thought the menu was a bit too limiting so I asked the owner for recommendations. I ordered the shrimp salad... I could not believe how clean, big and the fresh the shrimps were. Everything was really good.I would give this place 5 stars but I wish their menu had more choices.

10.description: Best go to Thai place around Loyola! I've had their noodle dishes, curries, etc. it's all good food at a reasonable price. Enough food for 4 people at $30.

5.description: If I could give zero stars, that would be my rating. If you have food sensitivities, stay away from this place! I placed an order online so that I would be able to write everything and make sure that our food intolerances were visible without their being a chance of being misinterpreted. Another "perk" was that we could get either a free appetizer or entree with an order of a certain amount.For each item we ordered, I specifically put no mushrooms and to make everything vegan. The yakisoba we ordered, while delicious, had mushrooms. The Tom Kha Soup had an option for tofu, so we opted for that, but it had chicken. When we called to let them know, the "chef" said he put tofu in the soup and offered to give us a credit for next time. However, a credit for next time is not going to help with how sick we are getting tonight.

3.description: Still love this place! Egg rolls are awesome and the pad see ew is better than anything I can find in the suburbs. My husband enjoyed his garlic chicken as well.

35.description: It's not a fancy sitdown restaurant, but if you like small family restaurants with good food at a great value, check it out. It's so unassuming outside you would miss it driving by on Sheridan. I've had pad Thai a couple of times, and it's always prompt and hot--I'm picky about my tofu, but I love the way they prepare it. Good peanut and egg distribution too and generous portions without being wasteful. Typically I will not finish in one sitting...but then change my mind and finish. It's not a two-meals-from one-entree type place, but that's good business in my opinion. Very friendly shopkeepers, and especially fresh vegetables for a place of this size.Check it out before a movie sometime.

19.description: One of the most reliable places in the neighborhood.  Always good for take out.  Haven't tried the sushi side of things, but all of the Thai food we've tried we've been happy with including: cashew chicken, pad thai, tom yam soup, thai iced tea, crab rangoon.  We probably order out here at least once a month, usually twice a month.  They're quick, well priced, and again, reliable.  Not a great place for a date or anything like that.  Eating in consists of about 4 2-person tables total.  During nicer weather they may have tables outside too.  But be wary if you're eating in that space may be limited!

28.description: This place is awesome because: -it's cheap-they have the best tom yum and papaya salad in Chicago!  -it's owned by the sweetest couple ever-it's good for a sit down meal or take away-the service is awesome-it's next to the New 400 Theatre (good restaurant for before/after a movie)-they have a great lunch specialI go here quite often and love the place.  I am allergic to coconut, which the owners always remember and will warn me if a dish has it.  I highly recommend this wonderful place!

45.description: I really, really wanted to like this place. I moved to the area a few months ago and had a bad experience at the adjacent Chinese place. I noticed this place was usually busy, which is a good sign. I finally decided to order some fried rice, egg rolls and crab rangoon. The man who appears to own it is extremely friendly. But what really counts for any restaurant is the food. The best way to describe the way the food looked was "old." Still, I went ahead and tried it and it still tasted old. Like it had been sitting around for ages and then just warmed up. The egg rolls and crab rangoon were so greasy -- the worst I've ever had in my life. The rice was also stale. I don't know what it is about the Asian fare in this few block radius, but it is very substandard. The Japanese joint had decent sushi - but their fried rice was just old looking and very sad. Maybe I'm just spoiled -- the one thing I could always get that was really, really good in California was Asian food. The only place so far that really met my standards have been Hello, Sushi and the Blue Elephant. The rest have really sucked, including a few in the downtown area. At least I have these two. But at this rate, I'm not inclined to try any others in the city.Perhaps Rice Thai has other dishes that are made with fresh ingredients, but clearly, what I got yesterday was not - so it is where it belongs and should have been put quite a while ago -- in the trash.What a waste of $18. That's a lot of money to pay for some fried rice and two appetizers. That's the worst part of all.

33.description: Love their Tom Yom soup with a side of brown rice.

43.description: Great little place for the neighborhood.  Just know it is a small 2 person show, but good food at a good price.  Personally, I stay away from the sushi, but I love the Tom Yum soup, and all the curries.  I feel all the chicken dishes are the best.  I call it 5  starts for Rogers Park

2.description: I wish I could just rate in the middle like 2.5.  I ordered yakisoba noodle dish with beef. There was no taste. I ended up adding soy sauce on it. There was more meat than noodle. So that's my hesitation with the rating. I don't know if that's a good thing. I think I appreciate their generosity but it doesn't mean that it's a good think all the time. There was no taste at the food I had. Well I figured I could order couple maki to get rid of my craving too but that didn't have taste as well. Ordered shrimp tempura which either didn't have the shrimp part or the tempura part. Ordered also crunchy roll, it wasn't crunchy at all. They were just rolls and since it was a take out order, I think they decided to give us whatever rolls. Not specifically what we ordered. If they wanna give us whatever rolls no need to have a menu for maki. So here I come to the end and it's why I didn't roll the 2.5 up to 3 but rolled it down to 2. I would spend my money on somewhere with tastier Asian food. Or rolls from the market are better for urgent cravings.

18.description: Rice Thai is a solid staple for the Rogers Park Area! The food it delicious and the price is on par with what they serve. Last time I went, I got an avocado roll, Miso soup, and a Thai Tea.  All were served up quickly, tasted great (especially for the cost) and hit the spot. Rice Thai is a definite thumbs up... it's just a shame there are not more seats.

41.description: After moving to Rogers Park, my editor told me to try Rice Thai. I discovered the restaurant was only about a block from where I live. One cold and snowy day, I decided to pop in and try their lunch special. $6.45 for soup, appetizer and entree was too good to pass up. The interior is very small and I imagine they do most of their business through takeout. They have the space for a patio in the summer. I'll eat there on the patio but I probably won't sit inside again.The hot miso soup was an instant full-body warmer after I stepped in from the snow. The potstickers were big and very good, but they were fried which I did not expect. For my entree, I chose the basil chicken. It was very authentic. They use ground chicken! It wasn't as spicy as I'd hoped but they did bring me some good chile sauce. The people working there were very friendly and checked to make sure I enjoyed everything. In short: I sent back empty plates and left with a full belly for under eight bucks. That's a good lunch in my book. I'm eager to try some of their other menu items.

52.description: I have been very happy with everything I've tried here. I'm a big fan of the pad thai, made spicy. I mean, yeah - it's pad thai - usually a decent dish anywhere, but I especially like it from here. I also like the crab rangoon which I usually don't care much for. Good place around the corner.

50.description: I just had 20 minutes to have some dinner, it was late and I didn't know the area. I decided to try Rice Thai Cafe, and that was such a good choice. I ordered a Thai Massaman and it was totally mouthwatering. I just cannot understand the bad reviews on this place. Maybe people are way too used to regular, non-genuine asian food.One of the best dishes I've tried in America so far.The service was simply as it should be, I felt comfortable.Notice that I have just been here once and I just ate one dish. If you want to try something new, go for the Massaman.It is SO cheap.

4.description: This place is great. Their lunch special is very affordable, they are always very kind, providing good service, and a clean and appealing establishment. It is rather small, which makes for it to get quite full rather easily but the food, atmosphere and service are so good that it does not even bother me that much. Reading the comments, it seems like they have issues with deliveries so I would advise people to dine in instead. They also seem to make mistakes with orders sometimes (i.e. chicken instead of tofu, etc.) so I think that by dining in, you would be in a better position to get those problems addressed in a timely manner. All in all, I would highly recommend this restaurant.

6.description: Not sure why they don't have better reviews! For a local small place tucked in the RP neighborhood, their Thai items are always good and very consistent. Love the Panang curry! Cheap and quick too! They also have a really good Thai Iced Tea, when I am feeling indulgent.Plus you can order right off of Yelp, which is convenient. They are closed on Monday's, learned that the hard way!Overall, satisfying inexpensive thai cuisine! Our go-to place when we want to stay home and eat!

22.description: I tried this place for the first time today and I was extremely impressed. The staff is very friendly and the service was very quick. I ordered the Pad Thai and it was delicious. I can't wait to eat there again.

15.description: Expensive!

57.description: Been gone for years and when I come home I stop there. Jim and his wife take the time to know you and your preferences. Having actually been to Thailand I can say with certainty that RTC is as authentic in portion sizes and taste as it gets. For a real experience in Thai cuisine give it a whirl.

20.description: Oh man! I have eaten here at least 2 or 3 times and I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. I LOVE crab Rangoon (like, LOVE) and I have always been so happy with the ones from here. I have also had sushi (although I unhelpfully can't recall exactly which kinds) which was also extremely delicious. Additionally, the owner is always warm, kind, friendly, and attentive. The space itself is a little small but it certainly feels cozy and not claustrophobic. Definitely get the crab Rangoon and then go see a movie next door! :-)

36.description: I have ordered from this place several times, it's mediocre but it will do if I don't feel like going too far for a meal.Today, I ordered Pad See Ew and Garlic Chicken for carryout. $20, not bad.Opened it up, poured my rice into the garlic chicken, and there it was.A long, coarse, curly pubic hair.I don't know who was scratching their balls and then cooking, but I can't bring myself to ever order/eat there again. Ever.

14.description: I've tried Rice Thai Cafe before - maybe 3 times, and in the past I would have given them 1 or 2 stars, but I went yesterday, and it wasn't as bad as the last time. The service was friendly enough, and the food was prepared very fast (maybe too fast?). I got the Tom Yum Soup with Tofu, which I believe was pretty tasty, with a lot of tofu. But, it was so spicy that I couldn't really take in any subtleties of flavors, and I think it was a bit lacking on vegetables. I also got Chicken Pad See Eiw, which tasted good, but, but was a little too wet, and a little lacking on chicken & veggies. Not bad. But, not amazing.Again, I've been here a few times before, and I think this was the best food they've made for me. I thought - "Hmmmm, maybe they got a new cook over there??". So, in the end, I suppose it was decent, but definitely not the best Thai food in Chicago. I would highly recommend Star of Siam or Joy's. But, Rice Thai can work in a pinch. 2.5 stars for the food, and .5 star extra because it's across the street from my home. Enjoy!

29.description: Just had dinner here and the service was very slow. They are apparently cash only,but don't advertise that anywhere but the register. We got a steak tortas that barely had any meat on it, and the chicken fajitas had a strange taste to them. We also ordered guacamole as an appetizer, but it didn't come out until our food did. (Without any chips so apparently I'm supposed to just spoon the guacamole into my mouth)The guacamole barely had any avocado on it. It was mostly a dry pico de gallo with a tiny bit of avocado. When I tried to ask for an itemized bill, the lady at the register gave attitude. For how much they're charging, they can keep their attitude and gross food.

42.description: love these guys. Super professional waiters make you feel like you are at a fine dining place. oh, and the food makes you feel like you are fine dining. the soup is super delicious, exotic and home made. the plates are large and beautiful with whole  grilled onions and peppers garnish. make sure to try a glass of fresh squeezed to order juice. Soon they will have a margarita bar and mariachi music. BEST of ALL... 24 hours and free parking. Nothing else is open for a fresh. healthy Mexican breakfast in the neighborhood, but here I come Del Rey! for my early morning ambrosia!

23.description: Horchata is pretty good and the carne asada tacos are awesome! I have yet to try the margaritas but I plan to soon!

47.description: This place has a lot going for it. In a land of grungy taco joints, El Rey stands out.* It has a parking lot!!!* Free delivery,,,wait for it...24 freakin' hours a day....whaaaat?* Free soup for dine-in customers*taco stand prices* Clean environment* Some kind of lovely apple concoction in the al pastor tacos* two kinds of out of the box salsas* Chips and Salsa while I waitedThe only con was the Packers mug on counter. I told the guy her seriously needed to get rid of that thing.I orignally ordered just three tacos. The guy asked if I wanted to make it a dinner with rice and beans. Sure but then make it two tacos. As I was waiting I noticed on the menu board that the dinner was three tacos. He adjusted the price to my two tacos without even mentioning it. That's great service. Oh, and the food was really good. I'm for sure going back.

8.description: Only seafood is dank I just had a burrito de al pastor.. tasted worst then the first time I tried it. Never eat the al pastor

31.description: ordered a few times, was good...the second to last time i ordered, i was sent terrible tasting/burnt chorizo with small hard pieces of something in it. after calling, i was told the manager would call back. that didn't happen even after the second phone call. food was thrown in garbage, money was wasted, and ended up not having dinner. i decided to try one more time this evening. They over charged my credit card...the driver said he could see where they did it and called but the phone kept going to voicemail. terrible customer service and now they're stealing. be careful, you're taking a risk ordering delivery from this 'business.'

34.description: Excellent service. The guy who took our order was very friendly and accommodating. I really like the soup that they give you for free if you dine in. It wasn't just a nasty freebie it was good! I found out that they deliver - joy! I'm very pleased with my first impression of this restaurant.

16.description: Closes at midnight apparently? Poor service multiple times, but good food. Wouldn't bother if it wasn't so close

13.description: This place has been changed often. So far the best.. best tacos on Clark,  awesome shrimp soup and fajitas. Drinks are also pretty good. And they always have specials..

11.description: Great place for late night taco cravings!I ordered the steak, pork and chicken tacos as well as their chips and guac. Everything was literally so good. I went to La Choza last time when I wanted late night Mexican food but wasn't that satisfied with their food. El Rey Del Tacos wins hands down!! Even though their tacos go for $2.05 each, which is super expensive for tacos in my book, they were definitely worth it!If I had to rank the tacos, it would be pork, steak then chicken. I loved that they included the grilled onions and peppers, they were a great addition to my taco experience!The guac with the chips was super flavorful and had a sprinkle of shredded cheese on top which was a nice touch!I would definitely revisit this place!

39.description: I rate out of 5, the asada (burrito), alpastor (tacos) the chips, the salsas,the horchata, and the serviceAsada (steak) 4/5 tender and juicyAlpastor (pork) 2.5/5 a little dryChips and salsa 2/5 chips look old and salsa is not one bit goodHorchata 5/5 nice and sweet, good amount servedSalsas 0/5 worst salsas I've ever had, was not spicy at all, my food would've been better if the salsas were better..sorryService 4/5 it took a while to get our food, the restaurant was half empty..the waitress was very nice, the food was served in good amounts. Not to mention the grilled onions and jalapeños. 17.5/30I would go back, I just wont get alpastor anymore and I would take my own salsa

37.description: Great 24-hour place tha now takes credit cards. Love the free soup, the guacamole, the tacos, quesadillas and the arroz con Leche. I think the drinks must be good --saw Alderman Moore and some friends knocking  back the margaritas a couple of Sundays ago.  The rice and beans accompaniment to the dinner plates ¡excelente !

0.description: This place has a huge menu.  They have lobster, mussels, crab, shrimp, snapper, tilapia, etc., etc...  They have a lot of seafood and you can get it done many different ways.  I loved the whole snapper in their garlic sauce.  They have the usual taqueria stuff too.  I had some Al Pastor and it was great.  They do serve alcohol.  The prices are very good....  This was my first time there and I'm a fan.  The place really is excellent.  Here are 2 criticisms..... #1 The empanadas are big, but only have ONE small shrimp inside.... so don't bother.  #2  They don't give you a bill listing what you ordered.  They just ask you for money without itemizing your bill...... so remember what you ordered!  They have a juke box.  This placed used to be a fast food joint, so it has some booths and tables.  They do have parking.  The seafood menu really is impressive.

38.description: Amazing service! Forgot the waiter's name but he's really nice. I like their tacos and they give you free soup!

27.description: Best Mexican food I have ever had.  My compliments to the excellent Chef and pleasant Server/ Host lady. The soup, grilled vegetables, chips and 3 perfect sauces were all complimentary and will make this my favorite Mexican restaurant.

32.description: To this person Attached.....Ok Ok Ok lets start....... why if the table was NASTY u sat on....????????Its doesn"t matter if she ask u for ID afeter or before....... u need ur ID that is it......If u see that she was bussy with the gossip with other employees why u dont caal her or u run out??? may be u r jelous with the guy that did noy pay attention to u...... annnnnddddd on top of that u r so stupid to order something to go if u are complening of everythinggg.... please give me a break....... u r  sooooo stupid_______________________________________________________La B.Rogers Park, Chicago, IL5 friends2 reviewsShare reviewComplimentSend messageFollow La B.1.0 star rating 7/11/2014I came In To Eat With My Girl a few minutes ago!!!! There was an older Mexican lady that served us!!! Something we noticed that I didn't like was the customer's service!!!! First  she takes our order and my friend ordered a lime margarita!!! She brings it over and right before my friend was going to drink it she asked for the ID!!! REALLY AFTER SHE MADE IT AND BRINGS IT SHE WANTS ID???? Second of all the margarita was not even done right it was so nasty!!!! We told her it was horrible and she Still charged for it!!! Third of all the table we sat on had to be cleaned cuz it was dirty!!!! Yells at another younger girl to clean it!!!! Every time we wanted something else we had to get her attention cuz she was to busy with the gossip with the kitchen  guy!!! Fourth of all we asked her for the check and she took forever to bring it to us when the whole place was empty so we walked up to the cash register to pay finally I always order food to go today was the first time that I actually dined in and I will never go back there why should I spend my hard earned money to a place with terrible customer service they obviously don't care about their business is the owner not aware of this or does he simply not care

48.description: I called for delivery at 2:52 am, they said 25 minutes.  It is now 4:21, and after 3 calls, still no food.  Maybe the food is good, but good luck getting it.

44.description: Go here!  The guy at the counter was super-nice and friendly.  Offered to make the food any way I wanted and chips/salsa/chicken soup while I waited for a carryout order.  It's also 24 hours, has parking and they deliver.  The chile relleno burrito was big and made well with beans, tomato and cilantro (I asked for no lettuce and sour cream).I've tried some of the other places in the Rogers Park/Clark St. area and the food is either gross or they refuse to make things even if they have the ingredients.Go to El Rey Del Taco.

24.description: Deeelicious and friendly.  I stopped in while I was waiting for my car in the shop for a taco, and was recommended the chicken and cactus.  I'm very happy that I went with the recommendation, it was delicious and huge!  Could not be happier with my meal, definitely worth a try!

7.description: Hands down one of the best taqueria's in Chicago. The food is reasonably priced, absolutely delicious and the margaritas are strong! I've taken several friends and co-workers here and they all fell in love with the place. The staff are friendly and attentive. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone that appreciates delicious simple comfort food.

49.description: Really great food! This restaurant location hasn't done well in the past but the new owners are great! Free soup and chips and salsa with every meal, even while you wait for carry out! Going home to enjoy the rest of the meal. Open 24Hrs and BYOB are a definitely plus. They also deliver.

40.description: So pleasantly surprised by our experience with El Rey del Taco today!  We've been meaning to try them out since they opened and today I ordered tacos for pick-up.  We tried the Carne Asada, Chorizo and Al Pastor.  All were delicious!!  And these are good-sized, generous tacos that come with roasted onions and jalapenos on the side!  My standard for a good taco joint is one that makes and authentic Al Pastor taco and this place sure does!  The seasonings were just right and they add the pineapple!!!  Deelish.  I was only inside for a few minutes but they have a nice selection of bottled beers and the place was very clean and bright.  Hope they stick around!

30.description: Everything was just "ok". With many other options in the area, I wouldn't rush to try this place again.

46.description: The food takes a while, because there's only one person in the kitchen, but the value is very good. I had the steak enchilada plate and it was very large.

1.description: They are a very nice crew, I met a couple of them when they accidentally delivered the wrong meal to our place. They were quick to come pick up the incorrect order and process a new order.The 3 stars is on the food itself and not the delayed delivery. Truthfully, it was bad but it just wasn't great. I would order from them in a pinch but it wouldn't be my go to.

9.description: Ridiculously good tacos. Great salsas. If you live on the North Side, this is your new King of Tacos! The service is great, too!

26.description: I was starving and couldn't even finish my meal here. This is certainly a first! I ordered a chicken burrito. It was incredibly bland and soggy. I sensed that the ingredients, or the entire burrito was sitting out all morning. The cheese was barely identifiable. I thought the cheese may have been soaked in water for a few hours before being included as an ingredient. The tomatoes were more of a paste. I couldn't find the chicken!My partner ordered 3 chicken taquitos. The onions tasted as if they were sitting out for quite some time, the meat was ground, dry, and very slightly seasoned.  His meal as a whole was bland, dry, and cooked without any pride whatsoever. I'd forgotten to mention the so-called rice water. It tasted more like a melted McDonald's vanilla shake. There was no flavor here...This place is a shame. I'd rate 0 stars if I could.  I was genuinely concerned about my health after leaving this pace. Never again!Cash-only! The ATM fee for the one inside the restaurant is $3. Consider that your tip!

25.description: Moved very close so was looking forward to a better than average place in walking distance. It's 50/50 whether I will go back. The best reviews read like an employees friend wrote them. Yes there it parking, 4 spaces and there is another shop (just closed for now) using the same lot. Not much street parking so walk if you can.It is very clean so that's good or this would be one star.The waitress probably thought she was just being friendly and helpful but my goodness shut up long enough for a person to think. For a lunch she was do a hard sell on $16-$19 dinners, really pushing the margaritas even after being told my girlfriend cannot drink and it's too early for me. We had to ask 3 times for just a few minutes to read the menu!Had the cheese enchilada's in mole. Some people will like the reddish mole, its just not the style I like. The rice was passable as was the beans but nothing to write home about at almost $10. She had 3 steak tacos, small, very small, lots of rice and beans. It was ok, at I think around $8.50. Most of the menu are high priced dinners, a little section at the back for halfway reasonable tacos and such.You'd think a place that pushes $20 meals would at least have glasses for your can of coke. Oh and I needed a knife so I got metal utensils, my gf got a tiny plastic fork.I'm used to places like this having the TV compete with the music but both were so blaringly loud it almost drove us out, especially when the drunk patron in back (only 2 other people besides us) started singing terribly and the 5 people "working" there were amused.There were a couple things on the menu I might like to try for dinner but I'll go someplace with a little more class at those prices, have a feeling way too many margaritas are consumed in the evening to be a pleasant place to hang out over a nice dinner. I WANTED to like the place and started by making excuses for them but finally had to leave totally disappointed. Waste of time and money.

12.description: I'm not a fan of the cheap, watered-down salsa. However, the tacos are great. I enjoy their horchata and they're usually open 24 hours, just not during winter. They have an interesting desert selection which I've yet to try. Their winter hours are 9am to midnight. The service is always friendly and welcoming. Even though the food isn't the best, I enjoy coming here.

21.description: Customer service A+! Free soup & chips w any purchase, even take out! The chicken tacos were absolutely mouth watering! I'll be back!!

17.description: Really good. Lots of tasty mexican food. More than I could eat for about 12$.  The tacos especially good. About 2$ each...nice little cup of soup.  I do agree with another reviewer though about their salsa ...  It Could use some serious revision.

10.description: Really terrible service. They brought the drinks wrong!  They didn't know their menu. The server argued when the order wasn't correct. They wouldn't give us manager or owners  informations. We've been here in the past and we liked the food. I will never return and dont recommend anyone eating here.

5.description: After work, it was a beautiful day outside, so we were looking for a place that had 1) outdoor seating 2) full bar 3) inexpensive food 4) tacos. This place hit all four on the head. Got a pitcher of sangria and a torta, both of which were great quality and LARGE portions for the price.  Definitely recommend going this place whether it's right after work, or at 3 am (it's open 24 hours!).

3.description: Was looking for Mexican breakfast. Pros: patio with a roof, bf liked huevos con chorizo which was beautifully plated, large portions, giant copas (micheladas perhaps?) looked fun, got to shock the other tables when I broke out in Spanish which is unusually good for a gringa. Cons: chilaquilles were disgusting: chicken and eggs were so so greasy. Plate was one brownish mess. Coffee took 25 mins to arrive- way after the food. Ridiculously huge portions. Half of us got useless plastic forks. And the place wasn't even busy!Y el colmo: $27 total which did NOT align with the menu prices. I wanted to love you but NOPE.

35.description: Unfortunately the salsas were absolutely disgusting. They only serve refried beans. Really? No black beans or charro beans. How sad. Carne asada & chicken tacos were amazingly tasteless. We couldn't even taste the cilantro on the tacos. It was bizarre. Waitstaff was nice... Kinda. They didn't like that I paid with a debit card so they up charged the bill $1. We were hoping that this place would get better, but if they up charge a bill for using a card... Not worth it.

19.description: Possibly the best tacos I've ever had. Normally I wouldn't have stopped, but I was hungry and it was the nearest place to get a taco. There was nothing about the place that stood out, and my expectations were low. I hoped it would at least be passable.Even though I ordered takeout, they gave me a cup of soup and chips and salsa. Unnecessary, but very kind. I had the soup and chips while I waited. The carne asada taco was the tenderest, most flavorful carne asada I have ever tasted, and the chille relleno taco was out of this world. I was amazed. Even at my favorite Mexican restaurants the fare isn't half so good as it was at El Rey Del Taco. I can't wait to go back. I'd rate the food 5 stars, the atmosphere 2.5 or 3 stars. Since I don't care about the atmosphere, I'm giving my rating for the food and the hospitality, which were wonderful.

28.description: Really good. Lots of tasty mexican food. More than I could eat for about 12$.  The tacos especially good. About 2$ each...nice little cup of soup.  I do agree with another reviewer though about their salsa ...  It Could use some serious revision.

45.description: My guy and I went in for breakfast this morning.   Ordered coffee, huevos a la mexicana and chilaquiles verdes.   HOLY SMOKES! SO GREAT! Here's what we got: chips3 salsasa cup each of an amazing chicken soup with pastaa platter that was easily 18" wide with beans, rice, "salad", and my eggstortillasgrilled torta breadcoffee with a hint of cinnamon (I love this trick so much(Incredible value. Great service. Food was phenomenal. Can't wait to go back when the patio is open for some BYOB magic. Maybe  a great place to watch some world cup this summer...

33.description: I came In To Eat With My Girl a few minutes ago!!!! There was an older Mexican lady that served us!!! Something we noticed that I didn't like was the customer's service!!!! First  she takes our order and my friend ordered a lime margarita!!! She brings it over and right before my friend was going to drink it she asked for the ID!!! REALLY AFTER SHE MADE IT AND BRINGS IT SHE WANTS ID???? Second of all the margarita was not even done right it was so nasty!!!! We told her it was horrible and she Still charged for it!!! Third of all the table we sat on had to be cleaned cuz it was dirty!!!! Yells at another younger girl to clean it!!!! Every time we wanted something else we had to get her attention cuz she was to busy with the gossip with the kitchen  guy!!! Fourth of all we asked her for the check and she took forever to bring it to us when the whole place was empty so we walked up to the cash register to pay finally I always order food to go today was the first time that I actually dined in and I will never go back there why should I spend my hard earned money to a place with terrible customer service they obviously don't care about their business is the owner not aware of this or does he simply not care

43.description: i liked this place.went to go to Panchitos for breakfast, but it is gone and this place is there in its stead.food was tasty and portions generous and prices very fair.had steak and eggs - came with wonderful grilled jalepeno and grilled spring onion - as well as rice and beans and wonderfully fluffy corn tortillas - oh and a free cup of chicken soup with macaroni.  chips are served with 3 types of salsa, presented very nicely in ramekins all in a single holder.  I liked the chips - thin and crispy - but didn't love any of the salsas - visually they were very pretty, but didn't have a lot of flavor, other than lime or vinegar.  one of them almost seemed creamy - like it had mayonnaise in it.   iI'm not saying it has mayonnaise in it, but it did seem like it had a mayonnaise or similar base.anyway - over all- I'd probably go back.  they are open 24 hours, so that's very convenient -and they have a parking lot -which is really nice.  table service was a bit slow - but friendly enough.  and the place seems clean.also BYOB.unfortunately it is cash only - which i don't usually do cash only places - but since it is so cheap - i'm willing to give it a pass.  I would never accept cash only for any place that serves alcohol or is more expensive, because i simply don't want to carry that amount of cash around with me.

2.description: Third time was NOT the charm!  My first 2 orders were online... both of which were totally messed up!   HOW friggin hard is it to make tacos with just meat, cheese, and sour cream?3rd time I figured I would stop in and wait for my order, thinking since I was actually there in the flesh that they would get it right.... WRONG!3 tacos, covered in a mountain of cilantro.  Drove back to get a replacement, and of course, yes it was written correctly on the ticket.  Guess I need to brush up on my Spanish so maybe they will get it right... but I got a feeling this will be my last order.  YEESH!

18.description: Best Mexican food I have ever had.  My compliments to the excellent Chef and pleasant Server/ Host lady. The soup, grilled vegetables, chips and 3 perfect sauces were all complimentary and will make this my favorite Mexican restaurant.

41.description: Yes, they truly are 5 star good. Price, food, service, all great. I had what was one of the few pricier items on the menu (a relative term for sure) at 13.99,: the skirt steak with enchiladas. The steak was marinated to perfection. Add to that the warm tortillas in a covered wooden bowl and the free, unexpected offer of a cup of chicken macaroni soup for an appetizer and it was a lot for the money. They just added a bar, but it was too early for my tastes to try it, but I will next time. This new place really stands out in an area that has more, good Mexican choices than most in Chicago. That tells you how good they are.

4.description: Nothing special about their tacos, which was RAVED about on Thrillist. Pretty standard, but nothing remarkable. When asked, "Do you want everything on the taco", I understood that as "do you want everything that comes free with it", not "do you want the extras (sour cream and avocado). So my surprise when I ordered 8 tacos (2x each of lengua, al pastor, adobada, chorizo), it was 2.75 each. I asked why it was so much after my card got immediately swiped (my fault) a little too late. I paid ~25 dollars for 8 tacos, which is absurd. Haven't tried anything else on their menu, but I'm not sure if I would return.

6.description: BUGS!  I go to check out, He says was everything ok and I whisper to him no, there's a bug on the chandelier over our table, he says that's impossible because we fumigate every week.

22.description: I'm not a fan of the cheap, watered-down salsa. However, the tacos are great. I enjoy their horchata and they're usually open 24 hours, just not during winter. They have an interesting desert selection which I've yet to try. Their winter hours are 9am to midnight. The service is always friendly and welcoming. Even though the food isn't the best, I enjoy coming here.

15.description: This restaurant is not open 24 hours. Was looking for a midnight snack on Saturday. I showed up around 12:20 and it was closed.

20.description: Great place for late night taco cravings!I ordered the steak, pork and chicken tacos as well as their chips and guac. Everything was literally so good. I went to La Choza last time when I wanted late night Mexican food but wasn't that satisfied with their food. El Rey Del Tacos wins hands down!! Even though their tacos go for $2.05 each, which is super expensive for tacos in my book, they were definitely worth it!If I had to rank the tacos, it would be pork, steak then chicken. I loved that they included the grilled onions and peppers, they were a great addition to my taco experience!The guac with the chips was super flavorful and had a sprinkle of shredded cheese on top which was a nice touch!I would definitely revisit this place!

36.description: Mexican Food that 'Hits the Spot".On the night we just arrived back into Chicago -- late due to delayed flight; was happy to find this place open in our neighborhood.  We definitely thought food was good, prices fair, and service attentive.  Recommended.

14.description: I really love this place. I've been coming here for months for a quick late night bite. The salsas are incredible. Horchata is delicious. Cash Only, atm available of course. Nice patio!

58.description: Absolutely delicious! I haven't had anything less than spectacular from here, so I had to make this my first Yelp review.Everything is very FRESH and flavorful. My favorites: Guacamole, Pico De Gallo, Nachos, Chicken Enchiladas in Mole, Carne Asada, Al Pastor Tacos, BeansThe mole sauce is great. It's not too sweet or spicy. The green/red salsas are also good. I'm impressed by the care they put into preparing and presenting the food. Even when I get delivery from Grubhub, everything is carefully packed and presented. You can tell that they take pride in their food. I have tried nearly every Mexican restaurant in a 5 mile radius, and I feel like I've found The One.

56.description: Lets update this review shall we? This taqueria remains THE BEST on Clark. The Best. A new favorite dish is the Lengua in Salsa Verde or Roja. I prefer the roja though. Served with plenty of tortillas, lime and avocado on the side. Best plate of food ever - you can eat yourself sick and silly and it's totally fantastic. Their salsa is always, always good, especially the verde. They also give you tons of extra lime and avocado with your meal (at least they do for the boyfriend and I, if they don't bring it to you, just ask, they will gladly fill your table with whatever you like and probably wont even charge you extra). I've never had anything bad here. Perfect tacos, sopes, nachos, enchiladas, mole, mouth-watering-life-changing skirt steak, chilaquiles to cure any ailment, their flautas are always a safe and delicious choice. The real problem is deciding WHAT to get.I highly recommend getting lengua or cabasa as your meat, especially the lengua, it is too good for words. The staff is also crazy nice, sweet, adorable, perfect. I love them. I tip big and eat well at Cuetzala.

29.description: The carne asada and the horchata were amazing. The tamales nejo tasted like rice cakes and had a strange spicy sauce. I didn't enjoy it much. The guacamole was fresh. Chile relleno was quite good as well. Overall, the carne asada makes this a must try.The enchilada was not great, but the lengua was phenomenal.

42.description: My el pastor taco was ok, not phenomenal... but I wonder if because I asked for no cilantro that there was something missing. It was just pork and red onions. A bit dry.The enchiladas were great! Completely forgot about the taco because of this! It was all amazing, until I found what I think was a piece of bone. It was grey and almost looked like a dog's toenail--but given that I'm not familiar with chicken bones, it could have been a part of the chicken. But it turned me off so badly that I couldn't finish the meal.The beans were runny and seemed more like white beans than traditional pinto--maybe they were pink pinto? They were ok. Same with the rice. It was good. Nothing to write home about, but still good.My favorite: the Horchata. Absolutely amazing. Really hitting the spot today. Cup leaked a little--I think just because they got jostled during transport. But easily remedied by putting into another glass. I'm not a horchata expert, but this was exactly what I was wanting and hoping for.I'd totally walk a half hour just fo

23.description: The food was good. Customer service was good as well. Price may be slightly higher than your typical  mexican joint, but quality was  worth it.The only thing I did not like was a bit of sales pressure to buy a drink from the waitress. She was very nice about it but that was the feeling I got. Not sure if I misread but nonetheless, will return.

47.description: I hate to give this place 2 stars but I have to. Let me start by saying that when I finally received my food it was phenomenal. We came in on a Friday night 1-18-13 around 6:30 and the place was nowhere near busy. There was one waitress in the entire place. Chips and salsa were promptly brought to the table and both were delicious. We shared steak and shrimp fajitas, and it was excellent! Now for the bad part. We waited about 30 minutes for the fajitas to arrive. By the time that we finally received the food we weren't hungry anymore. The waitress kept apologizing for the long wait. Honestly, the meal should've been compensated after that ridiculous wait but it wasn't. The food is great here, unfortunately the service sucks.

8.description: My favorite Chicago Mexican restaurant. My partner & I eat here often. A bit pricier than the surrounding neighborhood taquerias but the quality of the food is excellent. I have never had a bad meal here. A few of my favorites are the fish (tilapia) tacos, the chili relleno tacos and the pollo milanesa dinner. My partner is addicted to the steak tacos. Also, the complimentary chips & salsas (both verde & roja) are delicious...and unlike most places these days, they aren't stingy with them. I LOVE chips & salsa and they keep bringing them.In addition to the food, the restaurant itself is immaculate. The place is CLEAN and you can tell that the owner & staff take great pride in the place. I think the bathroom is one of the cleanest I have ever seen in a restaurant. Finally, I have to give a shout out to Denisa, our favorite server. She is extremely attentive & always has a smile on her face. She made us feel welcome from the moment we first walked in the place.If you are looking for a Mexican spot that outshines all the others in the hood yet won't break the bank, give this place a try. You won't regret it!

31.description: Salsa - amazing. Carne asada burrito - great. Guacamole - meh. Carne asada enchiladas - avoid like the plague.The enchiladas taste like burnt nasty. The sauce they use is easily the worst I've ever tasted. I lived in San Diego for 5 1/2 years, I know good Mexican food. You're better off buying Mission tortillas and a can of enchilada sauce at Jewel.Thank God I ordered the burrito too, planning on leftovers. The enchiladas went straight in the trash.

34.description: This the best little Mexican joint on North Clark. Small, simple, & homespun. Try the Lengua Platillo or awesome skirt steak. For CHEAP you can have a traditional tamal made from an ancient recipe of masa & ash wrapped in banana leaf & steamed. Get the dark mole to go with it. Enjoy with soccer in Spanish. Great evening!

16.description: The salsa was amazing, but that was about it.  The place smelled like Lysol upon entry, and that is always off-putting.  That said, nothing was overtly offensive.

13.description: I have walked past this place many times on my way to other Mexican restaurants and once I finally stopped in I regretted going past it. The decor is very nice and has a home feeling to it. The food was great. My family and I had tacos and gorditas. They have a great kids meal that is actually big enough for an adult. The food is very fresh and the staff is super personable. We definitely will not skip this place ever again!

11.description: Went tonight with the folks, brother niece and her boyfriend. Still the best. Great food, great wait staff. They now have a sign on the back door so you can park in the lot for free and walk in.

39.description: Complete joke. Ordered through grub hub. 2 hours later no food. Their driver lied and said they came and rang bell and left it with someone else. Problem is we watched the front door and no one ever came to our building of only 4 units. Never pay up front or the lazy driver will simply give it away.

37.description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!I usually order the chicken fajitas, which are honestly the best fajitas I have had anywhere. I have also ordered the tacos which are also very good. The prices are very reasonable and they offer free delivery in my area. The only thing that could make me love this place more is if they had a liquor license.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
