Our vegetarian sampler had Gomen (Collard leaves cooked in sauce), Dinich Alicha (Potatoes and carrot curry) and Yesimir Wat (Red lentil spicy curry)For sambussa - I would recommend lentil one and spinach for vegetarians. And our entree was delicious so I wouldn't really change anything there.Dessert - For dessert, we got chocolate diamond and Destaye but I wasn't really impressed with the latter. Chocolate diamond was delicious and hit all the right spots for us, chocolate lovers. We did not get the coffee - which I regret deeply now but it was pretty late at night and I wanted to sleep after coming home. Next time I will get it for sure.Service - Service was great. Non intrusive and friendly! I would definitely give them 5 stars for it. They also had a band playing while we were there and we were able to get seated immediately on a Saturday. The only thing I would note is that the food here is more on the slightly higher end. It seemed pretty reasonable with a groupon but full price is a bit on the moderate side for me. Great for a special occasion but not exactly a place I would go regularly.

3.description: A group and I came on a Saturday after 7pm. The live music playing during dinner makes hearing across the table difficult when the music volume increases, but I forgive them, because the musicians are very friendly. In fact, one even walked around the restaurant to gather feedback from their patrons. I'd come with friends to sample more entree toppings; the vegetarian ones I'd recommend are the gomen, duba wat, and yatklit wat. Avoid drinking water while you're eating injera, since the pores of the bread absorb water, making you fuller sooner. End your dining experience with the Destaye (My Happiness) which is appropriately named.

35.description: I brought my wife here for our anniversary, as a tribute to our first date, when we both tried Ethiopian food for the first time.  The atmosphere was quiet and there was only one other table seated, which was surprising for the dinner hour.  The server was polite and attentive throughout the meal.The dishes here were not bad overall, but the taste seemed uneven from one dish to the next.  Some offerings were quite flavorful, while others were rather bland.  Out of the six or seven dishes we tried, only two really stood out, and one (Gomen, or collard greens) was actually pretty unpleasant, presented cold, limp, and a little slimy, with no redeeming flavor profile.  My wife enjoyed the Sambusa appetizer, but like the entrees, it was a little pricey for what we received.More disappointing than the food, however, was this establishment's restriction on sharing plates.  Sharing a platter of food is a central aspect of Ethiopian dining, and the cover of the menu even lauds this cultural tradition, reading, "The ritual of breaking Injera and eating from the same plate is an ancient tradition."  In practice however, such sharing is prohibited by Ethiopian Diamond unless you pay for a double portion, despite the fact that a "single" serving platter is more than sufficient for two people.  In addition, a $5 "sharing charge" is applied automatically if 80% of your party does not order their own entree.  When I didn't finish my portion, the server removed the plate and boxed it for me in the back.  However, upon opening the box, hoping to get my money's worth out of the leftovers, I discovered a mess.  It appeared that the server had simply dumped the entire contents of my plate into the carryout box, creating a jumbled mix of various entrees, sauce, and soggy Injera bread.In the end, the mediocre food, restrictions on sharing, steep price, and the handling of the inevitable leftovers resulted in a somewhat disappointing experience, despite a pleasant atmosphere and otherwise good service.  With the abundance of Ethiopian dining in the area, we'll definitely be sampling some of the other options in the area before returning to Ethiopian Diamond.

19.description: Though I live near the original Ethiopian Diamond restaurant. I would come here instead for the great jazz band playing live.

28.description: Really disappointed, everyone gives this place such high reviews but this was the worst Ethiopian place I have been to. I ordered the Doro Tibs which is usually amazing at any place I go but here it was plain and sad. All of the food tasted like they got it out of a can. Nothing was fresh all the food was very plain and we were very hungry.I will not be going back.Go to Addis Abeba is much better.

45.description: Yeah, this is my go-to Ethiopian place. The food is great, the service is good, and the ambience, for a strip mall, is pretty all right, too. I came one night with some out-of-town guests while they were holding a wedding reception in the restaurant--a big, Ethiopian wedding reception. Oddly, the wedding party didn't rent the whole restaurant out, so there were still a few paying customers on the edges. The whole thing was charming. We had a dispute over the bill (concerning an honest mistake made by a very harried server) and the owner was extraordinarily sweet about it. So I go back constantly.

33.description: This is the best food in Chicago. I haven't tried anything that's not delicious. The service is friendly and fast. Saturday nights, Phil Cohran performs live. Check it out!

43.description: great food, pretty quick, great servers

2.description: Food was delicious. Injera was so fresh!  Got the traditional Ethiopian meal. The food was fresh and didn't take too long to get once we were waited on. The service is friendly, but don't expect anything to happen quickly.Place is fairly clean, even the bathroom not too shabby.

18.description: This place is great. I have been to another location as well and loved it.They have great chicken dishes. The sambusas are great. The fish is absolutely amazing, hands down! The potatoes and string beans are tasty. I highly recommend. This place has honey wine too and it's great.

41.description: This is my favorite place to eat ethiopian food in the area! There is usually a groupon for it - and its such a great value. We come in usually with about four people, and my three year old son, and order the vegetarian combo platter. There is so much food, its all so so delicious and we leave so full! The service is always really friendly, and they are always so nice to my son. Its a place i love to return to and I always try to bring new people with me to introduce them to ethiopian food.

52.description: This was my first Ethiopian restaurant and I loved it! It was very crowded when we arrived, but we were seated quickly. Because of the busyness, we sometimes had a hard time getting our waitress, but when the food came we were quite content!

50.description: First time trying Ethiopian food. And boy is it different. There is no such things as utensils! I suggest you go in big groups, one because it's pricey and two who likes to eat a whole tray of flour with one topping ? At first when they brought the side order of flour, I had thought they were towels. Oops ? The only problem I had with this place was that there were no napkins at all. Eating with just our hands tend to get very messy. But overall it was nice, being so unfamiliar with the food, our waitress had been very helpful on what's good for each of the meats. Side note, when you ask one of the waiters to take a picture, make sure you check everyone is in it. Our friend got cropped out. Poor thing !

4.description: Just tried to order through Grub Hub, they are closed, anyone know anything??

6.description: I tried Ethiopian food for the first time and liked the food a lot. It has nice flavors and was fresh. The service was amazing. We had one of our friends birthday and the waitress was lot nice entire evening.

22.description: Great place for a large group! Loved the sambusas - we sampled all the flavors and liked the spinach and beef versions. We tried the chicken tibs, shrimp bebere, and a few vegetarian options. One main dish is plenty for each two persons as each comes served on the tasty inerja with some really flavorful relishes. They had a nice South African Chenin Blanc that complemented the spiciness of the food.

15.description: New fare for us and the waitress guided us to an array of dishes with different flavors and textures. Of course you eat with you fingers which adds to the experience . Some dishes had a little spice , but flavors were still identifiable. We will be back. Service was pleasAnt. Not very crowded at midday   Portion size left for leftovers!

57.description: I love this Ethiopian Diamond! It's only a few blocks from my house, and as such, I've visited quite often. Ethiopian food in general is great for vegans but after trying a few other places this one takes the cake. I've gone for brunch, dinner, when they have live music, etc. The waitresses are always fast and friendly, the food is always delicious. I've tried several of their imported beer options and never been disappointed. I always leave with a full belly and plenty of take-away that keeps and reheats well. It may be a few dollars more expensive than some other Ethiopian places I've checked out, but the fact that it's within walking distance from my house and the friendliness of the wait staff makes it well worth it. A must try!

20.description: I always enjoy African cuisine. This place is no exception. Great friendly service. Delicious food and drinks! And come one it's an Ethiopian restaurant...so... AMAZING BREAD!

36.description: Outstanding.

14.description: We loved the live music on Saturday night!  The food was delicious and all the staff were very friendly.

3.description: This place is a real find. Ask for Frankie, he's a mastermind of haircuts and there is no way you will leave the place unhappy with him cutting your hair. Frankie will remember you even if you didn't come back for 3-4 months, and that just adds to the persona. The prices are super cheap ($6) so give a decent tip. Get your haircut here! Frankie is especially good with fades, lineups, etc. which is usually my style. Check out my profile picture, it does not lie.

1.description: Been going for years. Great place for a man's haircut, usually not a long wait. Friendly staff, $6 haircuts, allows me to be Mr. Generous with the tip, 100%!

2.description: This place is just around the corner from me and I couldn't ask for a better price ($6) or a better experience.  I love me some Frankie. He is a skilled barber and super friendly. Value for your money. Be generous with tipping

5.description: I would give it 0 stars if i could. The lady I had completely butchered my hair. I specifically showed her how much I wanted off, and she agreed to it. Then she just started cutting away and it went from almost the middle of my back to barely touching my shoulders. I also wanted layers. I told her to make them subtle and they came out choppy. Worst $10 spent.

0.description: The right place to go in Rogers park.  They have $10.00 haircuts that leave you looking cute.  Very happy staff, quick, saucy, spicy hairdo's too

4.description: This place is a hidden gem, so hidden in fact that I didn't even see it appear on Yelp! I remembered this place when my friend introduced it to me. I forgot that it was relatively inexpensive. They advertise $6 haircuts and seriously, I think that is awesome. Where can you get a good haircut for $6 nowadays? Anyhow, Frank was really nice and cut my hair again.I was astounded by the fact that he remembered me considering I was visiting from out of town the last time. He even recalled where I was from. Remember, tip big here because $6 is really not that much for them.

58.description: The first couple of times, no problem but lately it seems That if your black you can forget about good service. It seemed like I wasn't wanted. Maybe they earn enough from their high prices and limited menu.

56.description: my friend and I chose this spot because it was right across the street and looked cute. we ignored our other friend who said this place was terrible. we should have just listened. First annoying thing was the host took forever to seat us even though the place was pretty empty and we could see open tables After we were sat, our server never showed up! we waited 10 minutes before asking a bus boy for coffee and he said he would grab our waitress. When she finally showed up 15 minutes later she didn't apologize and just took our order and left. Throughout our whole meal, she never once checked on us, refilled drinks, or made any effort to be a good server- didn't even tell us her name What really pissed off my friend and I was that the same waitress waited on a couple right next to us and went through the whole menu with them, chatted them up and down, and was basically so much nicer to them when she never even made an effort with us. The bus boy eventually got us our check and he was a better server then she ever was.Besides the worst service I have ever received, the food was okay. It's hard to mess up eggs.

29.description: The food was amazing, unfortunately the service was terrible. The first time I went during the lunch hour our service was great. The server was extremely sweet and helped me decide between a couple of options. I was incredibly surprised when during the dinner shift our other server hardly knew how to do her job. She actually placed the check on our table before we were done eating and wanted to order more food. I thought this might have just been one bad server based on my previous service but looking at the other reviews our good service is seems to be out of the ordinary. I love the idea of this restaurant and if they get their act together they can be incredibly successful, but it's hard to justify going to a place where the service is crap.

42.description: Ok, so ended up on a Sunday afternoon,  was busy. Hostess said 15 minutes wait was more like half N hour. The bar was busy but was able to get some adult beverages.  Got a table outside but requested inside, ok can go with the flow. Waited for service but never was acknowledged after 15 minutes.  Was through after my beverage was done, so left. Food looked good though. Work on customer service.

23.description: Not. Good.  The "Heartland Stir-fry" was a smattering of sliced summer squash, a couple slices of carrot, and some cubed tofu, mixed with a very minimalist sprinkling of quinoa.  The whole thing was doused with soy sauce to the point where it was nearly inedible.  I asked the waiter, "Is this what I ordered?  It's not what was described in the menu."  He told me they have a new chef.  They need a new, new chef.  And some paint.  And new tables and chairs.  I used to go to this place when I was in college (in the 70s because I'm that old), and I don't think they've cleaned it since then.Not going back.

47.description: I think the streetwise lady in front of the morse market is more friendly than any server I've ever had here. It's really too bad cause I'm a health nut and like the food. Would be a regular if anyone other than the busser paid attention to me or refilled my water.

8.description: Buffalo chilli on a cloudy day. Perfect. Nice menu choices for the non-vegans/vegetarians. Beers on tap as well

31.description: If no stars were possible that's what this place would get. When the service is not rude, it's uptight. And in combination with slow!Thrice I've gone here, giving it plenty of "tries", and all times I was sat on a table with crumbs and sticky from the previous seaters. The service is slow, and the people at the bar and store counter were rude. They will answer your questions like they are stating the most obvious, and will roll their eyes when they think you're not looking. By the end I stopped smiling and trying to be nice and just paid and walked away.Needless to say, I wouldn't come back even if it was the absolute last option.

34.description: Since residing in Rogers Park I have found some truly great places, and yesterday I had lunch at the Heartland Café.And, as you walk upon this place you will see a lovelyarea with patio seating or if you prefer you can go insideand sit inside where there are ample tables and chairs and alsothere's a great bar where you can kick back and relax.I was welcomed warmly by Ryan who just happened to be myserver, and a great server Ryan was!And, since yesterday was pretty hot here in Chicago I chose tosit inside and I liked what I saw, exposed brick, some really coollooking stuff adorning the walls.And, a great looking bar, however, there was a Buffalo's Headabove the bar and that made me sad..But, boy, did I like the girl's tending bar, they were very cool.Now, Heartland's main focus appears to be a Vegetarian Menu andI will admit.. Vegetarian I am not!But, Nonetheless, they also offer good ol' American Staples like anall day breakfast menu and lunch/dinner options as well.I decided on a BLT, and gotta say it was really delicious, toastedon wheat bread with homemade chips and sweet pickles on the side.Boy, was I loving those pickles..And, for those of you that shop for your Organic, really healthy stuffHeartland has a General Store attached to the restaurant, and they evenstock Red Hen Bakery Stuff!So, I am giving Heartland Café a 4 star rating, because they deserve that,Service was friendly and Prompt, it was a great casual/comfortable placeto have a meal.And, when you check in on Yelp you get 15% off a meal too!So, if you haven't visited The Heartland Café you really should..For they are a very friendly place.. and you'll feel right at home...

16.description: So this was one of the first places I visited when I moved from SO CAL into the neighborhood. I love the fact that the community is so charming and got can walk to all these cool spots. My first impression of the service I was like... "I'm Norm from cheers. I'm home!" They came keep me away now. Adam at the bar keeps your entertained. It's never boring when he is working. Ask him to put on the stuff from lost and found. The Victoria's secret black raven wings are the BEST!?! The food is pretty good too. Lots of options for vegans, vegetarians and carnivores. Buffalo Bar is unique. We r just love the Buffalo on the wall with a pieced ear.

13.description: It is what it is!  Heartland has been here forever...well since I was in college and that's quite a while ago.  They rely on their hippy vive and that's cool but service and food are pretty average.  It' really at 3.5 star place but I'll give them four for longevity.  Most place in RP don't have the longevity that this place as.  Plus, I had a hot waiter with dreadlocks twice so that's cool.The places gets crowded and service is often subpar.  If you are a veg or vegan they have you covered.  That said, most of their food is a bit bland.  I've had breakfast here and lunch, never dinner.  I know this is a lame ass review but nothing stands out on their menu for me to write about.  OK, you can shop here for some drug rugs and other trinkets...how's that for a review?

11.description: This place is so good and cute. After my boyfriend and I walked around trying to find a good breakfast place we ran into this. So glad we did. I got two eggs hash browns, bacon and English muffin for $10! So affordable for how much you get. There smoothies are good and what is even better is that they have an organic store connected. I highly recommend this place!

39.description: i enjoy this place a lot, like /a lot/. food is always so fresh, the mimosas and bloody marys. the meat and produce is tops!!! the waiting staff are always friendly and professional, even with my hungover ass. good beers. personal brunch superheaven.

37.description: Shitty service. There were tables available the whole time and we could not get a seat. According to host her excuse was she was busy seating other people. Asked to speak with manager and apparently they do not seat people at tables when theyre backed up even if tables are vacant?? Makes no sense. Then we were informed they were busy attending a table of many people. Not even an apology from the host or the manager. Amazing!! No wonder several people left upset. Very disappointing as this place was highly recommended. I am new to the area so they lost a possible longterm customer. Checked out a place called Growling rabbit as it was also recommended and host was very attentive. We were seated immediately and the food delicious.

0.description: I came here this week, after spending an afternoon at the Museum of Contemporary Art and preparing a paper for school. I had been told about this restaurant by a friend and a professor of mine and decided to give it a go.Firstly, Oscar, my waiter/server was incredibly cordial and professional and enjoyed sharing ideas with him with regards to literature. He was a very conscientious host and clearly enjoyed what he was doing. Thank you Oscar!The food was better than I'd even anticipated. I had a vegetarian chili, topped with avocado slices and a side of cornbread. For my entrée I had the "heartland stir-fry" and let me tell you, it is by far my favorite thing on the menu. By the time I finished my meal I had the strangest urge to lick the plate... Everything was THAT good.So good in fact that I plan on frequenting this establishment more as the time progresses. Thank you very much guys. The experience was very enjoyable. Go to Heartland everybody...

38.description: The Heartland Cafe is wonderfully comforting. Three meals in three days to give us the strength  to endure all three Grateful  Dead shows. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner were all relished during the long weekend.Service was perfect. Waitstaff clearly love their jobs and interact with patrons like old friends getting reacquainted.Every bite was delicious. Sandwiches, chile, salads, kombucha, local beer, everything was in the pocket.It's a long way from Bakersfield, but I will be back sooner than later.Thank you Heartland!

51.description: It is what it is!  Heartland has been here forever...well since I was in college and that's quite a while ago.  They rely on their hippy vive and that's cool but service and food are pretty average.  It' really at 3.5 star place but I'll give them four for longevity.  Most place in RP don't have the longevity that this place as.  Plus, I had a hot waiter with dreadlocks twice so that's cool.The places gets crowded and service is often subpar.  If you are a veg or vegan they have you covered.  That said, most of their food is a bit bland.  I've had breakfast here and lunch, never dinner.  I know this is a lame ass review but nothing stands out on their menu for me to write about.  OK, you can shop here for some drug rugs and other trinkets...how's that for a review?

27.description: Want great food? Great smoothies? And hot gorgeous servers? Come and check this place. I only ordered one of their best smoothie but gurrrl! The server makes me full. Hot

32.description: This place needs help. After moving to Rogers Park, it seemed like the convenient answer to our brunch prayers. After going three times, there is just no going back. Service is downright awful. On our first visit, our server literally answered his ringing cell phone while walking up to take our order. Second visit, it took no less than 15 minutes to be greeted by a server and receive waters. When we finally were greeted, we heard the dreaded "I didn't know you were in my section" line. Third visit, same story but with an ice cold egg bake to top it off. Overall, the owners need to flip this place, keep the omelette chef (the only thing worthy about this spot), and just start over. Rogers Park needs a place like this, but I can't even tolerate the service at this point, which is a real bummer.

54.description: Great breakfast, friendly and fast service, and my bill was under $11. I am definitely a fan!

48.description: I've been to this place multiple times for breakfast and love their breakfast options. I'm a vegetarian and can always appreciate a wide range of healthy items to choose from. Their veggie sausage I am so in love with- it has loads of favor and is very filling. I came in once for dinner and sat in the bar area and chose their veggie lasagna that had a side of sweet potatoes. The lasagna was great but I feel the sweet potatoes were too overpowering that it took away from me fully enjoying the lasagna. I think something else would compliment it better. The atmosphere is a big plus here the only thing that slightly lacks is the service, hence the 3 stars. I think servers should be checking in more periodically or more servers should be staffed. Otherwise I really do like this place for breakfast. Food is awesome!

44.description: I am NEVER going back to this place. I live less than a block away so I go all the time mostly for breakfast. They have no respect for the community they are in. Not that the food is that great either and the staff takes a really long time to come take your order.

24.description: I was hesitant to spend my money here based on some of the recent reviews, but I thought I should try it myself at least once. What a mistake. While the server was friendly enough, I was seated for 10-15 minutes before he arrived. The hostess had come to retrieve my menus - apparently they don't have enough even though there was only one other occupied table inside & still tables available on the patio - when I informed her that no one had come to take the order. Plenty of wait staff breezed by the table, but none bothered to stop. The bus boys appeared to be the only conscientious staff. The waiter brought the overpriced drink quickly, but then the meal was incredibly slow in coming. It would have been better if it never arrived at all. The only item edible on the plate were the three tiny pickle slices. A thoroughly disappointing and expensive meal. I won't be back, but I get the sense that the owner and staff don't care about that. Apathy permeated this place.

7.description: Very friendly and helpful staff, great food especially if you are vegan or vegetarian, like me. The house blend tea and porridge are my favorite. If you're into a power breakfast, they have a great eggs and potatoes combo meal for just $5. Can't beat that deal! I will continue to be a regular customer.

49.description: I've lived in Rogers Park for 10 years and would tell everyone how great this place is but that time has passed. The food used to be so good and atmosphere so fun, Tina Fey even mentions it in Bossy Pants.The food used to be good enough to make up for the crappy service but the menu has gone to crap as well for the last year and a half. I walked out on my most recent visit.  I sat for 10 minutes on a Sunday morning. I sat in the patio after walking in and taking a menu. They didn't see me. Fair enough but when a server did come out for another party, he completely ignored me. Then I went in and asked for someone to wait on me, the busboy had to come out twice and apologize. That is how long I was waiting.  I left.This used to be a great place to read the paper and enjoy the morning but no longer my place.This is  what happens when the hippies start making management decisions. The most recent brilliant idea was to make half  of the restaurant into an expensive health food store. Was the working class people that live in this area demanding a place to buy their Wheatgrass and vegan supplements? Doubtful. Do they really think people are going to trek to this isolated part of Rogers Park to buy gluten free brownie  mix? No parking and a bum on ever corner.  They had a good thing going but good intentions don't  pay the bills.And to the servers at this place, fuck you. I've put up with your excuses with smiles and "oh no worries" and over tipping for years with never even a slight recognition that I'm a regular in the neighborhood.  Your service is the worst in the city. I hope you over bake your next pottery bowl in the kiln.Lemon out!

40.description: The food was absolutely delicious and the service was great! We'll definitely be back!

53.description: Man this place is amazing I can't believe how incredible everything is well I come here and it's all happening I'm feeling kind of sick now but that has nothing to do with this place it's a personal thing

30.description: Walked into this place cause I was visiting and happen to be hungry at the time. Had no idea what this place is and what a vegetarian is.  If your a vegetarian.  Go for this place. If your a meat lover... Still some light shined your way.  I had a buffalo burger and it was ace! #meatlover ...sorry vegans

46.description: Was very excited to try this places, just to be left with sadden disappointment. Service is trash! Food might taste better if it was actually brought out hot, like its supposed to.

1.description: Heartland has a comfortable, worn feeling that is difficult to duplicate and is usually earned over time. The past decades Heartland has given back a lot to the community. A unique position.Their outdoor cafe area is one of the best in Chicago.They have and still focus on "clean" ingredients and dishes before it was trendy.Service and food quality is inconsistent, but never terrible.Overall eating or drinking experience fair - almost borderline good.If you are visiting Rogers Park the Heartland would be a very good choice for casual dining or drinks.

55.description: I like the atmosphere. I don't think I chose the right meal off the brunch menu (farm eggs, with hash browns, veggie sausage and cornbread). Wish they had eggs Benedict. I'll come again and give it another try.Tip: if it's your first time and you check in on Yelp, you get 15% your meal.

9.description: This place needs help. After moving to Rogers Park, it seemed like the convenient answer to our brunch prayers. After going three times, there is just no going back. Service is downright awful. On our first visit, our server literally answered his ringing cell phone while walking up to take our order. Second visit, it took no less than 15 minutes to be greeted by a server and receive waters. When we finally were greeted, we heard the dreaded "I didn't know you were in my section" line. Third visit, same story but with an ice cold egg bake to top it off. Overall, the owners need to flip this place, keep the omelette chef (the only thing worthy about this spot), and just start over. Rogers Park needs a place like this, but I can't even tolerate the service at this point, which is a real bummer.

26.description: I love Heartland cafe. Seriously, I do. Which is why I can't give them just one star. It's a cool funky spot that has been a part of Rogers Park my whole life and in so many ways represents the neighborhood. Unfortunately, this place is extremely hit or miss, and my last time dining here was a definite miss.I must preface this by saying I have not had a bad breakfast experience here, so if you can make it for brunch, I would recommend checking it out. Sitting outside in the summer, eating and omelette and maybe having a bloody mary or mimosa on a saturday or sunday morning is really quite magical.Dinner on the other hand is another story. The last time I went there with my girlfriend I ordered the Chef Revival salad, and was served garbage. Seriously, it tasted like garbage. The lettuce was wilted and slimy and masked by an insane amount of french dressing. It was so disgusting I could not get the taste and thought out of my mouth for several days, and each time I thought about it, I felt like I would wretch. My girlfriend ordered the heartland stir fry with chicken. While the flavor was okay, the chicken was about the toughest, driest chicken you can imagine, bordering on inedible. The service is never that great but this past time was exceptionally mediocre. I wanted a beer and my girlfriend wanted a glass of wine. They were out of wine, so she ordered margarita. It was served unceremoniously in a pint glass and while it tasted okay, it definitely seemed like it was just some commercial pre-mix that you could buy in the store. I asked the server what Three Floyds beer they currently had on draft and he told me Apex Predator, a great beer, but produced by Chicago's own Off color brewing company, not Three Floyds. I ordered it anyways and it was great except it came out after my garbage salad even though I had ordered it before. After we ordered we didn't see our waiter again until the bill, when he apologized for getting slammed. It was Tuesday, more than half the tables were empty. I've been a waiter before and in no way was the restaurant slammed. He didn't bother to ask us how our meal was, ask if we wanted another drink, anything. This place could be great. It's just a shame they can't get their act together. Will never eat dinner here again, and probably stay away from Breakfast for a while as well. That garbage salad will haunt me with it's slimy disgustingness.

25.description: I love this place. The patio is great. The service is amazing. The food is incredible. I recommend the panhandler or the breakfast pie!

12.description: I've lived in Rogers Park for 10 years and would tell everyone how great this place is but that time has passed. The food used to be so good and atmosphere so fun, Tina Fey even mentions it in Bossy Pants.The food used to be good enough to make up for the crappy service but the menu has gone to crap as well for the last year and a half. I walked out on my most recent visit.  I sat for 10 minutes on a Sunday morning. I sat in the patio after walking in and taking a menu. They didn't see me. Fair enough but when a server did come out for another party, he completely ignored me. Then I went in and asked for someone to wait on me, the busboy had to come out twice and apologize. That is how long I was waiting.  I left.This used to be a great place to read the paper and enjoy the morning but no longer my place.This is  what happens when the hippies start making management decisions. The most recent brilliant idea was to make half  of the restaurant into an expensive health food store. Was the working class people that live in this area demanding a place to buy their Wheatgrass and vegan supplements? Doubtful. Do they really think people are going to trek to this isolated part of Rogers Park to buy gluten free brownie  mix? No parking and a bum on ever corner.  They had a good thing going but good intentions don't  pay the bills.And to the servers at this place, fuck you. I've put up with your excuses with smiles and "oh no worries" and over tipping for years with never even a slight recognition that I'm a regular in the neighborhood.  Your service is the worst in the city. I hope you over bake your next pottery bowl in the kiln.Lemon out!

59.description: The food is decent.  The service is horrible.  I'm not sure if it's a prerequisite that you have to be a stoner to work here, but the servers certainly act like they are stoned. Is it too much for you to smile, server man?  I mean, you act like you are serving someone at a funeral.  Sandwiches come with chips and a pickle.  My date and I didn't receive any pickles.  I asked for them and before I can even finish my sentence I was interrupted - "no we are out!"  Jesus dude.  It was 2:45 and we sure would have liked to order from the 3 o'clock and after menu. NOPE.  Forget about it. I used to like this place for some reason, but now I'm really wondering why.

21.description: Heartland Cafe is one of my favorite places to get breakfast or lunch. Everyone there has always been super friendly, but it can be a little slow, which is fine because if I wanted fast food I wouldn't be here. The menu is super solid, I've had most of the breakfast items and some of the sandwiches, all of which were great. I haven't been disappointed once coming here. I love that their menu caters to both meat eaters and vegetarians alike and both meat and non meat dishes are great. I would definitely recommend Heartland for any time of day!

17.description: It's been three years since I last came here, and I was so disappointed! The hostess was too busy eating oatmeal to notice us for a minute, then once we were seated it was 5 minutes before we got water. After 15 more minutes of waiting, I finally flagged someone down to ask if we had a server or could at least see a menu...the entire meal was so slow and my entree was sub par. Do not get the skillet--it was a scant plate of watery spinach with rubbery cheese melted over top. I left dissatisfied and went to a nearby bakery for a pastry.

10.description: I like the atmosphere. I don't think I chose the right meal off the brunch menu (farm eggs, with hash browns, veggie sausage and cornbread). Wish they had eggs Benedict. I'll come again and give it another try.Tip: if it's your first time and you check in on Yelp, you get 15% your meal.

5.description: The new male Latino person with the Perez Hilton voice who works the store of Heartland is a real jerk.  His customer service skills are zero.  He messed up a my order on several occasions and offered only attitude in response.  He also hung up on my wife in mid sentence during a take out order.  I've been coming to this place for 20-years and have never experienced this level of rudeness.

3.description: I would've totally given this place 5 stars, but our server was a little rude and kept rushing us when ordering/eating/paying. Other than that, the outdoor seating is great, the food was excellent, and we got our food quickly.(Also, 5 stars for the vegan sausage)

35.description: I was so excited to come here with my mom because I love cute little places like this, but I was sorely disappointed and probably will not return. When I walked in, I was immediately drawn to their little market inside with local products and foods. The service was great, and everyone was friendly.I just cannot describe how awful my food was. I ordered a vegetarian gravy sandwich, and my mom ordered a salad. While her salad was just meh, my sandwich was sickeningly sweet, greasy, and lukewarm. I had my mom taste it to make sure I wasn't just exaggerating. I wasn't.After talking to our waitress, she said there was nothing she could do, she would not bring me something else without having me pay for both entrees, and would not take even a part of my dish off of the meal. These dishes are not cheap, so I ended up paying over $30 for a salad and a sandwich I barely took a bite out of. Only the little market inside gave this place an extra star.

19.description: Hadn't been here in years, the reviews made me hesitate. But, liked it, no issues. I ordered 1 buckwheat pancake with blueberries. 1 egg and coffee of course. Good, environment was laid back, just what I was looking for this Saturday morning. (They refilled my coffee often, as it should be).

28.description: I think you can see why with many other reviews. Service bad, plain and simple . after waiting really long for the food and noticing others who came after us getting theirs before us, I'm not sure I'll ever go back.

45.description: After multiple attempts to communicate with the business. It's come to this...a less than positive and public review of what used to be a solid neighborhood staple. Rogers park in general is lacking of places with a patio, and Heartland could fill a niche...but given the sub-par service and barrage of excuses for why they're less than stellar, I don't foresee that happening. They have adequate staffing for peak times, enough seating, and a good menu...the only thing they're missing is consistent management and excellent customer service. It's unacceptable to forget about customers seated on the patio, have really high wait times for food (without having a full house), to have waitstaff that are defensive and passive aggressive, and have the most customer concern comes from the table bussers. The bussers deserve full credit for playing the role of the management (with limited authority.)The management is unresponsive, and is MIA most of the time. Not sure who the owners are, although if you're reading this, please feel free to reach out for more information.Your brand reputation is taking a hit.

33.description: We've been coming here for a couple years ... the service has always been fine but the menu and food used to be better. I think we gave it a last go today. I miss the burrito. And the broken up a la carte omelette thing really chops my pickle. "Plain" omelettes are $5 ... so I'm guessing that's just the eggs whipped up fancy or something. Add cheese? Thats $2. Wanna add ONE veggie? Oh, $1.50. So, I can get Egg, Cheese, and One veggie for $8.50? I am not sure why this insanely pisses me off. To get a decent content omelette, you're dropping about $11-12 on it! I just can't take it. Sorry. Anyway, omelette issues aside, everything else has been just ok.  I got the stir fry today .... waaaaay too salty. And they changed the cornbread ... bad move. Definitely. Definitely bad move. Le sigh. Sorry Heartland ... hit me up when you decide to raise the bar back up.

43.description: Hadn't been here in years, the reviews made me hesitate. But, liked it, no issues. I ordered 1 buckwheat pancake with blueberries. 1 egg and coffee of course. Good, environment was laid back, just what I was looking for this Saturday morning. (They refilled my coffee often, as it should be).

2.description: I had been here for lunch once before many years ago and enjoyed it. My sister now lives 15 minutes away so we went here for brunch when I was in town. They no longer have the breakfast burrito but the egg pie and fritter are great alternative options. The fritter was moist on the inside with a great crisp on the outside and had a vegan gravy on the bottom which was fabulous. I got the strawberry banana smoothie with the breakfast combo. It's two eggs your way with a side of meat and one buckwheat pancake. The pancake is HUGE so I couldn't finish it all but still delicious. The side of meat was a small dish of amazingly seasoned and lightly grilled seitan. It was in short stripes though rather than the typical hash or cubes style. So great! Everything about my meal was delicious and I'm super pumped my sister is living close for a whole year. Food baby here I come.

18.description: The redo is nice, especially if it's nice outside, since most of the seating is outside. Service is a little lackadaisical, but friendly.

41.description: I came here for Sunday brunch and I got exactly what I wanted. I ordered the egg, pancake and bacon combo. This was the first time I've had a wheat pancake with cinnamon. The eggs were perfectly scrambled and the bacon was crispy and had really good flavor. My server was funny and gave his honest opinion. They are located Roger's park and its at a great location. The area is lgbtq friendly, artsy and very diverse. I will definitely come back.

52.description: Hilariously bad at everything a restaurant does. It took about 15 minutes for a host to show up, and then seated a group of six but only had one menu to give us despite the dining room being at about 20% capacity. From arrival to finish it took us 90 minutes to eat and that is with rushing out at the end. They were out of half of the things we asked for on the menu. They overcharged us, charged us for things we ordered but never received, etc. The consensus on the food was that it was dry and lacked flavor. And not cheap enough to merit a visit for any reason -- a burger and a beer came to almost $20. Also I just realized I never got my pickle! This place seems to be dying a slow, painful death along with the dreams of the flower child generation. Let's help put it out of its misery.

50.description: Always enjoy coming and sitting outside with my dog!

4.description: Since residing in Rogers Park I have found some truly great places, and yesterday I had lunch at the Heartland Café.And, as you walk upon this place you will see a lovelyarea with patio seating or if you prefer you can go insideand sit inside where there are ample tables and chairs and alsothere's a great bar where you can kick back and relax.I was welcomed warmly by Ryan who just happened to be myserver, and a great server Ryan was!And, since yesterday was pretty hot here in Chicago I chose tosit inside and I liked what I saw, exposed brick, some really coollooking stuff adorning the walls.And, a great looking bar, however, there was a Buffalo's Headabove the bar and that made me sad..But, boy, did I like the girl's tending bar, they were very cool.Now, Heartland's main focus appears to be a Vegetarian Menu andI will admit.. Vegetarian I am not!But, Nonetheless, they also offer good ol' American Staples like anall day breakfast menu and lunch/dinner options as well.I decided on a BLT, and gotta say it was really delicious, toastedon wheat bread with homemade chips and sweet pickles on the side.Boy, was I loving those pickles..And, for those of you that shop for your Organic, really healthy stuffHeartland has a General Store attached to the restaurant, and they evenstock Red Hen Bakery Stuff!So, I am giving Heartland Café a 4 star rating, because they deserve that,Service was friendly and Prompt, it was a great casual/comfortable placeto have a meal.And, when you check in on Yelp you get 15% off a meal too!So, if you haven't visited The Heartland Café you really should..For they are a very friendly place.. and you'll feel right at home...

6.description: Heartland is a gem. It is unique and has an aura of its own. The new construction has lead to less seating but the grocery store looks great. Food is always good. It seems that they could benefit from being more stocked with some basics but it didn't bother me much. This place is just real and has no pretentiousness that you can find all over Lincoln Park, Gold Coast, etc.

22.description: I've lived in Rogers Park for a decade and I'm always hearing pressure to "save the Heartland Cafe" by giving them business.  About once I year, I give it a try and I always regret it.  I'm starting to think that bad service is part of their business model.  The food is terrible.  Everything is kept to the minimum of clean.  Don't waste your time or money on this café.  A business should stay afloat due to their merit, not a neighborhood campaign to keep an old establishment running.

15.description: Great breakfast and fun bingo night on Mondays. The people here are very welcoming, and the pancakes are to die for.

57.description: Perfect Omelette. I had Spinach/Feta which was wonderfully addictive.  Also my table mates indulged in the buckwheat pancakes and the Panhandler.  Made with turkey sausage very very nice. Chris our server was attentive , super sweet and highly adorable.  Thanks again Heartland.  You never disappoint !!

20.description: Excellent food - I loved the freshly made and perfectly crisp potato chips - and great drinks.

36.description: They have once again changed or altered the management and it is back on my list as one of my favorite restaurants.  The new look is well done, and comfortable.  The food it very good, though I still wish they would bring back the Dukes Tostada.  With the new design, layout, and personnel, the service was a bit spaced out, but I have not doubt they will get it together once everyone adjusts to the changes.  It a Roger's Park treasure.

14.description: The staff were friendly when I stepped in, our server tended to my fiends and I right when we sat down.We ordered the Barnyard sandwich, Heartland Panhandle, Breakfast pie, breakfast combo and the fries.The only items that really stood out were the fries and the pancakes from the breakfast combo. The rest were just average and unmemorable but worth a try! I could order just a stack of those pancakes and an order of the fries and be completely satisfied. The syrup for the pancakes was different and had a brown sugar note to it, super delicious! The fries were a combination of regular fries and sweet potato fries, seriously so good! Definitely a nice place to have in the neighborhood and the market inside has a nice variety of locally produced food items!

28.description: Good food, great service. I used to frequent Petes Grill about once a week a when I moved to RP five years ago but hadn't been in here for at least a year. Woke up this Sunday morning craving their breakfast special and headed over. I had two perfect pancakes, two eggs, and two pieces of bacon for $5.25. I added a decent cup of coffee made just the way I like it with three creams no sugar for $1.35. My friend had the same special with french toast and added hash browns that looked awesome for a dollar or two more. They also have really decent sandwiches, burgers, and gyros. Best of all, the staff are super friendly no matter how busy they are and Pete's Grill is located right under the Howard Street red line el station.

1.description: Friendly service, generous portions, good coffee. A straightforward breakfast counter consistently good.

9.description: Great food, great price, and the guys their are so awesome! I will definitely be going back. So convenient being directly off the howard stop

29.description: I tried this place for the first time on Sunday and I was very impressed. The owner was so nice, friendly and welcoming. He had a great rapport with his customers and the food was delicious, fresh and very affordable. I ordered the french toast and turkey sausage patties special and I ate every bite. There is not much seating but I'd be glad to take this to go if necessary.  I will most likely become a regular here.

23.description: I eat here pretty much everyday and let me tell you, best breakfast ever! I get the Wisconsin omelette is has 4 different kinds of cheese and I get hashbrowns on  the side soooo good!!! Also it's not on the menu but they have one of the best bacon grilled cheeses I have ever had! The customer service is amazing one if the reasons I go in there, the staff is super sweet, nice and caring! Food is done within 10 minutes at most, my kind of place I am so impatient! Petes will always be my number one choice! :)

5.description: Very clean breakfast and lunch spot. The staff at the service counter is extremely friendly and accommodating. The food is served fast and hot. A wide selection of breakfast food for a small diner. Our breakfasts were delicious and economical for Chicago food prices. Great little diner for a quick breakfast or lunch.

31.description: This spot is for the breakfast and lunch crowd. The hours are from 6am to 3pm , I believe. It's cash only and is right downstairs from the Howard Red Line. This is great for those wanting to grab a bite on the way to work.  The employees are very nice,the prices are reasonable and the food is okay.

25.description: Can't ask for better quality food for that price. I've paid more for food at other restaurants for less food and poorer taste. Pete, Ted, Tina, and Carlos are very nice, they make it a point to know everyone in the neighborhood that comes in and remember their orders. The French toast is great and their ham off the bone is delicious too. I don't carry cash often and they don't take credit cards, but knowing that its worth coming prepared with cash.

12.description: Pete's is my go to spot for simple food, that's consistence with great service and people watching. And the know how to make grits!  I mostly only eat breakfast here.

37.description: Pete's has some of the best, convenient and economical breakfast and lunch food on the planet. Sadly, they know my order when I call. Does that mean I go there too much? Yes, probably does - because it's that good!

21.description: Great food & service!  Guys are really friendly behind the counter.  CASH ONLY so be prepared.  Great breakfast place.  Don't be fooled by the fast-food style atmosphere.  We've been here a few times now & our omelets & french toast are perfect every time.

16.description: I eat here pretty much everyday and let me tell you, best breakfast ever! I get the Wisconsin omelette is has 4 different kinds of cheese and I get hashbrowns on  the side soooo good!!! Also it's not on the menu but they have one of the best bacon grilled cheeses I have ever had! The customer service is amazing one if the reasons I go in there, the staff is super sweet, nice and caring! Food is done within 10 minutes at most, my kind of place I am so impatient! Petes will always be my number one choice! :)

17.description: Undoubtedly my favorite breakfast spot side moving to Chicago in 2013. Pete and his pops are great people who produce deliciously large portions of comfort food. I've picked up the same breakfast so often they know me by my order!

10.description: This place is exactly what you think. Quick food, at cheap price. -You want quick eggs, ya get eggs. Nothing extravagant, but the people there are wonderfully kind, accommodating, and friendly. For that reason alone they can have my business for quick eats.

11.description: Like everyone says, the food is delicious and the staff is very friendly. I'm only giving 3 stars because of the very uncomfortable seating: high backless stools only. Also marring my visit: a female off-duty bartender who was so loudly complaining about how a customer had annoyed her and other customers at her bar, that I couldn't hear myself think. Oh, the irony. Not Pete's fault, but I gather she's a regular. Be warned.

26.description: I love this place.  I work nights so it's one of my favorite places to grab breakfast before hitting the sack.  The bacon is always crisp and the pancakes DELISH.  I like to call in my order when I leave work and they have it ready for me to pick up.  Fantastic place,  great, friendly owners. Cash only.

27.description: First time at Pete's. Wife and i were looking for breakfast. Decided to try Pete's  thanks to Yelp reviews. Pete's surpassed all expectations. Food was excellent - real homemade taste. The place is small but very, very clean and welcoming. There was no smell of food on our cloths when we left, which is a big plus for being a small place. Great customer service, priced right. Lots on Menu. We will definitely come back.

35.description: The neighborhood is Rogers Park not the one listed above.  I love Pete's Grill.  I have been going here for 7 years.  Excellent breakfast.  I too am a regular so they know my order by just a single phone call.  Very friendly staff...all of the workers are family.  For a cheap good breakfast in Rogers Park go to Petes.

8.description: I finally ate here after walking by it for months. Excellent food, great prices! Staff is super friendly. I recommend this place to anyone in the neighborhood.

0.description: Hole in the wall of awesome.  After a weekend out, this is the perfect fix for any hangover - classic breakfasts and at such an amazing price!  Not to mention you can order chicken tenders at any time of they day, which is my go to breakfast food after a night out. The service was great!  I'm not sure if it was Pete himself at the counter, but whoever was taking orders was the most helpful and service oriented person I have met in this area of Chicago.  Do make this a frequent stop on your weekly routine!

38.description: Exactly the type of place you want in your neighborhood. Quick, high quality eats with friendly service in a clean space. Right below the Howard Red Line, perfect for a pre-commute breakfast, or for when gyros are really the only option.

20.description: Best breakfast and the most friendly and welcoming staff! Super affordable. We always get the pancake, french toast special and the greet potatoes. Pancakes/french toast, eggs, turkey patties. Potatoes have onions, peppers and feta cheese! Literally the best.

19.description: Holy cow!  This place is a diamond in the rough.  Great food, great prices, and the owner is one of the most welcoming I've ever encountered trying a place for the first time!

33.description: This place really hits the spot.  Very good breakfast food at reasonable prices and fast friendly service.  Conveniently located next to the El too.

2.description: Small and unassuming, Pete's Grill serves up a good, solid, very inexpensive breakfast. Pete himself is a delightful guy, his staff members are kind and efficient, and his restaurant will now be a regular spot in my morning diner rotation. Try it and you'll surely agree.~Peter O. (not Pete, the owner of Pete's Grill!)

34.description: Cheap prices, great diner food.

32.description: One of the few restaurants you can go that still offers great customer service. The owner and his son are extremely nice.The food is good (not necessarily healthy, but tastes good!), definitely the best breakfast in town. Their home-made pancakes are the best I've had. Prices are fair. If you're in the area, I would definitely recommend.

18.description: Great food & service!  Guys are really friendly behind the counter.  CASH ONLY so be prepared.  Great breakfast place.  Don't be fooled by the fast-food style atmosphere.  We've been here a few times now & our omelets & french toast are perfect every time.

13.description: Forget the snobby brunch places downtown. This is my Sunday morning go-to! Best staff and great food at unbeatable prices. Cash only though.

4.description: I want to start by saying that the service is impeccable. Very nice gentlemen! I've had damn near all the breakfast items lol. The grits are truly delicious. Pancakes and French toast are also pretty good. They have delicious breakfast sandwiches! The buffalo wings are the only other non breakfast item I've had, and they were bomb! Only downside is that they close at 3, when I wish they stayed open all day! Fast and good food, so if you're in the mood for breakfast, get here fast! Well before 3 pm lol

24.description: Great food!

6.description: Amazing service and absolutely some of the best breakfast and lunch food in the northside of Chicago.  The cheesey hash browns with onions are amazing and I'm a huge fan of there polish and French fry combo.  Service is top notch, they treat you family I swear.

22.description: Holy cow!  This place is a diamond in the rough.  Great food, great prices, and the owner is one of the most welcoming I've ever encountered trying a place for the first time!

15.description: Very nice cordial service! The entire kitchen staff greeted us and the handsome (wink wink) guy at the register even threw in an apple juice for my one year old! Went out with my parents and sister for a hearty breakfast and we found exactly what we were looking for! We got the (2) 3 piece pancakes with 3 links, 3 French toast, hash browns, western omelette, and grits! Let me just say that I don't need lunch and it's only still early! I am only in Chicago for a short time, but I will return. Down home hearty food with a smile is all I need!

7.description: This pace is an excellent breakfast spot, right off the Howard red line stop - a perfect, convenient place before going north to a game or to the campus area. The staff is so friendly too! Very much a standout restaurant! The food was delicious, one of the best in the area. Very nice difference compared to other chain restaurants nearby.

36.description: I had lunch here and it was really good. They were not too busy and the tea and coffee we had was fresh and the staff was great.  Unfortunately they are cash only and they are only open till the early afternoon but the open very early morning.

30.description: The french toast and sausage patty breakfast special is delicious.

3.description: This place was great! I had the daily special with French toast, sausages, and hash browns. The costumer service was excellent! I will definitely be returning.

14.description: This place is a hidden gem. The restaurant itself is nothing fancy--a few tables and counters with stools. As for the food, it's standard American diner fare, but I must say that it's very good diner food indeed. This is an excellent spot to grab a quick breakfast or lunch.The real draw, though, isn't the food--it's the people. The owner and his son both man the counter, and they're two of the friendliest people I've ever met. They greet all the regular customers (a mark of a good diner!) by name, and anyone they don't know is "buddy" or "friend"--and you know they mean it. CTA conductors stop by from Howard terminal to talk about their day, and they meet other locals who've stopped in for a cup of coffee and to shoot the breeze about their jobs, their families, etc. Sit and watch and you'll be treated to a true slice of Chicago life.

58.description: Great food and service! I took my kids and they did not complain, so this place is a keeper for those days I do not want to cook.

56.description: Another great dinner (deal) at La Cazuela!! Shrimp burrito had so much shrimp! Just awesome; tasted great! Love their refried beans and rice And, fantastic guacamole and chips. Friendly service, slow at times but I understand because so many people were there and only one server. The food came to us quickly and was outstanding. Yum! ¡Muy Fantástico! We sat out back in the beautiful & lush landscaped patio. BYOB

29.description: Awesome tortas!

42.description: My man & I ordered in using GrubHub for a midday taco fix. We got 3 chix, 3 pastor, 3 chorizo. Plus a side order for $1.50 of salsa. The tacos were alright, overbearingly covered in their onion/cilantro mix. The tortillas hot, fresh. Though I felt the steak and the chicken tacos needed some seasoning to highlight the meat. The chorizo got away with it because the seasoning is built in. The side of salsa, please skip it. It is a ridiculously hot, soupy sauce. Unless that is your thing. NO chips included by the way....so have your own at home.

23.description: I kept passing by this place for awhile, then one day, I decided to eat lunch there.  Not the worst food I've had, but not a whole lot to write home about either, although the re-fried beans were very good.  The staff is not big on substitutions; I wanted a banana smoothie instead of the usual soda offerings for the lunch special I ordered.  We went back and forth a bit, then they told me the bananas they had -- a few were right next to the cash register -- were green and they didn't want to use them.  So why were the bananas out there?  Bring cash instead of a debit or credit card if ordering lunch specials.  Most of the specials are under ten dollars, and the cashier won't take a card unless the order is ten dollars or over.  Maybe I missed it, but I didn't see a sign stating that.  I ended up having to order something extra which irritated me.  I don't tend to keep going to places that demand people order a certain dollar amount before they will accept cards.

47.description: I really used to love this place, but then they changed the lunch menu (tacos)......  I would come in 2X a week and now won't be going back anymore.  Sad to say, but they have lost a loyal customer.   The food is good tho.

8.description: My wife and I order here at least once a week. I dig their restaurant, and they have never messed up our pick-up order (probably just jinxed it). I also am a big fan of their red and green salsas. The red is a bit spicy, but the green is just right. I have noticed that the veggies they use (tomato, lettuce, cilantro, onion) are always fresh and crisp, which definitely sets them apart from just any taqueria in the neighborhood.Tostadas: excellent and huge!Tacos: outstanding (get crispy!)Chile Rellenos: meh, skip itBurritos: very tasty and very fillingChorizo: a little over-seasonedCarne asada: tender and juicy, if a little on the fatty sideBeans and rice: decentMy only gripe: no carnitas :-(

31.description: basic little mexican joint and i had a good chicken burrito and a good shrimp cocktail, both very good sized portions

34.description: Overall:  Good food, tasty tacos (made it to the TimeOut Chicago taco lists!), and nice staff.The Deets: Easy parking, and lovely inside filled with bright colors.  The menu is what you'd expect at a Mexican restaurant, but the standouts are the tacos that are $2/taco for all meats and $2.50/fish taco.  And they make their own freshly made tortilla chips brought to your table - like so piping hot you gotta be careful putting it into your mouth!The "al pastor" taco is simply lovely.  Not greasy and has a wonderful spice to it! Love it.   Also, the "chorizo" (sausage) taco is to die for.  So nicely charred and just all around a great chorizo taco.I'd gladly come back here for the tacos.

16.description: I don't know about the other dishes, but the first item I tried was La Mariscada - an amalgam of seafood over rice.  THIS IS AMAZING!  The octopus in it is, by far, the best I have ever had.  I could just eat that.  It's tenderized to perfection in a fashion that is extremely rare.  The red salsa is very spicy and fish broth is used.  It is interesting and delicious.  If you can't stand the heat, however, don't even attempt it.  As for the owner whom people are criticizing on here, he is very stern, cantankerous, and cheap.  However, once you eat the food, which is also quite easy on your wallet, he is easy to overlook.  I'm an awful critic of most Mexican joints here in Chicago being from Phoenix, but this is my exception!  Try La Mariscada!

13.description: Great food, especially the pork burrito!

11.description: UPDATE: I called to order the chicken soup, since it's not bad. NOT great, but decent. Last time they forgot my tortillas. Now it is supposed to come with 5 of them. You can make tacos out of the chicken, etc. THe lady forgets them, i call, she agrees to give me a free steak taco on my next order. TODAY Was that order. DID I GET IT? OF COURSE NOT, I got the bitter owner who just likes to argue and even admits to NOT HAVING TO KEEP "HER WORD", since he didn't agree to it. THEN HE says, ok, you can have a free CHICKEN taco. I DON"T WANT a CHICKEN TACO. HONOR YOUR WORD. NO MATTER HOW GOOD UR FOOD USED TO BE, THE FACT THAT YOU HAVE NO IDEA OF 'KEEPING YOUR WORD' I WILL NOT RETURN. I HATE WHEN BUSINESSES HAVE B.S OWNERS. HE RUINED IT FOR ME. what a jerkOLDER: I should have learned my lesson the first time. Their chicken soup could be sooo good one day and then another like they warmed up leftovers from 2 days ago. Like actually the chicken tasted older. I wish i could say...Make it like u did the first time, geez! Today i called in to order a late lunch. It was 2:56, AND i knew Lunch ended at 3pm. I order my lunch special and the lady replies in broken English that lunch is over at 3pm. I tell her it is 2:56, and she tells me that it is 3:05. So not only do they have "not so great food", but They cannot even honor their own policies and were so petty on that lunch ended that I had to share this. THE FOOD HERE IS GETTING LESS AND LESS TASTY. THEY ARE SLACKING, or buying cheaper ingredients, OR hired a different cook. I have no idea, but Now I am avoiding them for awhile. So disappointing.

39.description: This is my only Mexican place. My husband and I never go anywhere else. He loves the chorizo burritos and tacos, while I tend to get the chicken. Everything is fresh and delicious. We love the green salsa.They have a nice seating area and a pretty outdoor garden where you can eat when the weather cooperates. We usually get it for pick-up though, and it's always fast and friendly.

37.description: We live around the corner and love being able to walk over with some beer/wine in tow for an authentic and unbelievably affordable Mexican dinner!  The tacos are well seasoned and packed.  I love that they are topped with cilantro and onion rather than just lettuce and tomato.  Their salsas are fresh and the red is better than I've had anywhere else in Chicago.  I love that they set out chips, two salsas AND refried beans when you sit.  The tamale was a little dry, but at $1.50 each they are a deal.  I took a star away for the loud TVs and slightly musty smell on our last visit.  It would be nice if at dinner time they turned down the TVs a bit and maybe put on some background music.  Lovely patio for dining as well. Im glad to have it in my neighborhood.

0.description: Great food. Love the mushroom quesadilla and pork tacos! LOVELY service. Family friendly. The back patio has wonderful atmosphere.

38.description: Came here on a Thursday night with friend to grab some well earned shrimp cocktails. Forty minutes later we get chips,  another 10 mins I get my drink and and while waiting another twenty minutes for my friends margarita, we both ravenously almost chipped our teeth. Beware they have rocks in  the beans!  Finally, Two hours later we get two shrimp tacos...now I understand That there was only one waitress but all I wanted was a gahdam shrimp cocktail. so upsetting that i got a yelp account.

51.description: It passed the rice and beans test with the wife.  The al pastor was extremely fresh and full of nice pineapple and onion chunks. We are sure to return.Great, friendly staff and clean bright environment.  They even sell used golf clubs.

27.description: Great lunch specials.  Clean, well-lit, nicely-decorated.  Fast, friendly, generous service.  Delicious chips with two salsas and bean dip.  Looks a little nicer than some of the many other mexican places on the block.  Hearty lunch for two plus drinks...$12.  Can't beat it.  Will return.

32.description: Two words: backyard patio

54.description: Two words: Fish Tacos!!One emotion: Bliss!

48.description: A friend and I each got a taco dinner (3 tacos of choice, rice, and beans), and between the two of us we tried the fish, shrimp, chorizo, carne asada, and chicken tacos. Each taco came packed with filling, and chipotle sauce and salsa verde were included on the side. The tacos were delicious, as were the rice and beans. The menu online is out of date; the tacos run $2-2.50 each.

44.description: Thought the tacos here were among the best. Had the shrimp, carne asada and the al pastor (which was by far the best al pastor tacos I've had in Chicago).  The shrimp tasted fresh and clean, and were seasoned well.  Carne asada was dressed with tomatoes and lettuce, but none of the others were, which confused us since we didn't expect to see lettuce and tomato at all. Not a bad thing, just strange.  Also had a milanesa torta, which was good and had ample melty cheese, but it paled in comparison to the tacos, truthfully. We also tried the shrimp empanada, which some people had said was really good, but I found it to be a little meh.  Would save your calories for the chips and duo of salsas they provide at the table.Service was efficient and friendly. Prices are reasonable/low. Easy street parking. In all, La Cazuela is easily our new favorite local Mexican place.

24.description: My wife and I order here at least once a week. I dig their restaurant, and they have never messed up our pick-up order (probably just jinxed it). I also am a big fan of their red and green salsas. The red is a bit spicy, but the green is just right. I have noticed that the veggies they use (tomato, lettuce, cilantro, onion) are always fresh and crisp, which definitely sets them apart from just any taqueria in the neighborhood.Tostadas: excellent and huge!Tacos: outstanding (get crispy!)Chile Rellenos: meh, skip itBurritos: very tasty and very fillingChorizo: a little over-seasonedCarne asada: tender and juicy, if a little on the fatty sideBeans and rice: decentMy only gripe: no carnitas :-(

7.description: We went today 6/20/14 Let me tell you that the service is horrible!! We went in, got the menus and then sat there for 20 minutes! While the ladies chit chatted in the back... Then finally the owner saw that we were getting frustrated so he told his waitress to come attend us..We ordered our food, I got the veggie burrito which was pretty good with their green sauce. Now my partner got the the shrimp volcan with hot sauce... Yeah it was horrible it had no seasoning it tasted as if the cool just dumped some hot sauce on top of it and this is a $14 plate.. Yeah so not worth it..Anyway.. We waited for our check for about 30 minutes.. Given the fact that the owner and his son were sitting next to us.. The waitress never stopped by and asked us how we were doing or if we needed anything else... So I waited and finally I got fed up and I went to the register and I complained how we've been waiting half hour and how no one has came to our table.. I also complained about the food... The owner said not to charge us for it which was good! But we think they might have a new cook.. Because the dodo is not good And the service sucks!! Will never go there again!!

49.description: This place rules! Had Carne Asata tacos and they were really fresh, great tortillas, fresh ingredients, amazing steak. I'll definitely come back!

40.description: Not a fan of this place anymore.  The last two times I've been here to pick up, the food was ice cold when I got home.  I live 5 minutes' drive away and the burritos were just flat out cold and sloppy.  The flavor was relatively bland as well so I will return to my quest for the best burrito on Clark St.  Also, they changed the ceviche, which used to be really tasty and had bigger pieces of fresh fish. Now, the fish is finely chopped, doesn't taste as fresh, more expensive and less flavor.  La Cazuela, you fell off!

53.description: yep, four stars.  i've been to this restaurant quite a few times, and each time i'm full and happy in under 20 minutes and for less than $10.  so, for a person that's not the biggest fan of mexican food in the states, i find myself eating quite a bit of it here.  perhaps in search of that authentic flavor, beats me.  but i like it here a lot.  you probably won't recognize the food here if you're used to cheese covered anything and sour cream topped everything.  if that's what you want, please proceed to the nearest taco bell (hey, this ain't hate, i love me some taco hell from time to time myself. can you say fire sauce?).i love the shrimp and fish tacos here, done right with two corn tortillas, meat, some pico and cilantro, with lime on da side. no white stuff.  get here for the lunch specials under 8 bucks (2 tacos, beans and rice for $4.99. yeah, for real).  i've also tried the tortas, and guacamole. everything so far is good. not a fancy place, but looks family owned, clean and the staff is kind.  i'm not a big soda pop drinker, but i like that they sell the mexican import of coca cola, you know the one sans the high fructose corn syrup. OH! i can't forget the homemade chips and salsas you get with the meal. a mild green chili/cilantro salsa and a fiery red chili sauce. this stuff is good. i spread it all over the tacos, rice, anything.  this place makes me glad i live up north sometimes.

30.description: I used to love this place.  I'd overlook the fact they never had the heat on, because the shrimp tacos were pretty good.  Then, they served us shrimp tacos with canned shrimp, cooked on the grill.  One of the worst meals I'd ever had in my entire life.

46.description: Just randomly stopped in for a quick lunch while on a walk. I've seen this place for a long while, but mistakenly dismissed it is one of many subpar Mexican restaurants on this strip of Clark St. I was super wrong.Great flavors, great prices. Had a few different seafood tacos and was pleasantly surprised. And they deliver! I grabbed a menu and will be calling them in the near future.

1.description: Very nice all around. Good food reasonable $. Look forward to trying the garden seating this spring.

55.description: I think (apart for the food) that the best thing about Cazuela is the decor and patio. It stands out to me, and doesnt make you feel like you are sitting in a dining hall or some random "i could be anywhere" taqueria.  Its never super busy, but Ive gone here with a group of about 10 and they were accommodating to the group and to the kids with us. Im a spice wuss, so I always need a taste tester for the salsas they put on the table! I usually end up burning the crap put of my mouth anyhow because the green one is so good!  I was a little wary of guac and (homemeade!) chips being $7, but the guac is SO GOOD and you get about two cups of it. I love the enchiladas and posole, and the horchata ROCKS! Although I am upset that I have to choose between the BYOB and horchata. A plus for me is that they have posole every day, not just weekends, and that it isnt spicy! Service (dine in and delivery) is meh, but then again this isnt Alinea.  For what it is, its my favorite! Stopped going to other mexican places after discovering Cazuela!

9.description: Mexican Food and Old Style....Hell yes!!!!! I was a bit leery when I saw the menu was loaded with fish entrees. As most of you know, I hate fish. My mind was put at ease when I saw that La Cazuela offers meat options as well. Everything my Wife and I ordered was delicious. Here's the breakdown. *Supreme Nacho's: Loaded to the nines with Guacamole, marinated beef, cheese and veggies. It was a meal in itself. *Carne Asada Burrito: Beautifully marinated steak and fresh ingredients. This football sized Burrito was fabulous. *Chorizo Taco: I'm quite aware how bad Chorizo is for a lipitor popping, old fart like me. But I can't help myself. I love it. This taco was bursting with flavor. Here's the delicious bottom line on La Cazuela. Everything I tasted was fresh, delicious and beautifully prepared. We both I ate like kings for $20.00. As my lovely Wife always says, "It beats a sharp stick in the eye"

26.description: Mexican Food and Old Style....Hell yes!!!!! I was a bit leery when I saw the menu was loaded with fish entrees. As most of you know, I hate fish. My mind was put at ease when I saw that La Cazuela offers meat options as well. Everything my Wife and I ordered was delicious. Here's the breakdown. *Supreme Nacho's: Loaded to the nines with Guacamole, marinated beef, cheese and veggies. It was a meal in itself. *Carne Asada Burrito: Beautifully marinated steak and fresh ingredients. This football sized Burrito was fabulous. *Chorizo Taco: I'm quite aware how bad Chorizo is for a lipitor popping, old fart like me. But I can't help myself. I love it. This taco was bursting with flavor. Here's the delicious bottom line on La Cazuela. Everything I tasted was fresh, delicious and beautifully prepared. We both I ate like kings for $20.00. As my lovely Wife always says, "It beats a sharp stick in the eye"

25.description: Even though it's a bit of a hike from my neighborhood,  I'll drive to La Cazuela again and again when I can. The tacos and the choices therein were fantastic!  Tasty, filling and price was affordable after a major loss at the track. Staff very friendly and oh my, the bathroom was great! Believe me, a nice bathroom does me every time! Oh...and PS...i didn't even go to the track.  Haven't been in years...i don't have a problem.

12.description: Okay.  Remember how I said the service was awkward?  Here's what I mean. Was here last Saturday, which used to be a good day to go.  Waitress was friendly, don't get me wrong, but so much was off:1.  It was freezing in there (always is) so I ordered hot tea.  The water she used was lukewarm and was from the coffee pot that had probably been turned off for at least 20 minutes.  2.  We both ordered waters in addition to our tea / Coke.  Only my husband got his.3.  We ordered a tamale, and she asked us if we wanted green or red sauce.  We decided on green.
