Tamale came....no sauce.  And she never brought it.  4.  There were no utensils.  And when we asked for them, you almost got the sense that we were asking for something extra.  And this kind of thing is pretty common there.  We used to really like going on Saturdays, because the Saturday server had the best track record.  She must have been off that day, or maybe she no longer works there.  See what I mean?  The service is very spacey.  Maybe they're not used to people dining in?  I don't know.  Still love their tacos, though, and will likely go again when we're in the neighborhood in a few weeks.

59.description: We sat in the patio for dinner. Most of the tables where dirty with plates and dried salsa which looked like it had been sitting there for an hour.  We waited for about 10 min. for a waiter but no luck. I finally had to get up and walk to the kitchen and inquire about a waitress. The waiter brought out chips and salsa but no ice water. The ice water came out at the same time as the drink order.  Our food order came out about 20 min late,r a little long for a simple taco plate. We will not be returning to this place.

21.description: I am Mexican and this food is very authentic.  Especially, the crispy tacos. These type of tacos are very hard to find in most restaurants, usually just a store bought hard shell fried, but not here.  They are authentic meaning a corn tortilla fried with ground beef--just like my mom makes.   Delicious!  Thank you La Cazuela.  The only other place I know that makes this is Camino Real in Hammond, IN.

17.description: We used to order delivery from there when it was on GrubHub.  Yep, we paid the exorbitant delivery fee for this place because the food was that good.  However, since they have changed to another on-line delivery service, we have tried to place several orders, and the order place can never reach the restaurant to place the order. Needless to say, we're done with them...and we probably placed 40-50 orders with them over the last year.

10.description: I love this place. I come here 2 times a month. They have some of the best Mexican food in Rogers Park. Great, Fast and reliable service. Everyone is so nice. This place is also BYOB

5.description: They are actually open @ 10 am, which is good BC I needed saving from my hunger induced rage that the auto parts store next does did not sell auto parts.The chicken taco lunch special fixed me up- Fresh food. Well prepared. Fast. Cost effective.Ladies Bathroom report 7 out of 10: no frills but Very clean. Large & Nicely tiled.

3.description: I used to love coming to this place to enjoy their garden seating in the back. I remember the food being a lot better back then. I had the shrimp fajitas today. There was no flavor on the shrimp. Bland and disappointing. I had to pay extra for avocado and sour cream, which usually comes with fajitas at other places. The highlights were the beans and rice that were pretty good. The tortillas were fresh and hot, though a little small. This dish was so bland though even with salsa, avocado, sour cream, peppers, and onions. Even the peppers had no flavor. No seasoning at all. 18 dollars later and I felt like I over payed for something I could have gotten at taco bell but would have had more flavor. There are so many more options for Mexican food in Rogers Park, I would not chose this one again. Mexican food with no flavor? That's what I call inauthentic.

35.description: I had been going to this place since 2000.  Some days the food was better than others, and I think the owner goes through a lot of cooks. But when it was good, it was great, especially the fish tacos and shrimp tostadas.  However, a few months I went there with my husband, and they served him canned shrimp in the shrimp tacos.  It tasted like cat food, and was the worse meal I've ever had in my entire life. That was the end of my love for La Cazeula, and I have no plans of going back.

19.description: The wife and I live only a few blocks east of the unofficial Clark Street Mexican district (a few blocks north of the unofficial Swedish/LGBT district of Clark Street), but have never tried any of the taquerias. I saw this one in TIme Out, decided to skip on Taco Bell for lunch and it was great!Quickly, the inside is much nicer than the average Mexican place, closer to a restaurant. The decor is fun, although they have a gigante flatscreen on one wall, so be aware if that's a plus or minus for you. More importantly, the "patio" is f---ing amazing. There is a 15' x15' area you could describe as a backyard patio (suburban grill, unused high chair, hoses) with about seating for 7-1 and a round outdoor fireplace.The remainder of the patio is AN ENGLISH GARDEN. I mean, the gardening is not Botanical Garden standards, but this is way beyond patio. We ate on a nice, intimate, metal table along a pebble-strewn path. There are tall hedges, flowering plants, shady trees, a rose bush. I am not greatly exaggerating to say I would get married here. Anyway, check out the photos, pretty nice.As for the food, I would say it was damn good overall. I'm not a Chicago Mexican-food scenester (if you are, go to Big Star = yum), but I was impressed.  I liked the pre-entree chips, which were crunchy but not crumble-flakey, and not ground-corn gritty. They came with refried beans and two salsas which were really good. The tacos were good, though I would want more seasoning. The quesadilla and enchiladas were cheesy, spicy and great. I also had delicious shrimp empanadas. Tasty, not-too-crunchy, not-too soft breading and good mix of shrimp, vegs and spice inside. The only thing I could have written off was the guac. It was too bland for me, but I DO go salt and cilantro crazy when I make my own.For drinks, we had tasty but pretty sweet margaritas, which were "upgraded" off-menu to be more fun. We had too many of them and drove up my bill, but otherwise, I'd say this was a $100 experience for $30-40:Same inexpensive tasty taco/burrito fare you'd see at most taquerias, but with the ability to order delicious entrees including beans and rice you'd pay way more for at a restaurant, all while watching a bumblebee collect pollen from the flowers one foot away from you. (note: bees were not a problem).Oh, and the waitress was very friendly and helpful!

28.description: Love this place! We love the salsas and refried beans that are brought out with chips prior to the meal. I had fish tacos today which were amazing. We have also tried enchiladas, tacos, burritos, and the shrimp empanadas. All excellent! Have always had fantastic food and service...the outside patio is wonderful in the summer!

45.description: My boyfriend and I can't stay away from this place! We had all the good intentions to try new places, but La Cazuela is just SO good!Andy loves the Chorrizo Chimichanga. Considering it's a greasy sausage filled burrito that is then deep fried, it's surprisingly less greasy than at other places! I personally am a huge fan of the tacos and/or tortas El Pastor. It's always moist, fresh and full of flavor. I am also a huge fan of the Carne Asada Enchiladas with red sauce.Speaking of the red salsa, unlike most places this is a creamy based red salsa, not just tomato based. It's packs a good amount of heat, but is rich with layers of flavor as well. When mixed with the beans, drizzled on a taco, or used as the enchilada sauce the heat is tamed down, but the flavor is not lost.In the summer the beer garden is a must do! It's like sitting on someone's back porch with bird feeders and flowers everywhere. Very peaceful and relaxed. They're a BYOB restaurant, but they do sell beer, Modello and only Modello.

33.description: The wife and I live only a few blocks east of the unofficial Clark Street Mexican district (a few blocks north of the unofficial Swedish/LGBT district of Clark Street), but have never tried any of the taquerias. I saw this one in TIme Out, decided to skip on Taco Bell for lunch and it was great!Quickly, the inside is much nicer than the average Mexican place, closer to a restaurant. We had too many of them and drove up my bill, but otherwise, I'd say this was a $100 experience for $30-40:Same inexpensive tasty taco/burrito fare you'd see at most taquerias, but with the ability to order delicious entrees including beans and rice you'd pay way more for at a restaurant, all while watching a bumblebee collect pollen from the flowers one foot away from you. (note: bees were not a problem).Oh, and the waitress was very friendly and helpful!

43.description: I used to live right around the corner from this place, ordered regularly, and as other reviewers have said the tacos were completely addictive, well seasoned, filling, esp the shrimp and fish, though friends have said the grilled steak tacos were also great. I don't eat red meat, but I trust her taste. Unfortunately my last trip there (after I moved further west and hadn't been for a month or so) was awful: I ordered chicken tacos and got dry overcooked meat, half the amount usually provided, and poorly seasoned.  It was  such a bad experience it's debatable if I'll go back.  If I do I'll be sure to tell them not to do the same thing to ne again.

2.description: The whole Red Snapper or Perch cooked with Garlic and white wine is to die for.  The crispy tacos are really good too.  Shrimp and fillets of fish are good also, for people who can't handle the whole fish.  Best place for a very reasonable seafood meal in Rogers Park.

18.description: My man & I ordered in using GrubHub for a midday taco fix. We got 3 chix, 3 pastor, 3 chorizo. Plus a side order for $1.50 of salsa. The tacos were alright, overbearingly covered in their onion/cilantro mix. The tortillas hot, fresh. Though I felt the steak and the chicken tacos needed some seasoning to highlight the meat. The chorizo got away with it because the seasoning is built in. The side of salsa, please skip it. It is a ridiculously hot, soupy sauce. Unless that is your thing. NO chips included by the way....so have your own at home.

41.description: Though normally when I'd say 3.5 I would have it down to a 3, La Cazuela had more than enough to make me want to go here repeatedly. So, in the end that works out for me.I was just keeping it simple today so I went with a veggie taco and two chicken tacos. These tacos are no joke as they pack a ton into them. The veggie taco is mostly rice in it, while the chicken had a whole ton in there. Now, my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach, but I "had" to force down a chicken tamale along with getting a side of guac. The tamale was really good and the gauc was so good that I ended up stuffing myself for the rest of the day. c'est la vie.It's rare that I stop in rogers park, it's normally a drive through for me depending on where I'm going. I'm thinking that I'm gonna need to change that now.

52.description: C and I discovered that La Cazuela has a garden/patio. Very serene. A perfect hideaway.  We had tacos.  Fish and al pastor.  Excellent.  I really loved the refriend beans.  Theirs are the kind that are velvety smooth.We keep coming back.

50.description: We call this place, "Rat Garden."  Anyway, I go here for the outdoors. You can drink, smoke, eat, and watch the rats run through the bushes.  It's funny when yuppies jump up from there chairs and then try to laugh it off and finish their food without being totally disgusted. I LOVE this place. The ceviche sucks, but the fish tacos are pretty decent.  The shrimp empanada is gooood!  The salsa is different, spicy, and I enjoy it, although my sister does not. The owner is cool as hell and there is free parking in the bank parking lot next door. What more can you ask for?

4.description: I've been here several times to sit in the nice outdoor garden. Normally it's in the Spring or after a spell of really bad weather, like this past winter. Someone really does put quite a bit of work into that garden and it's the closest place to my home that has Mexican food with outdoor seating. To get outside you walk through to the back of the place past the cash register and turn right and out the door. There are a few tables set up on a concrete pad, then a few more scattered through the garden area. It's a city lot so the view is of other houses and garages but it doesn't take away from being there. Many times ours has been the only group out there, or maybe one of two or three. At times that has affected the service since it's a pain for the waitstaff to come out there but it's never been bad enough to avoid sitting outside. They are certainly friendly enough and bring huge cups of ice water probably to avoid having to refill often, good idea. The food is decent. They serve two salsas on the table with tortilla chips. Not the best I've had but not bad at all. I usually get shrimp quesadillas here and they're quite good. They are served with rice and beans. The servings are quite large, you could easily make two meals of them. Most everything is under $10. If you want to sit outside and have decent Mexican food in a nice garden check it out!

6.description: Meh. This place is incredibly close to my apartment, but id rather go out of my way to avoid it most days. Their tacos are pretty expensive ($3 and honestly pretty tiny). I can go to any of the other billion taquerias on Clark for the same quality but usually cheaper and larger.  I will give them credit for their carne asada though--delicious!Horchata was not impressive at all. Added alcohol to it when I got home to make it more bearable (it worked!)Waited a pretty long time at the place for our tacos, probably upwards of 30 minutes. I'd definitely suggest calling ahead if you're going for take out. Not that big of a deal though, everything tasted really fresh when we got home so they probably just had a lot of deliveries or something. That being said, I'll probably skip this place next time I have a craving for tacos.

22.description: The tacos are my favorite, especially the shrimp and fish tacos, they're outstanding.  I also really enjoyed the enchiladas with chicken and mole, although one time when I ordered it there was no cheese...hmm.  Try sitting in the outdoor garden, it's beautiful!

15.description: Terrible service.  I waited an hour for three tacos.  The server never came by to refill my drink.  The food and service earned one star.  They get a second star for tuning all tv's to the Cubs game.

57.description: Super fast service, really yummy chicken tacos. I will be coming back!

20.description: Best Mexican food I have had by far! Staff was super friendly and the food was delicious! I highly recommend the fried plantains and the chicken enchiladas. The back patio is so adorable! Make sure to bring some Pacifico along! La Cazuela will definitely be my regular choice for Mexican cuisine.

36.description: tried this place twice - both times very tasty.friendly service that can be a bit slow - but not too bad.very cute back garden/patio area - unfortunately, the tables out there are so small, that the patio won't work if you are more than two people.  oh well.we'll be back again and again.

14.description: My wife, who is Mexican, and I have picked this place as our go-to taco place.  She is usually a lot pickier than I with this cuisine of food and rightfully so. There isn't anything special about the place but the steak tacos mexican style are glorious!The reason I give 3 stars instead of 4 or 5 is as follows:The workers do not offer any type of friendly behavior, you MUST phone ahead and add 5 or 10 minutes to the estimated time.  When you call and order a pickup, do not expect a thank you or any type of salutation.  A hang up sound will be all you hear.  They also require a $10 purchase to use credit card, which I find very annoying and usually just add a few Jarritos to the order.  Overall, we still use this place due to the lack of great quality nearby as we have tried and failed with many other options.

28.description: Ringing in the new year by saying goodbye to my old, kinda ghetto gym (won't name any names) and saying hello to V-Tone.  This gym is only a little over a year old which means the machines are pretty new and up to date.  There is a good size weight room with pretty much all that you can ask for.  The gym is kept clean and is in good condition which is always a plus.  The cost is great!  A 3 month membership is only $105.  They are now offering yoga, for an extra price, but it appears that some months they will offer classes for free.  Mind you it's not a huge place however, they are looking to expand this summer.It's a few steps off the red line (Jarvis), which makes it pretty convenient.  If you're looking for a gym in Rogers Park and don't feel like joining every one else at Bally's, this is your place.

1.description: My favorite place. Love everybody who works there. Nice and clean environment, every time I go, always see the cleaning lady around. Also they have the best YOGA class. I have been taken yoga class multiple place many years, never feel so good about yoga as much as this one. Unlike other yoga class, it is less intensive, more relaxing. It adjusts my mood and relaxes me even the time I came in exhausted & sassy. The first time I came in was a Saturday morning, door was open, we did yoga with fresh air, sunlight and meditation music mixed with outdoor birds' singing and train noise. Best experience ever. Compared with other gyms I had been to, I feel way more personally connected here.

9.description: Great neighborhood gym. It has everything you need. The outdoor gym is the best part of you like doing calisthenics

29.description: December 2010 update: they've opened a third space, a classroom for yoga, at the eastern end of their building. Hardwood floors, the same deep red walls as the cardio space, and a couple of mirrors. This is good.They've also filled most of the available wall space in the other two rooms, and in the men's locker room, with advertisements. This is bad.Still, I'm a fan. Into my 13th or 14th month of membership. You can't go wrong here.

23.description: Ok, I just joined for  the new year. I lost three pant sizes on my own,  just by a change in diet, and want to tone and bulk up in muscle. The owner, Tony, is SUPER nice, and has a sense of humor. WILL NOT sell you stuff you do not want, is NOT pushy, and is the nicest person I have met in a while. I could HUG this guy, but he will crush me in his paw. Lol! I joined for the year and cannot wait to get started tomorrow AM, at 5:30 AM. This will kill me, but I am committed. The place is perfect, not too far from where I live, though I have to commute by train. It is closer to work which is perfect, as I can go before or after work. I want to keep this place MY secret, as Tony and the place is AWESOME, and I have not even started to work out yet. Once I have spent a month in here, I will be back with another review. BUT let me tell you, things are GREAT thus far.

5.description: This place has friendly staff, isn't crowded,Keeps the place clean, and has fair prices. I don't really have any complaints other than maybe they could show something more female friendly on the TVs or eventually get machines with their own TVs on them. That sounds picky but it's easy to find time to go to the gym when you can watch your favorite show and get in your cardio. The other gyms in this area have terrible reviews. I like this place and will go back as long as I'm in the neighborhood. It's RIGHT off the red line Jarvis stop and seems like an overall safe area. I haven't taken any classes yet but they look fun and I hope to soon!

31.description: A gem of a gym.  Great buy for the buck.  Place is kept impeccably clean, members seem to be attitude free, staff readily available, all the necessary equipment-machines-etc. and brand new to boot.  Fitness classes and yoga are supposedly in the future; for this deal, I can wait.  Being so new the membership is still low, so I've yet to be there when I would call it "busy" or "too busy."  Get in, get my workout done, get out, no muss, no fuss.  I checked out Bally's (bleck!), several YMCAs, and a handful of other small, private clubs.  Nothing came close in terms of value, atmosphere and equipment.

25.description: Oh, golly gee, this is a great place, so great that I am reluctant to even write a review, for fear that others will want to join. First of all, it's super clean, an important piece for me; second super friendly guys that run it - brothers in fact, so the care of a family shows; great price,; excellent choice of equipment, basic and very new;and I look forward to the expansion, but Shhhhh, it's a secret!

12.description: This place is awesome. I almost feel a little hesitant writing this review because I like it being Roger's Park's best kept secret. The annual rate is really affordable. The equipment is well maintained, clean and diverse, I never feel like I have to wait in line to do something. Big weight room, great cardio and lifting machines. Every time I arrive the attendant is always really friendly, towels are plentiful. Not too many seats to sit on in the locker room when changing, but that's a minor problem. The showers are all clean too! Can't say enough great things about this gym

21.description: I have been a member of 2 gyms in the past and not wanted to go. This gym is very comfortable and never crowded. Love it!

16.description: I usually go to the gym during the day and there is hardly anyone else there. Even when I've gone at night all the equipment I want to use is available.Their Facebook page is also updated with lots of useful exercise and diet information.The only reason they lose one star is - I don't really know what some of the equipment is for because there are no instructions. Some of them show diagrams of what muscles are being worked while others don't.Also, of course, there is the downside of having only one location so if I go visit friends or family I don't have a gym membership I can use.

17.description: Ringing in the new year by saying goodbye to my old, kinda ghetto gym (won't name any names) and saying hello to V-Tone.  This gym is only a little over a year old which means the machines are pretty new and up to date.  There is a good size weight room with pretty much all that you can ask for.  The gym is kept clean and is in good condition which is always a plus.  The cost is great!  A 3 month membership is only $105.  They are now offering yoga, for an extra price, but it appears that some months they will offer classes for free.  Mind you it's not a huge place however, they are looking to expand this summer.It's a few steps off the red line (Jarvis), which makes it pretty convenient.  If you're looking for a gym in Rogers Park and don't feel like joining every one else at Bally's, this is your place.

10.description: V-Tone and I have a love hate relationship. I worked out there three times a week for close to 10 months and have lost a total of 50 lbs. But ended up recently changing gyms. Pros: - Helpful staff- Large cardio area- Clean throughout- TV's have decent channels - AffordableCons:- Weight room is pathetic. Lots of machines, but only ONE squat rack, which everyone seems intent on using for anything but squats- Locker room is tiny. I'd often find myself changing in the showers because any more than 3 people and it's too packed- No overnight lockersIt was good while it lasted. If you are in it only for cardio and/or just use machines to lift, then this place should be fine. Waiting 20 minutes for someone to finish up 18 sets of curls in the squat rack was a deal breaker for me.

11.description: This is a perfect gym if you are serious about working out, but fall short of the cutoff for 'Beefhead' status. The amenities are clean, the staff is nice, and the equipment is ample for a well-rounded workout. Here you will not find the roid-ragers grunting ridiculously loud as they max their pump... or whatever. The low-key feel of the place is perfect for those who have a little ways to go, but want to get in and get a good workout. Rates are very reasonable, too.

26.description: Much to what others have already said, I will only reiterate. V-Tone Fitness is a brand new gym, I think only about a year old. All of the equipment is fairly new, and if it isn't, it's kept clean enough and in high enough condition that I can't tell the difference. The staff is extremely high quality. I've gone to their sister store V-Tone Vitamins for supplements and advice, and the service continues its excellence here at V-Tone Fitness. They are very professional and precise with their work, thoroughly knowledgeable on all of the equipment, able to suggest workout plans and other entities of fitness. I've never seen it too crowded. I have experience with many gyms in the area and this is one of the less-crowded gyms, which is MUCH appreciated. As another user has already noted: it's not a health club, so you won't get the additions of a jacuzzi and pool as health clubs typically offer, but the service and quality of the gym surely make up for all of that.Overall, very professional, definitely an upper-echelon gym if you're serious about your personal fitness.

27.description: This place is inexpensive, clean, and full of a great selection of equipment. Its never so crowded that you have to wait to use a cardio machine. The staff is helpful and professional. Its not a health club- so you will not find a jacuzzi in the locker rooms or any spa services around. Its a great neighborhood place, clean and new, and not at all pretentious. And if you live in RP, its the only place to workout and get away from that Bally's crowd (which is reason enough to give this place 5 stars).

0.description: I really like this gym! Its not super packed so you don't have to wait for machines, and every time im in there someone is cleaning. All the staff is super friendly, and its a great space to work out and take classes. Very reasonably priced at $25/mnth if you tKe advantage of this yelp deal and pay in advance. Cant beat it.

20.description: This gym is very clean and not crowded. The equipment is well-maintained, and it has a nice, family-owned, neighborhood vibe.I enjoy the people in this gym because they don't all seem like vain meat heads and barbies. Just normal folks choosing healthy lifestyles.Rates are cheap, and it's great that we don't have to sign a contract (we got a couple's rate).If you're in the Roger's Park area, I wouldn't think about going anywhere else.

19.description: Just joined yesterday. Very nice, no frills gym, no contract, very easy to join. Includes a cardio room, weight room, some classes, nice TVs, wifi available, and a little supplement shop in the front. Only reason I give it 3 stars is because the classes aren't included in a regular membership--you have to pay $15 extra each month or something like that. Also, there isn't a lot of space to do things on the floor like push ups, crunches, or stretching. Cons aside, there are tons of pros. It's family owned by two brothers, and they're very polite and helpful. The women's locker room is SPOTLESS, and that's a huge compliment coming from a clean freak like me. As a woman that likes to weight train, I automatically noticed that there was an equal ratio of men and women in the weight room, with girls that were bringin' it! It's nice to not be the only buff girl :). Also, unlike Bally's a few blocks away, there is no weird singles vibe, and no creepers analyzing how supportive your sports bra is with their x-ray vision. I'm excited to be supporting a family owned, local business. Go on in and talk to Franco at the front desk. He'll take care of ya.

2.description: I've been going here for a few months now. It's a great, small neighborhood gym that's not expensive. The staff is really friendly and, as other reviewers have said, the cleaning lady is always there. There is only one squat rack, but I haven't had any issues yet with people using it for things other than squats. The locker room is kinda small, but I live nearby and don't use it much.

32.description: I have been a member for a few months and find the staff very friendly. It is a perfect gym to hit after work without the hassle of dealing with a big fitness club. The facility is clean and the price is fair. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is it's limited programs. No spinning, court sports, etc...

18.description: Much to what others have already said, I will only reiterate. V-Tone Fitness is a brand new gym, I think only about a year old. All of the equipment is fairly new, and if it isn't, it's kept clean enough and in high enough condition that I can't tell the difference. The staff is extremely high quality. I've gone to their sister store V-Tone Vitamins for supplements and advice, and the service continues its excellence here at V-Tone Fitness. They are very professional and precise with their work, thoroughly knowledgeable on all of the equipment, able to suggest workout plans and other entities of fitness. I've never seen it too crowded. I have experience with many gyms in the area and this is one of the less-crowded gyms, which is MUCH appreciated. As another user has already noted: it's not a health club, so you won't get the additions of a jacuzzi and pool as health clubs typically offer, but the service and quality of the gym surely make up for all of that.Overall, very professional, definitely an upper-echelon gym if you're serious about your personal fitness.

13.description: This is the first gym I've joined and I like it a lot. I've gone with the after work crowd, on weekend mornings, and weekday mid-mornings and it's never crowded -- there are always machines open. It's family-owned and you can almost always find one of the brothers cleaning/maintaining the space.  The women's locker room is always clean, too.One downside is the classes are $15/month and being a small gym, they only have a few classes.It's a great neighborhood gym, good rates, and convenient to get to (parking is easy, next to the train, and walkable depending on where you are).

4.description: I started going here in 2013 and I love it.  The equipment is well maintained, the club is clean, the locker rooms impeccable and I can't say enough good things about the staff.  The brothers who own the club are awesome and always willing to chat.  This healthclub has a family feel rather than corporate.  I started going here while extremely overweight and felt nothing but support and encouragement from the staff.  They get to know you and are super supportive.  My partner ran into a bigot one day and the owner, Tony, swiftly kicked him out of the club and revoked his membership.  These guys are awesome for the community!  They also expanded the club with a backroom for floor exercises and other activities.  Rob, one of the personal trainers, is BY FAR the best personal trainer I've worked with.  After moving out of Rogers Park to the far NW suburbs, (50 miles away), I continued to come back into the city to train with him weekly.  I highly recommend him if you want a jump start on your goals and encouragement to keep going.  He walks the walk and knows EXACTLY how far to push you.If you buy the 1 year membership, it's less expensive than any big chain club and worth EVERY penny!  Can't really put a price on my health anyway.Overall, this is the best health club I've ever gone to.  While I don't miss the city life, I do miss V-Tone and my V-Tone family.  I lost just over 100lbs at V-Tone and felt great doing it.  Go check it out now!

24.description: Just joined yesterday. Very nice, no frills gym, no contract, very easy to join. Includes a cardio room, weight room, some classes, nice TVs, wifi available, and a little supplement shop in the front. Only reason I give it 3 stars is because the classes aren't included in a regular membership--you have to pay $15 extra each month or something like that. Also, there isn't a lot of space to do things on the floor like push ups, crunches, or stretching. Cons aside, there are tons of pros. It's family owned by two brothers, and they're very polite and helpful. The women's locker room is SPOTLESS, and that's a huge compliment coming from a clean freak like me. As a woman that likes to weight train, I automatically noticed that there was an equal ratio of men and women in the weight room, with girls that were bringin' it! It's nice to not be the only buff girl :). Also, unlike Bally's a few blocks away, there is no weird singles vibe, and no creepers analyzing how supportive your sports bra is with their x-ray vision. I'm excited to be supporting a family owned, local business. Go on in and talk to Franco at the front desk. He'll take care of ya.

6.description: Tony & his staff do a great job at the gym. Trainers are encouraging & motivating to use good technique and push yourself. bathrooms are always clean & restocked. Great selection of cardio/weight equipment that is well maintained.

22.description: This is a great small neighborhood gym.  They've expanded their space and now offer classes.  It would be nice for the classes and times to expand, but i'm sure they will at some point.  It's in a great location and the price is just right compared to some of the 'big box' gym memberships.  I've been a member since just after they opened.  Would recommend it to anyone.

15.description: Walked in the door of this, my neighborhood gym, to find an overly-muscled hulk behind the desk.  I asked if they offered yoga classes.  His answer - yep.  I asked what type of yoga?  His answer - huh? I asked what time were the classes offered?  His answer - a pointed finger at a sheet of paper.  I asked what the charge was?  His answer - huh? My thought as I walked out the door -  Not the kind of place I would even consider taking a class.

7.description: I love this place. It's less than a ten minute walk from my house,  I pay less than $30/month. It's very clean, the owners are really nice,  and I don't have to pay extra for classes, which is my favorite part!

8.description: I have been a member of V-Tone for over three years now, and I have nothing but good things to say about it. Yes, it's on the smaller side, and the locker rooms aren't that big, but that's what you get when you are a member to a privately owned gym. This isn't a franchise gym, like LA Fitness where the locker rooms are 1,500 sq. feet. What you pay for at V-Tone is quality. The equipment is always clean, and fully functioning. There are tons of cardio equipment. Anthony, the owner, and his little brother, Franco are always nice, and attentive to your needs. The weight room can get a little crowded, but that is to be expected when you are working out during a rush hour time of day, like in the mornings, or after work. Overall, if you prefer a gym that is affordable, has a lot of amentities, is clean, plus friendly staff, then V-Tone is definetely for you.

30.description: Being in Chicago for the summer, I got a three-month membership for $105 and have been incredibly satisfied.  Echoing what other reviewers have said, the gym is kept in pristine condition, the employees are friendly and helpful, the cost is great, it is never too busy, and there is a wide array of equipment for both upper body and cardio.  Highly recommended.

3.description: Great neighborhood gym with awesome new equipment, I recently moved to the area and started going to V-Tone.  The membership package is very inexpensive and the attention you receive is nothing like anywhere else I've been.  Nice sized workout facility with a neighborhood feel. This place helps release endorphin's with less stress and always has fully stocked beverages and towels.  Recommend to all.

14.description: This gym is very clean and not crowded. The equipment is well-maintained, and it has a nice, family-owned, neighborhood vibe.I enjoy the people in this gym because they don't all seem like vain meat heads and barbies. Just normal folks choosing healthy lifestyles.Rates are cheap, and it's great that we don't have to sign a contract (we got a couple's rate).If you're in the Roger's Park area, I wouldn't think about going anywhere else.

28.description: Beautiful, clean, very friendly and accommodating staff. Great prices. Pedicure was perfect! I'll be coming back.

1.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! Needed a last minute wax and called 2 hours before they closed and they offered to stay open late past their close time to fit me in! The atmosphere when I walked in totally blew me away because it feels super fancy and upscale but not to the point where you don't feel comfortable. One of the owners was working that night and he lives in the neighborhood and wanted this place to be an affordable place in the area that felt like the environment of a Lincoln Park salon. Mission accomplished!!!The prices here are incredibly reasonable and the staff are so down to earth. I had a fantastic wax experience and can't wait to come back for other services! Side note to those who care, this place NEVER double dips their wax and is super clean and hygenic. Beware of this at other places especially if they're on the cheaper side because there are a few in Rogers Park. Anyone who's looking for a relaxing experience should come here! It's definitely one of the best hidden gems in Rogers Park that I could definitely see becoming a go to place for your salon needs as word gets out about this place!

9.description: The owners are soooooooo friendly.  Definitely a Lincoln Park experience at a Roger's Park price.  You can't go wrong with BYOB!!!!!!!!!The place is tastefully and beautifully decorated.  It's vintage, but modern.GINGERSLAM NAIL BAR= PERFECTION.  they've earned a new customer! !!!

29.description: I can't wait until Gingerslam franchises this idea for a high-end-at-a-reasonable-price-point nail salon where I live. Beautiful ambiance, fun people, gorgeous nails. Love this place!

23.description: Wonderful first visit to Gingerslam! Can't wait to go back. Salon is clean, relaxing, and beautifully decorated.  Everyone was super friendly and attentive! You won me over Gingerslam!

5.description: So glad I finally visited Gingerslam! Got a brow wax and mani-pedi from Marshawn, and all services were spot-on perfect. The polish they used--and I think they're the only salon in the city that has it--called Smith & Cult has lasted well over a week with no chips, and it's not even a no-chip gel formula! Insane. The owner, who was super friendly, made me a delicious cup of tea. As for the salon, it's cute and extremely clean. And prices are very reasonable. Will definitely visit this place often.

31.description: The owners are soooooooo friendly.  Definitely a Lincoln Park experience at a Roger's Park price.  You can't go wrong with BYOB!!!!!!!!!The place is tastefully and beautifully decorated.  It's vintage, but modern.GINGERSLAM NAIL BAR= PERFECTION.  they've earned a new customer! !!!

25.description: Calling Becky Sue!  Calling Becky Sue!  What a terrific program they have, and a beautiful relaxing design.  Great massage chairs, excellent music, scenery is relaxing and conducive for getting the toes and the fingers done right!  And she knows toes and fingers.  Ask for Becky Sue, and get the personal touch that makes you feel right at home, along with meaningful conversation. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place and again don't forget to ask for Becky Sue!

12.description: Awesome experience!!! Becky was great and took a ton of time on a regular mani/pedi. Walkin was no problem and the place has an awesome vibe.

37.description: If you are looking for a great new spot for all of your mani/pedi needs look no further. GingerSlam has a great location, easy parking, lots of options/services and the most talented and friendly staff I have encountered since moving to Chicago!! Becky Y gave me the the best manicure and introduced me to these awesome new Reaction Nail Colors. It's fun because the polish changes when the temperature of your hands change... So it makes things like switching laundry over, doing dishes and drying your hair more entertaining because your nails are constantly reacting to the changing temperature. I live this new nail bar and cannot wait to introduce all oft friends to this new gem!!

21.description: I'm thrilled to find a friendly, clean nail salon in the Rogers Park neighborhood. Everyone is welcoming and professional. I will definitely be back! AND Maybe you should come too?

16.description: What a wonderful place!!!!! From the Trevor the owner to the Amazing staff - everything was awesome. It is a BYOB place where 100% you Will the great Service and wonderful nails!!!!!!!

17.description: Glad so many people are enjoying themselves here but I did not. Everyone is kind and the decor is cute but when I went in my mani pedi took forever for a pretty bad result. They made me soak my fingers in acetone for like 20 minutes to get my gel off and then the stylist took pains to chemically dry out my nails to make the gel polish stick better. Even after all of this some of the nails  puckered immediately and they began to chip the next day! It's nice that they offered a free fix but after a nearly 2 hour process I just wanted to get out of there and never come back. There's also a self-congratulating gentrifying vibe going on-- as if they are improving upon and bringing niceness to Rogers park that doesn't already exist. I'll take a quality manicure at a standard salon any day over this experience!!

10.description: First time ever getting a manicure. I went in and got a manicure by Mona after getting fed up with the damage I did with 25 years of biting my nails and cuticles. Mona did a great job on me. She was thoughtful and was a trooper with getting my fingers looking like I didn't stick them in a blender. I was surprised to see BYOB. Next time, I'll bring some beers with me. The owners are cool and friendly. The regulars who religiously go there seem to faithfully attend the survives provided by GingerSlam. I'll be coming back :).

11.description: The salon is very clean and nicely decorated. They have a wonderful selection of high end polishes as well as OPI and Essie. I had a pedicure and was really pleased with everything from the polish application to the exfoliation and beyond. I will be recommending this salon to my friends! Can't wait to come back.

26.description: I love GingerSlam!It is gorgeous and the massage chairs feel like soft buttery leather. I waited to write my review to see how long my pedicure lasted-- it's been 4 weeks and it is still perfect. Now I just want a pedi because I want a new color. I also had a shellac mani done which lasted the full two weeks (and I wash my hands or use hand sanitizer at least 40-50 times per day). Becky did a fantastic job and it is such a lovely place to spend time. I also adore the owners. They certainly know how to make a vision become a reality. Now, if they could make a high speed rail from Milwaukee to GingerSlam, I'd be all set.

27.description: The salon is very clean and nicely decorated. They have a wonderful selection of high end polishes as well as OPI and Essie. I had a pedicure and was really pleased with everything from the polish application to the exfoliation and beyond. I will be recommending this salon to my friends! Can't wait to come back.

35.description: Very nice place with friendly people. Not to mention a great remodel of an existing space. If you live nearby (even if you don't) this is a great place to go. Grab a bottle of bubbly on the way. They are BYOB and they will even supply the glasses and a cooler to keep your Dom cold.

8.description: Very nice place with friendly people. Not to mention a great remodel of an existing space. If you live nearby (even if you don't) this is a great place to go. Grab a bottle of bubbly on the way. They are BYOB and they will even supply the glasses and a cooler to keep your Dom cold.

0.description: I had a great experience at Gingerslam. I am so happy they are in Rogers Park. Trevor, Becky, and Marshon (I hope I am spelling her name correctly) are great! I got an awesome manicure and pedicure from Becky, I even upgraded to the Yves Saint Laurent nail lacquer (just $5 for the upgraded polishes). The owners (Becky and Trevor) live in the neighborhood and wanted to open a nail salon in Rogers Park that they would love to frequent themselves without leaving Rogers Park. Mission accomplished! The decor is modern, inviting, and in very good taste. The atmosphere is relaxing, and fun. Gingerslam is a great space for a lady to relax and get a pleasant, extremely well done service. Marshon is a fully licensed estetician so you can go there for your facials and waxing services as well. Did I mention they are BYOB? What is not to love about Gingerslam? This is my new nail bar!

20.description: What a great addition to The RP! Trevor, the owner, was working the front desk last Saturday, and very sweetly asked me to come back in 30. Not a problem at all since I was a walk-in. So glad I waited for what ended up being the best mani/pedi I've had in ages. Mona did my nails and she was fantastic. Really scrubbed my feet and cleaned them up. I'm more a fan of a thorough pumice treatment for the feet rather than wasting time on leg massages, and Mona was great. My feet are so smooth! Can't be beat for $37 plus tip. The salon is also tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. The whole staff is really friendly and makes you feel welcome and relaxed.

19.description: Great service, beautiful work, friendly staff, fresh environment.  Highly recommend and I don't live nearby.  I will be back!

33.description: Wonderful! I will never go anywhere else. This nail bar offers a plethera of services in a hip, snazzy and super clean space. The attention to detail is evident and they produce high-end service and results at a great price point;  oh, and did i mention it is BYOB? This place rocks! Go and see for yourself, you will leave happy with GORGEOUS nails.

2.description: Absolutely loved my time here!! Everything was amazing. I am going to become a regular here for sure!

34.description: No chip Manicure and pedicure: Gracious, patient technicians wait while clients select their lacquers ( even assist with your selection, the salon offers a huge selection of CND, YSL, OPI, Tom Ford, Chanelpolishes ), then create gorgeous colors to compliment your style. I love the opi downtown neon on my nails. This is my first time here and this is the perfect spot for a spa day. The ambiance is calm and inviting. Would definitely be back and I think I found my regular salon. I'd recommend this salon to everyone! I love the outcome of my nails. I had terrible gel added to my natural nails but the aesthetician was able to revive and restore my damaged nails. You're offered your choice of light drinks which I think is a great way to satisfy the customer. In my opinion, I appreciate the fact that the staff/owners were concerned about the needs of the customers by checking on you during the service. Overall I love this place already and I'm returning. FYI for utmost guarantee for service try to make an appointment ahead of time!

32.description: What a fabulous addition to RoPa!  I previously ventured to Evanston or other burbs for my nails.  Not anymore!!! Great location, great prices, great quality, great service!!I have already been to the salon twice, and have two more appointments set up. Note that these appointments are not because I NEED to go, but because I WANT to go. Rebecca did a fantastic job on my mani and pedi. I am very hard on my hands, and my no-chip manis have held up beautifully. They are extremely gentle with the no-chip removal process, too. Going to try the vinalux/high gloss next time (longer wear than regular, but not quite no-chip).I have tried the ombre gel (color changes with temperature) - so much fun grocery shopping at Mariano's with a mimosa - the cold changed color.  Also have tried an upgraded Channel polish on my toes - such a rich color.  Love the ambiance - relaxing but very fun.  You can't beat watching classic movies like Auntie Mame and Some Like it Hot. They encourage BYOB, and have a great setup with ice buckets and stemware available for use.  It was lovely to enjoy a mimosa while being pampered.They are still working out some of the kinks in scheduling, but you will have that with any new business.  The staff is extremely friendly, accommodating and respectful of my time and theirs.  They do take walk-ins, but I would highly recommend making an appointment.  Can't wait to try a facial and a steam pedicure at some point.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Ginger Slam!

18.description: If you want to get your nails done super quickly by indentured servants who sleep in 4-hour shifts above the salon, definitely don't come to Gingerslam. If you want nails, skin, or brows that look amazing in an environment that is friendly, welcoming, and unpretentious, you should definitely come to Gingerslam. The people here are super nice, very good at what they do, and you can drink (BYOB). It also helps me to know that they enjoy what they do and want to be there. That makes me want to be there!

13.description: This is a great place to get a mani/pedi! Clean, great massage chairs and Becky did a very good job with my ingrown nails on both my hands and feet. Trevor is warm and friendly and makes you feel very comfortable. He offers tea and is happy to accommodate BYOB.  I will be back!

4.description: I am honestly kind of embarrassed that I haven't written a review yet...I've been here 3 times already and LOVE it!! Such an amazing asset to the neighborhood. The salon is clean and nicely decorated, and the owners are super nice, friendly, and genuinely care that you're happy with the service. Plus BYOB doesn't hurt ;)So happy this is nearby so I don't have to give my business to one of the sweatshop salons

24.description: You. Guys. Omigod. Go there. Right. Now. I took my guy friend here, both for pedicures but only me for nail polish. In the past he and I have walked into places that shame him for being a guy who gets pedicures but this place, run by local cool guy, Trevor, welcomed us both with open arms. We came with wine, which we were given an ice bucket to keep cold (no fee!), and a ready-for-anything attitude because we knew this was a new place. By the time Becky and finished with my feet and I had my emotional relaxation orgasm, my friend and I agreed we found our new nail place for life. Marshawn (I have no idea if that's the correct spelling) is a licensed aesthetician and I plan to come back for some waxing. I hear she does allllllllll the waxings. I expressed some reservations after I bruised once before. She was quick to say that means my past waxer made mistakes. I'm inclined to believe that. Anyway! Best pedi ever. Kick ass massage chairs, really nice people, greaaaaat movies playing the whole time and some frigging designer color choices. Support the local Rogers Park business and make reservations. You will *not* regret it!See them soon!

6.description: Very nice place, everybody is cool. I went there for my nails and I got my eyebrows waxed as well, and Im very pleased with the results, I highly recommend this shop.

22.description: We went for the first time, got in same day, met owner and had the lovely Mona working on my mani/pedi. Very cute decor, wonderful massage chairs and the overall experience was excellent. Best part .5 miles from my house and byob. We will come back and maybe do a girls night with friends. Highly recommend.

15.description: You. Guys. Omigod. Go there. Right. Now. I took my guy friend here, both for pedicures but only me for nail polish. In the past he and I have walked into places that shame him for being a guy who gets pedicures but this place, run by local cool guy, Trevor, welcomed us both with open arms. We came with wine, which we were given an ice bucket to keep cold (no fee!), and a ready-for-anything attitude because we knew this was a new place. By the time Becky and finished with my feet and I had my emotional relaxation orgasm, my friend and I agreed we found our new nail place for life. Marshawn (I have no idea if that's the correct spelling) is a licensed aesthetician and I plan to come back for some waxing. I hear she does allllllllll the waxings. I expressed some reservations after I bruised once before. She was quick to say that means my past waxer made mistakes. I'm inclined to believe that. Anyway! Best pedi ever. Kick ass massage chairs, really nice people, greaaaaat movies playing the whole time and some frigging designer color choices. Support the local Rogers Park business and make reservations. You will *not* regret it!See them soon!

7.description: Oscar de la Renta dog dishes. Ombre gel polish. Wouldn't have thought I'd combine those terms when describing a salon in my neighborhood. But given that my first of many future visits to GingerSlam exceeded my expectations?Cheers to GS owners and staff  for bringing a Lincoln Park experience to Rogers Park. And at RP pricing...I'll get back to that. I love patronizing businesses when they're in their infancy, because you get to see how everyone performs under that type of operational pressure. GS has a solid team, with most of the core staff being friends for decades outside of the business. It shows--while the salon itself had the usual first-week kinks to work out, the team was a talented, charismatic and well-oiled machine. The interior of GS is sophisticated yet approachable, with a great balance of vintage glamour and modern aesthetics. There are three pedicure stations, which are light blue and white (think Marie Antoniette)--which pair well against the buttery-yellow walls and chandeliers. Two gorgeous pin-up girls adorn the walls, as well as designer logos and a flat-screen which was showing the classic "Auntie Mame" film from the 50s. While I enjoyed Rebecca's gentle yet effective pedicure care (the massage and exfoliation scrub were fantastic) to my winter-trodden hooves and talons, I gazed in horror at the customer's glass of wine next to me. I gasped when I saw her bottle of Merlot. As I did not have wine. And that is NOT supposed to happen when I'm getting a mani/pedi. Sure enough, there was a BYOB sign on the door. I made a mental note, sighed in relief and settled in for the rest of my pampering.After the polish was applied, I was taken to one of two manicure stations (another will be added) for the Ombre gel. Remember the Hypercolor t-shirts from the '90s which would change color when heat came into contact with the material? Imagine that wondrous effect on your nails. When they're warm (either through body temperature or exposure to heat), my nails change from their original deep salmon color ("Crantini Bikini"--which also looked pinker in the swatch than on my nails, guess my blood runs cold?) to almost Barbie hot pink--and when I was doing dishes they changed to champagne pink. When they cool down, they're back to their original shade--but I've noticed that the tips are usually darker than the nail bed (again, the body heat). So I basically have a non-stop party on my fingertips. And since each incarnation of the polish color matches my skin/undertones--I suppose I have an ultra-stylish soiree?Halfway through the manicure, I asked if GS offered Brazillians, as I was going to head to another salon for one but didn't have an appointment. Trevor then confirmed with the esthetician, Marshawn, that they'd be able to fit me in.  I'm no stranger to this procedure, but I was a bit wary of being ad hoc scheduled for one when 1) the esthetician's other scheduled client just walked in, and 2) it was my first time at the salon. While I didn't want the customer to wait unnecessarily, I also didn't want to end up with random fur patches.Neither happened. The waxing area was prepped for me, initial questions were asked regarding allergies, and the general waxing procedure was explained. She stated that she loved the wax she would use on me, because it was efficient in x/y/z ways. And that the wax loved her. Good, as I didn't want the wax to hate her. I didn't want anything but love in the process of my first Brazillian since November. Marshawn upheld the utmost standards of process cleanliness, conversational levity, and tactical effectiveness. Note--the waxing area is divided from the main salon with a curtain. I had no issues with this whatsoever, as the area was 100% private, but it may be surprising to people used to receiving waxing services in separate rooms with closed doors. When paying for my services, I again questioned the pricing. My initial hesitation upon making my appointment was that the prices were reasonable for a reason--my final astonishment was that the prices were reasonable for services which were excellent.  Trevor appreciated my suggestion of raising the price of the Brazillian, but explained that they were trying to ensure that customers would use their salon on a regular basis, and not just consider it for special ocassions.  Which is understandable, as I share his concern that this neighborhood may not be able to support a place like this. So people in this neighborhood who support places like this in other Chicago neighborhoods?Keep your money local. Try GingerSlam. Love it? Share the accolades and come back. Like it? Let them know what they can improve. Hate it? Honey, text me before you need a mani/pedi, I'll pick up some Cabernet and we can all have a glass and a discussion. But we can't complain that we don't have what we want here, if we don't then support it when it is here. Don't our pooches deserve water in designer dishes?

36.description: Oscar de la Renta dog dishes. Ombre gel polish. Wouldn't have thought I'd combine those terms when describing a salon in my neighborhood. But given that my first of many future visits to GingerSlam exceeded my expectations?Cheers to GS owners and staff  for bringing a Lincoln Park experience to Rogers Park. And at RP pricing...I'll get back to that. I love patronizing businesses when they're in their infancy, because you get to see how everyone performs under that type of operational pressure. GS has a solid team, with most of the core staff being friends for decades outside of the business. It shows--while the salon itself had the usual first-week kinks to work out, the team was a talented, charismatic and well-oiled machine. The interior of GS is sophisticated yet approachable, with a great balance of vintage glamour and modern aesthetics. There are three pedicure stations, which are light blue and white (think Marie Antoniette)--which pair well against the buttery-yellow walls and chandeliers. Two gorgeous pin-up girls adorn the walls, as well as designer logos and a flat-screen which was showing the classic "Auntie Mame" film from the 50s. While I enjoyed Rebecca's gentle yet effective pedicure care (the massage and exfoliation scrub were fantastic) to my winter-trodden hooves and talons, I gazed in horror at the customer's glass of wine next to me. I gasped when I saw her bottle of Merlot. As I did not have wine. And that is NOT supposed to happen when I'm getting a mani/pedi. Sure enough, there was a BYOB sign on the door. I made a mental note, sighed in relief and settled in for the rest of my pampering.After the polish was applied, I was taken to one of two manicure stations (another will be added) for the Ombre gel. Remember the Hypercolor t-shirts from the '90s which would change color when heat came into contact with the material? Imagine that wondrous effect on your nails. When they're warm (either through body temperature or exposure to heat), my nails change from their original deep salmon color ("Crantini Bikini"--which also looked pinker in the swatch than on my nails, guess my blood runs cold?) to almost Barbie hot pink--and when I was doing dishes they changed to champagne pink. When they cool down, they're back to their original shade--but I've noticed that the tips are usually darker than the nail bed (again, the body heat). So I basically have a non-stop party on my fingertips. And since each incarnation of the polish color matches my skin/undertones--I suppose I have an ultra-stylish soiree?Halfway through the manicure, I asked if GS offered Brazillians, as I was going to head to another salon for one but didn't have an appointment. Trevor then confirmed with the esthetician, Marshawn, that they'd be able to fit me in.  I'm no stranger to this procedure, but I was a bit wary of being ad hoc scheduled for one when 1) the esthetician's other scheduled client just walked in, and 2) it was my first time at the salon. While I didn't want the customer to wait unnecessarily, I also didn't want to end up with random fur patches.Neither happened. The waxing area was prepped for me, initial questions were asked regarding allergies, and the general waxing procedure was explained. She stated that she loved the wax she would use on me, because it was efficient in x/y/z ways. And that the wax loved her. Good, as I didn't want the wax to hate her. I didn't want anything but love in the process of my first Brazillian since November. Marshawn upheld the utmost standards of process cleanliness, conversational levity, and tactical effectiveness. Note--the waxing area is divided from the main salon with a curtain. I had no issues with this whatsoever, as the area was 100% private, but it may be surprising to people used to receiving waxing services in separate rooms with closed doors. When paying for my services, I again questioned the pricing. My initial hesitation upon making my appointment was that the prices were reasonable for a reason--my final astonishment was that the prices were reasonable for services which were excellent.  Trevor appreciated my suggestion of raising the price of the Brazillian, but explained that they were trying to ensure that customers would use their salon on a regular basis, and not just consider it for special ocassions.  Which is understandable, as I share his concern that this neighborhood may not be able to support a place like this. So people in this neighborhood who support places like this in other Chicago neighborhoods?Keep your money local. Try GingerSlam. Love it? Share the accolades and come back. Like it? Let them know what they can improve. Hate it? Honey, text me before you need a mani/pedi, I'll pick up some Cabernet and we can all have a glass and a discussion. But we can't complain that we don't have what we want here, if we don't then support it when it is here. Don't our pooches deserve water in designer dishes?

30.description: I have not used their services, and, being a man, am unlikely to do so - but I appreciate their community-mindedness in putting out water for Dogs. Whence some stars.

3.description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! The best manicure/pedicure offered in Rogers Park - Marshawn, Becky & Trevor are awesome! They're able to make make my feet feel brand new each and every time. I won't go anywhere else for a pedicure. If you're in RP, check them out!

14.description: Love, love, love Gingerslam! My daughter and I have birthdays close to one another...Grandma came to town and decided to treat us to birthday pedicures. Nice, right? But you must keep in mind that my daughter is 4 years old...I was pretty doubtful that she'd last long enough for our toes to be beautified and actually dry. Becky and Trevor were wonderfully attentive to all of us, and helped keep my daughter happy the whole time. We had fun and left with lovely feet. That said, next time I'm going without the kiddo and with a bottle of wine!

3.description: I have tried the prawn shrimp and let me tell you they are the best ones I have tried so far. I love to eat prawns and have tried them almost everywhere. My husband had their ceviche and it's sooo delicious highly recommend their seafood. Next time I'll have to try their tacos.

1.description: Really good. The spicy langustinos are listed as " best in chicago" on the menu.  I have to think they are.   Highly recommend.

2.description: The rice was dry and flavorless, and I'm pretty sure it's a few days old. The beans were disappointing. The enchiladas were also some of the worst I've had. Old, boiled and unseasoned chicken with a flavorless sauce. Totally gross. Thanks for making me feel even worse on a day I'm sick. I'm never ordering from here again.

0.description: It's the return of a Nayarit style (Mexican) seafood restaurant to Clark Street in Rogers Park.It was our visit but a small order of langoustines was very generous and well seasoned. We also got the fried fish with garlic. I had expected stronger flavors with the fish, but it wasn't overcooked and there was always an option with the salsa (or even the sauce from the langoustines). With the chips and salsa that came to the table complimentary was a sample of their ceviche. We did (against menu rules) try the crab tostada from the bottom of the seafood menu - imitation crab of course. I guess I could have asked...but figured to try it.Will have to try their Siete Mares next time along with a full portion of their ceviche, or go with a sampling off the more typical non-seafood Mexican options. We did get a large horchata to share between us and it came in a large oversize margarita glass - unique but a spill concern when a 4 year old and a crowded table are involved. Maybe a regular will be enough next time. So for a first visit, better than average, but reserving a star until future visits.

4.description: First of all, I didn't try any of the seafood. But everything we ordered was bland or greasy or both.The $8.50 Nachos Supreme had fake gas station style cheese sauce instead of real cheese, so that was disappointing. Their beans were thin, bland and all around not that good.If you run a Mexican restaurant, the most important part of your menu is your rice and beans...THEY COME WITH EVERYTHING!!So maybe their seafood is good, but I would stay away from everything else.It just wasn't very good at all.

29.description: Wow! This place is amazing! This place is nestled among a lot of other restaurants on Clark but stands above the rest. The Tamales are amazing including the desert tamales. All are also dirt cheap!

42.description: These tamales stay hot for years!  I'm a vegitarian and had the beans & cheese and the jalepeno & cheese.  Delicious!  And even better the next day with some scrambled eggs.  The price wsan't bad at all for such good quality tamales.  In fact, these were my first in 5 years.  My former habit, at first halted at the lack of good tamales, is back!

23.description: I cannot believe that we have monthly visits to this gem of a Guerrerense Mexican restaurant and I haven't Yelped it!!!Let's just say the name is not only a name, it is the principle and the guiding light for this little locale, hidden behind an obnoxious orange awning, and among a plethora of other Mexican joints, panaderias, and dollar stores.  Now, you may think I am a little partial, especially since my friend's aunt, from the state of Guerrero, is one of the owners, but I believe in diplomacy. I know you're probably thinking that my favorite is the obvious, tamales, and although, they are exceptional and prepared to the precision of Central Mexico's regional, portable delight.  My favorite is the POZOLE---ordered blanco (white), with chicken, and everything added on top: diced avocado, diced white onion, fresh-squeezed lime juice, some dried spices, completed by a side array of chicharrones and crispy tortillas. If you opt for the pozole while in the restaurant order up a 6 pack or 12 pack of tamales to go, and for those of you with the slight of sweet tooth cravings, might I recommend trying the pineapple and strawberry tamales---son riquisimos.

47.description: Great place if you're just looking for tamales.  Larger in size, and very authentic.  And you really can't beat the price - my wife and i picked up a 12 sack for just $10.  They also threw in sides (read: small styrofoam drinking cups full) of red and green sauce, as well as sour cream for no charge.Only problem I had was that I found a hair (from a head, definitely not mine) in one of the tamales, but what are you gonna do?

8.description: What up Tamales!  I have been eating here for years and was surprised to learn that I had never written a review!  Their tamales are excellent and they make them fresh every morning.  You have to get there early as they can run out at times.  The prices are extremely affordable and the service is friendly!  Ellie and her son Fernando are always wonderful and they truly care about their business and customers. *They are great to get for parties.  You can get a ton of tamales for a fraction of what you would pay for a catering order elsewhere.

31.description: I go here frequently for my tamales, mainly because they're nearby and I can count on them to be reliably tasty.  My favorites are the frijoles y queso and the pollo verdes.  The Jalapeno/queso left me gasping for water and was ultimately inedible to me.  Only for those with Iron tongues. Their tamales oaxaquenos are good, but you have to like mole a great deal to enjoy them. Order early as they start early in the morning (before 6:00 am) and only have so many on hand per day to sell.  BEWARE:  One sweet tamale I once got had a long black hair in it, which turned me off to the place.  However I should have complained and I didn't, so I can't say how they would have responded.  But I have eaten others (nonsweet) since then and haven't had a repeat occurrence.

34.description: Great Tamales - and I am almost always the only English speaking person in there.  Mi Abuela is in the back con su hermana making the tamales fresh by hand every day.  I dare you to try to eat $10 worth!For a unique and special treat try the Tamale Oaxacena - chicken/mole tamale wrapped in a banana leaf.  Really, really good.(I lived in Guadalajara for 7 years, so I know Tamales!)TO'B

16.description: For me, and my family, these were the most authentic "streets of Mexico" tamales that we've had in Chicago. It absolutely reminded me of waking up early in Mexico City on Saturdays or Sundays and heading out to the market to pick a few dozen tamales up for breakfast.Inexpensive? You bet... phenomenal pricing. And if you're there on the weekend, make sure to order the Pozole (Mexican soup/stew).Muy, muy bueno.

13.description: I cannot believe that we have monthly visits to this gem of a Guerrerense Mexican restaurant and I haven't Yelped it!!!Let's just say the name is not only a name, it is the principle and the guiding light for this little locale, hidden behind an obnoxious orange awning, and among a plethora of other Mexican joints, panaderias, and dollar stores.  Now, you may think I am a little partial, especially since my friend's aunt, from the state of Guerrero, is one of the owners, but I believe in diplomacy. I know you're probably thinking that my favorite is the obvious, tamales, and although, they are exceptional and prepared to the precision of Central Mexico's regional, portable delight.  My favorite is the POZOLE---ordered blanco (white), with chicken, and everything added on top: diced avocado, diced white onion, fresh-squeezed lime juice, some dried spices, completed by a side array of chicharrones and crispy tortillas. If you opt for the pozole while in the restaurant order up a 6 pack or 12 pack of tamales to go, and for those of you with the slight of sweet tooth cravings, might I recommend trying the pineapple and strawberry tamales---son riquisimos.

11.description: This place is great! The food is really good, I will be purchasing my Christmas dinner from them again this year.

39.description: Ya' know, this north-of-Devon stretch of Clark Street ought to be named as the Latin equivalent of Greek Town.  There are so many places, Mexican, Peruvian, specific spots specializing in tamales, like this place, Quesadillas, Burritos, seafood, Cuban sandwiches at La Unica (OK, so its not on Clark St.). But last weekend, the only time it's served, I came for the Green Pozole, and copped a couple of tamales, too.I had a chicken tamal with red sauce, a pork tamal with green sauce, and the Green Pozole, which had hominy and shredded pork, and was accompanied by onions, large slices of avocado, and pork rinds. Both the tamales and the soup were seasoned for heat as if someone had done a market survey on me personally for flavor and spice. It was just so good, I know that this pozole will be one of my favorite "destination dishes." Especially after the big cold door closes on Chicago in November. I would also love to try and make it, but for $10.00 for a bowl and two tamales, fuggedaboutit! I'm driving up here.I should say, too, the service was very sweet and gracious. It's one of those places where you can take your high school Spanish for a test drive and they will be both appreciative and amused.Oops...almost forgot: get the Orchata ,too!

37.description: I love this place. They open around 5am - perfect for the morning Metra commute as the RogersPark station is around the corner.The two standouts for me are the spicy pork, and the jalapeno cheese tamales, but even if you're ordering the chicken or beef ones, I would only recommend the spicy/hot instead of the mild--it's just a better combination of spice that you completely miss out on with the mild. I've found that they're variable in spiciness day to day - some batches will make your eyes water better than others, but overall they're consistently good. I even brought in a couple dozen to a work "pot-luck" for something different -they heated up nice in a microwave and everyone loved them.

0.description: Amazing. I had the green pozole (soup) my mouth is still watering it was that good.... Don't order the large unless you are hungry.  I did and I couldn't stop eating it was sooooo delicious.  Street parking was ok to find.  Make sure you pay the meter.  Restaurant/Seating area is basic.  There is a waitress who will take your order at the table and serve you.  If you're looking for ambiance, this place looks more take-out-Ish........ But Amazing Soup!!!!

38.description: I've been on a quest for Champurrado in Rogers Park, which seems like it shouldn't be that hard, but it has probably because of the odd hours I want it. Anyways I found the winner. Not only can I get a LARGE cup of Champurrado, but also some decent red tamales. I love sweet tamales and I was a bit disappointed with the one I tried. It was not sweet and half of it was uncooked. That is not going to stop me from giving it another chance. The red chicken tamales were good though!. I'd definitely come back to try others. FYI-they are not open on Mondays.

27.description: only tried the tamales here but they were not good.  much better places in the city.  i've had better from some of the little street venders.  i'd skip it.

32.description: Really good, really cheap tamales can be had here. They have good, strong flavors. I get them by the dozen for take-out. Be warned: they will run out of tamales! Do not take them for granted.

48.description: These tamales are the bomb and now they take Visa!!!  Finally a tamale restaurant on the North side. They have bean and cheese tamales, which is unusual and perfect for children. They also have a very good Posole (hominy soup) on weekends. There is no ambience but the tamales are great. You can place your orders for parties here.

44.description: The BEST tamales and such a great price.  It is always crowded with all kinds of people, and I love to stop by after getting off the Metra or dropping off the I-Go car to grab several for dinner.  Delicious!

24.description: Get here early or they will run out! All the Tamales, pork, chicken, green sauce, red sauce, it doesn't matter they are all great. Also had the pozole which is available on weekends. They have 3 kinds, didn't know that pozole was that versatile. I had the red and it comes with tostadas, chicharrones, and the options of oregano, lime, pepper flakes, and onions as a garnish. Can't wait to try the enchiladas next time as everything seems very authentic. The only downfall being that they run out of food fairly quickly on the weekends, and the tostadas were stale. They have a small menu, but i'd be willing to be 95% of the items are really good.

7.description: Good pablamo peppers and cheese tamales.  Mediocre pineapple.  No salsa for order to go.

49.description: I've been searching for awhile now for a restaurant on this Rogers Park stretch of Clark that I could really RAVE about. I think I've finally found it.Tamales Lo Mejor de Guerrero is a simple, order-at-the-counter kind of place. Their excellent tamales are listed on handwritten neon-colored posters below the counter, in both English and Spanish. They've got the standard, red, green, chicken (hot or mild), pork, sweet (with STRAWBERRY or PINEAPPLE), cheese and frijoles, and other varieties. Each is only $1, plus tax.I ordered one mild chicken, and one cheese/frijoles. The woman at the counter went into a back area, and quickly returned with my piping hot tamales, wrapped in traditional corn husks. There are a decent number of tables in the front, as well as other items on the menu, but these "best of guerrero" tamales are what will bring be back.

40.description: Tamales lo mejor de guerrero7024 n clarkThis was our 10th outing on our exploration of clark between devon and howard. As the name suggests, they sell tamales. Just tamales. The prominent signs, upon entering, advertise 6 types of tamales: pork, chicken, cheese and beans, cheese and jalapeno, strawberry and pineapple. The night that we went they had neither cheese and beans, strawberry or pineapple. (very disappointed!)The meats come in mild or spicy.mild means that the meat is mixed with a green salsa.Spicy means that the meat is mixed with a red salsa.We ordered a spicy pork, a mild pork, a spicy chicken, cheese and jalapeno.As they prepared our tamales in the back we noticed another sign, set back a bit, for a few types of tamales we didn't recognize.Tamales de elote (sweet corn)Corundas (the masa is mixed with the veggies/meat, instead of stuffed, and cooked in a corn husk purse)Tamales oaxaquenos (pork in a negro mole, wrapped in banana leaf instead of corn husk)And tamales negros con mole verde (the masa is not stuffed, somehow ash is used in the preparation, and it's also wrapped in banana leaves).The tamales negros were a full $10 plate, so we did not order those. And they had no corundas. So we added a tamale de elote and a tamale oaxaqueno to our order.Upon review, the regularly listed tamales were, well, respectable. Good. Not amazing. But fine. Pretty big. The jalapeno tamale was too spicy for my taste, but I'm a little delicate.The real standouts were on the alternate menu.The tamale de elote was sweet and lovely.The tamale oaxaqueno was smoky and interesting. There was a little bit of a communication barrier, but the server was friendly and wanted to help. I'd recommend you try something off of the special menu. I still want to go back for those dessert tamales.p.s. the tamales freeze beautifully. And at 6 for $6, I'm thinking of buying a sack and keeping them in the freezer for a quickie lunch.

30.description: Yum!! My friend and I were staying in Rogers Park for a weekend, in town just for the Fever Ray show at the Metro.
