15.description: Their selection is outstanding - you could easily spend a day here and not see everything.Sadly, the service leaves something to be desired. They make up prices on the fly, and there seems to be no rhyme or reason or consistency in their policies. I hate feeling like I've been ripped off every time I've shopped here. Much of their costuming & "vintage" pieces are of dubious quality for what they charge.Still, this is the place that may have that one elusive item no other store has. In my book it's one of those necessary evils - I really love just killing time here wandering around every room with no idea what I'll find on the next shelf or around the next corner. Too bad I dread going to the register.

7.description: I love this place! They have unusual items that they don't have at any of the other costume shops in Chicago. One of the reasons for this is that it is also a vintage shop, and the owner sometimes provides costumes for television and movies. She also goes to estate sales and buys up some unique items. There is really quite a bit of stock. The basement is full of stuff too, but you have to duck your head in some places or you will receive a big bump. I could spend hours sifting through items if I had the time.The only thing I would change is that there are hardly any prices on anything, but sometimes that can work to your advantage, if the owner is feeling kindly towards you. You have to be willing to try and negotiate on prices. It is also in kind of a questionable area, but I am rating the shop itself and the staff.

8.description: There is no other place in Chicago that has this kind of assortment of odds and ends.  It is paradise for the conceptual photographer looking for a prop or if you need a halloween costume of ANY KIND. They are really nice.  Granted, some items can be overpriced, and parts of the store a little musky (what antique store isn't?) but this is all cancelled out by the fact that they have saved me more than a few times when I needed something very specific.

3.description: If you are lucky enough to never walk in here, consider yourself blessed.   The majority of items can be also found at goodwill, the brown elephant, and etsy, and without a money hungry woman who bait and switches about what she charges for everything, to include rentals.   There is a special place in hell for people like the owner of this place.   She's real hungry to sue as well.    I can honestly say that renting from the Grinch would be more successful and less stressful.  Steer clear artists especially, unless you don't mind being screwed over hard.

14.description: After exploring more antique stores in Chicago over the last 2 years(and becoming slowly more well-rounded on antiques), it really has dawned on me how junky this store really is, especially the basement. Although you can still find some decent things here, and this is definitely still better clothing-wise if you're looking for vintage/Halloween/etc. clothing, than either Edgewater Antique Mall, or Broadway Antique Market.If I could give it 3.5, I would. The pricing here isn't inconsistent like at Edgewater Antique Mall, or BAM, and the staff at least has remained decent over the years. I'd ideally put this at 4 stars, if the basement was ever cleaned up. And I don't even have a problem with their low basement ceiling, either!

58.description: I had some very tasty carnitas and al pastor tacos here.

56.description: Superb veggie burrito--way beyond standard fare. At first I thought the price seemd high but it was well worth it. Very nice surprise.

29.description: We ordered dinner at 5:30 pm on 2/7/13.....we still have not gotten our food for delivery and it is know 7:00 pm! Are you kidding me!!! We called 10 times to complain  that we never got our food and yet every time we call they either tell us its on its way or that he was here? He never showed up? Also each time we call she seems to not know our address or our phone number even though we let it with her every time we called her? Horrible customer service! To all....don't ever order from this place for delivery! They just lost a very good customer!.......Ended up getting food after 2 hours of waiting.....the food wasn't cold...but was not very warm....the girl who answered the phone got our address wrong per the delivery guy and the address on the bag? This is the second review where she is mentioned...wish I knew her name...stopping in tomorrow to talk to manager...also one of the dinners had an avocado pit in it?.....My feelings still stand with the above statement:(

42.description: Increhible, increhible, increhible.  Hands down, one of the best Authentic Mexican dishes in Chicago.  Quality plus quantity.  Camarones a las diabla.  Whole red snapper plate.   Rice soup.  Quesadillas and many more.  You can't go wrong with the dishes here.  Home cooking at its best, except at Los Portales!

23.description: My family thought the food was good, but their ordered was completely correct. Mine, on the other hand, was completely wrong. I asked for no onions or lettuce and to please make it on a corn tortilla, which is an online option. My meal came with what could have been extra onions and lettuce and a flour tortilla. If you cannot make accomodations, then please do not list them as options. Delivery was fast and food overall tasted good once I scraped off the onions and ate around the flour tortilla.

47.description: Sorry that I absolutely cannot recommend this place. Has the worst chiles relenos I have ever tasted here. Soggy, overcooked, not much cheese but swimming in some gross orange sauce. VERY unappetizing; not to mention expensive for what I got. Will definitely not be ordering from here again!

8.description: After eating here several times I have to agree with everyone this place isn't good. Food is bad. Service is bad. I wish them the best and hope they can do better though.

31.description: WOW that was fast!   I have been searching for a dependable and affordable Mexican delivery place, and this is it!  The order was perfect, hot, large portion, and very friendly driver.  I might even go there to eat in, it was that good.  Order with confidence!

34.description: The perfect hole-in-the-wall taqueria. No gringo condescension on the menu. Good tasting, good portioned, affordable dishes. The lunch special is a steal. Finally I found a quality Mexican option east of N. Clark.

16.description: Overall pretty decent food.  The Pico de Gallo seemed like it was a day old though.  Ordered a Vegi Burrito,and a few tacos.  Overall tasty.

13.description: I'd wanted to try this restaurant out since it got to the neighborhood a year or so ago, but just never got around to it. Finally decided to give it a try -- very fresh food and many choices to choose from. The carnitas chalupa had a generous portion of meat but I was expecting it to be a bit more crispy. It's a minor detail and I probably just had the wrong expectation. I prefer a thinner tortilla so next time I'll get a chimichunga. I prefer crispy tacos but those seem to be hard to find. I love frijoles, so got a side order which was a generous portion in a 16 oz. container and they were delicious. Not too greasy but very flavorful. I did not get an order or rice or an entree with rice, so cannot attest to how that is. I also ordered a salad that consisted of baby greens, fresh sliced tomatoes, cucumbers (I think) and sliced avocado. Asked for the dressing on the side so I can eat the salad at my leisure and not waste it. When ordering online, a choice of salad dressing was not offered that I could see. What arrived looks like a creamy concoction of some sort that looks very good. My only complaint is that there didn't seem to be a way to order one small order of chips and salsa or pico de gallo - nor do you get chips with an order -  so I wound up getting more than I needed (16 oz) - and $6.50 for a container of it with a small-medium bag of chips seems like a lot. But I justified it by the fact that you can use it on so many things. Love it on eggs, in salads, etc. All in all, got enough food for several meals since I do the small and frequent thing vs. regular size (which are actually huge for me) meals.

11.description: Without a doubt my new favorite place to grab a bite. I have recently moved back to the neighborhood and all my old standby favorite taco places have either closed up or changes their menu's. My friends recommended this place so I decided to give it a try. They take PayPal so placing a pickup order was super easy. I was greeting by the hostess when I arrived 10 minutes after placing my order online and the order was already waiting for me. I love the taste of their carne asada and, being a bit of a taco purist, opted for only onion and cilantro. I ordered a set of chips and guacamole which was quickly assembled and I was on my way. As I sit here eating, the red salsa is delicious, the meat is spiced perfectly and cut broadly and the tacos themselves are stuffed generously. Overall I am very, very pleased with this experience and look forward to working my way through their menu. :-)

39.description: i will say, the prices seem to be partially based on the cashier's mood.  maybe there are people he is friends with that get the menu price and a normal amount of tacos...?unfriendly service. they do not bring you water.not environmentally friendly. everything is in styrofoam containers.  the food itself is ok.  not the best, not the worst. but it always ends up being twice as expensive as it should be because of the misleading menu.

37.description: This is a good joint for anyone who wants some cheap eats or is a vegetarian (I'm guilty on both charges).  Their veggie menu has everything from burritos to fajitas to even a falafel sandwich.  I tried the fajita with seitan (tofu) and was pretty pleased. Not a whole lot on there, but you do get green peppers, rice, beans, steamed bok choy - weird, I know, and plenty of seitan.  The corn tortillas were deliciosas tambien!  Our service was decent, but the main plus of this place is they hook you up with chips, salsa picante and salsa verde before the meal.  Oh, and did I mention their lunch specials are mad cheap?

0.description: Still great for its class of restaurant. We eat here 2 or 3 times a month. It can sometimes be hard to choose between steak tacos, al pastor tacos, the steak burrito or the chile rellenos. Plenty other great things on the menu.Delicious, quick, and cheap. What more could you want?

38.description: Tried the pastor for the first time last night and it's not the best pastor I've ever had, but definitely good.  Overall, this place is a good place to try if you're in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't go out of my way. I guess I'm a little grumpy about having to spend $4.50 for a large horchata. Wha?!

51.description: Literally the worst Mexican food I've ever had.Growing up in southern California causes you to develop a decent palate for cheap Mexican food. This place is neither cheap, not good. Actually it's not actually food. Still searching for food Mexican food in Chicagoland. Why does it suck here?

27.description: I live about a block away from the Chipotle on Sheridan in this area but I never mind walking the extra distance to Los Portales.  For what you pay at Chipotle, this little restaurant gives you way more for your money. (I don't know about anyone else but Chipotle has really been stingy with the meat lately).  They have a fairly large menu but I always just stick to the tacos and burritos.  I have to say that the food is pretty tasty!  I ordered delivery once and everything went smoothly.  However, I usually just walk over there to save some time and money.Not the fanciest mexican restaurant you'll ever visit but still a great neighborhood spot!

32.description: Having just moved from El Paso, I assure you that this is as good, if not better than you'll get at the border. Pretty much everything we've gotten here has been delicious, and a great value. The tortas and burritos are huge, and they seem to know how to deliver on the comfort element of their Mexican dishes. Definitely the best dining value in the immediate Morse Red Line stop area.

54.description: Pretty lame, and also overpriced.I called and ordered Bety's Combinacion - a chile relleno and an enchilada with a side of rice & beans and tortillas.  I requested a cheese enchilada instead of beef or chicken.  The food was ready in 10 minutes, which was great.  I grabbed a Mexican Coke out of the cooler, which brought the total to $13.30, which seems pretty pricey.When I got home, I found one soggy enchilada and a chile relleno SWIMMING in orange sauce.  The last time I checked, ranchero sauce was red.  I fished the enchilada and chile relleno out, and they weren't bad but they definitely weren't good and they weren't worth the price.  The refried beans and rice were completely flavorless.  And they didn't even throw in any chips and salsa.Maybe the entrees are better with meat, but as a vegetarian, I won't be coming here again.

48.description: We stopped by about 9:40 and placed an order. We were told it would take 20 minutes. When we asked for updates, we were told "not yet" with no explanation. It was finally ready after 35 minutes. The chips were stale and the guacamole had the pit left in it. The tacos were incredibly greasy. Just an awful meal.

44.description: They're 2 or 3 stars, hard to call. The food is good & the salsas are fabulous. However the service is spotty & I've been over-charged EVERY time I've eaten here. We always order the same thing, and week before last it cost almost $50, this weekend when we ate there it cost $26... the only difference was the previous time we ordered an extra side of rice and beans. It's better to dine-in, that way it's clearer what you have & haven't ordered. Also, I had a very negative experience while waiting for my husband to arrive. I waited about 20-30 minutes, during which time the waiter came by 3 times to ask if I was still going to keep waiting. At some point, the delivery drivers (who were very busy not delivering anything to anyone) came and actually took the chairs from my table so they could have a better view of the TV and somehow couldn't understand my English. I've had it with this place. The entire staff made me feel totally unwelcome and like they were waiting for me to leave, and it really seemed as though they were talking about me in Spanish (they'd look at me, say something and laugh, and then the waiter would ask if I was still waiting, then he'd go back in the kitchen and I could hear laughing). Maybe it's in my head, but I don't want to go in there anymore. And since they don't serve margaritas I have even less reason to go.

24.description: I order from this place maybe once or twice every few weeks and have never been let down. You know the food is going to be good when you walk into the establishment and there is this little old Mexican lady in the kitchen doing all the cooking. I love to cook myself and the fish and el pastor taco's with onion's and cilantro are to die for here...You must try them!!!

7.description: All I can say is yum...yum!! My favorite place I Rogers Park to get Mexican food. I've had the fajitas, burrito and quesadillas all very tasty but my favorite dish is the Molcajeteada de Pollo o de Mariscos highly recommend this dish!!

49.description: These people delivered our food and forgot an enchilada dinner. We called them back to tell them about the food and they kept hanging up on us. When we finally got through, they knew they forgot it and told us that the delivery guy was back on his way.. thirty minutes later there no delivery made. we called again and they hung up on us AGAIN. Now they wont answer their phone. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE people! We will be going there  tomorrow to make sure we get our money back! SUCH DISHONEST PEOPLE!

40.description: As a native Texan, and a relatively new Chicagoan, I've had some Mexican food here that's been anywhere from passable to great.  Los Portales, unfortunately, rated far below the least impressive I've had.  I was in the mood for a Tex-Mex style combination plate, so I went with the Combination 2, which includes an enchilada, taco and quesadilla.  The taco, on corn tortilla, was the only thing that resembled its namesake.  The grilled chicken was a bit tough but otherwise flavorful.  The lettuce on top wasn't exactly fresh, but it was acceptable. The enchilada and quesadilla were unspeakably bad.  The enchilada was pretty much a thin burrito slathered in mysterious orange sauce after the fact.  The steak (I asked for a cheese enchilada) was tough and stringy.  The "quesadilla" was just the enchilada without the sauce.How this place has ever received a good review is beyond me.  Either the quality varies wildly or the reviewers in question have suspect taste.  This appears to have been made by a novice cook with little experience with Mexican food of any variety.  I hate to rag on a restaurant in my neighborhood, but having just moved to Rogers Park, I was really looking forward to having a Mexican restaurant around the corner.  This was extremely disappointing and gave me almost immediate intestinal distress to boot.  I can only hope they improve.

53.description: I am a regular here, and while I can say that there are probably better taquerias around, this one has some sort of charm that's kept me coming back for the two years that I've lived here. There are cheaper items (whoever said they are expensive?) such as tacos, sopes, huaraches, etc., that will fill me up just fine, especially with the chips they bring out (love it!) for around $5. They also have some breakfast items (they open at 10AM, I think), and they also have a dinner menu with more expensive entres. Unfortunately, my favorite item, enchiladas, is on this part of the menu, for about $9 I think. What can I say, I'm a poor student.Also, this place is BYOB, and there is a (cash only :/ ) liquor store immediately next door that I sometimes drop into while waiting for my food at LP, so I can enjoy my huarache with a Carona (and just ask for some lime slices when you get back!)

30.description: Decidedly mediocre Mexican food - and they screwed up our (online) order in three or four different ways. I've been here before and I think this is my last attempt.

46.description: Their once glorious vegetable empanadas now all have chicken in them. Did they tell me this when I ordered them and stated explicitly that I wanted them served vegetarian? No, they just served me meat. Don't you monsters know that I wrote the most hilarious 5 star review for you on this stupid website? And now you force feed me meat? A THOUSAND MILLION SHAMES. It also so happened that the texture was wet and crumbly. It's like they ran out of vegetables and substituted meat and sawdust as "vegetables." Non-vegetarians will not be pleased.

1.description: Chicken burrito: much better at chipotle (neither of them are really authentic Mexican anyways). The Vegetables are not fresh and the chicken is not well seasoned. Chipotle is cheaper.Tamal+tostada +taco meal: the meal is bland overall with not enough vegetables and the same filling on different tortillas. Only the Tamal had something close to a flavor.Overall this place was not worth it. The food is expensive and bland. And the service ? There barely is any at all, with a grumpy waiter who doesn't even greet customers and frowns when you ask for napkins.

55.description: No the best mexican I've had but the service was very attentive. They had chips and salsa out before my butt heated the seat up, and they were very pleased to take our order. The portions were a little small (not by 1950's standards) but for the typical overfed Amercian (cough, cough - me) it was not quite enough. Also I need a little zip in my salsa... A little pizzaz, some wham-pow, or at the very least a small kick. I got none of these and my burrito suffered for it. But the preparation was still good and it was better than Taco bell. That being said I would not go out of my way to go here again.

9.description: Portions are generous, and food is usually very good.  BUT I just ordered carry out and there was beef/pork/steak (?)  in my veggie taco and fish tacos.  C'mon, keep meat out of my veg/pescatarian food.  Hard core vegetarians beware!

26.description: All of the one-star and two-star reviews complaining about things like "not environmentally friendly/doesn't speak English well/didn't bring me water" etc are downright stupid.  I wonder if you guys even read what you write.This place is great.  My experiences are with dine-in only, maybe their delivery service is shoddy, but since my boyfriends apartment is a block away, there is really no point in delivery.My favorite part of this place is how ridiculously cheap it is.  None of those bullshit $4 tacos that places like Big Star seem to get away with.  The only reason my boyfriend and I ever manage to spend more than $10 a meal between the two of us is when one or both of us decides to go for a burrito (which by the way, are huge and delicious).  These aren't gourmet yuppy burritos and tacos.  These are simply and delicious.The service inside has always been fantastic, and quick.  I don't think I've ever waited more than about 5-10 minutes from sitting down to chowing down on my food + chips and salsa + horchata.  This is my favorite horchata in the city, and some of my favorite tacos.  Ya'll can keep Big Star, I love Los Portales.

25.description: Decent food and good eat-in lunch special options.I had chicken mole - it was tasty.  The refried bean were very good, but the serving was super skimpy.  The rice was nothing special.  There was a mini-salad that was a nice touch, but the dressing was icky bottled ranch.  I think they would do better to just squeeze a bit of fresh lime juice and add a teensy bit of cilantro to yum it up.The orchata was okay.Both the green and red table salsas were really tasty -- the best part as far as I am concerned.The service was great and the server was very sweet and accomodating.Weird part:  the warm corn tortilla's that came w/my meal were served on a tray but covered it what appeared to be a dollar store dish cloth.  I was a bit set aside by this.  I dunno -- just seemed unsanitary -- although it was certainly a clean cloth.I liked T.L.P. and will give it another try.(PS - husb. had a burrito -- he said it was "eh")

12.description: This was the worst Mexican food I have ever had. The meat was dry  and tasteless, the tortillas were wet and falling apart and my "Spanish rice" was bland there were no vegetables I can't believe they call that Mexican food. They should be ashamed of themselves. If you like wasting your money whuchbi just did sure go there. The only good thing about this was the horchata. I mean are you kidding m I'm legit upset. Eat 24 should take them off their service because this is a horrible place. They owe me $9. Horrible! Americanized Mexican food that's what it is. Just americanized.

59.description: Cheap and good food with a surprising mix of items on the menu. The dining room is really small (like 5 tables) and it was kind of confusing whether or not I should sit down or order at the counter. Turns out I should sit. There was one younger lady working the front of the house and she brought me a nice size basket of chips. I ordered a vegetable burrito and was surprised when it came with a nice little side salad. It took a little longer to make the food than I expected it to but it wasn't very long. They also have breakfast menu options as well as a vegetarian burger.

21.description: I came into the restaurant to order tacos and the waitress that took  my order was very rude. I asked questions regarding how it would be for extra items on the menu. Her response was "do you want the Food". I tried to complete the order and the person cooking the food came to the counter and said something in Spanish to the waitress and the waitress snatched the money from my hand. I asked for my money back and I have not returned since. The food is good but the restaurant needs new staff. It's a shame.

17.description: All of the one-star and two-star reviews complaining about things like "not environmentally friendly/doesn't speak English well/didn't bring me water" etc are downright stupid.  I wonder if you guys even read what you write.This place is great.  My experiences are with dine-in only, maybe their delivery service is shoddy, but since my boyfriends apartment is a block away, there is really no point in delivery.My favorite part of this place is how ridiculously cheap it is.  None of those bullshit $4 tacos that places like Big Star seem to get away with.  The only reason my boyfriend and I ever manage to spend more than $10 a meal between the two of us is when one or both of us decides to go for a burrito (which by the way, are huge and delicious).  These aren't gourmet yuppy burritos and tacos.  These are simply and delicious.The service inside has always been fantastic, and quick.  I don't think I've ever waited more than about 5-10 minutes from sitting down to chowing down on my food + chips and salsa + horchata.  This is my favorite horchata in the city, and some of my favorite tacos.  Ya'll can keep Big Star, I love Los Portales.

10.description: Had two burritos there over the weekend while working an event. The first, the chicken burrito, tasted okay. The chicken was rather dry, but had decent flavor. The next day, I tried a steak burrito (my favorite), and it was horrible. The beef was all gristle and literally inedible. I'm sure it was the cheapest option, but I cannot imagine why you would serve something that bad to your customers. Gross.

5.description: Folks, it's a tacqueria. It's not a fine dining restaurant. I've eaten here 4 times. Each time delicious. If you like tortas (the Mexican sandwich kind of torta), this is a great place to have one. No, it's not piled with meat like Arbys. I should hope not. But the bread is just perfect. You get the right vegetables and sauces. Things that should be crisp, are crisp.Both table salsas are tasty (I personally prefer the green one). If you get sala to go, it comes in quite a generous container.And I can't praise the molcajeteada too much. I've just had it with steak. You get the steak and a sauce something like are really good enchilada sauce served in a molcajete, with grilled green onions, a paddle of nopale (cactus), and a couple of pieces of fresh cheese. Delicious!And I like that they always (or almost always) have horchata, the rice and cinnamon based drink that goes so well with spicy food.

3.description: I've gone to this place 3 times now, and I plan on going back. I love their vegetarian options: veggie tacos, veggie enchiladas, etc. I definitely recommend their green jalepeño and cilantro sauce if you're not afraid of a little heat. The lady who always takes my orders is friendly, and the food always comes out quickly. I haven't been to many of the other taquerias around Clark, so I can't really compare, but I've always been happy with the food I get from Los Portales.

35.description: I've eaten here twice so far, and both times I've been pretty satisfied. The dishes are pretty balanced in terms of ingredients. They're nicely prepared, and they're not greasy messes. The chorizo is good too.My only complaint is some dishes are a bit pricey, but that's what happens when you're too lazy to walk a ways up to Clark St, aka the outdoor taqueria mall.

19.description: This place is pretty good. The burritos and tortas and maybe the quesadillas are probably their best items. There are some bad things like their milkshakes (but who goes to a mexican place and orders a milkshake?....well i did once).The green and red salsas they have with their chips (which they also give out for take out) are amazing. They are two of my favorite salsas ever. This obviously isn't a 5 star restaurant, but it's still really yummy.Also, I'm a repeat customer (I order on Grubhub for carryout and they recognized me after like 20 times lol

28.description: I live really close to it, so go pretty often.  However, I always get takeout; I'm not sure about the dine-in experience.  Their tortas are really, really good.  Sometimes the meat can be a little fatty, but that's kind of what you expect from a really low-cost Mexican joint.  If you live nearby and you don't want to walk to Clark Street because it's cold, then it's definitely worth a try.

45.description: Great neighborhood spot for quick and cheap Mexican food. The steak, chicken and pastor are all great so you can't miss! The people that gripe about this place clearly have uber high expectations from a place with 4 tables... Topolobampo this is not...

33.description: also, quite possibly the best chicken enchilada's with salsa verde EVER.

43.description: First of all, let me just say what a culinary WASTELAND this area of Roger's Park is. Good grief. Anyway, I'm performing in a show around the corner at the No Exit Cafe and I've found myself becoming a regular at Los Portales. I keep coming back because it's close, quick, and cheap. By no means do I come back because the food is great. It's not. The hostess is really friendly and the service is quick (at least for take-out orders). I've only tried their various tacos so far and they're just ok, mostly bland. However their green salsa is really good so I just dump a whole lot of it on top. Not sure what some negative reviewers were expecting from this place. I can't imagine what made anyone have high expectations. It passed my test of being convenient, fast, cheap, and not giving me food poisoning.

2.description: I had to go find my old yelp account to write a review on this one. Just ordered take-out here. First the man working the check-out didn't even acknowledge me until I asked if I could order. I asked for the $6.99 Quesadilla meal and the $3.50 orange juice. He told me the orange juice was going to be $5, so I assumed it would be a bigger drink. Nope, same size, guess he's just making the prices as he goes. I get home and open the box the quesadilla came in and it is just one small quesadilla and a side of salsa. I've never had any problem ordering from there in the past and actually enjoy the food, but the overpriced small portions and bad attitude from the staff ensure I will never be going back again.1 star.

18.description: I order from this place maybe once or twice every few weeks and have never been let down. You know the food is going to be good when you walk into the establishment and there is this little old Mexican lady in the kitchen doing all the cooking. I love to cook myself and the fish and el pastor taco's with onion's and cilantro are to die for here...You must try them!!!

41.description: Can only review the food, as I ordered delivery, but I was quite pleased. Chorizo quesadilla was delicious and far less of a disgusting grease trap than I'd ever expect of such a thing. I got the tacos al pastor and an order of guacamole - both good! The guacamole is a bit spicy, but still very good. I especially liked that they put an avacado pit in the order to help keep it from oxidizing.I'll definitely order from here again!

52.description: Fast delivery, chicken enchiladas to die for (be prepared for spicy red sauce and lots of cheese!). Refried beans are a little bland, but everything else I've had here is great. And I just can't quit ordering those enchiladas.

50.description: Not the best or cheapest.  Decent.

4.description: I an eating here now, thinking to myself that I must have left my brain on the nightstand to even consider going to this place. I worked many years in the hospitality industry and I am always very sympathetic if I endure a bad meal. I was fuming when I left this place. I could not understand how they deemed it acceptable to serve me food that tasted as if it was marinated in cardboard. What a complete waste of money.I ordered two tacos and a steak torta. the tacos had ZERO taste. The two sauces they plopped on my table had ZERO taste. When I bit into my torta that is when I began to get angry. A huge sandwich with three small pieces of steak. THREE SMALL PIECES OF STEAK. Look at the picture I posted. How could an establishment have the audacity to serve this to a paying customer. Next time I have money to throw away and am craving food that taste like a sock, I will go here. Scratch that because if I make the stupendous decision to come back here, my wife will probably knock me unconscious by executing a roundhouse kick to my fat face.

6.description: Our first two times there were decent. Since then, ever experience has been progressively worse. It seems that the kitchen just puts in a dish whatever is laying around, not what is on the menu, which means you can end up with some fairly sketchy food. The quality and content of the food is simply too variable for this place to earn a high rating. And when it isn't good, it REALLY isn't good. The enchiladas were actually nauseating last time we went. The sauce resembled Campbell's cream of tomato rather than a real enchilada sauce. The contents were bland. Some of the appropriate sides were missing. Eh. $10 card minimum

22.description: Been here once. Food was good but I thought $10+ was a little high for a burrito with a tiny side of guacamole and a can of pop. Carnitas were tasty, and it is hard to find carnitas, let alone good carnitas. Guac was tasty. So good food if a little more pricey than other hole in the wall Mexican places.

15.description: I would say this is a pretty good place. We live in the neighborhood and have stopped in a few times, and have not been disappointed! It's nothing fancy, but when you just want some delicious Mexican food, fancy doesn't cut it anyway. The service is good, and they have tons of veggie options for my veggie husband. It's BYOB, which I always like. Have tried the delivery, but thinking of doing so soon!

57.description: Very average. The chips weren't fresh. I agree with other reviewers that the food was inexpensive. I'll come back one time to check out the seitan options, but for non-vegetarian I'll be going elsewhere.

20.description: I'd wanted to try this restaurant out since it got to the neighborhood a year or so ago, but just never got around to it. Finally decided to give it a try -- very fresh food and many choices to choose from. The carnitas chalupa had a generous portion of meat but I was expecting it to be a bit more crispy. It's a minor detail and I probably just had the wrong expectation. I prefer a thinner tortilla so next time I'll get a chimichunga. I prefer crispy tacos but those seem to be hard to find. I love frijoles, so got a side order which was a generous portion in a 16 oz. container and they were delicious. Not too greasy but very flavorful. I did not get an order or rice or an entree with rice, so cannot attest to how that is. I also ordered a salad that consisted of baby greens, fresh sliced tomatoes, cucumbers (I think) and sliced avocado. Asked for the dressing on the side so I can eat the salad at my leisure and not waste it. When ordering online, a choice of salad dressing was not offered that I could see. What arrived looks like a creamy concoction of some sort that looks very good. My only complaint is that there didn't seem to be a way to order one small order of chips and salsa or pico de gallo - nor do you get chips with an order -  so I wound up getting more than I needed (16 oz) - and $6.50 for a container of it with a small-medium bag of chips seems like a lot. But I justified it by the fact that you can use it on so many things. Love it on eggs, in salads, etc. All in all, got enough food for several meals since I do the small and frequent thing vs. regular size (which are actually huge for me) meals.

36.description: While I haven't been to the actual restaurant and can't really comment on the appearance or seating of this place at all, I've ordered delivery through grubhub from here a few times and they're great when you're craving cheap Mexican food that's of decent quality.Usually I order 3-4 of their chicken tacos with a bottle of Mexican Coke or a cup of horchata (both of which are great drink options from this place) and it's quite filling- the chicken tastes like it's of pretty good quality and whether you choose to get tomatos/lettuce or onions/cilantro as your topping, they don't add an excessive amount like other Mexican places. Both the red and green salsas they include are delicious and add a lot of flavor to the tacos. I've also tried their carne asada steak tacos when a friend ordered them, though I'm certainly not as much of a fan- the meat was tough and really didn't seem to have the flavor or quality that the chicken tacos did.I've also ordered their chips and guacamole- the chips are nothing special, but the guac is pretty good and they give you a LOT of it (as they should, considering the $7.00 price tag.)Stay away from the chocolate milkshake (and, by extension, likely all of the milkshakes)- a friend ordered one and stated that it tasted like syrupy chocolate milk.Again, great if you're craving cheap, decent-quality Mexican food.

14.description: THE best tacos I have ever had. Great service. Great prices. Literally everything on the menu is amazing. My favorite taco place!

12.description: It's cheap, but it's also bad, especially when compared to other places around the area. The steak was bland, greasy, and a there was a little gristle to it. The burrito I had was just a soggy mess.

7.description: Whatever! The food comes fast and is good. I love this place. I do takeout most of the time. Do you guys tip when ordering take out?

19.description: I love this place.  Ive been eating here for 10 years.  When I was pregnant I would take the train and bus in rain, snow, etc...just for 2 steak tacos.  Yes, the steak tacos are greasy. But I love the cheese.  And I would like to add that you can just come in and sit down.  I've never ordered at the counter unless I was taking it to go.  The food comes sooooo hot....never cold.  Love the 2 hot sauces.  The green is my fav. The red is the HOT one and the green is still hot but more milder.  My 6 year old daughter is in love with this place as well.  When she attended school over there she would beg to go everyday.  Everyone I bring here becomes just as addicted as me.  They do have their on and off days but it doesn't stop me from coming.

1.description: Since living in Rogers Park I have passed by and seen morethan a few Taco Joints, especially on Clark Street.And yesterday, I found Taqueria Hernandez, and what a great find this was.Located on the corner of Clark and Lunt Taqueria Hernandez is quite thepopular place, yesterday the restaurant dining area was filled with customersand everyone there seemed to be enjoying what Taqueria Hernandez wasserving up.And, I've gotta say, their tacos may have been the best I've ever had,And, these people don't fool around when filling your taco with the meatof your choice, they are more than generous!And, for $2.25 per taco, you are getting something that will make you wantto come back for more, yes, they are that good!So, if and when I get a taco craving I will make sure that I will end upat Taqueria Hernandez, because out of all the Taco Joints on ClarkStreet in Rogers Park I believe I have found the best of the best.What a great impression you made on me Taqueria Hernandez,so here's your 5 star rating, well deserved!

2.description: Tanquieria Hernadez is easy to miss. It's just a small unassuming corner spot. Heck I forgot I visited until my friend mentioned it recently. I was immediately at home in the folksy decorated diner atmosphere and seeing the staff in a slow period cleaning away while jamming to some tunes. The service proved to be as welcoming as my expectation. I ordered a steak taco and chicken. They were on white corn tortillas, packed full of meat, and served with tomato and lettuce (which was fine by me I'm not crazy about cilantro or onion lately) I also had the choice of red or green salsa, which were hot and hotter. The meat was filling and inexpensive. If you are in the area don't miss out on this spot.

9.description: I can't believe Taqueria Hernandez is on here!  I grew up around the corner from this place and they serve, in my opinion, the best tacos in the city.  I know!  Their steak tacos are so good.  They serve them with lettuce and tomato, which might offend some onion-and-cilantro purists out there.  It's okay, I get it.  But their steak is nice and crispy, and the tortillas are so corn-y.  Add some lime and salsa verde and I am in taco heaven.  Their tortas and tostadas are pretty bomb, too.The service is friendly and super duper quick, and you get used to seeing the same guys working the flat-top.  I never got adventurous enough to try and strike up a conversation (my Spanish is middling at best), but I always imagined becoming a friendly regular here.For the record, this place is pretty old-school.  I'm not sure they take credit cards, and they're not trying to reinvent the wheel with their food.  But every time I'm up in Rogers Park I make a point to stop in for some tacos.

6.description: Taqueria hernandez its fuckin gangsta , its so old skool and i've been going there since i was 8 years old and now im a grown man with two kids and still going to the same place, i love their food and the employees are very friendly too, j just love this place :)

18.description: After hitting the rest of the options on clark, between devon and howard, I would never go to Hernandez again. So many other, better options. No.

10.description: The food was decent but the portions could have been bigger.  The torta is small and could use more meat. Also there were a bunch of gang members looking hard at me and my girl friend whistling at her when we stepped out. I'll go again when I turn gangster which is never because we didn't feel safe when we left.

13.description: Well the prices are cheap.  The staff is friendly.  This place is close to my home, so I really do want to like it.  Honestly though, unless I really need a fix and it's super-cold out, I'll walk the extra block.  Unlike a few other places in the neighborhood, they have no vegetarian options.  Additionally expect a bit more than your fair share of grease, but a few slices of fresh avocado can make up for it!

16.description: good, cheap, everyone else in the place was speaking Spanish. however, I didn't get the consumate Torta experience I was seeking, although I have no complaints.

17.description: This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Rogers Park and there is definitely no shortage in the area.. The staff here is super friendly and the prices are extremely cheap and refreshing.  This place has a great atmosphere and is frequently filled with Loyola students

15.description: I'm not sure why there's not more love for this place, but it's really good and pretty cheap. I'd also like to add that they do have a vegetarian burrito, not sure if that's new or not but I just picked one up for the missus. It's pretty authentic and I've been, along with most of my family, coming here for years. I would recommend taking your meal to go though, there's really not much in the way of decor.

0.description: I am biased on this place only because I've been coming here for over 30 years and I might not know any better. Nothing has changed except the price. You don't get chips and salsa when you dine in. Tacos and Tortas are good. Sauces and food is made for Mexicans very authentic not trying to cater to anyone else's taste. It's a fast food place.

5.description: i love taqueria hernandez! their food is cheap and tasty. their workers work very hard and their waitresses are super sweet. my dad first started taking me here and i've loved it ever since. if you're a familiar face, they'll definitely treat you like it.

11.description: Tasty if not messy burriots; bring your spanish.  They have a diverse soda cabinet ice cooler. Juicy con lechuga.  Good spot on a street where there are more choices.  I also had a small candy by the register which was tan and sugary.  This was the highlight of the inexpensive, quick meal.  I would go back.

8.description: Here is one of the rare instances when I REALLY  need a half-star rating system.  2.5 in this case.  In my old Lunt-and-Sheridan-dwelling days, I would stumble in here some late nights every once in a while on my way home from some point south on Clark (and once from the Mark II...ugh).  I vividly remember one night in the early spring of 2002 when I got my burrito home, queued up an X-Files season 2 DVD, and then watched in horror as I lost control of my motor functions and poured the entire cup of hot green salsa into my burrito.  Since I was drunk, I tried to scrape it out and insisted on eating the whole thing despite my mouth being on fire.  (FYI--the red sauce is hot, the green sauce is HOT.)It was adequate drunk food, but I'd never had it sober until tonight.  For $4.36 including tax I don't expect much, and wasn't disappointed.  The chicken burrito tasted fine, if a little bland.  It was actually satisfying without feeling too greasy or heavy.  However, I found several gristley pieces in the meat, and that is a dealbreaker for me.  Any time that I have to chew gingerly, for fear of crunching down on something that is not quite consumable but not quite solid either, is a bad meal.  I would consider coming back if the conditions were just right, but I won't get chicken again.

3.description: Old school, no-thrills taqueria in Rogers Park.  I agree with the reviews that advise you to go with the steak tacos.  My wife order them and they were great.  I got the burrito al pastor, and it was only so-so.  Note, no flour tortillas for the tacos, although they do you the white corn (blanco) variety.  Service is fast.  The dinning room is quite bare, but very clean.  Usually a few family in there having a meal

14.description: This place is fantastic, authentic, and a great value.    Know that the "dining room" is pretty spartan as far as decor and ambience.  I come here for the made-to-order authentic Mexican food and don't mind waiting the several minutes it takes them to make it fresh.   You can also get your Mexi-fix to go. It's a welcome change from the faux adobe hacienda-type places and that frozen-then-soggy microwaved junk that sits under a mound of chihuahua cheese and is delevered to you 90 seconds after ordering.         The chorizo burritos, tamales, tacos....all good.  They will add heat if you like, and also have red and green salsa.

4.description: Pedestrian at best. Stopped in for tacos after work, since it's right there near the Metro. Everything was just average. The steak was a bit chewy. Nothing fantastic, but nothing offensive, either.

58.description: go to any of the other taquerias on clark. this place is awful. the food was bad. the service was bad. they even have terrible chips and salsa.

56.description: husband and i are exploring clark's taqueria's from devon north. this was our first stop.Quesadilla with chorizo. a few gristle bits in there. Too much chorizo, not enough cheese.Picadillo (ground beef) taco. Kinda like sloppy joes, not in a good way.Cochinita pibil taco. Perfect. With cilantro and onions. Bbq pork in a very earthy, spicy sauce.Chochinita pibil dinner. Good. but the taco's better. Dinner doesn't come with onions and cilantro, which is what made the taco so good. Jeremy had to salt the beans. What?Pineapple pop. Fine. But wanted tepache (pineapple beer). Out. also asked for Mexican coke. Out. not very reliable menu, eh?Small dining room with crazy guy wanting to make conversation.Don't think lady at counter knew much English.salsa forgettable. Would only come back if dying for a pibil taco.

29.description: Nasty! I don't care if it's open late, I don't care how tired of Deluxe Diner, and I don't care how cheap the food is; this place is gross. What little chorizo was on my plate was burnt and tasteless. My friend order the chicken burrito and there was more lettuce inside of the burrito than anything.  I won't be back.

42.description: Pretty good. As soon as we sit they served chicken noodle soup and that was delicious. We ordered super taco, chicken enchilada and 2 regular tacos. It was good portion food for the money we paid. Some other place  we order food from we pay 30 bucks here we paid 18. Only thing is instead of salsa they have red and green sauce. The red one was bad kinda taste like old. Everything else taste just right. Definitely will be back. We passed the place 3 am on Friday it was still open. So if u need late night Mexican this is the place.

23.description: It's literally the closest taqueria to my apartment in a land of a million taquerias. But I dont go here out of convenience, I go here because it's pretty good! It's the standard taco stand fare plus  limited American food (why) selections. I've never had anytihing other than tacos and orange juice but that's all I really get at these corner taco joints. They have one of those fancy machines that cranks out the fresh orange juice. It's fun to watch! On my last visit they let me bring my bike inside and didnt make a fuss about it. Nice!

47.description: Okay, so change in opinion. Found a bone in my Quesadilla, and a sickening amount of cartilage. Good, but dangerous to eat.

8.description: This place has some of the best tacos I've had in Chicago. The lengua and fish tacos are especially good and don't cater to banal American tastes.

31.description: 24 hour availability to Mexican food? Yes, please! I looooove this place and have been coming here for years. I've never had a negative experience and they have great value. I highly recommend the super tacos and enchiladas suizas with salsa verde, and horchata of course! There dessert and soda options are also deliciously awesome. Me encanta :-)

34.description: 3 tacos + coke + chips and salsa = $7.75

16.description: It's literally the closest taqueria to my apartment in a land of a million taquerias. But I dont go here out of convenience, I go here because it's pretty good! It's the standard taco stand fare plus  limited American food (why) selections. I've never had anytihing other than tacos and orange juice but that's all I really get at these corner taco joints. They have one of those fancy machines that cranks out the fresh orange juice. It's fun to watch! On my last visit they let me bring my bike inside and didnt make a fuss about it. Nice!

13.description: went here the other nite & had 2 steak tacos with onions and cilantro. my friend got the super tacos but unsure as to what kind. however she enjoyed her food & i did as well. he steaks were flavorful and they werent stingy with the meat in each taco. the place itself is pretty small but we ordered it to go anyway. it seemed like we waited for a while before we received our food but i think somebody else took our food order instead of theirs so they had to remake our food. no big deal to me since i wasnt in a hurry. if im in this area i would definitely stop by here for some good cheap eats!

11.description: One of the best pork tacos in the city.

39.description: Friendly service and always the best  tacos & crispy wings in Chicago! The spicy sauses are fabulous, it s really yum when you add to a meal. It s a small place but great time to stop by:)

37.description: It's the chicken Chimichunga that gets me every time. I love it. I love the salads that comes with it and the service with a smile. This is a staple in my diet. ^_^

0.description: Holy MOLE!!!Wow.  Just finished work and lo and behold, Taqueria El Chorrito has come through and made my day/night/morning/whatever this time is!  And boy did I need it.After hearing rave reviews tonight, I finally decided to give this place a whirl.  Why had I not before...  Friendly and fast service, affordable, and unique!  I sampled...am still eating most of, no judgement...the chicken mole quesadilla, a steak super taco, and a lengua burrito.  SO FLAVORFUL!  The lengua is cooked perfectly, totally tender and juicy - fresh vegetables, creamy goodness, and, although I am not a mole expert, a very pleasant peppery (but not overly spicy) quesadilla.  I *was* hoping I'd get some more of the ripe avocado and lettuce that I saw piled on other folks' plates (there was some in my super taco but I think they may have left it out on the burrito though I asked for it?), and the burrito's tortilla, 15 minutes in, is falling apart in quite a melty way...but whatever, it tastes great and I am happy THANK YOU T.E.C whoooo! And nope, not drunk.  =D

38.description: I've only had their guac and chips, but the guac is exceptionally yummy. Not too much cilantro or lime, like most spots tend to do. Chunky and garlicky perfection, and the chip to guac ratio was spot on.

51.description: i had a chicken quesada from this place and it was dry and plain tasting.and the prices are a little steep for a hole in the wall placeno thanks

27.description: Best tacos in Chicago after 3 years of serious soul searching for a taco place to love. El Morelia in STL will always be first. The service here at El Chorrito is fine, depending who takes your order. I don't care if I eat in the alley and they yell at me while throwing tacos at me as long as they are throwing their tasty tacos at me. I bring my friends here when they are in town to show them how good they stack up to the tacos back home. They won't ever be better, but good enough is good enough for me!

32.description: Get the lengua tacos (onion & cilantro, obviously).  So tender and delicious.  They really pile the meat on for their tacos, too.  I ate three, but would have been fine w/two.

54.description: you see, I'm not very picky, which is why I give this place 5 stars. sure, the beef could have been a little more tender, but who cares? it was delicious. I was also pretty drunk by the time I got to this place, so my taste buds were a little lazy. I would go back.

48.description: This place, seriously CANNOT be beat when you're in a hurry, and need a tasty, sizable burrito that tastes great for a very good price.  I have eaten here dozens of times on the way home from a night out or headed home from work.  Just get in, get the food, get home, and savor it.  Fresh and delicious.

44.description: Phenomenal food every time I go... If you get there early (usually around lunch time) your meal, even if its just a super taco comes with a soup of the day. Last time I had their soup I believe it was Menudo. I'm not a fan of tripe but the hominy was delish!

24.description: I've been to this place numerous times and come to one conclusion: the tacos (specifically the pork) are amazing and in my eyes, the only thing on the menu. Served traditionally with cilantro and onions with lime on the side, this is my favorite local spot for late night cravings or a delicious meal

7.description: 5 stars.For a taqueria, these folks point for the fence and slam it home. Every time. Great food, decent service.Ambience is meh, but its A TACO STAND, not the four seasons, what did you expect?Recommend: guac. Chicken enchiladas with salsa verde. Horchata, of course. Steak tacos with grilled onions and cilantro.

49.description: I think that the only reason this place is still in business is because of it's location right next to three bars! I guess if you're drunk, just about anything tastes good & you don't really care how you are treated by staff. The woman that took our order was quite aloof (which is fine...I think I would be too if I had her job). The wait was average (this was for take-out). When we got home, I quickly opened my food because I was starving. I ordered the enchilada meal (beef). The first bite I took was disgusting because I heard a "crunch", which felt like dirt or something was in my food! After spitting that first bite out (yes, I was THAT hungry!), I pressed my luck again hoping for no more crunches. Luckily, that was the only one. Now that I could actually focus on the food, I realized it was quite mediocre at best. Everything was watery & just kind of bland. Even the re fried beans, which I normally love, were not very good. My girlfriend had a steak burrito. I tasted it and it was a half step up from my meal (which does not say much). The steak was full of chewy and fatty spots which I spit out into the trash can. Needless to say, we will not be going there again. It is disgusting!

40.description: Stumble upon...This place had really good Mexican food. Their tacos are delicious, so are their elotes and horchata :) Even if there were times where I didn't want their Mexican food, I would get their chicken wings, that came with fries, and the way that they bread the wings are SO GOOD!

53.description: Chicken burrito + bottled Coke with real sugar = good stuffI might even say the burrito was better than I've had at El Famous, which is a little further down Clark.I love hole in the wall mexican joints, and this place delivers.

30.description: Been there 3 times in the past few months. First time wasn't bad, steak taco with side of rice and beans of average quality for $5.50 plus tip. Second time I ordered the same thing. Steak was burnt, rice was tasteless and mushy, beans were so watery, the only thing keeping them on the plate was the pile if melted cheese on top.Third time, same as above. I finished the taco and sifted through the cheese to find some beans and went to the counter to pay. Since there were other customers there I didn't want to complain about everything so I told the waitress that the rice wasn't very good. There was a guy eating at the counter, he turned and said to me, "you're right!"

46.description: The food here is absolutely delicious and the prices cannot be beat. Their portions are huge! Dine in and you get a cup of the soup of the day. We go there all the time and they remember us! My daughter loves their quesadillas and their chilaquiles and enchiladas are superb!

1.description: The only good thing about this place was the actual food. Lemme give a break down:Chips and salsa:The chips were SO BLAND. Literally hard and old looking with no flavor or salt. It was served to us in a basket with two napkins laying on top of it and the waitress also brought out the green and red salsas... but in bottles. How on earth are we supposed to dip our chips in bottles? So long story short the chips were gross and the salsa was difficult to eat with them. The food:I personally got a chorizo taco and 2 corn tortilla steak quesadillas which were absolutely amazing. My friend got 2 steak tacos and said they were very good. The tacos were relatively big and came with many toppings (although we ordered them almost plain). Overall, no real complaints about the food. The service:So. Horrible. The waitress was okay most of the time but was very short with us. Towards the end my friend and I were going to pay but I had a question about the check and the waitress just decided it would be easier to have separate checks. The waitress said "Oh so you're paying credit?" before leaving the table. We had a bus to catch so we stood up at the counter to pay and when I tried to hand her my card and she said "oh, we don't take credit, only cash." Are you kidding me? Why wouldn't she bring that up while she was at the table, she obviously recognized we were paying by card before. I just handed her cash and we walked out. The physical restaurant:It is tiny and pretty shabby. The menus and just up at the counter and you have to get them yourself. There were probably a total of 4 tables and 4 chairs at a counter, probably all of which could use tightening. Everything seemed kind of dirty and out of date. Overall, I really wanted to like this place. We put in a lot of effort to get there and were severely disappointed as soon as we walked into the tiny restaurant and were served the bland chips. The service was so horrible that it doesn't matter how good the tacos were, we will absolutely not be returning.

55.description: After further reflection (and further burrito-eating) I'll say this:  Chorrito has the best burrito in Chicago.  Or, to be more accurate, the best burrito I've had in Chicago.  Why is it so good?  I'm not quite sure.  I can't bother much with prose composition these days (too much work) so I'll do a little verse with obvious rhymes.ChorritoWhy is your burritoSo good?  I've never understood.Maybe it's the torillaThat could be aReason,Or maybe how you seasonYour meat.  (I like the pollo.)Oh-boy-ohBoy!  A Chorrito Burrito:Joy.

9.description: Great breakfast burrito.I like the lady behind the counter.  She laughed at my stupid joke :)

26.description: I had a burrito from here that made me wanna do dirty things to it. Totally worth the calories and it was the size of my thigh. I'd happily do it again.

25.description: We eat here all the time. Delicious, quick, friendly.

12.description: A disclaimer: I've never patronized El Chorrito sober, and likely never will. That said, it's a great late night drunking burrito place; everyone has to have one. Though dollar for dollar, The Little Mexican Cafe blows it out of the water, its hours, speed, and good humor make it great for when I'm frequently drinking next door at Norse.I'm giving it a 4 star pendant on being drunk and looking for food post 1 AM.

59.description: Best Authentic Little Mexican TaqueriaVery small. Very good. Very authentic.  Go for the tacos al pastor.  They have very fresh cilantro and lime in all of their dishes.  Its like a day trip to Zihuatanejo!    You could blink and miss this place. It seats about 15 people max.They have very authentic and rib sticking soups with corn and pickled veggies. Super tasty.They also make lots of fresh juices including carrot and orange.

21.description: A disclaimer: I've never patronized El Chorrito sober, and likely never will. That said, it's a great late night drunking burrito place; everyone has to have one. Though dollar for dollar, The Little Mexican Cafe blows it out of the water, its hours, speed, and good humor make it great for when I'm frequently drinking next door at Norse.I'm giving it a 4 star pendant on being drunk and looking for food post 1 AM.

17.description: This place is awesome.  Great food every time.  The young lady that works the counter taking orders seems to be here all hours of the day and night.  She deals with a LOT of crazy customers.  We all love her.  She has the best attitude! The cook staff smiles and interacts with regular customers - even if there is a language barrier.  I love that because it really makes this place authentic. Fast, courteous, excellent, inexpensive prices and consistently just darn good Mexican food. Period.

10.description: I would give it negative stars if I could. I came here after a few drinks and decided to have some food, The girl behind the counter was rude, could care less about customer service and obviously didn't want to be there. When we finally got out food it tasted good and half way thru a cockroach fell from the ceiling into my food. When notifying the waitstaff or yet again Girl who was behind the counter she didn't look my way, didn't care and kept doing whatever she was doing. She was basically waiting for us to leave. There was only 2 other people in the restaurant and I could have made a scene as they looked like they were enjoying their meal, but I just sat there waiting for some kind of interaction with someone who would say sorry or anything, she finally grabs the plate throws it in the dirty dish bin and throws my money at me on the counter and walks off.. No Sorry, NOTHING..  If you like rude customer service and bugs falling into your food then please come here and eat.

5.description: I always get 2 steak super tacos and it always always hits the spot. They are very generous with their toppings. Like, you have to pick at it with a fork before you can pick up the taco and take a bite. I just don't understand why it's so good. I just keep coming back. I have tried anything else on the menu, but my friend like the quesadillas. I think how they cook their steak is delicious so anything on the menu with steak will probably be good.I know it doesn't look like the cleanest place, but that doesn't matter. You go there for the food. If you go for 2 steak super tacos, I guarantee that you will leave saying "the spot was hit."

3.description: Didn't care much for the thin charred burrito, but the taste and tenderness of the beef was on point.Was upset that online and here it said they're open late/24 hours on Friday, but when we came back for more at 5a, they were closed. UPDATE TIME PLEASE.

35.description: I live directly across the street from this place and avoided it for over a year because I never have good luck with 24hr restaurants. So glad I broke down and gave this place a chance!  The prices are really good and the avocado burrito, vegetarian nachos,  and pico de gallo are all delicious! My boyfriend loves the steak and chorizo tacos with onion and cilantro. The service is friendly, which is not usually the case with some of the taquerias on Clark street. This is definitely my go to spot for tacos and burritos in Rogers Park.

19.description: Love this place. Two tacos, probably one lengua and one al pastor, with cilantro and onion, make a fantastic meal. The last time I was there, they threw in a complimentary bowl of menudo. Very tasty! Nice people, classic atmosphere.

28.description: I ordered the steak tacos and the corn tortilla was, oh so dry. The steak wasn't as tender as I've had in the past either. Only thing great was the lettuce was fresh. I think I'll keep looking.

45.description: Best. Tacos. Ever.Get them with cilantro and onion. Seriously, I don't even like cilantro and this was amazing.

33.description: I think this place has the best guacamole I've ever had! They are not cheap on their guac dip, putting big chunks of avocados and tomatoes in it. Plus, I love their steak and pork tacos! Yum, so good and full of flavor! I will definitely go back again!

43.description: Best taqueria I've been to outside of the San Francisco Mission district.  Hole in the wall place, but they've got a very extensive menu and extremely reasonable prices.  Love the chorizo.  Super Tacos are loaded with meat, tomatoes, avocado, onions, cheese, and sour cream...but these are fork tacos, not walk and eat tacos...but I'm not complaining.  Staff is very friendly too.  And given that I usually frequent this place after an outing to one or more of the bars on the same block...I love that they're open late.

2.description: I am getting annoyed at this place.... On a Friday and Saturday nights, this place does well from its bar patrons next door.... Taqueria El Chorrito needs to appreciate the amount of business that we bring in your doors.....That late night server girl can be quite rude and indifferent.  How about a smile and waiting on the tables and bringing some chips out?  Are you going to go bankrupt putting out a small bowl of chips? Seriously!... Maybe we should pass a hat in the bars and take up a collection for you.While the food is very good, your attitude has gone south.  Don't be too surprised when the boys walk over to the new restaurant in the works across the street.Wake up or you'll loose your clientele and business!You're not that special, honey!

18.description: awesome tacos. the chicharron in green sauce is a little spicy but super flavorful and soft. the cochonta pibil had great taste and nice texture. great local spot.

41.description: Really good drunk food. Also really good when you're sober! Try the super tacos, they're super good! Guacamole is amazing as well! Love this place!

52.description: For an inexpensive taqueria, you can't get much better.I prefer the vegetarian taco dinner which is basically an obscene feast for the money.Kudos also for saving me from many a horrendous hangover by staying open till I come home drunk as a skunk and desperately need sustenance.Fresh squeezed orange juice is available, and while I've never had it, the magical orange squeezing machine is a major draw.

50.description: I've always really liked this place, and it's open super late (like 4 or 5 a.m.)   I was a regular when I regularly would stumble out of Jackhammer after doing and drinking bad things.  Always hit the spot, consistently good, but do know this is more a taco/burrito joint than a 'full-service' restaurant.  Last time I was there, the prices had gone WAY up (like not the incremental 25-50 cents but like a LOT), so points off for that.  I guess if you don't raise prices for several years, makes sense that they go up mucho, but still.

4.description: Yummy!I had both the pastor and chicken super tacos here and I thought they were DELICIOUS. They're also open late, so that's a major plus. I found the food to be incredibly filling and the ingredients, for what they were, to be fresh. This is not the place to go for a nutritional meal but it's great tasting, delicious Mexican fast food. FYI, seating is very limited and if you go on a cold day, like I did, cold air will disrupt you meal every time someone opens the door.

6.description: Good Mexican food right on my block. Very clean place. I had a burrito and it was great!

22.description: Dig.  Came here around lunchtime on a Saturday.  I was expecting it to be slammed because of all the students who live in the area, but maybe they weren't awake yet, because there were only about 3 other people in there (all eating in).  My friends have long talked about this place as the perfect post-bar food, but I've just never partaken when I've been on that block.  This time I tried takeout for lunch, and I thought it was a really solid joint.  SOPE: Had a pastor sope, and it was THE BUSINESS.  It was layered with all kinds of tasty things.  Really quite filling, too.  You'll definitely need a knife and fork, and not flimsy plastic ones either.  I think the sopes are the sleeper hit here.  Check 'em out.  (Although I haven't tried the huaraches yet, so maybe those will be even better...)GUACAMOLE: Tasted really good.  Chock full of onions and cilantro, not overpowering with the lime.  I usually don't like tomatoes in my guacamole because they tend to make it watery, but this was actually great.  Chips were a little greasy, but that's what you get with freshly fried chips, so whatever.TACOS: I had an asada taco and a cochinita pibil taco.  Both were great, and they're much bigger than at many taquerias.  Like maybe twice the size as some I've had, because they're stuffed so full.  For $2.25 each, I think that's totally fair.  (Yes, at some other places you can get tacos for $1.75, but they're smaller.)  I actually was so full from the sope and the chips & guacamole that I saved these for the next day, and they were still good.  Two tacos were more than enough for lunch, and I am a hungry girl!SALSAS: Not very good.  The salsa verde tastes like a tin can.  So maybe get takeout and use your own salsa.I'm not sure what the food is like late at night, but the daytime cook did me some solids.Yes, the place is dingy.  No, the service is not going to blow you away.  This is a taqueria, dudes.  They make good food, and you eat it.

15.description: Been coming here since the 1990s and lately (last few years) the quality is pretty consistent. Carne asada tacos range from good to phenomenal when the chef is on. Taco dinner with 2 tacos rice and beans is only $7 and change. Open 24 hours!!!

57.description: Everything I've had here has been delicious!  Four out of five times I've been drunk from vodka redbulls at the Jackhammer next door, but the time I was sober was still pretty damn good.also, how can you not love the fact that it's inside a tiny greasy spoon that used to be called "Hamburger Chili"?

20.description: Greasy.  Sadly, the pastor burrito, pleasingly grilled on the outside, with generous chunks of avocado, was overpowered by ridiculously greasy pork, which is sad, as al pastor is usually the most delicious of meat choices.  Adorable, kitschy counter.  Being from SF/LA, I'm not sure if this is good for Chicago standards or not.  It's slightly authentic.  It was not be celebrated on the West Coast. The salsa was weirdly gelatinous and the cheese was philly-cheesesteak like.  Not awful, but certainly nowhere near SF/LA standards.  It was like junk food burrito, rather than nourishing meal.  Perhaps the tacos are better.  Burrito is roughly $10, tacos $3.

36.description: GREAT food, at all hours.  They're open late, always friendly, and the food is great.  I've had a quesadilla, a burrito, and steak tacos on different occasions, and I've never been disappointed.  GO HERE, and go here often.

14.description: A fantastic taqueria, El Chorrito satisfies my Al Pastor cravings. $2.25/taco and two will easily fill an adult up. Sublime salsa verde, and open late. $10 credit card minimum. And the large horcharta is HUGE and a steal.

1.description: Not the widest selection in the world, but I found some black cowboy boots there that I like for only $80.  I got my foot stuck in about 8 pairs of boots.  Pretty embarrassing.

2.description: This is a great store for western wear, as you could probably guess from the title!  They've got everything you could need from suede jackets with fringe, to chaps to bandanas!  Check it out, if nothing else, for Halloween!

0.description: Heading down this past Halloween I head into the city with a partially completed look.  Driving down Clark over and over again, you never really pay attention to the stores you pass by at 9 or 10 pm.  But there's always that one time where you think to yourself, "OH! There's a western store there! I should keep that in mind next time I need anything like that"Honestly, who really thinks like that?  Like, yeah, one day, I'm going to need to go to a Western Store?  Well me apparently.  And Halloween weekend.  This is one of those times.  "There's got to be a store where I can pick up a cowboy hat."  And since I have an abnormally large head, none of those fly by night Halloween superstores wasn't going to cut it.  It's too late to ebay me a hat, too far to drive to some random google location, so what the hooyah, drive down Clark until I find my aforementioned western store.And just my luck, I happen to make the right turn onto the right street, at the right time.  So what do I see out of the corner of my eye? A giant mural that says something to the affect "Jessica's Western Wear" "Yo Nick - you think they have cowboy hats there?" "I dunno, I'd seriously question the integrity of any western wear store that doesn't sell cowboy hats. If there's anywhere that would sell it, we might as well take a chance at a place with a 15 foot mural that says "Jessica's Western Wear" So we park.  It is open?  Has my quest for the finished costumer been in vain? Will this be some sick ruse that the gods have played on me the eve of a fanstastic weekend?  No.  This quest does not end in vain. Jessica's is open for business. As I walk in, what do me eyes behold? Aside from a whole array of Quinceañera dresses. Boots, shirts, and Cowboy hats.  Nick was right.  Integrity saved.   I find the perfect hat - it's black, size HUGE, and it's in my dollar range.  Win. Win. And Win.  Halloween weekend too? Mega-Win.

1.description: Don't leave your instrument with these guys. Took my horn in to have it cleaned and get a new valve. They had it for two weeks. They shipped it to a different store and didn't tell me that. So, I go to get my horn the day that I was going to fly to my gig. So yeah, I call and they said they didn't get my valve and they didn't bother cleaning it and that my horn wouldn't be in until 6pm because it was at another location. Luckily I had changed my flight due to some storms sweeping through otherwise I would have gotten to my show with no horn. Nice. Did they care? Nope. They didn't care at all and were not helpful at all. Guess I will keep my horn in Los Angeles. One would think that Chicago had their shite together but no, no they do not.

9.description: A great local music store (and by music store, I mean instruments and sheet music, not albums and CDs).I take guitar lessons here because its local to me and the people have always been very, very, nice.  They offer all kinds of music lessons and have a decent selection of guitars and sheet music.  If they don't have it, they are willing to order it for you.I've been eying a harmonica but maybe I should master my guitar before I step out into entertaining down in the "L" tunnels with this economy.But at the prices that this store charges, I know I can still afford my music lessons!  Check it out!

12.description: Under new ownership. I believe the new owners name is Chris.Flatts & Sharpe Music Co. is as cool as it's ever been.Whenever I stop in to see what new guitars she has in stock, I always see someone getting piano or guitar lessons.I've been looking at a silver steel guitar with the resonator, and the Washburn frettless bass guitar, and may be making those purchases soon.They also have drum sets, microphones, guitar pedals, tab books, instrument cables, and more.note: If your looking for recording studio gear or software, this is not the place for you.

21.description: Under new ownership. I believe the new owners name is Chris.Flatts & Sharpe Music Co. is as cool as it's ever been.Whenever I stop in to see what new guitars she has in stock, I always see someone getting piano or guitar lessons.I've been looking at a silver steel guitar with the resonator, and the Washburn frettless bass guitar, and may be making those purchases soon.They also have drum sets, microphones, guitar pedals, tab books, instrument cables, and more.note: If your looking for recording studio gear or software, this is not the place for you.

16.description: I had "learn to play a musical instrument" as an item on my life's wish list for more than 2  decades. Each year it was relegated to the bottom of my wish list because I was too busy or maybe I felt it was too indulgent. This May, I decided to begin guitar lessons at Flatts & Sharpe. I'm so glad I did. The shop is a wonderful small business owned and operated by musicians and those who love them. As an adult coming to music lessons so late, I can't praise this place enough for making lessons so accessible, reasonably priced, and unintimidating for beginners. My progress is slow due to my own lack of time for practice, but the lessons give me great pleasure. All the teachers are working musicians who happen to be very skilled at teaching adults who have never played.  If you've always wanted to learn an instrument, go here. My guitar lessons at F & S have become one of the highlights of my week.

17.description: The worst experience in my life,spcialy the Banjo lesson, and the owner seems very rude, she was talking to one of her employee and she act like askd al a B....dont go there if you want to buy an instrument , the prices are so high.i dont recommand this shop to anybody.

10.description: Guitar Center's floor generally doesn't really care whether they can help you or not; I've walked in there ready to buy countless times but left instrumentless and headed to a mom and pop store where the folks actually try to answer what you're asking.
