Flatts and Sharpe not only gives my neighborhood local color but also goes out of its way to let me try, reconsider, and come back and spend without regret. I've had a bass guitar fixed and bought two guitars, an acoustic amp, and countless strings, straps, picks, books, steel slides, stands, and kapos. Some prices are a little jacked on maintenance items, but on the major purposes the slight difference was worth it for the time the folks put into my personal needs. They could diversify their inventory more, but still one can find some internationality.

5.description: My son has been taking guitar lessons at Flatts & Sharpe for about 6 months and was taking them at his school thru F & S for 2 years before that.  We cannot say enough about this place - we love it!!  My son's instructor, James, is so patient and kind with my son and at the same time cool and hip and teaches my son songs that he is interested in.  The owner, Chris, is also very cool, hip and sweet.  We've had so much fun going to the performances and being involved with this business and plan to for many years to come!

11.description: My whole family loves the painted bird guitars in the window. I love being able to run in there when I need a last minute cord

22.description: This is a really nice music store, with both sheet music and instruments.  The sell acoustic and electric guitars, mandolins, and drums.

0.description: Excellent place to learn music! I've been coming here for five+ years for guitar lessons. Diverse clientele and staff, who treats everybody with respect, regardless of age, interest, or experience. You learn the music you want and love, but you also get the instruction you need.I'm very happy with my progress at Flatts & Sharpe!

20.description: This is going to be a brief review.Flatts & Sharpe is a great local music store.  I love the fact that it is walking distance from Loyola.

19.description: Nothing but good experiences here.  Super nice staff, cheap and dependable repairs.  Good spot.

2.description: It's nice to have a neighborhood music shop.  It reminds me of my childhood when I use to run to the store excitedly to pick a new song to learn on guitar.  They've got a decent basic collection here and prices are standard.  It's a charming place, really.  Their estimate to repair an old, but rare, guitar I picked up was a bit ridiculous, so I passed on it.  Everything else is pretty cool.  I take lessons with someone else (Sandip Burman), so I can't speak for the instructors, but the prices seem reasonable. I'm glad they're in the area.

18.description: totally successful trip! I Found all the suzuki violin books for my daughter, got some piano sheet music for myself and signed my son up for drum lessons! This is a full service store.

13.description: I went into Sharps and Flats with my boyfriend just before Christmas 2008.  I was looking for a less than standard size guitar, as I have very small hands and wanted one that I could really learn on.  My boyfriend decided to buy me the guitar for Christmas.  The night that we made our purchase was great.  We went in, were helped promptly and we selected a 3/4 size acoustic.  It was inexpensive, just under $100.  I was pleased.However, less than 2 months later, the guitar started to twang on the E string and the more I played the worse the twang got.  We assumed that the fret had raised and took it back to Sharps and Flats where they agreed to fix it at a reduced cost.  Well so much for that... the next day they called and told me that the guitar was not fixable at the price they quoted me or any other price. They offered to sell me an upgraded guitar for half off. When I arrived to pick out the replacement guitar the owner explained to me that the guitar I had purchased was cheaply made, not under warranty and not fixable (never mind that this was the same gal who told me she could and would fix the guitar 24 hours earlier).  When I started looking at more expensive guitars to replace my now apparently worthless guitar, she told me that she could only offer 50% off of the exact same 3/4 size guitar.  The same guitar that she had mentioned less than a minute before was cheaply made and not worth buying. So I asked her "Why I would spend money on the same guitar when you just got done telling me that instrument  is a piece of sh**t?  She really had nothing to say expect "I don't really know what else I can tell you. The guitar you bought did not have a warranty. It sucks, I know."  So I asked her about the 50% off of a new guitar the guy on the phone had mentioned. She just said that she could not offer the 50% off of anything expect the same exact guitar.  I kept tell her that this was a customer service issue.  We did not come in at Christmas to buy a cheap badly-made guitar. We came in to buy a nice instrument and this was the guitar that we were sold by her employee.  In the end we just took the broken guitar (which, according the gal at Sharps and Flats, has a warped neck and that is why it can't be repaired) and walked out.  My boyfriend should have just thrown his 100 bucks out a window because we got NOTHING for our money. Not even an apology. We will NOT be back.  I am going out tomorrow to buy a new guitar elsewhere and will NEVER give my business to this store again.  I am a big lover of local businesses and not giving money to the corporate giants, but in this case, I would have been better off at Guitar Center. Total let down!

4.description: The only reason I give it 2 stars is because they give lessons and showcase students' talent. Besides that, I'd give it a solid ONE star. If you need anything ordered, repaired, suggestions about an instrument, etc, do NOT talk to the owner. She has no clue about band instruments. I received a Clarinet that was broken, and along with it, was given a broken reed. I took it back to get a different reed and was given a SAXOPHONE reed instead. If you own a business, make sure you leave the details to those that know how to do it. Don't just give customers something you think will work to get them out the door quicker. Also, the customer service was pretty lame. I didn't feel like I was "cool enough" to be in on their conversation at the counter.

6.description: Not good customer service. First off their hours are horrible. You can call there in the daytime and they will answer the phone, give you info on products but then show up right afterward to be informed they are not open. I walked right in the door only to be told immediately they were not open, while there was someone at the front counter being waited on. If you refuse to make a sale then no one should be there to mislead those walking by. Also they don't have a good inventory of instruments. Some people would say oh well they sale beginner instruments. The contrary is true. It's much harder for a beginner to learn on an inferior instrument than a quality one. A music store for musicians is gonna want their students and patrons to succeed at playing. Store profits is the only positive outcome to selling junk instruments.

15.description: This is going to be a brief review.Flatts & Sharpe is a great local music store.  I love the fact that it is walking distance from Loyola.

7.description: I started taking lessons at F&S about a year and a half ago and between the lessons and the twice-yearly performance opportunities i have been able to rapidly advance in terms of music theory, technique, and everything in between (although still got a long way to go!) everyone is always very friendly and go out of their way to help. Ive purchased a bunch of helpful music accessories as well as had my guitar set up and been very happy. I always feel at home when I am in the store.

8.description: Still terrific.  Dashed in as they were closing because the nephew is now into jazz.  Got a terrific fat book of standards for him from the wonderfully helpful woman in charge.  Thanks and keep on rockin'!

3.description: Great location.  OK music store.  There are much better in Chicago.  Service was average. knowledgeable about guitars, but really nothing else.  I asked to speak with the owner about a repair, never met her yet.  I used to work in a similar music store (small mom and pop shop).  The owner I worked for was very good about keeping the store clean and organized.  Flatts and Sharps doesn't have the same love and care.  carpets need to be vacuumed.  Sheet music needs to be inventoried and organized.  I found it hard to find standard books for my beginning lesson students.  With some TLC and more knowledgeable employees this shop would be great.  I hate to say it, but Guitar Center on Halsted was a much better more personal experience.

14.description: A good neighborhood music store. They have the mid priced stuff, and a good selection of sheet music. Not every store can have uber high end stuff, and this one doesn't, but it has decent stuff to for a quick string change, upgrade, fix and mid priced guitar items. Lots better than Guitar Center in terms of service. Someone below complained about cheap $100 plywood guitar? You think GC would treat you better? Crazy.

12.description: I had a lot of fun at the bear night, which I think is held regularly. I did not get the usual "no chasers allowed" vibe I get at bear events in LA & SF. Friendly hunky patrons, no attitude from bartenders. A-OK.Would have given Touché another star were it not for weak drinks. I don't come to Chicago to pay LA prices for weak booze!Oh, and the music was atrocious at times. The macarena in 2009? Really? Somehow, though, this helped keep conversation moving, as it provided fodder for fresh conversation.All that said, you could find much worse leather/bear bars around.

7.description: How do I put my first experience to Touché into words? Worst experience ever. I will never go back. Upon entering within 5 minutes of me and my friend entering the bar and heading to the back bar, was greeted by and unfriendly bartender who preceeded to ask us and I quote, "were you wanting to buy a drink, and if not we're going to have to say good night to you." We had not even been at the bar for less than 10 mintues to find that we were not welcomed at the bar. Of course plenty of other men were drinkless and was not harassed by this bartender. I would say avoid at all costs. I will be sure to tell everyone I meet that touché is an unwelcoming and unfriendly place to go to and to not waste your money supporting this business.

3.description: This place is disgusting!!!  I am a bartender down the street and I made the mistake of going in twice and waisting my money. It stinks, crappy drinks and the nasty attitude of one of the bartenders offended me enough to where I will Never return Even though it's a close and convenient place to have a drink.

1.description: Was visiting Chicago for NYE. Had checked out other places online and this was the only place not charging a crazy cover. $10 and we were in, coat check for $1 and drinks in hand we checked out the front of this cozy, neighbourhood bar. Made our way to the back and the bartender there was super friendly and made us feel very welcome. Needless to say we had a blast, loved the 70's 80's Levi/Leather vibe......

2.description: Touche is The Best Gay Leather Bar I have ever been too,  & I,ve been to many.  Friendly Staff, Cheap Drinks, HOT Guys, Bears, Leather & Skin. Chicago has The Best there is to offer,  That is for sure,   Now they need another one in Boystown.

9.description: Sunday draught beer is .50 cents!This bar isn't meant for everyone. It's meant for those with a darker side to their sexuality (gay or straight). If that's not you don't go.They offer pretzels and chips and often on Sundays they have a bar-b-que... Free! They have theme nights to keep life interesting. This bar is one of the few gay bars that doesn't suffer from ageism. If you're a bit twisted stop by sometime and say hi if you see me.

10.description: Well, if I wasn't qualified to review Jackhammer, Touche is totally out of my league. Seriously I like Sidetrack- all those rooms with a different theme and so many bars from which to choose. But we can't go to sidetrack every time......on IML weekend we must visit Touche.And so we did. the first remarkable thing is that there were leather men getting their hair cut on a stage? Do they do that every night? I did venture into the 'back room' with a more imposing friend. I happily obliged to remove my shirt, but I was the only person not wearing a shirt back there. Then again some weren't wearing pants in the back room. So I guess I had that on them, right?As with its southern neighbor- see previous review- the regulars are quite welcoming. I dare say it was a commodious, if trouser free, environment. In terms of decor, the walls are painted black for an extra bit of leather infused noir.Overall, I can say I'll become a regular. But that said I'd sooner frequent Touche than John Barleycorn.Leather daddies are a most welcoming fraternity. But just fy.... for the LP mommies that may want to go slumming, let's leave the trodgs at home.

13.description: I OBJECT! Cheap draft beer on certain days, good dark bar thats close to my place.But I went there one night with my gay boy and as we PAID to get in - the bouncer-man told me I couldn't go in the back. He did the finger wag and everything! Well no shit I can't go in the back! But on the other hand, you made me pay and i ain't gettin no tail-  I demand compensation!  And not in the way of compliments and adoration, thats free and expected.Next time I'm gonna tape them down and strap one on - I'm going in! So be careful who you hit on in that back room- he just might have a Uterus!

16.description: Sweet bartenders and great specials.

17.description: Another place to go if you want a very different experience from N. Halsted.  This is a leather bar, but you don't need to be wearing leather.  There are certain nights that you need it on to get into the back bar.  It's pretty dingy inside and out, but that adds to the atmosphere.  One of the popular nights is Bear Night, which happens on the first Saturday of every month.  The crowd is decidely bearish with various gradations of muscled, brawny, burly and husky.  But there are plenty of guys that don't fit that description and have a fine time.  One thing I've noticed on Bear Night is that someone who doesn't fit the bear description can have a hard time getting served at the front bar--20 minutes standing with money out while other guys are getting served much faster.  Not a coincidence.  The bar gets really crowded on Bear Night, and they have free pizza at midnight resulting in a pizza stampede.  They sometimes have a long line to get in the bar after 10 on Bear Night--something to keep in mind during the winter.  The music here is usually really good, but there's no dance floor.  There is some seediness in the back room, but you can avoid that if you want.  Guys, don't bring your girlfriends here.  It won't be comfortable for them.

15.description: I went on a Bear night, so I can't really speak for what the scene is usually like. The front bar was packed and loud, so there's a lot going on- not a sleepy, boring place.The back bar has a very special corner, so if you're not up for that, you might want to avoid it.

0.description: If you're looking for a pretty boy bar this is not it... so why complain?  Check out Sidetracks and have fun!  ... In short, take a hike to Halsted Street!Now that we got that out of the way... Touche is a leather bar as well as a neighborhood place to greet, meat and eat. ;)   It's known for its seamier side of Gay life and that's OK.  Many different club nights, theme events and regular guys looking for fun action.Everyone is accepting and the environment is friendly.Enjoy!

5.description: This is a classic gay leather bar -- diverse crowd, very leathery on the weekends, casual during the week, lots of great parties --- and don't we love Allan, muscle bear Jeff, and sweet Rickie! The Sunday 50 cent draft is the best deal in town - now this ain't a swanky joint, so just kick back and have some fun.

11.description: Touche... Touche is trashy in it's own glorified sense. Not only do they have a bear night  where the aroma of urine gets a twinge of body odor but they also have what I took to be a "how to" night. I'm not sure what the actual name of this specific night is/was but basically it is a how to night. The two nights I went not only did I learn "how to" play with candle wax but I also learned "how to" fist someone. Of course my own sick mind thought this was absoloutely hilarious and kept picturing the "master" as Martha Stewart teaching us one of her many skills. Needless to say it can be worth it for the laughs alone but when it comes to dirty leather sex... try the Eagle. The door man here is a plus (at least in my opinion) not only is he hot but he's a pretty cool guy if you get to talk to him. The bartenders are well rounded and aware. But all that aside just grab a bottle of poppers, a six pack and log into manhunt.net for the same expierence minus the smells.

8.description: One of Chicago's last true Leather Bars.  Perfectly decorated.  Old posters on the wall and ceiling...porn playing on televisions...a backroom with a dress code.  Generous pouring bartenders...and local beer on tap.  They also give back to the leather community by allowing leather contests to be held there.  Maybe not the largest space, but then again being packed in is part of the fun, right?

4.description: I should premise this review with the fact that I'm not into the leather scene. Sure a harness is fun to put on during street fairs, but that's as far as I'll go. So this bar was not really for me. I came here on a Saturday night while visiting their neighbor Jackhammer and found this place quite empty, with some crazy shenanigans involving a human pinata in the backroom going on. Overall I'm sure this can be a fun bar, it's got a pool table after all, but it isn't quite my scene.

14.description: Gay men come to this bar to have sex. Not necessarily at the bar, but not necessarily not at the bar. If that sort of thing makes you squeamish, stay out of the back room.Touche is the host of the Mr. Midwest Rubber competition. They have theme nights such as Piercing Night, Dungeon Master Night, and the ever popular Handballer Night. Toto, I don't think we're in Kansas anymore.On the other hand, it's reasonably clean, and the bartenders are friendly. The clientele tend toward bears and leathermen, but they're pretty open, and not at all aggressive -- unless you want them to be. Drinks are cheap, and specials include 50 cent Bud and Bud Light drafts on Sundays.Open until 4am, for your late night cravings.

6.description: Touche is Chicago's quintessential gay Levi & leather bar. The men who frequent this place are "bear/leather" types of dude: masculinity is dripping from the walls. It's seedy, with porn on the TVs, mirrors in the bathroom that are situated so that you can see your neighbor's cock, and extracurricular activity abounds on the back porch. Yes, VERY SLEAZY, so of course I'm in love with this place! The bartenders pour a mean drink ($4.50 for a well drink AND the same price for a bottle of Budweiser: so stick with the well drink), and everyone is friendly and chatty. Props to the sexy bartender, Dan -- an Andy Roddick lookalike -- for pouring stiff drinks and for being friendly and helpful as to what to do on the "Chicago scene". This bar is open WAAAAY past your bedtime, so prepare for a good time and make sure you save cab money for the ride home (that is if you don't catch a ride from your trick, ha ha).

12.description: Last night I woke from a nap craving friend chicken. I knew I wasnt about to whip any up and remembered a Popeye's was near.I drove down and then waited..and waited. Finally got to the window which is this scary turning-lazy-susan thing so the workers are never in direct contact with you which is a bit creepy.Luckily though the food was good and hot. The gravy is better than KFC, the coleslaw is not. But the chicken was really good and spicy. I forget about Popeye's when I get fast food cravings but hopefully I'll remember this one. Just be prepared for a wait. I'll assume food was being cooked right then which is why there was a wait at all.

3.description: I'm particularly fond of the mild flavor chicken pieces, along with the biscuits.  In short, I like the food.  The service, however, is pretty bad.  No, it really blows.  I've had my order wrong on the last two occasions, despite clearly indicating what I wanted.  Screw it; the I'll just get the fried chicken from the grocery store next time.

1.description: Last few times chicken was wet breading not cooked. I called told store manager. He was very nice professional offered me a free dinner.     I finally decided to cash in my free dinnerI waited in line  told cashier im here to turn in complimentary dinner. She tells me to wait to the side. Im waiting, waiting. Wasn't really busy inside at the time. Im waiting , I had no idea who, or what I was waiting for   I finally asked is he coming out. She pointed to a guy that was working up front.    She said we have to wait on customers, ( like im not.)  People like to be informed if they're waiting.  Just say the manger is here, be with you soon as he can.  Manager was still friendly about the thingI won't be back, those employees don't deserve 10.00 ahour.   To the nice manager find another place to work.

2.description: GHETTO is an understatement with this Popeyes. The worst Popeyes in the Northside of Chicago.Every time I come here it's terrible customer service.  The management is just as ghetto. As I come in the manager is arguing with a customer. Everyone who works at this Popeyes are ghetto and rude besides the male employees. The experience I just went threw a few moments ago compelled me to write this review .I just got a meal from here a few minutes and a light skinned african American girl with red hair not only messed up my order by loudly talking to her fellow employees WHILE taking my order but after calling out my number just pushed my meal towards me without a "have a nice day" no "Thankyou" or nothing just silence after having waited 15 min for a simple two piece Teusday special!  This is the type of service I expect to receive in the south or west chicago not up north!

9.description: Yeah, yeah. The chicken is good. But frankly, I'd stay away from this location.The neighborhood? Not my favorite. Either I attract a lot of a attention here, or this place is just full of people who enjoy telling strangers how they are the spitting image of their 25-year-old estranged daughter with four kids. It's a little shabby on the inside, too. There are some much nicer locations that have been recently renovated.They do have a drive-thru, although it took me forever to notice it. This seems to be a Popeyes thing, as it's been at every location I've seen so far, but the drive thru window is a strange turning table in which you're at all times separated from an employee by a pane of what I assume to be bullet resistant glass. I bet the employees dig the fact that they don't have to smell anyone's nasty breath, but man it is a pain to understand someone when they're trying to talk to you through it.The quality of the food here is questionable, too. How can you be out of both chicken nuggets AND barbeque sauce simultaneously? Who's not doing their job? I wonder. She gave me honey mustard sauce instead, whch was fine... Until I saw the suspicious rip in the container and the congealed yellow goo crusted around it.Save yourself the food poisoning and the awkward interactions with the weirdo clientele and go to the one on Irving Park and Ashland instead.

10.description: Horrendous service.  Thank goodness the food is so good or I would never be back.I drove through yesterday afternoon.  Couldn't understand a word from the person taking my order; then the person repeated my order back to me incorrectly and I had to make corrections.  Pulled up to the drive through window and paid, only to be told I had to "pull around and wait" even though there was no one else in the drive through line and only a few visible customers in the restaurant.  When my order was brought out to me it was incorrect; I had to get out of the car and go inside to get it corrected.The person who took my order and the person I encountered inside were both sullen, unfriendly, and disinterested. They both muttered and wouldn't make eye contact, forget a pleasant smile or an "I'm sorry" when I had to go in to make things right.Fortunately the food was delicious, although why the heck don't they have sides of cream gravy?

4.description: I'm writing this before I get my food, assuming that it will be up to par. That's why I'm giving two stars. This has certainly been a one star experience so far. The crew working here is understaffed, impolite, and way too nonchalant about serving customers. I have been here for 20 minutes - waited in line for 15 minutes with only ONE person in front of me. I won't be back to this location.

6.description: I first pulled up to the drive thru window and waited for 15 minutes. The car ahead of me did not proceed past the menu and I quickly realized that she hadn't been addressed. I parked and came inside and waited in line before giving my order. The lady at the counter was very nice and she was the only redeeming factor other than the quality of the food (which is always consistent). I saw a woman who had arrived after me and ordered the same thing receive her food while I waited for an additional 15 minutes inside. The crew seemed really disorganized! The lady who was waiting at the drive-thru menu in front of me earlier was inside at this point and asked to talk to the manager. The manager said that the intercom was broken (there was no note on the menu) and that the customer should have pulled through to the window to order. She was offered nothing for her wasted time. Overall, this location is hectic, disorganized, and dirty. The only positive thing is that the food is consistent...

0.description: I've been guilty of going to this Popeyes Chicken location in the past when I just can't get the craving for fried chicken to go away.That said, avoid the drive through at this location if you go. Trust me, you'll only end up going inside anyway, and going inside is always 10x faster.This time around, knowing that, I went in. I was shocked that they had Cajun chicken already ready, (often they do not), and my biscuits and sides were promptly created as well. (Mashed potatoes and Red beans & rice are old faves.)The staff was polite and the service was shockingly prompt.Oh, and yes, there was a single drive-through car waiting for their order when I arrived. ;-) Ha ha!

5.description: I always come here. The food is good. So that's why I keep coming back. But the service here, specially at the Drive Thru is real ghetto. No thank you for coming to our restaurant, no thank you come again. Kind of feel unsafe handling my credit card to some person via some anti-crime swivel window thing. So over all the food is good. But forget about the friendliness here. That's why I gave them a 2 star rating.

13.description: If you don't want head bobbing and attitude with your chicken you are better off going to another Popeye's. Once you get past that and the "watching snow melt wait" you've got yourself an average chicken dinner. Chow down!

11.description: The food is great.  I love popeye's.  The workers are hit and miss, but most of the time they are good.

8.description: I arrived in the drive-thru at approximately 5:30pm. The time it took to wait behind one car and then wait for the cashier to acknowledge me on the intercom took a total of 11 minutes before my order was placed (5:41).  I was told my order would take 7 minutes to complete, and after paying, to park my car and my food would be delivered.  My food was brought to my car at 6:10 (29 minutes after ordering).  I ordered a 12 piece tender meal.  I left, checked the contents of my bag, and saw that a) the fries were missing and b) the sauce packets within my bag had exploded.  I drove back to the store, waited again for someone to acknowledge me at the drive thru window, stated I was missing part of my order and that I needed a new bag with new sauce packets.  I waited 7 more minutes for these items.  From the time I pulled into Popeye's until the time I left, 47 minutes had passed.  Never again will i return to this location or to any Popeyes.

14.description: I agree - it's hit or miss here - a hit being first in line when the chicken is fresh out of the fryer. (Unless you have an ulcer - go for the Spicy - which isn't really all THAT spicy.) Most of the sides are only so-so - though the Cajun fries and those biscuits are pretty good.This location leaves a bit to be desired (despite it's being across the street from a police station that always seems to be deserted.)  Lately I've been doing the drive-thru - but when the chicky is good - it is good.

7.description: For some reason, I just had a hankering for some Popeye's. The chicken was good. Real good. Classic Popeye's. The place was clean and I witnessed no service issues and didn't have any myself.

29.description: Food arrived cold (grub hub)steak not marinated or flavored and of low quality (tough)chips like plain doritos and pico de gallo was all onion and cilantro ( almost no tomato)You have options. go elsewhere

42.description: I had s steak  burrito and it was GREAT....Nice placeService is goodI shall return

23.description: I used to love this place.  But the last few times have been disapointing and I wine be going back.  When my was there a couole months ago, his girfriend discovered a piece of stainless steel in her food. The kind found in a brillo pad. They offered him. A credit for their next visit. While she was reticent to return,  she agreed. But there was no record of a credit Ave it was never granted.I owned my own business for 30 years and I believe in transparency.  Which is why I object to the fact that they never give you an itemized bill. Just a piece of paper with your order scribbled in restaurant shorthand and a total. Tonight we questioned it and it turned out we were overcharged. In addition, the service was pretty bad. The restaurant is quite large and there were only 2 tables. The other was just hanging or watching tv. The part of the counter which wood give then a full view of the patrons is blocked by drink machines.Our waitress said "just tell me when you're ready. But we had to get up and go find her in order tob place an order.Like I said,  I used to love this place. But it's overpriced and far too much work for mediocre quacamole and super greasy chorizo. Frankly, I've never  been bkown away by the place.  But it was convenient to my home.  When I go out eat, I don't want to have to work this hard.

47.description: Our go-to place for homemade, authentic Mexican food. Just like in a small Mexican town, the staff is there to please and is very helpful and cheerful. Inexpensive, BYOB: we eat til we're stuffed and can't seem to spend $20 at this place (for two). No the original La Choza we remember and love, but this is an awesome place with great food.

8.description: I ordered from La Choza via GrubHub. The tacos are delicious; plenty of meat filling them. Gorditas were a bit greasy, but still flavorful as well.The reasons I'm only giving four stars are because a) I requested lime on the side and none was included and b) the delivery order says (in ALL CAPS) NOT to ring my bell, but the driver did anyway and it woke up my roommate. :(

31.description: La Choza es la chingona! I, though just a humble guero, can't say enough about the delicious tacos here. The carne asadas are good, but the pastor, carnitas, and lengua...que rico! I lived in L.A. for many years, another land of authentic Mexican tacos, and La Choza ranks with some of the best from out there. Also, their chips, and offering of three varieties of extremely fresh salsa, only add to the dining experience. The horchata es deliciosa. Service: always exceptionally friendly, and prompt.P.S. get the tacos with only cilantro and onion, with a lime wedge on the side--hold the American lettuce and tomato! ;)

34.description: expecting a little hole in the wall from all the reviews was a nice little place but no dive. had guacamole as an appetizer. didn't need it as the chips and salsas would have done well. also had the chicken burrito. very family oriented but very good the rice water or horchata was good too. very pleasurable dining experience.

16.description: Came here for the first time after a taco craving at midnight. I ordered the Pastor, pollo and asada tacos, as well as the guac with chips. Everything was just okay. The pollo taco left no impression and it felt like I was just eating it to eat, not because I really wanted to take another bite. The Pastor taco was better, the pork was juicy and flavorful. The asada one was okay. The chips weren't salted and the guac was very blend. It just felt like I was eating a combination of crunchy and buttery things but they had no flavor. There are better taco places around, so I'll definitely check those out before I head back to this one.

13.description: Very clean. Clark street pretty much a " Mecca" for nice homestyle mexican food cafes. Best salsa selection I've had at any of these places along Clark street.

11.description: I called to place an order for pickup or delivery but the girl clicked right in my face disgusting

39.description: If you want inexpensive but delicious Mexican food with nice service and a clean environment, you're in the right place. Be sure to try the pastor (the true test of a Mexican restaurant's worth) and have some guacamole while you're at it!

37.description: Most entrees here are less than $10 for a large plate of food. This is a clean and calm sit-down Mexican restaurant with good service. I had the taco dinner plate (3 tacos with rice and beans), which was delicious, and my friend had a good burrito dinner. The horchata was also very tasty.

0.description: This place is all kinds of awesomeness. I love Mexican food and this place has a great menu with a lot of variety at a reasonable price. I highly recommend the Tampiqueña and the pozole... It's scrumptious.My boyfriend and I have dined in and ordered delivery. Dine in is casual, and the servers are very friendly. Service is pretty fast.Delivery is quick, customer service is on point, food is delicious. Great place to eat :)

38.description: Excellent tacos at dirt-cheap prices! I got a taco dinner with 2 carne asada tacos, 1 al pastor taco, rice and beans for ~$7. These tacos are loaded with meat--the carne asada were tasty but the al pastor was really delicious. And their beans were amazing! I really have no idea how they make those beans so good. Plus the salsas that came with the complimentary chips were awesome on both the tortilla chips and tacos and pretty spicy. My only complaint would be that there was tons of lettuce and tomato on my tacos--if only I'd known to ask them for cilantro and onion instead!

51.description: I have been to La Choza three times because it has good, not expensive food. The atmosphere is comfortable and casual: On weekdays it is pretty empty and it is usually guys watching the Mexican futbol games. I am vegetarian so I keep getting the vegetarian sopes which taste really fresh and only two fill me up. My boyfriend loves the pescado a la plancha.

27.description: Ok... We ordered food on GrubHub last night and this place managed to get three strikes all on one evening. I ordered cheese enchiladas and my boyfriend ordered chorizo con huevos. The food arrived safely, 45 minutes later... Thank goodness I cut into my enchilada and looked instead of just taking a bite... Chicken enchilada and my vegetarian tummy would not have gotten along. My boyfriend calls back, tells them they gave us the wrong food for me and they need to deliver the cheese version. She got irritated with him because we wouldn't come pick it up and then proceeded to argue in Spanish with her coworker over what the problem was. The second round of food gets there and I finally start eating. Five  minutes in, my boyfriend starts feeling extremely nauseated and tells me to stop eating.  He was sick the rest of the evening and I woke up in the middle of the night with a very ill tummy...  Never. Again.

32.description: I have never reviewed a restaurant before but my food was awful. The deliver was very fast and I was glad since I was hungry. I ordered three carnitas tacos, two steak tacos, and one milanesa torta. I know it is a lot of food but they have a 15 dollar minimum for delivery. Everything was awful. The carnitas still had bones and cartilage in them. The steak tacos were more like grizzle tacos, and the torta was bland and greasy. I had a bite of each one and through them out.

48.description: Cheap and delish eats! Pretty big portions on dinner plates, will be back again!

44.description: My friend Cassie turned me on to this place a couple years back, and I absolutely love their food.  Probably my favorite Mexican food in town.  Their Tampequena steak dish is what I usually get.  Perfect thinly cut piece of meat, flavorful, kinda smoky, with an enchilada, rice, and refried beans on the side.  Perfect.  And cheap!  Last time I was there, I tried the chicken enchiladas with a mole sauce that blew my mind up.  I just love their food.  Then I go to the tamale place next door for a to go order so that I can keep the flavor going into the next day.  You're not paying for ambience, as there is none.  Pleasant service. And the place is banquet huge-you'll probably have a section to yourself if you go. But believe me-the food is worth it.

24.description: This place is awesome. The chicken enchiladas con mole were great! Also had the pechuga de pollo con queso was really juicy! Chargrilled! The beans and rice are basic food items but were still enjoyable! And they have Mexican Coke! Definitely a good spot!

7.description: I work very close to this restaurant and often stop for lunch to grab a couple carnitas tacos for carryout.  They are delicious. The rest of their food is mediocre, and the service varies dependent on who is at the counter.  I go basically out of convenience when it's too cold to walk somewhere better.I will NEVER be back, however, as today I received inexcusable service.  The waitress completely ignored me even though I was the only person at the counter.  I had to ask if I could order.  When I tried to get my tacos, she  snipped "No carnitas today!" as if I was an idiot to not know they didn't bother to make it today. I ordered a small soup and a pastor taco instead, even though their pastor is just ok.  Instead of ringing me up, she ignored me the entire TWENTY MINUTES it took to get my food.  When my order was finally ready, she tried to charge me $10 for an enormous soup.  I told her I ordered a small and she claimed they don't do small soups to go.  I kindly responded that she did not tell me that when I ordered and I was not willing to pay $10 for soup.Rather than working with me and admitting her mistake, she was rude and rolled her eyes at me.  I walked out, hungry and angry and grabbed tamales from next door where the employees are competent and kind.

49.description: This place is small and easy to miss, but has (hands down) the best quesadillas I've ever had. I love going to this place.Food:     Again, the BEST quesadillas I've ever had. They're amazing and huge. Order the flour, not the corn. The guacamole is also phenomenal. Big chunks of avocado and a great lime and cilantro flavor. The food is already super cheap, but the quantities are so large that my husband and I sometimes spit a quesadilla and some guacamole and still bring home leftovers. The two of us can have dinner for less than $15, including drinks.Drink:     They serve horchata, always delicious, and you can get bottled Coke that is imported, so it has sugar can in it instead of high fructose corn syrup. It is SO much better than American Coke.Service and Atmosphere:     The place is very small and cozy. It's also spotlessly clean. You can tell that the employees take great pride in the restaurant. It is also almost never crowded (a well kept secret of Rogers Park) and open super late. My husband and I don't speak Spanish, so the language barrier is particularly rough at this restaurant. The staff is very patient, however, so that makes work out. My only complaint would have to be that they don't come back to the table very often. It's hard to get a drink refill, so we usually order extra water right off the bat.

40.description: This place is a gem.  It's location near the Rogers Park Metra made this a often stop for me on the way home from work.  The portion size is HUGE and the price is super low.  I've tried a bunch of stuff on their menu and have yet to be disappointed.  Chips and Salsa while watching Telenovelas can't be beat.  Service is great along with the food.  Easily accessible on the 22 bus or the Metra - although if you blink you'll miss it.  I highly recommend a stop here to get a burrito or sopes.

53.description: La choza Mexican grill7022 n clarkstop #8 on our travels north of devon, on clark.there was a lot more good than bad at this taqueria. the dining room was large and bright with plenty of seating for big groups, and small. Tall backed chairs. the decor was typical, with frida khalos and the such peppering the walls.it was quiet, with a spanish soap opera murmering quietly in the back room.our waitress was one of our best thus far. we had five at our table (the starbirds, the lorises, and anne). Immediately neal attacked the waitress by asking her what she recommended on the menu. though flustered she was sweet and funny and pointed us to the tampiquena (skrit steak, mole enchilada, and guacamole) which husband ordered. Neal pushed further and a dish that wasn't available on the menu, a shrimp and pineapple concoction, was offered. Neal bit. Both of her recommendations were right on. the steak was sweet and spicy and tender and lovely, though we thought the mole was bitter and gritty. the shrimp dish was actually served in a half pineapple. the shrimp was mixed with some sort of ranchero sauce and cheese and fruit, etc. it was sweet and spicy, gooey, homey, comfort food. neal, when done with the shrimp itself, poured some rice into the pineapple to soak up the sauce. he ate that pineapple dry. julie ordered herself the chicken fajitas. they came out nice and charred with lots of red and green peppers. she took leftovers home. tasty.anne ordered the enchiladas with verde sauce. she got 4 huge enchiladas. the verde was very spicy, but she seemed happy. She also took home leftovers.i got the bum plate. i ordered the taco dinner with one chicken, one steak, and one pork taco. boo. The tortillas didn't hold up. The fillings were bland and riddled with gristle. The tacos were topped with iceberg lettuce and tomato. The beans were fine, a little runny, but tasted really beany. The rice was light and fluffy. Mild. Ultimately, though, I was supremely disappointed. But everyone else at the table was so pleased that I'd definitely consider going back. I'd just never get tacos again. The menu is large enough to sample other options. And on the front of the menu were the specials. I'd definitely order from the specials. That seemed to be where the real magic lived.Just to round out this review, we started with free chips, pico de gallo, red and green salsas. The red was bleh, but the green was very 'green' tasting, if you know what I mean. Good. And the pico was fresh and delicious. Very spicy. The chips were pretty light and fresh. Oh, and we got a guacamole appetizer which was lovely. Creamy, but with big chunks of onion and tomato. Anne and Jeremy got the Mexican cokes. The starbirds and I got orchada, which was fine. Our bill averaged out, with tip, to about $15 per person.

30.description: Love that this place is on grubhub it makes my specific order easy to pay for and pick up when it is convenient for me and the food is really tasty.

46.description: Just had dinner there. My what a great place for Mexican food. Best mole sauce ever. The waitresses are always friendly and fun. You gotta go.

1.description: If I could give them a minus star I would! The worst delivery food ever.-CALDO DE GALLINA was DISGUSTING. I am a cook and could distinguish instantly that it was OLD AS HELL!! no veggies Just garbanzo beans, onions and fat! DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE ORDER THIS.-FAJITAS MIXTAS same thing!!! Its all OLD, HARD, COLD AND JUST NOT FRESH AT ALL!! We will NEVER order or try again, my GF wants to throw up when she smells mexican food thanks to this place.

9.description: Best burritos and horchata I've had in Rogers park. I definitely recommend this place it's my go to for Mexican food in the area. The restaurant is very clean and chill.  The staff is attentive and friendly. It's convenient for me as it is walking distance from where I live but it is also located near bus stops and minutes from the red line.

26.description: Me and my friend found La Choza through grubhub. I not am sure if this had some affect on how are food turned out; maybe grubhub customers get terrible food? We ordered tacos, nachos and a torta. Delivery was swift it took them about 20 minutes to arrive at my apartment. Upon seeing and tasting our food I realized why the food may have arrived so quickly. The torta was burnt, the chicken was bland, and the nachos were stale. The nachos had nothing but hard cheese on them and barely a spoon of sour cream. Nothing else. The torta was black and it even had a long hair in it. Thankfully for my friend her tacos were okay. I would not recommend eating here.

25.description: Our first time trying La Choza was as take-out. The second time we dined in, and now we have TWO great ways to access tasty Mexican fare! It's a clean, bright establishment with clean updated restrooms. There was an open kitchen (well, a large pass-through window anyway), the food was cooked to order, and our waitress was attentive. I tried the chilaquiles (verde) this time and was very happy. I took some home and still delicious next-day! We ordered the chorizo gordita again but decided we liked it better when it came delivery. This second time in-restaurant was a little dry. The hub got his usual steak burrito and we did tongue tacos again too without complaint. The bill was reasonable which we anticipated since we'd ordered a prior time. The star of our dine-in experience was the trio of salsas - red, green and rustic, i.e. fresh, zesty and zippy! So inspired, I make my own version now at home of the finely diced tomato, onion, jalapeno and cilatro with squeeze of lime. All in all, La Choza is still delicious and still worth going back in-person or via delivery.  (:

12.description: Our first time trying La Choza was as take-out. The second time we dined in, and now we have TWO great ways to access tasty Mexican fare! It's a clean, bright establishment with clean updated restrooms. There was an open kitchen (well, a large pass-through window anyway), the food was cooked to order, and our waitress was attentive. I tried the chilaquiles (verde) this time and was very happy. I took some home and still delicious next-day! We ordered the chorizo gordita again but decided we liked it better when it came delivery. This second time in-restaurant was a little dry. The hub got his usual steak burrito and we did tongue tacos again too without complaint. The bill was reasonable which we anticipated since we'd ordered a prior time. The star of our dine-in experience was the trio of salsas - red, green and rustic, i.e. fresh, zesty and zippy! So inspired, I make my own version now at home of the finely diced tomato, onion, jalapeno and cilatro with squeeze of lime. All in all, La Choza is still delicious and still worth going back in-person or via delivery.  (:

21.description: I was more than pleasantly surprised!I had a pretty straight forward, typical order.  Cheese quesadilla, steak burrito, horchata.Cheese quesadilla was prepared perfectly, served with sidesSteak burrito was very tasty- I had to share it with my two trusty roommates, the yowling and panting was getting out of control.I seriously have a new go to!

17.description: I wouldn't even give it a star. Waitress was too busy talking to someone that she forgot to tell the cook about our order. Plus, the other table ordered a different entree that they returned it due to it having a bad taste. I waited 40min for my food. Once I heard her tell the cook you haven't made her order I was extremely upset. Walked up to them and told them forget it I don't want anything! As we were walking out, she yells to tell me at least pay for the horchatas. Wtf! I left a $5 on the table but shouldn't have! Never will I ever go back!

10.description: Can't complain about this place. I love quesadillas and they have this "super quesadilla" for $7 that really hit the spot, it was enormous  and the steak was good. I'm eager to try their other food. This place is just another solid mexican diner In chicago with really affordable prices and good food, one of my favorite parts about the city.

5.description: One of my go to spots for Mexican food in Rogers Park. There are a lot of choices, from El Famous Burrito, Uptown Taqueria, Hernandez, and Rocky's Tacos to name a few. La Choza, holds a high ranking due to their authenticity of their food, the quality of their meat, and the consistency of his quality of food and service.The place is huge. If you dine in, I don't think you have to worry about finding a table. You can sit close to the counter and watch some TV, or you can sit in a secluded corner in a quieter spot. Service is quick and friendly. The restaurant is clean and welcoming with portraits of Frida Kahlo and paintings of places in Mexico.The food is amazing and priced to please. Some of my favorite entrees are breakfast dishes. The Desayuno La Choza is filling and satisfying with 2 eggs over easy, slightly spicy tomato sauce and onions on top, and rice and beans on the side. Served with fresh, hot, warm corn tortillas. The burritos and tacos are also a good deal. I like that they fill their burritos with the yummy stuff and not too much lettuce like El Famous. The horchata (sweet rice water with cinnamon) is decent, but not as good as Diamante Azul which is a little smoother and sweeter, which is my personal preference. If you want a taste of what home-cooked Mexican food can be like and aren't lucky enough to have a Mexican mom to cook for you, this place comes in at a pretty close second to my Mom's home cooking.

3.description: Stay away. I ordered a steak tostada and the steak taco dinner with horchata. The steak is definitely precooked and then scooped out of a bucket and warmed up on their stove making it hard and dried out. But for some reason the fat never renders so be prepared for those chewy pieces. Also food showed up an hour and a half after I ordered it so cold and soggy. I'm hungover so I'm still gonna eat this but I will never order from here again. Even the horchata is watered down. Only good thing about this place is its super cheap but you get what you pay for. After a FIVE dollar delivery charge though plus a 20% tip I should have just ordered my favorite Mexican food from El Asadero through Postmates. Now back to picking at my food...

35.description: See that great looking picture of Tacos ? yeah well that isn't what you get here, nope that is what you expect to get from a Mexican Place when you order Tacos, Meat Onions and Cilantro I cannot eat Tomatoes so I order Tacos that should be a safe bet at any Taco Joint other than Taco Bell and I never go there, but this place thinks they needs to put lettuce and Tomatoes on their Tacos, oh and they didn't give me any limes not that it matters I have 4 Tacos I cannot Eat ! and they are closing so no time to go back either thank baby Jeebus I also ordered a Torta and I made sure to say no Tomatoes on that as I knew it would have tomatoes so I didn't go completely hungry tonight, also this is the only place I have ever gone to that does not put pickled Jalapeno's on their Tortas WTF ? really can you not do anything even close to the same as every other Mexican place I go to I mean really I eat the hell out of Tacos and Torta's I know what I am ordering I should not have to ask what comes on either item as at over 30 different places I can think of off the top of my head all make them the same way and that is in 4 different no make that 6 different states they all make them the same way I won't be back any time soon I know where to get Tacos and Torta's made the way they should be

19.description: I used to love this place.  But the last few times have been disapointing and I wine be going back.  When my was there a couole months ago, his girfriend discovered a piece of stainless steel in her food. The kind found in a brillo pad. They offered him. A credit for their next visit. While she was reticent to return,  she agreed. But there was no record of a credit Ave it was never granted.I owned my own business for 30 years and I believe in transparency.  Which is why I object to the fact that they never give you an itemized bill. Just a piece of paper with your order scribbled in restaurant shorthand and a total. Tonight we questioned it and it turned out we were overcharged. In addition, the service was pretty bad. The restaurant is quite large and there were only 2 tables. The other was just hanging or watching tv. The part of the counter which wood give then a full view of the patrons is blocked by drink machines.Our waitress said "just tell me when you're ready. But we had to get up and go find her in order tob place an order.Like I said,  I used to love this place. But it's overpriced and far too much work for mediocre quacamole and super greasy chorizo. Frankly, I've never  been bkown away by the place.  But it was convenient to my home.  When I go out eat, I don't want to have to work this hard.

28.description: So I'll up this by one star just because someone called the next day to apologize about our experience and offer some free guac next time we come. I definitely appreciate the customer service.  Whether or not we dare try again remains to be seen...

45.description: we stopped here on the way home late night.  We were the only customers and I think they were getting ready to close.  The meat in the enchilada was very dry and gristly.  my husband had the carne asada burrito and his meat was ridiculously gristly,  every bite had to be spit out. We didn't finish our meals.  BUT our friend had the nachos which were EXCELLENT!!  Large portions overall here.  We will come back and try again during normal hours to give it another try. It may have been just the bottom of the barrel late night.

33.description: My friend and I came here after seeing that our first choice was closed. Our experience was mediocre at best. - The chips that come on the table were decent but tasted almost store bought. The salsas were delicious though.- We both ordered Horchata, which can be hit or miss, and it was actually very refreshing and tasty.-I ordered a steak taco and a chicken burrito while my friend ordered two steak tacos and a chicken tostada. We both agreed that the steak tacos were delicious, definitely one of the best tacos I've ever had and it was only $1.65, although to add cheese, sour cream, or avocado costs $0.25 each for tacos, $0.50 for tostadas, and $0.75 for burritos. While the steak was mighty taste, the chicken was pretty disgusting. It was chewy with a weird taste on both the tostada and the burrito. Overall, the atmosphere was comfortable enough even though there was an awkward moment when we walked in where the employees just watched us as we looked around, unsure if we were supposed to sit down by ourselves or not. My ultimate advice would be to avoid the chicken.

43.description: I have been here a few times over the past 6 months. I have both dined in (they have a huge space) as well as done take out. If they delivered I would eat their food a lot more often! My wife is a fan of the veggie burrito. I really enjoy the pollo fajitas. I have tried the pollo taco but didn't care for the chicken. The chorizo taco is very good. The stuffed poblanos are excellent. Also, excellent horchata. Check it out if you have not done so yet.

2.description: What do you prefer when you go out for Mexican? A trendy looking spot with average food or a restaurant that looks like your abuela's basement with knockout food? La Choza is the later. In fact, their Carne Asada is so good you might smack your grandma. It's a quiet little spot on Clark serving up some of the best Mex in RP. There are large tables for groups and small tables for small groups. The menu has all the go-to items plus some more unique stuff. The service is friendly and too the point. Try the carne with onions jalapeño and cactus. I did and it was quickly one of the best Mexican dishes I've had.

18.description: Ordered food at 9:06pm. Was supposed to be delivered by 10:25pm. It was not. I called the store to conform order at 10:47pm. Were not helpful. Had to call again to replace the order. The food arrived at 11:40pm. Delivery driver wasnt pleasant. Tacos were cold and burnt. Chips were stale. Called to complain. Was told that there was nothing they could do. Was not offered refund for return. I work in the industry. I get it - problems occur. But work on your customer service. Never ordering from this business again. Terrible service. A literal $24.21 thrown in the garbage.

41.description: I wrote this review before I had tried the Vegetarian burrito! It was very tasty, very large and less than 5 dollars.

52.description: Formerly Taqueria Mexico from across the street.  The place is clean,  modern and the service is pretty good for a small family owned restaurant. Do not go here for tacos or burritos, try El Famous or some other place if that's what you want. Stick to the entrees such as the Enchilladas en Salsa Verde, the carne asada, the costillas or even the chilliquillas.  All spicy, but delicious. The rice has improved and the beans are excellent. The shrimp dish in the pineapple is a treat as well.  Excellent soups as well. BYOB.

50.description: Our second time coming here and the tacos are better than I remember.i must first stress how ridiculously delicious their three salsas are. They are the best I have had at any Taqueria on Clark, or any Mexican restaurant anywhere. One a semi-spicy roasted tomato, one a spicy verde and another a fresh chopped salsa with jalapeno, tomato, onion, cilantro and a few other ingredients making it not quite a typical picco de gallo. All of them are the perfect spicy and just so damn tasty!I ordered 4 tacos, lengua, which was so tender and flavorful, asada, which was also delicious and flavorful, pollo, which was nothing special and for the first time, carnitas, fried pork, which was delicious and a nice change from the al pastor. I did not have to add salt this time like last time, all the meats were more flavorful than I remembered them being on our first visit and I was really quite impressed.There were a few cons however. We specified cilantro and onion on all tacos but my dinner-mate got tomato and lettuce on 3 of his 4 tacos. NO GOOD. Really ruins the flavor of the taco. He didn't say anything but had it been my tacos I would have requested C and O. This wont keep me from going back but it has put a bad taste in my friends mouth.Service can also be a bit slow but we weren't really in a rush. All in all 13 bucks for 8 tacos and 1 diet coke.I would really recommend new patrons trying the lengua, asada and carnitas for taco fillings! Delish.

4.description: I ordered this restaurant through grub hub. I had a torta and tostada. The first thing I noticed was the brown lettuce but figured, "hey, it's just lettuce". Then I bit into the torta- the meat was rancid causing me to immediately vomit. I threw away the rest of the food, worried about the kitchen sanitation.

6.description: The food is amazing especially the pozole and the Carne tampiqueña.  Plus the servers are very nice

22.description: Now, I'm a Zaca Tacos type of girl so I didn't think any other taco place in the city would offer great tacos. La Choza definitely beat my expectations. Now, I have a north side taco place and a south side one, too. I was very pleased with their steak tacos and they used the freshest cilantro and onions. There was also pork pieces in the refried beans which I liked. I'll definitely be a regular.

15.description: It's a typical greasy Mexican fare on Clark in Rogers Park (and I mean greasy in a good way).  While, I've only been once, we split a chorizo burrito and enchiladas and I had a cabeza taco while my friend had a chicken gordita.  Was in the mood for tamales instead of enchiladas, but they don't have them.  Cabeza was delicious and tender.  The enchiladas were good and the chorizo was cooked perfectly.  I liked the atmosphere better than most no frills restaurants.  The bathrooms are clean and the decor is nice  The place is deceptively big and you can find a comfy seat and have your owns space most times.

20.description: REALLY good.  I got guacamoe, it was very fresh but needed some lime.  Still, I added salt and it was fine. Also got a carnitas taco and YUM.  They have good rice and beans, their salsa verde is really potent, and delivery is fast, fast!  Very happy with my order and the prices.  Will definitely order from here again!

36.description: Tacos were very good &  this place is clean!

14.description: I was more than pleasantly surprised!I had a pretty straight forward, typical order.  Cheese quesadilla, steak burrito, horchata.Cheese quesadilla was prepared perfectly, served with sidesSteak burrito was very tasty- I had to share it with my two trusty roommates, the yowling and panting was getting out of control.I seriously have a new go to!

3.description: Best place for authentic Jordan's in Chicago!!Market prices with a great knowledge of the Jordan shoe series!

1.description: This place is a complete rip off. They over price on shoes that you can get from Nike. The people in there try to up sell you. They had a pair of shoes that I got from Nike for 135.00 but the funny thing is I have the same pair of shoes and I only paid 65.00 for them, talk about a huge mark up. FYI they sell fakes also, so buyer beware....I'll take my money elsewhere

2.description: If I could rate them a zero I would. I believe a one star is extremely too much. I went here looking for some all black Air Max for my nephew the guy originally said no taxes then when I got to the register he rang up taxes when asked why? He told me because he felt like it. I turned around to tell my mother I won't be coming back in the store again but I told him go ahead I'll still going to purchase the shoes. He places my money back on the counter and said the shoes are no longer $89 now they 120 and am i in the conversation now, and he refused to sell me the shoes he basically changed the price 3 times while I was at the register. I will never walk through these doors again when I originally walked through the door and I said good morning no one spoke back. I will give the African American gentleman that works the floor credit he is very polite but the Chinese owner is extremely rude condescending and ignorant. Please do not shop here you should go nowhere where the service is just plain disrespectful.

9.description: This place is the bomb yo! Straight up man. They'll hook you up with the latest kicks and keep you in style. And if you're a frequent customer you'll be treated very nicely with deep, deep discounts. The prices here are unbeatable. Oh fo sho!!!

10.description: One of my favorite sneaker shops in Chicago.They'll hook you up if you're a frequent customer, pretty loyal guys. As long as you come in and you're respectful, they'll be nice to you.If you're looking for a new Jordan release or pack, this is probably your best bet on the North Side. It's also walking distance from J Bees, another nice shop.

4.description: Besides the neighborhood being crap, and the place smelling like stinky feet. They have a pretty good shoe selection and they work on lowering prices with you. Now I'm hearing a lot of guys stopped shopping there for the fact that they have been known for selling fake Jordans. Nike town has an account with Jordan so the best way to know is by going on there site and com pairing.

6.description: P & J's is a shady operation. My girlfriend went in there to try and buy some Retro Jordan's for me and they tried to get $1000 per pair from her because she isn't too knowledgeable with the Jordan brand . Laughable. I went in with her another day and they wanted a little over market value as I knew what I was talking about, but, alas I got myself a pair of black infrared size 15's. So... besides them actually having Retro Jordan's in the back of the store... they will for sure try and rip you off and are completely rude.. so I am only giving 1 star. The people who have given 5 stars are probably friends.. as everyone else knows how rude they are. Buyer beware. Please try and look up prices online if you plan on buying from them. The owner is extra rude on the phone as he is in person because he knows he is running a shady operation. Know your prices before you buy. The younger kid is a little more nicer than the old dude, but, they start talking Chinese/Japanese when you seem to know what you are talking about per the shoes. Cracked me up. Good luck.

11.description: so i pre ordered some jordans here. the olympic 7s. went there on they day of the release and the dude there said he sold my shoe i pre ordered. i was in a state of total disgust. they didn't seem to care at all. the guy show any kind of remorse. this place is terrible. they didnt offer me any kind of retribution for their huge mistake. take my advise and never go back to this place. they stare you down once you walk in the store and there is always workers watching you.

5.description: Way to expensive on the Js dude over price on them plus he rude your better of waiting in line for a retro release.

7.description: The only reason this place even gets one star is because Yelp will not allow me to give it none. The owner was the most RUDE person I have ever met, and literally ignored us as we were trying to talk to him. I would never recommend anybody giving their money to this horrible establishment. Not to mention I didn't even trust my car to not get broken into while outside. TAKE YOUR MONEY AND SHOP ELSEWHERE! Worst customer service I have EVER experienced.

8.description: Its quite obvious that Nef who wrote the review about the 11 Breds at PJs has very little knowledge about the shoe game. And if you dont know much about the shoe game this isn't the place to go for a release as big as the 11s, that part I will agree. There are very few independently owned shops that will give info about a release like that over the phone and you will usually have to pay more because youre guaranteed the shoe (unlike chains like Foot Locker, etc). No, its not totally legit but  its how the game works, for better or for worse. I feel sorry for Nef because he clearly tried to walk in early and get a pair of shoes that hadn't been released yet, and I have the shoes now and had no problem getting them from PJs. So, if you want a major release, you can get it at PJs. I'd recommend going one or two days before and asking what the process will be. You may or may not get an answer about a raffle ticket. Then, camp out the morning before. When dude comes out and says they aren't selling them unless you have a ticket or whatever, stay there. Then, when they give you a price, pay it or walk away. Or, go before release day and pay double or triple retail of the shoe. If you aren't looking for a major release, its a decent shop. Kinda crowded. Has most decent Nike releases, definitely an urban/hiphop flair. Nothing is labeled with a price. Yes, the owner names the price when asked. Normally its about 20$ more than I think is reasonable, unless the shoe has been on the shelf for awhile. He's built a customer base on loyalty. People who go in there every week or every 2 weeks and buy shoes don't have to deal with the 20$ price markup or the run around over majorly sought after shoes.  Also, don't expect to bargain with him in front of other customers. Ultimately, I give them 4 stars because I've never had a problem getting a major release shoe. I've had friends tell me stories about waiting in line for hours and eventually not getting the shoe, and I've never waited for more than an hour or so and I've never walked out empty handed.  Its a reliable place to get all Jordans and a few other releases.

0.description: My son and I have been going to pj's since he was ten,he's 22 now and we have always had a friendly welcome. The owner is great and so are his sons and others that work there. They of coarse have all the latest trends at a great price. We have always gotten a discount and I think that is because we were frequent customers . They have larger sizes, 13 and up which we appreciate because it's hard to find larger sizes.Yes, the neighborhood isn't Michigan Ave, but the best kept secrets are places you'd least expect.Drop the attitude and take a stroll to PJ'S!

29.description: I went there for a mani/pedi and will not be back. It was not clean and there were flies circling my head the entire time. The lady who did my pedicure made 2 of my toes bleed and did not even exfoliate the bottom of my feet. The manicure lady made one of my fingers bleed and it was overall just not good. Will NOT be back here. Gross.

42.description: Initially good service, did not have to wait long for a pedicure.  the magazines were not up to date (that is a big reason i go to get a pedicure).  Bertha did a nice job with the pedicure, shaped my nails nice, scrubbed my feet etc, but the paint job was a little messy.  she used a q-tip with remover to clean is up but it still looked a little gunky along my cuticles.  She then put on the flip flops handed me my bill and walked away.  my feet were still wet and had not fully rinsed from the foot scrub.  They don't have feet driers here so I just had to sit there until my feet were dry.  then i cleaned my feet myself and paid my bill and left.  Don't think i will return

23.description: HOMOPHOBIC. No thank you.

47.description: Roger's Park is seriously lacking in places to get a decent manicure ( see review of Windy City Nails). While attending Loyola I always passed Carmen's and knew they were really popular with the students for eyebrow threadings. I didn't even know they did manicures and pedicures until recently. I went in last week for a mani/pedi combo for $35. Standard price but above standard service. Josephine, my nail tech, did an amazing job and was  very detail oriented. For some reason even when I have my manicures professionally done they still chip within 24 hours. Not this time, I'm three days strong.  While getting my manicure, some how or another I got talked into getting my hair cut by Carmen, the owner. I was hesitant because I'm very selective about who I let cut my hair. But Carmen threw out the fact that she "has several African American girls" who get their hair cut there. I went with it. Initially I was freaked out because she cut my hair wet after I asked her not to (curly/wavy hair can look very different, ie:short, when dry after a wet cut) for that minus half a star. But the cut turned out ok. The other half star is missing because they can be pushy. Thanks guys but I really dont need my eyebrows threaded or my whole body waxed or any other additional service you offer.

8.description: I used to go here for threading. Stopped by today as a walk in at 10:24 a.m. to find the door locked and the shop dark. I don't have time to waste parking only to discover a place that is so unprofessional they can't be bothered to open on time or post a note in the event of an emergency. I am very disappointed and will not be returning after 10 years of patronizing this business. I will go down the street to Shiva's.

31.description: Update: very nice and very reasonable.  I got my back waxed and it was $40 and you should ask for Ashourina, who is great (but she is off on Mon and Wed)  Outstanding job, basically painfree and good conversation.Highly recommended!

34.description: Loved the hair cut.  Thought it was a little over priced for the simplicity of the cut though.  In these hard times people can't be spending so much on a hair cut.  Also, eyebrows are $7, when on Devon Ave the Indian salons do eyebrows for $5.  Lower your prices, you'll get more customers.

16.description: I just left Carmen's. I'm African American and I'm growing out my perm so I went there to get my ends trimmed. I told Dolly I needed less than an inch cut off all round to get rid of the split ends and I wanted her to cut it DRY. She totally understood, cut the bare minimum (being as I HATE seeing any length cut off of my hair) and was done in 15 minutes. LOVE!I'll be back in 6 weeks to maintain this natural hair of mine.Thanks Dolly!$25 buck for a haircut... you be the judge.

13.description: I've only gotten my eyebrows threaded at Carmen's.  I cannot praise my artist Ashrina enough for sculpting my eyebrows.She has worked with me through the good and the bad.  When I couldn't get to Carmen's, I often made the mistake of going somewhere else and my eyebrows always ended up being a mess.  I would walk in and Ashrina would say "oh what happened" all I could do was put my head down in shame LOL.  She is quick, but she also takes her time when your eyebrows are in need of some TLC.Thanks to Ashrina, my eyebrows are full and have the natural shape I've always wanted.  On top of that, who can complain about great eyebrows for $7/per month?  I couldn't ask for anything more.  She and her father (I think) were always friendly.  We would chat it up about the weather and the economy.  Great people.

11.description: 2 years later and I still drive from the Gold Coast to Carmen's.Eyebrow threading is still the best deal around ($7). I confess...I've cheated a few times...and I always come crawling back with my tail between my legs.Any day but Tuesday go to Marleen and for the weekends go to Marleen or Ashirina. DON'T GO TO THE GUY...just....dont.

39.description: I love Carmens!! I have been going for years, but just like any other some employees are better than others. For hair I always go with Carmen, she is GREAT!! Her daughter, whose name I'd butcher, also does a decent job as well. I first starting going to Carmens in 2002 only for eyebrow threading, they do a great job and I am very particular. I eventually gave in and decided I'd see how they did with hair cutting, and I am VERY pleased. They have never let me down.

37.description: I can only recommend this salon for eyebrow threading. I do not recommend for waxing! They use some kind of refill roll-on wax gadgets....like Nair roll-on but with wax...totally ineffective and unsanitary! Unfortunately I didn't notice until after the wax that there was a big blond-ish looking pube stuck to the applicator...I'm a brunette and the carpet matches the drapes so that was _not_ my pube!!!Other than that, my eyebrow threading have been fine-though they seem to have different staff each time I go in and have a snit if I try to card the service.

0.description: So glad I found this place!After a disappointing threading at another salon last month, I was beginning to think I would never find a good salon in Rogers Park.But then I found Carmen's!First of all, Carmen and her family (her husband works the front desk and her daughter is another hairdresser) are incredibly kind. It seems like they all really enjoy their adorable little salon and they treat their customers very well.Carmen took the time to LISTEN to what I wanted, which I appreciate very much. Got a few inches off of my hair and my brows threaded. It was quick, efficient, and just what I wanted. And it is so affordable! For such great prices and wonderful service, I will definitely be a regular at Carmen's.Can't say enough good things! Check it out for yourself :)

38.description: If you only go here for threading, you'll never be disappointed.Unlike some price-comprable places on Devon, the folks at Carmen's will never give you too-skinny eyebrows. They're also very quick and professional. I tried a couple of other services, but both occasions were nightmares. I had the most painful and excrutiating bikini wax of my life, and the other time was a manicure. To my horror, the woman doing my nails used the same bowl and same cuticle cutter on me that she used on the woman before me without cleaning either! Talk about unsanitary!Ugh. Like I said, stick to the threading.

51.description: This place is a joke.  I went there to get my eyebrows done and came in to find about seven women sitting around.  Obviously business is slow.  The man who seemed to be in charge quickly barked orders to one woman who asked me what I'd like.  I told her my eye brows which the sign advertised as being $7.  She asked if I'd like them waxed or threaded and I said waxed.  Once she was finished I went to pay only to find out that it was $12.  When I explained that the sign said $7 the gentleman's response was, "That's not correct.  It's $12."  When I told him that I felt that was dishonest, he told me that was fine, it was still $12.  I left without tipping, which I never do, and won't ever go back.  I feel bad for the women who work there.

27.description: I've been here multiple times only to get my eyebrows threaded. They always do a fantastic job. They all seem to listen to what I had to say about how I wanted them done. I've only had to wait maybe once for like 5 minutes, every other time, I can just walk right in a get seated no matter what. For only $7+$3tip, I can't find a better deal anywhere else! Since I've moved from the area, I still travel (I live in La Grange now) if I can get my hands on a car just to get them done still. Thats how good they are.

32.description: I have been coming here for haircuts since college back when the price was $10 (now it's $18).  I would rate the haircuts at 5 stars if Robert or Ashor were still there but they are not.  Both always did a superb job cutting hair and knew exactly how to cut and style male hair.  But now they are gone and I've been pawned off on the rest of the staff.  The cuts are ok - still better than some other places.  Nevertheless, they routinely mess up the important items like sideburns or back of the neck or don't fade the hair.  Yes I may be a little picky, but as long as I still have some hair left I will be picky!!!  Oh, one more thing - if you are using an ATM / Credit Card they will run it as an ATM card to avoid the fee on their end, unless you tell them.

54.description: Got a great, quick men's haircut from Robel. Recommended.

48.description: Since moving away from the Rogers Park neighborhood a few years ago, I have desperately missed my eyebrow waxings at Carmen's.
