They always did such a nice, thorough job with my brows, and you can't beat the price. There was a guy there who looked like Joey Fatone. He would do an amazing job. If he's still there, ask him to do your brows. You will not be disappointed.

44.description: I went there for only a shampoo blow out and was shocked at the price.  $35.  I normally only pay $25 anywhere else I go.  To get it flat Ironed was an extra $5.  I had an interview the next day so I was kind of stuck.The girl did a good job, but like other posters have noted, the place just looks dirty and generally unkempt.  The only reason I had anything done there is because I am new to Chicago, and I needed to be together for an interview -- and I always like how my hair is done (flat ironed) when someone else does it for me.  I need to practice doing it more I think.The guy tried twice for me to get my nails done saying they had a special on it that day -- and I declined both times.

24.description: Ok. Let's get real. I work at a waxing salon. We do threading and waxing services. Our estheticians are awesome. I get all of the services for free. You are probably wondering where I am going with this...The point is, I STILL COME TO CARMEN'S TO GET MY EYEBROWS THREADED even though I could get my brows done for free at my work. That's how awesome it is. I schlep down Sheridan Road and drop the $7 because my eyebrows look flipping awesome everytime I walk out of there.

7.description: I have been here several times, and have YET to see Joey Fatone. Has he moved on? (see previous review for reference).Every so often I get nostalgic for my old stomping grounds (and, I've never been threaded anywhere else!) so I popped in here today for a quick brow threading...and voila...no mess, no fuss: 10 minutes later I'm strutting out with much less hair above my eyes. $7 + tip. Can't beat it, and no breakouts or scary skin rippage from bad waxers! Would've liked them a wee bit thicker, but hey...they grow back. It's definitely still an improvement. Easy metered parking right in front, side streets possible, many bus lines (36, 151, etc) plus red line Loyola stop. If you haven't tried threading, I suggest you give it a whirl...less pain, in my humble two-browed opinion. *ps I had a TERRIBLE haircut in college here, I would never let them touch any hair on my head. But eyebrows...YES.

49.description: Love the place, been going there for Years for threading, but the one thing that sucks is their hours, a salon should be available for business on a saturday morning at 9 am at least, they don't open till 10, Im usually on the other side of town by the time they open.

40.description: My 5 stars indicate how happy I am when I get my eyebrows threaded at Carmen's.  Aside from that I have gotten waxed, but I can do that anywhere.  The #1 reason I go is to get my eyebrows threaded.  I have been getting them threaded for over 10 years, and they have NEVER looks as good as they do when I leave Carmen's.  It's the perfect arch.  My mom ALWAYS critiques my eyebrows when I get them done, but whenever I go to Carmen's, she has nothing but good things to say (this is VERY rare, haha).

53.description: Carmen has been doing my hair for years now, she does a great job...wonderful staff, family friendly atmosphere with expert professional service.   Eyebrows, nails, facials, the works.

30.description: i must start by saying i exclusively go to carmen's for my eyebrows.  they are expert threaders, and i trust them wholeheartedly with my prominent brows.today i went for a haircut as well.  school's starting soon, and i figure i should at least be somewhat groomed... and although i'm happy with the result (i have pretty simple, long, straight hair), i had to fight to not get layers put in.  it went something like this.S:  you like layers?J: no, they don't really work for me.S: but they look nice.J: they do when you actually do your hair.S: but you just need to blowdry and flat iron.J: i don't do either.S: it doesn't take very long.J: neither does air drying.S: so you want layers?J: no, thank you.S: just a few in back?J: no, that's okay.S: maybe in front?...i could go on, but i'm sure you get the point.  i am a grown-ass woman.  i have lived with my stick-straight, thick as all get-out hair for 30 years.  please don't fight with me about how i want it cut.  please?  just do as i ask, and i PROMISE i will tip you mightily.  i will always go there for my brows, but i may need to find a new place to get this mop trimmed.

46.description: I have only gotten my eyebrows done here so I can't critique the other services. I initially did the threading, but then moved onto the waxing. I am a real wuss when it comes to pain around my face and I just decided the fewer times things were ripped from my eye are the better! I ave been happy for the most part. If anything they can be on the thin side, but I feel like for the price you can't get that picky. I do have to mention that their sales techniques are lacking. Telling me what I need in order to look better or that my nails look bad as I am signing the receipt or that my eyebrows are too light, just isn't going to get me to spend more time with you! But for the price and quick get in, get out it works.

1.description: I've been to many places looking for a flawless eyebrow threader. Finally I found Carmen! (The mom). They are a family owned and operated salon which makes the experience that much more graceful. I can't say all the technicians are worth the compliment but Carmen is very talented. I recommend her!

55.description: A great place for a good haircut and style. But what I like this salon even better for is their eyebrow threading service. They have a specialist there who is really great at this.  They are very reasonably priced and have great service. The salon does get crowded with students from Loyola at times, mostly on Friday afternoons I have found!

9.description: Best eyebrows ever -- thats all I can say. I didn't know what to expect $47 for no chip mani and eyebrows for perfection - will be back.

26.description: I love going to Carmen's beauty for all my hair and nails needs.  It is conveniently located by Loyola (I am in Rogers Park) within walking distance of where I live.  Everyone is very friendly and I feel welcome every time I step in the door.  I have had the threading done, it is very reasonable, $7.  I have never had a problem with over threading, taking too much of the brow away.  I have also had manicures/ pedicures, waxing, my hair cut and colored here.  The prices are all reasonable.  Typically the wait isn't that long, depending on how many students are present.  They are open now on Sundays which makes it even more convenient.  I usually pay around $35 for a trim, style and blow dry.  Not bad considering I always like the cut.  The waxing services were a bit off because you don't really have a totally private room, the walls are very thin,you can hear noise from the main parlor which is a bit distracting when you are in such a compromised position.  Worth trying out if you live in the neighborhood.

25.description: I have been here several times, and have YET to see Joey Fatone. Has he moved on? (see previous review for reference).Every so often I get nostalgic for my old stomping grounds (and, I've never been threaded anywhere else!) so I popped in here today for a quick brow threading...and voila...no mess, no fuss: 10 minutes later I'm strutting out with much less hair above my eyes. $7 + tip. Can't beat it, and no breakouts or scary skin rippage from bad waxers! Would've liked them a wee bit thicker, but hey...they grow back. It's definitely still an improvement. Easy metered parking right in front, side streets possible, many bus lines (36, 151, etc) plus red line Loyola stop. If you haven't tried threading, I suggest you give it a whirl...less pain, in my humble two-browed opinion. *ps I had a TERRIBLE haircut in college here, I would never let them touch any hair on my head. But eyebrows...YES.

12.description: I've been here several times-a no chip manicure, threading, haircut. The experiences were good ones and the service was stellar. I read a couple of previous reviews for this establishment prior to going, and was dumbfounded by negative remarks, after my positive experience at this salon. In the past, I have paid $100 for haircuts and upwards of $40 for a manicure. I found the owners here to be very courteous plus the place clean and reasonably priced. Also, the skills/knowledge of the people (esp Carmen, the owner, and Nikos(sp)) who work here were as top-notch as other salons who charge more for the same quality of services. I will be back-it is convenient, a great value. This salon is a Rogers Park hidden gem.

21.description: 7$ for amazing eyebrows is definitely worth it. I used to pay $15 up in Streeterville (same thing..different area code). I've been to at least 3 different people and they all did a great job - no complaints here.

17.description: waxed and threaded my eyebrows into shape!

10.description: First: they are now up a few blocks from the address I found when I Googled them. I'm not sure of the exact address, but you will find them on Sheridan between Pratt and Farwell.Went for threading service and it was great and affordable. I didn't stay long, but the overall vibe was down to earth, relaxed, and knowledgable. I got the sense that the staff enjoys working there and are customer service oriented.I'm looking forward to visiting again soon for a haircut and mani/pedi.

5.description: I looooove this place!  Carmen and Ashourina are super nice.  I cut my hair with Ashourina, Carmen's daughter.  I also do my eyebrows here.  I have curly hair and since I put myself in Ashourina's hands, my hair grows wicked fast and I am always happy with whatever she does.  I recommend them to anyone.  My mom loves the place too.  So do 2 of my nieces.  I really recommend them.

3.description: Carmen is a wonderful, personable lady. She knows about customer service and calls me by my name. She even offered me some pizza she bought. However, I get home from my full highlight (I used a coupon on the advertisement, which said it was $55...they charged me $65), and I notice there is a half inch of roots. I mean, it looks like I haven't gotten highlights in a month when I got them...yesterday. I really wanted to be proud of Carmen's work as I think she is a great lady, but the highlights were not well done at all. I'll have to get new highlights in a few weeks since she did not do them all the way to my roots.

35.description: I only go to Carmen's for threading, and my experiences have been mixed.  Generally, they do a good job with eyebrow threading, and it's fast and cheap here.   Price and convenience are the major reasons why I go here.  However, I've found that some of the staff are a little better than others.  I've never come out with creepy or overdone brows, but sometimes they look great, while other times, just okay.  The last two times I went in, the ladies who did my brows really hurt me!  I don't know what was different, but I was almost crying, and I've had threading lots of times before with no pain.  I think the lady I had last week was new.  Yeeeouch!   Occasionally, there seems to be a bit of a language barrier.  One time, the lady who was doing my brows asked me if I wanted something else done, and I told her no twice, but she did it anyway, and I was charged for it.   I don't think she understood me.      If you need some fast and cheap brow work, this will do, but I'm still interested in alternatives. I'm modifying my review, and upgrading my rating to 4 stars.  The last few times that I've gone to Carmen's for eyebrow threading, I've had the same person do them, and she is really good.  I think I'll stick with them for awhile.  Oh, the good threader's name is Marleen.  Tell her the short girl with the funky brows sent you.  :)

19.description: I can only recommend this salon for eyebrow threading. I do not recommend for waxing! They use some kind of refill roll-on wax gadgets....like Nair roll-on but with wax...totally ineffective and unsanitary! Unfortunately I didn't notice until after the wax that there was a big blond-ish looking pube stuck to the applicator...I'm a brunette and the carpet matches the drapes so that was _not_ my pube!!!Other than that, my eyebrow threading have been fine-though they seem to have different staff each time I go in and have a snit if I try to card the service.

28.description: The Apocalypse is upon us. It just cost me $40.00 for a trim and a blow dry at Carmen's. I just got boned. Never again.

45.description: I walked in and did not know what to make of the place, the music was bad and strange. It did not look very sanitary. The nail polishes I had never heard of.  I checked out this place because my friend worked close by, I was too uncomfortable to even entertain sitting through any services here. The owner talked to me about working for him and said that if an employee leaves without notice he would withhold their last paycheck. I told him that is against the law and left. WTF?

33.description: This place was absolutely HORRIBLE! So I don't know what everyone's raving about.  I walk in and some guy comes running up from a back room asking "what do you want?" in a rather rude tone when I said I wanted my eyebrows done he said "oh... she'll do it" as he walked away.  the woman he pointed to was sitting in her client chair picking at her nails.  WOW that's a wonderful first impression! So she sits me down and I tell her I want my eyebrows waxed  and she tries to push threading on me.  I was trying to not do threading since it hurts so damn bad! I insisted i wanted waxing so she then made me move over to the sinks to do my eyebrows.  That seemed kind of weird. I've never seen any salon do that.  Anyway she does the first eye and moving on to the next eye finally says "Is it too hot? If it is let me know" I was fine but she was over half done!  Afterwards she had slathered so much baby oil on my eyes and forehead I had it in my hair! She also had gotten wax in my hair. I'm not talkin my hairline either I'm talking like in the middle of my head.  She brings me back to the original seat and starts threading to clean it up.  They charge me and I go home.  SO i went home to shower bc I felt like a grease ball, look in the mirror and she did such a terrible job I had stray hairs all over!  The next day I woke up with a big line of pimples above both eyebrows... the worst part is that it was so bad I still have pimples all over my forehead a week later.  So unless you want to go home and shower afterwards, pluck your eyebrows after paying someone else, and deal with your face breaking out the price is not worth it!!

43.description: oh carmen's.  how you are a blast from my loyola days past.  here's the thing--you don't go here for great customer service & chatty stylists.  you don't go here for hair cuts, colors or manicures.  you go to get your eyebrows threaded for 5 freakin' bucks (although i have heard they raised the price).  my brows were AWESOME when i lived there-i had an arch like you've never even SEEN.  and you just can't beat the price.

2.description: Let me start by saying that I will never return to this place again. I used to go to Carmen's all through college at Loyola to get my eyebrows threaded. I lost track of them for a while when they moved locations and happened upon them again this July, at which point I went to get my eyebrows done for a wedding. It was awful. The woman who did mine refused to even out my eyebrows or trim the sides because she wanted them to be "natural." They looked awful, and I had people keep asking me why my eyebrows were uneven for a week. I stayed away for several months, but owing to the fact that they had always previously done a good job, I went back this past Saturday morning to get my eyebrows done for yet another wedding. I told the younger woman who was working there about my horrible experience in July and how I wanted to make sure I didn't get that employee again. Instead of apologizing for my terrible previous experience, she got angry at my and snapped at me that only she and her mother worked there (when I had been there in July, there were multiple people working there, so I have no idea what happened). She then gave me a very rough threading where she didn't bother to pluck out the strays afterwards and didn't bother to put anything on to soothe the skin. She was so rough that I now have a patch of scraped, scabbing skin below my left eyebrow. And they are slightly uneven. I beg you all not to support this business. If I could leave no stars I absolutely would. They deserve to be run out of business for treating a customer with such a complete lack of respect.

18.description: Update: very nice and very reasonable.  I got my back waxed and it was $40 and you should ask for Ashourina, who is great (but she is off on Mon and Wed)  Outstanding job, basically painfree and good conversation.Highly recommended!

41.description: I get my eyebrows threaded or waxed on a fairly regular basis but I tend to try new places out and not go to the same place twice.  This is one place I'll definitely go back to.  The lady that did my brows was very quick and as painless as the threading experience can be.  I thought she did a very good job.  My eyebrows are naturally asymmetrical and she actually managed to make them look a lot more symmetrical, which I've found to be rare.  I would highly recommend Carmen's for eyebrow threading.  Oh and it's $7 for anyone that was wondering.  Not as cheap as some places but still a very good deal in my opinion.

52.description: I had the one and only Carmen cut my hair today.  It turned out great, she's got some wonderful skills, and I just really enjoy my cut in general.However this place is a bit odd.  I walked in and immediately another girl tried to get me to get my eyebrows threaded.  Then she wanted to wash my hair, and I had just washed my hair (wasn't expecting to get a hair cut today) and so I declined. The place is awkward in a lot of ways, I didn't quite feel comfortable there.   It also cost more than I was expecting.  $25 dollars for only a cut.  $10 extra dollars for it styled! geez!  So I won't be going back even though I do like my haircut.

50.description: I walked in by chance, attracted by the "7.00 eyebrow threading" sign in the window.  I usually get my eyebrows threaded at a different place, but thought I'd try something new, and $7.00 is a deal, considering that the standard eyebrow waxing price is $15+.  I was pleasantly surprised after they threaded them.  The shape they did was impeccable, and it actually did not hurt nearly as much as other places I've gotten my brows threaded at.  I am a regular eyebrow customer there now, and have never been disappointed with anything.   I've had many different employees there do them, and they are all good, but I think the guy (I don't remember his name!)  is the best.I must say, this is not your typical pretentious salon.  It is obvious that it is family-run, and I think that really contributes to the friendly atmosphere.  They play ethnic music (I think it is Assyrian) which contributes to the laid-back atmosphere.  Gotta love this place, I highly recommend!!!

4.description: No muss, no fuss kind of place. The ladies seemed nice, threaded my brows quickly and I was outta there! They only allow card for $10 and over so if you get a thread ($7) they force you to do a $3 tip but for their services I would easily pay $10 anywhere else.  Or just bring cash and tip what, one dollar less? Your choice, but I have definitely found my new threading place in Chicago.

6.description: LOVE this place! I had no idea it was even there and I live right in the neighborhood. Super friendly and accommodating. I was in a jam to find a nearby place to get my eyebrows threaded and they even stayed open a little late for me just so I could come in. Thanks so much!

22.description: So, pretty much, my eyebrows had gotten completely out of control. I looked like Burt from Sesame Street. I fail at tweezing my own brows and I don't really care for waxing, so I decided to try threading at Carmens.I still don't understand how threading works, to be honest. Basically these cotton threads are dragged around your brows and the hair comes out. I'm good at scientific explanations.Anyway, I walked in and I said that I was in for a brow threading. I was immediately sat in a chair and leaned back. I told the threader that I didn't want thin brows - I just wanted to clean the current ones up.There was very little chit chat, she went right to business. I will say - it burns a bit. However, it was over in 2-3 minutes which was very tolerable. No pain no gain. The price was 7 bucks before tip and I have 2 beautifully sculpted brows. I couldn't ask for better looking brows, I love them!I will definitely be back. The price is right and it's so much less of a pain in the ass than waxing.

15.description: Ashourina does an amazing job on hair. I have thick, wavy hair that, on occasion, locks when it's wet. She knows exactly how to cut it so it looks sleek and sexy. And seriously, for the price? You just can't beat it. They also do threading which is also good.I'm giving 3 stars for their nail services. I had a mani done here once and that was absolutely the last time. I left with sore fingers and worried that I'd develop an infection from repeated deep-clipping of my cuticles. Also, the paint job was only so-so.  So, go for the hair and threading and you'll be a happy camper. Never get your nails done here, you'll be sorry if you do.

20.description: 2 years later and I still drive from the Gold Coast to Carmen's.Eyebrow threading is still the best deal around ($7). I confess...I've cheated a few times...and I always come crawling back with my tail between my legs.Any day but Tuesday go to Marleen and for the weekends go to Marleen or Ashirina. DON'T GO TO THE GUY...just....dont.

36.description: Ok, so I admit this place is seriously lacking in atmosphere, but their eyebrow threading is amazing.  It's cheap, and my brows have never looked so good.  I also had a cut and color by Carmen, and she did a great job.  I have curly hair and she did exactly what I asked, adding some nice layers and shaping it.  The best part is that the total for all of this was under 100 bucks.  I think I paid almost 200 last time I had a cut and highlights, so I would definitely be willing to go back.  Just don't expect a hand massage while you wait, or a comfortable chair.

14.description: So, pretty much, my eyebrows had gotten completely out of control. I looked like Burt from Sesame Street. I fail at tweezing my own brows and I don't really care for waxing, so I decided to try threading at Carmens.I still don't understand how threading works, to be honest. Basically these cotton threads are dragged around your brows and the hair comes out. I'm good at scientific explanations.Anyway, I walked in and I said that I was in for a brow threading. I was immediately sat in a chair and leaned back. I told the threader that I didn't want thin brows - I just wanted to clean the current ones up.There was very little chit chat, she went right to business. I will say - it burns a bit. However, it was over in 2-3 minutes which was very tolerable. No pain no gain. The price was 7 bucks before tip and I have 2 beautifully sculpted brows. I couldn't ask for better looking brows, I love them!I will definitely be back. The price is right and it's so much less of a pain in the ass than waxing.

3.description: Cute but hard to find art gallery in Rogers Park. I used to live a block away, otherwise there is no way I would have known about GAC. Very community oriented. They offer tons of classes, from figure drawing and painting to yoga and crafts for the little ones. Prices seem totally reasonable. Best of all they have parking and are just steps from the RP Metra station.

1.description: I LOVE GREENLEAF!!!!!!!I've been a longtime resident of Rogers park and this is yet another of those hidden gems that you are super surprised to find and once you do, hardly want to share, so that it will never change. But I can't resist.The owners, Kathie and Denis Paluch are the BEST. So down to earth, very rooted in the community and dedicate, heart and soul to each member and visitor. They live just around the corner and arrive at a moments notice to welcome guests and when issues arise in the studios. Heck, they've even lived in a tiny little house across the street and dreamed for years of buying the old car shop (or whatever it was) and turning into a creative haven for artists and creative-types.They have strong ties to former area artists such as Ed Pashke and curiosities like Chicago Reader  writer and author, Dan Savage and probably so many more I don't realize yet. I'm sure I could go on.But the very best part is the tremendous service they offer to artists in need of a harbor and a studio sanctuary. I'm LUCKY ENOUGH to be one of those. New to the studio space, but long time associate artist.The center offers several free gallery openings per year, where artists can sell their "wares" without commission. These shows are ALWAYS PACKED! There are also art salons, critiques, art supply/junk swaps, and so much more. But my FAVorite is the annual, and much anticipated road trip to Monroe Harbor for a boat ride and pllein aire painting session. I think it's even on the owners boat! worth joining just for that session! But join for the year. It's well worth the very low membership dues.They have two gallery openings this fall (2014): one is Oct. 5th and is part of the Rogers Park Artists guild art walk. The other is Friday evening, where all artists open their studios to the public. Really. Festive and full of inspiration.I can't say enough good things!

2.description: So cool - a hidden gem just west of the Rogers Park Metra. A couple times a year they have open studios and you can walk around and check out tons of art for free. It caters to working artists so the level of art is amazing. Rogers Park needs more places like thiis. If you catch the owners Kathie and Denis for a conversation you'll see how passionate they are about bringing culture to the masses.

0.description: I can't say enough great things about the Greenleaf Art Center.  Its truly a neighborhood gem and makes me sad to not live near it anymore as my kids would sign up for all the children's classes.The space is great - a beautiful restored factory building that opens into a busy Chicago neighborhood.  Last time I was there, the owners were working on even more improvements and I can't wait for my next visit.I have not taken any adult classes, but, have sat in on the kids classes and was very impressed with the lessons.  Kathie Paluch kept my kids happily working the whole time and I've found the lessons to be age appropriate.On the other hand, I have very much enjoyed a few of the Gallery Open Houses.  The "long hall" as you walk into the studio has a lot of really great completed work, most of it for sale.  But, as you wander through the studio you find that a large majority of the studios are open and the artists are happy to show you all their works in progress as well.  The artists are all so great - every one of them focusing on a different style/medium and each of them interesting in their own right.  Of course the drinks and snacks are fun and generous as well!  My only regret is that now that word has gotten out about the Spring and Fall Open Houses, they have become more busy.  Good for the artists and art center, not so good for those of us that have enjoyed a more personalized walk through the studios in the past!  Finally, in this busy Chicago neighborhood, parking is never an issue (well, unless you come during one of the bi-annual art shows, at which case, you shouldn't be driving anyway :)).

29.description: We just tried Yuen's - Yum! It's hidden in a tiny strip mall, so even though we live pretty close, we never even noticed it before. But we walked by a few of days ago and picked up a take-out menu and ordered delivery yesterday.We give it 4 stars instead of five becasue it's not the most amazxing, awesome food, but it's really, really good! So if they let you give 4.5 stars, that's what we would give it. The crab rangoon - very good. Not the best, but there's a good amount of tasty filing. Hubby really liked the fried rice. I loved the Singapore noodles - tasty and pretty spicy, just how I like it! The lo mein is done with a different type noodle than we are used to (a little thicker and flatter), but was good. And hubby special ordered the veggie delight with just veggies that he likes, and he loved it.For those of you keeping score, that's two loves, two really likes, and one like for the individual dishes.The delivery was fast (by a really nice guy), and it was fairly inexpensive. Win!

42.description: The food is fine - pretty standard fare for hole-in-the-wall Chinese.  There is parking for pick-ups and delivery is quick.  So why only 2 stars, you ask?  Because I don't appreciate the racist commentary about my neighbors that I got from the delivery driver.  Completely inappropriate and gross.  I won't be ordering from them again.

23.description: The only thing I give this restaurant credit for is: PRICE. otherwise, all their food tastes nothing but THE SAME. i don't think they wash their woks before cooking the next dishes... because regardless of what you order, you get the same exact flavor and smell. But what can you say? They ARE cheap. I like their beef hor fun, although it's really oily.

47.description: Yeun's only earns 4 stars for me because it is literally the only Chinese place that delivers to me that is not over-priced and is actually edible. The portions here are HUGE so it's quantity over (top)quality. The Tso's chicken was ok as well as the bbq pork with chinese greens. The fried rice here is delicious, especially the spicy kinds and they put the large size in this oversized square box that weighs 5 pounds and takes me 2 days to eat. The egg drop soup has fresh sliced green onions on it that gives it a very earthy flavor. The chicken almond ding is very different tasting but is obviously made with freshly cut vegetables and although maybe a little bland touches up nicely with a bit of salt. If you order enough food you get some free chicken wings that are also fantastic.Anyways, bottom line, if your pockets are hurting and you're hungry this is the place that satisfies without putting you on the street.

8.description: Combination Lo Mein: 2 pieces of shrimp +  5 pieces of beef + 5 pieces of chicken + 50 pieces of vegetables = $9.00. Garlic Chicken should be called "Vegetables and Other Fillers over Some Pieces of Garlic Chicken".

31.description: Order from somewhere else!We've ordered from them twice and each time they've forgotten the sauce for the Mu Shu Pork. Each time we call & they say they'll send some but then never do. The first time, after repeated calls about the MIA sauce, they offered us a refund only on the dollar value of the sauce, about a dollar. Each time they promise to deliver but it never gets delivered. We eventually got the sauce after an hour of waiting.All of this wouldn't have been so bad except the first time, the person on the phone barely spoke English and it was difficult trying to get them to understand the situation. The 2nd time, the woman on the phone was the rudest person I've spoken to in years. She kept sighing and asking if I was sure I wanted the sauce. She single-handedly made me furious over something that should have been trivial. If she hadn't been so rude about us wanting the sauce I would have given them a better rating, and we may have ordered from them in the future. But it's not worth it. 100% of the times we've ordered from them our order is wrong and there's serious difficulties trying to get the correct order.The other food (pot stickers, egg rolls, Beef with Borccoli) was average at best.

34.description: Not bad. Ordered the lunch special, via Grub Hub. He got the Rib Tips with garlic sauce. I got the Mongolian chicken. Both were alright, hit the spot when you crave TV and Chinese food.Its great! Comes with a myriad of fried rice choices, an eggroll (not good) and a pop for like 5.50. Cheap.Portions are OUTTA CONTROL large. Leftovers for a few meals. The Rangoon. YEEEES PLEASE. Large, fully stuffed. Good. Not like other places that just give you crunchy fried batter. These are mainly creamy filling. Though they don't come with sauce.

16.description: Not bad. Ordered the lunch special, via Grub Hub. He got the Rib Tips with garlic sauce. I got the Mongolian chicken. Both were alright, hit the spot when you crave TV and Chinese food.Its great! Comes with a myriad of fried rice choices, an eggroll (not good) and a pop for like 5.50. Cheap.Portions are OUTTA CONTROL large. Leftovers for a few meals. The Rangoon. YEEEES PLEASE. Large, fully stuffed. Good. Not like other places that just give you crunchy fried batter. These are mainly creamy filling. Though they don't come with sauce.

13.description: Worst Chinese I've had in a long time. Food was stale and dry. Inside place seemed run down.

11.description: Second time I've been here and was ok the first time, but this was awful. The sauce for the S&S chicken tasted metallic, I got the worst egg rolls I've ever had (I'm pretty sure they were old toilet paper rolls) and God tried to warn me but I didn't listen... Pad Thai. Usually, something that tastes pretty much the same wherever you go (unless you try the instant microwave kind... do not do this thing), but this was absolutely inedible. Granted, they are a Chinese restaurant, but I was naive for thinking it would be ok. The almost nonexistent meat was chewy and weird, I asked for spicy and it didn't happen, but the overall taste was just rude. I had to throw it away.In the issue of fairness, it was a large portion (that got thrown away) and everything was very hot and quick.

39.description: The food is good and definitely fast.We got the chicken fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, and crab rangoons. I am really picky about crab rangoons and was pleasantly surprised. I usually prefer them to be sweeter but these were still tasty.

37.description: ok where should I start here??? The price is cheaper than others, portion was fine and food was good. I've had better but c'mon u for the price it is actually a very fast delivery and good portion food. I got the beef pepper tomato and hot sour soup. Beef pepper needed bit season or salt. Hot and sour soup should be named hot and sweet soup. It was little bit different than others. My bf always gets orange chicken and fried rice/he is a taster of those two believe me/ As long as he didn't complain about his dishes I will give them an A. Crab rangoonS/8 for 4.50 can you believe it???/ are perfect!!! Over all until I find better place around my neighborhood I will get my Chinese from there!!!

0.description: Their orange chicken is the best. If you order delivery they will fill your box over the top! Love this place!!

38.description: Portion size outweighs the food quality.  I would rather have half the portion they serve with better quality ingredients, the meat is low grade.  I don't know why people can't understand that: Low Prices + Big Porions = Low Quality FoodStill haven't found really good Chinese takeout in RP.

27.description: Great value. Had schezuan shrimp. Asked for broccoli but there wasn't any. Other veggies were a bit overcooked and the eggroll was a bit undercooked. The large veggie soup is great and super good value.  For $5-$6 lunch combos you can't go wrong.

32.description: Had Yuen's delivered via GrubHub and was thoroughly impressed. Delicious Szechuan shrimp and broccoli and some of the most flavorful hot and sour soup I've ever had. I even liked my boyfriends egg foo young, which I usually hate. Also, the portions are huge, which is great... 6 meals for $30, not too bad!

48.description: What do you do when you're desperate to satisfy your hunger pangs on a cold misty evening at 8:30pm? You go to Yuens and order their combination spicy fried rice and the best fried chicken wings this side of town! Prices are reasonable (Fried Chicken wings: 3pcs for $2.50; 6 pcs for $3.50 - they give you the entire wing, not sections). Their small size orders put others to shame as you get a lot. And again, prices are pretty good. If you live in the area, it's worth a try. Otherwise they deliver as well.

44.description: LOTS of food for little money! And it's tasty too.   We had mongolian chicken (which I've never had with chicken before) and it was WAAY spicy but so good i couldn't stop eating it even tho my mouth was on fire.  And also had the kung pao chicken, again amazingly spicy but very good.  Not as good as the mongolian I thought.  But then again, i'm not a huge peanut fan,  and there's lots of peanuts in it. We also had the potstickers which were possibly handmade...they were very thick and full and juicy and really good. For $5 for a small, you get a ton of food.  Each container gave us two meals!  I'm going there again.  I've posted pix of our meal.

24.description: Kind of indifferent towards Yuen's.It's not bad food, but also not OMG AMAZING. Just your standard American Chinese food.Ordered Mongolian Beef, which seemed to be more veggies than beef. It came with chicken fried rice (which it took me a while to find the chicken), and an egg roll. Apparently for them, fried wontons means just deep fried wonton warpers, no filling at all. (But based on the price I wasn't too surprised.) Happy they called me to tell me they were out of watermelon for their smoothies--well, not happy they were out, but glad they called to find out what I wanted instead. Strawberry, not bad, but the watermelon was sort of why I picked Yuen's.I think my biggest complaint was how long it took. It's only a five minute drive, yet it still took an hour for it to arrive. (Thinking they use a delivery service 'cause the old dude who brought me my food didn't even know that I had paid already.)Won't be my go-to place, but it'll do.

7.description: Yuen's rules! Seriously. The portions are large and the food is classic Chinese takeout. We order here almost every week!

40.description: Food was super cheap but C- in taste.We got Veggie Delight, Broccoli & Tofu in brown sauce, and Veggie Lo Mein.

30.description: Decent-ish.. Big portions, but even with ordering "extra meat", I was underwhelmed as it was mainly veggie filler.. Pot stickers were doughy (good for me, bad for the wife) and egg rolls were good.. Crab Rangoon was so-so, though better than some places.. Fried pretty hard, and and a decent amount of cheese.Schezuan combo was meh.. Chicken was overcooked, beef was a bit tough, just bland.. Very much so for the Mongolian Beef.. tough, so-so flavor, a bit of heat, but nothing that stands out.Overall it's better than some places I've tried, worse than others.. Delivery was a little over an hour via Grubhub to Uptown.

46.description: Yuen's chinese kitchen serves good food at an amazing price.  I stop by this place at least once a week to get the lunch specials and fried noodles.  This is one of the few places that you can get Pan Fried noodles also and it's delicious.  I can buy one dinner at 7 bucks and split it to 3 meals, what a bargain.  They also use considerably less fat and grease than other Chinese restaurants in the area as well.  Rib Tips are a popular item as well, 4 bucks for a large portion of rib tips, rice and a drink, you can't go wrong.Good food +  large portions + small price = great stuff

1.description: Don't order anything expensive. Low quality here. I placed an order for Garlic shrimp + extra shrimp and vegetables for delivery. It wasn't made the way I ordered with garlic sauce. But made with tons of Hunan sauce/gravy, way too little shrimp (I counted) and few vegetables. Tasted like I was eating salt.However, the double happiness fried rice is good and made fresh the first time I ordered it. Be careful about your meat orders and the special instructions. You won't get what you paid for.

9.description: I've definitely had better fried rice. I mean, it was edible, but I won't be coming back here again.

26.description: I was a little skeptical about ordering food from a strip mall..however-we ordered quite a bit-veggie fried rice, veggie egg rolls, schezwan broccoli, lo mein, and vegetable delight all of which were pretty good. They use a different sized noodle for the lo mein though..wider and thicker than normal. I would order again for sure.

25.description: Hurts business when there is no website or online menu......................it's 2012 people.

12.description: Good lord! Grease, grease, and more grease. We ordered Beef with Broccoli, Szechuan Chicken, and Veggie Egg Rolls. The egg rolls were boring and I remember thinking, "How can you mess up egg rolls? They're deep fried deliciousness." I became more concerned when I got to the main dishes. I had to put plastic bags under them because they were dripping oil. Why are they so oily?? They both had lots of veggies but they were so drenched in oil that it didn't matter. Also, we asked for spicy and neither dish delivered. Were the portions large? Yes, but I can't imagine eating any more. I feel uncomfortably full and the meal was bland.

21.description: Good standard Chinese fair with ample sized portions. Not the best Chinese food around but you do get alot of bang for your buck.

17.description: So I had to write about Yuen's. I haven't had the best of luck with Chinese delivery restaurants on the Northside of Chicago. Actually, delivery in general. The food is usually not great or their delivery takes for ever. Now I've ordered from Yuen's twice and both times, they've surprised me.I first ordered from here back in December...they estimated 45-50 minutes for my delivery time when I ordered online via GrubHub, which I expected considering it was a Saturday evening. The delivery guy showed up in 20 minutes. My food was hot and actually pretty good. I ordered from there again today (another Saturday evening) and, once again, GrubHub said it would take 45-50 minutes to get here. The delivery guy showed up in 25 minutes! And once again, my food is pretty damn good!Yuen's is now my go-to Chinese place on the Northside! Hopefully I don't move anytime soon because it took me almost 2 years to find a place I actually liked!

10.description: Have had no end of delivery problems with this place. Half the time, the delivery people cannot find my address (I live four blocks away!). Other times, they cannot figure out how to punch in the code for more doorbell. More than once, I have placed an order online, received a confirmation email, and had no food arrive. Then, when I called, they would tell me "something's wrong" with their online system, and they never got my order! I am done with place.

5.description: I ordered here once a few months ago and I've never ordered since. I got the chicken fried rice and it was awful. It tasted just horrible like if it went bad. I don't recommend this place.

3.description: Good Fast and Delicious! The only Chinese place I order from. Always Fast, always hot and fresh!

35.description: I like Yuens.  It is consistently good Chinese food.  I like the pan fried noodle dishes and excellent Mongolian beef.  Huge portions are a plus.

19.description: Big, big portions for a decent price.  When I worked closer to the place, I went there often for lunch.  I always ended up taking half the food home for dinner.  Yuen's is one of the more decent Chinese food restaurants in Rogers Park.  I wish their pop/soda selection was more diverse, but I have no complaints about their food.

28.description: It's no-frills Chinese food.  What I like is they have our food ready for pickup within 15 minutes.  They also give super big portions.  Even a small will have leftovers.

45.description: Hot, fresh, tasty, fast delivery. Good meats, plentiful veggies, huge portions. Different dishes actually taste...well, different. Pot stickers rock. Lo mein also a winner. All the soups are great. Egg foo dishes are in a heavy brown sauce that I'm not a fan of, but that's just a personal taste thing. As far as Chinese take-out goes, Yuen's is a top-notch value.

33.description: yuen's has great food huge portions and their smoothie line is wonderful..i like the pina colada smoothie..have ordered from them time and time again and will continue to do so..

43.description: Fresh, not so greasy, traditional Americanized Chinese food. It's cheap and I'm a fan.

2.description: We ordered shrimp fried rice..Rice was well cooked spicy, seasoned But main hero of the rice which is 'Shrimp' was not cleaned  They are not deveined.. They just serve like that..Unclean shrimp cause serious health problems.

18.description: Kind of indifferent towards Yuen's.It's not bad food, but also not OMG AMAZING. Just your standard American Chinese food.Ordered Mongolian Beef, which seemed to be more veggies than beef. It came with chicken fried rice (which it took me a while to find the chicken), and an egg roll. Apparently for them, fried wontons means just deep fried wonton warpers, no filling at all. (But based on the price I wasn't too surprised.) Happy they called me to tell me they were out of watermelon for their smoothies--well, not happy they were out, but glad they called to find out what I wanted instead. Strawberry, not bad, but the watermelon was sort of why I picked Yuen's.I think my biggest complaint was how long it took. It's only a five minute drive, yet it still took an hour for it to arrive. (Thinking they use a delivery service 'cause the old dude who brought me my food didn't even know that I had paid already.)Won't be my go-to place, but it'll do.

41.description: Cheap quick eats that satisfy.

4.description: If there was a way to give this restaurant a negative star I surely would. This is the very first time that I would have ordered, because I heard the food was very good that's only if you can get past the RUDE SERVICE. The guy that answered the phone was beyond ignorant. He would cut me off while trying to order and seemed as if I was bothering him. Also it says they open at 11am, well they did not get there until 1130. My coworker ordered from this place just 2 days ago and I was rudely told they don't deliver to this location and then he hung up on me. I would suggest NOT going to/ordering from this establishment unless you are a fan of rude and unprofessional behavior.

6.description: I ordered online (Yelp Eats maybe) and I was there in about 20 minutes, a few minutes longer than my usual place tells me on the phone. (It was sort of weird going for an ASAP pickup and only being told to come in 10-30 minutes.) The food was super hot and neatly packaged. Everything was tasty, with the exception of the egg foo young, but not many places nail that dish in my book. (Hunan Spring does good, but their s&s dishes sport reconstituted pickles like a cheap burger joint.) It's nice because there is a parking lot off Clark St., but the logistics of the lot are always bad. I've been to a gyro place next door a few times and the lot is just too small for the obligatory idiot. This time the obligatory idiot was Yeuns delivery guy. He sat blocking my entrance to the lot from Clark St for quite a while, then parked diagonally in 2 spots. When I got inside, I was asked to wait a few minutes, then had some delivery instructions for the driver that had followed me inside.

22.description: Okay, so I love Chinese food and I've had this place before and it was decent so I thought i would go for it again. i ordered the General's chicken dinner that included fried rice w/ egg roll and a pop. I also ordered pot-stickers and I could have tripped myself for doing so. The pot-stickers were so gooey and just all wrong, I couldn't get past the second bite so to the trash they went. The General's chicken was kinda of edible but it had an interesting after taste that made you questioned what the hell they cooked the food in. I took a few bites and vetoed the the chicken as well. Finally I got the rice and egg roll. The rice tasted like they cooked it in a pan that wasn't cleaned b/c it has a soap/chemical taste to it and the eggroll was FOUL. It tasted sour and looked like someone dropped a crap load of cinnamon in the eggroll....I took a bite, looked inside and threw it away just as I did with the other food. Everything was nasty except for the canned pop! Negative on Yuen's Chinese Kitchen, I rather eat noodles!

15.description: Ordered, and they never showed up. We called them, they would not pick up.Do not order from this poser "Chinese" POS!!!

20.description: So I had to write about Yuen's. I haven't had the best of luck with Chinese delivery restaurants on the Northside of Chicago. Actually, delivery in general. The food is usually not great or their delivery takes for ever. Now I've ordered from Yuen's twice and both times, they've surprised me.I first ordered from here back in December...they estimated 45-50 minutes for my delivery time when I ordered online via GrubHub, which I expected considering it was a Saturday evening. The delivery guy showed up in 20 minutes. My food was hot and actually pretty good. I ordered from there again today (another Saturday evening) and, once again, GrubHub said it would take 45-50 minutes to get here. The delivery guy showed up in 25 minutes! And once again, my food is pretty damn good!Yuen's is now my go-to Chinese place on the Northside! Hopefully I don't move anytime soon because it took me almost 2 years to find a place I actually liked!

36.description: The food is good and the delivery is fast...what more could you ask for? Oh yeah and the price is right! Love this little place

14.description: The best Chinese food takeout place in Rogers Park. You can order online and get lunch and dinner specials, and orders are ready for pickup within 15 minutes. Large portions, rich tasting food, and great service!

28.description: The ham/cheese sammy was amazing!!! We also had some delicious iced coffees which made the mango doughnut taste like heaven.

1.description: "This ain't F****n around shit!" - True DetectiveOh.my.gawd.Coffee was great.Doughnut was great.Cheese biscuit egg sandwich was great.You need to go there.  Right now.

9.description: Thank you yelpers for this tucked-away powerhouse of a breakfast place. It is just a small counter with a little chalkboard menu, but everything made here is made with love. You can't go wrong with the cheddar biscuits, and I highly recommend having it with fried egg and bacon jam. I had mine with a cold brew coffee but the person I went with had a cherry syrup iced tea that made me regret my choice. No doubt, this place gets all the stars.

29.description: The iced coffee is killer good, the herbed biscuits - wow. I really like that they buy local. Always friendly and they seem to want to get to know their customers. Everything is quality here. Also right off morse stop - we needed a coffee shop here!!

23.description: This place popped out of nowhere, and it's one of my favorite neighborhood lazy weekend stops. It's literally placed in the hallway between 2 bars, but that doesn't make a difference. The coffee is amazing, the cheesy biscuit with egg is quickly becoming a staple in my diet, and the people are great. Being placed in a dog friendly neighborhood, they allow dogs to come in, and greet them with a homemade bacon treat. It's a little pricey, but well worth it.

5.description: Good made with love and good humor.  The smack dab crew are always up early, working hard and smiling.  The food is delicious, and I do mean delicious.  Savory biscuits that melt in your mouth (thank you butter), sweets that make you drool.  My fav is the egg biscuit with bacon (yes, bacon) jam, and a Concord grape donut to finish off.  If you a fan of coffee, you must try it with their awesome homemade syrup.Must try!  Say Bonjour for me.

31.description: Terrific coffee counter steps from the Morse red line entrance. It's adorable! Such sweet, friendly staff too. Halfwit coffee has smooth, full flavor; so glad to have coffee options this close to the train. And the frequent visitor punch card helps remind me to keep coming back!

25.description: Amazing vegan doughnuts, super friendly staff. They really care about everything they put out. I'm not sure if I come here on a weekly basis because of the Glenwood Sunday Market, or to the market every Sunday because of their doughnuts... Either way, something has me hooked and I'm not complaining!

12.description: I'm not a huge coffee person, or a huge pastry person, but someone on yelp said something about cheesy biscuits and I had to know. I love biscuits. Love them. Eat most of my meals with a biscuit. Not really, but kind of.Anyway, this cheesy biscuit breaks my top 5 list. Number 2 behind my grandma's cheesy drop biscuits. Cheese-y. Herb-y. Light and flaky. It doesn't get better than that.Also, now I have somewhere between my apartment and the train to grab breakfast, and that's worth five stars in it's own right.

37.description: The coffee and pastry counter is open from 7:30 - 11:30 during the workweek. We were lucky that they were open today (Memorial Day) so that we could drop in. The coffee was great -- drip coffee only with simple syrup to sweeten it, which I hope means there will be iced coffee once it gets a bit warmer. Aside from coffee, I had the zucchini and cheddar scone. I would say it was somewhere between a scone and a biscuit -- extremely light, a bit sweet, completely delicious. I was loathe to share it with my husband. He got the strawberry shortbread which was a bit over caramelized on he bottom, but the strawberry filling was extremely good. Super convenient given their proximity to the red line and the owners are completely delightful.

21.description: Potent iced coffee! Delicious egg sandwich!Yum! Yum! Yum! I'll be back.I am so glad they are open on Saturday now.

16.description: The coffee and pastry counter is open from 7:30 - 11:30 during the workweek. We were lucky that they were open today (Memorial Day) so that we could drop in. The coffee was great -- drip coffee only with simple syrup to sweeten it, which I hope means there will be iced coffee once it gets a bit warmer. Aside from coffee, I had the zucchini and cheddar scone. I would say it was somewhere between a scone and a biscuit -- extremely light, a bit sweet, completely delicious. I was loathe to share it with my husband. He got the strawberry shortbread which was a bit over caramelized on he bottom, but the strawberry filling was extremely good. Super convenient given their proximity to the red line and the owners are completely delightful.

17.description: Smack Dab! in the middle if your taste buds is where this friendly little bake shop will impress you. The cheddar biscuits: sublime. The bacon jam: heavenly. I will be back to try more of the offerings at Smack Dab!, and it will be soon. If you do nothing else mew and different this year, treat yourself to a Smack Dab! I believe you will never regret it.

10.description: The vegan donuts were amazing. The coffee was good and the cheese biscuit sandwiches were very very good. Definitely will be going back for weekend breakfast!

11.description: Interesting location.   Iced coffee was good.    The biscuits with cheese were excellent.    This was a great place to stop for coffee and a pastry.

26.description: Great coffee, amazing pastries and delicious breakfast sandwiches. Check it out ya fucks. Don't be cheap, tip well! See you all there.

27.description: I'm not a huge coffee person, or a huge pastry person, but someone on yelp said something about cheesy biscuits and I had to know. I love biscuits. Love them. Eat most of my meals with a biscuit. Not really, but kind of.Anyway, this cheesy biscuit breaks my top 5 list. Number 2 behind my grandma's cheesy drop biscuits. Cheese-y. Herb-y. Light and flaky. It doesn't get better than that.Also, now I have somewhere between my apartment and the train to grab breakfast, and that's worth five stars in it's own right.

35.description: This is the cutest, most pleasant coffee counter I've ever stopped in! Christine was super friendly and greeted me and my SO so warmly. I heartily recommend one of their cheddar asparagus biscuits. This is a down-to-earth, local/organic presence that Rogers Park is blessed to have!

8.description: Cheese biscuit and egg. AMAZING. Slightly addictive! The strawberry rhubarb pastry was really good, though on the pricey side. Coffee was great too. Great hidden gem inside of Red Line Tap.

0.description: This place is seriously amazing. The owners and people who work there are all so friendly and take the time to chat a with you. I've gotten different pastries from there but the blueberry donut is seriously the best! Today I tried the cheese biscuit with egg and bacon jam (sounded strangely good) - it is seriously one of the best things I have ever eaten in my life. They are such a great local business and I love stopping by when I have a chance. Definitely check this place out!

20.description: The stuff tastes home made. Pretty glad money CAN buy it. I've had two of the donuts and the biscuit. Won't miss a chance to try something every Sunday market day now.

19.description: Finally got to check this place out and I LOVE IT! I'm so happy Rogers park finally got a good coffee shop with very friendly workers. The coffee selection is delicious ( enjoy drinking it black) and the pastries are to die for! The cheesy biscuit was so good but my favorite was the fruit tart pie( not sure of the name) with apples and cherries. Can't wait to frequent this place more often. And the people that work there are so friendly and make it so enjoyable to go there. You can tell the baker really has a passion for what she does ( which is the best part about this place)  and she is good at it :)

33.description: I had a reasonably-priced herb biscuit. Very tasty, and the service was extremely friendly!

2.description: I made a special trip to Smack Dab, because all the Rogers Park people I know keep raving about this place.It is a very small shop, adjacent to the Morse Red Line stop. I got a coffee to go, as always -- their only sweetener is some organic liquid (agave, maybe?), and that was good. I liked the coffee very much.Since I don't anticipate visiting every day, I got a cheesy biscuit to eat then and a blueberry tart thing for later. The cheesy biscuit is the savory selection. I was pleasantly surprised how light it was; I kind of expected it to be heavy, but it was far far from the dreaded "hockey puck" density. Delicious.I saved the blueberry tart for dessert after dinner. it, too, was light and flavorful. It had a really nice texture, and a flavor that was not overpowering or too sweet. Definitely not a savory treat, which it doesn't aim to be. The sweetness and texture were just right. Yummy.To all my friends who live north of Devon Avenue -- you were right. Smack Dab is worth making a special trip. Everything was outstanding. Highly recommended!

34.description: Stopped in early and had a delicious piece of almond toast and a cold brew. Very friendly and quick service, will definitely come in again!

32.description: This has absolutely terrific coffee. I'm particularly fond of their cold brew. They make their own in-house almond milk, which is hella impressive. Love the organic cream, personally, instead. And I always get tempted by their baked treats in the morning. So far, I've had berry tarts, cheesy biscuits, almond toast, and cinnamon toast there and they were all exceptional! Very convenient to the Morse stop. Love that this place opened up here! Oh, and Christine is super friendly and just a joy to talk to every morning. She makes this place even more awesome than it already is!

18.description: This is the cutest, most pleasant coffee counter I've ever stopped in! Christine was super friendly and greeted me and my SO so warmly. I heartily recommend one of their cheddar asparagus biscuits. This is a down-to-earth, local/organic presence that Rogers Park is blessed to have!

13.description: They are now reopened in their new shared space with the Red Line Tap (7006 N. Glenwood) and just reopened this Thursday 11/19/15.Our first time today - great cheesy biscuits (my preference), we went with savory jam (tomato on one side, onion on the other). Sweet butter biscuits were also available (grape vs. pumpkin butter). Did give the vegan donut a try with the tropical mango starfruit glaze (grape glaze was the other option this morning)...but preferred their fruit cream tart pastry which is a must try. They also had a tea cake and a pastry bar as well we didn't try. They accept credit card as a plus.

4.description: A limited choice of coffee but it's been consistently delicious. No espresso drinks. Amazing pastries. I love that it's located inside of a bar/club.

24.description: Who needs friendly neighborhood business with great coffee and cheesy biscuits? Everyone. That is only among the many reasons this place is amazing. Smack Dab is a must for the early morning commute or to fuel a stroll through the farmers market on Sunday. Mmm homemade pastries.

6.description: I expected something more. I went thinking I could get more than hot or cold coffee so was disappointed but the guy working was nice and the iced coffee was good so I got over it.The desserts were few so more in terms of selection would be nice.

22.description: A little over priced, but the people who work there are fantastic! they are so friendly. Its also conveniently located near the train. P.S The fruit tarts, and the cheese biscuits are delicious!

15.description: Smack dab between the Pub [I had to use it], the supper club, and the Glenwood Sunday Market, sits this sassy coffee and pastry counter, serving cheap but tasty fruit filled/laced/inspired goodies.

7.description: Just visited for the first time. Wow what a super friendly and awesome staff. Very laid back, excellent suggestions and easy to relate to. Great biscuits! I got the egg biscuit with bacon jam and devoured it. A great union of sweet and savory. I should have gotten a second one. Cinnamon rolls were warm and perfect. They also have vegan selections as well. Great pastries made in house (doughnuts, cookies and tarts).

36.description: Smack dab between the Pub [I had to use it], the supper club, and the Glenwood Sunday Market, sits this sassy coffee and pastry counter, serving cheap but tasty fruit filled/laced/inspired goodies.

30.description: This place is everything you could want in a coffee shop! The coffee is of course great, however the thing that makes this shop so incredible are the two lovely owners. I feel like I've stumbled out of my apartment and into the happiest and most welcoming place in the world. The cute decor is icing on the cake.... or on whatever wonderful pastry they have baked up that morning!

3.description: OMG!! Their cheese biscuit egg sandwich with tomato jam is great! The place is so great and closer to the Redline-morse stop. I read so much about their donuts and I am definitely coming back on the weekend to try them.

14.description: Who needs friendly neighborhood business with great coffee and cheesy biscuits? Everyone. That is only among the many reasons this place is amazing. Smack Dab is a must for the early morning commute or to fuel a stroll through the farmers market on Sunday. Mmm homemade pastries.

12.description: I've been seeing Brian for over a year now and he's fantastic.  If you are like me and enjoy a deep massage he's by far the best.  He's really commited to making you feel you great and if he knows there's a spot that's really troubling you he'll make sure he really works it (even if it means going over your alloted time).  I highly recommend giving Brian a chance if you are looking for a regular massage therapist, you won't be disappointed.

3.description: 5 stars all the way!Brian is a true  professional! I am so happy to have found someone locally who is this good! I have had several sessions with him and he is amazingly talented at what he does. I got tired of trying various locations though some stupid Groupon or whatever and finally yelped and found him! He is highly  experienced  in numerous types of massage and he is extremely personable, immediately putting you at ease. He has a really good feel for what your body needs and when. I would highly recommend him to everyone !!!!!

1.description: He listens. Then, he let's you slide into relaxation as he applies his expertise. Brian knows how to encourage both your detachment, to ease away tension, as well as focus, so you can recreate the bliss when you're off the table. While it's difficult to give him 5 stars knowing that means he may be so swamped with business he can't fit me in, I hope someone else finds health and healing in a partnership with Brian. 5 it is!

2.description: I have been to Brian on several occasions and he is excellent. The one thing that makes him stand out is his focused intensity.  He is very thoughtful and responsive to what my body needs. I have never had to tell what pressure I need as he is very intuitive. I recommend him to All. It also doesn't hurt that he is nice person.

9.description: You can get a massage anywhere in the city - but don't bother looking around.  Brian is a natural...with fear of sounding cheesy...healer.  He's all about welness, posture, and stress relief, and he has a comforting presence about him.  If I could afford it, I would come see him every day.  The setting isn't like your typical snooty over-priced spa, but instead is more like someone's home.  I cannot say enough good things, just go and find out for yourself.  I originally found out about him through a friend who said how great he is.  She was right; so am I.

10.description: I first went to Brian on the recommendation of a musician friend of mine who also suffers from severe tension. As a performer myself, I carry a lot of tension throughout the whole of my body. Brian is wonderful, a real professional with a gift for intoning healing calm and relaxation in his clients, a thing of which I am in great need. One of the things that struck me immediately is how quickly he can pinpoint exact places in need of release, also his attention to detail not only of what the body needs but the levels of pressure that the person can take. Brain is fluent in various techniques (including reflexology) and uses them throughout the sessions. He's also adamant about a "no-after-pain" massage, he wants to know immediately if something is not feeling good, during and post massage. Seriously, just the nicest guy too! You won't be disappointed.

4.description: What do you do when your college student daughter calls and says her back hurts? You go to yelp, look up massage therapists and hope for the best-and we found the bestBrian taught her so much about posture, stress, working out, that she continues to see him once a month-he listens to her questions and she always sounds happy when she finishes an appointment- Of course he handled the issue that she first went for.He's great

6.description: Wow.   I have been to a number of massage therapists over the years.  The only thing that makes me sad is that I found Brian after leaving a job where I had insurance that would have paid for massages.  Now I have no insurance at all.    I should have checked Yelp sooner.I first went to Brian after spending a week not being able to make a fist with my left hand.  Having no insurance and not being able to do my job in such a state, I did the logical thing.  I googled my health problem.  I have had various RMI problems with my hands and wrists over the years, ( thank you  ( GiantCoffeeCorporation!! ) and figured it was more of the same kinds of stuff but worse.  One of the things I found talked about massage, and yoga and all of that good stuff.  Being someone who does believe all of that can help, I thought, "Hmm.  Massage.  That probably WOULD help a lot."  When I saw Brian's Yelp reviews and his location,  about 1 block from me, I decided to try him.  Wow.He found a knot in my shoulder.  When he worked on said knot,  I could feel the release in my hand.  It was amazing.  I know that sounds hokey, but damn.  And after a couple of sessions, my hand problem was gone.  It's true what everyone else says about him.  He really is that amazing.  I am not a girl to schlep all over the city.  For anything.  But I would travel to Beverly to get massages from Brian.

15.description: I made an appointment and then had to cancel it at Skylight Wellness.  Brian sent me back an extremely rude email about how he had to juggle things around to fit me in and he was sure I would keep experiencing pain if I didn't come in to see him.  It was a very unprofessional guilt trip.  As long as I didn't violate the cancellation policy, I should not have been reprimanded like a child.  I will NOT be returning here EVER.

0.description: I've been working with Brian for about 6 months now and I'm becoming a bigger fan with each visit. As a hair stylist I spend about 10 hours a day on my feet. On my first visit he accurately pinpointed some of the common issues in my industry; something I was definitely impressed with. Since then, we've gotten much more customized to what my specific issues are without having to rehash an in-depth consult on each visit.On a service level, I really appreciate Brian's professionalism and attention to detail with a laid back demeanor. Brian's hands (and sometimes a nice elbow) paired his knowledge about posture and balance have become a much needed tool against the aches and pains that often come with my occupation. High marks all around.

5.description: Brian at Skylight Wellness gave me the best deep tissue massage I have EVER had. He is knowledgable, comfortable, professional and so in tuned with his clients. They also offer other services such as acupuncture, etc. Their space is beautiful, and the staff is phenomenal.

13.description: I love going to Brian for massages. He really gets the tight spots and the bonus is that he helps you with tips about posture and how to stretch. He cares a lot about his clients' well being and does a fantastic job!

11.description: Brian's massage work is both therapeutic and relaxing.  He is super knowledgeable about the body and its functions.  I also get positive results from his massages.

8.description: Brian is a miracle worker. I have been to different MT's in the past and he by far is the best. His knowledge and complete understanding of the muscular and skeletal system provides him with the tools to individualize your problem and target the area that most needs work. He has given me several tools and tips to continue my healing on my own, ie posture, stance, etc. He truly is a healer. You will leave his serene, unpretentious space feeling a million times better than when you walked in. Brian is the best kept secret in the Massage Therapy world.

14.description: I can not say enough good things about Brian Chambers and Skylight Wellness. I too, like many of the other reviewers, have been seeing Brian for years whenever I can afford a massage, and I have yet to get a massage anywhere else that can rival Brian's. I always feel 10 times better after a session with him, and if I have a certain body complaint, Brian will always address it. Further more, besides being the best massage therapist I've ever gone to, Brian is an amazing person. He really cares about his clients and will bend over backwards to make them feel comfortable and to try to make a massage financially feasible. Do yourself a huge favor and book a massage with him immediately!

7.description: Thanks to Brian my neck pain is gone.  Brian has a holistic approach to massage with extensive knowledge of anatomy and kinesiology. He discusses what to do between appointments to maintain posture and health. I work long hours and thought that I might have to switch jobs; my body was not recovering.  Now I know that I can continue and I am feeling more relaxed and capable after every massage.

58.description: Do NOT order delivery from here! This review is for a delivery order. I'm gonna keep this simple. 1. The food arrived 1 hour late. No exaggeration. 2. The food was cold and the texture of the rice and proteins (fish and chicken) made it seem like the food was not prepared to order. The rice was stale, the fish and chicken both dry and tough. The chicken tasted like it had been covered in saran wrap and reheated in a microwave. 3. The phone number listed goes straight to a recording. We were unable to get a hold of anyone from the restaurant to check on our order. 4. The delivery driver finally called us en route because she could not find our address and needed directions. When she arrived 2 hours after we placed our order, she said our food was late because she "needed to get gas."I'm being generous with 2 stars because this was just a delivery order, but I also see others having problems with delivery. Unfortunately, we did not receive the 5-star customer service that others had received as a result of the mistakes.  Consistently late delivery orders - unacceptable.

56.description: Excellent food, great service, Badou is the man.

29.description: Service was horrible. Rice and chicken was obviously reused and microwaved. The chicken was also very tough as well. It also took a long time to get our food. One of our entrees actually came before the appetizer, and it took over 30 min for it to arrive when the restaurant had only two other couples besides us. There is also random women and men and children running back and forth in between the kitchen and the dining area. It seems very unsanitary and almost like a bunch of families are living in the back. It's really strange. I don't like random people with their hair hanging out and leaning over the food while it's being cooked....Then we ordered the tilapia national dish and we thought we were eating tilapia. After we finished it, the waitress asked us if we liked it. And then stated "we actually ran out of tilapia so we made you catfish instead." Wth? Why didn't u tell us that BEFORE we ate it? We actually don't eat catfish and it disgusts me. How dare we order a meal and you change the fish on us and don't even inform us? We were so mad and it literally left a bad taste in our mouth. That type of stuff isn't acceptable. I WILL never come back here. That was the worst dining experience I have had while living in Chicago and while the food may be authentic, the whole situation was horrible. Shame on you badou! And shame on you fellow reviewers for steering me in the wrong direction. This place deserves a 0 stars and a visit from the health department.

42.description: Great food! My friend and I had the Yassa Chicken and Mafe. I highly recommend these dishes. They were as tasty as they were back in Senegal. The atmosphere is welcoming and quaint. Friendly staff. I hope they expand soon :) Overall-- it was definitely worth the red line trip out there.Definitely on my Chicago top 5.

23.description: This place would be the best choice when you are in mood of "I'd like to try something different today". Food is healthy and exotic. The place is small but clean and well decorated. People who work there are very friendly. I'd like to take my vegetarian friends to this place. Probably the best casual restaurant around Howard area considered the price and the taste. Some people mentions that the service is slow, I agree with It but the time we were dining was also around 3 o'clock. Good food deserves to wait anyway. I heard microwave noise too but I don't see it as a problem at all. I often make food by myself with raw food. It is pretty common to use microwave to melt butter & prepare fresh veggies, heat up rice. Don't think using microwave is necessarily a sign of unfresh /old food.

47.description: Great food, wonderful staff. The ginger drink is excellent. We loved the plantains, chicken mafe, and lamb yassa. BYOB, free parking in a small lot in front. The masks and batiks on the wall took me back to my year in West Africa. I'll be back!

8.description: This place has amazing food! The staff was super nice. The entire experience was laid back and perfect. We are going to be fighting over the leftovers tomorrow.

31.description: Terrific tasty food (lamb w veggies and the veggie pastel appetizer).  I mean REALLY tasty.Parking was a piece of cake.  Owner and staff were so pleasant.  Picked food up and left and enjoyed it at home.

34.description: Badou is a small intimate restaurant  on the far north side of Chicago.  Evanston is literally across the street.  The main reason I enjoyed dining here was the no frills, unpretentious atmosphere.  It had a cool, friendly vibe where one table didn't hesitate to ask another table how they liked their dish and vice-versa.   My wife and I ordered the app of Pastels with chicken and we also wanted their coconut chicken soup, but they were out.  We then had Mafe with chicken and Thiebou Djen for entrees.  Everything was made to order and tasted good.  My wife didn't care too much for the Mafe, as she thought the flavor of peanut butter was overwhelming.  I enjoyed both dishes equally, however.  Sengalese food can be on the spicy side but the owner will cut back on the heat if you ask.  We did and it really helped.    Again, this is a real life mom and pop joint.  When we left we smelled like food and the owner was looking through his wallet to give us change back.  So please check your attitude at the door or leave it in your car if you dine here.  Oh yeah, they have free parking.

16.description: Found this place on GrubHub, but couldn't order cause their computers were down. Decided to go in person. I'm glad I did. The servers were excellent, and the food was wonderful. We started with veggie pastels, which was a meal in itself-definitely order those. I had the chicken mafe with the thick peanut sauce, subtle flavors of cardomon and cumin. My mate had the Yassar Guinar, chicken and onions infused with the lime. The latter took a while to come, as the owner/chef had just arrived, but it was really worth the wait. Next time I will try the foufou.

13.description: In a never-ending quest to try ethnic eats off the beaten path, I went to Badou with two friends on a Saturday night. Although the restaurant, situated in a barren strip mall, lacks ambiance, Badou's food has more than enough flavor to compensate! (WOW.)Almost immediately after we were seated, Badou himself pulled up a chair and described the dishes already underway in the kitchen. Ignoring the menu, we agreed on a few things that would give us a complementary but contrasting taste of Senegal. (He said he would be happy to make anything else from scratch, but if you place a custom order, you'll be waiting for a few hours. Feel free to BYOB and/or board games!)Soon Badou brought out three pastels, addictive little chicken empanadas.
