Here's what I really like about Hong Kong.  The dinner combo comes with Chicken fried rice, unless you get a Lo Mein dish. 1 egg roll, 2 fried chicken wings and 1 crab rangoon... and it's $5.25 to $6.45 and it's tons of food. Definitely enough for 2 or 2.5 meals. For the price it can't be beat! My second meal was Sesame Chicken and it was okay. I probably won't order that again. It was drowning in sauce and soggy. However, my roomie got the Generals chicken and it was delish. I will def order it the next time I go. A friend ordered the Egg Fo Young and he loved it.It's not the best Chinese food I've had but it's definitely not the worst. Again, for the price and all the food you get it can't be beat..I guess next time I get the S and S chicken I'll ask for the sauce on the SIDE!PS: You can get half a dozen Almond Cookies for 1.00 and their good.

19.description: Right down the middle of the road.  If I were taking a customer satisfaction survey, I would reply "Meets Expectations" for just about every facet of the restaurant.Service is exactly what you would expect.  Not too cold, not too warm.  Although, I will say that one time, my food was ready in the promised 15 minutes except that they left the egg roll for the end, which took an additional 7-8 minutes.  Not much in the grand scheme, but poor kitchen management.Prices are tough to beat--$1.95 for small soup, most small main dishes in the $3.75 range.Fried shrimp:  C, too greasy and breadyEgg drop soup:  B+, surprisingly flavorful but not saltyEgg roll:  C, vegetables should be crisperMoo shoo:  C+, again vegetables seem overcookedChicken with snow peas:  B-, fresh vegetables, somewhat blandShrimp fried rice:  B-, tasty but not too heavy or greasy, needs more vegetables

2.description: I'm disappointed to write this review because I ordered from this restaurant a few months ago and things went well.  My experience tonight, however, was bad enough that I felt I should share it. I ordered from GrubHub around 5pm tonight and didn't receive my order for about two and a half hours. Getting my order involved multiple calls to the restaurant, finding out the GrubHub order had never been put through, hearing that the order was on its way when it really wasn't, and the owner finally delivering the order in person. I appreciate the personal touch, but I don't appreciate the lack of communication and unreasonable delivery time.

18.description: This place left a flyer in my door.  I ain't no racist so I don't discriminate.  I also shave my groin so I know that the three pubic hairs I found in my food weren't mine.  Even though it wasn't on the menu, I asked this place if they could make Mongolian Beef.  They were kind enough to accommodate my modest request, though I am pretty sure I didn't ask for a side of crotch rug.  It took over an hour for this place to deliver some warmed up rice.  The large shrimp fried rice contained but a few gravel-sized squeakers and the crab rangoon was as moist and bland as a suburban housewife watching a Denzel Washington movie.  Do not order food from this joint.  Since they don't sell lightbulbs, I guess I'm saying don't call them for anything.  Pubes.

13.description: My experience has really changed with this restaurant. I had one really bad experience here, but I tried it again 6 months later. And, now, this is easily my favorite Chinese restaurant.I've eaten both in the dining room and I get carry out frequently. It's conveniently located near the metra tracks and it's so easy to order through grub hub.The people that own and operate the restaurant - I believe it's a family - are lovely. They are always nice and surprisingly friendly. This has become my favorite weeknight place. I really enjoy it and I'm glad it's in the neighborhood. Thanks Hong Kong Chinese Restaurant!!

4.description: I love writing good reviews. I hate writing bad reviews. In this case, I feel compelled to be honest and not sugar coat our experience. I have been trying to find good Chinese in this neighborhood for a couple of years now. This is not it.Egg Rolls tasted freezer burned and also seemed to have been cooked in rancid oil. My wife couldn't even swallow it. She ran to the kitchen trash and spit it out.Crab Rangoon ... Same problem with the oil. Chicken Fried Rice ... Worst I have ever had. Cold diced chicken dropped on top of a very dark brown, very dry rice that tasted awful. Orange Chicken ... The best thing we had and it was not very good at all. Bottom line ... I expect good Chinese food to be made with fresh ingredients and cooked with fresh oil. Not happening at this place. Not at all. My search continues. I will never order from this place again.

24.description: This place has some really cheap Chinese food. And the chefs are great at doing any sort of speical orders -- whether its more spics, less salt, or whatever you want. The food here is good, not the best Chinese food in the world, but at around $5 dollars an entree, you really can't complain much.

6.description: I want to give -5 stars.  Food was 25 min late when it took a hour for delivery as it is.  To say the least it was cold.   Grubhub called the restaurant on my be half and I was told that I am wrong.  Never argue with a customer this is how you lose business.

15.description: Under new management! The food and service have both improved tenfold since the new owners took over two months ago. The new chef really knows what he's doing.Despite having read all the sketch reviews concerning food quality and cleanliness, I decided to take a shot on this place. I was in a hurry, and tempted by the more than reasonable prices. The woman behind the counter was really patient with answering all my questions, and my veggie fried rice was ready in five minutes flat.The food is delicious, the service is great, and I'm really optimistic about the change in management. Definitely worth checking out.

7.description: The food was awful. Dry ass fried rice and Bland Egg Foo Young. Close this sucker. How the hell can you make bad China-man food.

8.description: This place is my new go to spot for Chinese food. Great menu selection, great pricing, and there orange chicken is the best!

3.description: Solid, cheap Chinese food. Not my go to but a pretty good fall back option. They're very quick as well

14.description: Hong Kong is the best Chinese Restaurant in Rogers Park,  hands down.   The Hot and Sour Soup, Chow fun,  and everything else I've had from here is delicious.   Prices are reasonable, delivery is quick, and they have online ordering.   Really authentic food,  nothing else in the area comes close to Hong Kong.

58.description: This place did not dissapoint. Our favorites were the jalapeno gnocchi, short rib, beef tenderloin with blue cheese. Also loved the Moscow mule. Food is well prices. Atmosphere is very nice. Can't wait to come back!

56.description: A true gem. Great people, delicious food, twists on cocktails and tapas. Highly recommended. A must. Near the beach.

29.description: As a person who loves variety in her meal, this tapas style restaurant was a perfect choice. A friend and I split the bacon wrapped dates, spicy potatoes and macaroni & cheese (my personal favorite). Each dish was tasty and I was a big fan of the fact that they brought each one out as it was ready, not all at one time.The service was also spectacular. I tend to drink water very quickly and the waiter was always promptly there to refill my glass. The prices are extremely reasonable too, with each tapa priced around $6-$8. The only thing I was unimpressed by was the creme brûlée dessert, but the quality of everything else made up for it.

42.description: We walked in but the place looks like a mess hall ...server was not that friendly ... Claimed all reserved and we have to wait for 30 minutes .. We were not even allowed to sit in the bar .. She claimed  its all reserved too .. We can't wait 30Minutes .. The entrance is goofy dark and nasty ... Not even a chair to sit down ... A total downer ... Even there Tapas may taste good ... But will not come back again to this place !!!!

23.description: I visited here because I had Groupon voucher for their Sunday brunch, which is much better than expected. We ordered three tapas, all three were very delicious. My bf had french toast which he enjoyed a lot. However, the eggs for my egg benedict was a bit overcooked. Overall, except that the food is pricy like most tapas place, I'd come back again.

47.description: This is a hidden gem.  I just moved to Rogers Park and so glad to have this restaurant in the neighborhood.  Each dish is better than the last and the sangria is yummy.  The service is just excellent.  Jill made the dining experience that much better.  Notable items were the empanadas, jalapeño gnocchi, bacon wrapped dates (the sauce is incredible), and the salads.  Everything is fresh and reasonably priced.  I also ordered the Sangria, which was actually pretty good...so whoever commented that it was the worst they ever had is being used to their advantage because it begs you to order it :-)  I am looking forward to trying out the new brunch which I also heard is great...the French Toast is apparently a winner.

8.description: I had a great first dinner here! Lots of traditional tapas in a cute setting for a reasonable price! There are some other unique tapas that are less traditional. We were really pleased with all but a couple dishes (we didn't think the paella was worth it). But the filet was amazing and so was the gnocchi! Our only criticism was that we ordered our food all at once (8 dishes for the four of us) and they came out at nearly the same time, way too fast, so that we had some dishes cold by the time we got to them. I would suggest that they either tell people that or even better as how they want it paced. If I go back I will split my order in half to have it be a bit slower and more relaxed.

31.description: What a pleasant surprise in Rogers Park. Before I start, let me say that I have never officially eaten at a restaurant labelled as tapas, but don't expect anything too far off the beaten path. Tapas simply refers to small plates which arrive as they are prepared by the kitchen and are served family style. Twisted tapas does have a very diverse menu, and while I enjoyed every plate, nothing quite stuck out as the (in caps) dish of the night. My girlfriend did enjoy the sangria, so don't pay attention to any other Yelp member who says otherwise. Ultimately, I would probably save this restaurant for a special occasion as it is quite pricey due to the size of the serving portions. But the atmosphere was nice, the the wait staff was responsive, expedient, and charming, and the overall dining experience was pleasant. A five star rating would require a real knock out dish which I didn't find this time around. Choi!

34.description: Sooooooo delicious!  The food was amazing, even on a busy Saturday night, and came out hot, fresh, and fast (but not too fast). Our waitress, Lauren, was helpful with menu choices and never rushed us, even though we slowly ate for over two and a half hours. We're vegetarians and found plenty of delicious options, and didn't even get to try them all because we ate so much. Our favorite dishes were the watermelon salad, jalapeño gnocchi, goat cheese and roasted vegetables on toast, and the chocolate pie. I can't believe it took us so long to try this place but am so happy we finally did. We will be back very soon and often.

16.description: Maybe I only like this place because I've never been to Spain, nor had tapas before. But I have been to Rogers Park and this place is great. Got caprese salad, Mac and cheese, and spicy potatoes. I wouldn't get the mac again, it wasn't bad but there were a few other things on the menu id like to try that are more unique. Sick potatoes are a must with the cumin and paprika...yummm!I'll be back for sure to try the sangria and jalapeño gnocchi.

13.description: The food here was amazing! What a great neighborhood find! Brought my dad here we had stuffed mushrooms, black bean cakes, lobster ravioli, tilapia(which didnt even taste like fish) and for dessert the chocolate pie with rumchata bananas, and the tiramisu that was not your run of the mill, it was definitely homemade and outstanding dessert! Definitely be back again. We got here right as they opened the first ones to be seated on a Saturday nite. Great decor felt very relaxed here. Great place!

11.description: A new(ish) tapas restaurantin Rogers Park!Here's what we got: Baked goat cheese ($7.50) in tomato sauce served with 5 garlic herb toast points. Verdict: Would not order again for 2 people. This is a better dish for when you have at least 4 people to share! Tasted alright, not the best I've had. Bacon wrapped dates ($7.75) 6 in a roasted pepper sauceVerdict: The dates themselves were delicious, but the presentation was lacking. It looked like they were just thrown quickly into a dish haphazardly, and they got the sauce all over the toothpicks.Mini crabcakes ($8.50) served with dijon mustard sauceVerdict: Delicious!!!! They are truly "mini"- one per person, and it comes with 2, so order accordingly. Braised beef and corn cake ($9.75) with tomatoes, queso fresco and chipotle mayo all atop a corn cakeVerdict: Pretty good. The beef was really dry, but the portion was generous. The corn cake was really good on its own. Caramelized banana ($5.95) with tequila caramel, vanilla ice cream and walnutsVerdict: Pretty standard dessert. Can definitely taste the tequila. Ice cream was really quite good- better than the banana. Street parking is available but can be difficult to find- try different side streets away from the lake!Service was excellent- our waitress was kind and friendly. One small note-- as an avid yelper, I didn't really appreciate their large chalkboard making fun of a yelper who didn't like their sangria. Seemed petty to me.

39.description: This restaurant has been a few different places since I have lived in Edgewater and I have  wanted to try it given its proximity to the lake.  It seemed like a great place to stop in after a day at the beach but there was always something the prevented actually eating a meal there.  One time we stopped in and they could serve drinks, but could not use the kitchen for some reason.  Again, I think these were all issues when this was a different restaurant.  On a recent Friday evening we were strolling in the neighborhood, noticed this place was open and took our chance to check it out.  I am very glad we did.  I have honestly never had better service at a restaurant in my life.  There are a lot of options on the menu and we basically told our server what we like and she made some amazing choices.  She was funny and helpful with out being too invasive.  While clearing dishes she did drop a plate in my lap, our server felt awful about it and apologized but it was such a great meal I honestly didn't even care.  I have been a server and know that accidents happen and a plate in my lap wasn't going to ruin such a great evening.  The best part, when they check came they had comped some items to make up for the incident with out us even asking.

37.description: You come here for Jill. Without her, you're just like...why?! It's like your restaurant wants to be forgettable. Tapas are fine. Tasty enough. (It's tapas, after all ) But you come for the experience.

0.description: My fella and I used to make up occasions as excuses to go out to eat at Twisted Tapas. (I'm serious, we even celebrated the day we became FB official...lol). That's how much we freaking loooove the food! The sangria will actually make you tipsy! Andddd, the friendly, cool, and efficient waitstaff is the bomb.com (we absolutely adore Charlie and Jill).Every friend, colleague, couple, and family member we've convinced to come with us has loved the place too. We even got my mother-in-law to change her mind about tapas! Check it out; you'll be glad you did, and I bet you'll even go back (and see us there ;))

38.description: Helped friends move into the neighborhood, so they obliged by inviting me here for dinner.  They also allowed me to run with the ordering.  Per TT's Instagram feed, I went down the line ordering those I thought would be the most flavorful and a few more which sounded interesting.  There were five of us for a late dinner.Our menu:Bacon wrapped datesPaellaBaked goat cheeseJalapeno gnocchiLobster ravioli(My buddy ordered a) Lamb tenderloin that was served with assorted vegetables tossed in a balsamic sauce.Dessert:Bacon wrapped datesTiramisuWith every plate ordered, my mouth experienced orgasms from flavor explosions created within every dish.  The one word which described each plate; superb.The dates were covered with a tasty, beef gravy but the portions were kinda tiny.  The gravy is what tied the flavors together. (It was so good, we needed another!) The paella was on the spot. The seafood within it, was uber fresh and complimented well.  The goat cheese was accompanied by buttery garlic strips of bread. Once that was finished off, the sliced house bread came in handy. (If they offered additional garlic bread for a cost, I would definitely buy more. How about for an extra $2 bucks?)  I could go down the list, but I'll stop here.  With each dish, we shared an overwhelming feeling of.. Damn, this is pretty f%$King good!That's huge right?  Through dinner and drinks, I kept thinking.. "man, this would be a great spot for a date."  Now to find a hot date...

51.description: I'm not too sure why this place has 4.5/5 stars, honestly...When we walked in, we were greeted by a funny sign that said something like "try our sangrias that one man on yelp said was the worst sangria he's ever had" - will post a photo. I laughed so hard because I'm a server, and yelp reviews get pretty dang funny! So we ordered a pitcher of the white sangria. Honestly, that sangria was pretty bad...Then we ordered a few things:Brussels sprouts & bacon - GOOD LORD. Cooked so perfectly. The Brussels had a nice char to them, just how I like them. The balsamic sauce was sweet yet tangy. Loved. Scallops - came with THREE scallops. Yep. Just three. The creamy sauce was almost TOO creamy and bland. The spinach was super soggy. Not a fan. Grilled octopus - honestly, again not a fan. When octopus tentacles are grilled correctly, they're crunchy yet still chewable in the middle. There was a nice crisp, but it was like chewing leather. However, the cold salad that it came with? Now THAT was good!!! Almost like a ceviche of sorts. Baked goats cheese - super delicious. Goats cheese and tomato sauce and served with garlic bread. Creamy and delicious.Our server was a nice, funny lady, sure. But would I come back? Probably not, honestly. Too pricey for the quality of food that is served.

27.description: Bob and his crew are a class act. His staff are attentive and fun. The decor is bright and lively. But the food...ah, yes, the food!!! Amazing tapas fusion. The beef tenderloin and shrimp chorizo is delicious. The paella is perfect. Salads are incredibly good, and portions are generous. Couple that with a great wine list, and some expertly made cocktails, and you've got a winner.

32.description: A new(ish) tapas restaurantin Rogers Park!Here's what we got: Baked goat cheese ($7.50) in tomato sauce served with 5 garlic herb toast points. Verdict: Would not order again for 2 people. This is a better dish for when you have at least 4 people to share! Tasted alright, not the best I've had. Bacon wrapped dates ($7.75) 6 in a roasted pepper sauceVerdict: The dates themselves were delicious, but the presentation was lacking. It looked like they were just thrown quickly into a dish haphazardly, and they got the sauce all over the toothpicks.Mini crabcakes ($8.50) served with dijon mustard sauceVerdict: Delicious!!!! They are truly "mini"- one per person, and it comes with 2, so order accordingly. Braised beef and corn cake ($9.75) with tomatoes, queso fresco and chipotle mayo all atop a corn cakeVerdict: Pretty good. The beef was really dry, but the portion was generous. The corn cake was really good on its own. Caramelized banana ($5.95) with tequila caramel, vanilla ice cream and walnutsVerdict: Pretty standard dessert. Can definitely taste the tequila. Ice cream was really quite good- better than the banana. Street parking is available but can be difficult to find- try different side streets away from the lake!Service was excellent- our waitress was kind and friendly. One small note-- as an avid yelper, I didn't really appreciate their large chalkboard making fun of a yelper who didn't like their sangria. Seemed petty to me.

54.description: Food was amazing and so was service.  Three people ate dinner and had drinks for $60. Very affordable.

48.description: We keep on meaning to try this place and today we finally stepped in - we should have come here far earlier. It's fantastic! Sometimes with tapas restaurants you order a normal amount of dishes and the bill is crazy expensive. Here, we ordered a normal amount of dishes (I believe eight, no alcohol drinks, no dessert) and the bill came to $58. We were impressed! Plus, the dishes were a good size, just right for sharing between the two of us and we were stuffed to the gills, and brought some home for lunch tomorrow.The seasonal special, the watermelon salad with feta, tomatoes, and almonds, is to die for. Get it! Go now and get it. You won't be sorry.My husband loved the spicy potato wedges, and we both loved the deviled egg assortment (five egg halves). The only sort-of miss was a chicken-and-chorizo croquette, which we thought would be more of a taste sensation, but which was actually a bland fried meat, well, croquette. We ate them anyway.  :)The wait staff was excellent! We'll definitely be back!

44.description: This place is just unbelievable!!! Affordable best tapas! So proud that rogers park has this gem!

24.description: If you are in the mood for small plates - this is the place to go! The service was great (Jill) and the decor was solid . Jill was very friendly over the phone and when we got there she knew exactly who we were.  Not sure if that is a good thing ora bad thing. I happened to have called back before heading out for the 30 minute drive to ask if they had anything Gluten Free for a friend of ours and sure enough they have an entire menu full of items. I have snapped some pictures of our bill and some others. If not for this restaurant being in the city , where the parking could be hard to come by I would have given it 5 stars. Enjoy-

7.description: Still one of the best neighborhood spots you'll find in Rogers Park. They get busy but watch how their best servers handle a rush. You gotta love this place. Good vibe. Good food. Good people.

49.description: I've been here a few times now. I'm only taking away 1 star because of parking. I know that's not something the restaurant has any control over. I love the jalapeno gnocchi and the poached pear dessert. I love the decor. I'm sure I'll be back again.

40.description: I had a great experience today the service was great and they accommodated us the craft cocktails are awesome. I had not your mamas colada and also tried the bourbon fizz.  Not usually a bourbon fizz guy but this one was great.   Not too sweet.  The lobster ravioli and bacon wrapped dates didn't last at our tingle and tiramisu was OFF THE HOOK.  The lamb cooked medium rare was perfectly cooked.  Words can't describe how the food made me feel.  Not sure why they call it twisted.

53.description: Two words: Jalapeño gnocchi! But seriously, everything I tried here was great, from the sangria to the black bean cakes to spicy potatoes. The food at this place provided the perfect combination of traditional Spanish and modern, international flavors. The one slight downside to the place was the service. I was here as part of a large group, seated in their private party room, so my experience with their waitstaff may not be representative, but our server was inattentive, forgetful, and a bit rude. It took quite q while to get any service at all, and when we did order, some of the drinks and tapas that we ordered were forgotten and/or brought out only after long delays.

30.description: Here are some red flags about Twisted Tapas. 1) Paper napkins. 2) Bartender wearing shorts and knee high yellow and red socks. 3) Half the beers are the menu end in "lite." 4) No-one is at the restaurant - not even at the bar, at 5:45. The waiter was kind.

46.description: had a dinner here for 10 in the private room--did a great job--this really is a nice neighborhood spot--very good food and a real kichen--I don't really understand the whole discussion about the Yelp Sangria--that drink sucks anywhere on Earth--T2's is better than most!--One pissy comment--I do not like bread sliced into the super thin pieces (i saw that they had a bakery bread slicer)--I think you should serve it in larger chunksPlace is very good and recomended

1.description: I decided to give this place a shot a few weeks ago with a few friends because I found a Groupon for it and it was a hidden gem so close to where I live. I can't forget to mention the high ratings on Yelp, which I always check before buying a Groupon. However, my experience was less than mediocre. Let's start with the service. We came here on a Saturday morning with NO RUSH. The waiter took forever with everything -- to take our order, to come out with our food, and to even bring us our check. He also never checked in to see how we were doing or if we needed anything additional (like the dish that he forgot to bring to our table) -- he instead hung out by the bar to chat with his colleagues. Then, brought us our check without even double checking that my Groupon was not deducted from the total. I did not get the impression that he lacked the experience, but that he was just being careless. Next, the food. I ordered orange juice as well as the baked goat cheese, stuffed mushrooms, and the garlic potato salad tapas. The orange juice was delicious and the baked goat cheese and stuffed mushrooms were worth the try. The garlic potato salad was served to me still frozen, which ultimately ruined my appetite and made me wonder what else was not served to us fresh.Overall, Twisted Tapas was not worth my morning or my appetite. I would not recommend this place.

55.description: This place made me forget I was in Chicago and took me back to Europe! The food was delicious, the drinks and cocktails are wonderful,and our server, Jose, gave us a 5 star experience. Because of this gentleman, I will become a regular here. The atmosphere/environment is calm and inviting with the windows wide open. Did I also mention it's down the street from the lake? Many thanks to the people in kitchen who satisfied our stomachs and thanks again to Jose for a wonderful dining experience!!Recommended: bacon wrapped dates , the cucumber salad, the caprese salad, the potato salad and the imperial wagyu short rib.. All excellente!!

9.description: EVERYTHING WAS WONDERFUL. The waitress was a doll, the hot toddy was just the thing, we ate shrimp and scallops on toast and mushroom stuffed gnocchi and paella and every bite was delicious. And to finish it off, nutella empanadas. I just walked out and I already want to go back!!!

26.description: My fella and I used to make up occasions as excuses to go out to eat at Twisted Tapas. (I'm serious, we even celebrated the day we became FB official...lol). That's how much we freaking loooove the food! The sangria will actually make you tipsy! Andddd, the friendly, cool, and efficient waitstaff is the bomb.com (we absolutely adore Charlie and Jill).Every friend, colleague, couple, and family member we've convinced to come with us has loved the place too. We even got my mother-in-law to change her mind about tapas! Check it out; you'll be glad you did, and I bet you'll even go back (and see us there ;))

25.description: I called at 5:15 and was told they could not accommodate our party of 7 at 7:30.  They called me right back and said they could at 7.  I explained we couldn't be there until closer to 7:30 and they said they could make it work.   We got there and our table was waiting.  We were 3 kids and 4 adults.  Tons of great menu items to choose from.  It comes out as it is made so you feel a little like an endless parade of food appears before you.  I loved it.  Seared tuna, escargot, Spanish omelet, lobster ravioli, pumpkin ravioli, fish tacos, and empanadas.  It happened so quick we didn't want it to end so then we ordered seasonal pork tenderloin, paella, croquettes, garlic potatoes and baked goat cheese.  In the pause we realized we had got too far so the second round wasn't finished but we made sure we had some of everything.  Very good.  Then the kids wanted desert. Pumpkin flan, white chocolate mousse, chocolate pie and bread pudding.  Again, delicious.  Great wait staff, nice atmosphere and yummy food.  Would go back for sure

12.description: Ordered the hotty toddy drink which was hot cider and bourbon. Thought it was pretty goodFor food I got the grilled shrimp, baby octopus, paella and short ribFor dessert I got the chocolate mousse cake and pumpkin cheesecake. Overall the food was very good and the service was good as well. A little expensive for the amount of food you get though but it doesn't break the bank

59.description: I've dined here at least 7 times and it's been great every time.  This place is a hidden gem well worth the trip even if you're not a Rogers Park local.  Some of my favorites are:Wagyu beef short ribs Grilled octopus Various lamb specialsMango shrimp saladFor drinks I really like their sangrias.  The mixed drinks and wine list are great as well.The service is always excellent and friendly.When the check arrives, I feel Ive had a really great experience for a very fair price.I wish them continued success and will visit again soon.

21.description: This place was a nice surprise.Was on our way to BabaReeba and this popped up on yelp randomly. It was right down the street from where we were so we decided to give it a try.The Sangria was pretty good. Didn't blow our socks off but we've had worse. The service was attentive and came around just when we needed,The tapas ordered;Grilled Cctopus,Shrimp & Scallops with gorgonzola sauce,Bacon wrapped datesCharred Brussell Sprouts with Bacon and CherriesScallops over spinachCrab CakesChicken and Chorizo croquettesWhite Chocolate MousseI have not a single complaint about anything but the croquettes. All of them were among some of the best I ever had. The portions were very reasonable for the prices and everything was executed very well.The croquettes on the other hand we had to force down. The problem was that they weren't filled with anything creamy like cheese as one would expect from a croquette. The only thing you could taste was dry chicken and the mediocre sauce it was served with. I would honestly re-think that dish as it almost ruined an amazing meal with no noticeable flaws.

17.description: The only thing good here are the drinks and service. I wanted to like this place soooo much and have gone here 4-5 times. Hands down the most boring BLAND food I've ever had. Every time. Very disappointing

10.description: I was pleased to dine at Twisted Tapas prior to a recent performance at nearby Lifeline Theatre. Rogers Park is notably undistinguished with regard to decent dining options, but TT proved an exception in terms of food and ambiance.VIBE: Comfortable tavern-like setting. Music not to loud. Conversation-friendly. Not too dimly lit.SERVICE: Prompt and attentive. Tapas came quickly. Servers courteous & helpful.GOOD: Broad, varied menu of tapas, both traditional and non-. Well-chosen, affordable wine list. We enjoyed all four dishes we ordered; favorites were Twisted Cigars (spiced chicken sausage in phyllo, very tasty) and jalapeno gnocchi (surprisingly light, perky but not too).NOT SO GOOD: White chocolate malt mousse was well-conceived and flavorful, but the mousse was gummy (too much gelatin?).I'm glad this is an option in the neighborhood. (Years ago, Heartland Café was my destination, but they've been on a long downhill slide.) I'll definitely be back.

5.description: Twisted Tapas is great. The service is fantastic - our server was very knowledgeable about the food and his recommendations were on point. I really enjoyed the imperial short rib, the beef tenderloin with blue cheese sauce, the grilled octopus and the jalapeno gnocchi. I definitely recommend these (in that order). We also had the cigar, which was new on the menu. This needed more flavor, but the texture was good. For the cocktails, I really liked the chili mango margarita. It was refreshing but strong. I originally had the new fashioned, a twist on the old fashioned, but didn't quite enjoy it. Our server was gracious enough to replace the drink for me, which I really appreciated.

3.description: I went here for brunch because I had a groupon and the reviews looked good.I got a chicken breakfast burrito, deviled eggs, stuffed mushrooms, and bacon wrapped dates. The service was satisfactorily polite, and the dishes came to the table at a good pace.The burrito was incredibly mediocre. It was like an egg scramble with veggies and dry chicken breast drowning in melted american cheese wrapped in a grilled tortilla. Despite being so cheesy, this was somehow bland. The burrito was served with sour cream and a typical tomato, cilantro, onion salsa. One thing I did like about this dish was that the salsa was served in a soft, flexible silicon cup so that it was easy to aim where you pour on the burrito.The deviled eggs were ok as a whole, but really it was great and bad at the same time. The dish served 5 different iterations of deviled egg for you try to including a beet, bacon, and tuna. Visually, it was a beautiful plate. All the deviled eggs were too cold as if they were sitting in a fridge right up until it was brought to the table. Most of the deviled eggs tasted like grocery store deviled eggs (even the bacon one disappointed), but i absolutely loved the tuna one. I think it was made with sriracha mayo mixed into the yolk with raw tuna and topped with fish eggs. That bite was absolutely fantastic!The stuffed mushrooms were pretty good, but there was nothing special about them. I think they were stuffed with rice and topped with tomato sauce and cheese.The bacon wrapped dates were good with crispy, flavorful bacon, but i didnt like the sauce. It tasted like a creamy maple sauce, but i really have no idea what it was supposed to be. I was a little disappointed because this is usually a favorite for me when i eat at tapas restaurants.This meal had some good things about it, but i regret coming here overall. The food was just not good as a whole. The only thing i really liked was the tuna deviled egg; i just ate everything else because i was very hungry.Although this brunch was a disappointment, i feel that this doesnt paint the whole picture for twisted tapas. The pictures from dinner just look so good, but none of those items were available at brunch time unfortunately. I wouldnt mind coming back here for dinner and giving it a try.

35.description: The white sangria was watered down, the made us use the same plates for different tapas, the bacon wrapped dates was burnt, on and on. If you like Emberco or Cafe baba Reba do not go here.

19.description: had a dinner here for 10 in the private room--did a great job--this really is a nice neighborhood spot--very good food and a real kichen--I don't really understand the whole discussion about the Yelp Sangria--that drink sucks anywhere on Earth--T2's is better than most!--One pissy comment--I do not like bread sliced into the super thin pieces (i saw that they had a bakery bread slicer)--I think you should serve it in larger chunksPlace is very good and recomended

28.description: Oh twist....i miss you so much in LA, this is a love letter to you because i still have fantasies about eating you ona regular basis. This basic **tches in LA kbow nothing of exceptional tapas at a reasonable price. Mac and cheese sweet baby jesus i miss u the most...Ill see you soon next time I'm home mkay - love you!!!

45.description: This place is a must. So far from everything people miss it. But I have taken so many people here (vegetarian and non) and we have loved everything! Palella and stuffed cucumber is the best with black bean cakes and jalapeño gnocchi close second!

33.description: Overall, the food was good; we tried about 6 different plates. Nothing really stood out to me as "amazing". The staff was pretty busy so my fiancé and I sat at the bar. Although it was tasty, I was hungry after about an hour. Twisted Tapas is certainly worth a try and is unique respite from the typical burger and gyros places that are sprinkled through Rogers Park. Give it a try and decide for yourself if it's something you wanna frequent.

43.description: I was really excited to find a tapas place in east Roger's Park. I love this neighborhood but the one thing it lacks are good and diverse restaurants. Seeing as I love tapas, I was excited to try this place! Overall, they have really solid food! The typical dishes you find at tapas places were all delicious here: tomato with goat cheese, bacon wrapped dates, paella, grilled beef skewer. A couple dishes I was surprised at were the scallop and shrimp with gorgonzola sauce - the sauce was so good I was wiping the plate clean with bread! The escargot dish was also very tasty though much of the flavor of the escargot was overpowered by the cream sauce that was over it - not that it wasn't good. One dish I wasn't a fan of was the grilled tilapia with wild rice but that might have just been me and my preference to not have beans and crunchy textures in my rice. Will definitely be back to try more dishes!

2.description: I love tapas but these tapas, unfortunately, just didn't do it for me.They offer a bottomless bread basket which is nice and the portion size of the tapas are definitely shareable, but the flavors just didn't jump out at us.My friend and I ordered the lobster ravioli, grilled octopus, ahi tuna, shrimp and scallops, and the creme brûlée. The lobster ravioli was crazy salty! We needed to take gulps of water in between each bite and some bread to cut the salt. The ahi tuna was bland and has no flavor whatsoever. The grilled octopus was cooked well but the pico de gallo was very acidy which made it hard to want to keep eating it. The shrimp and scallops were just okay; it was creamy but when eating it, you can't really tell which are scallop chunks and which are cheese, so you end up surprising yourself. The creme brûlée was also not noteworthy. Our server also was not very professional. He would just take his time writing our orders and sat in an empty chair next to us.

18.description: Heard good things about the place.  Stopped by at 11:45 AM and was told they didn't have room (despite two empty tables).  No offer to wait at the bar, no estimate of wait time.OK, we will take our business elsewhere.------------We returned, and the craft drinks were delightful, the variety of tapas was really nice, and the bacon-wrapped dates were amazing!  I'm glad I gave it a second chance.  I'll also give it a third.

41.description: We've been missing this place since the previous Wrigleyville location closed, and couldn't be happier to find out its reopened! Went in last night and had a wonderful dinner; jalapeño gnocchi, beef tenderloin and spicy shrimp. We will be back quite soon!

52.description: Jill is simply the best host/manager.  I hosted a surprise party for my wife's 30th and Jill made sure everything and everyone was taken care of.  The food is amazing but the overall experience cannot be beat!  We will be lifelong patrons coming for the delicious food and dining experience.

50.description: I have been to Twisted Tapas twice now & had to write a review about this hidden RP gem! The sangria is GREAT! Both times I went I tried different tapas and have yet to be disappointed. Some of my favs have been: bacon wrapped dates, Spanish omelette, caprese salad and beef skewer. All the tapas are full flavored and even offer a gluten free menu. The staff are friendly and interior is colorful and modern with big windows that open up for an indoor/outdoor feel. Located 1 block from the lake. Can't wait to try the Sunday Brunch sometime on my way to the beach!

4.description: If you are in the mood for small plates - this is the place to go! The service was great (Jill) and the decor was solid . Jill was very friendly over the phone and when we got there she knew exactly who we were.  Not sure if that is a good thing ora bad thing. I happened to have called back before heading out for the 30 minute drive to ask if they had anything Gluten Free for a friend of ours and sure enough they have an entire menu full of items. I have snapped some pictures of our bill and some others. If not for this restaurant being in the city , where the parking could be hard to come by I would have given it 5 stars. Enjoy-

6.description: This place is great and every time we go, we say "We should come here often". We tried the Buffalo with cauliflower puree last night. Amazing

22.description: Great for brunch. Best Benedict Florentine we every had. I am sure everything else they make is good. Much care in preparation and presentation. Service great. Friendly. I like the décor.

15.description: Helped friends move into the neighborhood, so they obliged by inviting me here for dinner.  They also allowed me to run with the ordering.  Per TT's Instagram feed, I went down the line ordering those I thought would be the most flavorful and a few more which sounded interesting.  There were five of us for a late dinner.Our menu:Bacon wrapped datesPaellaBaked goat cheeseJalapeno gnocchiLobster ravioli(My buddy ordered a) Lamb tenderloin that was served with assorted vegetables tossed in a balsamic sauce.Dessert:Bacon wrapped datesTiramisuWith every plate ordered, my mouth experienced orgasms from flavor explosions created within every dish.  The one word which described each plate; superb.The dates were covered with a tasty, beef gravy but the portions were kinda tiny.  The gravy is what tied the flavors together. (It was so good, we needed another!) The paella was on the spot. The seafood within it, was uber fresh and complimented well.  The goat cheese was accompanied by buttery garlic strips of bread. Once that was finished off, the sliced house bread came in handy. (If they offered additional garlic bread for a cost, I would definitely buy more. How about for an extra $2 bucks?)  I could go down the list, but I'll stop here.  With each dish, we shared an overwhelming feeling of.. Damn, this is pretty f%$King good!That's huge right?  Through dinner and drinks, I kept thinking.. "man, this would be a great spot for a date."  Now to find a hot date...

57.description: Back again to a true favarite spot. The Grilled Lamb, Paella and Herb Brined Pork Tenderloin were amazing.      Twisted is an outstanding restaurant.

20.description: Great meal as always. Always a pleasure to eat and mingle with friends and family here. The Sangria was great like always.

36.description: One of my fav places in Chicago. I was here two times in the last 2 weeks :) Thats sums up how much I like this place . Everything I tasted here was 10/10 . We tried Fish, gnocchi ,chicken skewers and crab cakes ..actually a lot on the menu except the red meat .Everything was cooked to perfection and tasted awesome.Each dish has it own unique flavor.Place was very causal to drop by anytime and  even romantic for a date night . Service is really good and food comes by very fast . We were not impressed by the desserts but with all such good food, we can easily pass the dessert . we tried the red and pink sangria and both tasted really good. A must try place for all Chicago Tapas lover !

14.description: The service is a solid 4 stars. Jill, our waitress, deserves a 5. She was witty and helpful. The bus service could have been better. Most people who enjoy tapas like clean plates brought over. We had to ask. We also had a empty few plates and glasses that lingered on our table far too long.The food was mixed. Some plates were very good like the mac and cheese, bacon wrapped dates, and the beef wagyu. However, some were not good at all. The Jalepeno gnocchi was just gross. It tasted like a lean cuisine. The bread was offered without oil or butter amd wasn't that good either. The sangria was too sweet. The shrimp in oil was nothing special. This earns a solid C+ in my book. I would not go back. If I lived in the neighborhood, maybe. But I don't.

58.description: This neat place has good food and especially service ! Matt at the counter made sure that my wife and I were properly greeted and asked if we needed any help with the menu. I spent several years in Germany and The Netherlands and haven't ever bothered to search for a good döner joint within my hometown. For those having those dreadful withdrawals from the European style döner, give this place a shot! It will be the closest thing to one here in Chicago.

56.description: The food here is great and everyone who works here is so nice!  I had the falafel and veggie lahmucun.  Other reviewers might be bothered by how they pronounce or interpret "lahmucun", but all I care about is how awesome it was.  They can say it however they want to say it as long as they keep making more of that deliciousness to get in my belly!  Not that I would ever be able to finish one.  They are huge!  I can't believe how gigantic they are for that price!  I brought the rest of mine home and ate it cold for dinner (warmed up salad would be gross) and it held up really well.  Even with the tasty sauces inside, it didn't get soggy.  Everything was very fresh and clearly homemade.  This place is a great little spot...go check them out!

29.description: This is the place where I go if I want enough food to last me for 2-3 meals and I don't want to drop a ton of money.  Basically for less than $9 you can get a kebab the size of your forearm that tastes delicious and can last you 3 days if you portion it out.  Did I mention it tastes delicious?   My go-to is the #2 with cajun fries inside of it.  Also, the falafels are delicious and worth the $2-3 extra.The guys that run it are pretty nice too.

42.description: Oh SP. You are delicious. Food is consistently good, and the service is above and beyond. Also, the portions are more than generous. This place always satisfies, and often exceeds my expectations. They're doing it right!!

23.description: I ordered the chicken kebab entree with fries. The chicken was ok but nothing memorable. The fries hardened quickly as they cooled off, suggesting that they're likely frozen. Certainly not worth the money and definitely not for delivery.

47.description: From start to finish it was a great experience. Since it was my first time Matt, cheerfully helped me go through the menu and select what I would like most appropriately. I took his recommendation and ran with it. Can't even tell you how happy I was. The chicken was extremely tender and the sauces seemed to come together like a Symphony in my mouth. Matt was very kind about  asking how everything was and even offered to wrap up the rest of my leftovers. Unfortunately I killed the whole wrap which was about the size of my forearm. I highly recommend trying this place and I'm sure you will go back again and again...

8.description: I have been looking for a kebab place for a long time. Even though it was a but of a drive for me to come here it was one of the best decisions I have made!! The food is awesome, and the workers are very friendly and welcoming for it being my first time coming here. I will be back soon! Highly recommend!

31.description: Today was my first visit, I think I'm in love. Not only was Joe incredibly helpful in suggesting what we might like, he was also great at explaining the varying degrees of heat in the sauces and honest about whether a non-hot sauce lover would find them appealing. I had a #2 Chicken, Cajun fries and sauce in a Lahmacun Wrap (the fries are so delicious I pulled them out first). The sandwiches are huge, so you could easily split one between two people - or have late night leftovers! Go to SP Kebab and ask Joe what to get. He won't steer you wrong!

34.description: - Solid kebabs every time, food always tastes super fresh.- I've never had a bad meal here and the staff is always friendly and welcoming. The owner is almost always there and remembers your face, which is nice.- Parking is scarce, there's some short-term free street parking on the north side of Pratt directly south of the place.- Prices are very reasonable considering the quantity of food you receive.Definitely worth checking this place out if you like kebabs or want to try something different!Only downside is if you eat-in, the chairs can leave your clothes smelling very strongly.

16.description: I was told 45-60 minutes for delivery (a single, SP salad, #23 on the menu), and at the 50 minute mark, they called to tell me they were slammed and their driver wasn't back yet. I was then told my order would be next for sure and should make it within 20-30 minutes from that point.Lo and behold, my elusive salad arrived at the 90 minute mark, complete with what seemed like 1/4 cup of the onion that I had asked to exclude, and for dramatic effect:  3 hours later I have the obvious signs of gastrointestinal distress from tainted food *ahem. Thanks but no thanks; never again.

13.description: great place for a quick and tasty meal. The best fast food kebab I've ever had. Plus they are very friendly!

11.description: Food was very good. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I hope you are hungry as you get a lot of food for a reasonable price. Half off for Loyola students on Tuesday!

39.description: Ordered from SPK from grub hub, and while the delivery man had trouble finding my address (which was a first), the food was top notch. Their Greek salad is phenomenal!! Whatever that tortilla is that they serve it in is off the hook.  In the restaurant, the staff is so polite and friendly! The restaurant is small but clean and well-designed. I'm so glad I live within walking and delivery distance of SPK! I've ordered from them several times and will keep coming back!

37.description: Food is always very fresh, hot, and tasty. Portions are very generous and worth the price. Easily one of my favorite restaurants in the area. If you order on grubhub or visit in person it will not be regretted. The restaurant itself is small, but has a good number of tables and is exceptionally clean. I personally recommend the chicken kebab in the lahmacun wrap. Falafel and hummus are also very good.

0.description: I've been all over Chicago to try and find food similar if not close to the Döner Kebab in Berlin Germany where I am originally from.Now I finally found the place that delivers and caters to my desires. The first time I went there, I made the mistake and ordered the tripple meat kebab wrap. The mistake was NOT the taste, as the wrap was freaking amazing! I just didn't expect to get an order big enough to feed me through 3 days...which it did.If you ever went to Germany and tried their iconic street food from Berlin, the Döner, this is the place in Chicago that will give you THAT experience. Bold flavors, great meat, chicken & pork, great sauces and while I am not used to Cajun Fries in Germany, they are still soooo good, especially when they are inside the wrap with all the other ingredients.Thank you SP kebab, I will come back often!

38.description: One of our favorite place. Every time we come here, it's always so good. Food is fresh and so is the meat and veggies! Love love! I always get number 1 chicken and ceasar salad is also good.

51.description: This place is amazing!!! Yes, of course, the food was delicious and the portions are more than desirable but it's the customer service that will keep me coming back. I spoke with Timothy and right away he made me feel like I had been a regular. I would highly recommend this place. Delicious food and excellent customer service...what more could one ask for?

27.description: Best falafel and Cajun fries in the city!  The sandwiches are humongous, flavorful, and loaded with fresh veggies. I'm a strict vegetarian and have been eating here regularly for years.  Yesterday was the first time I ordered the SP Salad (#23). it arrived in a beautifully airy, crispy, garlicky, oily bread bowl and was the best salad I have ever had in my life!  Don't even bother with the side dressing. Seriously, that salad is good enough for dessert.

32.description: Stopped by this place, which was open late (10pm) on a Sunday evening.  Ordered #2, a chicken lahmacun wrap with french fries (the fries are inside the wrap).  This wrap was delicious, filling, and very large (after I finished I felt a little too full...).  Definitely a place to go if you're hungry.  I would say they could probably cut the size of the wrap by 25%, cut the price 25% and it would be a go-to place for me.  I'd rather a smaller kebab a couple of dollars cheaper.

54.description: Why does this place get 4-5 stars ?? Service was ok. The tall guy was very nice and humble but overall it was slow. Food, it was inedible. Chicken seemed completly season less. It tastes very funny. I don't know if it was suppose to be that way but I have half a wrap left that I don't even want to touch. Whoever wrapped this one needs better training. The moment I opened wrapper, the whole wrap was a complete disaster. I'm not even sure if I want to give it another try :(

48.description: Yummiest Mediterranean-type wrap I've ever had. The Cajun fries are amazing plain or even better within a wrap. And the portions are huge! The lahmacun wrap is amazing- crispy and soft

44.description: I hadn't been here for a while, and just went back last night. Anything that I had to complain about before is gone. They changed their menu in the best way possible. The falafel is delicious! I love their wraps, the bbq sauce is homemade and their greek salads are so good. Definitely recommend this place. Even if you have tried it in the past and weren't impressed, give it a second chance! They have made changes for the better.

24.description: So delicious and big portion sizes. Service is great and they really care about their customers! Love this place and it's definitely a must-try. You will leave stuffed and satisfied.

7.description: Enjoyed the falafel wrap. Great bread, not the usual store bought, cheap, pita bread. Tastes almost homemade...

49.description: By far one of the best if not the best sandwich I have ever ate in my life. The guy that works there named Mike was very helpful on my selection! I just moved to the neighborhood and this is the very first place I yelped. I will gladly return to this place at least twice a week.

40.description: Love this place. Ingredients are fresh, and the guys running the place are awesome. One of the better takeout spots in the area.

53.description: This place is amazing, staff are super friendly and very polite. I went to this particular location and unfortunately was hit with the parking nightmare and one of the staff members were kind enough to run my food order out to me in the car... What!!! :-)I would definitely recommend this place for the SP salad(as this is the only thing I've ever ordered) anytime.

30.description: I've been here a couple of times with different reviews and it's finally time to write a review. My usual order is a kebab in lamucan wrap with half chicken half work, french fries and homemade sauces.First of all, the kebabs are huge. You will leave this place stuffed. The first time I went near closing time, the server told me he added more chicken and pork. The second time I went with a friend, he gave us an extra falafel.The service is great, and the food is yummy.Note: Loyola students get 50% off most items on the menu on Tuesdays! Just show your Loyola ID.

46.description: Every time I eat here, I kick myself for not eating here more. The falafel is great, the salads are fresh and the fries are amazing (though I recommend ordering them as a side instead of inside the sandwich). The feta cheese is a great, distinctive addition to the falafel sandwich, and if you order it spicy, it's actually spicy. Sandwiches come in either a Lahmacun wrap, which is neater and easier to eat, or on a crispy flat bread that IMHO is tastier. The staff is also super friendly, the kind of people who know their customers by name. I'm still in the restaurant and I'm already looking forward to coming back.

1.description: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. have been coming back time and again even though I live more than an hour away.good drunk food, good pregame food, good value food, awesome service.get the secret hot sauce if you're up for adventure!!recommend the wrap and Cajun fries.only disappointment is that they're not open in Hyde park.. YET?? :)

55.description: Great place.  I was looking for these wraps for a loong loong time. The price is a bit high but still worth it. They could also add some beef to the menu...

9.description: Huge portions and fast, simple, spicy kebabs. Great taste and easy on the pocket. Their cajun fries are simply the best!

26.description: We Chicagoans take advantage of our short summers which means we stake out at the beach as long as possible. How lucky are we to also have SP Kebab within walking distance from the most popular Rogers park beaches! This European/Middle-Eastern fusion eatery is absolutely delicious and they provide healthy options. The portions are huge and the quality is gourmet. The owners are usually there making sure customers are completely satisfied while providing a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. Oh and they are BYOB. What a treat to have SP Kebab in Rogers park. I hope they expand and take over our awesome city!

25.description: This place is delicious, fast, and a great deal! To top it off, the staff is incredibly nice, always asking if you enjoyed your food when you head out.

12.description: I love the #1 mix with chicken and pork. They are very friendly and are quick with making your meal.

59.description: The #3 is AMAZING!! Service and food is phenomenal here. Super friendly staff and just all around cool guys. Thanks SP Kebab!!

21.description: Went to this place on the brink of starvation, seriously was ready to pass out. Didn't eat anything all day except a piece of toast in the morning and I was ready to stuff my face. The oversized wraps looked so appetizing and filling. I ordered a mild lumacun wrap on the advice of the cashier for a first timer. I asked to sample the chicken and the pork and decided to go with pork. I got it with all sauces and the fries inside. I also decided to order a side of Cajun fries.I really wanted this place to hit the spot but it just didn't. I thought my starvation would work in their favor but it was a let down. First there is what I have coined as the Chipotle effect, when you don't get to the good stuff until you're half way through. I had to eat half some biga** wrap just to get to a part I would enjoy. While I have a big appetite I have a small stomach so by the time I hit the sauces and fries, I'm full. I couldn't stop though because it's exactly what I was waiting for. Needless to say, it just wasn't that great. The sauces and fries inside the wrap were its saving grace. I noticed almost everyone else in front of me order spicy wraps so maybe that's the way to go.While the wrap was whatever, the Cajun fries were sooooooo freaking good. They have a really nice kick to them and are so flavorful and crisppity, crunchy.

17.description: Great place! Very generous portions, and Matt behind the register was extremely friendly and pleasant.

10.description: Always big portions and always tasty! Love this place

5.description: One thing Logan Square is missing is a top-tier kebab shop, so when we saw this place after a trip to the beach, I was eager to give it a try.  The space is pretty nondescript, but the service was terrific, the price was right, and the food was outstanding -- great doners, surprisingly tasty salads, and the fries!  Perfectly seasoned and creatively prepared and presented.  The only complaint I have is that it's not any closer to my apartment.

3.description: I went here last week and I think it has easily become one of my favorite places. In fact, it was so good that I came back later during the end of the week. I got the pork wrap the first time and the chicken wrap the second time. The meat was seasoned quite well and complimented the garlic sauce quite well. The wrap also had fries inside, which is something I haven't seen before. Initially, I was somewhat skeptical, but it went along great. The portions are also massive given the price. I was unable to finish it, so I was able to eat it for another meal. Also, the workers are super friendly and I greatly appreciated their recommendations. They told me they are coming to the South Loop eventually, so I am rather excited for it. I might be their regular.

35.description: The only place when You can taste real european kebob. First choose between chicken, pork or vegetarian base. Then wrap bread or pita. Now the tzatziki sause comes, the most important element of the SP Kebab. I love the taste Of this kebob! I will be back soon :)P

19.description: I've been here a couple of times with different reviews and it's finally time to write a review. My usual order is a kebab in lamucan wrap with half chicken half work, french fries and homemade sauces.First of all, the kebabs are huge. You will leave this place stuffed. The first time I went near closing time, the server told me he added more chicken and pork. The second time I went with a friend, he gave us an extra falafel.The service is great, and the food is yummy.Note: Loyola students get 50% off most items on the menu on Tuesdays! Just show your Loyola ID.

28.description: I was told 45-60 minutes for delivery (a single, SP salad, #23 on the menu), and at the 50 minute mark, they called to tell me they were slammed and their driver wasn't back yet. I was then told my order would be next for sure and should make it within 20-30 minutes from that point.Lo and behold, my elusive salad arrived at the 90 minute mark, complete with what seemed like 1/4 cup of the onion that I had asked to exclude, and for dramatic effect:  3 hours later I have the obvious signs of gastrointestinal distress from tainted food *ahem. Thanks but no thanks; never again.

45.description: I had the #3 (chicken) which was absolutely delicious! It's impossible for me to describe the brilliant combination of flavors packed into this wrap... You must try it yourself. To top off the great food, the customer service was A-1 (which is rare in this area). Timothy helped me decide was to order as a first timer, and my wrap was ready super fast!

33.description: You Guys Rock!!! We loved your European Kebab! We were on a mission to find a Berlin Doner Kebab and we found it! Thank you Guys!!! We will see you guys again for sure!!! Chris and  Nicole

43.description: Many would just pass by this place because it truly can go unnoticed which is very unfortunate. This place is amazing! Huge portions for the price is a great deal any time of the day. The guys there are super friendly and personable and truly help you decide on what to choose and won't disappoint you. I got the Chicken Kebab in Lahmacun Wrap w/ fries, salad, and homemade sauces which is all together in the wrap. At first the fries inside the wrap threw me off guard but once I took the first bite I was convinced. The ambience was very laid back. It's a small place but it didn't feel that way and we had stroller! We will definitely be back on a consistent basis.

2.description: If subpar tasting food and not edible falafel are your thing then this place is for you! I ordered a little bit of everything today to sample with my friend:Greek saladChicken wrap Falafel Cajun fries Greek salad, served with tzatziki as dressing came in an edible shell for a bowl which isn't disclosed in the menu. Fresh tasting, but not exactly healthy Chicken wrap, chicken was tender but overall bland tastingCajun fries, pretty flavorful but soggy Falafel, not even edible.. Literally took one bite of one and threw the rest in the trash. Just not edible.   If there's nothing else around, sure eat here.. But this is Chicago... You have other options so don't eat here.

18.description: So delicious and big portion sizes. Service is great and they really care about their customers! Love this place and it's definitely a must-try. You will leave stuffed and satisfied.

41.description: We were traveling from New York to Chicago and arrived late and just needed something fast and easy and this place was more than AMAZING!!! The #3 with chicken was so good I could have eaten 2. They are large but perfect if you are hungry. The sauce, the salad, the fries all wrapped up is amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone. ! Christian and Matt are extremely friendly and gave us a great food recommendation.

52.description: We come here ALL the time! They have some best tasting food ever.. Everything is good.. Owners are super cool and polite. One of my fav spots to go and there is a liquor store 2 spots down..

50.description: So, since my last update the sammiches are back up to their usual greatness. it is impossible to go wrong when ordering from SP Kebab.  Every item on the menu is fresh and tasty and like nothing else available in RP.  The guys who work there are, actually (not probably) the kindest and most sincere employees of a f.f. joint in the neighborhood.And, they've added mozz. sticks to the menu.  I mean, come on, spicy cajun fries, a #1 Chicken lahmacun, AND mozz sticks?  It's the perfect balance of healthy and, well, fried items. Sold!  Deliveries are normally very fast on the weekdays -- but weekends it's the normal hour or so.  Pretty soon I am going to need Kebab Anon at the rate I am going.Go there now!

4.description: Went to this place on the brink of starvation, seriously was ready to pass out. Didn't eat anything all day except a piece of toast in the morning and I was ready to stuff my face. The oversized wraps looked so appetizing and filling. I ordered a mild lumacun wrap on the advice of the cashier for a first timer. I asked to sample the chicken and the pork and decided to go with pork. I got it with all sauces and the fries inside. I also decided to order a side of Cajun fries.I really wanted this place to hit the spot but it just didn't. I thought my starvation would work in their favor but it was a let down. First there is what I have coined as the Chipotle effect, when you don't get to the good stuff until you're half way through. I had to eat half some biga** wrap just to get to a part I would enjoy. While I have a big appetite I have a small stomach so by the time I hit the sauces and fries, I'm full. I couldn't stop though because it's exactly what I was waiting for. Needless to say, it just wasn't that great. The sauces and fries inside the wrap were its saving grace. I noticed almost everyone else in front of me order spicy wraps so maybe that's the way to go.While the wrap was whatever, the Cajun fries were sooooooo freaking good. They have a really nice kick to them and are so flavorful and crisppity, crunchy.

6.description: The only place when You can taste real european kebob. First choose between chicken, pork or vegetarian base. Then wrap bread or pita. Now the tzatziki sause comes, the most important element of the SP Kebab. I love the taste Of this kebob! I will be back soon :)P

22.description: Once upon a time, I went to LUC, if you go there now, support this place. Its the equivalent of Chipotle in the sense of portions, but its so much better. Huge kebabs which have all kinds of homemade sauces which take hours to prepare (used to have a friend work there). The owner Peter is one of the most friendly guys ever. A #2 with Chicken or Pork is a standard. You can get hot sauce as well on it. They load it with fries and all sorts of good stuff. If you're normal, you could probably break it into two meals, but go for gold and chow down if you ever go to S.P. kebab.I went there for years, its great bang for your buck. The falafel is good too if you're a vegetarian. Seriously, if you don't know, now you know...

15.description: The wraps are the perfect portion for a hungry college student who is trying to stretch their buck. I could never finish in one siting and would often take the rest to go. The french fries are nice and crunchy. The sauces and fries wrap perfectly with your choice of meat.Whenever I would go in, the staff was extremely welcoming. I have not been here in a while, but it is a must try.

57.description: Ive been wanting to try this place for a while, I'm new to the neighborhood and am feeling places out. I am really glad I stopped in! It was my first time in and had no idea what to order, the guy behind the counter was really helpful and happy to explain the menu. I ordered the #3, HOLY crap! HUGE! fresh veggies, good sauces, tasty meat! it was really really good! I'm definitely putting this place on my favorite list!

20.description: My favorite place to eat in Rogers Park. Huge wrap with juicy flavor meat, always fresh veggies & haven't had a better cajun fries in my life yet. Even the number #3 with fries in the wrap is a bang for your buck. Speedy delivery, best staff very professional.

36.description: Ordered the #1, which was the chicken lahmacun with the mild sauce, for $7.99 to go. I will definitely be back! The portion size is huge and although I was starving, I still was not able to finish it, which is even better because I got a second meal out of it! They do not skip on the meat and veggies. The wrap was heavy and loaded! The veggies were very fresh and crispy, the chicken was seasoned and cooked to perfection and the sauce added a whole other flavor profile!

14.description: I had to drop it down a point. It just isn't as good as when I first started going. I think the owner needs to train the employees better. There isn't enough flavor, not enough salt, and not as much veggies as it used to be. The wraps used to be packed with fresh veggies, not as much anymore. Staff is friendly and the place definitely deserves your business.

58.description: Neighborhood gem. Great, friendly service and very good coffee and tea.

56.description: Love the coffee and customer service.  The decor needs some help.  Can't wait for the warmer weather to sit outside and enjoy a beverage.

29.description: I love Ethiopian food and this place does it well. Good for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Free wifi and reasonably priced coffee and tea. This morning I had a blueberry muffin that was moist, buttery and delicious! They get their muffins from a bakery, but make their own baklava, brownies and cookies. Order the Ethiopian tea. It's a black, spicy tea that's excellent. I didn't add any sweetener and really enjoyed it.

42.description: I love this place. Great atmosphere for reading and conversation, the coffee is just right and the staff is so friendly they make you feel at home.

23.description: Greatest coffee in Chicago. Nicest people. A great neighborhood place, and the place I'll probably miss most when we move! Man, seriously great Ethiopian coffee and food.

47.description: This place is my go to one for breakfast and coffee in Rogers Park. The coffee, in my opinion, is very good. My ideal Sunday morning is sitting outside as I enjoy their combination platter and coffee.The people there are very kind and patient. A true neighborhood gem. Highly recommended.One caveat: Make sure you're not in a rush when you eat there. The pace and feel of the place is very laid back.

8.description: Not impressed with the $3.75 "Morning Muffin" since a delicious muffin should not cost as much as a 4-pack from the local Mariano's while being half the size as well. I can go to Smack Dab! if I want to pay outrageous prices on baked goods; at least there I am getting a much higher-quality product to justify the stratospheric price. Also, as a wine connoisseur the coffee here fails to impress me either. Sorry, but after several visits and purchases of various items, this place has nothing more to offer this writer, but I wish them all the best aa they are sincerely pleasant people and I have mo complaint about the quality of their items- just nothing to justify the prices.

31.description: I adore this coffee shop! The young woman who's always working is SO sweet and has the brightest smile on her face everyday. She is very personable and remembers you even if you've only stopped in a few times (take note, owners--give her a raise!!). The amazing service is what keeps me coming back. Their coffee is awesome, and it's definitely worth it to stop here instead of the Starbucks down the street.As long as I continue living in Rogers Park, I'll continue to enjoy my coffee here.

34.description: Pastries are great! Coffee and tea selection is wide, and drinks are delicious. Coffee has high caffeine content.

16.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and I'm so glad this place exists. Great hours - opens early and later than most cafes I know. Food is great and very affordable - I'm vegetarian. Giant chocolate chip cookies and brownies - nom nom nom. The service is not super fancy (the man was on the phone while taking my order) but I don't mind. I wouldn't expect them to go out of their way to kiss your ass but they seem to know their patrons and are friendly.

13.description: The whole bean Ethiopian Highland Coffee available inside is excellent -- one of my favorite coffees period.  I take it home and grind it myself, but they will also do it for you as you wait.  Great stuff.

11.description: The perfect cup of coffee every time. I go out of my way to come, laptop in hand, and set up shop at Royal Coffee. Yodit (sp?) or Judy, the cafe owner, is the sweetest person always tending to every customers needs. She knows practically everyone in this neighborhood! The atmosphere is laid back and totally unpretentious. The food is amazing and I have yet to try the Ethiopian dishes. I hope this neighborhood gem stays put!

39.description: Came here for the first time today. I ordered an iced mocha and used the free wifi to do some school work. The iced mocha was very rich and delicious. The staff is very friendly and there seems to be many regular customers who the employees know by name. My only complaint is that there is no A/C, however they have fans running indoors and plenty of outdoor seating.

37.description: Stopped by Royal Coffee this morning while walking by. I was intrigued by the Ethiopian food on the menu, so along with my coffee I ordered the Ethiopian eggs. What a wonderful surprise! Fresh and perfectly spiced, and served with Injera - a crepe like sourdough bread made with Teff. My server was very kind and was very pleased that I enjoyed the food so much. Oh, and the Ethiopian coffee is so smooth and no trace of bitterness. So glad I stopped by!

0.description: My favorite place to get coffee, work, print and eat. Everyone is so nice and lovely. I've never been disappointed with the food. I've spent whole days happily writing, memorizing and reading. I love the Cheese Pita with Spinach, the Vegetarian Plate, the Lamb Wrap and today I'm going to try one of their crepes. I'm excited to try it!

38.description: I fear for the future of this place.  When I had brunch here with my friend today, the table was only semi-clean,  and there were several dead flies lying in the windowsill behind us in addition to other live ones swarming about.  My food was fine but no one offered me butter or jam for my toast or salt and pepper or directed me where to find such things.  My friend commented the coffee wasn't the same delicious Ethiopian coffee she'd had there before.  Oddly, the restaurant no longer seemed to have an Ethiopian staff which makes me wonder if they've changed hands and gone downhill.  This used to be the best place to get breakfast in Rogers Park but I don't think I'll be back after this.

51.description: Sometimes I deal with seriously spotty Wifi when working at coffee shops, but the Wifi here was consistently perfect. Big plus.The customer service here was also fantastic. They bring the drinks and such to your table. I also got offered free Ethiopian bread to try a couple different times while here. Nice added touch.Also, there are outlets EVERYWHERE. It is very computer-friendly to say the least..Prices for drinks are reasonable and I tried Ethiopian tea for the first time here. Interesting spice-heavy flavor. I will likely be coming back.

27.description: I went here for the first time today and I am mad I did not know about this place sooner. Not only is the food amazingly delicious and filling but the local people are super friendly. It's exactly how a neighborhood coffee spot should be.  The place starts out quiet and calm and then it becomes a buzzing beehive of locals in search of coffee, food, a place to catch up with friends or have a celebratory coffee and dessert as we witnessed today. The menu is as diverse as the neighborhood. It's an Ethiopian centric coffee house with a heart beat all of its own. Today a friend and I popped in around 11:00, I tried the spinach cheese pita ( it's meant to be shared) and the crepes. We got one wild berry and one strawberry and they were oozing fruit.  You get two crepes in one order so if you do go with someone order two different kinds so you can share. I ordered the chai tea latte and my friend got he Ethiopian tea. Everything was nicely done.  I hope this place remains a staple on Pratt and Sheridan. It's a great local business to support. The staff is friendly, attentive, hard working and sweet.This nice woman and her family were eating close to the door and as we were leaving i inquired about her opinion of the french toast. She said it was perfect. So good that she didn't even need syrup. She had me sold. She was even nice enough to give me a slice and  in exchange I gave her some spinach cheese pita.  Gotta love Chicago! As much as I am looking forward to eating my left overs tomorrow; I am excitedly awaiting my next visit to Royal Coffee. SO glad I have a gym membership..this could be come a dangerous love affair.

32.description: Really great local coffee place. I only had their americano and a few macaroons (which I normally not a fan of). The americano was great, very strong, and I loved the lime macaroons. Service is great and despite what an earlier review stated, the owner/manager is a very nice guy.

54.description: I haven't been there in awhile, but I need to go back.  It's a nice, welcoming peaceful place.  The food is good and reasonably priced, especially the breakfast fare.  The atmosphere in the place is always warm, and the owners and staff are very pleasant people.

48.description: I love this place. I've been buying my beans here for years. As I prefer sun dried to process dried beans, I searched for some time before finding Royal Coffee who provides premium  sun dried beans at a reasonable price.
