I grind at home but they will grind for you as wellThe coffee is strong, bold and dark. The beans ooze the fragment oils and aromas that make your nostrils quiver with temptation and desire. For such a robust flavor, I'm always surprised by the fact that's is so mellow and not more bitter or acidic. The owners are a genuinely wonderful and authentic Ethiopian couple and sometimes their son. You are welcome with big smiles and after a few visits will become family. Bright airy space with big windows and outdoor seating allow you the comfort of chilling and enjoying your coffee experience. There is usually interesting local or ethnic art work on display.I've only eaten the Ethiopian breakfast which I've always enjoyed.

44.description: But please do not water down the liquid soap in the restroom until it feels like mostly water. That's pushing "economy" too far, I think.

24.description: I really wanted to like this place. I went awhile ago and ordered a couple of drinks. But the bar area was just so dirty. The espresso machine needed to be cleaned as well as the counter area around it. The drinks themselves were a little bitter...over extracted.  The owner was friendly though...but not enough to make me want to come back.

7.description: This is the best, most adorable, most awesome coffee shop I have yet to find in Chicago. The coffee is absolutely perfect and the staff is so freaking friendly I don't even know what to do with myself. Gah! Awesome.

49.description: Please don't go this place. Owners have been changed and so the OLD reviews are no longer relevant.This place is not good at all. I think the 4 star reviews are quite deceiving. I would not recommend it at all because of the hygiene, rude staff and weird ppl. I went there with my gf the waitress who were serving us was SUPER RUDE. We ordered a vegetarian sandwich and she ended up getting one with meat. My gf is vegan and with a graduate degree is native English speaker. The waitress who was serving is the owner put words in her mouth that she did ordered pork sandwich and then yelled at her telling her she ordered the meat one. We still paid for everything without even eating a bite. Top of that she called her b$):ch and when I tried to ask her how can she call my gf with such abusive language the group of ppl charged towards me asking us to leave. This was the worst ever experience of my life. We both are working professional with graduate degrees from one of the best universities and working on managerial roles for multi national companies. We totally respect people and mindful of what people around us. Making a mistake and then abusing customers and threatening them to leave is INHUMANE. We are considering taking an action against this restaurant. I really hope ppl stop going there.

40.description: I just had what can only be described as a weird experience. My boyfriend and I are always into trying new places to eat in Rogers Park and so far we've been successful, but this place certainly proved that you just can't win 'em all. I really enjoy vegetarian places with fresh vegetables and ingredients, so I ordered the Greek salad along with an iced mocha (as did my boyfriend). The iced mocha was decent but my first sip was purely chocolate syrup-- perhaps all iced coffees come unstirred and I'm just inexperienced. Either way, I was caught off guard with a very chocolatey surprise.Our Greek salads started out decent but as I dug through it I noticed that the lettuce was wilted and browning and there was something DISTINCTLY off about the black olives. They were also served with packets of light Italian dressing, which to me was a little puzzling for a Greek salad.Our server was a lovely girl, which is why I gave this place two stars instead of one. Altogether a rather odd meal.

53.description: Great location and the owners are so friendly. My only that, but their coffee is amazing and the prices are reasonable   Great choice!

30.description: This is my favorite coffee shop in the whole city.  The owners treat you like family.  Everything is delicious and affordable! I always study here and it really has the best energy.  Ethiopian veggie wraps are my favorite! Love them!

46.description: Hold on a moment.  Was my previous review simply sentimental rubbish?Maybe.Went in with eyes open yesterday, Saturday, around 1PM.  Was greeted by the lady owner (Yoyo?), no one in the place, was asked if I wanted to sit outside.  I said yes.For the next 15 minutes patrons went in and came out and other tables were served.I walked back it and briefly spoke to the only waitress in the joint.  She snarked at me about being busy.Not good.Ordered soup -- was just okay.  The spicy side of bread that came with the soup was so/so.  The coffee was wonderful as usual.  My pal ordered an omlette and the ingredients were f-ed up -- not what was ordered.   Anyhow, all in all, at time point I thought everything was going about 3 stars.  I still was loving being stone's throw and bounce to the lakefront.But then I saw the bathroom.  Eeee-Efin-Gads!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!It was F-I-L-T-H-Y Dirty and gross.Was this why the Chicago BOH shut them down over the winter.  Grossity gross gross.  Sticky pee floors, dirty sink, stack o damp paper towels.  Just felt like toxic waste in there.  Me no like.If that is how the do the bathroom, how do they do behind the counter when no one is looking?But the coffee is still too much of the delightfulishousnessity.So, I will try again.

1.description: This is my new favorite cafe/coffee place. I'm new to Rogers Park, having just relocated from Lakeview East. Gotta love Lakeview, but sometimes it feels like the stores/boutiques there are for someone else that makes a lot more money than money I do. (Example: the cheapest coffee I could find at Intelligentsia on Broadway was $4.)This is more of a "real" people, neighborhood place where the employees know the customers, and welcome them warmly. They also have some nice vegetarian, and even vegan options (I'm a vegan.)When I called to ask if they had free Wi-Fi, the man who answered the phone said to me, warmly, "Of COURSE!" The place has an Ethiopian focus - a type of food I know very little about. The coffee at the place is very strong, and the vegan sandwich I had reminded me a little of Indian food. But if you're a meat-and-potatoes type person who doesn't have an adventurous palette, you will still find plenty to like here.

55.description: Fantastic coffee and not too busy on a Saturday afternoon, which seems rare for a coffee shop in Chicago. There is parking to be had on Sheridan or a side street nearby. The staff is very pleasant and it's a nice change of pace from THE larger coffee chain.  The WiFi signal is strong and it feels a little foreign and Ethiopian, which is cool.

9.description: The people are always very nice here.  The food is pretty good, not great, but good.  The atmosphere and people are the best thing.  I'd rate the coffee, but I don't drink it.  So..... sorry about that.  I'd bet the coffee is great from what I see going on there.

26.description: I work from home, you see, and cruising coffee houses has kinda become a thing for me.  My office is wherever I find myself in the city that day. I happened upon Royal Coffee after waking up entirely too early for a client visit in Rogers Park at 7am... I was desperate for caffeine, it was one of those days where you wake up exhausted.... you go to work without your coffee, and you actually have to focus for two hours before any chance of caffeine will come your way...The struggle....So I'm driving down Sheridan and pump the brakes upon seeing a corner coffee house, park two blocks away and walk up a tree lined, sleepy street with the birds singing about spring, the trees budding and tulips in full bloom. Royal Coffee sits in a historic building on the corner of Sheridan and W. Pratt, next to the Pratt Beach House.  It has a lovely outdoor seating space with wrought iron chairs and tables and a gate you have to walk through from Pratt to get to the building.  Being on the corner means it wraps around Pratt and Sheridan giving you a great view of this small slice of the neighborhood from the windows that make up the entire front and side of the cafe. So I wander in and I find myself transported to a real neighborhood cafe... The owners are an Ethiopian couple and the wife opens the shop, and does everything - just her.... She makes the drinks, cooks all of the food upon order, and I swear she knows everyone who steps in that door. I order a vanilla latte and grab a seat facing the windows and proceed to observe.  For the regulars, the people who are obviously there to pick up their caffeine on a daily basis she just brings them their coffee without them having to say a word, inquires about their personal lives, asks about their family and tells them to say hi to their mother for her. It feels like home.  This is the kind of place where you will be chided if you don't eat all of the food that was cooked for you, where you won't get a bill but have to tell the owner you're leaving. This is the kind of place where all are welcome, where people who come in are embraced, where people return for the feeling, where people with apparent mental health are not seen as a nuisance but asked to stay, brought a coffee, and asked about their morning. This is where old men gather to speak in their own language and get smacked by the owner for talking to loud - all while heartily laughing at each other - this is where strangers chat with each other for the sake of chatting. There is a chemistry to this place that is phenomenal, created by a woman who has successfully brought a piece of her culture to her business.  There is art on the walls, Ethiopian coffee for sale; a breakfast, lunch, and specifically Ethiopian menu to peruse, a t.v. on the far side of the cafe showing the morning news, people reading actual newspapers, and a sleepy early morning vibe that turns into a busy and bustling afternoon.  They could make a movie about this place, they could write a book and I would be entranced.This is it for me, I've found my place in the world.

25.description: I live down the street from Royal and have enjoyed visiting a number of times over the years, for both dinner and coffee.I had a really disappointing experience the last time I visited. I was stopping in for coffee, and I brought the guy I'm dating with me. He had a Starbucks cup in his hand from earlier in the day.The owner threw him out of the restaurant because he was holding the Starbucks cup. It was awkward and embarrassing. The restaurant was not full at all, so it was not because he was taking up space. He was standing next to me while I was waiting for my coffee.I didn't want to leave him outside and I really didn't like the way the owner talked to him, so I left as well without my coffee.

12.description: I stumbled onto this joint today after attempting to find a seat in a over capacity Starbucks on the same block. Let me first say, I shop "locally" and absolutely love Mom 'n Pop restaurants, shops, bars, and coffee shops. This Coffee Shop deserved a review.... It was completely dead... I wonder if it was due to this unique pungent odor in the place... maybe patchouli & arse incense? I came up to the bar top and placed my order at the counter after the owner or manager got up from his camped out tables in the open seating area. He gave me a hard time because I didn't purchase enough and had my debit card in hand. To top off the ordering experience they threw in a dirty napkin back into the stack, it obviously had a cup of coffee sitting on it before and left a cup ring stain on it. I had to request a clean napkin. Their standards are below par. I will post a photo. The chairs are weak/loose and you think you get the feeling they might fall apart while sitting in on one of them. I also observed him chatting on his phone while sitting in the main area and then trying to take orders, yelling to his staff and talking quite loud to the other person on the phone. I wish I could upload a video to Yelp!! It was obviously an inconvenience for him to end his conversation at assist people as they wanted to spend money in this cafe. I won't be repeating this experience here again.

59.description: Nice people but not the coffee. Crepe is good.

21.description: Great ambience, great music, and it seemed like a lot of the customers there were regulars. The Ethiopian coffee was absolutely amazing (best black coffee I've ever tasted) and their baklava was mediocre and possibly store-bought. They don't have a very wide pastry choice, but all of their food items looked good. The Ethiopian tea was very flavorful with a lot of cinnamony spices to them~ could be a little too strong for people who are sensitive to spices though. 2 of the staff members I interacted with were not that friendly, but one was super helpful.

17.description: I live down the street from Royal and have enjoyed visiting a number of times over the years, for both dinner and coffee.I had a really disappointing experience the last time I visited. I was stopping in for coffee, and I brought the guy I'm dating with me. He had a Starbucks cup in his hand from earlier in the day.The owner threw him out of the restaurant because he was holding the Starbucks cup. It was awkward and embarrassing. The restaurant was not full at all, so it was not because he was taking up space. He was standing next to me while I was waiting for my coffee.I didn't want to leave him outside and I really didn't like the way the owner talked to him, so I left as well without my coffee.

10.description: Wonderfully friendly service, and delicious food and coffee. Free WiFi, nice atmosphere, and relaxed vibe. Prices are reasonable. We get bags of the whole bean coffee to brew at home. They've even given us their own (cafe-use) stock when we've come in last-minute asking for a pound of coffee. Really, a great experience every time we've been there.

5.description: I work from home, you see, and cruising coffee houses has kinda become a thing for me.  My office is wherever I find myself in the city that day. I happened upon Royal Coffee after waking up entirely too early for a client visit in Rogers Park at 7am... I was desperate for caffeine, it was one of those days where you wake up exhausted.... you go to work without your coffee, and you actually have to focus for two hours before any chance of caffeine will come your way...The struggle....So I'm driving down Sheridan and pump the brakes upon seeing a corner coffee house, park two blocks away and walk up a tree lined, sleepy street with the birds singing about spring, the trees budding and tulips in full bloom. Royal Coffee sits in a historic building on the corner of Sheridan and W. Pratt, next to the Pratt Beach House.  It has a lovely outdoor seating space with wrought iron chairs and tables and a gate you have to walk through from Pratt to get to the building.  Being on the corner means it wraps around Pratt and Sheridan giving you a great view of this small slice of the neighborhood from the windows that make up the entire front and side of the cafe. So I wander in and I find myself transported to a real neighborhood cafe... The owners are an Ethiopian couple and the wife opens the shop, and does everything - just her.... She makes the drinks, cooks all of the food upon order, and I swear she knows everyone who steps in that door. I order a vanilla latte and grab a seat facing the windows and proceed to observe.  For the regulars, the people who are obviously there to pick up their caffeine on a daily basis she just brings them their coffee without them having to say a word, inquires about their personal lives, asks about their family and tells them to say hi to their mother for her. It feels like home.  This is the kind of place where you will be chided if you don't eat all of the food that was cooked for you, where you won't get a bill but have to tell the owner you're leaving. This is the kind of place where all are welcome, where people who come in are embraced, where people return for the feeling, where people with apparent mental health are not seen as a nuisance but asked to stay, brought a coffee, and asked about their morning. This is where old men gather to speak in their own language and get smacked by the owner for talking to loud - all while heartily laughing at each other - this is where strangers chat with each other for the sake of chatting. There is a chemistry to this place that is phenomenal, created by a woman who has successfully brought a piece of her culture to her business.  There is art on the walls, Ethiopian coffee for sale; a breakfast, lunch, and specifically Ethiopian menu to peruse, a t.v. on the far side of the cafe showing the morning news, people reading actual newspapers, and a sleepy early morning vibe that turns into a busy and bustling afternoon.  They could make a movie about this place, they could write a book and I would be entranced.This is it for me, I've found my place in the world.

3.description: Rogers Park is the home of Loyola University, but it's also the home of awesome, bold, and delicious Ethiopian coffee served in Royal Coffee.  After a short bus ride (#147 or #155) northbound from the CTA Loyola Red Line station, this coffee shop, located on the northwest corner of Sheridan and Pratt, is looking for their "loyal" fans to come by!  Surely "RC" already has their fan base, without a doubt.  The owner lady was very friendly and knew all of her regulars.  Daddy J. was able to get his Americano fix.  For $3.00, he had a 20 oz. cup, with a cup of perfectly-measured milk on the side.  He was really "wowed" by their coffee and swore to come back for more in the future.  I, on the other hand, experienced the awesomeness of Ethiopian tea.  I LOVED the combination of mint and exotic spices.  I should have upgraded to the 20 oz. size!  Royal Coffee also serves breakfast and dessert.  I'm now convinced that I want to be part of the royal family, though I don't reside in the neighborhood.

35.description: This review is for coffee-on-the-go experiences only: Better quality coffee than the Starbucks around the corner. Cheaper prices than the Starbucks around the corner.Quick service.I typically make my coffee at home (cheapest option there is!), but I like to use Royal's whole beans, and when I need a caffeine pick-me-up on the go, they're my first choice.

19.description: The food was flavorful (I got the veggie plate). The service was nice and attentive. The owner even came out and gave us some free Ethiopian bread fresh from the oven to taste. He said it's the kind of bread you eat with soup. The wifi was fast and smooth. Everything that I would want from a cafe. Unpretentious. Good food and solid coffee at a reasonable price.

28.description: I enjoyed my visit. Vicki was very nice and helpful. I had a morning glory muffin, coffee of course, and the most delicious Ethiopian chicken wrap made with the signature Injera bread native to that country. The food variety offered is pretty good, there's seating, a bathroom, in case you plan on staying some time and the prices are reasonable.

45.description: First of all I want to say the food here is good and prices are decent and the owner is very nice. So far we had coffee, ice mocca and lamb wraps, which were all good except for one which had one piece of meat in it.Now for the bad: I never know exactly where to order. The service is slow, especially when it comes to paying. You can easily wait 45minutes, even when you go to the register. At times I've even felt ignored while waiting to order, and the waiter/ess were looking right at me! To top it all off when I order my iced coffee, I pretty much have to put it together. What am I paying you for then?! Even though Starbucks costs more, at least they put your drinks together for you.

33.description: I stumbled onto this joint today after attempting to find a seat in a over capacity Starbucks on the same block. Let me first say, I shop "locally" and absolutely love Mom 'n Pop restaurants, shops, bars, and coffee shops. This Coffee Shop deserved a review.... It was completely dead... I wonder if it was due to this unique pungent odor in the place... maybe patchouli & arse incense? I came up to the bar top and placed my order at the counter after the owner or manager got up from his camped out tables in the open seating area. He gave me a hard time because I didn't purchase enough and had my debit card in hand. To top off the ordering experience they threw in a dirty napkin back into the stack, it obviously had a cup of coffee sitting on it before and left a cup ring stain on it. I had to request a clean napkin. Their standards are below par. I will post a photo. The chairs are weak/loose and you think you get the feeling they might fall apart while sitting in on one of them. I also observed him chatting on his phone while sitting in the main area and then trying to take orders, yelling to his staff and talking quite loud to the other person on the phone. I wish I could upload a video to Yelp!! It was obviously an inconvenience for him to end his conversation at assist people as they wanted to spend money in this cafe. I won't be repeating this experience here again.

43.description: The coffee was terrible. I ordered a basic flavored latte and it was terribly sweet. I couldn't taste the espresso at all. I also ordered the Chai latte and it was slightly better. For the price and risk, I won't be back for coffee. I didn't try any of the food but the food menu did catch my eye. They have a nice patio and wifi and BYOB. I might come and try lunch or to hangout on the patio but certainly not for coffee.

2.description: This is the #1 best cup of coffee available in Rogers Park and the owners are wonderful people, too. Royal is a true neighborhood gem and I stop in every chance I can.  The Ethiopian vegetarian sampler for breakfast is my favorite menu item for a hearty and delicious way to start the day.

18.description: I love this place. I've been buying my beans here for years. As I prefer sun dried to process dried beans, I searched for some time before finding Royal Coffee who provides premium  sun dried beans at a reasonable price. I grind at home but they will grind for you as wellThe coffee is strong, bold and dark. The beans ooze the fragment oils and aromas that make your nostrils quiver with temptation and desire. For such a robust flavor, I'm always surprised by the fact that's is so mellow and not more bitter or acidic. The owners are a genuinely wonderful and authentic Ethiopian couple and sometimes their son. You are welcome with big smiles and after a few visits will become family. Bright airy space with big windows and outdoor seating allow you the comfort of chilling and enjoying your coffee experience. There is usually interesting local or ethnic art work on display.I've only eaten the Ethiopian breakfast which I've always enjoyed.

41.description: Bugs!I went to this place beause of the good reviews but upon entering, their coffee machines looked dirty, there was coffee running down the sides and it was all dried and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. I'd already put my order in so I didn't want to leave. I got an iced coffee. I'd drank half of it when I felt something come through my straw and into my mouth and it was a tiny little bug. Don't come here.

52.description: I came with a friend for coffee and breakfast.  Who thinks ethiopian for breakfast but I thought, what the heck.  Ordered the vegetarian sampler and their house coffee.  So the coffee was quite good.  When the plate came I thought that the portions were kind of small but I ended up taking half of it home.  The important thing is flavor though.  They have it and it actually worked for breakfast, for me. Filling, refreshing, but not too heavy.  Love it! I also appreciate that the owner was our server.

50.description: Run by a warm and friendly family, offering a quiet and relaxing atmosphere, and the prices are incredible. In the winter time, my partner and I eat their lentil soup and home made bread at least once a week and in the summer, the outdoor space is great to sit and read. I cannot say enough about this place and how special it is.

4.description: Went here on my first day in Chicago. It's a neighborhood coffee shop that offers Ethiopian teas, coffee and food. My sister goes here regularly so the owner recognized her immediately. Walking in they have an ample outdoor patio as well as a good amount of indoor seating. There are a couple TVs in the back but the volume is low enough where you could read and not lose concentration. My sister and I ordered a chai tea and vegetable wrap made with injera. Maybe it was because we walked 25 min to get there but everything was delicious. The chai tea was a perfect blend of sweet and spice, and the vegetable wrap had great curry flavor with the lentils and veggies. I could definitely eat three of these babies. I can't wait till I go down again because this will be my first stop.

6.description: Yummy french toast and great iced mocha! The owners were so polite and they treated me like an old friend even though it was my first time visiting! The others on here who have said the same about this place are right!

22.description: The Ethiopian tea was delicious. Very aromatic and easily drinkable. The machiatto was perfect, great balance of strong but not bitter (no sugar needed!). The food was good, had the combination plate, and wild berry crepes. I have to say, the coffee is the strong suit of this place. The food is good, but come for the coffee!

15.description: Was surprised and upset by my interaction at Royal Coffee today. Sounds very much like what Liz. H described (see other reviews below).I have been here before for coffee and have found it adequate. Today I went in the store to order a sandwich and was told, by the lady who owns the cafe, that I would not be served unless I disposed of an empty Starbucks cup I was carrying. I would have easily been willing to throw the cup away, but the woman's tone and shrill manner completely turned me off to the cafe. She made a scene in front of other customers and continued to harass me even after I said I would leave.It was embarrassing and unnecessary. I would have complied had I been addressed in a more polite and professional manner. Will NOT be coming back here.

57.description: This cafe is host to the entire community and the menu serves as a backdrop for all of the connecting that takes place here! I've had breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacktime here and it never fails to deliver a consistent, relaxing experience of food and cool people. there's a simple elegance that the owners model with their downhome approach and personal touches. It's rare to see this kind of engagement nowadays--but I'm glad this family is sharing their passion.

20.description: Was surprised and upset by my interaction at Royal Coffee today. Sounds very much like what Liz. H described (see other reviews below).I have been here before for coffee and have found it adequate. Today I went in the store to order a sandwich and was told, by the lady who owns the cafe, that I would not be served unless I disposed of an empty Starbucks cup I was carrying. I would have easily been willing to throw the cup away, but the woman's tone and shrill manner completely turned me off to the cafe. She made a scene in front of other customers and continued to harass me even after I said I would leave.It was embarrassing and unnecessary. I would have complied had I been addressed in a more polite and professional manner. Will NOT be coming back here.

36.description: Although I live a few blocks away, it took me a few months to discover this gem of a place. Now that I have, I stop by at least once a week, for food or tea. On my way now to try their Ethiopian coffee. The staff is nice and friendly.

14.description: Absolutely loved it! The Ethiopian style eggs and nutella crepe were awesome! I enjoyed the service and the attention given to me. The woman there was so motherly and kind. Im definitely coming back!

28.description: This place just opened and I am very impressed. Fantastic customer service, clean atmosphere, and fun staff. My nails were done quick and they look beautiful! The polish selection is amazing! Can't wait to go back!

1.description: FYI $28 for a basic 15 min pedicure ONLY!!! And no clear top coat over color. NEVER AGAIN...All beauty no brains! The place is spacious and pretty but the nail techs are too uninterested in their work or the effort (not that my feet are in bad shape or anything). I do like how they are  sanitary with the basins and tools. Sanitizing is the main reason why I came but I wish I could find a place like princess nails (I miss the tech named ICE!) who didn't mind putting in work that leaves my pedicures LASTING. Lee gives you a hot towel "massage" which was more like just wiping my legs down with it and a less than average finish (sloppy polish) that isn't worth the money. My feet were not throughly exfoliated. The overall quality is cheaply performed. Princess nails on Clark if only I wasn't scared you'd give me foot fungus we'd be the bff's I long for...sigh.Also, a tech sat next to mines and chatted the whole time distracting her and disturbing my "spa" like experience they represent. Puh-leaze!....

9.description: I just moved to the area about 2 months ago and was looking for a local nail salon to call home. Well I saw that my apartment complex had a discount with them so I decided to give them a shot. Upon arrival I noticed the prices were average and they had a nice collection of colors. The place was warm and inviting. The decor was lovely. The technician was nice and talkative. He made me feel comfortable. Although I liked the place and how convenient it was I must say his work was not that great. My nails were shaped and cut uneven. I tried a rather different color by OPI it was a dark plum and the texture of the Polish was like wet sand. He put too many coats of the polish on my nails. It made my nails feel like I had mud painted on. After two days two of my nails snapped right in the middle as if he filed too much in that area. And another one chipped on the edge with washing dishes. I am a person who frequently gets fill ins at several shops and never had a nail break after two days of service. I'm going back today just because it's right across the street. I will ask for another technician and hopefully have better service.

23.description: Had a very nice pedicure and brows experience here! Great to have a high quality place in the neighborhood.

5.description: I never do reviews but I had to do one after my horrible  no chip manicure. I went to get my nails done here after my sister suggested  it. The  place is really nice and inviting  I will say that. But I would not go here for a no chip manicure. I got my nails done on Wednesday  and by Friday my nails started to chip. I would have went in to get this fix but I was already on vacation... can you imagine  my regular  painted  toes lasted way longer than my no chip manicure. The no chip manicure  didn't last even 3 days, by a week the nail polish was chipped off on all of my fingers

25.description: I've only been there once, but I was very impressed!  Very reasonable prices.  Very clean.  Very nice folks.  This is my new go to place for manis and pedis.

12.description: Newly opened spa and not any run of the mill kind of setup.  When I saw the sign in the plaza, I expected to see a typical nail salon.  Instead, it's decorated ceiling to floor.  The ceiling was adorned in an intricate pattern or ceiling masonry, rather.  The heating and cooling vents are situated all around so that the salon is properly ventilated, heated and cooled.  There are accents in colors, types of tiling, flat panel televisions and a very large (wall) flowing water fountain that can be heard across the room.  I would assume to give a sense of tranquility to your spa time.  They offer multiple stations for nail care which are along either walls and over twelve spa massage chair stations.  It's an uber nice setup which could easily handle a "GNO" spa day or large bridal party.So the other day my Ma was complaining about the weather and how her hands were looking dryer than usual.  I felt for her and remembered reading a review which mentioned "in winter weather, a paraffin wax treatment will rejuvenate dry hands."  Decided it was time for a spa day for Ma.  Got her a spa pedicure ($28) and the paraffin wax treatment for hands ($8).  I think she was in for about an hour plus.  They offer a number of plush seating at the front of the spa which overlooks the span of the nail salon.I liked that there was a good amount of conversation between the staff member and my Ma.  Another staff member made small talk with me while I waited and between staff and other customers it was casual.  I mention this aspect because of how in some other salon situations; when dealing with workers constantly speaking in their own language, they forget about their customers and may talk about them or use awkward looks or obvious glances which can be off putting.  None of that happened here, Ma had a great time and was happy with her spa day.  She expects to see "Kim" again.  Ma enlightened me that I will have to bring her back in the future for a spa day with her sister.  Walk ins are welcome and there is plenty of free parking in the lot.  Since they are a new salon their pricing is competitive with salons in the area.  If bringing your little ones also, there is a discounted price.

21.description: I made an appointment for 6 pm for a mani pedi and was not seated until around 6:30. I really love this place because they do a really good job with my nails always (the men at this place do amazing nails), but I had to be somewhere so I was only able to get a mani. The front desk person was very apologetic and accommodating but I just couldn't give the time. I think that having an appointment is kind of important and they should not have let other people who just walked in without appointments in front of me... Which is the reason I had to wait for 30 min for my treatment. That being said, I still really like his place I would just avoid it Friday afternoons.

16.description: I have been here 3 or 4 time maybe 3 months ago the customer service was awesome, cool and relaxed greeting. Yesterday,  I treated my mother to getting her nails and eyebrows done. The very moment we walked in the door it was like we were attacked on what we wanted done as if it was hella busy and I needed to get people in and out fast. I've never seen this lady there before but I have never felt so rushed. The moment we walked in her first question to my mother was what color what color what color, over there, over there without any greeting. But first experiences was more like a spa, you were calmly greeted with a smile, then you were asked how can we help you (they actual allowed you time to answer the question) and escorted to where you would sit. This was the sole reason I chose this particular establishment but now that I've experienced it yesterday it has lost its spa like atmosphere with the services at the front. No thanks, looks like they're going for the more ghetto clientele.

17.description: i had the best Pedicure of my life at Lee Nails. Amy was wonderful and so attentive. I didnt feel rushed and she actually let me soak and enjoy my coffee before she began my pedicure. I appreciated that as it was a rough week and I just wanted to chill for a moment. I have been back twice since then and the people are all so nice and warm. The place is super clean. They also do a great job on eyebrows.

10.description: I have no idea how to feel about this place. They have a $10 minimum on credit cards or something and since I usually just get a polish change (I workout every day and type a bunch for work so manicures often get ruined after a day and are therefore not worth it) it never meets the minimum. I'll usually be like "okay nevermind then" and then they say that they'll take me because they don't want to lose my business. Why don't you just remove the minimum then? They also don't allow tips on credit cards. I do not carry cash around so I don't tip them. I'm not going to carry $2 around so I can tip the woman who spends 10 minutes doing my nails if I'm so inclined. Take credit card tips.The quality of the work is so-so. Some of the women are super good and quick, and others are so sloppy it's not worth even the small amount of money I pay.I also come here on Mondays to get my eyebrows waxed. There is one woman who works there, I believe her name is Amy, that is AMAZING. Barely any pain and she takes no time at all. I tip her 50% every time because I'm such a baby about pain and she's so nice to me.I go here because I have no other good options, basically.

11.description: If you have a limited amount of time, don't go here. I've also noticed that the pedicures don't last as long as they do when I go to other places.

26.description: The staff is friendly, efficient and competent. The salon is spacious, clean and inviting. I was offered options and offered water or tea. My pedicure made a rough day feel better and the massage chairs are brand new! Check out the new grocery store - grab a quick workout and then TREAT YOURSELF!

27.description: This shop opened recently.  VERY nice interior, staff is not only friendly but very personable.  Felt like I was just one of the friends there each time I've gone! Even after the 30% grand opening special is over, the listed prices are very competitive.  Especially with the great level of service and amenities offered.  I won't go anywhere else!

0.description: USE THE OPI GEL COLORS!  I received my first gel color and had NOTHING but issues; it was the lower quality Kiara Sky and it peeled, chipped and four nails ruined within 4 days.  I went back and had a new tech do my nails.  He said to ALWAYS use the OPI.  I did and my nails looked great for 3 weeks!  Every time I go in, Michael does a great job and I ask for only him.  And, Amy does a FAB pedicure.  I highly recommend.  Also, to note, they only take CASH tips.

20.description: First of all , they are expensive . Yet, their quality of their service is very poorly . I just got a mani and pedicure , and they charged me 45$ . My manicure was poorly colored. Their waxing is as well poorly service . They only hurt your nail by doing their supposedly manicure service , and the coloring your nail is uneven , and all over your place . I will never go to that place again .

19.description: I had a very nice experience with Mike who did my pink and whites. For those who don't know what pink and whites are, they are no-chip manicures, but they use 2 different color gels, (pink and white). Because there is no polish, they never, ever chip. It is a bit more expensive (only a bit) but you save money and TIME because they last 4 weeks.  Only a few salons do this type of nails and only 2 in the neighborhood know how to do it correctly.  Mike was personable, gentle, and did a PERFECT job!  I will definitely go back here. Kim did my pedicure and she was great.

2.description: To say that I am disappointed is an understatement.  Not so much with the quality of the work; but the most recent experience I had with the management when I returned to the salon  requesting that my nails be redone after my no-chip manicure was chipping on every nail less than 48 hours after receiving the service.Instead of politely "hearing" what I was saying, the manager's demeanor was instantly defensive. He proceeded to argue with me, telling me that I was wrong-- and in front of other customers!   I totally get it that sometimes manicures don't last as expected-- that is why there is a guarantee. Not a big deal.  What *is* a big deal is the fact that I have been to this place many times. I am always considerate and a generous tipper.   And, this is the first time I have returned for a re-work.  I am not a customer who looks for every opportunity to get free work done, just because of a tiny chip (and they know that).Bottom line: if you have a good customer (or want to keep your customers), if they have a complaint, just do the courteous thing and listen. Even if you don't agree, suck it up and say something like "I'm sorry this did not work out, let me make it right for you." If I had received even a hint of good customer care, I would not be writing this review and they would not have lost a loyal customer.  Shame on them. Good for the next place I choose to take my business.

18.description: I have been going here since they first opened, and I can say that everything has gone down hill over the last two years.  Tonight was the end of my patience.  No one was waiting when I walked in, so they filled the tub for my pedicure. The water was way too hot (really? Don't you all do this for a LIVING??). My polish on my toes is on my skin, and you know how when they trim your toe nails and then paint the ends? Umm, nope. Not any more at this place.  My manicure is not any better...you know how they put cuticle lotion on and push your cuticles back? Ummm, nope.  Not any more at this place. Done. With. Them. There are too many other better places to go.

13.description: I visited this salon the other day for the first time. The staff were very rude. I asked for the tech's name to report this matter to the owner and they wouldn't give me her name. I never post or rate but my experience was terrible !!!! I love Lee nails on Devon, way nicer and better staff. Stay Away!!!!

4.description: I just moved to Rogers park about a year ago and have not found a nail place in the area. I typically go to this place in the loop during my lunch but since I had been off all week I needed to find a place. I sometimes go to a place off of Lawrence and western but is quite a ways from me. My BF actually recommended this place because he knows someone that works here so I gave it a try. I walked in and was impressed by the cleanliness and how nice the place looked overall. I was greeted immediately and was asked to pick out a color which they have so many options. They can do basic polish to specific designs. I opted with the matte finish since I had never tried it before. I originally wanted to go with a dark red but was advised that I should go with a dark purple because of how the matte finish would look. Anyway .. Danny did my nails and he did a great job ! He was very thorough and detailed and took his time. He made great recommendations and overall was just fantastic. I would recommend going to him if you want a job well done. This will definitely be my new nail place !

24.description: Newly opened spa and not any run of the mill kind of setup.  When I saw the sign in the plaza, I expected to see a typical nail salon.  Instead, it's decorated ceiling to floor.  The ceiling was adorned in an intricate pattern or ceiling masonry, rather.  The heating and cooling vents are situated all around so that the salon is properly ventilated, heated and cooled.  There are accents in colors, types of tiling, flat panel televisions and a very large (wall) flowing water fountain that can be heard across the room.  I would assume to give a sense of tranquility to your spa time.  They offer multiple stations for nail care which are along either walls and over twelve spa massage chair stations.  It's an uber nice setup which could easily handle a "GNO" spa day or large bridal party.So the other day my Ma was complaining about the weather and how her hands were looking dryer than usual.  I felt for her and remembered reading a review which mentioned "in winter weather, a paraffin wax treatment will rejuvenate dry hands."  Decided it was time for a spa day for Ma.  Got her a spa pedicure ($28) and the paraffin wax treatment for hands ($8).  I think she was in for about an hour plus.  They offer a number of plush seating at the front of the spa which overlooks the span of the nail salon.I liked that there was a good amount of conversation between the staff member and my Ma.  Another staff member made small talk with me while I waited and between staff and other customers it was casual.  I mention this aspect because of how in some other salon situations; when dealing with workers constantly speaking in their own language, they forget about their customers and may talk about them or use awkward looks or obvious glances which can be off putting.  None of that happened here, Ma had a great time and was happy with her spa day.  She expects to see "Kim" again.  Ma enlightened me that I will have to bring her back in the future for a spa day with her sister.  Walk ins are welcome and there is plenty of free parking in the lot.  Since they are a new salon their pricing is competitive with salons in the area.  If bringing your little ones also, there is a discounted price.

6.description: If you get the organic pedicure and you add $30 you can get a gel treatment on your finger nails. Being a guy, I didn't know where to turn (I didn't need false nails) I loved all the attention I was given. I loved the paraffin wax treatment and mask to my legs. I really liked it but it was my second time here. The first time I was here I didn't know about their other services and got the basic package. While I was there I got a wax on my feet and eyebrows. I would recommend this place to anyone.

22.description: I really want to like this place, mostly because it's close to my house and I can always get in quickly. However, I can't justify the cost anymore ($38 for mani and pedi) given that my nails are always chipping by day 2.  The main problems I've noticed is that 1) they don't "wrap" the nail polish around the tip of the nail so the top edges start to wear down almost immediately and 2) they extend the polish to basically on top of the cuticle, so as your nail grows, the polish pulls away, leaving a "flap" of polish that's not stuck to the nail at your nail bed. This snags every time I run my hands through my hair, and eventually the whole "sheet" of polish pulls off the nail. I've been several times with several technicians and the same thing happens every time.  This last time they also didn't put clear coat from edge to edge so it's like a matte perimeter around each nail... For quality of services I'd give 2 stars, the extra star is because the salon, as others have noted, is very nice inside.

15.description: I use to be a tech. Here, builted plenty of clients for the salon but i still get a bunch of bullsh** smack from the employers as sokn as i leave.. if i would of known it would be like that i wouldnt be working for them in the first place.lets just say this place is full of it.

7.description: I came here to get a no chip manicure.as I came in they greeted me. The place is warm and lovely.they have quite a few selection.This is my first time to come to Lee Nails but I was disappointed .During my service, I have to wait for a while  for my tech to do costumer eye brow and they just walk in  I've already told the tech I won't have time to do mani&pedi . Now that I have to waited longer .I won't be back

8.description: Beautiful space! But I didn't like the gel the used on my nails. It lifted within a few days, then soon after peeled off. I got the deluxe pedicure ($55) and it lasted a long time, the massage was nice, but she didn't spend enough time on my toenails. I need someone to get in there! My only complaints. Seems very clean though, lots of room and chairs

3.description: There's a nail salon around the corner that I can walk to, but it's tiny, always overcrowded and so is the parking lot. Instead, I drive down to Clark & Howard for services from Lee Nails. Very clean, very spacious and the prices are reasonable. More importantly, I've never left there not feeling my best! My mani-pedis or brow waxes are always perfect! I'm a nurse and the no-chip manicures last me a couple of weeks, which is darn good considering I wash my hands frequently throughout the day during treatments. The huge parking lot is such a convenience - no running in and out to feed parking meters. Some days I'll hit the gym (LAF) and buy groceries (Jewel's) all in one day since they're in the same plaza.

14.description: I made an appointment for 6 pm for a mani pedi and was not seated until around 6:30. I really love this place because they do a really good job with my nails always (the men at this place do amazing nails), but I had to be somewhere so I was only able to get a mani. The front desk person was very apologetic and accommodating but I just couldn't give the time. I think that having an appointment is kind of important and they should not have let other people who just walked in without appointments in front of me... Which is the reason I had to wait for 30 min for my treatment. That being said, I still really like his place I would just avoid it Friday afternoons.

0.description: It's a small White Hen.It's ok, I guess.The staff is friendly and let me use thier microwave to heat up my frozen meal.

3.description: Howard Jewelry & Loan is one of the best places to go if you need anything. I was giving the opportunity to purchase an engagement ring from their store & walked away with a diamond wedding/engagement ring for my partner & also a diamond wedding band for myself. I was giving one of the greatest deals ever so, for that reason alone, I will never buy jewelry from anywhere else. If I ever need some jewelry or even a big screen television, Howard Jewelry & Loan has it all. The people that work there are just a great pleasure to work with & they also know how to find you whatever you're looking for to fit your needs..!

1.description: I love this place! They especially have a beautiful, large selection of vintage rings. Bianca was a total doll when my now fiancé and I were shopping for rings. She knew exactly what I was looking for. My then bf was able to put a ring on hold and she even even gave a slight discount. We will be definitely return here to get our wedding bands.

2.description: Great Pawn Shop ! Nice people to do business with,Honest and fair. Awesome selection of great jewelry and musical instruments. I will never again buy my wife some new jewelry from a store. you cant beat their deals and gold will always be gold and silver will always be silver no matter where you purchased it from! Why pay full price?

5.description: I had to pawn some jewelry (this is the first time). They didn't make feel embarrassed or trashy for having to pawn.  I got what I need.  It is a very in and out kinda of please.  Easy street parking, small place. I will go there again if I need it. In a quick glance they had some good merchandise.

6.description: These guys are great. They pay top dollar and are super ethical. I've pawned many items with them and have always gotten a fair deal. They are WAY better than any other pawn shop I've dealt with in the past.

7.description: This place is a gem! Literally! Not only do they have all the cool electronics and jewelry but they actually have a jewelry designer there! I don't have to just try to sell my grandma's jewelry. I was actually able to turn it into a piece i will wear everyday thanks to Richard!!

0.description: cant miss pawnshop I travel from the southside to do business with rich and Bianca   you can"t go   wrong trust me they should offer me a job much as im in there

4.description: Ive been to a few pawn shops around the Chicago land area and this is at the top of my list.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and I didn't feel like they were trying to make money off me.  They were honest and straight forward.  They have competitive prices and a huge selection, especially for jewelry.  If you are in the area or don't mind the drive, its worth your time!  Overall, great customer service and you get what you are paying for.

58.description: Was here last night...contrary to other reports, our orders did come with ranch and celery per order.  Always nice to have.  Got a single order of my favorite flavor (suicide!), and they were good, but for some reason they weren't as memorable as the ones I usually have in Evanston.  Maybe because you don't get to see them toss the wings in those big metal bowls.What really knocks this location down for me is that they lacked the cheddar chips!  Also known as the waffle fries, I was really disappointed that they just had regular fries (despite having a picture of the waffle fries hanging above the register).  Surprisingly, the cheese fries they did have were pretty well seasoned, but they just weren't the same as the chips with the deep orange cheese sauce that hardens 20 minutes after you get it.Wish we had gone the further 15 minutes up to Evanston, but it's hard to complain when you're diving into some tasty wings.  Especially while surrounded by faded trading cards and old Bulls posters.

56.description: I was always wary to try this place, but once inside it was a very friendly atmosphere and courteous service. And the wings are GOOD. Definitely the best I've had so far in Chicago. It's well worth a trip, and their fries are good too. I recommend it to anyone.

29.description: Double order of Suicide wings is where it's at. The wings could be more meaty though.

42.description: this location is not as great as the one on Clark.. but this place does seem to be a little cleaner inside, but i would not be coming back to this one due to the quality compare to the one on Clark.

23.description: I used to believe that this place had the best wings and I'm slowly starting to take that back. Over the years the prices for the single order has gone up and the quality seems to be going down (it's not what it used to be 10 yrs ago) I have noticed the Clark location always seems to be better in taste for some reason. Also where did the waffle fries go? Last time I went I wanted to try something different and got the tender dinner which was pretty good amount of food for the same price of a single order! Overall the wings are still pretty good but I hope they bring this place back to what it used to be.

47.description: One of a few places that makes me miss living in Rogers Park, Buffalo Joes's is one of the best wings places out there. I love getting their suicide wings when I have a cold so I can cleanse my sinuses!  On other occassions I get a single order of hot and an order of fries. Sometimes the fries are a little too salty, so give 'em a shake in the baggie to dust off the excess salt. I LOVE that they give you ranch dressing as I am anti-bleu cheese, thanks, Buff Joe's! The only reason they don't get five stars is because as many reviewers have mentioned, the wings are TINY! They used to be a lot bigger, what gives? I wouldn't mind paying a little more for bigger wings.

8.description: Buffalo Joes is good. I've never ordered anything that I didn't like from there. Watch out for the long lines and don't expect a lot in terms of customer service from the cashiers. The prices are expensive in comparison to similar places in Chicago.

31.description: Smells delish! Wings are cool,cash only!

34.description: Yum, good wings and rib tips. This is a fast food place, not a gourmet BBQ shack. The wings are indeed small, but you still end up with a good amount of food for the price.

16.description: Well, this was a major improvement from the bug in my burger a few years back. I got the mini tip with fries, they were super tender. The kool-aid was delish. The oreo parfait was not that good. It was like cakes crumbles layered with flavorless creme. While we were waiting in line the cashier forgot this guys lemonade, when he asked for it, she kinda got an attitude,  and turned her back and made a face. Hmmm

13.description: I used to believe that this place had the best wings and I'm slowly starting to take that back. Over the years the prices for the single order has gone up and the quality seems to be going down (it's not what it used to be 10 yrs ago) I have noticed the Clark location always seems to be better in taste for some reason. Also where did the waffle fries go? Last time I went I wanted to try something different and got the tender dinner which was pretty good amount of food for the same price of a single order! Overall the wings are still pretty good but I hope they bring this place back to what it used to be.

11.description: Cash only, good wings, generous portions, fish sandwich was huge & tasty. A young Friday night female cashier was very nice & helpful on our first visit, forgot her name. We'll be back.

39.description: Best thing to bring to a party. People always seem so happy when you walk in the door with  Joe's wing. I love the spicy and the suicide both have that tang you are looking for and just end up eating more wings.  Even when it is cold it is still good to eat but if you get it hot. The wings are just nice and crispy.

37.description: Good wings that can use more meet but are tasty - yep, this is the place. Been going here since America made me into the fat ass I am now. Thanks.

0.description: I've had mixed feelings about Buffalo Joe's wings as I believe they have changed over the years. I wrote a review for the Clark St. location recently where I detailed the changes, and explained that I don't go nearly as much as I used to, since Wingstop came to town.Well tonight hubby wanted rib tips, and I remembered that this location had them. We ordered a large double order of the hot wings and a large order of tips, which comes with fries, bread, and rheir delicious barbeque sauce. Both were excellent! Hubby was pleased, as well, and said he would go back. Yay!Be aware, though; they don't have the waffle fries, and they take cash only. They do have an ATM, but I refuse to pay ATM fees! If you're a Bank of America customer, there is a BOA a few yards east on Howard St.

38.description: I used to be a big fan of buffalo joe's on howard. Stopped going when the chicken wings starrted shrinking.  Not sure what kind of bird they are serving now days.

51.description: The wings are pretty decent.  However, there are wings out there that are better.  I have nothing bad to say about buffalo joes except that they don't accept credit cards and that their wings are wayyy to small.  I'm not a big eater but the wings I had today were tiny.  They were macro wings.Lady at the register was real nice and took care of us pretty well.  I will definately return because of the taste but not the size.

27.description: On my very first visit i was hooked.The prices are reasonable and the bbq rib tips are so tender & juicy  even a toothless person can eat them easily and not very fatty or bone filled.The sweet smoky bbq sauce is to die for and the size of the piecesof tips are just right, not too big, not too small.The chicken wings are awesome as well as they are cooked to perfectionso they fall off the bone as you eat them and they have the same wonderful sweet smoky sauce..Also a great plus feature is, if you need a large pan of tips or wings for an occasion they will fulfill this request promptly and for a reasonable price.this is my got to for the best bbq in chicago.i give them a 10+++++++

32.description: I was in the area earlier today and stopped in. It's a fairly nice spot. There's counter seating as well as a separate seating area. The bathroom wasn't bad  even though the mustard container doubled as the soap dispenser. Whatever,  it's a fast food joint. They have ribs, burgers, polishes, chicken wings and even baked potatoes with various toppings. I opted for a cheeseburger special and a rib tip special. I didn't eat it all at once. I tried them both and they were pretty decent. The fries were really good. The tips  were tender and meaty and the sauce  was nicely balanced. I don't know the last time I had a cheeseburger from a regular old side spot but this one was certainly satisfying. The prices are reasonable too. I can't eat like this too often but if I was in the area and wanted to be bad, then yes, I'd return.

54.description: Great wings. I'm not usually a fan of chicken but I love the wings here.

48.description: Suicide wings...NO! I loves me some good wings, however, any wings that start with the name "SUICIDE", are not for me. I'm more of a mild sauce kinda gal; and they do have some good mild wings here. The service is fast, and you can even call in your order ahead of time, and they'll have it ready when you get there. I must admit that I was a bit skeptical about this place since it is not in an area I'm familiar with. I certainly am happy I decided to try it. I'm thankful for good friends, and good wings. Try it!

44.description: Could it be? Two same-named establishments who operate at opposite ends of the spectrum? The answer to that is YES.Holy crap. I called ahead to place an order to pick up for the following day. It was a decent sized order that involved a party pan of wings and such. You know how many times I had to call before someone could take my order?? Four. Two calls played out like this:Buff Joe's: Thank you for calling Buffalo Joe's on Howard. Can I help you??Me: Hi. I would like to pla---------...[dial tone]The third call kinda went along the lines of:Buff Joe's: Thank you for calling Buffalo Joe's on Howard. Can I help you??Me: Hi. I would like to place an order that will be picked up tomorrow.Buff Joe's: Okay. Let me get someone who can take that order, sir.[Employee puts phone down on counter][I wait......for seven minutes].Yeah. I hung up, but not before I heard about what some of the female employees did the night before. Let's just say they had quite an evening and they couldn't wait to get off...of work.At this point you're probably saying "Why didn't this guy just call the Clark St. location?" Well, because I needed the order for a certain time and the Clark St. location couldn't guarantee me getting my food at the hour that I requested.I didn't learn from the previous three calls so I made the fourth call. The gal took my order. Verbally repeated the order and the time. We said our goodbyes.FAST FORWARD to the next day. I go to pick up the order...and you guessed it...THEY HAD NO RECORD OF IT. I got a "Sorry" and that's about it. No compensation. Nada. Wtheck!!**For those who are interested in the quality of food, it's sub-par compared to the more popular location. OH, and Howard doesn't have waffle fries.**Cash only, just like the other Buff Joe's.

24.description: I've been going to Buffalo Joe's for years. This review is based solely on the wings as it is the only thing I ever get. I'm originally from the east coast and have been trying for years to find some good buffalo wings in the city. Good: While these are a little different from traditional buffalo wings they are still pretty good. They are a little on the small side, but you get a lot more than you would at most places. And they do a nice job getting the wings at the perfect crispiness. I always get the suicide, and while they are far from being suicidal hot, they get the job done. I like the extra touch of the jalapenos on top.  You also get a pretty decent amount of celery to go with it. They also have a parking lot which is a huge bonus for a place in the city. Bad: Couple things to note. The place is kind of drab and old. The kind of old that makes a place feel dingy. They do takeout so that shouldn't be a problem. Also the place is cash only, can be annoying for someone who rarely has cash. But they have an ATM  which like all ATM's has a service fee However, there is literally both a Chase and BOA just one block away so its a small complaint. Also, while I don't normally get fries, my friends have complained that they do not have the waffle fries here like they do at the Evanston Buffalo Joe's.

7.description: I have lived less than a mile from Buffalo Joe's on Howard Street for 15+ years and for years my neighbors have raved about this place. Finally tonight I tried it for the first time. We got a single order of suicide wings and an order of the chicken tenders with spicy sauce to go. We got home and our food was still hot. The wings were on the small side, but there were 14 of them and they were very good. The chicken tenders were crispy, hot and tasty. None of the sauces were overly hot, actually could have used a little more heat. They have a parking lot next to the building. The place was decently clean for a divey wing joint.

49.description: Once upon a time, when I was just a young cub trying to make it in the white man's world, my brothers, both Northwestern Alum, asked me to pick up a couple Buffalo Joe's pans of hot wings for a family get together. That day, everything in my life...changed.The sauce entered my bloodstream like Vampire blood, and I metamorphosized into the mad Chicken Wingophile you witness before you today.I tend to favor the one on Howard, they have the best cheese fries. I also appreciate that there's a billboard in their parking lot advertising a local hospital's treatment of indigestion and heartburn. Their wings could be juicier and larger, but at least they're cooked to order, and their colorfully named 'Gutbuster' sized soda drinks are a nice touch.I double dog dare you to try the double-sized Suicide Wings, as these are mostly to blame for my internal hemmoroids condition. I'm convinced their wing sauce qualifies as a Schedule I Controlled substance, as I have been unable to wean myself off of it in spite of the interventions staged by my friends and family(I swear I'm taking it one day at a time, Mom!). Service is a friendly smile at the order counter, ambience is a mini-TV in the corner surrounded by Chicago Sports' paraphernalia, and food quality is the best wings in town.

40.description: I tried the suicide wings....fantastic!

53.description: For some reason I prefer this location over the one in Evanston. I was hooked on this place immediately, the suicide wings are the best, if you can handle it. They even serve Kool-Aid, lol. This is one of those spots I love to take Southsiders because the food is that good.

30.description: Wings are overrated here.  I enjoyed seeing my piping hot wings and tasting the tiny wings' tasty meat and perfect crispy skin.  But I am not a fan of the shallow flavor of the suicide buffalo sauce (it's not that spicy compared to BWW's blazin' sauce).  Hot dogs were overcooked and the cheese on the chili dog tasted plastic.  However, the waffle fries were crispy and great!  My trip all the way out to Evanston for these wings were not worth it, despite all the other reviews.

46.description: Ribs and wings are awesome here. Hamburgers are pretty good too.

1.description: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE service. Waited over an hour and a half just to order the food and it took over another hour cook it. While we waited nicely for over two and a half hours, however the phone orders were clearly given priority, the employees attitude made you feel guilty for ordering food. We were told and I quote" that we should not order a Double pan because the boss will not like it and she will be yelled at". I mean really? Waiting in line for about two hours to have the employee tell you not to order what you want because she will be yelled at by her boss? But hey about 70 people with phone orders went right ahead with huge orders and no problem. Never going there again. Call ahead or ordering on the spot, waste of time bad I can do without the attitude other places. Wings are great, not worth the headache. Small tip- if you pay the cashiers about $50 extra you will get your wings right away out the back door. Nice establishment

55.description: I don't want to be a negative nancy, but come on, these wings are nothing special.They are tiny.When I say tiny, I mean REAL tiny.  Hard-to-eat tiny.  More bone than wing tiny.  Now, I came here because I love my chicken wings and I wanted to see what the fuss was about.  Really, for those of you who are avid wing fans -- the stuff at Jewel's hot food counter is better.Another negative?  H.A.T.E when wings come with Ranch instead of Bleu Cheese.They were just OK, and thats it.  Don't make a special trip.

9.description: Best wings and fries in Chicago. The cashiers are usually rude, except a couple of them. Please get a credit/debit machine. Prices are ridic.Be careful, somedays this place will serve you a batch of bad, miscut so called wings. Be sure to always check before you leave! Be weary of the freezer burned tasting ones as well.

26.description: This is definitely a place I'll miss when I move next week.  I've tried a pretty good variety of things here and they've all been good.  Then I got to where I ordered the same thing every time (not something that's a very common order) and the lady working at the register remembers every time.  Impressive!  Especially for the price, can't go wrong here.

25.description: best buffalo wings ever!!!

12.description: Looks like these chickens were starved cuz the wigs were skinny and the bone snapped too easily. Melts in your mouth not in your hands. But it wasn't m&m's. Still gulped em down and feelin satisfied. It's definitely become hit or miss rather than consistent. Definitely way better in the high school days.Service was good and friendly.  Parking lot.

59.description: This place has pretty good wings, I understand why they are famous. I can't stand those jumbo wings that every dime a dozen place are serving these days. Size does not equal flavor. Joes wings are small and packed with deliciousness. I ordered a double order spicy and while the amount of jalapenos might have frightened me, they added the perfect amount of flavor. I wish they accepted cash since I'm now living off my credit cards right now..... oh well.... I probably need to save money anyways....

21.description: Get their mini tips! It's a solid meal for a great price. I've been working in the area for 5 years now and this place has not failed me. Very good burgers, giant fish sandwiches, and pretty good ribs.

17.description: I dropped by there a month or so ago and tried the wings. To be completely honest I wanted to throw it away, there's no meat on the wings at all. Your basically eating skin and sauce, fries are so-so. Your regularly Sub Joint has way better wing they just missing the different sauces. Will not spend my money there again sorry to say. The trick is giving you so many wings you dont notice anything eles (I think). I really hate giving reviews like this.

10.description: In My Humble opinion, Buffalo Joes has the best Buffalo Wings Ive ever Tasted!!

5.description: I'm a Buff Joe's fan, but this is my least favorite location of the bunch. The wings are just as good as the other locations, but no waffle fries? That's just wrong! I'll keep returning to Buff Joe's for my Chicago/Evanston wing fix, but I think I'll be choosing alternate location for my future trips. Bring ca$h money if you're stopping by, cards not accepted.

3.description: The wings were pretty mediocre. I don't see what the hype is about. Sure, the sauce was good and the chicken was cooked properly but it didn't give me a WOW moment. Also, I was getting a bad vibe from one of the staff members. It's like she hated that one of the people in our group was a vegetarian or hated that I asked for 4 water cups for my whole table. Although, the order did come out in a timely manner.I feel like it could possibly be a good sports bar with a few touch ups here and there though.

35.description: UGHHHHHHH WHY???The wings had so little meat, I think the chickens were anorexic.  Jokes aside, really, for 20 wings, there was practically no chicken there.  It was little more than bones encased in skin & sauce with an occasional scrap of chicken here or there.  And not even the fried part was good; the wings tasted vaguely and unpleasantly of catfish.  Those amazing waffle cheese fries apparently can't cross Howard street, because they serve run of the mill hot dog stand fries with liquid cheese here. The soda even tasted off! Yuck, yuck, yuck.  Yeah, I'll just drive the extra 10 minutes north and eat at the downtown Evanston one next time and forever after.

19.description: Reasonable prices. The rib tips were good. For me the suicide was not that spicy perhaps they mixed up the order.The employees were super friendly and made some recommendations. It s cash only, but there is an ATM inside. Perfect place to order from and take home to eat.

28.description: I normally go to the Buffalo Joes in Evanston, but this is my second time at this location. This place is just a little closer to me and it has a parking lot, which is always nice. I just saw an article on Yahoo featuring this as "Top 5 Wing Places in Chicago".The wings here taste similar to the ones at Evanston, which are amazing and perfect in every way. Though I will have to say the Evanston one is a little better. The only thing was they didn't have waffle fries at this location. They have regular fries which are seasoned. I was skeptical at first when they told me this because waffle fries at the other location complements the wings perfectly. The fries here are good, but it still doesn't compare to the waffle fries. Another thing about this place is that they have rib tips, which was decent.

45.description: Friday afternoon we ordered a single tray of spicy wings for Saturday's big Saints playoff game, which they lost. The girl took my order and name, but no cash was required. (And this joint is CASH ONLY, though there's an in-store ATM machine in a pinch.) I arrived precisely at 3:30 for my scheduled pick-up time, but they weren't ready yet. I waited about 5-6 minutes and was ultimately happy that they weren't sitting under a heat lamp waiting on me and getting all steam-mushy. In the car, the sauce smelled more like a spicy BBQ, and I thought for a minute that they weren't going to be a traditional buffalo flavor, but alas, the sauce was divine, everything I had hoped for! (Sauce choices are mild, spicy, suicide or BBQ - we got spicy.)The wings boasted nice heat, decent meatiness (for the size they were anyway - they are NOT wings on steroids, for sure), a well-cooked skin (I hate when the skin texture is soft like a raw chicken's), and the pan fed 6 people w/ 9 skinny wings left. Wait. The tray only fed 6 people? And so this is why they get 4 stars instead of 5 - the pan is supposed to feed 8-10. For $43.83, I expected it to serve the 8-10 people it claimed on the menu, not a mere 6! (Okay, MAYBE a 7th including the leftovers.) Also, none of the accoutrements were included - celery and dressing were extra. Overall, these wings - the spicy ones anyway - are damn good. I would definitely go back for more, not to mention, to try the fried fish, charbroiled burgers, and rib tips as well.

33.description: Being from the "Home of Buffalo Wings" before moving here, I've always wanted to try this place.  It's no where near as good as the other reviews suggest unless maybe 'cause it's the only rib (and wing) place around?  Even that's a stretch.  The product is far below what you'd deserve from a carry-out / restaurant.  You decide:  I like rib tips and saw they had a $8.25 Special of wings and tips with fries and a drink.  I ordered mine to-go no sauce - as I always do - no fires, slaw, or drink.  And for the exact same price I got wings in a size so small killing that chicken was plain cruel.  The rib tips were just as small.  At BJ's "dry" is the keyword,  add no quantity and you have it all.  Can you say J P Alberto's?  Go....run!

43.description: Nasty. Great food for when your drunk!

2.description: Got the order wrong over the phone, big time.Wish they accepted email orders or you can order on-line.Only accepts cash and doesn't provide gift cards for credit for wrong orders.  Wings are okay to good, but not great. Consider other Joe locations if you like them.

18.description: I normally go to the Buffalo Joes in Evanston, but this is my second time at this location. This place is just a little closer to me and it has a parking lot, which is always nice. I just saw an article on Yahoo featuring this as "Top 5 Wing Places in Chicago".The wings here taste similar to the ones at Evanston, which are amazing and perfect in every way. Though I will have to say the Evanston one is a little better. The only thing was they didn't have waffle fries at this location. They have regular fries which are seasoned. I was skeptical at first when they told me this because waffle fries at the other location complements the wings perfectly. The fries here are good, but it still doesn't compare to the waffle fries. Another thing about this place is that they have rib tips, which was decent.

41.description: Service is always pretty good here, the cashiers in front are always really nice. Closer to me than the one in downtown Evanston and there's a parking lot. The only downfall is that they don't have waffle fries! Their steak cut fries still get that amazing seasoning though. Orders don't come as "saucy" as the orders in downtown Evanston do but you can always ask for more sauce on the side. I'm salivating writing this review.. DELISH!!

52.description: This has to be the worst restaurant in the entire city. People actually think this place has good food ? MAybe if you never ate anything in your life. Skip this place and go to that place up on Howard and Ridge instead or Popeyes... Brenda and company will treat you right over there.

50.description: I went for lunch after reading good reviews, and it stood up.I'll be back. Thanks Lonn...B

4.description: 1st of all its 31degrees outside and INSIDE the place as well. How can you eat at a place that's freezing COLD. I like the place but really what's up with the heat.  Everyone in the place sat freezing cold with their coats on!!! Hello management!!!

6.description: I have been to Buffalo Joe's two times, both at this location. The first time I came around was in May 2015, experience was great. The second time (12/02/2015 @ 6:30 pm) ... not so great. First, I arrive to the place with my friend and I and we are ready to order, waiting for the cashier since she was just standing around, when a few seconds later, she answers a phone order, okay, that is fine. Finally she gets off the phone after 3 minutes and my friend and I order our food. AS she is taking our order, the phone rings again for another phone order, she picks up the phone AND takes the order while my friend and I were ordering.Personally, I work at a place with a drive thru and tend to be cashier upfront at the same time as being drive thru. If I am assisting a customer up front and a car is in the drive thru, it is common to ask the person in drive thru to please give me a moment while I continue to assit the customer up front. I have been in experiences like this as well with other places so I don't mind.She didn't even ask us to give her a moment, and I found that very rude since I got cut off in the middle of ordering.She appeared to be hispanic, she was short, had tattoos on her right arm and purple hair in the back.Other than that, the food was great! Came out fast and filled me up. I'll give this place another try since the food was great. Customer service wise? I think it can improve more.

22.description: My boyfriend loves this place. Upon my moving to Chicago, he wanted to celebrate with rib tips, so that's exactly what we did.
