I wasn't too crazy about them so I wasn't all excited when he said he wanted to go there again last Saturday night, but this time we went and there was a "Manager's Special" for a cheeseburger with fries and a drink... One of the most delicious, greasiest, juiciest, messiest burgers I've ever had in my entire life...As I watched my boyfriend dance and sing love songs to his rib tips, I joined in and did a lil somethin' somethin' to my plate as well. Only taking away one star cause the refills of the super small and super sweet pink lemonade cost $.75 each :(

15.description: Best wings on the far northside, I never been to the one in Evanston, but the  Howard st. location is on point. The suicide wings are my fav. fries are seasoned really good, burgers are badass, and occasionally I have a loaded bake potatoe which is really good. One thing that I noticed is that there wings have been getting smaller and barely have any meat which sucks cause this place is really good but they need to fix that. If your ordering carryout or dining in on a big sporting event day call ahead early with plenty of time cause it gets packed.

57.description: I've been meaning to go there for a long time, so last night on my way home from work, I stopped and picked up a double-order of spicy wings.  They turned out to be really good!  They came with celery and ranch dressing.  Not beautiful inside the establishment, doesn't take credit/debit cards, but overall pretty darn good.

20.description: I live close and have never been there, so was feeling like a little junk food and we tried it.  We got rib tips - they have super sweet bbq sauce and are served over the french fries.  They are ok - didn't love them.  Tried the wings - they are wings, nothing exceptional but fine.  We also tried the shrimp dinner - I liked the shrimp but I could make the same in my oven.  The fries were not crispy and just tasted like frozen fries thrown in the fryer.  The cocktail sauce was horrible - it tasted like sweet ketchup.I could have had better food for $30 takeout.

36.description: Welcome to Buffalo Joes home of the suicide chicken wings. Due to lent I couldn't take any photos, taste, smell, look at or touch these fried chicken wings. As soon as lent is over i will make sure to have a follow up post on these amazing wings. This not so hole in the wall but seems like a hole in the wall restaurant has been a staple to evanston for many years. It's funny because I've only been to the downtown evanston location and my friend jimmy has been telling me about this location for over a year now. This place for sure has better deals, better sized wings, rib tips!, friendly staff and a shrine of michael jordan memorabilia. I mean c'mon rib tips, wings, fries and a drink for 9 bucks! It's like I'm stealing from them. My brother and jimmy had the wings and has said that they are way better than the downtown evanston one, larger, flavorful, perfectly cooked to perfection and great to the last bone. This time i couldn't order the wings so i ended up with the chicken burger and a broccoli and cheese baked potato. Both items were delicious. This being a wing specialty restaurant I am very surprised that the other dishes were just as good. Hope you enjoy the pictures! Hot wings in a month for a follow up post must happen.

14.description: Been going here & to the Evanston location since I was in high school.  Great wings, fried fish, rib tips.  Howard location does not have the waffle fries but better fried fish options.  Never had anything bad, food is consistently good.  Opt for carryout, not much ambience but who cares-the food is happening & a great value!

3.description: Unforgettable experience with all Tibetan traditional singing bowls, gongs and ceremonies! The two hour massage was very intense and professional. Detail, concentrated on pressure points, without leaving any part of your muscles untouched. There is nothing to compare with- you just need to try it to understand. It's really combines your body and your mind recovery.

1.description: Lama Lobsang gives the best healing massage ever!  I have seen him several times and every time has been different and totally worth it.  For me, he works very deeply and sometimes intensely, but I'm confident that he is sensitive enough to give people the lesser intensity if appropriate.  In addition, Lama Lobsang is a Tibetan monk and the massage is a sacred ceremony and puts you in touch with a depth of being.   For some reason, the info about price is given 4 dollar signs ($$$$) but really this is wrong..... the price is VERY reasonable and is on par with, or maybe a little bit less than, the average massage therapist.  Most sessions are 2 hours, and although you can book a shorter session, I highly recommend the full 2 hours.

2.description: I met Lama Lobsang Palden yesterday afternoon for a Tibetan Healing Session. It was a truly incredible experience. I woke up feeling different this morning. For the first time in as long as I can remember, I feel totally at peace. We had a brief consultation beforehand and he worked on specific areas. It was deep, but extremely relaxing and did not cause any soreness at all. I would highly recommend him to anyone who feels stress/anxiety or physical/emotional pain and truly wants to heal themselves and expand their consciousness. I will 100% go back to the Lama.

0.description: Lama Lobsang Palden has many years of experience in the Tibetan healing arts. From his childhood in Tibet he was educated as a monk and he continued his studies in India. He has a thorough grounding in the teachings of Tibetan Buddhism, the essence of which is compassion for others.  The form of massage he practices is just as much a destressing of the mind as the body. He is well attuned to the needs of the individual and the treatment is adjusted appropriately. He combines the use of sacred sound, including the recitation of mantras accompanied by bells and horns, with bodywork. It makes for a real opportunity to lay aside the pain all of us carry around.

4.description: I am writing a review of Lama Lobsang Palden's Tibetan Healing Massage Ceremony. lamalobsang.com/TibetanH…A few friends recommended him to me and my boyfriend got me a gift certificate for my birthday. I had been a bundle of nerves for months and months, and Lama Lobsang's massage was one of the most healing experiences of my life. I left feeling completely renewed and it's been a month and I still feel great!

3.description: DONT EVER GO THEREI bought 4 premeir deluxe massage table, even they have life time guaranty but I used them only 3 months they all fall apart, All of them make the squeeze sound when I gave massage for customers on the top of that 1 is broken.  I called them they asking me have to film and record the sound and send the film to them.  If it is a real problem I have to pack and send it back.  Too much work and too much time, plus i have to spend money for shipping.  I dont trust that table even if they replace.Please dont do the same mistake as I do.Horrible service.

1.description: I've been here a couple of times.  The first time, several months ago, I was looking to upgrade from my student massage table to something better quality, and figured this would be a good place to compare models in person.  Unfortunately, they only had one table in the showroom that was in the price range I was looking at.  The staff answered my questions readily enough, but didn't seem all that interested in making recommendations or sharing their experiences or actually, y'know, selling their products.  I shrugged it off as their business being more online-focused, decided not to come back unless I was looking for something specific, and left it at that.Fast forward to yesterday, when I was looking for a stone warmer for hot stone therapy.  I looked on their website and saw they had a very competitive price on the warmer I wanted; even better, it was listed as being on "In-Store Special!" for $10 less.  I figured, sure, for that price I'll make the drive out there.  Unfortunately, when I arrived, they informed me that yes, the advertised price was accurate, but they were out of stock until June, a fact listed nowhere on the product page.  (How they manage to stay in business with such lackadaisical suppliers, here in this age of Amazon Prime, is an exercise left to the reader.)Perhaps I was a little unreasonable in my expectations that an item listed as being an "in-store special!" actually be, y'know, in the store.  Or maybe I was just annoyed at having wasted over half an hour in Chicago traffic.  But when I stepped out of the door (directly into an alleyway - how is that up to code??) and was almost hit by an oncoming car, it seemed like a good indicator from the Universe that this was not a place worth any more of my time.

2.description: I've been a dozen times and the service seems to get worse and worse.  If you know exactly what you need and just need to check out, you'll do fine.  If you need to ask a question, good luck.  They'd rather sit at the computer than help you out.  I'll be purchasing supplies elsewhere from now on.

9.description: Very good prices on quality products.  I bought my massage chair here, and, after 4 years, I'm still very happy with it.  It's lightweight and very portable, with a carrying case on wheels.  Also bought a small hot stone warmer for $59, that I saw everywhere else for $99 or more.  Grapeseed oil is the best price I've found anywhere.  They guarantee everything.  And they are very convenient for me, with a showroom with regular hours.

10.description: This place has the worst customer service ever.  I visited the store about 2 months ago.  Lady sitting at the desk looked right at me and didn't greet me at all or ever.  The other lady was on the phone and never greeted me at all once she was done.  I was in the store about 10 minutes and was never greeted at all.  So, don't ask why, but I tried again this morning.  There were 2 guys and one woman.  I walked in and no greeting.  I finally stared at the guy at the desk and he finally said hello.  Never said "can I help you with anything".  I said I have some questions about the massage beds he responded okay what are they in a rude way.  He wasn't knowledgeable at all about the products at all poor salesman.  I guess they don't want my business or business at all. He stepped away because the other employee was having computer issues and never came back to ask me anything. Once again the woman looked right at me an never said hello.  I have a background in sales so I know the importance of customer service.  I was ready to purchase several beds, but I will NEVER go back to that store again!!!!

4.description: Walked over to see if they carry essential oil bottles and roller bottles as I would rather spend my money in my neighborhood than online. I pushed open the unlocked door and was greeted by a man yelling "excuse me we are closed." I stepped back and checked the door and found the hours listed among a lot of other stuff and sure enough they closed at 430 my bad it was 455. The door was open  though. If they were open for a private event a sign would have been helpful. In any case yelling at a potential customer is not good business.

6.description: My experience here is similar to the previous poster. The place is really geared towards website sales. It's almost just a "side business" that they have a showroom. The guys at the front are busy filling orders and its pretty much a "self serve" warehouse. That said, what they lack in customer service is made up in the savings. I've looked online at product and supplies and the prices IN the showroom are pretty damn good. I got my table from here and the price was good but seems like all the tables they have are only 26" wide. While you can get side extensions I'd prefer a wider table without the hassle of extensions. Personal preference. The fortunate thing for me is I live 15min from there so it's close and convenient. I'd rather save money then have someone falling all over me to help me find what I can find on my own if that means higher prices. I'd like to go with 3.5 stars. 4 stars for their prices and 3 for the environment.

11.description: Margie is the greatest!!! The prices and inventory are affordable and of great quality. I needed a massage chair in a pinch and didnt have alot of money and I went right down there and got one that has made me enough money to pay for it and my new table I upgraded to. It is beautiful even though it was discounted for cosmetic damages I cant tell. They gladly took it out and showed me all the repairs and the fine quality of the table. A $3-400 table for $157. They always have great come ups. Im going tomorrow to buy a fleece cover for my table and headrest for only $25. I love this place for all my massage needs.

5.description: I went into the store in May to buy a table. The one I choose came with a set of sheets. I also bought an oil resistant table cover. When I got home the sheets didnt fit the table. I had to drive over an hour back to the store to get another set. I have had 4 massages on the table and the fo-leather cover is already wearing out in one section. I called and asked for a refund and was told I could drive in again and get another one but not a refund or I could mail it to them and pay for the shipping and they would send me another one. I asked why I would want another one if it was of poor quality. Sorry thats all we can do. I hope the table lasts longer. Buyer beware.

7.description: Best Massage was recommended to my by students at the massage school where I teach. Several have told me, over the last year, that Best Massage had really good prices, on everything from tables to supplies. But, because I really didn't need much in the way of supplies, I never checked the place out.Finally, my holster that holds my massage oil when I work fell apart. I needed to get a new holster before I work this weekend. After teaching today, I made the trek to East Rogers Park for what is, for me, an essential supply.The store is located on the south side of Howard, only one or two doors west of Sheridan Road. There is metered parking on the street.The store itself is fairly well-organized. When I entered, I saw two men sitting behind a long counter, obviously busy doing something. I was not greeted when I came in.The place is not really that big, but it does have a few massage tables set up. The tables were easy to find - they're big. I saw some CDs displayed, along with linens, bolsters, different kinds of lubricants (oils, creams, gels), aromatherapy oils, and a few books. However, I was looking for something pretty small. I did not see what I was looking for, so I asked the two men if they carried holsters. I was told, yes, they did, and one man got up to show me where they were. I found them on a shelf in the back of the space. There was a typed/printed label on the shelf that was pretty small - at least, I sure didn't see it earlier when I was looking for it. The man pointed them out and walked away.I did end up buying a holster that holds one bottle, for $7.00. It was a reasonable price.The customer service was practically non-existent. The two men clearly were working on something - I don't know what, but they didn't seem to be doing anything to help a customer. Since the purchase was so small, I pulled out a $10.00 bill to pay. Well, that was a problem. One man asked the other "do we have any cash?" Gentle Reader, it was about 3:30pm. Was I the first customer of the day? Is it so old-fashioned to pay cash for a small purchase? Confronted with how difficult a customer I apparently was, I dug through my wallet and pulled out smaller bills and coins, so that I was offering $0.07 more than the actual purchase price. The man had to go to the back to find $0.07 cents.So, I got what I wanted. When I got back home, I looked at their website. My impression is, they really want to do website sales. I'm not quite sure why they even bother having a storefront, if they don't want to be bothered by customers actually walking into the place. According to the website, they've been in business since 1999. I don't know how long the storefront has been there.Would I go back again? Well, maybe. I mean, they weren't actually rude to me. They just had better things to do. Would they have given me more time and attention if I'd said, "Hey guys, I'm a massage school teacher and I can send business your way."?? I don't know. It was pretty lax. If I need something desperately, I'll probably go in again. Or if I want to replace my table and want to see and touch tables so I can make a better purchasing decision, maybe I'll go again. In such a rough economy, every purchase should count. Every customer should count. If my shopping disturbs the work they need to do, maybe they should just close the storefront. I mean, I didn't even get a "hello, how are you dong?" or "Let me know if I can help you find something."Not great. Meh.

8.description: I am very disappointed in your customer service regarding products that I have purchased that failed to work after your "90 day warranty." I purchased 4 table warmers in August and ALL of them are not working properly or just not working at all! I called and they told me that there was nothing that they could do because it is out of the 90 day warranty. That is RIDICULOUS! I have spent hundreds of dollars on their site and I am thoroughly DISGUSTED with their customer service! Please be mindful when purchasing from them and if you want to take a word from me "DON'T BUY FROM THEM!!" A table warmer should not die after 4 months of use. The fact that NOTHING was done to accommodate me after purchasing hundreds of dollars of products from you is wrong and I will NEVER purchase anything from your company again!

0.description: I purchased a table recently and have to say was impressed with the quality and price of it. Definitely the best prices around for massage equipment!

I now continue to go to Gail to get my hair colored and I love it! She uses some brand called Organic color systems and it seems a lot less harsh on my hair than other dyes or peroxides I've used :) check out their Instagram, I tagged them in my hair dye pictures!

1.description: When you're in the mood for some late night munchies, this place really hits the spot. The hot cookies can be quite delectable (depending on which flavor you get and your taste palette). Personally, I like the double chocolate chip, red velvet white chocolate, and white chocolate macadamia nut. The cookies by themselves are really. However, the cookiewich (ice cream sandwich) is what I love the most at this place. Unfortunately though, the staff never makes it properly. The ice cream just isn't seated or spread between the two cookies properly. This always causes me to adjust it myself and get my hands super messy in the process. It's not perfect, but it is tasty - and that's what makes me keep coming back.

9.description: Insomnia cookies are my favorite! As a Loyola student who lives close to this location, I was super duper excited and had been anxiously waiting for it to open up. The best part of this location is that they deliver REALLY FAST! And the cookies are still warm and gooey. Mhmmmm, deliciousness in every chocolate chunk (those are my favorite!) I have the insomnia cookies app downloaded and lately they've had 12 cookies for $10 only and with delivery it's only $11.85+tip which is almost $4 less than when going to the store to pick up a dozen for close to 16-17 bucks! Cookies stay fresh for a few days and taste just as good when I warm them up in the microwave. Thanks for being so awesome Insomnia!!!

23.description: Great for a quick midnight snack, and convenient for the college kids :) we had one of these on my colleges campus and it never ceased to amaze me how busy they are. Gotta get your cookie fix!

25.description: Good and delicious cookies

12.description: How do they not deliver 1.5 miles away. Called them and said were in the cutoff zone ut on their own website it says we are in the zone. Seriously? Why the hell would you Advertise delivery when you clearly dont.

21.description: All the cookies here are fantastic! There is no way to pick just one favorite! I can literally eat like 5 of them in one sitting. The staff are all really friendly and efficient. Even when there is a line that goes out the door, the pace is good and I never have to wait too long. Everyone has to try Insomnia Cookies at least once in their lives. It is life changing.

16.description: Waaaay overrated.  The cookies really aren't that special at all, besides being warm.  I guess its perfect college students who don't know any better when coming home from the bars or needed a study break, but you can make much better cookies at home- from scratch, or from a roll in your local grocer's refrigerated aisle.

17.description: I don't actually know what their cookies are like. We waited for a few minutes while the guy in the corner was sending a text or playing angry birds and the service girl was nowhere to be seen. We only saw her after we left and could see her coming from around the corner. I guess they don't want to work. Almost reminded me of the service from the show Faulty Towers, but at least there you got a service.

10.description: Sigh. Regretfully, I ordered delivery from here. Yes, I admit it. I had cookies delivered to my doorstep. And no, it was not "worth it:" Worth the wait, worth the cost, worth the sad realization that popping refrigerated cookie dough from Jewel in the oven would have been quicker, warmer, cheaper, AND more delicious. I learned my lesson. Next time I'll just bake them myself. Sigh.

5.description: Today was my first visit to this newest location of Insomnia Cookies,and pretty new to Loyola it is, 12 days old as of today!And, okay, I must admit that I was pretty excited about this place beingopen because I have never had Insomnia Cookies before today.And, upon entering I found a very small cookie place interior, but theyoung man who rang up my order was very nice!Now, these cookies vary in price and honestly, I thought that $1.50 per cookie was an okay deal, and they also had some specialty cookiesfor $3.00 like a Smore's cookie that now I wish I had gotten causeI have such a fondness for Marshmallows..They had some ice cream choices as well, but, didn't come for Ice Creamcame for cookies!Now, for any of you that may unfortunately truly suffer from Insomnia thisCookie Paradise will deliver to you until 3am..For the record.. I do suffer from Insomnia from time to time, and Iwill desperately try not to dial Insomnia's digits...So, welcome to Loyola Insomnia Cookies, may you deliver many cookiesto Insomniac's all over Chicagoland!You're serving up very tasty cookies indeed!And, if you visit Insomnia Cookies on Sheridan Road don't forget to tipCookie Monster on the counter!After all, C is for Cookie....

11.description: I was so psyched when I found out an Insomnia Cookies was opening up right by Loyola. Warm and delicious cookies available til 3 am. What more do you want?? I've made the walk down from the Morse area several times just to get cookies. I've tried most of what they offer and everything is good! My personal favorites are the jumbo cookies, especially the peanut butter cup one. If you want a cookie a la mode their ice cream is pretty good as well and they give it to you in what looks like a small pizza box, which is pretty funny.If you're craving cookies, any time of day, this is the place to go!

22.description: Not Fresh for me.

0.description: The reason that this place didn't get 5 stars is because of the prices. I had the smore delux cookie and it was around $3.50. The cookie was pretty delicious, but it was hard to justify spending that much for ONE cookie. The employee we delt with was SO SWEET AND FRIENDLY. I wish we had gotten his name so I could give him a shout out. He had dreads half way to his shoulders. I mean, he was such a pleasure to interact with. The actual store front is small and a little cramped. I would come here again.

20.description: Insomnia cookies are my favorite! As a Loyola student who lives close to this location, I was super duper excited and had been anxiously waiting for it to open up. The best part of this location is that they deliver REALLY FAST! And the cookies are still warm and gooey. Mhmmmm, deliciousness in every chocolate chunk (those are my favorite!) I have the insomnia cookies app downloaded and lately they've had 12 cookies for $10 only and with delivery it's only $11.85+tip which is almost $4 less than when going to the store to pick up a dozen for close to 16-17 bucks! Cookies stay fresh for a few days and taste just as good when I warm them up in the microwave. Thanks for being so awesome Insomnia!!!

19.description: Oh my effing gee!!! You know how some nights you make yourself a nice dinner and have some wine and you just want a little something sweet to top it all off and you realize that you ate the last of your Trader Joe's dark chocolate covered pretzels last night and there is literally nothing sweet in your whole apartment unless you want to spend an hour and a half making rice pudding?  Yeah, me too. Enter Insomnia Cookies and their super speedy delivery of just-baked warm chocolate chip brownies, double chocolate chunk, and snickerdoodle cookies.  The minimum delivery order is $6 so I had to order all of those.  And of course I had to eat all of those because they were SO RIDICULOUSLY DELICIOUS.  And now I'll have to do an epic spin class tomorrow, but it was oh so worth it.

2.description: No delivery! What?I live 5 minutes away by car and didn't qualify for delivery from this location.  What's the point of having a cookie delivery service less than 2 miles away if they won't deliver? As for the cookies, they're pretty good. A little too sweet but they are cookies after all.

18.description: Not too impressed with the chocolate chip cookie I had. The only thing that makes this place stand out is the hours and college kids late night cravings are satisfied. Otherwise, it would be an ordinary cookie joint with your average cookie flavor.

13.description: Nothing special!. The cookies tasted below average for the price.Expensive for the quality and horrible customer services. Do not waste your time and money for cookies that aren't worth it.

4.description: When I finally got to try Insomnia Cookies, it was a cruel discovery that its reputation is based on its business model rather than its cookie quality.The store seems to cater to the late night college kids or drunk folks with late night cravings and no ingredients to make cookies at home. The only food options available are milk, cookies, and ice cream. The cookies themselves are not remarkable. They don't have any interesting flavors of cookie available (just your standard oatmeal raisin, chocolate chop, white chocolate macadamia, etc.), but they are kept warm.  I found my cookie to be so sweet (the white chocolate macadamia) that I threw away a couple of bites. Granted, I don't have a huge sweet tooth, but I still enjoy a good cookie.  If I want a good cookie at some crazed drunken time, I think the better bet is 24-hour Subway cookies.

24.description: Today was my first visit to this newest location of Insomnia Cookies,and pretty new to Loyola it is, 12 days old as of today!And, okay, I must admit that I was pretty excited about this place beingopen because I have never had Insomnia Cookies before today.And, upon entering I found a very small cookie place interior, but theyoung man who rang up my order was very nice!Now, these cookies vary in price and honestly, I thought that $1.50 per cookie was an okay deal, and they also had some specialty cookiesfor $3.00 like a Smore's cookie that now I wish I had gotten causeI have such a fondness for Marshmallows..They had some ice cream choices as well, but, didn't come for Ice Creamcame for cookies!Now, for any of you that may unfortunately truly suffer from Insomnia thisCookie Paradise will deliver to you until 3am..For the record.. I do suffer from Insomnia from time to time, and Iwill desperately try not to dial Insomnia's digits...So, welcome to Loyola Insomnia Cookies, may you deliver many cookiesto Insomniac's all over Chicagoland!You're serving up very tasty cookies indeed!And, if you visit Insomnia Cookies on Sheridan Road don't forget to tipCookie Monster on the counter!After all, C is for Cookie....

6.description: My husband and I just got a six pack of cookies from here for the first time tonight. I wouldn't say it's worth the cost. You can get a whole bag of fresh soft cookies from jewel for half the price. I asked for two double chocolate chip cookies and a mint chip cookie and my husband got a snickerdoodle, peanut butter and white chocolate chip cookies. When we got home I realized that I got two regular chocolate chip cookies and the mint. So she didn't listen to what I actually ordered which was slightly annoying. Luckily the chocolate chip cookies were still warm and pretty tasty. The mint chip was not that great. It was hard and cold.I think if you're really craving cookies and can't be bothered to run to the store or make your own, ordering cookies for delivery is worth it.

15.description: All the cookies here are fantastic! There is no way to pick just one favorite! I can literally eat like 5 of them in one sitting. The staff are all really friendly and efficient. Even when there is a line that goes out the door, the pace is good and I never have to wait too long. Everyone has to try Insomnia Cookies at least once in their lives. It is life changing.

7.description: First time here, great cookies I recommend the Smores Deluxe it is amazing. Great service and I got warm cookies I would definitely come here again. Great service.

8.description: I assume I'm giving this place 2/5 stars because I didn't eat said cookies at 3 a.m.I mean, the cookies are decent. But by the time we walked back to the apartment they weren't warm. And they certainly weren't $15 tasty.I would probably give it another go to try one of their ice cream sandwiches, but it would have to be late or I would have to be drunk enough to pay for these cookies again.Bring $15 by my apartment and I'll make you a better batch.

3.description: After coming here multiple times after MIDNIGHT, I realized they consistently served us cookies that weren't fresh. They were cold and you could tell they've been sitting there for a while. I felt like the cookies tasted below average for the price. I'd rather have ate Subway cookies or drive to the LP Location. They also have some super ghetto music playing at night. The songs aren't even filtered... not very professional on their part.

14.description: They were extremely rude to us. After waiting in a long line, they told us that they would not be accepting credit card. Then I ran to the nearby CVS to get cash. After paying a $3 fee to get cash, I went back there. They told me that they wouldn't accept cash or card. Thanks for nothing...

0.description: Do not ever bring your phone to be fixed here. I have never had a more terrible experience with having a phone fixed, and I break a lot of phones! I broke my Galaxy S3 so I brought it in and they said they said they would call me back with a quote. They told me it would be $100 bucks so I told them to do it and they said 2-3 days. I get a call back 3 days later asking what price they quoted me at. Then they asked if I agreed to it or not and I said I did, then they said another few days. Another week goes by and I never get a call back saying it was ready. I go into the store to check if it was back and they explained the tech guy had been out of town and had a family emergency and that he has a bunch of phones to fix but it should be done soon. Another week goes by, I get a call saying they didn't realize it was both the screen and the LCD and that it was now going to be $220. After they told me this information they said they would just get my phone back for me so I could bring it across the street because they would do it faster and cheaper. I tell them to bring it back in and they said it would be back the next day. I go in the next day and it wasn't there, of course. I then explain the whole situation to the lady for working and told her how unacceptable the whole situation was and I asked for a price break because I had been paying my phone bill for over 2 weeks with no phone. When she called back she explained she could not give me any discount because it cost them $210 to get it fixed and they needed to make a little money off it. Um..... you don't deserve the money! Finally a few days later I get my phone back and the place across the street fixes it in 24 hours. What a nightmare! I will say that everyone that was working was extremely apologetic and were trying to get my phone back but whoever you have fixing your phones needs to get fired and I know you all know that.

28.description: Native RPers know the Cap'n.  Go for the minestrone soup   -- nothing 'iffy' 'tall 'boutit.  If you are doing a party at home, the gigantuan sub goes over really well.  Make sure you have a sharp knife on hand tho' - ala Karen Black in Trilogy of terror -- back off my end of the sub man (the crusts on these will rip outcher fillin's).

1.description: So good.  Great sandwiches, great soup, the people there are nice and the portions are huge.  When you read the other reviews about this place and people say "they have had the best sub ever", they are telling the truth.  If you have never been, this is a must go.

9.description: It has been awhile but I love the subs! Nothing too fancy, but it's a great place! I would say it's got a classic Chicago vibe and I love that.

29.description: The original Nemo's! Here is my secret: while living in the RP, I once dated a boy. His idea of romance was a sub shop, and said sub shop was none other than THE original Capt'n Nemo's. The relationship didn't work out (shocking, and our only other date was Deluxe Diner), but I fell hopelessly in love with the Capt'n...more often patronizing the Lakeview location, but never forgetting my true homemade soup and crunchy bread beginnings on the far north side. The ambience is a little lacking, I seem to recall an aquatic theme...but its the same damn fine subs, soups (free samples!) and quality service. DO NOT park in the lot to the south, you'll be towed and screamed at my the man that owns the laundromat. This is where it all started. Sighhhh...make the trek. Experience where all the magic began :)

23.description: I would skip the Italian beef, but the subs are pretty good. When I lived within walking distance I would occasionally treat myself to a sub. The sandwiches are tasty but honestly I prefer Potbelly. The South Sea's pretty awesome though, which is what I usually get

5.description: What happened to this place? It used to be the best in town.  I just paid 26.00 for 2 sandwiches with half the meat than they used to put on it.  If I wanted a bad sandwich I would go to subway.  They also changed to a cheap garbage bread as well.  I will never come back to this place again and I was a customer for over 20 years.  They charge an extra $2.00 per sandwich made with beef as a posted surcharge,  what idiot Does that if they want business?

31.description: This place is pretty dingy -- apparently they've been here forever, but haven't bothered to replace any of the furnishings.  The subs are good, and they have quite a few interesting ones on the menu, but the soup looked REALLY iffy to me.  Just grab your sub and go.

25.description: I got the americanne half + chilli. I left full.they seem to have a different soups on certain days.the secret sauce(and they don't skimp on it) is good and I will be back to try more subs. service was good too.

12.description: This place is okay if there's not another sandwich shop nearby.  Capt'n Nemo's is a little more pricey than most restaurants of this type.  The sandwich sizes aren't as big as what is found at other places, but there is a little more variety of meats being offered. The soup is better than what is found at most places.

21.description: Great, friendly staff and the BEST subs in the city. My dads been coming here since it opened on the early 70s and says it hasn't changed a bit. Spread the word about the Captn and support this Rogers Park staple.

16.description: There are no sandwiches quite like a Nemo's sandwich - that's why they've been around forever. Once you have a Nemo's, no other sandwich measures up. The meats, the cheeses, the captn's secret sauce. Perfect. Great prices.This place is kind of easy to miss - it's a very nondescript building, small sign - make the trip! It's worth it!

17.description: The original Nemo's! Here is my secret: while living in the RP, I once dated a boy. His idea of romance was a sub shop, and said sub shop was none other than THE original Capt'n Nemo's. The relationship didn't work out (shocking, and our only other date was Deluxe Diner), but I fell hopelessly in love with the Capt'n...more often patronizing the Lakeview location, but never forgetting my true homemade soup and crunchy bread beginnings on the far north side. The ambience is a little lacking, I seem to recall an aquatic theme...but its the same damn fine subs, soups (free samples!) and quality service. DO NOT park in the lot to the south, you'll be towed and screamed at my the man that owns the laundromat. This is where it all started. Sighhhh...make the trek. Experience where all the magic began :)

10.description: Best subs in the city. 1. Maybe a dollar more than subway or potbellys.2. As another reviewer noted, they have pineapples, radishes, mustard, hard-boiled eggs, secret sauce, turkey, ham, bologna, volpi genoa salami, liverwurst, mortadella, swiss, american, and provolone. Quality stuff!3. Secret sauce is AMAZING.4. Another reviewer said subs are small? Maybe he went there on an off day. But so far I cant remember going there on an off day. These subs are as big or bigger than subways or potbellys.5. The soups are amazing and homemade!6. Now available toasted.

11.description: Yo dude you gotta go to Nemo's. Sandwiches are loaded up.

26.description: I started going to Capt'n Nemo's in Winnetka in high school over 10 years ago and subs don't get any better than this.  All three locations serve up the best subs with HIGH QUALITY MEATS, the finest cheeses in the land and fresh veggies.  They cook and slice their own roast and italian beefs for god's sake.  Try getting that at Jimmy Subno'z.  The chili and soups are awesome and I don't even like split pea.Do yourself a favor and stop eating the garbage they serve at the chain sandwich shops and start eating at Capt'n Nemo's!  Make sure to say hello to the sandwich artist known as Carmelo in Roger's Park.

27.description: No frills long-time local sub shop whose menu boasts of 'home-made' soups. They rush up and offer you samples while you stand there trying to make sense of their idiotic nautical themed menu.  (Look guys, sub sandwiches lost any 'submarine' connotations shortly after the Beatles first LP.  GET A NEW THEME.) It's been here forever, and nothing has been done to improve the interior since god knows when, so they must be doing something right with the food?  Wrong. Next time I read about a car going off the road and into a building, I'll hope it's straight into Capt'n Nemo's.  (The dead weekday lunch hour assures me that the human toll will not be great.)So here goes:My italian beef was dry and bland, but very spicy.  Dry, bland, AND spicy, you ask?  Yeah, it's possible.  Bleh.Beef and barley soup tasted a lot like soup.  Loved the slime texture.  When I get lunch I want to slurp beef-flavored loogies.  But hey, it's home-made!NB:  Order excruciatingly clearly, or else they will fuck up your order, like they did my girlfriend's.  To their ears, "Seafarer" sounds just like "Turkey Club."  Thanks idiotic nautical themed menu!  Er, YAR!!!!

0.description: If you have never had one of their sandwiches and you're looking to these Yelp reviews to see if it is worth going, I'm tell you to go right now.  This is your sign.  Go. It's worth the gas or the footsteps it takes you to get there.  Plus, it's super affordable in comparison to other sandwich shops!I know it says I only have six check-ins at this place but that's only because I rarely check in on yelp since I go there so often.  I'm a regular and loyal customer to the point where most of the workers know me and my order (but I should add that they got to know me the second or third time I came to eat at the place).  This place is a bit like a whole in the wall; their interior isn't the most impressive, in fact, I'd say in needs a make over, but they have a number of places to sit.  The tables, trays, and floors are also always clean.  As for their food... Oh my god, so good!  They have a variety of selections to order from and as a vegetarian, I always order the Super Cheese (extra Captain Nemo's Secret Sauce, sans tomato and onion) and their Split Pea soup.  From what I've heard, all their food is made by them from the yummy soup to their "Enhanced Brownies".  In case you're wondering, those Enhanced Brownies taste so rich you wouldn't believe it's from a place like Captain Nemo's.  Their bread tastes incredible with their sandwiches and their creations are delectable.  I have introduced many friends to their food and am proud to say, they have all loved it- I'm not one to exaggerate, they ask to go their on a regular basis and have gone back repeatedly without me.I know it sounds like I was paid to write this review (I wasn't, they don't even know I'm writing this), I just love this place so much that I would love it if other people reading this gave it a try!

20.description: i remember when this was the *only* nemo's and the line was always out the door.  still delicious, still quality, still exactly the place i want to be when i'm craving a soup and sandwich.  my personal favorites?  the northern italian and split pea soup.

19.description: Ive been eating here since i was a kid, lets just say its been a LONG time, sandwiches are still great and i love the minestrone soup. I stop in for a High Flyer as often as i can.

2.description: So I have literally just ate the best sub of my life! No joke ! I mean I was licking my lips after, like my dogs does when he has had something tasty. Came here when someone recommended it, telling me that they have been there over 30 years. I love establishments with history. Boy am I glad I tried it.  Amazing! The guys behind the counter couldn't have been any nicer.  Offering me samples of soup and chili. So I ordered a turkey, lettuce and bacon sub and turkey chili to go. And wow - was that sub perfect. They say it's all in the bread and that bread was perfection. Everything was.  Definitely a must try.  They definitely have a repeat customer in me. Can't wait to try different subs!

18.description: First visit. Better than expected. Figured it would be kind of dumpy and the food not very good. Instead, it was great soup and I loved my sandwich. Can't wait to go back.

13.description: 1. Overpriced 2. so-so quality meat3. Secret sauce was terrible IMO4. Subs are extremely smallI have no idea how anybody could say this is the best sub they ever had with a straight face. Capt'n Nemo's is extremely mediocre. If you want a good sub try Bari's or Vinnies.

4.description: So it appears that this Capt'n Nemo's location has been aroundfor a long time, not as long as me but pretty close...I love Sub Sandwiches, however, since visiting another Sub place I havebeen on a quest for a truly great Sub place that will not stuff my Sub Sandwich with a head of lettuce!Well. today I hit pay dirt, I found  this  gem of a place, and from start tofinish it was just about perfect in every way..So, yes, this Capt'n Nemo's location looks pretty dated, and the interioris not the most modern or chic but if you are coming looking for a great Suband great chili you most definitely have found your spot!The turkey club was delicious, ample amounts of meat and toppings, andBacon to boot....This place has 5 Menuboards filled with various sandwich choices/combinationsso take your pick, this place has you covered!I also ordered a bowl of chili which was offered to me in Beef or TurkeyVarieties, I myself chose the beef and it was a great choice truly..This Chili was thick and had the perfect amount of meat and spice, loved it!Now, honestly, the only issue I had was that Capt'n Nemo's does seem tobe a bit more pricey than some other Sub places, but, I  have become abeliever in you get what you pay for and this place was far Superior tothe other Sub places I have been to..So, if you haven't tried Capt'n Nemo's you are missing out on a great place,So get yourselves over there like Pronto!!It's a win-win, they will serve you up some great tasting food and youwill patronize their business...Can't get much better than that....

24.description: I lived for many years in RP, a few of them just around the corner from the Cap'n.  You won't get a better sub or soup at twice the price.  Does it lack ambiance?  Hey, it's Rogers Park, whatdd'ya want?  Just go and enjoy the food.

6.description: So, satisfying!  My husband and I have been coming  here for years but we've missed a few months due to scheduling. Well, we got there today and I  ordered the Seafarer. it was perfect, fresh bread, fresh veggies, the tuna, egg, captain sauce, I missed you.  A sub sandwich comfort food celebration, oh happy day!

22.description: Buyer Beware!  I really like the sandwiches.  However, last week I ordered 2 sandwich trays over the phone. It totalled about $80.  When I went to pick up the order I was told there would be a 7% fee for using my debit card.  Are you kidding me?  There is no mention of this on the website nor did the guy mention it when I placed the order.  I feel scammed.  Such a disappointment.  Who doesn't pay with a card these days?

15.description: Definitely the best subs in the city. Certainly the most interesting. If you're looking for a boring turkey sub go to Subway or Potbelly. I mean, they have turkey but like all their subs they put a riff on it. Come on...they have pineapple sauce, radishes, mustard sauce, hard-boiled eggs...secret sauce!! I know, it sounds weird. But trust me, they taste awesome. And the bread is perfect, really crusty on the outside and pull-out-a-front-tooth-chewy on the inside. So yeah, you can get a basic sub and it'll be great. But the world is full of basic subs. Where else can you go and get one with liverwurst, muenster, salami, eggs, sauerkraut dressing and secret sauce? Or my favorite, the South Sea, with ham, salami, american cheese, eggs, secret sauce and pineapple sauce. Say what?!?Yes, the place is worn around the edges but so what.  Portions are decent, prices are fair, soup is excellent.  If the subs seem a bit smaller than elsewhere (again, Subway or Potbelly) that may be. The bread may (possibly) be a teeny bit shorter but the meats and cheeses are really piled on. Like, hard-to-get-it-all-into-my-mouth, piled on. That's definitely not the case at most sub shops.

7.description: Excellent sandwiches,  fresh soups, and really neat old maps and pictures on the walls.  Staff is friendly too and always offering a free sample of the soup.  My only complaint is that they are closed on Sunday.  There is free parking around the corner on Jarvis for 1 hour by the market.

8.description: Capt Nemo's has a very delicious sub that is unique. The texture of the bread is crunchy Italian bread but not to hard the meats and cheeses are of the highest quality the soups are excellent.

30.description: The Capt'n's secret sauce.That's all you need to know.  The place itself isn't anything to write home about, but their subs and especially their chili are mouthwatering.  An institution in Rogers Park, they've been there since I was a kid.  Definitely worth checking out if you're a fan of submarine sandwiches.

3.description: I've always seen this place driving by and decided to give it a try after seeing it on Chicago's best. I got the Balboa sandwich and turkey chili. Sooooo good and it came with a drink. I spent around $8 and it was worth it! The workers were nice and everything was clean. I will be coming back!

14.description: The boyfriend said this was a place to eat a real sub and by far this place is the best real sub spot! Their sauce is delicious. Walked in and was offered samples of the soup delicious as well!!! Yum yum yum

58.description: We went here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. The reviews I read here are right - Susie is a one-woman show; she serves, cooks, busses, and manages. Because of this, things move very slowly. I do not recommend going here if you are in any kind of rush.The food was unbelievable. I had a mixed vegetable omelet with hash browns and toast. The portions are huge and the prices are low. I definitely want to go back to try some of her lunch/dinner options. The woman knows what she's doing.

56.description: Walking into this small storefront, on this narrow side street, and waiting for a friend at a solitary table, with two other solitary diners around me, I felt like I was in some kind of novel, perhaps by Hemingway. In a quiet little lonely place, with strangers, and a diminutive Asian mom shuffling between the tables and the small kitchen. Some quiet music wafting through the dull lit room. And then came Bonnie!I wanted to introduce my friend to both her first Korean food experience, and hopefully to Bi Bim Bop ($8.50). That's what we ordered. And it was a hit. The menu has a nice limited choice of breakfast and lunch items, and some creative omelets. I would definitely like to sample breakfast sometime. Breakfast at a price breakfast should be. Omelets are all priced around $5-6.00. The vegetables in the Bi Bim Bop were very fresh. I loved the zucchini. I don't think I've ever had Zucc in my Bi Bim Bop (now there's a good book title!) The Bulgogi was tender and delicious, and the rice at the bottom was brown-nice and nutty. The serving is not huge, but enough that you could take some home like my friend did.  I personally left no Bi, Bim nor Bop in my bowl. It all went to my belly. Visiting Noon Hour Grill was a very pleasant experience for it simplicity, good value, authentic neighborhood feel and Korean flavors. Take a friend, catch up on things and linger for a bit with Susie. You'll like it.

29.description: So cute! Suzy is this tiny old Asian woman that cooks everything all by herself. It's not the most amazing special food but it's very good and she is adorable. It feels like you're at home eating breakfast.

42.description: A must-visit in Rogers Park. Susie runs the show here, single-handedly performing every task, front of house and back of house. The Korean dishes are incredible. The more American style food is not 5-star, but as long as you watch Susie and understand her importance in this world, you will never leave unhappy.

23.description: Like eating at Abuelita's, only she is making Korean food instead of Mexican, but it is still homemade and made with love. After a few visits, Susie remembered us and our order and even brought out the gochujang (fermented red chili paste) without me asking. When I had the bi bim bop, she walked by and saw me prodding at it and just chimed in, "Mix it, mix it." It was disarming how genuine and familiar she treated me, which added to the homemade quality of the experience.I always get the bulgogi omelette with kimchi and hash browns. The meat is so flavorful and tender, Guy Fieri would be speechless. Three fluffy eggs and melted cheese complete the yumminess of this huge omelette. I can't get enough and crave it every weekend. The bi bim bop is really tasty too, with fresh ingredients and the same bulgogi as an option. All this delicious food is prepared by one person. Susie runs the whole place, from taking orders, preparing meals, serving, cashiering, dishes, busing, everything! She has so much energy  and passion, and it really comes through in her cooking. Speaking of Guy Fieri, this is the kind of gem that Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives should highlight. You may have to wait a bit at busier times, but definitely worth it!

47.description: Come for the best breakfast of your life! Allow yourself two hours on a weekend day and an hour during the week. The Korean style breakfast items on the menu keep us coming back that we haven't even tried the traditional ones or lunch yet, but I'm sure it's all great!

8.description: Like eating at Abuelita's, only she is making Korean food instead of Mexican, but it is still homemade and made with love. After a few visits, Susie remembered us and our order and even brought out the gochujang (fermented red chili paste) without me asking. When I had the bi bim bop, she walked by and saw me prodding at it and just chimed in, "Mix it, mix it." It was disarming how genuine and familiar she treated me, which added to the homemade quality of the experience.I always get the bulgogi omelette with kimchi and hash browns. The meat is so flavorful and tender, Guy Fieri would be speechless. Three fluffy eggs and melted cheese complete the yumminess of this huge omelette. I can't get enough and crave it every weekend. The bi bim bop is really tasty too, with fresh ingredients and the same bulgogi as an option. All this delicious food is prepared by one person. Susie runs the whole place, from taking orders, preparing meals, serving, cashiering, dishes, busing, everything! She has so much energy  and passion, and it really comes through in her cooking. Speaking of Guy Fieri, this is the kind of gem that Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives should highlight. You may have to wait a bit at busier times, but definitely worth it!

31.description: Good food. Sweet lady doing all the work. Ordered the bi bim bop and it was excellent.

34.description: 5/5 for food value, very reasonable... most meals under 10 with drink and it's a decent serving. 5/5 for food quality, extremely good, home cooked style authentic cuisine with a twist. 4/5 for cleanliness. Atmosphere is good. It's operated by one person to serve, cook and everything else. Cash only.

16.description: OMG this place is amazing. Been here at least 10 times (right around the corner) and never fails to amaze. Susie is friendly and the fact that she does it ALL herself is incredible. The food is fantastic and consistently so. One of those hidden gems in Chicago!!

13.description: Cute little place, Susie is a hoot.Good flavor, good portions, very inexpensive. The menu is mostly Korean with some American breakfast offerings too.

11.description: What a gem this place is. With a total of five tables in the restaurant, Susie herself is the greeter, the server, the busser, and the chef! Since she's the one and only worker in the restaurant, be be prepared for a wait, but trust me, it is so so worth it. I enjoyed my breakfast so much that I was tempted to return for dinner. Susie, you got skills!

39.description: I've lived a block away from this place for 6 months and FINALLY tried.  Why did I wait so long??!?!? This place was delicious.  She's the cook, server, and clean up all in one.  Despite the many roles our food still came out in a timely fashion.  I shall return soon!

37.description: Great Breakfast Place meal for two was $12.50. Service was excellent!!!

0.description: Real home cook meal! The food is delicious, the portion size is big and the price is cheap.Although it can be slow at a time since there's only one cook when I went there. So if there are too many people around, maybe you should consider finding another place if you are hungry.

38.description: Love this little place!!!! Amazing!!! If you like Korean, are Korean, or don't know if you may like Korean, go! The woman who owns, runs, and is the entire staff is a gem!

51.description: This place is SO great.  Bulgogi Omelet w/ Rice everytime.  The little korean lady who owns, cooks and operates this business is adorable, tough and sweet (and a great cook!).   It CAN take awhile to get your order, but that is part of the charm.  This is not a place to go when you are in a rush.  We like to enjoy the wait time with a rousing came of Uno, Crossword Puzzles or scheming.

27.description: Apparently they close whenever they want! Today I went looking for some good food and walked in 14* weather just now at 11:00 and lights were off and door was locked I'm very upset if you are suppose to be open your ass better be open!

32.description: The hours for Suzy's Noon Hour Grill are a little confusing. Yelp says they're open at 8AM, but my fella and I dropped in at 8:38 and Suzy was nowhere to be found. We took a walk around the block and came back after 9 and Suzy was there, but the door wasn't open. It was clear that she was prepping for the day, but let us in since we were standing outside the shop. I almost felt guilty being there - like I'd dropped in unannounced and it was an inconvenience...but we pressed on.Fella ordered the bibimbap and I had the yukejang. Since Suzy runs a solo shop, she was judge, jury and executioner for our meal. The bibimbap was lovely - with lots of good fixins, including perfectly marinated bulgogi and an over easy egg. The brown rice was a hearty foundation for the rest of the bowl.The yukejang, while not the most traditional (there was celery in there...) was still tasty. Not too spicy with lots of shredded beef and veggies. The portions were not lacking in the least.A couple things to be aware of: 1. this place is cash only. 2. the pricing is a bit imprecise. Meaning: the entrees we ordered were one price on the menu (say $8.85 and $7.85 or something to that effect...) and the bill was two entrees for $9/pop. Not breaking the bank for sure, and the breakfast was most certainly worth $9 - but I could see how this kind of thing might irk more particular customers.

54.description: 5 out 7 people ordered Bi Bim Bop -and all loved it! The other two dishes were very tasty, too. Everything tasted home made and fresh.  Service was quick, even it was just one lady. Definitely will be back!

48.description: My sister has been raving about this places for months, so we finally got to try it.  The place is a little hole-in-the-wall, and is completely amazing!  It was three adults and two 4-year olds, so we were a pretty good group.  Susie rearranged the other people so we could conveniently sit by the window.I ordered the bi bim bap with bulgogi and it totally lived up to my sister's hype!  The beef was flavorful and tender, the veggies fresh and crispy, and the rice not too sticky.  Our friend, Jeff, went to town on the hot sauce - touting it's awesomeness... but my sister and I just stuck with the original taste.  Jeff also let us taste the pancakes, which he claims are the "best pancakes he has ever had" - they were extremely light and fluffy... and had almost a "malted" flavor to them.  Definitely worth getting if you're a pancake fan.  Also, you may wanna check out the korean pancake (particularly the sauce) - the reviews for it are amazing, and the guy at the table next to us nearly licked his plate clean it was so good.  I would highly recommend checking this place out - be prepared to wait for your food since it literally is only Susie doing everything - but the wait is TOTALLY worth it!p.s. Don't forget it's CASH ONLY!

44.description: The restaurant is located on a super colourful street. Came here for lunch today with a friend at about 1:00PM. When we walked into the place, we were the only customers. Shortly after, a couple other tables walked in to fill up half the restaurant. Susie runs a 1 man show here. I love it! It makes me feel like I'm being invited into her home to eat some good korean food. Throughout our experience, it seems like she is pretty well known in the neighborhood.We got the bulgogi rice plates (#1 on the lunch meal) for lunch today. She offers you white or brown rice with your meal. The meat is marinated well, but it was a bit too sweet for my taste. It was cooked with a few random vegetables and we didn't have to wait too long!I don't think there were any other drinks offered besides water today? Not the most fanciest of places, but very comfortable. End of story: Lunch for 2 = $17. Awesome deal.I'll definitely be back for a quick good lunch if I'm in the area. Seems like they serve breakfast too.

24.description: i seriously LOVE their food. yes, it is impressive that its run by an old lady who is sassy -- but not all of us like the sassiness, which is why i can't give it five stars. their breakfast is amazing, american or korean. i could rant and rave about how perfect their food is, and can say less than nice things about the owner and her service. the service is slow -- but everyone knows this coming in since its one lady. she won't accommodate you and please don't even bother ordering sides because there is basically no point. she won't let you order them and tell you you're ordering "too much." either way, food is tasty so i don't mind suzy's sassiness from time to time.

7.description: There is something special about a little old lady working alone to cook you Korean style breakfast while playing ACDC over her stereo. How do I feel from the moment I step in this place? Charmed. Susie is awesome. Solid food. Cheap. I can't ask for more.

49.description: Delicious food. I ordered the bim bop and it was reasonably priced.It was so cute how Susie acted like mom after I got my plate. She walked over to my table and advised me to mix up the food. I didn't, so she walked over again and said '' mix it up plz, it taste better that way''.  Like a child wanting to please mom, I went ahead and followed her directions. Did not regret that move at all as the food was even more tastier. Although she works alone, I realized that she made sure that her customer were comfortable. This place is reasonably prized and will definitely go back!

40.description: Seriously the most delicious bibimbap I've ever had, and I've tried many different bibimbaps. I would recommend it with the Bulgogi. Cant wait to come back and try other items!

53.description: I'm definitely a fan.  Sometimes I eat there and sometimes I order to go.  It is true that service is slow, but what do you expect when one person does it all.   I guess Susie is a believer in the idea that if you want something done right, you have to do it yourself.  I'm ok with that.Although others may have had different experiences, Susie has never been anything but pleasant and friendly to me, and everyone else whenever I've been there.  We love the omelettes there & she makes great hash-browns.  I'm also a big fan of the bibimbap.  A few others have commented about it being salty, but my experience is the opposite, in fact it is what i get when I want something simple and lightly seasoned.  The chili sauce served on the side is spicy and salty - but that's what condiments are supposed to be...In the end, the food is tasty and cheap and I'm glad to have Noon Hour in the neighborhood.

30.description: Best place for breakfast in Roger's Park. Be patient with Suzy as she is a one women show. The wait will be worth it. The Spicy Ramen Soup is the best Hangover medicine I know.

46.description: I've been coming here for the last three years, usually with my buddy Whit Whit--we'd meet up Fridays, because those were the only days I didn't have class and she wasn't working at Trader Joe's.  She'd get the Chop Chae, I'd get the Bi Bim Bop and we'd go half on a Korean pancake.  We learned after our first visit to never order the coffee, which are thimble-full mugs of hot, bitter brown-flavored well water.  Me and my friend would yuk it up, catch up, and be totally amazed that Susie was running this ship all by herself.  I'd look around myself curiously at the other patrons, because I was pretty sure I was either going to end up marrying someone from here or the YMCA--that's how much affection I have for it.My last few visits have been a little bit spotty--I've become a huge devotee of the spicy ramen noodles--my buddy Whit told me she saw the seasoning come out of a Maruchan packet.  When I ordered it today, the beef tasted like a MISTAKE--it tasted like I should be afraid of eating it.  I'm sure I'll still return, but the next time I'm going to order hesitantly, no meat darker than a chicken.  Which hurts, because the bulgogi/kimchee omelet is ridiculously good. The last few visits, the music has also been pretty off the wall--it was opera, then John Williams movie soundtracks, and today it was some hillbilly country that made the questionable meat that much harder to digest. Also, a friend of mine's boyfriend who is kind of a tool blanked me while we sat a table apart, and he was noticeably rude to Susie while ordering. Not cool, guy. To sum up, Noon Hour Grill needs--meat that's not terrifying, and to be rid of its low-caliber clientele.

1.description: We come almost every weekend - it is our FAVORITE breakfast/brunch/late lunch spot. Suzie's food is hard to beat, and just watching her do everything by herself is a feat in itself. She is a wonderful cook and Noon Hour is a delightfully quirky little spot. The prices are good, the food is delicious, and be sure to check out that mysteriously creepy 80's looking clown poster she has on the wall...Go Suzie!

55.description: Suzy (Susie?) is the best! I love the blend of  traditional Korean and American breakfast. Honestly, I don't know how she does it. Walk by on any Sunday and the place is packed. The atmosphere is just as great as the food, with clown paintings, Korean children, Rogers Park weirdos and classical music. Her food is very much comfort food and there is not a bad dish in the house. My boyfriend and I don't go to often but she always remembers his order because he gets the same this every time, a chicken and cheese omelet.  Highly recommend anything with Kimchee. My advice, skip the Heartland and go to Noon Hour Grill.

9.description: Susie and her restaurant/diner are about as good as it gets. There are no frills and no fancy here - but there is an abundance of good vibes - Susie is incredible, and her food is delicious. Please stop by, support the neighborhood and local families and business owners - and enjoy one incredible Bi Bim Bop - cooked to perfection! Susie is one incredible chef, business owner and woman - just incredibly lovely -THANK YOU, SUSIE -

26.description: Wow, another great meal at Susie's Noon Hour Grill! She handles everything by herself and really exceeds expectations! What a hidden gem this is!

25.description: Very very bad customer service!!! Old lady running the place has no good manners and right conduct!!! Came in at 9:10 am today and as soon as she saw me she said she's not ready and just keep on saying.... NO... NO... NO. I ask her what time she'll be ready because I can wait but she keeps on saying NO and had the nerve to say I ran the place so I ran my own time. Would not recommend this place to anybody unless you wanna be waited by an old lady with bad manners.

12.description: I walk by this place frequently on my way to the Morse Red Line and read many reviews here on Yelp.  Well, I have one thing to say and that is that I stand with the majority of people who have given this place 5 stars.  Susie does it all and is very sweet, I plan on coming here often and throwing it in to my weekly routine.

59.description: Bi Bim Bop w/ bulgogi hit the spot!  Pancakes were also very tasty (and I don't normally order them)...Can't wait to come back and try other things.

21.description: I read the reviews here before going... and I don't have any complaints. Susie wasn't able to make the Bi Bim Bap cause she was out of the rice, but that's alright. That happens. No biggie. I ordered bulgogi instead. It was delicious. I respect the hell out of the owner for running this place, it adds to the charm. Great cheap cash only food in a legit atmosphere. I wouldn't say Susie is 'rude' Maybe a little stand offish and not the most outgoing person ever, but that's ok too.

17.description: I am super bummed to be writing Noon Hour a bad review, but more bummed that I really didn't enjoy my meal here because I was so excited to check it out. Although I cook Korean food regularly on my own, there are just some days where I'm hit with a craving for mama's cooking and I don't want to be the one making it.I tried the bulgogi and kimchi fried rice. Really bad. The overall taste was very bland, the rice was mushy, and there were clumps of white rice that hadn't been thoroughly mixed in with the seasoning. On the plus side, the portions are big, and the bulgogi was pretty well marinated with a nice flavor. I also liked the homey feel of the restaurant...although I was the only customer and even then Susie was a little slow, so I can only imagine what the service is like on a busy day.I do plan on returning because I want so badly to be wrong about this place. I'm hoping my experience was just a fluke, and am willing to risk a couple more sad meals to find a hidden gem on the menu. Next up, bibimbap!

10.description: Love this place. I've eaten here several times now. My first visit, I had the Bi Bim Bop... delicious. On my second and all subsequent visits I have enjoyed a dish called Octogawa (sp?) that reminds me of my Japanese grandma's cooking and my childhood.   A tasty mix of rice, egg and ground beef served with a soy sauce,  sugar,  green onion and chili pepper sauce.   I find myself craving this dish often now and I'm glad I live nearby. I hope I have Susie's energy when I reach her age!

5.description: YES.$10 for a big thing of bibimbop. Tofu, brown rice and extra gochujang, everytime. So good.

3.description: The wait is always worth it here. Korean comfort food at its best. So much respect for Susie and the work and love that goes into her scrumptious food. They don't make 'em like Noon Hour Grill anymore.

35.description: I am super bummed to be writing Noon Hour a bad review, but more bummed that I really didn't enjoy my meal here because I was so excited to check it out. Although I cook Korean food regularly on my own, there are just some days where I'm hit with a craving for mama's cooking and I don't want to be the one making it.I tried the bulgogi and kimchi fried rice. Really bad. The overall taste was very bland, the rice was mushy, and there were clumps of white rice that hadn't been thoroughly mixed in with the seasoning. On the plus side, the portions are big, and the bulgogi was pretty well marinated with a nice flavor. I also liked the homey feel of the restaurant...although I was the only customer and even then Susie was a little slow, so I can only imagine what the service is like on a busy day.I do plan on returning because I want so badly to be wrong about this place. I'm hoping my experience was just a fluke, and am willing to risk a couple more sad meals to find a hidden gem on the menu. Next up, bibimbap!

19.description: My best friend took me here for breakfast one day and it's this little hole in the wall spot that will seriously  become your favorite! Their pancakes are amazing and the lady that works there is so nice. Highly recommend anyone to check it out!

28.description: Small hidden gem one old Korean lady runs this place seats 21 food is out of this world no waitress or waiter just her  5 star food all the way around !

45.description: I've had one thing on the menu, 3 or 4 times now. The bulgogi and kimchi omelette. I'm sure other things are good, even fantastic. But I can't imagine anything being more perfect than that omelette and those hash browns. If it ain't broke, don't fix it, and this thing is perfection. This insanely delicious beef, perfect kimchi and some type of magical mystery cheese. Just stop reading the rave reviews and COME here. Don't care where in the city you are. Just do it. And someone else mentioned the coffee... I thought it was fine. Great even.

33.description: Don't go expecting a quick meal, go for a delicious change of pace. The food is fantastic, but since Susie is the only employee, it can be a bit slow when it's busy. Worth the wait.

43.description: Excellent food, but don't go if you're in a rush.  Worth it for the bibimbap.  Tasty, generous portion, reasonable price.  Cash only.

2.description: this place is run by a single older Korean lady and she kicks ass at what she does. I ordered the chap chae and my boyfriend got the bibimbap. Both dishes were delicious and filling and I look forward to coming back. This place only takes cash so be prepared. It was fairly busy for a small place when we got there as well but we managed to snap a seat.

18.description: My sister has been raving about this places for months, so we finally got to try it.  The place is a little hole-in-the-wall, and is completely amazing!  It was three adults and two 4-year olds, so we were a pretty good group.  Susie rearranged the other people so we could conveniently sit by the window.I ordered the bi bim bap with bulgogi and it totally lived up to my sister's hype!  The beef was flavorful and tender, the veggies fresh and crispy, and the rice not too sticky.  Our friend, Jeff, went to town on the hot sauce - touting it's awesomeness... but my sister and I just stuck with the original taste.  Jeff also let us taste the pancakes, which he claims are the "best pancakes he has ever had" - they were extremely light and fluffy... and had almost a "malted" flavor to them.  Definitely worth getting if you're a pancake fan.  Also, you may wanna check out the korean pancake (particularly the sauce) - the reviews for it are amazing, and the guy at the table next to us nearly licked his plate clean it was so good.  I would highly recommend checking this place out - be prepared to wait for your food since it literally is only Susie doing everything - but the wait is TOTALLY worth it!p.s. Don't forget it's CASH ONLY!

41.description: Everybody and their morther, grandmother, cousin, and sister raves about Susie and her little Korean diner. I finally came here to try it about a week and a half ago. The restaurant is located right across the street from the L tracks. My girlfriend ordered the bibimbop with bulgolgi, which she thought was really good, but not as good as Yeowoosai. Susie also doesn't serve the bibimbop in a stone bowl to keep it warm sadly. I ordered the kimchi omelette, of which I was not a huge fan. Normally I really like cheese and egg, kimchi and egg, or any of these items separately, but I just was not digging them together for some reason. The cheese and kimchi combo just didn't jive with me. I give Susie mad props for running this place by herself and doing everything from cooking to cleaning to bussing by herself. However, I've heard this place can be slow when busy for the aforementioned reasons. I also think she really needs to accept credit cards because almost every restaurant accepts them and we had to go find an ATM to pay. Overall, Susie's joint is A-OK, which is 3 stars by Yelp standards, but I wouldn't say I'm a fan (4 stars in the Yelp hierarchy).

52.description: The food was great. I had the bulgogi and kimchee omelet. It was sooo good except for the cheese. Disgusting processed terrible cheese that only took away from the meal. The rest was delicious. Bacon was very good and the coffee-fantastic! the food I saw on other people's tables looked great also.But I have to take off 2 whole stars for the service.YES-I know she is a one-woman show, but that is why the service is slow and she gets only 3 stars!She is fully capable of hiring a food runner and/or someone to take orders. She makes the coffee, food, wipes down the tables, takes orders, cleans. Literally everything. I totally respect her for that, but it really put a dent in my visit.Unfortunately, as good as the food is, I will not be returning.When I go into a breakfast joint, I'm hungry and I don't have an hour to wait for an omelet.

50.description: Look, I'm going to break it down for you like I did back in 5th grade at my first dance.Loved it!  The small dive interior may throw some off.  But, just wait until Susie comes out to make you feel like you're at her house.  Oh, and she'll let you know when you're eating your food wrong or ordering wrong.  Some may not like this, but it makes me feel like I'm a guest of hers (those of us who have Asian family members know what I'm talking about).  Yes, service is slower, but come on now.  If I went to your place to eat lunch and rushed you, would you like that??  You can say that you're paying for fast service, but with such low prices, you're paying for the food and the authenticity that comes with it.  I almost feel like we should be honored to be served by someone like Susie who is bringing us into her kitchen.Call me biased because I thought Susie was the cutest thing, but I don't care; I enjoyed every moment of my Bulgogi and Bi Bim Bop, and I will enjoy many more as I frequent there in the future.

4.description: Quiet and cosy place. The lady who runs the place cooks every dish to order so it takes a while. The best thing is like you are having a home cooked meal at her table. The kimchi omelette was a hit, but the other dishes we ordered were just average. The portion sizes are substantial for the price. Might visit again if I am in the neighborhood but won't be seeking it out specifically.

6.description: Great local cheap spot. Flavorful fresh food. Decent prices and portions. The owner is very sweet.

22.description: Stopped in for bulgogi and the reviews for the place made me think it'd be a larger, higher end establishment. I was greeted by a wonderful older korean woman who took my order then began cooking. I'm used to bulgogi coming with many little dishes of various side items but this was the beef, some light vegetables and short grain I believe brown rice.I missed all my condiments and sides but my meal was nice. They do not accept credit cards so I'm glad I had cash on hand.

15.description: Stopped in for bulgogi and the reviews for the place made me think it'd be a larger, higher end establishment. I was greeted by a wonderful older korean woman who took my order then began cooking. I'm used to bulgogi coming with many little dishes of various side items but this was the beef, some light vegetables and short grain I believe brown rice.I missed all my condiments and sides but my meal was nice. They do not accept credit cards so I'm glad I had cash on hand.

57.description: I used to come here every weekend with my boyfriend. It's homey, no-nonsense, affordable and delicious. I love the kimchee bulgogi fried rice, the bibimbop and the Korean pancake. Susie runs one of the most unique joints in the city, and it's worth a trip.Note to people who have never ventured in before: Susie's a one-woman show, and when she gets busy, it may take a while for her to get to you. Be patient!

20.description: I love coming here & Susie is the most nicest lady ever! I literally just walk in & she'll just ask Bin Bon Bop? She knows my order by heart already.. Love this place!

36.description: Best bibimbap I've ever had and you can get BROWN RICE which truly takes it to another level.
