I've only ever ordered that so can't comment on any other items on the menu but other people seem to like the pancakes a lot too. Susie is incredible, she runs the whole place singlehandedly. Because of this, a couple times I've seen groups come in, seat themselves, then be annoyed she doesn't come to serve you for a few minutes (because she is busy cooking, bussing, and cleaning) and they have walked out. Their loss! Susie will come when she can, and the wait is worth it. Great coffee too.

14.description: The hours for Suzy's Noon Hour Grill are a little confusing. Yelp says they're open at 8AM, but my fella and I dropped in at 8:38 and Suzy was nowhere to be found. We took a walk around the block and came back after 9 and Suzy was there, but the door wasn't open. It was clear that she was prepping for the day, but let us in since we were standing outside the shop. I almost felt guilty being there - like I'd dropped in unannounced and it was an inconvenience...but we pressed on.Fella ordered the bibimbap and I had the yukejang. Since Suzy runs a solo shop, she was judge, jury and executioner for our meal. The bibimbap was lovely - with lots of good fixins, including perfectly marinated bulgogi and an over easy egg. The brown rice was a hearty foundation for the rest of the bowl.The yukejang, while not the most traditional (there was celery in there...) was still tasty. Not too spicy with lots of shredded beef and veggies. The portions were not lacking in the least.A couple things to be aware of: 1. this place is cash only. 2. the pricing is a bit imprecise. Meaning: the entrees we ordered were one price on the menu (say $8.85 and $7.85 or something to that effect...) and the bill was two entrees for $9/pop. Not breaking the bank for sure, and the breakfast was most certainly worth $9 - but I could see how this kind of thing might irk more particular customers.

36.description: I'm an unemployed soul whose 11 year old Trek in excellent condition was literally lifted out of a locked (and pretty invisible) backyard.  While I've done what I can to get her back, I just got depressed all over again looking for a new one (Mom wants to chip in for it for my birthday...yay Mom!).   Everything now is either too flowery, has a weird shape, or just costs a hell of a lot.  And oh hey, my experience with the people in the big bike shops ranged from pissy when I didn't immediately glom on to their suggestions to condescending, to oblivious to the fact that I wanted to BUY something from them; i.e., put money in their pockets...during a RECESSION.  Just got home from my last stop of today (the first was the Maxwell Street Market to see if I could be lucky enough to purchase the bike back from the criminals who took it).  Robert's Cycle is waaaaay up on Clark, and yes, has bars in its windows to discourage aforementioned criminals.  But it is an easy walk from the Red Line Morse stop -- west on Morse about five blocks to Clark, north on Clark two blocks.  [And no Chads or Trixies to be seen.]This place made me feel like all the time cruising through multiple bike shops was worth it.  Someone asked me within one minute if I needed any help, then proceeded to show me what they had that matched my criteria (trying to duplicate my old bike).  They even had a few '08 models left, unlike any other store I went to, one of which I almost went with.  The reason I went here was to look at Raleighs, which are not carried by that many area dealers, as far as I can tell.  In Raleigh I found a nice compromise between my old bike and all the things I hate about most newer bikes (see above).  They allowed me to take my two finalists out for a spin, and helped me adjust the seat, etc. beforehand.  Everyone in the shop -- three people -- helped in some way with my purchase.  And, though it was closing time, they were patient with a mother and two kids who needed air in their tires, but didn't make that easily understood.  (They got their air.)  Very kind and utterly unpretentious souls here.  I rated them moderately priced.  What I mean is that from glancing at prices this week, they are lower priced than the big bike stores (Village Cycle and Kozy's) and probably even lower than a lot of other small shops.  But an "inexpensive" rating makes it sound like they are giving them away, which wouldn't make good business sense.  And they had some good markdowns on prior year models (but there are not that many of those this time of year).  The bike also comes with a complimentary 90 day tuneup and some other maintenance that I am not remembering right now.  From what I saw, the other posters who liked these guys for repairs and maintenance are undoubtedly right on target...quite a few bikes in there waiting for owners to come back for them.  All in all, I am so very pleased to have bought a bike I'm not just settling for, but really like -- from a mom and pop type operation that truly deserves the business.  Go there -- you'll be glad you did!!

29.description: A phenomenal bike shop: friendly, honest, and remarkably inexpensive.  Unlike many places, they'll try to fix before replacing, and their mechanical work is top-notch.  An invaluable asset for riders of any level.

42.description: I went there today because I started riding my bike (actually my boyfriend's) this week instead of the train to try and save money. So I don't really know what I'm doing....Anyway, the bungi cord on the little rack came loose and wound up winding itself around all the gears of my rear wheel! The bike wouldn't move properly and I had no idea how to fix it. So I took it there and they fixed it in 5 minutes and only charged me 5 bucks! Very nice and easy to talk to and ask questions.

23.description: They are passionate about bikes and very knowledgeable and helpful. I went to another store before and was misled into buying something I didn't need, and when I went here for a different but related issue, it was explained to me how/why the other guys were wrong.Also, every time I'm there I keep feeling based on how I'm treated like they know me except that I'm certain I haven't been there often enough to be remembered (at least not in a short time period). Come here before you go anywhere else. A+

31.description: Seriously, this was the best service I've received in the city in a long time.  My girlfriend and I were there to buy a lock and a helmet - not a big-ticket purchase, but we wanted some information.  The gentleman who helped us was unbelievably knowledgeable and incredibly patient, even going so far as to teach both of us how to identify a high-quality bike in a used bike sale.  Definitely worth stopping here for your biking needs!

34.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and needed a tuneup and a fix of a flat. I took the bike in on a Saturday morning, they looked it over, told me what they'd do and what they'd charge and that I'd have it in a week. Guess what? Five days later they call me and say, "your bike is ready." They did exactly what they said they would do, no more, no less. No upselling, no overcharging. Sure, they're a couple of goofballs, but they get the job done. And I'm happy to take my bike here. They've been in the neighborhood for years -- my grandfather bought a bike for my father here when he was a kid in the '50s.

16.description: Quality, long-enduring independent business still very devoted to quality service and product.  The owner and his staff work hard to keep their doors open despite being taken advantage of by big media or overshadowed by large and less accountable franchises like Kozy's. I recommend patronizing this Roberts bike shop.

11.description: With the plethora of bike shops in Chicago, I wouldn't recommend this one. Without writing a lengthy review, I'll say I was quoted a different price when I dropped the bike off than when I picked it up. I left the shop agreeing to $30 less than the amount they told me when they called. When they called (three days after it was supposed to be done) to tell me it was complete and charge me more money, they also suggested I get more work, something to do with the hub. I asked what the part did, why it needed $20 worth of oiling and the gentlemen couldn't really explain, he compared it to a car (which I know less about than bikes) and left me still kind of confused, so I just left it alone. No fun.

39.description: Totally got a flat one night after riding my bike to wrigley field. Totally lame. Walked up to Robert's, as it's the closest bike shop to my house. Guess what? The tire was punctured, too! Great, awesome, love it. Well, they fixed the tire in about 20 minutes, and while I waited, one of the clerks hooked me up with a helmet, and gave me a little lesson about how to fit it properly to protect the dome.The dudes working there are quite friendly, making jokes and alla that. After dropping about 60 bones, I rode home on my new phat tire with new shiny brain bucket. Solid. Check these dudes out if you wanna fix up your ride.

37.description: Roberts Cycle is one of the only bike shops I'll go to. They are totally unpretentious and super helpful. I went in here after having patched my rear tube for like the 4th time. They recommended a more durable kevlar tire. And wouldn't you know it, I haven't had a single flat since I upgraded.

0.description: These guys are great. Old school. Busy, but will take the time to explain things. My experience here has been with parts and sales. They don't surprise you with the bill, but let you know the cost up front. Also, they stand by their work. If something goes wrong withing 30 days on anything they did, or you just need something adjusted, they do not whine about it. They just fix it.  This is a real-old-time-Chicago-neighborhood-joint where outside of the actual work they do, they will take the time to B.S with you, really bad puns included. Love this place. And the wheel men who work there. You guys ROCK!

38.description: Man, I am a TOTAL n00b when it comes to biking.  I'm from LA, and that shit don't fly there.  But, here...ah one of the many reasons I have the hots for this town...anyways.My tiny needed a straight up overhaul on his 80's rode bike he found broken on the side of the road in Santa Barbara and shipped all the way here.  We rolled (literally, he couldn't ride his bike) into Robert's and it clearly had been there for awhile (ask the owner about its story) and we were helped right away.  I wish I remembered her name, but this super tuff chick helped us immediately and gave us this fantastic Bicycle Mechanics 101 lesson, hooking us up with free repairs and free advice.  They did a ton of work, including a new tire and inner tube, and all kinds of other stuff  for like $30. (See you know I'm a n00b when I can't even tell you what he had done).  They also gave us some good bike routes to check out.The kicker, though, they have this totally bitchin ad from the 1980 Moscow Olympics hanging up that I'm in the works of stealing.  If anyone has any Ocean Eleven experience (or saw that one South Park) give me a call.

27.description: Great shop. They really care about helping bikers out. If they don't have the right bike or part for you, they will help you find it either by ordering it or referring you to other great shops. The guys and gal that work there are knowledgeable and avid cyclists. I go here for parts, tips & advice, and minor tuning, but they also have a pretty good selection of used bikes with some character (older frames, single speed conversions, etc.)I bought a Roadmaster converted single speed here a little under a year ago, got into an accident with it. They guys at Roberts Cycle helped me put together a claim at no charge, and they even ended up doing the repairs below the cost of the estimate! I came to them looking to buy a new bike, and they have a good selection, just none that fit me. They recommended another shop and were very helpful.I come in and know the guys by name and they remember me. You can't easily find that in a shop: genuine friendliness. I feel comfortable asking for advice and tips, and I feel thanks to them I've gone from a recreational no nothing rider to an avid cyclist who can do minor repairs and even convert/fix up my old bikes.Head here if you want a positive bike shop experience, or if you're looking to get more into city cycling!

32.description: I've been looking around to buy a new bike and checked out quite a few places, and the reviews here helped steer me to Robert's. So today I went to the shop with the whole family in tow, we got there right at noon when they opened, and they could not have been any friendlier. Right away Hector began to help me with my purchase, and when I told him that I really didn't know all that much about bikes, other than how to ride one, he was totally unfazed and continued to ask me questions about what I wanted to do with the bike, where I was riding, etc. After finding a bike that fit (I'm 6'5") he got it all adjusted so that I could take it for a test spin around the block. While I was gone he and my family chatted ab out riding, and what bikes they might be interested in. On my return, and my positive review of said bike, he took it in the back to get it all fit just so. After fitting me for a helmet and graciously accepting my payment ('natch) I was on the road with my new ride.I can only review the service I received from Robert's and my new bike guru Hector, but it was outstanding, and I would recommend the store to anyone looking for a new bike to upgrade from their big box special. After I chose my bike Hector took me through all of the steps on the quick-release, locking it, even lubing the chain when and where and how often. Maybe this is the kind of service you get at every bike shop where you buy a bike, and if so, great, but if not, do yourself a favor and head to Rodgers Park when you need a new bike or some bike repair. I'm so pleased with them that I'm going to make this our new family go-to bike store, and hopefully bring the wife back soon to get her a new ride.

13.description: Robert sometimes suggests the wrong thing... and you find out later on.

24.description: Took my bike here to have a flat fixed. They also told me my tired needed to be straightened. Wow what I difference that made! My bike rode so much better after that. They did a great job. I will be taking my bike back in for a tune up soon.

7.description: I came in today and had such a great experience. The back tire was stolen off of my friend's bike, and I decided to surprise him and get it fixed. At first they quoted me $160, and I was freaking out a bit because that is a lot more then I expected (I don't know a lot about bikes and apparently I had to buy so many different pieces for the back tire/wheel since it is a 7speed bike). They knew I was in a sticky situation (especially since the bike would just be used for leisurely activities like riding on the lakefront) so the associates must have talked to the owner, and he dropped the price down to $100. He was running around the shop finding used parts for me to make it work at that price! It was so nice of him, and that price was more reasonable to me and a little closer to what I had expected. In addition to price, they were very patient and understanding with me, and all of the associates were very knowledgeable and were more than willing to teach me more about bikes and the parts I was purchasing.Even though this place is a hole in the wall and the associates don't look like what you'd would expect walking into a bike shop, it is certainly a gem and a great place to go if you need a fixing.

40.description: $100 for new tubes, major tuneup, and new brake on my bike.  While another overpriced shop in Evanston told me it was a lost cause, these guys recognized the true genius of a genuine Chicago Schwinn and treated her like the valuable antique she is.  They were great at explaining to me (a bike newbie) what they had done and told me to make sure to bring it back in if I had any issues.The only delay was the owner was experiencing some health issues and it was spring busy season, so it took about 2 weeks.

30.description: I am the only 24 year old in the world that doesn't know how to ride a bike. Yes, I'm aware that I missed a pivotal part of childhood. No, I never cared that I couldn't ride a bike... However, now that I've moved to Chicago and there are so many beautiful lakefront trails, I want to learn. I found a used bike sale in Evanston next week and stopped into Roberts for a helmet and lock in preparation. Considering everyone on Yelp said the sales people were so helpful, I noted that I knew nothing about bikes, so I would appreciate any knowledge they could impart. In addition to telling me all about various types of locks, helmets, etc., they were nice enough to give me tips for what to look for (or more what to steer clear of) when I go to my bike sale. They even took me into their basement so I could see some examples, get an idea of what bike would fit me, etc. Incredible service. I'll be back here for every bike problem I encounter.

1.description: I have been to Roberts several times, and my experience is consistently great. I have a cross-bike that's about 20 years old; I use it to bike for fun, but the last year, I started commuting more and more, so, more miles. Summer 2013 I got the tune-up special, which was precipitated by a broken spoke. The tune-up transformed my bike, shifting and braking, most notably.Summer 2014, the left crank arm fell off on the Lakefront Trail, and I limped home with one pedal (more possible that you can imagine). They put it back on (no charge) and asked me to come after 100 miles so they could retighten. We did this three times; they said this was typical (never a charge; they did it while I waited).Fall 2014 my click shifters went; it turns out that, while lifting my bike to use my building's vertical bike rack, I'd unknowingly cracked them. They found a used one, gave me a good price and fixed it while I waited. I was grateful as it was a gorgeous late fall day, and I'd planned a trek. The week afterwards, though, had to take it back in because it wouldn't shift. The guy that repaired it took more time and said that the shifter and derailleurs were so old that they didn't communicate well; I also needed another derailleur to go with the new shifter. I was bummed about that, but it made sense, so I had them fix it for a reasonable price, using a used one that was in the store, so I didn't have to wait. Overall, they are resourceful and honest, and I've always had the greatest service. Every time, I feel that they're committed to help keep me on the road! #kudos

9.description: This is a small shop with an old-school ambiance around the store.  Let me explain.  Many customers are spoiled by big corporation customer service, fake smile when you walk in the door and someone following you around the shop asking if you need any assistance.  You will not get that at Roberts.The times I've been at the shop, I have had to wait my turn, sometimes 10 or more minutes. There are not a lot of sales people on the floor. If you talk to someone other than Rich, it's usually a shop guy that comes out of the back from working on the bikes.  When you do get to speak to Rich (the owner), he will give you his undivided attention.  He is extremely knowledgeable.  He's not going to kiss your ass to make a sale, he's not going to talk you into anything that you do not need. He can be brash and quirky and he likes to talk a lot, but if you can get past that you are golden. Remember you're not going in there him to stroke your ego, he's just trying to fix your bike. Rich told me the philosophy of the shop is not to try and sell new bikes, but to help you utilize and fix your current bike.  Therefore, he will help you find an economical solution to your bike problem.  I was sold a Trek bike that was too big for me. But instead of trying to pressure me into buying a new bike, he modified what I had to make it rideable and more comfortable until I can afford something new. And the modifications he made to my existing bike were extremely affordable.This is a great shop.  It's been around for over 25 years. I think that says something about the quality of work they provide.  Don't go there for high-end bike boutique feel, go there know that there are several experienced, hard working men that work like hell to make your bike great.

26.description: I wanted to like this place.  It is a bike shop in my neighborhood, plus my neighbors bought their bikes here.  However, I made three trips here, and when it came down to actually buying a used bike, it was cheaper to buy a new one at Rudy's on Irving Park.  Roberts sells their used bikes with minimal fixes. In other words, "as is."  The bike I was interested in had mismatched worn thin tires and poor pedals.  Roberts would not budge on the price at all even though I was going to buy new tires, pedals, and grips. Disappointed, I just left.  Maybe they are good for new bikes, but their prices are not competitive with other bike shops. Bummer.

25.description: Great place! Can be slow, but they're thorough. (Got my bike there and tune-ups.)

12.description: Brought my bike in for a much needed tuneup. After being out in the elements all winter they were still able to save my chain which in turned cost me less money than what I expected. It took them a week and it was ready for pick up! I definitely think they are inexpensive, nice, and just overall knowledgeable about everything that had to do with bikes. I have already recommended them to friends.

21.description: I love this place!  I walked in to check out the bikes after my bike had been stolen and I have to say everyone in the place was so friendly and helpful.  This is the kind of place I would recommend everyone check them out!

17.description: It was a fast and great quality service! I highly recommend it to everyone!

10.description: This is a nice place to get a bike. You can all ways work a deal with them. The best tip i can give any one is BRING CASH!

5.description: A real bike shop like you remember going to as a kid! They don't try up sell you, the prices are reasonable (labor is a bit high) and they stand by the work. The guys working there are bike guys! All around a good experience and will definitely come back again!

35.description: Great little neighborhood bike shop.  I live near Uptown right now, which has a little better selection of accessories, but Roberts is a great place, and when I ended up buying my current bike a few months ago, I went there.  Their selection of bikes is solid, but it's the people that you're there for.  I've been back several times, and they're a helpful, talkative group of people, and attitude-wise, are basically just happy that you're biking, and happy to help you out with pretty much anything related.  I've seen people of every age in there, getting their (or occasionally their kids') bikes fixed.  The staff has consistently not tried to hard sell anything whatsoever, and the owner is around regularly, and just as down-to-earth and helpful as the rest of the staff.

19.description: I went in to replace my bent handle bars, and the owner argued with me that they weren't bent. I can assure you they were quite bent in an accident with a car. He kindly agreed to sell me the replacement at a good price. I'm very competent when it comes to bikes and mechanics so I found his dismissive attitude a little disturbing. The new unbent bars did the trick, but I installed them myself just to be safe.

28.description: Brought a recently-immigrated friend over to get his bike fixed. They were no-nonsense and very fairly priced. Did good work.I wouldn't bring a $7,000 road pixie here, but for your around-town beater, it's the place to go.Also, there was a good-looking young woman working there, as I recall. That always spruces a place up.

3.description: I brought my bike here last year and they did a great job with it so I brought it right back.  See, I was bad in taking care of my bike and left it outside all winter long because I didn't have any room for it anywhere. I thought the wheels were gone since they were pretty rusted, however Richard took the time and said that he would take care of this for me along with other miscellaneous repairs.My bike is finally in top shape for riding this summer.

33.description: I recently had a flat tire from "biking the drive" and hitting a rather large pothole.  I took my bike to Roberts since they are right down the street from me.  It was a warm day so they were very busy and asked if I could wait to get my bike back the next day.  When I mentioned I had to go out of town and would like to take my bike with me, they quickly agreed and had me out the door in 20 minutes.  The shop is very tiny and luckily I was able to use their one and only chair to wait for my bike.  The staff was very knowledgeable and you could tell they loved what they do.  I viewed other customers as I was waiting.  They all received very detailed, expert answers to their problems and had a  solution by the time they left the store.  It was only $15 to replace my tube and get me back on the road.  Also, they fixed my loose seat at no charge.  I can't wait to come back when I need a tune up.

43.description: Stars for over-all experience - but as M.A. notes - it's an east to miss and somewhat dusty hole in the wall. But Kris and Richard are the real McCoy and I would trust them with my life, er, bike any day. We found them via Google when looking for good used bikes for our friends from Holland. And ended up buying one for ourselves as well.They are now the only place we will go for repairs and/or parts. What a refreshing break from the attitude and prices you'll find at The Pony Shop and Turins.These guys REALLY know and love bicycles. And I love the way one of them (not sure which) has "repaired" his glasses with a band-aid (I assume he puts on a new one every now and then.)ALSO, if you go in the morning, a few blocks down you might run in to Nik M.'s TAMALES WOMAN (see review) and negotiate a fair price for her exceptionally good tamales (real live street food!)

2.description: Made a bad decision to try these guys out instead of going to my trusted bike shop in my old neighborhood that's now 8 miles away.  My right shifter stopped working, basically rendering my bike a single speed, and figured the cable had either broken or come loose, possibly a part broke.  Took it to Robert's and got a bad feeling right away.  My 2009 Jamis road bike was apparently beyond their skill level.  Got some story about how they only have one mechanic who works on my type of bike, a road bike.  Any bike mechanic at any shop in the city should be able to work on the shifting cable of my type of bike.  Took the bike in on Thursday, was told they'd look at it Saturday, called on Tuesday and they said they hadn't looked at it because the ONE mechanic who is apparently skilled enough would not be in until Thursday.  I called Thursday and was quoted $260 for replacement parts.  I asked them not to work on the bike, I was coming in to pick it up after work.  When I picked it up the guy started telling me some ridiculous story about going to a bike repair seminar a few years back and somehow that's where the $260 quote came from.  I have no idea what he was talking about, but I don't even think they looked at my bike to see what was wrong.  Felt like I was being scammed. Ended up going to my regular shop (even though it's 8 miles from where I live now), dropped it off on Sunday, they called next day Monday to tell me my bike was ready, went in and they charged me $12 for the repair.  Lesson learned.  Should have gone somewhere I know does quality work and that has the best interests of me and my bike in mind.  I think the majority of this place's customers must be people who really don't know any better about pricing and service, or just need flats fixed because they don't know how to do it themselves.  I don't even want to think about what they would have done to my bike or how much it would have cost me.

18.description: Brought a recently-immigrated friend over to get his bike fixed. They were no-nonsense and very fairly priced. Did good work.I wouldn't bring a $7,000 road pixie here, but for your around-town beater, it's the place to go.Also, there was a good-looking young woman working there, as I recall. That always spruces a place up.

41.description: I really liked the experience of buying my bike here; they made sure everything was set up correctly, and told me to stop back in a few months for a free tune up.  Unfortunately my bike was stolen after 6 weeks (frickin' Rogers Park).  Maybe I'll come back and buy a used one.

4.description: An overall very solid experience with some serious work done on a vintage bike. The initial aim was to just get the bike to work again, and aside from a totally unforeseen issue (pedal broke off from rust damage), they were able to work through everything that needed to be done.- Their level of craft is impeccable. - Initial timeframe given to me was 2-4 days, but they had it done the next day. No promises on if that's common, but it certainly helped my own experience.- They went beyond the initial scope to fix a few other things that weren't estimated out. The total was about the amount of a car payment by the time it was all said and done, but significant work was required. Labor costs are fair for the work, especially at their level.- They sold me on some components that were a bit more expensive, but always for a very good reason. Rust-proof chain and thicker-material tubes--all easily justifiable. The prices themselves have a slight profit creep, but they're a repair shop, and that's to be expected.My own use case was for repair/reform rather than for sales, so I can't comment on that. They're not pushy; they're honest. Definitely not a hipster spot, which is fantastic. These are totally the kind of people you want to fix your bike in the first place--they care about their craft.

6.description: Really great find. Great service at a very reasonable cost. Glad they're in the neighborhood.

22.description: Old cranky man and overpriced parts! Never had my bike serviced there and perhaps never would. I know it's sorta neighborhood place that has been there forever, but the old man has to learn how to be nice to customers. I wouldn't go there. Uptown bikes has much better prices and WAAAAAAY more friendly staff members!

15.description: Old cranky man and overpriced parts! Never had my bike serviced there and perhaps never would. I know it's sorta neighborhood place that has been there forever, but the old man has to learn how to be nice to customers. I wouldn't go there. Uptown bikes has much better prices and WAAAAAAY more friendly staff members!

20.description: Today was the first time I had been to this bike shop and I'm really glad I went here.  I just happened to get, who I believe was the owner to assist me.  I was dropping off a bike that had not been ridden for at least five years as it is a second bike.  I wanted a tune-up and to update the wheel locks etc.  The guy was super friendly and knew what he was talking about.  He showed me exactly what I needed and I was in and out in 20 minutes..  Look forward to doing more business with them which is perfect as they are very close to home.

8.description: Great shop. They really care about helping bikers out. If they don't have the right bike or part for you, they will help you find it either by ordering it or referring you to other great shops. The guys and gal that work there are knowledgeable and avid cyclists. I go here for parts, tips & advice, and minor tuning, but they also have a pretty good selection of used bikes with some character (older frames, single speed conversions, etc.)I bought a Roadmaster converted single speed here a little under a year ago, got into an accident with it. They guys at Roberts Cycle helped me put together a claim at no charge, and they even ended up doing the repairs below the cost of the estimate! I came to them looking to buy a new bike, and they have a good selection, just none that fit me. They recommended another shop and were very helpful.I come in and know the guys by name and they remember me. You can't easily find that in a shop: genuine friendliness. I feel comfortable asking for advice and tips, and I feel thanks to them I've gone from a recreational no nothing rider to an avid cyclist who can do minor repairs and even convert/fix up my old bikes.Head here if you want a positive bike shop experience, or if you're looking to get more into city cycling!

14.description: They repaired a flat tire on my bike in just 15 minutes and it only cost $15.  I couldn't ask for any better service.

58.description: Went here on a Sunday towards the end of football season and was seated right away. It's a plus that they have so many screens so you're able to catch your favorite game (if you're not a Bears fan). The service was good and the food was just okay. Although it wasn't crowded at all, the food took an extremely long time to come out. For an appetizer we had the red pepper spinach dip and I do believe it would have been tasty had it been hot. When it came to our table, it was lukewarm, on the verge of being cold, but we were so hungry that it wasn't worth the complaint and time for them to fix an entire new order. I had a burger for my entree which was much better than the dip but nothing worth going back for. Also, we had dirty plates on our table for a while after we had received new food. The abundance of TVs were nice and the food wasn't awful, but I don't see myself going back to eat.

56.description: My boyfriend and I came to this place last night (1/30/15) to watch the bulls game and have a couple drinks. The bar is at the entrance so we sat at the bar and didn't explore the rest of the establishment.  No on acknowledged us when we sat at the bar, the bartender said absolutely nothing, that's fine because he was busy, it took the bartender a long time to even come over to us, they should have had 2 bartenders. We ordered some drinks, wings and pizza, OMG! The food took a very long time to come out!!!! and they were not packed, I even thought the bartender forgot to put our order in. I noticed that another person placed a food order long after we did at the bar but our food came out together on the same tray.  The service was just too slow, and off here, the food was good, drinks could have been made better but on the plus side they had ample amount of alcohol.  There wasn't anything special about this place. I wanted to check out the regular menu but right now I'm not sure I'll come back.

29.description: After reading the reviews my first thought was I should have read about it before buying the groupon.  This place is a complete waste of time.  I would say they weren't ready to open as their lack of attention, service and organization were appalling.  When we first walked in their was an employee sitting at the bar talking to the bartender.  No one was at the hostess stand at 6pm at night.  The place was empty.  After 5 minutes of waiting we finally were greeted by a gentleman who showed us to our table.  We got to the table sat down and immediately noticed a big crusty food stain on the black table cloth.  Gross!  Who ever bussed the table clearly didn't care.  When the waiter finally got to the table he was kind enough to change the tablecloth for us.  We ordered some beers.  The first one came out in good time.  15 minutes later and no waiter in site I saw the beer sitting at the bar and went up and asked the bartender if that was our beer.  She said yes and I took the beer off the bar and delivered to our table.  The bar tender said nothing.  They were out of one of the beers that were ordered and we re-ordered from their beer selection.  The waiter was basically non existent.  Shame on him bc we are big drinkers.  I even made a comment to  him that it would behoove him to pay attention to low beers as we were there to watch the blackhawks and we liked to drink hoping that would entice him to be more attentive.  NOT THE CASE.  We order chips and guac.  He had to come back 15 minutes later and ask us what we ordered again.  Another gal came by to check on us once and she got some refills of beer that were actually delivered to the table.  The dinner order took at least 30 minutes to arrive.  We ordered a burger, a side Cesar salad and a cup of tomato bisk soup.  The burger and salad were ok.  The soup that I ordered for dinner was not even edible because of the massive amount of salt.  When the waiter finally came back to take the plates away he didn't even respond to the full cup of soup sitting at the table as he cleared it away.  To make matters worse I went to use the restroom and the door barely opened.  I mean I literally had to put the weight of my body up against the main bathroom door to get in.  Once in and all was said and done there was no soap...anywhere in the bathroom.  I sure hope the person who brought our food out hadn't needed the soap before serving us!  We loved this place when it was Hop House.  Needless to say we will not be back.  Step it up folks...you won't be there for another 6 months at that rate.

42.description: Went there tonight with a group of 7 and waited 20 minutes for someone to take our order if you think that's bad No it gets worst waited another 30 minutes for our food only to find out they ran out of chicken wings so they gave us chicken tenders instead which took another 20 minutes and we had to complain just to get our water and drinks, talk to the owner or manager and she didn't apologize or showed any concern until I talk to her 1 on 1 then she decided to take 20% off the bill and a free drink which was okay but I think she needs to show Empathy towards all her guest and be a little more has on and concern it's not the customer fault if you're short staff.

23.description: Can I give zero stars, because if I could I would. I've been meaning to stop in for a while since we live in the neighborhood. I knew we were in trouble when the cook came out and asked what kind of sauce I wanted on my Thai chicken... Thai sauce, buffalo sauce, barbecue sauce? Um, I ordered the Thai sandwich, I wanted the Thai sauce. I didn't have terribly high expectations but I expected that when I ordered a sandwich advertised as having onion straws on it, it would actually have onion straws on it and not two sorry rings of raw onion. Supposedly it was a mistake and the chef was on it. Twenty minutes went by, then 30. My sandwich was now ice cold and flies kept buzzing around and landing on it. The waitress offered to remake the whole thing but if onion straws took 30 minutes how long would a whole sandwich take? After about 45 minutes and still no onion straws the manager offered to take 25% off the bill. I thought he meant off the whole bill. But oh no, he only took it off the one sandwich. Which, at this point, I had taken a bite out of since I realized the onion straws were never coming... It was gross. So I basically paid $9 for French fries. Definitely will NOT be coming back.

47.description: My hubby and I went there today because we wanted to try a new place.  I was somewhat reluctant because I believe this is the third restaurant in 3 years (I could be wrong).  When we arrived there was only 2 tables.  I heard someone apologizing to one of the tables about their food and then the cook came out and apologized.  Our waitress was extremely slow and seemed to be new (didn't know how the southern potatoes were prepared) but was sweet.  Then I hear the same person apologize to the other table about their food and eventually brought her a new meal.  At this point I'm getting concerned.  We arrived around 12:45 and I ordered a burger and my hubby ordered hash browns and an omelet and we didn't get our food until almost 40 minutes later.  I asked for medium well and the burger was well done, a little over seasoned and the bun was charred (from leaving on the grill too long).  The fries were very hard, but not terrible.  My husband was not impressed with the breakfast at all.  The positive side is that the staff was very pleasant.  Ill never say never, but I don't think we'll be going back anytime soon.

8.description: WOW me and my gf been many times in the hard water grill and today New Year's Eve they don't let me get inside cus the bouncer say my ID looks old now I have to stay home and I lost $70 for the tickets

31.description: It's a slow Monday evening and they are out of Revolution on tap, Orange Sesame wing sauce and to-go containers.While the food was decent, the server seemed a little scatter brained. I see why we don't come here a lot.

34.description: Everyone is entitled to their opinion which is why I will write a review to save anyone else that comes here. I understand now why this place has closed several times and reopened and has terrible reviews. I mean do you care about your establishment or not?This place is horrible. It took the host about five minutes to notice that we walked in the restaurant. Then, after we were seated it took forever just for the waiter to take our order. She brought us our water and my cup was filthy. It had like red sauce on it. Gross! I mean seriously. It wasn't even THAT busy. After we placed our order and got our food, no napkins. So I had to get up and get them from the bar. It seemed everyone around us was getting more service. I felt bad for the waiter because she was running around like a chicken with its head cut off. I would never come here again. Mind you the entire time we were there, there was this other waiter that looked like she was a crackhead and walking around helping other tables but when we finally finished up she came over to our table. The food was crap.

16.description: I had a group of 12 people come the the College Football National Championship this year. The host was very accommodating. I had actually called ahead to give them a notice of our plans, but had no idea how many people were planning on showing up till a couple hours prior to the game. There was a great special on miller lite, well drinks, and 1/2 price appetizers on Monday, that we took advantage of, and they even let our group use a Groupon that is currently available. We had a great time as a group and felt well taken care of by the staff, who appeared to be sharing responsibilities in delivering our food and beverages. The wings were noteworthy. We tried the bbq, the habanero chipotle and the sweet Thai chili. All were good! I don't think anyone used the ranch dipping sauces. The buffer sandwich (buffalo chicken), which I had, was amazing. I really want to go back and have it again. Right now. It had the best grilled onions on it, which is weird, but gooood. I also substituted the ciabatta bun for a pretzel roll since all the guys who ordered burgers had that bun. I didn't taste one, but the burgers looked great (huge and delicious). I'll definitely try one some time. The fries were good, too, sort of standard and not meant to be the stars of the show. Another guy tried the mac n cheese balls, and he said they were great. I believe him, since he didn't share and didn't take his time eating them. There are TV's all over the place in this bar, and it should be a go to for catching the game. They could improve on the onion straws, not my favorite and the chicken fingers, we're sort of disappointing compared to the rest of the food. I think they were essentially the exact same ones you get from Jewel. I know they could do better there. Lastly, I think the service was good but there were some times when I felt it could have been even better. It took a while to get things or drinks refilled some of the game and other times, they were very attentive. Four stars for good wings and sandwiches and accommodating our group on the fly. There is room for improvement, but I can recommend this place... And I do.

13.description: The Dirty South Salad was absolutely delicious. Great flavor, the chicken perfectly blackened and spicy and avocado fresh; for a small salad, it was filling.  (Previous reviewer must only eat ghost chilies)  Bartender was pleasant and sweet, but waited too long for delivery of a salad.However ....  It was empty!  I was one of 3 people in the restaurant/bar.  My glass sat empty for almost 10 minutes before the bartender returned to ask if I wanted another one and I was charged for 'rocks' (ice) for my drink per mixed drink (I only had 2).  The lighting is bad, everything had a pinkish-red hue to it.  And the music ... I was going to order dessert, but the music was a HUGE deterrent.  It was mostly rap and hip hop.  Way too urban for the setting.  For that reason alone I probably won't be back.Perhaps I'll order from GrubHub  or BeyondMenu, but as a regular visitor, won't be back.  This may explain why they were so dead at 6-7 pm

11.description: Love this place !  Recently i tried the best Guacamole and chips in my life ,sliders are delicious as well !

39.description: "If you're going to frisk me, you may want to check my hair as well--it's big, I may be hiding something in there." While both male/female bouncers and my date found some humor in my statement, the mood quickly changed when we were allowed inside without my date being searched. Bless his heart, he flipped out more than I did ("So you're really going to frisk just her and not me? Really? Are you...seriously?"), and was then also frisked. And we also turned around and left.It's not the principle of being searched that's the issue. It''s that this place is evidently now attracting a crowd which led the restaurant to have to complete searches prior to entry to ensure patron safety. And the restaurant's hired hands lazily used typical profiling standards to guard the fort. I wasn't even going to post about this event (happened in March), but given that I've read several other online reviews where customers mentioned that non-white patrons were searched and white ones weren't? Hard Water has got to get their security together and tell them to cut this nonsense out. I don't care if myself and the others were outliers, no customer should ever have this complaint. Frisk everyone or frisk no one. Let's play Devil's Advocate for a second. Maybe I had a thuggish, rogue-ish appearance (as if that's a justification), and I looked like "one of those people" who would stick a gun-toting midget in her purse.My date had spent the day enjoying golf at his club, and was wearing khaki pants/polo/loafers. I spent my day at the office/brunch/shopping, and was wearing a skirt/blouse/nylons/pumps.Yes. The interracial preppy couple is coming. There goes the neighborhood!  Was I searched because my Balenciaga purse was last season? Which, ironically, wasn't even opened and reviewed. Again, Lil' Rambo may be up in there--and he's pissy when he doesn't have his gin martinis. But in all seriousness, frisk everyone or frisk no one. My assumption is that the security is either only used for large parties (which seemed to be the case when I last visited), or is a constant after certain service hours.  Given that I have met and spoken with Hard Water's management and staff on several occasions, I know that they are not only absolutely congenial but absolutely professional and absolutely awesome people all-around. And their staff is quite diverse, in several aspects, so my issue is not with them. I'm still rooting for this place to succeed, but unfortunately I'm not returning unless I know their wannabe-Gestapo have goosestepped off for further basic training.

37.description: I really wanted to like this place. I used to visit regularly when it was Hop Haus. It looks cool, the staff tried their best to be nice and helpful. Unfortunately, the food was really not very good. We shared nachos and the cheese was cold, the portion was small and the chicken was pretty non-existent. Not worth $10.00. We had a burger and chicken sandwich, again pretty small portions for the price, the fries were undercooked and I was left underwhelmed.  They also charge for re-fills on soft drinks. I haven't seen that policy used by a restaurant in 20 years.  I might give it another chance, but I was disappointed.

0.description: A while back I went there and they had some ridiculous burgers. Novelty things like a doughnut burger, or gluttonous staples like a mac and cheese burger. Those are now gone. That's unfortunate, because what's left is same old bar food.Place is nice enough. Very friendly staff. TV's are all over, which is not for me, but it may be for you. Food is unremarkable but tasty. Drinks are cheap.They really need to work on what music they play, namely someone's free spotify account doesn't quite cut it. I can put up with loud music when I'm going down to sit and eat and talk, but when you get an obnoxious ad on top of it it really sullens the experience. The drink menus could also use some updating. I don't mind flimsy paper menus, but at least make it easy to read.

38.description: Seriously strange place.  For one, you cannot reach them on the phone (to see whether they are open) and there is very little info on their website.  My friend and I went there for dinner last week.  The place was almost empty and stil lthe service was unbelievably slow.  All the tv monitors (which are at each table) were on the same sports channel.  We requested that our tv channel be changed.  The server kept telling us she's working on it but was never able to figure out how to change it and I guess just gave up.  From time of ordering (which we waited at least 20 minutes to do despite only one other table of customers) to our food arriving was 45 minutes so good thing we weren't starving.  I had the "dirty south" salad which was actually really good.

51.description: I've been coming here since it was The Hop Haus, and then Rolland's Place.  Mainly because  it was in walking distance and I used to meet friends to watch sporting events, have some food and do some socializing with my friends.  With the iteration (new owners) that is Hard Water Bar and Grill: it seems to have the same "identity challenges" as the previous two restaurants: "Do we want to promote the business as a restaurant, a sports bar, a family friendly bar, or a family friendly restaurant?"The main changes are that the sports related pictures have been removed, and most of the walls painted red.We came on Thursday night at approximately 8pm and were 2 of 6 patrons in the entire restaurant.The employees were friendly.The menu-it's basically a revision of the previous restaurants' menus (yet seems to have less options to choose), even though Hard Water is now owned by different people.  To compare the "old with the new" I ordered a "build your own" cheese burger.  It was good, yet might as well have come from Hop Haus or Rolland's based on the same pretzel bun and flavor. The mac and cheese that I had as a side item tasted just like the Hop Haus mac and cheese- better than store bought, yet not better than what I make at home.  My friend had burger "sliders" that looked like the same items from the previous restaurants.  Overall- it's bar food: burgers, sandwiches, salad, pizza.  It would be appreciated if they offered at least one steak choice.For being located on a corner of two main streets (Clark and Howard) one would think that all three versions of the restaurant would be busy much of the time. Yet, Hop Haus got sold among family, it changed to Rolland's Place and that stayed open about 6 months.  Then Hard Water opened with new ownership. The reality is that very little has seemed to change from the previous two incarnations, OTHER than the employees are more friendly and management actually stops by the table and asks about us/our meal.  And, Hard Water actually offers some social variety (trivia night) and some food and drink specials.We left about 9pm and the other couples that were at tables had been gone about 30 minutes. There were three guys sitting at the bar watching hockey.  Other than them, there were no other patrons.I can say that I tried it, yet it's not like I would go seek out going there again.

27.description: I went here with a date last night for the Hawks game. We were sat right away and the place was pretty empty. After a few minutes, the waitress dropped off two menus (literally dropped in front of us) and asked what we wanted to drink... I asked what was on tap and she went and got a crinkled up paper drink menu and said she'd be back.Ten minutes later, who I assume was the manager came by and asked if we'd ordered yet. No. Ok, so she took our order. Strike one.A few minutes later the original waitress asked if we'd ordered yet and made a comment about how she couldn't remember, oh so funny. Not funny. Strike two.The manager again brought out our food and checked up with us after that. The food itself was OK... I wasn't blown away but we had two burgers and they were decent. Oh, look, now we're done eating and enjoying the game and who starts coming by every couple of minutes like a vulture? The original waitress. Who couldn't be bothered to actually do any serving or waiting but now wants to make my date and I extremely uncomfortable and rushed.I spent $40 for two beers and two unremarkable burgers. Including a very underserved tip that was NOT meant for Crystal, the name on the ticket, who I assume was our horrible excuse for a waitress. So yeah, we planned on moving to the bar and watching the rest of the game and buying more to drink but since Crystal was so set on rushing us out we decided to go somewhere else where our business would be appreciated. Right after I signed the bill and set the book down next to me, not on the end of the table, but in front of me, she rushed on over to grab it before I even had time to put my card away... Horrible horrible service.I really wanted to like this place and was hoping to start bringing my weekly trivia group here. But thanks, Crystal, assuming that's even the name of the rude, distracted girl that did not help us once; I won't be back. I seriously regret wasting my money here.

32.description: First off , I only give it two stars because the waitress she was very polite. Unfortunate the menu was so small the selection was not appetizing, more so for sitting at the bar. Believe me when I say you're better off going to a "sub joint" to get the food that was listed. The bartender had her boy friend there kissing and hugging so that made it look kind of hole in the wall.  They didnt have less than half the items on the menu so we just had drinks. Seeing people play video games on the TV took me by surprise, what is this, a game room for grown men? Could it hurt to get a new pool table and clean the patio, its so dirty! Overall I  didn't like and will not go back.10/21/2015Now that I have experience the nightlife of Hard Water; I could say I enjoy the environment. The Bartender Nora is great.

54.description: No no no.  The one waiter on a Friday night helped people sat after us and took 15 minutes to get an order from us,  that we forced on him because he was trying to run to the next table.  Some blond girl at the bar was. ..talking?  I saw no bartending going on at all so. ..i have no idea.  Also,  they have NAPKINS FOR TOILET PAPER.  Nasty. 2 dollar drafts...just kidding.  Their tap is broken.  And their menu online doesn't match the online because they don't know what they want?  Surely their food must be magically? Nope, standard bar food. And onions in the buffalo chicken sandwich?  Gag. The TBLT panini only had one side of the sandwich toasted?  Come on,  even burger king can toast bread. Also,  when we were done eating a random blond came and asked how we were doing?  I don't know if this was the owner or not,  but maybe she should be working during the actual busy hours instead of showing up at 8 pm?  We will not be back,  in fact we would have left half way thru dinner were it not for our groupon. Go next door for good food, service  and entertainment.  This place is a joke.

48.description: We waited and nothing, no one came to take our order. A big group came in after us and got their order placed before us. And to top it off on our way out we got a little attitude "I'm sorry... You couldn't wait a few minutes!" We will definitely not be coming back!

44.description: Wow.  The recent reviews here make me believe we will see this place change hands again soon.  Maybe they are going more for the later night bar crowd?  Too bad.  Gateway was unique and loved by the neighborhood and the two places that followed,although different concept than Gateway, still had regulars and the staff seemed to care.  Managements response to reviews here does seem more confrontational and excuse filled than seeing the real problems. I don't need to hear about all your operating woes, I have my own work place with those.  We come here to unwind, have a drink, have a bite to eat.  I want this place to succeed, but I have my doubts.

24.description: I saw one of the meetups I go happened to have Karaoke event at this bar so me and my friend went there for mainly Karaoke. As we were waiting but nothing was going on I asked one guy working there if there was Karaoke happening that night. He said Karaoke is not available at this place...  Do not put wrong promotions to induce people like this... You wasted our time and gas.

7.description: Finally checking this place out!God, this place looks great!And, Missy and Renee the G. MRock!So, this place/location has a bit of a History, for it has previously housedHop Haus, Rolland's, and now it is known as Hard Water Bar and Grill.And, honestly I had previously dined at both Hop Haus and Rolland'sbut neither one of those places came close to how impressed I was as I walked into Hard Water tonight.As I entered I was welcomed warmly by both Missy my server and Renee,Hard Waters General Manager.I was so impressed with the Interior/ look of Hard Water that I started snappingaway with my I-Phone Camera, trying to capture as much as I could.Hard Water has a lovely bar area, and if I were a drinker I would have lovedto sat there and kicked back a few, however, these days I opt more forDiet Coke with Lemon, or Hot Tea, or.. Hot Chocolate!God, have I become boring or what?But, I did sit in a big comfy booth where I perused a great menu filledwith Apps, Pizza's, Burgers, and finally I came across exactly what I wantedwhich was a Turkey BLT sandwich with great crispy tots which I can onlysum up as perfection!I also started with a Caesar Salad which was one of the best, freshest, tasting salads I have ever had, no pre-packaged salad mixes here folks,and you can tell/see the difference..And, okay, I may not have had any Booze but I did indulge in warm,doughnut sticks with the most delicious chocolate, nuttela, marshmallow,sauce ever!And, yes, I love Marshmallows so much I will take them anyway I can get them!Now onto the Props!To the entire staff at Hard Water, The Owner who I met tonight but nowhis name escapes me, Renee the General Manager, Missy, my lovely,outstanding server, Chef Chris who is so Impressive he should be the9th wonder of the world, and to my friend Ace, who I wish the best fornow and always,Thank You all for a perfect evening and a perfect meal, you will beseeing me again very soon!You may be the latest/last occupants to occupy this space, butdefinitely not the least....

49.description: Atmosphere was good, but food was less than average. The veggie sandwich consisted of little pieces of grilled veggies on white bread. Very boring. The nachos were covered in cheese whiz and very few veggies and beans. Very disappointing. Still waiting for the tater tots that should've come with the sandwich.Service is the worst I've seen in a long time. Had to go to the bar to get our own drinks. Won't be coming back here again.Tater tot's never arrived. This place is a hot mess. Looking forward to the next restaurant coming into the space.

40.description: This place used to be a great place to have in the neighborhood but after last night I'm never coming back.First, my boyfriend and I arrive around 11 and are "greeted" by a really rude bouncer who checks our IDs, then turns to my boyfriend who is of Mexican descent and says he needs to frisk him.  Doesn't even check my purse, but full on frisks my guy.  So, two thoughts come to mind...eitherA.) This place is racistB.) This place has a safety problem that I don't want to be a part ofWe decide to stay despite this, and take a table.  The waiter in this section serves both tables on either side of us but never ONCE acknowledges that we have taken a seat, never brings a menu, nothing.  We finally just ordered our drinks at the bar and sat back down.There were 3 or 4 guys sort of wandering around looking at tables acting really bizarre.  I told my boyfriend I was going out for a cigarette and he said he didn't feel comfortable with me going alone, but I insisted and went out.  Turns out these weird guys were all part of the security team.  If you want people to feel safe at your bar, don't pay people to make your patrons feel less safe.I see them frisking more people outside, none of them white.  Just leaves an extremely bad taste in my mouth.  The drinks are good and the food has been decent in other visits but after this experience I'm done with this bar.  I'll go to Ward 8 or Peckish Pig

53.description: This bar has a fun atmosphere and professional employees. I tried an appetizer called buffalo chicken dip. The dip was tangy and tasty. The bartender was friendly, knowledgeable, and wore a cool bow tie as a part of his uniform. The cosmopolitan was made perfectly, for me means not really sweet and slightly zesty from the lemon. The restaurant is very cozy despite is size. I was touched when I walked into the ladies room and noticed  the detail of having various items such as lotion, and other personal items free to use on the counter if you need it.  The other patrons were friendly, there are televisions to watch sporting events and enjoy yourself. I will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items.

30.description: My girlfriend and I went here for my birthday last night.  We arrived around 7pm, the place was pretty empty.  Despite this, IT TOOK 30 MINUTES TO GET A WAITRESS!!  Ok, fine, maybe the waitstaff is a little understaffed this evening.  Yeah......not likely.....- It took 20 MINUTES BEFORE SHE CAME BACK TO TAKE OUT ORDER.- Once we placed the order for a couple of burgers, IT TOOK 40 MINUTES TO PREPARE.- We ordered dessert, a cookie, it TOOK 30 MINUTES FOR THEM TO BAKE THE COOKIE.- IT TOOK 20 MINUTES FOR THEM TO BRING THE CHECK!We never got the cookie we ordered by the way, it never came and we just left.  Waitress kept coming back saying "I'm sorry about the cookie, it's still baking".  Seriously?While there, we saw a few other people leaving.  Other people began to arrive and didn't even get menus until after sitting for 15-20 minutes.  People were complaining, people were leaving, people were very upset.  I couldn't believe how horrible this place was.  The food was 1/5 - just stay home and warm up a can of ravioli and dump it over a plate of fries (the frozen kind) and call it a night.HORRIBLE service. FOOD NOT WORTH THE WAIT.Will NOT be back. I will NOT recommend this place to ANYONE.  YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!

46.description: Seriously flawed experience. Looks great but life is bad here, at least on Sunday afternoon . U don't want the details anymore than I want to relive them. Worst managment ever. When everything goes wrong at a table you MUST be apologetic NOT confrontational. 1 hour for tepid, burnt hogslop. Hogs might even reject it.I would go back at night to just drink beer, but I'd be afraid of dirty lines in this joint. One star because I like the decor. Get new management or die, guys.

1.description: Yikes. The food sounded good, but it was exceedingly terrible. I make better guacamole and buffalo chicken dip. The Dirty South Salad was bland and the chicken on it was lukewarm (make up your mind, cold or hot!). The drinks were so yucky. I told the server I don't like dark liquor and she brought me whiskey. The double dip app that we got was brought out separately. My salad entree was brought out separately, then taken away because it wasn't finished. My husband asked for a medium WELL burger, and they brought him medium RARE. Ew. Nothing was as it was described. Then, when we got the bill an automatic 20% gratuity was included. I wasn't going to stiff her. I'm not terrible. But the chart at the bottom suggested 18% for good service, 20% for great service, and 22% for excellent service. I don't see why she thought she could rate herself for a party of two.Overall, not happy. Not going back.

55.description: I have been a patron of this restaurant since the Hop Haus days. Man....I miss Hop Haus....Anywho. I frequently come here with colleagues because it's conveniently located, parking is free, and they have a decent beer selection. I truly hope my next experience here will be a bit more positive and that what we experienced was simply opening jitters:- The heat was not on. It was snowing outside and the heat wasn't on. Apparently, someone had turned off the heat the day before, and the place takes forever to warm back up. The staff were all walking around with their coats on (I felt so bad) and overall, it was a chilly environment for a snowy evening.- They advertised $2 drafts, but upon reviewing the menu it was actually $2 PBR or Miller Lite. No big deal...I ordered a PBR...They were out of PBR.I will say they were kind enough to extend the $2 rate to the beer I did eventually order.- They also advertised half appetizers. Despite the fact their Mac and Cheese is listed UNDER Starters, this discount did not apply.Like I said, I am willing to chalk this up to a bumpy beginning - I will probably go back for the reasons aforementioned. But man...I miss the Hop Haus.

9.description: This place is pretty good. Decent food, good beer, and the cocktails were actually very good. Have been here a few times, always sort of get a weird vibe, but we live in the neighborhood so we will probably be back.

26.description: Four of us went for a Sunday evening dinner. The first sign of a problem was that the place was only about ten percent full. Right away we received glasses of water and a menu. The menu was very limited, three types of salad, two types of burgers, one chicken sandwich etc. Three of us ordered salads and one a hamburger. After a 20-minute wait with no one telling how much longer we had to wait or offering bread we left. Sorry, but just lousy service. This place used to be called Hop Haus and had a nice menu and good service with good food. I don't know what happened but this is now very disappointing.

25.description: I wish I didn't have to update my 5 star review, but my last review would be misleading as most things have changed. -You still only get one server on some bust nights, leading to some pretty slow and poor service. -Trivia has gotten way better on Tuesdays (a plus)***-THEY CHARGE FOR EVERY SINGLE FOUNTAIN SODA YOU DRINK-*** normally one would think that FOUNTAIN sodas come with free refills but the "New Policy" is $2.50 for every single fountain soda you have. Yes...Obviously the restaurant is struggling and looking for any corner to make a buck. This is not the way Hardwater... -The chef must have been fired...because the Carribean "Flatbread" is now a poorly made pizza, and the Margarita Flatbread is now just a strip of cheese pizza with some sun dried tomato. Not Balsamic glaze like before, no fresh basil..nothing like before. WHY HardWater...WHYYYYYYYYYY....So much potential lost.

12.description: I came with a cousin for a few drinks and just a chill time until we had to head somewhere around midnight. The bartender was nice and always around. The drinks were amazing and they usually have some sort of deal on Yelp. Great experience!

59.description: I had a group of 12 people come the the College Football National Championship this year. The host was very accommodating. I had actually called ahead to give them a notice of our plans, but had no idea how many people were planning on showing up till a couple hours prior to the game. There was a great special on miller lite, well drinks, and 1/2 price appetizers on Monday, that we took advantage of, and they even let our group use a Groupon that is currently available. We had a great time as a group and felt well taken care of by the staff, who appeared to be sharing responsibilities in delivering our food and beverages. The wings were noteworthy. We tried the bbq, the habanero chipotle and the sweet Thai chili. All were good! I don't think anyone used the ranch dipping sauces. The buffer sandwich (buffalo chicken), which I had, was amazing. I really want to go back and have it again. Right now. It had the best grilled onions on it, which is weird, but gooood. I also substituted the ciabatta bun for a pretzel roll since all the guys who ordered burgers had that bun. I didn't taste one, but the burgers looked great (huge and delicious). I'll definitely try one some time. The fries were good, too, sort of standard and not meant to be the stars of the show. Another guy tried the mac n cheese balls, and he said they were great. I believe him, since he didn't share and didn't take his time eating them. There are TV's all over the place in this bar, and it should be a go to for catching the game. They could improve on the onion straws, not my favorite and the chicken fingers, we're sort of disappointing compared to the rest of the food. I think they were essentially the exact same ones you get from Jewel. I know they could do better there. Lastly, I think the service was good but there were some times when I felt it could have been even better. It took a while to get things or drinks refilled some of the game and other times, they were very attentive. Four stars for good wings and sandwiches and accommodating our group on the fly. There is room for improvement, but I can recommend this place... And I do.

21.description: After waiting 30+ minutes from ordering were told the kitchen didn't turn the oven on.  The bartender entertained our 7 year old with the "f-er".   This place is horrible for families.

17.description: I went here with a date last night for the Hawks game. We were sat right away and the place was pretty empty. After a few minutes, the waitress dropped off two menus (literally dropped in front of us) and asked what we wanted to drink... I asked what was on tap and she went and got a crinkled up paper drink menu and said she'd be back.Ten minutes later, who I assume was the manager came by and asked if we'd ordered yet. No. Ok, so she took our order. Strike one.A few minutes later the original waitress asked if we'd ordered yet and made a comment about how she couldn't remember, oh so funny. Not funny. Strike two.The manager again brought out our food and checked up with us after that. The food itself was OK... I wasn't blown away but we had two burgers and they were decent. Oh, look, now we're done eating and enjoying the game and who starts coming by every couple of minutes like a vulture? The original waitress. Who couldn't be bothered to actually do any serving or waiting but now wants to make my date and I extremely uncomfortable and rushed.I spent $40 for two beers and two unremarkable burgers. Including a very underserved tip that was NOT meant for Crystal, the name on the ticket, who I assume was our horrible excuse for a waitress. So yeah, we planned on moving to the bar and watching the rest of the game and buying more to drink but since Crystal was so set on rushing us out we decided to go somewhere else where our business would be appreciated. Right after I signed the bill and set the book down next to me, not on the end of the table, but in front of me, she rushed on over to grab it before I even had time to put my card away... Horrible horrible service.I really wanted to like this place and was hoping to start bringing my weekly trivia group here. But thanks, Crystal, assuming that's even the name of the rude, distracted girl that did not help us once; I won't be back. I seriously regret wasting my money here.

10.description: Went here to eat end of last August and the food was great, really delicious!  Went back week of Christmas 2015 and was disappointed that the entire menu changed and nothing was good anymore.  My mom had a taco salad and there was literally a piece of wax paper fried/cooked into her food.  Pizza was entirely not delicious either.  I was really excited to go back for the grilled pizza I had enjoyed so much in August.  What happened to the chef who knew what he was doing?  Bummer.  Won't be back.  The server was sweet, although she charged all the wrong prices on the tab and we had to talk to a manager because none of it made sense.

5.description: I love this restaurant. We have ordered their Fish & Chips every Friday (I'm an immigrant from Wisconsin) on Seamless.com. Even though they did not have my Fish & Chips this Friday :(    I'll forgive them this time and hope to get it next week. Food is great, prices are great & even though we are too lazy to get off our couch, the service is great. Please don't run out of fish EVER again on a Friday! haha

3.description: No more burgers so I tried their jerk chicken for take out.  25 minute wait for a really dried chicken.  I got a side of rice and mashed potatoes???   I could cook better at home than this.

35.description: We came at around 5PM on a Friday to enjoy some delicious burgers. The restaurant was practically empty. We both ordered a burger, a salad and a beer to split. Salad was quite good and a decent amount. The beer to my surprise was a small bottle for $5 = not a good deal. The burgers came out quite fast, wouldn't expect any different with no customers present. Both burgers were quite greasy and not all that good tasting. The type of burger that gives you stomach ache for the rest of the day while you are wishing you never got a burger to begin with. Total bill with 20% tip would come to about $42. Quite pricey for a burger joint. Maybe the drinks are better.

19.description: "If you're going to frisk me, you may want to check my hair as well--it's big, I may be hiding something in there." While both male/female bouncers and my date found some humor in my statement, the mood quickly changed when we were allowed inside without my date being searched. Bless his heart, he flipped out more than I did ("So you're really going to frisk just her and not me? Really? Are you...seriously?"), and was then also frisked. And we also turned around and left.It's not the principle of being searched that's the issue. It''s that this place is evidently now attracting a crowd which led the restaurant to have to complete searches prior to entry to ensure patron safety. And the restaurant's hired hands lazily used typical profiling standards to guard the fort. I wasn't even going to post about this event (happened in March), but given that I've read several other online reviews where customers mentioned that non-white patrons were searched and white ones weren't? Hard Water has got to get their security together and tell them to cut this nonsense out. I don't care if myself and the others were outliers, no customer should ever have this complaint. Frisk everyone or frisk no one. Let's play Devil's Advocate for a second. Maybe I had a thuggish, rogue-ish appearance (as if that's a justification), and I looked like "one of those people" who would stick a gun-toting midget in her purse.My date had spent the day enjoying golf at his club, and was wearing khaki pants/polo/loafers. I spent my day at the office/brunch/shopping, and was wearing a skirt/blouse/nylons/pumps.Yes. The interracial preppy couple is coming. There goes the neighborhood!  Was I searched because my Balenciaga purse was last season? Which, ironically, wasn't even opened and reviewed. Again, Lil' Rambo may be up in there--and he's pissy when he doesn't have his gin martinis. But in all seriousness, frisk everyone or frisk no one. My assumption is that the security is either only used for large parties (which seemed to be the case when I last visited), or is a constant after certain service hours.  Given that I have met and spoken with Hard Water's management and staff on several occasions, I know that they are not only absolutely congenial but absolutely professional and absolutely awesome people all-around. And their staff is quite diverse, in several aspects, so my issue is not with them. I'm still rooting for this place to succeed, but unfortunately I'm not returning unless I know their wannabe-Gestapo have goosestepped off for further basic training.

28.description: I should have known that the experience wasn't going to be a good one when there were only a handful of people in this place for their $2 taco / $2 tequila night.  I mean, that's a GREAT deal, right?  Well, it ALL came together once we spent the first five minutes in this place.  First of all, it is FILTHY.  The glass wear is the same!  The bartender was a nice enough guy but he did have to ask me FOUR times what I wanted to drink then, to top it all off, there was some brownish/black thing hanging out in the bottom of my glass.  YUCK!  Onto the tacos..... there was so much wrong with the tacos that sadly, they were definitely not even worth the $2 per.  By the way, I am still not convinced that the "beef" in the beef taco was not cat food.Will never be back.

45.description: Fool me twice, shame on me. We have been going to this place since it was the Gateway. Really enjoyed it when it was Hop Haus, still was okay as Rolands but now, it is terrible. The service is the worst (you know when you have to ask for silverware and your waiter thinks that the hostess should have taken your order that things are bad). The menu is extremely limited. The prices aren't good. And the food isn't very good either. We went once when they had just opened and it was disorganized and bad. So we thought it was just because they were new. My son and I went back tonight and waited more than 45 minutes for a pizza and a sandwich (after asking them to take our order and for silverware and napkins). They brought out a complimentary bowl of tater tots (greasy) because of confusion but the order still took another 30 minutes. There were perhaps three or four other tables in the restaurant when we sat down and probably as many staff members on hand. So volume or lack of help wasn't the issue. At any rate, we had them wrap up our food and left. Would have been better off at the Burger King across the parking lot. We won't be back. There are plenty of other great places in Rogers Park and we will frequent them instead. Maybe when this place changes hands again, we'll be back.

33.description: My family and I went here for Mother's Day and we had a horrible experience. The service was horrible. Me and my daughters arrived before the rest of my family. I had to call the waitress over to get an appetizer while we waited for the rest of the party. She gave my daughter a cranberry juice that was watered down. Then when my cousin got there they gave her a water instead of the lemonade she ordered. When we placed our orders it took well over 30 minutes to make it.
