My youngest daughter waited over an hour to get to cheeseburger sliders and fries. My aunt received a turkey blt with burnt bacon ,my cousin received a cheeseburger with no cheese. My mother asked for dressing on the side for her salad and they brought out a salad that was soggy from dressing. More was wrong but I'll end with this . I was charged around $81 for a $54 bill. I had been here a few times before ,but I won't be back.

43.description: Even for pub fare, the menu is limited. I tasted the Mac and cheese balls appetizer and it was okay, but the chicken fingers were salty yet bland. I wouldn't eat a whole meal here. If you like having tv's everywhere, it might be good for watching a game, but there's nothing special about this place.

2.description: I have eaten here several time  in the last two months as well as phoned in my order for pick up. My favorite is the Hardwater Burger, which is on a pretzel bun and comes with caramelized onions and a side of delicious french fries. Its one of my favorite burger places in the area.

18.description: I'm done...every single time (no exaggeration) I come here my food order is incorrect. It doesn't matter if I order an entree or a bowl of chilli it has to be sent back at least once. I don't think it's all the kitchens fault, if the bartender would translate the order correctly and look at the food when they hand it to me they would aee its not as I ordered it. I'm not dealing with it anymore, I won't be back here again.

41.description: This place is terrible. Came with my girlfriend on a friday night around 11pm. The bouncer gave me a dirty look to start with. The guy lets some guys in and stops me at the door and checks if I'm carrying a gun... Come on! I get inside, the waiter ignored me the whole night, i ended up getting my drinks from the bar. Some guys started getting rowdy and they get kicked out. This place is a nightmare never come here.

52.description: Came in for a casual bite on a weekday night. My boyfriend and I were seated right away because there are plenty of tables in there. There's a tv at every angle too. I order the "Dirty South" salad, and ate every bit of it. It seemed fresh and they didn't skimp on the chicken. Our waiter was nice too despite trying to rush from table to table since there weren't many people working that night it seemed.

50.description: They try really hard here to be attentive. The drink prices are not only reasonable, but sometimes they offer specials.  The impression you get though is that they are trying to get over the hump but still have problems getting to the finish line. They try to promote events, but attendance is enemic. The menu is ok, but nothing to get you warm and fuzzy. Sandwhiches are decent and salads are big, but nothing to make you want to rush and come back.  It must be a tough location to succeed because it has changed hands so often.

4.description: Insanely good burgers. Very fun crowd of employees... Like a family. It's the ultimate "Cheers" bar. Feels more like just hangin'-out with fun, fun, cool, sexy friends.

6.description: Ghetto ass bar! I was trying to get some drinks after work,i wasn't even drunk but the bouncer didn't want me get some drinks. I hope this place get clossed. Karma is going to be a bitch

22.description: ZERO stars. Two giant thumbs down. noNoNO.- Appetizer took 20 minutes...kind of defeats the purpose if they take that long- Entrees were brought out not even a minute after the appetizer...thanks for giving us time to enjoy it!- 4 of us in our party and we each ordered burgers, all of which came out of the kitchen wrong (not cooked to requested temp, wrong toppings, wrong sides)- The burgers were dry and unappetizing. - Server was all over the place: He was trying way too hard to be funny which was annoying. He was acting stressed like he was taking care of 50 tables, even though we were his only guests. He kept disappearing and had to be hunted down to drop the check and then again to run our credit card. - We had to get up and get our own condiments and go up to the bar to ask for the beer we had ordered since our server was nowhere to be found. This place is abysmal. If you want good food and good service do NOT go here.

15.description: I should have known that the experience wasn't going to be a good one when there were only a handful of people in this place for their $2 taco / $2 tequila night.  I mean, that's a GREAT deal, right?  Well, it ALL came together once we spent the first five minutes in this place.  First of all, it is FILTHY.  The glass wear is the same!  The bartender was a nice enough guy but he did have to ask me FOUR times what I wanted to drink then, to top it all off, there was some brownish/black thing hanging out in the bottom of my glass.  YUCK!  Onto the tacos..... there was so much wrong with the tacos that sadly, they were definitely not even worth the $2 per.  By the way, I am still not convinced that the "beef" in the beef taco was not cat food.Will never be back.

57.description: My wife and I went here for a drink and dinner recently, and we both really liked it. We had wings, burgers, and the donut stick things. First the wings, man were they good! We didn't expect them to be quite as good as they were. They were crispy, not soggy like some wings get, hot, and delicious. I saw they have a 50 cent wing night on Wednesday. I've been looking for a new wing Wednesday location, and I think I found it! The burgers were good though extremely messy to eat. Not a big deal, that's why the napkin was invented! I had the hard water burger (bacon cheeseburger), and though I wouldn't say it was my all time favorite burger, it was darn good, and I'll definitely be ordering it again. The dessert, I honestly don't remember it's name, donut something with a nutela dipping sauce was outstanding. It almost taster like funnel cake sticks. Sooo good, no complaints on the food!I docked one star because the service was a little slow. The place wasn't packed, but the waitress seemed to be a little swamped. She never returned for drink orders, we ordered food first because we wanted to check out the beer menu, which is pretty good (Lots of Lagunitas and great specials). When we first arrived nobody was there to seat us or tell us to sit down. I'm guessing this is just an off day, or at least I hope so because the drinks and food are great! That said, the employees were all incredibly nice and seemed happy to be there, which does make it more enjoyable to be there.Normally I don't compare restaurants that replace an old one at a location, but I do want to mention that unlike when Hop Haus became Roland's, and was pretty much the same mediocre menu and terrible service, this place is completely different. The staff is super nice and the food is much better than that one, so don't fear a third face lift of the same place, this is a whole new restaurant. I'm looking forward to doing some wing Wednesdays and watching some baseball/football games there. TVs are everywhere. Definitely recommend this place! BTW, I used the $16 for $30 groupon to try this place out. If you're on the fence give it a shot. With the groupon, wings, 2 burgers, dessert, and two beers only came out to about $14.

20.description: They seem to be trying but they're a bit inconsistent.  Their wait staff is very nice but the food, while fresh, lacks the "skill" level needed from a preparation standpoint.  Also, they have many TVs in the place and they're often all tuned to the same channel.....  I hope that they get it together.  It is a very nice "interior" with a lot of potential if they can just work the issues out.

36.description: If I could give this place zero stars, I most absolutely would. I had the misfortune of visiting this establishment more than a few times back when it was Hophaus. Even then, the food was good, but the service was always terrible. Servers were all the same. Slow, unattentive, and rude.  Fast forward to 2015, and it is now the Hardwater Cafe. I will try my hardest to keep this review short, because this crap hole isn't even worth more than the words that I am typing now. This past Saturday afternoon around 1:15, my friend and I were literally "HANGRY". We walk in, and considering how big this place is, there was no one at the bar, and three tables occupied with groups of no more than 2-3 people. The bartender told us to sit down at any table we like, and a server will be with us. Now mind you, this place is dead, as it's 1 in the afternoon. We sit down, and over TEN MINUTES LATER a young man comes up frantically, as if preparing for the apocalypse, hands us two menus, and then swiftly turns to his left to go to the server table to get us a drink menu. He then places the drink menu on the table and says, "Oh, and let me present you with a drink menu". Not a second later, he runs off. Literally, HE RAN OFF. I quickly turn and say, "Umm, can we???" But it was too late, he was gone. I guess we needed more than ten minutes to decide what we wanted to drink, let alone order food! After another 3 minutes or so, we just got up and left. My friend and I both knew at that point, this was going to be a cluster you know what. With our past bad experiences with this place, and since we were so hungry, we weren't even going to take a chance with the joker of a server we had. The bartender that initially told us to get our own table, watched us walk out with a smirk on his face, and didn't say one word, nor did he even ask us what was wrong. Great customer service! It was almost comical. You always want to give someone the benefit of the doubt, especially when it comes to establishments that continuously change names and management. However, I will no longer be giving Hardwater Cafe another chance. Or whatever name it is, once I have completed this review. Don't waste your time! The Hardwater Cafe is a JOKE!

14.description: I wish I didn't have to update my 5 star review, but my last review would be misleading as most things have changed. -You still only get one server on some bust nights, leading to some pretty slow and poor service. -Trivia has gotten way better on Tuesdays (a plus)***-THEY CHARGE FOR EVERY SINGLE FOUNTAIN SODA YOU DRINK-*** normally one would think that FOUNTAIN sodas come with free refills but the "New Policy" is $2.50 for every single fountain soda you have. Yes...Obviously the restaurant is struggling and looking for any corner to make a buck. This is not the way Hardwater... -The chef must have been fired...because the Carribean "Flatbread" is now a poorly made pizza, and the Margarita Flatbread is now just a strip of cheese pizza with some sun dried tomato. Not Balsamic glaze like before, no fresh basil..nothing like before. WHY HardWater...WHYYYYYYYYYY....So much potential lost.

0.description: So I made an appoinment here for extensions. We talked all about extensions the different kinds, the after care, the prizes bla bla.. So I decided to get them I left a 300 dollar deposit and he said he would call me by Tuesday to set up an appoinment to get them done. This happend on a Friday. Tuesday he never called. I waited, Thursday came,  NOTHING. I called him he said "oh yea i haven't gotten the extensions yet but i'm working on it. But for sure I'll get them by sunday so you could come that day I said ok I'll wait for your call. Saturday came and he never called so i called him and he goes like " woman i told you to come Sunday" Any***** way I thought i had asked him to let me know BTW My extensions were HORRIBLE looking!! He didn't put enough. He gave me a terrible haircut the extensions looked squared. You could tell right away i had extensions. Withing a week I went back and told him I didn't like them and to give me a better haircut to cut them shorter. He said OMG woman you payed all that money and then for you to cut them right away?!  I said well i didn't like them he said the good thing is that you came back here because no other hair salon cuts extensions!!! hmmm??... after that i never went back. I don't recommended They totally BLOW!!!!!!!!!!

3.description: Really decent beer selection. They have Delirium Tremens, which always earns (by default) at least 3 stars in my book. It's a small store right by Devon market, which makes it easy to get groceries and a decent beer in one trip. Nice guy at the register as well. It's great to have another solid booze store in the 'hood.

1.description: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but I stopped in on my way home from work to pick up beer and I left happy.Decent selection of Goose Island, Dogfish Head, and most of the major craft breweries you'd expect to see at a bigger liquor store...  they even had some of the beers that tend to sell out quicker at larger stores, like Dogfish Head's 120 min IPA.  And if you really want an PBR or something, they've got that cold too.  The prices were maybe $1 or so more per item than your large grocery store liquor department, but not badly over priced at all.

2.description: Love Hahn liquors. Mr. and Mrs. Hahn are always so sweet when I come in, they don't have the most inexpensive options but they have a pretty decent beer selection. Glad to have them in the neighborhood!!

9.description: Prices and selection are what one might expect from a indie liquor store, BUT Mr. and Mrs. Hahn are the nicest people in the city of Chicago.  Seriously!  Worth the trip there just to support a great local business.

10.description: I effing love Hahn Liquors. Every time I go in there with my fiance, they tell me to be careful because he's underage (he's 31. it's apparently the only joke Mr. Hahn knows but it cracks me up every time lol). Mrs. Hahn is adorable and gives great advice on what to buy. I went in looking for a sparkling red and she told me what to buy both for a nice occasion and for just a random weeknight. We buy well-priced six packs here all the time, as well as good wine and sometimes liquor. Even when it's a little more expensive than a big box store (which is rare), it's worth it for the awesome customer service! :)

4.description: This is a solid liquor store with a good selection of everything. If you're looking for deep discounts then take the time to hop the bus down to Binny's. If you want a good selection at a decent price, then you go to Hahn's.  Great service as well!

6.description: I think I have picked up a bad habit.  I went for a 3 mile run and again I ended up at a liquor store.  I guess the cool thing about running is you notice some establishments that you missed while driving.  Anyway, the friendly Asian cashier lady was telling me that the store has been open since 1977.  I don't know why I was comparing myself to a liquor store, but for some reason I felt better about my age.  Hey, maybe because I was in slightly better condition than the store.  I just need to shed a rice bag worth of fat, have surgery on my shoulder (preferably bionic arm attachment), transplant a few fast twitch muscle fibers, and an injection of gingko/ fish oil bathed CSF, and I'm good as new!  Okay, so this summer I have been all about finding the best white beer.  This store has Wittekerke, Blue Moon, Hoegaarden, Blanche de Bruxelles.  They even have Three Floyds as well as other relatively hard to find brews.  The beer prices are reasonable, it sure beats getting price plundered by Devon market a few blocks down.

12.description: Overall, an excellent place. There is plenty of wine and booze. The beer selection is decent but could be better. The prices aren't that great but aren't horrible. The couple who runs the place are really nice.

5.description: My favorite local liquor store!

13.description: I agree with Scott K. on pretty much all he says.  The owners are nice, but when we went to the Speakeasy - a BYOB restaurant across the street - with a bottle of red wine that needed a little chilling, the waiter asked us knowingly, "Hahn Liquors?"  The bottles are all warm there.  The beer selection is also good.  You can get Great Lakes Brewing Co. beer here, Dogfish Head, Anchor beers, and a reasonable selection of international beers like Sam Smith's.  The German selection is a little disappointing, however.

11.description: I used to think the owners were really sweet people, but I changed my mind this evening.  A month ago I brought back a bottle of wine that tasted baaaaaaad!!! I knew it was a risk to buy, as it was a bit dusty and the place does get pretty hot in there, but I took a shot.  I shared it with two other people and we all passed on it.   Anyways, after a little fuss, they let me take a different bottle of wine, and that bottle was great.  So, I went in there tonight to pick up a bottle.  I was going to ask Mrs. Hahn to choose the bottle, so I wouldn't make a bad choice, but instead, they both told me that I could not purchase wine there anymore.  I've been giving them my business for over 7 years.  I've returned only two bottles of wine in all that time, but apparently I must have insulted them.  They told me that I just didn't like the wine and that it wasn't bad.  Although I don't think so, even if that was the case, why not just tell me that you won't reimburse me for the wine?  Oh well, the extra trek to In Fine Spirits for well cared for wine and good customer service is worth it.  Sorry Hahns!   I'll be telling all of my neighborhood friends to stay away!!!!!!!!

8.description: This is a convenient place on the border of Edgewater and Rogers Park that offers a nice variety of beer, wine, and spirits.  Prices are as you should expect to find in the city.  The best part of the shopping experience is the delightful Mrs. Hahn.  She is always happy to see you, and goes to every effort to remember your name.  The Hahn's always want to ensure you are satisfied with your purchase and experience in their store.  Glad to have this establishment in our neighborhood.

0.description: LOVE this place.  It looks like such a small store from the outside.  You go in not expecting much.   And then you realize the selection there is fantastic!  Some great local beers in there and Mrs. Hahn is probably the cutest thing in the world.I'd recommend going in there and trying out Half Acre's Daisy Cutter.  I'm surprised such a little neighborhood liquor store has stuff like that.  Love 'em and I'll keep on going there 'til I move.

7.description: Hahn Liquors, I've got to leave!So much for Rogers Park,Hahn Liquors it's now long-sleeve!It's autumn, Devon-and-Clark!Happy in summer heatAt night I'd walk to you,With sandles on my feet,To buy some cheap-ass brew.Your selection was impressive,For a tiny corner store.(Did you know sales tax's regressive?Let's stick it to the poor.)Two Asians, man and wife;They smile when you pay;A simple small business life - "SIR YOU HAVE GOOD DAY."Hahn Liquors, I had forgot,All that summer heat,The PBR I boughtAnd the sandles on my feet.

58.description: Stopped in here with a friend for breakfast after many reminders by my wife about how much she likes it. She stops in here all the time to grab some coffee and work. Anyway, the place is pretty cool in general. It has a great small neighborhood coffeeshop feel to it, which I loved. The coffee was pretty good. I generally like my cappuccinos a little stronger, but I'll just ask for an extra shot of espresso next time. The food was great. I'm a huge skillet fan, and I had one of there veggie skillets. Everything tasted great, and it was a massive amount of food. We hung out there for probably about two hours just chatting and sipping our coffee. I will definitely be back in the near future.

56.description: Visited for my first time this morning for Sunday breakfast with my family. We all had a great experience and fantastic meals. It's always a bonus when a place is kid friendly (my kids loved the cinnamon rolls). Staff was very friendly and prices are reasonable. We will definitely return soon.

29.description: The vegan options are delicious - the vegan skillet being more reliably awesome than the vegan burrito. The vegan desserts are all pretty amazing. It gets crowded on the weekends, so get there early or be ready to wait a bit. I've never had to wait too terribly long though. Wonderful staff and management. All around good people. This is my go-to brunch location. No mimosas, but you can BYOB.

42.description: I like the food here, especially that there are many vegetarian and vegan options. Recently they switched from counter service to full service; at first I liked the switch but since then the quality of the service has been inconsistent, too often slow. I want to like this place and Rogers Park does not have many good dining options so I am hoping that this restaurant will work on improving its service. The food gets four stars and the prices are good too.

23.description: Amazing cinnamon rolls. I am an expert on cinnamon rolls. Yes, yes I am. I live 2 blocks from Ann S.  I love the Growling Rabbit. I wish I lived 2 blocks from THEM!

47.description: I will admit, I hate breakfast,  so I can't comment on that.  But, their baked good and lunch/dinners are awesome.  For $9 you can get a combo plate with a salad, cup of soup, and 1/2 sandwich.   It is a little expensive,  but worth it, in my opinion, for fresh, scratch made food and home made baked goods.  The desserts are also really good and so are the loaves of bread you can take home.  My go to place for a fresh, home made, lunch or dinner and awesome baked goods.

8.description: Vegan burrito - really goodVegan peanut-butter choc cake - rich and good..Quick service.. good people.. Will see u guys again for sure..

31.description: Undoubtedly one of the coolest and best places I've been to in the area. I ate one of the best sandwiches of my life. It has a hipster flair and menu choices suitable for anyone's tastes.

34.description: Had the skillet Mediterranean.  It was excellent!  The coffee was probably the best I've had in Chicago, a local brand I can't remember the name. They have a small patio with metal tables & chairs - no umbrellas.  The lunch menu looked fabulous but breakfast is served all day.

16.description: Great service and food! Today was my second time and this place is delicious, i tried the carnitas bombwiche and the hangover skillet the best breakfast by far.

13.description: The French toast flight is AMAZING. Be prepared for your taste buds to go wild. Very sweet too.

11.description: It's probably safe to say that I loathe the Growling Rabbit.  This is honestly crazy disappointing to me too because the staff were mostly attentive to my needs and I really love their name!  It's just that everything else really fell short.I went out to the Morse area on a cold weekday morning to get some work done, and was constantly plagued by extremely loud music playing in the background (really, at a coffee shop?!), unsatisfying overpriced food, and extremely creepy or far-too-energetic cackling and crazy customers.  My toast had remnants of some disgusting spread on it that didn't taste of butter (believe me - it was gross; I couldn't even finish a single slice), the scrambled eggs were somewhat bland,  and ironically the potatoes were overly seasoned.  To top it all off, the seats were hard and uncomfortable, and the entrance door doesn't fully close properly so I was constantly greeted by a cold wind of below freezing temperature.  Maybe it was just a series of unfortunate accidental failures and inopportune timing, but after such a dreadful experience it's safe to say I will not be traveling here again.  Even if the commute was 5 minutes away instead of 15 minutes away, I don't think I would go for fear of another disastrous morning.

39.description: This place is much improved.

37.description: Hands down this is one of the best places to eat in Rogers Park (doesn't hurt that its less than a block from my apartment). I literally come here for the bacon and the Lattes. The charm, helpfulness of the staff and the great food earns them 4 stars. Service can be slow...very slow... like an hour and 10 minutes slow...which is the only thing keeping the Rabbit from 5 stars.

0.description: Me: -reads an article about this place relocating soon and finally decides to try it-Apparently this place is making the move from Rogers Park to somewhere in Edgewater and that bums me out now that I've had the breakfast!I came here ages ago for a drink while meet a friend before I moved to the neighborhood and the hot chocolate remains fantastic as ever. The breakfast was great. Honestly just a well cooked, simple comfort food breakfast. And the scrambled eggs are all I ever desire to be able to make at home. Service was semi-quick and very friendly. Apparently this place also has loads of options for any veggie friends you may have!

38.description: Love the ambiance! The staff are all very friendly and laid back. If you are vegetarian and like spicy food, you've got to try the Buffalo Tofu Sandwich!

51.description: My boyfriend and I decided to finally give this place a try after living in Roger's Park for almost a year. Unfortuately, it was on a Monday and they were closed. Kind of a weird time to be closed. Anyways, we stopped in the next day to get some deserts. He got the oatmeal cream pie and I got a slice of the carrot cake. We paid just over $9 for both, which ended up feeling expensive for the quality that we got. The cookies on the oatmeal cream pie were too crunchy and stale. The cream inside it was bland and had a skin/shell formed on the outside from not being freshly made. The carrot cake was filled with small fruit pieces which completely changed the taste. It did not taste like a traditional carrot cake should be. The cream cheese frosting was not very sweet either. I am a huge sweets person, liking most of what I try, but these two deserts were sub-par. I have yet to try any of their other food, but from what I experienced with their deserts, I will most likely not bother.

27.description: I thought this was a wonderful place for breakfast!! I had the breakfast burrito which was huge and very tasteful and flavorful! The wait for the food was a bit long, about 40 minutes but it was delicious! I will for sure be back!

32.description: The baked goods are scrumptious and the coffee very tasty. The owner is a remarkable woman.  Salt of the earth and smart!  Oh, and very motivated.  I am extremely grateful to have this cafe in my neighborhood.  The quinoa tacos are so yummy!  My favorite is the oatmeal vegan cream pie though.  Talk about better than chocolate!  Well, really close anyway!  Thank you Growling Rabbit!

54.description: This is a small, local diner with a lot of the Loyola crowd. I love this place. The skillets and omelets taste amazing. I usually get the veggie ones. I'm also hooked on the coffee-from a small batch roaster out of Minnesota. Like others have mentioned the seating is a challenge especially on the weekends, it's often busy, and sometimes there is a wait at the register. Not sure if I'd bring a big group of people here when it's busy-may be good to call ahead to get a heads up. Basically, I've never had a bad experience food wise at this restaurant.

48.description: I really wanted to like this place, but after my 2nd visit I can say I really dislike this cafe.My first visit was on a Saturday morning with waiter service. They were busy, but there we a few open tables left open around 11 am. The service was slow, and I overheard the person behind the counter, it may even have been the owner, continuously reply to complaints from customers about the wait with a rude "its Saturday, we're busy, deal with it"-like the customer flow was an inconvenience. Maybe they need to staff another person or two to keep up. The second time was a slow week day-with counter service. Cool that's fine, but they're not set up for counter service to work well. There is no place to get/refill water so you have to wait in line anytime you want some. No silverware or extra napkins- again another trip to the counter. They had cleaning supplies left out in the dinning room and the coolers viewable from the dinning area were sloppy and full of half prepped food items and the dish tub was overflowing. The foods ok but nothing special. Overall this place isn't welcoming, and it seems like staff/owners don't want you there.

44.description: After an initial not-so-great experience, I was enticed back to Growling Rabbit by a friend who's a regular there. This time, I had a much better experience, mainly because the young lady working behind the counter was incredibly friendly and warm. How much difference does customer service make, folks? A lot. A LOT! She was so outgoing and chatty, I don't even know exactly how much I paid for my coffee and treat, and whether or not I should have gotten a refill. I'm still not crazy about the space, especially how you have to go down a couple steps when you enter, but hey - I don't think that's the fault of this place's owners. The displays looked much more appetizing than I had remembered, too, although I did not partake of anything but a cookie.My second experience was much, much better than my first. If my friend wants to go to Growling Rabbit again, I will go with a good attitude and perhaps even an appetite.

24.description: Sweet, relaxed little place with delicious food and lots of airy bright light pouring in through the glass walls. Nestled in a semi-ground / semi-underground level. Huge food selection! Caters to Vegans, Vegetarians and Carnivores. Breakfast all day, lunches, soups, salads, and best of all anything with the green coconut curry sauce on it mmmmm - like the Vegan All Day sandwich. Mexican offerings are superb - Huevos Juan is delectable, aka yummers. Bakery treats, good coffee, weekend brunch specials. Why oh why did we wait so long to discover this place? Also, no rabbits were harmed or actually growling at this cool joint.

7.description: After an initial not-so-great experience, I was enticed back to Growling Rabbit by a friend who's a regular there. This time, I had a much better experience, mainly because the young lady working behind the counter was incredibly friendly and warm. How much difference does customer service make, folks? A lot. A LOT! She was so outgoing and chatty, I don't even know exactly how much I paid for my coffee and treat, and whether or not I should have gotten a refill. I'm still not crazy about the space, especially how you have to go down a couple steps when you enter, but hey - I don't think that's the fault of this place's owners. The displays looked much more appetizing than I had remembered, too, although I did not partake of anything but a cookie.My second experience was much, much better than my first. If my friend wants to go to Growling Rabbit again, I will go with a good attitude and perhaps even an appetite.

49.description: This place is boss. They have the best tofu sandwich I've ever had, the Vegan "All Day", which is kind of a transcendent experience. All of their baked goods that I've tried are delicious (I got the Salted Caramel Cake today and it blew my effing mind). I'm a big tea fanatic and I love their selection of loose leaf tea. Big fan. Glad that they're nearby and inexpensive for what you get. Also, rabbits. Need I say more?

40.description: Wonderful place to eat and great environment. Service was helpful and friendly -- food was excellent. I'm giving them four stars instead five stars because they took the buffalo tofu sandwich off the menu for some ridiculous reason. Put it back.

53.description: June 20, 2015 UPDATE: Sadly dropping the Rabbit from 5 to 3 stars because of significant table-service struggles.Fourth time today at the Growling Rabbit since they've shifted to table service, which started as an experiment for the weekends and then got expanded to every day. My suggestion to the owner: this isn't working. Customer experience is getting worse.The staff are personally nice as always, but look increasingly flustered and often are glancing around the dining room looking confused. Every time I've visted recently there have been basic table service frustrations: no coffee for long periods of time, food time almost walk-out long (as I write, I sit at a table having arrived *54 minutes* ago but no food), food delivery without silverware (just saw it happen 3x in a row to ppl around me), not being able to get someone to grab a bill and run the check. Today when I was a the counter, a women was there ordering a scone for her table because she couldn't get someone to take the order at the table. Said she had waited 30 mins.3-stars stay because the staff are still nice and look like they are putting a lot of effort in and I still love the food and general vibe of the Rabbit, but simple table service that looks "easy" takes some training and *efficient systems* to care for customers well, and Rabbit hasn't caught up on this. I'm sure their plans for a new space will seem like the solution, but I am concerned this will not fix staff training or old systems. Hope they figure out a way to improve! Another table behind me just told the server they will leave without their food. Bummer.CR----Been in Rogers Park now for 8 months, and I've decided The Growling Rabbit is my favorite, and not it's not just cause their name is awesome (picture it in your head for fun. right?)  The handmade-chorizo omelette with fresh avocado, green onions, tomato, cheddar: huge and savory and perfect. Baked goods are: well, they're baking them in the back, so awesome. Staff are universally friendly and easy-going. The space isn't big (13 tables? + a counter that runs the width) but feels bigger because of big bright windows on all sides of the corner lot.This place typically hits that nice sweet spot between coffee-shop and cafe: on weekdays, you can easily camp with a laptop (wifi is pretty dependable) and enjoy coffee and a snack, or you can have a lunch-quality meal.They're busy and popular on the weekends which has had them recently switch to table service on Saturdays and Sundays--instead of ordering at the counter you wait to be seated. This has been a little rougher: service can be a little spotty as you feel like the servers who normally work behind the counter don't quite have an efficient system down for a rush. But the great food and warm environment remains, and the Rabbit has earned its place as a regular haunt.

30.description: Growling Rabbit has really turned out to be a great place for lunch. And the staff is very friendly.

46.description: My wife and I were first introduced to The Growling Rabbit when we were in the area looking for apartments.  A property manager recommended them partly for their amazing bacon.  Strange to me that a place so vegan friendly would have such killer bacon, but such is life, full of surprises.  We tried it and, of course, everything was great.  The sandwich I got was tasty and the bacon was crispy and delicious.  Fortunately, we moved into a place pretty close (not the place that gave us the recommendation, sadly), and now we have been coming pretty much weekly.  My wife loves the vegan all day sandwich, and I have gotten a couple breakfast sandwiches (always with bacon), the adult grilled cheese (also with bacon) and the Friday Mac n cheese special (you guessed it...  bacon).  I'm seriously obsessed with the bacon here.  Best I've ever had at a restaurant.  They actually make it crispy when you ask for it that way, which is more than I can say for other, more well known places.The only bad thing I can think of about their food is actually a good thing.  Their desserts are too good.  Not only are they going to make me fat, but they have so many that look good, even to me, the pickiest person ever to go to a restaurant.  I always want to try like 7 every time I come in and neither my wallet nor my stomach could stand that.The service can be a bit show at times, but this is quality food made to order and the staff is somewhat small.  But everyone is friendly and the good more than makes up for the wait.  I love this place and we'll be coming as long as I live here.  Five stars!

1.description: Umm ... ordered a  breakfast "skillet" -- it came in a ceramic salad bowl.With lots of those restaurant-style potato chunks I don't like (over salted, some burned edges), instead of hash browns. With cherry tomatoes and feta cheese curds that were almost raw -- they were warmed, but not cooked (hence appropriate for the bowl, I guess).With tiny squares of lunch meat ham (not chunks or bites).And with a couple of fried eggs, and some baby spinach. And some toast -- with what looked and tasted like blueberry pancake syrup, instead of jam.It wasn't bad, exactly -- just very strange.Service was attentive, friendly, and generous -- but I was served coffee WITH NO SPOON.(I've experienced this elsewhere, and I don't understand it.)Oh, and they were playing some music I could not identify -- perhaps obscure 90's punk rock? Pretty loud, too.  Prices are quite reasonable. This is actually one of the better choices in the neighborhood, but I'm not sure if I want to return.

55.description: Ohh la la I love that I get to update my review! Recently went into this joint and everyone was happy!! Yay yummy food AND happy people ?! See now I HAVE to come here more frequently  thank you for the attitude check and of course most importantly the superb food.

9.description: I love Growling Rabbit! The Black Bean Bomb Burger is the shiiiznets! Also, people complaining about service stop whining it is obviously not Fine dining restaurant! it's a modern diner! Go to Chinatown where you truly will experience bad service.

26.description: Great food, good service, cozy atmosphere, and affordable! I highly recommend this neighborhood spot

25.description: The relaxed atmosphere heightens the charm of The Growling Rabbit. The friendly staff and delicious food also make this cozy restaurant a staple of Rogers Park. For those interested: there are plenty of vegan options but I recommend getting an order of their bacon.

12.description: June 20, 2015 UPDATE: Sadly dropping the Rabbit from 5 to 3 stars because of significant table-service struggles.Fourth time today at the Growling Rabbit since they've shifted to table service, which started as an experiment for the weekends and then got expanded to every day. My suggestion to the owner: this isn't working. Customer experience is getting worse.The staff are personally nice as always, but look increasingly flustered and often are glancing around the dining room looking confused. Every time I've visted recently there have been basic table service frustrations: no coffee for long periods of time, food time almost walk-out long (as I write, I sit at a table having arrived *54 minutes* ago but no food), food delivery without silverware (just saw it happen 3x in a row to ppl around me), not being able to get someone to grab a bill and run the check. Today when I was a the counter, a women was there ordering a scone for her table because she couldn't get someone to take the order at the table. Said she had waited 30 mins.3-stars stay because the staff are still nice and look like they are putting a lot of effort in and I still love the food and general vibe of the Rabbit, but simple table service that looks "easy" takes some training and *efficient systems* to care for customers well, and Rabbit hasn't caught up on this. I'm sure their plans for a new space will seem like the solution, but I am concerned this will not fix staff training or old systems. Hope they figure out a way to improve! Another table behind me just told the server they will leave without their food. Bummer.CR----Been in Rogers Park now for 8 months, and I've decided The Growling Rabbit is my favorite, and not it's not just cause their name is awesome (picture it in your head for fun. right?)  The handmade-chorizo omelette with fresh avocado, green onions, tomato, cheddar: huge and savory and perfect. Baked goods are: well, they're baking them in the back, so awesome. Staff are universally friendly and easy-going. The space isn't big (13 tables? + a counter that runs the width) but feels bigger because of big bright windows on all sides of the corner lot.This place typically hits that nice sweet spot between coffee-shop and cafe: on weekdays, you can easily camp with a laptop (wifi is pretty dependable) and enjoy coffee and a snack, or you can have a lunch-quality meal.They're busy and popular on the weekends which has had them recently switch to table service on Saturdays and Sundays--instead of ordering at the counter you wait to be seated. This has been a little rougher: service can be a little spotty as you feel like the servers who normally work behind the counter don't quite have an efficient system down for a rush. But the great food and warm environment remains, and the Rabbit has earned its place as a regular haunt.

59.description: Finding a coffee joint on my way to a friends house is not the easiest. However, as I was walking I remembered this joint. I stopped in. Got a cup of much needed coffee. It was good.What I really liked was that they had a full menu. Sometimes I forget to eat and today was one of those days. I opted for the Lunt Quesadilla. I had mixed feelings about it. While I thought it was good, whenever a copious amount of caramelized onions were in a bite it got a little too sweet for my liking. But they also gave me avocado. And if you are anything like me, avocado is the greatest things to have added to your plate at any time.

21.description: Little bit of wait but because they make everything from scratch. Worth the wait! Food was delicious and our waiter was very generous. Coming back tomorrow.

17.description: We are new to the area so we are trying out local restaurants when we can. The Growling Rabbit has a cute name, and the menu looked good. I wasn't even deterred by what both the menus and our server said would be a long wait.However, I had the biscuits and gravy, one of my favorite dishes, and it was probably the weirdest thing I've ever eaten. The gravy was green, and the "biscuit" was a ciabatta roll. I DO NOT like ciabatta bread, so that was awful. The green gravy was strange - it did not taste like biscuits and gravy gravy, but it wasn't bad. The flavor would be good if it was what I was expecting, but it was so strange that I really did not enjoy my meal.

10.description: My wife and I were first introduced to The Growling Rabbit when we were in the area looking for apartments.  A property manager recommended them partly for their amazing bacon.  Strange to me that a place so vegan friendly would have such killer bacon, but such is life, full of surprises.  We tried it and, of course, everything was great.  The sandwich I got was tasty and the bacon was crispy and delicious.  Fortunately, we moved into a place pretty close (not the place that gave us the recommendation, sadly), and now we have been coming pretty much weekly.  My wife loves the vegan all day sandwich, and I have gotten a couple breakfast sandwiches (always with bacon), the adult grilled cheese (also with bacon) and the Friday Mac n cheese special (you guessed it...  bacon).  I'm seriously obsessed with the bacon here.  Best I've ever had at a restaurant.  They actually make it crispy when you ask for it that way, which is more than I can say for other, more well known places.The only bad thing I can think of about their food is actually a good thing.  Their desserts are too good.  Not only are they going to make me fat, but they have so many that look good, even to me, the pickiest person ever to go to a restaurant.  I always want to try like 7 every time I come in and neither my wallet nor my stomach could stand that.The service can be a bit show at times, but this is quality food made to order and the staff is somewhat small.  But everyone is friendly and the good more than makes up for the wait.  I love this place and we'll be coming as long as I live here.  Five stars!

5.description: This is a neighborhood gem in East Rogers Park!  The Cuban sandwich was phenominal and to lean that everything is homemade from scratch is a plus.  Great place to grab a quick tasty bite.

3.description: This is a great little place for breakfast. The food is very tasty and presented well. I especially enjoyed my "hangover breakfast" that was so creamy and rich I left half on the plate. The staff is friendly and attentive. Having said all that, the decor needs an overhaul. There is rotting wood around the window, filthy looking footstools as chairs at an isolated window table, and paint rubbed off the table legs. Sometimes a bit of patina makes a place look kitschy, but it does not work here. It looks dirty without actually being dirty. Don't let that deter you if you just want good breakfast.

35.description: Stumbled over this place on our way north. Everything was fresh and made to order.  The roasted potatoes were amazing. Friendly staff and light atmosphere.

19.description: Finding a coffee joint on my way to a friends house is not the easiest. However, as I was walking I remembered this joint. I stopped in. Got a cup of much needed coffee. It was good.What I really liked was that they had a full menu. Sometimes I forget to eat and today was one of those days. I opted for the Lunt Quesadilla. I had mixed feelings about it. While I thought it was good, whenever a copious amount of caramelized onions were in a bite it got a little too sweet for my liking. But they also gave me avocado. And if you are anything like me, avocado is the greatest things to have added to your plate at any time.

28.description: When I left The Growing Rabbit I told the waiter that I had the best sandwich in months. A trukey sandwich with gouda, chuteny and other great toppings. I like a spot to chill, read a book, strike up random conversatons and enjoy a good meal. This is your spot if you're looking for the same thing. As a new father, I also like that this trendy spot has changing tables in the restrooms. Thanks!

45.description: Growling Rabbit has changed its concept and menu in the last couple of months. (Apr 2015). The Rabbit now has a full time waitstaff (Melissa is outstanding) and an excellent brunch menu...Including specials.  My partner and I walk to the restaurant after tennis the last two Sunday's. We  have ordered carnitas skillet and This weekend Bahn-Mi-Wich.  Hoisin glazed house made Asian inspired sausage w pickled carrot, cucumber sliced jalapeños cilantro fried egg and dura ha ailing on a pretzel bun.  Delicious.  Whatever they are doing now is just excellent. (Also I hear they will be expanding to take over the old Morseland building).  The restaurant is sunny and inviting. The perfect stop after spending time at the park.

33.description: I was really happy with the combination of great food and friendly service.  Our server was genuinely interested in our experience there. The food was fresh and cooked perfectly. If you want grease, go to Ihop.  This food makes you feel healthy and not regret it if you eat a little too much.  Make sure you try the cappuccino!  Holy crap it's good!  I'll be coming back often.

43.description: Went on Sunday over Memorial Day weekend. Busy but wait staff made us feel like it was even busier. Definitely seemed frazzled. Bacon quiche w/ quinoa salad was really good! So was veggie burrito. Will return but hope the environment feels more welcome.

2.description: I really like the food here, so my boyfriend and I were very disappointed to go during their regular hours yesterday, only to find that it was closed!  Apparently, they NOW CLOSE AT 3PM, and not at 6pm, like it says on Yelp, their website, and their menus.  There's just a small sign on one of the doors that states their new hours.  SO CALL FIRST!Also, when I repeatedly knocked on the door, the two employees kept talking to each other, rudely ignoring me.  Eventually, one relented, and I was able to point out that even the menus in their windows listed them as being open until 6pm.

18.description: I like the vibe of this place. Not at all pretentious and good food. Met some girlfriends there, we all enjoyed our food, had some left over, and were able to spend a long time chatting and catching up without feeling rushed. I am looking forward to trying it with my family, which has one vegan, one vegetarian, one meat eater, and one toddler. It seems like this menu has something we would all be very happy with. Very sad to hear they are moving down the street and out of the neighborhood, but we will definitely be visiting their Edgewater home.

41.description: Vegan burrito - really goodVegan peanut-butter choc cake - rich and good..Quick service.. good people.. Will see u guys again for sure..

52.description: We go to the Growling Rabbit frequently on Sundays. While it's a little chaotic and they could benefit from a little more organization, it's got a great vibe, good food and they are committed to the neighborhood. Nice to see a place like this deservedly thriving in Rogers Park.

50.description: I live very close to the growling Rabbit and was skeptical at first. I love the character of this place. The food is very, very good! I really like that it is a small place that makes your food to order. It make take a little longer than a chain fast casual, but it is fresh and much tastier. This is a great place for vegetarian/Vegans as well! My husband is a meat eater, I am not, so we like places that really cater to both.Staff is pleasant and attentive. If you want a genuine meal not out of a freezer, this is your place!I would give it 5 stars, but i do think it is a little pricier than I think it should be, but not outrageous.

4.description: Coffee was delicious!! Will walk across the entire city to get some of this stuff.  The atmosphere was very cozy and chill.

6.description: Probably the best breakfast I've had in Chicago in 2015. Ordered an egg white vegetarian omelette. Egg whites were fluffy, veggies were perfectly sautéed, pan fried fresh potatoes garnished with chopped scallions. My sourdough toast was crisp and fresh out of the toaster. It was served with a homemade fruit purée / jam. Ask them for a side of their homemade ketchup. Really outstanding. (You can taste warm spices like cloves and allspice). Bottomless coffee. This place is awesome .

22.description: I want to give this place a higher rating, because the food is generally pretty good and the baked goods are delicious. However, each time I've gotten something with any kind of sauce on it, the food has come out absolutely swimming in it. The bread on the Cuban sandwich was falling apart because there was so much mustard (although the meat on it was very good), and the Hangover Skillet I got this morning was absolutely buried under the red eye gravy - my plate looked like eggs on top of a sea of brown sauce with indistinguishable chunks of meat and potato floating in it. Unless that's your thing, I'd recommend asking for light sauce or sauce on the side here.

15.description: I thought this was a wonderful place for breakfast!! I had the breakfast burrito which was huge and very tasteful and flavorful! The wait for the food was a bit long, about 40 minutes but it was delicious! I will for sure be back!

57.description: It's probably safe to say that I loathe the Growling Rabbit.  This is honestly crazy disappointing to me too because the staff were mostly attentive to my needs and I really love their name!  It's just that everything else really fell short.I went out to the Morse area on a cold weekday morning to get some work done, and was constantly plagued by extremely loud music playing in the background (really, at a coffee shop?!), unsatisfying overpriced food, and extremely creepy or far-too-energetic cackling and crazy customers.  My toast had remnants of some disgusting spread on it that didn't taste of butter (believe me - it was gross; I couldn't even finish a single slice), the scrambled eggs were somewhat bland,  and ironically the potatoes were overly seasoned.  To top it all off, the seats were hard and uncomfortable, and the entrance door doesn't fully close properly so I was constantly greeted by a cold wind of below freezing temperature.  Maybe it was just a series of unfortunate accidental failures and inopportune timing, but after such a dreadful experience it's safe to say I will not be traveling here again.  Even if the commute was 5 minutes away instead of 15 minutes away, I don't think I would go for fear of another disastrous morning.

20.description: Took close to an hour for a grilled cheese. I realize that they only have a six burner stove to work with, but it should not take that long for a simple grilled cheese sandwich.

36.description: Took an hour to get seated and more then a hour to get my food. Got water spilled on me by my waiter. This place is a mess. By the time you get your good you're already mad at the world!

14.description: Little bit of wait but because they make everything from scratch. Worth the wait! Food was delicious and our waiter was very generous. Coming back tomorrow.

12.description: Delicious ceviche in place of salsa... Tasty tacos. Agua Fresca. Excellent service! This place was perfect for our Saturday lunch. They even threw in a free dessert :)

7.description: Fresh seafood, mouth popping flavors in a relaxed atmosphere. This is quite a hidden gem. The coconut shrimp is sweet and light. The tilapia is moist and fill of flavor. This is a must stop if your in Rogers Park.

20.description: Went back this time and ordered fish and shrimp tacos as well as gave their cesina taco a spin. The fish and shrimp tacos are great and generous in size. Cesina's never really been my thing but I'd like to try it at different places just in case it's a difference in recipes - so wouldn't hold this one against them.We figured to give their huarache a try with costillas de res - good taste, but understand it'll be a little more work cuting around the short rib bones.Starters now at the table are a little house ceviche (fish) and crackers which is a refreshing alternative and clearly signals to you that their specialty is in the seafood.Bonus - an all season paleteria opened just north of here one block!

19.description: This is where people go to eat who know Mexican food, they do a lot of takeout. But go there to eat and they will treat you well! I had the breaded chicken torta...soooo good.

1.description: Just finished my first order from El Pulpo Loco. I've passed by this place numerous times but felt an allegiance to my favorite taco place closer to home. What forced my hand today? Lent. I needed fish. I craved octopus. Their ceviche Pulpo was outstanding! Their orange salsa (don't know what it's really called) was incredible. Very flavorful and spicy. This is some good stuff!

2.description: Excellent food, reasonable prices, and friendly service. We had three different ceviches and the whole fried tilapia dinner. We thought the shrimp and octopus ceviches and the tilapia were great, and we didn't care for the white fish ceviche. The restaurant interior was simple and clean. Metered street parking is available.

9.description: What could be a better barometer of a Mexican seafood restaurant than a bowl of fish soup?  Frankly, the Caldo de Pescado ( fish soup) I ordered didn't really taste of fish . Served with  a very healthy portion of catfish, perfectly cooked potatoes and carrots , the tomato broth was very bland.   Even the addition of lime, cilantro, & onion didn't make it memorable.  So, I took it home , added a half cube of Knorr "Caldo de Camaron ( shrimp flavored bouillon), and finished it there.  (At $10.99,a bowl, I wasn't going to throw it out! )   The server was extremely friendly and accommodating. Unfortunately, my soup was not memorable.  I may go back and try a sautéed  or fried menu item, and give it one more chance.

6.description: My fiancé and I saw this place from the road while driving into the city from Evanston last week and decided to stop in and give it a try on a Friday during Lent. We ordered:Calamari Appetizer- OK and a bit forgettable.Combo Ceviche- Easily the standout of the night. Have the mango added when they ask because it is awesome.Fish and shrimp tacos- Both were pretty good, but I preferred the fish to the shrimp.Shrimp al mojo de ajo- Gigantic and really good. There were five large shrimp split open, rice, salsa, lettuce, tomato, and French fries (which were fantastic). It also came with a side of bread or tortillas.We were given a basket of fried tortillas with homemade sauces to start. The bill was about $30 for all of the aforementioned items before tip.The service was ok (I had to usually ask to have my water glass refilled), and the decor is nothing to write home about. However, the food was good, and we are definitely interested in going back!

18.description: Great seafood. Great value. It's also a very cute family business. The waitress was super nice and convinced us to try this new dessert on the house. Not that we needed much convincing. Love it!

10.description: Like some other reviewers, the place the was empty when we got there which gave us pause but happy that we stayed.  I got the the Ceviche Pulpo Tostada (have to get octopus at the crazy octopus, right?) and they did not disappoint.  It was delicious.  Could have been happy with just that.  And for $3.99, can't be beat.  My boyfriend got the, wait for it, cheese stuffed bacon wrapped shrimp.  Needless to say he was very happy.  Horchata for both us.  Just a really enjoyable meal.  Also got a $2 taco to boot and it was reliable.  Would definitely get all these items again.  Will be back for more pulpo.  Wasn't the fastest of service, but the food was good, so it was worth the wait.  Oh, and our server was very friendly.  When we were paying the bill, she asked if we'd ever been there before and when we said no, she sent us home with a gift of flan.

13.description: The place was empty on a Friday night at 6 pm, which is generally not a good sign, so I was a bit skeptical. But, it was close to home and I'd seen some pretty good Yelp reviews. What a hidden gem!  A friend and I started with complimentary homemade fried tortillas and beans. Then, we shared the coconut shrimp which was sweet and crunchy and better than any I've ever tasted! We also shared Bistec a la Mexicana and the steak was tender and flavorful. Each entree came with rice, beans and guacamole. Although we were too full for dessert, the server brought us a complimentary treat -- a bite-sized serving of red jello topped with a creamy rum liquor sauce. By the time we left at about 8 pm, a few more customers had wandered in. Although they've been open for about a year now, I'm betting not too many folks in RP know they're there because if they did, the place would no doubt be packed!

16.description: After reading the reviews, I decided to give it a shot. After sampling few of their dishes I would simply say that the grilled fish and grilled shrimp is a 5 star experience. Everything else is average to good. The service was great and the place wss nice and clean..definitely will be back

17.description: Love the food here!!!! Try the fish tacos, the ceviche mixto, and the 7 mares!!!! Omg try everything they are great!!!!!

15.description: A nice find. Had three tacos, Carnegie Asada, Fish and Cervina (which could be a misspelling). I haven't quite figured out the ritual surrounding the chips and bean dip. But the tacos were super boss, and then some.

0.description: We will be back!!!Wow! I'm not crazy about Mexican food and I'm now crazy about this place. We got the coconut shrimp and the garlic shrimp- delicious. We split both. The rice is so full of flavor. Sauces are also delicious. Staff is friendly.

5.description: Excellent food! Large portions and wonderful family service.  Enjoyed coconut shrimp, steak tacos and enchiladas.  Everything was delicious.

11.description: It was good.  Empty the whole time we were there, but the tacos were good and the ceviche was delicious!  Worth a go!

8.description: Terrific food- free ceviche is delicious.  The tilapia was delicious and perfectly cooked.  Great service in English or Spanish.  A sweet little family place, soccer on TV and kids playing in the corner.  Horchata and tamarind drinks tasty and not too sweet or watery.  Generous portions.  Will definitely be back!

3.description: We first tried this place during a taco crawl. We were so impressed we came back. It's got awesome fresh food. The shrimp tacos are amazing and do not have that nasty frozen taste in them. The calamari is great and cooked just right. It is well worth the trek to get here. As taco Mexican restaurants abound in the neighborhood,  they truly set apart themselves with amazing fresh tastes that burst on the tongue in amazing ways. Great prices that are very reasonable and friendly staff. They have good horchata!

14.description: Excellent fresh and flavorful. Very nice server. I loved the Sopa de Pezcado. Clean and bright. Of course mexican and Latin music in the background. A very present surprise right I my second neighborhood

4.description: I love this place!  The food is great and the service is too!There are many tacquerias to choose from on this block but El Pulpo Loco is the one to visit!

58.description: Dependable and delicious. Authentic? Perhaps not, but the food quality is high and everything we've tried tastes delicious. The staff is always friendly and they've never screwed up an order. Glad to have them in the neighborhood.

56.description: The staff is friendly and efficient and the veggie burritos are always up to par.  I have to go out of my way to avoid passing by it so I won't buy a burrito every day!

29.description: Horrible customer service. Employees rush customers through the line for no reason. Asked employee politely to SLOW DOWN and communicate with us and she gave us major attitude. Never returning to this location.

42.description: I really love Chipotle. When I lived in MN I would go there at least twice a week. This location, however leaves something to be desired. First off, the rice here is weird. It is consistently just a little bit mushy compared to the rice at other Chipotles I've been to. Second, I have yet to have a burrito wrapped here that did not have either a big tear in it, or be wrapped in such a way that it falls apart when you eat it. Now normally I chock this up to the person wrapping the burrito being new, or just one out of every 10 burritos falls apart or something, but I have been to this location at least 10 times, and if my husband and I both order a burrito, they will both have holes in them or not be wrapped properly . This location is really close to where I live, and I love being able to walk there, however after getting yet another burrito with a big hole in it yesterday, it might be worth the drive out to the burbs to get my chipotle from now on.

23.description: The food is great but the customer service for on-line orders at this location is terrible. It's a broke down Chipotle. They keep messing up my on-line orders, most recently twice this month. They either forget to put in the brown rice or black beans. On other occasion they had my salad in the oven waiting for me to pick it up, it was baked and the lettuce turned to mush. One other time, when I went to pick up my order, they kept giving me someone else's order twice, I have written corporate about this but they have not improved. In my experience there 's a careless attitude in getting the on-line orders right, even when I am waiting and I ask them to please make sure it's right.

47.description: good stuff

8.description: Worst chipotle ever. Never prepared for lunch hours - constantly run out of meats especially chicken, skimpy portions, and service with an attitude. I won't come back.

31.description: I like Chipotle. I like Chipotle a lot. It's not a "Mexican Grill" and it's not really authentic ANYTHING but it sure is delicious.This location is great. It's clean, it's reliable, they don't make me order a burrito before I use their restroom. The staff is nice.I like that this location offers the brown rice option, and the burrito bowls here often get HUGGGE. Sometimes I order a burrito bowl and then just supply my own tortilla at home because it seems that I get about 30% more fillings that way.Meat here is generally kept pretty fresh.

34.description: I love Chipotle. The food, the consciously-sourced ingredients, the general atmosphere. But, this location is not so great. I guess it's most likely due to the throngs of Loyola students flowing through here, but it seems like the staff is phoning it in, big time. Also, twice we've had the same cashier, a mountain of a girl, who has been pre-occupied throughout the transaction bs-ing with other employees. One time, I asked for one fountain drink and due to her distraction, gave us two. I politely told her that I had just asked for one. She looked at me and goes: "uuuh, well, I rang in two," as if to say "come on, don't be a dick and make me void the soda, just pay for it." Needless to say, I once again asserted that I only wanted one, and she called the manager over. The problem was solved, it really wasn't a big deal, it's just after having great experiences at just about every other Chipotle I've ever been to, this one is a weak link in the brand. I know, I know, first world problems like a MF-er. No worries, I'll still cram their burritos in my suck-hole.

16.description: The food is great but the customer service for on-line orders at this location is terrible. It's a broke down Chipotle. They keep messing up my on-line orders, most recently twice this month. They either forget to put in the brown rice or black beans. On other occasion they had my salad in the oven waiting for me to pick it up, it was baked and the lettuce turned to mush. One other time, when I went to pick up my order, they kept giving me someone else's order twice, I have written corporate about this but they have not improved. In my experience there 's a careless attitude in getting the on-line orders right, even when I am waiting and I ask them to please make sure it's right.

13.description: The food was not good. The Tacos were not crunchy, the meet looked iffy. Very disappointing since I live quite close. Both my husband and I got upset stomachs after eating there, will not be going there again.

11.description: This is probably the most inconsistent chipotle ever!! First they have a sign that says there is an outage there chicken they normal use!! Like how is that even possible... Then I had to repeat my self 5 times on what I wanted on my burrito bowl! If the staff member wasn't so involved in a convo with her co worker she would have probably would have better customer service.  Then I turn around with my order and the dinning room was soo dirty, cups laying around and tables dirty as ever.  At this point I just wanted to grab a fork and leave!! But guess what there was NO FORKS!!!! Don't even get me started on how long it took to get me that one fork! Ugh behind disappointing!!! Sucky part is I love so close to this location and I rather just go to the taco place next to my house instead.

39.description: You don't go to Chipotle looking for Mexican food, you go to Chipotle looking for Chipotle!  One of my favorite fast food "Mexican" chains, and this one in Rogers Park is definitely the best! The staff is always super friendly and they move quick so the wait is never terribly long (unless of course it is 12pm and all the Loyola students have decided to go there for lunch).  The quality of the food is so fresh and their guacamole is aboslutely delicious!

37.description: Chipotle is good in a pinch...is it some place I would reccomend for authentic mexican food...probably not...but I like the idea that the food is fresh! The reason I give 2 stars for this location...there were several items that had run out. And, I had to ask for extra items to compensate for other things...but they begrudginly give it to you...smh! Will I ever visit again...if I need something in a pinch the chicken bowl is good...I will say this I love chipotles guacamole and chips...but this location...the serving tray must not have been the right temp because the guac was turning brown...how do they just let that ride? They could easily be a 3 or even 3.5 stars if they got it together.

0.description: This location keeps the standards of the Chipotle brand. The location is in a good spot, next to the Red Line El train stop at Loyola. Lots of college kids eat there. On good weather, the outdoor seating is fun.

38.description: I lost my Chipotle virginity when I was 19.  It was a sweet moment, that burrito and I.  When we met, it was spicy and delicious love-at-first-sight.  Barbocoa, was her name.  She left her taste on my lips-- I reminisce of our time together, peppery tears in my eye.I hope we meet again.  And. *sigh* I know we will.

51.description: Worst service!!!  Food under-cooked, overcooked, they don't care.  Pile on the rice, cheat you on the guac, pack everything at one end of the burrito or the other,  tear the tortilla up, put the wrong ingredients on as your telling them what you want, walk away from the first and last stations and just leave everyone standing there,and of course, they can't move the customers through, so the line is out the door even when they aren't busy.

27.description: Love this Chipotle! It's a block from the beach, which means it's great for picnics. The staff is super efficient even though the lines tend to stretch - it's a popular location for Loyola University students.

32.description: When I worked downtown Chicago there was a Chipotle across the street.  It was always packed.  Luckily Chipotle has an app where you can order online or you can go to the website.  It saved twenty minutes waiting in line.  Five StarsI now go to the Chipotle at Loyola.  The space is large to handle the university and the lunch crowd from the neighborhood.  Five StarsI am GF and Chipotle is my good to place for quick eats.  I love the fact I can order items that are GF without all the hassle.  Five Stars.I know the food is really American Mexican, but it is good and it is reasonable for the price.  I definitely like it better than most of my fast food choices.  Three stars

54.description: damn you MCDONALD'S how the hell did you get the Barbacoa SO RIGHT?!?!? You only flaw is you use flour tortilla's hate to admit that the barbacoa is always on point! when I'm heading home I get the taco special and then go home and put them on corn tortillas so much tastier that way.

48.description: your typical chipotle except they serve alcohol on occasion.

44.description: Great service. Always fresh. Love the food. Can't do wrong. Outside seating is great for people watching! Always offers LUC discounts when school is in sesh.

24.description: The first time I went to a Chipotle (years ago) I was impressed they had carnitas...it gave it a little authentic taco restaurant street cred and I respected the fact that a corporate fast-food restaurant didn't just have chicken or beef options. You know what you're getting with Chipotle, which is the point. Small, manageable menu, speedy service, adequate food. It gets the job done when the hunger sets in.Of course living in such a culinary and ethnically diverse city as Chicago, it's difficult to give Chipotle more than 3 stars, because there are so many more deserving taquerias that are better and cheaper. Chipotle is an average taco restaurant and as far as corporate chains goes, it's a solid choice and you know what you're getting.

7.description: Try to think of the times this place might be busy: lunch and dinner time. I recommend you save yourself time and order your food on your phone. [Maybe save yourself and everyone else in line time by placing your huge office orders via fax, online, or by phone.] HOWEVER that won't guarantee your order will be correct. I once had to return a burrito because an employee added sour cream which completely ruined my burrito. To be fair it was ONE screw up vs the 10 (or 20.....) other times I've eaten here.While this location is further from my place (vs the Berwyn location) I would rather come here because it seems like the food is more seasoned vs the Broadway & Berwyn/Foster location.

49.description: I am writing this review from the perspective of someone who has been to a few Chipotles in his day. This one is larger (probably due to Loyola), but it seems this place gets backed up and slower than many of its contemporaries. Also, the downside of having to ask for a bathroom key like its a BP on the southside is a bit demeaning. I dont want to admit to anyone behind the counter that nature is calling thank you. I have a better idea, kick out the riff raff if you think they are there just causing trouble. If not, let them pee.

40.description: This review is not so much for the food but for the way it's prepared. I think Chipotle has decent food and I applaud their use of natural ingredients.However, I'm not sure if it is systemic but this particular location is SO STINGY! They put half a spoon of your salsa and guacamole and even when you just get chips and guacamole they have the nerve to scoop out a little guacamole so it's not even full. Stop short changing us!

53.description: Best fast food place in Rogers Park. Staff is always freindly and I always get more food for my money. Plus it's all organic meats and grass feed! Love it:)

30.description: Fast service, great food (if limited in options). I like the new additions to the menu, such as the quesadillas and the possibility of having beer. My kids love the burrito bowls  --- it's good for the whole family at a very reasonable price. Plus it's pretty healthy.

46.description: I had the burrito bowl. it was tasty and very filling - even for a big guy like me ! the service was fine, the restaurant was clean.

1.description: I have been a regular face to this chipotle as I live in the neighborhood.They have hired new employees &ever since I have noticed the customer service has drastically plummeted. The cashier for one, a mixed looking girl with black curly hair, ran out of the store in the middle of a line making customers wait . This was around closing 9:45 (the reason I am not sure I think to flag down a customer for a lost item or incorrect order) and came back to the cashier without apologizing or cleaning her hands! .  Not all but a majority of the new faces who work the line look nervous and the happiness from the ones who don't work the line with a blank face and an occasional forced smile doesn't seem genuine. Food wise no complaints .apparently They ran out of black beans for the day when I got there and also brown rice. I do realize it was close to closing and they wanted to get ready to close up and go home but lack of preparation to the ones working the grill. By now you should already know customers will still be coming in ordering those main items until 9:59. **Went back today (2/18/16) and the experience went from bad to worse. I walk in with only two people getting served on the sauce side of the line about to check out. The cashier I previously mentioned was now working the line. This time she straightened her hair. Go figure. I was not greeted when I walked in (there was no one behind me at that particular moment it was semi-slow) instead eye contact was avoided however she smiled and engaged in brief conversation with the other two customers who were together as if she didn't see me standing there. She then *very slowly* without a sanitizing rag cleans a very small spot of sour cream on the sauce side. By this time another customer walks in behind me and she gives me the one moment finger signal and she decides at that particular moment she needed to take off her gloves and wash her hands. Really. She did nothing but remove a small drop of sour cream on the line with a chipotle napkin and toss it into the trash next to her .Her gloves were clean as day. However she felt the need to wash her hands (That should've been done the day she noticeably stormed out of the store) . Anyways to make a long story short Im standing at the line waiting to get served as two more customers begin to come in after me. This girl has taken over 2 minutes of my time and then adds to it by SLOWLY washing her hands as if enjoying the fact she's making me wait and letting me know she doesn't want to serve me. At this point there's only her and another cashier on the line and someone from the grill notices people waiting on her to finish so they get another employee to take my order instead. (The girl is still washing her hands) and as the person serving me gets to the sauce side the rude a$$ finally gets back on the line and happily serves the next customer with a smile. *That is extremely petty behavior* I was so turned off I almost lost my appetite. I come here to eat not deal with attitude and self righteousness. Make my burrito or find another job. I have a feeling because I wrote a review a few days ago she put two and two together and since I'm a fairly attractive woman and me and my boyfriend have eaten here before (she flirted with my boyfriend the entire time of serving him) I was treated with less than expected customer service. That is not what a restauranteur should be. I have never in my life left out of a chipotle unhappy until today. I will not recommend any of my friends to continue going to this one and will be taking my business to the chipotle downtown on state and Jackson where they can teach neighboring chipotles like this one and this particular employee in particular a thing or two about GENUINE customer service!

55.description: Thankfully there is a Chipotle in my new neighborhood! And the food is consistent with what I ate in Northern California. The staff is not as cheerful as what I am used to, but that is a social aspect of Chicago. The hot sauce rocks and I will be a regular over the next 3 or so years before returning to N. CA.

9.description: The first time I went to a Chipotle (years ago) I was impressed they had carnitas...it gave it a little authentic taco restaurant street cred and I respected the fact that a corporate fast-food restaurant didn't just have chicken or beef options. You know what you're getting with Chipotle, which is the point. Small, manageable menu, speedy service, adequate food. It gets the job done when the hunger sets in.Of course living in such a culinary and ethnically diverse city as Chicago, it's difficult to give Chipotle more than 3 stars, because there are so many more deserving taquerias that are better and cheaper. Chipotle is an average taco restaurant and as far as corporate chains goes, it's a solid choice and you know what you're getting.

26.description: My husband and I eat here every Friday night. Every single employee I have always encountered has been friendly and helpful. Great customer service!!!

25.description: Horrible customer service they even refused to cut my burrito in half told me to use the plastic knife by the napkins that tore my burrito and practically made it into a burrito bowl smh

12.description: Skimpy on guacamole. The employees give about half a serving of guacamole here. They purposefully only scoop up a half serving and barely dab it onto your bowl.
