I don't know why they do that. It pisses me off so much. Just give a FAIR SERVING OF GUACAMOLE! We know it's extra... So give us the correct amount!!!! Jeez, they wanted to charge me for ANOTHER serving of guacamole for a little extra dab from scooper that they did not put on my bowl when they should've. The quality of food at this location is very good! However, the workers are incredibly slow. Most of them don't speak English very well and you have to repeat yourself 2-3 times and almost yell because they don't get what "sofritas" or "no cheese" means. Sometimes they run out of forks at this location. There's usually lemons in stock for the water but not always. If they hired more workers they'd do much better, especially if they spoke English.

59.description: Yes, my favorite "Mexican" joint is a chain.  I might lose my Foodie Card for that, but so be it.  I can't help it, the food is just soo good!I also like choosing exactly what I want in my huge burrito.  I usually get the carnitas (pork) with salsa verde, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole. (even though the guac is extra, it's really good)I even like the decor and the music, and the place is bright and clean.

21.description: I love chipotle and I place online orders all the time..... They get it right about 50% of the time. Frustrating! I don't want to be "that person" who opens everything and checks it before we leave the restaurant... Especially at 9 months pregnant, I have to send my poor boyfriend back to get whatever they forgot (usually Guac that I pay extra for).. C'mon guys... It's all spelled out exactly what the order is.. Upside is the people are usually nice. :)

17.description: I like Chipotle. I like Chipotle a lot. It's not a "Mexican Grill" and it's not really authentic ANYTHING but it sure is delicious.This location is great. It's clean, it's reliable, they don't make me order a burrito before I use their restroom. The staff is nice.I like that this location offers the brown rice option, and the burrito bowls here often get HUGGGE. Sometimes I order a burrito bowl and then just supply my own tortilla at home because it seems that I get about 30% more fillings that way.Meat here is generally kept pretty fresh.

10.description: I am a Chipotle burrito addict. I live two blocks away which is bad for my health because I honestly come to this location at least once a week, if not twice. Sometimes the line gets a little long but its understandable given the Loyola location and time of day you go. However, I have always received good service and the food has always been on point. The baby bags of chips are always stuffed; I've been to other locations where there's literally been like 6 chips in it. My burritos are always wrapped nicely too. I love Chipotle!

5.description: Sometimes you just need a Burrito Bowl from Chipotle!!! I usually prefer the Steak with brown rice, black beans, corn, veggies, and guacamole. Overall the food is pretty consistent & fresh. I really like their guacamole. But, sometimes I take out from here, and I have to microwave everything for a minute - because it's already gone cold (and I only live a couple blocks from this spot)! So, maybe keep the food hotter??The best thing is that it's relatively healthy, yummy & they're open till 10pm!! You can't really beat that.....and....I know I really shouldn't be eating dinner at 10pm (sad face)....Usually, the service is pretty fast and friendly - but sometimes I see an employee who is obviously not happy, and I've seen some employees snip at each other. Not really what you want to see when you're grabbing chips & salsa - if ya know what I mean.Overall, it's not the best food in Chicago, but once in a while it's just what I need.

3.description: Meh. Average service. Decent food. I had to wait 10 minutes for brown rice the last time I was there. The line grew extremely long (as to be expected) and there were no apologies. It's a chain so you get what you get.

35.description: I ate here so many times as a Loyola student, and not only was the food delicious, but served up fast and by friendly employees. The burritos are my favorite thing to get here.

19.description: When I worked downtown Chicago there was a Chipotle across the street.  It was always packed.  Luckily Chipotle has an app where you can order online or you can go to the website.  It saved twenty minutes waiting in line.  Five StarsI now go to the Chipotle at Loyola.  The space is large to handle the university and the lunch crowd from the neighborhood.  Five StarsI am GF and Chipotle is my good to place for quick eats.  I love the fact I can order items that are GF without all the hassle.  Five Stars.I know the food is really American Mexican, but it is good and it is reasonable for the price.  I definitely like it better than most of my fast food choices.  Three stars

28.description: They skimp out on the ingredients often. I always have to tell them to put more. Today, they forgot to put beans in my bowl. And I ordered veggies, and she put in like 3 pieces and handed it down before I had a chance to say I want more. Literally 3 pieces.

45.description: Dear Chipotle,I love you.  That is all.  PS:  No QDoba is not better than you.  PPS:  Eating your burrito bowl like nachos is my heaven and I will be your witness.

33.description: So, this is a Chipotle. The food is fine and the cost is a-ok. It's the best of the fake Mexican fast food. That being said, some days, you're just going to want Chipotle and this a fine location. Lots of college kids, but the service is always friendly and speedy, even with a long line.

43.description: Burrito bowl is the BEST !  very filling very tasty !

2.description: Yuk...... it is as bad as it sounds, McDonald's Mexican food!!!!  OK, better than Taco HELL, but it is not Mexican food.

18.description: I'm a regular customer here at this location. The food is usually pretty great compared to other ones I have been too in Chicago. They are usually pretty fast unless they have someone new or something. They do have very long lines at times but reasonable considering this is located on the Loyola campus basically.

41.description: Barbacoa burrito bowl, baby!

52.description: Eco packaging and filling customizeable meals keep me coming back to this chipotle. Basically the only outside seating for a restaurant for blocks north and south on Sheridan. Chips are pretty good, but the lines are so long and the wait is nearly unbearable. Usually crowded as students flock here due to the lack of campus food options. The downtown chipotles handle this much traffic much more efficiently.The food is good and most of the staff are very nice in spite of the pressure the line must cause them so they deserve to be tipped. Sodas are good with free lemon slices.

50.description: Fast food that isn't too unhealthy, too expensive, and the line is usually short.  And, it is less than a block from my condo.  Win!

4.description: The quality of the food is inconsistent. Sometimes I've gotten rice that wasn't cooked long enough. I love chipotle but the service here is so slow and inefficient. Probably the worst chipotle I've ever been

6.description: Middle of the road for quality and service. Next to Loyola University, so expect an epic wait during peak dining hours. Overall, one of the city's better locations.

22.description: Teacher's Appreciation lunch totally ruined. My school bought lunches for our staff today. This restaurant took 128 individual lunch orders and filled 48 orders too late for us to eat and then made arrangements for the Lincoln Ave store to fill the rest and they totally lost the order. Teachers had no lunch. Thank God Pete's Pizza could step in but it was after our lunch breaks. Everyone scrambled. Lucky for me I had a break until 2 30,  being that the last place I  would ever frequent would be Chipotles, I drove to Mariano's on Lawrence and Ravenswood. Wow! Oyster bar special is fabulous. Ten dollars for three fresh oysters, three jumbo cocktail shrimp, two crab claws, a bowl of either clam chowder or lobster bisque. The waiter counter guy who waited on me has been chosen for the Fox show Master Chef. He will be on the Fox Morning Show Monday Memorial Day plugging the upcoming season. Wonderful experience today. Thanks to the total disregard for customer service from Chipotles I found a great place for lunch. If you want to frequent a restaurant that has no regard for their customers go to Chipotles, if you want a fun interesting experience check out Oyster Bar at Ravenswood Mariano's and meet a possible future Master Chef. You make the choice. Pretty easy one if you ask me!

15.description: I just came in around 11:10 am with my girlfriend to grab a quick bite to eat. Immediately I felt rushed by the young lady taking our order. There were five of us in line in total, yet I felt she was being very pushy and rushing us through the line. She used a very intimidating tone, and I felt I should just apologize. Honestly I love the food but I really wanted to just walk out. Three stars are based on service only.

57.description: While I express extreme regret that in the act of writing a review for this place I am, in effect, also admitting to the world that I have consumed food from a Chipotle, and therefore risk losing all of my cred, I have only rely on the feint hope that by giving it a shit review, I can expect to maintain some shred of dignity.Look, it's a chain restaurant, and chain restaurants--on average--totally suck and are not to be attended without extreme need.  Well, every once in a while one's threshold for "extreme need" drops perilously low to be equivalent with what might otherwise be considered "mild hunger" combined with "a strong desire to avoid meal preparation."I gave up on the burrito form of food delivery long ago, but if you hook up the burrito bowl and a bag of chips, then dip said chips into the contents of the burrito bowl, alternating with hot salsa, well, you don't do too bad.Until the next morning when you completely regret your decision.I still puzzle over why I have eaten here the handful of times that it has actually occurred.  I could have obtained more legitimate Mexican food offerings from many establishments roughly in this same neighborhood for not only less green, but also for fewer units of my soul.  Capitalism kills.But, uh, anyway, yeah. Guilty as charged.  And I wish it weren't so. I also wish Chipotlaway (see South Park) was a real product.

20.description: I waited in line for what felt like days. Not sure why service was so slow, especially because when I got my burrito home to eat it there was no meat on it. I mean service should be lightning fast if you take that step out?So thank you for taking 30 minutes of my life, 9 of my dollars, and sending me home with a tasteless, meatless, burrito.

36.description: After hearing friends rave about this place all year, I finally found myself across the street from one just in time for dinner. The line was long--a good sign, and it moved quickly. I ordered pork tacos with a side of chips and guacamole. It was reasonably priced, quick, and perfectly portioned. The tacos were marvelous, flavorful, and fresh-tasting. The best part was the corn flour tortillas by far--so much better than flour! The guacamole was ok, a bit too smooth for my taste, and it could have used more lime juice. Altogether a pleasant experience, I look forward to returning for a legendary burrito.

14.description: Chipotle should be pretty standard but this location is one of the most inconsistent one I've experienced.  I live only a block away so this location is an obvious choice for me.  Unfortunately, sometimes the meat tastes bland, like it wasn't marinated properly, and other times the beans and/or rice and/or fajita veggies are extremely watery.  Nowadays I tell the server to drain the water if I see it.Another issue is that this location seems to give smaller portions.  Not sure why, but it may have something to do with it being extremely busy during lunch and dinner hours due to the influx of Loyola students.  However, I've been to even busier locations before and they still provided a lot of food.The service is also slower than what I'm used to.  The workers aren't as fast as the ones from many other Chipotles, especially the one on Madison in the Loop where I go to for lunch when I work.  That Madison location is much more consistent with how the food tastes and the speed of service.Despite the downsides of this location, I still go there quite often because it's close, cheap, and pretty good.  Just wish it was more consistent and the service was a little faster.

58.description: Rogers Park is lucky to have the 400, friendly staff, good popcorn, ticket prices are reasonable, that's what you get with a family run business.

56.description: This is great theater for a myriad of reasons: - Convenient location... walking distance to Red Line stop, Loyola- Inexpensive (savings so you can go see more movies!) - Bar has specials and snack counter is efficient- Small, cozy theatre - Associates are friendly - CUPHOLDERS in the back of the seats in FRONT of me, so as not to take up any of my elbow room!!!!!! Love that! =D  Is it an older theater? Yes. But at the end of the day, I like to keep my wallet fat and catch a good flick in one fell swoop. New 400 allows me to get the best of both worlds.

29.description: Am I missing something, where is the "New and Improved" theatre???  We sat in theatre #3.  There was a big gaping hole in the ceiling, the screen is small and dull and the seats are lumpy although they were recovered.  Guess that must have been the new part!  To top it off 3 different people actually turned their cellphones on during the movie - WHAT?!?!  I knew it was a bad sign when we got there and saw they only had one person selling tickets and the line was almost to the end of the block.  It's a Friday night, seems they should have been better prepared.Kudos to all the people that work there, they were all very nice and the popcorn was great but they could not make up for the rest of the experience.I was really hoping to love this theatre but sad to say this will be my First and LAST time here.

42.description: The theaters are pretty beat up even for $8.50 a night showing and freeeeezing. It was cold out but I left with numb feet.

23.description: Super great prices for students, which is great since I go to Loyola and live in the area. I love supporting local businesses, so it's awesome to be able to frequent 400 so often.They're usually very up to date, but I guess I'm very used to theaters with more than 4 screens. Options are pretty limited, and it usually is a week or 2 before any movie changes. Movie times rarely go past 9 or 9:30pm, so a late night movie is rarely an option.Overall, a clean and friendly atmosphere. I love being able to be in such a historic old movie palace because 400 still has that vibe.Snacks and bar are pretty well prices, and they run specials for deals on drinks, which I always make sure to keep updated on.I also really love their popcorn and movie special events, where fliers are posted around the Rogers Park area.

47.description: Love being able to have a drink while watching a movie! Theaters are old, but prices are great and much more reasonable then big chain theaters.

8.description: This is an awesome little theater! I go here often and the service is always wonderful. There is a full bar, with specials and tickets are always cheap. The theaters are being remodeled and the new seats are really nice. They also do fun events from time to time. My husband and I went to their event for opening night of Star Wars and it was a lot of fun, with trivia, prizes, and themed cocktails.

31.description: I love this movie theater! It's more my style than your average AMC movie theater. Yes, the ground is sticky. Yes the seats are old but that doesn't take away from the friendliness of their staff and their drink specials! I always get their groupons, such a good deal! This is a gem to the rogers park neighbourhood. For me, I prefer to give my money to the smaller businessman so I will always come here for my movie fix. Popcorn and candy is reasonable as well. Parking sucks but that's okay. Another plus is they always show the best mainstream movies out at the time. Not the best choice if you're looking to see more independent films. Check it out you won't be disappointed as long as you're not looking for AMC quality!

34.description: I like having a movie theater in our neighborhood, but every time I go, I am greeted by someone who could care less about their job. I went last night to see a movie with a Groupon pass, and as told I wasn't able to see the movie because it was opening weekend. I reminded him that it wasn't opening weekend for the movie, and it was also a Monday. He then came at me with 'YEAH IT IS' and then his co-worker politely insisted, that no this movie had in fact opened two weeks ago. He then just sighed and said ' I was just kidding!' So, movies are great, location is great. Employees really bum me out.

16.description: Love this place. One of my favorite places in Rogers Park. Still go up there when I want to see a movie.

13.description: Held the 5th Annual Chicago Comedy Film Festival here November 2015 and will be back in 2016! Great weekend packed with great movies!

11.description: Be sure to come to the 5th Annual Chicago Comedy Film Fest now in Rogers Park. We're so happy to be part of the community and bringing international film up "north". Tickets here- eventbrite.com/o/chicago…

39.description: This is a great little local theater that's a great option for those who are looking to see the latest movies but not wanting to pay a premium. The theater seems to only show 4 or so movies at a time and the auditoriums are quite small compared to your typical AMC or Regal, but the price is $8.50, or $7.50 with a student ID. As long as you don't come expecting a super cushy theater, you'll have a nice and cozy experience.With a Yelp Check-In, you even get a free drink - and that includes alcoholic beverages!

37.description: What an adorable theater! It's a little run down, but the staff was friendly and the prices are pretty good (they have a groupon!). I'll definitely be back here.

0.description: A small neighborhood theater where we love to see the latest movies. It's not the cleanest but the staff is always friendly, the popcorn fresher than most places, and it has a small bar for the adults....  They show a good balance of movies so families can see the latest family friendly movie while the adults can watch the latest thrillers...  They also have special viewings throughout the year.

38.description: Went to watch Kingsman here on a Monday night. The interior looks a bit dingy and the rooms/screens are fairly small, but tickets are inexpensive and the staff is very friendly. The sound quality during the movie is great and the theater is dark enough that it's easy to forget how small it is when actually watching the movie. Overall this was a great experience and I'd definitely come here again.

51.description: I usually write good reviews but they make it kind of hard... Sorry guys. The people that work here are obviously underpaid or they wouldn't have such shitty attitudes. Thank god for dim lights or we might actually see what's crawling around in here. Sticky floors?! No excuse for it. Yes it's great because it's cheap but honestly I would rather pay $10 more to go to a nicer theatre  I hope they put a little effort into this place. Even if they have to charge a tad more they could make it an enjoyable place to go. Will update post if I see any changes but it seems as though the owner doesn't give a flying $&@$ about the place.Oh and you might want to call to see if the online show times are correct. I walked 2 miles to get there and they locked the doors 15minutes before the movie was posted to start. All they could say through the glass was that the movie started 30 minutes ago...

27.description: Small theater, and peaceful area. They even sell alcohol, omg! This is like the first, and probably only theater, that I have seen that sells alcohol. If you're in the Rogers Park/Edgewater area, and want to catch a movie, stop in!

32.description: PRICES: Are you kidding? In a world where you're easily looking at up to $13 per ticket, their prices are welcoming. They offer $1 off evening shows for students with a valid student ID. Bar prices aren't too shabby, either. Don't for get to Belly up if you have a card.VENUE: Small. Kind of tattered. Depending on what's playing, sometimes sound bleeds over from the neighboring theater. Honestly, the first movie I saw after the Aurora shooting was at this theater, and for a split second, I might have felt claustrophobia for the first time ever. I do appreciate that they have a bar. I got spoiled in San Antonio with the Alamo Drafthouse. They run 3D movies like everybody else, so that's usually an option for releases that also have 3D versions.LOCATION: It's great to have a theater so close to where I live. Seriously. It's my go-to movie theater. OVERALL: There would have to be a compelling reason for me to go elsewhere for movies. It's a small, local movie house, not a big, stadium seating, theater with IMAX and neon lights all over the place. I'm happy to see superhero movies in this theater, just as much as I am to see a comedy here. They'll not lose me as a patron anytime soon. Even though I rated it three stars (just an objective rating), I love it there. The stars aren't as much for me as they are for those of you deciding whether or not you want to go there. If you want to choose from a dozen movies when you walk through the door, this probably isn't for you. If you want reasonably priced entry and drinks while you take in a movie, this is the place.

54.description: This is Rogers Park little treasure.  The place is clean, people are decent and the people who works here are nice. They have a bar but the popcorn is so-so. Best movie theater around and super close to CTA.

48.description: A great little neighborhood theater for an amazing price!  I highly recommend going for the matinee- only $5!  Can't beat that anywhere except for the corner bootleg guy!Update: Their drink specials are a bait and switch.

44.description: Service: 5 stars.Concessions: 5 stars.So why is my rating just 3 stars? Only because the theater screens are so small. For me, part of going to the movies is the experience of the big screen. Still, I see a movie here almost every time I'm in Chicago, so I'm not complaining. I just don't want you, dear reader, to think this is going to be the perfect movie viewing experience.

24.description: It's not the best or most comfortable sitting and it's pretty small but it is also very affordable, you can't go wrong with that. They got booze and they got popcorn. What else do you want?  I think I have been here over 10 times in the last two years.

7.description: Everytime I visit the New 400 Theater I Love it more and more!I love that when I enter the staff knows me now, I love that I can geta great tasting medium bag of buttered popcorn for $3.75 too!And of Course, with Yelp Check -In a free medium soft drink or welldrink, and honestly my days of drinking well drinks are pretty much overso I always opt for a Diet Coke!But what I loved the most this past Thursday was I went to see St. Vincentwith Melissa McCarthy and Bill Murray, and yes, I am sentimental and Istarted to cry during a certain scene, and 2 rows in front of me there wasa woman sitting there crying at the same scene I was..After the movie ended as I went to the lobby I met the lady who was crying2 rows ahead of me, and she turned out to be a customer I had previously metat Jewel, and we both laughed about how we were crying during the same scene.So, for myself, people who complain about sticky floors, non-reclining seatsor old looking bathrooms you need to go elsewhere, because this little theaterhas been here for quite some time with good reason.Because it's a neighborhood place where everybody knows your name...

49.description: Honestly the best theater in chicago. Cheap drinks, cheap tickets, and amazing atmosphere.  What more could you want!

40.description: I like love this movie theater, it's great to have a place near by to see movies without the outrages movie and concession prices and you can get a cocktail type beverage if you want too boot, I'm a huge fan of The New 400!!

53.description: We decided to go here to watch Oujia...that was mistake #1. I had been here before they added the "new" to their name. Good news is the tickets were cheap, there is a bar, and it was not super packed. The bad news is that this place still seems to be run by a frat house, the concessions are similar to what you would find at a carnival, and the patrons seem to love talking during the movie. I witnessed an old woman confront some younger teenage girls who were talking almost throw down and fight...not what I had been hoping to see that night. I do not suggest coming here for a movie you really want to see badly.

30.description: I went last night with my family to see a kid's movie (inside out) it was packed which was expected my kids were excited to finally see this movie but when I got to the beginning of this long line I was told my youngest could not go to see the movie (18 months) I explained to them that's I have two other adults to take him out if he gets fussy and he was sleeping I was so disappointed but not as bad as my childrenI will never go in this establishment again not even to see a movie for myself if my kids are not welcome than I will take my money else where

46.description: This isn't a fancy schmancy movie theater, but it's cheap, and, more importantly, it has  a bar. The beer selection is surprisingly good, their mixed drinks are strong, and their wine selection...exists. They usually have cute drink specials that are thematically linked to a movie they're screening. While they may not be "the best bar in Chicago" (a claim they confusingly posted on their billboard last year), it's neat to have a neighborhood place where you can go to a movie and drink a beer. They only have the capacity to stream four movies at a time, and, for that reason, I wish they would be more selective with the movies they choose. From Happy Feet 6 to Ice Age 14 to Fast & Furious 27, this theater will pick up any dumb sequel that Hollywood releases. I know this is a pipe dream, but it would be wonderful if the New 400 showed some indie movies, foreign movies, or cult classics...or even went one week without having some lame-o sequel in it's line-up.

1.description: Is there such thing as a "dive theater"? I'd consider this one... Tiny little theaters (30-40 seats max), full bar, no problem with crowds or that one guy/girl in the front who seems to think their phone won't bother anyone during the movie. As an independent theater, I gotta give them props for keeping the place running.Unfortunately, props only go so far. The two biggest distractions to my movie going experience were the fire exit signs were bright white in a dark theater. Since I was watching The Force Awakens, any scene with a dark background suddenly had a bright spot in the bottom right. I get fire code, but man, I wish you could spend just $40-$50 per theater to get those less-intrusive edge-lit signs (instead of backlit). You'd literally make up the cost in energy savings in a few months. The second was the leaky ceiling. I wouldn't have minded if it was any place other than right in front of where the concessions guy fills the popcorn.All in all, this place is great for a cheap movie close to home, but you are better of going corporate if you want the best movie-going experience.

55.description: The New 400 Theaters is a very nice local theater that recently went through renovations. I am new to this Theater and I am very impressed. I saw here Divergent and Lucy when they first came out. The seats are very comfy and the size of the theater is just right not to small and not to large. The best part is the bar located at the main lobby. You can get a beer, wine or a mixed drink and the prices are just right. I would recommend that you come early because the theater gets busy and there is sometimes a line outside. There are also few nice places to eat on Sheridan Road and there is Starbucks next door. Parking is on the main street or if you are lucky on side streets, but I recommend taking the red line or the bus which stops pretty much right in front. I am looking forward to going here again I am eyeing the Gone Girl, I hope they have it hear because I want to see it and I want to see it at the New 400.

9.description: UPDATE: renovations are being completed and they've made some great changes. Seats, screens and other aesthetics.  I love this little local theatre and think the surrounding neighborhoods should continue to support it.

26.description: I am sad to say I will no longer come to this theater. I support small local businesses that are a part of this great community, but I do not think the theater is very community oriented as it used to be when managed by Thomas Klein. This manager was always welcoming and helpful with everyone. He was kind to employees and hard working. The quality, professionalism, cleanliness and overall friendly atmosphere is gone. This theater is no longer what it used to be.Such a shame.

25.description: I like this theatre. It's close to my apartment, tickets are not over priced like chains and food and drinks are really well priced (especially the alcohol!) the only two downsides are they have 4 screens so if it's not a huge blockbuster it won't be showing and the seats are a little out dated and uncomfortable. But they are vintage and affordable so I don't mind it.

12.description: I wish I could give less than one star. But it seems that every time I come here it is patronized by rude people who talk through the whole movie. If you like having your viewing experience ruined by people talking and making disruptive noises, then go on. I would recommend attendants to monitor the theaters. This is not a single incident, this happens every time and is really disappointing. Also, the facility is dingy and unkempt, save your time and go some place else. I hope the experience can be changed, such a disappointment for the Rogers Park neighborhood.

59.description: Great neighborhood movie theater a short walk from the red line. Management rocks and the prices are great. $6 matinee for first run 3d films and $3 for a popcorn? What a steal! Add a bar and that's just cherries on top. There's even a discount for students and they are involved with community events (had an ad for a 48 hours film festival). For those complaining about the decor etc, I think it's one of the charms of the location. It's an old building with lots of character. There's plenty of other modern theaters to choose from. Come here if you want an affordable day and a friendly staff!

21.description: Sure this place is old, not the cleanest, and maybe even a little shady at times but I can't help but love it. Maybe it's because I have some very fond memories from my undergrad days at Loyola, coming to this theater with various friends. Their prices are cheaper than most other theaters, their concession stand is a steal and they have a full bar! People will talk during the movie, some may even record the movie (I've seen this happen here) but just embrace the whole experience and enjoy it. Honestly if you're looking for an AMC vibe, go to AMC. This place is great for broke college students or locals who just want to watch a movie and have a fun time doing it. If you take your movie going experience too seriously, you won't like it here.

17.description: I am sad to say I will no longer come to this theater. I support small local businesses that are a part of this great community, but I do not think the theater is very community oriented as it used to be when managed by Thomas Klein. This manager was always welcoming and helpful with everyone. He was kind to employees and hard working. The quality, professionalism, cleanliness and overall friendly atmosphere is gone. This theater is no longer what it used to be.Such a shame.

10.description: Every time we go to the movies here there is always ALWAYS an issue with people talking through the movie and being rude as hell and of course if you call them out they will make an even bigger scene, we don't go here often and like to support local businesses but I think this was the last straw. I feel as though the staff should be checking theaters to make sure there aren't disturbances to deflect any patron on patron confrontation.... Should have told the staff but I guess expecting good behavior and etiquette is too much to ask for

5.description: This was my first time at this place and I can't believe I haven't been here before! The staff was friendly and the popcorn was so fresh and better than anything you'd get at AMC or elsewhere. The theater itself was small but cozy and wasn't super crowded (for a Monday afternoon show). I think I'll definitely be returning here again!

3.description: After a few times trying this theater I won't return again ...The popcorn was so ancient and stale that I couldn't eat it ...The screen is always so dim, dusky and dark that it ruins the movie ...Freshness and brightness, bitches ... (channeling Jesse ...) but it's too late for me

35.description: I was excited to see that there was a movie theater in the neighborhood, but the last time I was there their seats were dirty and disgusting, I saw a rat running around where the movie was shown- (something the manager admitted to and said that it was an ongoing problem that they were trying to take care of), and I haven't been back there since. Can anyone tell me if the place has gotten cleaner and rat free?

19.description: I love it! the fascists at Yelp HQ want me to elaborate but I have nothing else to say beyond "I love it!"

28.description: I enjoy going to this theater but the owners need to do a little upkeeping. Parts of the theater chairs go missing. The ceiling in one of the theaters *still* has a hole in it.  The carpet is long overdue for replacing.  I'm not sure how high their rent is or *where* their profits, if any, go. But putting some $ back into the theater itself would go a long way.

45.description: I cannot believe in the year 2015 a slummy theatre like this can be in operation.. This place is extremely dirty and gross. The staff is very friendly but the theatre itself is sit at your own risk...The ceiling has gaping holes the seat next to me has been tore to shreds and the place is just disgusting. You truly feel you are sitting in a porn movie house from the 1970's... Plain seedy...

33.description: It's small and neat. Not a place to go if you want huge screens and 100s of seats. Cheap and friendly staff.

43.description: The perfect place to see a film if you enjoy talking and making noise during the film. I've never seen a movie here without at least one group of people disregarding the rest of the patrons requests to be quiet. I would go to this theater more often of the management grew a spine and did something about this.

2.description: Love this place!I remember coming here as a kid before it was the 400. They've always been affordable and, given I now practically live across the street, crazy convenient. I cannot wait to see the free Halloween movies they'll be running. Plusssss it has a bar with decent drinks and affordable concession snacks.9/10.

18.description: Love this Community theatre!! Just moved to Edgewater recently, This will be my go to spot to see a movie.. Nothing like supporting a Neighborhood spot!!

41.description: Clean theater staff are decent seats are comfortable enough for a movie small rooms decent bar good for the price!

52.description: Everytime I visit the New 400 Theater I Love it more and more!I love that when I enter the staff knows me now, I love that I can geta great tasting medium bag of buttered popcorn for $3.75 too!And of Course, with Yelp Check -In a free medium soft drink or welldrink, and honestly my days of drinking well drinks are pretty much overso I always opt for a Diet Coke!But what I loved the most this past Thursday was I went to see St. Vincentwith Melissa McCarthy and Bill Murray, and yes, I am sentimental and Istarted to cry during a certain scene, and 2 rows in front of me there wasa woman sitting there crying at the same scene I was..After the movie ended as I went to the lobby I met the lady who was crying2 rows ahead of me, and she turned out to be a customer I had previously metat Jewel, and we both laughed about how we were crying during the same scene.So, for myself, people who complain about sticky floors, non-reclining seatsor old looking bathrooms you need to go elsewhere, because this little theaterhas been here for quite some time with good reason.Because it's a neighborhood place where everybody knows your name...

50.description: The first time I ever came to this theater, I had a giant rat crawl over my foot. Like a mental patient, I went back and gave it another chance... It smelled like dead rats. I guess if you're looking at this with a half glass full mentality, you'd say this was progress. All I know is that I was in a theater for 2 1/2 hours smelling the rotting corpses of rats. 3 stars. Hey, tickets are cheap!

4.description: We found this theatre two weeks moving into Chicago and it has become our favorite movie theatre here. They have $4 days for students on Wednesdays and they have special offers whenever possible. Comfortable environment, lots of movie fans flock the theatre for a chill theatre setting, and definitely better pricing than a Landmark or Regal theatre downtown. We go here whenever we can.

6.description: Best place in Rogers park to get a drink and catch a movie... Simply the best.

22.description: Cheap seats kind of theater.They have an awesome Groupon dealI just saw the deal they have on checking in!!Can't beat that

15.description: This is a great little local theater that's a great option for those who are looking to see the latest movies but not wanting to pay a premium. The theater seems to only show 4 or so movies at a time and the auditoriums are quite small compared to your typical AMC or Regal, but the price is $8.50, or $7.50 with a student ID. As long as you don't come expecting a super cushy theater, you'll have a nice and cozy experience.With a Yelp Check-In, you even get a free drink - and that includes alcoholic beverages!

57.description: Great deals each day for alcoholic beverages that you can drink inside while watching a movie. Something you cannot do at most movie theaters here in the U.S.Cheaper matinee prices, and even regular showings are cheaper compared to places like AMC. A little run down, but they keep the place clean, and friendly service too.I recommend this place only if your closeby, for all your movie watching.

20.description: Nice local movie theater small and intimate, prices are great and perfect for a cheap date night. Staff are super friendly!

36.description: I love this theater!  It's smaller compared to your typical AMC theater auditorium; however, it'll meet all your needs.  They usually only show 4 movies at a time on smaller screens than what you'd get at an AMC, but I'm totally okay with that.  You don't pay the insane $10-$12 prices you would normally pay elsewhere, and prices for an evening film are $8.50 or $7.50 with a student ID.  The films will usually be the more popular, money-making films, so don't expect an independent film here.  If you check-in on Yelp, they give you a free medium drink or well drink.  Candy and popcorn isn't insanely priced either.  My 2 complaints are that hot dogs are never ready and they have to come find you in the theater to give you your hot dog and that the bathrooms can get a bit gross.  Otherwise, the staff and management is always super friendly and accommodating, and I never have a bad experience when I go here!

14.description: Small theater, and peaceful area. They even sell alcohol, omg! This is like the first, and probably only theater, that I have seen that sells alcohol. If you're in the Rogers Park/Edgewater area, and want to catch a movie, stop in!

29.description: Great Bar.  Tammi is AWESOME.  She works the front  door and is always happy to see you in her special way.  She will watch your drink for you when you run out for a smoke break.  I love it when she wears her police hat.

42.description: This was part of my adventure with my friends Renny and Robert.After having already gone to Mary's Attic, Atmosphere, Marty's, and back to Atmosphere again...we chatted to some gays in the bar.At which point, my friend Renny lifted my shirt and asked the bar tender if he would have sex with me.  While I was startled, I was strangely thrilled by the new found freedom alcohol provided me.The bar tender supposed he would, and invited us to the Jackhammer.  I was like 'What? I am not going to a bar named after a power tool used to rip up streets....imagine what they could do to my back alley' ...despite my protests, we went.I was super jazzed that my cover charge was returned to me in the form of a drink voucher.  I bought beer! Yeah me!Then the bar tender from the other bar found me.  And then he decided it would be a great idea to tongue kiss me in front of my friends.  Which was hot, but decidedly dirty and out of character for me.  I was forced to order another beer to wash the taste of hot blond guy out of my mouth.I ended up talking to so many people that night, including an 'otter'  I never heard of that before.  Here's a lesson in homo-ness:Big hairy guys who wear leather: BearsSkinny hairy guys who wear leather: OttersSkinny boys with no chest hair, and usually barely legal: twinksSkinny boys with no chest hair who wear vintage t's and ripped jeans: hotAnyway, after my conversations with many boys....we decided to go next door to Touche...which is a whole nother story.I will say the bar was clean, had a very fun vibe, a great mix of a crowd (though a little bear/otter heavy), played good music, and the bar tenders are some of the friendliest I've ever encountered.I'd actually suggest checking it out, it isn't as scary as the name!

23.description: Home of my favorite bartender in the city. Danny is a delight and really gives the place a "locals" feel even when it's slamming busy. The drinks are good and there are always interesting people to meet. Worth checking out earlier in the evening, not just late at night. Jackhammer is my Cheers.

47.description: I went through a period of mourning when the Jackhammer transformed from "cozy gay dive bar" to what it is now, which is a not-as-cozy and not-so-divey bar.  Now it looks like a dance club.  The clientele is pretty much the same, but I've noticed a lot of younger people coming in.  So, the mourning is over and I've accepted the fact that the Jack is not the same as it used to be.  The old Jack is now relegated to nostalgia.  Generally I only come on Tuesday nights for Creaoke karaoke, which goes on until 4 am.  It's always a lot of fun, and the bartenders are a friendly lot.  And yes, there's gay porn playing on the TV's, but it's a gay bar called THE JACKHAMMER, with a new bar in the basement called THE HOLE, which has a dress code and is supposed to be very sleazy.  I only went down there once and was turned away the second time because I wasn't wearing leather or a jockstrap or a leather jockstrap.

8.description: I know this divey bar isn't a neighborhood "gem", but after our brief visit last weekend (June 2015) I can now say this place has deteriorated to a legitimate DUMP. We used to come here to play pool but now, the pool table is trashed and looks more like an autopsy had been performed there at some point. Shame on the management of this place for not keeping it at least tolerably clean. We won't be back.

31.description: So... I might regret saying this... but I think Jackhammer is on my top five list of gay bars in Chicago. Now, mind you... I was never there before the upstairs opened. I have only been there on a Saturday ONCE. We participate in the dart league that has two teams out the bar... which means my experiences are mostly $1 Thursdays. I know, I know... $1 beers attract $1 clientele. But when you're there for dart night and you're used to paying $4-$7 for a beer throwing in the league, $1 beers are a refreshing change of pace. The bartenders are always SUPER sweet. I'm such a sucker for a hot dude calling me "baby" or "beautiful". Giggle. Blush. I think my favorite experience here was on a Saturday night when we were here with my Uncle and his partner. As we were leaving (having spent our time on the second floor where they show sports and videos), we had to walk by all the TVs playing porn... and my uncle grabbed me and covered my eyes so I couldn't see it. He thinks I'm so sweet and innocent...

34.description: Still like it, but liked it better before the renovations, I guess (when it was kinda scuzzier).  Now, I sometimes feel like it's trying to be too many things to too many people (downstairs bar w/sorta-leather theme, half-assed dance floor--you have to walk through it to get upstairs--w/DJ, pool tables, strange theme nights).  Kind of odd layout and absolutely-no-privacy bathrooms w/uplit urinals.  I guess it works, because they're generally pretty busy.  Generally nice bartenders, crowd can vary greatly (twinks, leather, older, some college-types), but they're open til 4, prices are reasonable and there's a smallish parking lot across the street (DO NOT park in the lot to the left of the hardware store, you'll be towed).

16.description: I like this place because it attracts a refreshingly diverse crowd compared to all of the people you run into in Boystown.  They host various events throughout the week and the weekends I usually like to stop in for a drink or 10.  The bartenders have always been friendly and nice.  Never really done it, but I imagine it is a good chill place to visit during the week if you are meeting friends for a quick drink & to catch up.  On the weekends if you are feeling bold and adventurous you can check out "The Hole", in the basement space of the club.  It is a private club space, so if you have leather, you can walk in as is.  Otherwise you must strip down to your underwear, OR you can just take off your shirt if you have descent sized upper body tattoos.Even though this is a review for Jackhammer, it is kind of hard to leave out the fact that there is a leather & fetish type store next door if that tickles your fancy, as well as Touche, a darker and more raunchy bar/club worth checking out.

13.description: This place is wild. Wild, untamed and unashamed. It's also clean, with a well done interior. Filled with hot (albeit, gay) men. There's a lot for a straight girl to look at here as well.As long as you're not with a screamy, annoying bachelorette party - which, I was not. No one is happy to see the idiot Trixies in places like this.The bartenders are charming and adorable. Never too busy for a smile, even when working at lightning speed.There's a secret, special bar downtstairs called The Hole that has a dress code of sorts. Leather, fetish or nudity. Ladies you will be asked to remove your shirt. Wear a cute, black lace bra . . . if you dare to descend into the Hole.Otherwise, I stay upstairs to drink, dance and dish with my fabulous gay brothers in Andersonville and around. This place is friendly to women, as long as you're not an idiot, as mentioned above.Which . . . I am not. :-)

11.description: This is the type of bar that homogenizes homosexuals.  Typical flaming dance music..yadda yadda

39.description: This bar is going downhill. It used to be fun when it first remodeled but it is starting to get too dirty and it seems like a lot of people there are on drugs. We went on a Saturday night for the monthly underwear contest and it wasn't even crowded. It used to be packed with people dancing for these parties but now the crowd is alot smaller. They don't have the normal DJ working on that Saturday night anymore and the music isn't as good. Staff downstairs is friendly in the hole. Worst thing about this place is if there are people dancing you have to walk through the middle of the dance floor to get to the upstairs or downstairs bars or the bathrooms. Weeknights are ok, same people all the time and it seems they got rid of the DJ's during the week so the music is kind of boring. Guess we will just go to Charlies from now on.

37.description: This review is for The Hole, the seedy bar-in-a-bar occupying Jackhammer's basement.As someone "in the lifestyle" who prefers quality over quantity and doesn't "play" in bars, sleazy places tend toward less comfortable and pressured encounters. However, while The Hole certainly offers the opportunity for casual vice, I felt very comfortable. The bartender was a bit snippy, but the clientele was welcoming and gregarious. There's not much of a crowd here until 11:30 or so. Others mention the strict dress code: gear or shirtless men only. Tattoos help. The crowd was a mix of muscle men, bears, slim and average bodies, covering all age groups but tending toward early 30s to mid 40s--still with a fair number of 20-somethings like myself and a spattering of older men.They pour heavier here than at Touché next door, but prices are a tad higher, too, particularly for called liquor.

0.description: I f**king love this place.  The set-up.  The diversity of men.  The sleaze.  The bartenders and staff.  The multi-levels, and different ways to have a good time!I'm about options and this place gives you that!  I've gone three times now, and will keep coming but alone, hehe.  The only thing questionable for me is the music.  I'm a dancer more than a drinker.  I went on a Friday night recently, and just hated the music.    (I still danced for two hours though, because of the energy of those around me.)  Of course it was the first time I stayed on the main floor, and focused on that.Before my most recent visit, I was there Halloween night, which happened to be my birthday, and I was simply in heaven!  Or Hell, depending on your perspective.That night the music was dark/industrial i.e., Nine Inch Nails, Revolting Colts, Front 242, etc.  This is my genre of music!  I'm not sure if it was because of that festive evening, or a Saturday thing, but it was hot.  Well, at least in the basement it was!

38.description: I am not really qualified to assign a star rating to Jackhammer. You see, there is nothing leather about me. I wouldn't even presume to try. But as an experiential collector, this provided an enjoyable escape from the 'mos down in the hood.The music isn't fantastic, but the place is tidy and there is an adjacent leather shop. I do love commerce!The leather daddies are all welcoming, and indeed pleased to see non-leather types checking out the scene. Should you decide to stick around and strap on a harness all the better. But that is an individual decision left to the individual. Let me tell you, while others say the leather daddies are not fashion conscious, i beg to differ. These blokes drop some serious coin on their wares. Do you think custom made leather wear is inexpensive.As for the evening, there was a performance by some Sheena the Warrior Goddess woman. I saw some things I don't believe I've seen before, but that was the purpose of the evening. I didn't check out the downstairs bar- it was closed for a special event (a bar mitzvah??)- so I can't opine on that.In short an enjoyable experience for the collection.

51.description: I went to The Jackhammer last summer to see my boyfriend's band, The Flying Aarons, play in The Flesh Hungry Dog show. While none of the members of his band are gay (and probably very few of the groupies that came to see them play that night), it was still a fun experience. The Flesh Hungry Dog show is a sweet  variety show that transcends any sexual orientation lines. They had some great bands the night I ventured to the Jackhammer---definately worth going to this bar for TFHD show, alone.The Jackhammer, itself, is a kind of a neat, divey-ish bar, but I did definitely feel out of place being 1 of about 5 straight girls in the bar. If you're straight or a female, I don't know if I would recommend going to it on a night when there is no live music. It's not that it's a "questionable" bar or anything, but obviously the clientele is going to be gay men. You just might feel oddly out of place.....especially when gay porn is being blasted on every tv. But if I were gay, I'd be here every night of the week. There is some major beef in the house.

27.description: I have mixed feelings about the 'Hammer. On one hand, there's usually great guys here, the bartenders are nice, and the hole can be fun if you're in the sort of mood to indulge in such activities... or just watch.On the other hand, there's some seriously negative juju under the earth up at the 6400 block of Clark. From all the stories I've heard, to my own personal experiences I feel like the entire stretch of land from Devon up to the police station is an Indian burial ground. No, I've never seen poltergeists here, but it certainly feels like something is just, just... ...off for lack of words. The one thing that I truly don't like about JH though is the awkward layout. They play good music, have a decent stereo - but they shove the dance floor to the front, and have huge glass windows which ruins the intimacy. Plus, since you have to walk through the dance floor to either go upstairs or down into the depths of the hole, you have to walk through anyone who just wanted to shake their booty, leading to less booty shaking. Ultimately, hardcore patrons of JH are only there for the Hole, which is fine. It is just a missed opportunity to be great place for both the seedy and the prudish alike.

32.description: Sweet! Well more like ROUGH! I really enjoyed this bar, I've heard about it but never ventured out to the area. Last week a bunch of friends decided to try a new scene  (more of a leather type scene) other than the usual B-town scene. Yeah, they charge a $5 cover but you get a ticket for a free drink which makes up for the cover charge. The music is great and the bar is super spacious. Yeah, they have "The Hole" downstairs, can't really comment because I didn't venture down there but maybe one day...heeheehee

48.description: Yes Jackhammer is dark & loud, and there is indeed hardcore gay porn playing on a huge screen above the front bar, but it's also my favorite bar in the city. It's an extremely friendly, relaxed atmosphere without the attitude and more importantly the packs of drunk straight girls that act like they are at a zoo, of boystown. There is also a basement bar "The Hole" but its pretty much only guys and there is a dress code.

44.description: I finally made my first visit to the Jackhammer this weekend and I have to say I was kind of impressed. The decor is sort of cliche modern gay bar, which is totally dullsville, but the bartenders and crowd were great. I love the fact the crowd is so mixed, there really was someone for everybody and it seemed pretty attitude free. Bears, leather guys, twinks, hipster gays, which you don't really see at other Chicago gay bars. It was a total meat market, but in a fun way. I was there around 11:30 on a Saturday night and it was jumpin jumpin, but the bar is huge so there was plenty of room to spread out.  I also loved the fact they played hardcore porn at the front of the bar. I even owned the video that was playing (shut up!) which was kind of funny. If you don't like it, don't go. It's a gay bar, specifically catering to GAY MEN, many of whom are looking to get laid. When I was there, the ratio of men to women was about 50:1. No one seemed to have a problem with the women that were there, but it seems sort of dude focused, so if you want to drink Appletinis with your girlfriends, stick to Boystown.The basement leather bar, The Hole, is also great if you're into that scene. I didn't see anything totally scandalous happening while I was down there but they definitely have all the accouterments (public urinals, ha!) for when things get rowdy. I got kicked out for not wearing leather (which I kind of expected) but the bartender was super nice about it, unlike the Eagle.Overall I have to say this could be my new favorite gay bar in Chicago. Next time I'll remember to wear my chaps.

24.description: Fun looking sprawling gay bar in Rogers Park.  I can't really review Jackhammer itself as mostly I head towards The Hole downstairs, a tiny Leather bar with ambience oozing out of it's pores like the sweat on a boy being worked over on a St Andrew's cross.

7.description: Super safe a fantastically inviting crowd no matter what your "schtick" is: gay, straight, bi-... you will be well received and accepted. Always a fun, fun time... Dan Downstairs is an AMAZING bartender... have him make you a "Smurf Queff" cocktail!! Seriously: you hot ladies need to bring your lame boyfriend here and tell him to just "get over it"!! Cheers!!

49.description: I went to the Jackhammer to see a band play. I didn't really know what it was going to be like until I got there. I will be honest and say that I didn't really care for the extremely graphic porn on the television but that was fine because I just didn't look at it.I am a straight female and didn't feel at all alienated here. There was a lot of leather-clad bodies. The bartenders were nice, the patrons were all extremely friendly and I especially liked Barbie the hostess.Gay bars aren't really my thing but I would definitely consider stopping in again if the occasion came up.

40.description: I had a really strange experience here in the downstairs bar. Look for it. I did, but only because my friend asked me to meet him down there one day. In "The Hole," as it's known, you either have to wear leather (and not just a leather bracelet, which I was wearing) or take off your shirt. That's just during the week. Weekends, I believe it's underwear only, so beware!Boobs or no boobs, you gotta take off your shirt if you don't have the required amount of leather on. Oh, and I don't have boobs, but a girl who was hanging with my friend did have boobs. Luckily, she draped her long hair over them. She didn't seem at all uncomfortable with it and her boobs were nice to look at, so I suppose it wasn't too strange.But there IS a cage down there... AND you can get into it. I didn't climb in, but I saw someone get in, and I saw him do things to people while he was in it. Or maybe I should say I saw people do things to him while he was in there.Yeah. That WAS strange.The upstairs is clean and modern. They play bad gay music, but there are very few gay bars with good music, so that's neither here nor there.I'm definitely not knocking it. If you live up that far north, I guess it's nice to have something like that around. If you don't live up there, you'd probably only go to Jackhammer if you're in the area and don't want to schlep to some other place further south, or if a friend makes you go.

30.description: Forever in love with the down to earth raw staff here! : ) thanks everyone, always have a great time here with my boyzz, : ) and also the drinks kick a$$! : ) mmm nommy!

46.description: I agree that this is the one place where all the different crowds and age groups seem to mix without inflicting any discomfort on each other.  Everyone is just there to have a good time.  I'm not sure why they bother with the miniscule dance floor, but they do play good music.  Never saw the place before the redo, but if anything it might be a little too nice for a place called Jackhammer.  Yes, they're playing hardcore porn, so if that bugs you, don't go.  It's that easy.  There are no privacy dividers in the bathrooms, which resulted in me seeing something I never needed to see when a girl came in to use the men's bathroom.  Use your imaginations.  This is actually a good place to bring understanding straight girlfriends who can avert their eyes from and avoid bitching about gay porn in a GAY BAR.  However, I don't understand why guys would try to take these girlfriends into "The Hole", which is clearly designated as a men-only, dress-code section of the bar.  Anyway, it's totally fun and worth the trip out of Lakeview for a change of pace and scenery.

1.description: They've done a remarkable job renovating this place over the years, top middle and bottom.Lively, fun atmosphere with a younger crowd.  The cover charge with drink coupon is added red tape and a nonsense feature.  The upstairs bar, the drinks are weak and expensive in little glasses.  Not good value for your Gay customers! :(The pit downstairs is interesting, steamy and oh so male.  Love it.

9.description: The upstairs bar is mediocre with overpriced drinks.  I don't like the cover charge--for what exactly?  The "hole" (downstairs) smelled like poo the night i was there.  but, when i was down there it was like i walked into a time warp.  it was kind of magical and there were many attractive men around.  it's a good place to go if you're sloppy drunk and looking to get lucky, though i don't advise that.  i wish there were several star ratings for this bar:drinks: 1.5 starssexy men: 5 starssmell: 0 stars (unless you're into that)atmosphere, in general: 3.5 stars

26.description: Oh yeah:  I love this place!I first visited Jackhammer a few years back when somebody told me that the only bars in Chicago worth visiting were this one and the next door legend, Touche.The Jackhammer has a little something for everybody.  When you first walk in, you're walking right into the middle of the dance floor.  If you're a twink and showing up with one of your fag hags, stay on the main floor or head upstairs for a good "stand and pose" bar experience.Now, if you're there for impure reasons (like me), then immediately skip the hype and head for the back stairs -- go down to the Hole, boy!  That's where the REAL fun is.  At the bottom of the stairs you'll be met with another bouncer who's gonna make sure that 1) you have a penis (sorry ladies), 2) you take your shirt off (before 9) or have leather on (after 9) or take your pants off (after 9), and 3) that you're not a giggly little cologne wearing kid -- and if you are you'll get a lecture on how your behavior is "disruptive".  You see, the Hole has a full bar downstairs.  There's also a bathtub there.  Yes, that's right, a bathtub.  Can you guess what happens there?  Wanna find out?Also, the Hole has a back room/hallway where men go to, um, play.  And I ain't talkin' darts or pool, either.  :)

25.description: UPDATE: Jim the owner of Jackhammer sent me a nice emailapologizing for my past experience at his bar. Totally unexpectedand greatly appreciated. Thank you Jim!

12.description: For Jackhammer itself, a solid four stars. Good bar. But for Dan and the Hole -- five stars!

21.description: This place is wild. Wild, untamed and unashamed. It's also clean, with a well done interior. Filled with hot (albeit, gay) men. There's a lot for a straight girl to look at here as well.As long as you're not with a screamy, annoying bachelorette party - which, I was not. No one is happy to see the idiot Trixies in places like this.The bartenders are charming and adorable. Never too busy for a smile, even when working at lightning speed.There's a secret, special bar downtstairs called The Hole that has a dress code of sorts. Leather, fetish or nudity. Ladies you will be asked to remove your shirt. Wear a cute, black lace bra . . . if you dare to descend into the Hole.Otherwise, I stay upstairs to drink, dance and dish with my fabulous gay brothers in Andersonville and around. This place is friendly to women, as long as you're not an idiot, as mentioned above.Which . . . I am not. :-)

17.description: Fun bar for the far north-side crowd; decent prices and a lot of terrific, and easy-on-the-eye bartenders; awesome music and the Sunday buffet by Roe is not to be missed. We love Tim, George, and of course, Jimmy. Oh, and the patio is great for our few months of summer.

10.description: Go get your skank on. The place is best when is packed or completely dead. Fun venue, modern gay

5.description: My partner and I were visiting Chicago over the weekend decided to check out this bar. Living in Utah, we don't have the opportunity to experience places like Jackhammer very often.We got to Jackhammer a little before 11pm when the crowd was still pretty light, but within an hour things picked up. We spent most of the night in "The Hole" because what's more fun than having drinks in your underwear? Despite the fact that we are both into our 30s, this was the first time either of us had been at a bar in our underwear -- and we loved every minute of it! We both commented on how welcome the staff made us feel as soon as we walked in and the crowd was open and friendly as well. We're looking forward to our next visit to Chicago so we can visit Jackhammer again.

3.description: I went to the business next door leather 64ten and was planning to buy a few pieces of leather but Eric there was very rude and drunk so I changed my mind. He started screaming and cursing so I walked out and went to Jackhammer. Eric followed me there and continued screaming I was not welcome there. I am giving three stars because the employee at the door was very polite and apologized and said the manager was not there and he had no option. I also give them credit for maintaining close relationship with other local businesses. However, I think it is a very poor business model to refuse service to a client purely because the client did not wish to make a purchase at the business next door.

35.description: Hugely awesome - ha.

19.description: UPDATE: Jim the owner of Jackhammer sent me a nice emailapologizing for my past experience at his bar. Totally unexpectedand greatly appreciated. Thank you Jim!

28.description: jack hammer is fun! I really like the bar staff and door people, extremely friendly with great music and cheap drink specials, unfortunately its pretty far north and i dont like to take the bus or cta to get there and then drink and have to take an expensive cab ride home. I will go back though for some of the great events they put on.

45.description: its a fun place to go once in a while.   I like this place.   5 dollars to get in and a 5 dollar drink ticket!!  WOOHOO!  The guy at the back bar was a sweetie and attached to it is a toy store.   Wow the more I think about this place...the more I like it.   My roommate dragged me there for his bday on sat.   It even comes with its own palm reader....(im not gonna be married and I have a project that i need to stop).   :)   Enjoy!!  (Small dance floor but noone plays the darts in back!!)

33.description: Okay, maybe my first experience wasn't the best but I have this to say about Jackhammer.I got stink eye for kissing a boy on the dance floorI stepped in pukeI had to pay a coverYeah, end of story.

43.description: Lots of types of guys here, but definitely leaning towards bears and leather guys. I had a good time despite not being in the scene. The bartenders were pretty nice and hot. I know the Hole was open, but I didn't check it out.I'll definitely go back if I'm not feeling Boystown.

2.description: They steal your money once you check your stuff downstairs. Not even worth it to risk getting your stuff stolen. The underwear contest was okay if you're drunk. Drinks are reasonable and not over priced but over all it's a sex club pretty much and I won't visit again..

18.description: Oh yeah:  I love this place!I first visited Jackhammer a few years back when somebody told me that the only bars in Chicago worth visiting were this one and the next door legend, Touche.The Jackhammer has a little something for everybody.  When you first walk in, you're walking right into the middle of the dance floor.  If you're a twink and showing up with one of your fag hags, stay on the main floor or head upstairs for a good "stand and pose" bar experience.Now, if you're there for impure reasons (like me), then immediately skip the hype and head for the back stairs -- go down to the Hole, boy!  That's where the REAL fun is.  At the bottom of the stairs you'll be met with another bouncer who's gonna make sure that 1) you have a penis (sorry ladies), 2) you take your shirt off (before 9) or have leather on (after 9) or take your pants off (after 9), and 3) that you're not a giggly little cologne wearing kid -- and if you are you'll get a lecture on how your behavior is "disruptive".  You see, the Hole has a full bar downstairs.  There's also a bathtub there.  Yes, that's right, a bathtub.  Can you guess what happens there?  Wanna find out?Also, the Hole has a back room/hallway where men go to, um, play.  And I ain't talkin' darts or pool, either.  :)

41.description: Good mix of people but I would think Jackhammer is geared towards the older crowd.  I did pay a cover but they gave me a ticket for a $5 drink.  The place was clean and modern and the bar tenders weren't to bad.  I'm not sure what is up with the bathrooms as they are way out in the open with lights shining on the urinals.  Definably designed by a gay person.  This bar gets busier later at night and is open very late.   You may find people here more promiscuous than normal.  Techno music is played here as well.

52.description: The Jackhammer hosts a queer/queer friendly Flesh Hungry Dog Rock show every month which features 3 very cool bands of various styles (usually modern), and burlesque and comedy acts, that always draws in a eclectic crowd. It's like a punk rock variety show from the golden age of television. The founder of the show, Gary Airedale always books cool acts. fleshhungrydog.com/index…

50.description: In the past year, this bar went through a major remodeling, and transformed from a dive bar catering to bears and leathermen to a cute neighborhood bar catering to bears and leathermen. It's a lot brighter and cleaner now, with wall-length windows that look out onto Clark Street, an upstairs bar and dance floor, and a small back deck. In addition to the requisite male dancers and amateur strip nights, Jackhammer now hosts live music and other events. The clientele is still gay, but the bar now attracts a wider variety of gays and some straight folks. Be aware that the back bar on the main floor is still not safe for casual viewing, and the men's room -- while all clean and shiny, with new fixtures -- lacks any dividers between urinals -- or what would normally be stalls. So if you don't want guys checking out your material while you pee -- or worse -- you'd better hold it.

4.description: I was having a decent time, until I came across bolts that hold the stage together. They were sticking out and cut my leg. As I was gushing out with blood, non of the bartenders would take their precious time to grab me a bandaid. I had to practically go from bar to bar begging for a bandaid. One of them actually told me their was a line and I had to wait. In the end, Kevin, a bar back knew it was the right thing to do and stop to render his assistance.  I went to James to let him know what had happened. NOTHING! . NO RESPONSE.... way to manage your bar! It totally ended my night and your bottom dollar! Highly disgusted... anyone know a good lawyer?

6.description: What's not to like really!  Bartenders are all friendly. Customers are laid back. Not a pretentious place at all. The Hole downstairs is big time fun.  Dan is a well known bartender in Chicago and one of the ones that work "The Hole"  you'll have a great time. .check out underwear night!  Jimmy pops in sometimes very friendly also.

22.description: Was thrown out of this bar couple of weeks ago because a drunk dude knocked a just bought drink out of my hand. I turned to the bartender and told him what happened, he poured me another drink and then was going to charge me. I asked him why he was charging me and with that he told the hefty lady i had to go, WTF? No biggie though..I was sort of dragged there. Bartender was an ass...and i went home and got a good nights sleep! Besides the bathrooms are dirty.....

15.description: Came here on an adventurous (drunken) Saturday night, and enjoyed myself here, but wasn't really my scene. I was surprised it wasn't too busy, but it at least had more people and diversity than their neighbor Touche next door. They had a live performer doing some guitar ballads... which is kind of a party killer so the main room emptied out. I explored the infamous "Hole" downstairs. I guess we were there early because it wasn't too busy and they even let us in without taking out shirts off. I could tell it gets raunchy down there though. Anyway, I'd come back if a friend wanted to explore, but the farthest north I'd go on my own would be Big Chicks.

20.description: To be honest, I was very pleasantly surprised about the Jackhammer.  Of course, most people have heard of the Hole downstairs and that can be a little intimidating when first walking in.  I'm not going to review that section of the bar since I have never been, nor do I really have any interest.  And the great part of the bar is that you can have a fun evening without going down there or feeling pressured to go down.  The upstairs is very clean and with plenty of space minus an awkwardly placed dance floor (right by the entrance).  Much different clientele from that of Boystown as well.  You will get a much larger bear population at Jackhammer.  But you will also get locals from the neighborhood in Rogers Park.

36.description: Been going here for years, before the renovations.  Was much better back then when the drinks were actually pretty strong.  The first Saturday night of the month is the BEST - really fun with the spillover from Bear Night from the bar next door (Touche), why I gave 3 stars instead of 2, but every other day of the month is pretty dull.  Saturday nights do seem the best though all around, and I'm glad to see they are copying Touche and doing their own version of a Bear Night.  Also, go to Jackhammer for the **** weakest **** cocktails in the city with as much ice in them as they can stuff into the glass.  Dollar drink night isn't really as such - you have to "pay in" when you arrive - $7.00 for the first drink and receive a hand stamp that never seems to come off, then the watered down drinks are $1 after that.  No much of a variety of music - cookie cutter club cycle stuff, if you're into that constant thumping.  Why these bars think every gay man only likes that music is beyond me.  *Most* of the staff is friendly, but if you're not a centerfold hunk, you can tend to be ignored by certain bartenders.  The Hole downstairs can be fun, but you have to have some leather gear on.  But the "new" Jackhammer does not strike me as a leather bar any longer as it used to, and has a very twinky crowd at times with lots of attitude, except on the Bear Nights as previously mentioned, which are a blast.  It's worth a try if you have never been.  Enjoy and say hi to Barbi (who rocks)!

14.description: I went in on a Monday night. I must say if the shenanigans were that entertaining on a Monday, this place must be good everyday of the week. The weekends must be out of control specially with a backroom. The bartender in his sparkle pants with the fur boots made good drinks.

3.description: This is not your mother's veggie platter.  Linda's food is so great.  I'm crazy over her cheesecake.  She opened a new world for me with her raw chef abilities.  Does classes, catering and delivered meals.  Everything looks as good as it tastes.

1.description: Linda goes beyond your imagination with her food selection, "yummy" meals and appetizers. better options now, pick and choose your choices!

2.description: Green Spirit provides some truly creative, delicious and satisfying food. Linda is a master of her craft. I have used her catering service as well as weekly menu. I am a very busy business owner and having a few meals a week prepared for me really eases my time. So wonderful! I am so very grateful that Green Spirit exists...try it!!

0.description: I was interested in a raw food diet but was intimidated by the recipes I found online.  Most had so many random ingredients making it less appealing and incredibly expensive.  My friend and I decided to take Linda's intro. class @ Green Spirit and loved the experience.  We were introduced to quick and easy raw recipes that are not only healthy but tasted great and left excited to make these on our own.  If you are considering a raw food diet, I highly recommend checking out Green Spirit.

12.description: Terrific little store in a convenient location right on the 155 bus line.  John is super nice and really knows his stuff--some BEAUTIFUL vintage consoles for sale, and a nice little collection of vinyl (which gets bigger all the time)!  I always look forward to visiting the store, and know I'll be back soon!

3.description: I don't want to post a review because I want to keep this gem to myself!!! Groovy spot, fantastic customer service, total vintage heaven. I'll be back even though I live pretty far away!

1.description: Don't ever buy from Audio Archaeology THE WORST!!!! John Is one of the rudest most arrogant people I've ever dealt with! My girlfriend tried to buy me a vintage turntable from him for Christmas. Showed up in a flimsy box very poorly packaged and not working, also was dusty and looked  dirty and far from a full restoration with a dirty old stylus! We asked if we could send it back for repairs, not even for a full return. He was incredibly rude, asked us to pay for return shipping WTF?!! This was not a cheap piece of gear and it not only didn't work but was not "fully restored" as promised. We sent it back, finally got I back and guess what it shows up in the same shitty box he originally sent it in, with only packing peanuts, yeah it's loose in the box! Still doesn't work and now the right speaker doesn't work!! I've restored vintage receivers ams my own dual turntable and I'm very aware of how to operate and repair vintage gear. We ask for a return and refund he tells us it's our error and to "Tinker with it" "it's vintage gear get used to it" ummmmm wtf!!! Also claimed he put a new stylus on. Showed up with the same dirty shitty sylus. We paid for a fully restored and operational piece of gear. He never responded or gave us a return or refund. Well I had to spend my own time to repair this thing. Don't waste your time with this arrogant idiot! Well after a few hours of my own time it's working and the speaker is working. Thanks for nothing!

2.description: I absolutely love this place! The selection of incredible vintage record players is out of this world, which made it really difficult for me to choose which one I liked the most. After a couple visits and lots of great information on each and every player from John, the owner, I finally made my decision and bought a record player that I absolutely love! I listen to it almost every day and I couldn't be happier with it!
