9.description: This is such a great addition to the neighborhood.  It's one of my favorite record stores in Chicago!Everyone who works there is so helpful and friendly.  John the owner is the best.  He offered up advice for repairing a vintage record player I bought and always responds quickly if you're looking for a certain item or lets you know of great deals/finds they get into the store.  You must stop by and check it out if you're in the neighborhood!!!

10.description: I love this place! The best record store in the area hands down. The guys that run it are very nice and have a great (albeit small) selection of records in store. When I need a record they don't have, I will stop in and place an order with them (better to support local businesses than Amazon). They also have a great selection of vintage turntables and accessories!

4.description: Yes, they sell old record players,which work well, but are overpriced. And this is a nice thing if that's what you are looking for, don't want to go other places, and want to feel like "you got a good deal." However, the prices for said record players are higher than they should be. You will get a better deal, for instance, at Upscale Audio Exchange or 20th Century TV and Stereo Center, and the guys will tell you better stories about their experiences dealing with turntables, given that they actually grew up with them when they were widely used. And although it's cool they offer some new LPs as well as some old stuff, the prices on many of the older selections is a bit high, as is the price on the new LPs they have decided to carry in store. Also, the selections are kind of limited--I was hoping for more given other reviews, which make the place sound "better stocked" than it was when I've visited. On the days I've visited, the selection contained many LPs that can be found at other places in Chicago (Reckless, Logan Hardware, Dusty Groove) for less and in better condition. Sorry folks, but my visits have suggested it ain't worth the hype... (See my other 50+ reviews of Chicagoland stores for comparison/contrast here.)

6.description: I've been by this place a couple times now and I'm really impressed.First, the products the owner John has for sale are in great condition. Last time I was in there, he had some Zeniths, GMs, and Magnavox pieces from the 50's, 60's, and 70's. All the pieces are expertly restored with new cloth or finish, needles, etc. Some of the uglier pieces have been updated to a more "modern" color scheme with bright blues and oranges. An old radio was updated with a Bluetooth function for people who want to use their new technology on an older piece with warmer sound. There's something for every type of person who wants to participate in the vinyl lifestyle--no matter the age or experience of the buyer. There's stuff for the traditionalists and for those wanting something a little different.The record collection, though small, is great. I regularly frequent the reckless records stores in Chicago. They're terrific, but can be a bit overwhelming. You can always find a nice gem, but it takes hours of weeding through a lot of stuff to get to. The collection at Audio Archaeology contains only 40-50 albums per genre--but every album carried here is gold--be it a classic (from Miles Davis to BB King) to more contemporary fare (Black Keys, Flaming Lips, Ryan Adams, movie soundtracks, etc). Last time I was in there, there were racks out in the middle of the store that had some of the best Tom Waits albums--from the early years to his new stuff. Perhaps the best thing the store has going for it is the owner, John. Both times I was in there, John took time to walk me through what was new to the store--the history of individual pieces and his methods of restoration. There's something refreshing about his passion and transparency that makes one want to return to the store just to see what's new. However, with products this unique and in such great condition, I know that I won't be here to browse--I'm already counting on being a regular at Audio Archaeology.

15.description: This place is AWESOME!!! Plenty of records and turntable selections.Highly recommended!

0.description: The owner John is awesome & super nice! I bought amazing vintage records in near-mint condition - talk about a score! The prices are a steal for some of the records! For the crate diggers out there, dig in the bottom shelves and you will find treasures like I did!

5.description: OMG! I could not have been happier with John at Audio Archeology. Went in to start looking at upgrading from our Crosley turntable to an actual system. Really had no idea what to look for or what would be a good price. John walked us through everything. He explained the pros of certain elements and understood that we were not audiophiles. But we have a collection of vinyl that we love to listen to. He set us up with an amazing system. And after a couple of YouTube videos on how to splice wire and hook up speakers, we bought it and had set up in about 2 hours (pretty damn proud, considering I had never done anything like it before). Seriously, support your local shops and stop here. Oh and he has a great mix of older and new vinyl. So go here. NOW! Thanks again John!

13.description: I was at Audio Archaeology today for the annual Record Store Day. It was a great experience. The owner, John, and his people were very pleasant and helpful. He has a great selection of Audio equipment and vinyl recordings. Will definitely go back.

11.description: super cute shop and the owner was super nice. tons of great records to choose from. so happy to have it in the neighborhood. keep it up!

8.description: Really cool staff that is super helpful and friendly.  We went in to get a new needle the record player and we're really impressed with all the records, artwork, and DVDs they also had.  Definitely recommend!

14.description: Wow! Love this place! Great selection. The owner John was very nice and even ordered  some records for me. They only took a week to get in. I would love to upgrade my record player with one of the nice consoles he has.

7.description: This place is great! I had been searching for a vintage record player console and couldn't be happier with my purchase. John was super helpful and you can tell he loves what he does.

58.description: Remember that horrible snow storm a few weeks ago? The one with the foot of snow being swirled around by 40 mph winds? Yeahhh, that one. Well you know what I did that morning? I got up, threw on about ten layers of clothes, scraped the snow and ice off of my car, dug out the tires, and drove a slippery, sloppy 10 blocks. I then parked my car, got out, fell on my ass, got up and trudged into Sol Cafe. 2 Glazed and Infused donuts and a latte.Totally worth it.

56.description: I like the IDEA of Sol Cafe.  It is a much needed change in atmosphere on that side of town.  However, I was not impressed.  Went there with a friend on a Saturday afternoon.  I first noticed a man standing in his shoes on the counter, writing and erasing on the menu boards.  Fine.  However, he got down, and did not wipe down the counter where his shoes were just a minute ago.  I was thinking "please don't make my food on that counter!"  I would have left right after if it hadn't been for my friend who said their sandwiches were delicious.  My friend ordered, 2 ham panini's, a latte, and a donut.  We wait.  and wait. and wait.  Seriously, that was the absolute longest time I have ever waited for a sandwich.  She calls us up, only to find out that she spent all that time on ONE sandwich.  She didn't hear we wanted another, so we had to wait.  Again.  For way too long for a simple panini.  We take the food to go, and when we get to our destination and I open my sandwich, I am appalled that there was like, one skinny piece of  ham and a slice of cheese that hadn't even melted, and barely any peppers.  They were so cheap with the ingredients that I couldn't even taste anything aside from the mayo they used and bread.  For $6???? I paid 6 bucks for a slice of cheese and a barely there piece of ham that for some reason took 10 minutes to make?? Are you kidding me?  I will not be eating at this place again ever.

29.description: Wow! Very nice place, I had a quad mocha and a twerky bird sandwich, amazing. Also very happy with the atmosphere and the service I recieved. Definitely a place worth checking out, I am new to the area but I think this could be one of my very first regular spots. So very happy to have found this gem.

42.description: The place is trying to make everyone here deaf. It's certainly concerned with being hip and part of a "scene." Interesting menu items, good coffee. I just wish they would turn the fucking volume down on the music. It's a mid-Wednesday afternoon, ffs. The place is mostly full of people trying to work or read, and while that in itself can be criticized as annoying (Laptopistan), that's what most people look for in a coffee shop, really, and not whether cool music is playing really fucking, chest-vibratingly LOUD as all hell. The people who order have to yell over it to be heard.

23.description: By far one of my favorite coffee shops in Chicago! Located on the corner of a building with lots and lots of natural light in the morning, makes getting up and getting coffee there even more pleasant. The atmosphere is quiet most days and smells wonderful. No screaming steamers or burnt shots here. I'm pretty picky about my coffee, and as a barista myself I love espresso. They have great baristas that serve great drinks, crafted by hand. I normally get a mocha with an extra shot. Perfect from the first sip, never too hot and it holds temp for hours some times. Soooo gooood. The treats are good. But who doesn't love Benison's, I will say most days I don't get the treats cause they seem not as fresh as I could get from the actual places. But that would never stop me from still getting my coffee here.

47.description: So nice to find a healthy spot during a weekend swim meet at the Rex Plex. Loved the not chik'n salad wrap and side slaw. Clean, tasty, real food. Exposed brick, light airy spot. Nice staff too.

8.description: No more panini?? Boooooo. The offerings from the local supplier are way worse, expensive for what they are.

31.description: Stopped in for a quick coffee to go and was really impressed even with my super short visit. The shop was bright, spacious, and quiet. The barista was cheerful and the coffee was excellent. I didn't get any food but the sandwiches on the menu  and bakery items looked great. I'll be back when I need a quiet place to read or get work done in the near future.

34.description: Had a great start to our day at Sol Cafe this morning.  Even though it was cold and snowy outside, we were cozy and comfortable inside. In addition to the welcoming atmosphere, the food and drinks were all top notch. We enjoyed a breakfast panini sandwich, Chai Latte, Glazed and Infused doughnut, and a pour over coffee. We don't live in RP, so this was our first time at Sol, but we'll be back.

16.description: I stopped by here to meet up with a friend since it was a good halfway point. For how the surrounding area looks, Sol Cafe itself is a clean, trendy place to grab drinks/food. I ordered the Blood-Orange tea, which was nice - fruity and subtle, but with a nice kick of citrus. I also liked how they kept my tea leaves and told me they could make me another batch if I wanted. My friend ordered the afternoon delight, which was... well... delightful! It was light and sweet, and not quite like anything I've had before. He also ordered a red velvet donut, which I did not get to try. They have a selection of donuts from Glazed and Infused, which is great, but they looked a bit stale. There were not any tables open when we walked in, so the staff went out of their way to shuffle people around. Only thing I have to complain about is one of the people at the front got a little pushy about taking our order, even though there was nobody behind us. Not particularly special enough to make the trip back for, but it was a nice visit.

13.description: Sol is nice for a number of reasons... You can find things here that you can't elsewhere. They opened in an area that may otherwise be perceived as risky to a business person. They have great chai. I'm a regular here for their house-made chai. While the vast majority of places serving chai are pouring it from a concentrate, here that's not the case. Occasionally you'll walk in and they'll be simmering the ingredients cooking up a batch right there behind the counter.In the coffee department you'll find some drinks you won't elsewhere. The "Q" is a nice treat now and then when I'm not wanting a chai: espresso, smokey flavor, corn-infused milk, and paprika. There's also a thai drink that uses goats milk (seasonal maybe?) that I like.They have some delicious donuts on Fridays and weekends. The space is available to rent for private events, and they also host special events now and then for the general public. They also do catering. Free parking in rear makes it easy for an in/out if you're not on foot/bike.  Free wifi. They have a printer you can use.

11.description: This place is adorable, friendly, has a great vibe and is delicious. I just stopped by to try out their coffee and loved it! Lots of solid standard drinks (I always try a basic latte on my first visit) and a handful of really creative coffee concoctions! I'm already planning a return trip with friends to try the small, but yummy-looking as well as affordable, sandwich menu!

39.description: Roger's Park is on the rise again.  As the masses look for more affordable housing and a new neighborhood to conquer,  you know the neighborhood is coming along when the cute and trendy coffee shops sprout up.  Sol, however is more than just cute and trendy.  While the decor is top notch and some of the furniture pieces are original (see the bookshelves in the corner) Sol has also managed to give the appearance of not trying to hard.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and more importantly the cofee is pretty damn great.  If I had any complaints I'd say I wish it stayed open an hour later and had a tad bit more seating, but this location is my favorite so far of the Roger's Park coffee shops and the competition is certainly there.

37.description: I love Sol Cafe! Good food, good drinks, good service...what's not to love?Their coffee is top notch. These folks take their coffee seriously, but not too seriously -no one will judge you based on your order, so don't worry about that. Coffee not your thing? They also have a nice selection of tea. In addition to your usual coffee, latte, or cappuccino, they have some seasonal options available that are always interesting and worth a try. Pastries and food are also good, and on the weekends, they have donuts.Yes, I love their coffee and treats, but my favorite thing about Sol Cafe is that it is always welcoming and friendly. The staff are genuinely nice and always helpful. They are great about making recommendations and answering questions. Sol Cafe is my new coffee spot in Rogers Park. I will gladly go a few blocks out of my way to visit Sol when I'm in the neighborhood and in need of a caffeine fix.

0.description: It is surprising to see the slow Renaissance that Howard Street is experiencing, especially near the Red Line. And finding Sol Cafe in walking distance is a plus.I have had drip and pour-over, both of great quality. Since name brand coffeehouses like Starbucks have become playgrounds for toddlers and post-toddlers who are stuck with their mothers who are glued to their cellphones or entranced in conversation with their girlfriends, Sol Cafe reminds me of what coffeehouses started out as.The look screams hipster. But there isn't the off-putting hipster attitudes. Sol Cafe gets it right.

38.description: Awesome! Glad to finally have a place to go I this neighborhood. Super nice employees. Great tea selection.

51.description: I stopped by here to meet up with a friend since it was a good halfway point. For how the surrounding area looks, Sol Cafe itself is a clean, trendy place to grab drinks/food. I ordered the Blood-Orange tea, which was nice - fruity and subtle, but with a nice kick of citrus. I also liked how they kept my tea leaves and told me they could make me another batch if I wanted. My friend ordered the afternoon delight, which was... well... delightful! It was light and sweet, and not quite like anything I've had before. He also ordered a red velvet donut, which I did not get to try. They have a selection of donuts from Glazed and Infused, which is great, but they looked a bit stale. There were not any tables open when we walked in, so the staff went out of their way to shuffle people around. Only thing I have to complain about is one of the people at the front got a little pushy about taking our order, even though there was nobody behind us. Not particularly special enough to make the trip back for, but it was a nice visit.

27.description: My go to place for a catch-up chat or a few minutes of quality time with the boyfriend du jour! Yes, serious, but not so much so, good coffee, friendly staff - great owner - Go Nicole -- and a laid back atmosphere. Whether it's the harbinger of gentrification for Rogers Park, I am not sure, but no revolution can begin without caffeine.  Vive Sol Café!

32.description: What a fantastic local spot for all things coffee and beyond! The offerings are top-notch and creative, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the joint is comfortable, warm and welcoming. RP, this has been a long time coming, get out and support this place!

54.description: My favorite place to escape life... I took away one star for the service... It's just okay. The coffee and snacks are delish!

48.description: Hidden gem. The coffee is excellent, and strong. Made the mistake of getting bottomless cup of coffee, when we drank two cups each (it's a better deal if you're going to hang out there all day). The donuts were off the hook and the perfect compliment to the coffee. Lots of customers working on their laptops. Decor is funky and I love it. I'm excited to visit again and try more of the menu.

44.description: Best coffee in Rogers Park. In a field where it's easy to be like every other trendy cafe, serve the same flavors in a different location, Sol remains original. It's not a cafe that simply falls in line, rather they always try to provide a unique experience in a comfortable neighborly environment. And on the weekends, they have donuts, glorious donuts. Don't slack on the donuts though, cause they go quick.

24.description: This is now my closest coffee shop. Independent or otherwise. Unless you count the Starbucks inside the Jewel. Which I am not. I don't need any more Starbucks in my life thankyouverymuch.But yeah! Or perhaps I should say, hell's yeah! We love Sol Cafe at my house. I have enjoyed several of their specialty drinks and found them all to be quite good.So good and so friendly!

7.description: Roger's Park is on the rise again.  As the masses look for more affordable housing and a new neighborhood to conquer,  you know the neighborhood is coming along when the cute and trendy coffee shops sprout up.  Sol, however is more than just cute and trendy.  While the decor is top notch and some of the furniture pieces are original (see the bookshelves in the corner) Sol has also managed to give the appearance of not trying to hard.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and more importantly the cofee is pretty damn great.  If I had any complaints I'd say I wish it stayed open an hour later and had a tad bit more seating, but this location is my favorite so far of the Roger's Park coffee shops and the competition is certainly there.

49.description: Love Sol! Great service, great focus, great doughnuts and lovely down to earth staff. This place is a blessing I. Our neighborhood and I hope people go out if their way to support them! My only recommendation: add more child friendly props, book/toy corner or something so parents can corner their kids in a spot that won't disturb other patrons. In always a bit nervous my toddler may be disruptive to others and having a good distraction for kids alway works

40.description: I love stopping in here whenever I have a chance ever since the first time I came here. Everyone there is so helpful and are easy to talk to feels like you're talking to an old friend  sometimes also the way they describe the coffee is so detailed I swear you can almost taste it before you  choose it.

53.description: This place is wonderful and a truly unique experience.  The area could definitely use more establishments like this.For starters, the interior is gorgeous!  Clean, modern, chic, great lighting -- it is the quintessential urban loft.  I maybe a little bias because it is very similar to my personal decorating tastes, but I just love how this place looks.The service is also very good.  Both times I stopped for a visit, the staff was cordial and extremely helpful.  I was given a rundown of the menu options and accommodated based on my tastes.  They seemed very enthusiastic too.  What truly makes this place unique is its menu.  I am happy to see that they use almond milk as an alternative to dairy milk.  I was never a fan of soy and feel almond milk complements coffee/espresso better.  They also have a unique menu of vegan treats and sandwiches.  Plus, Glazed & Infused donuts on the weekends!  But the standout item is a latte unlike any other, called The Q: corn milk (prepared in-house), a spice-infused espresso blend and a special smoky-flavored sauce made exclusively for Sol Café.  This might be geared more towards those with an adventurous palate, but it does not disappoint.  The Q was smoky, tangy and spicy, with the corn milk adding a sweet element to tie the flavors together.  It was the most unique latte I ever had!Sol Cafe might be one of the best coffee shops in the city.  This place is a must for coffee house junkies and espresso aficionados!

30.description: Great space. I like the ambience and decor, although the music can be a little loud (it was '70s disco and funk the last time I was there). I've only ordered tea, but it was very good. Good for meeting friends or having a casual meeting.

46.description: Sol Cafe is my favorite neighborhood Coffee shop. It's funky, arty, welcoming atmosphere is the best. They come up with original and delicious drinks with healthy ingredients. One of my favorites is the. "Oh My Gourd", a coffee concoction containing pumpkin puree, coconut milk, curry, and all manner of deliciousness. They have a blueberry corn muffin that is to die for - I didn't even realize it was vegan! Another favorite is the hippielicious whole grain scone. On weekends they serve Glazed and Infused donuts - the best I have had since the famous Voodoo Donuts in Portland, OR. They are also really invested in the neighborhood, and have many events to support local artists, children, etc. A wonderful spot just off the Howard el stop that deserves your coffee dollars.

1.description: Pretty awful experience.Coffee was meh. Typical drip. Employees? Rude.Internet? Didn't work on my phone or chrome OS computer. 'Just restart it.' Thanks, I just did. Five times. 'Well then I don't know.'  Yep, I'm aware.So I get to go work at the Jewel Starbucks a block away. Joy. Least it was cheap, but I won't waste even $2.70 here again.

55.description: In love!  This is a picture perfect, homey, arty coffee house.  The staff was welcoming,  warm,  and friendly. They normally offer vegan pastries, but today the selection was down to a " hippie granola scone."   No problem.   The scone was hearty and delicious and filled with healthful sunflower seeds. Hippie indeed!   It came with cherry jelly which was the perfect compliment to the scone.  I also ordered a chai with almond milk.  They make their blissfully perfect chai in-house.  No mixes here. My friend thoroughly enjoyed his croissant and soy latte, which had the beautiful leafy flourish on top of a thick foam.  This place is so cool.  It's only a minute from the Howard red line stop.  Hop the train and proceed to enjoy!

9.description: Really, really excellent coffee.  They make really good chai in house too.  Pastries from local places on point.  Glazed and infused donuts on the weekends.  Super friendly staff.  My go to coffee shop.edit: now they have do-rite donuts instead of glazed and infused.... still outstanding.  :)

26.description: In the few minutes that I have spent here, I have compiled a short list of my observations for your enjoyment. DISCLAIMER: I only had coffee. No treats.I feel as though I have stumbled across a secret hipster society in the Southern most part of Evanston. - Men with beards? Check, both customer and employee. - Local art displayed? Check. - Fixtures that are unique and custom made? Check. - And most importantly, mason jars? Well double check. To serve iced coffees and as part of the light fixtures! The coffee I had, delicious. The employees were friendly. They have free wifi (something I am currently enjoying). And they have lots of treats. How they taste? I'm not sure but they look pretty damn good/sound good based off descriptions.I would definitely come back here (and maybe add more substance to this review). That is all.

25.description: Delicious coffee and snacks.  Great atmosphere as well.  A wonderful local spot.  Everything was delicious. I love the fact that they had a WiFi cafe and a printer for us all to use as well.  I hope they awill be here for years to come.

12.description: This cafe adds so much to the neighborhood. The staff are super friendly and they have a nice variety of tasty treats and drinks at a reasonable price. Great lighting and plentiful seating, I love the interior. Check it out!

59.description: Being born and raised in the WRP (West Rogers Park) / Rogers Park area, I know very well of the complete lack of unique coffee shops here. So you can imagine the pure rejoice my heart was singing when I had found SOL CAFE.This place is wonderful!The decor is awesome and extremely tasteful with large glass windows that allow   bunches of natural lighting in- which is helpful for a person with self diagnosed seasonal affective disorder such as myself. The seating is great and various: tables and chairs, counters and chairs, tables and bench, couches, and armchairs. Wonderful food: delicious soups (some of which are vegan) and awesome sandwiches. Also, Glazed and Infused donuts on the weekends - so delicious. They also have really tasty cookies and other pastries.Coffee is so... so... good from what I believe is sourced locally (a great plus!). They also have a large assortment of loose teas of which you get a free extra steeping of!Customer service is great- I'm always greeted with a smile and I actually feel like the baristas here are genuinely interested in how I'm doing. Sometimes I give a longer response than necessary...I must also mention the wonderfully overwhelming amount of OUTLETS. Seriously, outlets everywhere.Check this place out! I mean.. yolo.

21.description: Sol is nice for a number of reasons... You can find things here that you can't elsewhere. They opened in an area that may otherwise be perceived as risky to a business person. They have great chai. I'm a regular here for their house-made chai. While the vast majority of places serving chai are pouring it from a concentrate, here that's not the case. Occasionally you'll walk in and they'll be simmering the ingredients cooking up a batch right there behind the counter.In the coffee department you'll find some drinks you won't elsewhere. The "Q" is a nice treat now and then when I'm not wanting a chai: espresso, smokey flavor, corn-infused milk, and paprika. There's also a thai drink that uses goats milk (seasonal maybe?) that I like.They have some delicious donuts on Fridays and weekends. The space is available to rent for private events, and they also host special events now and then for the general public. They also do catering. Free parking in rear makes it easy for an in/out if you're not on foot/bike.  Free wifi. They have a printer you can use.

17.description: In the few minutes that I have spent here, I have compiled a short list of my observations for your enjoyment. DISCLAIMER: I only had coffee. No treats.I feel as though I have stumbled across a secret hipster society in the Southern most part of Evanston. - Men with beards? Check, both customer and employee. - Local art displayed? Check. - Fixtures that are unique and custom made? Check. - And most importantly, mason jars? Well double check. To serve iced coffees and as part of the light fixtures! The coffee I had, delicious. The employees were friendly. They have free wifi (something I am currently enjoying). And they have lots of treats. How they taste? I'm not sure but they look pretty damn good/sound good based off descriptions.I would definitely come back here (and maybe add more substance to this review). That is all.

10.description: Update: Come early or they might run out of apple cider. However, if you wait a little bit they'll get some more instead of just waiting for the next day to get some. Great customer service!

5.description: I've been here a handful of times and I can't seem to be wowed. The iced chai always tastes watered down and has a real muted spicy flavor. I've had the iced coffee, which wasn't too bad, but would taste like rubbing alcohol if I added vanilla to it.... :/ The last time I went, the internet wasn't working on my laptop AT ALL (which never happened a year ago) and I was connected but every single website I opened up would be blocked. So, I don't know. I love the interior of the place and I was excited when I first discovered it, but I want a good drink and this place just isn't doing it for me.

3.description: Sol Cafe is Sol good. It brings the neighborhood sól. Its employees have soul.My favorite thing about this cafe...oh man there are so many favorites...is the fact that I had one of the best vanilla latte's ever! You know it's good when there is no sweetener required. When I placed my coffee order I was asked if I wanted two or four shots. That was a first! This coffee shop is beyond hip and cool. Come in for coffee, made-to-order sandwiches starting at $5.95 (I'll be back for those), Glazed and Infused donuts, and pastries that are fresh and not dry like so many other cafes. Come in for a cafe stop, shop for cool art prints covering the walls, play games, use the place as an office and hook up to the printer for all your print needs. Here I was served the freshest almond croissant I've ever had - anywhere. I'm not sure if it was brought in from another bakery (I assume so), but I'll be back for another one of those for sure. Though my croissant was beyond moist and tasty, the Glazed and Infused donut case called out to me. How could one pass up a white chocolate praline with lavender honey cake donut? Oh not me!Such a welcoming communal cafe. They also host art events and private parties. If you haven't been here before, it's Sol worth it ;-)

35.description: Sol is everything a café should be: quiet, uncrowded, excellent service, artwork all over the walls, and delicious coffee drinks that are beautifully prepared. I got The Q, which was smoky and a little sweet, and so good. On top of that, they were doing $1 donuts from Glazed and Infused as it was evening and they were trying to get rid of the donuts. Well it took little (meaning no) convincing to get me to buy one. On top of THAT, they have chalkboards and chalk in the bathroom and encourage patrons to unleash their inner Picassos. As I was leaving, they were setting up for a musician, but sadly I couldn't stay for the concert. I would love to return and peruse their book selection, as this is the kind of place I could easily spend all day at. I'll definitely be back.

19.description: I consider myself a coffee and tea extrodanaire and so a place like Sol Cafe makes my top 10 list.  The location is ideal  and reflects the diverse cultures of Rogers Park.   From the amazing front entrance of windows to its wonder pipes and exposed brick interior,  you know its going to be a wonderful experience.   Friendly staff that is knowledgeable and honest with suggestion and the coffee and food to back it up.  Under the weather? You have to try the Dr. Feelgood and the Mocha is amazing.  As for  sandwiches... creative and absolutely delicious lick the plate worthy.   This is a place you have to experience.

28.description: I consider myself a coffee and tea extrodanaire and so a place like Sol Cafe makes my top 10 list.  The location is ideal  and reflects the diverse cultures of Rogers Park.   From the amazing front entrance of windows to its wonder pipes and exposed brick interior,  you know its going to be a wonderful experience.   Friendly staff that is knowledgeable and honest with suggestion and the coffee and food to back it up.  Under the weather? You have to try the Dr. Feelgood and the Mocha is amazing.  As for  sandwiches... creative and absolutely delicious lick the plate worthy.   This is a place you have to experience.

45.description: Simone has done an awesome job with this establishment. I go in a lot -- but not as much as I'd like to. Everything is top-notch, and Sol is a real asset to Howard Street.The staff is always friendly, the atmosphere relaxing, the coffee and food first-rate. I really can't say enough good things about Sol Cafe. I'm very glad it's in the neighborhood.

33.description: Stopped in for coffee and a cup of soup on a cold day. Friendly staff and great service. The coffee is top notch!

43.description: Sol Cafe is fantastic!! :)Decor: The best. Seriously. Some of the best decor/layout I've ever seen in a coffee shop.Coffee: Oh man. The cold brew iced coffee is sooooooo good. Smooth, tasty, not bitter. Great coffee!!Staff: Extremely friendly, helpful, etc. I had a problem with the Wifi a couple of mornings ago and Simone made sure it was up and running again within minutes and made sure I could get online.This will definitely be a regular stop of mine in Rogers Park! :) Best cafe in the neighborhood by FAR!

2.description: The low rating is for the WIFI. I love this place; I've spent countless hours and dollars here and I want to do more of that! But the Wifi has gone downhill and is not dependable. There aren't tons of people online- it's of average capacity. I've never had this problem at a coffee shop before and its a real downer. It wasn't specifically my computer, a friend was with me and had to use her hotspot.They need to fix it or upgrade their system. Otherwise, I really really love this place. Chill vibe, great music, fun and friendly servers and parking!

18.description: Rustic and creative. Great lighting, better drinks. Lots of different types of seating: comfy chairs, intimate tables, long tables for groups. Just east of the Howard L stop. My favorite coffee shop on the far north side.

41.description: I have to admit, I have a "thing" for coffee shops. No longer a bar goer, I like to hang out in coffee shops with atmosphere. Starbucks is fine but Cafe Sol is like it's younger hipper sister. I went in to work on my resume as they have free wi-fi. The staff is edgy in appearance but could not have been any nicer. I had a black coffee in a ceramic mug (I hate drinking out of paper cups) and a Hippie Granola Scone. Both were perfection. Plenty of outlets for laptop charging made it comfortable for me to sit and work on my resume for 2 hours. I did not feel rushed at all. They play an eclectic array of music at a volume loud enough to enjoy but not too loud to spoil your concentration. There is also a book section with adult and children's books to borrow with an assortment of classics along with beach reads. Someday, I'll ditch the laptop and come in just to read. Oh and drink coffee too. Cafe Sol is a welcome little business amongst pawn shops, dollar stores, and cheap mexican restaurants. Do yourself a favor and skip Starbucks this week and check out Cafe Sol!

52.description: I can only rate this based on my coffee-to-go experiences.Pro:Coffee is goodService is relatively fastCon:Signing for a $4.00 charge on my debit card?  Aren't we past this part in 2014?Server did not wash hands before pouring my coffee.  Gross.  Please wash hands if you are serving and taking money. Really.  This is not cool.Server chatting up other employee (off duty) while taking and preparing my order and while taking the debit card for my order (perhaps this is why she did not wash her hands)/I have a planned get together here soon.  I will come back and provide deets on that.I am VERY glad this place exists on Howard Street and hope they do their best to stick around and keep their heads down.

50.description: I really dig Sol Cafe. Great ambiance (exposed brick, rotating local art, large windows in front filling the place with natural light), good coffee, and snacks! Snacks include cool sandwich options, cookies, scones, cheddar muffins (with whole eggs inside them) and Glazed & Infused doughnuts on the weekend. Yay doughnuts! They've also got a number of outlets if you're planning on making this place your office away from the office. The reason for the four instead of five is the iced coffee refill price. Unless this has changed very recently, it's a full price refill. I would even go 4.5 since they are freeing up the internet from the 2 hour restriction.

4.description: Saw a fellow yelper (old high school friend too) review this cafe so I had to come and try it.  Rolled out of bed, nagged my husband to come with me, grabbed whatever clean clothing we had and headed out on this chilly morning amidst the sleep in my eyes. Quick splash of water and I was good to go. I have enjoyed frolicking to different coffee/tea joints just because I am too old to go "clubbing" and I enjoy some free WiFi with my caffeine buzz. So here's the gist of the visit. Easy to find, easy to park:  Score for me. Staff non pretentious and friendly. Score. Place has nice natural light, a great open layout that I appreciate. There are books available to read if you are so inclined. Drinks:I had their espresso drink called "The Q". I really enjoyed it. It has a smokiness to it and such a creamy taste and it didn't harsh my buzz from the caffeine from the espresso.  Yum. They serve Glazed and Infused doughnuts on the weekend so it was a must to pick one of those beauties to go with my coffee. My husband is more simple in nature and had a regular coffee that he enjoyed with his G&I doughnut. The only thing nerving was two lil pumpkins (kiddos) barging back and forth in the ladies restroom making it hard to focus on the task at hand when I went to the ladies room. LolOh by the way, they have chalkboard walls in the restroom that are dope! Chalk available to write any positive message if you so choose.I will be back as I enjoyed the place and will try their own signature grilled sandwiches. I don't mind taking the drive there. Support your local coffee shops, they are just lovely! Peace!

6.description: The place has a Bohemian vibe, the coffee tasted good, my girlfriend's tea tasted fine.I'm just a bit upset that they may have stopped making fresh sandwiches to just making a few in advance and storing them on a display like Starbucks. Fresh is always better. Talking about fresh, they used to have a sandwich called Twerky Bird. Jam, Dijon, Turkey, and cheese all in a panini. And they somehow made it work, it was bomb.Overall, still a solid café for beverages, I like the vibe, the staff, the patrons, and the smaller things like cups and plates. Just a damn shame fresh sandwiches are no longer served here.

22.description: Nice locally owned coffee/tea shop for the area.  Clean, spacious, and much better coffee than that place with green mermaid as their logo.  The staff is great, upon my third visit, they already knew my order (2 shot soy latte) which makes me feel like a regular.  WiFi, and plenty of outlets if you want to connect while you caffeinate yourself.  Books made out of paper on the shelves if you left your Kindle/Ipad at home, and there are board games if you wish to partake.  Music is very eclectic...one day its oldies, next is Beastie Boys.  Nice.  Stop by and support the locals, enjoy a cup-o'-joe, and relax.

15.description: I really like this place. There is lots of sunlight beaming into the place, hence SOL cafe, and it has a very comforting atmosphere. The staff is all very friendly and down to earth. I can't forget to mention, they have great coffee, and a nice selection of pastries. I'm a big fan of the hippie granola scone. Also, glazed and infused on weekends? Yes, please! It's also a good place to stay for a while and get some work done or read a book.

57.description: The place is very cosy. the wooden tables, the coffee filled sucks, the decors..nicely done. I also enjoyed my macchiato.  Pretty strong. The staff is courteous.

20.description: Saw a fellow yelper (old high school friend too) review this cafe so I had to come and try it.  Rolled out of bed, nagged my husband to come with me, grabbed whatever clean clothing we had and headed out on this chilly morning amidst the sleep in my eyes. Quick splash of water and I was good to go. I have enjoyed frolicking to different coffee/tea joints just because I am too old to go "clubbing" and I enjoy some free WiFi with my caffeine buzz. So here's the gist of the visit. Easy to find, easy to park:  Score for me. Staff non pretentious and friendly. Score. Place has nice natural light, a great open layout that I appreciate. There are books available to read if you are so inclined. Drinks:I had their espresso drink called "The Q". I really enjoyed it. It has a smokiness to it and such a creamy taste and it didn't harsh my buzz from the caffeine from the espresso.  Yum. They serve Glazed and Infused doughnuts on the weekend so it was a must to pick one of those beauties to go with my coffee. My husband is more simple in nature and had a regular coffee that he enjoyed with his G&I doughnut. The only thing nerving was two lil pumpkins (kiddos) barging back and forth in the ladies restroom making it hard to focus on the task at hand when I went to the ladies room. LolOh by the way, they have chalkboard walls in the restroom that are dope! Chalk available to write any positive message if you so choose.I will be back as I enjoyed the place and will try their own signature grilled sandwiches. I don't mind taking the drive there. Support your local coffee shops, they are just lovely! Peace!

36.description: Sol cafe had real soul-- friendly, down to earth staff, delicious coffee, and for the neighborhood. Free wifi and great music keep me coming back time and again.

14.description: I love Sol Cafe! Good food, good drinks, good service...what's not to love?Their coffee is top notch. These folks take their coffee seriously, but not too seriously -no one will judge you based on your order, so don't worry about that. Coffee not your thing? They also have a nice selection of tea. In addition to your usual coffee, latte, or cappuccino, they have some seasonal options available that are always interesting and worth a try. Pastries and food are also good, and on the weekends, they have donuts.Yes, I love their coffee and treats, but my favorite thing about Sol Cafe is that it is always welcoming and friendly. The staff are genuinely nice and always helpful. They are great about making recommendations and answering questions. Sol Cafe is my new coffee spot in Rogers Park. I will gladly go a few blocks out of my way to visit Sol when I'm in the neighborhood and in need of a caffeine fix.

28.description: A friend and I went here for dinner, and we tried the pholourie (on the house), jerk chicken roti, and goat curry. We were offered the hot sauce on the side, and it was extremely spicy. Overall the food was good. Service was friendly but inattentive; we were the only two people eating in the restaurant, and yet we still had to ask for water and extra napkins several times.The interior is simple, clean, and brightly colored. Street parking is available.

1.description: I am giving 4 stars based on the excellent courtesy of the staff. I am all in favor of supporting small business. The restaurant is a storefront located on the south east side of Howard street, slightly east of Ridge Avenue. 1. The restaurant inside was very clean ( do not judge from the outside or neighboring businesses)2. There is only street meter parking.3. You need to call ahead when you know you are going. Also a good idea to know what you might order. This being a small business not all menu items will be available . Also, the business hours published do not match the hours of operation. Make sure they are open before you head out.4. If you are from Trinidad or recently been to Trinidad, this is not authentic Trinidadian cuisine. Rather it appears to be a fusion of soul, Jamaican, and some aspects of Trinidadian. So if you are a picky Trinidadian ( Like most of my relatives especially the Indian ones) and you are super picky about your spices, then you may deem this to be closer to Jamaican style spin on "Trini " cuisine.5. One of things I wish I had asked is if they use Adobo type spices or seasonings because those do contain MSG and I had a dinner guest who is MSG and sodium sensitive.6. The Salad appears to be whiter basic iceberg lettuce. I wish it was a mixture of other lettuce varieties, even a butter lettuce would have been an improvement.For a fairly priced lunch its a better alternative than fast food.

9.description: This review is regarding their operations and not food.I have attempted to visit this establishment twice, on separate occasions, when their website, FB page and Yelp claimed that it was open but it was closed. PLEASE UPDATE ALL MEANS OF COMMUNICATION regarding business of operation. A flyer on your door does little or nothing to notify new or existing patrons.Especially consider setting up a voicemail.

29.description: I was walking by Taste with some extra time when their lunch special caught my eye- $5 for a plate of jerk or stewed chicken, plantains, beans, rice, and cabbage. Sounded like a deal to me, and I'm happy to report that the food was fabulous. The portions are relatively small- I was full by meal's end, but had I been really hungry to start I don't think it would have been enough. For the price, variety, and taste though it was definitely worth it!

23.description: Closed even though they said they weren't what gives.

5.description: A friend and I went here for dinner, and we tried the pholourie (on the house), jerk chicken roti, and goat curry. We were offered the hot sauce on the side, and it was extremely spicy. Overall the food was good. Service was friendly but inattentive; we were the only two people eating in the restaurant, and yet we still had to ask for water and extra napkins several times.The interior is simple, clean, and brightly colored. Street parking is available.

31.description: I went to Trinidad many years ago and have been missing this food ever since! Food was delicious and authentic, portion size generous, and very friendly staff. I got the curry chicken roti and it was great - can't wait to go back and try the goat! The only reason for 4 stars rather than 5 is that they don't deliver... Yet! The neighborhood is a bit iffy (though improving) and I'm not sure I would come here after dark... But would definitely order delivery for dinner!

25.description: Yes yes yes!! Grubhub jackpot with this place. Curry goat was amazing, very lean, very tender. Roti is outstanding as well.

12.description: I was walking by Taste with some extra time when their lunch special caught my eye- $5 for a plate of jerk or stewed chicken, plantains, beans, rice, and cabbage. Sounded like a deal to me, and I'm happy to report that the food was fabulous. The portions are relatively small- I was full by meal's end, but had I been really hungry to start I don't think it would have been enough. For the price, variety, and taste though it was definitely worth it!

37.description: The Best meal I had in CHICAGO!! Great quality and tasting caribbean Food!!!! I recommend trying EVERYTHING. thetasteoftrinidad.com

21.description: We are so happy we came here! Everything was delicious! From the doubles to the jerk salmon, oxtail, goat curry...even their Mac and cheese was fantastic! We were a crowd of people from India, Taiwan, Bahamas, Columbia and Italy and each one of us were happy with our dishes. Great for families with kids too. The owners were extremely kind and accommodating. We will be back!

16.description: A new neighborhood restaurant that offers great food at reasonable prices. I had the jerk chicken dinner and it was incredible. Very juicy, if a little greasy, and wonderful spice. The plantains were caramelized to perfection and the cabbage was sweet. I will be going back soon.

17.description: Yes yes yes!! Grubhub jackpot with this place. Curry goat was amazing, very lean, very tender. Roti is outstanding as well.

10.description: After reading the warnings from other people on here that this place isn't always open when their hours say they should be... I called first before coming for lunch. I'm glad I did, because even though the website said they'd be open at 11am, they said on the phone that they wouldn't have food ready till 1 or 1:30. I guess this place is a little too authentic :)If you are willing to deal with their inconsistent hours, it's worth it. The roti is spot-on phenomenal. I've been to Trinidad. I had roti from a handful of respected shops and carts around Port of Spain. The roti that I had here at Taste of Trinidad in Chicago is as good as any.I had the goat roti; I'm sure the chicken or beef would also be good. One thing to know about eating Trinidadian roti is that the cooks tend to not de-bone the meat. This makes eating this form of wrap a little more complicated. You wouldn't want bones in a burrito, would you? I'm not sure why they don't like to take the bones out, but this is the case both in Trinidad and at this restaurant. I still need to come back on a weekend to try their doubles. And if they do doubles right it'll make living through Chicago winter a little bit better.

11.description: Delicious, with all the right spices roti...yum, currie chicken...delicious and they don't skimp on the portions. Island hospitality is complimentary :) Glad it's been added to the Rogers Park area, I wish them nothing but huge success!

26.description: I lived in Trinidad for 24 years, and come here for awesome, true-to-the-islands Trinbagonian food.

27.description: Really good authentic food. The Roti was delicious both jerk and curry. Delivery service was fast and courteous .

35.description: A new neighborhood restaurant that offers great food at reasonable prices. I had the jerk chicken dinner and it was incredible. Very juicy, if a little greasy, and wonderful spice. The plantains were caramelized to perfection and the cabbage was sweet. I will be going back soon.

8.description: After finding out that our initial choice for Sunday lunch is still close at 12:30 pm, we wandered around Rogers Park to find a replacement.  We started off as the first guests at the restaurant and though there were a couple more patrons that came in, she has always checked on us if we needed anything.  Our server was attentive and described the dishes pretty well for us that have never had Trinidadian food.  We had the pholourie (fried dough) which came with a tamarind and mango sauce-it was amazing!  This will be ordered the next time we visit.  Afterwards we ordered the curry goat and chicken roti and both were excellent.Will definitely be part of our restaurant rotation!

0.description: The first time I went, I was blown away. The second time I went, I was addicted to the food. The third time I went, it was because going somewhere else would have resulted in me being severely disappointed that I didn't come here.I have had chicken roti, curry shrimp, grilled shrimp, jerk chicken, curry chicken, peas and rice, cabbage, pholourie, ginger beer, and sorrel. All of it was authentic, as I've had Trinidadian food before.For food this good, I don't mind going up to Rogers Park at all.

38.description: Ahhhh... My life is now fulfilled! I had the curry chicken, it was so tender and flavorful. I also had Palori, cucumber chow, and ginger beer which were all good!

20.description: I had the curry goat and really enjoyed it. You get a lot for your money. Wanted to try the jerk chicken but it had another 45minutes to cook. A good option if you're looking for a Caribbean meal in the north suburbs.

19.description: Really different and totally delicious. The meat is cooked perfectly. You get SO MUCH FOOD, even with just the lunch size!

33.description: Delicious food and freindly, hospitable service. The veggie roti is fantastic, and the homemade rum cake can't be missed.

2.description: We came here on a super hot day in the summer.  Unfortunately on that day they did not have the AC on.  I'm not even sure if this restaurant has AC!  But we came here for the food which did not disappoint.We ordered the plantains, ox tail curry, goat curry and a hibiscus drink to quench our thirst and cool us down.  I really enjoyed the drink and the ox tail. I am not a fan of goat meat but my friends really like the goat curry.  We also ordered a potato roti as an appetizer. It was delicious as well.  Service was friendly. I'm glad we came!

34.description: Let me start off by saying that if you're reading this review during business hours, you may now excuse yourself from reading (you can continue reading later)......you need to be headed to this restaurant PRONTO!!As a native Trinidadian who lived in NY for the past 17 years (until 2013, when I moved to Chicago), I can appreciate a good Trinidadian restaurant. Since moving to Chicago I have yet to find a Trinidadian spot that I wanted to visit; that was until I found Taste of Trinidad on Yelp 3 days ago. I went there that same night (Friday) and purchased a goat roti. The guy that served me was very nice; he told me he thought I'd enjoy the food and that I should come back tomorrow (Saturday) for doubles; because that's what I really wanted. Anyway, I left and it smelled so good in the car, I was ready to get home and get to it. I got home, opened up my roti and started to eat. Man, was that roti tasty. I mean, not just the roti skin, but the curry goat, potato & chick peas was all so delicious. I shared it with my husband and he was doubly impressed. We enjoyed that roti, just like the server said we would. And not only was the roti tasty, it was pretty big too. Next day (Saturday) I went back; purchased some doubles (thank God they had some for me), pholourie, jerk chicken lunch (with rice & peas) and a side of fried plantains. Let me just say that after all the Trinidadian restaurants I've eaten at in New York (and I've tried many), this restaurant in Chicago called Taste of Trinidad puts them all to shame. I can honestly say that this is THE BEST Trinidadian restaurant I've eaten from. The food is so flavorful its crazy. And the sauces they serve on the side.....OMG....they are a wonderful addition to the meals, but certainly not a necessary one. Fast forward to today (Sunday), and believe it or not, I was back at Taste of Trinidad for dinner. We purchased a goat roti (again), doubles (again) and the curry shrimp dinner (with rice & peas). My husband, my friend and I got home and we enjoyed our tasty dinner.Not only are the meals tasty, but the portions are so very filling. Next time I have got to try other menu items....I say next time because I am now a loyal customer of Taste of Trinidad.....visiting them 3 days in a row should say something. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this restaurant; the people working there are very friendly and the food is mmm mmm good. Like I said before, THE BEST I've had.......EVER!!!!Thank you to the cooks and staff of Taste of Trinidad. If you haven't already tried this restaurant, you need to get there ASAP!!

32.description: Best place for Carribean food I have come across since 1994. Hands down best place north of Roosevelt. Great concise menu. Goat curry is five stars and the service is attentive and prompt.

18.description: I had the curry goat and really enjoyed it. You get a lot for your money. Wanted to try the jerk chicken but it had another 45minutes to cook. A good option if you're looking for a Caribbean meal in the north suburbs.

13.description: Came with my friend who grew up n the islands...From the rice n peas to the perfectly done roti's, we were happy while he was having nostalgic waves. The curry goat was delicious!Come, enjoy!

4.description: I have been hearing of this new restaurant for quite some time but just today got a chance to try it out. Let me tell you, I did myself a HUGE favor making my way to the place. The staff are extremely knowledgeable, attentive, and welcoming. The food was out minutes after we ordered! Everyone of my friends and I enjoyed our plates... I had to tear myself away from my channa and aloo roti topped with in-house hot sauce. The calypso music playing made the meal even sweeter. With the clean and inviting ambiance, Taste of Trinidad is a restaurant that cannot be surpassed. It's wonderful to see this new gem add to the wonder of the city of Chicago! If you are in the area, I see no better place to eat than right here. Big up to all the owners and workers of the place! -Sydney

24.description: Had an incredible experience. The staff was super friendly and patience. We ordered 2 doubles, chicken soup, chicken curry dinner w/ rice & peas, chicken curry roti, jerk chicken dinner, & curry goat dinner for four people. Each meat dish was PERFECTLY tender. The soup was made from scratch. All the ingredients were fresh & delicious. The spice & seasoning was spot on! We are so coming back but we are going to order ahead for curry oxtail & parratta. Highly recommend others to go. The sorrel was delicious. It was not overly sweet & very refreshing. It was a very yummy experience.

6.description: I had the curry chicken roti with the in-house habanero sauce fabulous I do warn you though be careful with the habanero sauce it does have some kick but if you can get past the heat the flavor is spot on

22.description: Every time I am in New York I make a pilgrimage to Ali's Roti Shop in Brooklyn (and then to Allan's Bakery).. So I was excited to see Trinidad come to  my neighborhood. The goat rotis aren't as good as Ali's: too much potato, not enough meat and no chickpeas; but they're good. They were out of doubles by the time we got there. It's a family operation, really sweet young man working the tables but he was clearly overwhelmed even though the restaurant was mostly empty.

15.description: SOOOO GOOOOOOD! Much better than the one in Bronzeville! Roti wraps melted in your mouth! The doubles needs to be hotter not sweeter but overall - next best thing to moms cooking or back in Trini!

7.description: Well i thoroughly enjoyed this food, we had the brown rice n peas which is pelau n jerk chicken and stew chicken with macaroni pie and cabbage. It was all very tasty. The pie was very cheesy n oh so good, Jerk chicken is moist n well seasoned n falling off d bone . Might i mention we were both trini n this food gets our stamp of approval. Place was nice clean cool n neat too. U cya go wrong with this food

36.description: Great food and owned by a great family. Really enjoyed all my meals but the curry crab and dumplings are to die for! Just have lots of napkins

30.description: Great addition to the Afro-Carribean mix in Rogers Park. (much closer than driving to the South Side).Decor is nicer and roomier than we expected for a new restaurant entry with colorful walls, art, and dark wood tables/chairs. Sidewalk sign was out front advertising lunch specials. I think today it was one of the stew combos and 2 Trini tacos for $5 (or was it $4?). If you haven't had Trinidadian food before, go ahead and ask the friendly staff who will describe anything on the menu and make suggestions as well. We went ahead with the curry chicken roti, doubles (chickpea curry between two fry breads), and pholourie (chickpea flour fritters), and Trini tacos. To drink I tried a mauby - house brewed - like a anise flavored root beer. Housemade rum cake was our choice for dessert.Service was great...all the staff pitched in and a carafe of water was available at our table. Food did come out quickly to our table even though they had other customers after us sit down and order out. (but we were first in the restaurant). With the roti closing closer to $10, 2 tacos at $5, and apps less than $5 - I'd say this is closer to the one "$".Having designed the entrance to the restaurant with inner and outer doors, keeps out the cold with the heart of winter coming.

3.description: Stew chicken was a bit salty but still good. Glad I found doubles in Chicago. Macaroni pie was delicious, can't wait to try more.

14.description: Friendly atmosphere. Great island food. Oxtail stew was very good. Goat roti is delicious. The people are very friendly and very accommodating.  I try to stop by anytime I am in Chicago.

3.description: This is a great florist. I popped in one day to see if they had any cheap potted plants. My view is of a brick wall so I needed a little greenery to brighten my life when I'm in my apartment. I found baskets full of small potted plants for only $8.95 each. They have a good selection of plants all at very good prices. Their flowers look amazing. They're always working on arrangements and they look stunning. The next time I need to send flowers I'll definitely use them. Check this place out for all of your floral needs.

1.description: I worked with her for my wedding ceremony and reception. In a nutshell, I highly recommend her. I had no idea what kind of flowers I wanted to use and how to arrange flowers for the ceremony and reception when I came in. After about 30 minute meeting, everything was just ready from arrangement to delivery. What's more, I was on a tight budget and didn't want to splurge on flowers but still wanted to have all basic elements for wedding. Well, she was nice enough to adjust her initial quote so I can stay within my budget. On the wedding day, she arrived at the wedding location early enough to set up everything. Flowers were very pretty and fresh. I was so happy with my bouquet. It was beautiful. Anyway, there was nothing to worry about flowers on my wedding day. Thanks a lot Monica!

0.description: Looking for an affordable florist for your wedding day is not an easy task.   I visited two others before going to Rogers Park Florist and was drawn to this business mainly because of the owner, Monica.  She exudes this confidence, in a good way, that she is the best florist for my wedding.   My fiancé and I met with her to provide some of our ideas and thoughts but allowed her to be creative in her design.  She made me feel as if I can TRUST her to do a good job and she definitely did.  THIS bride was definitely thankful!

2.description: I've received 4 bouquets from this place so far and all have been absolutely beautiful!  Each one has lasted a week or more.  I also sent a bouquet to someone from here and they are so nice over the phone and did exactly what I asked for.  That was also another bouquet that lasted a week.

5.description: Really great florist! They have fresh, beautiful flowers. I walked in to get a bouquet for my friend's birthday and they were just so friendly and sweet and was very mindful of the budget I gave them.I think that I will have fresh flowers more often in my apartment now that I know there's a great florist nearby!

6.description: My story began Friday evening, on-line, as I was searching for a business that could send flowers the next day to my friend.I looked at ProFlowers, Teleflora and 1800Flowers some could deliver the next day but the charge was $15-$20. The earliest delivery for some was Monday or Tuesday. So my husband suggested I try the place across from Chuckie's on Morse. He said  he had a positive experience doing business with them when he bought flowers for me from them before.So I called  Roger's Park Florist to see if they were still open but it turned out that they were already closed, however the gentlemen on the phone told me that they will reopen at 10am on Saturday.The next day, I stopped by on Saturday morning and immediately saw very pretty already  made arrangements. I said I would like one just like that made. The florist lady agreed and took the information. She said she could deliver the flowers at 1pm the same day for $5. Wow!!!I asked her how will I know that the flowers were delivered. She said I can call them by 3pm and check. I said ok and left.At 1:05pm someone called my cell phone. I picked up but there was no answer. I recognized the florist number.  I was worried for 5 minutes but I figured that most likely  they got the telephone numbers confused. At 1:10pm my friend called me to thank me for the flowers.Mission accomplished!

7.description: I stopped in on a whim while walking home, thinking that if I was going to be drugged with allergy medication anyway, I might as well enjoy some pollen in my home. :-) It's a little shop packed with plants, vases, and fresh flowers. I asked if I could order a bouquet and the lady answered, "How much do you want to spend? I'll make it right now." Not five minutes and $11 later, I was holding a beautiful bouquet for my table, full of big, colorful spring flowers. It's been four days so far and the arrangement is still going strong - buds are still opening and nothing has wilted. Convenient location, great value, great service. I've found my Chicago florist.

8.description: I love this florist.  Monica makes great floral arrangements.  I have been ordering roses for my husband for the last 4 to 5 years.  Their bouquets are gorgeous.  Whenever I go to my husband's office people ask me where do I order these flowers from.  Excellent flowers, great customer service and delivery on time.  Thanks Monica!!!

9.description: Such a lovely place. I have stopped here twice for flowers. They have made wonderful bouquets. One of them was a total over-the-top arrangement to welcome my partner home...they went all out to make something complete gorgeous. Also, I have worked with them to deliver flowers to my mother - unlike some other places, they don't substitute! They send exactly what I ordered. Very nice and prompt service, too.

10.description: Rogers Park Florist has been the official florist for The Morgan and they change the arrangement every week. They are exceptional in quality as well as service. I love the tropical flowers and they are capable of any type of design from traditional to contemporary. It is my pleasure to give them 5 stars and the highest recommendation!

4.description: Nice people , beautiful bouquet , went above and beyond to deliver flowers when addresee was not available. Called me 3 times to follow- up. Good service. Would recommend greatly.

1.description: I will admit I haven't been inside a Sally Beauty Supply Store in someyears but I decided to go and visit them yesterday because my placeof employment has put so much grey hair on my head, be warned myyounger Yelp Friends, Stress will do this to you!So, since I like being a Blonde, and hey, I may like being a Blonde butDumb Blonde will never apply to me.. pffft......I walked inside this place and right away a grumpy woman/person asked if she could help me find something, geez, give me a minute here, I just walkedin the door!This Sally Store location is very small with cramped quarters, and I sawsome nice girly stuff like Curling Irons, Blow Dryers, lots of nail polish,and a whole bunch of fake eyelashes.I also found the aisle with the hair color/dye and boy, was this confusing,they had like hundreds of colors/shades, in lotions and crèmes, yadda, yadda.I stayed in this aisle for about 5 minutes and started to get a headache fromall the hundreds of color choices and wound up leaving the storeempty handed, Sorry Sally, no sale, no ca-ching for you!So, in ending this sad story of my grey haired existence, I wound up goingback to my place of employment which has given me stated grey hair andbuying a color kit!Welcome to my life....

2.description: The girls always seem to be too busy to help.  I just get what I came for and head out.  The store is very clean and I can always find what I'm looking for.

0.description: Sally's is a bit crowded -- not because of people, but because of how small the store is in the neighborhood.  But still, it's a good place to find most hair and beauty products.  There always seem to be sales and discount deals going on as well.

58.description: Sometimes I just want to sit around naked in a bean bag chair eating cheetos.  When I want those cheetos to be Egg foo young, this is the place I go.  The gravy is not overwhelming and it certainly does not hinder those inticing patties.The beef and broccoli is solid, and so is the sweet and sour pollo.  So the next time you consider lounging in the buff, you can do so knowing there's some take out that would love to join you.  Long live the Hut!

56.description: I thought this place was super yummy!  One of the better chinese places I have ever been to in Chicago!  My only complaint is that I think it is over priced!  If you're looking for good chinese food, go here!

29.description: Best Chinese Food in the city. Love the Ginger Chicken, Combo Fried Rice and Mongolian Beef!

42.description: Lunch special is amazing. I asked what I should try between the sesame, orange, general taos chicken. The gentleman at the counter recommended that I try the burbon chicken. It was amazing. The chicken was crispy and coated with a nice sauce that tasted like a spicy sweet and sour sauce. Came with delicious pork fried rice and a drink. For under 6 bucks the serving is equivalent to 2 filling meals. I will definitely come back.

23.description: I would avoid this place.  The person who took the order, rude.  I gave clear instructions on how to buzz into my building to the order taker.  An hour after order, i have a guy calling me on my phone, lost in front of my building, and has no clue my name.  I told him I gave them clear instructions, and gave him instructions.  He had no idea how to operate a simple buzzer.  The soup I ordered was cold, and the sweet and sour chicken was cold and rubbery.  This is not good chinese food.  I'm surprised they still stay in business.  There are a lot better chinese in the area, do not order from this dump.

47.description: As far as chinese food goes in Rogers Park, this place isn't bad.  THe mongolian beef was tender and plentiful although I wish it had more onions, and the general tsao chicken was very tasty but not as spicy hot as they claimed.  My daughter got the hot & sour soup but did not like it.  The spring rolls were bland and the wontons were good. We will be trying more dishes there again.

8.description: Tonight my boyfriend and I tried China Hut for the first time. We ordered the Golden Sesame Chicken and a pineapple bubble tea. The tea was great, but the chicken was a huge disappointment. The "sauce" is so hard and caramelized that every bite will stick to your teeth. The bottom of the dish was coated in a layer of rock-solid sauce. I'm not a picky eater but this was pretty unbearable. I'd recommend the tea, but stay away from the sesame chicken.

31.description: If I could give 0 stars, I most definitely would! Tonight was my first (and last!) time ordering from here. I placed an order for delivery and after an hour had to call and see where my food was. They said it was on the way, no biggie. I live less than a mile from this place so when another 20 minutes went by with no food, I began to get irritated! I called a second time and was told that my food was on the way (still? again?). I was told to call back in 5 minutes for a discount if I still had no food. 10 minutes later I called for a discount. Finally, after almost 2 hours, my food had arrived!Most of my food was cold, which I was afraid of since it was on it's way 40 minutes ago. Some of my food was not included and the rest was mediocre at best! I called to ask where the rest of my food was and of course there was no answer...all three times! Ultimately the 25% discount I was given covered the cost of the tip I would have paid and food that I never received. I guess now the question is, will my discount be reflected on my credit card statement, and will anyone fix the bill for the food I paid for but never got?Order at your own risk, you've been warned!UPDATE! The discount was reflected on my statement, however I never received credit for the food that I was not given!

34.description: they used to be much better, still decent  employees might get kind of cocky time to time...

16.description: Food is great and affordable!! The lady taking orders can be a lil ride at times but if you go on a Saturday afternoon you will be greeted by an awesome 10 year old lil girl taking orders!!!

13.description: I occasionally order from here and I don't have complaints but today I ordered an extra large COMBINATION fried rice and there was no meat in there. Like how???

11.description: Today I ordered beef and shrimp fried rice, My appetite was ready to accomadate the large order. The food  was horrible, not only did I taste the grease but it housed the smell of can grease. Just greasy and without flavor. I haven't eaten from China Hut since they relocated. What is going on

39.description: Ordered at 6:30 and food arrived past 8:30 pm. Food was very cold almost as much as the person who answered the phone called claiming "well he have deliveries". That doesn't mean the food should be over two hours late when the place is 10 minutes away. Food might be ok but not worth 2+ hours.

37.description: Terrible place. Decided to try this place since we live in Rogers Park and it was terrible. Order the food at 6:54 pm and it did not get here until 8:41. When I called to check the girl answering  the phone was very rude and said the order "showed" that it was on its way so she couldn't help me. When it finally got here it was warm and it wasn't even the right order. Out of the whole order that we did get, only edible thing was the mongolian beef (and at that, my husband was the only one who liked it) wished I would have read the reviews before I place the order! Waste of money and time!

0.description: This is the place you go to when you want a solid lunch on the weekends after a night of partying. The food isn't of the greatest quality (ie. Beef can be fatty) but the vegetables are always crisp, the shrimp is always big and tasty, and the chicken pieces are large in the fried rice. They also have pretty good bubble tea options, but tonight when I ordered my food at around 8:30, they were out of tapioca balls. They apologized, but it wasn't that big of a deal. The strawberry and mango smoothie was still delicious.I ordered off their Thai menu just to see what a neighborhood Chinese neighborhood could do with my favorite cuisine. I'd give them 2.5 stars for giving me a "crazy noodle" dish with large fresh shrimp but with noodles that were not too flavored. The noodles were large and not really cooked in any distinct sauce. Overall, if you want a decent meal from here, you can order the typical General Taos chicken or Lo Mein to satisfy your fast food Chinese cravings.

38.description: CONSISTENCY is the key to any business... and they do it right at China Hut.... always the best food for the price....  I order pick up to avoid the long delivery time , so I can't speak to that part of their business, but my orders are always correct- as I am very picky with my veggies- and hot and delicious.  NICE !

51.description: I am definitely a fan of China hut! I live in RoPo and work in Evanston and they deliver to both!!! They have pretty good afforable food, especially the lunch specials. :)

27.description: What a miserable experience. Order #: 1481891Ordered at 8:20. Called and was told it was on its way. I asked for an ETA. = "When it gets there. Called at 9:20 told it was out for delivery. 9:30 get call from driver to come out and open my door. I'm sick like a dog with the flu and this moron wants me to come out and get the food. NICE. Food is ice cold. Like drove with it on the hood cold. Egg Rolls completely inedible. Soup luke warm. Mongolian Chicken congealing. I call to complain = " Sorry we closed" Fortunately the neighbor's dog likes cold Chinese Food. Will never order from here again. I understand mistakes get made, but to be outright rude and tell customers to open the door and come out is ridiculous. Maybe they can put "Good Service" on the menu. :( Hour and Ten minutes for cold food. THANKS.

32.description: I have lived in Rogers Park for 6 years, and China Hut has been my go-to for fast, delicious Chinese food. The crab Rangoon and friend rice (pork and chicken) are awesome. They also have great smoothies, with or without tapioca, that are fresh. The atmosphere inside the restaurant is nice too, so it's a good place to eat in if you are looking for a quick bite.

54.description: There are three basic kinds of chinese food joints:-your hole in the wall take out seeded randomly in a neighborhood.-your hole in the wall restaurant in chinatown.-your chinese buffet situated in/around a shopping plaza.Location dictates China Hut would be your neighborhood take out hole.  But this has to be, by far the cleanest, hole in the wall take out Ive ever stepped foot in.  Its practically a wide open kitchen..which isnt exactly common with oriental spots.  Usually its a small order up counter that you could spy into the kitchen if you care to.  Young hispanic girls upfront taking orders and helping with final prep of dishes.  A debate arose whether the food was actually chinese cooked; though I did see asian faces by the burners.
