Question the authenticity if you must but the fact is no matter whose manning the pans, they cook up a good rendition.  And its refreshing to order with a full english conversation back and forth.   Decor and seating arrangement mimic that of a small scale chinese buffet.  Upkeep is quite imminent as I noticed mopping was done on two separate occasions.  Yes, my circle of friends are strangers to the silent, all business, dine and dash meal.  We actually enjoy our food and each others company.  So it goes without saying that we were there for sometime sampling one anothers food and engaging in some tom-foolery.  Not only that, it is quite a task to finish the food.  I feel it necessary to mention the generous portions that are given here.  A table of friends and family style is how you want to tackle it if you decide to dine in.  A few items off the menu should be more than enough for the house if carry out is the route taken.   I felt like i just walked out of a buffet after I finished up.  Like I mentioned to a friend..all I needed was my soft serve to complete the experience.  I did get a sweet part of my meal though.  They serve up shakes/bubble teas..which seem to be almost a necessity now.  I guess its the trend now that if you have an oriental restaurant of some sort, bubble teas go hand in hand.  Ive had Taro/Coconut at several places and its usually hard to get right.  This is where they surprised me the most as they were pretty spot on.  They only have one size but its pretty big and its only $3.

48.description: Great Food at a Great Price...my go-to for Chinese in Rogers Park

44.description: Very typical chineese restaurant. Since they moved accross the street the interior is much bigger, better, and a greater sense of feeling clean. They have a public washroom that is clean as well. Recently I feel they changed their recipe for beef fried rice. i asked about it and they put white peper in it now. I liked the orignal version better. They can do without the pepper. Nice place.

24.description: I ordered through eat24.com:  Chicken w/peapods, curry fried rice, and two egg rolls.  It would arrive in 40-60 minutes, according to eat24.That didn't happen.  Try nearly 1 hour and 45 minutes.  An online inquiry to eat24 had indicated that the food was en route.  A call to inquire on the order's whereabouts was rewarded with someone who was unaware that eat24 existed.The food did arrive during the phone inquiry with the otherwise useless person at the restaurant.Aside from the spotty delivery time, the food is generally pretty good.

7.description: Best Chinese restaurant in rogers park. In my experience, the service has always been good.

49.description: This place has the most consistent, cheap, Americanized Chinese food in the area. It shows because they are now VERY busy ever since they changed locations, and might explain why they moved in the first place. I have spent much more time here just waiting around for my food then I would for any other so called Chinese restaurant. Sometimes they get so busy it is literally impossible to keep up with shear volume of orders that are being placed. Be patient...good, cheap food is more than worth waiting for.

40.description: OK, back up to three stars. Our last couple of orders have been very decent, with no noticeable problems. The large portion of egg foo young is pretty enormous. The curry chicken was pretty tasty, even if I wish celery were not the dominant vegetable, and I really liked that they dispensed a decent sweet sauce into a cup instead of just dropping in those pre-portioned packs, which I think always manage to taste less good than the stuff they typically put on the table. I agree with Matt R that the meatball potstickers are a little odd to eat, but the gingery dipping sauce they included made up for my not adoring the filling. Though I keep hoping I'll find my Northside nirvana for cheap Chinese takeout, China Hut is most consistently meeting our needs.

53.description: Not bad dingy Chinese food.  They argue with patrons though.

30.description: Ok I would give the food 4 stars...but the overall review gets knocked down to 2 stars because of the extremely bad delivery service. I ordered via my Itouch using the Eat24 app at 6:10. Someone called from the resturant a few minutes later explaining what I ordered was a lunch special and not available. Ok thats fine just give me a small order of the beef w/ peapods. Email says 45-60 minutes. This too is acceptable since thats  what most of the delivery times estimate.7:10 - No Food so I wait.  7:30 - No food ... I go to Eat24 website and talk to Justin a very nice  live customer service rep who after looking up my order says its on its way and should be there momentarily.7:55pm Food finally arrives. Crappy delivery and not even an apology from the driver let alone a discount off the food.Food review Hot & Sour Soup - Tasty but more like tepid and sour because of the late delivery.Pan Fried Pot Stickers - Large but seemed to be kinda doughy. Tasted ok considering the too were tepidBeef With Peapods - This was good. Plentiful with the beef and peapods. Not all carrot and onion  with a nice sauce. This seemed to be a little warmer then the other stuff. maybe because it was packed in the middle of everything. Even cold this would be good. And finally the free egg roll because my order was over $10 - Good inside but somewhat oily /Soggy on the outside. And there was no Sweet/sour sauce for the egg roll.Everything was packaged well. No leaks and the condiments/utensils/cookies were packaged it their own bag which I liked alot tho they could have included a napkin.Would I order again? if I drove, definately.  But I am currently residing in rehab facility with no mode of transportation. All I have is delivery. Wont order again for that reason only.

46.description: This is not PF Chang's but for a delivery Chinese Restaurant, the food was pretty good! We will order again.

1.description: Confucius say: "If you want Thai food ... don't order from Chinese restaurant!!!"This is China Hut's version of Pad Thai. I'm beyond disappointed! If you've ever had real PT, then you know what it looks/tastes like. This had no egg, no bean sprouts, no green onion, about 5lbs of noodles, half a sliced chicken breast, chopped dry-roasted peanuts (which was the only thing distinguishable from the noodles!) ... and everything was doused in their "special sauce" which turned everything red!  Never, never, EVER again will I order Thai food from China Hut. It's still the best Chinese food I've had in this area, but I'll find a Thai place for my next Pad Thai craving! And to their credit, I called Marisol to complain - I mean tell her how unhappy I am with their version of PT, and she issued me a credit. Thanks, Marisol.

55.description: Ive only been to China Hut twice, but both times were good!I love salt n pepper anything, first off. The first time I went, I ordered the salt n pepper porkchops. This time, I had the salt n pepper smelt. I dont like how they changed the smelt though, the first time I went w friends and they ordered it. It came out how it usually does, in the full fish size. This time though, it was breaded fish nuggets of smelt but just as tasty.The staff are definitely friendly and accomodating, I asked for a coke and the lady at the counter gave me one on the house. Thank you! =-)The portions : wow. If anything, any review should be bumped up a star for the portions they give! I mean theyre good to begin with, but they give you a LOT!If you like chinese food and youre in the area, definitely check out China Hut

9.description: I usually order from little wok in Evanston off Main Street which I love their food. However my boyfriend and I decided to try China hut one day as it was closer to our apartment. We ordered the orange chicken ,chicken fried rice. And spring roles. The first thing I noticed was the orange chicken was really orange. All I could think of was the amount of food coloring used in the sauce. The  rice was extremely greasy and over cooked. The spring roles tasted like I bit into a sponge of grease. Usually when ordering fried rice I'm able to eat off of it the next day but when I looked at it in the refrigerator in the morning it was spewing  in grease. I knew going to a place called "China hut" would probably not be gourmet food. But please don't serve your customers grease bowls.

26.description: The fried rice was cool but the bourbon chicken was a complete FAIL! The sauce of the chicken was good but the chicken was fried so hard and it had so much breading on it that you couldn't even taste the chicken. The egg roll was nice and crispy but I won't be ordering any breaded chicken from this place again. Overall it was cool....not a place that's on the top of my list but not on the bottom either.

25.description: Just ordered from them today.  Good delivery time, very reasonable prices, and a very heavy bag!  I got: 4 eggrolls, one order of crab rangoon, 1 small beef fried rice, 1 large Jumbo Shrimp egg foo young, and a small beef peapods.  It ran me 32 bucks, which ain't bad for all that food.  The egg rolls were crispy but the filling was not good, they were combination shrimp and chicken and tasted really overmuch of chicken, there was hardly any shrimp.  The crab rangoon was great, and they gave me some of the nice sweet sour sauce in the sauce bag, which has a generous amount of soy sauce, hot mustard (which I LOVE), and sweet/sour sauce, plus ample fortune cookies.  That beef fried rice was perfect.  God.  It's been a while since I had great beef fried rice.  They know what they're doing with that.  So I'll be ordering from them again just based on that.  Their shrimp egg foo young had great big pieces of shrimp in it, but the sauce has a sweetness to it that's very off-putting.  The patties are also not packaged separately from the sauce, so you can't go make your own out of soy sauce and cornstarch.  Sucks.  I blew 8.95 on something I usually go gaga over.  The beef peapods, however, were great.  Overall, this is still an improvement from China Dragon, where I used to order from religiously but had to stop because their quality and standards dropped below ocean level.  I will be ordering from this place from now on, just with care.

12.description: Been going to China Hut since it was across the street. Pretty good and I've tried most everything they make.

59.description: Ordered $30 worth of takeout from here right around the corner from us. First mistake was to do it on a Sunday night right before they closed. Second mistake was to do it at all. We had: Vegetable Delight - Overcooked vegetables in a heavy white garlic sauce with no real soup base- nothing exotic like a Buddhist Feast, just your ordinary run of the mill stuff with a few mini corns thrown in. Hard to imagine that this was really a Chinese dish. Vegetable Lo Mein -because they ran out of Chow Fun noodles (affectionately known in our household as greasy noodles.). This was mostly noodles with very few vegetables but at least it had some peapods. Hot Sour soup - this was overcooked and had reached a steady state of uniform brown. Perhaps it suffered from being ordered at the end of the day. Moo Shu Beef - came with 5 rather thick pancakes (sort of like the ones you have a breakfast), no plum sauce and scallions cooked to shreds in an already overcooked dish. It did not have tree ears or  tiger lily buds. It was better than everything else which is not saying much. In addition we got a free order of pot stickers. These were very large, greasy with some sort of mystery meat bouncing around in the hollow interior. Again, these appeared to be made long ago. We also ordered one spring roll (just to try) which was greasy and had nothing fresh or spring-like in it. When we picked up our order they forgot to include our Mango shake, and we had to ask for it. It appears they do not cook with lard (see a previous review) but use fresh vegetable oil throughout. Got lots of soy sauce packets (which had MSG in it - suggesting that they use msg in their food), but no duck sauce. It is hard to believe that this place is so successful that they have two branches and have recently moved to larger quarters. The four of us ate about half of every dish. We threw all the leftovers out except for the Moo Shu which we might try for lunch tomorrow with some fresh scallions and a thin pancake with real plum sauce.The shake was pretty good.

21.description: I used to order from this location all the time when they moved from one side of the street to the other. But quite a few times I got food delivered. Then I went inside the place once when I walked by and watched my food being prepared. I was absolutely grossed out to see the cashier go from taking my order, handling other people's money and credit cards, to going to make a strawberry smoothie for me. At no point and time did she wash her hands and she peeled the banana with her bare hands. No gloves. The cashiers don't seem to do anything to protect their hands from touching your food. I stopped going for a couple months after that, but I really do like their Thai fried rice and the crab rangoon so I got a delivery a few months ago.I waited an hour and a half. They claim it takes an hour for delivery but this had bypassed that time. I called back to cancel and as soon as I said how long it'd been and I'd be canceling, a cashier slammed the phone down on me. I called back to speak to a manager. Now there are only 2 or 3 girls in there who answer the phones so I know they know who hung up the phone but all of them played innocent. And while I was on the phone, the delivery guy was at my door. But something about the food just looked gross. Maybe it was all the debating, but I'm convinced something weird was in the sauce. I just find it really convenient that five minutes after I complain, the delivery guy suddenly shows up. And the rice tasted like three-day leftovers. I haven't been back in that place since November and never will again.

17.description: I used to order from this location all the time when they moved from one side of the street to the other. But quite a few times I got food delivered. Then I went inside the place once when I walked by and watched my food being prepared. I was absolutely grossed out to see the cashier go from taking my order, handling other people's money and credit cards, to going to make a strawberry smoothie for me. At no point and time did she wash her hands and she peeled the banana with her bare hands. No gloves. The cashiers don't seem to do anything to protect their hands from touching your food. I stopped going for a couple months after that, but I really do like their Thai fried rice and the crab rangoon so I got a delivery a few months ago.I waited an hour and a half. They claim it takes an hour for delivery but this had bypassed that time. I called back to cancel and as soon as I said how long it'd been and I'd be canceling, a cashier slammed the phone down on me. I called back to speak to a manager. Now there are only 2 or 3 girls in there who answer the phones so I know they know who hung up the phone but all of them played innocent. And while I was on the phone, the delivery guy was at my door. But something about the food just looked gross. Maybe it was all the debating, but I'm convinced something weird was in the sauce. I just find it really convenient that five minutes after I complain, the delivery guy suddenly shows up. And the rice tasted like three-day leftovers. I haven't been back in that place since November and never will again.

10.description: Okay China Hut use to be my go to spot. The love has ended!!Ordered mu shu chicken with pancakes. When did tortillas become the pancakes???I'm nauseous  from the mu shu and about to throw up a little literally. Glad I ordered the papaya and mango smoothies. Enough enzymes to quell the nausea. What's going on, the fresh is gone, funny smells, beige filled plates and grease. Not working people. Not working. So sad. I enjoyed many a meal here. Now I'll end this diatribe with a tripTo the bathroom for some pepto bismol or kaeopectate which ever is needed first.

5.description: First and last time I will ever order from this place. I ordered online and they had my address incorrect for the delivery person. It took over 90 minutes and when I had called to inquire about the delivery time I was hung up on and had to call again. They said it was on its way and it took another 30 minutes. My drink order was incorrect and they omitted an item, and the food was cold.

3.description: For this place stick to the basics. I come for the pork fried rice on a regular.The honey rose chicken is delicious,also great. Basically anything that is a lunch special is probably your best bet. Stay away from the padthai noodles.

35.description: Good food, cheap prices, but...filthy restaurant.  Clean your windows and tables...they're Disgusting!

19.description: I ordered through eat24.com:  Chicken w/peapods, curry fried rice, and two egg rolls.  It would arrive in 40-60 minutes, according to eat24.That didn't happen.  Try nearly 1 hour and 45 minutes.  An online inquiry to eat24 had indicated that the food was en route.  A call to inquire on the order's whereabouts was rewarded with someone who was unaware that eat24 existed.The food did arrive during the phone inquiry with the otherwise useless person at the restaurant.Aside from the spotty delivery time, the food is generally pretty good.

28.description: I had heard good things about this restaurant, but I was upset by the service they provided.  I ordered a large lunch order, and had given them my card over the phone.  The lunch order was a gift for some friends, and they still charged my friend when they got to the apartment.  I hope they charge back to my card, but if they don't I'll be calling back.  C- service.

45.description: Okay, this place is pretty bad ass. I like how their online ordering, when it says spicy, is pretty darn spicy. Not "lightened up for americans", but decently hot stuff. The schichuan, curry fried rice, etc, are all quite awesome.  The thai dishes are also good, and no nasty chicken surprises in the pineapple curry chicken I got either.The potstickers are kinda funky - they have a tiny meatball in a big wad of dough, so after you eat the mealball you have like 1/2 the dough in each potsticker left. Also these guys are really inexpensive, too!Overall, I am very pleased. First time ordering from here for delivery, and I'll probably be ordering again at some point.

33.description: This place is fantastic good food seating smoothies out of this world wings huge portions, prompt, polite, i could go on and on.There are some places where you  feel confident to try every thing on the menu this is that kind of place .The only thing it does not have is parking, if it did  it would be packed and it usually has a decent crowd that is dispatched promptly I might add .

43.description: Tails said: Not impressed. General Tso had no spice, and tasted like fried chicken smoothed in BBQ sauce. Sonic said: If you're looking for cheap chinese food on the northside then you wont mind this place too much. In this neighborhood there are a lot of mexican restaurants and this gives some balance to food options on Clark st., Do not get the General Tso chicken. It is just chicken rolled around in some generic general tso sauce (no vegetables or seasoning). The fried rice is 'ok' at best. It's best to take out here - don't dine in.

2.description: I've been ordering there for years & the food along with the service gets worst & worst as time goes by. Today was my last day ordering there as they refused to deliver my food because I didn't have a ID & hung up in my face along with other disrespectful actions  & remarks. I ordered here plenty of times before to hear such nonsense ! I'm going to complain to the manager tomorrow since they said he or she wasn't available when all this was happening. If my complaint isn't resolved by them I'll complaint on a much higher scale...

18.description: Terrible beef fried rice.  The beef was clearly spoiled.  I had to call the city and report it.

41.description: One night last week, my family and I had a craving for some chinese food.  Not so much a craving, we just didn't feel like cooking anything at home.  Anyway, we were trying to think of where near the house might be good.  We had always passed by China Hut on clark but never stopped by.  We were familiar with their Lawrence location, so we thought it might be okay.Looked okay when we first walked in, but that impression soon changed.  We ordered the food and sat down.  Their were some high school kids there that kept going in and out of the place.  Using the restroom then leaving.  They were being kind of noisy and disruptive, enough for the police to stop by twice!  The food was decent, but there was way too much sauce on the sesame chicken.  It was like chicken candy, it was sticking to my teeth.  There was a lot activity outside of place, high school kids again, some grown people with no particular place to go.I had to go get the car which was parked down the block and had to pass by the place to turn down Clark.  A young man, who was standing right in front of the place motioned to me flashing gang signs.  I thought to myself "come on man, how old do I look"?  That type of element will drive away business.  It sure made us decide if we ever want China Hut, we are sure not stopping inside to eat.  Delivery at best.

52.description: I used to say that bad Chinese food is like bad sex, at least both take care of an immediate basic need. One problem with that is when you don't even get the basic needs met, suck (oops, I mean such) is the case with China Hut.Where to begin? My wife ordered Mu Shu Chicken which comes with those thin pancake tortillas. Unfortunately, my wife wasn't able to eat this as the pancake tortilla's were actually Mexican tortilla's with mold on them (A complaint to 311 was shortly placed so Public Health could investigate). The egg rolls I ordered were not received (something I didn't find out until I got home) and the crab Rangoon was basically cream cheese Rangoon since there wasn't even a hint of crab in it. All in all the meal was flavorless and greasy.Following the partially digested meal (as we didn't immediately notice the lovely mold) I was 'fortunate' enough to spend the latter parts of the the evening in the bathroom playing Angry Birds (kill two birds with one stone, so to speak).In any event, I don't need to go here again as I don't think my bowels or bathroom can take it.

50.description: Been eating here for years - Great food at decent prices but not so great delivery drivers...

4.description: It was good the first time I ordered.  Yet after the past few, the texture and the taste changed.  I liked the chef I had the first time I ordered from China Hut.  He was great.

6.description: Love the place. And I've tried about 80% of the menu over the years. FYI: Went there to order in person once. Saw a roach crawl right across the counter. I pointed it out to the girl. She acted like she didn't see it. Well, that's all it took for me.It's a shame too. I really like their food. And haven't found any restaurant in the area that can compare. Sometimes I will order due to my children's insistence. Then my husband points out the incident, and I feel ashamed.   : /

22.description: I have been ordering lunch at work from here for years.  Some things they do well, others they should just take off the menu.  Really, the appetizers I get, egg rolls, steamed pot stickers and crab rangoon, are normally very good.  Occasionally the rangoons are a little over done, but I'd say 9 times out of 10 they are great.  I also enjoy their fried rice, I've only done the pork, chicken and vegetable.  The pork can be a bit fatty at times.  I normally order the Chicken with Broccoli lunch special and I've never had a problem with it.  Big chunks of chicken and plenty of broccoli.  Today though, I decided to change it up and went with the Golden Sesame Chicken on the "Chef's Specialties" section of the menu and if this is what he specializes in, they need to find a new chef.  Virtually inedible.  It is basically fried dough with hints of chicken.  It was totally over done to the point where I couldn't even chew some pieces.  In the picture, it shows it sitting on a nice bed of broccoli? I got 4, yes 4 pieces of broccoli for an order that I wouldn't be able to finish in one sitting.  Also, whereas the chicken with broccoli has several large pieces of chicken that need to be cut before eating.  90% of the "chicken" with the sesame dish was about the size of the tip of my thumb and less than 50% of that was actually chicken.  I'll go back, due to convenience, but I think I'm done trying new things on the menu, I'll just stick to my guns.As other people have talked about slow delivery, when we order for lunch it is always delivered in a timely fashion.

15.description: Solid neighborhood Chinese. Nothing crazy, but it tasted good. No problems if you don't feel like cooking on Friday.Good: -Shrimp with broccoli-Eggroll-Chicken with broccoli-Steamed pot stickers

57.description: I never really complain about businesses unless they really suck. Sadly, this is one of those reviews.China Hut is one of the few places in the Roger's Park area with a glimmer of hope for decent Chinese food. Who else offers roast duck and can deliver?  Anyway, I ordered it last week and turned out to be way below edible: dry, flavorless, burnt duck. Ok, so maybe obscure items are NOT their specialty. Let's give this another try........ This evening, I called in my order of spicy salt smelt and hot & sour soup. I placed my call at 8:22 pm. I expect to give delivery orders a reasonable time of about an hour - I live about half mile away from the restaurant. Sitting at home, waiting patiently.....ate an apple to curb my hunger......called in at 9:35 to check on the order, was told by the girl answering the phone that my order went out and she was sorry for the delay but they were really busy........waited a little longer expecting dinner to arrive any minute......had some cheese and crackers in the meantime .... waited a little longer.....finally, my doorbell rang at 10:04. I answered the door to the delivery guy who apologized for the delay. He offered me a 10% discount, but I refused the food since I realized I was no longer hungry and was full from my snacking while I was waiting. So, the lesson here is that if you want a light, healthy, inexpensive dinner......call China Hut for chinese takeout and fill up on snacks around your house while you're waiting for your food to be delivered (insert sarcasm)

20.description: I just wasted $22. The food took 1hr and 15 mins to get to my place when I don't live far away. The shrimp fried rice tasted funny and they left the tapioca out of my smoothie. My smoothie was melted time it got here. I'll never order from here again Do yourself a favor and don't! I lost my appetite waiting for the food. Smh

36.description: Don't do delivery from here.  I had been eating China Huts food for 13 years.  I love the food but hate the delivery waits.  Waits are usually 1 hour but Tonight I'm still waiting after 4 phone calls to them.  First follow up call was after an Hour to Find out how much longer and was told "you meal is on the way"  Second follow up was another half hour later and was told "I'll give him a call".  After two hours I was told "the driver called you and was told no one ordered any food there".  And when I asked to speak to the General Manager... "they said they are to busy to talk to you now".  Have you ever wanted to tell someone.  Well that food you were suppose to drop off to me... well you know where to stick it!

14.description: This place has what seems like the par for Chicago Chinese take-out. And that's a bad thing when it comes to quality. Taste is awesome. The sauces are rich and flavorful. But the chicken that comes in such dishes as General Tsao's and Sesame chicken are all fatty and have very little white meat. It's mostly breading, which is disappointing because the sauce is so yummy. I haven't had any issues with delivery, but I live about a mile away. Food arrives hot and quickly. The prices are competitive and they have a valuable lunch special that includes a small entree, a side of steamed or fried rice, and an egg roll or soda can. The new location is clean and looks nice with plenty of space to eat in.I can't recommend this place when there are so many other better choices out there, unless they are the only ones open and you need it. Order from En Lai or Lao Sze Chuan in uptown. The former is tasty and well-priced and you'll have to wait longer and pay more for the latter, but it's better quality than China Hut.

58.description: My girlfriend and I was really craving thai food and I decided to look at what was around. I called, and the man that took my order was very nice. I order two pad thai, one chicken and one beef. I asked for the total and I was shocked to hear it. I was about to cancel my order because it was really pricy but he ensured me it was good. I got my order and I tried it for the first time. WOW best tasting pad thai I ever had, the portion are huge as well. You won't be disappointed.

56.description: This is the best Thai restaurant in the world. Also, the guy who runs it is the nicest man ever; you feel like he's your new dad or something when he is waiting on you, and then you realize you real dad sucks. The pad se ewe\ is the best I've ever had, the portions are huge, and you can sit on the floor with no shoes on. This place is the best, hands down.

29.description: The food alone warrants 5 stars. Every meal of my party of four was exceptional. Yet, in addition to the great food was a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The service is friendly and attentive. And owner is very kind and had a nice conversation with my party for some time. It is BYOB and cozy. Highly recommend!

42.description: No Complaints for the food, it was all House made and the best Thai I've had in a great while. However the amazing food out of the kitchen is not worth the lack of service and 2 1/2 hour wait after taking our order. This does not include the wait our small party of 3 had once seated to receive water. If it wasn't for the referral from one of my guests and the mere company of friends I wouldn't have waited. I'd say take out would be the best option. This place has amazing potential its a shame they don't have the help they so desperately need.

23.description: Had an absolutely lovely time here. We brought our toddler and sat in a window booth with pillows on the floor. I love that this is an option. The food was great. Although it is a little pricey, the quantity makes up for this. The three of us shared two meals. My husband had pad thai, which was delicious. I tried the cashew chicken, also very good. The food and atmosphere are wonderful. The waitress was very nice and enthusiastic. The owner was super friendly and welcoming. The only negative I experienced while eating here was that there was only one waitress. She took our order and got our food to us quickly, but didn't really come back to the table after that. The place was pretty busy, so we had to flag her down to get our check, and also for her to pick it back up. All in all, we had a great experience. We'll be back for sure.

47.description: I, too, have walked past this place forever and had never tried it before. HUGE mistake!  The food's fantastic here and ranks amongst the best Thai I've had in town. Seriously. Everything we ordered was better than expected and I can't wait to start turning friends on to this new-found gem.Two things to know in advance- 1. Dishes are prepared to order, so don't expect to just run in quickly and chow down. It may take a while, so relax- this ain't your normal 'hurry up, we gotta' turn these tables' eatery. It's BYOB, so pick up a choice bevvy at Hahn's to the west on Devon, have yourself a drink and chill out. 2. Prices are a little higher than normal. But the quality and freshness of the food in addition to the portion sizes make it well worth the few extra bucks.  Anthony was a wonderful host and genuinely nice guy who obviously cares about his guests and his establishment. Though it was our 1st visit, he made us feel like we were old friends. Go and enjoy!

8.description: Had an absolutely lovely time here. We brought our toddler and sat in a window booth with pillows on the floor. I love that this is an option. The food was great. Although it is a little pricey, the quantity makes up for this. The three of us shared two meals. My husband had pad thai, which was delicious. I tried the cashew chicken, also very good. The food and atmosphere are wonderful. The waitress was very nice and enthusiastic. The owner was super friendly and welcoming. The only negative I experienced while eating here was that there was only one waitress. She took our order and got our food to us quickly, but didn't really come back to the table after that. The place was pretty busy, so we had to flag her down to get our check, and also for her to pick it back up. All in all, we had a great experience. We'll be back for sure.

31.description: Very beautiful place and amazing food. Antony was a great host and he talked about owning the restaurant for 15+ years. Great iced Thai tea and very authentic Thai food! Also had a unique and refreshing fruit dessert!!! I hope to come back again soon. The small seating area near the windows and sitting on cushions really makes the experience at Thai Spice a unique and one of a kind experience.

34.description: Lived near here for many years before trying this place. Wished we had found it sooner. Quickly became my favorite Thai restaurant. Can't make a trip here without talking to the owner who is very proud of their food. Be ready to take your time with dinner. It's BYOB so bring a bottle and enjoy the atmosphere - the food is worth the wait. Every bite was delicious. It is the quintessential mom and pop place. Small staff, cozy vibe and a warm feel. They open at 5pm so call for a table if you plan on dining during prime hours.

16.description: Took forever to serve the food we only order an appetizer and a plate, No any advise for new costumer, I want to get desert but the waitress looks like she didn't know the menu. The food was good, but very expensive for 2 things.

13.description: Stopped here on my own one night after hearing good things. The service was amazing- my server, Anthony, was very attentive and friendly. I never mind dining alone, but he made me feel very welcome in a way that some servers do not. The food came out very quickly, I ordered the pad thai. It's not spicy, and I like spice, but it was very delicious. Not too ketchupy or sweet, very peanut heavy. The portion was very large, I definitely had leftovers. Would definitely come back!

11.description: You don't know how lucky I feel to have a place as good as this near my school! This is probably one of my favorite places for Pad Thai and Thai Iced Tea. The owner is also a sweetheart-he always tries to make conversation with the customers and is just a really nice person. I'm on winter break right now, but when I go back to school, I'm definitely dropping by again!

39.description: The service was terrible, it practically was 30 minutes  until i was brought  my entree.  Grand opening..grand closing.

37.description: Just moved to the area and been looking for my to go thai spot! Just had leftovers from last night and still awesome. Ordered the mongolian beef and pad kee mao both were yummy. Owner anthony is the sweetest !

0.description: I can't believe I didn't find this place sooner. This is some of the best thai food I've ever had and I've had my fair share. Everything they serve is delicious, fresh, and homemade. I can't even pick a favorite, because all their dishes are really wonderful and incredibly flavorful.For the traditional take out, the pad thai is FANTASTIC. Previously my boyfriend and I have gotten the Pineapple Fried Rice, Thai Spice Gaprow Kai, and Pad Seiw for the main course. All of them are delicious. For appetizers, we've gotten Crab Puffs, Egg Rolls, and the Cucumber Salad, all of which are freshly made and cooked.Really, I can't express how great this place is and the owners are just lovely people. I hope this place stays forever, because I always come back hungry for more!

38.description: Thoroughly pleased.  We had 4 people and spent about $54 total.  I really have nothing to complain about other than it was raining outside.  Seated right away, got our food quickly, and we were finished.  The place is BYOB and the owner told us how much a liquor license cost.  OMG!  I see why it's BYOB.  He would have to jack up his prices to cover the cost of that license.  The owner is super nice and willing to talk to you as long as you want to.  Quality ingredients and it shows in the taste.  I'm not from Chicago, but will be back to Thai Spice the next time I'm in town.

51.description: Ever since moving to Evanston... I haven't found a Thai food place that really hit the spot. Every other thai place was just so so... but this place is definitely a hidden gem! It's located close by Loyola and by its appearance.. you might not think much of it when walking in.. but these are the best places right?! In this case, it really is. Tony and his wife have had the restaurant for a while... and they're good people. I've been here on multiple occasions and each time.. I have left with a smile on my face. My favorite thing about this restaurant is the SPICE. Here's a tip: they advertise spice levels 1-5, but if you get to know Tony.. he'll let you go up to a 10, but ONLY if he trusts you! But... here's a fair warning.. 3 is already up there.. so be careful! I've had the pad see ewe and the pad thai so far.. and both are AMAZING with great flavor. The only thing I thought was odd about the restaurant was how they serve the thai tea. It's served in a wine glass... and there's not much of it.. it's not worth it (to me)... which is why I think it's more of a 3.5 instead of 4 star rating. Anyways.. enjoy!

27.description: Stopped here on my own one night after hearing good things. The service was amazing- my server, Anthony, was very attentive and friendly. I never mind dining alone, but he made me feel very welcome in a way that some servers do not. The food came out very quickly, I ordered the pad thai. It's not spicy, and I like spice, but it was very delicious. Not too ketchupy or sweet, very peanut heavy. The portion was very large, I definitely had leftovers. Would definitely come back!

32.description: Home cooked Thai food. Antony (the owner) and his wife are always welcoming. Great place for vegetarians!!

54.description: Best Thai in the city, undeniable.  It ruined me for other Thai restaurants.  Anthony, the owner, is extremely nice and always makes us feel like we are eating in his living room.  Chicago Favorite!

48.description: The food here never disappoints me, and I always leave with a full stomach and extra food. The crispy pomfret fish Is a great dish to try, as long as your prepared for the time it takes to cook the fish. This is a good choice for Thai food

44.description: Went back this past Friday after moving out of the area in 2013.  Still the best Thai I've ever had, and Tony is still the nicest person you will ever meet.  We miss you, Tony!!!  Saint Charles has some good Thai, but it still comes nowhere close to Thai Spice.

24.description: Took forever to serve the food we only order an appetizer and a plate, No any advise for new costumer, I want to get desert but the waitress looks like she didn't know the menu. The food was good, but very expensive for 2 things.

7.description: We enjoyed our dinner soooo much. The restaurant has an old fashioned decor, which is my favorite style. The food is very good and authentic.

49.description: Holy cow!!! Thai Spice is, in my opinion, the best Thai food in the city. Everything is just outstanding, and the portions are huge. The owner is also super nice. I mentioned that I hadn't ever tried Thai iced tea before, so he brought out a small glass for free. Truly a great place. I would recommend calling ahead though, because every so often they just don't open, which is sorta odd. When they are open though, they knock it out of the park every time!

40.description: I am so glad I found good thai so close to home! I love the Pad Thai (tofu)! Such a fantastic place. I can not wait to return.

53.description: This is a restaurant that I must have walked by a hundred times. I wasn't ever even sure it was open. And then I see here that the reviews are mostly positive -- overwhelmingly so. My experience was quite different. Let me start by saying that the food is very, very good. I'll get back to the food in a minute.Anthony greeted me at the door - I had made a reservation and he seemed to know it was me. I liked him right away -- friendly, gregarious, welcoming. I chose one of the traditional seats by the window, the kind where you take your shoes off and sit on a pillow. The rest of my party -- my partner and daughter -- arrived at 6pm. We ordered at 6:10 -- appetizer, soup, and two mains. The pot stickers were extraordinary -- fresh, delicious. The problem was they took 50 minutes. That was disappointing. While the waitstaff was running around like crazy, the restaurant was only about 30% full. The problem, it seemed, where the takeaway orders. Repeatedly, people were walking up to the counter only to be told that their order was going to be another 20 minutes. Some waited, some left and came back. Sometimes when they left and came back they were told it was going to be another 10 minutes. Most of the takeaway customers seemed to take it in stride. At 7:15 (over an hour after we ordered it), our Tom Kha Gai arrived. It was a generous bowl for $10 -- we barely made a dent in it. My daughter absolutely loved it -- it was her first experience with it. Tom Kha Gai in a Thai restaurant is kind of like Chili Rellenos at a Mexican restaurant for me; it's really how I judge the overall quality. This soup (this 65 minute soup) was outstanding. The chicken and the mushrooms were simply divine and the broth had a little heat but did not overwhelm the flavor. Meanwhile I was listening to Anthony taking a phone order -- an hour-and-a-half for delivery. Given that our main dishes hadn't arrived yet, I thought that was a little ambitious. At 7:45 our main dishes arrived. They were a mixed bag: the squid in black ink was amazing but the curry was weak both in flavor and ingredients. Now here's the kicker -- once we signaled that we were finished and ready to go, it was another 25 minutes before they returned with our food (which we had asked to be packed up) and the bill. That was extremely aggravating. The next day, when I opened up what I confidently thought might be a significant portion of the Tom Kha Gai for lunch, I found barely a 1/2 cup. I don't know if they spilled the rest or mixed my leftovers with someone else's, but that really pissed me off. While I don't want to discount all the glowing reviews I think there are some things going on at Thai Spice that need correcting. For starters, the kitchen is clearly understaffed (which happens in restaurants for lots of valid reasons). However, the front of the house needs to make this clear to customers. To be fair, the menu does state clearly that the food is cooked to order and, so, takes time. but over 45 minutes for pot stickers? Whatever the process is working in the kitchen should not bleed over into the relatively simple task of clearing dishes and totaling a bill. The prices, by the way, are reasonable.So we will be back but we'll probably order ahead or just do takeout. And if I order my favorite soup ever again I certainly won't trust them to transfer what I can't finish -- I'll do it myself. Finally, the entire front of the house needs to be (re)trained on two timeless service strategies: 1) never go back to the kitchen empty handed, clear finished plates away, especially when you've just been to the table to bring the next course, and 2) communicate with your customers. Let them know what's going on.I wanted so badly to really love this place. Clearly it deserves a second chance. But, at the same time, I think future customers need to be aware of the general confusion that my experience seemed to consist of.

30.description: My husband and I have been going to Thai Spice for at least 20 years. I love Thai food, and nothing compares to the quality, tastiness, sauces, and creativity of Thai Spice.  From the tofu, to the huge rock shrimp, to the real crab meat, it is all very high quality and delicious. Tony, the owner, treats everyone like a long lost friend. His wife, Oksana, is the genius chef who makes each dish and sauce.  The prices are higher, but you get what you pay for. Sometimes service is slow. However, each meal is being made so well, good food takes time.  So don't be in a rush when you dine there. Our favorites are the Crab Rangoon (huge, real crab meat, awesome sauce), cashew delight, and vegetarian supreme delight with tofu. There is not one dish I've tasted that isn't superb.  Tony has become a trained sushi chef in recent years, and it is like wise fresh and delicious.  If you care about the quality of food you eat, this place delivers.

46.description: Amazing food but a little expensive. All the food and ingredients are fresh with big portion sizes so the price is understandable.

1.description: The food here is great, but it isn't worth it for several reasons.First of all, the service is very slow. They can only really handle two tables at a time with the staff they have. If it's busy you will have to wait a long time. Because of this I would not recommend ordering pick up because it becomes their last priority. I ordered pick up once and it took two hours to be prepared.Secondly, the food is very overpriced. I understand that they use good ingredients such as wild caught, gluten free, etc but $18 pad Thai just isn't reasonable, especially from a place that isn't very nice inside and had slow service.

55.description: Absolutely wonderful authentic Thai food! I had the Green Curry and it was delicate yet perfectly flavorful... And the spice!I went for a 3 out of 5 and I had to take a couple of breaks while eating. Once you hit 5, there's a "secret" ladder you can take all the way up to 10. But no skipping levels, you have to order dishes progressively more spicy!Will definitely come back! Often!

9.description: This restaurant is the best thai food I've ever eaten and is one of my most favorite places to eat in Chicago. The restaurant is small and family owned, so service may be a little slow but the food is worth the wait. The waitresses and the owner are super friendly and add to the ambiance of the restaurant. My favorite is the massaman curry but you really can't go wrong with anything you order.

26.description: Although it might not look like much this place is a Dimond in the Devon ruff. The food is way above there local competition. Also if you like spicy this place will give you spicy. Owner is nice Nd friendly and will chat with you when you come in.

25.description: I love Thai food and I have to say this unassuming restaurant creates the most delicious Thai food I have ever eaten.  They have lovely floor seats by the windows and you take off your shoes and enjoy a remarkable evening.  The cucumber/egg salad is heavenly. Crispy, fresh, flavorful and like no other cucumber salad I have ever eaten.  I have been going to Thai Spice for years and I continuously bring friends there and everyone agrees it is their favorite restaurant in the city.  The service is kind, warm and welcoming.  It is a small restuarant and sometimes the food will come out slowly but  enjoy the pace and energy of this Chicago gem.  You feel as if you have a chef's table in a great restaurant. Bring a bottle of your favorite wine or beer to this BYOB.

12.description: Pad Thai and Drunken Noodles are out of this world. Best thai place in Chicago! Highly recommend

59.description: Some of the best Thai I've ever had. Careful if you ask for extra hot, you'll get it! Very friendly, and great food! I wish they were open for lunch.

21.description: Many of the Yelp reviews for this restaurant were quite positive, but though I'm originally from Chicago, I'm visiting from out of town.  Based on the reviews I decided to try it out.  Wow.  What a mistake.  On entering I should have known that there was going to be an issue.  First the manager informed us that the credit card machine was down and would be working with in the next few days.  Ok no problem.  Then we went to sit down and there was one other table filled.  The manager said pick any table.  We are two big muscular guys so we sat at a 4 top.  The manger made us move to a two top because it gets so busy on Friday night.  Over an hour later, there are plenty of tables open and a two person couple is sitting at the table we were rousted from.  We ordered Edamame and a spring roll.  The spring roll came out and 15 minutes later we were informed they were out of Edamame.  Offered to order another appetizer.  45 minutes in, we declined.  Our diet cokes came out and they were flat and tasted old/expired.  The waitress said that she knew they were old and that fresh diet cokes were being delivered in about 30 minutes.  Our food and the fresh diet cokes arrived in about a half an hour.  The food was good-- my noodles were a bit burnt but everything else tasted delicious.  The waitress was polite and apologetic but she clearly was having to work very hard to cover for a non-functioning front and back house.  For the steep (for Thai) dinner prices, the hassle isn't worth it despite the good taste of the food.

17.description: Great egg rolls and chicken potstickers. I liked the panang curry, though the sauce was a bit thicker than I am used to. We also had the pad Thai with chicken and it was really good. It's fun that it's BYOB. I want to try the pad see ewe next time I return.

10.description: Unexpected. There was little chance I would have happened in here simply walking by, as it doesn't look much from the outside. In fact, it kind of has the exterior of a good dive bar (which says something else for a restaurant). But not only was the dining environment quite pleasant, the food was of the highest quality Thai food I've had (including in Thailand).

5.description: My friend really wanted to come here for her birthday dinner.  She told us that it was the closest she could get to the food she had in Thailand.  She called in ahead of time to make reservations because she wasn't sure how busy it would be on a Sunday evening.   Later on while talking to the owner, he said he would recommend making reservations for Friday and Saturday nights but not so much Sundays.Oh before I forget, I should mention that this place is BYOB.  We ordered potstickers and papaya salad as appetizers.  I didn't try the potstickers but they looked good.  The papaya salad was really good.  Has a bit of a kick to it. I ordered panang curry while my friends had pad kee mao, pad thai and fried rice.The pad kee mao was my favorite dish.  The panang curry I ordered with the normal amount of spiciness but oh man, my mouth was on fire.  (btw spicy for me is sriracha sauce).The pad thai was ok.  It could have used more flavor.  A couple bottles of wine in, the owner comes by our table to say hi.  He was a super sweet guy who stayed to have a glass of wine with us and chatted for a few minutes. I would definitely come back here if I was in the area.

3.description: Probably the best Thai I've had in the city! Excellent staff as well! Everything was prepared fresh down to the chili paste. We were seated immediately, but had a lengthy wait for food. It was absolutely worth it! You can't rush quality and quantity. The waitress and owner made sure to stop by and check in while we waited, which I thought was pretty cool. They kept us up to date on the progress made on our meals. Overall awesome! I will return as often as possible in the future. Live this place!

35.description: This place was bookmarked for a while. We got to sit on floor with pillows next to the window. we forgot it was BYOB but oh well.We didn't seem to have huge issues with the wait or service, however, we were only the 2nd group of diners at 6:30pm on Sunday. it was evident that they were short staffed as more customers came in. There was only 1 waitress who was in training and the owner. the owner was friendly and passionate. We went with his recommendations. I love Thai cuisine but I was expecting something like a usual Thai spot like Opart or Royal. The food was certainly tasty but dishes are prepared differently and pricier. I was expecting something more authentic.We 1st ordered what was labeled as crab puffs. I was expecting some sort of stuffed pastry. This was just fried crab rangoon with a lot of flavorless cream cheese with tiny bits of imitation crab. this was the most disappointing part of the dinner. This had me confused on how the rest of the meal was going to be.   My go-to dish to test a place is the ground chicken and basil (pad kra prow). They had some sort of version was this which tasted amazing with the flavors soaking the rice into a soggy goodness. It made for tasty leftovers too. We also got the Penang curry noodles with chicken as well. the owner suggested/assumed chicken to us. I figured to go with what he said as it's a small operation and it may be best to go with what they have on hand or what they may be good at. I liked that parts of the rice noodle was charred crisp while still semi soft but the middle clump of boiled noodles was left unaltered by the chef. it wasn't mixed into the curry or stirred in the pan. I wasn't sure if it intentional or they forgot to mix in the curry. Other than that it tasted fine. Overall, the entrees were good. I think there are other more authentic places without the high price tag to try.

19.description: The food is amazing. The owners are super nice. If you are in the mood for Thai food. This is your place. So good. Plus the portion is enough for a couple meals. You for sure get your money's worth.

28.description: I rarely give any reviews at all, but this restaurant deserves five stars and more. Anthony's customer service cannot be beat. He genuinely cares about giving his customers delicious, authentic food and a warm, inviting atmosphere. He provides great service without overwhelming his customers, and is prompt in getting you whatever you may need. The food is served family style. When ordering main dishes, one order easily serves 2, if not 3 people. The food is incredibly tasty, fresh, and full of incomparable flavor. Prices are very fair for the amount per dish, and more likely than not you will leave with some food to take home (it just depends on how hungry you and your party are). My boyfriend and I ordered Mongolian beef and Anthony's favorite dish  (which unfortunately I cannot remember the name of, but if you ask, I'm sure he'll tell you in a heartbeat). Both were awesome, and my man said it  was the best Mongolian beef he has had. It is made with Angus skirt steak, ginger, onions, and a sauce that is clearly house made. The place is also BYOB, which I love. If you are in the mood for some delicious food, please give Anthony and this establishment a visit. I am sure you will find yourself coming back for more. I know we sure will!

45.description: Very divey place but does not have dive prices. Much more expensive than most other Thai restaurants.  There is slow service in a mostly empty restaurant. I'm guessing the food takes so long because there is only one chef.There is not as much of an extensive menu/selection, but many of the main Thai foods are listed. The best thing about this place is that they actually make really spicy food, the way us SE Asian people like it. At most other restaurants, when I ask to increase the spiciness, it usually just ends up unchanged and mild. This place is the real deal when it comes to spiciness.If you're the type of person who doesn't mind slow meandering service, this place should be fine.  If you just want to eat and go on your way, you might not have much patience dining here.

33.description: The food here is unbelievably good. I am extremely picky when it comes to Asian food and this place gets five stars from me. I got the Padga Prow with chicken, which was perfectly spiced and balanced. Great flavor profile. The chicken satay was terrific with a peanut sauce that is to die for! I will definitely be back.

43.description: The place has an interesting setting and being a Saturday night I was surprise it wasn't busy. I like that they have a traditional sitting area by the windows but those were full when we got there. I started with a Thai iced and it was good. We shared chicken potstickers, basil fried rice, Green chicken curry and Mochi ice cream- strawberry, green tea, and mango. The curry was really spicy and the rice also had quite a kick, both had very good flavors. The waitress seem new and not very knowledgable but helpful. There was another gentleman who took over and he was very courteous. The menu is small, simple, and priced higher compared to other Thai places. The food does take a while to come out so be very patient.

2.description: Although I find it somewhat odd that Thai Spice Restaurant is "BYOB", the food here is quite delicious. My wife and I both enjoyed our meals. She tried some type of ground chicken dish, while I purchased a Pad Thai with chicken. We swapped a bit of food, and I found both dishes to be flavorful, fresh and everything seems to be homemade.The owner was also quite friendly, willing to chat a bit and the wait was short. All in all, Thai Spice Restaurant is a pleasant dining experience.

18.description: I came here because of the great yelp reviews and because Pad Kee Mao is my favorite Thai dish and all the reviews seemed to say it was amazing. NOT. I mean it's O-K, but it's nothing to rave home about, especially at $20/dish (even though online it says $15.95, somehow I paid $40 for 1 Pad Kee Mao and 1 Pad Thai to-go order). Never in my LIFE have I paid this much for Thai food anywhere in this country or abroad. Not even my take-out sushi orders come out to this much. Sushi in Paris cost me the same. Perhaps my Thai food standards are a bit higher (spent years living 2 mins away from Little Thailand in LA), but Pad Kee Mao is supposed to be a suh-picy dish. This didn't even approach mild. It's one of those Thai places that cater to the white man's food palette, i.e. inauthentic.Overall, nowhere near worth the price. $39 dollars for two basic take out dishes. I can't deal.The search continues....

41.description: This is a sit down and relax restaurant.  Service is a bit slow because there is only one chef, but what you get is very good food. This is definitely a mom and pop place, and like Thailand, very chill.

52.description: Anthony, the owner, is the nicest guy! But it did take a crazy long time for my carry-out order.

50.description: Delicious ! First time trying had the chicken satay and the Padga Prow. They were both excellent! The portion on the Padga prow was huge enough to feed three people. I ordered take out on a Friday night around 730pm the place was busy as two parties of six had just arrived. The owner Anthony was so sweet he took his time, explained the menu offered me some tea while I waited. 15 mins. Was all it took and I was on my way. Thank you for a most pleasant first time experience, looking forward to the 2nd.

4.description: A friend of mine told me to stop through here to check it out. Its BYOB, so we bought a bottle of red wine to eat with our breakfast. The staff was great and the food was delish! I would have given this place 5 stars but parking is an issue. We drove around 3 mins trying to find a park.

6.description: This place was bookmarked for a while. We got to sit on floor with pillows next to the window. we forgot it was BYOB but oh well.We didn't seem to have huge issues with the wait or service, however, we were only the 2nd group of diners at 6:30pm on Sunday. it was evident that they were short staffed as more customers came in. There was only 1 waitress who was in training and the owner. the owner was friendly and passionate. We went with his recommendations. I love Thai cuisine but I was expecting something like a usual Thai spot like Opart or Royal. The food was certainly tasty but dishes are prepared differently and pricier. I was expecting something more authentic.We 1st ordered what was labeled as crab puffs. I was expecting some sort of stuffed pastry. This was just fried crab rangoon with a lot of flavorless cream cheese with tiny bits of imitation crab. this was the most disappointing part of the dinner. This had me confused on how the rest of the meal was going to be.   My go-to dish to test a place is the ground chicken and basil (pad kra prow). They had some sort of version was this which tasted amazing with the flavors soaking the rice into a soggy goodness. It made for tasty leftovers too. We also got the Penang curry noodles with chicken as well. the owner suggested/assumed chicken to us. I figured to go with what he said as it's a small operation and it may be best to go with what they have on hand or what they may be good at. I liked that parts of the rice noodle was charred crisp while still semi soft but the middle clump of boiled noodles was left unaltered by the chef. it wasn't mixed into the curry or stirred in the pan. I wasn't sure if it intentional or they forgot to mix in the curry. Other than that it tasted fine. Overall, the entrees were good. I think there are other more authentic places without the high price tag to try.

22.description: I have never been so badly misled by Yelp!  I do not understand what any of these great reviews are talking about, and I would be hard pressed to wonder if the restaurant hasn't fudged the data a bit.  The place was busy-ish for a moderately-sized thai place in the city.  My husband and I decided to check it out on a Friday night (only b/c Thai Aree is currently closed).  There are so many things that are impossible to account for in the food industry - people calling off, an unexpected super-busy night, running out of certain dishes, etc.  My review will reflect the MASSIVE DEFICITS that are under the restaurant's control.  Service:  horrendous.  When I walked in, I stood in front of the manager/guy who appeared to be running this show for at least a minute before he looked up from the receipt he was running to acknowledge me.  I don't need immediate seating - but reasonable acknowledgement yes.  We were seated, and then waited at least 15 min before any further communication - including water or wine glasses.  There was only one waitress working.  When she finally came to our table, she had horrible sniffles and proceeded to sneeze a few times while taking our order.  We blessed her and she complained about how bad her allergies have been.  As a fellow allergy sufferer, you take a Zyrtec or two to keep the sniffles in check.  This was pretty gross.  The wait time for food to come out was nuts; but I imagine this was due to short-staffed kitchen, which is sometimes hard to control.  Even after our first entrée came out, they had only brought us a single pack for silverware.  It was impossible to flag them down for anything - even w/ that annoying/hate to say it "EXCUSE ME!" that I was forced to call out; so my husband ate the pad thai w/ the massive serving spoon.  We again waited what felt like an eternity for the check; as Waitress Sniffles brought it to us, she dropped one of our fortune cookies on floor in front of us.  She picked it right up and put it on our table.  Yes, I know they are wrapped, and I'm sure the food we had just consumed was riddled w/ much more disgusting things than the outside wrapper of that cookie...BUT IT'S THE PRINCIPAL OF PUTTING FOOD THAT FELL ON THE FLOOR ONTO A GUEST'S TABLEPrices:  I was shocked.  Shocked, I tell you.  Never in my thai-loving days have I ever seen pad thai for $17.  This is not Arun's Thai, guys.  Yelp has the "$$" rating absolutely incorrect.  Most thai places have entrees that could serve 2 people easily, and the quantity here was not anything different from the norm.  The food itself was not bad.  It was fine.  But that leaves a huge mismatch between the price and the taste.  We ordered pad thai tofu; not very flavorful or spiced at all, and there were at best 5 pieces of tofu in the entire entrée.  And we ordered basil fried rice; again, not super flavorful but better than the pad thai due to the basil.  Cleanliness:  Overall fine for a thai place when you walk in and get seated.  If you want to go the restroom, you walk behind a small curtain into what appears to be their "overflow stock" area.  Was a huge mess that you would assume they would not want on display.  But the really horrible part was the lack of paper towels and toilet paper in the single bathroom.  Eww.This place was just something else.  The whole evening, my husband and I were waiting for Aston Kutcher to jump out from behind the odd décor and Punk us all.  We just kept waiting...Closing thoughts:Do NOT go here.Rather, go to - Thai Aree, Thai Café on Roscoe, or Yes Thai.

15.description: I went to Thai Spice on New Year's Eve. A couple had canceled their reservation for the night and we were able to get a spot. When we got there, Anthony (the owner) was extremely warm and inviting and accompanied us to our seats. I'm not sure if this is the norm (Anthony had told us that his staff was on Christmas break and that he, his wife, and a few others were the only ones there to run the business over the holiday break), however, it was very nice to have the owner so engaged with the customers throughout the time that we were there. He was incredibly informative when it came to questions about the food that they served (from ingredients to the various levels of spice (1-5)), and also had a very warm and genuine candor about him that was a pleasure to be around, especially on New Year's Eve. The limited wait staff that was there was always very attentive in making sure that our glasses of water were filled and that we had everything that we needed throughout the meal. Service was an easy 5 stars.In terms of the food:Food Price: It was a little pricier than what we're used to for Thai food, both in the city and in the suburbs, however, there were two things that I felt justified the prices after going through the experience of eating there: 1) The serving sizes were quite generous. My girlfriend and I were not able to eat even half of our meals. And even the next day when I ate my leftovers, I still had some left. 2) The quality of ingredients and execution of cooking the meal were both very good. 3) As a bonus that night, the level of service was top notch. So ya, the food was more than worth it for the aforementioned reasons.Food Quality: As mentioned in the previous paragraph, the food quality was excellent. The depth of flavor in my dish (Pad Thai) was phenomenal. I had initially asked for the highest level of spice that they had, but Anthony talked me off of the ledge and recommended I start with a Level 1 so that I could taste the quality of the food. I have never been talked down from eating a high spice level from any Thai restaurant that I've been to so that I could "enjoy the flavor of the food". He was right though - the 1 still had sufficient heat yet I was able to enjoy the food without sweating and begging for more water. This spoke to the pride that the owner had in the quality and flavor of his food. Many Thai restaurants, especially ones with subpar quality ingredients and a modest flavor profile, would relish in the opportunity of being able to smother a dish with max spice so that the inferiority of the meal's ingredients and flavor could be masked. Anthony was the opposite - he wanted me to taste the many nuances of my meal. In terms of ambience and environment, the lightning was inviting and warm, the restaurant looked relatively clean (our table was clean and prepared when we arrived), and the background music was at a comfortable level for this type of restaurant. They had pillows on the floor to sit on next to the windows for those who like to enjoy Thai food in that fashion. Aside from that, there was nothing that stood out to me as positive or negative here.To sum it up, their service was excellent, their food was excellent, and the restaurant itself was clean and comfortable. Anthony is a fantastic owner and a pleasure to be around. Whoever is cooking in the back (I believe his wife was on NYE but I'm not sure if this is the norm) knows exactly what they are doing. Congratulations to Anthony and his family for building such a nice business. We'll be back again to try spice Level 2 - 5.

57.description: I really like this place. It's not the best Thai around, by any stretch of the imagination, but it is definitely the best in the neighborhood. I love the friendly owner, but the service is really, terribly slow and uneven. Very flavorful, but it is extremely expensive compared to comparable Thai restaurants, which keeps me from going back very often.

20.description: I was a good sport about the ridiculously overpriced Thai food until it came time to pay for it (and a weird "gotta pre tip because of our computer" speech) and I found out they don't take American Express. Food was ok, but if you are going to charge LOL prices, take Amex. And let me write in a tip instead of being put on the spot verbally.  Will not be back. Ever.

36.description: If I could leave two different reviews based upon the service vs. the food, I would. Let me start with the food. The food is superb. It is some of the best Thai food I've had in Chicago, and the quality is consistent. One of my favorites is the Crispy Basket, which is delicious. We live a couple blocks away, so it's an easy walk over.Now for the service. It is appallingly, inexcusably, unprofessionally SLOW. If you come on a weeknight, at an off time, you may be OK if you're willing to wait at least a half hour for your food, but our average wait time during off times is 45 minutes. We will no longer go on a weekend night as the last three times we've gone, we have waited between an hour to an hour and a half for our food. I will order delivery, as I live a couple blocks away, but my last delivery order took one hour and fifty minutes to arrive. Granted, that was a Saturday night, but still far too long to wait.As I said, we like the food, and Anthony, the owner, is a great guy and manages to put out exceedingly good Thai food. But this place seriously understaffed, and needs to rethink its approach to dealing with busy time periods, and do something to get food out in a reasonable amount of time. So be forewarned. either come during an off time, or be prepared to wait.

14.description: I was a good sport about the ridiculously overpriced Thai food until it came time to pay for it (and a weird "gotta pre tip because of our computer" speech) and I found out they don't take American Express. Food was ok, but if you are going to charge LOL prices, take Amex. And let me write in a tip instead of being put on the spot verbally.  Will not be back. Ever.

3.description: The place is dirty and waiting for my cashier to fix her machine the tall woman that  works there keep grabing the people behind me and move them to another cashier when im standing there for 15 minutes, They seems racist and hostile toward customers. I will send a  complaint to the Better Business Bureau and Rogers Park Business Alliance.  The place looks like a dump.

1.description: Cheap stuff yea, I guess. But for the life of me I cannot understand why the staff insists on servicing those at the end of the line who have waited the least when opening a new register!!!!!!!Pisses me off every time and I bite my tongue. IT'S COMMON SENSE. IT'S QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE...Jackasses.

2.description: I am happy to he able to buy cheap cleaning supplies. Who cares what the place looks like! Not here to hang out just want cheap stuff and that's what it's got.

9.description: negative stars - seriously.I've gone in here exactly twice before (horrified with the disgusting mess)this time - I wanted  cheap light bulbs.  I had been told they had a new manager, so I decided to risk a trip.  While it's much cleaner than the last time, the staff is still loathsome.I can read - I consider it one of my skills.  I was running low on something at home and noticed a HUGE sign outside that my favorite brand was on sale here! bonus! I looked for signage to reflect the sale item to no avail.  I tried talking to the clerk who was stocking who insisted the sign was out dated.  When I went to check out, I left my cart for a moment to review the sign dates that the special was in effect.  I commented to the cashier who was more than rude.  "that is for the 'SUPREME' " ... (yes - she emphasized the word "supreme") as if those who shop there were unfamiliar with the concept and couldn't appreciate it and instructed the clerk I spoke to earlier to 'get some down for me'  so 'supreme means - keep it up away from the po' folk ... make them beg for the 'good stuff' that has to be kept on a high shelf to avoid shoplifting.  why - I'm not sure, it's not like you can sneak this kind of package out without drawing attention.  Still,  I didn't care.  I use the brand, let me shop!  if it's on sale, MAKE IT ACCESSIBLE!!!  By the time the guy got back there, I'd already 'retrieved it for myself'Yeah, I think I'll 'pay more' & shop elsewhere in order to be treated like a person.  they may have cleaned it up a little bit - but it's only a matter of time (soon) that the 'new' manager is 'broken' and the wading through crap to get to get to what is on the shelves will again be standard fare.

10.description: This place scares me. The staff all look depressed and are very rude, slow, pathetic looking people. The store is a disgusting mess. Nothing is ever stocked. Just piles in the middle of the store. The manger is called by them ringing a bell, I don't think its a reliable system since they had to ring the bell a few times before the lady with all the keys decided to make an appearance to the check out lane. The drink selection sux to, not really a reason to go back there.

4.description: negative, negative, negative stars.Since my last review, this F.D. made a bit of an effort to import (cleaned up and installed a new credit/debit card swipe machine). However, as of the last couple of visits; this store is in even worse condition than the last time I reviewed it.  The entrance vestibule (shared by the Scummy Sudz laundry next door) has an odor of urine and b.o. and there are black chunks of old ground in gum and other assorted nasties on the tile floor.When you enter the Family Dollar, the odor morphs into pee mixed w/moldy dry goods. People please, take a minute and call the toll free number and log a complaint about the condition of this store.  It is NOT COOL to let this go on as so many store owners are working hard to improve Morse Avenue.We need the Family Dollar to stay put and the Corporate Office needs to do something about it.  Here again is their number:  866-377-6420.I am going to work on bringing this issue to the attention of the RC Chamber of Comm., Ald. Moore, and others.   Feel free to message me if you like - let's squeak the wheel!!!

6.description: We call this place the Ghetto Dollar, which- is that offensive to someone? It might be, sorry. I didn't make it up. In any case, this store is messy and dirty and extremely slow, but it's very consistently so. It doesn't make failed attempts to get better or anything- it just stays nice and terrible. So nowadays we just kind of expect it, and it's kind of okay.Still a bad store, but not like... offensive. Meh!

12.description: A Family Dollar is a Family Dollar. They are mostly the same. This one though, you get to wait in line an extra long time. No matter the time of day, they only EVER have one cashier on hand and ALWAYS have a line. So, don't expect to run in this place grab some toilet paper and leave. Give yourself an extra 10 minutes of time to wait in line.

5.description: FD actually sent me an apology letter and a $5 gift card to use. The one thing I bet they didn't do was instruct the employees in this store. That would be too much like right. However, what they DID do was send another letter apologizing that the card sent out may not have worked. Mine did  - so, I guess I have the goofballs at this store to thank. Because of their incompetence, I made $10 in the deal. Thanks Family Dollar! But for God's sake, don't try to use a coupon on the date it is supposed to "expire" since it probably will be rejected.

13.description: I gave this three stars because of the very cheap but decent fake christmas tree I got here. It is convenient for me, no one would travel great distances to get here. I have had people cut in front of me many times, once so a lady could return a bar of soap. And they let her. Its a bar of soap... Once I walked out because there was an argument going on between the cashier, the manager and the lady in front of me that took so long I just had to get out of there. I continue to return for bag o' socks. My gf had bad luck with some family dollar brand ibprofin. I told her it was a bad idea, but did she listen? no. The parking lot seems to be a hot spot for being patted down by the police

11.description: I've shopped at Family Dollar for years, usually not by choice.My most recent experience with Family Dollar has made me re-think buying anything at all there. It was a blisteringly cold day (12°F/windy), and I was wearing a bulky leather coat with a hoodie (with pockets) underneath. I was also wearing thick snow boots that make a loud squeaking sound when I walk on tile floors (such as they have at Family Dollar). Why am I describing my wardrobe? You'll understand soon. I should note that I was *not* carrying a bag of any kind. I mention that because Family Dollar has a strict bag check policy, pretty normal for Rogers Park.As I entered the store, I nodded to the cashier, who smiled and nodded back to me, a rare occurrence at Family Dollar. Please note: at no time did she say "hey, you need to check your coat".I went to the back of the store to grab some plastic coat hangers, and decided to see if they had any interesting Christmas stuff on sale. It was at this time I noticed a man following me around the store. He was rather unkempt, with uncombed hair, wearing a dirty gray hooded sweatshirt with a black shirt underneath, wrinkled pants, and old shoes. My first thought was that it was a homeless guy who had come into the store to get warm.I started toward the front of the store, to the registers. I stopped to check out the kitchenware aisle, as my wife had mentioned that we needed a new utensil holder.
