Seeing nothing I liked, I started again for the front of the store...to find my path blocked by the same fellow who had been following me around the store, now staring at me.I asked, "Is there something I can help you with?"He didn't reply directly, instead he mimed I movement I thought meant he was implying that I was fat, moving his hands up and down his mid-section. He then said, "You seem to be carrying a lot of stuff.""Do you mean in my pockets?" I asked. "Yes." he replied.I then asked, doubtfully, "Do you work here?""Yes." he replied."Is there a manager on duty?" I asked.He said, "I'm the manager."Ah. Well. I then asked, "Would you like to search me to see if I've stolen anything?""Oh, I'm *going* to search you." he said.Uh, no. "Without my permission? I don't think so. At least not without the police being involved." I said."I already called the police." he replied.So, let's recap: me = not a shoplifter. The "manager" = dressed as a homeless guy (loss prevention camouflage? or just a slob?), rude, called the police even though no crime had actually been committed.I asked him his name. He seemed to have to think about it (or come up with a fake name), then replied, "Tony." I then asked him if he was the store manager, or an assistant. He didn't answer. I asked who his district manager was. No reply. I asked him if he was accusing me of theft. No reply. I pointed out that a shoplifter probably wouldn't wear such loud boots, as I would think that they tend to want to keep a much lower profile; "Tony" just shrugged.I asked "Tony" where he intended to carry out his "search" of me. Again, no reply.I decided to take pre-emptive action: I walked up to the registers, found an unoccupied counter (under one of the many cameras they have in the store), and emptied my pockets. Every pocket I had. My sunglasses. My gum. My keys. My wallet. My change. Everything. I invited "Tony" to pat me down or check my pockets for himself. No response. I asked him if I could go ahead and buy my coat hangers while we were waiting for the cops. No reply. I gathered up the contents of my pockets, and took my hangers to the open register, where the nice cashier I'd seen on the way in shrugged at me, smiled again, and rang up my hangers. I paid (with a bank card, a wise move considering what happened next), and at this point "Tony" told her to cancel the sale. Too late, though. He told her not to give me a bag or a receipt, though. He also said I wasn't allowed in the store ever again. So petty. At this point, the cops arrived. I knew the main cop, named Conway, from around the neighborhood. He asked "Tony" (who he didn't call by any name, and I was too angry at that point to think quickly enough to confirm "Tony's" name) what the problem was. He explained that he had *asked* if it was okay if he searched me, and I had refused. Uh, no.I told my side of the story, that I thought a crazy homeless man was following me around the store, that, indeed, "Tony" hadn't *asked* me ANYTHING, and that he'd called the cops *before* he'd even interacted with me. Conway asked "Tony" if this was true, and he stammered some bullshit response, not actually answering the question. Conway told me I could go, and apologized that I had been detained.I'm not sure I learned anything from this experience, except that "Tony" is an asshole, and not very good at his job. I'm glad that there is a Target opening up close to my neighborhood soon, so I'll soon have a better option for cheap plastic hangers.

8.description: This store looks like something from a 3rd world country. Seriously, can anyone say that they have walked into this store and it was clean?Can One person say that?What about more than one register open to assist with checkouts?Can anyone?The merchandising of the store is terrible, boxes strewn about in the middle of aisles, expired foodstuffs for sale, etc. Time for this Family Dollar to clean up its act or go away.

0.description: Is it unclean? YesIs it in an ugly building that often features unsavory characters loitering outside? YesCan you get cleaning supplies/detergent/paper towels on the cheap? AbsolutelyAt the end of the day, that's really all I expect out of a dollar store.

7.description: The prices are cheep, which is always a positive, but the store is always dirty looking and seems unkempt. The folks who work there are nice, but there never seem to be enough people there to make sure they can devote their time to you, and the rest of the line, and the stuff that needs to be shelved that isn't happening. The prices are the only thing that keep me coming back.

12.description: I had the Kung Pao Chicken, the flavor was amazing, however there were waaaayyy too many water chestnuts. There were more water chestnuts than chicken or veggies in my serving. The Egg Drop soup was thick, but delicious. It's worth a try, we will go again.

3.description: my usual place was closed for remodel. I looked this one up and saw the nice reviews. I was not impressed. I had the general chicken  bland but spicy (if you get that) and my husband had cashew and shrimp. pros: close to my home.         clean waiting area         nice friendly  employee         food was warm cons: food was bland adv price per person $10  and it's CASH ONLY** they do have lunch specials for $5.75

1.description: The General Tsos chicken was covered in garlic sauce. Nothing General Tsos about it. Also while I was waiting for my food there was a homeless man digging through the trash for food.

2.description: I ordered Szechuan chicken shrimp fried rice and Mongolian beef for my husband. The chicken is tender juicy spicy but not blinding hot. The fried rice is fresh in flavor delicately seasoned.My husband is picky when it comes to Mongolian beef. It did not make the cut

9.description: I ordered there Kung Pao chicken as carry out. The food was a little cold when I opened it up in the car, and there where too many water chestnuts for my preference. Next time I go back Ill order something eles and eat inside.

10.description: This place is fantastic!  The best Cantonese/Mandarin in the area.  If you have not tried it you need to as soon as you can.  I have lived in China for a short time and this food mimics what I had in the restaurants in Beijing and Yenan.  The woman that prepares the food is wonderful, super friendly and super helpful.  It is a pleasure to support a local business, especially one that is so fantastic!

13.description: Just a quick update, this place is still awesome! Loved the Orange chicken as well as the General Tsos, both are spicy and the chicken is actually nice pieces of juicy chicken, not dry or overly fatty pieces. My one complaint is the cash only policy that makes it hard to come here without planning ahead, since I don't always have cash on me.

16.description: Another restaurant near my business and how fortunate for me. The food's just  great and the couple that own and run it are the very nicest, sweetest  people! It's the only Chinese place within a mile. It beats to death the 2 others north of it past Lunt st. I love a number of dishes here having learned about them by breaking my --- stick with the  'tried and trues' rule. The reason i broke my rule was because Dragon Gate's so close that i eat here constantly, so i was forced to try other things fso that i wouldn't burn out, know what i mean Verne? My 'tried and true' rule is for places that i go to infrequently where i don't want to risk having a disappointing meal and i have a craving for some particular thing that i like there.Everything I've ever had from these wonderful folks has been good so I'm not afraid to try things. In fact, sometimes I'll request a special concoction or an extra this or that in the dish and it always turns out good. Their prices are very reasonable too. If you like Chinese food you won't be disappointed here!Things i especially like are pepper steak (with $2 of extra meat), pot stickers, combo fried rice with extra veggies, combo egg foo young (that's still great the next day when its egg foo old), curry dishes, teriaki chicken (all dark meat - yum, yum - a welcome relief from all the damned chicken breast everyone serves nowadays) and the list goes on....Dragon Gate is primarily take out but there are a couple of tables for a quicky meal. Parking's good because this part of Clark st. is not packed with stores. There's nearly always a convenient spot right in front or across the street. They close at 9 pm and on Sunday's.I know someone's gonna soon notice that i give all 5 star reviews or i don't give one. That's because I'm easy to please and i don't much let small slights irritate me. It's especially true because i'm a businessman who tries to always give great service to my customers but because this is an imperfect world full of flawed people (especially me) cannot always do so. Like Ricky Nelson sang - ya can't please everybody, so ya've gotta please yasself. I don't want to suffer a bad review without a chance to right a wrong, so i give other businesses a lot of leeway to do so.Therefore when i encounter a flawed business but i see that the owners / managers are really trying to do it right, I'm not going to drop any stars and hurt them. However, if i think that they're not bustin' ass tryin',  you'll hear me yelp about it from the throne, yessiree bob! But for right now, as a new yelper, I'm working from memory to review a place here and a place there, where i've really enjoyed things. Later, i'll probably pan a few dumps like everyone else, even though i prefer to stay positive because it's better for the bowels of an old geezer like me, know what i mean, Verne?

6.description: I remember living in the area and always frequenting this place as a child with my mother. I had not been here for over 6 years so I decided to make the drive with my coworker for our lunch hour. I am so glad we did. It was so worth the drive. The egg-rolls were phenomenal, the lunch specials could serve two, the prices are reasonable and the woman who works there still remembered me and my mother. Definitely will be my go-to when I am craving spicy and delicious Chinese for work.

15.description: I'm kind of ashamed to admit it, but typically Chinese food is one of the only kind of foods where I prefer the Americanized version (Panda Express!), but this place is an exception if for no other reason than it being ridiculously cheap. I always get pork fried rice ($3.75) and my girlfriend gets something equally cheap and then we get crab rangoon ($3.50) and our total is like $11 with tax. I usually have enough food leftover that I can bring it to work the next day. This is not a place I would dine in at, I'm not even sure if they have tables and if they do it would be awkward to dine in there.

0.description: Great service, great food, and low prices?!? I think I need to come back here! The lady at the counter was patient as we stood for about 10 minutes to decide what we wanted. She was very nice to us and did not try to rush us as we ordered about 10 dishes. I made sure to get the egg rolls like other reviews suggested. THEY WERE CRISP HOT AND FLAVORFUL. I didn't order enough :/Everything was still hot by the time we got home and we even had to wait to eat because some dishes were still steaming. All the meat was actual meat and I could decipher everything that was on my plate. I didn't get a photo though because everything disappeared :/ This food was better than ANY Chinese food back home in San Francisco. Great job!

5.description: Very good. Kind staff. I suggest tipping. They are cash only but that works for good food.

11.description: I'm giving this place 5 stars.  Let me tell you why.  First of all, I've tried just about every Chinese delivery place in the Rogers Park/ Evanston area, and this is the ONLY place that actually has FLAVOR in the food. Period!!  The flavor is VERY GOOD.... really.  It's well balanced, spicy is hot, it's deep and rich, etc.  I find the texture a tiny bit thick, maybe a little too much oil, BUT THERE'S FLAVOR!!!  Yum...And the sweet lady that was seemingly the only person working tonight when I picked up my food seemed to take pride in what she served me, as I told her I'd ordered from Dragon Gate solely based on the YELP reviews.  FIVE STARS!!!  better than MOST Chinese food places in the city.

8.description: Yummy, yummy. I got the Kung Pao chicken lunch special. The egg roll was crispy and not greasy. These are the smaller egg rolls with a thin wonton wrapper. The fried rice was chewy with a little crunch. The Kung Pao chicken was delicious. Flavorful and not too spicy. I loved the water chestnuts and the chicken was cooked to perfection. Every now and then I'd hit a chunk of pineapple, which normally I don't care for, but the sweetness added complexity to the spiciness. Yep, I'll be going back for more. Soon.

4.description: The Kind Son of the owners, I believe his name is Steeben is very friendly. The food is very delicious and always on point!And his AWP at Mid is quite strong.

14.description: The food was just ok, similar to the other quick Chinese places in the area. It was annoying to have to remember cash (it's cash only), but I will say the owner is an incredibly nice lady, which brings this up to 3 stars. Food alone would only rate 2.5.

7.description: I love Dragon Gate and have been a loyal longtime customer(25 years). The owners are wonderful and take pride in their business. I decided to write a review because after a long hiatus I decided to order tonight. The food was fresh and delicious. And over the long time I have been eating here the food is always consistently good. I love the egg rolls. Thin and crispy not to greasy. Chicken dishes are great! Prices are reasonable. Yes, there is no delivery and it is cash only but there is always parking in front and it is worth it if I have to stop and get cash. Best Chinese in the RP hands down, with wonderful customer service. You won't be disappointed. Love, Matt.

3.description: Was looking for something to do on Friday night.  Saw they had Karaoke and thought I would stop in.  Was about 10 pm, walked in, saw 7 people in the bar.  A mexican guy was butchering "Free Bird" By Skynard in the corner, and the bartender told me "cash only"Walked out, wont be back.  A lot better places to spend my time in the neighborhood.

1.description: just an update..i still go to dino's- friendly people, new karaoke host dj capp..plays karaoke songs from 50s to current also-I like it as anyone can sing regardless of skill level..from beginning karaoke to advanced singer all are welcome without judgement (just a tip- the more you sing the better you get!) still has pool table and great jukebox..try it you will like it! oh and very reasonable drink prices!

2.description: I've been living in the area for one year now, and I've been to Dino's at least a half a dozen times.  I no longer go there, the reason why is the place is cheap or low class and strange. It's the only bar that I've ever been to where you could be really nice to the bartender, tip them well plus buy them drinks, and they never ever buy you a drink in return, not even a free tap beer.

5.description: Grew up down the street and have been going to Dino's for years. No nonsense, old-school Chicago neighborhood tavern. One of the few left that has not either closed down, gone "upscale," or been overrun by hipsters. Also, one of the last of the slashies--you can take it to go, too.

6.description: Yes, that's right, I went to Dino's. Blame It on curiosity, or maybe five too many cocktails, but I dared to go where I would normally never set foot. On a Friday night well past a respectable hour, it was empty except for our party and 4 other folks. I was immediately intrigued by the wall of hooch behind the bar, that is for to-go purchases...who knew? I found a juke box full of good music and was able to commandeer it for the time we were there, and the bartender loved my choices. Apparently Jay-Z and Lil Wayne don't get a lot of play in Dino's. The ladies room, and I use that term loosely, has a padlock on the door. I don't want to know why.

7.description: This seems to be a place where the patrons take most of the stuff to go. from what I saw of them and the crowd the night I went that was a good thing. This place is a dive and pretty scary. Not in the best of Chicago's neighborhoods as well. They do have some poker machines and one pool table. There is alot of hard liquor and other alcohalic beverages that are available to get totally trashed with. So there are some good things even with bad bars and establishments.

8.description: I don't really like this place. They have some very reasonable prices on their drinks, but the crowd here can be really loud and rude at times. There's many better places to go to in the area!

0.description: I had fun at Dino's. Truth be told, it wouldn't be my first choice of bars in the future, but it was very close to where we had dinner and we had a good time.We went on a Friday night and there was karaoke, so they've got that going for them! The KJ was really friendly and he had a good selection of songs. You could walk right up to him and ask if he had something or you could browse the list online by going to a website that provides available choices. I ended up singing 2 songs over the course of about 3 hours. I had to ask where I was in line for the 2nd song because I seemed to have been lost in the shuffle, but he quickly put me to the head of the line so I was able to get another in before heading out. Right after me his son went up and actually sang one of his own songs, so that was cool.People in the bar were friendly, if not a little overly intrusive at times. It wasn't anything we couldn't handle. It seems like there are a lot of regulars who come for the karaoke, and we're flattered they took an interest in the newcomers.The bartender was pretty busy, so we didn't get a good sense of her personality. She came around as often as possible to check up on us. I was pretty bummed they didn't have Woodchuck available at the time though there was a tap for it, but that's likely not her fault.

4.description: Not exactly my kind of place as I've never been into dive bars.  But they get some serious points for being so nice. The bartender took the time to talk and I even exchanged drinks with some patrons.

58.description: Really excellent Mexican food.  We've driven past this place on Clark countless times and I've always been intrigued by the advertised "Super Tortas Futboleras".  After finally getting a chance to try these,  I am a huge fan!  The tortas are filled with authentic Mexican ingredients, filling out a light freshly-baked bread and  come in a great variety - we've asked the waitress to come back twice before we could finally settle on a choice, they all sounded so great.  I tried the Fresera  - pork leg, bacon, avocado and cheese.  It was great.  The size was just right at "regular".  All menu items have funny soccer-related names, including "F*** you, referee". In short, it was a very tasty and fun eating experience, I can't wait to go back and try their burritos.

56.description: Very average.  I had a steak taco... dry and fatty.  The chicken taco was.... fine.  Red and green sauce... fine.  Next time I would try another place on Clark.

29.description: With so many Mexican places on Clark alone, it is hard to pick one. Pick this place based off the yelp reviews and was not disappointed  I got the steak tacos from here and my wife for the steak tostadas. Both were very good. We will definitely go back to this place again.

42.description: I am sitting at work right now enjoying my lunch from Rocky's Tacos. Many times I have had some good Mexican food, but Wow! I was not expecting this. The food came earlier then was expected the price was reasonable and the food. OMG the food. Big portions, fresh, not slopped together. I am so happy that I gave this place a chance. So what did I order. Well I ordered the Quesadillas for a $1 (come on how awesome is that) and the the Flautas de Pollo for $11 (not bad for a dinner). For my drink I got a Jarritos for $2.00, and get this IT WAS STILL COLD and it's 91 degrees out today. I am just saying the last few resturants I have tried have disappointed me and took my money. This place sooooooo delivered exactly what I wanted. Great Place

23.description: Hola guacamole amigos and amigas!By far the best, fresh, delicious house made guac in Rogers Park. Given all the Mexican restaurants in the vicinity that's saying something very good about Rocky's.We've been loving Rocky's guac for years, taking it home, eating it in, and lugging it to Ravinia. Their good, fresh chips (sometimes so fresh they're still hot) make the experience complete. Oddly enough, we've not tried anything else. Given the exceptional reviews for their apparently sometime unique, interesting futbol tortas, we'll definitely eat a few full meals here to verify through our own experiences. Thanks Yelpers. We're looking forward to this.Hasta luego,Peter O. and S.

47.description: First visit today. Great torta, friendly service. Can't wait to give this place another try. (Another reviewer mentioned that they don't really offer any vegetarian options. I would second that; this is a meat palace.) The salsa verde was very spicy, and delicious.

8.description: SUPER authentic, amazing food, excellent service.  Love this place!

31.description: They have about a million Tortas, each named after a Footbol team, and each one I've tried has been perfectly executed.

34.description: Very extensive torta menu. These are heavy duty. Lots of different combinations of meat and in big portions.

16.description: Rocky Tacos is known for its variety of tortas, named after futbòl teams in Mexico, I guess. I don't know what a torta is, and I was looking for tacos. They have tacos. The tacos are decent, but not super-standout. I like their hot sauce, got a nice heat to it, but it's not tears in my eyes hot (and nobody wants that anyway). So I give it a three out of five, only because the cilantro has to be requested, which doesn't sit quite right with me.

13.description: Huge selection, reasonable prices, and generous portions. The place is clean, friendly, and the food rocks!

11.description: The name is misleading. Should be Rockys Tortas, because that is their specialty. I've only had one and I've been there at least 20 times. The maradona, i wanna try others but I always remember how good it is and don't want to ruin a a good thing i have going. I get their super sized one and if I don't finish it I take it home, it's huge!!!!!. Service is so so. Salsa is good. Horchata is ok. They do give you chips while you wait for food . Pico de gallo is delicious they put ham in it, like most of their Tortas. All Tortas are named after futbol players or teams. So anytime I want a torta I go to Rockys.

39.description: meh.  decent tacos, in a neighborhood full of decent taco joints.

37.description: Went here for cinco de mayo with my wife and another couple! Expecting it to be slammed. It was not surprisingly! We sat right down and ordered. I got the pork tacos. They were amazing! The food came out pretty quick but didn't get our waters refilled. After eating those spicy tacos would have loved to wash it down with some water. Overall good experience. Good food. Great prices! Will be returning soon!

0.description: This place is off the chain. Moving to Roger's Park from the south side had me worried I wouldn't have delicious Mexican food on hand. After enjoying a satisfying dinner here, I'm no longer worried.The tacos are phenomenal, picture-perfect, and made with a lot of care. Everything tasted delicious and fresh. The meat itself was tender and there weren't any bad cuts in it. I'm looking forward to coming back here.

38.description: Great food! Love the Tortas..When it comes to Mexican food, there's a variety of restaurants me and my fiancé visit. But when ever we want to eat Tortas we usually order from Rocky's. So far the staff is been great and really friendly:) We have been to both locations Montrose and Clark!

51.description: I am not a big fan of most Mexican food, but I really like their chicken soup a lot.  It is tangy, healthy and filling.

27.description: This place has the best tacos! You can't go wrong with the ground beef cilantro and onion combo. The seasoning is impeccable and I can't wait to order from them again.

32.description: Rocky's Tacos is one of my favorite places in Rogers Park. Everything I've had there has been delicious but I love their tortas, and they have tons of them to choose from. They have a very relaxed atmosphere and it is great for take out. Don't forget to order an horchata.

54.description: I had never been to this establishment and thought it would be good to check out.  I have been next door to El Famous and know their food well.  There was some confusion as to weather I was dinning in or taking it to go and my waitress grabbed the green and red salsa placed it on my table.  I ordered a steak burrito with beans and rice.  The food was pretty good, but not as flavorful as El Famous.  The fountain diet Pepsi I was given was bad.......i.e., meaning the syrup was out of date/code.  I did detect some discrimination by the waitress not giving me complementary chips and salsa.  Overall the price was higher than El Famous and the service was dismal.  I will not be returning.

48.description: the tostada al pastor is the best I have ever had.....  and I have had a LOT of Mexican food.   the staff is fantastic and Rocky himself is fun to chat with.....

44.description: Good solid tortas and breakfast food. Lots and lots of choices for their special tortas.

24.description: This place has every single type of torta you could imagine. The one I always get is the C. Blanco. The tacos are good too. The only thing that is different about this place than others is they put chopped ham on their salsa and I have never seen that before. Definitely worth trying!

7.description: I had the mole torta and I must admit the pork or whatever it was underneath the sauce had a real terrible after taste...I was starving and still tossed it in the trash ....horchata was decent but nothing special...will I go back? Not in a million years

49.description: Really disappointed in this place.  Yes I know, I know:  Mexico has a heavily meat-based culture.  Why am I expecting good veggie food at a taco joint?  Well, for starters, I can walk into any number of taquerias  around the city and be presented with some really tasty veggie tacos, exploding with fresh ingredients.  Not here.  There are veggie tacos available, but they are mostly comprised of flavorless rice that manages to be dry and greasy at the same time.  The salsa verde was okay, but they even put bits of ham in the pico de gallo!  Sigh...However, the hubby was happy enough with his torta.  Tortas are their specialty (even though they are called Rocky's TACOS).  They have 100 of them on the menu, (yes, I counted), mostly pork with not a token veggie offering in the lot. Ok, fine. I understand.  They don't want my kind there.  I can accept that.    But I do feel compelled to warn my fellow taco-loving veggies not to bother.

40.description: I used to really enjoy coming to this place for Mexican food. It seems like every time I come in to this small soccer themed restaurant my order is not as I asked. Its usually my to go stuff too. I really dislike beans or hot stuff and once I've come home to enjoy dinner, yes, they have added it to my meal EVEN though I requested it not to be on there. I keep coming back because the food is a lot better than most north side Mexican food. They have so many choices that it makes your head spin. I will try to be as patient as I could be next time I order.

53.description: To say that we like this place would be an understatement.  After the first time we went there, we went again about 2 or 3 more times in about a month.  Also, we ordered from them at least 2 more times.  It's safe to say we love their food.  Let's face it, you don't go to these types of restaurants and expect to be pampered by the service.  You may have to go to the counter to ask the waitress for napkins before she comes to you.  That doesn't make the experience any less enjoyable.  The focus here is the food. So far all I've had are the tortas even though their called Rocky's Tacos.  It doesn't mean the tacos are no good, but you can tell when you open the menu their specialty are the tortas.  It's so great when you are curious about trying a new restaurant and the food turns out to be great.It's small, so if it's crowded forget about sitting to eat and at least order to go.  If you get to eat there, there are an abundance of soccer photos and trophies to look at.  Either way when we want mexican food this is our place of choice in rogers park.

30.description: So many tortas to choose from as of  now I have not been disappointed . The tacos are not bad but are not as good as the tortas , the salsa that they give is really good

46.description: Originally went to this place more than four years ago, and was floored by the flavor, ingredient balance, and overall taste of their tacos. Would easily make the drive to restaurant, regardless of where I was in the city, as they had some of the best tacos in the city. Now that I live less than a mile from here, ironically I have dined here so infrequently that you would think I lived in Hyde instead of Rogers Park. The quality of their food has diminished enough to where, if I searched, I am sure I would find comparable alternatives. But since an excellent taco is rarely on my must-have list, I often settle for the good-enough options here...lesser of two evils, I suppose. [Note: this review is only about their tacos.]Their veggie tacos used to come with roasted corn and peas, an excellent vegetarian pico de gallo, and seasoned rice which was light and fresh.  Likewise, their tortillas were heavy enough to support their fillings, but no more--not so dense that you could eat them by themselves for a meal. Each of their meat tacos contained an easily identifiable part of an animal, with meat lightly fried and topped with enough herbs (mostly cilantro) and veggies so that each flavor of the taco came through. Flash forward a few years. Their tortillas are chewy and often stale tasting. Their meat tacos are so laden with oil that even if I knew which critter was inside the tortillas? It would just taste like greasy meat taco #1 (smothered in onions and cilantro), #2 (smothered in "sauce" and "huh?") or #3 (you do not even care at this point, you just need something reasonably non-bleh to eat)--enough of a distinction to separate the al pastor from the beef, but is that even beef in the first place? A previous reviewer mentioned the gristled quality of the "beef" in her tacos, which was accurate. I have left several of their "beef" tacos outside for street animals to munch on, as I am sure they get a bigger kick out of it than my struggling to chew the meat. The veggie tacos are so laden with bland and soggy rice that they really just seem to be a pity option for those who cannot/choose not to eat meat. Which is a shame as their veggie tacos used to be excellent. Again, I cannot vouch for the quality of their tortas. I will note, however, that whenever I have visited this place, diners seemed consistently happy with their tortas, which appeared to be well-made but pork-heavy. Plus, there are more than 100 of them, so a batting average of all of them being ick is highly unlikely. Speaking of which, they put diced ham on top of their pico de gallo. This has remained quite delicious over the years. Fingers crossed that the meat is actually ham and not Spam--or "Mystery X."

1.description: Best food since Texas. I had a taco and beans. They were watery....like bean soup. My Mom used to make beans like this and She served them over sauerkraut. ...but She was not a good cook. Rest her soul. So the rice was crunchy and that added texture to the beansI was surprised when I was charged an additional. 75 cents for the flour taco.  It didn't say anything about extra charges on the menu or when a ordered at the counter. ...I know to ask from now on since full disclosure and transparent transfer. ...has not caught up to this old school establishment.I took carry out so I cannot say if they offer chips and salsa at the table complementary on the house.

55.description: I decided to break from my usual place for Mexican on the far north side (La Cazuela) and try Rocky's Tacos. The interior of the restaurant is pretty basic, not nice but not super raggedy either like some of the taco spots in the far north end of Clark Street. I ordered tacos because I thought the tacos would be yummy (I based this on the name of the restaurant). Rocky's Tacos are the worst tacos I have ever had. I would rather have Taco Bell, at least I know the meat is beef and 10% "filler". I have no idea what type of meat was in my "steak tacos", it was more like gristle tacos. The tortillas were not even tasty. The cilantro and onion seemed to over power the flavor of the "meat". Basically the taco tasted like cilantro, onions, stale tortillas, with a surprising gristly texture.I was surprised that there were few taco options on the menu, about 90% of the menu has tortas in what seems like 100 different varieties. The tortas are not appealing to me because I do not eat pork. If you love obscene amounts of pork in one dish this place is for you. Most of their menu items seems to be tortas that have two or more different forms of pork in one sandwich. They should change their name to Rocky The Pig or Rocky's Tortas because their tacos are horrendous and potential customers will not go there thinking they have good tacos.

9.description: They have creative names for something like a Mexican scramble (sans eggs). There salsa and guacamole was goooood. I had the Flautas, which were a little overdone on the ends, but were packed full of chicken so I forgive em that. All in all, I like the soccer theme, although it would have been great to have the tv's on with some Futbol playing in the background. Next time, I'm going to try a Torta, which looked freakin amazing from the other table!

26.description: Rocky Tacos is known for its variety of tortas, named after futbòl teams in Mexico, I guess. I don't know what a torta is, and I was looking for tacos. They have tacos. The tacos are decent, but not super-standout. I like their hot sauce, got a nice heat to it, but it's not tears in my eyes hot (and nobody wants that anyway). So I give it a three out of five, only because the cilantro has to be requested, which doesn't sit quite right with me.

25.description: Just try it.  They have THE MOST AWSOME sandwiches here.  A selection unlike anything you have ever seen.Plus chips & ham/cilantro/onion/jalapeño salsa for your chips.  Yes, I said ham.They have tacos too, but I am too busy working my way down the sandwich menu.I only came here because my favorite tamale place in the world was closed. (Tamales Lo Mejor de Guererro).You should too.

12.description: Hola guacamole amigos and amigas!By far the best, fresh, delicious house made guac in Rogers Park. Given all the Mexican restaurants in the vicinity that's saying something very good about Rocky's.We've been loving Rocky's guac for years, taking it home, eating it in, and lugging it to Ravinia. Their good, fresh chips (sometimes so fresh they're still hot) make the experience complete. Oddly enough, we've not tried anything else. Given the exceptional reviews for their apparently sometime unique, interesting futbol tortas, we'll definitely eat a few full meals here to verify through our own experiences. Thanks Yelpers. We're looking forward to this.Hasta luego,Peter O. and S.

59.description: I walked here to try some of the places in my area as I just moved here.I had never had a torta before and it turned out to be a delicious sandwich.the portion size was gigantic and i just got a regular sized one. they have an even larger size available.i got the le tigres which was pork. the sandwich also had avocado, lettuce and onions (cooked) on it. the bread was fresh.I didn't try the tacos but i will be back for more tortas because the menu is extensive and the prices are reasonable! $5 for a sandwich that lasted me for 2 meals. You cannot go wrong here seems like there is something for everyone!

21.description: The quality of the meat is so bad. No flavor whatsoever. If you need something late and night and dont mind waking up sick the next day then go for it.

17.description: Fantastic!! Amazing chicken milanesa tortas! I am not like most that just eats Mexican anywhere - I want quality meats and sauces with flavor - Rocky's Tacos fits the bill. Great service, all the servers are kind and keep up with their tables. My husband is tough on on his tacos - he wants real meat and flavor again Rocky's did him in - this is our go to spot in Roger's and Edgewater. We live in Edgewater and have 10 places in walking distance we drive to Rocky's instead we love the staff, the food, the restaurant is decent inside always clean. Only drawback no parking but always parking on the street in the evenings. Would like to see better chips (the chips taste burned and dry - this place could do better I am sure of it) and a pico de gallo without the ham on top (must be a regional thing) - we don't eat pork so that is wasted and I always forget to tell them not to bring it to the table. Oh well  small issue. Overall you should try them out. Good for families and crowds large enough. FYI Music can be VERY loud at times - grandparents did not approve.

10.description: Okay, I had flautas here and was pretty unimpressed. They were so fried and greasy, and the chicken was extra bland. The salsa was on point though, so that's part of why I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 2. Staff was also so kind and courteous to us. My friend and I ran in here during a rainstorm and stayed to eat while we waited for it to pass. The gal working the counter was super friendly and knowledgeable and helped us with directions after our meal. I think it would be worth trying again, but I wouldn't recommend the flautas!

5.description: I was overwhelmed with their selection of tortas. My friend who lives in Chicago took me to this place and swore that they had delicious Mexican food. I was a bit skeptical bc most ppl who are not Mexican think that Tex-mex food counts as Mexican food....well my friend was spot on! This place was not only authentic but it also offered a MOLE torta!!! YES you read right, MOLE!!!! That torta sang to me!!!! As expected, the portions were huuugggee. I was very hungry but only able to knock off half of my torta. I'll be visiting this establishment once I return to Chicago...and this time I'll be ordering their guacamole as well.

3.description: Apparently, Rocky's Taco is okay with hiring abusive little mafia wannabes who yell at the customer for no reason.  Adios, mosquitos!

35.description: I may not be able to pronounce the items on the menu,  but I sure as hell want to try all of them. Generous portions all delicious. The Cubana style sandwiches are just amazing.Dine in or take out. ..either way you will be happy.

19.description: So many tortas to choose from as of  now I have not been disappointed . The tacos are not bad but are not as good as the tortas , the salsa that they give is really good

28.description: The absolute best tortas that you will ever eat!!! Huge selection and amazing taste. Guacamole is so tasty! They also have complimentary salsa and chips when you dine in. The salsa is amazing, it has tiny diced up ham. So good! First time I ever had a torta was here. After that I tried tortas several other places and none come even close to compare!

45.description: I just moved to Rogers Park from the wasteland to the north (Wisconsin). There are a lot of small restaurants on Clark Street and the signage outside of this restaurant made it easy to find. I ordered the Carnitas burrito and a side order of Guacamole. The burrito was good but the carnitas were not the best I have ever had. They were inconsistently salted (toward the end one of the bites tasted like someone had accidentally spilled the salt shaker on the meat)!  But it was still good. Much higher marks on the guacamole. Highest marks on the size. Most places charge you an arm and a leg for a little bit, but Rocky's guac was comparably much larger. It also tasted great! It was seasoned well and had chopped onions, cilantro, and tomatoes. While I was waiting for my food, I noticed on the wall some photos of their tacos. They looked fantastic. Definitely going to try them next time!

33.description: The menu is huge and a bit overwhelming with the tortas, so I played it safe with a Carne Asada based torta called A. Pavon.   I live about 1/2 mile away.  They said delivery would take an hour and it arrived in 25 minutes.  It would be easy for the sandwich to get all messed up in transit, but it was pristine and beautiful.  I ordered the large torta, and it was perfect to fill me up.  There's a dozen mexican places right down the street on Clark, and this is a good choice.

43.description: This is the place to pop your torta cherry if you haven't already and you're a gringa like me.  The bread-oh so soft and delicious!  I work in a bakery, so that's saying something.  The unbelievable combination of meats, cheese, pineapple, veggies, sauce, and spices is unmatched with any other food on this planet.  There's a million options to choose from, but if you close your eyes and point to something on the menu, you will not be disappointed.  The horchata is creamy and delicious and I don't care if it comes from a bag or a package-it's effing good.  Also, their fries are the slightly seasoned battered kind, which is the best kind in case you were unaware.  I have never had their tacos because I don't give a shit about tacos in a place that delivers a gigantic cheesy melty sandwich the size of a football.

2.description: I'm definitely a fan of this place.  Their sandwich list is ginormous and none have let me down yet.  Pazole  is solid and available everyday - I like that.  I like the tacos and both red and green salsas are fantastic and hot hot hot! Eat in, carry out or delivery, it's all good.  They have an 'Xtra large' horchata that comes in a small pitcher - love it.The same woman seems to be here all the time.  Waitressing the room, Taking phone orders and managing online orders.  She's amazing.

18.description: I just move literally right around the corner from this place. It's a great late night snack place. Their food is well put together and taste great. I lived there for about a month now and so far I've been there about 4 times. And I will continue going there if they continue serving me tasty good food.

41.description: The tortas were good even though they forgot to put the milanesa inside, the orchata & Jamaica were horrible water down. The servers were polite and friendly but the owner or person in charge was very rude when I gave him my comment it wAs like a slap on the face to him he said they don't make mistakes like that the so he said. He got a little loud that's when one of the server step in and told him that they did forget and the water was the last in the machine so they added some water to get my order out. Well in conclusion this will be my last time going to this location but I still the location on Montrose.

52.description: At this price, Rocky's Taco is literally as good as it gets

50.description: My wife and I just order from this place and we both loved it.  Not a whole lot to say, Mexican food is so similar it is tough to really differentiate one from the other, but they had fast delivery and good prices.   I would order from them over all places in my area.

4.description: This place has the best tacos in Rogers Park. Don't make the mistake of going to the other mediocre places! This is where you come to get fresh and delicious tacos. No where else. Promise. :-)

6.description: Just try it.  They have THE MOST AWSOME sandwiches here.  A selection unlike anything you have ever seen.Plus chips & ham/cilantro/onion/jalapeño salsa for your chips.  Yes, I said ham.They have tacos too, but I am too busy working my way down the sandwich menu.I only came here because my favorite tamale place in the world was closed. (Tamales Lo Mejor de Guererro).You should too.

22.description: Went here tonight for a late dinner. Service was awful, but the food was very good from now on I'll be doing carry out only.

15.description: This place has every single type of torta you could imagine. The one I always get is the C. Blanco. The tacos are good too. The only thing that is different about this place than others is they put chopped ham on their salsa and I have never seen that before. Definitely worth trying!

57.description: I was disappointed in this place.  I ordered a chicken burrito,  the meat wasn't tasty,  it was gristly and just not good.  I may try it again, but i don't know.

20.description: I use to be in love with this place, the vibe, food, service, the owner is amazing. Ranted and raved this place to all my friend and family until I returned back one day and had horrible service with the wrong order. But the icing on the cake is that I just had a newborn baby less than 3 weeks old and she was placed in her car seat strapped in on top of the high chair and the waitress knocked down the entire high chair with my baby in her car seat. As a first time mom, I will never return back to this place because of this experience. Food use to be great, service sucks and not to mention the safety and well being of my daughter was jeopardize because of a waitress' poor judgement and inability to pay attention.

36.description: Best torta i ever had,and probably the most selections of different tortas in Chicago all named with a soccer theme,try the Planillera,it's heavenly

14.description: The service is top shelf and the torta's are of matching quality! So many to choose from. I had the "Chicago Fire" and I had to come back the next day to try another!! It's my new fav local place cooking up authentic Mexican food.

3.description: This shop is a Chicago Gem. The collages and art that the owner creates give the shop a warm, personal feel. The selection of goods for sale is very broad. This is the store that has what you're looking for.

1.description: I used to love coming to Kim's corner before I hopped on the train to go to work.They really do have everything imaginable in that little store. Mr. Kim always greeted me with a smile and I always made room to have a little chat with him..ahh the good ol' rogers park days.

2.description: Mr Kim recently got a pack of stick on letter and numbers and has made about a million signs for everything in the store. It's super cute. SO now you can look into the cooler and see that the bacon is labelled "BACON" and so on.

5.description: I'm very happy to have this corner store by me. The owners are really nice and the prices aren't bad (for a convenience store).

0.description: I love this little store. They have literally EVERYTHING under the sun from coffee creamer to men's boxer shorts in an array of pastel colors.  You want Pop Rocks?  They got 'em.  Bologna? Got it.  Hair nets?  Check.But the greatest thing about Kim's is they take credit cards which a lot of little stores don't.  There's also a fine ATM in there for those neighborhood places that require cash only.And the people who work in there are really delightful.  I used to live near Sonny's and would have to force myself to go in there because that place just was not right.  I'll take Kim's any day of the week.

4.description: I always think this place is just crazy expensive.  Now, I understand it's a corner store but I see them bringing in items in their own van that they probably purchased at Costco and you can't imagine the rent on the location is very high.

3.description: By far the best barbershop in Evanston/Rogers Park. They have barbers who actually know what their doing and take their time, even if they have people waiting. Their all about quality! If you are like me and don't like waiting, make an appointment. Highly recommend.

1.description: Warning!!! Stay away from bald headed lady who cuts hair in the front. She is not good, she mess my face up. My beard lining was way off and she has dirty equipment. Do your self a favor, don't pick her even if your in a hurry.

2.description: Marvin really understands mixed-ethnic hair.  I am half white and I couldn't find ANYONE to do my hair and he was my saving grace!  He really listened to what I wanted and worked very long and hard to give me a precision haircut.

5.description: Been going here for about 2 years now, Mike is by far the best barber I've had. Really don't have anything negative to say.

6.description: Love it i've been coming here since my son's 1st hair cut and that was 4yrs ago. Wouldn't go anywhere else

0.description: Mike at Hairz R Us is the truth!

4.description: After bouncing around between a few barber shops, I happened upon this one.  Mike is the man, and he always does my hair right.  Yes the place is crowded from time to time, but to me, that's a sign of a barber shop that has a good reputation for doing great work.  It's a nice place to do business with.

28.description: NOTE: I have only ever ordered delivery from here.SIDENOTE: Delivery is normally a bad idea for mexican food, but this place is that good.Cheap as hell.I usually get the "extra" taco, which is a bit larger, has onions and cilantro, all for $0.65 more than the regular taco. So far, I think I like the Chorizo taco best, but the chicken is a close second; the meat is miraculously tender for a taqueria, and flavored wonderfully with their salsas! They're so cheap we usually get a sampler.I had the beef burrito and while it was pretty standard ingredients-wise, way above the average taqueria. They grill it longer or something and the tortilla is always slightly crunchy and the ingredients flavorful. Salsas. Awesome. Homemade, I think - spicier than most places are willing to risk. Overall, while there's nothing fancy in the food, I think this is the best authentic Mexican staple food I've ever had.

1.description: This place is SUCH a good deal! They have a bunch of $1 tacos, and tortas for a little over $5. The tortas are delicious, and they are also unexpectedly big. One torta will probably be enough to fill you up. 4 tacos is also just about enough to make you very full. All of the meats are good. I tried the pastor and chorizo meats, and they are both quite succulent. Chips and salsa are provided free of charge. Service is great.

39.description: Great chips & salsa, and food. We will be back!

9.description: The food is AMAZING, the service is WONDERFUL, staff and waitresses are a DELIGHT.  WILL BE BACK, LOVE THIS PLACE!!We had burritos, rice and beans and nachos with ground beef.  It was SOOOO DELICIOUS and very reasonably priced.  Our waitress was the nicest woman in the world.  It was clean and quaint and just a joy.  Made our evening perfect.If you're thinking about going, GO!

29.description: My boyfriend went out to get me some chicken soup. I understand, most of you don't come here to order chicken soup, but hey, "caldo de pollo" is pretty standard at a Mexican restaurant, so I usually trust most places to give me a decent bowl. Worst chicken soup I have ever had. So, I'm thinking, if there's real chicken in here, why does this soup taste like someone dumped 10 bouillon cubes in it? It tasted like the leftover ramen water--from the cheapest ramen you can get your hands on. Awful. How hard is it to make chicken soup? Toss the chicken in, a little salt,  pepper, and some vegetables. This soup had a cup of salt in it, and the chicken looked foul, not fowl--bruised, BLACK, and certainly not edible. I didn't even want to give it to my dog.

42.description: This place is definitely my favorite taqueria in the neighborhood. You get an amazing amount of food for the money ($4.50 burritos the size of your head!) and it tastes great. The Nachos and the Cheese Melt burrito are great - the sauce is perfectly spicy/cheesy. The free homemade tortillas and salsa are very good and of course you can't beat the $1 tacos! It's BYOB and the server is really friendly.

23.description: Good food if you get what you order. I love loud music. I also love to eat. The two don't always go together. The TV or music, depending on which is playing, is so loud the server has trouble hearing your order. I am not soft-spoken; in fact I am loud and I still had to repeat myself a couple of times to place my order. Twice out of the three times I have eaten in the restaurant I have been given the wrong item. I will admit they were close but not correct. A Carne Asada dinner is not a Carne Asada Taco dinner. Calling for delivery was a nightmare. The order taker could not hear us. She told us to hold on and went to the back of the restaurant and still could not here us. I appreciate that they are enjoying themselves but when I want food I want what I ordered. There are better places nearby where the noise does not make your ears bleed.

5.description: Was here for lunch and got a chorizo quesadilla with corn tortilla ($4.25) and a $1 steak taco. So, so good and so worth it at this price point. The quesadilla also looked mostly like a very large hard-shell taco but it was amazing and delicious and packed full of delicious cheese and meat.

31.description: It's too bad that their TVs are blaring at such an unpleasant volume.  The food is good but the noise is a major turn off-that and the dirty chairs.  On my last visit there I asked the waitress Twice to turn down the novela.  I think I annoyed her.

25.description: Two huge steak burritos, a diet coke, a Jarritos, and some delicious guacamole for a total of $18. Can't beat that price. And the food is tasty. Not the absolute *best* burrito I've ever had (that would take a bit more seasoning of the steak), but nobody's going to leave complaining (or if they do, you'll know they're some kind of alien in human disguise). I LOVE how they grill their burritos so the tortilla is slightly crunchy. Mmm. I wish this were in my neighborhood; I'd visit every day. Wait... Maybe I'm grateful that it isn't in my neighborhood, because, like I said, the burrito was HUGE. And I have no discipline when it comes to the immediate devouring of huge delicious burritos.Anyway, waistline be damned -- I'll be back for dollar tacos soon!

12.description: I always enjoy this place.  They have good Al Pastor and inexpensive tacos.  BYOB.  Some of their stuff is made with fresh masa, like the gorditas.

37.description: Called to make sure they had the sopas de menudo.  She said yes but there were only two left, so I requested that she back both for me.  It was good although a bit greasy for me.  I put it in the fridge for a few hours so the grease would coagulate and then eliminated the layer of fat.  Reheated the sopas and it was divine.  Takes the chill off and cures colds (and hangovers, I am told)

21.description: So seriously, I don't know how the entire city of Chicago is sleeping on this place, but they are.  Okay, well I know how, it's in the 7000 north block and most lame Chicagoans think the city limits stop at Irving Park.  Let's get down to business.  Food:  Yum:  The pork tacos and the tongue(if that's your thing) are insanely good.  So is the steak.  I mean they do it just right from the meat prep to the taco itself.  Coke In a bottle, a must at a good Mexican place, check.  Free chips and Salsa, check.  And the chips are perfectly salted in my opinion.  But it gets better, the tacos are $1.00-$1.65 depending on size.  CHEAP AND DELICIOUS.  I fed four adults for under $20 bucks.  Tell me when the last time you did that was...yea, didn't think so.Ambience:  Exactly what I want from a mom and pop Mexican joint.  Clean and with Mexican soap operas on the screens.  Service was prompt and friendly.  I will be  making the trek back up there soon.

16.description: Awesome taqueria!! Love it! Fast service and awesome tacos! Try the tripe tacos they are the best ones even if they arent in the $1 menu... also any of the $1 tacos are amazing as well.

17.description: Awesome food! Better prices! I got the dollar tacos; beef, chorizo, chicken, pork and the steak ($2) . So all this with chip and salsa, served with red and verde salsa (which was spicy and really good) and soda $11!!! The food was easily 4 stars but the price makes this place 5 stars! Parking was also easy on a Thursday night ~7:30pm.

10.description: So seriously, I don't know how the entire city of Chicago is sleeping on this place, but they are.  Okay, well I know how, it's in the 7000 north block and most lame Chicagoans think the city limits stop at Irving Park.  Let's get down to business.  Food:  Yum:  The pork tacos and the tongue(if that's your thing) are insanely good.  So is the steak.  I mean they do it just right from the meat prep to the taco itself.  Coke In a bottle, a must at a good Mexican place, check.  Free chips and Salsa, check.  And the chips are perfectly salted in my opinion.  But it gets better, the tacos are $1.00-$1.65 depending on size.  CHEAP AND DELICIOUS.  I fed four adults for under $20 bucks.  Tell me when the last time you did that was...yea, didn't think so.Ambience:  Exactly what I want from a mom and pop Mexican joint.  Clean and with Mexican soap operas on the screens.  Service was prompt and friendly.  I will be  making the trek back up there soon.

11.description: Can't beat their $1 tacos!! Caldo is good too! Nice place & employees. TV is really loud though, sometimes I have to raise my voice over the phone to order. Eat here a bunch with family :)

26.description: The best tacos I've had in many years in Chicago recommended 1000% tongue tacos tripe tacos and tacos al pastor were on point I am very picky when comes to Mexican food but this place left me satisfied is clean cheap and over all an most important has a real Mexican food taste to it go there and experience people don't be afraid to take your friend and family

27.description: In my final week of pregnancy I am trying to do all that I can to get this baby moving! I had a craving for Mexican food and I wanted to encourage some movement with spicy salsa, so we looked for a place fairly close by to try. There are a ton of options on Clark street but the Yelp reviews sold us on this one.The food was good... initially I wasn't super thrilled with the chips, but after a couple they got better (I think my first one or two were stale or maybe just not done all the way??). We ordered fresh guac that was delicious and I had the chicken quesadilla. The chicken was good but there could have been a bit more cheese. My husband really enjoyed his enchiladas and taco. He is a fairly harsh critic and kept saying "this place is really good!"....I would definitely go back. No frills, just pretty good food.

35.description: Dined in at this small Mexican spot off Clark street.  Started with chips and two kinds of salsa that come with every meal.  Just a standard red salsa and a green verde with chips.  I would give them a 3/5 for chips and salsa.I ordered the chicken quesadilla and it was loaded with flavor.  The chicken was juicy and marinated and dripping out with great tasting cheese.  4.5/5 on this meal.I also ordered 3 $1 dollar tacos which was a fantastic deal! Chicken, steak, and ground beef that came with onions and cilantro.  They were a 4.5/5 and a wonder value. Very pleased overall with this place and will certainly be back.

8.description: I went there on my 24th birthday with my friends. This was hands down one of the best value-for-money Mexican restaurants I have ever been too. With a great selection of authentic food, they have a great chef back in the kitchen! It is BYOB so you can get your own poison to go well with the food. The beans and rice here are to die for. I had the tortas and I am not exaggerating when I say that all my friends heard the crunch of the bread as I bit into it. All in all, great place for affordable Mexican noms.

0.description: This is the best Mexican restaurant in Rogers Park! I order from here 2-3 times a month and I just can't get enough of this place. Their guacamole is the best I've had from any Mexican joint. I usually order carry out from here but occasionally dine in and the staff is always super friendly regardless! Their prices are fair and what you would expect anywhere but they do have the special $1 tacos that you can't beat. I recommend this place to everyone!

38.description: Excellent little hole in the wall taqueria.  All of the tacos are great and the tortillas are made in house.  Try the tripe tacos, they were crunchy and delicious.  I will be back to try the huge, cheap burritos and the tortas.

20.description: I saw the photos and the ratings and had to go. The woman I ordered from was SO nice and the food was cheap. I wanted to like this place so much. I ordered the steak burrito. Unfortunately my food reflected the price I paid and made me feel sick for the rest of the night.

19.description: Best Mexican Food in Rogers Park.  Concerning standard tacos, burritos, enchiladas,  etc.... The steak, chorizo, and pork are amazing and all dirt cheap.  All eat in orders come with free chips and two kinds of salsa.

33.description: This place is great. My roommate and I were looking for a place to go for tacos every week, this was the second place we tried and were sold. The service is friendly, the prices are awesome and the food is deliciosa! I've tried most of the items on the menu and have never found something I didn't like! The horchata is yummy too. Go here for authentic comida mexicana!

2.description: Come here for the  $1 tacos ! If you eat in the salsa is super good add lime to your carne asada tacos to make them as tasty and authentic as the ones in Mexico , another option is the quesadilla with flor de calabaza along with mushrooms and carne asada. The tortas here are also super good ! Also if you eat in get some coffee it tastes just like Mexico with the cinnamon and pilloncillo.

34.description: I am very impressed with this taqueria.The salsas are good, the food come out hot off the grill, portion sizes are excellent (generous with meat and cheese), and the prices are the best I have seen in Chicago. They are open fairly late as well (10pm).Only downside was maybe my lime slice was not so juicy, but that's not really so important with the salsas being so good.If you live in the area or if you are ever shuttling between the north side and Evanston, I strongly recommend that you eat here.

32.description: Tacos were really good. Came very quickly.Always get the orders correct. Good customer service. My new favorite taco place.

18.description: In my final week of pregnancy I am trying to do all that I can to get this baby moving! I had a craving for Mexican food and I wanted to encourage some movement with spicy salsa, so we looked for a place fairly close by to try. There are a ton of options on Clark street but the Yelp reviews sold us on this one.The food was good... initially I wasn't super thrilled with the chips, but after a couple they got better (I think my first one or two were stale or maybe just not done all the way??). We ordered fresh guac that was delicious and I had the chicken quesadilla. The chicken was good but there could have been a bit more cheese. My husband really enjoyed his enchiladas and taco. He is a fairly harsh critic and kept saying "this place is really good!"....I would definitely go back. No frills, just pretty good food.

41.description: I've tried many of the small mexican joints along north clark and this place had the best Pastor Tacos.  For $1 you can get a small taco that is loaded with alot of meat, a great value.  The taste was great.  Azada and Pollo were also very good.  Definately get the Pastor though.  The salsa verde is perfect, enough heat but you can still taste the tomatillos.  I will be going back.

13.description: Horrible!! Found a hair on food. Will never be coming back. Disgusting. Also. Horrible service.

4.description: Want to edit my review. Every restaurant deserves a second chance. Though the food that day off not that great that day, we all have bad days.

24.description: Just had a fantastic meal of tacos with rice and beans for two, under $15. Great service, and BYOB. I'll be back!

6.description: This is a cute little place with a relatively small dining room. I ordered the Burrito Suizo Chicken and it was fantastic and huge. Overall this place is pretty much exactly what I would expect from a small Chicago Mexican restaurant.  The waitress was quiet but fun and sweet. I had left my food on the table when we left the restaurant and as I was getting in my car she ran out to hand it to me. Will definitely be coming back.

22.description: Authentic $1 tacos. Ask for some avocados on the tacos and you're in heaven. Bring your own beer to Cd Hidalgo and eat cheaply. They have slightly more expensive tacos for under 1.50 which are a little larger and include more varieties like tripe and tongue.

15.description: $1 tacos, sure they're little, but you can try all the different kinds and get lots of them, and everything is just delicious. Chips and salsa and refritos were all great, too, which is a good sign when the little things are also done well. Need to explore the menu, there's lots more to try.

40.description: Surprise - surprise: today's huarache (we chose with pastor) was done with black beans in the masa! (Initially I only noticed the taste and texture was different but I wrote it off that it was long since we had ordered).Don't suppose they've been reading my original post? Either way - I guess this is more traditional - I think a combination of red and green salsas on it, topped with queso fresco (?) and onions maybe if I remember.Another surprise - I usually never order the pollo taco anywhere with the expectation that it will be dry - but I figured worth trying something different for their $1 taco. Turns out, juicy, pulled in way so that the meat was fluffy rather than chunky - yeah hard to describe, and not skimping on the filling either. Great tortillas as usual (can they really be handmade for $1?)

7.description: Excellent food. Very small dining room. Bathrooms not so great. Will def go back again.

36.description: I ordered on a Saturday night, two ground beef tacos and one chicken taco along with a chicken burrito. It was AMAzING. By far the best Mexican in Rogers Park that I have tried. I have been very disappointed with others in the area, so I decided to Yelpmgood Mexican food in the area and this place popped up. I will be back for sure, ths is my he spot!

30.description: Chips were way too salty, server forgot my lengua (tongue) taco, and chile relenos was too cheesy/average at best. What rocked was their fresh made gordita skin. Just run-o-the-mill and won't go back.

3.description: Good prices and good portions! Tried a pambazos for the first time and it was excellent.

14.description: Been to this joint a couple of times.  Never dissappointed.  Typical but very good Tacqueria, with small double wrapped  Tacos for only $1.  Meat choices are all good -- usually we get a couple of each.  And, of course, they give you free Chips and Salsa.  And, best of all, it's BYOB.  Definately Recommended.

3.description: Well . I stop by to check what they have for sale. I see some sterling rings and coins in cases non of them priced. I know silver and gold very well so quick look and few questions. How much you pay for silver scrap - EVERYDAY DIFFERENT PRICE , ok but today is today, I added , what kind of silver? I told you scrap! , we have to check your silver first ! Ok. So I gave them sterling trim from Lenox plate , clearly mark STERLING . They put acid and try tell me isn't Sterling because turned green. I didn't see any green but say , ok. I took my piece and simply you decide if you like or not deal with this kind of people.!!!!!

1.description: I've been to Gold Star Jewelry & Coin on three occasions. Each time, I was treated like a valued customer. This is not your typical pawn shop. The people here are warm and engaging. They also are eager work with you. They just don't want your money, they want a lifetime relationship that makes you want to go there to help yourself in times of need. They also want to sell you items that that you are truly interested in.  The best part is they will go outside of the box to help you purchase that item. They will step outside of the box to help you.  They should be called: Gold Star, We got that name because we treat our customers like Gold."They really do.

0.description: Typically, I am turned off by dealing with pawnshops, but Gold star Jewelry and Coin Company really helped change my mind.Recently, I was a victim of a bike theft. Prepared to call every pawnshop in town, I eventually got to talking to Bruce. He was so helpful! He told me all about the online database to which all pawnshops are legally required to report, and how I could access that database to  register my bike. Thank you, Bruce, for being a sympathetic and helpful presence, in an otherwise harrowing ordeal. Thank you for your integrity and honesty.

2.description: As a first time Pawn customer I really appreciated their willingness to have an honest conversation about how the business works relating to what they are selling and what products customers are actually purchasing. The service is fast and the transaction flows with ease.

5.description: I would like to say I was in a huge bind today and Joyce Lowis really helped me out.I am loyal to people that are loyal to me. I believe whole heartedly in customer service. She was honest and fair that is rare these days. In conclusion Joyce has made a repeat customer and  loyal friend to her and her husbands business. I am new to the area and this was a goldmine of a find

6.description: Surprisingly I went into Gold Star not expecting much, but then I found the best deals on jewelry I've seen in the city. Pleasantly surprised I will continue my business with Gold Star.

7.description: This was the best pawn shop experience I've ever had. I highly recommend anyone who needs to buy it sell. They've made it a very smooth process. Best part, they very friendly!

8.description: I don't know what the rave is about this place. Maybe the owner was having a bad day even though it's only 10 in the morning. He was a jerk to me. I went in to pawn a something and come to find out it was fake. Ok... what could I do about that?  He offers me $10, then asked me how much I wanted for it. I told him how much I originally wanted before I knew it was a fake, and he laughed and said it was worth $10, then he asked me again how much I wanted for it. Well, now I'm confused b/c he just said it was worth $10. Then he goes off on a schpeel about something, I don't even remember what he was talking about but he was quite rude. Then he asked me again, how much I want for it, so I said $100, I mean, why not try right? He kept asking me so I thought, GO FOR SOMETHING!! He literally laughed out loud, threw my item at me and with a smirk said "Good luck" . Really? If it's only worth $10, why keep asking me how much I want? I need more than 10 freakin bucks! He was just rude and condescending.  I was already nervous to go in there. I had never been to a pawn shop before so it was a little intimidating and then I get spoken to rudely, laughed at and have my item tossed back at me? I see all of the reviews about how nice these people are, but I guess they're only nice if they can work with you. I'm already frustrated b/c I don't have money for rent and then I get treated like this....I cried all the way home. I'm not usually a cry baby but this experience did not help my frustration. I could have taken, "sorry ma'am this is fake and not worth anything" that's how this works, but the attitude is what ticks me off.

9.description: Joyce worked with me to get exactly what I wanted at my price point. I needed a silver chain for my dad. He wanted it to hang in an exact spot where he had been injured in an auto accident. The had  the chain cut, polished and ready to go the same day. I am happy with the purchase and found the price very fair for the chain even without the custom cut. Thanks guys!

10.description: The owner were friendly and I felt very comfortable in the store. Bruce is a great character and very interesting to talk to. He knows a lot about gold and gave me a fair deal.

4.description: Pawnshops can be intimidating, especially for a novice pawner (pawnee?) like myself. In an ocean of cluttered reviews and shops all over town, it can be difficult to find a reliable and honest establishment. That's why I feel very lucky to have found Gold Star.The main points of contact here are Bruce and Joyce. I'm pretty sure they are married. They couldn't be nicer or more friendly. I also really got the sense that they had great knowledge of the supply and demand and they weren't out to rip me off. Now, I'm not in Chicago often. Just now and again for business or to visit some friends. But after my experience with Bruce and Joyce, I'm planning to hang onto to any items I want to pawn until my next trip to the windy city. I don't think they make pawn shops like this is L.A.GO HERE if you have anything to pawn. If you are one of those people who are weary about pawnshops or don't know much about how they work, then don't worry, this is the place to go. You''ll have ease-of-mind and your wallet will thank you.

3.description: Having lived in Rogers Park almost 10yrs, I am beyond ecstatic that this store is here. Stopped by with friends to check it out before grabbing a cocktail next door at RP Social. Walked out with stationery, candles and cheese & sausage (which we ate with our cocktails). Ended up hosting Thanksgiving and went in again to get more cheese/sausage hors d'oeurves recommendations from John Paul. Walked out with that, knife set, coffee and more candles & stationery. Cool little shop that definitely has my business.

1.description: If you need to throw a classy dinner party, get someone a unique gift, or want to treat yourself to some fancy cheese, go here! The owners/staff are also super helpful & knowledgeable, and they are committed to the community. I am so glad we finally have something like this in Rogers Park!

2.description: This place was the BEST shop I literally stumbled across! I was visiting my stepsister who lives in roger park and looking for a unique shop that had goods that I couldn't just get in any city. I was looking for Chicago based anything really to bring home as gifts to my parents. The other shops that were praised online for here gifts and oddities  where quite generic and had very little to offer when it came to truly local products/creations. I happened to be walking back to her place when she spotted this amazing place. The guy who was working was fantastic (not sure his name oops) and knowledgeable of the inventory. He was great help in finding the perfect things to take back home! I could go on and on, but essentially I LOVED IT!!

0.description: I am so glad this opened in Rogers Park!  A great shop that carries awesome and unique items for dinner parties, birthdays, or other special events.  Especially for us etiquette-inept, who need a little (a lot) of help being proper guests or hosts.  The shop has only been open a few months, but I have already gone in multiple times with last minute requests:  cheese tray for a party, urgent birthday gift, wedding present... the list goes on.  In fact, again today, I called in with an urgent request:Procrastinating me: "OMG, do you carry desserts?  I need to bring a dessert!" Wonderful RPP person: "Sure, we can have something ready for you, when do you want to pick up?" Very thankful me: "ASAP" Truly awesome RPP person:  "No problem" See what I mean?  And the things they carry are really awesome.  Have you ever had a chocolate sausage?  No?  Well then, you must try it!  Need a decorative unique Chicago themed platter?  This is your place!  What about amazing smelling candles (which I always get compliments on, btw)?  Yep, right here.  Oh, you're going to a same sex wedding?  Lovely wedding cards perfect for the occasion.  Need a sandwich on the way to Rogers Park Social?  Why, hello yummy baguettes!  I also hear that they will soon have their packaged liquor license. I can't wait for that. I'm already a hit at parties when I bring anything from RPP; I have no doubt their wine selection will be to die for.  Thank you, Rogers Park Provisions, for helping make this etiquette-inept person into an Emily Post poster child.

58.description: A solid bar/music venue in Rogers Park.  I like that you can see great bluegrass (Sexfist) for free on Tuesday nights, I like the pool table, I like the nightly beer specials, and I like the mix of people that make their way into the place.  But for some reason, there's just something that keeps this place from being great.

56.description: My first five-star review. Total dive, in the BEST way.Located next to (and owned by) the historic Heartland Cafe. If you're young, open-minded, and like dive bars, there is basically nothing to not like about this place. The live music is pretty stylistically unpredictable--which I usually hate, but somehow it works here. The bartenders are wonderful and get to know you. You can get delicious food from Heartland brought over, and the drinks are reasonably priced. There's a pool table near the window, and a Ms Pacman / Galaga machine near the door. And if you come here more than three times, it really could end up being the type of place where "everybody knows your name."The best part is the Thursday Open Mic, hosted by the smooth, mellow-voiced Micki. In a time when most open mics in this city are seeing a recession-based lack of turnout, this one is thriving. And it's no wonder: Micki and the crew make everyone feel at home, and if you go enough, you become part of the family whether you like it or not. It's a fantastic little community.If you're looking for a sparkly clean, upscale place with bad cover bands, this joint probably isn't for you. But if you can embrace its original music and character--and it has a lot--you'll might find yourself having a really good time.

29.description: Great drink specials (they change throughout the year). One's I have enjoyed are 2 dollar tall boys and well drinks, or 1 dollar Miller High Lifes.The cover usually isn't worth it unless you know who is playing. But there is no cover on Tuesdays, and there's always live Bluegrass on Tuesday nights.Street parking is basically non-existent. Good thing it's right by the Morse Red Line stop... hey maybe that's where it got it's name (for those who don't know how to get there except by bike--which is okay, I guess).A neighborhood bar with enough dive to feel comfortable your first time here. The bathrooms may be something to complain about, but I don't think you want to spend too much time in there anyway.Oh yeah, the staff is pretty cool and laid back as well. Say hi!
