However, it still encompassed all the great qualities that are lacking in many ice creams that tend to melt way too quickly. It was the perfect dessert to end a fabulous home-like meal.It was home-style cooking at its best. Service was warm, friendly, and efficient. We were well taken cared of as the food came quickly and piping hot. Price was a bit higher than other restaurants, but portions and servings were well worth it. Our water was constantly refilled and the server kept checking on us from time to time. I'd be very interested in coming back to try their Aji de Gallina, Cau-Cau, and Ceviche.

59.description: This place has delicious food. Great atmosphere, and the owner came over to our table and chatted with us; he's a really friendly guy. The portions are big, and the service is not the fastest but overall a great experience. I would definitely recommend it to others!

21.description: Taste or Peru is delish! I'm so stuck on the Lomo Saltado I haven't got to try anything else really. I order the same thing every time since I have a craving for it often, that must mean something! Also pretty cool that guy fieri has been there!

17.description: I've been here a couple of times. During lunch hours it could be pretty quiet, at least from my one time coming here on a Friday. The other times I've cone here on a weekend. Now, I would suggest you call ahead and get a reservation if you're coming during the weekend, especially at night. The place is small and crowded with tables and chairs. But there is enough room to sit comfortable. There is a parking lot and street parking but that parking lot gets full easily. Now the food, it's just good! Damn good! You really taste Peru when you eat here, authentic and very flavorful. Don't forget to grab an Inca Kola, it's a must! The food speaks for itself and you cannot go wrong. They have a ton of seafood options too. Price matches quality, on point! Recommended and will keep coming back

10.description: Definitivamente delicioso! Every time I eat here, I feel like I'm in Peru. The food is absolutely delicious, only thinking about their ceviche my mouth starts watering. My friends and I have celebrated many birthdays here, because  is byob and they can accommodate big groups. Normally I will order: the Arroz con mariscos (is so big that 2 people can eat it), the ceviche is just perfect (just like in Peru), tamales, anticuchos and Inka cola (Peruvian Soda). And for dessert I usually get "Alfajores" its like a cookie with dulce de leche, and is to die for! The owner of taste of Peru is very charismatic and always making sure people are happy with the service and food. I'm latina and this is my favorite Peruvian restaurant in Chicago.

5.description: Taste of PerúNo, Perú isn't a person.  It's a country south of Colombia where I get my cocaine and west of Brazil where I get my crack, there's a little geography lesson for you.  Amazing family founded and operated places in the world really make me believe that there is still hope in the world to retain culinary tradition and culture.  Good enough for Guy Fieri, Good enough for meEveryone knows Guy's palette is legit.  For the most part he's on point, no difference here.   Ordered paella ("best in Chicago"), cilantro rice with chicken, seafood soup (Parihuela), stuffed potato (papa rellena), and mama carmen all which were mouth watering, double 'U'-tee-eff type of food.  BYOBBYOB lesson #1 - If a place is BYOB and you didn't have a good time, that's your fault.

3.description: The minute you open the doors, the intoxicating aromas greet you & doesn't let you go.  Authentic.

35.description: totally disappointing!  I spent over $40.00 here recently, which I usually order from here about once a month.  The portions were horrible.  about two ounces of meat for the famous Lomo Saltado!  I figured at $15.00 a portion, the meat and the potato would have a lot more to offer.   The food has gone way down hill.  I will just go and spend my money somewhere else from now on.  Not worth the high prices, and complete joke of portions.   I also tipped %20 for pickup.  Don't write your tab until you get your meal, as you will be waiting for some time, and judge your tip by that.  Disappointing to say the least.  breaks my heart, because I used to depend on this place for good food, at a reasonable  price.

19.description: Everything is so good here. From the salchipapas to the lomo saltado. So damn good. All the good is flavorful and tastes home cooked. Nothing will disappoint you.

28.description: This place has a cozy feel. The byob is great and so is the food. The owner walks around like a family member checking in everyone. The ingredients were fresh and the food was tasty. It's a small place but we didn't wait too long. Be mindful of peak times and you'll be in good shape.

45.description: The food is amazing. I have never tried anything I didn't like! Paella is my go to dish,  the seafood is fresh and yummy. The last two times I had Lomo Saltado, and just loved it. It's not a huge place, and the owner always stops by our table to see if everything is good. And it always is! Bring your own wine, there's no liquor. Ceviche appetizer is tastes of lime and is delicious. I don't think I ever had dessert, maybe that will be a treat for next time.

33.description: This is about as good as it gets for neighborhood restaurants.I highly recommend the seafood paella. Bring in a Pisco bottle for homemade Pisco Sours to be made and served by the everpresent host.

43.description: My first time trying Peruvian food with my Peruvian friend and it was excellent.  Very charming place.   Friendly service and great food.  Very Clean.    The food was flavorful, with high quality ingredients.    Plenty of Parking in the Plaza.

2.description: This review is for carry out only:Service over the phone and pick up was nice. Food was really flavorful and I would come here again. The main reason for 3 stars instead of 4 was that while the portions were large, it was mainly rice and sauce. There were very few pieces of meat in each dish and that was disappointing and overall not a good value for the price.

18.description: What a wonderful surprise on in a strip mall next to a laundromat.  This place was great and the people are super nice.  I would have never ventured in however it was recommended and I will be back.  VERY good food, wonderful Peruvian coffee and the waitress could not have been nicer.  PLEASE try this place, you will be amazed.

41.description: Definitivamente delicioso! Every time I eat here, I feel like I'm in Peru. The food is absolutely delicious, only thinking about their ceviche my mouth starts watering. My friends and I have celebrated many birthdays here, because  is byob and they can accommodate big groups. Normally I will order: the Arroz con mariscos (is so big that 2 people can eat it), the ceviche is just perfect (just like in Peru), tamales, anticuchos and Inka cola (Peruvian Soda). And for dessert I usually get "Alfajores" its like a cookie with dulce de leche, and is to die for! The owner of taste of Peru is very charismatic and always making sure people are happy with the service and food. I'm latina and this is my favorite Peruvian restaurant in Chicago.

52.description: This place is considered (the best hidden secret in Chicago) amazing service and amazing food. If you come to this place for the first time, make sure you order (lomo Saltado) dish. It is their number one steak, rice & potato dish. You'll thank me later. The owner is a real nice man as well. Always makes his costumers happy by making sure They are satisfied.

50.description: Delicious! CRAZY good food.  The mussels with cerviche appetizer was awesome  - and I'm not even that big of a mussels fan. We also had another appetizer that was potato based but sort of reminded me of a deviled egg flavor? It was phenom. As were all the main dishes that our table of 10 was served - everyone really enjoyed the food. The owner also treated us to a round of really tasty Pisco sours (there had been a small snafu with the reservation - another party took it under our friend's name) but I thought the owner and staff really handled the mix-up (and those will happen). It was completely worth the wait - I will definitely be going back! Yum!

4.description: Great place to have TRADITIONAL peruvian food. The enviorment and decoration is far from fancy but its ok for a casual lunch. Its BYOB so you can buy cheap beer from the liquor store in the corner. Here is my recommendation of what you should order (6 people), starting from the best:Yuquitas con huancainaCeviche de pescadoLomo saltadoTacu Tacu con lomo y huevoChaufa de camaronesCausa de polloChicarron de calamar

6.description: Great food! So glad i found this place. I had the combo for two and it was delicious and food deal. Ceviche mixto, chaufa, papa a la huancaina, and a tamal. I will definetly be back

22.description: The food at Taste of Peru is as authentic as anything I have had in Lima or Cuzsco, and maybe better.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere relaxed.   BYOB adds to the value.  When they  have a band the ambiance is transportive.

15.description: A great neighborhood gem! Authentic Peruvian food. Taste was also a stop for Guy Fierri on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives! Very friendly and attentive service. Plenty of parking too!

57.description: A perfect hole in the wall restaurant! This is the very definition of a hidden treasure. Located in a little strip mall with parking, Taste of Peru gave my taste buds a tickle. The Peruvian ceviche with fish, shrimp, calamari, and mussels with a side red onion salad was perfectly balanced. I have never been to Peru but this restaurant really felt like I was taken to a dream food land. Price points are very low considering the quality this restaurant brings. The tamale was one of the best I have ever had and the steak dishes were succulent.  Even the white rice had a deeper flavor! This is hands down one of my top favorite restaurants in Chicago. Oh yeah! It's BYOB and there's a liquor store on either side a block away!

20.description: Taste of Peru is a hidden gem in Rogers Park. My fiancé and I come here often and always get the Guy Fieri combo, it's perfect for two people to share and absolutely delicious! It comes with a tamale, chicken and steak skewers, a steak strip main dish with rice and fries, and a dessert. Everything is always perfectly cooked and the service is excellent! Oh, and they're Byob! You are missing out of you haven't yet dined here!

36.description: ¡Mucho sabor! ("Much flavor!" in Spanish)Great hole-in-the-wall to casually come with a group of friends. Their jalapeno sauce goes perfectly with all their dishes. Very, very, very flavorful food. Arroz con Pollo: 4.5/5 -- Very well-cooked chicken with amazing cilantro-based sauce and rice. I love flavorful rice that is fully satisfying on its own even when you're done eating all the meat. Simple dish executed to perfection. Arroz con Mariscos: 4.5/5 -- Speaking of delicious and flavorful rice, this dish definitely hits the spot as well. This is a plethora of seafood mixed into one incredible dish. All the seafood was very fresh and appetizing, except for the clams. Clams not as fresh as expected. Lomo Saltado: 4.5/5 -- This one was amazing as well. Honestly, all three dishes described thus far were outstanding, but I would recommend this over the other two for its uniqueness. Delicious stripped beef cooked with tomatoes, onions, AND fries. Never tried anything like it. Anticuchos De Carne O Pollo: 3.5/5 -- This dish included both chicken and beef. While the chicken was tender, chewy, and flavorful, the beef was lackluster and not the freshest. Tamales with Chicken: 3.5/5 -- Pretty good but nothing compared to the first three dishes above. Nevertheless, it was soft and full of flavor (surprise, surprise). The service is lackluster. The owner didn't leave us along for ten minutes straight (a long time), even though we wanted the space. We also had to wait thirty minutes for the check (ended up asking three different times). Nevertheless, definitely glad that I came across Taste of Peru this weekend. So much flavor! You cannot really go wrong with the Arroz con Pollo, Arroz con Mariscos, or the Lomo Saltado. Ordering all three, mixing a little bit of all three together at a time, adding the jalapeno sauce, and then eating is how I would approach my meal here. A must try!

14.description: Hidden gem on Chicago's northside. Came here for dinner last week and was blown away by all the flavors that Peruvian food has to offer. I had the Aji de Gallina & Lomo Saltado and they did not disappoint. I am a Southsider but I will be making the trip up north to eat here again! Can't wait.

58.description: Amazing. Shiva is incredibly nice, the salon is clean and neat, and Ali is an artist. Even on short hair, he takes his time to ensure you're really happy. I'll never go anywhere else, couldn't speak more highly of them.

56.description: Came in for eyebrow threading ($7) and also asked about getting a blow out/hair straightening.  They didn't give me any information about their services and how much that would be, instead first tried offering to wash my hair (um, no thanks) and then sitting me down in a chair to do something--lord knows what for lord knows how much--to my hair.I'm sorry, but wtf?  Where's your pricing list?  Isn't that a really really simple question?Their guy ended up consulting with Shiva, the owner, and then saying it'd be $15 for the blow out so I thought I'd try it.  They did not answer my question of what it would look like at the end (super straight? curly at the ends? volume?).  He also convinced me to trim the ends (another $10) which I knew I needed but was hesitant to let him do.Well, let's just say that the trim was weird (he cut strands kind of at random); it came out odd looking and kind of lopsided and the blow-out made my hair flat on top, weirdly curl around my face, and look strangely greasy from whatever product he used.  Shiva tried to do something else to 'fix' it by separating my front long bangs and teasing the back to give it a little lift (hello, early 90s)--but that looked even worse!The main reason I came in--for threading-- was done in a rush because they played with my hair so long (2 hours!), and it was painful and came out crooked.I walked away $38 poorer ($32 for cut, style, and threading, plus $6 tip) and looking so crazy I had to spend another hour fixing it before going out for NYE.  Thanks, Shiva.

29.description: They're super friendly and accommodating for walk-ins. I've come in several times for manicures & pedicures and always enjoy them. I haven't tried the other services yet, but this is my favorite neighborhood nail place!

42.description: Shiva's is amazing.  Ali is undoubtedly the best hairstylist I've ever gone to. I've been to Shiva's 3 times, and each time I've gotten a fantastic cut. He has an artistic sensibility that shows in his work; he doesn't just do variations on one basic cut. He gave me a stylish bob with bangs that is easy to care for, but I've seen him do other amazing cuts, particularly short cuts that look like they are from a magazine. He does trendy, edgy cuts as well as classic cuts.  Shiva, the owner, is also a great stylist and colorist. She does my color and highlights after explaining what will work best for me.  They are very friendly and flexible.  They do not push product lines on their customers.  ALSO, almost forgot, the prices are unbelievably reasonable: Shampoo, cut, dry and style have been $25 and coloring is very reasonable as well, so I leave a decent tip. So glad I found them, and they are only 2 blocks from my place! I hesitate to put a review here because I don't want to make it hard for me to get in with them!

23.description: UNBELIEVABLE! I went back here yesterday for a cuir and lowlights. This time I saw Shiva because of the reviews for her color work. I have the thinnest, finest hair on the planet and was hoping to add some volume with lowlights and a good cut. I could Not Believe what a great job she did,  for $70! I've had 2 friends who have both did celeb hair for TV and film. I can't afford Oak St. Salons anymore.  Neither have ever hidden my problem as well as Shiva, and these guys are no slouches. And btw, I saw a kind of moppy haired guy come in who sat in Ali's chair behind me. This guy looked fantastic when he left.  Hard to believe it was the same guy.  I've told my son about this place. Feel free to email me if you have any questions.  I'm thrilled! Run, don't walk to this salon. You'll be so glad you did!

47.description: I have been looking for a stylist since moving to Chicago in April. I've met some incredibly nice stylists, but Shiva takes the cake! I walked in around noon today (Wednesday) without an appointment just as Shiva was finishing up with another client. I waited only 10 minutes  before she ushered me into her chair and began asking questions about what I wanted. I know what I *want* my hair to look like, but I will readily admit that I am not an expert. Shiva listened to me, and then explained what she thought would work best for what I envisioned...and she didn't even scold me when I sheepishly confessed having cut my own bangs in a moment of frustration. She took charge of my cut, and it looks better than it has in ages! She also gave me advice about color, but again was not at all judgmental about the fact that I'd done it myself (she really wanted to know the number of the color I used). The cut cost $25.00 - unheard of!! I don't remember the last time I paid less than $60! I was so excited and pleased, I decided to have my eyebrows threaded for the first time, and the woman who did it was wonderful (I should have written down her name...next time!). It hurt a little, and made me sneeze, but my brows look amazing, and all for $10.00 ($7.00 + tip). As I was leaving, the infamous Ali introduced himself and said next time he'd cut my hair! Either way, this is going to be my regular salon!!

8.description: Not much to say about this place. The service is quick and the prices are great. For example, eyebrows threading is $7. Call ahead and they'll let you know when is a good time to come in to avoid a rush.

31.description: Ali (the guy) is phenomenal, its unreal finding such great service in the middle of nowhere Chicago! Love this shop. Walk in welcomed too! Worth the trip down to Rogers Park

34.description: My family from Miami is in town for a month and asked me where they could get a wash and blow dry. I took to yelp and found Shiva. It is in walking distance , I called and was able to make a double appointment  for 6 p.m. We arrived on time and waited for just a couple of minutes before they were ready for us. The prices were reasonable and the results were just perfect. Everyone left happy and well groomed. My only criticism is their customer service on the phone, especially to a first time customer. The person I talked to was not friendly or welcoming, had I not read the reviews on yelp I would have not made an appointment. I was a bad first impression.

16.description: Wow. Looking for a new salon in the neighborhood (my stylist recently moved away) and chose this place because of proximity and good reviews. I called on a Tues and had an appt  booked for the very next day for a cut, color and highlight. Everyone was  warm and welcoming and the atmosphere is very clean and comfortable. Shiva was super friendly, and put me at ease right away. She even took the time to blow out my very thick and coarse hair, to the point that her next client had to wait a few minutes. I  offered that if she wanted to leave it a little damp, that's okay, because I know how long it takes. She smiled and let me know that that was not an option. I am so happy with the finished product!! When it came time to pay, I could not believe how reasonable the price was!!!! I've paid twice as much for a lesser job. Long story short, you've found your new stylist.

13.description: Loved this place! I called like at 12:15 and said that I needed to dye my hair, the lady said they didn't have any appointments. I said I would just go somewhere else (not in a snooty way, but because I had to get my hair done for a photo shoot the next day).The lady told me to just stop by, so I did. I came in, and Shiva seen me right away. (Even though she was working on other clients). I told her I needed my whole hair dyed- I was a blonde, that went back to my natural black hair at another salon, and it was now starting to turn a coppery dark brown (yuck). She confirmed with me that the hair color was much lighter than my natural dark locks. When she put on the hair dye, she massaged it through my scalp-  (Which is awesome! I think this helps making the color actually get in ever strand). I waited in a comfy chair for like 40 minutes, she checked it, washed it out, and asked me if I wanted it blow dried and styled for an additional $15. I said no thank you.But she ended up blow drying it a little bit anyway, making sure the color was how I wanted it. She did such a great job! I will be returning here in the future. I think it cost around $48? It was a few months ago, so I can't remember the exact price. But it's worth it!Yeah, it's street parking, but I was able to find a spot that I didn't have to pay for (as it was by residential apartments). Good, quick salon. Definitely recommend it!

11.description: UNBELIEVABLE! I went back here yesterday for a cuir and lowlights. This time I saw Shiva because of the reviews for her color work. I have the thinnest, finest hair on the planet and was hoping to add some volume with lowlights and a good cut. I could Not Believe what a great job she did,  for $70! I've had 2 friends who have both did celeb hair for TV and film. I can't afford Oak St. Salons anymore.  Neither have ever hidden my problem as well as Shiva, and these guys are no slouches. And btw, I saw a kind of moppy haired guy come in who sat in Ali's chair behind me. This guy looked fantastic when he left.  Hard to believe it was the same guy.  I've told my son about this place. Feel free to email me if you have any questions.  I'm thrilled! Run, don't walk to this salon. You'll be so glad you did!

39.description: After many unsuccessful at-home hair dye jobs, I decided to get my hair done at a salon. I've never been to Shiva before but their prices are very reasonable for one-process color and they're not too far from Edgewater. I wanted to darken my black hair even more to a blue black. Nothing fussy. For some reason, other salons didn't have that color. Anyway, Shiva did and I booked an appointment. Shiva, the owner, did my hair and it didn't take too long, about an hour and a half. She was a very sweet and interesting lady. My hair didn't have strong blue accents, but I think that's fine. It would've looked too punk. It was definitely a bit darker. My hair wasn't crunchy or damaged. She blow dried my hair (other salons charged for this). I was happy with my color. As a model, I've taken photos since then and I've noticed the richness of the color in the images. It complements my pale complexion very well. Like Snow White!If you want a hair dye job for a reasonable price and in a casual environment, check out Shiva. She does a really great job!

37.description: Nahid threaded my man-brows today and did a lovely job. She got a great shape, trimmed and didn't miss anything. I'll definitely be back.

0.description: I have been getting my haircuts done with Ali for years. He is talented!He knows exactly what your hair needs.Best haircuts ever!

38.description: Great customer service. I arrived as a walk in and I was kindly greeted. I had never met Ali but took yelp customer reviews seriously (for once) and they turned out to be dead on. Ali was nice and specializes in female hair, but asked me what I wanted and gave a few suggestions for my hair style. Basically, I'm very impressed. Do yourself a favor and visit shiva, men and women alike.

51.description: I followed Sheva from Carmen's to her own shop. Shamefully I strayed to have someone closer to my home to do the threading on my brow...I am returning no matter the   distance. Sheva is a perfectionist as a stylist She is the best at threading and may I add her shop is lovely. As soon as you enter you feel the warm. Welcoming atmosphere. I highly recommend Sheva to anyone searching for anall inclusive stylist.

27.description: I went to this place because of Yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint.  Shiva highlights, cuts, and styles my hair so well, I am upset I didn't go to her three years ago.  The prices are much better than other salons, but this isn't the type of place where they are going to make you tea or anything.  That's fine with me.  It's clean, professional, relaxed, and Shiva does a great job.  I even tried threading (finally), and it didn't hurt at all.

32.description: This place is fantastic.   I've been going to the salon for over a year now, thanks to the great reviews of other customers.  I have only gone in to do my eyebrows with Shiva.  I moved to Chicago from Miami. I had been going to my eyebrow salon in Miami for over 8 years.  It was hard to find a place in Chicago.  The first few places I went were not good.  I started to look for places and reading reviews on yelp.  That's how I found Shiva.  I'm quite lucky.  She is fantastic.  She listens to what the customer wants and take her time to do a great job.  She doesn't rush and makes sure that the eyebrows look their best possible.

54.description: The man who cut my hair did not speak english very well, so there was clearly a language barrier there. I asked for bangs and he gave me short, baby bangs. I look ridiculous with them and have been hiding them since the haircut. I will admit, I should have been, to the millimeter, more clear on what I wanted, but in my defense a good hairstylist shouldn't need basic guidance.

48.description: I thought I found my hairdresser in Rogers Park a long time ago, but then my husband tried Shiva Salon and we both agreed that his haircut was much more precised and fashionable than ever before. I followed my husband; I went to Shiva and got a perfect haircut too!! Just as I was used to get it in Europe -very fashionable and great fit to my face! I much appreciate Ali's technique and his consultation. Very recommended!!

44.description: I love this nail shop. I went in for my first no chip mani and it was awesome. The lady was patient with me and walked me through everythg she was doin, plus i got a gud hand massage. I love the color and so dose my bf. Plus the shop is clean. Definitly going back again :-)

24.description: Ali is amazing and the the threading the women do is perfect! So so happy to finally have found my perfect salon!!.

7.description: I went to the guy (Ali) there and knew exactly what I wanted. He cut my hair way too short!!! Told him I needed shampoo and that I knew it was $10 extra and he acted like it was such an inconvenience then did really fast job. I told him at least 10 times I'm a nanny and need to be able to pull my hair back in ponytail. So what did he do? Cut it so short I can't pull it all up in ponytail!! I knew I was going to lose length but this is ridiculous! Usually when you are getting more than a couple inches off the stylist will show u where it will hit and make sure it's ok with you but not this guy he just chopped it off to the length he wanted. I let him finish cuz what was I supposed to do and it's an ok cut I guess just WAY too short even after I told him so many times I needed to be able to pull it back. Also had to keep telling him over and over I did not want layers!!! Such a disappointment no idea how this place has so many stars! I would not go back for a haircut for sure!

49.description: I absolutely love Shiva! I needed to find an affordable stylist that I could trust in the neighborhood.  I was not disappointed!  Thanks to all of the glowing reviews here, I tried this salon, and I will continue to return!! Shiva is very talented and adapted the look I wanted to look attractive with my face.  I almost can't wait to go back and get it cut again!!

40.description: When I moved to Chicago I bounced from barbershop to barbershop looking for someone I could trust with my hair, no luck. I got introduced to Ali through my ex and I was blown away how skillfully and quick - a quality not found in most shops - his haircuts were. I'd recommend him to any of my friends, regardless of race - he does it all, and well.

53.description: Got a haircut from a guy named Ali.  He doesn't speak English that much, but man, he knows what he's doing cutting hair.  Like, just seems expert--kind of wields scissors like a master chef uses a knife.   He said he studied fashion and style in England and Hong-Kong, and you get the sense that probably, if he spoke perfect English, he'd be in some super upscale salon, or cutting hair for stars.  But for now, he's working at Shiva's, so I'm going to get my hair cut there for as long as he decides to stick around Roger's Park.

30.description: I found this place due to yelp!!! I was reading all the great reviews on Ali. I went to get a hair cut here a few months ago. I have been a regular ever since then. Ali is amazing and gives a perfect hair cut every time I go. The price is very affordable for a mans hair cut I only 15 dollars each time. I would recommend this place to everyone!!

46.description: I recently moved to Chicago and I was needing a change in my hairstyle. To me, it just felt dead and I really didn't know for sure what I wanted. I just knew I needed it to be cut. I walked into Shiva's and I received a friendly welcome from Shiva, herself. I asked if she had time for a haircut and she was able to fit me right in. She asked me what I wanted and I knew I wanted to get at least 3 inches off. She actually asked me if i wanted my hair shampooed! That made it much better! Shiva actually cut off the 3 inches, put in layers, and helped me decide what I needed to do with my bangs. She then styled it for me and I loved my cut!! It made me happy to know I found a good hair salon near my apartment! She was just amazing! And so kind! :)

1.description: I've been going here for 3 years now, and here are my findings.If you want a color & cut, you're going to have Shiva. If you just want a cut and Shiva is busy, you're going to have Ali. I've had both of them before, and have always brought in pictures of what I wanted.I used to have Shiva highlight my hair (it's a pixie cut), and she always did a great job and I was always pleased with the color. However, when I went platinum, she didn't bleach it enough and I had to come back and have her do it again, since the first time my blonde hair looked orange. Due to this and the price, I have since started coloring my hair at home. When she cuts it, she kind of goes by the picture I give her, but it's never as close as I would like it to be. It seems like she ends up doing her version of it.As far as Ali goes, I think he honestly does what he wants. He'll take the picture I bring in and use it as a guideline, and end up doing what he thinks is best, which is usually on the scissor-happy side. My hair grows quickly so I usually don't care if it's a little too short, but it's still not exactly what I anticipated.With both of them, I usually end up liking my haircut in the end, but it's never my initial vision of what I bring in. I recognize that they can't exactly replicate what I want, but it seems like they both end up doing what they want instead of trying to get as close as to what I want.    Take this review with a grain of salt because pixie cuts are hard to get right, but I'm just giving my experience.

55.description: *UPDATES* to say I've been back twice. Once to see Ali again and once with Shiva herself. All beautiful haircuts.I had a great experience at Shiva with the stylist named Ali. I am so thankful for a local place to support. The haircut itself is beautiful. After reading reviews, asked Ali for a trim and layers and then just let him do whatever he wanted. After years of paying for cheap cuts done by students or at highly branded and sales-y type salons, Shiva was a breath of fresh air. It felt like no-frllls family time, and an honest place of business. They don't push products on you and many of their products are even found at CVS.Ali said his home country is more fashionable than we are here so if anyone is looking for a funky/unique haircut you should totally go and ask him to just have fun.

9.description: A perfectly lovely place. I dropped in without a scheduled appointment, around 5 pm, and they had a spot for me right away. There are only three chairs/stylists available, but they are efficient, and I can't imagine one would have much trouble if an appointment was actually scheduled. All of the stylists are pleasant and amicable. The atmosphere of the place was very comfortable and easy-going. I'm not the most chatty person when getting a haircut, and the stylist did not try to talk my ear off. I saw Shiva, and she was quite wonderful. My haircut is pretty straightforward, can't even really say I "style" it all that much, so I can't speak to the more involved cuts that many get. But Shiva was more than competent and made sure that I was satisfied before I left.

26.description: I have been looking for a long time for a professional in hair cuts and eyebrow threading and I'm very pleased to have found this salon because Shiva indeed is an amazing professional. Thank you so much for knowing how to do your job.

25.description: Loved this place! I called like at 12:15 and said that I needed to dye my hair, the lady said they didn't have any appointments. I said I would just go somewhere else (not in a snooty way, but because I had to get my hair done for a photo shoot the next day).The lady told me to just stop by, so I did. I came in, and Shiva seen me right away. (Even though she was working on other clients). I told her I needed my whole hair dyed- I was a blonde, that went back to my natural black hair at another salon, and it was now starting to turn a coppery dark brown (yuck). She confirmed with me that the hair color was much lighter than my natural dark locks. When she put on the hair dye, she massaged it through my scalp-  (Which is awesome! I think this helps making the color actually get in ever strand). I waited in a comfy chair for like 40 minutes, she checked it, washed it out, and asked me if I wanted it blow dried and styled for an additional $15. I said no thank you.But she ended up blow drying it a little bit anyway, making sure the color was how I wanted it. She did such a great job! I will be returning here in the future. I think it cost around $48? It was a few months ago, so I can't remember the exact price. But it's worth it!Yeah, it's street parking, but I was able to find a spot that I didn't have to pay for (as it was by residential apartments). Good, quick salon. Definitely recommend it!

12.description: Good cheap prices on a mans haircut. But slow . If you don't call ahead you wait for at least an hour

59.description: What a wonderful place to get any salon treatment. Shiva and her staff are so attentive, and patient. I get haircuts, eyebrows threaded, manicures and pedicures. All excellent. 5 year customer as well as my wife.

21.description: I came to Shiva yesterday for a haircut after skimming through tons of reviews online for various places. I recently moved back home from grad school and was paying $11 for awesome haircuts. I am very picky with my hair, so I chose to try it out after reading the reviews. Ali did a good job with my hair, but there are a few things that bothered me. He took everything else about my hair into consideration, but thinned my hair at one point in the very beginning. I only noticed because of the technique that seemed to be unfamiliar to me. I didn't ask for it, so I am unsure as to why he was doing that. I emphasized to him again that I do not want my hair to be thinned. He apologized and was able to answer my questions about everything else he was doing. I asked for an inch to be trimmed all around, including my layers. He cut my hair dry as I asked, so even after coming home, washing it, and blow-drying it, I noticed that my hair was shorter than the inch trim that I requested. He was a very nice man, but also very chatty. My mother was waiting in the car outside since we were running errands and I just wanted to get in and out. At the end, he humorously asked for my approval with a thumbs up and high-five :)When I was getting ready to pay, the lady who was ringing me up charged me $30 instead of $25. I asked her if that included the tip and she seemed confused. I let her know that I did not request a blow dry (Ali blow-dried my hair to check the evenness of the layers without me asking for it, so I thought she was charging me for that) and then she started talking in a different language to confirm this with them. I wish she confirmed with me instead of assuming. But we got this fixed and I was charged accordingly.I can be a tad bit difficult when it comes to my hair. But, my hair is a blessing and my best accessory, so I need to be happy with it. Overall, I would recommend  this place, but wouldn't be opposed to trying a different salon. The other customers there seemed to be happy with their hair.

17.description: Just moved to Chicago and was desperate for a color and cut. I went to Shiva because the reviews were good and it's walking distance from my apartment. I was not disappointed. Shiva gave me a great haircut and got my color just right with very little guidance. And the price was amazingly reasonable. I couldn't be happier.

10.description: I have had several excellent haircuts from Ali.  AND - he has quite a talent for cutting my 2 1/2 year old daughter's hair!

5.description: Another great haircut & Shiva was great about putting up w/my excessive tearing & fidgeting during threading. She even made me feel less awkward about coming in w/dirty hair since I'd been in the hospital & unable to wash it. Very happy customer!

3.description: I am the person guilty of going once every few YEARS for a trim. This morning I got my first cut in 2 years and Ali did an amazing job! After some light scolding (I get this all the time no mater where I go lol) and quick discussion on how much he would have to snip, he got to work. When I left I had some of the best layers I have had since my favorite stylist moved back to her home country 15 years ago; this is why I don't get my hair cut often. Now, I will for sure make sure I go every 6 months for a trim! And to think, this cute little salon is right down the street from me! Five stars for sure! Thanks for giving my hair life again!! I'll be back in a few months for the last 30% of bad ends to be removed! Hahaha!

35.description: If you're on a budget and you need a men's styled haircut, come to Shiva Beauty Salon. After a handful of unsuccessful or expensive haircuts, a friend recommended I go here. Its a very relaxed, clean, and welcoming atmosphere. The woman who cut my hair seemed like she knew what she was doing and was very sweet. I will definitely be going back.

19.description: I came to Shiva yesterday for a haircut after skimming through tons of reviews online for various places. I recently moved back home from grad school and was paying $11 for awesome haircuts. I am very picky with my hair, so I chose to try it out after reading the reviews. Ali did a good job with my hair, but there are a few things that bothered me. He took everything else about my hair into consideration, but thinned my hair at one point in the very beginning. I only noticed because of the technique that seemed to be unfamiliar to me. I didn't ask for it, so I am unsure as to why he was doing that. I emphasized to him again that I do not want my hair to be thinned. He apologized and was able to answer my questions about everything else he was doing. I asked for an inch to be trimmed all around, including my layers. He cut my hair dry as I asked, so even after coming home, washing it, and blow-drying it, I noticed that my hair was shorter than the inch trim that I requested. He was a very nice man, but also very chatty. My mother was waiting in the car outside since we were running errands and I just wanted to get in and out. At the end, he humorously asked for my approval with a thumbs up and high-five :)When I was getting ready to pay, the lady who was ringing me up charged me $30 instead of $25. I asked her if that included the tip and she seemed confused. I let her know that I did not request a blow dry (Ali blow-dried my hair to check the evenness of the layers without me asking for it, so I thought she was charging me for that) and then she started talking in a different language to confirm this with them. I wish she confirmed with me instead of assuming. But we got this fixed and I was charged accordingly.I can be a tad bit difficult when it comes to my hair. But, my hair is a blessing and my best accessory, so I need to be happy with it. Overall, I would recommend  this place, but wouldn't be opposed to trying a different salon. The other customers there seemed to be happy with their hair.

28.description: I too went here because it was close to home. The staff is cordial but the cut they have my daughter was so disappointing. I just wanted a trim and due to the unevenness the gentleman kept trying to straighten or even it out.... Well 3 inches later!? Anyway, I really wanted this to be our place. The search continues....

45.description: Awesome.  I moved here recently and had been looking for a place to get my hair cut and my nails done.  Shiva does an excellent job cutting my hair and they are the best place around here to get your nails done by far.  My first time there they also asked if I wanted to get my eye brows threaded (never had before!) and they also did an awesome job with that.  Above all everyone there is friendly and puts your comfort and needs first, I highly recommend it.

33.description: I just got home from my first haircut with Ali tonight and I will certainly go back.  He gave me some suggestions on how to cut/style my hair and they turned out amazing.  Very nice man and it's also very clear that he cares about the end result and operates with precision.  I walked in at about 5:45 pm on a Tuesday and didn't have to wait.

43.description: Ali did a great job fixing a really bad haircut I got somewhere else. He worked with the technique of a true artist, and cut my hair with flair and style. I now have a very chic short haircut. He works well on women's short hair. And I couldn't believe how low the price was for the quality. For shampoo, cut, blow dry and style it was only $25.

2.description: I just moved to Chicago from NYC and was looking for a new place to get my eyebrows threaded. I specifically asked for my brows to be kept thick and natural looking - I just wanted a quick clean up.What I got was half of my eyebrows removed to the point where I look like my brows are perpetually up and in wonderment.NEVER EVER coming back here. It's like they deliberately heard what I wanted and gave me the opposite. I am completely frustrated and furious and, the cherry on top, is I have an interview tomorrow where I will look like a cartoon character.Do not come here if you value your hair.

18.description: I am so happy I went to see Shiva!  I decided to come here after reading all the awesome reviews, and I am glad I did!  Shiva cut my hair quickly and perfectly. I was shocked it was only $25 for a haircut that would be $70+ other places in the city.  I'll definitely be coming back!

41.description: OH what to say about Shiva and her staff. They are just amazing. My husband started going to Ali because he is pretty particular about this hair. In the four years we've been in the city, Ali is the first person to actually know how to do my husband's hair correctly and he is so fast with those scissors! Ali also did our daughter's first haircut and he was awesome. We didn't need any fancy salon just someone to keep her entertained and he was awesome. He talked to her, gave her chocolate and sang to her while he was doing her hair. He even let me take pictures afterwards. Shiva did my hair a few months back (time for another appointment, I know) and she was amazing. Not only did she stay past closing time and let me keep my daughter there as my husbands job took him a couple more hours than expected to get home, but she also did the best full highlights job I have had in years. She even gave me a super cheap cut that still looks beautiful and I get compliments all the time. Beyond that Shiva also recommended products that work wonders and are actually within my price point which is always a seller for me than buying really expensive stuff I will feel guilty using. Go here.

52.description: I've got to say I agree with the others. Ali is pretty great. Communication can be a bit of an issue but this guy does really incredible hair cuts for $15. I've paid $30 for much worse. I've never seen anyone use two pairs of scissors at the same time, wow.

50.description: I just got a terrific haircut and blowdryer/style from the shop owner, who was able to fit me in today when my regular stylist at another salon was unavailable.  I couldn't be happier with the results.  She's quite talented.  I also got my brows threaded, and I am very happy with that service, too.$32 for a precision cut and brow-threading - both reasonable and well worth it!I think I will be switching salons!

4.description: I have long, layer-y hair and Ali just did a great trim and layer update.  He tugs a little when he's cutting and styling, but it just gets the blood flowing to the scalp! I'll definitely be back.

6.description: In absence of my regular hair stylist I went to Shiva salon and had my hair colored and cut by Shiva. I loved the results and came back with my mom to get manicures and a cut for her. The manicurist is very harsh, I had two fingers bleeding and my mom had three. Our fingers hurt for a couple of days, but thank goodness they are heeling fine. I would not be concerned if not for the fact that she is using same instruments for everyone. I was hoping to impress my mom since this was her first time getting a manicure and unfortunately it wasn't a good experience for her. I would recommend to ask for Shiva if you are looking to get a nice haircut and color and go to a nail salon for professional and gentle mani/pedi. Compliments to Shiva, I love my hair cut.

22.description: I am so happy I went to see Shiva!  I decided to come here after reading all the awesome reviews, and I am glad I did!  Shiva cut my hair quickly and perfectly. I was shocked it was only $25 for a haircut that would be $70+ other places in the city.  I'll definitely be coming back!

15.description: They do a great job with eyebrow threading. I'd highly recommend this salon even for the pickiest eyebrow people out there.

57.description: After some friends of ours recommended Shiva, the husband and I (always happy to keep our business local) went in for same-day, back-to-back appointments with our toddler in tow. We had our hair cut by Ali, and he was amazing. Best haircut I've had yet over my 4 years so far in Chicago. I asked for several inches off and English is not his first language, so he made sure he knew exactly what I wanted before he started (and joked that I better not cry when he was done. I didn't :). Husband was happy too---Ali gave him a cut that was stylish but not "fancy" and showed him an easy way to style it with a little product.The ladies in the shop kindly gave our daughter little crackers to snack on and weren't at all fussy at the fact that a small person was wandering all over their salon (or trying to).  Also, funny: Ali asked if he could give baby girl's hair a trim (I guess the bangs-in-her-eyes look got to him ;), so we held her while he did a quick cut all the way around---and I do mean quick, since she was squirmy and getting grumpy, but he still managed to texturize the ends and not make it look like a bowl cut! That's talent right there.I also got my eyebrows threaded and it was just how I like them. I wasn't as happy last time I went to Carmen's down the street so I might go to Shiva from now on for this, too. For two adult haircuts and a threading (and a thrown-in toddler cut) we paid less than what I paid for my last cut. Definitely going back.Happy family!

20.description: Wow. Looking for a new salon in the neighborhood (my stylist recently moved away) and chose this place because of proximity and good reviews. I called on a Tues and had an appt  booked for the very next day for a cut, color and highlight. Everyone was  warm and welcoming and the atmosphere is very clean and comfortable. Shiva was super friendly, and put me at ease right away. She even took the time to blow out my very thick and coarse hair, to the point that her next client had to wait a few minutes. I  offered that if she wanted to leave it a little damp, that's okay, because I know how long it takes. She smiled and let me know that that was not an option. I am so happy with the finished product!! When it came time to pay, I could not believe how reasonable the price was!!!! I've paid twice as much for a lesser job. Long story short, you've found your new stylist.

36.description: Went to Shiva's today for the first time and had a really nice experience. I showed a picture of the style I was looking for and my stylist suggested that I have the bangs a little longer than the photo. I agreed to try it and she went to work. I had her shorten the bangs a bit and she was very responsive, making sure I knew how much she was planning on cutting off before she cut. $25 for a cut, blow-dry, and quick style can't be beat!

14.description: Just got my haircut (Shiva) and manicure (Nahid). Been going here for more than 2 yrs. and never been disappointed in any service.

12.description: Okay, the five stars are based on the fact that it's practically a stumble from my front door AND that it's a fantastic presence in the community. I finally went for the first time today - around 9:30 - and loved it.  My top pick is DEFINITELY the Crafthouse booth.  I got two mammoth beer brats that just rocked my dinner world.  2 for $6? Not cheap, but after eating them, I declare them a helluva bargain. Every vendor was friendly with tips on how to cook stuff (rainbow chard? saute with onions and garlic, turns out) and while the produce prices aren't a steal, it still beats the big grocery stores for organic, and it's great to find items like garlic scapes, red kale, and other varieties that don't show up everywhere. I have also noticed that the foot traffic in the neighborhood is way up (I see LOTS of families walking by my window sunday morning) and I'm sure the local coffee shops and restaurants are reaping the rewards.I love this market!

7.description: Hear ye, Hear ye, Hear ye...come one, come all to the newest farmer's market in town.  The right honorable Rogers Park invites you to the city's greenest market in the fair city of Chicago!  All of the farmers are organic growers or are in the process of transitioning to organic. Being the FM fanatic that I am, I just had to check out this brand spanking new one.  I am telling you...I have a problem.  Upon arriving at the corner of Glenwood & Morse...you could just feel the excitement (truly it was palpable).  As I arrived about 10 mins before the opening, a crowd had already gathered...people eagerly waiting with the reusable bags for the ribbon cutting ceremony (nice touch!).  The Alderman was there with his wife to say a few words and then poof the flood gates opened.   Now the market...well, being the 1st day & all, there are definitely some kinks that need to be worked out.  For instance, it should open on time, the vendors should be there & ready BEFORE the market opens, the cars should be moved way before the market opens, the information booth should be set up & ready to go at least 30 mins before opening time, and most importantly, the vendors should have their booths well manned...poor ladies working the bread booth, it was swamped!  I am sure as the weeks go by, the kinks will get smoothed out and the market will be top notch.This is the definition of neighborhood FM...it is small and quaint.  Now, I am bit spoiled with the Evanston Market...it is spacious and well stocked.  However, the people are friendly & the vendors are super excited to show you what they have.  They should be as it is quality stuff.  I got a few things here, but I know that it will not satisfy my list of needs for FM food...so this will serve as my supplemental FM.  Overall, I do recommend checking this place out, however it is not going to stock you pantry just yet.  Plus, this is a great neighborhood to check out and the market is just off the Redline at Morse...pretty sweet!

20.description: Hear ye, Hear ye, Hear ye...come one, come all to the newest farmer's market in town.  The right honorable Rogers Park invites you to the city's greenest market in the fair city of Chicago!  All of the farmers are organic growers or are in the process of transitioning to organic. Being the FM fanatic that I am, I just had to check out this brand spanking new one.  I am telling you...I have a problem.  Upon arriving at the corner of Glenwood & Morse...you could just feel the excitement (truly it was palpable).  As I arrived about 10 mins before the opening, a crowd had already gathered...people eagerly waiting with the reusable bags for the ribbon cutting ceremony (nice touch!).  The Alderman was there with his wife to say a few words and then poof the flood gates opened.   Now the market...well, being the 1st day & all, there are definitely some kinks that need to be worked out.  For instance, it should open on time, the vendors should be there & ready BEFORE the market opens, the cars should be moved way before the market opens, the information booth should be set up & ready to go at least 30 mins before opening time, and most importantly, the vendors should have their booths well manned...poor ladies working the bread booth, it was swamped!  I am sure as the weeks go by, the kinks will get smoothed out and the market will be top notch.This is the definition of neighborhood FM...it is small and quaint.  Now, I am bit spoiled with the Evanston Market...it is spacious and well stocked.  However, the people are friendly & the vendors are super excited to show you what they have.  They should be as it is quality stuff.  I got a few things here, but I know that it will not satisfy my list of needs for FM food...so this will serve as my supplemental FM.  Overall, I do recommend checking this place out, however it is not going to stock you pantry just yet.  Plus, this is a great neighborhood to check out and the market is just off the Redline at Morse...pretty sweet!

19.description: A nice market, which really seems to have potential -- the produce and meats looked good and the prices seemed on target for small markets with local, organic/sustainable type products.  Another plus is that it really seemed to have a friendly neighborhood kind of vibe unlike some of the farmers markets here in Philly.  Good luck --- Glenwood's off to a great start!!

1.description: Take away the degenerate alcoholics, the hazy cigarette musk, and the basement indoor housing, and you have a place where everyone knows your name.  I true neighborhood farmer's market with a surprising variety of vendors (given its size) that should keep your fridge stocked for the week. Dogs and kids galore, and strangely easy to find parking. Come say hello.

2.description: Eh, you know? This is just one of those "eh" places. It's way, way too crowded for the amount of vendors. On one hand, it's a lot of the vendors people are familiar with for a lot of the things you want. On the other hand, they have about 1/3rd of a card table to put their stuff on (and you have about the same amount of room to move around.I'm happy to explore farmers markets as I love them, but this is just blah. After making the short loop around everything twice, I wanted to get out of there more than I wanted to even stay and take in the experience. I don't get what the charm is of this place - I really don't see any.  It's not horrible, but it's just not....good.

9.description: Came here at 8:15 last Sunday. Had no idea they opened at 9. All the tables were set up. The people were sitting there with wads of cash in their hands. And they wouldn't sell us anything.Also, we're all about supporting our neighborhood, but the prices at the Glenwood market are $1-2 more than the Daley Plaza Farmers Market on Thursdays. When Rogers Park is more than downtown, something is very, very wrong.

6.description: Summer has officially started now that the market's back! Organic & locally grown veggies & meats & goodies. It's a great little market. No it's not the biggest, but there's a great variety of produce and meats. This year they're doing lots of events too. Last weekend was all you can eat BBQ. They did a chili cook-off during the winter market; I can wait to see what else they'll be doing.Also, there's a truffle stand with free samples. Need I say more?

18.description: A great start to what I hope is a very successful green market in Rogers Park.  Like previous posters mentioned, most of the products were sold out fast but it was due to a great turnout and good vibe.  I'm sure things will improve with each new Sunday.  I look forward to supporting this venture in Rogers Park!

10.description: As a Rogers Park native, I couldn't be more thrilled when I started seeing the "Glenwood Sunday Market" flyers spring up around the neighborhood.  I've been there the past two Sundays, on the early side, and it's been bustling.Yes, the meat is frozen, but that is nice for those of use who live alone and can't go through that much meat at once!  I snagged some preserves, salsa, and granola for my first market harvest.  Next week, I hope to branch out a little more.Some of the vendors offer samples, which is always fantastic.  I'm much more willing to shell out the $ if I know I'll enjoy the product.Random - last week there was a knight challenging people to fight.  I wish someone would've taken him up on it.

13.description: I'm so sad the farmer's market season is over! I spent every Sunday morning here between June and now (October) and it feels like home! We come here to pick up our CSA share and always leave with a bunch of goodies (tofu, sausage, baked goods...) It is a great friendly environment that I am so happy to be a part of. I will come back and check out the winter market when it opens!

16.description: Skip the other overly crowded markets in Evanston or the Green City Market as this has a lot of the same vendors, plus others that we have not seen anywhere else.  Located on a side street, this market has lots of space and an excellent assortment of vendors.

17.description: Overall a good experience. Yes, there were a few opening day learning experiences, but nothing to stop anyone form enjoying the market.   The traffic was overwhelming(a good thing) and I think that they did a bang-up job getting this organized   Side note to Abbe. Yes the early birds did get all the worms.   It is too early in the season for tomatoes and onions, be patient and over the coming weeks as more varieties  are ready for harvest, I am sure the bounty will flow.

15.description: A great little market, and right around the corner from my apartment. I agree with other reviews that downplay the ' farmers' aspect here, as there seems to be very little produce. Because this isn't southern California, we actually have seasons and that means you can't find apples in July. That said, some great baked goods, unbelievable cheeses, and some of the friendliest vendors, neighbors and local business owners anywhere. It's always worth a trip.

0.description: The market is in the small street Glenwood next to the Morse train tracks.  You can find miscellaneous items from kale, strawberries, raspberries, whole wheat espresso brownies which I thought were excellent.  I purchased an herb, lime basil and can't wait to see it grow. The people are super friendly and they do take credit cards. I wish they would have more fresh fruits...

5.description: On the one hand, it is a weak version of a market.  On the other hand, it's their first year, and as with ice cream shops and used bookstores, you can never have too many.  (You could also apply the "pizza and sex" rule here.)  So I am glad to have them in the neighborhood.  I would like to see some more variety or simply more quantity of vendors, although I realize that the alley/train viaduct space is limiting. Let's see how they evolve and improve over the next couple of years.I've visited twice so far this season, once right after 9am and once around noon.  On the first occasion, I was disappointed to see several vendors not yet ready for business, and in one case not even present.  Another early criticism that I had read, however, was dispelled during my second visit--that some vendors run out of goods too quickly.  Every stand that I saw yesterday was well stocked.Sadly, I don't see too many actual farmers at this market, but there are a few non-leafy highlights.  For example, the practically ubiquitous Bennison's Bakery and Mint Creek Farms will outfit you with breads or sweets and sheep or goat meat, respectively.  But also there are a few places that you've probably never heard of, such as Sweet Attila's Bake Shop, available only online or at the market.  They make a pretty darn good lemon sandwich cookie, but some of their other stuff is a little too pedestrian for the price.  Or check out Crafthouse Market Goods for sausages:  they have a decent bratwurst and an odd, fascinatingly overspiced "pirate wurst."There was an outfit sampling drop-dead amazing Italian apple-cider doughnuts.  Uh-MAYzing.  It was too warm to buy any, or their pizza or other hot food, but I am keeping them in mind for a Sunday lunch (and dessert) when cooler weather arrives.The market runs until October 17th, and I will definitely be back.

11.description: Good, fun  market. However, for now I'd call it a neighborhood market rather than a farmer's market. So far, there is less produce and more processed products (chocolates, jams, cheeses etc.). Stuff seems to run out quickly (chicken eggs were gone when I arrived at 9:20), and a lot of lines. Everyone is friendly, though, and the market is a fun place to be on a Sunday Morning.If you're looking for tons of great produce sold by farmers with dirt under their nails, go to Evanston. However, if your in Rogers Park and looking for quality local food products, the Glenwood Sunday Market is good, and hopefully keeps getting better.

8.description: Just want to comment on some of the comments so far. Full disclosure, I am the Marketing Chair for GSM and am on the board and I am an unabashed fan of our lil' ol' market. Personally, I call it the little market that could!It is true that the first day, our vendors were taken by surprise with the turnout. There were 1000+ people there that first Sunday. We got feedback that they had never seen anything like this on an opening day of a new neighborhood market. Rogers Park just went and exceeded their expectations! The other thing our vendors have told us they have not experienced before is the level of enthusiasm and community support. We have volunteers showing up at 7am Sunday to help vendors unload!The truth is we have a farmers' market desert in RP and the demand is huge- we and our vendors are doing our best to meet that demand. We are actively seeking organic fruit growers, however people looking for fruit should keep in mind that it is still early in this region for fruit. More will be coming as the season continues.Since opening day, we have added several more vendors and the block is now full. Also, vendors have increased supplies and far less people are going away empty. The first day we did have an issue with cars being towed but that has improved greatly also.Sheree Moratto is a fantastic Market Manager with a can do attiude and generous spirit. I know the board appreciates your constructive feedback and I will pass it along to them. We are working hard to meet the demands of the community and raise awareness about what local food means. I can tell you all one thing. You will not find a market with greater heart in the city than this one!

3.description: Yes i still shop at the Glenwood Sunday Farmers Market. My latest discovery is already done and marinated tofu. One container is $6 or two for $10. I love that the tofu is already cooked and flavored for me and ready to go. I get the very spicy flavor. I eat it for lunch or dinner. I also like the fresh pesto stand again same price, one container is $6 or two for $10, very garlicky so watch out, don't eat it before a date or job interview. I find the vegetable stands very expensive and the tomatoes don't have that rich tomato smell so I am not too sure about them.

14.description: Love this market I can walk out my door and buy fresh fruit and veggies for far less than I would pay at the grocery store.

4.description: Glenwood Sunday Market is a fairly small farmer's market, but it has the necessities of any good farmers market: seasonal fruits and veggies, meat and dairy options, a bakery, and a few other options sprinkled throughout. I'm not sure of individual vendors names (I only know where they set up their booths), but here's what I make sure to get almost every Sunday in the summer:EggsFrench Baguette (we'll either do bread, cheese and fruits for lunch or we'll eat it with pasta that night)Veggies (zucchini, kale, squash, green beans--all whenever they're available/in season)Fruit (blueberries in the early months, apples in the fall)Cider (when it is available)If we don't buy meat, we'll drop ~$20 for the week's haul. Not cheap, but not awful (fairly comparable to buying organic at Mariano's). Less often, but when we can, we'll get meat for the week from the vendors there: bacon, pork loin and shoulder, steaks, etc. It's certainly not the most economical way to buy meat, but it's incredible quality. I also finally stopped by the mushroom vendor at the end of this season, and really regret that I hadn't before. The cheese guy that's there all the time is also wonderful. Bring cash.

28.description: Everyone who thinks this place isn't "Irish" enough or wants to hear live music should check out the live seisiuns on the first Sunday of the month at 6:30 p.m.  Last night the place was packed, Kathleen Keane and about 5 other musicians as well as two dancers entertained.  There weren't any knuckle draggers or mouth breathers to be seen.  There's going to be a special seisiun on March 21, too.  Come check out the longest continuously running Irish seisiun in Rogers Park!

1.description: Cheep and Dog friendly - not always people friendly  - great for a quick drink and some pool.  a Roger Park goody to check out for sure and keep as a late night option.

39.description: I've seen my share of dive bars in Rogers Park...this is the classiest of them.  Expectations are everything: this is not trendy, chi-chi (say "shee-shee"), or going to change your world. But it is a good place to sit at the beautiful bar and have a few beers.The prices might be a little high, but as any good bar does, they let you sit and be leisurely.I've never had a bad experience here...then again, I'm an infrequent visitor.  Despite that, I like it and if it were closer to me I'd probably be there a lot more.  I'd rank this higher on my list than the Red Line Tap...just for the record.

9.description: They have cheap beers and great staff.  The customers are friendly and from the neighborhood which is good.  I go for the improv show on Tuesdays, which you have to catch one day.

29.description: OK, time for another update. The last few times I've stopped in, there have been far fewer total screaming douchebags. A couple times I managed to enjoy perhaps a dozen minutes gloriously free from being subjected to someone's notion of a "good" song on the always-too-loud jukebox. So I'm now calling it a 3-star joint.PLEASE - if you occasionally use 2- and even 3-syllable words, if you can cross a barroom without dragging your knuckles on the floor, if you have a family tree with clear lines between the generations  - come and hang out at this bar! It's a nice place! Let's take it back from the mouth-breathers!

23.description: I am afraid to do this because I do not want it to change but.......I absolutely love this place. They have some of the BEST BARTENDERS in the city. The Stil is fantastic. Now if you live in Lincoln Park and like it -stay down there and maybe come up here when you grow up. I must say I REALLY disagree with Marcos L. While the jukebox is sometimes loud (which isn't necessarily a bad thing) the crowd is great and I have never experienced the so-called mouth-breathers that he refers to. I find it odd that people seem to equate locals with a bad thing. This is the type of place where it doesn't matter if they know your name and drink (and have it ready by the time you sit down) or if it is your first time, you will feel welcome and when you leave you will be glad you came. TIP HEAVY THE STAFF IS AWESOME!!!!!!

5.description: Favorite local neighborhood bar. Friendly bartenders and a good place to meet different people from the area. Nothing fancy. Just a good place to get a drink. Only reason they got 4 stars is they took out the shuffle puck table!

31.description: The Stil, as my friends and I refer to it, is a favorite of ours.  We haven't been around as much lately due to crazy schedules, but it's definitely our neighborhood "go to" bar.  They have some great beers on tap.  We had a small falling out when they stopped serving Blue Moon on tap.  Whatever!  But I have moved on to Guinness, so we're completely fine now.  Sometimes I wish that they would take credit cards, but then again there's a Chase ATM inside the Jarvis red line stop across the street.  The bar itself has a great atmosphere about it and the people who come in occasionally are always nice.  It can get loud on the weekends, but you just get louder.  Also, the bartenders are nice and quick.This is just a great bar to meet friends at, order a pizza and just hang out.

25.description: My review is probably pretty biased because i've known the owner and his family since my childhood. But on the other hand if this place blew i'd tell you. It has a nice pub decor, the drinks are cheap, they only take cash but do have an ATM, and the bathrooms are surprisingly clean for a bar. The bartenders are all pretty friendly. They do have a lot of locals, but don't get the wrong idea. They are actually friendly and welcoming and not clickish at all. Went in here for the first time in a year the other night and I felt like I was a regular in this joint. A friendly neighborhood bar with a live, diverse crowd on the weekend, without the Douchebag vibe I get from the bars in the "hip" neighborhoods.

12.description: My neighborhood bar.  Good folks.  Unpretentious.  Inexpensive.  I drink here regularly.

37.description: Poitin Stil opened a few years ago, trying to be an "authentic" Irish pub.  I have a grudging respect for its role in the rehabilitation of Jarvis Square (and as the only legitimate bar within reasonable walking distance of my apartment).  At first there were no jukebox, no televisions, and no pool table.  Now it has all of those things and has evolved into a sort of hybrid--a neighborhood dive bar with the trappings of Irish-pub pretensions.  The crowd is fairly eclectic, but I get the impression (visiting only every few months or so) that there are a high proportion of regulars.  Consequently, as a non-regular, I often feel a slight chill from the other patrons and a stony attitude from the bar staff.  Maybe I'm imagining this, but it just doesn't seem like a friendly place.The beer selection is decent, although last night I had a Franziskaner Weissbier which tasted nothing like the same beer that I had straight from the source last month in Munich.  I guess I'll put Franziskaner in the same category as Guinness: European beers which somehow don't taste as good on American shores.  (Self-indulgent side note: the best single serving of beer I've ever had was the pint of stout at the top of the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin.  It was like drinking the nectar of life straight from God's own teat.)This place has benefitted hugely from the smoking ban.  Cash only, by the way.

21.description: Even though the place was technically closed until dinner, the staff let us in for 20 minutes when we asked super nice! (we were on a bar crawl).  The bartender made good conversation and the prices were fair. Now I just need to come back when they're actually open!

16.description: Perfect neighborhood pub and dog friendly!!!

17.description: I honestly made an account just now to say that this bar is totally good for dancing. I'm a local in the neighborhood and just visited this bar last night and danced my butt off along with my roommate, while various of other including the bartender, joined in. I love this place, the prices are right, the games there are tight. Have a visit, I'm sure you'll enjoy the environment, the people, and the service.

10.description: An acquaintance wanted to go for a drink.And he wanted to be able to bring his dog.This has already drastically curbed where we could go.He also wanted it to be walking distance from his house (he's kinda bossy).I'm guessing by the name of the bar they are an Irish Pub, but it feels more like a "down home dive".  I would probably say that about any bar that had loud TV's playing sports and let dogs run around and bark.They had Gumball on tap - which made me plenty happy.There were people reading books, and others chatting it up.  Seems to be a real local hang out.  I'm glad this part of the neighborhood has something.It was really close to the Jarvis redline stop - which was convenient for me.  No drinking and driving! But riding the train while drunk is fun.Ironically, riding the train WITH drunk people IS NOT fun.Anyway, I had a few pints, and decided I'd had enough.  I decidedly did not fit in at this bar - but people were still very friendly, and honestly - the bar tenders were really kind and sweet.The drinks are cheap - but there isn't much overhead.  A juke box on the wall (which no one was using the three times I was there, because the "game" was on), a pool table, and a video game.  The bathrooms were clean - and it was, as many others have said, unpretentious.If you're in Rogers Park - give it a try.  Bring your dog.  Or I'll lend you my Sister in Law.

11.description: Great, relaxed place to have a drink, especially in the warmer months when the front windows are open.  Pro tip:  if you're just passing by and in need of a 6-pack, they sell 6-packs at convenience store-ish prices.

26.description: Nice neighborhood bar right off the Red Line at the Jarvis EL stop.  Drinks are reasonably priced, and the customer base is not dominated by douchebag/ hipster wannabees that inhabit much of the North Side.    I feel your pain Marcos L.

27.description: Simple, not too expensive and a pretty good crowd.Friend of mine and I were meeting other friends in Chicago for a play (which we missed thanks to one of said friends assuming he could drive into town at 5:30 on a Friday with no problem).  While I was disappointed that we couldn't get food here, they did let us bring in food from outside (who does that?  Awesome people).Granted, I don't have a lot of experience with Rogers Park in general, but of all the places I've been in Chicago, this place is one of the most normal, relaxed places around.  I thought prices were pretty reasonable considering that we were in the city and that the place was pretty clean for a dive bar (cleanest bathrooms I've seen in awhile too).I felt like a regular in just a few minutes.  Definitely a friendly atmosphere.  Would come again if I was in the area.

35.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. The crowd will vary night to night, ranging from slow (5 people + 1 bartender watching Family Guy) to packed (shoulder to shoulder, jukebox booming  Marvin Gaye with half the bar dancing in unison). The bartenders are great, and the regulars generally range from a mid-20s to mid-40s crowd. It's also a very diverse group - an intelligent and cultural mix reflective of the diverse Rogers Park neighborhood.Karaoke nights (1st Sat ea. month) are packed and a great time to meet people.

8.description: Great choice of beers on tap. A wonderful neighborhood bar - very CHEERS like. Bar staff is always easy going, friendly warm and caring. Prices are a good deal.

0.description: Great neighborhood bar, very friendly bar staff and great place to sit and chill with a new friend.

38.description: This joint is right around the corner from my place, it's clean, and thanks to the new Nanny laws it's no longer a smokehouse.  You'd think I'd want to go there all the time, right?Nah.  This is a middle of the road boring Irish pub with almost no character.  Sure, it's got some cheap drinks and an okay jukebox.  But it's just not my scene.  Too bad.  I was hoping it'd become my personal Cheers away from home.

20.description: It's too bad that reviews from 2008 still carry weight in the rating. They DO have tv's and pool table and juke box and either a pinball machine or arcade game.... But this is a neighborhood bar where lots of people from different walks of life meet in the same bar to talk to each other. It's a really friendly and welcoming place. And there are a couple food places close by that you can grab food from and eat in the bar or at the tables.

19.description: Nice neighborhood bar right off the Red Line at the Jarvis EL stop.  Drinks are reasonably priced, and the customer base is not dominated by douchebag/ hipster wannabees that inhabit much of the North Side.    I feel your pain Marcos L.

33.description: On an RP roll...I love this bar. For one, I am convinced that they always have the freshest Harp on tap (it always tastes better here.)Two, they have a fun jukebox.Three, it's always a nice mix of regulars, students, artists, etc.The TVs are a bit small and high for watching games but it's nice to get the score when you need it. Also, although this bar doesn't serve food, on special occasions, they have free grub to go around.In short, a great neighborhood place.Also, no credit cards, but there's an ATM inside.

2.description: Way back when, this place used to be a gay bar called Peppers.  It was my regular spot when I lived in the East Park.  I met my husband here.   Then it was a gay bar called Charmers.  Then it had a brief stint as restaurant Groupo Damici.
