When that failed, I figured the social downward spiral that had nearly destroyed the whole neighborhood had killed this cool little corner of East Rogers Park.  But I digress.  A friend and I stopped in here after a Sox game earlier this week.  The area is now known as "Jarvis Square", and boy what a difference a few years make!   This area has really cleaned up.  Lots of folks from the bars here were enjoying the outdoor tables and milling about, creating a very chill atmosphere.   Inside the bar, we imbibed with friendly locals, enjoyed the music, and shot some pool with a couple of hot looking guys.  The bartender was kind of standoffish at first, but warmed a bit as the night wore on.  We ended the evening nicely buzzed.  Perhaps the warm fuzzy memories of yesteryear flooding back are influencing my opinion of this place, or maybe going out instead of sitting in front of the TV put me in a festive mood, but I was thrilled to see my old stomping grounds getting some fresh life.  I plan to return to check out the food options at the other businesses.  Im not so naive as to think that everything's peachy in East Rogers Park, but the improvement was so stark from what it was a few years ago, that I'm tempted to go  property shopping over there.  Rogers Park is dead--long live Rogers Park!Get out there and support Jarvis Square!

34.description: What can I add to the previous reviews?  If you are driving to this bar, be forewarned that parking kinda sucks around it.  The street parking seems to be taken up by the residents' vehicles.  Don't dare park across the street in the laundry mat lot.  You WILL be towed by Lincoln Towing and (bonus!) pay $20 more than the posted fine to get your car back.  That being said...there seems to be some adequate parking a block or so further back towards Clark on Jarvis.  Just think of it as a way to burn those beer calories.The crowd is always pleasant and the staff is rad.  Bring cash or a debit card...and close the effing door when you go out to smoke.

32.description: Poitin Stil is my neighborhood go-to. I was more of a regular there a year or two ago, but with the current state of the economy, er, MY economy, I don't get there as frequently as I'd like.Let's be clear about one thing: this is NOT an Irish Bar. Perhaps it was at one time, but now it's a Neighborhood Bar. Others here have mentioned it's a "locals" place. Yes - yes it is, as it's the ONLY local around here. And therefore, YES, there are loudmouthed dudes who have been there since 3 when you show up at 8 or 9pm. Yes, there is Guinness & Harp (my former fave until they installed Carlsberg on tap), but there are 5-8 others to whet your taste for international beer-ality  (BTW - you PBR  trendoids? Find another "ironic" beer. It just makes you look cheap - and stupid.). Yes, there is always some dickwad that's going to play Violent Femmes on the jukebox - don't like it? Fill it up for $5, and play what you want.Avoid the 1st Saturday of the month, wherein karaoke proceeds - sorry, but I was done with shitfaced goobers and their off-key screaming/warbling of  "Hit me With Your Best Shot" 15 or 20 years ago...The bartenders are all very friendly and accommodating, the prices are reasonable (if you've got th' dosh - 3 drinks for $20 is not unreasonable), and yes, it's cash only.Also, Chicago? Fuck your smoking ban.

18.description: Poitin Stil opened a few years ago, trying to be an "authentic" Irish pub.  I have a grudging respect for its role in the rehabilitation of Jarvis Square (and as the only legitimate bar within reasonable walking distance of my apartment).  At first there were no jukebox, no televisions, and no pool table.  Now it has all of those things and has evolved into a sort of hybrid--a neighborhood dive bar with the trappings of Irish-pub pretensions.  The crowd is fairly eclectic, but I get the impression (visiting only every few months or so) that there are a high proportion of regulars.  Consequently, as a non-regular, I often feel a slight chill from the other patrons and a stony attitude from the bar staff.  Maybe I'm imagining this, but it just doesn't seem like a friendly place.The beer selection is decent, although last night I had a Franziskaner Weissbier which tasted nothing like the same beer that I had straight from the source last month in Munich.  I guess I'll put Franziskaner in the same category as Guinness: European beers which somehow don't taste as good on American shores.  (Self-indulgent side note: the best single serving of beer I've ever had was the pint of stout at the top of the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin.  It was like drinking the nectar of life straight from God's own teat.)This place has benefitted hugely from the smoking ban.  Cash only, by the way.

41.description: Pointinstil is an easygoing Irish bar on Jarvis--and a clean dive.  The jukebox has one of the best selections of music in the city--from R.E.M. to Johnny Cash and beyond.  Harp on tap, billiards, and corkboard darts round out the experience.This bar is cash only--but an ATM is located at the back.VERY smoky--try to go when they have the front windows open.

13.description: The bar itself isn't that bad, it's the total riff-raff clientele that really sucks.  And cash only?  Come on, it's 2013! I've gone there twice, and all the regulars go there every single day.  I actually did a count last night: 27 dudes and 4 women.  I mean, the people are nice enough, but if you are a male looking to meet a female, seriously don't waste your time here. If you want to talk to some of the local alcoholics, you'll find plenty. One guy sitting at the bar tried to sell me weed, so if that's your bag of chips, you'll fit right in.

4.description: It's like your Grandpa decided to have a bar in his basement and this is all he could come up with.  The interiors of this place are reminiscent of the type of decor found in the basement of housing in this area of Chicago.  It's a bar only locals would know about since it's found within the neighborhood.  I can recall nights where friends had mentioned to catch up at the "Puttin' Stil" or "Rasputin" except these are not searchable names for this bar (online) nor do I think they are names used by regulars.The details:  Cash only but I do believe there was a cash machine near the restrooms.  Decent beer list with nightly specials; special mentions would be availability of Gumballhead and Lagunitas.  $5 for a Stella in it's gold rimmed glass currently on special.  Jukebox is web enabled and has a ton of decent choices.  Three plays for a dollar and I would go back just for this detail, someone took the time to choose more than the regular choices of music.    What else? A level pool table and the ability to bring in your doggy till last call.  Visitors are mostly local, unless otherwise and the crowd is random in ages & types.  Parking is a son of a bitch in Rogers Park, expect to go looking and looking if driving.  (Also people park awfully close, so expect a ding or that you'll have to knock bumpers to get your car outta there.)

24.description: Adorably cute pub in Rogers Park.  Have had the best time here!  Cheap drinks and an AMAZING juke box, and low-key, but really fun and friendly local crowd.  Great, quick service too!  They really keep the drinks flowing!  Only reason I give 4 STARS and not 5 STAR is because they only accept cash!

6.description: Poitin Still is not a bad little bar. Since I've been recently working on and off in the neighborhood, I've been known to stop in for a drink here every now and then. They have a decent selection and, for the most part, decent prices.They have an eclectic mix of patrons, and most seem to be regulars from the neighborhood, which is always nice to see. I was surprised the first time I saw someone walk into the bar with a dog, but it turns out that The Still is a dog friendly bar, and I have grown accustomed to seeing at least one pooch lying at the feet of their human while that human sits at the bar and enjoys a beer.Much like any bar, some of the bartenders are better than others, and, although it feels as if I have been getting some rather stingy pours lately, they have all been very nice. The bar is cash only, but they do have an ATM if you forget to bring cash. Finally, no matter how often I visit, I'm always surprised by how loud it is inside, even when they aren't busy.

22.description: They have cheap beers and great staff.  The customers are friendly and from the neighborhood which is good.  I go for the improv show on Tuesdays, which you have to catch one day.

15.description: I love this bar.I go in when I do laundry next door. The bartenders are really nice, always recognize me and remember my preferences. The prices are good, the crowd is unpretentious and friendly, and every once in a while someone will buy me a drink without any expectations. I can just sit and read in peace if I want to. Nobody will bother you (even if they buy you a drink). There may be a lot of locals, but what do you expect? It's the only bar within walking distance of the neighborhood. Plus they have an excellent beer selection. And everyone is friendly.

40.description: I am not a fan of this place. Although the drinks are not too expensive and a good jukebox. That's all  I have to say that is positive about this place. Smokey, but it's a bar. It lacks character and is loud with horrible lighting. Too bad there are not too many other options nearby.

7.description: Cheap,  strong drinks.  My Bartender Michael is Da bomb. Best dive bar ever. They offer food during Blackhawks game and they grill in the summer during baseball games.

36.description: There are great roomy apartments in Rogers Park.  As long as you lock your doors, make friends with your neighbors, and don't leave your ATM card on the front seat of your car, not too many bad things happen.  You are close to the red line, 147, and 22.  Bally's, Dominick's, and Payless are right down the street.  The lake -- with actual beach area... that you don't have to pay for to sit on (thanks Evanston), is within blocks too.  So where's the neighborhood bar?All I wanted was a bar where normal people hang out.  I've had my fill of neighborhood bars with scumbags who come in barefoot and droll on the bar, only getting up to weave to the bathroom and flash some dirty looks.  I've also been to the bars where chicks wear body glitter and the guys all have on "My University is Better Than Your's" hats and sweatshirts.  Eww.  The Poitinstil had neither.  Prices were right.  Juke Box had some good ones.  People were nice.  Service was swift.  If you want more than that, go have a party at your own house.

30.description: I live 1 el stop away from this place, its a fun place... lots of regulars, sometimes people set up bags in front and anyone can play... bartenders are really cool, Carol is really nice.... so is the other guy whos name I can't remember right now... I go here to meet with a buddy of mine sometimes and he seems to know everyone in the bar so its always a good time...

3.description: This is the place that the love of my life picked for our first date. For me is a great memory and although I will never see it again, I guess this place holds a special meaning. I liked that it was roomy and yet not too loud. I still remember it like yesterday and although we are not together anymore, every time I pass by... I always smile :) :)

14.description: The Stil has been my local bar since I moved to Rogers Park four years ago.  I absolutely love this place.  It's unpretentious, has a decent and moderately priced selection and bartenders that are some of the finest in city that I've encountered (both in their service and as human beings).  It's the human factor that keeps bringing me back.  The clientele reflects the diversity of the neighborhood and I've found myself having all sorts of conversations with all sorts of people. I've made some fantastic friends there.It's the kind of bar that (depending on the day/time) you can go in and quietly read a book or do a crossword (yes, I'm that guy) or get riled up with a bunch of sports fans and yell at the TV (I'm also that guy).  It's absolutely a neighborhood bar in that there are a lot of the same faces much of the time and we know each other.  That being said, we're mostly a friendly bunch.  There's pool, darts, a jukebox, rotating featured art, improv many Tuesdays and a strong sense of community.

58.description: I moved into the Morse neighborhood a month ago and the CC has become my coffee shop of choice. I'm no coffee connoisseur and can't tell the difference between good coffee and great coffee. But full marks for service and ambiance. And the free wi-fi is a definite plus.

56.description: I started to be The Common Cup's regular after Ennui went out of business. I regretted that I didn't give The Common Cup a chance earlier. I've been going to this place almost daily for the past two years and never once had a bad experience. Food & Drinks: They got plenty of choices. After exploring their menu, I've established several 'the usual' orders and they have not disappointed me yet. Their quality of food and drinks always remain steady. Few of my favorites; banana muffin, cranberry muffin, cinnamon roll (SINFUL!), brownies sundae and their 'create your own sandwich' (pesto and chipotle mayos are delicious)Staff: I adore them all. They're laid back and super friendly. They never failed to acknowledge my arrival and say to "HI!" Also every now and then, I'll have a brief 'how are you today?' convo with them (I'm an American Sign Language user) They tried and willing. They're awesome,Cafe: To be honest, it took me a while to be find my zone in The Common Cup. After discovering my zones, I became addicted to going in and do my daily readings and play some crosswords. Once in a while I do some of my web work in there... free wifi and cheap refills... I can easily stay in there ALL DAY LONG!Bookworms, there are an excellent variety of FREE books for anybody to grab (make sure to donate yours to keep the shelves full) It is located in the back of the cafe.

29.description: Great neighborhood coffee placeThey have great options. Good for people who wants to break away from home to study.

42.description: Really liked this place. Lots of seating inside and a few tables outside.  Quiet enough to hear each other talk or to study.  Good iced coffee! Flavorful pies.  Such easy neighborhood parking on a Saturday afternoon.  Thank you for accommodating our meetup group!

23.description: Convenient and fast. Come here when you have to, never 'cause you want to. The seating is limited and cramped in the main space; just sad and cheap in the side space; nice outdoor seating, though. The coffee is decent, a la carte breakfast sandwiches get the job done, and the prices are standard. Very nice people. So much that I would live to love Common Cup more. I've been trying for many, many years but can't fall in love with it. For a quick cup of coffee on the way to the train, it's the only option on Morse. Otherwise, there are better options within walking distance.

47.description: Kind of pricy, but so friendly!They're kind of slow in the mornings, but the staff is personable and accommodating. Their pesto mayo is the bomb, and they make some pretty tasty sandwiches. I don't like that they rarely ever have the ingredients (aka bread) to make the sandwiches early in the morning. Sometimes I like to kill two birds with one stone and get my lunch before I go to work.

8.description: Nice neighborhood coffee shop. Super impressed with the baked goods -- haven't gone wrong yet! The plain croissant is especially good. My picky eater of a husband wakes up on the weekends asking to walk here just for that.The coffee is good, not great.

31.description: I am going to have to make Common Cup my summer time coffee shop because in the winter, it just gets too cold to work! As a student, I come here semi-frequently to get work done. The large room in the back has lots of great natural light and it's not usually too hard to get a table perfect for spreading out. But, brrrr! I went in there a couple of weekends ago and was in the middle of working when the air conditioning clicked on (why do they still have the air conditioning turned on in 20 degree weather?!). I tried to suck it up, but I already had my coat on and I was shivering and my nose was starting to run. So I asked the barista about it, who said something about not really being able to turn the air conditioner off, and that when the front door opens, it creates a vacuum that sucks all the warm air out of the back room, so that room would always be colder. I was totally understanding that he wasn't able to do anything (it's not like he moonlights as an HVAC tech), so I moved to the front room, where it was supposed to be warmer. However, with the front door constantly opening, it was freezing in there, too. I don't know how any of the other patrons manage to deal with the cold, but the owner really should look into it. Otherwise, the coffee is decent. The pastries are okay (wish they would add some variety from time to time). I like that they serve their tea in those cute little Beehive teapots. Staff is always pretty friendly and I like looking at the new art on the walls.

34.description: The latte was poorly crafted :( burnt espresso and dry milk, plus the staff was unfriendly.

16.description: The staff is very nice, and I enjoy their breakfast sandwiches. Great place to have a meeting or do some homework, though the atmosphere could definitely be a bit warmer. The layout is odd and music sometimes starts playing randomly. It can get very busy on the weekends, and I've wished the staff would say something about screaming kids or people loudly talking on their cellphones while others are trying to work.

13.description: Convenient and fast. Come here when you have to, never 'cause you want to. The seating is limited and cramped in the main space; just sad and cheap in the side space; nice outdoor seating, though. The coffee is decent, a la carte breakfast sandwiches get the job done, and the prices are standard. Very nice people. So much that I would live to love Common Cup more. I've been trying for many, many years but can't fall in love with it. For a quick cup of coffee on the way to the train, it's the only option on Morse. Otherwise, there are better options within walking distance.

11.description: Hmmmm. Kinda expensive for ho-hum tasting coffee. I want to support local businesses and see them do well but this place isn't somewhere I'd like to hang out. The people who work there wear it on their faces, too.

39.description: Nice cafe to have near the Morse red line station. Prices are on par with any other coffee house. Nice indoor seating area with a small outdoor patio. They also do their own version of ice cream and froyo which is similar to getting a blizzard or McFlurry. Free WiFi is available too. I have not had any of their sandwiches or pastries, but friends of mine have said good things. Overall a solid place to hang and grab some coffee or light eats, especially now that Charmer's turned into a more upscale pricier venue.

37.description: I needed to find a warm spot to read for an hour and Common Cup was the only coffee shop nearby. I paid more than $4 for a small soy steamer with syrup (pricey!--I could buy almost a gallon of soymilk for that price!) and it didn't come with any smiles from the baristas. Maybe that costs extra? The front area where I was sitting was also crowded, with narrow tables too close together. I'm giving it three stars instead of two for filling a neighborhood need of a decent coffee shop.

0.description: I've been back to Common Cup a few times this summer, and each experience has been very pleasant. The staff are pleasant. The coffee is good. The bacon quiche is delicious. The brownie is the size of my head, and a lot sweeter, too. The Common Cup is a relaxing neighborhood place in Rogers Park that deserves to be much busier than it is. I am very happy to go there, and I look forward to my next visit.And I was only going to do 4 stars, but I am realizing that I have absolutely no complaints. Isn't that the definition of a 5-star experience?

38.description: I really regret having to be the bearer of bad news but I went to Common Cup this week to have some coffee. I sat on the brown sofa chairs toward the back and noticed a roach problem. I kept my book bag on my lap the entire time and didn't set it down on the floor because I didn't want to take any unwanted guests home with me. I don't think I need to go on about why roaches are unacceptable for a place that prepares and serves food.

51.description: Tags: local, WIFi, low key, good hangout/work placeStopped here before my Chicago CS host got home from work. Great little place in Rogers Park. When walking in the place feels more like a cyber cafe than a coffee shop, but sign of the times. The Barista greeted me right when I walked in and it was obvious the shop was mostly locals. Order an Americano (my stand by) and some pumpkin bread. Wandered to the back where they have water and some comfy couches with magazines and other reading material. Once my bottle was filled I found a table up front. Started munching on the pumpkin bread as soon as I got a table. Barista was nice enough to shout the password of the Wi FI to me and I got to clacking on the keys. The bread was delicious, very moist but not cakey. Went well with the americano which had some real kick to it. Definitely stop by if I'm in upper Chicago!

27.description: I really like this coffee shop. It feels very local and you can tell they strive to connect with and give back to community. As far as the Americano I had, it was pretty good. Not too strong or weak. Plenty of seating and neat community bookshelf. Next time I'll try some food and see what I think. I'm sure I'll be back soon!

32.description: This was my go-to neighborhood coffee shop. I like that it's a locals-only type place that supports neighborhood artists and causes, and seems to have its heart in the right place. I've always just looked past the sort of dingy vibe and often-dodgy clientele (it's Rogers Park, after all) and enjoyed a nice enough place to get my work done.Today, they served me a large cup of coffee with a dead cockroach floating in it. I didn't discover I was truly sharing a Common Cup until I was about two thirds done and my coffee buddy decided to poke its head through the plastic lid to say hello to my teeth. The baristas were perfectly nice about it and fully refunded my coffee (with a sort-of confession about having to have the place sprayed twice as often as required), but it's enough to make this not my go-to neighborhood coffee shop. Bug problems are sort of a Rogers Park tradition, but that shouldn't extend to the coffee. If you do find yourself here, I would recommend avoiding the grungy upholstered furniture, and elevating your bag and belongings on a chair. There's obviously more to Common Cup than meets the eye.

54.description: Great coffee, friendly service

48.description: This cozy location is very welcoming.  The owner, Ruth, gave a warm "hello" as I walked through the door.  They use a local coffee supply called Counter Culture and it is very delicious.  Having a general conversation with the owner, Ruth, found out this location has been here 6 years now, I hope it stays as I will definitely be returning as often as I can.  Great coffee at a great location, as always cannot be free WiFi :) thanks for making my experience an enjoyable one.

44.description: Ok, it's possible that I wear my coffecup on my sleeve, but I really like this place.The first time I stopped in, it was a rainy Saturday afternoon. I'm guessing that's why it was on the empty side in there. There's quite a bit of seating in this place and yet, not enough at the same time. There are a lot of two-tops, but it seems like a lot of singles frequent this place, so the tables fill up fast. The barista I see most frequently here is adorable in that he totally schools people on drinks in the most polite way possible. One time, a customer came in and quite confidently ordered a macchiato. Before he scurried away to make it, he asked "Are you thinking this is going to be like the caramel macchiato from Starbucks?" to which she not-so-confidently replied "Uh...yeah."  He then educated her on what a macchiato is actually supposed to be (the way it's made here) and she enthusiastically accepted it. She seemed to genuinely enjoy that beverage.I, on the other hand, order a cafe au lait every time I go. I suppose it's a drink that could be messed up if a person really had no idea what they were doing, but it's always great as far as I can taste. The prices are absolutely fantastic too considering the portion sizes.It's a clean space with unique decor and all of the windows allow for some pretty great people watching. They even have a corner with a little library with ample books and comfy looking seating (that I have yet to check out, but I plan to sometime soon). I raise a glass to Common Cup!

24.description: I have been here many times and I will spill the good and the bad. They have a great menu with Quiche, sandwhiches, brownies, muffins  and drinks and all of the good stuff. They have plenty of sitting room and they accept credit cards but besides what they have  they lack 2 things. I really have to intentionally engage the baristas to get some sort of friendly patter going. They don't seem to be friendly or willing to connect with their customers. I have tried to no avail. No smiles or casual conversation. Also in the area where the coffee grinder is I have found it to be very messy.I have seen multiple times coffee grounds that were suppose to be in the garbage are just on the counter next to the waste hole. I have been there during peak and slow times and the attention to cleaning that particular area is not present. The establishment itself seems clean, just that one area. I still visit the establishment but those are the areas that seem to be their weakest. Being friendly and cleanliness in one area. Other then that the place is good. They have a special where if you buy a whole quiche you will get it for less then the rpice if you were to buy piece by piece, but that dont extend to other itiems. I once bought all of their brownies 10 to be fair and I asked if there is a discount for buying in bulk such as their is for a quiche and they said no.

7.description: Great service and very much a local business with solid food/beverages.

49.description: Great place nice place to relax. Great selection of tea very homey if your homesick. Serves oatmeal great joint want to buy it but I'm broke.

40.description: I go here for one main reason - there's no other option in the neighborhood.  HELLO STARBUCKS FRANCHISERS!!!  The coffee here is "ok" - nothing special.  However, I've several times tried an espresso here and it's not bad - it's downright horrible.  Not sure what they're doing to it, but it's nasty.  I tried it a few times because I though maybe it was the day or the person making it.  But even on different days and a different person making it, it comes out the same.  Awful.  Well, IMHO. :)The other coffee is not bad - thus the 3 star vs. 2.  They have some food there and I've had a couple of things which aren't bad.  The people that work there are pleasant and the do offer free wifi (you have to get the password from the person working there).  There's an outdoor seating area and generally a quaint place for coffee.

53.description: I love this place! I find myself caffeinating myself here on almost a daily basis. While I don't often munch here, when I have, the food has been quite satisfactory. Instead, I usually stick to coffee, espresso drinks, and teas.The coffee here is perfect, they always have two regular (one house blend and one rotating special blend) and one decaf hot varieties, as well as iced. I usually go for the special selection, but the house variety is smooth and tasty. Espresso drinks are rich, with a much more intense espresso flavor than you'll find at a Starbucks. The tea selection is quite varied, and i have yet to find one that wasn't delicious.The staff is very friendly, they always seem to know and acknowledge regular customers. Music is varied but always appropriate for a coffee house.I love supporting local businesses, and this is one of my favorites. They're really good about giving back to the community, which is so important up in Rogers Park. Hands down my favorite coffee shop!

30.description: Yeah...so....what's with the 5 star reviews?I live in the area and have done for some time now. This cafe is only a few blocks away and I am so disappointed that THIS is what is being offered as my local cafe.So, my reasons for dislike:First of all, the staff. I have never before been confronted by such a miserable, rude, lazy bunch of bastards in my life. You walk in, happy and smiling, looking forward to a nice drink, maybe a snack, a sit down....and you are met at the counter by some surly "dude" staring at you as if you've just taken a dump on the counter. "Oh, I'm sorry to disturb you with my simple and polite request for some coffee! I'll let you finish your phone call, allow you to look me up and down a few times and then decide that, for completely inexplicable reasons, that I am not cool enough! Judge away!".Secondly, the drinks, while drinkable, are not too good. I have had a number of coffees, hot chocolate and a couple of teas. Coffee tastes burnt....a weird mix of watery burn. The hot chocolate is simply powdered from a box with some hot water. The tea (bag...but whatever...) is massacred by barely warm water served in a chipped and dirty pot. Not good.Thirdly... and this is an odd one....every time my partner and I have been there, someone always confronts us about where we are sitting. I'm not talking a staff member pointing out that maybe we have strayed onto someone else's table who was in the bathroom or something. I'm talking some hostile other customer who has taken it upon himself to take personal offense at the table we have chosen to sit at, all because THEY wanted the table for themselves....even though they were already sitting at a table....and always brought up several minutes after we have started on our beverages. Strange. FInally, and others have mentioned this, the place is dirty. Dirty tables, floor, cups, spoons....just generally grimy. I can't really give any good points to be honest. They have the gall to have a sticker up, stating that "Friends don't let friends drink Starbucks", while completely disregarding the fact that they have modeled their store, menu and ordering system on exactly what Starbucks has been pushing for years. Also ignoring the debt they have to large coffee chains for opening up the coffee market in this country and actually creating (how ever lame it might be...) SOME kind of coffee culture. No Starbucks? Hell, this place would never have opened. Oh, and the place is pretty damn pricey too. But with endless lines of people rolling up to this crap hole, banging on endlessly about how great it is, there will never be a change. They will keep making a substandard product, keep being rude, keep being dirty....they have suckers giving them money, so they have no need to change. Until people go out and get a little focus, this garbage will keep going on.OH! I thought of a small plus point...they are open a little more often than other cafes in the area....and that's about it. Oh, and one more...the cakes, cookies and quiches are OK (I'm guessing they're made elsewhere, but I don't know)....but damn do the staff resent you if you order food. They are NOT shy about showing their annoyance at having to put a piece of pie on a plate. I kept trying with this place,  but I just cannot be bothered any more. I'll make my own at home. What a shame.

46.description: The owner, Ruth, is terrible. She's rude, like she woke up on the wrong side of the bed every single day. And she treats you like you committed murder if you use our debit card. If she wants a cash only establishment then she should just do it and deal with the consequences. To shame paying customers for 'the system' is just wrong. I regret walking in there.

1.description: Having recently moved to Rogers Park, I was excited to see a coffee shop within walking distance of my new place. I tried this place twice before making up my mind.The first time I went here I was told the macchiatos aren't like the ones at "Starbucks" which is fine. I felt annoyed that the barista included this trivial comment while I was ordering. She also commented I was probably searching for something like a "latte" and though I appreciate recommendations from staff, it felt condescending. I ordered a cappuccino and it was okay-a little bitter.Second time around, I ordered a mocha and it was slightly on the bitter side too. I think the shots aren't being poured quickly enough into the milk. The barista also asked me if I'd like whipped cream and though I asked for no whip, I opened my cup to see whipped cream. Not a big deal, but not what I asked for and I was the only customer.I won't be coming back here again since there are much more options around the area.

55.description: Solid little local cafe. Free wireless, my coffee was a-ok, and my quiche was pretty decent too. Nothing mind-blowing for the cost (it was a little pricey), but if I lived closer by, I'd probably be in once in a while.

9.description: "Take heed that you do not do your charitable deeds before men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father in heaven. Therefore, when you do a charitable deed, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory from men. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward. But when you do a charitable deed, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing, that your charitable deed may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly." -Mathew 6:1-4If you enjoy Chicago's own excellent Intelligentsia coffee and espresso served not hot enough, with a heaping helping of sanctimonious attitude, self-satisfied superiority and publically self-congratulatory martyrdom, this is your place. Ownership actually re-distributes all employee tips, calling themselves a community coffee house. Giving back to one's community is laudable, though using that admirable impulse to sell one's product and fill a jar with guilt tips is not. Really, why not drink good, hot, coffee drinks some more enjoyable, more warm and friendly elsewhere and give as much of your money as you like to charities of your own choosing? "Friends don't let friends drink Starbucks," boldly states a sign posted in this establishment (Really? WWJVD*?) At least we know that Starbucks is now required by law to give their employees all the tips they receive without even a portion distributed to ownership's pet projects.Espresso drinks are hand tamped to order in true barista fashion. Bakery items can be very good and are mostly or wholly made in-house. The cleanliness and sanitary standards of this spot are suspect, i.e. their owner-admitted cockroach infestation issue.In Him**,~Peter O.*Juan Valdez, world renowned Colombian coffee expert** ibid

26.description: I like Common Cup. Is it great? No. Is it awful. Again, no. It has been a reliable coffee shop for me for the last couple of years, and I regularly use it as a meeting place for work or as a place to kill some time before work. Staff can be hit or miss. Some of the folks who work here aren't always the friendliest, but there are several people who are very nice and do their jobs well. Restrooms and wifi are only for paying customers, so you'll need to ask for the wifi password when you pay. Luckily, they don't seem to care how long you stay. The other day, I spent almost 4 hours here, including having a meeting. I was never asked to leave. I was never asked to buy more things (though I did buy a couple of drinks and a slice of pie). Other neighborhood spots have asked me to leave or told me that I have to buy more items if I plan on taking up space for longer than 30 minutes (I'm looking at you, Towbar).Coffee is decent, they have a good selection of drinks to choose from, and the pastries are okay. The chocolate chess pie is very tasty, though. Some prices seem a little high, but others are fair. Common Cup isn't fancy, but it gets the job done.

25.description: Lately I've been in Edgewater a lot.  So, I often find myself cafe hopping.  Not so much for free Wi-fi, but coffee drinks and baked goods and well, my favorite sandwich of the moment....Breakfast sammiches.  I like to stop into them during the early mornings and could you believe there are some cafes that don't open till 10:30 am! I know, I find it strange as well.So about this Common Cup.  I like their coffees and the latte's.  The place is comfortable as well.  I also liked the service with a smile.  Baked goods are alright and their breakfast sandwiches are.. well, I dunno. Just a mere okay.  If getting one, go for the croissant.  I've had the bagel and been less than impressed, mainly because I could make a better bagel breakfast sandwich at home.  I don't like to be snarky but when I see that the meat looks like deli style out of a package (I.e. Sara lee) and what looks like microwaved cheese, my hopes for a great sandwich are, well.. kind of splat. Price-wise though, I liked that I could get a couple lattes and sandwiches for less than what I've overpaid recently in Ravenswood.  (Just for the sake of sharing, in Ravenswood recently, two breakfast sandwiches and a plain cup of Joe, put me back $18 bucks!  And no, it wasn't organic or foo foo.)

12.description: Best coffee shop in Rogers Park! With ample indoor and outdoor seating, it's a great place to study. They brew Counter Culture coffee ( NOT Intelligensia anymore) and it is delicious! They serve great pastries, pies, quiches, and breakfast sandwiches. Try the cinnamon roll!

59.description: I noticed that this place got solid reviews on Yelp, so I was curious to check it out.  It's a nice-looking establishment off the Morse Redline stop and the staff is very friendly.  My iced latte was decent, but I expected better, especially for paying $4.25.  Maybe if I am in the area again, I will go back, but I do feel there are better coffee houses in the area.

21.description: "Take heed that you do not do your charitable deeds before men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father in heaven. Therefore, when you do a charitable deed, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory from men. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward. But when you do a charitable deed, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing, that your charitable deed may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly." -Mathew 6:1-4If you enjoy Chicago's own excellent Intelligentsia coffee and espresso served not hot enough, with a heaping helping of sanctimonious attitude, self-satisfied superiority and publically self-congratulatory martyrdom, this is your place. Ownership actually re-distributes all employee tips, calling themselves a community coffee house. Giving back to one's community is laudable, though using that admirable impulse to sell one's product and fill a jar with guilt tips is not. Really, why not drink good, hot, coffee drinks some more enjoyable, more warm and friendly elsewhere and give as much of your money as you like to charities of your own choosing? "Friends don't let friends drink Starbucks," boldly states a sign posted in this establishment (Really? WWJVD*?) At least we know that Starbucks is now required by law to give their employees all the tips they receive without even a portion distributed to ownership's pet projects.Espresso drinks are hand tamped to order in true barista fashion. Bakery items can be very good and are mostly or wholly made in-house. The cleanliness and sanitary standards of this spot are suspect, i.e. their owner-admitted cockroach infestation issue.In Him**,~Peter O.*Juan Valdez, world renowned Colombian coffee expert** ibid

17.description: Sadly this is the closest coffee place to my house.. I am all for supporting local businesses, but this place is a bit over priced, and a little pretentious. Its funny how they have a sticker saying "friends don't let friends drink starbucks", however  they charge starbucks prices. There are  two.. maybe three  people who work there that are experienced in customer service.. The rest of the staff never says thank you, never smile, and are unresponsive when I've said thanks and have a nice day. I am a barista myself, and I personally am irritated with anyone else in the service industry that doesn't make an effort to be friendly... thats part of the job! I think in the future I will just forgot the 5 dollar latte and go over to smack dab on glenwood.. still pricey, but at least the people there are friendly.

10.description: I like Common Cup. Is it great? No. Is it awful. Again, no. It has been a reliable coffee shop for me for the last couple of years, and I regularly use it as a meeting place for work or as a place to kill some time before work. Staff can be hit or miss. Some of the folks who work here aren't always the friendliest, but there are several people who are very nice and do their jobs well. Restrooms and wifi are only for paying customers, so you'll need to ask for the wifi password when you pay. Luckily, they don't seem to care how long you stay. The other day, I spent almost 4 hours here, including having a meeting. I was never asked to leave. I was never asked to buy more things (though I did buy a couple of drinks and a slice of pie). Other neighborhood spots have asked me to leave or told me that I have to buy more items if I plan on taking up space for longer than 30 minutes (I'm looking at you, Towbar).Coffee is decent, they have a good selection of drinks to choose from, and the pastries are okay. The chocolate chess pie is very tasty, though. Some prices seem a little high, but others are fair. Common Cup isn't fancy, but it gets the job done.

5.description: The place is really nice and coffee and food are very good, some of the best in the neighborhood.Unfortunately the guy working behind the counter seemed overwhelmed because I needed a fork for my sandwich and acted like he was doing me a favor.  The service could have been better.

3.description: Nice place. Roomier than most other coffee shops I've been to. The people ate very nice hear and what i do love most is how not noisy they are. It seems like most other coffee shops are loud, JUST to make noise.The hot chocolate was pretty decent, but, cooled quicker than i thought it  would.

35.description: Decently chill place.  I scored an armchair which increased the happy points.  Delish vegan hot chocolate.  Barista was an ok dude.  I was a penny short and asked if he had one. He took it out of the tip jar and said sthg like "from the children".  way to slap on some guilt dude.  I ended up putting a buck in the tin which I may have done anyway but felt so shitty for asking for a penny, I did it.and as many of my reviews will state: no need to make soy extra since across the street at morse you can get a great deal on soy milk.  not more expensive than organic cow milk.

19.description: I frequented Common Cup often during the three years that I lived in RP as a grad student and I was never disappointed. My favorite drink was a double shot dirty chai with cinnamon. Their pie, particularly the blueberry, is wonderful. But they also serve a wide selection of teas. I reccommend either the blueberry rooibos or the raspberry green tea--both are tasty, healthy, and refreshing.

28.description: Great friendly staff. I love the soup of the day and strangely enough the oatmeal. A double espresso is the same price as a single @$2 a pop, so ball out.

45.description: Awesome coffee, desserts, pastries (and SUPER awesome owners). Haven't sampled lunch, but love the breakfast sandwiches too. We need more great small businesses like this one in Rogers Park.

33.description: I wanted to like this place. Alas, no way! Absolutely no ambiance. I would have ordered an espresso drink but the barista was conspicuously tamping the grounds with his fingers. All I can say is DISGUSTING. Won't be back.

43.description: Great neighborhood coffee shop! They have a nice selection of coffee and pastries. They also serve sandwiches. Nice staff and they also donate part of their proceeds to charity

2.description: Espresso was watery and one dimensional. For those that care, crema was absent. Latte milk needs to be frothed differently. Aim for a "shiny" appearance. Also, tapping the frothing cup should help with getting rid of large bubbles.There were no other customers waiting or placing orders when I arrived. No rush. Note: I revised my original review, as I realized hours later that it was tactless and cruel to review a bakery/pie shop's coffee with such scrutiny, regardless of its pretentiousness and my interpretation of the  "friends don't let friends drink Starbucks" sign as an indicator of it taking coffee seriously..

18.description: Service is horrible. Sunday afternoon at the coffee shop was made terrible by her. I ordered a latte and a slice of pie to be warmed. Waitress (younger lady) didn't hear me and made a rude statement as such. From there, no thank you after I paid. Handed me a microwaved pie, which she overheated to the point that it burnt my tongue. Thought she was just horrible to me, but her awful demeanor extended to the elderly man after me. Pass. The food and coffee is mediocre and service is appalling.

41.description: Best coffee shop I've ever frequented. Quiet, quirky, and community centric. A fantastic place to work from.I work freelance from coffee shops nearly every day, and when I moved near the Common Cup I fell in love with this little neighborhood coffee shop. Plenty of power outlets available from nearly every seat and consistant free wifi. They have mostly firm plastic chairs with small two-seater marble-topped tables, a few six-seater tables, and four or five comfy armchairs. They have outdoor patio seating when weather is warm enough.They bake many of the bakery items themselves, and the brownies in particular are perfect. Those rich chocolate squares of heaven may be directly responsible for my gaining a few pounds of late.The breakfast sandwiches are simple but delicious. One of the most affordable menu items. They always have fantastic quiche as well, which is also baked onsite. They don't serve Intelligentsia any more, which is totally fine because they serve Counter Culture instead, which is incredibly delicious and more socially conscious. For drip coffee (my go-to) they have the Number 46 house blend as well as the Decaf Rustico Espresso blend available every day. They typically have a third carafe of rotating regional or organic blend available as well.Baristas are always super friendly and they recognize the regulars. The owners are community activists and church leaders and the shop is definitely a hotbed for community meetings and non-profit workers coordinating events and the like. All of their tips go to non-profits and they have raised thousands of dollars through tips alone for local groups.TLDR: Awesome neighborhood coffee shop that is actively making their neighborhood a better place, with delicious coffee and home-made bakery items. Visit if you want a more personable coffee shop experience.

52.description: I love almost every single thing about the Common Cup and will continue to patronize and support them beacuase i think they are a great business. Their coffee and tea has always been good and food has been yummy both pastries and quiches alike. But I have one pet peeve at this place: there is some weird "drain" smell that seems to always be lingering around which tints every one of my visits with a slight 'ickiness'... I hate to point it out but maybe it is something that can be addressed. I don't live too close to this place but I would like to enjoy it more when I come over. This time of year I just sit outside :)

50.description: I love this coffee shop.  They have yummy pies and it always seems so bright and sunny there.

4.description: At first, I was impressed when I walked in and placed my order and received my meal - then I went downhill. The person (gentleman) working the morning/early afternoon shift was wonderful. I also thought it was cute to see the sign "Friends don't let there friends drink at Starbucks" but I know why "we" go there. They don't care about the customer 1st and you don't have to pay for refills of coffee and they are just as pricey.I was on my computer and the window behind me had a shade and I placed it down (I was there for 45mins) no problems, however the owner (very rude woman) decided to put up the shade. I said to her I have it down so I can see the screen and to please keep it down. She just blew me off like I was nothing and proceed to let the blind up. Then she was speaking to the nice gentleman behind the register to say "what a nice day the sun is shining" Then after running back and forth she leaves! The nice gentleman apologized and place the shade down for me. Since I am a paying customer who is staying after you leave owner - leave us paying customers ALONE. Oh, I won't come back, you lost my business.

6.description: Great little coffee shop. Lots of places to sit and enjoy a nice hot cup. I always try to stop here when I am in Rogers park.

22.description: On my visit to Chicago I stopped here for a breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was great and made to order. But, the service was poor. The cashier taking my order  acted as though adding bacon to my sandwich was a total hassle, and then when I paid she forgot to give me my change. When I stood there waiting for it, she made a nasty remark about  me needing to move so other people could order. I had to point out I needed my change, she scoffed at me, gave me my change and never said another word. So overall, the food was good, and the service wasn't great. I wouldn't choose to go here again.

15.description: The ambience is terrible: hard chairs, nearly bare walls, one room with AC and another really stuffy; nothing to make me want to stick around.  But on the two times I've been here, there were lots of folks on their laptops doing just that.  Is there a shortage of coffeeshops in this area?  Is the coffee here fabulous?  I've only had their green tea, and I'm not super-familiar with the area, so I'm not sure.  But the place sure is lacking in character.

57.description: Good drinks and pastries. Love the artwork up. Nice local cafe - would take it over starbuck's anyday. Only things is - damn those plastic chairs are uncomfortable!

20.description: It is funny that Peter O. posted just yesterday, because I have been reminding myself to call this place out on the whole "donation" tip jar thing. I am opposed to it because no employer should dictate where a hard working employee's tips go. It is complete BS and shows that the owners want to seem charitable, while not being willing to give from their own pocket. (How about the proceeds from every 10th drip coffee go to whatever they've deemed important and charitable). I asked the employees what they thought of this part-of-our-tips-go-to-the-local-theater-group baloney and they shrugged sarcastically and said, "What can we say, we're a charitable people?" Note: I was embellishing, that is not exactly what they said. Anyway, unfortunately small businesses often have clueless owners. Sometimes working for them can be WAY worse than a place like Starbucks that has to follow rules.

36.description: I'm here at least 3 times every week. They brew some of the best coffee and espresso ever - Counter Culture. Ruth and John are awesome people to have in the neighborhood, and their place has truly become a community spot.Everything a local coffee shop should be. Breakfast sandwiches and pastries are lovely.

14.description: Lately I've been in Edgewater a lot.  So, I often find myself cafe hopping.  Not so much for free Wi-fi, but coffee drinks and baked goods and well, my favorite sandwich of the moment....Breakfast sammiches.  I like to stop into them during the early mornings and could you believe there are some cafes that don't open till 10:30 am! I know, I find it strange as well.So about this Common Cup.  I like their coffees and the latte's.  The place is comfortable as well.  I also liked the service with a smile.  Baked goods are alright and their breakfast sandwiches are.. well, I dunno. Just a mere okay.  If getting one, go for the croissant.  I've had the bagel and been less than impressed, mainly because I could make a better bagel breakfast sandwich at home.  I don't like to be snarky but when I see that the meat looks like deli style out of a package (I.e. Sara lee) and what looks like microwaved cheese, my hopes for a great sandwich are, well.. kind of splat. Price-wise though, I liked that I could get a couple lattes and sandwiches for less than what I've overpaid recently in Ravenswood.  (Just for the sake of sharing, in Ravenswood recently, two breakfast sandwiches and a plain cup of Joe, put me back $18 bucks!  And no, it wasn't organic or foo foo.)

58.description: As a lifelong Rogers Park-er, I've been coming here for the past 16 or so years, ever since I was in my teens and my social life came into existence. While back in the late 90's/early 2000's the food was a 5, I've gotta give them credit, it's still a solid 4. I often order from them for work meetings and the food always arrives on time. Even when I order for delivery at home, it always comes 15-20 minutes earlier than the stated ETA. Also, if you go in to grab a slice, they often have "abandoned" whole pizzas that were never claimed that you can get for a fraction of the price. It's all in the asking. All in all, it's good food for a good price and meets service expectations (delivery times, etc.)

56.description: Good food. delivery time is good most times. Friendly delivery people. I like that they include a liter of RC cola with pizza nice little bonus!

29.description: great place to get a slice or two of pizza!! Also good place to get take out especially there side order sampler yum!! Tried various other food items and all has been good eats!!

42.description: Decent pizza. The cheese could use some work. Kudos to being open til 2am. I've been spoiled by the likes of Giordano's, so I'm a tad critical when it comes to sauce, crust & mozzarella. JB Alberto's was there for me when I couldn't get Giordano's.

23.description: Ok, so I feel bad that I had some bad blood with them late winter. I have found them to be an excellent pizza joint again. They have won me back as a regular customer. I had always liked this pizza for many years and had a slight mishap with them for delivering extremely late and sending burnt pizza.  Since then I've received my pizza on time and taste pretty amazing.

47.description: Their delivery service is terrible, got my order wrong and when they corrected it, the food I received was frozen cold.

8.description: Ok, so I feel bad that I had some bad blood with them late winter. I have found them to be an excellent pizza joint again. They have won me back as a regular customer. I had always liked this pizza for many years and had a slight mishap with them for delivering extremely late and sending burnt pizza.  Since then I've received my pizza on time and taste pretty amazing.

31.description: This place is wonderful. It's been 8 years since I've had food from here. And I must say the food is as great as it was from the jump. The prices are your normal pizza joint prices. But the quality of the food is 100x better. You have to try the food out before you judge...

34.description: Two Words: Fried Chicken!! No seriously, I work super long hours so when I'm exhausted and need to order out after my long day plus commute, I opt to order something I can utilize into other meals. Chicken rocks my world because it can be used in Frittatas , a scramble, a sandwich chunked or made into chicken salad. Add it to a rice bake or pasta!! It's endless. SO my point is that JB Alberto's creates such a fresh hot fried chicken box that suffices all my lasting weekly meals. This chicken is so flavorful and cooked to perfection. Always delivered hot to my door to satisfy my immediate hunger. I opt for the 12 piece to last me thru my next few days. JB's can rival flavor to any name brand out there. I am always impressed and very thankful.  I do recommend when u get that craving or need a longer term solution in this still hot weather.  * if only they had biscuits!!!

16.description: Damn..This might have been the ugliest/messiest pizza I've ever seen, see for yourself..I ordered a "stuffed" pizza and it came looking all unstuffed, and stuff..I usually don't complain(everybody says that, but I swear I don't). Their only answer was "well maybe next time don't order a stuffed pizza for delivery." Really? You'd say that to a customer?, you KNOW the pizza comes to your door looking like soup, so you don't try to find a better way to transport it or just say you don't deliver them at all? FOH!I'm a huge fan of J B Alberto's and I would like to continue ordering from them, but due to the bad experiences you will encounter in the future for "complaining" to a pizza place, I'm sorry to say, that me and you J B Alberto's aren't working out.Side note: I ordered 2 items(one pizza, one order of rings) and they forget 1 of them(can you guess which one?)

13.description: Best pizza ever! Seriously one of my favorite pizza deliveries in Chicago. I just wish they would open earlier. Love the hot wings too!

11.description: Without question JB's is the best pizza on the North Shore. I have been ordering JB pizza for over 30 years The thin crust is fantastic.You won't regret it.

39.description: Everything I've had at JB Alberto's has been great.  The ribs, pizza, fried chicken, friend mushrooms, garlic bread, etc... everything tastes fresh and homemade.  Plus the prices at this place are so reasonable.  The front staff are always pleasant and remember their repeat customers.

37.description: I order from here very often. I have had their Pizza thin crust, BBQ Chicken, BBQ Ribs, Fries, Breaded Shrimp and it is all very good. Fries and breaded shrimp are never delivered soggy, they come hot and crispy. Food is always delivered hot. The delivery is about an hour even though I live like 3 min away but whatever food is good. Its a quick lazy Sunday night meal. Their food is always consistent. I'm not a fan of their Garlic bread. Tried a delivery experiment with a friend. We both called in an order at the same time to be delivered to my apartment (same address), we paid with separate cards. We figured if their delivery people were organized the food would arrive at the same time. Well it didn't. My food arrived 30 min after my friends did......and it was the same delivery guy.

0.description: This is for a delivery order placed via GrubHub.We ordered a 12" deep dish pizza with pepperoni and bacon. The menu says this size serves 2-3 people. My girlfriend and I finished it off with only one slice leftover so if you do want to feed three people I would suggest ordering the next size up.The pizza was downright delicious. I've had my share of deep dish and this was by far one of my favorites. The thing that nails it is the crust. It's pretty crispy but still soft and flavorful. We didn't even bother with a knife and fork. We also ordered tiramisu for desert. It was a little small but after chowing down on pizza it was just the right portion. With the pizza alone J B Alberto's gets 4 stars. But they have tons of appetizers, salads, sandwiches, burgers, pasta... I'm genuinely excited about ordering from this place over and over again until I've tried everything. I full recommend grabbing a bite from here.

38.description: I've had the thin crust Pizza and the Fried Chicken to date. Marvelous food. They seem to know how to prepare food well. Had delivery once; pick-up once. Prefer to pick-up food --- was ready in 20 minutes. This is really a carry-out and delivery place; no tables or servers.

51.description: Pizza has been good in the past, but my attempt at getting it delivered tonight resulted in the driver not showing up after 2 hours and then lying about calling   me and ringing the bell. Attempt to resolve through management was clueless at best and hostile at worst. They really need to get it together.

27.description: The food hasn't changed at all. This is the pizza spot in the city. Ive been coming here since I was a kid. When I was younger me and my guys would get pizza all the time.

32.description: We ordered a 16 in. pepperoni and sausage pizza with mozzarella sticks and it came with a free qt of RC. I read that your pizza will be delivered in 20 minutes on yelp, but it took an hour like they said on the phone. Not a big deal though because that's normal for most pizza places. The pizza was really good. Really cheesy and flavorful. The mozzarella sticks were also pretty good. It says on their menu that they make their sauce and use fresh produce daily so that's also a huge plus.

54.description: I don't love this place but I do end up eating here a lot.  This place is the CSI Miami of pizza.  I never intend to watch the show but somehow I eventually end up watching the reruns.   I also feel a slight bit of shame after both events.Best things to get here are the spaghetti and the thin crust pizza (not by the slice).  One other positive is that they sell RC cola! Yup Royal Crown! Like a Boss!  Or at least that's how RC cola makes me feel, It's the pop of royalty.

48.description: I order from this place ALOT ... I usually order pizza and wings and once in a while a sandwich of some kind .. Almost everything I have ordered from here is good. Delivery doesn't take too long depending on how busy they are. But let me tell you why I'm only giving this place 3 stars. Today I ordered calamari and some kind of chicken pasta which I have never ordered before. The calamari was okay. The chicken parm pasta on the other hand was not. The chicken was rubbery almost as if they didn't cook it right. I was highly disappointed. I will still order from here but I think I'll stick to their pizza !!

44.description: Having not even received my order yet and I already know I won't waste my time coming back. Forgot my coupon for $2 off and when I didn't produce it at time of pick up instead of a "don't forget it next time" the pizza nazi told the cashier "take it off the order" and wandered off. I arrived on time and was told 20 more minutes and the website gave an inaccurate time. Same pizza nazi started talking to the cashier saying "the website never gives the proper time for the stuffed pizzas."  Maybe they should think about fixing that. Bad first impression. Not worth coming back.

24.description: I have been a long time customer, but after my experience last night I will never have them again. I placed an order for spinach lasagna with marinara sauce, and this was written in the receipt. They send me spinach lasagna with meat sauce. Seeing I ordered it for a vegetarian, this is a problem. I call them and tell them I want a new one. It took some time, but they sent another. This one also had meat sauce! I called and said I wanted a refund. I was put on hold for a while, and finally the manager picked up. He kept asking me to look closer and describe it to make sure it was really meat. I told him multiple times I tasted it, and it was meat. He refused to give me a refund, and insisted he send another, but I had to send the others back so he could inspect them. We got our third lasagna (this has now been a two hour ordeal), and it was mostly vegetarian. There were still at least ten pieces of meat in the sauce. It sounds like the kitchen does not pay attention, and they have some major cross contamination issues...makes me wonder what else is happening in that kitchen.

7.description: I really don't have the patience to write everything they've done to disappoint me in detail so I'm gona try to sum it up quickly:1) Sent me wrong desert but gave me a credit for my next order.  When I mentioned it for my next order the owner gave me a major attitude like I was trying to scam them for free food!  Why the attitude?  It was YOUR mistake in the first place!2) Never sent me ketchup even though I ordered fries.  I requested ketchup in the "special instructions" or "notes" section - they STILL didn't send ketchup!3) I ordered ginger ale - they gave me 7UP, which I really don't like, which is why I ordered ginger ale in the first place.4) I stopped ordering the chicken wings because after the first few orders - they just kept getting worse.  I loved them at first but then they would send them to me with no sauce on the wings but with the sauce pooled on the bottom of the container.  Weird.5) Forgot fries even though I ordered the "deluxe" sandwich, which meant it included fries.6) I finally decided to write a bad review when they completely messed up my pizza instructions.  All my ordering was done online so everything was in writing for them to reference as many times as needed in order to NOT make mistakes.  I wanted half giardiniera peppers on my pizza and they put them on the whole thing so my friend had a really hard time enjoying his meal.  Taking them off didn't help much as the oil from the peppers still made the pizza spicy hot.Again - my orders were in WRITING so why do they keep making mistakes?I'll never order from them again.  The more often you order from them I'm sure you'll start to notice them forgetting something or giving you the wrong thing.Go ahead and order from them and see what mistakes they can make with your order!

49.description: 5 words - Bacon Macaroni and cheese Pizza. Yes,  you will need to run ten miles after eating.  Also,  we eat this pizza at least once a month because it's a good deal and it's tasty.  But seriously, if you want to end it all on a happy note, get the bacon mac and cheese pizza.

40.description: Just like I remember it! My family has been ordering from here since the 80's. I now live in Miami Beach and was looking for some good Chicago pizza. JB's did not disappoint. My husband had not had it before and said it was some of the best thin crust pizza he has ever had. It was just as I remember it growing up. Light and crispy crust, absolutely perfect. Delivery was quick and friendly!

53.description: Tasty hot food at a decent price.  A cornerstone of Rogers Park.

30.description: Love the pizza here! Especially the Giant, its like a tradition for us to order the Giant every Superbowl, we've been doing this for the past three years. Speaking of which, football season is in, Go Bears!!!Aside from that, whenever I got free time, I like two grab a sausage slice. Only downside is that I wished they had more drink options.

46.description: I'd like to give this place 4 stars because my orders always arrive hot, taste good, and arrive within the time frame estimate on the web site. I've ordered about 5-6 times through Grubhub or their web site over the last few months, and on all but one occasion, items were just missing from my order, and I've had to request a refund for them. In every instance an item or items were missing, it was an extra side of something such as a dressing, that I'd requested to go with another item in the order. While their food is pretty darn good most of the time, this repeat experience of missing items is making me think twice about ordering from them again or recommending this place to anyone else.

1.description: I was going to die if I didn't get a baked potato. That only a slight exaggeration, I swear! JB Alberto's was the closest place that would deliver me a baked potato, and a surprise dinner for my boyfriend. Baked potato: average, but good. Loaded with plenty of cheese and fresh bacon bits. Big potato. Pizza: solid quality for a good price. Thin crust isn't my cup of tea, but my boyfriend gave it his seal of approval. Garlic bread: ordered to get my order to the delivery minimum, not good. Kinda chewy and just tasted...off. Delivery was quick and friendly. I wasn't *thrilled* with what I got, but with a menu that extensive, I'd really like to go back and try more! And yes, I'll be back for the baked potato.

55.description: Best pizza ever! Better than Lou Malnati's or Giordano's

9.description: Great food and a great family restaurant! Thanks for giving Rogers Park a great place to eat for so many years.

26.description: Pizza came all messed up. Slices were on top of others as if the delivery guy just threw the pizza in the backseat. Horrible.

25.description: Ounce for ounce the undisputed best thin crust pizza in the USA! ( I usually it with sausage, onions and black olives.) Try it! The secret is in sweet pizza sauce and the excellent crust. Oh so good!

12.description: My goodness gracious what can i say. The thin crust pizza will knock your dirty socks off! Great pizza,great service, great prices. Been a customer for 9 years.

59.description: Love JB's! Great thin crust and you get a free liter of pop with your pizza. Good for late nights where you can get pizza by the slice. The stuffed crust is a little saucy but still pretty good. I recommend the double decker pizza, which is basically a thin crust on top of a thin crust. They also have great sandwiches.

21.description: Make sure you order in advance. Wait time is 45 minutes for everything except slice pizza.

17.description: Absolutely love this place, so much so that my brother. Came in town tonight from KC. He asked about Chicago style pizza and I immediately thought of JB Alberta  Pizza. I bought a slice which they offer while we waited and gave my brother a bite, he was like Italian Delight which is a popular place in KC. Bro was like, "oh yea da bomb"! So I'm happy, he enjoyed it as much as i do, keep up the good work JB!

10.description: For a city that takes pride in its great pizza, you wouldn't know it if you live in Rogers Park and want some decent delivery pizza. Sadly, Pizza Hut is a lot better than JB's and that's not saying much. JB's is not cheap and their sauce tastes like straight tomato paste. I won't be ordering from them again.

5.description: It's rare to find a pizza place with excellent quality pizza & phenomenal service. Lucky for me, I found this place!On Valentine's Day evening me & my boyfriend placed an order for a large pepperoni pizza. The man on the phone was super friendly! He also asked if a 1.5 hour wait would be ok, because they were super busy with the the holiday.Let's just say, it was worth the wait! Not only did the pizza arrive exactly when the guy on the phone said it would, the delivery man brought with a free bottle of cola to go with our pizza! What a nice touch!The pizza was delicious! Good quality/amount cheese & nice crust. Not the best pizza I've ever had in my life, but still super good! We will definitely be ordering again.Thank you JD's for a great, easy Valentines Day dinner!!

3.description: JB's has been a family favorite for as long as I can remember. They're best known for their pizza, and the thin crust is especially popular with my parents and husband who aren't fans of thick crust. (I love that they always have slices for sale, and I am perfectly happy with a slice of pan to go!! It's my favorite!) They have the largest size pizza I've ever seen; if needed, and everyone I know loves them!The menu is quite extensive, with daily specials and everything from burgers and sandwiches to ribs, fried shrimp, salads, wings, pasta dishes, you name it! They have no seating, but are always busy. They aren't open until late afternoon, yet they're open late with fast carry out or delivery service. They are located in Rogers Park on Morse yet they deliver to Evanston!

35.description: I'm constantly ordering delivery from here! There food is always good..I love their cheese pizza! so yummy & their fried chicken dinner is good as well

19.description: I was craving pizza all day. I finally gave in and ordered delivery at 10pm. The pizza came 20 minutes earlier than expected. The toppings on the deep dish pizza were in perfect balance and they were actually on top of the cheese. I feel like some Chicago deep dish has too much sauce, but the amount on this pizza was just right. It satisfied my craving!The medium pizza also came with a free liter of soda!

28.description: Absolutely love this place, so much so that my brother. Came in town tonight from KC. He asked about Chicago style pizza and I immediately thought of JB Alberta  Pizza. I bought a slice which they offer while we waited and gave my brother a bite, he was like Italian Delight which is a popular place in KC. Bro was like, "oh yea da bomb"! So I'm happy, he enjoyed it as much as i do, keep up the good work JB!

45.description: I absolutely love their thin crust pizza. It isn't shy either - it's a great crust with tons of cheese/toppings plus a really great sauce - sweet and rich. Delivery is always hot and their delivery guys are super friendly. It's consistently delicious and their garlic bread is amazing. It's probably clogging my arteries, but it's totally worth it.

33.description: I live a few blocks away from here so I eat here all the time. Pizza is 4 star but the ribs weren't that good to me a little flavorless I've had them twice weeks apart It was good enough not to get a refund but compared to the pizza it was a let down I still go here for pizza a lot mostly by the slice

43.description: This is my hangover remedy haha! Always great food and open late. Love the pizza and buffalo wings. And the steak fries are definitely a plus and pretty filling by themselves. And their delivery coverage area is remarkable. A lot of restaurants in Chicago won't deliver all the way to Evanston but JB's does!

2.description: We have ordered from JB Alberto's several times & the pizza is hit or miss. I really like to be able to count on the restaurants I frequent; JB Alberto's is not one of them. It seems the only thing you can count on is waiting for your order. At least four times, JB Alberto's has seriously under estimated their wait time without so much as an apology. Even worse is the fact that we pick up our orders & end up standing in their busy doorway until it's ready. Tonight, it took an extra 30 minutes to receive a pizza that was supposed to take 45 minutes. That's 30 minutes of standing there while being told "it'll be 5 more minutes". When my partner expressed dissatisfaction, JB Alberto's employee simply turned away & went about her business. When the pizza was finally ready, she handed it over with no apology or thank you for waiting.I hope JB Alberto's learns that they can't skimp of customer service just because they have a long history of good reviews.

18.description: I had a Christmas Eve party and needed help with the food.  J. Albertos is in my neighborhood and so I thought I'd give them a try.  I had them bring a full tray of lasagna, a half tray of mac and cheese and 50 pieces of chicken.  Everything went great and it was delivered on time and the food was yummy.  My only complaint is that I asked that the chicken be packaged in 1/2 size pans so, it would fit in the sterno pan along with the mac and cheese, with the lasagna in the other sterno pan.  Well, they put the chicken in full size pans so, I didn't have anywhere to put the mac and cheese.  If they had gotten that right, I would have given five stars.  But otherwise they were a pleasure to deal with and the food was good.

41.description: Picked up a 16in thin crust cheese pizza for the first time tonight and was delighted to find out it came with a free 1liter drink! Pizza tastes great so I'll be ordering from here again soon!

52.description: JB's is always a good go-to spot if you live in or around Rogers. Not a ton to say, just a good, reasonably priced delivery pizza! I remember getting the Giant as a kid, it's perfect for parties and fun to try to fit through the door! Italian beef is decent as well!

50.description: I don't recommend ordering through grub hub for picking up an order there. This is the second time I've ordered through grub hub. Both times I ordered a pasta and a salad, and both times they forgot to put the salad in the bag. I did not realize this either time until I got home. The girl that was at the front desk tonight was also very rude and almost yelling at people. The food is okay, but the times I've ordered it got messed up.

4.description: I did a little research on JB Alberto's this morning and I found outthat they have been around since 1967!Wow! I was 6 years old in 1967 and had I known then what I knownow about JB's I would have been bugging my Mom to get on thephone and call JB's for.. No, not Salad! But Pizza!However, in all fairness to JB's, I don't think they would have deliveredto my house in Logan Square from Rogers Park.So, now I reside in East Rogers Park and JB's is close by, right off theMorse Street Red Line Stop.My 35 year old son actually introduced me to JB Alberto's, so I will givehim major props for this because Boy, do I like this place!There's really much to Love here Folks,From the Pan Pizza to pizza by the slice, you can't go wrong.Now, unfortunately I really can't eat much pizza anymore becauseall that gooey cheese and stuff can really clog up your arteries andthen you wind up in the hospital yadda, yadda..So, I order lotsa salads, okay, with grilled chicken and boy, do I lovethose!I've been eating lotsa lettuce stuff lately, and okay, yes, I feel kindof bad that I'm stealing the Bunnies Lettuce Supply but they need toget over that!Hey, they still have their carrots, lord knows I won't steal thosecause boy, do I hate carrots!JB's also has really good sandwiches and pasta, broasted chicken, fish,a pretty big menu with many choices/options.Now, for the record, this is definitely more a take out/delivery place, and theyare constantly busy.With good reason..Because it  truly says a lot knowing that a place has been around for49 years, to me it says that JB's is all about quality, and food that keepsyour customers coming back.If you haven't been to JB Alberto's in Rogers Park stop on by!Open Daily at 4pm..On Sundays I believe they open at 3..Daily Specials too!JB Alberto's, definitely worth a visit....

6.description: I give this place 5 stars for customer services, food was ready on time, & their pizza is terrific! The dough, the sauce, the cheese, & the meats are all delicious! I love their deep dish! I would recommend this place first to anyone! Also if your walking in expect it to be a bit busy this place is a stacked house but at least you can enjoy smelling some good cooking! :)

22.description: They have great pizza but advertise one price and charge another. The website menu and the physical menu list one set of prices, but they charge you a higher amount and hope you don't notice. It's a sad state of affairs when pizza places have to lie like this.
