I called, thinking it was just an online ordering error, but it's not. They are absolutely charging higher prices than they are advertising, and hoping you don't notice.

15.description: Seriously the best pizza I have ever had in my life! The deep dish pepperoni was amazing!! We ordered delivery and they brought us a free baguette roll and 1 litre of cola, we were so impressed. Very reasonably priced. I highly recommend this place.

57.description: real good and super cheap food especially since they're open late!!! two deep slices and i'm ready to go. only thing you gotta expect is that if you order something big it's gonna take some time but it's whatever for the taste and value

20.description: This plance can have 4 o 5 stars, if you greet and thanks for the business to a customer. Otherwise, your pizza is great

36.description: Very good Pizza! Don't believe the haters! You'll get your pizza in under 20mins! I only eat the pizza! Single slices available & pizza orders come with a free 1ltr of soda! Only thing is they open late at 4pm, not sure why they don't open earlier on Sundays for football games? They do close very late for all you stoners & drunkards!Their delivery service is ok, best go & pick up it up if you live in the area.

14.description: Some people might say that it looks like a dump, there pizza actually taste really great!!  I always order the 24"  pizza!! They have many more items on there menu I've tasted the wings and those are good too.. It's a carryout/delivery..They do take a long time to deliver, but it's well worth the wait.

58.description: They have Surly on tap!!! I thought I was dreaming. This fact alone would bring me back to this place over and over again... but, bonus -- R Public House is actually awesome, apart from serving awesome beers!Food is good -- The bacon wrapped dates are delicious. I was also excited to see they have a Juicy Lucy on the menu (there must be some Minnesotan connection) but I'd love to see a Blucy (blue cheese) please! The flatbread pizzas are also good, and the quality of ingredients seems really fresh.Service was good when we went there, especially given that the place was almost full! Everyone is so friendly, and the crowd is an awesome mix of older, younger, straighter, gayer, hipster, prepster... everything I love about Rogers Park. Only problem with this neighborhood is parking... DON'T park in the lot across the street by the dry cleaner... my visit last weekend unfortunately ended up costing me an extra $200, thanks to the owner of that lot (boo). But I'll still be back!

56.description: Went on a random Saturday and it's a good solid neighborhood bar.  It's affordable, the goat cheese pizza was flavorful and service was decent.  However, given the number of breweries cropping up near and far, I expect a better draft list.

29.description: I come here Sunday nights for dinner and karaoke with Sue, the "KJ" (karaoke jockey). Previously I used to go to karaoke when she ran the Sunday show at Parlour, at Clark and Devon, but they closed several months ago.I am glad Sue is now at the karaoke helm in East Rogers Park in part because it's very convenient for me. I live a block away. I also like that it starts at 7:30. Not everyone is a late-night owl and it's good to be able to sing fairly early, stay a few hours, and be home in time for a reasonable bedtime.Sue is a great KJ, as I said in my Parlour review. She works hard, using very good karaoke technology and her nice sound  system, to make everyone sounds as good as possible. She's conscientious and takes her job seriously. She is personable and friendly to everyone, not just her favorites -- which I've noticed can be a problem with some other KJs. She is encouraging to the singers and makes people feel at home and just have fun.She has a large songbook with a very diverse selection, and her computer has many additional choices not in the book. If you don't see it in the book, ask her to check her laptop.The sound system Sue has invested in is outstanding. I can't remember any other karaoke bar where the sound is so good.The food here is good. I enjoy the pizza and sandwiches, and they are generous with refills of non-alcoholic drinks. I have not noticed the wait staff to be anything but professional and friendly. It's quite good to have a karaoke bar where you can eat a satisfying meal. I've invited friends here, and we've all had a lot of fun.

42.description: I went on a Sunday afternoon to meet a friend for a late lunch and some drinks.   Overall I have to say it's a nice little hangout spot.    They had the World Cup game of Costa Rica vs. Greece playing at the time.   I ordered their apple cider beer drink, the particular name they called it I'm forgetting.     It was as good as Red Apple.    Being a fan of the Juicy Lucy I had in Minneapolis, I was curious to give it a try here.    It wound up being a good choice.   The pretzel bun it was served on was perfect as it didn't get completely soaked through like a regular bun would.    The fries were piping hot, which was good.    And our server was pretty nice, checking in at appropriate times to make sure everything was fine.    Overall it was a good experience.

23.description: Nice little hidden gem! The prices aren't too great on their own, but they have good specials. I got the all you can eat wings--great deal (especially for a bar), and they tasted great! They also have an assortment of creative drinks. The location is super convenient too, it's right off the Jarvis Red line. The atmosphere is nice and low-key and our waiter was great and friendly. I'll definitely return.

47.description: This is an interesting joint in a much needed spot. Decent beer list, the pizza I had was pretty good, but unfortunately one of the strangest service experiences. It took 10 minutes before someone even checked in with me (and it wasn't that busy) and then the server seemed to be in another world (got my order wrong, disappeared, brought the wrong check, kept making some really strange apologies that didn't really make sense, etc.) I guess anybody could have an off day. If management pays a bit more attention to their staff, they'll have a solid place.

8.description: A fantastic time with good music and amazing atmosphere. I lived up the street for 2 years and loved coming home to a lively neighborhood spot like this!

31.description: If you are coming here to drink and hang out this place is great. Coming to eat? Eh.. Not so much. The food is decent but the menu is boring and doesn't give me much to choose from. Everything I've had is good, but after a couple times of going here there's really nothing more for me to try. The bartenders don't seem to care about anyone but the people they know. I'm pretty sure there is a group of regulars that are always there because the bartenders are always talking to them the whole time and not paying attention to anyone else and how empty our drinks are.

34.description: I had brunch for the first time today here.  I like the different menu options.  I was slightly disappointed with the chicken and waffles.  I was hoping for their fried chicken, which I LOVE!!  Instead there were super thin chicken tenders with the waffles.  Wasn't expecting that and wasn't a fan.  Hopefully they change the recipe and use their fried chicken!!

16.description: I like R Public House. The food was great, especially the fries. OMG.I had chicken wings in buffalo sauce and they were some of the best wings I've had in a loooooong time. They have a full bar, but I kept to the Miller Lite they have on tap. For $8, I could upgrade to the "big girl mug" (which I could barely pick up, but I managed haha).The lighting was nice, dim, but plentiful. The only complaints I have is that I wish our server would have come around a little more and it would have been nice to actually hear the music that was playing. All in all, this is a great spot!

13.description: I would give this place 4 stars if it weren't for the terrible service we received...We had a group of 8 come in for dinner at 8:30pm on a Monday night. There were 2 bartenders and 1 server. The server was the worst... we were there until maybe 11 and he rarely attended to us to ask if we wanted more drinks... each guy probably only had 3 drinks but would have had much more had the server been more timely. I think the bartenders were just as lazy though. We were like their only customers.... and why wouldn't they want the extra $$$???Anyway... I got the Mr. Cheezy Pizza (Brie, goat cheese, parmesan and bleu). HOLY COW it was DELICIOUS. Omg I want to eat it right now!!! The brie and goat cheese made it absolutely amazing!My hubby got the Hot Chick Burger. He said it was good! It was a good amount of spicy! He said the banana pepper rings were good too.Overall, food was awesome! But service brought the rating down substantially...

11.description: I love this place. And what's fantastic about it is that it's across the street from my apartment. Why do I like this place so much?!1) The Girls Night Out menu. The fact that it's a whole menu along was wonderful.2) The jukebox. I'm such a sucker for these things it's really unbelievable...3) The Juicy Lucy. Mostly cause I love things that rhyme like a word game junky...4) It is literally across the street. If that isn't lazy pride then I don't know what else is. They have a great selection of gluten free beverages and menu as well which is always a plus in my book.

39.description: Full disclosure: I am completely biased.  This is my neighborhood bar and I practically live there.  That being said, I wouldn't go if I didn't think it was good.  There's a bar next door that's been there for ages that I hardly go to because I just never felt it was great.  But that's another review.There are so many good things about this place.  Let's start with the ambiance.  Finally, a place where "everybody knows your name" (sing along here) in Rogers Park!  The people who go here all tend to know each other or are just one degree away.  I've always had a great time and usually end up talking to people at the bar that I never knew before.  And that's the thing about R Pub (as we like to call it); the setting is laid back and one of camaraderie and friendliness.    Moving on to the food and drink - it's pretty damn good.  Personally, I think I like the pizzas the best.  They're pretty inexpensive, like $10 to $12, but easily feed two people and they use good quality ingredients.  I also really like the new kale burger for those days I can't bring myself to eat a Moo - trying to go more vegetarian.   But I digress.  Their appetizers are all pretty yummy - the nut crusted brie is fabulous! Drinks-wise, they have an interesting (in a good way) selection of beers, both draft and bottle.  They also have a small, but good wine selection.  And the bartenders are all pretty good mixologists.  So you really can't go wrong.Service - well, this is where I am going to be the most biased.  I haven't had a problem with service.  Yes, I know a majority of the people who work there because, like I said, I'm a regular.  BUT, I didn't know them when I started coming in and I don't remember having bad service even then.  I actually think the service is pretty awesome and it is what made me and my husband want to become regulars.  During busy periods, there is a host that helps seat people as soon as they walk in.  Bartenders are always attentive and can often suggest a good beer.  I often switch from bar to a table or vice versa and the servers never make a big deal of it since you know they will have to split the tip.  And they all have a friendly vibe which has led me to continue coming here and making new friends of both personnel and other regulars alike.  So I'm surprised at some of the reviews here.  But hey, everyone has their own experiences so my only suggestion to anyone reading this is go in and try it yourself.  I really think Rogers Park needs this place and more like it, and I strongly believe that we need to continue to give our patronage to this and the other cool little places that have popped up recently (Towbar, RP Social, Twisted Tapas, etc).  I will continue going as long as it's around!

37.description: So, we're doing a show over in Touhy Park and decide to come here afterwards.  When we got there and they asked us how many we said between 15 and 20.  They didn't bat an eye but said wait a minute and put tables together for us.  A majority of restaurants/bars if you did that would panic in front of you.  Good job on the professionalism.  Great drinks (I had wine) and the food is EXCELLENT.  I had the dates wrapped in bacon appetizer and the house salad (which was huge, delicious, and contained elements not found in most house salads-goat cheese, onions, etc.).  Great service, great food, great atmosphere.  What's not to like.

0.description: Just love this place. Found it when my daughter was at an away game at a nearby high school and we had an hour to kill about 30 minutes away from home...bar or sweaty high school gym...hmmmm? Boy am I glad I wasn't one of those moms who wanted to sit and watch my kid watch a game (no of course she wasn't playing - she was there to support her boyfriend who was playing - I'm not that bad!).Of all the nearby restaurants in beautiful Rogers Park this one sparked my attention because they have week night specials and the Wednesday night special was all you can eat mussels. Yum. It was amazing. They kept trying to fill us up with their addictive french fries and toasted garlic bread but we were having none of it - just bring me more mussels please.  And of course they did. The wait staff is amazing. The other menu items looked good. Kids had cheeseburgers. We also tried bacon wrapped dates. Delicious. All of it. Can't make a bad choice if you try. On our last trip (we've been three times now) we were told the all you could eat mussels was being discontinued but instead a mussels would be a permanent menu item  just not in the "all you can eat" category. I hope my family wasn't the cause of this...  I can't wait to try other menu items. Knowing they'll always be there we can probably try something other than mussels for a while!

38.description: The pesto chicken pizza is da bomb! This place is super nice and perfect for locals and travelers!

51.description: R Public House makes good use of its wood burning pizza oven, with unique toppings such as fried egg. Good food and drink always seem to keep the place jumping, especially on the weekends.  It's a nice addition to the neighborhood and will help to keep Jarvis on the Red Line map!youtube.com/watch?v=zawG…

27.description: I am long overdue in writing this review as I have been going to this place from shortly after it opened.A year and change ago, I was looking for a cold beer after unpacking in my new apartment. I happened into this bar and was warmly met by the staff and enjoyed not only a nice beer, but also a pizza.It's one thing to have good food and a decent beer selection, but it takes it to the next level when the staff are all pleasant and friendly. It would be easy for them to sit back and let people come in and hang out and then just simply serve food and drinks, but that's not the environment there. The staff are very kind, welcoming, and full of smiles.The menu is not expansive, yet has something that will hit the spot for most people. There's also the big plus that there is a late night menu so that you can enjoy a snack as the night goes on. The crowd that frequents are usually good natured and the noise level is moderate.I have brought a lot of friends here and they all love it. I foresee myself frequenting there for as long as I live in the area.

32.description: This is one of my neighborhood hangouts & I love this place!  The pizzas are great, big girl beers are big & affordable, & appetizers are tasty.  They have a wood fired pizza oven, a full bar, & a great neighborhood vibe!  Try one of Renee's famous bloody Mary's, perfect after a Sunday morning stroll in the hood!

54.description: Dinner with my Son Brian!Cool Place!Gotta say, I am loving my new neighborhood!Because I am discovering some truly great, new places, such as R Public House.Located on Jarvis, across from the Jarvis Red Line Stop you will find this gemof a place, and .. it's not a hidden gem by any means because it seems to havea crowd of regulars, but it's definitely a gem!What impressed me and made me the most comfortable as I entered thisestablishment was the diversity of this crowd, yes, there may have been a fewhipsters in the house but there were also folks my age relaxing and having a great time!The interior of R's Public House is most welcoming and comfortable, a reallybeautiful bar area and some high back tables, and I counted like 4 T.V.'s, eachwith a different channel for our viewing pleasure, Nice!The jukebox was playing great old school tunes and I had to laugh when theOsmond Brothers One Bad Apple came on and the crowd started singing alongto Donny Osmond's high pitched OHHHH.. hilarious!And, yes, this crowd knew the words to One Bad Apple, Circa the 70's.. Ahhhh....The sound level was also comfortable enough for me to carry on a conversationwith my 2 dining companions, so rare these days!Now, I must admit, I ordered a Miller Lite Double, just because and some reallydelicious hot, chewy pretzel bites and one of the best bacon cheeseburgers I haveever had, so perfect!R's Public House also has a Pizza Bar  where they will design your own pizzaand they have great daily specials as well!This place is pretty incredible in every aspect and I can't wait to return and thisbarely happens with me but R's Public House has all the right stuff!And, I'm sure that's what keeps people coming back for more..A great neighborhood bar/restaurant with a great vibe, happy people,a really cool server named Joe, delicious food and a pretty extensive beer list..What more could you want?As far as I'm concerned R's Public House has all their bases covered..And, that is a truly great thing...

48.description: Somewhat of a limited menu. If you're in the mood for a burger or pizza, this is a good option. Other than that, I'd go somewhere else.

44.description: TERRIBLE SERVICE! I live around the block and find myself here over and over trying to give this place a chance. Every single time, no joke, they have messed up part of my order. More recently, a hair was on my pizza. They could care less when I politely approached our server. Now, the pizza is pretty good, the burgers suck and fries are ok. Their pizza is the only thing worth trying on the menu. I want to like this place so much, but damn, get it together, or at least start treating the non-gay people the same way you treat the gay people.

24.description: GREAT FOOD :) get the f n hot burger... Shrimp pizza was really good too. Unfortunately, Gabrielle was a disappointing server to say the least. (I hate to take away a full star for service but come on...) Will definitely be back but we'll just sit at the bar.

7.description: Friendly, fast, good prices. AWESOME food.

49.description: I have been here 3 times and have been unable to receive any service. I would love to try food or a drink since this place is around the corner from my house. After spending 20 minutes standing in various spots trying to get attention from a server or a bartender, we left and spent our money elsewhere. I would love to keep the money in RP, but I can't ignore the non-welcoming vibe every time I try to spend money here.

40.description: Great service, our waiter was kind and quick to show us the menu and would regularly check in to see how we were doing. The place is spacious and has a friendly atmosphere, perfect for a hang out with friends on a long summer night. We had the f n hot burger and the pizza with goat cheese that i can't remember the name but both were cooked well and delicious! I had the apple cider beer which was sweet but still gave me a buzz. Love this place, will come back for sure!

53.description: Good beer and wine list, wish I would've eaten! Dart board that doesn't really work but the environment is nice.  Tucked away in Rodgers Park/Evanston.  Stop in if you in the neighborhood!

30.description: Love this place. Been coming I here for a couple of months now. Always great service and good people

46.description: Great service, great beer list. For food, I'd stick with the pizza or sandwiches/burgers. If you're a veggie, not to worry. Plenty of delicious options for you. I really like the meatza pizza, and the new girl. Lost a star because most of the apps taste like the frozen bag they came from and the sauces don't match. That's not a deal breaker for me, I will most certainly be back.

1.description: Their craft cocktails and homemade liquor infusions are so tasty!!!!  I got the PB&J martini and it legit tasted like the sandwich.  Every Thursday they have large mug beer specials.The food here is creative and it's really easy to find healthy and vegetarian options (shout out to the kale burger). The Gouda cheese bites are Bomb. They also have a wood fire oven for fresh pizzas. The decor is always changing depending on what holiday it's about to be. The ambiance is cozy and rustic.Also it's definitely a queer friendly bar and all the staff always have smiles on their faces.

55.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  I live just around the corner from R Public House and we go there often enough to where the bartender's know us. Whether that is a good for bad thing, well that's debateable.  The food is great and the booze is great. Not a big beer drinker, so I cannot comment on the quality of their draft list.  They do have CiderBoys on draft which I love.  Their liquor selection is great, and they alway seem to poor generously.  They have Truffle oil fries that are to die for, but all around I've never been disappointed by the food I've eaten there.  This bar is definitely a hidden gem.  Its got a great atmosphere and there is always a wide variety of patrons that attend.  I will be sad to be far away from it when I move, but will definitely make the trip back!

9.description: Tried this place out on a Friday night. Wasn't too busy; friendly atmosphere and staff. The reason for the three stars is that I ordered a Bloody Mary and it was bitter and strange tasting. It's hard to mess up a Bloody Mary, in my opinion, unless you water it down, which is what happened here. I tried another two cocktails and they were both weak. Had the cheeseburger and it was about average. Overall, not a negative experience, and I'll make it back if I'm in the area, but it's not a place I'd go out of my way to go to.

26.description: Just a great neighborhood bar and grill. The pizzas are extraordinary, try the Meatza and Saucy Chick for sure. The small plate offerings are exceptional and they aren't afraid to try something fanciful with typical bar fare, like the wings. A great place to hang by yourself and watch a game or with a group of friends in an otherwise oft-overlooked part of the city. The bar is stocked with a great beer and liquor selection, including some decent bourbon that you might not find at most Chicago bars. The staff is helpful and ready, never overbearing or preoccupied.

25.description: The Monday night meat loaf was fantastic! Meatloaf, mashed potatoes, green beans with garlic butter, OMG.And a Lagunitas IPA to top it off.

12.description: Dinner with my Son Brian!Cool Place!Gotta say, I am loving my new neighborhood!Because I am discovering some truly great, new places, such as R Public House.Located on Jarvis, across from the Jarvis Red Line Stop you will find this gemof a place, and .. it's not a hidden gem by any means because it seems to havea crowd of regulars, but it's definitely a gem!What impressed me and made me the most comfortable as I entered thisestablishment was the diversity of this crowd, yes, there may have been a fewhipsters in the house but there were also folks my age relaxing and having a great time!The interior of R's Public House is most welcoming and comfortable, a reallybeautiful bar area and some high back tables, and I counted like 4 T.V.'s, eachwith a different channel for our viewing pleasure, Nice!The jukebox was playing great old school tunes and I had to laugh when theOsmond Brothers One Bad Apple came on and the crowd started singing alongto Donny Osmond's high pitched OHHHH.. hilarious!And, yes, this crowd knew the words to One Bad Apple, Circa the 70's.. Ahhhh....The sound level was also comfortable enough for me to carry on a conversationwith my 2 dining companions, so rare these days!Now, I must admit, I ordered a Miller Lite Double, just because and some reallydelicious hot, chewy pretzel bites and one of the best bacon cheeseburgers I haveever had, so perfect!R's Public House also has a Pizza Bar  where they will design your own pizzaand they have great daily specials as well!This place is pretty incredible in every aspect and I can't wait to return and thisbarely happens with me but R's Public House has all the right stuff!And, I'm sure that's what keeps people coming back for more..A great neighborhood bar/restaurant with a great vibe, happy people,a really cool server named Joe, delicious food and a pretty extensive beer list..What more could you want?As far as I'm concerned R's Public House has all their bases covered..And, that is a truly great thing...

59.description: This hidden-away gastropub is rad.Great beer selection, great food--they even have a brick oven for pizza. Definitely a local establishment, patronized by Rogers Parkers--but I recommend venturing out to try it, if you're somewhat close.

21.description: I love this place for so many reasons. From the owner to the customers, everyone is great. The food is delicious and continues to get better. The juicy Lucy and pretzels are my favorites. Also a great selection of draft beers et al.

17.description: Came in and sat at the bar. The bartender say hi and I will be right back. After 10 minutes of people are me receiving food and NO ONE came back to me to ask me what I would want.......I left.

10.description: This is a neighborhood staple. Really solid menu with some of the best food you'll find in Rogers Park. They always have good beer on tap and good drink specials. It's a casual place; although I don't love the sports bar vibe, I understand why that makes money. The loud, half-crowded ambience not the most ideal spot for an intimate dinner, however the tunes are usually really decent. I've never had a problem getting a table or prompt service; the small staff is talented, especially the chefs. This pub has something for everybody and I hope they never change.

5.description: Had an awesome Valentine's Day dinner it was very delicious. My fiance and i had a great time. Hats off to Chef Aaron Whittington and the rest of the staff. Great wine pairing for each course.

3.description: The Rogers Park Cheers Bar - Nice to be known - live a 2 min walk away and love this place -   GREAT food and selection on drinks - Pretzel bites are the best! PLUS A Wood burning pizza oven!!!!Great pours makes this my go to quick drink spot - right off the Jarvis Red line!

35.description: I like R Public House. The food was great, especially the fries. OMG.I had chicken wings in buffalo sauce and they were some of the best wings I've had in a loooooong time. They have a full bar, but I kept to the Miller Lite they have on tap. For $8, I could upgrade to the "big girl mug" (which I could barely pick up, but I managed haha).The lighting was nice, dim, but plentiful. The only complaints I have is that I wish our server would have come around a little more and it would have been nice to actually hear the music that was playing. All in all, this is a great spot!

19.description: Sorry, R Public House, but I just can't give you my business anymore. Your food is good. Your drinks are good. Your general atmosphere is good. Your service, however, has never been that good and has recently been terrible. My last three visits to your establishment have been truly awful. Sorry, but three strikes is all you get.First, there was the time that I was dining alone and decided to go ahead and sit at the bar, where I was treated to the joy of being completely ignored. I just wanted a beer and a sandwich, but that was apparently too much to ask. The bartender never acknowledged my presence. I was finally able to flag him down, at which point he silently dropped a menu in front of me and then walked away to ignore me again. Everyone else was apparently a regular and was greeted and promptly served and enjoyed some friendly banter, while I sat wondering what was wrong with me. I guess I don't count because I'm not recognized as a regular. I finally got up and left without ever being served. Thanks for nothing.Then, there was the time I was with a small group. We all placed our orders. Drinks came quickly, but several of them were wrong, and somehow my drink was forgotten. Our food took forever, and again several people were served the wrong dishes and my food was forgotten. Our waitress tried to argue with us when we pointed out the mistakes, insisting that everything was right and if we had changed our minds about what we wanted then we should have said something before she brought the food out. Even though I asked about my missing order twice, it never came, so I ended up eating fries off of one of my friend's plates. Even though I never got my food, my order was included on our bill, which led to more argument with our waitress, who insisted that she had served me my missing meal. My most recent visit was no exception. Some friends and I arrived, sat, perused the menu, and ordered. I had limited time to hang out and eat, so I only ordered an appetizer, thinking it wouldn't take as long as an actual entree. Once we order, we waited. Then we waited some more. And waited. Finally, our drinks arrived. But where was our food? So we waited again. And waited some more. We watched the tables around us being served. We continued to wait. Finally, one of our group flagged down our waitress to ask about our orders. Apparently, she had never actually put them in. There was no apology of any kind. Finally, our food arrived over an hour after we had ordered. Sadly, it arrived just as I was leaving, so I never actually got to eat anything. I have friends who love R Public House and insist that it is awesome in every way, but I have never experienced that myself. Is there something wrong with me? Am I such a terrible person that they can't bring themselves to serve me? I wish I knew what it was, but I guess it doesn't matter when I won't ever try to eat there again.

28.description: This is a nice spot, with good beers on tap and a pretty interesting menu.  You'll find something for everyone on the menu here. I'd rate it higher as it is a 3 start kind of place, but they served up their signature "Juicy Lucy" burger to me hard as a friggin rock, with no cheese inside, just an empty cavity surrounded by a hard cooked meat shell.  I showed the server, he said "oh gosh I've never seen that before"... and brought me a cup of cheesey stuff to slather on it because it would have taken too long to re-do it. In the end, the burger sucked, but I was fed I guess.  And with a group of pals.  So I paid them and left, but didn't feel great about it.

45.description: I used to come here when it was grupo de amici which I absolutely loved, so unfortunately it puts high standards up for this place. Overall experience was smooth and problem free: pizza was very good (if you like thin crust this oven is great), burger was very tasty and their salad was better then most bar salads. Their menu is a bit small (if you don't want a sandwich or pizza your options are very limited) and the one "unique" dish we had--the blue cheese-bacon-wrapped figs--were a bit disappointing.We ate outside and were only inside a short time which looked nice but a bit too "tavernish". There is a wine store next door and a pub 2 doors away so I wish this place was a bit more family friendly and not "more of the same". That said, I'm sure I am not their target audience and for a sunny early dinner their patio worked fine for our family.

33.description: Super tasty fries and wings.  I love to go here on a warm summer afternoon and sit outside.  And the "Big Girls" drinks are amazing.  Plus they have gluten free beer.

43.description: Sorry, R Public House, but I just can't give you my business anymore. Your food is good. Your drinks are good. Your general atmosphere is good. Your service, however, has never been that good and has recently been terrible. My last three visits to your establishment have been truly awful. Sorry, but three strikes is all you get.First, there was the time that I was dining alone and decided to go ahead and sit at the bar, where I was treated to the joy of being completely ignored. I just wanted a beer and a sandwich, but that was apparently too much to ask. The bartender never acknowledged my presence. I was finally able to flag him down, at which point he silently dropped a menu in front of me and then walked away to ignore me again. Everyone else was apparently a regular and was greeted and promptly served and enjoyed some friendly banter, while I sat wondering what was wrong with me. I guess I don't count because I'm not recognized as a regular. I finally got up and left without ever being served. Thanks for nothing.Then, there was the time I was with a small group. We all placed our orders. Drinks came quickly, but several of them were wrong, and somehow my drink was forgotten. Our food took forever, and again several people were served the wrong dishes and my food was forgotten. Our waitress tried to argue with us when we pointed out the mistakes, insisting that everything was right and if we had changed our minds about what we wanted then we should have said something before she brought the food out. Even though I asked about my missing order twice, it never came, so I ended up eating fries off of one of my friend's plates. Even though I never got my food, my order was included on our bill, which led to more argument with our waitress, who insisted that she had served me my missing meal. My most recent visit was no exception. Some friends and I arrived, sat, perused the menu, and ordered. I had limited time to hang out and eat, so I only ordered an appetizer, thinking it wouldn't take as long as an actual entree. Once we order, we waited. Then we waited some more. And waited. Finally, our drinks arrived. But where was our food? So we waited again. And waited some more. We watched the tables around us being served. We continued to wait. Finally, one of our group flagged down our waitress to ask about our orders. Apparently, she had never actually put them in. There was no apology of any kind. Finally, our food arrived over an hour after we had ordered. Sadly, it arrived just as I was leaving, so I never actually got to eat anything. I have friends who love R Public House and insist that it is awesome in every way, but I have never experienced that myself. Is there something wrong with me? Am I such a terrible person that they can't bring themselves to serve me? I wish I knew what it was, but I guess it doesn't matter when I won't ever try to eat there again.

2.description: Great place! Went here after getting into Chicago. It's a great neighborhood bar with a solid menu for late night and dinner. I got a German brew and then the pomegranate Paloma which was perfect. We also tried the smoked Gouda bites which were amazing. You can't go wrong with cheese...so delicious. The dipping sauce was cheddar and yes it was a lot of cheese but it was perfect.  Great atmosphere and our server was so much fun! I'd love to go back here and try their coal fired pizza.

18.description: I am long overdue in writing this review as I have been going to this place from shortly after it opened.A year and change ago, I was looking for a cold beer after unpacking in my new apartment. I happened into this bar and was warmly met by the staff and enjoyed not only a nice beer, but also a pizza.It's one thing to have good food and a decent beer selection, but it takes it to the next level when the staff are all pleasant and friendly. It would be easy for them to sit back and let people come in and hang out and then just simply serve food and drinks, but that's not the environment there. The staff are very kind, welcoming, and full of smiles.The menu is not expansive, yet has something that will hit the spot for most people. There's also the big plus that there is a late night menu so that you can enjoy a snack as the night goes on. The crowd that frequents are usually good natured and the noise level is moderate.I have brought a lot of friends here and they all love it. I foresee myself frequenting there for as long as I live in the area.

41.description: Great service, great food, meaty wings , bartenders are very sociable and friendly, community vibe, personal bathrooms, open cooking area where you can view the food being made.  Amazing daily specials. Love the motto "no good story ever started with a salad".  Daily specials.  Less than half block from Jarvis redline.

52.description: What a great addition to the Rogers park neighborhood! Between me and my date over several visits we have tried the fish and chips, wings, steak sandwich, salad, and a phenomenal goat pizza! And a great beer selection too...Highly recommend !

50.description: Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. This is as good as gets in Rogers Park and would do well in any neighborhood. The pizza's are terrific and so are the sandwiches. This was my third trip and I am looking forward to the forth.

4.description: I stopped by for lunch here and ordered the sliders, a side salad (which was not on the menu), and a beer. I closed out my tab without looking Bc I knew the price of the sliders and the beer and figured the side salad would be around $4. Nope. The SIDE SALAD was $7! It cost exactly the same as my beer. That's just ridiculous. It was literally no more than 2oz of lettuce.  Never again.

6.description: A wonderful neighborhood bar.  Lots of specials and surprises.  Now, Supper Club Saturdays!  Went to the first one with a friend on 2/6.  Linen table cloths and live entertainment by Mr. K, playing an accordion and piano, with his lovely singing partner crooning all manner of covers.  The Boomers among us who have been to VFW/UAW/community center feasts, let alone real Wisconsin supper clubs, can certainly relate to the music.  Lots of polka and dancing by the owners and guests.Feature was Prime Rib or Cornish Hen, with soup or an iceberg lettuce wedge with blue cheese dressing.  A small bowl of crudites started things off.   Crudites were OK, and there is not much you can do to iceberg lettuce.  The Prime Rib was good, with Adam (10 oz) and Steve (7 oz) sizes.  I wanted mine rare, it arrived medium well.  Not sure if the waitress didn't hear me (it was pretty noisy) or if rare just wasn't an option.  Mashed potatoes were the real deal, not boxed mush.  I had my first Harvey Wallbanger, ever.  Nice, but switched to wine once the main course showed up.  Ordered dessert off the regular menu, a nice chocolate mousse, my dining partner had the rice pudding.Overall, we enjoyed the experience, although it was interesting to see the bar adopt a split personality; over here the regulars chowing on pizza and burgers, while over there we have Prime Rib and Cornish Hen on linen.  Layer on polka music and dancing, and it gets pretty entertaining!You cannot take yourself, or R Public too seriously or you will miss the fun.  Food was good, service was OK.  Pricing was appropriate.  Yes, I'd do it again!

22.description: Friendly place, much better than average bar food, and very fun karaoke on Sunday nights!

15.description: I am a frequent visitor to R Public House. The atmosphere is good. The food is always delicious. Get there on a Monday night for the amazing Meatloaf! The bartenders make the cocktails strong, just like I like them. They are also very friendly. Go there on a beautiful day, and sit outside on the patio! Great spot for people watching, and seeing all the cute guys walk their pups down Jarvis!

57.description: Yup, Surly on tap put me over the edge on this place. I went here when it first opened for brunch and thought it was meh but coming back a few months later, what an improvement. The wings and flatbread was great along with the beer selections. Right on about this place. We'll be back!

20.description: I am a frequent visitor to R Public House. The atmosphere is good. The food is always delicious. Get there on a Monday night for the amazing Meatloaf! The bartenders make the cocktails strong, just like I like them. They are also very friendly. Go there on a beautiful day, and sit outside on the patio! Great spot for people watching, and seeing all the cute guys walk their pups down Jarvis!

36.description: I will begin by saying that the first time that I went to this place I would have given it five stars. But since then I've gone three or four more times and realize that the only reason it was so great was because the owner was there and making the drinks and talking to people. Our favorite item is the cream cheese balls which are supposed to be filled with bacon and chives.  The first time we had that we were absolutely amazed how delicious it was. But each time since then there has been basically only cream cheese in them which does not make them taste good. These cream cheese balls are actually the one reason that we want to go to this place as well as the wings which are very good.Now I don't even really want to go anymore because it's been pretty inconsistent.  the cream cheese balls are not at all how they are described on the menu because there's only cream cheese. Also the first time we went we got these amazing bloody Marys and we've ordered them again twice since and they just haven't been as good and also they're missing many of the items that were there the first time. Really, these inconsistencies are what really frustrates me about R public house because I want to love it so much and it's right across the street from my house. But I really don't want to give them the business if they're not gonna give me the product that I want. I will say this, we went last night for some cream cheese only balls and wings and we had told them we were on our way to a concert so we were pressed for time and they jumped on it and immediately got us a menu , our drinks and our food so that was great. Unfortunately I would have given them two stars if that hadn't happened last night so then stepping it up last night really helped this review. Also I must say that I had the brunch burger the first time and it was amazing. So amazing that I told my coworkers the following week. But again I have ordered it since and  it just wasn't anything special. The egg on it was completely cooked through so there really wasn't any point in having it there. Very disappointing. The juicy Lucy which is supposed to have tons of cheese inside barely had any, although the bacon jam that they put on top was delicious. I will go back since I've heard really stellar reviews about the pizza but that's pretty much all I will go back for. Step up your game, R public house!

14.description: Been here a few times.  Like that it is close to home, low key & usually decent food.  Went the other day and it was ALL bad.  It's been about 6 months since I've been here, so don't know if they changed the kitchen staff.  Everything we had, had something wrong.  Chicken wings were good, but the celery was slimy and brown.  Smoked cheese sticks were so greasy you could see the grease drip out of them.  My burger was just dripping with grease from the fried peppers, had a little slimy limp pickle on the side and one tiny brown piece of limp lettuce on the side.    Pizza crust was soggy.  Fries were soggy & greasy.  Felt gross & sick when I left.  Service was ok, had to keep asking for more water, then he would only fill one glass?  Why not fill everyone?  Seriously considering not going back it was that bad.  Have had good food here before, but just feel sick & gross after leaving last night.

1.description: I hadn't been to a Jewel in 15 years, and I hope to never have to again.This store is just a re-incarnation of the horrible Dominics that formerly filled this space.The worst part of trying to shop at this jewel are the cashiers.  They are lazy and have bad attitudes.  Chewing gum.  Flipping hair out of their eyes every 27 seconds.  And did I mention lazy?

9.description: A considerable number of items are marked with a wrong price.  Very often they are placed at 2 locations within the store advertising different prices for exactly the same item.  This price got worse this month.  For instance, Del Monte Diced Peaches in light syrup, #24000 03409 are market at $2.79 in one location and $2.99 in another. At the register it scans for $2.99.Same thing happens with at least 3 or  items in that and other sections in the store.If you complain at customer service they will refund you 20 cents without any apology.  It looks like management knows about the situation but they're doing nothing to correct it.

12.description: I just left Jewel again in Rogers Park. Every time I go there the experience is worse the people are utterly slow ,uneducated ,and unprofessional in my opinion. I was in the express lane there were about six people behind me and the lady working at register told two people probably her friends so she could give them a discount out of the line to wait on maybe she's not from this country but that's not how it works here. I am so angry that I get more into it I will start to hurt peoples feelings so I'll stop now and I would never suggest anybody go to that you'll go to the better jewel in Evanston on Howard and McCormick. Unfortunately I have to give a star but I don't want to give one so I give the store a complete zero

21.description: I have to say that I am happy. They did a great job on the redesign and they captured several organic and specialty items I would go to Whole Foods for like 100 percent not from concentrate cranberry juice and soy and almond milk. The store is clean and organized.  The starbucks redesign is Aplus. Produce prices are ridiculous .....go to morse market or rogers park produce....but for wiiiide selection and essentials this place is excellent. My only complaint is the customer service manager who acted like a putz to his employees and a customer trying to use a check. However, other than him, the employees have been friendly and helpful. Thank you for investing in Rogers Park. Thank you for the bice store. I look forward to shopping here.

16.description: I come here to shop because it'd right across the street from where I stay when I'm in Chicago. But after my last experience with the store manager, I will no longer be coming back. He is a racist store against Asians. I rather spend more money at CVS than buy here again. The last experience left such a horrible impression that I am even considering never buying from Jewel osco again.

17.description: I have to say that I am happy. They did a great job on the redesign and they captured several organic and specialty items I would go to Whole Foods for like 100 percent not from concentrate cranberry juice and soy and almond milk. The store is clean and organized.  The starbucks redesign is Aplus. Produce prices are ridiculous .....go to morse market or rogers park produce....but for wiiiide selection and essentials this place is excellent. My only complaint is the customer service manager who acted like a putz to his employees and a customer trying to use a check. However, other than him, the employees have been friendly and helpful. Thank you for investing in Rogers Park. Thank you for the bice store. I look forward to shopping here.

10.description: I want to like this store, but I can't. I have been to this store at least 2 dozen times and it just seems to be getting worse. The produce is good however 95% of the staff at this store is just horrible. It would be one thing if they were just not friendly, but they are flat out rude and incompetent. I will not be going back.

5.description: I was very excited when this Jewel-Osco opened. That excitement turned to disappointment relatively quickly after a few trips there. I had been avoiding the store but decided to go in today. Now, I realize why I have been skipping this location in favor of just about anywhere else. Folks have already mentioned the lines so I won't belabor the point here. Also, there is no need to spend much time on the cashiers, some of whom but certainly not all, can be rude and unprofessional. As another reviewer noted, I have also been answered with silence when I've greeted some cashiers or been given a begrudgingly mumbled "hi" in acknowledgment of the audacity of friendliness. However, the one thing that got under my skin today is the apparent lack of a security presence or, at least, someone monitoring the environment right outside the entrance of the store. I have been offered the opportunity to have cable installed at my home (and the guy was standing there with an actual box or something) and cell phones. I have also been told "I hope you are taking antibiotics" when I dared to walk straight to my car after my shopping trip rather than turning and talking to the woman with a clipboard who claimed to have some affiliation with the Democratic party. These solicitations happen too often and are too tiring to make me a regular customer at this Jewel-Osco.

11.description: I've been waiting for this place to open for months! MONTHS! As far as Jewel-Oscos are concerned, this is as posh as it gets. Red carpets (literally). Meant to post this sooner. Sorry for taking so long. The wine selections, the staff, the hot food, the selections, the cleanliness - it's all VERY top-notch. :)

3.description: This is one of the worst grocery stores I've ever set foot in. I avoid it as much as possible. On a packed Sat. afternoon, I slipped and fell in a huge patch of something wet and slippery in the cereal aisle. I injured my hip, shoulder, back and knee.  I was told by the manager to go to the ER, which I did. Eight months later, I wait to see if they will reimburse my medical costs. I'm told they don't carry liability insurance. Smart for them! These are not cases that are big enough for lawyers.Cashier staff are rude, don't listen, don't answer questions, are inept and incompetent. I was trying to understand their coupon program. I had actually loaded my coupons from the website on my account. I kept asking if I should do anything. They wouldn't answer. Apparently I was supposed to enter my phone number in order to receive the discount. Guess what? No discount.

0.description: I rated them two stars because of the really nice variety of fruits and vegetables. Nice deli. Normally that would rate 4 stars alone, but not this time. Reading the other reviews you will see they have some serious customer service challenges. In short, they suck. They suck flatulent ass. They actually suck chunky farts. They suck so much so that people are pushed to Yelp to express their disapproval. All I can say is the cashiers hate America. They are the Taliban of customer service. I've learned not to challenge the depth of their capabilities.

20.description: I come here to shop because it'd right across the street from where I stay when I'm in Chicago. But after my last experience with the store manager, I will no longer be coming back. He is a racist store against Asians. I rather spend more money at CVS than buy here again. The last experience left such a horrible impression that I am even considering never buying from Jewel osco again.

19.description: The service at Jewel on Howard in Rogers Park is worse than ever. The employees only talk to each other and never say hello to any customers. They are unprofessional and rude. During peak hours there are few lanes open to check out and the ones that are open have the slowest checkers alive. The employees act as if they are owed something and don't need to be helpful to customers. Management needs to hire better, smarter, useful employees to replace the morons they currently have.

2.description: WORST Jewel I've been to. There is a constant stream of homeless in the parking lot that get really mad when you politely refuse to give them anything. My girlfriend can no longer go here, she's been followed around the store by at least four male strangers on separate occasions asking for her number and cat calling. Security is so lax we've seen people openly drinking in the store! There has been fights, he police have been called....just a horrible shopping experience. Management doesn't seem to care

18.description: Their produce is poor quality and the employees are COMPLETELY RUDE.   Also, can the cashiers stop touching my food with their two inch acrylic nails.

13.description: A disgracefully mismanaged DUMP. Regardless of whether you arrive at 10AM on a Saturday or 9PM on a Wednesday, you will find this store horribly overcrowded and understaffed. Checkout lines snake into the aisles, yet I have never seen more than 3 out of 12 lanes open. Just disgusting.

4.description: In the evening there is never a manager at the front end of the store and the person at the customers service desk is always in the cash office so it is basically unmanned and no one ever comes out when you stand there for hours. So if you stand there for hours you are S.O.L. In the evening I do not think I have EVER seen a manager in the whole place.Last night half the lights were out in the parking lot. You could barely see. Some kids assaulted me in your parking lot. It took at least 10 minutes for someone to come to the customer service counter and no one seemed to care. No managers were called. No apologies given. No one asked if I was okay. My shopping bags were torn. No one asked if they needed to be replaced. Why do I shop here? I work late and come in towards close and of coarse all the deli selections are packed up and gone. (Life sucks)Constantly there (fresh made guacamole) is either mislabeled or not labeled at all so I burn the hell out of my tongue. I work hard and all I want is some fresh guacamole people!!! Please just label it!!! If other groceries stores were closer or open later i would be there!Oh! And the Monopoly Game, or should I call it Monopoly Scam? Did anyone win that? EVER? Because I know I should have! In theory! But no! Was a total waste of my time!Really feeling like I should just save my money and just buy crappier food at Aldi and then at least my low expectations would be met! You always fail Jewel!

6.description: Good and Bad:Good = pretty nice store, offerings, layout, cleanliness -- especially compared with the Dominique's that was there previously. Bad = some of the rudest employees I've even encountered. Most (not all) are indifferent, don't say hello when greeted, have sour looks on their faces, grunt when addressed and ignore you at the deli counter. Last week, I heard one checker tell a bag person, "If a customer asks for their groceries to be bagged a certain way, you can decide whether to tolerate it or not". What? Today I said, "Hello, how are you?" to an employee in produce. I stood one foot from her. She just looked at me then went back to her duties. I said it again and she answered, "Fine" like I was pinching her at the same time. Then silence. I then said, "I'm doing well, thank you for asking" and I walked away. I don't need anyone to kiss my ass; they may be going thru something that keeps them from being pleasant. That's fair. But, if that be the case, you should be dealing with it and not at work.  I can see from other reviews - I'm not the only one. Tempted to go the extra couple of miles to Trader Joe's.

15.description: Decent salad bar. Expect to wait in line to pay ... every time.  Short employees consistently

7.description: Even by Jewel standards, this store is poorly operated and managed. It's ran more like a Moo & Oink than a grocery store trying to compete for urban middle class business. This was a HUGE downgrade from the prior occupant, Dominicks. The worst part of this store is the checkout process. When Super Valu bought Jewel they favored eliminating the self-checkout kiosks.  Jewel is incapable of operating a grocery store with enough actual checkout lines open, so this doesn't really work that well. They very often have 2 checkout lines open, and then the express line open. The regular checkout line will have a line of 15 minutes or longer, the express 10 minutes. The express line is intended to be "X" items or less, but there are always people in the line with 40 items. ALWAYS.  The cashiers are clueless to enforcing this, but worse is the general management at the store does nothing about it. I once asked for the general manager after waiting 20 minutes in the Express line, the GM didn't show up after a few minutes, I asked again and the cashier starts threatening to call security. I told her to do what she needs, and in no way was I being hostile, threatening, or even rude, but she starts yelling "94" over the intercom as if I was some great threat.  I was merely asking for a manager. Apparently there are no managers in this store. That was the last time I walked out the door and I vow to never set foot in this store again. I live two blocks away from here but will happily get in my car and drive to Evanston to shop instead of coming here. I no longer even come here as a matter of convenience leaving the el.They have a huge cooler that they've stocked only with beer, whereas Dominick's had a small selection of chilled white wine. Myself and at least 3 others I know have approached their customer service to request they put some wine in their huge liquor department refrigerator (it's a full sized walk-in 500 square foot room), staff apparently doesn't think this is an important request. One staff member whom received this request responded, "what would you like in there, red wine?" ... Yes, I'd like some chilled red wine. Sure. I don't care anymore since this location has permanently lost me as a customer.Their meat department is really lacking in quality. Prices often ring up for the wrong price here. During their store opening they had promotions that were incorrect in their register for over 2 months, despite them knowing about it the second day they opened.I've also had cashiers not be able to identify the produce/fruit I was purchasing, and have rang up things that were on sale as a different type of fruit/produce  that wasn't on sale, etc.  Speaking of produce... Byron in the produce department is a great guy.That this shopping center received TIF funds to be built is an abomination of the program itself.

8.description: some people may not be fans of this jewel at 1763 w howard st. I was so glad that jewel decided to build here. when I wrote jewel and mariano's, mariano's gave a straight out NOlI am able to walk and bring my shopping cart with me because I do not drive. I have not encountered any bad management, or rude employees. their supplies are adequate, and if you do not see it, just talk to the manager. I say if you are not happy, go to another jewel. you should praise and not complain.

14.description: Overall a standard Jewel with one huge issue--On average, you have to wait at least 15 minutes in the checkout line. Even when the store is packed, only half of the checkout lines are open. To make matters worse, there is no self-checkout. It's gotten so bad I that I go to alternate locations even though this store is located right across the street.If the store managers read this, you NEED to hire more people. A 15, 10, or even 5 minute wait to checkout is unacceptable in this day and age, especially if you only have a few items. I can't tell you how many times I walked in the store only to see the checkout lines overflowing into the store aisles!! Joke!

1.description: Seriously Rosy does excellent work. This is my second time at the salon and I couldn't be more thrilled. I was going for a dramatic change and boy did I get it! Rosy was quite the professional in both cut and color. The color didn't quite come out as I expected  (due to the shortness of the cut) but it was an easy fix. I will definitely be coming back.

9.description: I have gotten my hair cut here twice by Jesus. I have long blonde hair with a few layers. Both times it turned out great. The service is fast and you can tell everyone is happy and having fun at their job. It's a pleasant experience. No one tries to sell you products or schedule you for another haircut before you actually feel you need one. I really like the relaxed vibe of this place.

23.description: I am very picky about who I let cut my hair and since moving to Chicago, I've had to "audition" salons.  Luckily, I found a great one on my second try.  The people who work here are very friendly and they do a great job on my hair.The bright decor and the upbeat music are pure icing on the cake for an already wonderful place. Highly recommended!

12.description: I have been coming here for over a year even after I moved 45 minutes away. Best haircut I have ever had.

21.description: Just got an excellent haircut from Jesus Carlos here. I'm thrilled. Highly recommend!!

16.description: First time here and I will be returning!!! The prices are reasonable and my hair came out great!!

17.description: I've been going to this salon since my early years and I can truly say I have always been satisfied. The talent behind Jose's hands is indescribable. No matter what crazy style I come in with he always manages to make it happen. His staff share the same talent as he does. And his prices are very reasonable to both sexes.

10.description: First off, they play awesome music.  80's New Wave. New Order, Pet Shop Boys, Erasure, Depeche Mode.  Second, they are all really great at both cuts and colour.  I got an amazing cut, a really great scalp massage when I had my hair shampooed, and I am shocked it was so inexpensive.  This place is like Stein Mart, once you go, you get it.

5.description: I have been coming here for a little over a year and have been bringing my 6 year old son who is actually excited about his haircuts now. The entire staff is kind, fun, and listens very carefully to what you want done. Prices are better than reasonable and you are in and out in under 25 minutes ( for a simple men cut). great job - keep it up!!!

11.description: How could something so simple turn out so bad?!!! I went this past Friday around 3pm to just get my sides and back cut wich was a total fail by the guy who cut my hair. Only positive I can thank God I decided not to cut the top of my hair! Never again at this place

22.description: I had one of the best haircuts I've had in years today! He did exactly what I wanted, was super nice, and was inexpensive. One happy momma right here! :) I will definitely be coming back!

0.description: I finally found the perfect stylist. Jesus is amazing. He managed to give me the best haircut I've ever had, even though my directions were vague and o didn't really know what I wanted. The location is amazing, right off the red line, and when I called to make an appointment, the phone was answered on the first ring. After my wash and cut, Jesus gave me his card and said I can make appointments though text with him! As a person who hates making phone calls, I LOVE that! They also didn't try to sell me any products, which was a nice change from everywhere else. Quick, professional, and exceptional service. I'm so glad I chose Finally Here.

20.description: I have been searching for a hairdresser that not only did a great job,  but also was reasonably priced.  I have finally found them! My hair looks amazing and I felt like I was the only customer they have.  Awesome awesome awesome.  I am referring everyone I know!  Heads Up,  they only take cash!

19.description: I found this place amazing Even if you have no idea what kinda haircut or style u could come in here and they could give a perfect cut which you would love (exactly what happened to me  )Very friendly staff,knows wat they do reasonably priced I would definitely go there again The music they have also is amazing :PHighly Recommend !!!!

2.description: Got a haircut one time.

18.description: I am very picky about who I let cut my hair and since moving to Chicago, I've had to "audition" salons.  Luckily, I found a great one on my second try.  The people who work here are very friendly and they do a great job on my hair.The bright decor and the upbeat music are pure icing on the cake for an already wonderful place. Highly recommended!

13.description: Came to get a nice trim and my split ends still show. My hair looks the exact same and very damaged. Horrible service and disrespectful staff

4.description: If I can give them zero star I would.i went to Jose today to cut my bangs he cut it wrong when I told him that's not the way I wanted and it's not like the pic he started arguing with me, the other girl and guy he works with got involved.as I was sitting down 3 of them got in my face yelling I left and called the cops and the cops refunded My money.The worst experience ever.

24.description: Clean, friendly, and to the point. The stylists work silently (which I enjoy) and efficiently. Detail oriented as well. The tall guy gives a great head massage while shampooing. I'll be going back soon for sure.

6.description: I've been going to this salon for years and always receive the best sevice.  My hair always looks magnificent after there done.  I'm not sure about those other few bad reviews.  I was a client that day and time and there was no disrespect except by the unhappy customer.  I always come out feeling like a movie star

15.description: I have been searching for a hairdresser that not only did a great job,  but also was reasonably priced.  I have finally found them! My hair looks amazing and I felt like I was the only customer they have.  Awesome awesome awesome.  I am referring everyone I know!  Heads Up,  they only take cash!

7.description: Though the place was nice and the people were friendly. My hair is wrecked. The stylist and I agreed to take off 3 inches so it'll hang below my chin about an inch. Instead, my hair is cut along my chin AND not cut well. I have jagged edges (not the fashionable kind). And I have a side part that I can't move now unless I want to have mismatched hair on one side of my head. That's never happened before. Not going back.

8.description: Great inexpensive neighborhood salon. The owner is really warm and friendly. I love coming here to get a quick wash and blowdry.

3.description: Friendly and perfect customer service, great look and feel to the place, and amazing haircuts. Seriously, it's been a week and I'm still getting compliments on my cut! Definitely one of the best I've had in a long time. Just don't forget that it is cash only!PS: My usual technique with stylists is to go in with only a few broad ideas (in this case, "I like bangs" and "I like the sides and the back very short" - I have a pixie cut). I then tell the stylist to do whatever they think will look best for me. Some stylists do this ok, some stylists do it so extremely well it is beyond my greatest expectations. Jose is in the latter category.

14.description: I love this salon! As soon as you walk in you are greeted very nicely, it's always a great time not only do you go to get your hair done but you also have a really good time Jesus is hilarious!! He has me laughing every time I go & my hair always comes out fabulous!

12.description: Great store for big and tall guys with amazing prices. Plus they carry shoes sizes up to 16. Super win.

7.description: They would not take my return. They are not all about customer service here. Had to go all the way across town to Belmont where they took care of me. Belmont is where it's at if you want the best customer service!

20.description: I've been to better Marshalls.  This one is always poorly organized, and almost always picked over.  The selection is limited.However, I did have to return a coat today and had absolutely no problem doing so - in and out within five minutes!  Two stars for lack or organization, an extra star for quick returns.

19.description: I am a very frequent Marshall's shopper and this one really sucks.  They have no selection as far as mens clothes go.  I took my nephew there and he wears size 32x30 jeans, we were only able to find one pair of jeans that size.  It's kind of hard to believe that in the entire store there was only one pair of 32x30 jeans, but it is true.  There selection of tee shirts was very lacking as well.  The only thing that seemed to be in abundance for the mens department was polo shirts.  So if you are looking for polos then go for it, otherwise check out the one on Belmont or the one downtown.

1.description: In my initial review of Marshall's from 2012 I was looking for gloves, andsince I have already lost 2 pair of gloves this winter I once again neededto stop into Marshall's in hope of finding a new pair of gloves.Yes, I always seem to be losing my gloves.. and my socks come to thinkof it, because I'm just lucky like that.. anyway..So, I found this great pair of gloves that I really liked and they had thatrebel look that I love so much and I was really happy thinking I had foundmyself another pair of gloves until I lose them yet once again and I triedthem on and boy, did I love them but then I see the price tag of $29.99for these gloves and I stepped back, since when did some basic lookingrebel looking gloves come in with a price tag of $29.99?So, I put these gloves back since my place of employment doesn't payme enough to justify this purchase!Gotta honestly say, not much has changed in this store since my firstreview 2 years ago, it is still disheveled looking and the selection of justabout everything is not very good..And, I found this Black furry purse that I so would have loved, but of courseit was a designer furry purse so I had to pass that up too!The one thing I definitely noticed was that Marshall's prices on just abouteverything seem to have gone up, and honestly, their lack of selectionis a big negative for me.And, yes, I once again left empty handed, with no gloves and no furry purse which disappointed me Big Time cause darn it I would havebeen styling with my rebel looking gloves and my furry purse!Marshall's, I see no more reason to visit your Establishment..Sayanara.......

2.description: ATTENTION SOCIAL JUSTICE ALERT: I just went to Marshalls at: 7507 North Clark Street, Gateway Centre Plaza, Chicago, IL 60626 to return 3 shirts I had purchased. The outside door was open but the inside one was locked as they were not quite open yet. As I stood there waiting for the manager to open he had a meeting with his employees, which was right next to the doors so I could hear his 'speech'.This man (he was white) stood their in front of all of his minority employees talking about how he caught a young female attempting to steal something the night before. But he used very different language. He stated things like 'the hoods' and 'baby daddies' and other racist, condescending language. When they opened I was boiling but I held my cool and found my shirts to return. The young man who was assisting me needed assistance and who do you think came to help... yeah him. As he was working to exchange my shirts I couldn't take it anymore and I said, "Your name is Dale, right? I can't believe the racist, condescending shit I just heard you say to you staff of minorities. My name is Dr. Joel Filmore and I want you to remember it because I'm calling your corporate office"I would appreciate it if anyone who is inclined would call their corporate office to make a complaint on my behalf and on behalf of all oppressed individuals (I've already left my message). This is even more sick because his employees, all of whom are minorities, can't complain because they'll lose their jobs. Please call 847-557-2759.

9.description: I love this place, and I think I can actually say that every sales associate I've encountered has been really nice. I go here every time I need a dress for a night out. I look awesome and I rarely spend over $40. Boo yeah!

6.description: I think this Marshall's has definitely improved since the last time I was there.  I went in to buy two large pieces of furniture and was helped by two young women and one young guy.  They were all extremely helpful and friendly.  Whoever the current manager is, is doing a good job hiring.I love this store for their home items but I noticed a lot of clothes I liked on my most recent trip there, too.  This had not always been the case in the past.My only beef is, some of their stuff seems a little picked over.  The shelves need to be better stocked with more of that good discount stuff. But all in all I'm really glad to have this store in my poor little neighborhood with very few shopping options.  Thanks for taking a chance on Rogers Park, Marshalls!

18.description: I've been to better Marshalls.  This one is always poorly organized, and almost always picked over.  The selection is limited.However, I did have to return a coat today and had absolutely no problem doing so - in and out within five minutes!  Two stars for lack or organization, an extra star for quick returns.

10.description: Man, I've had this Marshalls obsession lately. GREAT DRESSES! I have so many cute dresses for work events / going out / weddings, you name it. You can't beat the designer names and quality for the discount price. This is one of my favorite locations!!

13.description: I have shopped at Marshalls my whole life, but I have to say that I was impressed with the good customer service and friendly staff at this location. Also, I was happy with the selection and the prices compared to the Marshalls closer to where I live. Even though this one is a little further away, I think it is worth it!

16.description: This place is good if you wear "urban" clothing. This a predominately minority neighborhood, so I find it amazing how many former suburbanites complain about it being "ghetto". Welcome to city life yuppies.

17.description: Average Marshall's, but better organized than the ones downtown since traffic is less here. This is my go-to place for items like hair styling tools (combs) and products (high-end brands like TIGI) as well as umbrellas (many for less than $9). Their men's section is, like the other Yelpers have stated, somewhat small but the women's shoe's selection is adequate. It's no DSW, but if you're looking for a pair of sandals for less than $30, they might have it here. There is not much variety in the home goods store. Due to shortness of staff, the lines can be long, particularly around their break hours. Overall, just an average Marshall's.

15.description: Enough about the stupid bathroom and dressing room rules already! Nobody here cares about that! It's a mild nuisance on an overall good shopping experience. I love a good bargain. I purchased 5 items, four from the intimates section and one from the shoe department, for under fifty dollars. The staff is also super friendly, the place is well-organized and the selection is moderate sized, with a variety of styles. This is also a good place for basics.

0.description: This Marshall's location isn't the best place for a treasure hunt, but checking out a TJ Maxx or a Marshall's location is what I do on a regular basis, since I often redeem their gift cards for points I've earned through using my credit card.  Therefore, I continue to patronize their stores.  If you're coming from the CTA Howard station, utilize that atrium directly across the station (you will see the sign for the Life Storage).  Using this pathway saves you time, and it's "Safe" (with a capital "S").  Ok, if you know what I meant, you won't elaborate on that one anymore.  A rule of thumb when visiting any discount store: go in to actually "shop" after a major holiday.  Why?  It's when they put stuff on sale and perform lots of markdowns.  I did find some possibilities, but I'm pretty picky.  However, there are deals to be had, not to mention that many winter coats and jackets are marked down $20 to $30 less.  I like TJ Maxx or Marshall's for their discounted k-cups.  Please, please check the expiration dates.  I noticed that many food items were expired since December 2014.  You might not die from eating expired food, but there's no guarantee that you will be alive and well.  Anyways, you need to be aware no matter what.  The items I purchased today: Twingings English breakfast tea k-cups ($5), Twingings Earl Grey k-cups ($4), and the Strawberry pomegranate k-cups ($4).

5.description: I usually shop at this location because it is convinietly located by my house. The selection of merchandise is limited and I believe it is due to the demographis. I prefer the Evanston location as it has a broad selection of merchandise. I will still shop at this marshalls when I dont feel like driving to Evanston.

11.description: I had always enjoyed shopping at Marshall's, particularly when I lived downtown. The shop in West Los Angeles was also a very pleasant experience.The selection is okay at this store and the staff seems nice enough, however, the fact that they don't even trust you to take the clothes into the stall to try on and return with them to either pay for them or have them put back is just so ghetto that I can't bring myself to like this store or give it a high mark.And then, God forbid you need to use the restroom. There is no key provided. And there is no code provided. They "buzz" you in to use the restroom, after you hunt someone down and ask to use it. Talk about undignified and humiliating. "Sara, can you buzz her in to use the restroom?" the young man I asked for a key YELLED across the entire store. So now the entire store gets to know that I am going to the restroom. Not that it really matters, but still. What do they really think is going on in that bathroom or what went on in it that made it necessary to instill this procedure just to let customers use the restroom? Is it really that much of a danger? Are you really that afraid that people are going to steal from you?Having these kinds of things in your store does only one thing. It makes people feel unwelcome and wonder if they should be there in the first place. If the people who frequent this store are really that unethical, then I do not care to even shop at this store. For these reasons, I will never go out of my way to shop at this store. If I do shop there, it is going to be because I was in the area for something else.In this day and age, there are plenty of places for me to spend my resources of time and money. This place will not be one of them. This place just makes me sad - and that is no way to feel when you are parting with your hard earned money.

8.description: Typical Marshalls. Stuff all over the place, but this wasn't as bad as others I've been too. Surprisingly, the line was not long here, but I'm sure it does get busy like all other Marshalls.Yes, if you need to go to the restroom, you need to be buzzed in. It is clean in there unlike other restrooms!
