3.description: This is the branch I usually purchase at. Never left the place without spending at least $70. The staff is nice, and I love the clothes. They do return items without a receipt, as I have done this before, in Marshall's, and other brand name stores.But, there seems to be an issue that includes eye rolling from the same manager at the cashier register. First time, I bought a nice top, and noticed at home that it has stains on it, so I came back to return it. The manager said I can't due to the stains. I explained that that is the reason I am returning it, she asked for id, and due to me not having a state id, because I am from out of this country there has been a problem returning it. Eventually she did.Today, the first issue was me not having a state id (I did have a different id, in English, for both occasions), and then she actually went above and beyond to not let me return it, and told me it's half a price and that's what I am going to get and if I still want to return it, I declined, saying, that she didn't want to let me return it anyway, she looked at me, and just like the first time, rolled her eyes and left. No sorry, no explaining. Great customer service from the person in charge. I got an apology from the nice cashier that was helping me. I guess if you're new to this state you can't shop and return like a person that is from this state. Your money is not as valuable, and you won't get treated the same. Too bad that that's the example she is setting for customer service in your location.

14.description: I shop at Marshall's a lot, so I get that selection issues sort of come with the territory. I've actually had pretty good luck here, especially with baby clothes. They usually have a good assortment of organic cotton baby clothes on the cheap - nice. My main issue with this place is that they treat you like a criminal the whole time you are there. You have to have an employee let you into the bathroom, you're not allowed to carry your own stuff into the fitting room, and if you (gasp) happen to forget something in the fitting room on your way out, the attendant will chase you across the store demanding your missing item. The whole experience always makes me feel icky - like they assume I'm stashing t-shirts in my purse. I get that they're trying to prevent loss in order to keep prices down, but why not treat customers like they are there to buy something instead of giving them the once over at every opportunity? There are plenty of stores that manage to make you feel welcome AND keep losses low - I'll shop there from now on.

4.description: This store is always dirty and its hard to find shoes.  They are mixed all never the place.  When I informed the manager, he said, well that's customers for you.  I have not purchased anything because I can never find anything!They only have one cashier or two if you're lucky so you always have really long lines.

12.description: The bad things out way the very few good things about this Walgreens.1. Store Management allows - very aggressive pan handlers to harass income and outgoing customers.2. Store Employees are either rude or unfriendly3. Store Pharmacy - has issues when filling correctly or completely online or automated prescriptions over the phone.4. Only good thing is its close to my home, but rather go to the Walgreens on Western just off Howard.

7.description: ***The review is solely about the pharmacy***I recently switched to this location for a prescription and needed to first call the pharmacist and then make a stop to pick up.On the phone:  The pharmacy tech was helpful, curteous and gave correct and specific information that I needed.At the store:  I drove up and noted the drive-through for the pharmacy.  The pharmacy tech was helpful, smiling, and very courteous.The only real downside was the parking lot itself which is oddly shaped and makes for weird angles and turns when driving.  The drive up is on the east side of the bldg.

3.description: Don't count on the store opening on time. If you're on your way to work and you stop here at 7, it won't be open for another 10 minutes.

1.description: This is the most disorganized pharmacy I have ever seen.  No prescription is ever ready on time and if they cannot fill something due to an issue, such as they are out of the drug, they do not contact you to let you know.  The staff are not knowledgeable about the drugs and have zero customer service skills, both the pharmacy and the store as a whole.  Having to wade through panhandlers to get in and out of the store does not help.  Recommend taking your business elsewhere.

2.description: Now I remember why I cant stand Walgreens. Horriable customer service. None talkative employees. No smiles and everyone looks like they hate their job. Over an hour wait for a prescription...while a client is waiting seems crazy.

9.description: I go here all the time because it is close to my house.  pros:  the pharmacists have been super helpful and  nice to me.  Most of the techs are also great.  The store is clean.Glad they once again have liquor, beer and winecons:Get rid of the beggars in front of the store!!  It drives me nuts to have grown men asking me for money as I try to go in and out.  Do not let your employees smoke in front of the store - really?They put the liquor behind the check out due to thieves, you can't figure out a better way to stop it?  It's really hard to see what you have and make a purchase there, people are always waiting behind you and it's tough to see what you have. - they need more workers in the pharmacy, it takes forever now to get a prescription filled

10.description: They hardly seem to be busy so fast check out for me  I dont have much to say since, well... its a Walgreens. What difference can there be. They have liquor!  yay.

13.description: This particular Walgreens had for sale, a book about the history of Rogers Park.I thought it was cool that Walgreens ordered this Rogers Park specific item.

16.description: The pharmacists are nice, but I usually try to stick with the drive-thru.  The lines are always long and confusing at checkout.  Usually at least one of the cashiers doesn't know how to use the register.  And after dark there's usually a gang of unruly teens in the parking lot.  One time someone peed on my car when I ran in to get supplies.  Not like a child, like a grown man.  ewwwww.  I'm hiking up to Main Street in Evanston for my walgreens needs.

17.description: The only reason I go to this pharmacy is because between my work and home, there is no where else to go. The pharmacy staff he is incompetent and rude. On several occasions have I called in a prescription, they tell me it will be ready by a certain time, then when I show up to pickup said prescription, they tell me they don't have it and it won't be available for days, or they can't give it to me for some reason or another. Today, I have a pressing illness that I need medication for immediately. I spoke with my DR. at 9:10 who told me he would call the pharmacy immediately with my prescription. I then called the pharmacy at 9:30 to find out how soon I could pickup my prescription. The girl I spoke with was totally rude. She told me that she didn't see that the Dr. called in, but that his message with the prescription could be on the voice mail and to call back later. I informed her that it was kind of an emergency, that I need to pickup my prescription ASAP, preferably in an hour (because that's how long they always say it will take), and asked that she have someone check the voice mails right away. She told me that she could not help me because they had other patients to attend to. Again I told her this was an emergency and I need my prescription right away. She basically didn't care, told me there was nothing she could do and told me to try back in an hour or two. If I had another pharmacy to go to, I would, but I don't, so unfortunately I am stuck dealing with the rude and unhelpful people there.

15.description: I do like this particular Walgreens.  And they have a bathroom you can use if you ask..BIG PLUS!  I get my prescriptions here as well, and the staff is a bit overworked, but very helpful and friendly.  They always answer my questions.They have a pretty good selection of merchandise and I think they are going to be adding ink refills as well..I think I saw a sign on that when I was there recently.Yep, there have been problems with panhandlers here.  I just try to ignore them.  Very convenient local place.

0.description: For pharmacy only!!!!!!!!!!Best. Pharmacy. Ever. Everyone is efficient, patient, knowledgeable,  and very nice. They also have a sense of humor. They always want you to pay as little as possible for your prescription and will help you find programs that will do that.I love everyone there. :)

5.description: Through location only, this Walgreens is awful. Literally within walking distance of a half dozen rehabs, psych wards, and nursing homes. The near dead zombie pace the aisles in a medicated haze. Its so odd and scary in here.That being said, the staff is kind of amazing. I don't know how they get most of these people to work here. Overly helpful, overly nice. I saw a woman having a seizure at the check out one day. I was frozen and horrified. It was like the staff had "customer with a seizure training" that morning. They laid her down, called 911, calmed her son, cleaned her face, all while continuing to check people out. It was outstanding. I would go to the location on western if possible. Clientele is scary. Staff is amazing.

11.description: I can tell you four things about this Walgreens:1.  Their parking lot is a blind-turn nightmare.2.  They do not sell windshield washer fluid.3.  They sell yesterday's newspapers, in case you want to be 36 hours behind the rest of the world.4.  Their electronic sign is very handy.  At night it displays the address of the nearest 24-hour pharmacy.  During the day I have seen it display weather alerts such as "Flood advisory until April 30 8 am."  Kudos for the community service.

8.description: I usually adore Walgreens. But a 2 hour wait on a prescription at 2pm seems really odd. Never again. Unfortunately, the doctor's office I go to is not responsive, so relying upon the pharmacy to call doesn't work. A store i n Lakeview, at Clark/Diversey never got a response and after a while, didn't follow up. Can't say I blame them. But this store just seems a bit off.

4.description: The review is pharmacy only....seriously, otherwise I wouldn't even walk in this place. I feel sorry for the people who work here. These are the worst customers I've ever had the displeasure of waiting in line behind. Every transaction seems to be fraught with confusion and tedious delay, rarely ever the cashier's fault. However, their pharmacy staff are AMAZING. I have never had a bad interaction with the staff here, ever. Recently, I had a problem with refilling a medication due to an error on my insurance's part. Jessica resolved the problem quickly and efficiently since I was almost out of my medication completely. She even says, "Be well" to the customers, which I think is a nice gesture. Love this pharmacy. But, I try never to go into the actual store. Unless you have a lot of time on your hands to wait in line behind 10 people, who are all borderline asylum level crazy and apparently get up to the register before deciding what they want to purchase. Never mind that they just spent 10 minutes in line waiting there turn, that time was not sufficient for their needs. You have been warned. Just try walking in to buy a soda. It will be the most tedious 15 minutes of your life!

14.description: I usually like this one; the pharmacists are generally really patient and nice.  My one complaint is with the drive through.  There are times when I have sat at the drive-through window for 15 minutes without being helped.Marc A. is right, there are lots of panhandlers here.  Not too long ago, a crack ho started pounding on my window while I was at the drive-through.

6.description: This review is for the pharmacy! The BEST pharmacy ever!!!! The pharmacists here are outstandingly good at their job! They go above and beyond their jobs. Shout out to Jessica and Buchi (the two pharmacists who helped me today). I have never seen a pharmacy so slammed and so FAST. Not only are the fast, but they remember everyone who's waiting. Wow! Very impressive. They all need big time raises! Walgreens, I hope you are listening to this review!

1.description: I got a tattoo here because 3 of my friends also had their work done and loved the results, both from Nestor and Kevin. I got mine done from Nestor. It was my first tattoo and was nervous but he was very relaxed and worked with me and didn't rush anything. As a result I got exactly what I wanted, and they don't discriminate if you get an unorthodox subject for a tattoo. If you have never gotten a tattoo I strongly recommend Nestor. And if you need more done go here. Great prices, wonderful people, and a chill atmosphere!!

9.description: I have  gotten 3 tattoos from here and am very pleased with them. Kevin the Owner and Nestor are AWESOME TATTOO ARTISTS. All the other employees at the shop are GREAT. Everyone is very friendly and always helpful with great ideas and art work. Will be back for more. This is the place to go for your tattoo or piercing.

23.description: I decided to check out Mind Crusher because of all the artwork and prices on the website and facebook page.  I had to be in Joliet for some training for work so I decided to drive up to Chicago since I was so close.  The shop was very clean and the staff was awesome.  The tattoo isn't even healed up yet and I have received several compliments on it.  I could not believe the price that he quoted me for a large tattoo on my chest in full color.  I was prepared to pay at least twice the price (I have been quoted as much as four times the amount Kevin Charged me).  I am still blown away by how inexpensive a competition grade tattoo was at this shop.  Do yourself a favor and check them out for daily specials (they were doing $30 piercings and tattoos while I was there).  I will post a pic on Yelp when it heals so you can see what I am talking about.The owner/artist Kevin will be doing tattoos at the Indianapolis Tattoo Convention at the end of September.  Great work at great prices!

12.description: My 17 year old daughter wanted to get her nose pierced and we went looking for a place that could do this. Her boyfriend (who is 18) had gotten several tattoos from Mind Crusher and really liked the work. I called and spoke to the owner who was very pleasant and after making sure that my daughter would have parental consent said her nose could be pierced for $20 and this included the stud. I have a friend that has a licensed tattoo studio in his house and he quoted me a price of $25. Mind Crusher is much closer so we went there. We were able to walk right in and after waiting only a few minutes, "Bear" was able to do the work. He was very gentle and made my daughter (who is shy) feel at ease. The owner (who was doing a full sleeve at the time) stopped what he was doing twice to speak to my daughter and I. The shop was clean, professional and the price was right! I would highly recommend Mind Crusher based off the piercing and tattoo experience that my daughter and her boyfriend have had here.

21.description: I've never been to such a clean, fun, relaxed,& professional tattoo shop until I walked into Mind Crusher. I heard about Mind Crusher from a friend of mine. She showed me her art and recommended I go there and see Kevin. I met Kevin about a month later, told him what I wanted, he drew it up and it ended up looking fantastic, better then I imagined in my head. Kevin has pure talent & strives for perfection, he's also one of the most down to earth, relaxed & fun person I've ever met. Since then I've gotten another tattoo from him that I love just as much. I would never go anywhere else! I look forward to coming in there again & recommend everybody I know to go there!

16.description: I am not going to write much because I am a little upset/ disappointed. I may not be the type of person they expect or like to tattoo on but I do expect to be welcomed and I didn't feel that at all. And to top it off the tattoo I recived was for lack of better words..well poor. It seemed the man just didn't care (which is quite sad for someone doing something so personal as a profession.) A tip for them would be to care about each client as if they were a "big ticket." They may be getting something small this time but if you can't prove yourself on a small job how can you expect for them to come back to spend any real money on a larger piece? :/ ok I guess I wrote more than needed.

17.description: A good tattoo shop is hard to find but look no further. This is the place to get your tattoo or piercing done. All the tattoo artists are friendly and very helpful. They all have awesome ideas and everyday they have great deals. I'm a client and I'm happy with all the tattoos I have gotten done here by the Owner Kevin. Check them out you won't be disappointed.

10.description: Great shop ! High quality work and the prices are amazing. I've received three tattoos by Nestor and one by Kevin Owens ) shop owner. I would recommended both artist for any tattoo idea.

5.description: I came in here on a referral from a friend. Maybe I got what I paid for, but still. I paid $30 plus a decent tip for three dots on my wrist (ellipses). I have several other tattoos so I know how to take care of a healing tattoo, but once this tattoo was done healing the edges were sloppy and the ink faded to a grey shade. I asked if I could come in for a touch up (they're supposedly free) and was told that I should go somewhere else, which I will because I am not happy with this at all. I wouldn't recommend going here.Edit: I was contacted by the owner and he was very nice and I will be getting my touch up. I will edit again once I have done so.

11.description: I recently went to get a cherry blossom tree tattoo on my upper back, it's been longer then a month and it looks freaking awesome the owner Kevin, of the tattoo shop did a awesome job on it, I am for sure going back and telling my friends where to go, this tattoo shop does a awesome job on tattoos and their prices and specials are freaking awesome, check out there Facebook page too.

22.description: Kevin is currently the best Color artist I've seen/met to date. His works is outright incredible, and he is very serious about what artists work for him. I cannot wait to spend more money at this shop. It shocks me everytime when I see his work, and then I am blown away by his extremely good pricing.

0.description: Such a great place to get exactly the piece of art you are looking for. The owner Kevin was accommodating and helped plan out the best possible tattoo. Very clean, true artists, and a great experience. You want the best, this is a great place to get it! As I read through some of the reviews, I could not believe how rediculou a some people could be. Don't believe the negative posts, as certain people you can truly never please. And hopefully you could see that from their petty reviews.

20.description: I loved this place!! Everybody there was very cool. Kevin was very nice. Oh my God , the prices are great!! They have specials everyday. And I was out of there in about an hour. I love my new tattoo!!

19.description: I decided to check out Mind Crusher because of all the artwork and prices on the website and facebook page.  I had to be in Joliet for some training for work so I decided to drive up to Chicago since I was so close.  The shop was very clean and the staff was awesome.  The tattoo isn't even healed up yet and I have received several compliments on it.  I could not believe the price that he quoted me for a large tattoo on my chest in full color.  I was prepared to pay at least twice the price (I have been quoted as much as four times the amount Kevin Charged me).  I am still blown away by how inexpensive a competition grade tattoo was at this shop.  Do yourself a favor and check them out for daily specials (they were doing $30 piercings and tattoos while I was there).  I will post a pic on Yelp when it heals so you can see what I am talking about.The owner/artist Kevin will be doing tattoos at the Indianapolis Tattoo Convention at the end of September.  Great work at great prices!

2.description: Their piercer, Jon, is absolutely amazing! I went in to get my tragus re-pierced and it went really smoothly. Have never had a better piercing experience! I'm at 12 piercings now and if I ever decide to get more I will for sure come back to Jon. Definitely go!

18.description: Got My Tattoo Done Here By The Owner Kevin. Pretty Funny Guy, Great Art Work & Reasonable Prices.

13.description: disappointed with their customer service. earlier this afternoon (about 12:30) I called inquiring about a piercing I was interested in receiving this day, they quoted a price for me and told me they would be able to service me anytime before 8, I clarified that I'd be coming into the shop later on that day. I arrived at the shop at 7 o'clock exactly and the shop had closed for the evening & had not answered their phone. I'm not sure if I will be returning for their service.

4.description: I highly recommend this place for your tattoo. The owner Kevin is accommodating and friendly.  I had my second tattoo done by BEAR and it's freaking awesome.  I brought my own design, it's a lion tribal tattoo and he did a good job. It took two hours to finish it but it's worth the wait.  They are very professional and excellent artists. They accept cards,  but I suggest to pay then in cash.  Yeah... tipping doesn't hurt just like tattooing. The place is cozy and clean.

6.description: Well... I will say the good and the bad. I went in for some cartilage piercings and had called prior to see how many could be done in one sitting because I wanted several. I was told they could do however many I wanted. Which, at the time I was like "cool". Went in, the guy was super nice, I got 3 piercings in one ear instead of the 5 I wanted because all they had left was 3 earrings. This was fine because my tolerance was pretty much up with the 3. It was a really easy/ mostly painless process and very affordable. I left happy, and I was happy... For a few days. I wasn't given any sort of cleaning solution or anything. He told me to keep it clean, and I did. I googled what to do and everything. Naturally, my ear was swelling, and I was having a hard time keeping the swelling down.    I can admit, this is where I should have taken the piercings out or went back to the shop. Of course I was desperate to keep them in and thought the swelling would go down, I've never had any problems before. But what happened next...    Basically, my ear swallowed 2 of the piercings. Quickly. It went from swollen and touchy to having the entire front part of the earrings engulfed and healed over inside my ear in less than 24 hours. Seriously.    Like I said, I messed up for not acting on it immediately. But now I had to deal with the consequences.    I had to leave town and while I was gone I went to another piercing place to ask for advice/ see if they could do anything before I made a doctors appointment. She told me that the problem was that the bar on the earrings was WAY too short ( no room for any swelling) and the gauge was also too large for that type of piercing. She also said that in the professional world it is known that only 1 cartilage piercing should be done at a time because they do swell. So, glad I *only* got 3... Anyway, she proceeded to cut the back off one with wire cutters and use a tool to cut the front of my ear to try and push the earring through. F%#* this hurt so badly, and I'm not the type to wince and freak out at all, but this had me in fetal position and I tapped out before we could get the earring out. It was bloody and awful, she told me before hand it was going to "feel horrible" but I guess I underestimated that. She changed the earring on the 3rd piercing that wasn't terribly f'ed up (only because it was lower and on softer tissue did it survive) and encouraged me to make a doctors appointment.   Went to the doctor the next day, they had to use 4 syringes to numb me and it took 20 minutes for them to cut and forcibly (seriously) PULL the earrings out. The doctor had never seen anything like it. The nurse was queasy. This actually wasn't horrible, especially in comparison to what I'd been through already, but I'm terrified to get the bill for it. All in all, the earrings were too short and it caused some serious problems. They shouldn't have used those for my ear. I accept accountability for not acting sooner though. But... Man, I will gladly pay more for a place to do it with the right earring next time.

15.description: We called just before heading an hour north.  The guy who answered told us no appointment was necessary and we could come in no problem that evening.  Once we finally get there, we walk in and , the only artist asks us "can I help you" duh. We want tattoos fool. Sorry can't tonight, would you like to make an appointment?  Excuse me we called and someone told us we didn't need an appointment, that's why we just drove an hour up here. Well we close at 11 so I can't tonight (it was 830).  Thanks mindcrusher for wasting 2+ hours of my life Bc your artists can't get their shit together.  More like funcrusher.

7.description: Wonderful place, I called ahead to get my belly button repierced and the piercer offered to stay open a littler longer to wait for me to get there. They gave me so much advice on how to take care of my piercing noticing the first time it didnt work out very well. The guy was incredibly professional and helped me pick out the piercing and the length based on previous experiences. I would definitely go there again. He also gave me an amazing price!

8.description: Love this place and all the employees are GREAT! I have gotten 3 tattoos so far and am very pleased with the art work. I've gotten my tattoos done by Kevin the Owner, he is a true Tattoo Artist. My husband has also gotten his work done by Nestor and Kevin all WONDERFUL. My total experience at the shop was AMAZING. Will be back soon for some more work and have recommended my family / friends. If you want a tattoo or piercing this is the place to go without a doubt.

3.description: Fantastic group of artists. Very happy with my new tattoo and the price I ended up paying for it.. I even had some cash left to tip my artist!  Ask for Bear !! Great shop I will be returning. Bravo!!

14.description: fyi I never worked there looser. the reason I came to you two times is because the first time you fucked it up I gave you a second chance to fix it and make it right I have witnesses that were with me that even heard you say wow I did a fucked up tatoo on you I'm sorry and then charge me again the second time to fix it. I now have the expense of getting A true professional artist to fix your shity work. just cuz u have friends of diff races don't mean u ain't a racist. wish there was a neg 0 rating!!

1.description: I frequented this bar 35 years ago when I went to school in Evanston.  Time has not been kind to the Tally Ho.It is a dive, and not in a quaint, fun way.  Drinks are small, poorly made, and surprisingly expensive.  Jukebox is $1 per song, so the bar is quiet and mostly devoid of patrons.  Someone who gives a shit should buy this place, as it is well positioned to take spill-over traffic from nearby establishments that get crowded.

2.description: cute place to play pool, have drinks & listen to old skool music! i was jammin friday nite with some coworkers. one of my coworkers has been comin here for several years now so we all decided to join her. they have a jukebox but later on in the evenin a dj started playin the old skool music with the accompanying video. drinks were good and strong so we were really feelin it later on in the evenin! :)

0.description: This place is very chill, drinks are budget friendly, and I know for a fact the standard pour they use is one full shot plus a little on top (I maaaaay have watched the bartender pour every time, just saying). The owner is super friendly, he seems to know everyone that comes through the door.  I like it there because the variety is nice and the drinks are cheaper than the super trendy neighborhoods. If there is a guy behind the bar, that's the owner!  Ask him for an oatmeal cookie shot!  Tally Ho is NOT a fussy or hipstery place (seriously, regular cocktails and beers) but I saw another girl order one from him and it looked so good I had to try it.  WORTH IT. I've heard there's a dj on the weekends, putting it on my to-check-out list.

29.description: Stopped in for some patties pre-putt-putt golf.  Having no place to sit, we ate them in the car, but luckily, they turned out to be pretty much the ideal eating-in-the-car food.The three of us chose the curry chicken, jerk chicken, beef, and cabbage patties and just passed them around the car like joints.  The curry chicken won for me and the jerk chicken won for my dad, but they  were all good.  I thought the delicious fillings deserved better than the obviously reheated crust, however.If I went again, I would skip the plantain pastries, which were an odd pinkish color for some reason and way too bready and mushy for me.

42.description: Get the hot beef patties and ginger beer. YUMMY!!Small place, pick it up, take it out, done.

23.description: I'd been aching for years for what we called in "West Indian Meat Patties" in New York. I'd have family bring in boxes full of them when they came to Ohio...I couldn't get enough!It came to my utter delight and momentary funky dancing to discover that this godsend of a place actually made them..."Jamaican Meat Patties". I hoped they were the same thing and the smell confirmed it. Heaven has been confirmed and it's in Rogers Park :)

47.description: i've been on the hunt for good jamaican food since island delights vacated hyde park, blue mountain moved to the burbs, and the latest, biggest hit of maxine's closing.  a jamaican friend of mine recommended this place to satisfy my jerk chicken cravings. the jerk chicken entree (and three patties) was enough to feed me and my two friends with some leftovers.  the chicken was oh so tender and juicy.  the jerk sauce wasn't as spicy as i'm used to, but it was good.  the curry chicken patty rocked.  the beef patty and veggie patty were good.  i miss the spicy spinach patty from island delights, but these were damn good.we had a plantain tart and sweet potato pudding to polish off the meal.  the plantain tart was like some wonderful pop-tart-esque treat.  it didn't exactly taste like plantain, maybe apple sauce or rhubarb or something, but it doesn't really matter--it tasted good.  the sweet potato pudding was dense and cinnamon-y.  good, cheap food (large jerk chicken entree with peas and rice, plantains and cabbage salad, three patties, and two desserts for $19.60).  curry chicken patty is the highlight here--two bucks.

8.description: Great place for some Jamaican patties they have a nice variety on deck.  They also have this cheese I can't find anywhere else. My wife and I always get two  pieces of the cheese when we go. They aslo have some small loafs of bread we get to go with the cheese.

31.description: I grew up in Brooklyn eating Beef Paties mon....I have been to Jamaica and eaten the paties.Caribbean American Bakery does not dissapoint. These are the real deal. They also offer peas and rice. They have other types of patties as well (chicken curry, jerk, vegi)

34.description: MEAT PIES!! Like a hot pocket filled with yummy goodness. Jerk chicken, veggie which they say is spicy, but.. really isn't. Beef or curry! (Cost $2.10 - $2.40) Curry pie is bangin', if you've had a curry flavored dish at an Asian restaurant or curry fries, you'll know this flavor. It's so tasty, two of'em is perfect. Their meat pies are kept in a warmer oven so they are always piping hot and ready to eat. Best to call ahead and see what they have available. I think Veggie is the only one that needs to be requested since they don't often have it readily available. They also offer a hodgepodge of breads with a specific element infused, i.e. one time I tried ginger bread. The ginger smells so potent it permeated the plastic bag. The options of the bakery are very few. Many are created well. I've yet to score a slice of Jamaican rum cake; which can be purchased whole or by slices. Since Easter they haven't gotten a chance to bake any, so I'm looking forward to the next batch. Their fudge brownies are perfect, just have that right firmness. Alas their packing options of the brownies are brutal, never leave them in the wax paper they are bagged in, otherwise it all gets infused with one another. A grave mistake I've made, best when eaten right away. Since Bridgette R. introduced me to this bakery I have been here more times than I'd like to share. Damn you curry pies, a new vice and appropriately priced.

16.description: On Fridays and Saturdays they have jerk chicken dinners that are worth the trip across town.

13.description: This place is great for their baked goods. The customer service is dry depending on who is working the counter, but honestly its fine with me because they arent rude, and their products are sooooooooooo yummy. wish i lived closer.

11.description: I got there right before closing but was still able to snag a couple of items. I decided on beef patties and jerk chicken patties washed down with a Jamaican ginger beer. The patties were tasty enough.  They were a nice size , under three bucks and seasoned well.The beef had a slight aftertaste. The ginger beer was okay, too. I'd probably return to try other items.

39.description: What a strange place. The kitchen is huge and there is no seating, but they make a great "patty."We tried the Beef, Jerk Chicken, Curry Chicken, and Vegetable patties. Each were very good with their own personality. The dough was great too!Best thing about going here was how friendly the woman behind the counter was.

37.description: This is a no frills kinda place.Many a time when I get a pattie and ting craving (and I don't want to spend an evening preparing the dough), the fi and I will pack up the car and the dog, grab a dozen patties and head to the beach.Don't be afraid to try all varities of the patties, you won't be disappointed.  My favorites are the curry and jerk chicken-but wait I love the beef too.  Ohh forget it I love them all :)

0.description: Went to you guys 2 weeks ago. Also checked out Sunrise Caribbean restaurant up the road. So here at the bakery I placed my order en route. I was given a call back to confirm that my 24 patties would be ready around a certain time. These guys are excellent. Bought 12 beef patties and 12 Vegetarian - all excellent.Crackers, white bread and some bulla. I had been here once before and these guys do a great job.

38.description: What is the deal with this place? I went to the one near Evanston and found well, nothing but these patties. No jerk chicken entrees or anything else listed in the reviews here. Seriously, their menu contained none of this. As for these patties, what is the deal with serving patties that taste like they've been defrosted and then reheated? I was expecting the pastry shell to be fresh and lively(I mean, it is a freaking bakery) and yet it just was sad and droopy. The jerk chicken inside was bland and even sadder than Droopy the Dog. I guess these are good and cheap enough to grab a few for a road trip, but it really isn't worth the trip otherwise.

51.description: Oh man, the meat patties are so good!  A meat pattie is like a jamaican empenada.  No seating, but damn good food.  Stop in, get a jerk chicken pattie, some plantain chips, and a plantain torte, all for less than $5, and you will be the happiest person in the whole history of the the world ever.

27.description: If you are serious about authentic ethnic food, hold on to your hat.Those of us who care deeply about jerk chicken are willing to search far and wide for the "best" in the city.  That's a good thing, because this place is way, way off the beaten path.  It's nowhere near your neighborhood, no matter where you live.  Don't fret: the drive is worth it.The inside is stark. No chairs, no tables, just a counter full of Jamaican pastries, a cooler full of exotic juices and sodas, and a giant, tiered patty-heater.  Oh, yeah.Here's what they will do:  Supply you with the best jerk chicken and beef patties in the city (I love the curry chicken patties too!) without breaking your bank (except for maybe the fuel it takes to get out there.)  They will be friendly, as will be the other patrons who stroll in for patties and pops for lunch.Here's what they will not do:  Make it snappy.  The patties are quick, of course, but it can take them a while to get the chicken ready.  I recalled this about my previous visit, so I called ahead to place my order (which was going to be large.)  The gentleman on the phone was very nice, but would not take my order in advance.  When I hinted I was curious to know why, he said, "we don't usually do that."  That was kind of lame.Who cares about that, though?  When you're in the mood, you're in the MOOD, and the food will not disappoint you.Another pointer: grab these to bring to a party when you want to knock everyone's socks off.  The one thing you CAN call ahead for are the mini-versions of the patties, which I have yet to try.In the interest of full disclosure, I must mention that I have had one experience involving less-than-impeccably-succulent chicken.  The (perfect) sauce remained the same, but the meat itself was a little dry.  It could happen to anyone.Headed far north? Headed southward from the far north?  Make the stop.  You won't regret it. Keep your GPS handy.I'm  compelled by the right kind of jerk.  Consider me compelled.

32.description: Beef patties. Fresh beef patties. And I'm not talking about burger patties. For those who venture, you will be rewarded. They have some other flavors of patties but the beef one is my fave. Try some of the bakery fare, it won't be your usual, but your tummy will thank ya! The jerk chicken is just okay, but really....just try a beef patty.

48.description: In my quest to find every meat product encased by a pastry in Chicago.. I got the Chicken Patty and the Beef Batty (I absolutely love these). Less than $2 a piece. I added it with the Plantain Tart. Wow. I don't know where the plantain is, but the filling was yum.I love the Far North/ Northwest for eating. What you get with living in one of the top cities in the world.

44.description: Dang. I went here when I first moved to RoPa and my girlfriend Andie turned me on to this place. She turned me on to the beef paties and OMG they were heaven! The other day I thought I would go back since it's been a while and turn my hubby on to them. Damn. Not good. Not good at all. Even my friend was with me who turned me on to them in the first place. Even she was disapointed.Maybe because it was the end of the day..I don't know. But I was seriously bummed. My husband thought they were pretty good (he will eat anything) but Andie and myself were shaking our heads.I will give em another whirl I'm sure. I still hear the jerk chicken is the bomb!

24.description: The meat pies are yum, but you've got to go early to get the best  flavors. The packaged treats are fine, but I'd much rather get the freshly baked ones.  Unfortunately any time I've gotten on of those, it's been very dry. I'll still grab a quick bite if I'm in the area, but I'm not going out of my way for it anymore.  Although if you're in Rogers Park, give it a try at least once.

7.description: My Jamaican sweet had a big milestone birthday and I needed a big authentic Jamaican food order. I wanted the the best and Caribbean Bakery delivered. The jerk pork was outstanding. Working with Michael was a pleasure. Everyone at the party gave rave compliments about the deliciousness.

49.description: 5 Stars for Jamaican Beef Patties.Yum.  Yum.  Yum.Chicken not as good.  Jamaican Beef Patty + Cheese is not bad ... not that much different from Without Cheese Jamaican Beef Patty.Not as greasy as the ones in NYC, but I sort of like that better.Party in my mouth!

40.description: Stopped by this place on a Dinner Crawl tonight and was very impressed.  Great taste, friendly staff.  Can't wait to go back!  Ignore the photo on here, though - they've moved west on Howard a bit since then!

30.description: I make my trek to the CAB once every few months and load up on Jamaican Patties.  If you've ever been to Toronto or NYC for an extended period of time, these delectable treats are impossible to avoid.  They are best eaten fresh, although the frozen ones are still excellent, its hard for me to recreate that combo of flaky, crispy and chewy in my own oven.  I usually go with half beef patties, half curry chicken.  Can't go wrong with either, although I give the beef version the slight edge.Just take off one star (only a half if i could) because its such a pain to get up there.

46.description: A secret some of the neighbors don't even know, Caribbean American  Bakery is unassuming and no-frills but has the most delicious baked items.  I highly recommend all the patties (they have veggie, too), and the cookies are delicious.  A Rogers Park must and a full belly for under $5.  Strictly carry-outs.

1.description: Why do you have such piss-poor service? There are so many sad part of this story. The first sad part is that I really like the food, their beef patties are the best on the northside; second sad part is that I have been going there for over 10 years; third sad part is that if they had better service I would recommend them to everyone. I have brought this to the owner's attention at least 4 times in the past 10 years and hire after hire they are rude. Today I walked in to get a patty and the young lady behind the counter was seated with her headphones in her ear, I had to be the first one the say "hello," then she said hello and stared at me like I did something to her. I then said, "o-k" and she said she was "waiting for me to say hello back to her." See because she had the headphones in her ears she didn't hear me say hello. I was now pissed off, so I ordered and asked for the owner. Now, complaint #5 in 10 years! I asked him to please post sign on all the items so I can lessen my interaction with his rude employees. He confirmed that he has heard this complaint numerous times, then instead of saying he will address the problem he wanted to talk about the signs I requested!I'm done!

9.description: A great neighborhood place, especially good for economical catering. The meat patties are the best of any place I know. Jerk chicken and rice&peas can't be beat. Lots of sweets available. I'm partial to the plantain tarts and the pineapple upside down cake.

26.description: Sometimes I get cravings for their meat patties.  They have some sort of tutti fruiti cake that is also very good.

25.description: I've been to this place a few time only out of sheer lack of anything else in the nearby area.  On all occasions I was less than impressed. The chicken leaves a lot to be desired, in that it only taste like plain grilled chicken with a slightly ginger flavored gravy over it, nothing like the savory flavors of true jerk chicken with a spicy Scotch Bonnet Pepper based jerk sauce.  And on several occasions they were either completely out of the jamaican curry chicken patties or jerk chicken or the  jerk chicken wasn't ready and it wasn't as if they had a line of people out of the door. The place is mostly empty when i go there, so there shouldn't be a reason for the food to not be ready or out. The lady behind the counter is unprofessional and rude, actually as if it's incredulous that you'd actually want her to do what she was paid to do which is take an order, ring it up, ensure that it is delivered in a timely manner and make sure it is delivered right. She did none of that. I went in one day and had to actually yell "Yoohoo"into the back because no one was up front manning the cash register. She finally sauntered out and took my order only to tell me that the jerk chicken wouldn't be ready for another 30 minutes...great(but I was pregnant and craving jerk chicken so I agreed to drive around and wait for it to be done.) I ordered 2 curry chicken patties also. So after 30 minutes of taking a scenic tour of Evanston and Winnetka I came back to pick up my order and she practically ignored me because two (I guess they were cute to her) guys walked in after me, and she was clamoring over the counter to take their order, and they were still in the process of deciding what they wanted. Finally she handed over my bag of food. But something told me to check it as I walked out the door, and sure enough I was missing the curry chicken patties, so I went in and let her know that they weren't in there. She actually attempted to argue with me and tell me that she put them in there.  Now I know I was a prego-fat-cow but there is no way I could eat two patties while walking out the door. So finallly she remembered that she didn't and handed over my patties, which is good for her because an angry, hungry preggo woman is not one to be reckoned with. That was the last straw. I usually go to this place only because it was the one that I knew of that was close to me, but from now on I'll just go back to traveling all the way to the south side to get Tropic Island Caribbean because the service and the food is far superior than this crappola.

12.description: Okay service but that's ok the food makes up for it. The Jerk chicken is one of the best in town, the beef patties are yum and so are the pastries. My favorite patties is the curry chicken :-)

21.description: The best jamaican beef patty ... OMG, empanada got nothing on this delicious addicting food!!! YUMMO - YumMY!!!

17.description: Best jerk chicken outside of Jamaica.Also give there meat pies a try.It's nice to have a bakery on the north side with this traditional stye.As a side note the do have a catering menu.

10.description: Absolutely one of the best jerk chicken dinners I've ever tasted. I would like to see more customer service attitude from the cashier but clearly she hates working there. It may be a cultural thing but I do like a smile and thank you when I'm patronizing your business. That is not to say anything negative about the food I would suggest this place to everyone. Reviews are supposed to be honest, not fake so sorry if that comment seems negative, to you.

5.description: When they have fresh things they are good but most of the time when I go there I want vegetable patties and they don't have them. They either never have Coco bread or the Coco bread that they have is old and hard. It is hard to find fresh Coco bread whenever I go. When it is fresh though it is very good.

3.description: I heard their beef patties were awesome, but I also heard that their staff is a little lackluster in the polite department. I went in and waited behind two ladies for quite some time since they were both from Jamaica and were having a private conversation with the sales girl. When it was my turn, I politely requested two beef patties. The woman next to me asked if they had the veggie ones, and the sales girl rolled her eyes at her! She never spoke to me, never looked me in the eye, and she certainly was in no hurry to help anyone in line. She just shoved them in a bag, put it on the counter, and started to walk off. When i asked if i could also have a cinnamon bun, the woman rolled her eyes at me too! Service score here is ZERO. Now, the beef patties were good, but Rogers Park Market (on the corner of Clark and Rogers) has bigger, better ones that are cheaper too. And, they don't roll their eyes at polite customers. On the up upside, their cinnamon buns here are DELICIOUS. I would love one, but I wouldn't bother going in here again. Perhaps if you look like you could be from the Caribbean, you get better service.

35.description: Got a dozen Beef Patties and couple of bottles of Ting.Patties are outstanding and will definitely make return trips for more.Freezing the rest for later.They have a new look storefront - see the photos. It's just east of the Howard el redline exit.

19.description: i havent been here in a few years so i had 2 make a trip cuz i love the beef patties! i tried a jerk chicken and a curry chicken patty but the beef ones are still my fave. the curry chicken was good & u can definitely taste the curry, but the jer chicken wasn't as spicy as i wouldve liked. but its ok cuz those beef patties made up 4 any disappointment i had! wooo hooo!

28.description: The place  is pretty bare bones, a fridge, some display cases and a pickup window. I decided on the bulla and a raisin bun. Jamaicans love ginger* and it is apparent in their baking. I was pleasantly surprised that the ginger worked well in both items (neither was overly sweet). The raisin bun tasted more like raisin bread cake with ginger (if that even makes sense). One thing to keep in mind, the items are very dense so don't grab a snack before dinner.Definitely worth checking out if you're in the hood with a semi-sweet tooth.My friend got a beef patty and a bottle of kola champagne and we went on our merry little way. My friend ate the beef patty in like 30 seconds so i'm going to guess it was good too. ps. and everything is really cheap!* of course not ALL of them

45.description: Jamaican baked goods and entrees on Howard street.Scratched my patty itch here last week. Got a dozen beef, curry chicken and jerk chicken patties for around $18. Three of us snarfed 5ive in the car before we drove away. Then we wallowed in happiness til they were gone.Will be back soon for the late-week entrees.

33.description: Where in the world did this place come from?! You sneaky little store you.It's rarely open when I'm in the area, but if it is, I'll stop in even if I'm not hungry. The jerk chicken is not the best in Chicago by far, but it's still pretty tasty, and the price is right. The name says it all thought. This is a bakery. The pastries are the bomb.  And i highly recommend the upside down cake, but make sure it looks fresh. Pick the lightly colored pineapples. With all that aside, the patties are where it's at. Beef patties are good, always hot and fresh(i hate when the meat is all dried up inside from other places). The jerk chicken patty lacks a bit of flavor but is still pretty good, especially if it's included with a beef patty. I'm not a big curry guy, but I do enjoy the curry chicken patty too. Really can't go wrong. Have a ting to wash it down.

43.description: The patties are worth the stop. I stock up on them whenever I pass by.  I have to try the plantain desserts.  So far, so good with consistency.  This is convenience food to nosh on and there are a number of patty varieties to choose from. As the Howard Street area improves, this place will grow with it.

2.description: My go to place for Jamaican beef patties. Caribbean folks swear by these, and theirs are delicious! There aren't a lot of Jamaican restaurants in the area, definitely not with good jerk chicken, so I'm happy that this place has it...and it's good. Comes with rice 'n peas, and plantain and sometimes cabbage. The gravy is a bit different than the authentic jerk sauce that I'm used to, yet it has a nice flavor and level of heat. They have a variety of freshly baked goods as well, whether you're seeking bread or something sweet. It's all carryout, no place to dine in, but very convenient. And if you call ahead, your order can be ready for pickup. I love that they're nearby and have been here for as long as I can remember. If I remembered to check in when I go, I would have millions!

18.description: The ONLY place for traditional Jamaican meat patties on the north side! Been coming here for over 25 years. Take them to go (it's not a place to sit and eat) and while you're at it, pick up some of their pastries. My favorite are the brownies and upside down pineapple cake. Yummy!

41.description: Admittedly, I have a certain bias towards this place, having spent a many days waiting with my dad to get those delicious spicy beef patties while being rewarded with an imported ginger beer or ting (grapefruit) soda.This set aside, the Caribbean American Bakery has the best patties in the city. It provides me with a very distinct mix of jamaican flavors while giving me convineience and affordability. They have jerk chicken, curry chicken, and curry beef, for the basics. Their hard dough bread is amazing, and will go well with butter on the top, fried plantains as well as a couple slices of lightly salted avacado on the side. It tastes delicious on its own as well!This place is definitely worth your attention if youre in the area, and isn't a large investment in comparison to some of the surrounding and less appetizing food options. Check it out!

52.description: This place has the best meat pies (fruit pies also available) that I have ever tasted.  Service and attitude of employees can range from OK to downright rude, but I like the aforementioned product, so I continue to return.Stay on your guard at all times around here, and don't even think of taking your goodies to the park across the street to eat unless you like tempting fate.  If you want to hang in the area, best to go to the beaches east of Sheridan Road on Eastlake Terrace.

50.description: JAMAICAN MEAT PATTIES! Amazing stuff. A couple of meat patties plus a ginger beer and I'm in heaven. They also have vegetarian patties but those aren't always available. And they will do cocktail sized ones with advanced notice.The baked goods are similar to what you would find in most bakeries with a few added bonuses such as plantain tarts. They also have carryouts: jerked meats, curried goat and oxtails.Convenient parking can sometimes be a challenge. And this stretch of Howard is rather dubious. But I've been stopping at this bakery for about a dozen years for my meat patty fix and never had a problem. Service was surly for a time but that seems to have been remedied.

4.description: First time at this bakery. Curry chicken patties are good. I  bought a loaf of the wheat hardo bread and it was very crunchy when I toasted it. I would come back to this place if Iam in the area to try some other things in the bakery.

6.description: Amazing brownies and ginger cake.One complaint: make more brownies so you have enough for folks popping in after 5P

22.description: This place is okay.  Ventured out to Roger's Park because of the rave reviews about the jerk chicken and patties.  My bf and I order some patties and a 1/2 of jerk chicken.  The jerk chicken was yucky, nowhere close to the authentic, spicy, scotch-bonnet jerk chicken I have come to love from Jamaica.  If you are a true lover of jerk chicken, been to Jamaica and appreciate the authentic flavors and spice of Jamaica, do yourself a favor and skip on their jerk.  They put an absurd gravy on it that nowhere resembles anything jerk-like.The patties were decent, enjoyed them. I actually wonder if they even make the patties there.  There was a girl in front of me in line arguing with the woman behind the counter because she wanted to buy a dozen patties.  The woman rudely said that wasn't possible without calling ahead.  Someone from the back came out and offered to sell her a box of frozen patties.  I also think they aren't made there fresh because the jerk patty tasted nothing like their jerk chicken.  The jerk in the patty actually had flavor and spice, unlike the bland chicken we ordered on the side.  The sauce was totally different in the patty than the sauce with the 1/2 chicken.  I could be wrong, just going on what I observed.  Nonetheless, they were solid patties, frozen or made fresh.  I have had better but then again, I have been to Jamaica and have high standards.  The people in this joint were so unfriendly, nothing like the many Jamaicans I have met over the years.  The employees need some of those new Bob Marley Mellow Mood drinks because they were anything but mellow and pleasant.    Overall, the patties were good... Were they worth heading up to sketchville where I was suspiciously eyed walking down the street and treated rudely in the bakery?  Definitely not.

15.description: This place is okay.  Ventured out to Roger's Park because of the rave reviews about the jerk chicken and patties.  My bf and I order some patties and a 1/2 of jerk chicken.  The jerk chicken was yucky, nowhere close to the authentic, spicy, scotch-bonnet jerk chicken I have come to love from Jamaica.  If you are a true lover of jerk chicken, been to Jamaica and appreciate the authentic flavors and spice of Jamaica, do yourself a favor and skip on their jerk.  They put an absurd gravy on it that nowhere resembles anything jerk-like.The patties were decent, enjoyed them. I actually wonder if they even make the patties there.  There was a girl in front of me in line arguing with the woman behind the counter because she wanted to buy a dozen patties.  The woman rudely said that wasn't possible without calling ahead.  Someone from the back came out and offered to sell her a box of frozen patties.  I also think they aren't made there fresh because the jerk patty tasted nothing like their jerk chicken.  The jerk in the patty actually had flavor and spice, unlike the bland chicken we ordered on the side.  The sauce was totally different in the patty than the sauce with the 1/2 chicken.  I could be wrong, just going on what I observed.  Nonetheless, they were solid patties, frozen or made fresh.  I have had better but then again, I have been to Jamaica and have high standards.  The people in this joint were so unfriendly, nothing like the many Jamaicans I have met over the years.  The employees need some of those new Bob Marley Mellow Mood drinks because they were anything but mellow and pleasant.    Overall, the patties were good... Were they worth heading up to sketchville where I was suspiciously eyed walking down the street and treated rudely in the bakery?  Definitely not.

20.description: I love beef Patties so I decided to try this place out and let me tell you I was disappointed. Beef Patties came out hot but the filling was mushy and fatty tasting. Could use some more spice .....more heat. I'm still trying to remember where I first tried them in high school.....they were great! I thought this was the place but I guess not. Will come back to try out their other foods though. It smelled good when I first walked

36.description: I have come to accept the fact that I am addicted to freshly made "Hot Pocket" kinds of food.  Easy to eat, easy on the pocketbook, (does anyone still carry a pocketbook?) and easy to find if you live in Rogers Park.I go here once a week. I get 1 of each pocket, I mean patty: beef, jerk chicken, curry chicken, veggie, and plantain (save for last.)  It is so cheap and delicious.I confess I do not buy my drinks here, I usually get a diet coke from McD's. Now this is a meal.Other Rogers Park "hot pocket" places are the Argo Bakery on Devon (cheese and red bean, separate, not together) the Pupuseria down the street on Clark.Try the Caribbean American Bakery.  The staff is so friendly.  They do have other things there, but I have no idea what they are.  I just make a bee line for the patty line.

14.description: I love this place. 1)It's family owned, they've been here longer than most of the other businesses and the residents. When you first come in, there's always one of the twins working. And the chefs are in the back. 2) for your order,If you want something quick, you get it.and if you want an entire order, you can call ahead. Reasonable prices, authentic ethnic food for us.3) the place is pristine clean. And lastly and thankfully, there's no hipsters,yuppies or students running the place.

3.description: I had gone there for a couple of times I needed quick cash. Great staff, always friendly and professional. They took good care of my stuff and I got it with no problems or extra charges. I would definitely will go there when in need. Fair prices for your collateral and they have some nice things you can buy for a good price.

1.description: I don't think I can give this place a star. When you walk in you are treated like a criminal. They don't accept an acceptable price for your item. I went to pawn an iPad three weeks ago and I will never go back. I hope people read this and decide to go somewhere else.

2.description: Service here wasn't great at all, for starters they didn't even greet me when I came in. They just kept on with there conversation as if i wasn't there. When I wanted to pawn my ring she told me she was gonna scratch my ring I just thought that was crazy. So I got my ring and got the hell out of there and I won't go back

0.description: I came in to sell my Mac Desktop computer. Esmeralda and Nick evaluated it and we negotiated an even exchange. I got a Mac book for an even trade and I am very satisfied with that. They were patient,  professional, and fare. So I highly recommend this place. :-)

4.description: lots of good things for sale and at the right prices . will make you a very fair deal if you need cash fast on some items not sure witch ones at the time .

3.description: I loved this store. The ladies were hilarious, and quite helpful. They have a lot of cool stuff. I'll definitely be back.

1.description: Traditional, old-school thrift store with low prices and a nice selection of stuff. Not huge, but great prices. (Has anyone else noticed that a lot of stuff at thrift stores is getting pricey?) I had especially good luck the other day in a huge section sale section they had of 1/2 off cookware/kitchen items. Got a near-new cupcake carrier for $15, and various glass pyrex stuff with covers for $1.50 and $2.50 respectively.

2.description: Passing by I saw really cute shoes in the window. Black Guess high heels. I wanted them. But the store was closed. And closed again because it was Sunday and Monday. So today is Tuesday and the store is open from 10 am to 7pm. I in front of the store by  9:59am to get my heels.  I scored PERFECT Guess shoes for $7. I felt so guilty that I looked around  to buy something else and found a perfect doggy treat jar and so I go to buy it and it is $1.50. Scored again!!!!I saw lots of jewelry, shoes, purses, board games, wine glass, plates that I thought were really nice.Can't wait to go back.

5.description: This is a nice little thrift store.  It's clean and well-organized which is rather a rarity among Chicago thrift stores and the ladies who work there are nice too.  Most of the clothes skewed a little matronly for me but they had a nice selection of housewares, jewelry and accessories.  Their book section was definitely better than average as well.  There are some real gems here and not a lot of junk.  The prices are so reasonable it's hard to go far wrong.  I'm definitely making this a regular stop on my neighborhood treasure hunts.

6.description: I shop here all the time.  Check the website for hours, which are limited.  Small thrift store, with some hidden gems.  I found a very nice women's business suit, that cost $4.  Most of my purchases are in the $1 - $2 range.  I get frequent compliments on my what I'm wearing, and some of my best finds are from this shop.  An added plus is the dressing room!

7.description: This place isn't at all hip, but the prices are really low. The ladies who work there are very nice and always say to "Have a blessed day!" when you leave. They often have sales. I don't think many people even know it exists, which is good for the rest of us! Only takes cash and closed Sun., Mon. and Wed.

0.description: I've found quite a few treasures here, including tons of quilt binding for $.50, some adorable kids clothes, and a gorgeous vintage dress for $1. Everything is very reasonably priced, and they have great sales on top of that. The ladies here are friendly, although they make me feel a bit neurotic about watching my kids at all times. They don't like your strollers and they don't want your kids touching their toy display. If you have a small child who breaks this rule (which mine did immediately, because that display is quite enticing), you will get some stern words.

4.description: To the person earlier who was surprised that this place "isn't at all hip" and that the women say "Have a blessed day"- this place is a small, part-time church thrift store. I don't think "hip" is what they're going for! This place is insanely cheap and so, so, SO nice. Some weeks they just have half-off sales because they love their customers. I found a $300 vintage leather jacket here one time for $7. The ladies who run the place are always nice and I recommend donating your extra change to the church. I'm not even religious, but if any community organization deserves it, it's this wonderful store.

3.description: Sorry Janna - I've been meaning to write this!  I saw Janna 9 months ago as my hips, back, glutes were on fire.  Janna performed many myotherapeutic techniques and even gave me suggestions as I told her about my long commute (sitting on lacrosse balls / stretching piroformis / etc).  she opened my hips up which I realized was what I really needed.  My hamstrings and glutes were soooo tight, but it was my hips that needed work, then those areas loosened up.  Thank you Janna - I'll be back as I've begun to run and I know I'll need massage!

1.description: My 70+ mom was visiting and found Janna on yelp. All I can say is my mom loved her! I'm going to get an apt for me!

0.description: I called To the Point Myotherapy looking for a Thai massage and I got way more than I bargained for! After leaving a message, Janna called me back pretty shortly asking me more about what I was looking for and after finding out that she gives her first time clients a $10 discount I made my first appointment.She works out of a small, unpretentious storefront in East Rogers Park called the Lumbar Lounge (gotta love that!) that is clean and mellow. The massage was just what I was looking for and more. I struggle with some chronic shoulder/arm pain which severely limits my range of motion and while Janna worked on me she also addressed this problem with her trigger point magic. I left with the intention of returning the following week but because of a conflict had to wait two which was when I discovered the Yelp Deal $50 for $80 massage!I had massage number two and this time she worked exclusively on my shoulder using myotherapy or trigger point massage and a cold laser technique. Upon her recommended I employ a tennis ball to facilitate more healing between treatments. So... now,  after treatment number three we see marked improvement in my range of movement and pain relief! Yay!!!My advice... if you have any aches, pains, issues with range of motion... go see Janna. You will not be sorry.

2.description: If I took better care of myself I wouldn't find myself in pain. A massage with Janna was just the fix, I couldn't recommend her enough.

5.description: I can be very hard on my body, and Janna is my favorite person to take care of aches and pains, and help the healing process. She always asks questions before we get started, and checks in a couple of times during our session to make sure everything is going well from my perspective. She really knows her trigger points! I honestly feel like a new woman when I leave--rejuvenated and comfortable--and I think I even walk a little taller. Highly recommended for all folks. If you are an athlete or you exert yourself physically on a regular basis, I recommend a visit to Janna even more!

6.description: I've seen Janna for two different running-related muscle injuries (calf strain and TFL strain) and she was able to help both strains heal up MUCH faster than they would have without her expertise!  She also informed me about scar tissue and gave  me instructions for self-massage to help the healing process along between visits to her office.  It was clear that she truly cared about my recovery.  The atmosphere of her office was also very calming, which put me at ease during the massages - a nice touch!  I am so glad I was referred to her and so grateful for her help!

7.description: Thai massage?  Table massage?  I finally settled on the Table since it was my first massage.  Everything, foremost Janna's gentle manner and firm touch, made my experience - what's another word for heavenly? - blissful.  I even got my chakras kneaded!  In my perfect world, I'd go to Janna after every yoga class.  As it is, I'll be returning soon.  Maybe this time I won't float out the door.

8.description: Janna is a superb and highly effective therapist.  She has kept me running and shortened periods of debilitating pain with her expert  use of multiple massage and stretching techniques.  She is completely focused on finding the technique that will work best for each client.Her knowledge of the body, the way it works and how it responds to trigger point therapy, isometrics and assisted stretching is encyclopedic.  She spends a tremendous amount of time staying current on techniques and her knowledge of applications that she can deploy for her clients.I have used many massage therapists over the last 30 years.  Janna is among the very best therapists I have worked with throughout the world.

9.description: Janna is a well-trained and gifted therapist. She is my "go to" therapist whenever I am in Chicago.  Thanks Janna!

10.description: Best massage I've ever had.  Janna has mastered getting the kinks out without causing soreness the next day.  In fact, my body feels more nimble, relaxed, and refreshed for days after one of her massages.  She really listens to what her clients are saying -- and to their bodies.  Time to make an appointment!

4.description: I have a herniated disc which has been causing me lots of pain in my glutes, hamstring and calf, as well as weakness in my right leg.  I did a yelp search for massage therapists and found Janna right in my neighborhood.  She specializes in trigger point massage, which was just what I needed for my sore and tight muscles.She always asks a lot of questions to see how I"m doing, and she's very attentive and tuned in to my specific issues.Janna has been so helpful with my situation.  Every time I see her, I walk out feeling better.  My pain is almost all gone now.Janna is terrific and I can recommend her without reservation.  Give her a call!

58.description: Great food.  Delivery dragged more than their estimate.  Had Italian beef with tiramisu.  Sweet and hot peppers. Could've used more meAt.  Delicious.  Can't wait to order from here again. Very very flavorful and left me feeling good.  Exceeded flavor expectations.

56.description: $7 bucks for a tasty sandwich, fries, & an ice cold beer!   The best deal in town.   Amazing chicken wings as well!

29.description: One of, if not the best spots for burgers and sandwiches in all of Rogers Park!Grill Inn has been by go-to option for a quick&easy dinner or late night munchies. The burgers are delicious and they put one of their specialty burgers with fires and a drink as a special every month. I would also recommend the grinders, which is like a sandwich on toasted garlic bread essentially. Really good! Fries are super tasty as well.The restaurant is clean and the service is friendly. As long as they're not too backed up your food comes out pretty quickly too. Grill Inn is definitely one of the few bright stars around the Morse red line stop!

42.description: I ordered here for the first time a couple weekends ago and was pleasantly surprised! I just ordered for myself this evening and it was still as good and even quicker! It was here in about 25 minutes and delicious. The fries were not soggy and were still warm. Definitely a great local option!

23.description: I once used their bathroom without buying anything so I had to go back.steak wrap in a spinach wrap was exceptional.they also have 3 dollar beer specialswin win

47.description: I had the veggie burger and I'm usually a meat (or double meat) eater. The veggie burger was actually really great. The prices there were awesome. They even have a dine in lunch special. The customer service was great also.

8.description: Pretty standard-issue burger. Would have been a lot better with seasoning, but there was none. The cooks are apparently unfamiliar with the salt & pepper shakers. And there were none on the tables. Ordered medium-rare, got medium. Fries were good. Not worth a return visit.

31.description: Everything is good. Seriously.

34.description: So nobody knows that this place actually serves up breakfast sandwiches. And they're really good, cause the grill guy fries up fresh eggs, mushrooms, bacon and grills it onto bread. They have like 8 options. I just wish it was available more than 11a to noon-- a one hour menu!I barely noticed this place right off the Morse Red Line stop for a while, but I think it's great. One of the cleanest Chicago fast-food /burger joints you'll see.Indoors has only 5 tables. Not bad for a quick lunch by yourself. Not sure I'd come here and hang out with friends: too small. Maybe one of the 3 outdoor tables when it's warm. But it's solid for to-go.

16.description: Portillo's, Five Guys, you don't stand a chance! These burgers are made of MEAT! Fresh meat, and mighty tasty meat it is, too. We've noticed Portillo's meat is grainy and dry, and five guys' meat sits like a lead ball in our bellies. Not so with Grill Inn burgers, no, Siree!We ordered online during a night of crisis, and after the food arrived (we were surprised at the delivery speed), we found the quality of the food quite high. Tasty burgers cooked just right ( I highly recommend the Morse Burger for MEAT LOVERS- it's HUGE!).Their Cajun Fries were SPICY and actually made from fresh cut, REAL POTATOES (Oh MY!).  Their ON-YON rings are the best I've had yet, even after being ignored due to a crisis, the rings (then cold) were still crispy and delicious! We had an Oreo pie slice that was a super finish to as close to fine dining as one ca likely get with burgers and fries.We are ordering again tonight before returning to our own cooking (updates later), but in future, Grill Inn has the burgers and sides we prefer over all others.Update: Philly Steak tonight (Yeah, real steak), cheddar fries and salad. Whoo hoo!

13.description: Currently eating at Grill Inn. I am glad to see that they have a few vegetarian options. I got the Veggie Veggie grinder and a side of Buffalo fries, and it is gosh darn delicious. The gentleman who helped me was a man with a hearing aid, not sure of his name, but he was super friendly and super helpful. All in all I am very happy eating my food right now and I will definitely be coming out here again to see the awesome guy who helped me and eat some more.

11.description: Late night order via GrubHub. Called to comfirm the delivery time and the person on the phone was honest, helpful and polite. Order did arrive as he estimated and the food was good. I highly recommend this place.

39.description: Great burgers, great fries, great beer--and a selection of cream sodas! They have a plate/beer special every day. The staff is always friendly, quick, and attentive. I have not had too many things, but the gyro burgers and chili cheese fries are my favorites so far. Cooked well, plenty of moisture. You can customize the fries with seasonings and toppings. The portion sizes are perfect. They have plenty of craft beer bottles at reasonable prices. Beware eating here on a hot day, though. It's like you're sitting in the grill. Thus the name.I believe they're on Grub Hub. Definitely a small gem in town.

37.description: I like the food. The chicken tenders are amazing. The burgers are pretty good too. Don't eat the tomatoes. Just trust me. My main problem is I always get delivery. And I live in an elevator building. With a buzz up system. I order through Grub Hub and explain the buzzer will call my phone and I will buzz him up. This driver keeps telling me my buzzer is broken. Today I knew for sure it wasn't and I had four people over who had made it work just fine. It is pure laziness on his part. I shouldn't have to pay a delivery charge and tip if you can't make it upstairs. Repeatedly.

0.description: This place is amazing. So many menu items. Burgers are huge. I had the double char burger with cheese well done and boy it was awesome. It takes awhile but it's well worth it. Dive in to the burger and it is still steaming hot. I have the seasoned fries and it was amazing.Place in general is ok, small but have a few tables. Was featured in Chicago's Best in 2014. And the review brought me to this place. Would definitely come back again.

38.description: I love the wraps they are crunchy and filled with chicken this place doesn't skimp on meat the fries taste fresh and everything is relatively affordable for the portion sizes.

51.description: Grill Inn has been my "go-to" for bomb.com burgers and fries. They're not too far from where I live and the pricing is pretty reasonable. I would recommend the Murphy Melt and the Cajun fries. Now, the only reason I gave them 3 stars is because my last delivery order was wrong and the employee who took my order did not keep up with his end of the bargain. I ordered a burger and fries with a coke and a water. When the delivery guy came, I took my food up to the apartment and realized I had no drinks. I called back, hoping that maybe the delivery guy had the drinks in his car and could bust a U-way. But the guy on the phone admitted he was at fault and forgot to include the drinks. Ok, no biggie, I asked him to bring them and he said it would take another 45 min to an hour. I'm like "ok well I'm not going to wait that long, so he said he would comp my ENTIRE meal. He didn't have to suggest that I would've been cool with just taking off the drinks from my bill. But I was cool with that as I'm a pretty regular customer here. The drinks were never taken off my bill. So, the next time I go, they can expect me to get a coke and water for free. It's not the end of the world, it's just when you tell a customer that you'll comp their meal or any items from their meal, and you don't, that's crappy customer service. Just saying. But the food is still good. Just make sure they have your order right :)

27.description: I've had mixed feelings with this place. Their fries are great but if you had flavor they charge you like a bitch! EAnd its just seasoning we have in our cabinet. Well I do. Their burgers are really good and well cooked. It taste fresh and when I ask for medium-well I get medium-well, sometimes its so hard to get that right. So, I started getting their char chicken sandwich which is really good. Now this time I got onion rings and I didn't like seeing a bag of frozen ass onion rings. I'm not tryna jerk but damn you're charging me almost $5 for frozen bagged onions rings? Also I do feel that this place is wayyyyy over priced. As I am eating g these onion rings I don't know what to think. Some of the rings meh and some are idk. But I don't think a chicken sandwich and onion rings should not cost almost $14.
