32.description: Awesome food with a friendly owner taking orders. It's one of my standard breakfast places.

54.description: Grill inn offers a solid burger for the price. My sister and I got "Char Burgers" and they were cooked well and had a juicy and flavorful taste to them. The burger hit the spot and captured some of the '4th of July grilling out' taste (perhaps hence the name Grill Inn...). The employees were nice and there was minimal wait for the food. My side order of fries, however, were a bit lacking in quantity. Despite this, we left full and content.

48.description: Their gyro grinders are divine. Food comes out hot and tasty everytime. Also helps that they are so close and convenient for me . Will definitely give something else on their menu a try

44.description: Good food! The cajun wrap or the garlic pita are really good and my fav. I like my fries to be a bit crispy and somehow they are never crispy but still not bad.

24.description: Flavor of the Patty is delicious and it is not covered by toppings that overpower the flavor

7.description: So nobody knows that this place actually serves up breakfast sandwiches. And they're really good, cause the grill guy fries up fresh eggs, mushrooms, bacon and grills it onto bread. They have like 8 options. I just wish it was available more than 11a to noon-- a one hour menu!I barely noticed this place right off the Morse Red Line stop for a while, but I think it's great. One of the cleanest Chicago fast-food /burger joints you'll see.Indoors has only 5 tables. Not bad for a quick lunch by yourself. Not sure I'd come here and hang out with friends: too small. Maybe one of the 3 outdoor tables when it's warm. But it's solid for to-go.

49.description: LOVE the food, but it takes forever to cook and the salads are very sub par. Best breakfast sandwiches around, wraps are great, and the burgers are amazing! Rude wait staff though.

40.description: This place is delicious, best burger I've ever had in my LIFE!! The staff was polite & very helpful! This is my new favorite place!

53.description: Thank you, Grill Inn. We ordered from your establishment for the first time yesterday. Side note: It wasn't a "banner day" for us. We moved to RP about a month ago and have had several mishaps with our new place. Yesterday, the day of our first order, a pipe had burst, flooding part of our unit; the furnace went out; and our space heaters overloaded the breaker leaving us without lights/power for a time. It was the titanic without the iceberg and deck music. Ok, maybe not that bad, but we spent most of the evening cold and wet.Back to the review.The fact that you stay open later during the week was a bright spot to a bad evening. The person taking orders was very friendly, and actually read my order back to me to eliminate mistakes. The food was delivered promptly, amidst the chaos of our household. When we dove into the bag like a hungry pack of wolves, we were happy to find the food cooked perfectly and it tasted fantastic. (I highly recommend the Yippe Ka Yay Burger and the onion rings.) The food was not greasy, nor did it weigh us down. Despite having to interrupt our dinner multiple times, the onion rings were still crispy and wonderful cold! The take-away: good food, good service, good price and flexible hours.

30.description: First time trying this place, got a burger and tater tots to go.  Service was very fast and the burger was great!  Cooked perfectly and tasted fresh.  The tots were the perfect side to go with it.  Will definitely be back and will spread the word about this place!

46.description: So been in RP for 17 years and this is the first time I had ordered from Grill Inn. Wow I certainly have have been missing out on something here.Food was delivered quickly and hot (like it just came off the grill/out of the oven hot).  Big points there. Jalapeño poppers were delish. Spicey chicken wings had a nice kick to them without the spice being too overpowering and they weren't those tiny (where's the meat) little things you get from most places kudos for that. Im a French fry  freak and their regular fries are very tasty. I also got a char cheeseburger which was grilled to a medium rare I didn't order it this way (IForgot to request it when ordering) could they have read my mind? It was juicy and the meat they use is of good quality and you can certainly taste it. My husband ordered the gyro grinder what a great concept however tasty but the meat was a little dry and one of the tomatoes on the grinderwas dried out (old?).All in all was pleasantly surprised and satisfied with the quality of food and will definitely order from them again. They have some interesting grinder and sandwich options I'd like to try with a side of the delicious fries of course!

1.description: once again i got a wrong order. ordered 3 Goose Island 312 and received Goose island IPA in a can. i called grubhub, and was told that GrillInn does not issue refunds (even when it is their mistake), and was told that if i bring it in there, they will switch it out. seriously?! why do you think i ordered for delivery? i could also wait 1.5 hours for them to come back and switch it. no thanks. call me crazy, but i believe that if its not my fault, and you have my money, then i get top priority for re-delivery. I've gotten a wrong order 50% of the time and I've threatened that i wont be back, and this time, really really i'm done.if the order wasn't typed out clearly for the restaurant via Grubhub, I wouldn't be so annoyed. how hard is it to read words on your screen? now, since they dont double check orders, they've lost a customer for good.

55.description: Been trying new places as often as I can. I had the BBQ Chicken Grinder. Best sandwich I've had in Chicago.

9.description: I ordered food for my son, who was sick at home. It was promptly delivered, and everything was very tasty, he said: homemade chicken noodle soup, garlic bread and chili. Hope I get to taste them too!

26.description: We ordered delivery. The veggie burger was burnt. It was actually black and I had to cut some parts out. The bun was soft and almost wet. The French fries were all soft and barely warm. What a bad meal for the price we paid. Won't go back.

25.description: I tried the True Bleu! Burger with Cajun fries and it was absolutely amazing. I liked that they did not drown the entire thing in buffalo sauce, but it had the perfect amount. It was really hot in the restaurant and there was a very annoying person who kept trying to talk to me even though I was clearly not giving off any "talk to me" vibes. I had gone to enjoy lunch and read my book, but in the end I decided to take my food to go because I realized that I wouldn't be able to enjoy my food there. The cashier was really friendly and apologized for the behavior of the other customer. When I got home, the food was hot and was happy with a more than generous amount of the Cajun fries. I am definitely going back!

12.description: Ordered for the first time tonight.  FANTASTIC WINGS!  A few more celery pieces would have been good but other than that, AMAZING!  Can't wait to order from here again.

59.description: Great burgers and best gyros in the neighborhood. Pretty good beer selection too. Would be five stars but they don't use their air conditioner in the summer and the poor exhaust system can make it stuffy.

21.description: I truly love these guys. Best Burger I've had from grubhub in Chicago.

17.description: I ordered delivery from Grill Inn for the first time and was super happy with what I got--a delicious hamburger that was perfectly cooked, still hot fries, and a green salad that was GREEN, fresh and crispy. Thanks Grill Inn. I'll be back and I'll bring my friends.

10.description: One of, if not the best spots for burgers and sandwiches in all of Rogers Park!Grill Inn has been by go-to option for a quick&easy dinner or late night munchies. The burgers are delicious and they put one of their specialty burgers with fires and a drink as a special every month. I would also recommend the grinders, which is like a sandwich on toasted garlic bread essentially. Really good! Fries are super tasty as well.The restaurant is clean and the service is friendly. As long as they're not too backed up your food comes out pretty quickly too. Grill Inn is definitely one of the few bright stars around the Morse red line stop!

5.description: Five of us went there Saturday at 5pm.The guy who took our orders and served us our food was just a great host. The food came out promptly and everyone enjoyed there food. I was a very pleasurable experience. The next time we are in Rogers Park we will be there.

3.description: Wow. I'm so angry......that we've lived in Rogers Park this long and didn't try this place sooner!Great burgers. Crispy, juicy chicken tenders. Spicy Cajun fries to die for (we will definitely be trying all the fries on the menu!).Got our delivery in about 20 minutes!

35.description: Had their veggie burger twice. The second time I walked in personally and loved the cleanliness of the small space. They seem very people friendly. I loved their veggie burger for the simple fact that No extra condiments are needed, it is full of flavor! Veggie patty tastes very fresh.

19.description: Love their veggie burger, I mean I really love it.  Great onion rings.  Great fresh cut fries too!  I'm going to try a Saarland one day but it's hard to get past the great veggie burger.

28.description: To enjoy the Grill Inn, it's good to know what to order.  I was told, their gyros and Italian beef were top notch.  I can't agree.  Imagine ordering an Italian beef or gyros sandwich while staying at the hospital and restricted to a low fat diet.  Maybe it was the bread of the Italian beef sandwich, it didn't work (even with extra dip!).  And the gyros was so standard.  I thought of it as a waste of calories.Again, wise to know what to get.  Like, their burgers or a chicken plate.  The good, is that their employees try their best to impress.  I'm speaking of "dine-in" service.  The place is kept very clean.  And likewise, so will you find their food presentations and offerings.Never a busied place.

45.description: I can't stop coming here. It's soooo good. I do not order the fries - they were so soggy - but the cheeseburger and onion rings make this place 5 stars!!

33.description: This is my neighborhood burger place.  It tastes good and isn't too expensive.  As soon as you walk in the door you can smell the grill and everything they're cooking.  It hits you like a wave of deliciousness.  Their Blazin' Fries will end up giving me a heart attack I'm sure but they're delicious.  During the fall for football games I get their wing, fries and beer special and their wings aren't the absolute best but you can't beat the price for how much you get.  As long as I live up here I'll be a regular.

43.description: Grill Inn was one of the first places I tried upon moving to Rogers Park.  It seemed like a very handy place to eat given that it is open late and a block away from my house.  This made it easy to eat while we were still moving in and had no plates or silverware.  But now, this will definitely still be one of my favorites.The first time I ate here, I was surprised by the size of the menu.  There are a lot of pretty varied options, and pretty much all of it looked good.  The name on the door doesn't exactly leave room for imagination as to what is on the menu...  a lot of grilled food, sandwiches, burgers, fries, grinders, that sort of thing.  That first time I ordered a Philly Steak sandwich and some Cajun fries.  I took it home and it was great!  Hot, fresh, and delicious even at 11:30 PM.  I went back every day for the next three days, (hey, I was moving and didn't have a lot of other options...), and my wife and I got some chicken sandwiches, salads, chicken tenders, burgers, and, of course, fries.  I don't think anything that we got was ever bad (though I'm not a fan of pumpernickel croutons on my salad), and it is pretty cheap and very convenient to boot!  Plus, the staff has always been very friendly to me as well.The only bad thing is that I didn't find out about their military discount until my fifth visit...  I could have saved so much if I had known!  The owner is a retired US Marine (Semper Fi brother!) and gives 25% discount to military members.  Like I really needed another reason to be a regular here.All in all, its not exactly Five Star, Michelin rated cuisine, but it is tasty, varied, inexpensive, quick, and convenient.  There are even enough healthy options that you could even eat there on a diet.  The staff is friendly, service is good, the place is clean, and the owner supports the military.  To me, there is no way this place does not get 5 stars.  I'll see you soon, Grill Inn!

2.description: Fine, you wanna screw up a veggie burger. Ok. BUT, how the hell can you F up a grilled cheese?This place used to be GREAT when it first opened. Now, it really seems like the folks working there don't care about what they are cooking.:(

18.description: The food quality was fine..... but their AC wasn't working so it was impossible to eat in the place..... I'm amazed that the guys were able to working in there.  It must have been 110+ degrees in there.

41.description: Worst service. This place should be shut down and a "manager" should never go out of his snotty little way to prove a Customer wrong and swear at a customer... ESPECIALLY when he winds up proving himself wrong in the process and feels really stupid afterward  ... Owner should be ashamed.

52.description: Portillo's, Five Guys, you don't stand a chance! These burgers are made of MEAT! Fresh meat, and mighty tasty meat it is, too. We've noticed Portillo's meat is grainy and dry, and five guys' meat sits like a lead ball in our bellies. Not so with Grill Inn burgers, no, Siree!We ordered online during a night of crisis, and after the food arrived (we were surprised at the delivery speed), we found the quality of the food quite high. Tasty burgers cooked just right ( I highly recommend the Morse Burger for MEAT LOVERS- it's HUGE!).Their Cajun Fries were SPICY and actually made from fresh cut, REAL POTATOES (Oh MY!).  Their ON-YON rings are the best I've had yet, even after being ignored due to a crisis, the rings (then cold) were still crispy and delicious! We had an Oreo pie slice that was a super finish to as close to fine dining as one ca likely get with burgers and fries.We are ordering again tonight before returning to our own cooking (updates later), but in future, Grill Inn has the burgers and sides we prefer over all others.Update: Philly Steak tonight (Yeah, real steak), cheddar fries and salad. Whoo hoo!

50.description: Ver friendly staff. Came in for the first time. Had the number 3 on the menu. It comes with chicken, fries, sauces n homemade sauces. Delicious, with great flavors. For $8.49. Very good portion of food for the price. Cajun fries were delicious. Best tasting wrap ever. Will come back.

4.description: So very good every time I go. Great Polish Sausage! Great veggie veggie grinder! Great char dog! And most recent- great Cajun chicken sandwich; so messy and so delicious.

6.description: To enjoy the Grill Inn, it's good to know what to order.  I was told, their gyros and Italian beef were top notch.  I can't agree.  Imagine ordering an Italian beef or gyros sandwich while staying at the hospital and restricted to a low fat diet.  Maybe it was the bread of the Italian beef sandwich, it didn't work (even with extra dip!).  And the gyros was so standard.  I thought of it as a waste of calories.Again, wise to know what to get.  Like, their burgers or a chicken plate.  The good, is that their employees try their best to impress.  I'm speaking of "dine-in" service.  The place is kept very clean.  And likewise, so will you find their food presentations and offerings.Never a busied place.

22.description: Currently eating at Grill Inn. I am glad to see that they have a few vegetarian options. I got the Veggie Veggie grinder and a side of Buffalo fries, and it is gosh darn delicious. The gentleman who helped me was a man with a hearing aid, not sure of his name, but he was super friendly and super helpful. All in all I am very happy eating my food right now and I will definitely be coming out here again to see the awesome guy who helped me and eat some more.

15.description: I tried the True Bleu! Burger with Cajun fries and it was absolutely amazing. I liked that they did not drown the entire thing in buffalo sauce, but it had the perfect amount. It was really hot in the restaurant and there was a very annoying person who kept trying to talk to me even though I was clearly not giving off any "talk to me" vibes. I had gone to enjoy lunch and read my book, but in the end I decided to take my food to go because I realized that I wouldn't be able to enjoy my food there. The cashier was really friendly and apologized for the behavior of the other customer. When I got home, the food was hot and was happy with a more than generous amount of the Cajun fries. I am definitely going back!

57.description: This place is great, they totally have the best veggie burgers around and the tater tots are amazing. Really good food, super quick service, and they serve cold beer! The deliver too. What more could you want?

20.description: Wow. I'm so angry......that we've lived in Rogers Park this long and didn't try this place sooner!Great burgers. Crispy, juicy chicken tenders. Spicy Cajun fries to die for (we will definitely be trying all the fries on the menu!).Got our delivery in about 20 minutes!

36.description: Pretty good! Fast delivery, easy ordering online and the food was fresh! Meat had lists of flavor and my hamburger had that nice charbroiled bite. I might go back in Memorial Day for a hot dog!

14.description: This is my favorite place to get a burger in the neighborhood! I definitely recommend the mother clucker burger with avocado! Great food, amazing service, and fast delivery. If you're looking for a solid burger and fries, go no further! Oh and don't forget the jalapeño poppers!

1.description: I wrote an honest review on Yelp to share my extremely uncomfortable experience at this salon, to prevent any future victimized customers, in a very thorough detail manner- but the salon keep manipulating their review and having my review removed forcefully. They disrespect the real customer's opinion. It is true that I received a very expensive keratin treatment service from the salon but they showed me very rude attitude with full of racism. They did not inject the right amount of keratin, and made my hair look terrible without any nutrient. My former hair looked better before the service. I want to ask directly - Why are you trying to conceal the truth? I am very disappointed at your manner and happy to bring up this issue publicly with the Yelp community. Please do not ignore your real customers opinion. Never go to this salon! The worst experience I had in my life time full of disrespect. They never said sorry and their skill is not enough to make your hair look good.

9.description: I work and live in the Loop, but going uptown to Zoey's Hair Salon is worth it. Not only Zoey does a professional work, but one feels like being with a friend there, not like in a factory of anonymous faces.I dyed my my hair in several places downtown Chicago, but now I only go Zoey's despite the distance. The color lasts, the cut is perfect and I never had to go back for a clean-up or fine-tuning...Totally worth the whole experience and its results

23.description: Zoey is awesome! she is the most patient hairstylist I have ever gone to. I have been getting keratin treatments for years. This is the best treatment I ever received. My hair cut is awesome and I have received so many compliments. The best part is that they  are so flexible with her hours. I did not get off work until 5:30, i asked if i can come in at 6 and she said no problem. The shops hours are very flexible for working people.

12.description: I got the Keratin treatment with a coupon from Groupon. My hair was extra dry and damaged because of bad dye job that I had gotten a few weeks prior. My hair was dry and breaking off at the ends to the point where I had to do something drastic. I decided on Zoe after I had read all of her amazing reviews. I am extremely happy with the job she did. My hair is so soft, hydrated and all around a million times healthier looking. The keratin treatment did wonders for restoring my hairs protein and sealing split ends. The total cost for me was 150$ because I had to use an extra ounce of Keratin. The price is very reasonable considering how effective the keratin treatment is (especially if you have damaged hair).I will definitely be returning in a few months for another keratin treatment. All in all, Zoe is a true professional at what she does and I would highly recommend her.

21.description: The salon is new, owned by mom and daughter (Alma and Zoey). Today I went in for a cut and even though I'm very conservative with my hair I felt confident enough to also do coloring. I wanted something natural looking yet noticeable. Alma gave me the options and her expert recommendations helped me to not hesitate any longer. She did a fabulous ombre with a gradient just 2 tones higher than my natural hair color. I recommend this place!

16.description: Bought Keratin treatment on Groupon. The people at the salon were so nice and my hair looks great. I will definitely return when it's time for a single process!  And they made sure that I got out on time because I had another appointment. Keep up the good work.

17.description: I came here back in September for a Keratin treatment and a haircut. It's now January and the Keratin treatment is still keeping my hair straight and frizz free. Alma gave me the cleanest haircut. My split ends didn't reappear until December. I will drive the extra 30 minutes to have Alma do my hair!

10.description: I have been pleased with all of the services so far. Keratin, color, and cut! My hair needed a lot of work and my stylist certainly did a great job with such patience. I was tired of the big name, expensive salon and spa. Glad I found this place.

5.description: I had a great experience getting Keratin treatment from Zoey (and Alma and 1 other woman working there. They each did a different step of the process bc they were busy). Zoey was clearly knowledgeable about the treatment and pleasant to chat with while she did my hair. I'd recommend Zoey's Hair Salon for anyone looking for a reasonably priced, good quality Keratin treatment. I'm very happy with how easy my hair is to take care of after getting keratin here.I found them through Groupon. I'd recommend reading the FAQs on Zoey's website before going to the appt. She did charge $50 on top of the Groupon because I have thick hair (which would have caught me off guard if I didn't read her website first). Regardless, $150 is a reasonable price for a quality keratin treatment that will last 4 months.

11.description: I have been getting keratin treatments for 4 years now because I have naturally extremely curly and frizzy hair. I bought a groupon for a keratin treatment at Zoey's and decided to give it a shot because it was such a good deal. Probably should have done some research first on the place, but decided to just go for it. I walked in, and I was not even acknowledged, even though there was a stylist doing someone's hair. I stood there for about a minute until another stylist (I think Zoey) came out and just told me to get in the chair. There wasn't any chit chat, no hi how are you, I just told her I had an appointment and she directed me. It was weird. Usually stylists are chatty and friendly but she wasn't at all. She then proceeded to start my treatment, and what I found her doing was applying the keratin incorrectly. What they're supposed to do is section off your hair and apply keratin to 1-2 inch section and comb it through about 5 times to ensure that it takes. This process usually takes about 25 minutes. What Zoey did, was slather the keratin throughout my hair in a very quick way. She skipped the step where you're supposed to comb it through each section meticulously. And I assure you, my hair needs this step due to its naturally extreme curl. I was curious to see how her incorrect method would take to my hair. Well sure enough, after the keratin sat and she blow dryed and straightened my hair, it was extremely straight. I was almost shocked because I didn't think her method would work. But then I was curious what would happen once I washed my hair 72 hours later. Well, what I assumed would happen, happened. My hair was pretty much in the same state it was before I got the treatment. It didn't relax my curly roots much at all because the product had been applied incorrectly. When I had left the salon, Zoey told me that every time I come in for a treatment it would be for the groupon price I had paid. I thought this was an amazing deal, however I will not be using it. I would rather pay the going rate and get a treatment done well and CORRECTLY that is going to last.

22.description: Zoey did a good job fixing my hair. No more flat iron even blow dry in the morning before going to work with her Keratin Complex treatment.... Now i have a great looking, smooth hair that i never had with other Salon before. I would love going back again and i would recommend to you and to my friends. 2 thumbs up actually, Plus they will accomodate you whatever comfortable time you request to come in. Service was great!

0.description: I had a keratin treatment on my hair by Alma and it looks great. She also gave me a haircut on short notice and I love u t.I will definitely be going back.

20.description: I just had my highlights done today by Alma and I love the results! Alma took her time and consulted with me on the color i wanted. She provides great customer service and I will be going back. I also got my haircut from her a month ago and loved the results as well.

19.description: I just had my highlights done today by Alma and I love the results! Alma took her time and consulted with me on the color i wanted. She provides great customer service and I will be going back. I also got my haircut from her a month ago and loved the results as well.

2.description: Haircut prices increased to $20, but still worth it!

18.description: It's been a few weeks since Zoey gave me a keratin treatment and I am pleased with the results! I have very curly hair and I must admit I was afraid of how my hair would look after the keratin treatment. My hair is now so soft and manageable. The best part is, my hair looks healthy and I have no frizz whatsoever. To add to that, Zoey is a friendly and sweet girl! It was the first time I met her but we were talking as if we were long time friends! Her mother, Alma, was doing keratin on another lady at the same time and I would recommend both ladies for keratin.

13.description: I had my hair cut, colored and highlighted by Alma and it looks great!! The mom and daughter team are so friendly. Great prices for the superior work..

4.description: For guys haircuts, Zoey's Salon is such a great value. $10 for a haircut that could easily cost $45 downtown. Incredible. Zoey herself is very charming and friendly. This is my new favorite place to get a haircut. I can see myself going here for years.

6.description: I would never go back to this hair salon. the women there is so rude and tacky enough to even yell at me to force me to buy an additional service. The worst hair salon in Chicago. 1. There is not even a legit signboard for the salon, so you cannot find it unless you remember the exact address of the salon. They might change the name recently, but the name of the salon is totally different one outside - salon Alma. 2. I purchased $99 deal for one keratin treatment at Groupon. My hair is exactly 3cm longer than my shoulder, and the female hairdresser here said since my hair is "too long", so I need to pay another $45 to get the full service. While making the reservation over the phone, I told her that my hair is medium-length and she said NOTHING but it would be enough for one regular dose of keratin treatment. She changed her words and justified it with lots of ridiculous reasons in a very disrespectful manner. - such as I am so proud of my job, so I need to be paid more. All the time, she was rolling her eyes and scolding at me with a loud voice. Very disrespectful. 3. She seems to be too proud of her hair certification - she emphasizes that she paid a lots of money for obtaining the beauty license, so she needs to be paid an additional payment to fulfill the service. She said since the price of $99 is not enough to make her beneficial or being proud of her job, so she needs to force extra charge on the customer. Why don't you put a higher price on the groupon deal from the first place, so you don't have to provide your customer ridiculously poor service in a tacky manner? 4. So unfriendly and impolite. I told her nicely "please take a great care of my hair", with introducing myself, and she was like "You are just getting the keratin treatment. I am just doing my own work. I don't care your hair turns out perfect or not." What the..? She said it is my freedom that whether I upload a yelp review or call the Groupon. The worst customer service I would ever gotten in Chicago area. I was not provided with water or any customer service, the minimum service I could expect from a hair salon. 5. The result of her work was so poor. After paying $150 bucks for my hair, I am totally dissatisfied with her result. My hair doesn't get straighten enough, I cannot feel any shine or improved smoothness. She never asked me whether I am satisfied with her styling or any of my concerns on my hair. Hope my review helps. My 2 hour travel to the salon was NOT totally worth it. I will definitely pay more and go to another closer salon with nice services and great skills, rather than getting hair done here at Zoey's. I strongly believe that they had to change their name of the salon since they are getting too many bad reviews of their work, so unable to manage their reputation. Poor salon.

15.description: Had a keratin treatment by Zoey, she was excellent very through explaining the process. She was timely and very personable love the results. I will definitely go back and recommend her to my friends and family.

7.description: I discovered this salon on Groupon and am so glad I did. Zoey and Alma are both very skilled, personable, and knowledgable. You'd think that anyone in this profession would possess all of these qualities, but in my experience that's seldom the case. They also have integrity. When I asked about a service, they were honest about whether or not it would be beneficial for my hair type, rather than encourage me to do it just to line their pockets. Bonus: through them I've learned about a hair extension method which is less expensive for the consumer and healthier for hair than the alternatives. I've since asked practitioners in other salons about this method and learned that they weren't going to offer it because of the expense involved in being trained, and the fact that this method of installation is a longer process than the others. Zoey and Alma remain on the cutting edge despite the expense and inconvenience required of them. Previously my extensions were bonds, and I was under the impression that removal always involved pain and some hair loss. Whaddya know, Zoey and Alma know a method that is painless and does not rip out your hair, it just takes a little longer. I guess that fact alone is the reason no other practitioners have told me about it!

8.description: Excellent Keratin products!,I found it in GROUPON My hair is so straight after a week, also I have a haircut and she did an excellent job because she didn't cut a lot like the times before I had my hair cut different hair salons and always cut more than what it is. My hair looks so healthy and long! Happy customer here!!! I recommend this place to my friends and family! FIVE STAR!

3.description: I have two great keratin treatment experiences with Zoey already and I intend to go back every 3-4 months as long as I live in Chicago. My hair is naturally curly, coarse, and dry (Asian) hair, and I have been doing Japanese straight perms for more than 15 years. Half year ago I decided to transition into a more natural and healthy look by doing Keratin only . Keratin doesn't leave my hair pin straight and flat like Japanese straight perm does, but I actually really appreciate that. Zoey is knowledgeable, patient, and attentive!

14.description: Love Alma! She did a great job on my hair for the keratin treatment. She's super nice and very kind. Will definitely come back to her for my hair cuts and kertin next time as well. A great mom and daughter duo. Recommend her highly!

58.description: I was driving down Morse on my way to meet a friend for Indian on Devon and was struck by the apparent makeover that this stretch of Morse has undergone since the last time I was in this part of East Roger's Park.  After dinner, I was compelled to return to see exactly what was going on.  Drawn in my the chandeliers, my friend and I spent the remainder of our evening at Chuckies.  The good: Awesome chandeliers, strange wall painting, good beer menu, decent specials and a diverse crowd makes this deceptively fancy-lookin' lounge a sweet place to sway about to the hot beats they blast while attending to the fascinating words rolling off the tongues of the folks at the table behind you.  The bad: There were a series of strange smells ranging from stale cigarette smell to burnt pizza.  I could have done without the odors (particularly the stale cigarette smell that eventually went away).  The pizza crust looked really good. I vote on the addition of a vegan pizza to the menu.

56.description: Went here on a Sat. night around 11pm with 2 girlfriends.  What an odd little experience we had.  Drinks were quite good and well-priced ($8 for a martini). I liked the set-up, too.  Kinda modern without being pretentious.  There was an odd mix of people. A group of bougie girls all dressed up for a club downtown, and then 3 - 4 groups of more casually dressed people having cocktails and chatting.  It was pretty chill.  They were playing decent pop/rock music in the background, but what was up with their sound system?!?! It kept getting OBSCENELY loud, then the staff would skip a song or turn it down...another song would come on and it would be BLARING again! It got to the point where we laughed every time a new song came on.  It was a little distracting to maintaing our conversation.  Service was okay. When we first sat down, bartender was prompt in coming over. She checked on us 5ish mins later to make sure the drinks were good, then *poof* she was gone. We even had to request our tab 2 hours later. I would have had another drink had she come back!I noticed they serve pizza. The menu options looked decent, but we didn't eat. Only one group of patrons ordered food and the bartender burnt the pizza. Yuuuuuuck. I got the impression that they're probably going through some growing pains, since they haven't been open too long. It was kind of a fun scene and definitely different than the other dive bars around Rogers Park.  I'd go back.

29.description: Fun atmosphere, but had a pizza and the whole middle of the pizza was soggie. Thought it would be good, but was disappointed.

42.description: I was very intrigued by this place.  From the outside, it looked like a very nice lounge, and I really like to support local businesses.  I went there with my fiancee and a couple of her friends, and was IMMEDIATELY struck with disappointment.  The outside, as stated, looks like it has potential, but as soon as you walk in, you're given the impression that the decor was slapped together, and it all looks cheap.  This, I'm willing to forgive, if my other experiences are positive.  They are not.The seating was laid out awkwardly, and despite the bar not being very filled, we had a tough time finding seating to sit four of us so that we could talk.  The music was excruciatingly loud, and we had zero chance of having any kind of conversation.  There were some people at the bar, that I got the impression were regulars, that were visibly drunk, and very loud and obnoxious.We went there on New Year's Day, in the evening, and the bartender was drinking behind the bar, and bragging to everyone about how she was still drunk from the night before.  When I asked what kind of beer they had, I was given a half-hearted attempt to list a couple beers.  I ordered one.  When she brought it to me, I took a sip, and I realized that it was not the beer I had ordered.  When she came back, I told her, and her response was, "yes it is."  Then when I proved her wrong, she said, "Oh yeah, we ran out of what you ordered."  It boggles my mind that she would've just randomly picked another beer and brought that to me, pretending it to be what I had ordered.We paid and left after that.  I will not be returning.

23.description: I was SO excited to see this place open just a couple blocks from my home. I try to support all the local flare, whenever possible. However, service was awful. While she seemed moderately pleasant, bar tender was too busy with her feet propped up on the bar and having her own conversation to tend the patrons. Drinks were not very good, seemed watered down. Way overpriced, especially for the service we received. Automatic 20% gratuity added for a two-top. Kind of explains why the place is ALWAYS empty. Two stars for ambience, but I won't be going back.

47.description: My girlfriend and I stopped here for a quick drink the other day.  I looked at their drink specials, one of which was for Miller Lite draft.  There were two Russian girls behind the bar who I don't think could speak or understand English very well.  I asked for the Miller Lite draft special, and one of the girls brought me a bottle.  I explained that this was not what I wanted, and she had to ask her manager what I was even talking about.  Never got my draft.  We left after our beer, not too thrilled with the place.

8.description: I am updating my review because I tried their pizza. It was terrible

31.description: Not impressed. The first draft beer I asked for was out but u wouldn't know it given that the tap handle hadn't been removed. The server/bartender didn't appear to know the register software that well (even though she was the only one there) and rang me up for a smithwick's vs a dos equis. One pint of dos equis cost me a total of 7.13 but i suspect i was overcharged the price of the smithwick's. The bathroom is unisex. This could get dirty and unattractive for evening guests. Fixtures were broken. The sink was leaking onto the underneath cabinet. You might not see all of this given the minimal bathroom lighting. This place looked nice from the outside. It does not look divey at all. I was mistaken. I just came from the Oasis and was FAR more impressed because they weren't trying to be something they are not. To sum it up, this bar was empty when i got here and i had to ask the one on-duty staff member for toilet paper so that i could, then, put it on a broken holder. Enough said.

34.description: Worst. Bar. Ever.UPDATE: FRAUD ALERT! Our incompetent bartender gave herself an extra $3 tip on my boyfriend's credit card. She basically stole his money. I can't say this will happen to you if you go here, but seeing as that I've NEVER seen this before and she was so brazen about it would make me worried. No amount of comping could make up for this complete loss of trust between customer and business.I am amazed that there are good reviews of this place because of my experience was so bad. I don't have a strong opinion of the decor or atmosphere, it was slightly nicer than the Glenwood and Red Line Tap but the service and drinks were so bad I can't give this place more than 1 star. First off I asked for a Hoegaarden and when the bartender pours it it looks like the keg is empty, don't know why she didn't know that already, but oh well, I ask for something else. She pours it into the glass like a total amateur, straight down. Of course it's about half foam and she looks as disappointed and confused as me. Okay... I ask for Hacker Weiss and she looks confused. I point to it in the menu. She nods and sets off. She comes back with a beer that is the wrong color and about 3" of foam. She acknowledges the foam and does nothing about it. At this point I'll take whatever is in front of me so I go to town. It is actually Smithwicks and it tastes watery.In the meantime my boyfriend's gin martini shows up in a tumbler on the rocks with a lemon. What? He asks for olives and our clueless bartender takes 2 olives and sticks them on the ends of straws and hands one to each of us. Like a lollipop. Then the "martini" actually tastes like straight up gin. We didn't bring anything up with our bartender because a) she didn't have a strong grasp on the English language and b) she made no apologies for our drinks and I didn't have faith that she would understand our criticisms or offer to comp. I watched the other 2 bartenders pour more extremely foamy beers so it's not that we got the wrong lady (though I did see one of the others make a normal-looking martini).Sooo if you want wine or bottled beer you're probably okay. Steer clear of draft beer and cocktails. All in all just go to the Glenwood instead, Chuckies is too frustrating to waste your time on. If you insist on going here, hold on to your receipt in case they try to squeeze a better tip out of you!

16.description: I remember this place when it first opened. Great bartenders, great service and decent pizza. what ever happened!! Now, all we get are bartenders who spend their entire shift outside smoking cigarettes talking to their friends or family and ignore the costumers. Not welcoming at all. Went for a couple of times and still feel the same way. Even decided to have breakfast at 6:30am that was a joke. It was never open. Oh well. I won't be stepping in that place again.

13.description: How this place is still open vs how many licks does it take to get to the end of a tootsie roll pop?....both answers, the world will never know.

11.description: I had pizza here about 2 months ago and it was decent to almost bad. I could have (and have, actually) probably made a better pizza myself.It's a shame that such a gorgeous space gets such bad reviews. I love those chandeliers, but pretty decor and fancy lighting should NOT replace good food.

39.description: I will never go back here. It looks trendy and hip, but if terrible service is trendy, and mismatched unnecessary decor is hip, then count me out. Drinks were okay, and they had some fun alcoholic slushie drinks, but the food menu was a joke. I was there with 2 girlfriends in the middle of the day, no one else in the bar at all, and the bartender ignored us almost the entire time. She was too busy texting, the whole. d*mn. time. The decor is just weird. "Crystal" chandeliers with some kind of "modern" attempt at native american art on the walls, antler and trees and stuff. But everything was sleek and metallic.Seriously, skip this bar, not worth the time.

37.description: We call this place "Yuckies". Go to the Glenwood.

0.description: Everyone calm down.Yes, the service is mediocre. In fact, I recently ordered a salad, and got something completely different--a "salad" was misconstrued with a "sandwich."  Another gentlemen, who happened to be friends with the bartenders, ordered bacon with his sandwich, and got cold prosciutto.  So, with maybe 6 people in the bar, the poor service was not attributable to bandwidth, customer hate (see friend), or anything else I observed. The reason is that the owner, Alex, who is of Eastern European descent, hires Eastern European girls who don't have a commanding expertise of English, or of American beer (e.g., not knowing what an IPA is).But it's admirable, and they try their damnedest--and are very sweet in doing so. So don't fault the workers at least.

38.description: This is a very odd place - but not in a bad way...just weird! It's a little mismatched for the area. Rogers Park tends to be a little dumpy and this bar, from the outside looks more like an ultra lounge. The service left something to be desired only because the bartenders seemed busy with texting on their cell phones or flirting with the male clientele. Other than that, they were actually very nice and willing to help when they had the time. The overall prices are too high for this location but their specials are prices very low to make up for it. For example, a Miller Lite is normally $4 for a goblet but their special has Miller Lite as $2 - so in the end, the pricing worked in my favor. I didn't try the pizza but it looked good. I will keep coming back.

51.description: Bottom Line Up Front: You're not going to find a whole helluva lot of better full service bars that serve food in the Morse corridor. This place seems forced. I want to say a bunch of horrible things about it, but other than being a bit over priced for the neighborhood and looking a little out of place, it's not a bad bar. The bar can be seen from the Morse Red Line Stop, so it's pretty easy access. The inside is TINY, but the stainless steel/industrial vibe is actually different in ROPO, so I kinda liked it. They have this super crazy painting on the Eastern Wall as soon as you walk in. It's totally weird/awesome and I couldn't stop looking at it. The Bar has the usual suspects for liquor, and a pretty nice little selection of drafts. The cooler had a bunch of different canned beers everything from Hamm's and Keystone Ice to Heineken and Modus Hoperandi. The food was actually pretty good. This place gets a star for the food. The prosciutto and mushroom pizza was tasty, even if it was NY style. The bartenders were a couple of attractive Eastern European women who were about average with their English, but they were very attentive and they get extra points because they're also the cooks.Chuckie's has outdoor seating. I'm a sucker for outdoor seating. You get a star for that. I love watching all of the weirdos in my neighborhood.On to the negatives! The bar has this "super sexy" track light (see, i told you it was forced) above the bar. That wouldn't be such a problem if it wasn't directly in your line of sight to the televisions. Additionally, the language barrier prevented the Bulls game being screened in high definition, even though the place has a bunch of classy HDTVS. "IF I'M GONNA WATCH THE BULLS LOSE, I DAMN WELL BETTER SEE IT IN HIGH DEF!" The previous two negatives were minor pecadillos... price was the biggest negative. In a neighborhood where you can find dollar beers, my Guinness was $6. Look, I know the place LOOKS like a Lincoln Park bar, but you can't charge Lincoln Park prices all the way up here! They did have some $3 Old Style can specials, but I don't think anyone should pay more than $2 for a can of Old Style.

27.description: Worst place I have been too I waited 15 minutes to get served and I got completely ignored and left. They only had 6 people and it was Christmas eve.

32.description: I just live a block away from Chuckie's. I walk past it everyday and I happened to go on Friday night. My observation : Overly expensive drinks despite an average ambiance!   Less selection of Appetizers compelled us to get fries from the restaurant nearby. Although we did not plan to eat, but from what I realized, the food did not catch my attention either, no one nearby was ordering food (given that everything was above $18.)Give it just a 2 star. I think it wasn't a value for money decision.

54.description: I was really wanting to love this place because it's within walking distance of my apartment.  I am all for promoting local businesses - especially in Roger's Park!  We have been desperate for more restaurants in the neighborhood.  It was very smoky when my friend and I entered.  We were both confused, thinking that the bar was allowing people to smoke despite the city's smoking ban.  However, we quickly realized that the smell was burnt pizza!The waitresses were very sweet and beautiful girls.  However, there was an extremely loud and obnoxious troll-like guy sitting at the bar.  Initially, we thought that he was just a drunk patron, but later he went behind the counter and started preparing food.  His loud cackle and annoying voice actually echoes off of the minimalistic decor.  When my friend and I looked at other customers, we could see that they were just as annoyed and frustrated with the drunk elf as we were.Our pizza was so badly burned that we couldn't even eat half of it.  I know that crispy thin-crust pizza can be charred, but this was inedible.  Hopefully the owners will properly train the staff how to make better pizza and get rid of the loud employee.  Until this happens, we won't be going back.

48.description: Great place to catch a drink after work or for a first date.  Never to busy and never to loud.  Nice place staff is always friendly have a good selection of scotch.

44.description: Such a disappointment. They have a great location, a half a block off the red line, and about the same to my doorstep.  The atmosphere was modern, with a decent, albeit pretentious vibe for Rogers Park. And every day walking home i see daily specials, but the upsides end there.My wife and I walk in to a mostly empty bar, and waited only a few minutes for the waitress/bartender/cook to come around and take our drink order.  Yes, one person.  On a Saturday night. Granted it was only 7:30, but still.  Now I saw plenty of other people behind the bar-- At least four of what I thought were customers casually strolled behind the bar on into the "kitchen" (corner). But none of them were interested in helping out.It took several attempts at eye contact with the one employee before I could convince her that my wife and I would also like some food to go with our overpriced beer (and I know it's far from an Irish pub, but it irks me when people can't pronounce Smithwicks... but I digress).  Apparently the menus in front of us on the table did not send the message that we were hungry.We each ordered a pizza; she got the margherita, I got prosciutto and mushroom.  Being so near the kitchen (corner), we watched as she (the bartender/waitress/cook) stretched the dough and applied the cheese, only to pause, walk around the half-wall to our table, and ask if it was alright that there was no basil.  They were already pretending tomato sauce counted as tomatoes on a margherita pizza, and now, no basil.  So its a cheese and olive oil pizza.  Fine.A few minutes after throwing my wife's pizza in the toaster oven, it arrived at our table, a miserable pool of grease and olive oil.  Since we could see the kitchen, I knew that she had not even started to prepare my pizza, so I went ahead and snagged a slice of hers while I waited.  The crust was so very thin, and lets not forget, cooked in a toaster, that it was impossible to pick up without everything sliding off the razor thin sheet of half cooked dough.  Even attempting the fold maneuver only tore the dough to pieces until you just had a sloppy handful of greasy cheese. Call it uber-thin-crust, fine, but if that's how its gonna come, at least give me some silverware.Finally, 15 minutes after my wife's pizza, my pizza arrived.  My prosciutto and mushroom pizza.  I was horrified to find that what they referred to as prosciutto was literally cold, thin sliced deli ham, thrown on top of my pizza.  Now maybe I have high standards, and maybe most people don't know that prosciutto and ham are completely different preparations of meat, and that prosciutto doesn't come in a square block. But COLD? It seemed as though she had forgotten what was supposed to be on the pizza, and at the last minute, remembered and tossed a handful of lunchables over my greasy plate of cheese.So to summarize:1: Understaffed2: Poor service, probably because theyre understaffed3: Way too many random people wandering behind the bar 4: Overpriced drinks5: Terrible food6: TERRIBLE AWFUL FOODI would give this place a zero if I could.  Never going back.

24.description: This is easily the worst bar in the world. DO NOT GO HERE. You're in for the worst time of your life, I promise you. My boyfriend and I almost never ever go here and we live really close. We don't go because we know it's a crappy bar and no one is ever in there. I don't like sitting in empty bars, it's not fun.Stupidly we give it another go a couple weeks ago, grab a drink or two before we head home, we think.As usual no one is in the bar except 2 other guys. They are BLASTING Adelle at ungodly volumes with basketball playing on the TVs. It's clear these 2 guys would rather just hear the TV and so would I since my ears are bleeding from the volume. We order 2 drinks and the guy takes my boyfriends credit card and drivers license (what???) to start a tab even though we don't want to start a tab and pretty much know we're going to chug these drinks and race outta there because this place BLOWS. Our bartender disappears and we see another female bartender appear for about 2 seconds and then also disappear. The entire bar is then left unmanned for a solid 20 minutes. Our 2 fellow patrons sit there with empty bottles and my boyfriend and I sit there with 2 empty drinks, ready as F*** to pay our bill and go, all the while Adelle song after Adelle song blares on the speakers, mocking us.  My boyfriend even gets up and tries to see if they are down the "hall" in this very tiny bar but they are no where to be seen. I could have stolen liquor, damaged property, attacked other patrons, whatever. These assholes just completely abandon their customers, their tips for the night and their jobs for over 20 minutes. What, were they banging in back? Pissed off doesn't even come close to describing our emotional state. Nothing is more unsettling than being trapped while your credit card and drivers license is held hostage and you wait on the whims of idiots. The female bartender finally appears and we demand our check and get the hell out. We will never ever ever stupidly think we can just grab an enjoyable drink at Chuckies before we head home. I'd honestly rather be kicked. As far as trying their food? Are you kidding me? Never in a million years. There is no way this place is up to health code. Their staff is barely conscious. NEVER AGAIN.

7.description: Worst margarita I've ever had... It was made with rum (not tequila) and the entire cocktail tasted like salt. The staff was friendly, but I didn't have the heart to tell them the drink was so bad..I had to finish my friend's for her..Good specials but don't order the cocktails

49.description: Well, well, how Morse Avenue is all growed up now. In a neighborhood that never seems to gentrify, it seems to be gentrifying. Despite a bartender that has a bit of a tough time understanding your order, this place is a stylish hangout that seems to be doing well. After the Mayne Stage, it's a good place for a nightcap.

40.description: I'll be honest, I frequent this place because it's cheap and I live right down the street.  The service is horrendous (bartenders are ridiculously slow and incompetent---needed my help making a bloody mary and forgot the ice!).  I think they might have some kind of shady undercover business or something with the high turnover rate they have.  They don't run the place well (don't take a credit card or ID when you open a tab? Really?! Bathrooms often don't have toilet paper...it seems like they give drinks away).  I've only eaten there once and the pizza was aiite.  At least the drinks are cheap and the flaky servers are friendly (probably because they're always drinking....).

53.description: I was really looking forward to stopping by here as i've passed by this place several times over the past year. Last week was finally the day, the day to be disappointed.I swung by for a late mid-week lunch with the intentions of having a few drafts to get a feel for the place. My plans changed after 4 mins of sitting @ the bar.I decided to order a Margerita Pizza (which i didn't know it was a toaster oven pizza) then the waitress disappeared w/o asking what I wanted to drink. The sad thing is ... I WAS THE ONLY ONE THERE. After a good 10 minutes, I called her over and said, "Can I have something to drink?" She finally obliged as I went with a diet coke as i figured i'd eat my lunch and not hang out after being annoyed about the wait to order a drink. So the pizza comes and it's coated in Olive oil, ugggh and the basil didn't taste fresh either.Some reviewers had it right to say this place had potential. Externally and interally, this place looks cool/hip but the service and food blew so i'd rather check out better bar options Rogers Park has to offer.

30.description: My co-workers and I went here after work on a Saturday night, around 12:30am. We work in the neighborhood and wanted something close and more low key so we could drink and talk. Morseland was very loud and crowded, so we kept moving. We arrived at Chuckie's and a few drunk middle-aged women were dancing on the tables, but despite that we went in. The customers in there seemed to have seen better days. In their defense it was almost 1am. The the only unoccupied table away from the dancing women had a beer on it, but we sat down anyways. A server came up to us and we asked for the specials. We decided on mango margaritas that were $5. They came from an alcoholic slushy machine behind the bar, and even though they looked nice, they tasted off. I was hungry and wanted food, but for $10-$15 a plate I didn't want to risk buying something equally gross. After a few sips of it and a man reeking of weed and booze talking to us way too close, I got a headache. I wanted a glass of water (which most servers usually bring anyways), but our server was nowhere to be found. The resident crazy woman came in and stood in the middle of the bar with a lit cigarette, but no manager or bartender asked her to leave. Eventually we just decided to go, so my friend went up to the bar and asked for our check. We scurried out of there and will not be going back.The bar looks very nice and the selection of alcohol seems great, but the patrons and service is totally lacking. The entire time we were there we felt like we needed to watch our back, because everyone there had been served too much to drink. Chuckie's is the equivalent of seeing a pretty women on the street but then hearing how stupid she is when she talks, a total turn off. Next time we will just go to Red Line Tap.

46.description: I experienced this place for the first time today and I loved it! Staff was very nice and it was a laid back atmosphere. If you want to just go have a drink with a few friends and chat, this is the place to go!

1.description: I was hesitant to order delivery from here again as I had a horrible experience with them a few years ago when I tried their food, but this time I was only ordering wine so I figured it couldn't be that bad. I was wrong. Placed my order a few minutes before 8pm for two bottles of Pinot Grigio. First the delivery time gets pushed back, which I can deal with, no prob. 9pm rolls around (delivery time, or so I thought..), I receive a phone call from the restaurant asking if I'm "still interested" in the wine I ordered and paid for. Told them yes, they said OK and that it would be here in 10-15. 915, I get another call from the restaurant telling me they only had one bottle of what I ordered and asked if I wanted a substitute for the second, told them yes.Finally at 950, I get my order. Just about 2 hours for wine? That's pretty ridiculous considering all they have to do is grab the bottle from the fridge and bring it here. *Oh, and by the way, I'm 27 but your delivery guy didn't know that since he never asked for any ID. Makes me wonder how many underage kids have gotten booze through your delivery without your knowledge? I'm sure they're loyal customers now! ;)

55.description: My wife and I did a bit of Ropo bar-hopping on St. Patty's day. Stopping by our usual haunts and seeing familiar faces. We decided to hit Suckie's to mix it up at someplace new. What a waste of time.Our easy 2 drink order was mixed up, and it was even a beer and a whiskey straight up. Not rocket surgery. Then it was impossible to find our server to get any refills, because she was off filling the place with burning pizza smell. After 20 minutes of trying to flag down anyone, we hit the bar to pay our tab. Voila extra drinks on our bill that we never ordered and certainly didn't receive. Rather than contest the charges with the bar I removed it from the tip and got the hell out of there.

9.description: Well for starters I would like to thank this establishment for giving me a reason to start a yelp account. After driving around for about an hour searching or a place that had a television to watch the World Cup and served drinks and food, I recalled "Chuckies" which I've passed by that looked amazing.It was 2:45 pm and the place was empty. (Always a bad sign). I asked if they served food and Alexis who I just found out was the owner responded, "yeah we do". He was the only person I'm the place and to see the television my friend and I sat at the bar. I ordered a "frozen drink" and I asked what alcohol would taste better and e responded rum. The only available frozen drink was raspberry. I watched him as he poured Svedka Vodka into a playful margarita glass. Because I've bartender before, I noticed he eyed about a 3oz shot which I'm not complaining about as it turned out to at least be worth what it costs but not blended well at all. He told me, "the alcohol is at the bottom, give it a swirl." My friend tasted mine but asked for the same with less alcohol. The menu looked great. Specialty pizza, fancy sounding sandwiches and pastas. My friend ordered Gnocchi. Alexi said that would take twenty minutes. She then ordered the White Pizza, Alexi said he didn't have any truffle oil. I ordered the margherita  pizza which we decided to share. I then asked to use the bathroom. It was wet, no tissue. Upon returning to my seat we waited for our pizza and I had finished my drink. alexi never asked anything and stood off to the side on his phone. Finally the pizza came. It was a plane old cheese pizza. No basil, no mozzarella, no olive oil. I said to alexi I didn't order a cheese pizza, he said that's the margherita. Why I didn't leave and ask for my money back I don't know. The pizza was greasy, he had no Parmesan cheese and the dough was chewy and uncooked. I asked Alexi if he wanted to give us something else since we were eating a cheese pizza we didn't order. He said sure and have us the hot lava cake with ice cream. That was terrible and he gave us forks. My friend ordered spiked coffee for the road. Half of it was baileys and he asked us what alcohol it a me with. My friend had to direct him to his own menu which said baileys. Asking for the check, he had included the dessert which was on the house. I wish I could give this place half a star. alexi should be ashamed. He's the guy in the picture by the way. He had nothing on his own menu and didn't know how to mix drinks at all. He laughed at most our questions an I can't tell if he was on something or just slow. I'm never going back and I only wish I read the reviews here before going. This place is terrible but lures you in with its modern decor. What a waste of time and money. His response to the food by the way was, "basically you oh to any bar and everything is frozen and we just heat it up for you." And then he laughed. I seriously want my money back. I'm calling the BBB and posting this on google and Facebook. I'll probably tweet about it in hopes people don't go through what I did. Ew.

26.description: Go anywhere but here. I live in the neighborhood and walk by this place all the time to get to the L or other places. It's always empty and that should have been a clue. But one Sunday after moving some furniture with a friend we decided to go a get a bit and an afternoon cocktail. So we thought we'd try this place as it doesn't look too bad from the outside. I guess as they say, never judge a hook by its cover. The same apparently goes for restaurants as well. We go in and there are maybe 3 or 4 younger people sitting at the bar. It was as if my friend and I each had 3 heads because they all turned and just stared at us. I'm not if they were talking and stopped or they said anything to us because the music was blasting at top volume. Eventually the waitress comes over and wow - the attitude was also at rope volume. She says something but we seriously couldn't hear her so asked he to repeat it. You can imagine how she loved being asked to repeat herself when it took all she had to get up and come to our table when clearly we were disturbing her. Once again, she mumbles something that sounds like something about drinks but we still aren't quite sure. So my friend and I are just looking at each other like "wtf?" and simultaneously we decided to just leave. Waitress might have said something to us as we brushed past her - who knows. Who cares. She probably didn't and doesn't and just went back to whatever she was doing other than her job. So can't really comment on food or drinks. But doubt seriously that us ever going to happen as I'm going back to just walking past this place. I suggest the same to others.

25.description: Horrible experience. I went here with a few friends on a weekday at 4. Walking in, we were the only people in the place, we sat at one of the tables, and waited for the waitress/bartender to come up to us and take our drink order. I ordered an apple martini, my friends ordered a beer and a cider. Our drinks came out quickly, and then the waitress/bartender disappeared. My martini was gross. Not even the slightest taste of anything apple, just vodka. And the glass (or the mixer) was dirty, there were little black pieces of fuzz in my drink. I would have sent it back, but the server was nowhere in sight. So I kind of sipped on it until it grossed me out too much.No one else was inside the bar, and my friends drinks became empty. We were going to order another round, but decided against it because the waitress/bartender was outside for 20 minutes, smoking and chitchatting with other people, while we sat inside with empty glasses. So we decided that because of the service we were receiving it would be better to close the tab rather than order another round of drinks. The waitress/bartender finally comes back inside, and walks behind the bar. My friend asks her for the check as she walks to the bathroom. The waitress/bartender brings the check to the table, and I ask if it's possible for separate checks. She responds with a no, because the other girl asked for one check so she couldn't split them (which wasn't true, my friend said no such thing!). So I walk up to the bar and pay the tab...Never again.

12.description: EXCELLENT brick oven style pizza. Decent cocktails as well. My Latte tasted weak though. The mixed drinks and pizza are definitely worth checking out

59.description: Such potential wasted!Chuckie's has a great location--1/2 block from the El and on a street that sees a lot of foot traffic. It also has an appealing interior as seen through the floor to ceiling windows.But in somehow trying to be unique, Chuckie's just ended up strange, in a tetched in the head kind of way.First, there's the name. Chuckie's? Really? Second, there's the food. The pizzas are okay but pricey at about $10.Third, there are the drinks.Expensive. This is still Rogers Park, people, no matter if you put a chandelier in!Fourth, the bartenders, while superficially friendly, can be inattentive. I may go back--the beer list is not bad and the pizza is tasty--but it's not gonna make my list of bars to frequent any time soon.Note: I could be wrong but I believe all the tables are high-tops, so probably not a wheel-chair accessible place.

21.description: Everyone calm down.Yes, the service is mediocre. In fact, I recently ordered a salad, and got something completely different--a "salad" was misconstrued with a "sandwich."  Another gentlemen, who happened to be friends with the bartenders, ordered bacon with his sandwich, and got cold prosciutto.  So, with maybe 6 people in the bar, the poor service was not attributable to bandwidth, customer hate (see friend), or anything else I observed. The reason is that the owner, Alex, who is of Eastern European descent, hires Eastern European girls who don't have a commanding expertise of English, or of American beer (e.g., not knowing what an IPA is).But it's admirable, and they try their damnedest--and are very sweet in doing so. So don't fault the workers at least.

17.description: I have been back to Chuckies a couple of times since my first review. Unfortunately nothing has changed. I am still amazed at how awful the service is. The fact that the bar "tenders" are either at the end of the bar ignoring their customers, or cannot be found, or the fact that when you do interact with a bar "tender" they are almost impossible to understand. At this point the owner should have hired some staff who speaks English as a first language. It does not make any sense to have bartenders that the customers cannot effectively communicate with. The music was over the top loud, and the martinis were not as good as they used to be.  Did I mention Chuckies always smells like burnt frozen grocery store pizza? They have a menu, but as far as I know there is no kitchen. When I go to Chuckies I feel as if I am interrupting the staff and they don't want anyone in the bar.  It sucks that this bar is so crappy because there are really not many bars to hangout in Rogers Park

10.description: The place has a human trafficking vibe, you know what I mean?

5.description: Someone else already wrote what I was thinking, money laundering. The bartender had never heard of Red Zinfandel, couldn't really tell me if they were serving food or not, yes he seemed confused. This confusion was confirmed, when after waiting outside for our drinks, we went back inside and he had forgotten the whole conversation. At this point we left while he was making excuses about being busy. We were the only people there. It was truly a twilight zone experience.

3.description: Preeeetty sure this place is a front for some illegal activities. It's always, always, always empty, the pizza they "serve" was frozen, and the one time I tried ordering via Grub Hub in the middle of the day, when they were so clearly supposed to be open, they never responded to the order and GH had to cancel it for me.

35.description: Meh. We always walk by and say "we should go there", so we did, but despite the menu, they weren't serving food. So we left.Why bother with a menu if you won't serve food? They don't actually have a kitchen so I'd beware of any food ordered. Was it frozen?

19.description: This place started off great with me going in there ordering a beer. Then I was surprised with the bartender giving me a drink on house when I got there. So I was like wow but then things turned!!! I sat there with my friends for at least 20 minutes waiting on the bartender to come back to serve us. He was too busy talking to a buddy of his at the end of the bar instead of serving us!!! So were going 20 to 30 minutes at a time until we got another beer. This was on a weekday when there was only a few people at the bar.

28.description: Maybe the best pepperonii pizza I've had, lots of cheese and crispy pepperonii.  Great drinks.

45.description: Remember those Childs Play movies where that evil gingerkid doll wrecked havoc? It seemed no matter what anyone would do to vanquish that little shit he'd come back! Again and again! Well I'm happy to report he's finally been destroyed because when you hear the word "Chuckie's" you won't be irritated by the memory of that demented toy, but think of a lounge that is a doll.There's great specials. Like martinis? They have a ton of tasty versions. Watermelon, mmm..... Or white chocolate. Yes, please. Beer? Good selection. Nice pours. Wine? Yup. They got you covered. Food?!? Yummy pizzas and paninis. All of these are decent servings and well made. And did I mention it's ALL inexpensive? Well, it is.I said to my partner, "If this place was in Lincoln Park or Wrigleyville it'd be packed to bloody hell."He replied, " You're right. And gee, your hair looks terrific!"Speaking of looks, the space is a lil small but very pretty with elaborate crystal chandeliers, mirrors, and modern furniture. What is also attractive is the charming staff and management. So hospitable and attentive. To sweeten this already appealing situation...an awesome dj. Tired of going to bars or lounges where it sounds like they play the same top forty songs ad nauseum? Or an uninspired Itunes list? Yea, me too. This guy mixed it up and the patrons appreciated it. He even tossed in some Portishead, Duran Duran, and Elvis Costello. The vibe was very chill. The crowd friendly, service awesome. I definitely welcome a sequel from this "Chuckie."

33.description: Don't ever come here. There are plenty of better options - Glenwood/Red Line Tap are right near by, Heartland Cafe has friendly staff and good food, same with Morseland.Worst service ever, excruciatingly slow. Wrong drinks--repeatedly, and the bartender was loath to correct any of her mistakes. I actually had a conversation with my girlfriend whether it's required to get a bartending license or something in Chicago, because if so, these bartenders DEFINITELY did not do their homework.Plus, the atmosphere is terrible. "Edgy" decor messed up by odd selection of music, TVs that are covered partially by track lighting, and the constant smell of burnt pizza and a vague hint of cleaner.

43.description: I'm really trying to keep the rating at 3, even though it's edging closer to 2 stars. I like that this bar is newer and adds some foot traffic to the area. It looks a lot bigger from the outside, but has a fair-sized interior, with a long bar and a handful of high top tables. They have daily food & drink specials. The music playing is kind of loud at times. Sometimes you can hear the person in front of you, and at the next song you have to yell. The music selection is also all over the map. One minute we were listening to Lily Allen and her expletives, and the next was something Enya-esque. Now, as far as the service, I've really had better experiences to be honest. The bartenders (female) we had seemed like they were newbies. They had a handful of them though, which is nice... if they were really on the ball with their customers. Also, for being a full bar, I was surprised they didn't have TWO things I asked for. Our bartender went over to ask another what Sweet Tea Vodka was, and did the same when I asked for a lemon drop with Chambord. So, she kind of improvised on that drink. Here's a free tip from me to you (bartender) btw, it's easier to get a sugar rim if you use a lemon around the rim. Sugar doesn't stick dry, honey. Anyway, I think the manager (or someone higher up) came around to our table and chatted with us a bit. Nice gesture, maybe too little too late.

2.description: I've walked by Chuckie's several times and thought it looked like a really neat place. They seem always to have drink specials in the window and it seems to be open late (I;m usually stumbling out of Thursday night trivia at the Glenwood when I'm walking past) but I've never been inside. Before last night. And I think I've gleaned some insight into why it's always empty. My experience wasn't bad. Just, well, weird.My husband and I ran into an old friend at the Cubs game Sunday evening and wanted a place to talk, have a drink and maybe share some munchables. Since we live in Rogers Park and she was staying in Evanston, we were looking for a place that would not look askance at three middle aged Cubs fans in full Cubs regalia. Do you know how hard it is to find a nice casual place open in RP on Sunday night? We didn't. First we tried the Peckish Pig. Closed. The bar next door to it? No food. I had an inspiration: the 626 next door to the Glenwood on Morse. Even though the sign on the door said it was open Sundays until midnight, it was closed. But Chuckie's was right next door. It was quiet and open. Eureka!There were folks on the sidewalk cafe, many talking loudly on cell phones. We went inside, completely empty and completely quiet except for two young women talking animatedly at a table. We nosed around and eventually one of the young women came over to us. She was a waiter! The other woman scurried to the sound system and turned on obnoxiously loud music. We were there to talk. And one of us is kind of hard of hearing. Did we need music? OK. She turned it down halfway. Why didn't she just turn it off? I have no clue.My friends ordered beers. I was in the mood for the frozen margarita I have always seen featured on the window sign. And was there food? Oh yes. There was pizza. We also ordered a Pizza Margharita. There were only 3 of us in the whole place, but for some reason our waiter took forever t get us draft beer and my frozen mango margarita? Large chunks of ice in syrupy-sweet warm margarita-flavored foam. Yuck!The pizza margharita was the weirdest, though. Isn't pizza margharita basil and tomatoes? That's what I thought it was, anyway. The pizza took forever, but OK it's pizza. It was thin crust, heavy on the mozzarella cheese with Greek olives and mushrooms. Huh? Not what I was expecting. But the weirdest part is that the waiter brought with her two different kinds of barbecue sauce. Barbecue sauce! Two different kinds. And then scurried away. I got up and found a shaker of Kraft Parmesan cheese and a jar of pepper flakes at the bar and brought it back to the table. No oregano or any other condiments. The pizza was pretty good, actually. Crispy thin crust and lots of gooey cheese. And the olives and mushrooms were perfectly fine, just not what we expected when we ordered. The whole time we were there, we were the only people in the restaurant. The two young women waiters were not at all attentive to us and seemed to be gossiping merrily with each other the whole night in some Eastern European language. There was nothing particularly wrong with our food or our beers. The frozen mango margarita was a huge disappointment and the lack of attentive service was a big non-starter. Not to mention Greek olive and mushroom pizza instead of the Pizza Margharita and the barbecue sauce accompaniment. I wouldn't go here again unless, like last night, it seemed like the only possible option.

18.description: This place creeps me out every time we stop in.  When it first came to the neighborhood, we went for drinks, pizza and to try to support it.  We were excited about a new place, but it has steadily gotten weirder and seems almost seedy now.  At the Art Fest they were charging $10 for a drink and served it in a disguised cup made for coffee that ended up breaking down and leaking 10 minutes later. Where are they finding these girls that call themselves bartenders and servers?  Really strange vibe.
