29.description: Delicious pizza and wonderful service.  This place was so good that my mom and I came here twice during our visit to Chicago.The first time we came, we ordered the thin crust super veggie pizza.  We didn't have to wait too long and it tasted so good.  The second time we came, we ordered the cheese stuffed pizza.  It was absolutely scrumptious (although I would ask for less cheese next time), but we had to wait 45 minutes.  Big mistake when you're famished!  I would suggest calling ahead or starting with an appetizer.  I have to say though, it was just as delicious as Lou Malnati's, yet with a slightly different crust.I was very pleased with the service both times.  Our waiters couldn't have been nicer.  Plus, we were seated immediately.  I think this location must be off the beaten path, and therefore does not get as busy.  My only complaint is the prices.  I think paying almost $20 for a small, veggie deep dish is pretty outrageous.  I know they boast having more ingredients, but give me a break.If you want to stuff yourself with some delicious deep dish and don't mind the price or the wait, come to Giordano's.

42.description: I brought my inlaws here and we were seated promply, we called ahead and made a reservation...  They gave us a nice corner booth and had a high chair waiting for the baby, very family friendly pizza place.  We ordered the "meat, meat, & more meat" deep dish and after a few apetitzers, it did'nt take to long to get to us.  Giordano's met our expectations for what a Chicago style deep dish should be.  Our server was excellent and very attentative!  She deserves a raise.

23.description: The phone order staff needs work - the young, college-aged male working the evening of 2/27 told me he had 'no clue' about the price of our pizza and was dismissive when (politely) asked for an explanation of the tax -- which he initially over-charged.Hint to management: the pizza is pretty well-made, but it doesn't serve itself.

47.description: If you order gluten free pizza because you have to, stay far away from this place.

8.description: Chicago is known for many things...one of these to deep dish pizza. If you travel to Chicago and do not indulge in this hallmark of the Chicago food scene, you have failed as a tourist. We have eaten pizza at at least a dozen local pizza places in Chicagoland area (Mr. is from Chicago and insists on hitting up at least one of these places during each trip.) this lady visit, we returned to Giordano's. We have, based in our extensive market research, decided this is the best example of Chicago deep dish pizza. First, deep dish is NOT pan pizza. It's deep dish, meaning a slice stands at at least 1.5 to 2 inches high. There is a lot of sauce. There are a lot of toppings. There is a lot of cheese. Whatever your toppings of choice may be, be prepared for a hearty slice of pizza. I am a little sized woman and one piece is plenty. My Chicago guy (who grew up on it) can usually manage 2-3 pieces. I tell you this in case you are wondering if you should "order up a size." We usually get the smallest size and ALWAYS end up taking at least 2-3 pieces home. It makes for awesome leftovers so no real harm is done. Order up some beer, face the TV to watch whatever Chicago team is playing and enjoy all that makes Chicago great.

31.description: People are a little too sensitive if having to wait for a server is their only problem with this place. There were only three other tables when my boyfriend and I arrived and we were sat right away. We didn't even look at the menu, except I wanted a mixed drink so I glanced over that section. Our waiter immediately came over and we ordered a stuffed cheese pizza. It arrived in exactly 40 minutes and it was PERFECT. PERFECT. PERFECT. PERFECT. Did I mention it was perfect? The cheese. The sauce. The crust. Perfect. Perfect. Perfect. I'm from Texas and nothing compares to this pizza... We only get to choose between Papa John's or Domino's... Noooo!!!

34.description: First deep dish I ever had. It was a good way to get started, and I will take all my New York friends here as their introduction to deep dish as well. Service was slow, but congenial. It's not a bummer if you go with that in mind and are not starving. Plan ahead and order a few pitchers, so by the time the pie comes out you're in the perfect mood.

16.description: Decent pizza I don't like the crust all the time I really should look into that sometimes when I order it doesn't taste like its cooked all the way

13.description: I love this place!The owner is really sweet and always wants to make sure everyone leaves happy and with full bellies. All the servers are fantastic. I've had a few different servers everytime I've been there and they're always super friendly! The pizza!!! Stuffed is the way to go. Tastes amazing and it's HUGE! The prices seem steep at first, then you see how much pizza you get and its totally worth every penny! I recommend spinach and bacon on every stuffed pizza!

11.description: I always get the vegetarian deep dish pizza and I absolutely love the filling. It has just the right amount of vegetables to cheese. I have been to this location once, it is a small comfy location however I never stayed to eat at the location. The crust is thicker than most deep dishes I have eaten at but it works with the heavy filling. This pizza just melts in your mouth!

39.description: Ask for chelsea, she was cool and brought the order in a timely manner, the food was really good, my first time in chi-town so had to get a deep dish pizza

37.description: Pizza tasted great.  Ready when promised.  Service was much better this time around.  You have to respect the place that changes for the better. Updated my review.  Will order more frequently.

0.description: This is the place for your classic Chicago deep dish pizza. I personally prefer Lou Malati's but this place is still decent. The pizza is right out of the oven but ours was a little undercooked at the center: the dough for the crust was a bit gooey. Also, their knives are VERY dull and it requires lots of effort to cut the pizza. The service was nice but definitely the food and knives could be better.

38.description: Their pizza is delicious!I just moved to the area and was excited to see a Giordano's down the street. I called to place an order for pick up. The person was very friendly when I told him that I wanted a small stuffed sausage and green pepper pizza. It took about 35 minutes. The pizza was very cheesy, which is perfect for me because I love cheese! I got full after eating 1 and 1/2 slice. I can't wait to try the thin crust and other items on the menu.

51.description: For some reason, my girlfriend wanted to get heart-shaped pizza from Giordano's for Valentine's Day.  Nearly every Giordano's I've ever been to is amazing, and I recommend them most definitely.  This one is embarrassing.  Reservations were for 8, and we got there right on time.  Half the place was empty, and now I know why.  Around 915, we get the waitress' attention (who was obviously busy with her whopping 2 tables) and she tells us that our "ticket was lost."  The pizza was never made.  She went to talk to the manager, and a little blame game ensued.  Finally, the manager went and hid in the back while he sent the waitress to apologize over and over again.  When I called to talk directly to the manager, he said he "doesn't even know what to say, except sorry."  Again, every other Giordano's I've been to is phenomenal.  This one is a train wreck.  AVOID!

27.description: One of the better deep dish pizzas in the area. I swear it is better than at other Giordano's locations! Appetizers leave something to be desired, but pizza is great! Recently tried their eggplant parm dish family style. It was pretty good, and for around $20 we got enough food for five people easy. We had leftovers for a few meals the next couple of days--it was a great deal!

32.description: I've eaten at Giordano's on two separate occasions.  Each time I wanted to dive into the deep dish pizza like Uncle Scrooge McDuck used to dive into his money bin.  I can NEVER eat more than two slices (mostly because I always have to get an appetizer first).  This is some seriously amazing pizza and if I ever find myself back in Chicago, I'm sure I will make a point to stop into one of their many locations.  You should too!!

54.description: I had drafted a review a few months ago giving this place 5 stars because I thought the stuffed pizza was so excellent.  However, I ordered a pizza about a week ago or so and ended up almost choking on a piece of copper wire that I found inside the crust.  I contacted customer service TWICE and they only thing they asked me was where I ordered from.  It was a trite email; there appeared to be no intention on their part to apologize or to make amends.  I will never order from there again, and I plan on telling everyone I know about this.  What a horrible letdown.

48.description: I don't know why it was so hard to have a competent waitress here. Our waitress acted as if she had no time to answer our questions or wait on us. I live giordanos but I will not be coming back to this giordanos.

44.description: The food at this place is pretty good.  However, if you are looking for good customer service, you might want to look elsewhere.  I have called in a number of orders to pick up over the past few months.  Each time I went in, the cashier said maybe three sentences to me: "dining in or pickup?", "What's the name", and "$X".  No have a nice day or anything.  They did the bare minimum.  I was particularly annoyed when I went in to pick up an order, and I split the cost with a friend.  I told the girl to split the payment.  She put the entire order on my credit card.  When I informed her, all she said was "oops.  Let me get my manager."  That's it.  No apology or anything.  The manager wasn't much better.  He came over to the cash register, pressed some buttons, and fixed it.  However, upon leaving, there was no "sorry for the inconvenience" or "thank you for your patience", nothing.  This is not the only time that I have had such lousy customer service.  It is just about every time I go in there, save for 1 or 2 times.  The majority of the time, there is just some young kid, with a neutral expression, who does the bare minimum, in terms of customer service.While I have frequented this place, I can definitely say that I am just about ready to give up on them.  While the food is good (hence the 3 stars), I'd rather spare myself the irritation of the zombie-like customer service.

24.description: I haven't dined in but they have always been very professional and helpful on the phone, no attitude, speaking clearly and accurate - A rare find these days with any customer service. It is much appreciated. Thanks.

7.description: Great Food, has become my go to place for pizza and chicken parm sandwiches. Must try!

49.description: I'm so surprised to read negative feedback from others as my experience was a true delight.This was my first time to this Giordano's on Broadway near Loyola.  The food was awesome.  I'm a native New Yorker and biased to thin crust but must admit the Giordano's deep dish with pepperoni that I had was amazing.  Our waitress Cecilia (sp?) was very friendly and did a good job in taking care of our group of 8.  Jennifer and John (management) were really nice and I can't thank them enough for their hospitality and kindness (they actually donated about $100 worth of food towards a charity I am involved with).  VERY nice and shows the character of the family that owns this location.I look forward to going back again and my positive review is based solely on the quality of the food (excellent) and the service (excellent) from this first visit there.  It has nothing to do with their generous act.  Should the food and service been sub-par, I would have simply not reviewed.For those with bad experiences, I'd give this Giordano's location another shot.

40.description: Yay! I'm a fan.Thin or thick crust, this Giordano's location consistently serves up some delicious pizza. Mainly I order online through their well organized, user-friendly website, and have also to applaud their friendly, polite, well dressed, neat and timely delivery people. I've only eaten a few times in-house with S. and sometimes her mom. The atmosphere is charmingly neat and old fashioned Disney movie pizza place, including red and white gingham printed table cloths and framed, old Chicago memorabilia. Kind of cliche.' Okay, truly cliche.' Servers always have been more than friendly and efficient enough (Erin is especially cheerful and charming). There is a smallish outdoor area on Sheridan though I've not had the pleasure. The beer is on tap and bottled, cold and reasonably priced and they serve at least one passable red wine. Their Caesar salad is pretty darned fresh and there is plenty for two adults. I admire their minestrone. S's mom adored their tira mi su. Though the pizza! It's the pizza that both thin crust and stuffed is very, very good and keeps me wanting and ordering more. Best as always,Peter O.

53.description: I love deep dish pizza! Unfortunately, Giordano's uses canned tomatoes for its "sauce." My mom visited from Georgia was completely dissapointed in her Chicago deep dish experience. There are far superior places to eat deep dish, like Gino's. There was a small puddle of water in the middle of our pizza from the canned tomatoes, and the serve said it was supposed to be like that.Not sure if this is the Evanston location or just a bad day to go, but I think I'll be visiting the several other places before I go back to find out.

30.description: I like Giordanos but this location we had a sub par deep dish pie.  Overcooked and hard crust like it sat up under heat lamp or was otherwise just not prepared very well.  Salad was pretty good.  This is the second Giordanos lately where I've been underwhelmed. Maybe just a coincidence but expansion can do this sometimes.  The atmosphere at this Rogers Park location was also very sparse and not up to G's normal level.  Service I have to say was friendly and well timed.  G's are opening a new location right down by me so I'll give that a chance.  Caution flag.

46.description: I live very close to this Giordano's so I eat here the most. I've been a fan of Giordano's since I first moved to Chicago in 2008 and I still think they have the best stuffed (deep dish) of all of the big chains. I like their new menu items including the orchard salad. I often split the salad with someone and then split the Special pizza.This location feels warmer and more inviting than most. I suppose this is because it's not in a very touristy area or a cheap strip mall. It's on a quiet corner in Rogers Park. It feels like a neighborhood pizza spot. The wait staff are mostly Loyola students and they're very nice and cheerful. I would caution anyone that with a gluten allergy that their "gluten free" menu consists of a choice of thin crust pizza or spaghetti. I live close so I'm sure I'll be back the next time I want some good pizza.

1.description: First ever Chicago deep dish that was true to it name. Loved the service and the food ... Will be back for more. Ciao for now

55.description: since i am from the ny/nj area, i am very biased to regular crust pizza.  however, giordanos in rogers park had delicious deep dish pizza.  one slice was already very filling for me.  the sauce was perfect and the cheese inside of the pizza was so delicious.  there is an ungodly amount of cheese, but thats what chicago pizza is right? i would recommend this place.  however, i would ask the locals to see which one is better because i am pretty sure there are much better deep dish pizzerias in the area.

9.description: Ordered a personal pepperoni pizza for pick up. $7.64 and 25 minutes later I had a steaming box of deliciousness. I stuffed my face with stuffed pizza and loved it. More please. Giordanos needs to move to the west coast.

26.description: Ordered a personal pepperoni pizza for pick up. $7.64 and 25 minutes later I had a steaming box of deliciousness. I stuffed my face with stuffed pizza and loved it. More please. Giordanos needs to move to the west coast.

25.description: My friends and I came on a Monday night, so it wasn't busy at all and the food was served at a very reasonable time after ordering. We ordered The Special stuffed pizza and the BBQ Chicken Lover on thin crust. Both were delicious but nothing special. It was my first time there and after hearing about Giordanos and reading the reviews, I set my standards maybe a little too high. This being a gourmet pizza place, the prices are quite high, but I didn't mind paying for the experience.

12.description: Wow what happened to this place? As you can see with my reviews, I hardly give two stars. I am a pretty positive person no matter how bad the other reviews are. And Giordano's is known to the locals as being overrated and mostly tourists like this pizza or Chicago transplants,but we still liked them despite the hate.We have been going to this Giordano's location for quite some time but we were going so many times that we had to chill out. Two years later and I am so disappointed. Pizza slices are small and not the usual huge pieces that you expect for deep dish pizza. I wish I had a picture but we tried it one last time and the pizza was so flat that it was not a deep dish pizza at all, completely deflated dry crust. It was horrible. We are not one to throw food away so we ate it,and we called them to let them know we were completely not happy. They offered to make us a new one but we were not looking for a free hand out. The owner or manager looked strung out too when we told him in person about it and showed them the pizza.Looks like Giordano's is downsizing in quality and opening more locations instead which is bizarre. I should have been charged a thin crust pizza instead of deep dish. What a rip off.We are switching to Lou Malnati's. Bye bye Giordano's.

59.description: Giordano's has become my go-to pizza place for out-of-town visitors. Though it's definitely not my personal favorite, it's a good intro to Chicago-style pizza. Of the 3 locations I've visited, this one is definitely my favorite. A small note for the budget-conscious/bargain-hunter: everything here is big enough to share for lunch- sandwiches and salads included. Favorite menu item: the greek salad. When I discovered it, I had to have it twice in the same week. So good.

21.description: I love this place!The owner is really sweet and always wants to make sure everyone leaves happy and with full bellies. All the servers are fantastic. I've had a few different servers everytime I've been there and they're always super friendly! The pizza!!! Stuffed is the way to go. Tastes amazing and it's HUGE! The prices seem steep at first, then you see how much pizza you get and its totally worth every penny! I recommend spinach and bacon on every stuffed pizza!

17.description: The phone order staff needs work - the young, college-aged male working the evening of 2/27 told me he had 'no clue' about the price of our pizza and was dismissive when (politely) asked for an explanation of the tax -- which he initially over-charged.Hint to management: the pizza is pretty well-made, but it doesn't serve itself.

10.description: Words cannot even explain how upset I am with the customer service at almost every giordanos on the northside. I ordered from the one on montrose as a dine in and was ignored. I order from the one on clark as a delivery and they got it mixed up and put it for pick up and when i went to pick it up after learning it would be ANOTHER hour to get it delivered they tried to pass off the delivery charge on me too??? I was certain that maybe third time was a charm and ordered from the rogers park location and i was dead WRONG! it was worse, the food was late and upon arrival our 2 2-liters were missing and the ranch dressing tasted like garlic dressing. The poor driver had to go to the store and get our 2 liters. ( i wouldnt have cared if i hadnt already paid) but after a whole night of throwing up their BLAND pizza i checked and the sodas were expired... I will never order from here or any giordanos ever again!!! Thank you rogers park location for making this the cherry on top of the sundae. When i called to complain, the manager told me that the pop didnt make me sick all night it was just flat, and was basically telling me i was wrong... Working in a resturant business thats where she crossed the line. I will be having my husband go down there and get a full refund.

5.description: No complaints about this place, the service, and food was great. I will definitely return in the future.

3.description: I was really surprised at the quality of the pizza sauce since this is a chain that is very popular. I ordered an extra thin crust pizza while a friend got a deep dish. Both of us found the sauce to be super water. Her way of enhancing it was dumping a bunch of pepper on it while I asked for ranch sauce. But to be fair, the extra thin crust was very crisp and thin though it wasn't super light. Between this chain and Lou Malnati's I would pick the latter. Or even if you're in the area and looking for pizza, walk the extra block to JB Alberto's. I got their BBQ chicken wing appetizers which was tasty. The wings were fried and then smothered in BBQ sauce and it was definitely the highlight of my meal though a tad expensive as a $10 appetizer. But overall this place is a bit pricey for mediocre pizza.

35.description: I love giordanos.. Before coming in make sure you call in to order your food, unless you don't mind a 30+minutes waiting.Do not come here, if you super hungry. Unfortunately I made that mistake. The place is nice, I like the vibe. The waiters and waitress are really nice.I recommend this place! Go!

19.description: After going back to Giordano's a couple more times, I have to increase my rating from 3 stars to 4.  The problems of food not being ready in a reasonable time have not happened again, and I have tried a couple more of their pizzas, and everything has been delicious.  Given that they are about 3 blocks from my house, Giordano's is definitely my go-to pizza place.

28.description: Pizza is 4/5, atmosphere is what you'd expect from a place like this, waiter I had was great 5/5, price is on the high side for most items, especially pizza, drink prices are about average. Got served timely and enjoyed my visit.

45.description: The beer list is too limited and the appetizer quality was poor... its a shame this institution stands to represent Chicago to tourists as a great example of for our cuisine.

33.description: I went here for lunch a few weeks ago and we ordered the stuffed pizza, but they got the order wrong. On the bright side the waitress was extremely nice and they gave us a 10% discount on the bill. On the bright side, the pizza tasted excellent.

43.description: I recently went here with my girlfriend on a Saturday night (in the Summer) and we sat out on the patio.  It's a really nice little spot to relax and have a drink and some pizza.  The restaurant is a little older looking and it's not exactly the most glamorous spot on Sheridan Rd., but, it also wasn't super-crowded and we were served instantly with appetizers, drinks, and big glasses of water.The pizza was delicious and just as I remembered it and our server was super-nice and friendly.  They had a couple of beers on draft too (Goose Island Green Line is what I ordered) and I think they were around $4.25 a pint, which I thought was pretty reasonable.All in all - if you're craving a little Chicago deep dish and in the area, I'd recommend this location for sure.

2.description: I would like to start this Review with a bit of History..In the year 1974 Efren and Joseph Boglio opened the firstGiordano's on Chicago's South Side.And, through out the years Giordano's has been acclaimed withthe Title of Chicago's Best Pizza by CBS Chicago, NBC,The Today Show, Chicago Magazine and the Chicago Tribune toname a few.I will now name this portion of my Review Oops I did it again..Ever since my Heart Attack in March I can honestly say thatmy eating habits have become much more healthy..I eat lotsa salad, and I'm sure the Nation's Bunnies are nothappy at me cause I'm eating up a vast portion of theirlettuce supply..But, Okay, every now and then I get cravings, and yes, unfortunatelyPizza is one of those cravings..So, last night during one of my cravings I made a call into Giordano'sin Rogers Park.And, yes, I ordered a Stuffed Sausage and Roast Beef Pizzawith light cheese and light sauce..And, Toasted Meat Ravioli..And, upon arrival, our pizza was still steaming hot, and definitelypicture worthy if you'd take a peek at my pic!Now, in all honesty, the Ravioli was a bit overdone around the edgesbut after I dunked them in the marinara sauce they were tasty enough..Giordano's menu prices seem pretty comparable to the otherpizza places so I really can't complain there..However, they charged us a delivery fee of $4.05 nd they are onlylike 6 blocks away!So, props going out to Giordano's for a pretty fine tastingStuffed Pizza..Not so many props on the Ravioli..And, that delivery fee, that really sucked!!Oh, and props to Britney Spears for Oops I did it again,,Hey, I may be 54 but I'm hip to Britney...Gotta admit, I like residing in East Rogers Park..And, I like Giordano's...

18.description: I love their extra thin crust pizza and their stuffed. This review is mainly for the buffalo style wings appetizer. I get them well done aka fried hard. They are so fresh and of great quality. A perfect size in my opinion. They're not jumbo which is what I love. The sauce is perfect. They are better than many places that I can think of off the top of my head that are known for wings. Just perfect! Add some pizza and....delish!

41.description: My guy and I went here on Friday night. The place was moderately busy, but with lots of open tables. We were seated in a booth, and then we waited. And waited. Five minutes, ten minutes... we were actively trying to catch a staffer's eye or flag someone down, but no one seemed to be paying attention. This, despite there being a lot of servers milling around.Fifteen minutes in, a large party of ten or so came in, was seated at a table RIGHT next to our booth, and was immediately served. We hadn't even been offered water or checked on once. We got up in disgust and left. One of the other servers actually chirped "Have a great night!" as we walked out the door. Well, we walked down the street to Leona's and had a very nice meal with attentive service. Seating your customers and then remembering they exist: not exactly rocket science.

52.description: I really don't like leaving low ratings for a good place like this, but this was outrageous.We ordered pizza at 11pm.  Granted, it was Christmas Eve but their online ordering system said they were OPEN and it would be 60-70 minutes for pizza.  Those 70 minutes went by...and a lot more.  We figured that with it being Christmas Eve and the only ones open, there must be a delay in delivery time and waited patiently.Fast forward to now...THREE HOURS & FIFTEEN MINUTES later; when we've tried to call they aren't answering their phone and their site is now listed as CLOSED.WTF?!  If you weren't going to be processing an order for us because you were closing, at least have the DECENCY to call and tell us, especially since your system accepted our credit card payment!!!  Then, at least, we could've gotten something else to eat instead of sitting around STARVING.How many other orders were paid for and never got past "preparation" stage in the order tracking system that you conveniently just left behind??NOT HAPPY.  :(

50.description: One of my favorite 'fixes' when I visit Chicago -- cheesy deep dish pizza with sausage, Chicago-style. Our evening here on a vacation visit in April 2012 lived up to our expectations, and our server was friendly and excellent.

4.description: Ahh Chicago Deep Dish. A good friend of mine always tells me that he doesn't consider it pizza. I totally understand that idea, especially after growing up in New York City. With that in mind:Firstly, the restaurant decor is your typical pizzeria restaurant. However, since this is a chain, it has a chainy Italian feel to it. It may not necessarily be best, but, it does the job.Secondly, you're talking to a die hard pizza fan. So, I'm going to be a little critic in this review.I got a sausage deep dish, and honestly, the pie seemed a little dry, overall. I would say it was definitely filling because I ate three slices and I could barely walking out of the restaurant, but, it seemed A-OK (just as my Yelp star rating says).Deep dish is an interesting concept, but, not exactly my favorite version of pizza. It is definitely filling though!

6.description: Things started off on the wrong foot for this location, but improved by the end of our experience. We have been in town for a week and planned to end the trip with a Chicago treat. Since we have Chicago style pizza places back in SF, I knew that I should place my order ahead to ensure that it would be ready for dinner. We had to drive up to Glenview before dinner, so we placed our order online at 4:30, ordering a stuffed pizza and a Cesar salad, for pick up at 6:30. We received the confirmation email that the order was received right away, but as we were in Glenview, we received another email at about 6:02 pm confirming our order again. Weird since I had placed it awhile ago. When we arrived at 6:28, my father went in to retrieve the pizza and was told that there had been a problem with the systems and our pizza wouldn't be ready for 30 minutes. WHUT?I went into the store and asked (kindly) for an explanation. They explained that the order went to corporate, but not to their store, and that they had just entered the order. That's nice, but I'm hungry. I asked them what they could do to remedy the situation. Angel, offered to remove the price of the salad from my order. I countered that they also deliver the pizza, since we were now inconvenienced because of the error on their part. He agreed and said that my refund would be on my card in 2-3 days. I'm happy to say that it was delivered promptly and was DELICIOUS!! Great customer service and I appreciate them working to fix the mistake.

22.description: Wow what happened to this place? As you can see with my reviews, I hardly give two stars. I am a pretty positive person no matter how bad the other reviews are. And Giordano's is known to the locals as being overrated and mostly tourists like this pizza or Chicago transplants,but we still liked them despite the hate.We have been going to this Giordano's location for quite some time but we were going so many times that we had to chill out. Two years later and I am so disappointed. Pizza slices are small and not the usual huge pieces that you expect for deep dish pizza. I wish I had a picture but we tried it one last time and the pizza was so flat that it was not a deep dish pizza at all, completely deflated dry crust. It was horrible. We are not one to throw food away so we ate it,and we called them to let them know we were completely not happy. They offered to make us a new one but we were not looking for a free hand out. The owner or manager looked strung out too when we told him in person about it and showed them the pizza.Looks like Giordano's is downsizing in quality and opening more locations instead which is bizarre. I should have been charged a thin crust pizza instead of deep dish. What a rip off.We are switching to Lou Malnati's. Bye bye Giordano's.

15.description: Waited a few days to write this review after our horrendous experience. We were visiting from out of town and had waited months for deep dish. We usually go to Gino's East but didn't feel like venturing downtown. So we ordered online from this location for delivery to my brothers place (less than a mile from the store) figuring it would be faster. We were quoted an hour - typical time for a deep dish. After 1.5 hours and no pizza, we called to check on the status. The worker apologized and said our pizza was on the way and would be there in 5 minutes. Half hour later, still no food. We called again and asked to speak to the manager. He only wanted to give us $15 back on a $55 order. The food arrived minutes later. No apology from the driver. Salad was warm and wilted. Pizza was cold and had to be heated for awhile in the oven. The manager then proceeded to argue about comping our meal and then after a few minutes said he could give us $50 credit on next order. Really, he's arguing about $5 at this point? Needless to say, even with credit, would be hard pressed to order here again. Which is a shame, because the pizza was good even reheated.

57.description: They are overpriced and have mediocre food for what you're expecting to get. The sitting area is extremely cramped and the staff are not very pleasant.  There are plenty of better restaurants in this neighborhood.

20.description: Waited a few days to write this review after our horrendous experience. We were visiting from out of town and had waited months for deep dish. We usually go to Gino's East but didn't feel like venturing downtown. So we ordered online from this location for delivery to my brothers place (less than a mile from the store) figuring it would be faster. We were quoted an hour - typical time for a deep dish. After 1.5 hours and no pizza, we called to check on the status. The worker apologized and said our pizza was on the way and would be there in 5 minutes. Half hour later, still no food. We called again and asked to speak to the manager. He only wanted to give us $15 back on a $55 order. The food arrived minutes later. No apology from the driver. Salad was warm and wilted. Pizza was cold and had to be heated for awhile in the oven. The manager then proceeded to argue about comping our meal and then after a few minutes said he could give us $50 credit on next order. Really, he's arguing about $5 at this point? Needless to say, even with credit, would be hard pressed to order here again. Which is a shame, because the pizza was good even reheated.

36.description: I have been here many many times. Pizza is very good. Drinks are OK. Service seems to be delivered  with very little urgency, but not awful. Please bring back the anti pasto salad! It was my favorite item on the planet and you took it from me!!!!Otherwise, pretty good pizza joint.

14.description: Delicious pizza and wonderful service.  This place was so good that my mom and I came here twice during our visit to Chicago.The first time we came, we ordered the thin crust super veggie pizza.  We didn't have to wait too long and it tasted so good.  The second time we came, we ordered the cheese stuffed pizza.  It was absolutely scrumptious (although I would ask for less cheese next time), but we had to wait 45 minutes.  Big mistake when you're famished!  I would suggest calling ahead or starting with an appetizer.  I have to say though, it was just as delicious as Lou Malnati's, yet with a slightly different crust.I was very pleased with the service both times.  Our waiters couldn't have been nicer.  Plus, we were seated immediately.  I think this location must be off the beaten path, and therefore does not get as busy.  My only complaint is the prices.  I think paying almost $20 for a small, veggie deep dish is pretty outrageous.  I know they boast having more ingredients, but give me a break.If you want to stuff yourself with some delicious deep dish and don't mind the price or the wait, come to Giordano's.

0.description: This guy is a crook.  He buys stuff on Ebay and resells it.  He "bought" stuff from me.  I sent it to him, naively, because I didn't know how Ebay works.  Then he never paid me.  $450 in the toilet   Don't do business with this slime.

Took a trip to Chicago and I stopped by Laced Up for some kicks. Not only did the store had huge selection but the people there were super friendly. I was looking for a rare shoe and they hooked up me good!

28.description: We ordered Two Extra Spicy Kung Pao Chickens with Egg Rolls and Fresh Fruit Smoothies. I explained to my out of town friend that this restaurant uses top grade fresh veggies, and that the Chicken and Beef is of good quality, cooked to order. The egg-rolls are even hand rolled and deep-fried to perfection. I absolutely love ordering take out from here and the staff does like to interact with their patrons. It was in the evening and the total prep time for out food was probably about 25 minutes from phone order to pick up. The Smoothies are made fresh, The Mango is good but on this particular day I ordered a Papaya mixed with Watermelon which comes with the Tapioca Balls. The smoothies are very on point and I sometimes drop in to order one after leaving the gym. This Kitchen does take time for the food preparation but I really appreciate the extra work they put into their dishes. - Much Love

1.description: Orange chicken does not taste like oranges at all. Place is over priced.  They charge you an arm and a leg for fried rice while everywhere else it's included.  Go to Hong Kong Restaurant for included fried rice and the Fung's Mandarin Cuisine for great pricing and selection

9.description: I enjoyed Far East Kitchen a lot. I had the Bo Kho, which is a Vietnamese beef stew, with rice as well as a BBQ pork Bahn Mi. The Bo Kho was very rich and the beef was tender. The soup in the stew was sweet and creamy and paired well with the rice. As the chef suggested, I dipped the soaked the bread from my Bahn Mi in the stew and the combination was amazing. The Bahn Mi itself was decent, but not great. It was a little hard to bite, but the pork inside it was good. I decided to just eat the pork and soak the rest of the Bahn Mi in the stew, which was a great choice. My only complaint with the place is that in the picture, the Bo Kho had tripe in it but when I got the soup, there was no tripe. The chef said this is because most customers do not like tripe and he had to throw away a lot of the tripe. I hope that this changes in the future! As Phulia suggested, definitely order the Vietnamese food! The people working here are Vietnamese and they specialize in Vietnamese food.

29.description: First time ordering tonight. Food was descent - egg roll were done to perfection. Chicken Egg Foo Young was good had enough sauce came with a good amount of scallions. Combination fried rice was good only down side the couple pieces of shrimp had a slight fishy smell. Pulled them out and rest of rice was fine.Will try again but not combo rice.

23.description: Don't let the humble appearance of the building inside fool you.  Menu is blend of Chinese & Vietnamese, has generous portions, and great quality.  I love the Pho here!  (And I'm a Pho snob!)The Shrimp Summer Rolls have HUGE shrimp in them and some of the best peanut sauce I've ever had!This is definitely my go to spot for Pho!  I made the mistake of trying a chain Pho restaurant, Bahn Mi & Co.  Was HORRIBLY disappointed.  Small business quality is where it' AT!

5.description: It was a new place I was trying out and the delivery service was quick and my food was delicious

31.description: Ordered lunch for take out with a friend. With one order ahead of us and our two orders, we waited a total of 20 minutes for our food. I thought this was quite quick!Although there are seats to eat at a counter, this place is definitely a delivery or dine out place. Moderately price. My lunch special cost roughly $8.I ordered the Sweet and Sour Chicken lunch special which came with fried rice an egg roll. The sweet and sour sauce was delicious as was the fried rice and egg roll. I'd definitely try again.

25.description: Absolutely love this place! The food is very, very delicious! You can taste every ingredient that they put in, the chicken, beef, and pork, everything is delicious! But what I like most about this place is the food is very healthy.

12.description: "Oh you like it hot? I make you cry, I make it so hot you CRY!"Whoa.I order an obscene amount of Vietnamese food for a single person on a Wednesday night. I'm evidently entitled to a choice of three complimentary Chinese side dishes. Two were breaded like mummies and fried like Nevada asphalt. One was chicken fried rice. I ask for the rice,  heavy on the chicken and as little rice as possible. And as spicy as possible. No--spicier. *cashier points to men sitting at the window* "You know why I say that?" *men look at me like, "whoa"**I return the look like, "OMG play along, they still haven't made my food yet"*"Because the last guy who said he wanted the food so, so spicy? He said, 'I want to cry while eating it, I want to cry!' So I make it that hot--SO hot! HOT"WHOA.In due fairness, I instigated the hyperactive conversational tone by running down my list of dietary demands like greased lightning, and my fellow Jenny ("NOT Jennifer--Jenny--easy to remember, right Jennifer?!") kept up without breaking a sweat. Wanted something with avocado, they had nothing--except avocado smoothies which are usually sweet enough to make me lose a tooth by looking at them. She offered to make a non-sweetened version, "No condensed milk, no syrup, nothing." Wanted little to no salt in my food, "Oh girl, we got this." Wanted my summer rolls with as little rice vermicelli as possible. They substituted bean sprouts. So this place is actually within walking distance of my place in Rogers Park...and actually makes surprisingly decent Vietnamese food?I've always been hesitant to order from here, as the reviews are either great or abysmal. But I finally gave in yesterday and don't regret doing so. Having said that, I can't really address the main themes of the critical reviews--this place's delivery and their Chinese food. For all I know, you order General Tso's chicken at 3pm, it arrives at 10:30pm and resembles Kublai Khan's...something...of his you don't want anywhere near you, much less with a packet of soy sauce.Which is why my common sense kicked in when I was hungry enough to devour a Khan kebob, and I walked to the restaurant and ordered what I sensed they made best. My initial impression was that everyone who worked there was so incredibly personable. One of the cooks even greeted me while never looking up from an intense wok shake session, as if his life depended upon the perfect saute. And then Ms. Jenny appeared out of nowhere. Literally, it was Bewitching. My food could've been 100% breakfast-for-squirrels quality (what? They like pho!), but she literally would bring me back just for her personality.But since I finally got to reviewing the food...I ordered each variety of their summer rolls and too much pho. My name is Jennifer, and I'm a pho ho. The rolls were alright--enough protein to balance the veggies, the peanut sauce was more smokey than spicy with just enough sweetness. Nothing remarkable, nothing critter-brunch level. Didn't get around to eating the pho until today--which allowed me to examine it in all of its gelatinous glory (which was a reassuring plus in itself--doubting the broth was canned). Was actually able to skim about a millimeter (give or take some layers) of solidified fat from the top of the broth. There could have been more protein (I had the meatball and beef) and fewer noodles, but everything combined was quite flavorful, light but filling, and a great dinner.Was my food as nuanced and "authentic" as some I've had down by Argyle? No...but am I really comparing a hole-in-the-wall place in Rogers Park to Little Vietnam? Pho no!But when I want to stay local and still enjoy one of my fave cuisines, will this place suffice?Yes, more than enough. It doesn't have an impressive facade, it attracts all walks of life from this neighborhood, and don't even bother trying to eat your meal there unless you like cramped quarters. But go anyway. And ask for Jenny.[And if you're a heat fiend? Ask for your food so spicy it makes you want to go medieval Kublai on someone. My food didn't make me cry, I sniffled and doused the rice with homemade scotch bonnet/habanero sauce...but they tried.]

21.description: I dunno man. I've just had better Chinese food elsewhere.So it was a Tuesday and I was craving Chinese, and Great Wall on Pratt & Sheridan is closed Tuesdays. So I settled on Far East because it was cheap and close. Ordered through GrubHub, and an hour later I had some definitely not piping hot sweet and sour chicken and the most mediocre crab rangoons. It wasn't awful, just not up to the quality of regular Chinese food...I'm not a picky takeout eater.

16.description: I will only eat chinese food from this place! Trust me, when it comes to chinese food or asian food I am by the far the pickiest person. The food is always flavorful! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The staff of Far East Kitchen is the most kind and warning people ever, you can tell they truly care about each costumer. So before you judge the place by the location or how it looks you should try out their food first. It definitely worth it!

17.description: ok..my local shout out.....Far East has an incredible staff which you can tell immediately is family. Full of closeness and teamwork, just walking in makes you feel good that you are there.From the more recognizable menu items to the true Viet selections, there is something to please everyone who is searching for the flavors of the East.I have not indulged in too many items but did fall in love with the combination fried rice. The shrimp dishes are done with impeccable perfection noting that the shrimp are genuinely jumbo and cooked so they are tender springy not rubbery or hard.Always a plus. This last order, altho, in error they had given me Beef with Pea Pod in lieu of the Beef with Broccoli I had initially requested, but not an unpleasant variation to a delightful veggie so no complaints here. Just make sure if u pick up to sneak a peek.This small take out(also delivery) establishment is a wonderful staple in this Rogers Park neighborhood and truly worth a visit when u have a craving for good fresh ingredients and a sincere appreciative smile from a family owned proud business.  If you had a late night or a long day at work, getting off the train at Morse or Lunt...no time to cook..please...visit Far East....Fresh Hot Definitely Tasty Genuine. A Major yes..will repeat.

10.description: No online menu nor a website to see what they offer, so they won't be getting my money

11.description: Yuck! I ordered sesame chicken and crab rangoon on Grub Hub. The chicken looked like chicken tenders rolled around in some light colored sauce, smelled like wet dog, and the meat had this unnatural purple color. Completely inedible and I threw the entire container out. The rangoon is mostly the fried part, some cream, really light on the imitation crab. I guess I'm just grateful that this all came with a safe looking side of white rice. Needless to say, $20 and some white rice later, I will absolutely NOT be ordering from this restaurant again. If I wanted rice for dinner I could have saved the money and the hour of waiting and just made some myself!

26.description: Awesome every time!!! Lemon grass chicken rocks!!! I like the fact that Jenny the owner always greets me with a smile and remembers my name. Best in the area in my opinion!!!

27.description: This place is great!  Super cheap, tons of food and it's delicious!  It's our go to Chinese take out spot.  They are also very fast.  Wonton soup and Mongolian anything is awesome.

35.description: This is my first Yelp review inspired by how bad this place is. I was surprised it wasn't on Yelp already. This is literally the worst Chinese food I've ever had and maybe the worst food I've ever paid $10 a plate for. The Lo-Mein noodles are literally cooked noodles without any sauce and uncooked vegetables piled on top. It took them 35 minutes for them to finish cooking my food as well. Do not go here, there are other Chinese options within a couple of blocks well worth the walk.

8.description: If you're looking for excellent Vietnamese food, head over to Argyle street. For a quick, inexpensive bite in Roger's Park, make this your go-to location. The little son of the owner is quite hilarious as well.

0.description: Why order deep fried chicken chunks covered in sugar sauce when you can get the fresh Vietnamese food here instead?  Well, unless of course you are in the mood for that, and really, who could blame you?  'Murica!But seriously-- the Vietnamese food here is super fresh and delicious.  I ordered my favorite, Banh Xeo (savory crepe) and the spring rolls.  Very good food!

My food didn't make me cry, I sniffled and doused the rice with homemade scotch bonnet/habanero sauce...but they tried.]

19.description: Don't let the humble appearance of the building inside fool you.  Menu is blend of Chinese & Vietnamese, has generous portions, and great quality.  I love the Pho here!  (And I'm a Pho snob!)The Shrimp Summer Rolls have HUGE shrimp in them and some of the best peanut sauce I've ever had!This is definitely my go to spot for Pho!  I made the mistake of trying a chain Pho restaurant, Bahn Mi & Co.  Was HORRIBLY disappointed.  Small business quality is where it' AT!

33.description: I tried this place for the first time yesterday hoping for a Banh Mi shop and in that regard was disappointed that a Vietnamese restaurant doesn't have those on their menu.  But I opted instead for a standard Chinese dish of Kung Pao Beef and it was better than expected from a little hole in the wall.  Maybe I'm less picky than some, but I thought the staff were respectful, responsive and made my food quickly.  I got take-out so I wasn't there to see how I'd be treated in the cafe, but I don't have much concern that I would have been treated in a similar fashion as I had already been.  My food was ready within 5 minutes of ordering. This is a very small cafe with little seating and it's difficult to see unless you walk past it right on that side of Glenwood, but I'm glad it's in the neighborhood.  I live right in the area and it's nice to have something other than a grill in the direct vicinity.  I hope more of these stretches on Glenwood start inviting in good restaurants like this one.  And hopefully they'll read this and add banh mi sandwiches!

2.description: I came here for a bubble tea and Sadly it was Not good. The Taro "tea" was very bland and the bubbles were extremely mushy ( not fresh). I wanted to give the place a try since it is a family restaurant but the bubble tea didn't work at all. The Pad Thai had a good flavor but not enough vegetables. As a family owned business I would concentrate in making really strong products people would know me for. It is extremely difficult to be competitive with bubble tea which is priced as high as machine made bubble tea from companies like vivi but which do not come close to its quality.

34.description: This place used to Ms. Egg Roll #2. Recently, new owners have moved in under the name Far East Kitchen. The food is better but the service wholly and completely unacceptable. I was treated with utter disdain and pure disrespect. Under no circumstances will I ever spend another penny in this place.Here's the story:I'd tried this place a few times before and I was glad that the quality of the food was much better than the previous occupants. I came in on a Saturday night at around 7pm. Once I entered, I witnessed the two gentlemen behind the counter screaming at each other. Full volume screaming. The louder of the 2 men left. Once he left, I placed my order and paid for it. I ordered a large chicken egg foo young. They aren't the fastest at getting food out but I was okay with that. I decided to go get some things at 7-Eleven and come back. When I got back, I was sure my order would be ready, as I was gone longer than I intended to be. I placed my order at 7:10 according to the time stamp on my receipt. I returned at 7:40. I had been gone a full 30 minutes. The guy who took my order tells me "I'm making your order now." He then goes in the fridge and put the ingredients for my food in the pan. So...he STARTED my order a half hour after I ordered it.I said nothing because I was curious as to how this guy would handle this situation. As he made my order, he did not say anything else to me. It took him 15 minutes to make the food. He bagged my order and handed it to me at 7:55. After giving me my order, he simply turned away to go back to what he was doing. I decided to give him another out. I said, "I just know that there's an extra egg roll in here or something." Did not raise my voice or have any malice in my tone. The guy tells me, "You get an egg roll when you spend 15 dollars. You order wasn't that much." To summarize, it took 45 MINUTES to make an order of egg foo young.I left. I knew I had to leave at that moment because I would have gone off on the guy and I didn't want to give him any excuse for fucking up so badly.I decided to go in the next day they were open (Monday) and give the guy a chance to explain himself or make it right. I used to work in restaurants. Shit happens. So I'm not the type to jump all over people when they mess up. Making a scene or throwing a tantrum isn't my style anyway. And I won't make this a cultural or racial issue because I've been eating Chinese and other Asian food all my life and most of my experiences are positive. The food is good and the people are nice.I went in and in a hushed tone so not to influence the other customers, I recount the situation to the guy. He gets offended. He says, "So what do you want?"I say, "You took almost an hour to complete an order and you have no explanation?" Still being calm with this guy. He gets even more irritated and says "you want me to say 'sorry'? you want something else?"I tell him "I shouldn't have to prompt you to apologize for unacceptable service, but the least you can do is apologize. Or if you're having a busy night, you can ask if the customers if they mind waiting a little longer. You shouldn't start an order 30 minutes after it has been placed."He say "Sorry." flippantly but then immediately follows that with "it don't hurt me any"I asked him what he meant. He says it again "it don't hurt me any. you want me to say sorry, I said sorry"I said, "That's fine. I won't come here anymore." He says "Okay, don't come here."I was able to keep my cool because I kind of expected this reaction from him(see my review about China Spring on Clark and Lunt). I was just hoping that he would prove me wrong and be decent about the situation.So there it is. Far East Kitchen doesn't give a fuck about you as a customer, they just want your money. If that's how much they value their customers, I can only imagine what level of care they put into making their food.BTW, this guy was taking money and making food at the same time. He was wearing one latex glove but he was handling some of the food with his bare hand. Some people might not be comfortable with that. I can't predict what your experience will be, but dine at your own risk.

32.description: The meat in garlic sauce taste weird, you guys should not use onion instead of green onion, also there are no wood ear and bamboo shoots which are necessary.

18.description: hole in the wall off the red line very authentic asian foodbahn mi was very good and for a great priceowner is a nice gentleman also

13.description: I dunno man. I've just had better Chinese food elsewhere.So it was a Tuesday and I was craving Chinese, and Great Wall on Pratt & Sheridan is closed Tuesdays. So I settled on Far East because it was cheap and close. Ordered through GrubHub, and an hour later I had some definitely not piping hot sweet and sour chicken and the most mediocre crab rangoons. It wasn't awful, just not up to the quality of regular Chinese food...I'm not a picky takeout eater.

4.description: I got delivery and they came fast, but they got my entire order wrong and didn't include a fortune cookie. It was disappointing when I was really looking forward to eating some Chinese food

24.description: I generally order my Chinese takeout from a place up in Evanston... but the delivery guy can sometimes be creepy/odd, and the buzzer in my new place isn't working... so I decided to walk over to Far East Kitchen and check it out.It's a hole in the wall for sure, but well, I sort of love places like that. You order from the window counter, and there are seats by the window if you want to dine-in. There are a lot of signs taped up below the ordering counter with various menu items and specials and pictures of bubble teas.I ordered beef lo mein and kung pao chicken. They made it fresh, and were ok with my special request (no bell peppers). This gives me hope that when I want a banh mi sandwich I'll be able to get it without cilantro.First up, there's just one size for lo mein -- HUGE. I've never seen a takeout container that size. But I welcome that since one of the main reasons to get takeout is so you'll have leftovers all week.All the food I got was good, though I will say it's not exactly what I'm used to getting when I order these items. The noodes in the lo mein are different, and there are more veggies. The kung pao is different too -- and not as spicy as I was expecting. But, as I mentioned, it's all really good. They threw in 2 egg rolls for free, and typically I hate egg rolls, but I even liked these. Especially when dipped in the kung pao sauce.I will definitely be back and look forward to getting to know this little place a lot better.

6.description: First time order and I will be back. The Summer Shrimp Rolls on the Vietnamese Specialties part of the menu are terrific. The Chicken with Onions and Peppers was good, but I didn't have dreams about it. Certainly in the top 2 Asian Cuisine restaurants near the Morse Red Line stop.

22.description: Never again.  Ordered first time and received incorrect food and it was cold.  Called them and was  told it was too late for them to make it and deliver it.  They  asked me to try again.   I tried again. .completely messed up order.  Cold.  Stale just nasty!  save your money and try somewhere else!

15.description: Honestly I'm a HUGE CHINESE FOOD FAN, and eaten from MANY Chinese restaurants and WOW, I've lived in Rogers park for 5 years and just ordered from this restaurant, and must say one of the BEST CHINESE FOOD IVE EVER HAD.. May I add in very picky and a tuff critic.. The only way I write a review that's great is if it's DUE!! I know where I'm ordering a lot from!

7.description: Pro tip: Order the Vietnamese food. I'm pretty sure these hustlers know how to keep a business afloat. What do Americans think of when they hear 'Asian food'? Chinese, so it's what they keep in stock. The gold lies in the Viet food though, which is why you've had better Chinese food elsewhere. Just keep that in mind the next time you throw your beef broccoli or orange chicken out.Like most Vietnamese entrepreneurs, they cover their bases with fresh staples, and some fillers for people who want the typical shit, like general tso's and crab rangoon. If you wanna be basic, fine. But if you wanna support these folks, try what they're good at. The pho won't disappoint. They're real nice here too.

36.description: Crispy Vietnamese Crepes- NOT.  These are SOGGY, OILY Vietnamese crepes.  The flavors were fine, the sauce was great, but the whole crepe was sitting in a pool  of oil.  These crepes can be torn apart, rolled in the romaine leaves, and eaten with your hands.  I first put napkins under it to try to soak up the oil.  These were completely saturated and the crepes were still dripping.  Also, the shrimp were sliced into thin halves and some were not deveined.  I was really hoping this unassuming place would have great crepes, and they COULD if they just used 70% less oil.  The staff were very nice, but I can't understand why they would serve one of their specialties this way.

30.description: Pretty standard Chinese takeout food with surprisingly high quality. The prices are pretty middle of the road, but the food is pretty solid and the servings are more than generous. This is a great place to stop by on the way home from work to grab a quick bite. They're always pretty speedy if you stop in, so you never have to wait long. The staff is great and super friendly.

3.description: Their shrimp is the best I have ever tasted.One of the best Asian restaurants I have tried. BIG LIKE.

14.description: I like this place a lot, granted their menu has changed for not the better but its still good Chinese food. The people are friendly and food is good. I wusually get the same thing when I go there: chicken fried rice with wings but since that is gone from their menu I ordered the assorted plate. That expereice went has the following: shrimp toast was soggy. Crab Rangoon was not fresh and the egg rolls could have been fried a bit longer. The chicken sticks were okay.

58.description: I used to come here when I used to date a guy that lived around the corner.  That was many MANY years ago & the place has grown considerably since then.  They offer a larger variety of produce & spices; not bad for a local market!

56.description: Nice small neighborhood market near the Morse red line station. Their produce is pretty good and reasonably priced. The meat selection is also pretty good. However, the groceries themselves are much more expensive than hitting Aldi or even a Jewel or Dominicks. Also, the cashiers are not very friendly in my past experience. Overall, a nice spot to have for odds and ends, but not somewhere I would do my regular shopping at.

29.description: I just moved to Rogers Park and have been on the hunt for a good local grocery store that can hold me over between bigger trips to Food 4 Less. I LOVE the Morse Fresh Market. It is small (aisles too tight for more than 1 cart), but clean and well organized. The meat is fresh (I bought a few packages of house-made brats) and the produce is cheap (tomato pints were on sale for 79 cents!). The parking lot is a narrow one-way,  but this is definitely a store I can walk to in the future. The staff at the deli counter was helpful, and the staff at the registers were speedy. I was very surprised by their specialty cheese selection. I went in for just a few items, but left with a basket full of yummy and low-priced finds.

42.description: Morse Fresh Market is a wonderful local grocery store.  The customer service, impeccable merchandising and fresh produce makes going there a treat.  The aisles are a bit small, so go during off hours to keep from bumping into anyone.  There are lots of hidden gems throughout the store.  I highly recommend going here and help support our local businesses.

23.description: We live only one block from this market but we will never go there again. Not only are their products very expensive but the manager (elderly Hispanic gentleman) is incredibly rude. My partner and I were treated in such a rude and dismissive manner there recently that we walked out and spent our money at Jewel instead. I'd rather go a little farther and save a little money and be treated with respect than waste my money at that market. Not to mention they allow beggers to loiter in front of there establishment. Really obnoxious place, totally not worth any time or money. Huge thumbs down.

47.description: Shopping at Morse Market is a breeze due to the small selection of items they have. This store is like a mini Whole Foods on this street of Rogers Park thanks to their great assortment of health food options; granola, nuts, chocolate covered goodies. Yes, chocolate covered raisins are healthy in my opinion. Their meat and cheese department is stocked with fresh seafood, nicely prepared salads, and other things that can easily be cooked on a grill. Plus, they have a lot of Caribbean, West African, and Latin products so you can make all sorts of delicious marinades, rubs, stews, and soups. As a young Nigerian-American, this is always my go to place to shop for good quality groceries in Rogers Park.

8.description: I love going to get fresh produce here. Its very price worthy & way cheaper than whole foods, marionos etc.  I love avacados in smoothies & sometimes they have them for only .69 cents. The staff are very friendly. One time when I was checking out, the guy thats always in the front of the store, maybe he's the manager, just handed me about 4 bananas & said take these for you & the baby.

31.description: I was a college student and lived right around the corner for 2 years. This place was amazing. The prices for all fresh things like produce and meat and stuff were really cheap, while still being high quality. They upgraded a bunch of stuff recently like shelving and the checkout lines. Everyone is super friendly and if you go there enough, they will recognize you and say hi when you walk in. If you buy packaged foods, the prices are not as cheap.However, their guacamole is literally the best thing on the planet. I'm pretty sure I gained at least a few pounds. And their cooked drumsticks are also amazing. They also have a crazy good selection for such a small place and they have their own parking lot.

34.description: I've only heard great things about this place..We shall see!Since I've been residing in Rogers Park I have found some ofthe best/coolest places, and up until today Morse Market had onlybeen a place that I had heard great things about, and after my visittoday I have to say that everyone who praised this place was righton the money!Morse Market is a great market filled with produce galore at somereally low prices, A really great deli counter where there are many at sale and great variety, a prepared food station where you canget yourself a delicious  looking rotisserie chicken for $6.99 too!Oh, and can't forget the fresh Cuisine de France Parisian Breadthat they were bringing out of the oven, you just know I left the storewith a loaf of that!There is such a great variety to choose from in this store, everythingfrom your basic needs to specialty type items at very reasonable prices.Now, I will admit that it kind of irked me to find out upon enteringthis market/place that I needed to have a quarter to obtain a shopping cart!So, I stood there searching my purse for a quarter which I did not havebecause I used all my quarters for laundry..So, Lo and Behold the Shopping Cart Gods must have been lookingdown kindly at me because on the side of all those damn carts was onestray Jewel Cart, Man, is this Karma or what?So, in I went with that sucker and I will admit that some of those peoplewere giving me dirty looks because those store aisles were so narrow..Hey, I was giving them dirty looks right back because they wouldn't getout of the way of my very special Jewel Cart!Okay, so in ending, I like this store/market, it has great selection/variety,and really inexpensive prices!There is a small parking lot attached too!And.. there were lots of watermelons outside..Ahhh...Located a few steps to the right off the Morse Red Line Stop..Definitely worth a look see!Just make sure you bring a quarter!P.S. Props to my nice cashier too!

16.description: This is an awesome local grocery store. The prices are low relative to Jewel, Target, and especially Whole Food and you can get 'most' of what you need here (or at the very least a substitute of some sorts). Be sure to each fruits, veggies, and meats quickly; the foods are fresh and don't really last long on the counter nor in the fridge.

13.description: Morse Fresh is my main market in the neighborhood for produce and some meats. Their produce is fresh, great quality and fairly priced; I don't know how they do it. They have a good variety of meat, including free-range and organic that are marginally more expensive than Whole Foods. They make their own sausage and do a lot of the butchering, and their quality is amazing. Limited deli but it has many things you need (olives, etc.). Sometimes there are incredible deals on the cart, which has gently bruised veggies and fruits (i.e. 4 avocados for 99¢, perfect for guac).No wine or beer, though.The owner often greets you when you come in, even though the place is always whirring. Cashiers and stockers are always helpful and good-natured.They also have a surprising selection of green-friendly products, textiles, soaps; a lot of things you'll find at Whole Foods. Genius merchandising! #kudos

11.description: Can't say enough for them. I've been going here since 2001. Best produce and meat cuts in the neighborhood at low prices. Very clean at all times, nice staff, never an unpleasant odor. Grocery selection is great for a smaller market. Dont expect to pay big box store prices on processed grocery items, of course, but those are still reasonable. Excellent cheese and deli selections.The checkout line is elite for a store of any size. They have a lot of registers and are always well-staffed for the demand. There are cashiers who've been there at least 8 years and are always very nice and operate efficiently. The boss is always helping them out and greeting people. They do special orders. Just inquire. On Mother's Day, my wife and I hosted for about 20 people, and they made 40 fresh rolls in about a hour's notice. Just ask, but be more courteous about the notice, obviously.

39.description: My favorite local grocery store. Always clean, fresh produce, friendly staff, reasonable costs. If you need your meat sliced, the butchers will do it! There's a parking lot too and a few yards from the red line on Morse!

37.description: 10 STARS!  100 STARS!  1,000 STARS!Best Market in Rogers Park and the surrounding 5 miles w/out a doubt.My 2007 review cracked me up when I reread it.The stinky old guy is gone.  He's been replaced by the lovely, illustrious and friendly Arlene (who is kinder than kind and sells Streetwise with a smile).MFM is a WONDERFUL place.  I shop there daily to pick up this and that.  I have no complaints at all -- no cons to speak off.  The store is extremely clean.  No bad smells coming from the deli or butcher's area.  The fresh fruits and veggies are always terrifically crisp and well chosen.  Any problems upon getting home -- just come back the next day and let a mgr. know and - voila! Credit issued!  The dry goods, frozen foods, baked goods and prepared foods and not left on the shelf too long.  The coffee selection is good (I am a coffee snob).The aisles are quaint -- the staff are everywhere picking through and restocking foods, always willing to help out a customer.  The check out aisles are open or opening as needed.It's worth the trip from wherever you are to check out MFM.  It surely puts every other market in and around the area to shame.   (especially the Rogers Park Market on Clark Street and Rogers :::cringe and shiver:::  that place has vermin behind the meat counter and is unsanitary in many other ways.  DO NOT eat their meats or poultry.  You have been warned!

0.description: Awesome place. They have everything you need for grocery shopping. If they don't have it, you really don't need it!

38.description: I love this place!  It's a true neighborhood grocer where the staff knows you and greets you hello each time you enter. The store is always clean and the produce prices are amazing. You can find everything here including a great selection of international and organic items. This is my regular grocer and go to place especially for deli items and breads!

51.description: I haven't written a review in many moons, but this place does indeed deserve the love.  They work hard and obviously care about what they are offering their patrons. They're a throwback, and I applaud that.

27.description: What a gem. Last year I was going to Lifeline Theater (very close by) and had a bit of a cough. So I stopped at this unassuming, at least from the outside, looking market for cough drops. What a surprise. Amazing produce section,  good variety and great prices. I was so impressed by the grocery selection in this not very large store.  And it really seems to cater to different dietary tastes.  For a really small example refrigerated hemp milk, daiya and naan pizzas, four kinds of liquid smoke, great hot sauce selection, fresh nopales.  A great little store.

32.description: Excellent produce, very good meat.  Yeah, it's a bit pricier than big box stores, but it's also a neighbourhood shop, not a chain.  I find it to be worth going because the owner listens to me when I tell him I like a product and will buy it if he keeps it in stock, because of the sheer variety of produce, and the quality of the meat.  The staff is friendly and seems to have low turnover.Try the guacamole!

54.description: After living a block from HarvesTime in Lincoln Square, when I made the move up to Rogers Park, I was dreading schlepping to a Dominicks or Jewel via the train. Imagine how lucky I figured myself to be when I discovered the Morse Fresh Market a mere TWO blocks from my new place.It's small and the aisles are tiny, but that's my only (weak) complaint. The produce section is fantastic and no matter what time of day, seems like there is always at least one employee stocking and keeping the section looking awesome. I love the meat department's selections, the deli staff is nice, they have a great selection of numerous ethnic foods, and even have a surprisingly kick-ass selection of cat foods. Awesome place.

48.description: Being a Chef I am always amazed at the quality of the food and produce that I can get at Morse Fresh Market. The y also have great quality meat and fresh seafood for resonable prices. I shop here at least once or twice a week. I would recommend Morse Fresh Market to anyone. Great Neighborhood Market.

44.description: It's the closest market to me and when I'm feeling lazy I hit it. However the prices are ok and when you have Devon nearby, it pales in comparison.

24.description: Morse Fresh is my main market in the neighborhood for produce and some meats. Their produce is fresh, great quality and fairly priced; I don't know how they do it. They have a good variety of meat, including free-range and organic that are marginally more expensive than Whole Foods. They make their own sausage and do a lot of the butchering, and their quality is amazing. Limited deli but it has many things you need (olives, etc.). Sometimes there are incredible deals on the cart, which has gently bruised veggies and fruits (i.e. 4 avocados for 99¢, perfect for guac).No wine or beer, though.The owner often greets you when you come in, even though the place is always whirring. Cashiers and stockers are always helpful and good-natured.They also have a surprising selection of green-friendly products, textiles, soaps; a lot of things you'll find at Whole Foods. Genius merchandising! #kudos

7.description: Moved from Lincoln Park to Rogers Park almost 2 years ago and fell in love with this grocer. Never had many problems with anything until today. Bought some grated Romano came home and was opened and empty. A few days later I stopped in and asked about getting another one because the one I had bought was opened. Explosive and embarrassing was his reaction to the question. So much so that I will now go out of my way to shop at trader joes. My family was built on family business and I've always made it my priority to support local business. However success of a small business is built off of quality and service. I'm saddened to have to say that is most certainly not the case.

49.description: This is a great market if you're looking for a small amount of items for a good price. However I've come here many times with a very long list of groceries and have had a nightmarish time finding all the items on my list. They have a very extensive list of foods and cuisines, but the way the food is stocked makes little sense (I'm assuming this is due to the size of the building itself). Another complaint is that there always seems to be too many employees working. I know this sounds like an odd complaint and many of them have been helpful when it comes to finding where something is, but a lot of them are constantly re-stocking produce items, which don't need to be re-stocked. These workers get in your way, and when it gets crowded, the small market seems entirely too full and makes the shopping experience more stressful than it needs to be.

40.description: Friendly, small store that is a great place to buy produce.  They also have spices and other items that are not always found in the bigger grocery stores.  I've been satisfied with the meat that I've purchased, and the prices are fairly reasonable for that.

53.description: After eating in Mexico for three weeks I sought a market that would have plenty of 'ethnic' choices and someone had confirmed this was a great market long before my trip. I love that the store is small.  I avoid stores where an entire  aisle is just soda and chips - I don't like 15 aisle stores which are very American of course, but it's a bit much. This store seemed to have absolutely everything I needed, which I found twice as fast, and my $63. bill would probably have been $100. at my regular store - Whole Foods. The guy who helped bag also volunteered to go to my car with me and the rest of my bags - a "community" touch the big markets are too big to bother with. The produce is beautifully kept with organic choices - yay - everything in the store was neat. This is now my primary go-to store, I'm about to go now and cut out all the "new excess" that's become the usual shopping trip.

30.description: Being new in the neighborhood, and also loving to cook , I was scared to death of not finding a resource for all my culinary needs as well as my weekly staples.Located just off the Red Line station at Morse, this smallish wonderful market was a godsend.Upon entering, it is the usual supermarket atmosphere with bustling cashiers and baggers. When you follow the straight line of entry you are immediately introduced to the produce section which in my opinion is as enticing to the eye as well as the selection offered. Wonderfully categorized choices of fruits..veggies..and enticements of all sorts of decadences only a chef can appreciate. The packaged fresh herbs are generous and in prime picking. The meats..pre-packed or at the meat counter are greatly desired. I have indulged in the Hot Italian Sausage (lean..spicy...delicious) and some other homemade delectable mixtures. I do recommend trying any variety which entices you at the moment.The only one issue I do have about the meat is their ground beef selection. Very greasy even on their higher 90/10....not a good beef mixture cut wise for a good flavor but I have not yet requested any specialty grind, so we will see. The deli counter I have yet to try but the selection looks promising, altho I did find my imported Feta Cheeses there! The French Feta is an extremely off the charts creamy  unobtrusive mild choice. Great in a Spinach Omelette!The basics of the store are great and I can generally find all needed for spectacular meals and staples without a trip to the nearest Jewel.  So yes to Morse Fresh Market. Make the visit if you need great meats/sausages or fresh produce. So grateful for the proximity. Good stuff!!!
