46.description: Best market in the neighborhood. Plenty of fresh produce, loads of organics and healthy options at affordable prices! Kicks trader joes butt and puts all the other markets to shame.

1.description: I've made purchases and didn't realize that I was over charge until late evening and they were closed and went to the store day after .When I went there, no ones care and gave me lecture of how I suppose to check my receipt after every purchases I can understand their point but they way they making me feel like I'm trying to lie to them is unacceptable

55.description: I love this store so much. from the outside, it looks like many other little grocery stores you see in other Chicago neighborhoods. but this one is special. this is the kind of place that makes you feel like you live in a different era or at least in small town America. the manager greets you every time you walk in the door and says, hello friend! the space is small but beautifully stocked. it is the cleanest, most well put together grocery store you will ever walk into. the prices are super reasonable. they carry a tremendous stock of organic and free-trade foods. the produce section is stocked with exotic fruits and vegetables that you will never find at Jewel or Dominicks. They have a huge selection of artisan cheeses, too. basically, you just feel like this store is run with a lot of love and attention. this is the kind of grocery store  that makes you want to run Dominicks and Jewel and every other giant corporate conglomerate or supermarket out of town. this is a true neighborhood grocery store. as long as I live in Rogers Park or anywhere near Rogers Park, I will continue to shop here for everything I need that Morse carries.

9.description: One-stop shop, really! I've stopped going anywhere else. They have great produce and a good selection. For a while I had to actively convince myself to stop by other places because I frequented this store too often, but I've given that up. This store is a local favorite for good reasons!

26.description: Best local market in rogers park! I often shop here for my produce and cheeses, and sometimes bready things!-Clean-Organized-Freshness of products-Variety (notably produce and cheeses)-Convenient (1-2 min walk from morse red line, and a 10 min walk from my place)-Friendly personnel (the owner? Is usually standing by the checkout lines with a sincere smile, greeting those coming in and out)-Price. Regular priced items are pretty decently priced compared to other supermarkets, though certain items better priced than others (eg, bananas are more $$ here than jewel). Sale items tend to be a good deal though, so cost tends to balance out.

25.description: We went into the store not sure what to expect and found good prices and GREAT service.  We wanted a beef brisket for the holiday, the butcher helped us pick out the right size  for our family and trimmed it for cooking.  The fresh produce and deli are equally as good. (Although I wish the deli would just list the price by pound and not 1/2 lbs)This store is a great find!

12.description: Best local market in rogers park! I often shop here for my produce and cheeses, and sometimes bready things!-Clean-Organized-Freshness of products-Variety (notably produce and cheeses)-Convenient (1-2 min walk from morse red line, and a 10 min walk from my place)-Friendly personnel (the owner? Is usually standing by the checkout lines with a sincere smile, greeting those coming in and out)-Price. Regular priced items are pretty decently priced compared to other supermarkets, though certain items better priced than others (eg, bananas are more $$ here than jewel). Sale items tend to be a good deal though, so cost tends to balance out.

59.description: I really love this place. I buy all of my fruits, vegetables, and dairy here, and indulge in some of their imported goodies (Mexican Coca-Cola! Jaffa Cakes! Special flour!) when the budget allows. The people who work here are super nice and always willing to help me find things. They are a spotlessly clean store, which is a super plus. Love it so much.

21.description: I've lived in Rogers Park for two years and Morse Market has been my go to grocery store. I never wrote a review because all the good things I could say had already been stated by previous Yelpers. Great prices, diverse produce, and a welcoming atmosphere? What's not to love. I was in today and it was quite busy. At the checkout I was bagging my own groceries when the owner, a very pleasant mustached man whom is usually greeting his customers with a friendly hello, came by and started assisting me. I told him there was no need and I could finish it myself. A moment later he came back with a container of fresh, plump strawberries and placed them into my bag and thanked me for helping out. I have no problem bagging my own groceries and have done it many times but his thoughtfulness  and generosity compelled me to give them a great review. It's a simply friendly gesture like this that makes morse market my go to grocery store and one of the best businesses in Rogers Park.

17.description: We went into the store not sure what to expect and found good prices and GREAT service.  We wanted a beef brisket for the holiday, the butcher helped us pick out the right size  for our family and trimmed it for cooking.  The fresh produce and deli are equally as good. (Although I wish the deli would just list the price by pound and not 1/2 lbs)This store is a great find!

10.description: I recently moved to Rogers Park and was looking for where I'd get all my grocery items. I didn't have to look far. Within a 5 minute walk of my place, Morse Fresh Market offers so much, for so little. Really great selection of fresh produce and meats at low prices. I don't go anywhere else for my food. The staff is also very friendly and helpful! If you live in Rogers Park, make this your go-to grocery store.

5.description: I've only heard great things about this place..We shall see!Since I've been residing in Rogers Park I have found some ofthe best/coolest places, and up until today Morse Market had onlybeen a place that I had heard great things about, and after my visittoday I have to say that everyone who praised this place was righton the money!Morse Market is a great market filled with produce galore at somereally low prices, A really great deli counter where there are many at sale and great variety, a prepared food station where you canget yourself a delicious  looking rotisserie chicken for $6.99 too!Oh, and can't forget the fresh Cuisine de France Parisian Breadthat they were bringing out of the oven, you just know I left the storewith a loaf of that!There is such a great variety to choose from in this store, everythingfrom your basic needs to specialty type items at very reasonable prices.Now, I will admit that it kind of irked me to find out upon enteringthis market/place that I needed to have a quarter to obtain a shopping cart!So, I stood there searching my purse for a quarter which I did not havebecause I used all my quarters for laundry..So, Lo and Behold the Shopping Cart Gods must have been lookingdown kindly at me because on the side of all those damn carts was onestray Jewel Cart, Man, is this Karma or what?So, in I went with that sucker and I will admit that some of those peoplewere giving me dirty looks because those store aisles were so narrow..Hey, I was giving them dirty looks right back because they wouldn't getout of the way of my very special Jewel Cart!Okay, so in ending, I like this store/market, it has great selection/variety,and really inexpensive prices!There is a small parking lot attached too!And.. there were lots of watermelons outside..Ahhh...Located a few steps to the right off the Morse Red Line Stop..Definitely worth a look see!Just make sure you bring a quarter!P.S. Props to my nice cashier too!

3.description: Stopped in for a loaf of bread today and was turned away because I didn't meet an unadvertised $3 minimum to use my debit card. I told the cashier I didn't need anything else, since they were out of the second item I came in for, and she just shrugged. Glad that a convenience store opened up across the street because they didn't mind the low charge on my card.

35.description: Produce heaven!!!! So many types of fruit and veggies at reasonable prices. Some items are a little pricey, but that is to be expected in this type of market. (Example: Frozen Pizza for $6.) But if you're going for a moderate amount of food, this place is good.Deli always has good specials. Meat counter is excellent. Owner is always present and friendly. Staff is polite and helpful. They do not sell beer, wine, or liquor.

19.description: I love our local store Morse Fresh Market - their guac and salsa are the best!!! I honestly think they are tastier than some restaurants'. And if you look at date packed section on the lid you'll see today's date. They always have variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, breads, etc. and I love the fact that you can find international foods here too! One of my favorites and luckily walking minutes from home. The owner/manager is nice and always welcomes you with a smile. And pricing (important!) is lower than chain grocery stores (which I dislike a lot for overly priced low quality foods). Go local! :-)

28.description: CHECK YOUR PRICES WHEN PURCHASING ITEMS!I picked up some Supremo Chihuahua cheese the other day from them that was priced differently from the retail price. On the shelf it shows the price was $3.59. when I got home I realized they added their own price sticker to the cheese! They attached a weighed out price and priced it at $7.49 a lb! If you went up to the deli they had the same cheese done by cut for $2.99 for 1/2 a lb. THEY ARE VERY DISHONEST ABOUT THEIR PRICING AND WILL MAKE UP THEIR OWN PRICES FOR PROFIT!

45.description: My grocery store of choice within Rogers Park. Great prices and selection, friendly staff, and conveniently located right off of the Morse Red Line stop.

33.description: I'm going nowhere else to get produce and most meats. I haven't tried the seafood selection, but their chicken and sausage selection is great and priced well. Can't beat tasty chicken drumsticks for 99 cents per pound.The produce is neatly laid out. And they have at least ten different types of potatoes. Who doesn't like potatoes?And it's conveniently just west of the Morse red line stop, so it's an easy in and out. Bring a backpack with you and just load the bags into there and, voila, easy as pie.You're probably better off leaving most dry goods to other places, but any of the spoilable foods should be fair game. If you see me outside the store eating raw potatoes like a fiend, just leave me be.

43.description: Exactly what a local market should be. Friendly, fresh, helpful, responsive to customers needs, has organic options, and is affordable.The owner says hello to me each time I walk in, the produce guys are great, and the butcher will take great care of you.If you're still going to Dominick's, you're a dum dum...

2.description: This grocery store is amazing! It's a good size mercado that has a lot of SE Asian fruit and South American grains. My sister goes here for her weekly food needs. Walking in it is much bigger than you expect it to be. All of the fruit and vegetables have little labels for what they are and proper use and storage. Really cool and helpful if you want to try something different you've never used. The isles don't really have signs so you'd have to come here often to learn the layout, but staff on hand were very helpful. Specialty items in bulk you'll probably find at Trader Joes. The store has a lot of dry goods and canned items but typically not for nuts and dried fruit. They do offer a large selection of sausages and cheeses as well as fresh fish and meat. Outside of the store, walking along the train is a huge retaining wall that has murals of all kinds the entire way. My sister and I walked along this the day I got there and it was so much fun. I recommend this store and neighborhood if you live in the area or are visiting. There is a parking lot if you need so it's also very accessible.

18.description: I'm going nowhere else to get produce and most meats. I haven't tried the seafood selection, but their chicken and sausage selection is great and priced well. Can't beat tasty chicken drumsticks for 99 cents per pound.The produce is neatly laid out. And they have at least ten different types of potatoes. Who doesn't like potatoes?And it's conveniently just west of the Morse red line stop, so it's an easy in and out. Bring a backpack with you and just load the bags into there and, voila, easy as pie.You're probably better off leaving most dry goods to other places, but any of the spoilable foods should be fair game. If you see me outside the store eating raw potatoes like a fiend, just leave me be.

41.description: i have been buying my produce here for years, but no more. i buy a case of grapefruit about every 2-3weeks for fresh squeezed juice in the am. never had a problem when there was bad grapefruits (usually 1 or2 per box) returning bad produce. or sometimes the count was off(32-33, when there should be 36). they always made it right. but all of a sudden one of the managers (or owner, i don't know) decided to believe i was lying about the shortage of a box i bought last month, which was short 4 grapefruits. i chose to chalk it up to his having a bad day. i bought a case yesterday & when i got home & put them in the fridge....therewere 3 rotten,moldy  grapefruits. so i brought them back today, & guess whose working...mr. cheerful-don't worry, the costumer is always wrong!!!!i showed him the bad produce & he refused to return it. ok....lets for the sake of his argument, side w/him on the shortage. but here MR. CHEERFUL!!!, are BAD grapefruits. one would think he'd be smart enough to take the bad produce & give me THREE good grapefruits & i'd be happy & continue shopping there. it'd be good business 101. but he said that when i buy a case that it's WHOLESALE & no returns.ok, lugnut....you lose a costumer & i will tell all of my friends who shop in r.p. to not go there. the ROGERS PK FRUIT MARKET is just as close & much FRIENDLIER!!! they will get my business. & i suggest you go there too.

52.description: This grocery store is bigger and has more to offer than Edgewater Produce, but it could be a bit better in quality.  They have a big selection of produce, but some of them haven't been up to par, namely the jicama, green peppers, and zucchini.  They offer grass-fed beef along with other meats and a pretty big deli selection of meats and cheeses.  I wouldn't get the canned goods or cereals you can find at Target, but they do have produce that's cheaper than Jewel and a bigger variety than Edgewater.  Their parking lot is kind of crazy, but I'm thankful they have a parking lot at all.  The cashiers and store owner or manager is pretty friendly.

50.description: Grocery pickings are good.  For the space they have, I feel they do a good job with providing various products to the diverse neighborhood.   Thank you,

4.description: Great neighborhood grocery store with very good prices- especially on the produce and meat!  I definitely recommend this place for all your grocery needs, especially if you live in the area.  There's a small lot for parking but it's pretty tight so it might be best to just park on the street or walk.

6.description: Yes, yes, yes!This spot is about half a block from my home and when I first discovered it, the mere awesomeness of produce brought me to tears. They have just about everything you could need (REALLY missing some good beer/wine) and the staff is helpful and courteous. The prices are hard to beat and the meat/seafood selection rivals a Whole Foods. Overall, A+!

22.description: Can't say enough for them. I've been going here since 2001. Best produce and meat cuts in the neighborhood at low prices. Very clean at all times, nice staff, never an unpleasant odor. Grocery selection is great for a smaller market. Dont expect to pay big box store prices on processed grocery items, of course, but those are still reasonable. Excellent cheese and deli selections.The checkout line is elite for a store of any size. They have a lot of registers and are always well-staffed for the demand. There are cashiers who've been there at least 8 years and are always very nice and operate efficiently. The boss is always helping them out and greeting people. They do special orders. Just inquire. On Mother's Day, my wife and I hosted for about 20 people, and they made 40 fresh rolls in about a hour's notice. Just ask, but be more courteous about the notice, obviously.

15.description: This place is awesome! Wish it was near me. The produce is fresh and it offers smaller portions perfect for meals for two. The organic options are a nice surprise, great selections at competitive prices. Staff is helpful in pointing me to the right direction. Definitely stop by!

57.description: I used to shop here until I found Jerry's Market in Niles. Jerry's prices are in average 59 cents cheaper than Morse's. The only thing I still buy at Morse Market is their delicious Lemon Pepper broiled chicken.

20.description: I love this place!!! The owner is incredibly nice and always welcomes you when you walk in. They have a gorgeous selection of produce and meat. They have a ton of organics. Also, there's never a line to check out!

36.description: The produce is fantastic, the food is fresh, and they have an awesome range of gluten free items.  Seriously a dream market.

14.description: Definitely the best meat selection and the best ground beef I've ever got for 2 bucks a lb

12.description: Best carnitas tacos ive had in Chicago to this day. A must go!

3.description: I'm driving in to the office from Evanston on a weekend afternoon and hungry.  So, I'm double grumpy.  I'm thinking about the mediocre food options that I have already overdone.  I'm on Clark instead of Sheridan for some reason I can't remember and I'm seeing taqueria's on the right and other ones on the right.  I'm driving and can't Yelp or then I'm that guy on the road I hate, but I see what might be an open parking spot or it might just be some room at the end of a bus stop across from Taqueria El Charro.  So, I pull over and take my chances.  Pretty darn good.  Nice service, a few mid afternoon customers, loud spanish language tv and really good tacos, with excellent pico de gallo which is in my opinion a gating item.  I'm from the west coast and know and love good Mexican food.  I left with a smile on my face and managed to get a bunch of work out of the way on my happy, full stomach.

1.description: This place is a non-descript restaurant that is inexpensive BUT great food.  I always check the Mexican restaurant with their easy menus and prices so these are my requirements for me to review them.  They have a great chicken tostada (pulled chicken) and a lot of flavor and the price is just right.  I am so glad that this is so close to my work.  Will definitely a go to place for me!

2.description: I tried their Asada tacos, three of them, two with onion and cilantro, one with lettuce and tomato. I ate one of the onion and cilantro with no sauce, one with green sauce and the lettuce and tomato with the red sauce. They were all pretty decent, nothing special about them, maybe a little more gristle than I like, but not a big deal. I'm sure there's a difference between the sauces, but not really sure what it is. I think the red sauce is more tomato to it. Because tacos are so basic and simple, it's hard to see how how one place can be different from another, so average is still good. The service was pleasant enough, I had takeout. I feel good enough about El Charro to return, and that is a really good recommendation, because between Devon and Howard, there are 436  taquerias on Clark St. I'm pleased to know that this is one of them. One thing that definitely stood out about El Charro was the number of ingredients (meats) they offered, like tripe, tongue and avocado. That's pretty cool and earned them another star. And the house special looks like a nice adventure too. Like the Terminator, I'll be back!

9.description: A great authentic taco go-to restaurant. My favorite are the pork, but the chicken are also great. Complimentary chips and salsa and pickled veggies at the table. Taco platter comes with three tacos of your choice and a heaping serving of rice and beans. Can't beat the price or the taste!

10.description: Just stopped at this place for lunch and was very pleasantly surprised. Great prices, large portions, friendly and fast service. I got the small size al pastor burrito and it was delicious. Full of flavor, and pretty large for a supposedly "chico" burrito. My husband got carne asada and al pastor tacos and was also very happy.Minus one star for the loud TV and insubstantial paper napkins of which you have to use 10 to wipe your face... but the food makes up for those small drawbacks. I'll definitely be back when in the area!

4.description: This is my first impression, so I may update later.  After a perfectly AWFUL experience at El Pueblito, I walked to Taqueria El Charro, and the sign said open.  The lady behind the counter told me they were closed.  As I turned to walk out and pointed out that the sign said open, the guy in the kitchen asked what I wanted, and said it would be no problem.  Less than five minutes later, I was out the door with my chicken burrito.  I will definitely give them another chance!

6.description: I am super happy to have stumbled into Taqueria on a random Monday morning. My breakfast plate of eggs with chorizo also came with rice, beans, and a little salad that included two big quarters of avocado. The portions were huge and everything tasted awesome for $8- which included tax and tip. I also really liked the fresh salsa that came with the chips, it had a nice spicy kick. I would definitely return to try other things on their menu.

15.description: husband and i are exploring clark's taquerias from devon north. this was our 2nd stop.comfortably large space.Glass with ice came with jariscos (mandarin this time)Loud Mexican juke box with old guy feeding it dollars. fantastic.Jeremy had asada con nopales (steak and cactus) plate with beans and rice. Came with corn tortillas and avocado. Jeremy said the avocado was lovely. The beans were salty and good. the rice was excellent and mingled with the steak fat in a really sexy way. I wasn't too keen on the asada. Chopped really small. Good flavor, but gristle, you know? The nopales were soft and well flavored. I had 3 tacos. Asada (don't need to get it again), picadillo (solid, with tomato and lettuce), and the barbacoa (best of the bunch, with onions and cilantro). I liked that the barbacoa wasn't too fatty. I hate chunks of fat. (like there was in the asada).The tacos were best with a little green salsa.Speaking of salsa, both green and red came to the table, very flavorful, and seemed homemade.The corn tortillas were hefty and tasty. Tacos held up beautifully. We shared a chorizo quesadilla. On corn tortilla. Good balance between meat and cheese. Perfect.Really good experience. Would go again. just not get the asada.

0.description: This place is 2 blocks from my house and hands-down amazing. Some of the best huevos con choritzo I've ever had -- plate and tacos (I've had them both). Nothing fancy inside, but you're getting generous, delicious portions and great service. If you go for breakfast, they'll do fresh squeezed OJ for $3. Seriously. Get it. Seeds and all.

5.description: The burrito w skirt steak was amazing!!! Very clean place right around the corner from my house.

13.description: My beau and I stopped here for take-out and were very pleased with our meals. He had quesadillas and enchiladas rojas. I had enchiladas verdes. The entrees came with slices of avocado which we both found to be a nice bonus. They included a green and a red salsa. My beau was particularly fond of the red saying it was not just spicy hot but really pleasantly flavorful.

11.description: Yum. Just ordered some sopes from this place and delicious!!

8.description: I came here with my boyfriend's family after a wedding to kill some time before the reception (3 hours in between). We happen to know the owners because they have done taquero's for our parties in the past, so we decided to check our their restaurant. It's nice to come into a restaurant that has pretty much all the meats you want in a taco. Most places don't carry the ones I like to eat (Tripita, Lengua, etc....yes I'm one of those people) and it was such a relief to know they had it! We had both the red and green salsas as well a pico de gallo brought to the table. Both sauces had a nice kick to it. I ordered the carne asada, lengua, and suadero tacos. All three were delicious and exactly what I wanted. The Horchatas were huge and also as delicious. (and i'm not saying this because know them...everything really was yummy!) I definitely plan to come back the next time im in the area for the tripitas tacos.....I missed those this time around.

14.description: Great simple Mexican food at a good price! Loved it!  Looks like they opened up a new one in Waukegan and the food there is just as good!You would think there would be a lot of good Mexican food in waukegan, but not the case.  Thank goodness El Charro is now here!

7.description: This little no-frills, homey Mexican place is awesome for a simple meal.  They have everything that you would like from fajitas to tacos to enchiladas to horchatas to quesadillas to homemeade desserts in a case.  I ordered the bean and chicken tacos and they were both delicious, the chicken one being really tasty.  Service was fast and friendly.  Unfortunately they didn't have nachos there though the machine was on the counter, and my friend said to not bother going to the bathroom as it wasn't clean.  I couldn't vouch for that as I didn't brave it.  But still, the food and service was great...just avoid the bathroom if possible!

28.description: Went here with several friends the other night and had a very good experience. We ordered miso soup and 8 or so of their specialty sushi rolls and were very impressed with the quality of the food! (We especially loved the green dragon, Loyola, and bulgogi rolls). The staff was very friendly and sweet. It's BYOB, which is always a huge bonus. My hesitation to give five stars is because it's a counter you have to go up to and order at, and you have to pour your own water and bring it to the table - not a true sit down restaurant, which I prefer. Also, if you need to use the restroom, you have to go outside to get to it. I would recommend relieving your bladder prior to coming here (at least in the winter)! We will definitely be returning to this place and are pleased with the new management.

1.description: I am always confused about why this restaurant isn't more crowded when I come inside. On three separate occasions, I've walked in and no one was there. The music wasn't even on until I sat down, and the staff looked somewhere between bored and concerned. It could be the time of day I'm going, but this place is so underrated. I love vegan sushi rolls. Their miso soup is delicious. Their avocado maki rolls are incredible. The server and cook are always nice. It's quiet and good for a date night. My only suspicion about why it doesn't get more customers are the two Chinese food restaurants directly across the street with terrible food that I always avoid. When I went in with a guest, my guest was looking for the usual greasy, fried foods. Asahi is not that. You eat with chopsticks. The food is fresh, made to order and healthy. Only downside is their drink selection is a refrigerator full of sugary drinks, and I wish they had more options outside of cans or bottles. Green tea is always a good alternative. Only other con is the guest I was with ordered salad, and they said they were out. How could a restaurant this healthy be out of salad? That was about as odd to me as some place like Popeye's being out of chicken. If you don't already like or want to test out Japanese food, you may be better off at the greasy spots near the theater. But if you're looking to eat healthier, this is that place!

9.description: This a cozy lay back  relax  place. I was very impressed  the food sushi dragon roll is very good. Fresh and quality  is outstanding! Susan the chef  is a very kind  soul.Her menu  has a variety  of  theseafood  and veggie .It's worth the wait to get this excellent  sushi experience. Good thing byob!Prices  are great!

29.description: I just began eating sushi and this restaurant made me so happy that I did! The sushi was so delicious, the server was very welcoming (she even gave us a free roll since we had a first timer with us), and the menu had lots of variety. The only reason why i gave this place  4 stars Is because it was a little pricey with very few deals. Otherwise great place to eat!

23.description: I love the Asahi Roll. Susan, the owner is always really friendly and s very skilled cook. I've stopped in just to say hi, and buy one of her delicious rolls on my way home. She makes things in house and homemade, and her assistant Kaleigh is fun to talk to and always makes sure that the experience was a good one. They also have a program with a card. You buy so many rolls and you get one free. Their process are also fair for the market. Definitely a small business I enjoy supporting.

5.description: It's under new management now! The food and service is so much better now! The quality of the food went from a 5 to a 10!

31.description: Excellent, attentive service, cute new neighborhood sushi place. The place we usually go to just closed, and my boyfriend and I were really hoping for some sushi. We stopped in after a workout and were immediately greeted by the friendly owner. I ordered an avocado roll and she immediately told me about all vegetarian options (woo hoo!). We were also comped some delicious miso soup. We will be coming back :)

25.description: If you're looking for good sushi, look no further then this lovely and humble restaurant. This was my first experience with sushi and I automatically fell in love with their dragon rolls. Ill definitely be coming back for more.

12.description: I love the Asahi Roll. Susan, the owner is always really friendly and s very skilled cook. I've stopped in just to say hi, and buy one of her delicious rolls on my way home. She makes things in house and homemade, and her assistant Kaleigh is fun to talk to and always makes sure that the experience was a good one. They also have a program with a card. You buy so many rolls and you get one free. Their process are also fair for the market. Definitely a small business I enjoy supporting.

37.description: I was walking by the place and decided to pop in.  I ordered the bibimbop, which as the cook said was "very healthy".  It was also very tasty, and the price was reasonable.  Next time I go in, I will try the sushi.  I also liked the decor in the place; the previous restaurants that were in that spot used a lot of dark colors.  This restaurant is in a bright, festive yellow.

21.description: Awful. Probably the worst sushi I've had, and definitely the worst I've had in Chicago. So overpriced and underwhelming that the prices would be too high for a restaurant twice as good.Small, low quality cuts of fish with questionable color. Uneven temperature and amounts of ingredients (crab pulled straight from the fridge, warm cucumber, far too much rice).Poor preparation and service. The restaurant only seats 6 - 8 people and it was still understaffed. Learn from my mistake and find somewhere else to go.

16.description: Do yourself a favor and give this place a try! They only opened up a month ago and after one visit I have high hopes for their future. My boyfriend and I started with their kimchi fries, something that they created themselves, and I'm already craving more just a day later. My only complaint is that there should be more sour cream and green onions on top, otherwise a totally one of a kind taste. After our fries we were given complimentary miso soup that we later got more of because it was so flavorful. I'm not a huge sushi expert but the California rolls I got were incredible. The atmosphere is incredibly warm and friendly, reasonably priced, the owners are very personal, welcoming and gave lots of good tips/recommendations on what to order. Leaving a place after such a great experience is such a rare and fulfilling feeling! Will definitely be back. :)

17.description: New owner! New menu! Delicious food! The food was fresh and really good! The restaurant is clean and cute! The owner/chef and staff were very friendly! Must check this place out! Will be back soon!

10.description: One lady working there. Very nice. Went to ring up food and realized she forgot to make items. Offered an item that was just made for the same price the menu states. Sushi is bland. Miso soup spilled out all over the bag. Will not make a return visit.On a positive note it was ready when I arrived to pick it up...

11.description: Good thing we were sharing our food because we had 1 roll every 10-15 minutes. I was pretty annoyed with this situation because we were the only table then people started to come for pick up and maybe we were 3 tables in total. If the taste of sushi was good I could compromise with them being slow but it wasn't anything special. Too much rice and they were just falling apart. For the quality it's overpriced. I would just go to "all you can eat" sushi restaurant on the cheaper side and would have better taste. Owner (assuming) is nice. She gave us free miso soup which tasted good and then disappointment followed by main course! I will not go again. I do not recommend it to people who love sushi.

26.description: The owner is super friendly her name is Susan. I have become a regular here. Great atmosphere really laid back for a sushi place. I would recommend the Mexican roll. Every time I come here I feel happy the staff is friendly and talkative.

27.description: I got take out from here about two weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised! To begin, the owner and other young lady were EXTREMELY nice. I ordered the TNT roll and another that I can't think of right now but they were both delicious! I asked a question about delivery (which they do offer) and the owner (I'm assuming) asked if that was my first time there and then gave me a complimenary miso soup. As other reviewers mentioned, it is booming with flavor and I ate every bit of it. The portions are a nice size and, again, very tasty. As I was leaving, the sweet owner told me, "I hope you like everything!" I loved it all and will probably be ordering delivery from here tonight. Nothing beats great customer service except for great customer service+good quality food!(Also, I'm not a student, but I'd imagine that it would be a good place to eat and do work as they offer free wifi).

35.description: Very good food! I have been here a few times and really liked their bibimbop as well as their sushi. Definitely will come back especially since it is very close and convenient.

8.description: In the past few years, three sushi places have rotated into this space, and finally we have a good one. I've been here 3 times and found the service to be great (the owners are super nice), the food is consistent and reasonably priced. I usually just get a chef's selection (I was there was more variety than just 6 doubled up pieces of nigiri), and it's always been good. Haven't tried too many of their rolls, but the bibimbap was also solid. BYOB.

0.description: Best sushi place local!  Small and cozy!  New management is way better than the old. The new owners are really nice couple! I will be definitely be coming back here in the near future

20.description: The amount of times that I have eaten at this restaurant is a little embarrassing. I just love their ramen and udon noodle soup. It has never failed to satisfy my cravings. The owner is very friendly as well. Great neighborhood go to for ramen or udon soup.

19.description: Best bibimbap I've had in Chicago after living here for 3 years. Very friendly staff.

33.description: Do yourself a favor and give this place a try! They only opened up a month ago and after one visit I have high hopes for their future. My boyfriend and I started with their kimchi fries, something that they created themselves, and I'm already craving more just a day later. My only complaint is that there should be more sour cream and green onions on top, otherwise a totally one of a kind taste. After our fries we were given complimentary miso soup that we later got more of because it was so flavorful. I'm not a huge sushi expert but the California rolls I got were incredible. The atmosphere is incredibly warm and friendly, reasonably priced, the owners are very personal, welcoming and gave lots of good tips/recommendations on what to order. Leaving a place after such a great experience is such a rare and fulfilling feeling! Will definitely be back. :)

2.description: Great spot in the neighborhood and friendly staff. Great quality food! I like the dragon rolls mostly I usually get the green dragon roll. The Mizo and the ginger salad is also good. It's located near the beach and is a nice walk if you located near by.

34.description: Wow, can I say this place is great. I always walk by this place and ever since the remodel I've been itching to try it, we had the gyoza, volcano roll, the don kat su and chicken kat su, though for my tastes the don kat su was a little too salty for my tastes (I'm a salty eater) but I think it is due to the meat, which is pork because the chicken version was not that salty and I assume they use the same breading. The volcano roll was a tad spicy but not too hot, and the gyoza and miso were great, though I wish they had a steamed version of the gyoza because these were fried. All in all the food is great, reasonable price, and local, the decor could use some work and as other have been to the previous restaurant that was here before, I have to agree that the decor is very fun and vibrant. I will definitely come back for quick sushi when I crave it!

32.description: I have eaten in many small restaurants around the world, many with terrible decor that is salvaged by excellent service and better food.  This was not one of those restaurants.  The service was slow, we were told to get our own utensils and clean up after ourselves, the tea was of low quality, and at $60 for two, this certainly wasn't cheap.  The entire operation seemed like it was slapped together last night and there was absolutely no restaurant experience to speak of.To be perfectly honest, of all the restaurants I've been to around the world, this was the worst.  Poor service, terrible food and high prices.

18.description: Came here with my wife and we both loved it. The gyoza was excellent. The sushi rolls we ordered were excellent. The presentation was nice too. But the prices are what made this place better than other sushi places in the area. We got four different sushi rolls and gyoza and everything was only 5.95 each. And the quality of everything was amazing. The service was very good too. More people should go here.

13.description: I got take out from here about two weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised! To begin, the owner and other young lady were EXTREMELY nice. I ordered the TNT roll and another that I can't think of right now but they were both delicious! I asked a question about delivery (which they do offer) and the owner (I'm assuming) asked if that was my first time there and then gave me a complimenary miso soup. As other reviewers mentioned, it is booming with flavor and I ate every bit of it. The portions are a nice size and, again, very tasty. As I was leaving, the sweet owner told me, "I hope you like everything!" I loved it all and will probably be ordering delivery from here tonight. Nothing beats great customer service except for great customer service+good quality food!(Also, I'm not a student, but I'd imagine that it would be a good place to eat and do work as they offer free wifi).

4.description: Huge disappointment! We popped in because of the proximity, and we were extremely hungry. Once we got our menus the lady (I'm assuming the owner) disappeared in the back, when she came out we had to call her to take our order (the whole place is about 12 sq feet) 20 min later still no food on the table. I got tired of waiting and went to tell the lady to at least bring us the Udon noodles so we could start eating something..the server felt bad and brought us miso soups, and all of a sudden all the food came at the same time. My Diet Coke came with no straw or the lemon wedge I asked for. The combination sashimi platter was sloppy..not slices of fish, but 1 inch squares!!! The white tuna was half frozen and so was the fake crab stick. The White dragon roll hardly had any white tuna..mostly avocado and it was not worth $12.99. Over priced, terrible service and bad quality of food. We will not be returning or recommend this place

24.description: What a hidden gem!  It's Spring, which means snow in Chicago and I wanted some miso soup to warm me up.  Found Asahi and I'm so glad I did! What a hidden gem :-)  walked in with my sis at 8:3pm and there was a steady stream of traffic for pick-up orders which we took as a good sign.  We both ordered miso which was some of the best I've had.  Warm, flavorful and salty (my preference).  My sis ordered spicy sushi rolls and I ordered the bulgogi roll.  Thumbs on both!!  It was my first bulgogi but not my last.Small little restaurant (about 6 tables), great ambiance, really sweet owner and personable waitstaff.  And most importantly, great food!

6.description: New management has upgraded menu, service, preparation in a big way. Recommended. Quality sushi that doesn't try to out-fancy the laidback Rogers Park vibe.

22.description: Delicious food and absolutely spectacular service!!! We had a wonderful time tonight and will be returning soon!

15.description: The owner is super friendly her name is Susan. I have become a regular here. Great atmosphere really laid back for a sushi place. I would recommend the Mexican roll. Every time I come here I feel happy the staff is friendly and talkative.

7.description: We have only visited Asahi Roll since their latest turnover this summer.  The new management/owners are delightful, friendly and amazing chefs.  We stop in here every couple of weeks now for affordable, delicious sushi, Japanese noodle soup and hospitality.  Staff is sweet and knowledgeable.  Sushi and soup is incredible.  Go give them your money -- eat a ton for a very reasonable price!

36.description: Best bibimbap I've had in Chicago after living here for 3 years. Very friendly staff.

30.description: I came back and tried their bibimbap and I am officially sold. It is SO delicious and satisfying. This place better stay open because it's about to become my go-to place in the neighborhood for take out.

3.description: What a hidden gem!  It's Spring, which means snow in Chicago and I wanted some miso soup to warm me up.  Found Asahi and I'm so glad I did! What a hidden gem :-)  walked in with my sis at 8:3pm and there was a steady stream of traffic for pick-up orders which we took as a good sign.  We both ordered miso which was some of the best I've had.  Warm, flavorful and salty (my preference).  My sis ordered spicy sushi rolls and I ordered the bulgogi roll.  Thumbs on both!!  It was my first bulgogi but not my last.Small little restaurant (about 6 tables), great ambiance, really sweet owner and personable waitstaff.  And most importantly, great food!

14.description: Really great space. The food is always delicious and the owner is very hospitable! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for great Asian cuisine. I live nearby and often see the staff around. They always say hello and are extremely friendly. It makes you want to go back. As far as the prices I find them reasonable for the good quality food that is served.

58.description: Hot ginge and super rad highly recommended, but the skill of the bartenders here are such that they could serve you swill and make it magically delicious.Ambience is wonderful, definitely a place for conversation over drinks. Not for those with dog allergies as pooches roam freely through the bar!Bar area is cozy, with an adjoining lounge, very quiet in the afternoons/weekdays and very very busy on weekends!

56.description: Went here last night and was more than impressed with the cocktails and the beer selection at this place. The owners were there and they helped us out. They are great people and overall was very impressed with the place. I will be back there in the future for sure.

29.description: Erik and Wally are great guys, mixing up great libations! These guys know quality booze when they taste it and I couldn't ask for a better supporting cast. You've got to try they're newest members of the booze family Bombora Vodka and CooranBong Vodka.

42.description: Leo serves the most amazing cocktails and this establishment is destined for long-term success! Craft cocktails at its finest with a low lit comfortable ambiance.

23.description: The entire staff was welcoming! The margarita was the best I've EVER had! I came on a weekday after work and there wasn't a crowd. I'm already anticipating my next visit to Rogers Park Social!

47.description: I appreciate deeply what is trying to happen at this "community oriented watering hole" in Rogers Park.The bar tenders are really some of the friendliest people I've met in the city, and on the few occasions I've visited - if you didn't know what you wanted from the tap - they were more than happy to provide a sample.No one likes being stuck with a pint of beer they don't want to finish.Every time I've visited, this place has been really busy.  Perhaps it is because it is located a stones throw from the Morse Red Line stop, perhaps because it is in a very pedestrian friendly part of the city, or perhaps it is because people like to drink alcohol, and will go any place it is served.While nothing definite stands out in my mind about the decor, I must confess that this bar actually felt like everyone inside knew each other.  I can't remember the last time that happened to me.  It was a really good feeling.I also love it when I get seating by the big front windows.  I like seeing all the people pass by, and enjoy seeing the smiles on peoples faces when the recognize a friend who they are meeting there.  Seeing a hug exchanged, and then a friendly gesture of opening the door is actually heart warming.Rogers Park is a very established neighbourhood, and I am glad to see that a bar of this caliber has found a place to call home.  It's a little bit hipster, a little bit gay, a little bit sophisticated, a little bit down-home.  Hence "Community" in the name... there is totally something here for everyone.Stop in and have a drink.  Or 3, like I do.

8.description: The walls, carpeted slickly with shredded magazines, carefully woven into a super rad wallpaper; the drinks, eclectically and stiffly mixed; the environment, half hipster, half Mad Men living room, have all created the perfect place to sip on good beer and cocktails, surrounding oneself by pretentiously unpretentious people, to the low-key and community-esq vibe that is--Rogers Park. Come socialize at the Social. Five stars.

31.description: Showed up on a Saturday afternoon, myself and my significant other were the only two patrons. Bartender was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Drinks were phenomenal (mine had pop rocks on the rim). I don't like grapefruit, and I ended up with some kind of grapefruit vodka concoction. It was delicious. Like many other reviewers have stated, the drinks did take longer than I'm used to for preparation, but I also chalk that up to watching him use FRESH (like he sat their and squeezed the fruit) ingredients. I'll take quality over expediency any day.The space is mid-century/modern chic. The location is great! I walk by this place on a daily basis, I might have to stop in more often. It often looks pretty busy though, and I can see it getting crowded quickly.Is this my new go-to??

34.description: This place is dope! Stellar cocktails, cool decor and you can bring in your own food (after 2 or 3 strong drinks, I need pizza). It's even dog-friendly. The bartenders are friendly and welcoming. Met up with some new friends here and it's a perfect environment for talking and getting to know people. I highly recommend.

16.description: What a wonderful place to ring in my 21st. This bar is a hidden gem. Intimate enough without feeling claustrophobic. We loved the bartender, Leo, and I was so pleased with both drinks and with the free tequila shot he gave me  definitely will be returning with parents or friends. Only complaint is they should get some food, but the bar snacks were yummy.

13.description: Friendly staff and the pimm sours were to die for. Definitely will visit again next time I am in town.

11.description: All I can say is I am glad I ran through the downpouring rain from Edgewater to Rogers Park for this place. I was meeting a friend for a "mom's night out" and thought it would be cool to venture out to the RP. I did my search on Yelp and discovered this place that had good reviews so I thought let's check it out! I was very impressed, It had this cool house party vibe to it and I went on a Sunday so it wasn't that packed-perfect! This was sorely needed in Rogers Park. The drinks are great, a little on the pricey side for this part of town but worth it,because they are really unique and well crafted. I can't believe this place is so close to me. I considered meeting my usual haunts in Edgewater but I really wanted to just try something new for once and I am so glad we did. And the music was not bad at all-I expected this divey bar type music that usually is not that great and mainstream,but they played pretty cool music including some indie international stuff which was from my part of the world (read:eastern european). So I give them an extra star for that.I saw they do live shows here too so I will be sure to check it out here again,maybe bring the boys this time.

39.description: This is a great little local bar in such a cute little nook.  We had a couple cocktails and then some wine, and all our drinks were delicious.  The bartenders are also very pleasant.

37.description: Great place. All the drinks are first rate (and the silver gin fizz is EVERYTHING !). Great bar staff, music is excellent.. Great place to meet, chat and drink.

0.description: At the Morse stop? This place is off the cobblestone alley along the tracks covered with Rogers Park murals and it's is your best choice for a chill conversation with a friend over a drink. Low slung-ceiling with a light retro-furniture vibe, this place isn't trying too hard (thank god). There's a TV, but it ain't a sports bar. They have live music some nights but it's not trying to be a concert venue. It's just a genuine neighbor-friendly pub-ish kinda place. No food here, but there's some nifty cocktails, and beer lovers (e.g. me) won't think their list is huge but it always has a enough perfect craft options on tap that I've gotta think through my choice. Plus the bartenders know what they're serving and are happy to help. Friendly staff, great vibe--this is five stars all the way.

38.description: What a wonderful place to ring in my 21st. This bar is a hidden gem. Intimate enough without feeling claustrophobic. We loved the bartender, Leo, and I was so pleased with both drinks and with the free tequila shot he gave me  definitely will be returning with parents or friends. Only complaint is they should get some food, but the bar snacks were yummy.

51.description: This place is delightful. It is undoubtedly our neighborhood favorite. Friendly crowd, cute doggies sometimes, good drinks, nice bartenders, cute space (though sometimes getting a seat is a challenge, but that's a sign of its appeal), and fun music (except when they play some French music that doesn't quite agree with me. Some nights they have live music, which is also pretty nice.

27.description: All I can say is I am glad I ran through the downpouring rain from Edgewater to Rogers Park for this place. I was meeting a friend for a "mom's night out" and thought it would be cool to venture out to the RP. I did my search on Yelp and discovered this place that had good reviews so I thought let's check it out! I was very impressed, It had this cool house party vibe to it and I went on a Sunday so it wasn't that packed-perfect! This was sorely needed in Rogers Park. The drinks are great, a little on the pricey side for this part of town but worth it,because they are really unique and well crafted. I can't believe this place is so close to me. I considered meeting my usual haunts in Edgewater but I really wanted to just try something new for once and I am so glad we did. And the music was not bad at all-I expected this divey bar type music that usually is not that great and mainstream,but they played pretty cool music including some indie international stuff which was from my part of the world (read:eastern european). So I give them an extra star for that.I saw they do live shows here too so I will be sure to check it out here again,maybe bring the boys this time.

32.description: This place is fantastic.  The vibe is friendly and cool, with a bar for the single lady or couple of friends to hang at, and an open space with varied cozy, quirky and hip furniture for more intimate experience if you want that.The cocktails are destination worthy - unique, good price point, and dangerously delicious.  I downed 3 Sassy Ginges with seemingly no effect...until there was!  And it feels local... yes - a place I can invite my friends up to the "far north" for.  Yep yep!

54.description: This place is amazing!!! And thankfully a good fifteen minute walk from my place, elsewise I would definitely take to drinking more than I should. :-) The ambiance is classy but warm and friendly, the cocktails are well-thought-out as well as fairly prices, and the beer list is awesome! Also, I love all the dogs. My new favorite bar.

48.description: A group of us came up here for a friend's birthday a few weeks ago. We loved it. They let her reserve a couch, so there was room for the 10 or so of us who were there. They had delicious cocktails. Things got SUPER busy later in the night and it was a little hard to get to the bar to get a drink.A few of us tried the margarita, which was really good (they add a shot in an inside out lime!)Try the beer cocktails. You don't see those a lot of places and the one I had was great (coffee liqueur, coffee stout, and a few other ingredients )

44.description: Drinks, board games, couches, and dogs. It's very comfy and the drinks are great. Reasonably priced as well. I'm definitely taking my dog next time. My absolute favourite drink was Freda's Floral Sparkler. I also enjoyed the Hot Buttered Rum.

24.description: The dog game is reason enough to spend a lazy afternoon here. The Oh, Pear and Mezcal Mule def roiled my tastebuds in a good way, as was the board game selection and people watching. Snacks leave something to be desired (hummus plates are the basic bitch in the appetizer circle of life). This is the perf place to grab a drink or two with your core, or awesome people you just wanna get to know better. Where else can you get your face licked by a Corgie and your mouth set on fire while playing Scrabble?

7.description: Great local spot. The bartenders were very friendly, the drinks were delicious and they are dog friendly. Can't wait to come back on a date with my 4lb Yorkie. They also had live music the night I was there. Very cozy spot. Glad i found it before winter hit.

49.description: I think this is a great bar.Someone else wrote "you feel like you're in someone's living room and there's a big party going on" - that's about it.  Pretty gay/hipster, some decent people watching, everyone's extremely nice.  I'm not a huge margarita drinker because they're just so damn sugary, but this one these guys make is crazy good.  It's got a halved carved out lime in the middle with the sugar syrup in it, so it's fun and not noxiously sugary - so so yummy.  Good mid-level music, pretty nice people, good chairs, etc.

40.description: The price, creativity, quality, and location make this place one of the best bars I've  been to

53.description: A great addition to the neighborhood! Incredible rotating tap list, great cocktails, and very knowledgable bartenders who know what they're doing and how to steer you towards something you like. The vibe is fun, with great mid-century furnishings. I don't even really mind that they charge Wicker Park prices in Rogers Park--it's totally worth it.

30.description: Stopped in for a pint. Place seemed happening on a Monday night with a small band playing. Intimate, places to sit, good friends. Can't say I spend much time in bars but was a nice scene.

46.description: This is my absolute favorite bar in all of Chicago! When I travel to Chicago from Ohio it's the place I feel most comfortable. The bartenders are so welcoming and are more than happy to suggest drinks based on your tastes and what you normally enjoy. The overall feel of the bar is very relaxed and comfortable. They display art from local artists, have signature cocktails designed by their bartenders so there is always something fresh and new to try and these cocktails don't cost an arm and a leg. It's also dog friendly! I recommend checking it out! I always have a great experience here!

1.description: Wow! I love this place! It makes me want to move here permanently so it can be my local watering hole. When searching Yelp along the red line to find a bar to gather some graduate school friends, I found RPS. The reviews sounded great, so I messaged them to see if it would be a good place for my group. Erik, one of the owners, was a treat to work with! He made it so easy, so inviting and so fun. They put up a sign reserving a small section of the couch seating area for us. We ended up having nearly 25 people from our group come through the bar that night. The bartenders were so hospitable, friendly and helpful. The drinks were delicious! We even ordered in some food, which worked out really well. I did a lot of tasting of the menu that night and my favorite is the Alchemist (note that my current default drink is an old fashioned these days). After the group departed, there were 4 of us, and we each had a final alchemist and played a game. I would highly recommend Rogers Park Social whether you want a solo drink on your way out or on your way home for work, whether you are meeting a friend or two, or if you are looking to plan an inviting and fun small social gathering. I have a few more weeks in Chicago and I plan to be back at least once a week until I go home.

55.description: Never disappointed here. Amazing atmosphere, delicious cocktails and beautiful tenders. Great smiles surround you and you know you are in the right place with every passing moment. Thanks guys for helping me celebrate my 50th!!

9.description: Had a great time at RP Social. This place embodies all of the diversity and personality of Rogers Park. Manager/barkeep was knowledgeable, gave great recommendations, and is a badass. Love that this place is in the neighborhood!

26.description: Went here last month for the first time to have my 25th bday party. The atmosphere of this place was really chill and defenitley a great place to get away from the the rough crowds of many of the bars in chicago. I had booked in advance and the owner, Erik, was very helpful in making sure my party was comfortable. He was even cool with us bringing our own food which was a big plus. I saw some complaints on here that the drinks took too long but I felt that it was the same wait time as any crowded bar. The only difference  is that their drinks were worth the wait! The bartenders really put attention to detail in every drink and I personally prefer that over a bartender just quickly throwing a drink together.All in all I really enjoyed this place, the people were nice, the bartenders and staff ( including the bouncer) we all very friendly and accommodating  and I will definitely  recommend as well as return to this place. Go see for yourself!

25.description: Best bar in Rogers Park if not the entire north side.

12.description: The entire staff was welcoming! The margarita was the best I've EVER had! I came on a weekday after work and there wasn't a crowd. I'm already anticipating my next visit to Rogers Park Social!

59.description: Absolutely a hidden gem.  Visited for the first time this weekend after an early performance at the Red Line Tap.  It's exactly like hanging out in a friend's living room - an eclectic friend with a huge living room, a bar, and a fantastic beverage menu. The cocktails are hand-crafted and done well.  The bartenders were as nice as could be.  The spaces were comfy.  Watching them make the drinks was like performance art (plus they'll explain as they go which is fun!)  Overall this place is was great.  Will definitely be back!  Note: A pretty large group (25-30?) wandered in, and there was more than enough space.  The drinks do take a little time to make, but trust me.  It's worth it.

21.description: Okay, okay, okay! Last night I met an old coworker for cocktails at RPS. She drove in from Villa Park just to relive her last experience here. I was so happy she tried the new "Summer Cocktail Menu". Matt our bartender served up a bit of magic. In her first summer cocktail offering it was in a cool coconut glass, then he mixed a colorful gin cocktail from their new summer menu in a martini glass...Pride does not even describe how pleased I was Doville had such a phenomenal experience, "AGAIN". Thank you Rogers Park Social and thank you Will & Erik for bringing this to Rogers Park (60626). What a little gem. In the words of my friend Doville "I wish Villa Park had something like this". I just smiled, a REALLY big smile!!!Love you guys!!!!

17.description: Awesome and unique place. This is a good spot for dates or just hanging out. The drinks were creative and priced fairly. The atmosphere is really chill and comfortable - you can actually speak with someone without needing to shout (crazy concept for a bar, huh?). The bartender was attentive and friendly. I'll be going back when I'm in that area again.

10.description: As a Peruvian, I'm happy to say this place offers pisco sours!!! They're delicious. Good environment and a very friendly staff makes for an amazing hangout spot.

5.description: Love this place just found it a few months ago and it my go to place - and DOG FRIENDLY!!! Amazing selection and the Bartenders are so cool. MUST VISIT if your in Rogers Park.

3.description: I would say that RP social is hit or miss in terms of cocktails, with probably more misses than hits. I've tried several cocktails and there were only a few that were really solid and it is heavily dependent on the bartender making the cocktail. The negroni and the blueberry pisco sour were very strong drinks - balanced, sweet but strong. But most of the other cocktails in the menu were not as balanced. Some ingredient - the sourness or bitterness usually - were always overpowering the drink. I would recommend Ward Eight as an alternative to RP Social. It is near enough and I've never had a bad experience there.I do like that RP social allows you to bring your own food though. It's great to have your choice of good to complement the cocktails here.

35.description: Been to RPS twice now and while I enjoy it, I think they need to beef up the staff and expand the space. The drinks here are phenomenal, and I've not been disappointed with anything I've had. A+ for that. The problem though: those delicious drinks take a LONG time to make. Most recently I was there on a busy Saturday evening, and the 2 bartenders just couldn't keep up. We stayed for about an hour and spent 40 minutes of that time waiting in line for a drink. The other 20 minutes were spent squeezed against the back wall by the windows, since there wasn't anywhere else to go. My first trip there was at 5 on a Saturday and we were basically the only people there. That experience was great, and if I make the trip back, it would definitely be when there's not much of a crowd.

19.description: Really fun place and really good drinks. The bartenders are nice and it's a cool place to hang out at with friends. It can get crowded on weekends but the service is generally efficient

28.description: Rogers Park Social has an incredibly nice staff and host a ton of wonderful events for no cover. Their drinks are creative and I've played a few games of monopoly with friends there (they provide a few games). My one complaint about this place is the size. I walk past it daily and often want to stop in only to see it packed with patrons. I'm glad they are doing so well, I only wish the space were bigger. The owners have done a fabulous job! Love all the French music and their being dog friendly.

45.description: I love this place!  It is not only inviting and warm, but adds a nice panache to the neighborhood.  I'll happily pay for a great cocktail in a nice environment with great music and staff.  Keep your crappy sports bars, your imports from Philadelphia, and your divey cash only "restaurants."  This is the best of RP, and I hope (dear god I hope!) that this becomes the model for other places in Rogers Park.

33.description: YASSSS! This spot is so good. Atmosphere. Service. Yummy cocktails. And I always meet really awesome people here.

43.description: What a gem! A friend introduced me to Rogers Park Social last night after an event at the Mayne Stage. What a cool, cozy, relaxing spot.  The drinks are reasonably priced, and the service was friendly. I only wish I lived closer!

2.description: This was an amazing find in my neighborhood! I heard of it a while back and was impressed by the raving reviews. The ambiance is amazing, the decorations had me staring because there's a ton of little details i didn't want to miss. They have a great toffee beer I highly recommend as well as the golden gurl. And I'm always happy to see not your fathers root beer beer on tap at a bar-it's one of my favorites. The service was great as well! I will definitely be back and I highly recommend this place!

18.description: Strong, reasonably priced drinks that all have their own personality. I started off with a Rum Punch, which was refreshing and not too fruity. I also tried the falling star- a crafty little concoction. Loved the whole cozy atmosphere, the friendliness, the bartenders- the whole evening was wonderful. New favorite!

41.description: OMG! There is a swanky cocktail bar in Rogers Park. Outfitted to suit the trendy youngsters of this city. Shocked & impressed. My bartender was the best!! $16 for two drinks is not my norm. But it was totally worth it for my intoxication level by the time I walked out. : )

52.description: THE RO PA SO! Best bar by far in Rogers Park. Quality drinks you can't get anywhere else because their bartenders actually know what they are doing and they take the time to make your drink great! So happy they are getting business, it's just been a little too crowded in there recently. Standing room only, can't even play scrabble. Sad face. But it's still good, so hang out here!

50.description: Feels dirty to not have reviewed Rogers Park Social yet. Came here for the first time the night after they opened, feel in love, and have never been disappointed yet. Perfect, chill, aesthetically pleasing atmosphere. The owners are super nice, the bartenders are prompt and friendly, the seating is diverse and comfortable. Weekdays are chill, weeknights are a perfect mix of active yet relaxing, while weekends are busy but the service and seating never suffers. The cocktail and beertail menu is insanely cheap (everything is under $10, I believe) and the beer menu has just enough on tap to stay interesting at excellent prices, as well. The place is a breath of fresh air for a neighborhood deserving of a lounge like this.

4.description: Okay, okay, okay! Last night I met an old coworker for cocktails at RPS. She drove in from Villa Park just to relive her last experience here. I was so happy she tried the new "Summer Cocktail Menu". Matt our bartender served up a bit of magic. In her first summer cocktail offering it was in a cool coconut glass, then he mixed a colorful gin cocktail from their new summer menu in a martini glass...Pride does not even describe how pleased I was Doville had such a phenomenal experience, "AGAIN". Thank you Rogers Park Social and thank you Will & Erik for bringing this to Rogers Park (60626). What a little gem. In the words of my friend Doville "I wish Villa Park had something like this". I just smiled, a REALLY big smile!!!Love you guys!!!!

6.description: Great local hangout! They have a very good beer selection, it's not extensive but well thought out. Lots of signature cocktails, I recommend the Mezcal Mule, its sweet and savory. Cool atmosphere with couches for lounging and board games for entertainment. They also have live music fairly regularly and they're dog friendly. RP Social is a must if you find yourself on Morse or at Loyola.

22.description: Great drinks!!!!   Poor service!!

15.description: OMG! There is a swanky cocktail bar in Rogers Park. Outfitted to suit the trendy youngsters of this city. Shocked & impressed. My bartender was the best!! $16 for two drinks is not my norm. But it was totally worth it for my intoxication level by the time I walked out. : )

57.description: Cute dive bar. It's been fixed up the last few years and is super nice for a dive bar. It's chill with most seating being couches. They have board games and live music some nights. Great selection of beer and a killer margarita. Hands down the best margarita I've ever had (they even make their own juice!), but man will they cause you to tear up the floor! Nice location in Rogers Park too!

20.description: Greatness! It can take a while to get a drink, but the drinks are great (and cheap) and the staff and clientele are true rogers park perfection.

36.description: So I've lived in East Rogers for a year or so now. I always had trouble convincing my friends to come up north for a night on the town. "What's even up there", they would say. Well--RP Social is up here. With a rotating drink list that has something for everyone, and even boasts some vintage favorites, I feel right at home and now so do they.Cocktails:They're worth trying a few of. My friends and I usually order a smattering of  things and share. One is simply not enough. The one that sticks out the most to me is their hot buttered rum from this winter...garnished with a cookie and full of real Kerrygold butter...I would say do it. I did it. And I'm a happier, more complete person for having done it. But outside of that, they do boast a very interesting collection of liquors and bitters behind the bar. Try something new, you won't regret it.Service:The bartenders are all lovely. Very amicable....when you can get their attention. They're busy people though, I get it! I just wish the drinks came out a tiny bit faster. When they do come out, they're always well done, though. So I can't complain that much.Ambiance:It's retro-mod. I'm sure there's a real word to describe that look out in interior-designer-land, but I am unaware of it. In short: I like it. They have vintage furnishings, fun old board games and (my personal favorite) they allow dogs to come hang in the bar. DISCLAIMER: if you have a noisy dog, or a nervous dog, this is NOT the place for you to bring them. It's very mellow. But relaxed dogs are always greeted with smiles and tons of attention from the staff and clientele.Give it a try. It's small, so it fills up fast. Go early, stay late. Great for a fun night out, without voyaging down to LP.

14.description: Showed up on a Saturday afternoon, myself and my significant other were the only two patrons. Bartender was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Drinks were phenomenal (mine had pop rocks on the rim). I don't like grapefruit, and I ended up with some kind of grapefruit vodka concoction. It was delicious. Like many other reviewers have stated, the drinks did take longer than I'm used to for preparation, but I also chalk that up to watching him use FRESH (like he sat their and squeezed the fruit) ingredients. I'll take quality over expediency any day.The space is mid-century/modern chic. The location is great! I walk by this place on a daily basis, I might have to stop in more often. It often looks pretty busy though, and I can see it getting crowded quickly.Is this my new go-to??

58.description: Why is it that everytime you leave an area, all of a sudden restaurants and services appear overnight?  Maybe its just me :)  When I lived near what is now five guys, there was nothing!  We had McDonald's express/subway and we were thankful!  Now you lucky people have five guys, chipotle, starbucks....the list goes on and on.  Anyway back to the review.  I'd heard the hype surrounding this place, so I made a special trip as to form my own opinion.  Upon entering, we were greeted by the free peanut sack that people had raved about.  It was nice to have something to snack on, but I found it very gimmicky.  I don't eat at burger joints for the free snacks.  I ordered a cheeseburger and fries.  The fries were very good, the star of the meal.  However, I was not impressed by the burger.  The burger itself was fine, but the bun was soggy and barely covered the burger.  So as a result, I will not be rushing back to five guys.  But, from the bottom of my heart, I am truly happy for you current Rogers Park residents as anything is better than that terrible McDonald's Express!

56.description: So so, nothing to write home about.  Probably wont go back, because there was nothing spectacular about the place and there are several well known burger places in the area.

29.description: Still haven't been able to park here, but they finally opened a Five Guys in Lincolnwood Town Center where I often shop--so that's what this review is for. Same observations as for the one in Chi. Ridge. But I wish my neighborhood one had easier parking!!!!!

42.description: Best thing here are the free peanuts!Burgers are a bit over rated plus way too many condiments offered for a sloppy mess of a sandwich with the works.And they should get out of the hog dog business. When I asked for it done Chicago style, the militant lady rolled her eyes and pointed to the menu board for condiments served. Then when I got my dog, I saw green peppers as in bell peppers, not sport peppers and the dog was sliced lengthwise and griddle fried. Bun was not steamed  and sandwich fell apart for sloppy mess #2.Thank you 5 Guys for the free peanuts!

23.description: Not too shabby. They always completely cover their their fries with salt, so I always order my fries with no salt, and do it myself. They are a little pricy but their portions are pretty massive.

47.description: First time (in California) was really good. Second time (in California) was OK but not great. Third time at Loyola was really mediocre. I scanned the reviews and agree with the 1 and 2 star ones. They serve the burger terribly by putting it at the bottom of their greasy sack of fries and nothing to put it on to eat it there. The quality is fair but not better and the "workmanship" on the burger is less than acceptable. The fries are abundant and mediocre and the price for all this is very high for the value received. The only plus are the peanuts and unlimited drink to wash them down with. Perhaps next time I'll bring a large pocket to stuff with peanuts and order a drink to go!

8.description: This was my first experience at a Five Guys and was surprised how good the bacon cheeseburger tasted!! The burger was very good and I was impressed how clean the restaurant was.  Good Job Five Guys will definitely return.

31.description: If you like burgers and fries you're going to want to go here.

34.description: The cajun fries are the only thing that justifies coming to this otherwise overpriced establishment. Yeah, the burgers are OK but hardly worth $6.50 a pop. At least the meat is fresh not frozen like McDonalds, which is a bit of a plus, I suppose. You know how else you can have a freshly made burger? Go to Dominicks, buy a pound of ground beef and make it yourself in the comfort of your home. Not sure I'll be back anytime soon except for the fries.

16.description: I love the yummy free peanuts, and I want to love their food, but I always get a belly ache after eating their burgers.  Service is Amazing!  Always clean.

13.description: I would not recommend this place or five guys in general. Their burgers are nothing special then plain old patties on boring white bread buns. I would not suggest getting too many toppings because the bun just cannot handle them. By the time you get to your last bite you'll have condiments leaking all over your hands. The Cajun fries are nothing special nor are there regular fries. Get a small size if you are eating with two people, the large it is an overkill. This is just an average burger joint with average food. I'd recommend McDonald's Burger King Wendy's and any other fast food burger chain you can think of over this place. It's just not worth what you pay for it. However if you're a Loyola student and are in need of a quick meal I guess you got to do what you got to do.

11.description: Not too shabby. They always completely cover their their fries with salt, so I always order my fries with no salt, and do it myself. They are a little pricy but their portions are pretty massive.

39.description: The burgers are great.  The fries and peanuts are good.  The employees were friendly.  It is close to home and the fountain drink dispensers are about the best of their kind that I have ever seen.  You can get several different flavors of several of your favorite drinks, all by touch screen.  It was the highlight of our visit.

37.description: Let me answer a question for those that keep talking about the fuss.  What is all the fuss right? Like totally, here are the answers for some of you.Fresh meat, never frozen hamburgers.  Hand formed meat patties.Fresh cut fries fried in peanut oil.Why the fuss ?  Because it's not the shit you get at a usual char house where the typical burger is a frozen patty.  Also, you can almost guarantee that the peanut oil used to fry the fries is always fresh.  Trust me, (i.e.) Jimmy's burgers on the corner may not always change out the oil.  It's the reason why their french fries often taste like burnt pizza puffs or my biggest grievance, when fried mushrooms taste like fish nuggets.
