Ugh.  For Five guy newbies, you want to order a "little" burger.  Which means single patty.  The often complaint is their pricing but you have to understand how to order to get your bill to the right amount.We popped in the other night for a quick meal before a house party, you'll be happy to know Five guys is typically open till 10 pm.  Wonder what happens when Jacob is cold and hungry.  I become more critical.  It was about 20 degrees out and inside you couldn't tell for certain if the heaters were on.  I hate eating in the cold and that too, we sat closer to the kitchen!  The floors were wet from the traffic of college kids with snow stained shoes.  FYI, some rugs during the winter months would be helpful or get an employee out here routinely with a "caution" sign and a dry mop.  Another hangup I have mostly about this location is all the signage.  In this tiny space, it's overwhelming.  I get it, every Five guys location has all this advertisement of the rave reviews received in other states.  Why not put up shit that you've gotten here in IL.  Kind of tired of reading about stuff said in other places.The food we got was consistent with Five guys quality and I would rate them higher because I do like Five guys as a quick but not greasy burger option but eating in the cold was not appealing.  Also the state of the floors, granted the season of January, but to put down a sign and try to clean up the water would have been appreciated.

0.description: I enjoyed my  burger and  fries. Just needed salt/pepper on burger and you're good. The pop machine is sooo awesome.

38.description: Food was decent - cheeseburger tasted like a fast food burger and cajun fries tasted like fast food fries.  That's what I was expecting.My major complaint is that it is ridiculously overpriced.  For two burgers and a fry it was over $20... not a fast food price.  Yes, I know it's Chicago and a trendy restaurant, but come on!  Portillo's is far better and less expensive.  I could go to a sit down place and pay the same price!Five Guys: lower your prices, and I'd come back.  Otherwise, I'll go to McDonald's and get my fast food fix at a fraction of the cost.

51.description: So walking in I could see why the inevitable comparisons to In-N-Out happen. The decor is very close red and white tiles every where. The people behind the counter wearing the same type of paper cap. The menu board in the same style, both have hand formed burgers from fresh not frozen meat.Aaron S. and I ordered up our burgers with everything and sides of fries and sat down waiting for a short time. I notice all the signs that say how good the burgers are, and I have to say seeing all that boasting made me a little skeptical. There is no need to have that signage all over the place if your product is really that fantastic.Burgers and fries arrive. The burger was a decent size. You can tell that the patties are hand formed by looking at it. I gotta say though, while I found the meat to be juicy and fresh and of decent flavor, I found it to be way under seasoned. Does it compare to IN-N-Out? No not really. Does it live up to all the hype on the walls? Not exactly. It was good don't get me wrong, but for me the lack of seasoning made it not live up to it's potential.What was the real star here though? Those fries. Hand cut, fried to perfection. Nicely salted, and in a huge portion. A small comes in about a sixteen ounce cup plus they fill up your bag with enough fries to refill the cup. They were probably the best fries I've ever had, and I would come back here on those grounds alone. Hand cut fries are fairly simple but not so simple to get perfect, and that is what they do here. I was debating giving them only three stars but I those fries are what the fourth star is for.

27.description: Five Guys saved me from eating dining hall food every day. The burgers are delicious, the fries are delicious.Definitely worth your money.

32.description: Great place for a burger and fries.  They added BLT to their menu.  Meh.

54.description: Absolutely love their fries! The burgers are just okay to me, nothing special, and everything there is way too pricey for me. Am giving them 3 stars for the heaping portions of terrific fries (which I happen to like soggy) and because the staff there have always been really nice. Plus, I like getting the free peanuts while waiting for my fries to cook. Typically, then I go down the street and pick up a double cheese burger from Mickey D's for $1, because I think you get a lot more value and flavor for the money for that than you do for a Five Guys burger.

48.description: The guys at this place were really great! We went here before our mothers day movie date. the food came quickly and you get a TON OF IT!!

44.description: I had yet to visit a Five Guys joint. I walk by this one every time I jump on the Red Line to get downtown. But not today. I decided to stop in and get a burger to go, largely because I needed a little TLC - and also because I hadn't eaten there before.The place was not busy. Only a couple of people at a few tables and no one in line ahead of me. It took a while to process the simple order of a mini cheeseburger and fries. But this is a good thing, when it comes to fast food. So no complaints here. If you want custom-made fast food, it ain't gonna be that fast. For that, go down the street to Mickey D's - if you please. But you'll be missing a great dining experience if you do.The price was more than I should be paying these days for such fare, but as I said, I needed a little TLC, so I was treating myself. Had time to visit the bathroom, which was messy. I just don't understand why people don't bother to flush. But that's not Five Guys' fault. When I got my food, the bag had so much grease on it, I was grateful to have an extra large baggie on hand to put around it. I threw it in my bag and went on to my next destination - the El across the street. Greeted by a few policeman who barred the doors, it was clear I would not be taking the Red Line at this moment. Apparently, there was a "problem" at the Wilson stop. Something told me it wasn't a mechanical problem, either -- given what I've come to learn about that stop.I quickly had to decide, as I watched a 147 whiz by, whether I would wait for another one to get downtown. Or I could catch the 155 that was coming and just go back home. Not remembering what the stop would be for my destination off the 147, I found myself focusing instead, on the wonderful smelling burger and fries that were just beckoning me. So I jumped on the 155 - greeted by the same bus driver who had just dropped me off 15 minutes before in the other direction. I know this, because he said "Back again?" Whereupon I told him that the Red Line was not running due to some kind of hostage situation at the Wilson stop. I also decided it wasn't worth it to wait for another 147 going downtown. Besides, I'd have to think about which stop to get off at. I was happy that my burger and fries were still warm through all of this chaos. My first action, after tearing into my burger and fries - was to fire up the 'ol laptop to do a review, before I forget. Overall, I am very pleased with this burger and fries. The mini is more than enough for one person to eat. And the fries runneth over, such that I will put the remainder in the freezer for a snack at another time. This burger reminds me of Fatburger in L.A. -- they were known for some of the most juicy and freshly made burgers in town, garnering awards, much like this joint.I probably won't be back again for some time, until budget permits. Paying nearly $7 for a miniburger and fries is pricey for my budget. This holiday season has brought a few more challenges than I was expecting. But isn't that always the way? Less than good financial news is often brought at the end of the year, just in time to spoil people's plans and lives. So thank God Five Guys Burger and Fries is around as comfort food. Expensive -- but well worth it. In fact, I'd skip a few meals for one like this. So that's my story, in the Windy City, this Monday, December 5th  - pitch black outside - at only 6pm. Well fed and ready for bed. But too early for that. Besides, I have work to catch up on. You know, for that client who doesn't really deserve it. But, a girl's gotta eat, right?

24.description: I've never really been a huge fan of Five Guys, but this location gave me a pretty good experience. The service was really friendly, and the burger was very good. It's in a convenient location, as it is a block from the Loyola stop. Even though I am not a big fan of the fries, these were still pretty good. If I were a Loyola student, I'd come back.

7.description: I have eaten at plenty of other five guy locations, and never had an issue. I just moved here, and will not go back.The hotdog had the weirdest texture (tofu-like) and smelled funny. It took forever and there were no orders in front of mine. The worst part were the employees, the person who took my order was so rude and made it seem like I was an inconvenience for getting food there. Bad overall experience.

49.description: This place is pretty hyped, and some of my friends rave about it, but I'm glad it's rated 3 stars here... I think A-OK is a pretty fair statement.  As far as chains go, yeah, it's a good burger.  But it's definitely not a 5-star burger.  I'd say it's your average, dependable burger, and the fries are pretty good too.  If you can make it to a bar or some other non-chain burger joint... there are better burgers out there.Service is fine, free peanuts are a nice touch, and I don't really mind the wait at all.  I'd rather know I'm waiting for my burger to be cooked to order, rather than them nuking a pre-cooked burger and dropping it on my plate.

40.description: I was somewhat disappointed with my burger. I never thought that could ever happen with five guys since I'm in love with them. Not sure, maybe it was an off day. My brother loved his so not sure what was wrong. It was still tasty, just not as tasty as I've had at other locations. Fries though were amazing!Guys are all nice though and they have the cool soda dispenser with tons of coke products, even vanilla coke if that's your thing.Parking is awesome, it's Loyola area but there is un-metered street parking around the corner.

53.description: Never went to one before but it was delicious. A little pricey and this location was a little slow, but I'll be going back.

30.description: My last visit was horrible. Idc about their burgers anyways. But no seasoned fries. Really!?!?! I came home and opened a bag, nooooooo!!!!! Just salted fries!!!!! Disaster!!! And I know their toppings are free but I asked freaking pickles on mine. And that was missing too. That burger and fries ended up in a trash. money so not well spent at this time!

46.description: The burgers here are ridiculous (meaning excellent)!! My daughter and I love this spot.... The guy that helped us out at the register was very friendly and did a job well done. But, I guess since it's near a college campus the guys are always checking out the women. That's the only downfall I have when I come here. My child shouldn't be asking me questions about why there staring at women.

1.description: It was alright. Should have just went to the grocery store.

55.description: I've been there 3 times. I ate the cheese burger. It was ok, but I liked it less each time, and felt grosser after each experience. Here's why: The preponderance of self-promoting signs (maybe it's tongue-in-cheek, but then again maybe it isn't, and whatever it is, it's annoying).The greasy, sloppy appearance of the burger ... a burger is always going to be "bad for you", but it should at least LOOK fresh and appetizing. This is especially puzzling considering these are made to order. Why does my burger look like somebody sat on it or put it in a microwave?The poor quality of the cheese. It just tastes ... off.The too-high price. This IS a fast-food joint. It's not like I'm paying for ambiance (cf. the tacky signs). And I'm not seeing any of those signs promoting grass-fed beef or organic produce, so it's not like I'm paying for premium ingredients either.The ho-humness of the fries. They're a perfectly serviceable vehicle for ketchup, but that's not what great fries are in my book. Without ketchup, they're fairly tasteless and lack that delicate texture. And I don't like the Cajun seasoning.And, as another reviewer so aptly noted, the burger's striking resemblance to something from Wendy's (minus the square meat).  Seriously, so true.If free toppings are a big deal to you (and I guess I AM glad you can get free veggies on a burger somewhere), and you like big burgers but aren't super picky, then you could eat here and be happy. For me, it's In-N-Out for fast-food burgers or else I'm saving my money for something better.

9.description: Really good burgers and fries!!! I order my cheeseburger with jalapenos, bbq sauce, raw onion, and lettuce. So yummy.

26.description: I've avoided this chain for a number of years, despite the hype. Today I gave in and although the burger and fries were tasty, they're far from being the best. The bun didn't hold up (one of my pet peeves) so I wound up eating my sandwich with a knife and fork. Easy online ordering made for an efficient pick-up experience, but prices were a tad higher than I expected from a fast food experience.

25.description: I would give them a 5 star if the burgers weren't that pricey. But yes, they are juicy and tasty, get all the toppings you can get, the price will remain the same with or without toppings. And go HUNGRY, the normal size burger is huge!

12.description: At first you may be shocked at the expensive prices, but it is worth it if you need a good burger.  I usually get the smaller bacon cheeseburger because the regular size is pretty big!  Fries are good as well.  The taste is definitely worth the price.

59.description: I really, really like five guys. The burgers are solid - very juicy. I don't think I truly appreciated the place until I had not so stellar burgers at Wellington's and M Burger. I especially love all the toppings - most for no extra charge. Yes, I'll have some veggies like mush and peppers to not make me feel so bad about the unhealthiness of the burger I'm about to eat!

21.description: Bacon cheeseburger, all the way with jalapenos, regular fry and a large drink! It's not healthy, good for you or in my regular diet but it's so f%$#ing awesome!! Five Guys is my go to burger, and since I only eat red meat once every few months I think that says it all. You can come here, get a great burger, eat, go into a food coma and continue with your day or you can still be waiting in line to spend more money on an over-hyped burger at one of those gourmet burger places. I've done both and I'll pick FIve Guys, every time.

17.description: I should preface this by saying I haven't been here in awhile now, but the last severals time I did go the people working there were simply awful. The food is what I expect from 5 guys, and in general I like it, which is why I am giving it 2 stars. The people working there are loud, inattentive, and overall annoying to have to listen to while eating. Also, the a couple times I was there I had to ask them to refill the ketchup dispenser, which isn't a big deal, but it took so long to do I ended up eating everything before it got done. I will likely give them another shot in the future, but if it's still bad I'll have to just go to the 5 guys in Evanston for my fix...

10.description: Been there a few times and loved it. Super yummy, people are friendly, service is great. Not Gourmet food, just really yummy, tasty hamburgers!!!

5.description: I'm going to give this place a four star review because I have to admit the burger was awesome. I didn't love the fact that I spent probably $30 on two double bacon cheeseburgers one order of fries and two soft drinks. But where I have to give them credit is I didn't crave the Burger on more than one occasion even after my distaste for the price. That says a lot about the food.

3.description: This is another one of those places that is way over-hyped.  Sure, the food is fine, but not great.  Seriously, go to Wendy's......

35.description: Yes, it's more expensive than most fast food ($13 for a burger, fries and a drink) but it's the extras that make Five Guys a great place. The burger itself is pretty typical, but they have a large selection of toppings and they don't charge you extra for them. There's a fancy fountain drink machine that lets you add different flavors to your drink (like vanilla to your root beer) which is pretty sweet. The fries are good and they give you more than you can eat. My one complaint is that the place is decorated with quotations that praise the restaurant like "best burger" and "mouthwatering fries". These are everywhere andI could do without them, but overall a great place to grab a burger.

19.description: Bacon cheeseburger, all the way with jalapenos, regular fry and a large drink! It's not healthy, good for you or in my regular diet but it's so f%$#ing awesome!! Five Guys is my go to burger, and since I only eat red meat once every few months I think that says it all. You can come here, get a great burger, eat, go into a food coma and continue with your day or you can still be waiting in line to spend more money on an over-hyped burger at one of those gourmet burger places. I've done both and I'll pick FIve Guys, every time.

28.description: I love 5 guys, fresh ingredients and the best fires out there ( gotta get the seasoned fries)There are a lot of choices in the toppings, and they are all fresh.There is a problem with the parking but,  you just have to park a little bit away, or just a little farther down the block.The burgers are well worth it.Also they have the coke freestyle machines and you can make hundreds o f selections for your drink,  and free refills.

45.description: Had to detour and try this place after hearing that they are about to set up shop here in my beloved Hyde Park.  Ordered the Hot Dog for my daughter, surprised how greasy it was, but she liked it, so points were scored there.  I tried one of their famous burgers, which was wrapped tightly in foil and weighed about 100 lbs.   Drum roll please....  The burger was indeed tasty.   Most memorable about my burger was the bakery style bun, which added a nice element.  I had heard people rave about their fries, folks, don't believe the hype - nothing special about these fries.   Verdict:  3 stars, not bad, but not overwhelmingly good either.

33.description: Way, way overrated.  This is just mediocre food in a (loud, plastic, fluorescent)  fast food atmosphere at sit-down restaurant prices. Remember Checkers? (Apparently they still exist on the South side.) Think of Five Guys as Checkers, only with food that's not as flavorful and (easily) twice as expensive.It makes sense that people would rave about Five Guys food when comparing Five Guys to McDonalds.  But how lucky we are that Five Guys and McDonalds aren't the only options.

43.description: I'm mainly writing this review to mention the new space-age ultra high-tech coke machines this location has.  There are two of these bad boys on premises. Basically, there is no longer 6 or so of your standard coke/diet/sprite/root beer/iced tea/lemonade choices, instead you get a touch-screen menu with what seems like an infinite number of selections of all types of carbonated flavored beverages that have ever been invented (and sold by Coca Cola Co.), including all the flavors of Fanta that you didn't even know existed (peach?).  The only downside - you have to make up your mind quickly while going through a couple levels of menu selections with a line of increasingly impatient patrons starting to grow out of your back. And free peanuts to go with the fancy soda!

2.description: My first 5 Guys Visit!So, Initially my Birthday Meal was supposed to have been at anotherupscale restaurant..However, because I am not very well co-ordinated and a bit of a KlutzI somehow pulled something and wound up with a pinched sciatic nerve,which pretty much K.O'd my dinner plans!However, since I am not hard to please I decided to not go too far frommy residence and try out 5 guys.Now, honestly, I have heard various opinions on 5 guys, but since I neverfollow the crowd and always make my own decisions I decided to seefor myself, and gotta say, so glad I did.Honestly, 5 guys delivered me one of the best Cheeseburgers I've everhad in my life!And, since I had never been to 5 guys before it was explained to meby the nice/cool guy working the counter area that there is a little cheeseburgerwhich is a one patty type deal and then there is the Cheeseburger whichis worthy of 2 patties..Okay, so since it was my Birthday I went for the gusto and got the Cheeseburgerand boy, was that ever delicious, truly one of the best!And, it kept getting better, truly delicious hand cut fries, easily rivaling myfavorites from J.B. Alberto's!For the record, I don't use or say the word Delish as some of my youngerYelp Friends do, I'm Old School.. Sue Me!And, did I mention this 5 guys has not 1 but 2 Coke Freestyle Machines?I Love these machines, I have one at work and I'm always playing with iton my breaks, seeing what flavor combinations I can come up with.:)Hey, when you're 53 you take what excitement you can get!Now, the old saying, you get what you pay for, seems true enough.5 guys menu prices seemed a bit high and I winced a bit as I handed overmy hard earned cash, just hoping that this meal would be worth the price Ipaid.And, happily I can say it was worth every penny.After todays visit I finally understand all the hype..And, in my opinion it's well warranted...

18.description: One of my favorite burger joints. Love the fries they are like the ones you get at Fairs. I normally get the Cheese burger with fresh Jalapenos for that extra spicy flavor with french fries. I like to add the vinegar to the fries with salt which reminds me of Fish and Chips in England.

41.description: Five Guys makes no bones about their business. They make burgers, fries and hot dogs piled high with whatever toppings you want. Their portions of french fries, which are fried in peanut oil (YUM!) and large enough for a big person and easily shared between 2 or 3 people. I often just get an order of regular fries and eat the free peanuts that they leave out for their customers.My standard order is a regular fry and a hot dog with grilled onions, grilled mushrooms, ketchup and mustard. Go with the hot dog over the burger.

52.description: There seem to be a lot of fancy schmancy, foodie-type burger and hot dog places popping up these days. They spend a lot of time over-thinking how to reinvent the wheel. The results are usually just okay and rarely merit all the praise.Five Guys does not fit this mold. They have honest to goodness awesome food. It tastes fresh and is incredibly satisfying. You don't have to be some five-star chef to make a great burger. Oh, and if you order the large fries, plan on sharing them with someone. Huge portion!The only bad thing about five guys is the wait. It takes a lot longer than one would expect for a burger and fries. Of course, I might just be a little too impatient too.Highly recommend this burger stand!

50.description: If  you haven't heard it, yeah this place is good.  In N. Out wasn't good to me btw.  I don't know what everyone rants and raves about how good they are.  To me, five guys was better.    The fries indeed are just perfect - crispy and full of delicious.

4.description: I get here (along with 2 other people in front of me) at 9:58pm. The store closes at 10pm. It was fairly busy but the girl at the register tells me that its after 10 and she will not be able to take my order. Really? Why would you turn away business? I know I came in right at close but again the store is busy and they were still making burgers at the time. It wasn't like it was dead and they were cleaning and getting ready to leave? Not good for business

6.description: 4 stars for the burger and friendly employees. 1 star for the fact that the condiment counter and floors are sticky and gross- My shoes literally stuck to the floor around the pop machine, and I found only one table that was clean. C'mon, 5 guys! I mean, who is managing this place? (Also, if the dining area is dirty, how clean are the grills? etc) Next time I'm taking it to go.

22.description: I thought it was fantastic.  Great burger with all the toppings you want.  Over 8 dollars for a bacon cheeseburger is pretty hefty, especially since I could get a superior burger from Johnny Rockets for two dollars less, but they closed the one downtown next to the Chicago Theater, so Five Guys it is.  It's a great choice when you just need a good burger.

15.description: I have been living here for almost a year now and have only been here once! The time I went the burger was so disgusting and it was soggy! It was falling apart on me while I was trying to eat it which was awful! The fries are probably the best thing about this place! I won't be ever returning here again!

57.description: Over cooked tasteless burger, under cooked fries, large drink for $12.  I'd rather go to McDonalds for better tasting food half the cost.

20.description: I've been to a few Five Guys in Ohio and it is definitely some of the best food that you can get from a semi-fast food restaurant. It is a little more expensive than fast food chains but like I mentioned, the food is much better. The decor is the same in every location I've been in and adds a nice vibe to the place. The Sheridan location near Loyola was similar to other places I've been. My only complaint was that it was slower than other locations I've been to, despite there not being much of a crowd.

36.description: First, I LOVE Five Guys. I used to eat and enjoy it all the time when I lived in Detroit. However, this particular location is lagging in so many ways.I've eaten here three times. Each time, I get a sloppy burger which is also relatively tasteless. McDonald's does a better job of keeping their burgers looking more presentable. I understand the patty's are hand-molded, but come on, for a burger that costs $6+ I expect more.Do better, guys.

14.description: Good burgers and friendly staff. I enjoy that the burgers are the same way every time I go in there. The peanut that they have for you while you're waiting for your burger is a nice touch.

1.description: I would like to give it zero stars if it were an option. I ordered the sesame chicken combination platter and what I got was a clumpy greasy mess. The shrimp fried looked like something that was scrambled together from last night's leftovers and was soaked in grease. The woman who took my order was rude (per usual for Chinese restaurants in America). Never again!

9.description: For cheap Chinese food, this place gets five stars. Best chicken fried rice I've found around Rogers Park. Everything I've had from here has been great, and they're very consistent with how they make their dishes from order to order - I've ordered from this place TONS of times, and I've only once had something be off or weird (they also delivered my food a lot faster than usual that day, so I'm not sure what that was all about). But even then, it just went from being better than most of the other Chinese places around here to being at the same level. The only weird thing is they put corn in their egg drop soup. I'm not sure what the deal with that is. Also, I've never had a problem paying by credit card. You have to ask, and they do have a minimum (like $10 or $15, not really a big deal), but I've never been told I couldn't use my card.Side note: GrubHub has this place listed as China Spring Chinese Cuisine. Don't know if they changed the name after they opened or something? But yeah.Edit: They have friggin' smoothies, too. And they're good. How could I forget that? And how could that not be awesome? That alone counts for a star.

12.description: I wouldn't order from here if my dog needed to eat. First off, I called in to place an order for delivery. The chick who answered the phone was extremely rude and snappy. She put me on hold for 10 minutes then after asking for a vegetable egg roll screamed down the phone that they were close to closing. She refused to take my bank card and asked if I had cash because the total was only $17.00. When did places stop taking your bank card? Once I told her to cancel my order she hung up on me. I called back to ask to speak to the manager. She said "Manager not here" and slammed the phone. Will never order from here again and I will be certain to make sure I tell all my friends in Rogers Park this place has the worst customer service. Hunan Spring is the worst Chinese spot in Rogers Park!

21.description: (Yelp has this address listed as Hunan Spring, but I swear my takeout menu says China Spring:) - either way, same address).I am rating this restaurant based on carry out only (there are a few small tables, but I've never seen anyone dine in).  China Spring is pretty good, but can be a tad greasy.  I was hesitant to try it but have since ordered from there several times.  They have a huge menu and everything that I've had has been tasty.  They are super fast, friendly and very reasonably priced.  I recommend China Spring for a fast, easy meal. I hope that they stay in business because I think they're a tad better than some of the other fast Chinese/ Thai places in the neighborhood.

16.description: (Yelp has this address listed as Hunan Spring, but I swear my takeout menu says China Spring:) - either way, same address).I am rating this restaurant based on carry out only (there are a few small tables, but I've never seen anyone dine in).  China Spring is pretty good, but can be a tad greasy.  I was hesitant to try it but have since ordered from there several times.  They have a huge menu and everything that I've had has been tasty.  They are super fast, friendly and very reasonably priced.  I recommend China Spring for a fast, easy meal. I hope that they stay in business because I think they're a tad better than some of the other fast Chinese/ Thai places in the neighborhood.

17.description: I was hesitant about trying this place but it was the closest place for chinese near my apt. It looked pretty busy, so I decided to try it. the girl taking orders in the front was on the phone taking carry out/delivery orders, so I had to wait awhile till she was done. I ordered my Chicken Chow Fun and paid the $8. It took about 15min till it was ready. There was only two people in the kitchen. The lady who gave me my order was really nice. I went home and enjoyed my chicken chow fun. the chicken was better then I expected and it was a good sized portion. I will be back to try more things off their menu. They even have my favorite moo chu pork on the menu.

10.description: Food is okay. Ordering is a f****ing nightmare!

5.description: I'm not sure why the north side is such a desert of decent Chinese places.  I get it, Chinatown exists, but that's soooo far away!  Anyway, of the 3 Chinese restaurants in the mile stretch on Clark between Morse and Rogers, this is the best.  I crave chinese like a pregnant woman, so I promise you I know what I'm talking about.  The wonton soup is fantastic and the general tso's chicken is never fatty or risky.  Decent crab rangoons, excellent egg rolls.  The chick at the register can be kind of a b sometimes, but she means well, I'm sure.  She probably doesn't understand the fake attitude American customer service requires and I can't blame her.  As long as you keep making the most delicious pork lo mein this side of town, cuss me in your language however often you want, sweetheart.

11.description: I will admit that my review is based solely on my single experience with their fried wings. I was in the area and the scent of the wings was in the air from Clark street. I am SUPPOSED to be ona diet, but those wings smelled so good. the lady behind the counter was friendly and took my order. Not even a complaint that all I sought was a single lousy order of wings!! The only downside is that I had to cross the street to PLS check cashers to get cash out of the ATM (which didnt work so I had to wait in line, but thats a whole 'nother story) because they do not accept cards for orders under $10. Either way, it was very much worth it. Those are some of the best chinese food wings Ive had in years!!! Matter of fact, I live 20 minutes away, but I think I'll drive over now for an order.

3.description: I have always told with my wife that all Chinese food tastes the same and am always hesitant to get Chinese for dinner. We just recently moved to Rogers Park and tried CHINA SPRING for the first time. It has totally changed my mind about Chinese cuisine! Everything I ate tasted great and didn't have the normal MSG flavor that most Chinese food has.

0.description: Second visit: this is seriously the best orange chicken I have ever tasted!  Quick delivery, consistent feast, ten dollars cheaper than my usual place.  Nice delivery guy, lots of food, great pork lo mein.  I'm sold.  Side bar: broccoli is not a garnish, it ends up a gross farty smelling addition to an otherwise great dish.

20.description: I was hesitant about trying this place but it was the closest place for chinese near my apt. It looked pretty busy, so I decided to try it. the girl taking orders in the front was on the phone taking carry out/delivery orders, so I had to wait awhile till she was done. I ordered my Chicken Chow Fun and paid the $8. It took about 15min till it was ready. There was only two people in the kitchen. The lady who gave me my order was really nice. I went home and enjoyed my chicken chow fun. the chicken was better then I expected and it was a good sized portion. I will be back to try more things off their menu. They even have my favorite moo chu pork on the menu.

19.description: I ordered on a Saturday night, it probably wasn't before 6:30pm that I called.  It took over an hour and a half for the food to be delivered.  A friend of mine in my building orders from here all the time and he's never had a problem.  I will never order from there again.  The food wasn't hot and not that good.....

2.description: Ghastly. The missus ordered chicken egg foo young, I had chow mei fun. She pushed it away after a bit, said it had no flavor and the rice was bad. Mine was OK, not great. Had hot and sour soup, too. It had an odd and unwelcome aftertaste. Egg rolls could have been Chun King, straight from Jewels' freezer. The search continues...

18.description: I order here all the time, and they've always been fairly prompt (within the hour). The ingredients taste fresh and the price is good, but some dished can be a tad greasy. My favorite are the rice soups, chow funs and the singapore chow mie fun. They've never screwed up my order either - just ask them to read it back when placing order.

13.description: Paid for 20$ of food with a 50$ and the delivery driver actually started to walk off with the change. I'm not sure if this works on anyone besides people that are falling down drunk but he seemed upset that I actually asked for my change back. Does anyone tip more than the cost of the food on delivery, have I missed a new trend? I thought only taxi drivers performed these kinds of shenanigans.

4.description: Great price. Fast delivery. Highly recommend . They cater to any special requests. The food is always fresh. Nice family owned business.

6.description: This is my chinese take-out standby.   There aren't really many places for Chinese food in the Edgewater/Roger's Park area-- and although you could get pho just down the street, sometimes you just want some good greasy Chinese American in front of the TV, ya know what I mean?If those are your expectations, then this place won't disappoint.  My last order: Wonton soup, and the chicken and shrimp with eggplant.  Since it totaled over $10 I got a free egg roll.  The soup was a little salty, but the wontons were big and it also had shreds of pork and cabbage, which is more than I can say for other take-out places I've tried.  The eggplant dish was not as spicy as I would have liked (sriracha in the fridge to the rescue!) but it was perfectly greasy, the eggplant was nice and soft, and the shrimp large and plentiful.  The portion (for $9) was very large, good for 4 servings at least.  The egg roll was an egg roll, what more do you need?The food came within 40 minutes.

15.description: Wont ever order from this place again.The food is okay and they give you healthy portions. But you cant screw up orders and not take responsibility for it.Second time ordering from this place. Called and ordered Chicken with Garlic Sauce and a small Shrimp Egg Foo Young.I told her that I was paying with my card and the woman taking my order asked if I had any cash. I said no and she reluctantly took my card number. I went through this the first time I ordered from them but I Iet it go.I get my food and I got Chicken with Broccoli and a large egg foo young instead of a small. I overlooked the egg foo young because I didnt specify small or large, but she should have asked.But I did not ask for Chicken with Broccoli. I called back to inform her of the mistake. She giggled and insisted that I ordered chicken with broccoli. I told her that I dont like broccoli and I know what I said. She was silent. I hung up because I was very hungry and I wanted to eat and go to bed.I called back the next day and I began to explain the mix up and this time she called me a liar. I told her I'm going to visit them in person to get this resolved. If you make a mistake, you correct it. You dont accuse customers of lying.I understand with certain restaurants that English may not be the first language of the people who work there. So when I order, I speak very clearly, but not in an insulting way.So to be misunderstood and then accused of lying is unacceptable.Take a chance with this place if you want, but dont be surprised if they give you the food they thought you ordered instead of what you asked for.

7.description: First place I've found in Chicago that does mongolian beef reasonably well, though they could do with less onion in the container. Sesame chicken is good, and the presentation always makes me laugh: plastic takeout container packed with yummy chicken and a huge, bright green broccoli floret in each corner. The sweet & sour chicken has that funnel cakey taste which I'm not crazy about and the sauce tastes a little ketchuppy. Sometimes they leave out the egg roll we order with a coupon, no major complaints, though. It's so close and there aren't many options for Chinese around (sad), so we usually hit up Hunan Spring if we're in the mood for it - nothing really stands out but it works. I'm still waiting for a great place for takeout in Rogers Park.P.S. The place is actually called China Spring, and GrubHub has it listed under both names. Just so you know what you're looking for!

8.description: It never fails.  Each and every time there is some issue with the girl who takes the orders.  I placed an order for several lunch specials.  I let her know I would be paying with a credit card.  The order far exceeds $10.  She says CASH ONLY FOR LUNCH SPECIALS.  Okay, where does it say that on the menu.  She could not point it out and I still have not found it.  I asked for a manager, who is conveniently not there.  She caves in the end and we complete the order.  Simple fix.  STATE ON YOUR MENU THAT "LUNCH SPECIALS" CAN ONLY BE PAID FOR IN CASH.

14.description: This place is great for take-out. The inside is small and really hot, so i wouldn't recommend eating there. My husband and I shared a wonderful mango smoothie, the szechuan  bean curd was quite tasty and spicy and I really liked the chicken with peapods, but it was a little bland for my husband. I would also recommend the crab rangoon, they are huge and very flavorful.

3.description: This nail salon is under new ownership. My go to nail person called me and let me know he was leaving the salon he was currently working at (a 5 star salon on yelp) to open up his own salon. I just went to visit him and he is determined to make it a great spot. I've been going to him to do a gel fill, gel nails and pedicures for a year now. I would recommend him over and over again and can't say enough good things now that he's taken ownership of this salon. If you want the very best, ask for Frankie (now owner of the salon).

1.description: This has been my go to place for a few months now, mostly because of the close proximity to my apt. Lucky for me they are so wonderful here! I always get a regular pedicure and a gel manicure and everyone I've had has been great. Ling is one of my fave nail technicians! She always matches my toe and nail colors perfectly. They also give you a punch card which is great if you go there often! The price is reasonable too! $50 for a regular pedi and gel mani! Love this place!

2.description: Queen Nails is awesome!!!!  The staff is friendly and make you feel sooo comfortable, it's very clean and inviting. Thank you Winnie and crew!!!  I love my nails and got so many compliments!!!!

9.description: I really felt relaxed & pampered! The service was extraordinary & super friendly.  I only get this done 3 X's a year but from now on I'll b goin more often...Go Bulls!!!

10.description: I just returned home from a very negative experience at this nail salon. I normally go to Princess Nails further south on Clark, but they were closed.  I requested to get my acrylic set removed and then have it replaced with an acrylic French tip. They put me on a station to have my nails soaked off...and then ignored me for a half hour. My skin got very dry, and there are several areas of my fingers that were covered with an acrylic film and it never got removed. When they were finally ready to give me my mani, my manicurist had a laptop set up at her station and was watching TV AND instant messaging while attending to me!!! I couldn't believe it. I was further shocked when her phone rang and she answered it. She wasn't at all interested in doing a good job, and I had to show her flaws several times. The nails she gave me are thick and ugly, and will look horrible in a week when they grow out. While drying them, she burned my thumb and it really really hurt because the acrylic got over-heated. The polish had bubbles in it, so I asked her to redo it...and she used acetone remover. Um...shouldn't she know that acetone will melt the surface of my nail??? So now one of my thumbs has a rough texture to it. At that point, I didn't even bother telling her what to do, I just wanted to get out of there. Thankfully, she gave me a lower price than advertised, maybe because she could tell that I was very unsatisfied. However, I didn't go there to save money, I went there to beautify my hands, and this business did a poor job.  I usually give high tips to even mediocre service because I know how challenging it is to work in a service industry, but this woman did not receive one from me.

4.description: I'm still fairly new to the city and had been searching for a  great nail salon somewhat near my home. I had tried a few salons in the area, but hadn't  come across a salon I wanted to make my new home. I must admit that I'm very picky. My first time in was right when new management took over. John did my nails. I was so impressed. He listened to what I wanted and they turned out exactly how I like them!!! Ever since, I've been coming here for John to work his magic! The owner and all of the other technicians are very friendly. Prices are very reasonable. They have a huge selection of nail colors and brands and have a lot of nice touches that I haven't seen in other salons in the area. They work very hard here on customer satisfaction. I have NEVER left disappointed!

6.description: I purchased a groupon for a hot stone pedicure.  I called Friday for an appointment on Saturday and mentioned the groupon...seemed like an appointment wasn't necessary however the groupon says by appointment only. I arrived ten minutes before my appointment and they were busy but still sat me in a chair to soak my feet in hot  water while I waited. I was taken about 15-20 minutes after that. Although the guy who did my nails was odd, he meant well and did a great job on my French pedicure. He seemed passionate about foot health. He could have been seen as pushy but he was only trying to encourage me to return to the salon.  Kim was also very sweet and professional.  I would suggest giving this place a try regardless of the negative reviews. I will be returning!

12.description: I like this place.  They have the best massage chairs, they're cheap, and they're nice.

5.description: Thanks Frankie you are the BEST Love my nails come and check out Queen nails under new management Come visit i promise u will walk out with a big Smile and very satisfied

13.description: New to the area, I was desperate for an eyebrow wax, so I popped into this salon. The sign says that it's under new management. The store was clean and organized, and I was greeted promptly and asked to sign in. I wasn't too thrilled that the waxing station was an office chair about five feet from the front door, but I was desperate and I've definitely seen worse. For seven bucks, you can't expect a spa bed, I suppose. Kim was my waxer, and she was very friendly, asked for my name, used it several times, and suggested I come back soon for a mani/pedi. My brow area wasn't prepped or powdered, and the wax application was heavy and a bit too hot. Upon removal, no calming or wax removing gels were applied. The results were perfect, however. Overall, I wasn't thrilled, but in a pinch I'd go back. I'll ask for the wax to be cooled a bit more before application.

11.description: Nail salons are sparse in Roger's Park, so the pickins are slim. I stumbled upon this nail salon tucked away between the typical track style store fronts along north Clark Street. I asked for a mani pedi. picked my colors and mounted the typical message/foot tub chair. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the nice woman attending my feet took her time and care to do a efficient and thorough job. She paid just as much attention to my nails. One hour and $35 later, I walked out with a sense that this is my new "local" spot.

8.description: Horrible experience. The nail tech made two fingers bleed and I've lost all my nails, thus having to get fake ones. My right middle finger is still numb....hours later. The pedicure done by Ms.Kim was the best I've ever had but after the experience with my nails hell no, I will never return. Never mind that its a complete hole in the wall. Cuz if  you do the job well I don't care about the surroundings. Never mind that they turn the TV to what they want to watch...something that isn't even in English.This is the second time I've been there. The first time, Ms. Kim did my nails. She did ok.....but the nails were chipped 2 days later. DO NOT go there!

0.description: Been here 4 times and its a pleasure every time! The salon is under new ownership and I am so happy it is! They have many workers and stations, so if you go during a busy walk-in hour, you'll be fine. They offer mini water bottles and check up on you frequently which is great!Also, they literally can do any type of nail art or style you want. And they take their time on you! They want you to come back and thats why they offer the best service possible. If you come 5 times and get your card punched, you can get $5 off of their already affordable prices!

7.description: This nail salon sucks ! I once came here for a full set of acrylic nails . When i first arrived the nail salon was very crowded and loud . Nobody greeted me or even noticed me for the first 5 minutes . Finally I called over one of the employees to ask a question about what I was getting . She abruptly said "what do you want ?" How rude !!! I was tempted to walk out but I really needed my nails done & there wasnt really another place I could go to at 5pm on a Saturday . So I waited my turn and after an entire hour I was seated to start on my nails . The lady whom had rudely spoken to me was the one doing my nails . She did a terrible job ! First she didnt remove all the color that was originally on my nails . Then she made me bleed twice & ripped my cuticles off basiclly . Then the nails she applied were WAY to big & very boxy . A week ago despite my first horrible experience I went back for a basic manicure . I mean what can be difficult about a basic mani ? It was very empty so I was immediately sat down .  The man whom did my nails was kind at first . But he started making me really uncomfortable . He was being unprofessional and kind of whacky . He stared so awkwardly at my hands and was rough with them . Then he kept asking for my phone number . I wanted to leave at this point but i needed my nails done by 8am the next day. He asked what I wanted done and then he kept bribing me to get something else . I said no I want what i originally asked for . He still painted what he wanted on my nails ! I couldnt believe it I was so pissed . I wasnt even going to pay at this point because it wasnt what i asked for . But i didnt want no trouble so i pulled out the 12$ for the mani & he says no its 25$ . On the menu where they have all there services it says $12 for a mani . He says he gave me a no chip manicure so i gave him $15 and walked out. Two days later my nail color started chipping. That doesnt sound like a no chip mani to me . He ripped me off . I will never go back here again !

3.description: This is one of the great gems of Rogers Park! Nighat does some of the best threading in the city, quickly and with skill. Haircuts are excellent. She also does color, facials, manicures, and more. Her prices are very low. You are treated to a background of Pakistani music. The place is not fancy, but I leave not having spent a whole lot of money, and that makes me happy!

1.description: I first came here because we had just moved from St. Louis and it was the closest salon that I could find that did walk-ins. Now we are moving to uptown and I will go out of my way to come back! The owner is amazing, she knows what she's doing and is genuinely a great person. The prices are very low and yet you will get better results than the places that charge three times as much.

2.description: I stopped in here today for a mani/pedi and a facial after seeing the wonderful reviews left by others. While it was an okay sort of neighborhood salon, I was rather disappointed. It's obvious they get their products from Walmart, except for the Mary Kay hand scrub they used for my manicure. Actually, they used it for my pedicure, too, which was really odd. Rosa is very aggressive and tedious with the cuticle trimming and drew blood on both my big toes. There's no pedicure chair, just a cracked plastic tub to put your feet in under the manicure table, and then the scrubbing happens right there too. Balancing your feet in a position that's convenient for scrubbing and toe painting while sitting in a wheeled chair is really awkward. While my toes now do look very nice, I could totally do this myself at home, and better. The facial was definitely better, but it used generic Walmart brand stuff that made me wonder why I was paying for the service when I could just go buy this stuff off the shelf myself. The chair was rickety and uncomfortable. The extractions were also not what I am accustomed to. No magnifying glass, no light, just raking the tool across my face so quickly that I wasn't sure there was really a point. I will say that Ms. Jamal's facial massage was heavenly, though, and would be a real highlight in a better salon as well.I am admittedly spoiled by spas, but I didn't walk in expecting zen. I've had cheap mani/pedis that at least still had a proper chair and didn't draw blood. The girl sitting next to me was getting a henna tattoo. Ms. Jamal's work there was absolutely gorgeous. If I ever go back, it will be for some henna - but I'll be looking elsewhere for my mani/pedi and facial.

0.description: My husband introduced me to the owner about 12 years ago and I have to admit I was skeptical to come and get any sorts of service done since I was a strong believer of luxury spa and salons. I was pleasantly surprised with my experience. Nighat the owner is professional, warm and kind. I have been coming to her for all of my beauty needs and even bring my kids for their haircuts. My husband won't let anyone touch his hair except Nighat as she is the master of haircuts. We make a special monthly trip down to the city to get our services done. Her personal care and touch exudes in every service that she provides. Almost all of our relatives go to her.

4.description: I've been getting my hair cut at Hadis Fades on Irving Park.  Great place, great prices but not in my neighborhood at all. So I've been looking for something a little closer to home. And I've found it. Salon City looks like a beauty parlor but one day I noticed a small sign in the window. 'Fades. All kinds.'  Ask for the manager, Ms.Jamal, she is a perfectionist. Great haircut, great price, friendly service... And right on my way home from work. Perfect.

3.description: This place is the pits.  It's a hang out for every thug and public drunk in Rogers Park.   It's little more than a purveyor of pints in paper bags.This place should be closed.

1.description: First off, there are only 5 other reviews for this place and most of them were from like 5 or more years ago. I lived right around the corner from this place and it is pretty good. I used to go to Dominick's for alcohol before they closed and when they did, I switched to this place. The prices are not bad for a small liquor store. It's also pretty safe. The owners and 2 mexican workers are pretty passive. They obviously aren't there to give you a five star greeting, but they aren't disagreeable in anyway. They also have a pretty good selection.

2.description: There are few places I refuse to go into alone.This is one of them.  The place is creepy.  The people who work there are creepy.  Frankly, I don't even like walking past there but I have to to get to Morse Market, which I love.Rogers Park: Please close this place.  It unnerves me.

0.description: I agree with the previous review coming to this place's defense. If you feel like this is an unsafe place, you need to take a day-trip to Funkytown proper. This is a little, dingy neighborhood liquor store, but I have never seen anything violent or scary take place here. Just some kooky drunks getting their pint of Gilby's. The prices aren't even that bad for the little mom n' pop place it is. Also, in addition to the older man and woman, the two Mexican dudes who work there are pleasant enough. I even watched them one night be serenely passive with some customer who was clearly trying to antagonize them. They got yer smokes, they got yer booze. That's their purpose in life. Quite frankly, I read the negative reviews of this place like this:"Non-white people scare me."

4.description: I just have to respond to the reviewers getting down on Soo. First, sure, it's a pit. Sure, there are gang bangers that hang out outside and kill the trees (as well as other things, I'm sure). But at least this is a business that has hung in there and remained open to serve the drinking public of East Rogers Park when so many others have fallen by the wayside (often with a little help from developers and their friends in high places). Hey, look around Morse. "I see gang bangers" "Where do you see them" "Everywhere from Lakewood to Ashland, man! Open your eyes." Sorry about that. There are two liquor stores left on Morse now. I try spread the wealth between them.. Sure, I like the staff at "non-Soo" better, but I want both to stay open (it's not so bad to have competition, you know). Bars on the windows when they they close? Oh yeah! You betcha'. I'd deem them "fool" for less. "Aarr! There be booty, bottles and butts in dar!" In short, I can't blame anyone for going to Jewel for a 18 pack and grabbing the Red Line (I've done it, for price sake) if they worry about their safety at Soo. The Gift of Fear can keep us all safer if we listen to it.

0.description: The best jewelry repair shop that I know of. Jose, the owner is the best. He is honest and a joy to deal with. The price for repair or if you want your own design to be made by him is very reasonable. I will highly recommend this place. I have never been disappointed and I have been going here for at least 10 years. 5 stars!!!

1.description: OMG the worst customer service ever . I just finished placing and order on the phone the lady that helped me seems so unhappy and seems as she did not want to be at work I just can't  explain the way she talked . Just so not want to help you and just wants to rush the order and just kept saying anything else , and when I was finished never said thank you and Ended the call I feel very sad for this lady date and time 2/22/16 11am

2.description: I had seen this store in my neighborhood and wondered about it, and then, I received an arrangement for my birthday.  It was really beautiful and fresh.  The fruit was delicious and lasted for several days.  They deliver, and it is made the same day.  I would definitely order this for a gift.

0.description: Staff is always pleasant.  I've picked up several things from here and it's always been a good experience.  GF hasn't complained yet :-)
Took over an hour for my haircut ,and it still needed to be redone.

3.description: This nail salon is amazing!!! First of all cleanliness is a huge factor for nail salons for me and this one is super clean and just remodeled - it's so pretty! Second the owners are so sweet and accommodating! They all make sure you are satisfied! Lastly you can't beat their prices!!! Especially being a student! And as a student you get a discount! It's also perfect for someone who tans you can get all pretty for your night in one place! Found my nail home!!

1.description: I will begin by saying that the nail salon is very clean and the technician I had was very nice.  I walked in for a no-chip manicure and was accommodated right away.My nails looked good when I left, but after about three days the polish began to peel up around the edges.  I did not have any time to stop back in to the salon to get it fixed, so I just let it be.  After a week, the polish was peeled up so badly that my nails we getting caught in my hair any time that I touched it.  After a week and a half, my nails had multiple chips and one of my nails had actually broken.  When I have had a no-chip manicure in the past the polish has simply grown out and has still not chipped after wearing it for three weeks.  This no-chip lasted a week and a half.  I went to another salon to have it removed.  I won't be back to Passionate.

2.description: Found my new nail place! The staff is friendly and accommodating and they will not let you leave until you are satisfied. The prices are reasonable and they offer a student discount. Also, the salon is clean and decorated nicely. Would highly recommend.

5.description: The place looks amazing. Very clean and have plenty of services at a reasonable price. The people are nice and they do a great job at pedicures and mani. In not big on pedicures but after coming to them I'd come back again. They pay great attention to detail and love to converse to get to know their clients. I'll be coming back again. Great job guys!

6.description: I have tanning package here and the beds are awesome, all new bulbs , people are super super nice. My nails look effin fabulous ! Highly recommend ! Nails,tanning,waxing and more ! Love it here !

0.description: Great nail salon in the area with friendly staff, great customer service and high quality works for reasonable price! I had to wait about 10 minutes until my turn but it's definitely worth it. They treated me with great care and made me feel like home. I had Deluxe Pedi and it came out great. The place was really huge, clean and well organized with plenty of modern chairs. Highly recommended!

4.description: Been waiting to try this place for a while, as I live right down the street from it. My roommate got her eyebrows threaded, they looked great. I got a pedicure, no complaints here. Good service, good job, a little expensive for me, but a good experience all the same!

12.description: Best & beautiful earrings that are inexpensive & culturally stylish!  As others have said you can cheaply purchase pure, unrefined shea butter, and also for sale is black soap, incense, oils, crafts.  I love the clothing -- features both ethnic fashion and some nice western labels.  Keywords: very affordable.  The owner or his daughter is always there, always accommodating & always welcoming.Tip: There's unmetered street parking out front on Sheridan but no parking from 4-6 p.m. for rush hour.

7.description: I love this store and the owner.Since the north side lacks African or Caribbean imports, this is my go-to shop for natural shea butter. I wish the owner sold different varieties of oils, otherwise I would do all my hair shopping at this place. Besides my precious shea butter, you'll find lots of African-related clothing, jewelry, body care, and more. If you have any questions, the owner is very helpful and will recommend anything regarding your needs.

19.description: I discovered this great spot while on the north side one afternoon with my husband. Upon my 2nd visit I received again excellent customer service from Mr. Ntamere . I found him to be accomidating, warm and charming I also found two beautiful masks in the process. Another nice place to visit in the city!

1.description: On Halloween, one star: The hours on the sign for Saturday say 11 a.m. to 7 p.m., and it was horrible trying to find a parking spot in this neighborhood. I really wanted shea buttern and had been to this place years ago. Today I saw the lights were on inside, but no one was there. I waited 30 minutes in the pouring rain to see if someone would come. I was there at 12:30. No one ever came and another customer drove up, came to the door and left within minutes. For a shop this easy-to-miss and with the parking the way it is, he should honor his hours. I am not coming back. I paid the parking meter for nothing. I am cold, wet and shea-butter-less. And he is not even answering the company phone number on the sign.Changed to three stars: I left a voicemail message complaining about the time I wasted outside. The owner called me three times and left two messages apologizing. While I did go somewhere else and told him so, the fact that he continued to apologize and called back was somewhere between annoying and relieved that he actually cared. While I still don't know why there was no sign left on the door, the lights were still on and the "Open" sign was turned around, I do respect that he tried to right a wrong though so i came back to this post to edit. Would I go there again? I have a nice choice of shea butter for now, but IF I go again, I will definitely double park, figure out whether it's open and make sure someone is inside before I spend 20 more minutes driving away looking for a parking spot again. Then I may venture in.On 11/28/2015: I went back to the location for one more shot (and I ran out of shea butter). Got there at noon and watched a couple peer in, shake their head and say, "Well, it is a small business." They turned around and turned back to the location. I was baffled. Not again! Sign still says open time at 11 a.m., but the lights were out and no one was around at noon. I went to see a movie and came back at 2:20 p.m. Lights on now, but there's a sign on the door that says someone would be back in an hour -- without saying when that hour ends. I just shook my head and left. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. Fool me three times, I'll never go to that place again.

2.description: Excellent, excellent customer service. The owner is very attentive and takes his time to explain the benefits of various natural products. He talked me in to getting the Shea butter scrub and I absolutely love it. My skin feels so soft and moisturized. I also bought the Shea butter. I'm glad I found this spot. Will be coming back.

9.description: Love this place! Went in today to purchase earrings and nag champa incense. Very reasonable pricing and great variety of ethnic pieces. They have a little bit of everything; clothes, jewelry, soap, furniture, etc. Great customer service. Will definitely be going back!

6.description: Great products and great service. The owner is always willing to answer questions and help you find what you are looking for. Like everyone else who reviewed this wonderful establishment, I go for the hair and beauty products as I am Nigerian and what better place to get products that work for my hair and skin? The jewelry is also really cool as well as the décor items. I enjoy my experience here every time I go. Check him out!

18.description: This place is a gallery of beautiful African crafts.  I have found some amazing gifts here.

10.description: I searched and searched for a location that sold Authentic African Black Soap because even though this is Chicago, unfortunately, that is not an easy thing. So.. Thanks to Yelp and my GPS system, I was able to find Unan Imports! The soap was VERY reasonable, I got the big tub for $10.00!!! That is SO worth the search and drive.  I also picked up a tub of Cocoa Butter, I only passed on the Shea Butter because it is easier to find in the city than the other two and I already had some at home.  The clerk was very helpful and nice. Unan had a nice collection of African attire and jewelry, if you are looking for that and YES I would come back again and again for the Soap, Butters, and oils.

13.description: I love this store as well. The shea butter, perfume oils, and HEM brand incense  (which I can't seem to find anywhere else in the city) really do it for me. It's also where I go for cheap thrill jewelry. The owner is cool and personable but never overbearing.

16.description: Cool store full of African imports and such. Owner is very friendly. The shea butter is great for the winter.

17.description: I just saw today that this place is starting to carry fair trade items - yay!   Definitely a place to check out.  The owner is very friendly!

15.description: Great small business, and the owner is extra helpful and professional. I was searching for raw shea butter in Chicago. I went here to purchase some shea butter, and this store has a great selection. I purchased 2lb of raw shea butter, but he also had smaller sizes starting at $5. Great price, and great quality. Store also carries black soap, and a great selection of jewelry accessories, very unique and cute hats. If your in Chicago and looking for shea butter, or unique fair trade accessories go here!

0.description: If ever you want to meet one the best person on this earth; go to Unan's.  I've been coming here for 5 years and it's always a delight to meet, talk and purchase items from here! Always honest, always helpful !!! Unan always a delight to see you!! You have some of the most beautiful and authentic African artifacts and supplies that have adorned my home and have been given as we'll appreciated gifts to family and friends!!!

5.description: Also confirming the owner's knowledge and attentiveness. My partner has eczema and the African Black Soap has really helped him, thanks to the owner's recommendation.

11.description: For Real. All different kinds of African imports from black African soap, which by the way, is perfect for acne prone skin. A whole tub for $10. yes, ten bucks and the stuff lasts like 6 months. Next time I am getting the shea butter scrub because they didn't have a smaller jar than the $20 and I could not justify spending that much even though it was worth it and would have lasted probably an entire year....They have all kinds of free trade items, cute costume jewelry with an ethnic flair and also authentic clothing. Coupled with sandals and statues and furniture, this store has a little bit of everything. All tastefully displayed and inexpensive.Love. Love.

8.description: Wonderful owner and excellent products! My honey has been looking all over for cocoa butter. We tried every store possible in Chicago. We were excellently surprised they carried it here!  Yesterday he was able to make a homemade organic body butter with the cocoa butter we purchased from Unan and other organic ingredients. I love the outcome!  I also purchased the cutest maxi dress. ;)Highly recommend this store!

3.description: Do you suffer from severe ashy skin? Shea ButterIs your skin kinda, well, you know, not cover girl or ambi smooth? Black SoapWhen you went out last Saturday night, was your jewelery game not proper? Earrings, rings, whateva!Is your hair all kinds of wrong and you need to cover it up for the day? Yep, Hats galore. Ooooh, I love your new condo. It's hitting! But, it's kinda empty! YEP, they have furniture to warm up your space. I LOVE this place. And I had been wanting to go for a very long time. However, having lived in East Garfield Park and this place being all the way in Rogers Park and not being open on Sundays, I just couldn't find the time. So, one day, I didn't have to work, so I scurried on over here and was floored by the vast selection. Everything you could need to get your easy breezy on, is available here. And for very reasonable prices. The owner is AMAZING! He's very nice and very helpful. I was looking for a very specific pair of earrings. He went to his back room and searched and searched for these earrings, to no avail, but the fact that he even tried was very nice. Shea Butter, Black Soap (in liquid or solid form), BEAUTIFUL jewelery, clothes, furniture, this place has it all. And much of this stuff is limited so you won't be worried if a million people will have the same items as you. DEFINITELY worth a perusing!

14.description: I just purchased a beautiful African mask from the Ivory Coast from this dealer. This store has a wide selection of masks, carvings, traditional clothing, and textiles to choose from. The quality of the items is just outstanding and the owner provides welcoming, friendly service. Prices range from the reasonable to the slightly more expensive, but the artwork for sale is truly worth the price.

4.description: Very unique store. I was searching online to purchase black soap locally and was quite pleased to find that I can. It was not easy to find, but after weeks I found a blog where someone mentioned this store and the sale of black soap. So I trekked over on a Saturday afternoon with the whole fam and we spent an hour browsing the little store. The owner makes craft jewelry so I bought my kids a bunch that they loved.The store sells a variety of black soaps independently packaged by owner, as well as other organic soaps made by Nubian Heritage and Dudu Oson. There are also tubs of Shea Butter for sale, in addition to body oils, castor oil, and other oils I can't remember by name. Hats, not sports ones, are also for sale for men and women. They are very casual and classic in style. Then there are scarves, cultural African clothing, masks, instruments, and so much more that I probably didn't get to see while I was focused on buying what I went there for.The black soap is absolutely worth the trip there and I will be back. We do not use any other soap becuase this black soap has been so effective in cleansing, as well as eliminating skin issues, especially my two teens acne problems.A great find in Rogers Park.

58.description: Love. This. Place.Fantastic acoustics in a gorgeous venue. Saw a band last night, Sierra Maestra, from Cuba, and they were MONSTERS. Congaaaaamania. I sat in the balcony, quaffing my reasonably priced beer and gazing down on this incredible band. The lights were great, the sound was amazing, and I'm coming back here again and again.

56.description: Great food and drinks.  However- the real gem here is football season.  Watch the games live on their theatre screen in the back while you get great service.  I miss this place soooo much.

29.description: What up Mayne? My favorite ESPN anchor is Kenny Mayne. He's my Mayne man. It would be horrible if a water Mayne broke at the Mayne Stage.. Ok, I obviously don't perform here because my jokes aren't funny... However, there are well qualified commedians that do perofrm here.  Simply put: easy street parking, right next to red line for pub transit, great comics come here, and the theater layout is pretty cool.I saw Dave Attell here and it was awesome. Before the show we ate at the bar and noticed a lot of very cool comedians have been there (they got a bunch of old signed/framed promo posters on the walls).  I'm def going to start paying more attention to this place. As for the bar food, not bad, not great... I really like this place and I'll come back..

42.description: It is 9 PM and I just got home from a Leon Russell show. I was really excited to see him in this venue but it was a huge disappointment. The sound was terrible! The bass was shaking the room and the sound was so loud that it was incredibly distorted. The sound for the opening act, one woman with a guitar, was fine but she was far from great and unscheduled when I bought 4 tickets at $50 each. Can say the burgers were good but the onion rings were greasy and doughy, sauce was super tasty though. I have been there for several other shows. Think it might be best for acoustic music. That's it, very unhappy right now.

23.description: We are ALWAYS at this place because it is soo close to home. Service is hit or miss but we love Manny, Corey, Johanna, and Kelly...they all take good care of us!

47.description: So cool!Nestled onto a random strip of Morse in Rogers Park, the Mayne Stage is an impressive event space. The theater is comfortable (major AC in 100+ weather!), appropriately lit, small without being claustrophobic, and easy to get around.I saw NovaLima, a Peruvian band here, and I had a wonderful time. First, we each got a drink, and the drinks are well-mixed and well-priced ($6 for each of ours). They must know how to sell an appropriate number of tickets, because the small space was intimate and not too crowded - though still fun and lively. The acoustics were also wonderful. Helpfully, it's right off the Morse red line stop, too!

8.description: Mixed feelings about this venue. My wife and I went to see Janene Garafalo here, and even though the theatre lends an intimate setting, I feel like the seating arrangement is a bit awkward. I suppose this is to accomodate the people serving food and drinks, but I felt somewhat distracted from the performance by the constant shuffling of food-runners and waiters. If the right act were to come through, I would definitely come back.

31.description: Let me start by saying that the folks who originally gutted this space and built the Morse Theatre from the once neglected building did a phenomenal job. The result was a splendid jewel in a neighborhood should rise to the occasion. The concept of restaurant/bar in the front and performance space in the back works extremely well as independent siblings.The shortfall comes with the technical appointments in the performance space. First, this was built to accommodate fairly simple stage bookings like comics and musicians. In other words it's not a theatre for shows requiring specific needs - like sets and lights. In fact, there is very little backstage space and even less off-stage changing room for such occasions.From an audience point of view, there is a genuine lack of feature (white) lighting to cover the stage. There are some beautiful accents (colors), but if a performer takes a few steps sideways or moves to the front of the stage, the fixed rigging of white light just doesn't allow the performer to be lit. Ouch! This is a HUGE point when the audience simply can't see the main attraction. This can be fixed, but it hasn't seemed to be a priority. If you can't adjust your hanging lights to cover the front of the stage, then the real fix is to add a moving spot - and an operator.Most importantly, the sound system seems ample and perched properly to do it's job - but it doesn't. For a music venue, I have found that a singing performer just can't be heard above the instrumental in various areas of the house, upstairs or down. This could be the operator and the mix of the sound from the board. Whatever it is, the sound person needs to take of the headphones (that's right) and actually listen the the sound in the house. My multiple visits have left me so frustrated with the sound (and lights) that I feel embarrassed that this stunning neighborhood space is in the wrong hands.The Shakespeare Theater on Navy Pier has a similar arrangement. Perhaps they can let a technical hand to how to make things work properly.Mayne Stage has so much going for it but what it lacks is crucial. Even the seating arrangement doesn't seem very comfortable and efficient overall and as a "VIP" I've had to jockey for a "guaranteed" seat. That's not right. Please get your stuff together. Please. I beg you.

34.description: Purchased tickets for a Saturday cd release party. Mayne's listing, and pricing, implied that the artist would perform. Wrong. Six of us bought tickets and all they provided was a dj and the artist greeting people. Asked for refunds on tickets and they just laughed at us. Buyer Beware, they do NOT care about their patrons.

16.description: This was my fifth visit to Mayne Stage in Rogers Park and I am just writing a review now.  Perhaps the reason is that my previous visits were more for the sake of my BF who loves comedy shows and could spend hours on YouTube watching people I don't really think are funny (according to him, I'm lacking a sense of humor, but to each their own).  This last visit for us was for my sole enjoyment since I am a HUGE Janeane Garofolo fan.  Because I had a good time, I was actually able to take note of the many assets Mayne Stage possesses. The theater has valet parking for $5, but street parking is plentiful if you don't mind walking a couple of blocks because it is located in a very residential neighborhood.  It's a nice venue with a restaurant and bar attached to the front, making it very convenient to have dinner and relax prior to shows, which usually don't start until 10:30.  If you skip dinner, never fear, because you can actually order from a decent sized menu in the theater and usually very attentive servers.The main theater itself has a nice setup, with a pit, surrounding booths around the perimeter of the bit and then balcony seating.  The theater has great sound and I personally don't think there is a bad seat in the house.They really try to get a wide variety of performers and in the case of my 5th visit, really try to offer something for everyone.  Though it might be a trek for people who live south of here, it's still worth the trip.

13.description: Perhaps I'm biased because my hubby plays here every so often, but hubby aside, I've been to a lot of performance spaces in my lifetime and I always enjoy coming here.
