Situated in the Rogers Park neighborhood, the venue stands tall and proud in the neighborhood with it's glowing outdoor signage and cool classy vibe. Their is a front lounge area where you can enjoy drinks and a great food menu. They also have entertainment on the small stage after hours. The venue is spanking clean and kind of reminds me of Park West. There is sunken seating area where you can get a real upfront kind of experience with seats along the wall and tables. Depending on seating needs they also pull random tables into the middle of the area there.Surrounding the sunken area on the main level are the side wings with quaint tables and booth seating to enjoy a more private experience. The tables are two-tops with curtains between the tables. The main level has banquet seating with a large table for enjoying smaller party gatherings and the balcony area has tables all around the perimeter. The sound quality is lovely, and depending on who is working the sound board that night you can really hear all of the performers on stage nice and clear.I've had the opportunity to be on stage and the vibe is super intimate. The bathrooms are nice and clean, the additional "green room" and hangout rooms for the performers are also top notch.Intimate. Clean. Upscale in feel. Super acoustics and a great programming mix. Parking can be a bit tricky, so get there early!

11.description: Mayne Stage is so hit-or-miss. We live right down the street and love the venue - it's such a cool building and we have really enjoyed their trivia nights, Oscar nights, etc. But we always seem to have a problem when we try to make reservations - signals get crossed, service is spotty.... It can end up being a headache dealing with the restaurant at times.

39.description: The stage and theater are just gorgeous. I saw a Chicago Starlets showhere this past weekend and it was a perfect venue for them.Now keeping in mind I've only paid as much as $15 or $20 for thistroupe in the past, at $35 a pop I expected a great venue. What Ididn't expect was an inattentive and rude staff.  Because seats werelimited, some of squeezed into a booth. The waitress ended up puttingus all together on one check without asking us. Every 30 seconds sheinterrupted the show to ask how we were doing. By standing right infront of our view. She asked if our check was ready by standing rightin front of our view during the very end of Michelle L'amour's act. Itwasn't, and we tried to tell her that, but she grabbed the cash andran.When we finally flagged her down after the performance to see if therewas change for us, she then started being huffy, saying she couldn'tfigure out which money was ours, and that maybe we didn't pay herenough. She was right, as we tried to tell her during the performancethat she kept interrupting! (I mean really... check on us while theemcee is up or when you see an empty drink.)We finally settled things and headed up front to order some food andmore drinks and watch the live band. Again, great atmosphere, decentfood, etc. But the waiter seemed to forget we had ordered any food,and we had to chase him down to ask when it would be ready. We alsohad to chase him down to get our check.Maybe the stage was over-staffed and the restaurant under-staffed, butoverall I'm disappointed. There are many wonderful things to loveabout this place, but the staff is certainly lacking and not worth thelong trip up north.

37.description: My coworkers and I went here for an informal gathering.  I was slightly dismayed that the bartender had no idea how to make a manhattan.  In fact, he had no clue what Early Times even was.  I'm not sure how this is possible, but if I need a place to stumble home from after a few too many drinks, I suppose I'll come back.  The live music blows though.

0.description: Last month our daughter was married at Mayne Stage. Our daughter and her fiancé had already scoped the place out and when we saw it we were both surprised and impressed. Cat, Jacob and the whole staff were wonderful to work with from the get go. The menu and wine selection process went well and they happily worked within the budget. The day of the wedding was magnificent. The room was beautiful and we could tell by the look on our guest's faces that they were in for a magical evening. Cat and Jacob coached the bridal party through the ceremony and reception like pros. They were very experienced and managed the entire process perfectly.  The staff was very attentive without knowing they were there!The ceremony and reception came off without a hitch. The food was outstanding, the bars were perfectly set up and no one's wine glass ever emptied!!All in all it was a wonderful day!!

38.description: This place is so cool. A small bar area with a nice beer selection. Plus a small restaurant/pub area for food, but we did not eat there : (.  In the back, a stage for live shows, intimate seating, with a professional staff. It gets better. $5 dollar valet. Plus...clean restrooms

51.description: I went to a concert at the Mayne stage on the 30th of December. The house was pretty full. I was so impressed with the whole package! The food was great! The service was great! The seats and the sound was great! I was very happy with the entire evening.

27.description: I live so close and I can't figure out why i waited so long to see a show here? This venue is GREAT. Nice and cool, with nice service and good seats. Alot of music venues are crap but this one is comfortable and they have some good acts.

32.description: Good food and great sound. the layout here is really cool. i have only been here once and was working a party so didnt really get to enjoy the place to its fullest. I will most definitely be back here as a guest in the hopefully near future though and it is mainly due to the staff. They are very nice and were a pleasure to work with.

54.description: This is what Chicago must have been like in the roaring 20s. Good vibe, good food, expensive booze.I did not have the chance to sample the restaurant and its accoutrements, but I did get to check out a music show here recently. The sound here is excellent, as it should be for such an intimate place. I love that there is a balcony to this place for such a small theater. Heard that the owners put in 6 million to this joint and it shows. The lighting and seating areas areas were really polished and new. The bar area was a bit undersized; had there been a crowd it would have been a fireharzard in there. Had a great time sitting up close to the bandstage and really feeling the music.Now onto the bad. The only weakness of the place is the service and pricing of drinks. The food was really good; a tad overpriced given the area and the fare at other places. I have had stuff that tops this place, and they should respect that. Well, you readers will have the option of listening to me, or not. But that's the honest truth. What really pissed me off was that I had to pay 6 dollars for a pint. Of beer. One. To add insult to injury, my friend, who doesn't drink had to almost pay double the amount for soda water and fruit juice just for ordering her drink in the theater instead of at the bar. "I would have walked to the bar, it's dead in here!" was her response. I couldn't blame her. And neither would you if you weren't told of the drink price discrepancy from the get go. "You could speak to the manager," was our kind, dainty waitress' response. If she wasn't in on the duping I'm a bald, ball sniffing monkey from Madagascar. If your going to gouge us on the food and drink, at least be honest about it. Phooey!Oh, and tell us you have a parking lot so we don't valet for god knows how much!

48.description: Great small venue and excellent bar. Easy access by the Red line and on outdoor cafe (but not on Mondays). A fun place for a show. I suggest you go here at least once a month.

44.description: Review for musicians who gig:This one really depends on the sort of band you (think you) are. If you're a classy act with fans that want to sit down and watch, it's easily worth 5 stars. I almost feel guilty giving it 3 stars cos they clearly shoved a ton money into this place. But I felt a bit like a fish out of water here. Or in the water, cos the whole thing felt like a cruise ship gig.Load in is through the alley to the north of the venue. You load directly in to back stage. The stage is huge, way bigger than any place else I've played. Lots of room. And lots of staff. I can't imagine what the budget is like to run this place. Stage managers, assistants, the works. You'll find plenty of help here. Parking is on street and it's a crowded neighborhood so you may have to search for a bit after load in.The room is huge, the sound booms. For a cost they'll record your gig and give you a digital copy. We did and it sounded good, dropped it right into protools and started mixing a live release.Bands get half-off a meal at the restaurant/bar in the front of the place. It's a good deal with good food so take advantage of that. I'd go back just for dinner.They have a box office to sell tickets. They have someone to take your ticket. Fans walk into the lobby and are greeted with a full bar. Two staircases frame the opposite side, leading up to the balcony. It's clean and carpeted. TVs broadcasting from the venue so you don't miss the show. There are banquets. Tiered flooring. Main floor tables. It's classy. Too classy? That's up to you.

24.description: Great venue!!! Nice intimate place to see music. Good sound system and decent food to boot. I'll definitely be back.

7.description: My now husband and I had our wedding at Mayne Stage. I can't say enough about the venue, the food and the coordination. Coordination - I just love Kat and Jacob. They were just amazing during the planning. Kat was our main point of contact and she was always very honest with us if there was some issue we should know about. She is very detail oriented, will work with you on pretty much anything, and is an absolute JOY to work with. Her fun and creative personality is a huge asset to Mayne Stage. We could not have had our wedding without her. (PS - I planned my own wedding, but Kat helped so much!)Venue - just perfect. Each and every guest I spoke to was amazed and the uniqueness of the venue and how beautiful and perfect it was for the wedding. The colors, the hard wood, the stage, the balcony, the bar areas, the HISTORY, the super clean bathrooms and the fact that I had my dream wedding in a THEATER! It was a dream come true for anyone trust me. The venue is PERFECT!Food - I was really nervous about having a buffet dinner. The tasting proved to be excellent and Kat was willing to work with us on modifications to the menu. It was so easy and they were so accommodating. They even created special plates for our vegetarian friends. What? Who does that? Mayne Stage does! Kat does! So the big question - was the food as good on the day of as it was in the tasting? YES! It was amazing. The food may seem a little more 'pub' style for some, but we had Panko Crusted Lemon Chicken (YUM!!!!), Salad portion Salmon (Amazing), grilled veggies (people could not stop talking about them) and pasta/salad, etc. My Mom, a very picky eater, is still talking about the food as are many of the guests. Super happy with the result!If I could give Mayne Stage 100 stars, I would. I was seriously worried about coordinating a wedding, picking the right venue, and doing the right things for our wedding, and it was so easy with Mayne Stage, Kat and Jacob.Love love love Mayne Stage for your special event. We will be doing our big events here for a long time to come!!!! Thank you Kat and Jacob! We love you dearly!

49.description: They've done a lovely job on this venue.  It is comfortable, the beer and spirits selection is nice, and the service is fine.  In the venue the servers are fairly considerate and try not to be obtrusive during the show.  The chairs are comfortable and the tables are small but serviceable.  They sound and lighting is fabulous.  Taking away a star because there is dill in the tarter sauce and seasoned salt on the sweet potato fries. Heavy-handed and unnecessary in both cases.

40.description: Great small venue for some jazz! Fun crowd and attentive servers. Near red line and easy parking. I don't recommend Act One.. the restaurant attached- I'd rather eat elsewhere for my money. The end.

53.description: Might just be my fave venue in the city. So classy, elegant, aesthetically pleasing, good sound, pretty stage, nice tables, yummy drinks, quiet servers, awesome views from all angles...I can't stop with the compliments. My little problem is the neighborhood creeps me out, so I can't go solo, like I always do at other music venues.

30.description: I've seen a hand full of show's here [actually more like a dozen or so] and hot damn! Great sound and atmosphere [lighting is so so, but no movers so they do what they can] and amazing beer selection! Food and service has always been solid and definetly on my top 5 venues in this city for sure! Check out the pub up front too!

46.description: horrible service and management.they will lie right to your face - unbelievable.

1.description: We visited the Mayne Stage for a Moth Story Slam event. From start to finish, the venue was organized and efficient, from collecting tickets, to directing unfamiliar folks to the seating area to taking food and drink orders. That's right, there was no need to run back to the bar - a server visited the tables throughout the venue. We did pay for that convenience with a loooong wait, however. There seemed to be a system in place, and we quickly figured out that the server was trying to get everyone in the section's drink orders placed and delivered before moving on to food. (I wish she would have just told us that - we weren't sure, at first, why she kept putting us off.) The drinks were good, as was the typical "bar fare" food. Just don't expect many healthier options.Since the performance space is small (230 seats), the atmosphere was "cozy". We sat in the main sunken pit area and... let's just say I was glad I knew my neighbors (and we got there early enough to get seats together).We didn't see much parking available, but this venue is very, very close to a red line stop!

55.description: Great north side venue. Great sound, great atmosphere.

9.description: My husband and I had our wedding at Mayne Stage a few weeks ago.  From the moment we decided on this venue, we knew it was going to be a unique and amazing experience, and they still managed to exceed our expectations!  Having already raved to everyone who will listen about how much I love this place (my co-workers, my relatives, my eye doctor), I feel like I should put the word out there for anyone who is thinking about having an event here.  Never having planned a wedding before, I now feel like I was worrying about a lot of details that I didn't need to, because they took care of us from start to finish. Kat, the events manager, and Jacob, the stage manager were not only extremely accommodating with all of our questions, requests and last minute changes, they are genuinely fun and awesome people, and aside from all of their hard work, their presence at our wedding made it that more fun. Two of the top things on our list were to have an open bar and great dancing, and not only was their catering and bar package super affordable (and delicious), the bar and waitstaff was amazing.  I wish I knew all of their names, but Manny, who waited on the bridal party hand and foot, and was so attentive and friendly throughout the entire night, and when I started to get the pre-wedding jitters before the ceremony, he rushed up to the bridal suite with shots for me and my bridesmaids (it was a night wedding, so this definitely wasn't the first time he brought us drinks).  Our bartender, Rae also took wonderful care of all of us, and all of our guests raved about how great she (and the drinks) were.  We were also excited about the dancing, because Mayne Stage is known for it's sound quality.  They provided us with a staff member to DJ for us, using our playlist, and Jacob did a great job as an MC!  They also provided stage lighting and hung all of our decorations and lanterns and charged us next to nothing to hang the extra fixtures. I know there is so much that I am going to have to leave out, because this could go on forever, but I have to mention how great the planning and post-wedding process was.  They let us come in countless times to see the space and Kat and Jacob made special trips to the venue to meet with us and answer any questions (mostly on Saturdays and Sundays or at night).  They let us leave our decorations there overnight after the rehearsal, and come in the day after the wedding to pick up all of our things, which they had already boxed up.  Anything we didn't want, they discarded for us.  When I woke up at 7am the day after, worried about what had happened with the rest of our wedding cake, they had already had it covered (thanks to the rest of the staff and the restaurant manager, whose name unfortunately escapes me).  We really were worrying about so many details that we didn't need to.  Every guest we spoke to said that the wedding and the venue was absolutely amazing.  Many even said it was the most fun wedding they had been to, and while it is a unique and beautiful space, we definitely have the staff to thank for that. I know I had way more fun than most brides have reported, and that's because I didn't have to worry about a thing.  I encourage anyone who needs an event space to check it out!

26.description: Incredible venue. Small and intimate but appointed with great character. The details remind me of the fifties. It has been redone very well. The bar is a great example of carpentry. And the staff is excellent as well. The beer choices are very diverse and always seem to be changing. The food is very good. We had the sweet potato frites and a flatbread.  Both were excellent.

25.description: Perhaps I'm biased because my hubby plays here every so often, but hubby aside, I've been to a lot of performance spaces in my lifetime and I always enjoy coming here. Situated in the Rogers Park neighborhood, the venue stands tall and proud in the neighborhood with it's glowing outdoor signage and cool classy vibe. Their is a front lounge area where you can enjoy drinks and a great food menu. They also have entertainment on the small stage after hours. The venue is spanking clean and kind of reminds me of Park West. There is sunken seating area where you can get a real upfront kind of experience with seats along the wall and tables. Depending on seating needs they also pull random tables into the middle of the area there.Surrounding the sunken area on the main level are the side wings with quaint tables and booth seating to enjoy a more private experience. The tables are two-tops with curtains between the tables. The main level has banquet seating with a large table for enjoying smaller party gatherings and the balcony area has tables all around the perimeter. The sound quality is lovely, and depending on who is working the sound board that night you can really hear all of the performers on stage nice and clear.I've had the opportunity to be on stage and the vibe is super intimate. The bathrooms are nice and clean, the additional "green room" and hangout rooms for the performers are also top notch.Intimate. Clean. Upscale in feel. Super acoustics and a great programming mix. Parking can be a bit tricky, so get there early!

12.description: I've been in the venue for a concert and absolutely loved the setup as well as the service. The bar outside of the venue caught my eye so we returned to it one day for brunch. It was amazing, they have nice booze deals and delicious food. I won't be getting the beermosa again but that's only because they have some really good drink selections I want to try in the future. And the food was absolutely delicious! Can't wait to go back!

59.description: Fun place, $15 coverage.  Full bar and food, first come first serve seats.  My only hang up was the sound.  The band overpowered the singer bc the acoustics was set up improperly and not corrected throughout the performance.

21.description: Decent place to see a show if u get here early. A bit pricey and tough parking. Food is good service is good. Sound is great . Good place to perform if you are a band

17.description: Do not hesitate to attend any event here.A best kept Chicago secret really, though they've been open for years. It's a sort of two story theatre-in-the-oblong, and often a dinner theatre. We've attended plays, musicals, live music performances, films and televised sporting events, all but one noteworthy for their excellence. Mayne Stayge boasts by far the best high end sound capability of any Rogers Park venue and that of many larger and better known theatres we've experienced. We have seen and heard Rachel Barton-Pine  play never before performed violin works; live chamber music; many performances simulcast via WFMT or WXRT and hosted by their announcers; a live performance of newly created dual guitar music for an old black and white Hitchcock silent film while watching that film on their big screen; rock; smooth jazz; International World music; and much more; pretty much everything but rap. Tomorrow we will again enjoy the Superbowl on their 22 foot screen with that phenomenal sound almost making us believe we are in the stadium, though without the annoyances of actually being outdoors in January. The only rather awful sound experience was a Leon Russell show a couple years ago, and frankly I mostly blame his crew as every other musical performance has been so exceptionally calibrated. Seriously, the ratio is something like 500 very good and excellent to one truly distorted, overly loud and sadly unenjoyable live show.Table service provides the full range of soft drinks, alcoholic refreshments and pub grub from a limited menu out of the Act One, which is part of this Pritzker family owned property. (Where would Chicago be without the Pritzkers, by the way) Tables are small on the main floor, seating can be tight. Join their list to receive emailed bargain and even sometimes free shows. Finding street parking can be difficult, which makes their valet parker a very popular man on show nights.Best.Peter O. and S.

10.description: Saw the Don Quichotte (the German version) operetta. It was our 1st time here and definitely not our last. Everything was wonderful! The bar had reasonably priced drinks with a decent selection, the staff were great, the venue was intimate and well laid out, the performance was awesome. We were literally sitting in the orchestra pit and they all played period  instruments which made the performance extra special. They have a restaurant that looked good too.

5.description: Checking out a free concert for the World Music Festival Chicago how cool is that. The BBQ chicken wings are really delicious paired with some crispy fries is heaven. Loven Chi town baby. Yes and the Venue is very nice gotta check it out boo

3.description: My husband and I were married at Mayne Stage just over a week ago, and I am still euphoric about the flawless, unforgettable party they put on for us. It is hard to know what to compliment first: the unpretentious nature of the venue itself, the easygoing event coordinators who always made the planning feel less stressful, the incredibly fair prices, the way that everything was 100% customizable, or the way that the entire place feels like a hidden gem. The first thing wedding guests said after "congrats" was always "how did you find this place?" As we initially toured wedding venues last fall, one stumbling block was always the way that, as a couple on a budget, we always seemed to be more of an inconvenience to these places, rather than an asset. Mayne Stage, meanwhile, was the only venue that seemed genuinely excited for us, our happiness, and the big party we intended to throw. The warmth and welcoming nature of this place cannot be overstated. And every last guest was pretty pumped about late-night tater tots.

35.description: I love the space, but purchasing tickets is a real hassle online! It's truly impossible! I'm going round and round, getting error message after error message. Hopefully the issue will be solved in a timely fashion because I'd like to see the show I'm interested in seeing.

19.description: Nice place to enjoy Latin Music and Jazz.  We saw Orquesta Aragon earlier this year and today Cuban pianist Roberto Fonseca. Sometimes they open the dance floor.

28.description: What a fantastic venue, completely unique among any place that I've ever been.  There's a pub in the front and an intimate comedy/music theater in the back.  I recently saw Dave Attell here and not only was he awesome, the venue made the experience that much cooler.The theater has three tiers, with a sunken main floor, a ground level of perimeter seats, and an upper level ditto.  There is a mix of seat types too:  the front-facing seats on the main floor are chairs but the side seats are padded benches, and some of the ground-level seating is booth-style.  For every pair of seats there is a little oval table just the right size for a couple of drinks to rest comfortably.  I had never seen this before either.  All in all, the room design is pretty neat.Their programming is pretty neat too.  During the wait for the show to start, the big screen advertised an eclectic assortment of past and future shows--stand-up comedians; musical pop-culture parody troupes; obscure world music, niche bands, previous-era favorites on the comeback, 60s tribute concerts, and various other more straightforward indie music acts; specifically themed improv groups; opera (!); in short, all that is weird and wonderful in the world of comedy and music.

45.description: I saw Marc Maron here over the weekend, and I was impressed.  I do wish we arrived earlier to get better seats, as we were upstairs on tall chairs, and you had to kind of kink your head to see through the grate next to peoples legs in front of us.  Kind of a bummer, but live and learn. It was a cool place, super chill, great drinks, easy-ish parking, and the staff is fantastic.

33.description: LOVE this show.  I've performed there twice with the Her HRC show, and I have to admit that it's one of my favorite stage spaces in the city.  The theatre itself has a sexy vibe, really classy and upscale.  The attached restaurant is also good.   I always look forward to returning to Mayne Stage! :)

43.description: Where to start .... this music venue spared no expense.  This venue has more of a lounge feel which I really liked.  The acoustics are really good and the ticket prices are very affordable.  We saw Scull Orchard, Lydia Loveless and Dex Romweber Duo; almost five hours of great music for $12.00 a ticket.  Seating in general admission so if you want a table and chairs arrive early.  They have a good selection of craft beers which automatically earns a star.  They have a bar and extra bathrooms in the balcony area.  Everything is well maintained and very clean.  Parking can be an issue but they do offer $5.00 valet parking.

2.description: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday 12/10/2015.  The staff were so friendly and we got immediate service and fast responses.  He ordered the Angus burger, I got the Special Burger and we had the Nachos as an appetizer, lastly the Apple Crisp as a desert.  The food was DELICIOUS.My burger was a little salty but overall the food, experience, ambiance and service was 5 Stars!I recommend this place.

18.description: Love. This. Place.Fantastic acoustics in a gorgeous venue. Saw a band last night, Sierra Maestra, from Cuba, and they were MONSTERS. Congaaaaamania. I sat in the balcony, quaffing my reasonably priced beer and gazing down on this incredible band. The lights were great, the sound was amazing, and I'm coming back here again and again.

41.description: My first time to this venue was for an event sponsored by the CGMC called Lipsticks and Lyrics.  Overall very funny show. The show consisted of CGMC members dressing up in drag to raise money for CGMC.  As for the venue.  Great location.  A few doors down from the Morse el stop. So very convenient.  Once entering..  Looks great.  Layout flows well as you can either walk into the bar area or directly into the theater area.The theater is designed well.  spacious, from the majority of the seating, you can see the entire stage.  We were sat, we were to the right and on the middle floor.  No complaints at all.  The servers/hosts were great.I would definitely go back to this place for another show.

52.description: Super nice venue!Clean, great selection of microbrew beers and nice staff. However, they don't seem to book the best shows. Also, the place has no character: it's too big, new and sterile. I saw some jazz here, but longed for the Green Mill or Andy's.

50.description: Tremendous venue! I don't think there's a bad seat in the house. It only seats 230 people on two levels and the sight lines and sound are great. You're seated at nice wood tables and they have servers come around to take your drink orders. Mayne Stage is attached to Act One which had live jazz starting at 9:00 p.m. the two times we were there.It's located steps from the Morse Red Line station.

4.description: My wife and I were married at Maybe Stage, so this review will focus on how great it is as a wedding venue. Still, I should mention that it's a great spot for dinner, concerts, or just drinks. Good food, relaxed atmosphere, and they're always playing music, whether it's live or just someone's iPod hooked up at the bar. MS was the first of a few venues we looked at. The space felt perfect for my wife and I; not too stuffy, just nice. And customizable too. Having a bunch of different seating, staging, and bar access options made us comfortable that the place would never feel too big or too small regardless of how many guests were able to attend. For the record, we ended up with about 100 and they filled the space nicely, though with the second floor balcony and two bar areas, 150-200 guests could probably fit comfortably. Oh, and the stage. So good for live music. Or guests had so much fun dancing to the band. Basically, it seemed like we kept hearing the same compliment over and over from our guests throughout the night: "You guys picked an amazing venue."The food was great. I would echo David's review--we were initially nervous about doing a buffet. But people really seemed happy with our slider bar. In fact, my wife's (very non-vegetarian) uncle was mainlining the kale sliders all night, because they were so good he didn't notice the separate cheeseburger tray. Definitely happy with our trio of burgers, pulled pork, and kale sliders, as well as all the sides and passed apps. From the moment we booked the venue, Kat was both helpful and reassuring. I can't tell you how nice it is, during the occasionally fraught wedding planning process, to deal with someone that defuses stress instead if adding to it. Every time we went to Kat with a concern or request, she always found a way to make it work and never let us feel like we were being high maintenance. By the time the wedding rolled around, we were comfortable that we were getting everything we wanted, and under budget at that. The day of the wedding, the entire MS staff was so reliable. Special bonus points to Jacob, who salvaged a ridiculous ceiling decoration we'd brought to the venue in a tangled mess. All in all, the place looked exactly like we wanted it to, the staff really looked after ourselves and our guests, and everybody had a great time. If you're thinking of having your wedding here, please do. And invite me, so I can have more pulled pork sliders.

6.description: This is a great venue and other than the large sign outside designating it as a theater, you can't really tell that this is a venue for music or shows at all until you walk through the regular looking bar and restaurant in the front. In the back of this building is where you will find their small will call window, another bar, and then a pretty decently sized venue with floor seating with tables of 4 set up, some chairs set up along the edges of the first floor, and then a small second floor of balcony seating, some of which has better views down to the small stage than others. So definitely get here early for a show, since the good seats definitely disappear quite early here it seems! We lucked out and got three chairs on the top level on the corner but were in the first row of chairs there so we got to look directly down onto the performance beneath us which was kind of a cool way to watch a show. Servers will also come to you to take drink orders throughout the show which is really nice since that way you don't have to miss a second of anything you paid money to see. The drinks aren't too pricey (we got three mixed drinks for about $20) and they were pretty strong too. The service here is all pretty friendly and happy too, although at will call I saw a ad for a show with a clown in it and I told her how terrified of clowns I am and she said that she promised he was a nice clown...not sure about that one!

22.description: This was my fifth visit to Mayne Stage in Rogers Park and I am just writing a review now.  Perhaps the reason is that my previous visits were more for the sake of my BF who loves comedy shows and could spend hours on YouTube watching people I don't really think are funny (according to him, I'm lacking a sense of humor, but to each their own).  This last visit for us was for my sole enjoyment since I am a HUGE Janeane Garofolo fan.  Because I had a good time, I was actually able to take note of the many assets Mayne Stage possesses. The theater has valet parking for $5, but street parking is plentiful if you don't mind walking a couple of blocks because it is located in a very residential neighborhood.  It's a nice venue with a restaurant and bar attached to the front, making it very convenient to have dinner and relax prior to shows, which usually don't start until 10:30.  If you skip dinner, never fear, because you can actually order from a decent sized menu in the theater and usually very attentive servers.The main theater itself has a nice setup, with a pit, surrounding booths around the perimeter of the bit and then balcony seating.  The theater has great sound and I personally don't think there is a bad seat in the house.They really try to get a wide variety of performers and in the case of my 5th visit, really try to offer something for everyone.  Though it might be a trek for people who live south of here, it's still worth the trip.

15.description: What a fantastic venue, completely unique among any place that I've ever been.  There's a pub in the front and an intimate comedy/music theater in the back.  I recently saw Dave Attell here and not only was he awesome, the venue made the experience that much cooler.The theater has three tiers, with a sunken main floor, a ground level of perimeter seats, and an upper level ditto.  There is a mix of seat types too:  the front-facing seats on the main floor are chairs but the side seats are padded benches, and some of the ground-level seating is booth-style.  For every pair of seats there is a little oval table just the right size for a couple of drinks to rest comfortably.  I had never seen this before either.  All in all, the room design is pretty neat.Their programming is pretty neat too.  During the wait for the show to start, the big screen advertised an eclectic assortment of past and future shows--stand-up comedians; musical pop-culture parody troupes; obscure world music, niche bands, previous-era favorites on the comeback, 60s tribute concerts, and various other more straightforward indie music acts; specifically themed improv groups; opera (!); in short, all that is weird and wonderful in the world of comedy and music.

57.description: Really one of the best venues I've been to in Chicago.  I loved everything about it.  The sound quality, the layout, the people, the drinks... everything was spot on.  Second to the venue was the cabaret show I saw.  Jim Caruso's Cast Party was super fun.  Basically they invite all local performers to come up on stage and perform.  You get a chance to hear people sing that you probably would never encounter otherwise.  I saw people perform from big shows currently playing (Beauty and the Beast, West Side Story) all the way around to a friend of mine that is amazing but only does theater as a hobby.  Not the first time Mayne Stage has hosted this show and I sure hope it's not the last.  Great night out.

20.description: First time New Year's Eve. Great show. Beautiful, comfortable clean refined venue. Super nice. Great servers & employees. Perfect size. Not huge cavern & not cramped sweaty small room!  Really loved it. Drinks & apps from restaurant also very good. Husband & I can t wait to go again. Valet too!,

36.description: Beautiful theater space. Entire building has clearly been imagined as a thoughtful artistic space. Dinner in restaurant was well staffed with adequate service. Recently attended an event with bar service on the second floor (balcony), friendly bartender. Conveniently located off the red line station. Perhaps it was because of the busy evening but restroom cleanliness left a great deal to be desired. Otherwise, look forward to future events at this theater.

14.description: Great Venue, intimate auditorium with versatility, given the dance floor/table seating/ main floor and great booths in the mezzanine, and balcony too.  We've seen excellent acts, often on US tours.  Drinks and finger food both are reasonably priced and the place is clean and professionally run all around.  Neighbors, you owe it to yourself and to Rogers Park to check it out for yourself.

3.description: What food I received was excellent. However I dont appreciate being told Maria's wont refund HALF of my money for receiving HALF an order. I even allowed Maria's about an hour, to get the OTHER HALF of my meal to me. I would never spend 10.99 for delivered fajitas to only receive the meat and tortillas. I wasn't being outrageous I was asking for 5 bucks back. Also if you look on Google Reviews, this issue has occurred before, adjust your staff.

1.description: Let's say I was going to test out this restaurant by ordering food and yes this will probably be my last time ordering from this place!Theyre menu has different categories of food which I enjoy resturants that have many choices but then...it went down hill..I decide to order mozzarella sticks and boneless, unbreaded chicken wings covered in sweet bbq sauce.I ordered roughly after 3 am (I was indecisive on food to order ^_^)The estimated Grubhub time gave 4:12am..that passed so I call grubhub.they let me know the food delivery was going to be roughly 4:33pm..by time I got this memo it was 4:42am.then after 5am I got it...I ordered mozzarella (which were huge!),by the time I got them, they weren't even gooey and cheesy. It was like a big piece of mozzarella cheese breaded in light crumbs.I ordered boneless bbq wings..the most dried out and hard boneless chicken smoothed in bbq sauce..I had to stop "Tryin" to eat (given i was very hungry)and just throw in the towel.The pieces of hard dry meat was hurting my teeth.I was expecting juicy pieces of boneless chicken wings smoothed all in yummy in bbq And what I got.... -_- nope nopeGiven the facts: I work overnight and unfortunately I am limited to certain restaurants open during that time if I decide to now and then order.So its kind hard to try to order somewhere else if one restaurant fails you. I ordered expecting estimated time 4:12 am lets try almost after 5am.hot but not hot in terms of how delivered food should be !lastly you should never sent a paying new customer food that you wouldnt Dare eating!one star given the mozzarella stick was huge like dinosaur sticks

2.description: This place has the best pizza and wings! I always order for delivery and they are quick and delicious! My most ordered from place by far!

9.description: I went in and ordered.  Got a turkey sub that was actually not bad.  The turkey was chunked up like leftover Thanksgiving turkey.  It wasn't sliced deli meat.  With a tangy dressing.  The problem is I DIDN'T ORDER IT.  I walked in and the counter person was snippy and wanted my order before I had a chance to look at the menu.  I ordered a Turkey, Bacon Avocado sub.  She took the pizzas she was making into a back room and returned less than a minute later with some food.  So either she was in such a huge hurry (and there was no one else in the joint) or it was a mistake they made for someone else.  I took it to go because there's no place to sit.  Didn't realize it until I was blocks away.  Either way, it wasn't what I ordered.  I won't be back.

10.description: Tried this place a couple times. The giant Mozzarella sticks were novel at first, but they were not that great. Everything before my last order was alright, but...I just ordered an italian beef, with peppers and cheese. The cheese I received was a side of melted cheddar in a cup, and the pepper was just a tiny amount of giardinera in a small cup. Cheddar cheese? really? For a Chicago sandwich shop to pass this off as an italian beef is ridiculous, but it might have been forgiven if the beef was good, but it was of course chewy and tough instead of melt and gooey. WTF? Italian beef is pretty hard to mess up. The Luke skywalker wrap was also mediocre, but tasted like a breath of fresh air after that sorry excuse for a beef sandwich. The Key Lime pie tasted like garbage. Boo-urns.

4.description: I have ordered delivery from here "late night" a few times already. Most recently I ordered my favorite mozzarella sticks, these are hand-made, massive and always hot. There's nothing better than hot, breaded cheese, when you're not so sober.  Their burgers are so-so but their BBQ wings are super good.

6.description: Owner needs to reevaluate his/her staff or if he was the manager I spoke to...he could care less that my pizza was cold, pie was old, milkshakes were flavorless, and burger king has a bigger patty than theirs. Dont waste your money here.

12.description: i ordered from there the other day they have good prices and they were ontime. ordered a small thick crust pizza but i got a think crust and it could have been a little hotter

5.description: Ordered delivery online. Pizza arrived cold and not cut as requested (Pie cut/slices). The taste was okay for a cold pizza cut the wrong way.Garlic bread was decent but nothing to write home about.Delivery was early, only reason it get's two stars.

13.description: I got sick of eating Subway all the time, so I gave this little place a shot a few days ago. The food was okay. Actually, the veggies didn't taste very fresh to me. And the wait was insane -- I was the only person in this tiny shop and they took 15 minutes to make a veggie sub! And the hot and humid little shop did not make the wait any more fun either. I think I'll just stick to Subway from now on!

11.description: Wow!   Possibly the best sub that I have had in a LONNNNG time!  I got the Avocado Club sub.  Amazing!  The vegetables where so fresh.  Thick slices of fresh avocado.  Bacon.  Turkey.  Real Mayo.  Red onions.  Red Vinegarette.  Juicy Tomatoes.  Crispy Lettuce.  WOW.Maybe I was lucky and got an exceptional sub right after they first opened, but it was soooooo good.  The guy making it up was very friendly t

8.description: Since I've moved to my new 'hood its safe to safe the most stable and functional relationship I've kept in the past 4 months has been with Maria's. I call (actually I grubhub online) and she comes, food and large amounts of ketchup and mustard in hand. Our talks don't change much, I usually order the Beautiful burger with friend abd a cup of cheese, it helps me get over whatever kind of crappy day its been, and it arrives, beautiful as ever. I once just ordered desert.....and it was awesome. Maria's generally has anyting im in the mood for, and like i said, it usually helps me make better whatever crap day its been. Plus they deliver fast.

0.description: I had to try this place out after Shane's glowing review and I was pleased with the results, although I'm certainly not as passionate as he is about them. :) I ordered the Turkey Ranch sub and it was tasty! The thing that struck me the most about this place was how friendly the guy was who I ordered from. He even took 4 cents off my total to make it an even $5. FOUR CENTS!I went at around 6pm and I was the only one there! The place is pretty warm (not the best feeling during the summer) which makes me feel bad for the poor saps who have to make subs at that temperature. I'm actually surprised they're not naturally toasted subs.

7.description: I ordered through Grubhub and got a gyro sandwich and a hot dog with fries. Why? The menu didn't specify the gyro came with anything,so I figured I'd split my order into two meals. The delivery guy couldn't figure out how to push my door bell so he called my cell "your food's here". Okay. Didn't even thank me for tipping him and just left. I had ordered my hotdog Chicago style, as the menu claims, "Jumbo Chicago style hot dog with tomatoes, onions, sweet relish, pickle, a dash of celery salt, on a poppy seed bun.", minus the tomatoes.So when I open the box and see that inside is a plain hot dog on a plain bun with a pickle spear tossed by the fries, I was confused. I found a little cup of onions in the bag, packets of mustard and ketchup, and that's it! What the hell?! I scrambled to maybe find a packet of relish, something. Nope, nothing. Then I opened up the gyro sandwich, WITH FRIES. I could've skipped over the hot dog that came with fries but I didn't even know what to expect. Oh, and another pickle spear, the hell? And the tzatziki sauce was on the side, which I can appreciate, but it wasn't enough, and I usually hate a lot of sauce so they were extra cheap on that. The gyro was actually pretty good, not the best i've had, but not the worst either. Don't think I'll order from here again.

3.description: I walked into this store to get some guidance on how to navigate the web on my Samsung Gravity T. When I approached the desk, the guy says "Oh, is there even any web on that phone?" As if to say, "that phone is soooo old...." Right. I'm gonna ask about how to use the web when there isn't access on my phone. I suppose he may have gotten customers like that before, but there was no reason to invalidate me in that manner. "Yes," I said. There is web on this phone. He then barely took a look at it, as though he were totally annoyed. He gave me very little information, citing that he wasn't sure about very much. I have been very frustrated with T-Mobile's service, which seems to decline every day. From the spotty coverage to the terrible customer service, I've about had it with this company. The only thing that has stopped me from switching immediately is that I don't care to either get into a binding contract or pay for a new phone with another carrier. But I'm on the edge, for sure. I can't do short code (SMS) texts on this phone -- which means I can't take advantage of the numerous deals out there, but most importantly, I can't use the CTA bus tracker, unless I got to the web page, and hope that I can access that. Others can simply send a text with the bus tracker code and find immediately when the bus is coming. I, on the other hand, have to go thru several pages that are difficult to navigate and if I'm lucky, I might get some info. Not cool. I've complained about this to T-Mobile and the BBB and all I've heard back is "we just don't do it." This should be disclosed when you sign up for service, not after.The store was nearly empty the whole time I was there, mid-morning on a weekday. It's not like I was stopping them from making sales. I am, after all, a customer, who pays every month. I'm the reason he even has a job. Too bad they can't figure that out.

1.description: I am extremely unhappy with T-Mobile. I have been trying to get a phone that I purchased in April replaced because it doesn't work and I have been getting the run around ever since. This was one of the many T-Mobile stores I visited for help. Of course I didn't get any-lot of passing the issue back and forth.  Only two people were actually helping customers and there were a lot of people waiting to be helped. Also, There were many associates standing around and seemingly doing nothing on the clock. I am currently shopping other providers.

2.description: I have been coming to this location for a few years now and it's my favorite tmobile store, anytime I've had issues the associates have helped me out.  The management has recently changed  but most of the employees are still the same, the new assistant manager does not do much I've walked in there because I needed a new phone and there was a line of people and he was on his phone standing behind the associates instead of helping customers. (He always says he does not have a register, we'll ok then answer people's questions while they wait in line).  I'm giving this store  5 stars because of a few ppl  , there's a blonde girl I forgot her name but she's very friendly and there's a tall Hispanic guy that's very tech savvy overall great store  but management does need to improve.

5.description: T-Mobile sucks period... they're going bankrupt and they don't care for customer service or retaining loyal customers.. damn shame

6.description: I am writing this primarily because of the manager, Ryan.  He is so helpful and knowledgeable!  He answered all my questions about the promotions that T-Mobile was having that weekend and he gave me  really sound advice.  He and the other T-Mobile staff always make sure to great me when they come in and it makes my experience there overall pretty pleasant.  They should give the guy a promotion!

7.description: I have had to go to this T-Mobile store many times over my 7 years as a T-Mobile member. A few times bad for me but mostly for good reasons (phone upgrades.) Always attentive and helpful and the security guard is great at helping people pay their bills on the automated machine as if he himself actually works for T-Mobile. Always a pleasant experience. Way to go T-Mobile

0.description: Received excellent service every time I walked in the store. Professional, helpful, not condescending.... I recommend.

4.description: I agree withMartin DON"T EVER PICK UP A T-MOBILE PHONE OR SERVICE. They are very dishonest from the employees to the managers. Actually Im going to fill out a complain with FCC and with Better business bureau. I finish my contract with Spring and I was shopping around so I went to this T mobile store  to see if my phone was unlock. the employee name Fabian put a sim card on it and told me that it was unlocked, no problem switching over. I decided to comeback the next day after analyzing every monthly plan. This time I got Jack Zavala, I told him that want to switch companies so he asked me if the phone was unlocked. I told him that Fabian told me the day before that it was unlocked. So I paid around $65 for the first month of service. The problem was the my iPhone didn't work so he said give some time until tomorrow if not talk to the  A. Manager. So I called sprint and they told me that I cannot use it in the USA if its not with them. Well I went to A.Manager the next day with my telephone number already switch to T mobile and he checked my phone and told me that he doesn't know whats going on and Told me to go to the cellphone a cross the street to get it unlock that they had been unlocked phones for them......well it didn't work ether....I come back and I told him that if not possible. Then he told me that the only option is to get a new phone...Well already with my cell phone number switch i decided to avoid a bigger problem and been without service for a while so I decided to buy a Lumina..so he told me that the price was $179 and it was the cheapest smartphone..so i said ok. he told another employee to ring me over and he keep asking me what price the A manager told..he was checking in the register the price of the phone and he asked me twice what was the price that the manager told me so I said i think it was $179...very estrange also he questioned me why i was changing companies...like saying are you crazy of changing to T-moblie...Anyway left went to my house and Checked t mobile web site...the phone was $50 dollar less on their website...then I realized that they are a bunch of Scammers and dishonest  people...I'm returning the phone and canceled this service...even dough I'm going to lose $50 dollar of restocking fees.....STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!!!!!!

3.description: Great first try and I'll be back. Just tried it out since I saw it pop up on Google recently. This place seems really new: the outdoor sign is still a temporary banner. It's across the street from Sol Cafe by the Howard stop.Guys working the place seemed to be the owners--when I walked in a guy jumped up and was really friendly and said they don't have take-out menus printed yet and pointed out everything on the chalk menu and some highlights. The place has some tables, but is a counter-service take-out place size.I settled on the smothered chicken--which turned out to be fried, boneless, tender and soaked in gravy. Yum. Sides: Mac and cheese had a ton of flavor and yams were in some addictive cinnamon sauce. Large piece of soft cornbread too. Portions were really big: for me I had some leftovers (which made the $10 a little more worth it)Service was great: the guy made sure to show me that the gravy in the to-go box was pretty full, and he made a point to double bag it so it wouldn't spill. Only downside was cash only. Normally I'd only review if I've tried a place a few times (and here I want to come back for the Jerk chicken), but since this is a new local place I wanted to help out by getting up an early review.

1.description: How have they been here for like 8 months and I'm JUST discovering it?!? The food is always fresh, hot, and made to order. So far my favorite is the jerk BBQ chicken. Even though the meat is grilled and not smoked, the jerk seasoning itself is perfection for those who are looking for jerk flavor authenticity. I got home and decided that I wanted more sauce and pulled a bottle of Sweet Baby Ray's out the fridge thinking I would never notice the difference and how wrong I was. Both the jerk seasoning and the BBQ sauce are unique and stand out individually yet blend together. The cabbage and curry chicken are both very good also. I can't wait to try the fried chicken and fish. You literally see him breading the meat, hear it hitting the oil and sizzling...it's just that fresh. Cant wait for them to add dessert to the menu, but in the meantime, it's working out just fine. Welcome to the neighborhood Fatboy!P.S. If there is something you want to try, at least on the Caribbean side, they offer snack packs for $3.50. Perfect for a taste and it's the perfect size for lunch.

2.description: I ordered a combo of the jerk chicken and jerk rib tips and it did not disappoint. Well spiced and full of flavor. Perfect amount of heat where it had a nice kick but didn't overpower the meal. Well done!

5.description: The moment that the husband and I moved to Rogers Park, Fat Boys was on our list to try, My husband had the BBQ Jerk Rib Tips, our friend had the Jerk Chicken, and I had the BBQ Jerk Chicken. My order was definitely our favorite. Everything was spicy and delicious. The rice & peas were scrumptious. I wish that I had ordered the greens instead of the cabbage as my second side. The cabbage was yummy, but the greens had the silkiest texture. I can't wait to try more off the menu.

6.description: Thanks Fat Boys!!  Your boy got lunch before work here.  Cant stop eating now!!  This is what black business looks like!!   I will continue to support y'all!!

7.description: Had their smothered pork chops too on another visit with dressing (and was it greens?). Another great experience. Large servings, great prices. Easy calling ahead and food was ready when I dropped in.

0.description: Simple, straightforward, abundant, tasty, inexpensive. This place is a gem.I ordered the BBQ jerk chicken small dinner with cabbage and rice & beans. Fantastic.I can see myself becoming a regular on nights I don't feel like cooking.

4.description: In my experience, the soul food is much better than the Caribbean food.  To qualify that statement, I should say that I've only had the jerk chicken and the rice and peas on the Caribbean side. The foods that I've enjoyed most include:Smothered chicken : PHENOMENAL...flavored very well, probably the best version of this i've ever had.Macaroni and cheese: Not exceptional, but a great sideCabbage: Goes well with the smothered chicken gravy, however I would never order this separately.Sweet potatoes:  Standard goodnessThe Jerk and rice and peas were..ehh; I wouldn't recommend or order either of these again.

3.description: So, I know that this is a "convenience" store and the prices are going to be a little higher, but this is ridiculous. Walk a block in either direction and you'll find some of the same products for half the price. There's a new place a block up Lunt that's just as nice and offers much better options for a lower price. That being said, the guys who work there are always super nice and the place is well located. If it weren't for the high prices, I'd be there more often.

1.description: Great place to go grab late night munchies. The owners are extremely nice and friendly. Prices are a tad high (as stated in previous reviews), but not high enough to scare me away.

2.description: I've been going to sonny's for over 15 years now.......almost daily. Convenient for sure!! However, Sonny is no longer really there anymore (Retired??) But, he still owns it. It use to be, when I came in......I would receive a nice greeting.......and a sincere Thanks for my business. Now, Sonnys has a young Tall guy ( who, I believe is running the place) that can't say Hello or a thanks!! In fact, he generally won't say anything. Though, he talks......I've heard him. His way too young to be angry at life. Move on if you don't like it......as I will just move my business down the street to 7Eleven where they appreciate my business. Sonny, take note!!

9.description: The place looks as though it's been around a while and could use some updating.That said, The prices are on the high side in my humble opinion, but it's a convenience store, and you pay the price for convenience.  After all, it's not a Jewel or Dominicks.I've always found the clerks to be friendly and I've joked around with them quite a bit - so it may be one's approach too in how they interact with you. I've always found them to be friendly.incidentally, The soda being flat isn't the fault of the store -- it's the fault of the vendor that sold it to them.All in all - for quick, limited selection (which, for it's size, is pretty suprising)  by all means stop here!  I know I do!

10.description: Sonny has toughed it out in Rogers Park for years, putting up with disrespectful punks, robbers and assorted low lifes, along with the many nice folks who appreciate his little store.I'm partial to his freezer full of premium ice creams...perfect for those spontaneous cravings on summer nights.Don't forget to say hello to Sonny!

4.description: Sonny's food store is the best. Sonny is an amazing person and so funny! Family owned businesses are rare and this one is a gem.

6.description: Went here the first day we moved into an apartment building across the street. We got most of the things anyone who just moves in needs. It was a bit pricey but like they say you pay for convenience.

12.description: Only stop here if necessary. For selection and quality, think dirty gas station. Now up the price by about 15%. I stopped in for some pepsi and snack foods. The soda was flat (and expensive) and the cookies were stale. I would personally recommend White Hen just down the street. I know, support local businesses, and I know White Hen's selection isnt that great either, but its a gem compared to this place.Two stars is for the good attitude of the clerk. Much nicer than some of the convenience store owners further down Sheridan.

5.description: I have one word to describe Sonny's: Ugh.I used to live in the apartment building that also houses Sonny's and it was by far the most convenient place for me to pick up whatever processed junk food I happened to be craving at 11:33 pm.  HOWEVER, I only went there because it was close...otherwise, I'd say don't.Dusty. Musty. Old. Overpriced.  And I swear Sonny is running some kind of racket through there.  He used to make hand over fist on laundry cards for that apartment building which made me want to impulsively steal things to get my money's worth (I never did but I'm not going to say I didn't think about it).The help is weird.  Some are actually completely creepy.  There are plenty of other corner stores in the neighborhood.  Really.  Go there instead.

13.description: Sonny's is expensive compared to the chain stores that make up the flotsam and jetsam of Rogers Park. But the clerks are funny and up-to-date on all the local happenings - especially Carlos.  I can always find what I need at Sonny's, especially if I am too inebriated to locate the car. At the same time, parking is crap around here unless you want to fight the other locals for a coveted street parking spot, so if you're on foot, go to to Sonny's.

11.description: This is a decent place for a quick stop. They carry all your essentials -- a little high priced they are, but it is a very quick stop. They also have an ATM inside and carry various newspapers.

8.description: It is convenient, has a wide selection for a corner shop, and the staff are friendly. It is a little expensive but you pay for the convenience of having a neighborhood corner store with late hours. No, it isn't a boutique store and it isn't a cheap discount store, but it is convenient and has enough of a selection to make it worthwhile. Glad to have them in the neighborhood.

0.description: This is a convenience store; if you aren't sure what that entails, you probably haven't reflected upon the American social scene very often. The prices here are justifiably inflated as a reflection of the additional convenience provided by the store's existence. With that said, all the staff member I have met seem like decent guys, and are never anything but polite. The product selection is sufficiently wide, and the hours are immensely convenient.

7.description: Store is pretty dirty and everything is marked up by 20% or so. Walk two blocks to the 7-11 and save your money.

1.description: Funky little store, tucked away in an unassuming spot. I have been meaning to stop by there for a while, and I am glad I did. Good vibes, and friendly customer service. The furniture there is unique, and well priced compared to other boutique-y places that love to sell junk for way more than it's worth. Excited to pick up a neon-painted kitchen hutch and antique utility cart for my art studio. By the way: they also do student discounts!

2.description: Found this gem tucked away in Rogers Park. Besides having awesome vintage furniture, the owner is kind and helpful. Scored a cute retro clock for my bedroom. Definitely will be back.

0.description: a VERY hidden treasure that we would have never found were our slumlord (zero yelp stars for Oberheide properties, btw) not too cheap to pay for recycling and we weren't using the recycling center on Ravenswood. They deliver, too, though we were so excited to finally have a new dresser (this beautiful mid-century thing with really well-done joinery, original hardware, etc. for $135!) that we rented a truck from home despot.

3.description: Do not go to this store. I would give them  zero star if I had the option.I walked into the store with the intention of buying a phone on the spot. I was the only customer in the store and there were two sales associates. They were busy chit chat than talking to the customer. I walked out right away. I ordered a Samsung Galaxy 5s online, but decided to exchange for an iphone 5s. I called the customer care and were told I could exchange for a new phone. When I walked into the store, the sale associates told me the opposite and they were not being helpful at all. I now have a call customer care and get a new phone shipped to me, which means I won't have a phone for a few days, since they ported my phone number over. Some T-Mobile store are better than the others. This is definitely the worst I have seen so far. I will never walk into the store again. If you get corporate discount for T-Mobile through your company, take advantage of it; you will get way better customer service than in the store or over the call center from India.

1.description: Was sent  there by Tmobile phone customer care rep to pick up some advanced sim cards. I made sure to the phone rep that I need the Isis ready NFC capable sim. the phone rep calls this store and employee by the name of MARISOL told her they have that type of sim. I drove there, waited in line for 20 mins even though there were hardly any customers at that time.  I was asked for my ID and gives me regular sim.  I asked, why you told tmobile rep that you have the isis ready sim? I wouldn't have driven here and wasted my time. Never apologized to me and I drove back empty handed. Totally clueless ! AVOID this store!Update: I contacted the store manager via email. He replied to me by saying he would take care of this but now it has been  a week and he has NOT contacted me. I don't recommend this store to anyone. There is one on Lawrence & Broadway which is a corporate store

2.description: This company is criminal.  In May 2014, I transferred my service from Verizon to T-Mobile.  I was told by a company a representative that I was being signed up for an account that offered free international roaming.  She also informed mwe that she was conducting a credit check.  She happily took my driver's license and social security number.  Three months into my account with T Mobile, I discovered on a business trip that I was not signed up for the account I was told I was and that no credit check was ever performed.Amazingly, T Mobile's solution was to tell me my service would be cut off so they would change my plan over.  i would lose service while I was traveling out pf state on business!!!!!I was lied to by this company and their sales representative collected sensitive personal information under fraudulent circumstances,  Oh, and I should add that within a week of signing up with this outfit of criminals a credit card was opened in my name without my permission.I would advise anyone to think twice before consorting with this den of thieves.

9.description: This place is just great! I love walking into this store. They treat each and every customer that walks into that store the best. Every time I go in with a problem or just have a question the reps are very knowledgeable and take the time to help me out. Honestly this store is the best, I have gone to other T-Mobile stores and I live right by the Howard one but I prefer coming down to Rogers Park. The reps here are especially great and patient, there are two young ladies there that are just the friendliest and really know their stuff! Keep at it girls!

10.description: I am so disappointed with the service I've gotten from this store.  In the five months that I've been with T-Mobile, I've had more service and phone problems than I've ever had with any other cell phone carrier. I picked T-Mobile because I was eligible for a discount off my phone plan from an organization I belong to.  Well, I never got the discount I was supposed to get, and when I went back to the store and spoke to the same woman who set up my service, she told me that I had it all wrong and I was not eligible--this after she spend nearly an hour with me telling me about the discount I would get.  Basically, I was treated like a moron and told that I didn't know what I was talking about it.  I did get my activation fee waived as it was supposed to be, but I had to come into the store three separate times to make that happen.  My phone, which is only five months old, is also having problems; I've never had anything happen to a phone after such a short period of time.   I have never been so frustrated with a business I've used.  I hope that if any here dares to do business at this store, they have better luck than I did.  I'm changing my phone service ASAP.grrrrrr!

4.description: Amazing... these guys are the T-mobile masters.I have been here many times before;  First time with my mom to star family plan in 2009. Each time these guys here have been amazingly helpful. Today I had a problem with my SIM card being full and I needed help deleting over 3000 messages on my phone! These T-mobile guys are the best, never laugh at my funny problems and are always extremely helpful. I greatly appreciate this awesome customer service!

6.description: This store is convenient for me so I've gone in there on occasion to resolve issues with my phone. The first time I went it, the sales rep was good and helped me solve a very minor issue that involved navigation. However, this last visit was really disappointing. I stood in line for around an extra 5 minutes while one of two reps chatted away with a customer. Chat all you want, but when there are 2 more people in line, take care of them. The other rep seemed to be taking his sweet time, too. My phone had locked up with a memory issue and it was unusable. The rep looked at it and after it was taken out of the case, it seemed to be working. I figured the email account I'd added couldn't be supported by the phone and asked how to delete it. I'd tried to figure it out, but it locked up. He hands me the phone and says there is no way to do it, and that I have to call a number which he will provide. Then he ran off to do something else and never did give me the number. That was a complete lie or an inaccurate statement by a rep who does not know how to do his job. When I got home, the phone stayed unlocked long enough for me to figure out how to delete the email account.The fact that he either didn't know how to do this or just decided to tell me to call it in out of laziness is very unprofessional. On top of that, running away like he did and not even bothering to provide me the number he promised just made me feel like I was bothering him. And I probably was. Maybe he wanted to get back to his Internet surfing.

11.description: Excellent service every time I come here. The general manager is very nice and is always willing to help me with what I need. The staff is very professional and always greet me when i walk in the door. T-Mobile is where it is at!

5.description: Although there may be some who do not agree, on Christmas Eve I went to this store to purchase a Nokia Lumia 521 for my daughter who is already a "prepaid" T Mobile customer. I wanted her to have it as a present because she loves it so much. When I went to the store, I had 1/2 hour left on my lunch hour and decided to stop by here since its right across from my job.When I entered, it took someone 10 minutes to acknowledge me. I try and come prepared to save time on everything I do, so I knew what I wanted, I knew how much it cost, I knew the color, the specs and everything. All I needed was the phone. For review, I wanted to buy outright the Nokia Lumia 521. I reviewed it online for a few days and it seemed like a good purchase. There did not appear to be any stipulations on purchasing this phone but the sales person refused to sell it to me. He kept telling me I needed to buy a plan in order to get the price of 126.00 for this phone. I was pretty sure I told him we already were T Mobile customers and had a pre paid plan. I even asked if he was sure about what he was saying. He had that arrogance that sales people have when they think their words "are god like", so I told him that I will not be purchasing after all....not until I checked on what he said. Then I drove to another T Mobile store on 35th Street right off of Kings Drive on the south side of Chicago. When I got there, the place was jammed packed. They had the most wonderful holiday music playing and they were obviously taking care of the business.When it was my turn, I told the salesperson the exact same thing I told the T Mobile sales person on Sheridan Rd. I even had a copy of my "chat" with corporate for the salesperson to view after reporting the Sheridan Rd store as having some idiots working there and that they lost a sale because they refused to check.This nice young man was very helpful, he checked the computer, he went to the back to get the phone, he asked if I needed the sim card activated, asked me for the payment and gave me the phone and I was out of there. Imagine if corporate knew that salespeople in some of their stores were making mistakes like this? I should call Undercover Boss and ask them to do a segment on this location because clearly, they do not train all of their people well.

7.description: These guys are as good as it gets as far as I'm concerned! I have TERRIBLE phone karma. As in, no matter what phone I get or service I have or how careful I am, I always end up with huge phone issues. Every time I've been in this store everyone who's working has been as helpful as possible and even downright friendly. Not something I'm used to in a cell phone store. So, thumbs up, gents! You have my vote! And my constant presence, since I always manage to break my phone...

8.description: I've been using this particular, Rogers Park T-mobile store for over 3 years now. They had really helpful and efficient sales representatives in the past, but lately (I had to go there 4 times in a row since last November),  I've had more service and phone problems than I've ever had. There is especially this sales rep called ROBERTO. Sorry for being so specific and giving names and such, but I have to tell you that you should avoid that guy like plague! It takes AT LEAST AN HOUR for him to do the simplest task, and at the end of that hour he just tells you to call the customer service. No, I'm serious. I waited for an hour there, only to be told to call some number he gave me (and I initially went to that store, only because it was impossible to talk to somebody when you call the customer service number). Moreover, when I tell him that I came to that  particular store before with a similar complaint last year (when sales reps were different) and that it took 10 minutes for them to take care of it, he responds "then go to those people". Nope, I'm still not joking.I now go the t-mobile store that's close to where I work in Lincoln Park and I'll soon change my phone service too. If you can't change your phone service, at least avoid the t-mobile store in Rogers Park. They are slower than a sloth and can't do anything half-decent.

0.description: I really only go to the location because of Diane, she is fantastic!  I have been going to this location since it opened and at the time I was thinking of switching providers but Diane is really one of the reasons I stayed with tmobile. She is very knowledgeable, professional and always goes out of her to assist me. My family lives abroad, and she took the time out to really figure out the best way for me to be able to call abroad and have it be cost efficient. Plus she takes the time to get to know her customers. I have found the rest of the staff not professional or helpful. I suggest if you go to the location ask for Diane, and she will go out of her way to help you figure out whatever issue you may have.

12.description: Authentic Mexican food, and it's all vegetarian! I love Mexican food but hardly ever go to Mexican restaurants, because it's so hard to find food that doesn't have hidden meat or meat products in it, and when you do, the only veggie option is something boring like a cheese enchilada. Not here - there's multiple soy meat options, combined with authentic Mexican ingredients, so I had the rare occasion of being able to enjoy some of the dishes I can never get. I got two enchiladas- one was huitlacoche, one was soy steak and nopales. These were huge - one would have been plenty, but I couldn't make up my mind so I had to order two. The other people I was with got the steak tacos, tamales, and flautas. Everything was amazing, right down to the chips and quite spicy salsa roja and salsa verde. Can't wait to go back and try more of their menu items... I'm really wondering what vegan chicharron would taste like.

7.description: Love this place! Wish more people discovered it - it seems a little tucked away and doesn't get a lot of business yet whenever I'm there, but the food is wonderful (I'm omnivore but like healthy food I can trust, and this is definitely both). For vegans, Howard is becoming a great place to hang out - between this one and the Amazing Kale Burger a few blocks over, you definitely won't have to go hungry. I've been four times and always get random tacos and they're all spectacular. It's all fake meat in spicy sauce with veggies, how could you go wrong?

19.description: I was about to give this place 4 stars, but there was nothing this place did wrong.  The service was friendly, the food was good, the space inviting.  So why was I hesitating to give it 5 stars?  Probably because I'm not a vegan, and this place isn't located in a trendy location.  With that said, I encourage people to try some great food, and delicious smoothies, and leave any preconceived notions at home.  It may not be for everyone, but definitely worth a try.

1.description: 5 star for food, 3.5 star for delivery. I came here on a whim for a bank holiday,  and was extremely pleased with the food. Note to the veggie folks: there is a lot of fake meat -  very few options that are 100% veggies without soy chorizo or mock chicken or mock carnitas. Overall food portions are extremely generous and food seasonings are good -  the green sauce is excellent and everyone gets their chips to start out. Notably they also make huaraches,  something moderately rare for Chicago. Prices are also super cheap.  I haven't had a chance to check out juice options but will sometime. Also,  I'm not sure if the waitress is also the chef or not -  the place seems pretty quiet / not that busy.  I hope they make it as a business! Delivery explanation : I ordered through grubhub and whether the restaurants fault or grubhub our order took almost 2 hours to arrive. I feel for all of them but it sucks as being the person waiting for your food delivery.

2.description: Looking for incredible vegetarian/vegan Mexican cuisine?That particular, ever-elusive unicorn of ethnic food DOES EXIST right at the far northeastern edge of Rogers Park.  With 2 locations in the city, this place really brings the goods- delicious, fresh, and wholly satisfying. And you may even be able to fool your most stalwart meat-eating friends with the vast selection of soy-based substitutes available here. Fresh juices and smoothies of just about any variety you'd imagine will provide a healthy start to your meal.
