I can't believe how many dishes are offered on the menu and can never decide in less than 15 minutes. Don't forget to check out the daily specials and soups as well. Service is fast and friendly and the prices are very reasonable for food of this quality. The dining room is bright and spacious and always kept spotless.  Home delivery is available but they are closed on Friday evenings after sunset and Saturdays before sunset, so call ahead to confirm. Also, please note that this is a 'cash only' business, but you can visit the atm at the gas station across the street.

9.description: They ran out of regular cheese. Craziest thing I ever heard. Not to mention waiting almost 40 mins and then finding out no cheese for my food. Should call ahead to make sure there is cheese next time!

6.description: I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious everything tasted. I ordered the homemade tamales, chicken fajitas, guacamole and the banana ice cream and everything was divine!

18.description: Very good vegetarian tacos! I'm your typical omnivore, and the vegan meats here taste just like the real thing. Also, the salsa here is nice and spicy, just how I like it. My husband and I got our order to go, but we definitely plan to return for a sit-down meal since the atmosphere was laid-back and they're BYOB.

10.description: Go on Sunday and get that pozole verde, tamales Oaxacan style and a taco to put those delicious fresh salsas on.

13.description: Great mexican vegetarian food. I had the entomatado de asada and lentil soup. Very tasty and well made. Not too spicy but did have good flavor. I had a fruit and veggie health drink and while good was a bit overpriced.  The tortillas were the best part of the meal. They were excellent, wanted more than just one container!

16.description: Had a great huarache with huitlacoche and a quesadilla with calabaza. Also got the salsa verde pozole with the soy meat and a fruit smoothie with papaya and guava. A little pricier than Clark Street options and smaller portions, but it is one block from home. Smoothie options are something you would not find at your usual Mexican place. Soy/vegan options a plenty. The pozole bowl was a generous portion though and the heat and taste was good. We got it not so much for the soy but just to try something different from their menu.

17.description: Just tried this place and the food was super tasty. I'm not vegetarian but I would come back here anytime. Everything we ordered was delicious! Great addition to the neighborhood. Only bad thing was the Laura Pausini CD playing. Need better music.

15.description: We've loved the other location for years and to have one in our back yard now is too good to be true. Welcome, we love you! As a lifelong vegetarian I always used to wonder what real Mexican food was like. Turns out it's delicious.

0.description: The Purple Grandma offered to buy a belated birthday lunch for me at this restaurant, because she knows I am a vegetarian and like trying new places. A day later, my only complaint is that Quesadilla Le Reina Del Sur is all the way on Howard Street, and I would have to get in my car and drive 20 minutes to get there. Were it not for the snow and cold, I might do just that. Yes, the food was that good.I've eaten at this place long ago, when it was Lakeside Café, now long gone, so it was easy to find, just east of the Howard/Sheridan Road intersection. Because snow and sleet were blowing and I am a big weenie about weather the older I get, I took a pay parking spot right in front. Normally, paying for parking is against my principles, but weather makes you do strange things. I can't tell you if free street parking is easy or not.The restaurant doesn't look much different from its Lakeside Café days - still light and airy and comfortable. We were the only customers, so we were served with chips, two kinds of salsa and a veggie salsa, and waters right away. There is a huge menu of smoothies and juices, but we were on lunch patrol.The salsas were all good.  The green is the mildest. The red and the veggie mix have a definite kick that is not too intense. Purple Grandma ordered an omelet with mushrooms and rice and beans on the side. What you don't know about my friend is that she is a small woman who really doesn't eat much. When her entrée came (in reasonable time, by the way), she stared at it, and I laughed. She said, "That's enough to feed me for three days." She's right. For the average overfed American, it's probably a normal portion.I wanted to sample different things, so I ordered ala carte; the standard tamale, a taco with soyrizo (fake chorizo), and a quesadilla with nopales. I liked all of it. The tamale came first, followed by the taco and quesadilla. (I uploaded a photo.) I didn't use any salsa on any of these; none of them needed enhancement. I finished the taco and took the remains of the tamale and quesadilla home. I was almost uncomfortably full until about 8pm, and then I recovered enough appetite to kill off the leftovers. It wasn't three days worth of meals, but it sure held me.I had a cup of coffee, which was good. In fact, when I first tasted it, I thought, "this is really good." The sugar that came with it was brown sugar on a small plate, and a small creamer. I don't know if the creamer was non-dairy or not, but I suspect that it was.Delicious food, good service, and a broad selection of vegan and vegetarian food. The only thing that happened that was a little strange was an elderly lady wearing a company t-shirt sitting at a back table. She was playing with her phone, which isn't unusual, but then she played some sort of video featuring shouting and explosions, and we got the full benefit of that. It only went on for about a minute, and Purple Grandma and I just looked at each other and laughed.I really liked what I had, and I would go back to try other menu items.

5.description: This is a wonderful vegan/vegetarian Mexican place! I can't eat cheese and I can still have great tasting Mexican food, how awesome is that. They use fresh ingredients and make their own tortillas! And watch out for their massive smoothie/juice list, so hard to decide, but always delicious!

11.description: Great flavors, awesome selection,  mostly vegan and best of all close to home,  even though I love their original location some times it could be a bit of a drive

8.description: I have long loved the restaurant at Fullerton & Western, and was thinking of making the trek there from Rogers Park for lunch.  I checked Yelp to see if it had their Sunday hours and was absolutely delighted to find there was a new restaurant half a mile from where I was.  I rounded up my sister and her gf, both carnivores, and told them if they were willing to eat at a vegetarian place I'd buy them lunch.  They were in as long as it wasn't vegan and had cheese, they said, and I knew it did - I'm not vegan myself and I dislike vegan cheeses. We pulled up right in front and were dismayed to find a Cash Only sign on the door.  Back into the car and to an ATM.  Back to the restaurant, so excited and hungry...We were greeted by a friendly server and told to sit wherever we wanted.  We chose a big table and got ready to order.  I had coached S and GF earlier that they should make sure to order dairy cheese because I knew they wouldn't like the vegan cheese.  We ordered guacamole and tried to order drinks. The girls were disappointed there was no soda available, but hey, it's a juice bar and they did have horchata.  I was hoping for some iced tea, but none of that either.  We got water.We ordered guacamole and once we added salt, it was really good.  I was also disappointed that the chips seemed to be bagged - one of the best parts of eating Mexican is fresh-made chips.  The trio of salsas we were served with our chips was almost delicious enough to make up for this.We asked for smoothies and I ordered a huarache (basically an open-face quesadilla) with soy carne asada and dairy cheese.  I'd had this twice at the Western location and it was perfect - not too greasy, perfect seasoning on the soy meat, lots of cheese, good sope base.  S and GF both ordered flautas with dairy cheese.  I also mentioned to the server that I would be ordering some beans and tamales to go - I do that regularly from the other location as I live in the distant suburbs now and I like to bring home Chicago food.We waited for our food.....and waited some more.  We were the only people in the restaurant, so it didn't make sense that we were waiting so long for smoothies, which we'd wanted to counteract the delicious heat from the salsa.  We figured maybe they were bringing them out with our main dish - but after twenty minutes, we really didn't see why we didn't have ALL the food.  Another table of people came in at that point and were followed in by a woman who didn't seem to have all of her marbles and kept asking for money and hot sauce.  While we had initially spotted only one person working in the restaurant - our server - several more suddenly came out to help oust the marbleless lady and threaten her with police.  So that was fun.Literally 50 minutes after we entered, we were finally served our smoothies and then our entrees. We were starving at this point and couldn't wait to dig in.  Then I noticed that my hurarache didn't seem to have any cheese on it.  Instead it had beans.  I proceeded to have the following conversation with our server.Me: I'm sorry, I don't see any cheese on this.Her: We don't have any cheese.Me: ....I ordered cheese.Her: Do you want vegan cheese?Me: No.  Why didn't you tell me when I ordered cheese that you....didn't have any?Her: I'm sorry. I'm sorry.  The lady went out to get some cheese.  She will be back in five minutes.Me:  And then you'll put cheese on top of this?Her: Yes, she will be back very soon. Five minutes.Me:  Why didn't you tell me you were out of cheese when I ordered?Her: I'm sorry.  My English is not so good.  Me: It seems pretty good to me.  We're communicating right now.Her: I will bring the flautas. They are okay without cheese, yes?S and GF:  Well, no, not really...Me:  No. We ordered them with cheese because that's what we wanted.Her:  I'm sorry.  I'm so sorry.  You want to wait for the lady?Me:  No.  You guys want to go?  They did and we left.  She didn't charge us anything, just told us to leave, so we got free salsa, chips, guac, and smoothies. Because of that and how sweet our server was, they're getting the second star.But seriously....1.  You don't take credit cards, even though a vegetarian restaurant generally appeals to a slightly more upscale crowd accustomed to using them, oh, and it's 2015?2.   You ran out of cheese?  At 1pm on a Sunday?  You're a MEXICAN RESTAURANT.  You can't run out of cheese.  It's not reasonable.3.  Then we order food with cheese - and specify the kind of cheese we want, and on all three entrees....and you don't tell us you're out of cheese?4.  THEN, you attempt to serve us our entrees as if we somehow won't notice the lack of cheese, and are surprised when we object?5.  Also, our food took 50 minutes when we were one of only two tables in the restaurant?  With no explanation?  I have never typed the word "cheese" so many times in one sitting.  But seriously. These guys have got to step up their game a LOT.

3.description: Not very tasty. I was surprised by all the positive reviews on here. I guess its slim pickings for vegan mexican food in Rogers Park but they still have a ways to go before I give this place another shot.

14.description: This is my favorite place for vegan tacos, hands down. The fake meat selection is extensive and I've liked nearly everything I've tried. The tamales are soooo good and the guac is good quality. The soup was so so, but not everything about a place can be outstanding. Very reasonably priced and BYOB. Check it out.

4.description: I dined at this place based on the strength of its Yelp reviews. My experience was so off base from the others that I felt the need to add some dissonance in here. To the owners - please take this feedback to heart, as we would like to see you succeed in the neighborhood. We ordered nachos and a veggie burrito expecting healthy Mexican food, as advertised. After all, $20 usually goes a long way for Mexican in Chicago. The nachos were an oversized pile of bland chips with a thin layer of melted cheese, refried beans, and some fake meat. There were no vegetables present. The chips/topping ratio was extremely imbalanced. The veggie burrito had more of an array of ingredients, and it was quite a large portion. However it was equally as flavorless and disappointing. We specially requested guacamole on both our items, however it was not included. They get a bonus star for not giving us a significant hassle when we asked our order be corrected. The guacamole tasted wholly unseasoned and relied too heavily on some thick slices of red onion. In addition to serving better quality food, I think this restaurant should rewrite the menu to be more descriptive. Our main issue here is how expectations did not add up to reality. "Healthy" and "vegetarian" implies actual vegetables will be present. Instead all we noticed was what was left out. The prices also seem unfair for what we got.

1.description: Villa. Actually strives, and I mean really strives, to provide the worst and most unprofessional service I've ever encountered as a ducking paying customer. After calling three times (and the phone ringing so many times, that it literally times out and disconnected), they finally answered..and the associate actually hung up when we were asking for a size. My friend called back just to ask for the associate's name, and they hung up on her too. Tryna drop some bills and this is what we get?? This is outrageous.

0.description: Yeah the employees aren't super helpful, but that's not why you come here. Great shoe collection, as well as hats t-shirts and random other apparel. Pretty decent sales depending on when you go. Plus they do sneaker releases too. You don't come here to get waited on, you come her to get cool kicks and clothes, and that they do well.

12.description: hidden gem in the Rogers Park community.  Great taqueria inside with awesome guacamole! def worth a field trip here to shop and grab lunch.

7.description: I feel lucky to live so close to Chapala.  I always immediately head to the back counter to see if they have any tupperwares of guacamole left.  It tastes great with Doritos Tapatio flavored nachos.  The "pollo entero" (served with grilled green onions and spicy peppers, corn tortillas and spicy sauce) and yellow rice with beans make an amazing take-out meal and I'm always happy to have the leftovers in the fridge.They used to sell Goya coconut water without added sugar and it was the most refreshing, lovely drink.  For months all they've had in stock has been the super sugary kind.I also recommend the fruity popsicles at the front freezer in the summertime -- yum. And the "chicharoncitos" at the butcher counter, mmm...

19.description: One of my favorite cheap eats in Rogers Park.  You enter a supermarket storefront and in the back there is a dining area frequented by mostly Hispanic customers.   Take a look in the hot bar to see what they are serving up that day.   Chances are that you probably won't know what the heck it is, but look anyway.  In my case I sit down at the tables and order up a couple of tacos or a burrito.  May sure you ask for the onions and limes, or cebollas y limon to put on your tacos.  To be honest,  it helps that I speak some Spanish because many of the employees don't speak much English.  If you want a safe bet just get the carne asada tacos or burrito.  You can also order a taco plate that comes with beans and rice for a couple of bucks more.  Add their delicious green or red sauce and you have a great meal.  Love this place!

1.description: Fuimos a comer tacos a este local La comida especial mente los tacos estan muy pobres - sin carne solo son tortillas cebolla y cilantro nada recomendable Nunca más volveremos a ese lugar ( fuchi )

2.description: Been going here since i was just a teeny weenie. Best chicken, best tacos. This place is a Chicago staple. I will go nowhere but here for Tacos and chicken. Prices are great, the guys are always on it, and everyone works hard which is why i will bring everyone i know here! Lalalalalalove this place! Literally can't go wrong, and please try that red salsa they make in house..amazing.

9.description: The taco stand in the back is the best- try the cesina (my favorite!), the lengua or the cabeza.  Great guacamole!  Mexican Coca Cola!  The service is terrific!  Plus, you can get two tacos each, a soda, and a side of guacamole for about $12.Go Chapala!

6.description: Visits now number in the upper two-digit range.  Never a disagreeable moment.  Pollo rostizado, and you can taste the flames.  So reliable, a gravitational force has formed that virtually prevents me from dining elsewhere in a neighborhood blessed with Mexican cuisine.

18.description: our 16th stop along clark between devon and howard.This was going to be a different kind of a review. We were thinking perhaps 3 stars.I was going to talk about the amazing chicken. $5 for a half a chicken, served with tortillas and a generous portion of grilled onions and lettuce, tomato, sour cream. about how the chicken tasted like magic. was wonderfully seasoned and moist. perfect. I was going to talk about how the horchada was good. you could taste the rice powder, but not in a bad way.I would've talked about the carne asada, cesina, pork, and chorizo tacos we tried. all of them servicable. not amazing. a little dry across the board, but tasty, especially with a little of the smoky, red, chipotle salsa.I was gearing up to exclaim over the bowl of grilled onions we were presented as a free appetizer. They were delicious and surprising. sure the dining area set up in the back of the mercado was a little skeevy looking. a little dirty. and sure it was a little hard to order cause they were out of both the barbacoa and the carnitas (disappointing!) and the guy working the counter knew so little english.but the food was good, super cheap, fast. This was going to go down as a surprisingly positive experience.That is, until Neal and I both walked away with a raging case of food poisoning. Husband and Julie came out unscathed. It must have been the pastor that both Neal and I tried. Come 9pm the next evening we were fevering hard. Neal was throwing up. My body was rejecting the bacteria in a different way. This went on for over 24 hours and I was left beat up and depleted, horrified and sad. Sorry Chapala. I was ready to give a positive review, til you done me wrong.Never again. I don't care how delicious your chicken is.

10.description: This was the second stop of my Ethnic Grocery Tour.This Mexican grocery store sells fresh produce, memorable guacamole and specialty items such as Mexican sour cream. There is an eating area with about 10 little booths where you can eat some the best carnitas around and roast chicken. They also have a selection of  tacos like cabeza tacos.The store was packed when we went in on a Monday morning, it might have been due to the heavy thunderstorm, but people looked pretty happy to be there.

13.description: back in the 00s i lived in a condo across the alley from this place. you walk out the back parking lot to the alley and that was my condo off to the right, 3rd floor. call me a baby, call me a whiner. but chapala had 3 dumpsters that they filled up every evening, 7 days a week, at about 7pm. crashing glass. stomping on boxes and pallets, etc. this usually lasted until 9pm. then between 3:30 am and 5am every day, 7 days a week, a private garbage truck showed up. for about 15 minutes it was rolling dumpsters, slamming the metal lid open, slamming the dumpster against the dump truck, then hydraulics of the dump truck lifting the dumpster and slamming it 2 or 3 times to get every last smashed item out of the box, hydraulics slamming back to the ground, slamming the lid back to the dumpster and against the wall. then 2 more times.every day.nothing on the inside of that joint could give it any more than that one star for me.

16.description: wow...when other reviewers say this is a gem it truly is..i had heard about carnitas from fellow co worker of mine..(little meats) so i read the reviews and went down there..it is  wonderful food and as i went on a saturday had to do a double take as i thought i saw the rib of a pig there under carnitas..but they do have it...very juicy and tender.. almost fall of the bone..enjoyed the meatless tamale as well..will most certainly go back.

17.description: My daughter introduced me to this place. It's a nice sized grocery store leaning towards the Hispanic community. But it the back next to the deli is this little seating area that has tacos, burritos, tortas, etc. It is pretty spartan, but the fare is authentic as the street markets in Mexico. 6 Tacos, a pineapple soda and a horchata set me back $8. Best of all,. there is a small parking lot behind the store.

15.description: I live near this place and always used to frequent this place for a torata de milanesa or chicken burrito with Lot's grilled onions and peppers on the side.  But since I have been watching my weight I frequent less maybe once a month. I recommend the pollo/chicken asado and the fresh carnitas when they come out fresh so ask how long it has been sitting out their. On the weekends though there is usually a line of people with huge orders so be patient. I also must warn you that the seating and table area is not so clean but the food is good and cheap and the horchata/ rice water is just right.

0.description: I love the restaurant that is in the back of the grocery store the food is very delicious and affordable. but my only two complaints are that the waiter service needs to be more organized. i have experienced other customers sitting down with shorter waiting periods get there food before me even though i have been longer but its worth the wait . Also there needs to be a better way of cleaning the tables after customers leave because when the next customer wants to sit down they choose not to because it has left over cilantro onions and what not and that's bad for business. The food is what keeps me going there but the restaurant needs to pick up there service game. Oh and try there Guacamole its Da bomb they have some packaged and ready to go..They service Menudo, Barbacoa, Rice and Beans, Whole Char Broiled chicken, Tacos, Tortas, Burritos, and there signature salsa's

5.description: My go to for tacos, carnitas, and some mex rice. The guys at the diner in the back are friendly and the prices are great. I find myself in there at least once a week or two, as I can't get enough. When you order tacos, they give you some great red and green sauce, grilled cebollitas(bulb onions), lime and some grilled jalapenos. Freakin Yum!

11.description: There's a restaurant in the back of this place that's fabulous.  Just order a medio pollo, served with grilled spring onions, limes and plenty of corn tortillas.  and be ready to get your hands a little messy.  :)This place has character.  Not somewhere you'd get dressed up to go, but they've got great food.

8.description: Great Tacos, cheap prices.

3.description: This is hands down the best tacos in town!! My boyfriend and I can't get enough of the chicken the lengua the chorizo and the steak all amazing!! They sell the chorizo at their meat counter it is definitely one of my favorites!! I wish I could give this place 10 stars!!

14.description: Pretty outstanding traditional taqueria at the back of the supermarket. A very basic setup with booths, no menus (you can browse the bain-maries) and also use the large wall listing of menu items (no prices, but the food is super cheap). One can order at the counter or at the tables and your food will be brought out on plastic plates with some plastic forks. Feel free to eat with your hands as there is a wash basin in the seating area, this is real no frills and an authentic Latino eating experience.Crowd very much Latino, local and crowded for for lunch on a Thursday.For the food. We went with a couple of pork tacos, which were decent. Served with a plate of lettuce, tomato, grilled jalapeno (nice and hot) and some grilled whole tiny onions with tortillas. Followed by a half chicken that was pretty spectacular and highly recommended. A serving of Chiccarones which were just OK, needed some salt and little too fatty. Finishing with a pork torta, which was solid a good size crusty bread roll with pork, avocado and mayo. Good sauces on the table to accompany. All for $20 with two cans of soda. Pay at the counter and dump your trash.Enjoy!

4.description: We get carnitas here often for parties.  I love the back for tacos and carnitas.  You need to put your uptight housewife person aside and just go for it.  It's not super clean, it's not super English-friendly, you'll be the only white girl, but you'll have a happy little lunch that is the real deal.  The people are so nice, and the food is really awfully good.  Maybe my favorite tacos and carnitas on the Northside (see my reviews of Don Pedro and La Chaparita for the whole city), which is saying something.

58.description: I should have written this review a few months ago, along with several others I am finally getting around to writing. After hearing so many horror stories about customer service lately I thought it was important to share some great customer service stories with Chicago! *stepping off soap box*I heard about Cally's Curls & Co from a friend of a friend of a friend. I, obviously have curly hair, but not tight kinky curls, and have in past gotten decent haircuts, but always felt like it could be better. The haircuts were ok,  and these are high rated salons, not a quickcut type place...we talked about how to avoid the "triangle head" or when my hair was long it would stretch out the curls, so I felt there was definitely some knowledge of curls there. I just never really felt they understood my curls. I decided to take a chance and try this place out, and I was pleasantly surprised! My stylist was Betty, who was so sweet and talked to me about what she was doing to my hair the entire time. She explained the entire deva-process, which I'd heard of before but not all the details and the reasoning behind it. I love that, it tells me the artist is trained, willing to "train me", has a passion for her craft and is thinking about it throughout the entire cut (cut, wash, trim, dry). In the end I got a new head full of beautiful bouncy volume lush curls and a head full of knowledge on how to style and use the best products....PLUS I'd also gotten a single process color to cover this dreaded gray and it was the best color I've had in a long time, and it has lasted much longer then the salon I was going to prior, and my head didn't stink afterwards either. I am planning my next appointment soon and am looking forward to another fabulous experience.

56.description: Obviously I have curly hair. And although I have a lot, and it's thick, it is quite easy to blow out, if you know what you're doing. Let me start that I normally get blow outs done about once every couple of weeks. So I know what my hair is suppose to look like.Unfortunately, Laneeta, as sweet as she may be, did not. Anyone with curly hair knows that in order to get that sleek smooth look, you need to use some arm power to stretch them out, if not it will look like a 5 year old just brushed out my curls...and that is unfortunately my blow out looked when I left the salon. When I was paying and expressed my dissatisfaction with the blowout, the woman at the front desk told me to come back again the next day to speak with the owner. Excuse me, but as someone who works and was extremely dissatisfied with Laneeta left my hair big, frizzy, and triangular (curly girls know what I mean). These are  things that a curly girl never want. Although I was excited to try out a place that specializes in curly hair, I unfortunately cannot say that I will be returning for Lanetta's blowouts.

29.description: If you are looking for a place to celebrate your curly hair (all curls welcome), then this is the place to go.  I live in the northern suburbs, have been trying various salons, but this one is a keeper. I have discovered that all of the stylists are trained to cut my curls, and if one isn't available, I know from experience that another one can step up and help me out. The atmosphere is friendly, low key, and none of this walking out of the salon with really wet hair because they don't want to take the extra time with hair that isn't straight.

42.description: I have very tightly curly hair and had been searching for a curly hairstylist to cut my hair for some time and came across reviews for Laneeta Page at Curls and Company salon. I lurked the reviews for Curls and Company for about a year before I finally decided to make an appointment in July of 2013. I was really satisfied with the short curly bob cut she gave me. Then in March 2014 I went back and asked her to give me an even shorter bob cut.  I love this cut even more! If you have tightly curly 3c/4a hair, and are looking for someone who knows how to cut your natural hair, I would highly recommend Laneeta!

23.description: I love this place. I just  had my  second appointment with Bette, after going to the same person at a Michigan Avenue shop for 10 years.  Bette's color is beautiful.  My former hairdresser always did a single-process red, and would not entertain the idea of highlights.  I also love the cut, and am ecstatic  about how much curl it's brought out. Finally, the salon seems completely drama free, as is Bette.  I truly appreciate that as well.  She really listens to what you have to say, and doesn't act like she's doing you a favor to cut and color your hair.  My only complaint is that I didn't start coming to Curls & Co sooner (and that's on me).

47.description: I want to say at this point I've tried every single place people with curly hair know about in Chicago, and I'm really digging the cut I got here. I've got mad thick hair of 3b curls (defined as, fyi, "copious curls that range from bouncy ringlets to tight corkscrews... curls' circumference are Sharpie size"). I've been getting my hair cut short for a few years now (think pixie-'fro, just below my ears). As spunky as my haircut from Sparrow in Logan Square was, I inadvertently gave myself a seriously high-maintenance hair cut and I found myself going back way too often.  Think curls growing out to look like earmuffs by your ears, flat top, with a shape reminiscent of a yield sign.... Not cute, AND a hefty sum if it means I have to go back every 4 weeks.  I'm convinced now it was a weird way the stylist cut in my layers. I needed to find someone who knew how to cut my hair so it could grow out looking good. So I called this place on a Wednesday afternoon and without a problem got an appointment that Saturday. I asked for Cally. I think there's a lot of benefit in having your hair cut by someone who has a similar hair texture and understands the way it works. She gets that curly hair cutting is something like sculpting - two week grace period if some strands seem out of place or the cut settles in funny. I've never gotten a devacut before but I'm now a fan of the process as it makes sense for my hair type. She studied my hair from all angles, had me get up and turn around, asked tons of questions, and really listened to what I asked or suggested. Also loved that after years of my hair naturally parting a certain way she was able to break up the curls put some life and lift into my hair for a new edgy look.  You know it was a good cut when you leave feeling like a rockstar.

8.description: If you are thinking about trying this place out - just do it and find out for yourself! I am sure you will be happy.

31.description: I've always had to find "special" salons that really know how to cut curly hair.  When I ask a salon if they cut curly hair and they respond, "Yes, of course.  It is all the same."- I hang up immediately.  It is NOT all the same.  Texture = different.  I had a great stylist back in CA, but now that I have returned to Chicago, I figured I would check out Callie's place and see if the hype was true.  It was easy to make an appointment and the receptionist was really personable.  I liked her right away.  The salon was clean and had a good feel to it.  I like the funky-fun vibe inside.  Parking was easy.  I was offered a drink.  The coffee was good.  So, all the "stuff" was great... How about the actual haircut?Love it.Bette cut my hair and I have to say- It looks great.  My curls are happier.  They LOOK curlier and prettier. (To give you a reference: I have curls like  Anna Lynne McCord.) I know a lot of "the tricks" about curly hair- But she taught me a few more and they really make a difference!  I am spending WAY LESS time on my hair and it looks MUCH BETTER. (I am so serious that I had to put that in CAPS.)I do have this fantasy of bangs... Like real ones.  And I asked for a little... And she gave me a little.  And the fringe is so very little that it blends into the rest of my hair.  So I went back in two weeks later (she told me to do this if the fringe wasn't enough). And she gave me more!  But it still isn't "bangs". She is probably doing me a favor but if anyone has proof out there are real bangs that look attractive on a gal with curly hair- Send it my way!

34.description: My hair is wavy and cowlicks = thus I have never truly been able to grow out my hair because the average stylist cuts it uneven and it grows out looking bad.I have not been to C & Co for a years now due 3 bad experiences. The first visit was within 6 months of their opening and was excited because I live in Rogers Park. I believe it was Cally the owner who cut my hair. I found her method interesting but cannot remember why I didn't like the cut.The second time I went was December 2010 and cannot recall that stylists name either. I asked her to reshape my hair for it to grow out. She cut it all off and my co-workers commented on how bad of a cut I received. Luckily I know how to grow out hair quickly - eat lots of protein, take multivitamins, and massage your scalp every other day - so now super short cut after 4 months now has achieved 2" of length. The third and final time I went back and I asked the same stylist from visit #2 for a trim and she cut it all off again! At the most it should have been 1/2" or the ends. I was stunned and never went back. I found Laws of Hair and have never had a chop off and my hair has been able to grow out.I really liked the staff and hoped for the best. I would recommend this salon as perhaps it will work out for someone else.

16.description: I was here yesterday and got my eyebrows done if I could I would give -5 stars. She chopped one of my eyebrows in half and ripped the skin off the other. I hope my brow grows back and pray I don't scar! DO NOT get your brows done here.. it's been a nightmare for me.

13.description: I didn't know I had the hair requiring a special cutter until I had my first cut at Cally's Curls and Co. (by Cally, herself).  Now, I know.  I've had the best cut in my life!!I am amazed and so impressed with how this special Devacut  for curlie-heads, like me, has made it so that my hair is ALWAYS looking great and wearable, without washing, for days!Sometimes three/four days go by without a wash, and I think to myself "oh, I should wash my hair",  i look in the mirror and say, "no way!  My hair looks great.  I'm not washing it.    Cally suggested great products to use between washes that also work nicely, but really, even without products, my hair remains beautifully curled, no matting, no knotting, no smashed down bed-head to contend with. I've had 3 Devacurl cuts and will go back for a 4th and 5th.  Ask for Cally!!(I live in California, but I'm from Chicago, so I make a point of visiting Cally's Curls every time I'm in town!  I tried a Devachan salon in L.A., and it was the same great cut,  but waaay more expensive.  Cally's Curls & Co.  keeps it real.  Normal salon prices.  You will not want another cut after your cut from Cally's Curls & Co. )

11.description: I have never found a salon or a stylist that could really cut my very curly hair.I have always been told that my hair needs to be really short or even worse straightened. I have always wanted to embrace my curls but never thought I could.I came across Curls and Company on the Internet *VERY CURLY FRIENDLY to say the least! I felt I had to give them a chance, "could they really be as good as they look on their website?"Long story short, Curls and Company blew me away!!!!!Exceptional!Kelly, my stylist went above and beyond!My hair has never looked or felt so beautiful!THANK YOU

39.description: Yesterday evening, I had a DevaCut done by Laneeta! Let me say, never have I had such manageable and beautiful hair in my life! I never thought that my curls could truly pop or have shape until I came into the salon yesterday. The experience was absolutely amazing. I hadn't been in anyone's salon since I've been natural ( I did the big-chop in 2010), so I was a little nervous about coming into the salon. However, the salon staff made me feel so relaxed! It was such a pleasure to be so happily greeted upon entering into the salon. It also comforted me to know that everyone in the salon, and I mean everyone, was knowledgeable and comfortable with African-American natural and immensely thick, kinky-curly hair. There has been plenty of times where I have been turned away upon walking into the salon because they did not have the tools, resources or education about working with my special curl type. I appreciate the diverse culture and fun environment that Cally's provides its clients. Thank you so much, Cally's Curls and Company for making me feel special and included in your salon and services.Laneeta knows so much about curly hair! She took the time to educate me about my hair and how it works. She gave me a tutorial at the washing station and she taught me how to finger detangle my hair ( I didn't even know that combs were a "no-no" when it came to curly hair). She even allowed me to finger detangle one side of my wet hair while she watched so I could know how to do it at home! Also, she gave me loads and loads of advice about how I can maintain my hair so I can keep my curls in tact. Wow! She paid close attention to my needs, wants, desires and lifestyle when she cut, shaped, washed and dried my hair. I am a minimalist, so I needed a curly cut that would allow me to get up, shake and go. Laneeta gave me just that. I am now on my 2nd day hair and my hair looks like I just got it done. I've never had 2nd day hair and I am sure I can stretch my wash-and-go another 5 days. I am absolutely amazed.I am a forever client. Many thanks goes to Laneeta and to the entirety of the Cally's Curls and Company staff. I appreciate you all!

37.description: Went to the salon about 3 months ago for a cut after almost 3 years of not cutting it. I met with Kelly, who is a lovely girl. Had i know she had an appointment before me i would have reschedule for a later time or next day. She was almost done with the first person when they started to washed my hair. she worked on my hair while finishing up the other person. Wasn't too happy that i didn't get the full attention on my hair but she did listen to what i wanted. I was afraid of losing my length but she worked it out. I wasn't so happy with the cut. i felt like my hair was still flat and wasn't curling like it use too. Didn't go back for the touch up because i decided to wait it out for the next cut. but now i'm ready for a not just a good haircut but a Great  haircut.Let me mention that the last time i paid for a curly hair cut was 4 years ago and was in love with the idea of a curly haircut. I loved my hair it curled and had life. but after 3 yrs of not doing anything buy dying it my hair needed some TLC. so 3 months later i'm going back to try it again. I think they do a great job but shouldn't take appointments back to back. everyone wants their time on the chair and the spot light on just them. Don't mean to sound needy but i want a great haircut i love my curls i love it when the stylist take time. it creates customer loyalty and with me hair is what makes you smile just a little more. hopefully this saturday i will have a better experience and can write a better review. I would still recommend this place to anyone that has curly hair.

0.description: Yesterday marked my first appointment and I had a fantastic experience!I called the salon Friday afternoon to book an appointment and they were able to take make 2 days later that following Sunday. The receptionist I spoke with was very thorough when explaining what to expect during my appointment: there would be an initial dry cut, then a wash, a dry, and then a follow-up cut; she also mentioned to arrive with my hair detangled and with minimal product. Right off the bat, I knew I would not regret coming to the salon.The day before my appointment, I received an e-mail confirmation of my appointment containing the name of the appointed stylist and recommended arrival time.  On the day of my appointment, I walked in with my 2c-type curls combed out (a couple of inches past my shoulders) and ready for chopping. I met with Margaret and explained that I wanted to go for a bob and showed her some reference pictures. She looked at them with some detail and determined what would work best with my hair. She proceeded with the dry cut explaining everything she was doing. She cut just enough and left some room for additional cutting for the 2nd cut. After the wash, she asked if I preferred a gel or creme for styling/moisturizing and proceeded with styling with my head flipped over to ensure maximum curl. (I've been to several salons in the past who would terrifyingly comb all of my curls out after the wash, apply a bunch of heavy products, and had no idea how to dry curly hair.)Once I was all dried, Margaret continued with the 2nd cut to style my new bob which turned out absolutely amazing! The cut was so precise and detailed, she made sure that there were no stray pieces longer than the rest of the cut. She also explained that if I wanted to go a bit shorter after getting home and styling it on my own, they have a policy where you can book a new appointment within 2 weeks of your original appointment and they will do the cut with no additional cost.I will definitely be booking my next appointment here and recommending to all my curly friends!

38.description: I had a devacurl cut by Bette, who based on other reviews I thought would be great. I have big loose curls - which can tame to wavy in dry weather. From day one of the cut, it never really laid right. All the dreams of super manageable curls curtesy of a devacut... dashed. I don't think I'd ever go back to the salon or the style of hair cut.

51.description: Maybe they were just having an off day, but this was the worst haircut I've gotten in the city, and the one I've paid the most for. I wasn't seen until a half hour after my scheduled appointment, and then the whole process took ages. It was my first time getting a Devachan cut, and I had positive hopes for it. The problem was that, before the dry-cut, the stylist spent a long time styling my hair completely differently from how I do it. It seemed to me to defeat the purpose of a dry cut, because I was never going to curl my hair the way she did, as I expressed to her. Anyway, I found the wait and time and cost annoying, but the worst part was that the haircut ended up truly terrible. It was uneven, it wasn't the right shape, and random locks would stick out in random places. I had to go elsewhere to get it fixed. I do have to qualify this review by saying that I had a junior stylist, and I imagine the senior stylists and the owner are as talented as the many five-star reviews claim. Even so, I wanted to share my less-than-ideal experience and suggest curly-haired girls on a budget proceed with caution.

27.description: I have been following Cally for at least 6 years. I used to get my hair cut at Devachan in New York and since moving to Chicago I would only go to someone who was Deva-trained. Cally has a wonderful salon, and she is a curlxpert! She knows what she's doing and cares a lot about the work and making clients feel great. A fantastic experience every time!

32.description: Finally. A place that really and truly GETS it. Got my first cut a couple hours ago...won't be the last. -- I wrote that four months ago already (!!) on their Facebook page after having them cut off about 6 inches or so. I haven't been back but that's only because my hair still looks AMAZING. I absolutely love this place, love the way they talked about my hair and how to take care of it. When I get tired of the length, I'll definitely be back!

54.description: Thank you, thank you, Cally's Curls and Company!!Yesterday I got a curly cut from Lindsay and she listened well to my specifications and checked in with me often during the haircut, and even though I knew on some level when I was leaving the salon that my hair was still too long (I'm a grad student on a budget, my haircut needs to LAST!), I felt so well-taken-care-of that I left anyway.A few hours later, I'd convinced myself that I didn't like how the layering looked in the back and told myself I'd call the next day about returning to the salon for a touch-up.  Everyone who was working at the salon mentioned that that service was available for up to two weeks, which is a super generous and accommodating policy.So I called today, and I showed up, and Laneeta fixed the back layering and shortened my hairdo as I'd wanted.  And they even shampooed, dried and styled my hair all over again.  And best of all, this touch-up was truly FREE!  (Though of course I tipped Laneeta for her quick and detailed work!)I've never ever been happier with a haircut before, and it's all thanks to the attentive stylists at Cally's and their generous touch-up policy.  Thank you, Cally and team!

48.description: I cannot believe I haven't written a review for this salon yet!I have always had curly hair and was getting by with my stylist in my hometown. (As long as she didn't do anything to my hair after cutting it, the shape itself was ok.) For Christmas 2011, I bought the Curly Girl book for my littlest sister and in reading it learned that there are actually people who cut specifically curly hair.SAY WHAT?!I hopped on Google, found Naturally Curly's web-site, and saw there was a salon less than a mile from my house.Jackpot!I've been getting my hair cut by Cally since January 2012, and it is always an amazing experience. My curls have changed and loosened a bit over the past few years. Cally explained to me that hair restructures once every 5 years and gave me some tips for styling my newer hair type.The price is more than double what I paid my previous stylist, but it is well worth the price to have someone who understands my hair type working on it. Cally has helped me evolve my routine as my hair has changed and always listen to what I want and need.I highly recommend this salon to anyone who asks. In fact, I now carry some of their business cards to pass out to people at work or on the street who ask me where I get my hair done. Having my hair done here has turned me into some kind of curly-cut evangelist.But honestly for curly girls, coming to Curls and Company is finally finding home.

44.description: I went to Kelley to chop off my years of hair abuse, relaxing my curls. She listened, took her time, & educated me about cut, how to use products, & said if I needed a few pieces fixed, come back in a week. She, & the salon are a much needed place for us curly girls!!! Great place!

24.description: I was here yesterday and got my eyebrows done if I could I would give -5 stars. She chopped one of my eyebrows in half and ripped the skin off the other. I hope my brow grows back and pray I don't scar! DO NOT get your brows done here.. it's been a nightmare for me.

7.description: Laneeta is amazing!  Just needed to say that first off.  My mother and I had been getting our hair (her African American, me 1/2 AA) chemically straightened for about 25 years and we finally decided to go natural about a year ago.  My 5 year old son has beautiful thick curls but I didnt know how to take care of it and it would just turn into a poofy afro after awhile.After being dissatisfied with a salon close to home, we sought out Cally's Curls and Company and decided to make an appointment with Laneeta after reading some reviews about her.  Even though it's a 45-60 minute drive for us, we love this place!  Laneeta took the time to show my mother and myself and my son how to take care of our curls, and since the first curly cut my son got from her, he's learned to love and fiercely guard his locks.  It's as if Lanetta waved a magic wand and made our curls appear!  Prior to seeing her, I had gone natural for a year and then went back to straightening because I didn't like the big afro I always ended up with and didn't really understand what to do.  Even though she always has clients, she never seens rushed and takes plenty of time to explain things to us.  The three of us have never been so happy with our hair before!  She really cares about our happiness with our style and will goes the extra mile to see that you're satisfied.  She even suggested some styles for me for a wedding I had coming up, and showed me how to do it myself.The salon itself is bright and pleasant, and we've always been offered refreshments during our appointments.  I wish we lived closer, but it's worth the drive for us.  Laneeta's pretty popular so make sure you book in advance, but once you see her, you'll completely understand why.

49.description: I really want to like this place but after my haircut, I believe the deva cut is more of hair cut theatre. I came in with my poorly treated hair. The stylist asked me a bunch of questions, which I personally believe were for giggles. I told her I hadn't gotten my hair cut in a while and my hair is doing this really annoying shape... I call it the trapezoid. You know when your hair weights down at the top and it poofs at the bottom and in general your hair shape looks like a trapezoid.  I loathe this look,  and yes I know some women like it, whatever I hate it. Meanwhile the stylist was working on another lady, who again she can like her hair however she wants, was getting a trapezoid cut. So she cuts my hair dry, washes it, dries it out and cuts it into a trapezoid in fact it looks exactly like the other girl's hair.  I start to panic because I had my hair cut short and the only way to fix it was to cut it into a pixie. I asked for bangs on a whim, hoping to break up the shape. Bangs were not a good idea, but that's on me. How she cut my bangs are a different story.  She didn't cut the full portion of my bangs I have to push back half of my bangs because they are the length of the rest of my hair, the actual cut bangs are so short that if I let my hair curl the bunch up into a disaster. Long story short in order for my hair not to look like a 'friend in cosmetology school,'  cut I have to straighten my hair every day. It still doesn't look good but it's better than the curl and all of my friend still ask,  "what the hell happened to your bangs."  I'm quite disappointed and irritated that a place who specializes in curly hair butchered my hair.  Here's to 3 months of flat ironing.

40.description: Great cut. Never have seen my curls so defined. BUT damn, she CUT my hair. I'm feeling a bit bald and have no clue what others styles to do with my hair now as I'm not the one to just keep in in one. I feel it will grow better now with a cut so defined but good Lawd I is bald. Lovely salon, lovely people, yummy coffee. Very knowledgeable about hair. If you want a trim make sure you are real specific about a trim and not a oh shit, the next day I realized I have no hair and look like a boy cut.

53.description: I have been going to Cally's Curls and Company for a couple of years.  Cally and Bette have taken great care of my hair.  They always have good suggestions, and I love the color and care of my hair.  I also get a great blow out when I feel the need for straighter hair.  I have had the Keratin treatment too, which has helped with the frizz!  Highly recommend the salon.

30.description: Just styled by Laneeta today and got a great cut and great advice about upkeep. I like that she takes her time and really does a great job.  I have a pet peeve about stylists who say: "you need a trim" but then 30 minutes later you realize you got a few inches taken off. Not so with Laneeta. She said a trim and she did a trim. I will certainly be back and to see her for future trims.  Otherwise, everyone at Curls and Company, in general, is very professional, on-time, and they have free parking to boot. It's also walking distance to Marshall's so after you get your super cute "trim", you can go and get a cute dress or top to match;-) My only gripe is that it is sooo far from my home. I live in Hyde Park and it takes me generally 45min-1 hour to get there which is not anybody's fault. However, that is a testament to how much I like this place if I'm willing to travel that far.

46.description: I want to say thank you and tons of hugs for the wonderful cut and product suggestions.  Cally is the sweetest and most knowledgeable professional I've  met.  She has allowed me to finally enjoy the waves in my hair.  For years I've tried to find the right cut and products and I've hit the jackpot with Cally and her place.Every time someone comments on how good I look, it's a reflection on Cally.The Deva products she carries are the best.  I can't believe for years I followed the advise of another hair stylist to use hair spray only to hold the girls.Cally you are truly a gem that helps so many shine!

1.description: I had a rather pleasant experience at this salon. I believe the stylist I was with was Lanetta. She was really gentle with my hair and explained the reasoning behind everything that she did to my hair. I never expected my curls to come out the way they did. I would like to eventually go back to have a devacut. This was my first time going to a salon like this so if you've never been- don't expect to pay under $50 for services.

55.description: As a girl with kinky curly natural hair, finding someone to cut and style it is a bit of a challenge- especially since I live so far north. A round-trip 2-3 hour commute for a cut and style is far from ideal. That's where Cally's Curls comes in. I had a friend do a big chop on my hair, it came out not quite right. Not wanting to look like a frizzy baby bird, I called and booked an appointment with Laneeta. Walking in, the place is fun and modern and everyone was friendly. Laneeta was sweet and took care of my hair, explaining her process every step of the way and answered all my questions. I even walked out with some kinky curly hair tips. The style fit my face so much better and I got great curl definition. Extra bonus points: A few days later when checking my card statement I noticed that my charge was higher than what I'd been told I would pay. So I called Cally's to see if there was a mixup and they went through so much to help me figure out the problem. They called everyone but my bank on my behalf, turns out my bank was the one that made the mistake. I really appreciated how quickly they helped me and how much effort they put in, instead of a LOL NOT OUR PROBLEM approach that happens so much these days.Will definitely be going back for my trim!

9.description: I have been going to Cally's for a year now. I am so glad I discovered Cally's for my very coily hair. The Devacut is great, the stylist gently cuts your hair in very small sections to cut your hair in a way that is best for your curl pattern. I did not know how to properly perform a "wash and go" on my hair. The stylist showed me how to properly finger detangle my hair, and perform a wash and go style that enhances my curl pattern. Now that I know how to finger detangle and wash and go my coily hair I have not done a "twist out" or "braid out" or any of the other "out" ultra time consuming hair styles that are popular for women with natural hair. I wash and go and I have never looked back.

26.description: Let me first start out by saying this salon is 1 hour away from where I live but I have to say, I've found my new salon. I will continue to travel this far because I am ecstatic about my hair cut. I have not had a haircut in over a year because every salon messes up my curly hair. It's like they don't understand any other texture that is not straight.I have been following the Curly Girl Method for a year but I desperately needed a haircut. I went into the Deva stylist finder and found this place but wait.... then I went on Yelp and I was sold because they had great reviews. Anyway, I was assigned to Kelley and I loved her. She whipped my hair back into shape, I had the most beautiful, moist curls when I left there and the second day my hair looked even better. Kelley showed me how to style my hair and gave me great tips. I've already recommended this place to my friend and will continue to spread the word.

25.description: I didn't know I had the hair requiring a special cutter until I had my first cut at Cally's Curls and Co. (by Cally, herself).  Now, I know.  I've had the best cut in my life!!I am amazed and so impressed with how this special Devacut  for curlie-heads, like me, has made it so that my hair is ALWAYS looking great and wearable, without washing, for days!Sometimes three/four days go by without a wash, and I think to myself "oh, I should wash my hair",  i look in the mirror and say, "no way!  My hair looks great.  I'm not washing it.    Cally suggested great products to use between washes that also work nicely, but really, even without products, my hair remains beautifully curled, no matting, no knotting, no smashed down bed-head to contend with. I've had 3 Devacurl cuts and will go back for a 4th and 5th.  Ask for Cally!!(I live in California, but I'm from Chicago, so I make a point of visiting Cally's Curls every time I'm in town!  I tried a Devachan salon in L.A., and it was the same great cut,  but waaay more expensive.  Cally's Curls & Co.  keeps it real.  Normal salon prices.  You will not want another cut after your cut from Cally's Curls & Co. )

12.description: I went to Cally's Curls recently to get a cut and all-over color. I wish I could give a better review for the cut itself, but it's actually one of the worst cuts I've had. My hair has never been frizzier, or frumpier since I went to Cally's. It just looks lifeless. Now that my hair is growing out, I can see the cut is actually incredibly uneven. It's so uneven that my husband, who never notices these things, actually noticed. I was hoping to find a salon that knew how to cut curly hair, but this place misses the mark.The women at the salon were incredibly nice, and I wish I could go back, but the haircut is so terrible that I won't do it again. I'm giving stars simply for the women at the salon--since they were so friendly, but I won't be going back.

59.description: My haircut was just ok

21.description: I went to Cally's Curls recently to get a cut and all-over color. I wish I could give a better review for the cut itself, but it's actually one of the worst cuts I've had. My hair has never been frizzier, or frumpier since I went to Cally's. It just looks lifeless. Now that my hair is growing out, I can see the cut is actually incredibly uneven. It's so uneven that my husband, who never notices these things, actually noticed. I was hoping to find a salon that knew how to cut curly hair, but this place misses the mark.The women at the salon were incredibly nice, and I wish I could go back, but the haircut is so terrible that I won't do it again. I'm giving stars simply for the women at the salon--since they were so friendly, but I won't be going back.

17.description: Love love love this place!!!!  I have gotten several curly cuts with Laneeta, as well as done the pintura highlights and she does an amazing job.  She makes the pintura highlights look super natural on curly hair and not at all like the old school streaky highlights that they do at some hair salons.In regards to her cuts, they are on par with the Devachan salons in NY..so no need to go to NY to get your curly cut!

10.description: I have been coming here to have Kelly cut and style my 3c curly hair for over a year and she is amazing. My hair never looked as good before I started seeing her. She is SO skilled at cutting and shaping curly hair, and she's the only stylist I trust with mine.

5.description: I visited Cally's Curls & Co on 8/22/15.  My experience is highlighted below.My hair:I have thick, kinky hair. It can probably be safe to classify it under the '4B' category most curlies follow.  I use very little heat; I primarily wear it twisted & tucked during the work week & out in a fro on the weekend; it was collarbone length when stretched & around my earlobe/nape of my neck when not stretched.Quality of service:My stylist was Star.  She was cool & laid back.  She was very patient with my curls and walking me through how to properly care for my hair [think how to properly wash, condition, style, trim, and even how often I should be washing/conditioning].  She did not use a comb throughout my visit and stuck to the finger detangling method.  She walked me through all the products she was using, their benefit, and how to use them.  Even during my visit we talked about things I didn't come in for, e.g. how to color hair without using bleach; dry shampoo; & straightening curly hair.  Prior to starting service, we did do a consultation where I walked through what my current routine was and what I was hoping to get out of the visit.Overall Salon experience:I thought it was cute that there's this London/Rock & Roll theme throughout.  Clean. A bit on the smaller side but that wasn't any type of issue. Amid the reading selection is a copy of Lorraine Massey's Curly Girl book.  That was a good book to peruse while waiting.  Coffee, tea, and [ice] water are available to guests.  It was a friendly environment; I didn't catch her name but the receptionist was friendly and helpful.Location:From the address you'll notice that it is located at the last Red Line stop.  There is sufficient parking.  So easily accessible by train & car.  I also do want to shout out the fact that this salon is among the newer businesses contributing to the growth & expansion of this neighborhood.  I did really like my cut but moreover than that I thought I left with healthy hair.  I didn't leave second guessing what my stylist told me - which has been my experience in the past at other salons.   My hair didn't feel greasy.  It's always nerve-wreaking to try a new salon, especially with my hair type, but I'd totally recommend the salon to another curlie regardless of her hair type (wavy to kinky).

3.description: Stick with a Cally,she's the best.She did a great job on my girls hair.Good prices,free parking,nice atmosphere.

35.description: The first time I came here, I saw Laneeta.  Her cut was only $45 at the time.  I told her I wanted to chop of a few inches of my hair.You know that feeling when you talk to someone and you suddenly think  it won't go well?  Like when you check in at the airport, and the attendant just scans your id and hands you your boarding pass without saying anything, and you walk away with that sinking feeling that your luggage is going to Seattle instead of Boston.  Or when you order a latte at Starbucks, and they just tell you how much you owe without looking up.  You just know that your drink will be wrong.Unfortunately, I got the same vibe from Laneeta. And so I chickened out, and told her I didn't want to chop off a few inches after all, and just wanted an inch and some reshaping.  I say this not to complain about Laneeta.  She's lovely.  I mention this because others might think the same thing I did, and I want to reassure them that their worries are unwarranted.   The fact is, Laneeta is a quiet and serious type, and if you're used to chatty perky hairdressers, like I am, you might start getting a little risk averse too.  But don't worry!  Laneeta gave me an AMAZING cut.  Seriously, just the perfect, walk out of the shower and shake it out, fall into place, low maintenance curly cut.   In fact, I recently went to an actual Devachan salon and dropped $120 plus tip, and it was not nearly as good as Laneeta's cut.  Plus, I didn't get any sort of snooty and condescending advice from her.  I got *actual* good advice about taking care of my curls.Cally's runs a lot of specials, and I occasionally drop in for blow outs or to buy Kevin Murphy products.  They've always been super friendly and helpful.

19.description: I was really hoping for a great experience. I'm so at a loss for words, went in with a full head of natural hair some damage was looking for a nice taper with a lot more hair than I walked out with. Now I have less than an 1/2 in on the sides & a couple inches at the top. The haircut is so patchy it's embarassing. The manager tried to find a resolve bless her heart but once you cut off all of someone's hair how do you fix that! Can't even look in the mirror without getting mad...time to start all over smh. 4 years of natural hair gone!

28.description: Love this place. Second cut I get. Loved Cally!

45.description: I want to echo a few other posters here to say that if you don't have super curly hair, than the special, pricey cut may not be for you. I have looser curls and the curly cut didn't really seem to work for me very well. It's okay, but not worth the price tag.

33.description: Just saw Bette yesterday. She took the time to really listen to what I wanted, to explain what she was doing, and to make me comfortable with my first curly haircut. I will go back, and I completely recommend Bette!!

43.description: I have really thick botticelli and corkscrew curls. First time getting a curly cut here, the process makes sense for girls who always wear their hair curly. If you straighten or blowout your hair like me once in a while, the ends will end up to be uneven. Wonderful customer service and curly hair styling tips and tricks from Betty. The Deva products are great, definitely recommend them for thick curly hair-I use the DevaCurl B'Leave-In and DevaCare Arc AnGEL.

2.description: Cally, owner and curly hair specialist, is knowledgeable about all hair types, as well as the total look achieved by matching your cut with your type of hair, and with the shape of your face. The  stylists, and even the receptionist I met, who herself has very curly, beautiful hair, know a lot about the many hair products, and which ones are best for your particular hair type.  They have a education programs for their customers as well, to help those of us with challenging hair, so we can manage our well-cut hair when we are on our own.Cally gets to know you over a few cuts, so even with hair that changes with the weather and humidity, you will get good advice and responsive attention to your preferences.

18.description: This was my first curly cut after deciding not to put heat on my hair for an entire year in order to bring back my natural curls in all their glory. Callie the owner cut my hair and I can say that it's one of the best haircut I've ever had. The shape of my hair looks so much better and my curls absolutely pop versus being tangled among the heat damages pieces. I wanted a fresh start and Callie gave me one! I will definitely be back!

41.description: I had my hair done by Laneeta (cut and DevaCurl treatment)  and I have the frizziest, driest,  most unmanageable hair ever!  You think your hair is kinky and too dry?  Come see me and we'll compare:-).  I can't even wear an afro because my hair will dry out halfway through the day and start to knot and tangle at the ends. No I'm not trying to win a contest, I'm just emphasizing this because I work with my hair a lot: and have done most everything, braids, extensions, twists, perms and relaxers and now natural for the 3rd time in my life - but being relaxer free, it can easily take an entire day or more to make my hair presentable: and I use all the natural sulfate and phosphate free products out there, including a few home remedies and all the great advice out there, from the youtube natural hair divas to best-selling books. With all of that, I still have to settle for protective twists and braids to keep my hair from drying out. With Laneeta it took a couple of hours to transform this dry frizzy mess into observable curls and even some ringlets. Wow, a minor miracle for me. It looked photo-ready for once and I got some nice compliments in the process.The only downside to this was that the results were temporary.  I'm certainly not blaming Laneeta, it's just a message that I need to go to her to maintain the quality of the hairstyle, and the price for what I got was quite reasonable.  I've spent a lot more and gotten far less for my money.So if you think your curls/kinks/knots are hopeless go see her. Honesty is her best feature.  She noted my dryness and gave me great tips on how to deal with it.  It's a lot of work, but again, that's not her fault.  While she worked on my hair she told me what she was doing and how she did it with the expectation that you have to maintain the style at home. And she didn't try to push products, even though I did end up buying the set.  As for at home maintenance?  Let's just say I'm working on it, but haven't found the right balance yet.  But since I saw first hand how great my hair actually could look I know there is hope for me yet.  I plan to see her again very soon.

52.description: Wonderful!!I struggled through my entire young life with terrible haircuts done by straight haired ladies that never seemed to have an idea why i would want to where my hair curly. I would get a cut and then almost certainly they would say, "Now, do you want me to straighten it?" No! I love my curls I want you to make them look great! Cally always does! She is amazing, fun, interesting, easy to talk to and great at what she does. You can tell she really cares about her clients and her business. I went in last week for a cut and color and, though it came out nice, after a few days I felt it really could have been a little shorter and lighter. I called Cally's and she called me back within the hour and told me to come back in that week for a touch up, which I did. The cut and color are great! I have been getting compliments from everyone I see and she did it all for no charge!!! She is great, well worth the trip (I'm out in the burbs) and money. If you're a curly head, take a trip to see Cally. You will leave happy!

50.description: Lindsay Konrady is my stylist at the salon. I never have a problem getting an appointment on short notice since it's hard for me to plan ahead.  She always does a great job and my color and cut always is just want I wanted.  At my last visit, she was asking me about my eyebrows, and I told her that I was in need of a wax.  She did an eyebrow wax for me while my color was processing and she did a great job.  The salon is cute and parking is easy in the lot next door.  I recommend Lindsay if you are new to the salon and want a recommendation on a stylist.

4.description: I had to write a review, we found this place for my 12 year-old niece who really struggles with her curls and has found it almost impossible to get decent haircuts.  We found this place online and decided to call and make an appointment (with the owner - we were weary, didnt want to take any chances).  Well, all of our expectations were met and more, the haircut, service, and salon were excellent.  Very happy with the cut, style and recommendations on how to style at home.Thank you Cally - Abigail loved it!

6.description: My first curly cut after embracing my frizz factory natural curls.  Thanks to Starr for giving life to the curls and making it a great experience overall. The salon is located by a shopping mall and there is adequate parking. The staff is warm and courteous. My stylist was spunky and fun. In the past, I have left salons feeling a little ripped off and manipulated into buying their recommended products but not here! She sent me home with simple tutorial for maintenance! I left with a bounce in my curls and a spring in my step!! Definitely a gem for curly girls!

22.description: I was really hoping for a great experience. I'm so at a loss for words, went in with a full head of natural hair some damage was looking for a nice taper with a lot more hair than I walked out with. Now I have less than an 1/2 in on the sides & a couple inches at the top. The haircut is so patchy it's embarassing. The manager tried to find a resolve bless her heart but once you cut off all of someone's hair how do you fix that! Can't even look in the mirror without getting mad...time to start all over smh. 4 years of natural hair gone!

15.description: Let me first start out by saying this salon is 1 hour away from where I live but I have to say, I've found my new salon. I will continue to travel this far because I am ecstatic about my hair cut. I have not had a haircut in over a year because every salon messes up my curly hair. It's like they don't understand any other texture that is not straight.I have been following the Curly Girl Method for a year but I desperately needed a haircut. I went into the Deva stylist finder and found this place but wait.... then I went on Yelp and I was sold because they had great reviews. Anyway, I was assigned to Kelley and I loved her. She whipped my hair back into shape, I had the most beautiful, moist curls when I left there and the second day my hair looked even better. Kelley showed me how to style my hair and gave me great tips. I've already recommended this place to my friend and will continue to spread the word.

57.description: You have curly hair?!  Do not pass go, do not collect $200.  Instead, go straight to Bette at Cally's Curls.  She cut my hair back in November (I know, a belated review), and did an excellent job.  I had shoulder-length super curly hair, and she gave me an Audrey Tatutou cut, and I love it.  A few strangers have even complimented my hair.Another note about Bette- you can tell she *loves* her job.  I could see her smiling as she cut my hair!  People who love their work tend to be good at it! Give Cally's Curls a try.

20.description: The first time I went to Cally's Curls and Company was in January. This was about 2 months after I began the journey back to my natural curls (after 8 years of straightening irons and Keratin treatments). I decided I'd go with the more expensive ($76) Devachan dry cut with Bette. I had A LOT of heat damage so I was ready to chop all of my hair off but Bette did not recommend that I go too short. I got about 3 inches taken off to bring my hair to shoulder length. I was not impressed with the cut only because my curls were so lifeless. In dire need of a professional hair cut, I went back a couple days ago and got another Devachan cut with a junior stylist, Lindsay ($56). My curls are much closer to their natural state than they were in January so it was easier for the stylist to see my natural curl pattern. This time around, I love the cut because I got layers so I've got a cute, curly bob going on. So overall...GREAT service-- friendly staff that offers tea and cookies :)GOOD haircut-- for someone whose curls aren't all there quite yet.OKAY price-- a little on the expensive side.

36.description: I hate to write this because I really wanted to make this my forever salon however I have been going here for over 3 years and things just keep getting worse. I have lost 3 beauticians in the time I started going here each time they left the salon each of them tried to take me with them. I really love the curly cut but each time I go the prices have been different and one time I asked for a blow out cuz I can't do it myself. She agreed and then I went to pay and had a $50 charge for a blow out. She never said anything about the up charge especially after getting highlights I did not expect to pay that much for a hair appointment. This last time and final experience was the worst. I went to Kelly who is new. She almost had me on tears several times. I have never had my hair pulled so much and even with all the flinching she just kept on trucking. She did highlights on me. I went in to get highlights and roots covered. She questioned my color and left my roots horribly grown out. I went to my new salon and she couldn't figure out the mess Kelly had done on my hair and I ended up getting color and highlights done to fix the mess. I am sad to leave Cally's cuz the owner seems really nice and knowledgable. Just wish the business was run better with stable pricing and quality work. Having people stay in their chairs for more then a year would be helpful too cuz I hate changing people after they know my hair.

14.description: Yesterday evening, I had a DevaCut done by Laneeta! Let me say, never have I had such manageable and beautiful hair in my life! I never thought that my curls could truly pop or have shape until I came into the salon yesterday. The experience was absolutely amazing. I hadn't been in anyone's salon since I've been natural ( I did the big-chop in 2010), so I was a little nervous about coming into the salon. However, the salon staff made me feel so relaxed! It was such a pleasure to be so happily greeted upon entering into the salon. It also comforted me to know that everyone in the salon, and I mean everyone, was knowledgeable and comfortable with African-American natural and immensely thick, kinky-curly hair. There has been plenty of times where I have been turned away upon walking into the salon because they did not have the tools, resources or education about working with my special curl type. I appreciate the diverse culture and fun environment that Cally's provides its clients. Thank you so much, Cally's Curls and Company for making me feel special and included in your salon and services.Laneeta knows so much about curly hair! She took the time to educate me about my hair and how it works. She gave me a tutorial at the washing station and she taught me how to finger detangle my hair ( I didn't even know that combs were a "no-no" when it came to curly hair). She even allowed me to finger detangle one side of my wet hair while she watched so I could know how to do it at home! Also, she gave me loads and loads of advice about how I can maintain my hair so I can keep my curls in tact. Wow! She paid close attention to my needs, wants, desires and lifestyle when she cut, shaped, washed and dried my hair. I am a minimalist, so I needed a curly cut that would allow me to get up, shake and go. Laneeta gave me just that. I am now on my 2nd day hair and my hair looks like I just got it done. I've never had 2nd day hair and I am sure I can stretch my wash-and-go another 5 days. I am absolutely amazed.I am a forever client. Many thanks goes to Laneeta and to the entirety of the Cally's Curls and Company staff. I appreciate you all!
