0.description: omg arrow is the BEST. they have great prices, value, selection, location, ordering, customer service, delivering, products, reviews, EVERYTHING. I love arrow. Ryan is running this business out of his apartment, NOW THAT'S DEDICATION. Ryan knows what hes doing. He's amazing. ORDER THEM NOW!

3.description: Open on a holiday and both young ladies were happy and smiling ... Imagine that....Great food, great service, great value... Simple

1.description: Across the street from Loyola's lake shore campus, just a half block away from the Loyola redline stop and practically next to 5 guys, this huge Potbelly's location is decorated with Loyola banners, table and signage. You all need some signed posters from the Volleyball champs for 2015! By the way, I enjoyed my Turkey bigs with everything - as always. Oh, there is Free wifi by the way.

2.description: I speak not only for this location but for Potbelly as a whole. Forget about the horrible/unedible Jimmy Johns and the tastless Subway. Potbelly is the Best sandwich chain, and the Wreck is the best !!! Please keep it up :)

5.description: This is my second fave Potbelly location in the city. The staff is always attentive and the roomy dining area is clean.

6.description: This is my go to Potbelly's shop. They do Deliver but have a $25 Minimum where as the one on Clark as a $10. Chris the manager is always very friendly as is the rest of the staff. Plus I love that I don't have to pay for parking.

7.description: nice place ...pleasant staff .....pretty busy  cuz it's so close to Loyola

0.description: Hands down my favorite Potbelly location, although the organization as a whole is still five stars.Coming from restaurant management, its easy to notice the little things.  In this case, its the little things that always make for a great experience!Some "fast casual" places are very obvious that you're a customer and you're talking to an employee.  Less personal, more assembly line.  Not the case here.  I honestly can just relax here, it almost feel's like I'm at a friends place having a bite with them.  They remember me, ask how I've been, its nice.  They even make eye contact with you when talking to you!  Sad to say, but that's not very common in similar places any more.Marco, Stephanie, and Phi were working tonight, had a great conversation with them as it was a bit slower.  I'm helped most often by these three.  Quality was on point, as usual.Hats off to management too, I've even had to deal with the area operations manager when there was a minor snafu with the website delivery ordering process.  She was quick to address the issue, resolve it, and even followed up.  Well structured management, which is obvious by the apparent morale of everyone there.Kudos guys!  One of my favorite go-to spots!

4.description: Every Potbelly I have ever been to has had great food and great staff. This one is no exception. We ordered with no issues, paid, and were on our way.The Potbelly was pretty clean when I was there even though it was very busy. It is laid out just like any other one so nothing too unique there, but why try to fix what doesn't need fixing?It is right next to the Loyola campus so it will be filled with college students a lot of the time. So if that doesn't bother you, then by all means, enjoy a Potbelly sandwich. You will not regret it.

1.description: Below is the whole blurb from their website.Here's my take: Michael the cheese guy gets one of the stars all for himself- a cheese guru & stand up comedian/philosopher. Go for him alone.the rest of it= limited but a good place to get salad and berries and organic coffee and little snacks.Small but cute. I Love that LU is so committed to teaching it's students practical application of skills- one of the stands sells produce from the University's student run garden.WHEN:  June 10 to October 14, 2013WHERE:  Southwest Corner of Albion and Sheridan Roads, ChicagoMARKET HOURS:Summer Hours:  3 p.m. to 7 p.m.Fall Hours:  2:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. (September 30 to October 14)Link Card AcceptedWe look forward to the upcoming outdoor farmers market season and seeing you. The Loyola University Chicago Farmer's Market seeks to increase access to healthy and sustainably grown fruits, vegetables, dairy, meat and prepared foods.We bring you a relaxing atmosphere where you can purchase fresh local food.The Market is a direct result of a student project in the Loyola's Solutions To Environmental Problems (STEP) Food Systems course. Conceptualized and planned by the students, the Market's goals are to:Increase access to fresh nutritious locally grown and produced foods to community members in a densely populated urban settingTo contribute to Loyola's mission to serve those in need by providing a community gathering place where fresh, nutritious foods are affordableTo support small growers that apply sustainable agriculture and land conservation practicesTo support small producers with entrepreneurial spiritProvide a place where all can purchase local and seasonal foods to support the "farm to plate" lifestyleFarmers' Market Prices Competitive With Grocery Store ChainsAre you interested in purchasing vine-ripened tomatoes directly from the farmer that grew them but worry that they'll stretch your budget just a little too uncomfortably? Think again. Emerging investigations are beginning to challenge the notion that produce purchased from Farmers' Markets is more expensive than their supermarket counterparts.  Sometimes, consumers can even purchase better quality food for less at their local Farmers' Market. For more on the affordability of local food, check out a compelling blog post by New York Times and Washington Post writer, Barry Estabrook.Is Local Food More Expensive? A Consumer Price Perspective on Local and Non-Local Foods Purchased in IowaVermont Farmers' Markets and Grocery Stores: A Price ComparisonLearn more about farmers' markets and how they are shaping our local food movement. Check out the Farmers' Market Coalition. The Coalition offers a variety of educational opportunities, support, and news about farmers markets across the nation.For more information on the market and how to get involved, please contact Gina Lettiere at glettie@luc.edu or 773.508.8255.

2.description: It's pretty small but what did you expect for a farmers market in a mall community? There are maybe 8 booths but they all sell different foods like bread, cheese, coffee, fruit, or veggies. This time I bought jam and cheese but next time I will definitely try to remember to bring more money. Michael the cheese guy is the cheese. He has little sampling presentations that are to die for. I was left with so many choices I didn't know what to buy. I was offended for him when 5 girls came, sampled everything, then just walked off. This isn't Costco... The guys who sell jam and pesto and guac are really nice but I honestly think its overpriced. The jam is great and tastes really homemade but the other foods, while also delicious, are not worth the hefty price stickers.

0.description: Remember my rant about cheap and abundant Devon Market's produce?  That was all before I got on this organic kick.  Loyola U's Farmer's Market is tiny, plentiful, and kind to my tiny budget.Let's start with the actual Loyola U tent.  Their produce always looks hecka' fresh and is competitive with Devon Market ($2/ bunch of greens).  Some of the kids running the table seem spaced out (maybe it was the heat), but no one is rude, and the guy with brown curly hair is cordial.My next stop is down the center where Arthur and another guy are selling peaches $5/ pint, $6/pint raspberries, and $5/pint blueberries -- warm, sweet, and organic also.  These guys are chatty and just as sweet as their peaches.  Love them! The guy selling on the left side of the market has THE BEST corn on the cob -- not sure if it's organic though. $0.50/ear.Last but certainly not least is my guy, Michael.  He's the most approachable cheese connoisseur  I've ever met -- not snobby at all.  I bought cheese from him today even though I have plenty at home -- he's just that cool.  When you go, try AND buy the cheese that tastes like roast beef (perfection!) and the strong gouda (I literally got goosebumps after tasting it!)If you're looking for tons of every kind of produce stacked wall to wall like Whole Foods, this is not that.  If you like the challenge of purchasing what's in season at reasonable prices and cooking meals accordingly, go here. $40 will take you a long way.

address: SW Corner of Albion and Sheridan Rd

1.description: This Go Grocer location is fairly new to the Loyola Neighborhood.And, it's not the biggest of stores but it carries some pretty cool stuff!Like, my favorite Champagne in the world Veuve Cliquot' for $47.99a bottle! What a steal!Lots of Craft Beers to choose from but IMHO why in the hell do youneed craft beer when Miller Lite is on the shelf.. honestly..And, they have lots of imported chocolates, oh geez, all this is sounhealthy for me..okay onto the healthy stuff!Some great looking produce, and my individual size fruit cups filledwith watermelon for $1.99, boy, do I like this!And, yes, Go Grocer has lots of Organic Stuff, they also had amannequin in the window wearing a Go Grocer sweatshirt hoodie,hey, better him than me!Okay, seriously, this is a nice little store with nice employees/staff,and a decent supply of product..And, lots of organic/gluten free stuff, and.. Veuve Cliquot'!Welcome to Loyola Go Grocer, you've got my vote..

2.description: I went to Go Grocer tonight at 11pm and it was closed despite the sign on the door saying it was open until 12am on Fridays during loyola's Break. Also I haven't seen JoJo there. This place has gone to shit since she left.

0.description: Very clean, organized, and a wide selection of wine. Which is what makes people happy.

3.description: Great place to try unique pizzas and pasta. Plus, it's student run so everyone is very friendly and helpful. Loved it.

1.description: One day I popped in to have a slice and it was 5 bucks, and it was actually pretty tasty. Good enough to warrant a second visit. So on my second visit I walked in, approached the register, and there was a confused looking girl there scanning the dining area. She called out a name several times, and then disappeared. There was one girl remaining, working on some food. Making a pizza or something. I stood there for another 3-4 minutes and I didn't get any service, or even an acknowledgement of my existence. I left and got something else. This place is run by all female students. Not bad to look at either. Here is a lesson for you, students. If there is a customer in your store with money in his hand, talk to him. Thanks.

2.description: Came here with my parents. We had the buffalo chicken pizza (without the blue cheese) and it was amazing! The pizzas are a pretty generous size, which is nice, and they're a thinner crust. Nice and crispy, and made fresh to order. I love this place.

0.description: I don't go to Loyola...but one of my friends does and I'm so glad she showed me this! It's so good and because it's targeted at students is super affordable, especially when considering the portion sizes. I also like knowing that everything is made fresh in house and the chalkboard wall is super adorable and welcoming to the customers!

4.description: Much love for this place. The classic mac'n cheese pizza is a personal fav. And they just got in-house dishes and compostable dishes - just a cool green feature. It's run by students, which is hard to believe because the place is so legit. They just added smoothies, but alas, no avocado smoothies. Only mixed berry and mango. I guess that's fine. Very interactive, fun, casual place to hang out.

28.description: Don't get me wrong, it's not like Papa Romeo's is the finest cuisine on earth.  If you are looking for an entree or even deep dish, I most likely wouldn't send you here.  But if you are looking for a hand tossed pizza that's hot and hits the spot, you really can't go wrong.  My BF is obsessed with this place, and can't even explain why.  Sometimes you just want something simple and bad for you, and this is a good place to get that.Also, it's across the street from our favorite liquor store, so we run in, place the order, grab some beer, and by the time we're back we have a pretty darn good pizza for 11 bucks.

1.description: I wish I could give zero stars. I ordered last night from Grubhub and should have checked Yelp first. It took almost 2 hours for a pizza and fries to arrive and both were so bad that we couldn't eat either. The pizza looked like it had been shaken around the topping was all over the box, it was so greasy that the grease had actually come through the box to the underneath and the dough was completely raw. At $24 for a pizza I was completely disgusted. The fries were raw, there was ketchup packages all mixed in with the fries which also seems really unhygienic. Pretty nasty all in all. I called grubhub and got a partial refund from the 'restaurant', not 100% as it should have been. Save your money and go to 7 Eleven instead!

9.description: DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!! I ordered my food from here at 3:30am, one large pizza. After getting off the phone, i realized the woman didn't ask for my name or phone number, and we were staying in a hotel...After waiting over 2 hours THE PIZZA NEVER CAME! Not a call, and no one answered the phone. Then i awoke to a $40 charge on my card, when i ordered a $18 pizza. Its now been two days and i have not heard back, keep getting told to call a different manager and that this somehow isn't their fault....WTFMORAL OF THE STORY DON'T ORDER FROM HERE!!!!!1

29.description: we paid $30 for a pan pizza when we ordered deep dish. any decent chicagoan knows the difference. get it right! and also, how can you mess up the address?p.s.: i want my delivery tip back! you'll be hearing from me in the morning.

23.description: So, I just spent $70 on a couple pizzas and some cheesy bread (basically another pizza).  For that price they better be the best pizzas in the world, but they were good.  That's it.  They were good.But I can order "good" pizza for a lot less than this.  I probably won't order from here again but I can't say it isn't satisfying.

5.description: ** ALERT*** This location is now closed but they didn't bother noting it anywhere!** This place's service had been steadily declining over the last few years and now ends with them closing but posting NOTHING on their door (as of last Thursday... when, apparently, they have been closed for two weeks) and rerouting the phone number, with no note of this, to their Skokie location. I waited a few days to post my review so as to be able to explain calmly and rationally what happened.I called Thursday night to order a pizza. The same gruff person, who is very difficult to understand on the phone, and seems to have just as much difficulty understanding the caller, answered and never bothered telling me this. He just took my order and told me that my pizza would be ready in 15 minutes. There I am, 15 minutes later,  standing in front of a dark storefront, with a locked door and the ONLY reason I knew they had closed the location was the guy who runs the place next door happened to be walking up to his place, told me and said that they closed and were routing the calls. I knew I had called the right number because I called directly from their website which, oddly, ALSO doesn't show this location is closed. 1. Had I known I was calling Skokie, I never would have ordered, 2. I wasted time and had to find out from someone who didn't even work for Papa Romeo's that they were closed and 3. When I called the number again, the guy who answered (different guy) didn't bother apologizing, and his only response was "yeah that location has been closed for two weeks, they just haven't had a chance to update the website." Um thanks?!? Like I order pizza every other day and should just KNOW this?If you close your location, post a sign on the door, make sure your website is updated, DON'T just reroute calls without telling someone their call has been rerouted, especially when they're actually calling a location twenty minutes away and DON'T use a "well DUH, and??" tone with the person when they call ticked off that they just unknowingly showed up to an empty storefront. This is Chicago. There are a million and one options when it comes to ordering pizza, so, frankly, they should try focusing on good customer service or will eventually find all the locations need to be closed. The pizza is good but not good enough to sustain the business without it.

31.description: Large pizza with 3 toppings from Papa Romeo's = me very happy.Pizza was well done, just the way I like. Crunchy, easy on sauce, very tasty.  Pepperoni, mushrooms, black olives delicious.I checked Yelp first, of course, and reviews were not very good but I took my chance and I do not regret it.If you're from Detroit and you like the round "rising crust" style pizza that you usually see there then this is the place for you.  It was very reminiscent of Papa Romano's in Detroit.If you are in this neighborhood and you are craving good pizza you should try Papa Romeo's.

25.description: not good. tasted like a frozen pizza. in fact i would have preferred a frozen pizza. DiGiorno was talking about papa romeos in all their tv ads...

12.description: Your looking at the clock and it's pushing 3AM.  You want food and you find Papa Romeo's is open (grubhubbed it).You think about pizza, sammiches, etc.LISTEN TO ME!Do not do it.  Go into your own fridge or cupboard and make eggs and toast, have a bowl of cereal, eat cardboard -- whatever!  But don't order from here. It is really bad.  Greasy and floppy and sick -- worst pizza I have ever, ever, ever had and way, way, way too pricey.Icky poop.

21.description: I placed a Xmas Day delivery & while it's a busy day, the pizza arrived 90min after ordering and was cold/barely warm. They said they'd send another but it'd arrive very late and that I was lucky enough to be able to order on Xmas day and I shouldn't complain. A waste of $, time & a good appetite.

16.description: I've avoided ordering from Papa Romeo's before because of issues with them overcharging my credit card, but tonight we figured we'd take the risk just so we could get some food quickly.  Big mistake.  The gyro platter that my roommate ordered came nearly cold,  with tough meat AND pita bread. He'd also ordered extra meat and sauce,  neither of which he hot.  His fries were completely cold.  (How it had a chance to GET cold is beyond me,  as the restaurant itself is just down the street - we could've WALKED it back and it still would've been hot,  if it had started that way to but begin with.)  But the biggest problem was the so-called half-pound of Buffalo shrimp which was supposed to come with cocktail sauce.  Not only was there no cocktail sauce,  there were only EIGHT SHRIMP - and all eight were cold.  We made the order through GrubHub,  and when we called to complain,  the operator at GrubHub couldn't get through to them because they weren't answering the phone!  We got $10 from GrubHub for our troubles,  but that doesn't change the fact that we will NEVER order from this restaurant again - and nor should you.  If they're not willing to answer the phone when GrubHub calls them,  I'd say that's a good sign they get such calls all the time,  and that can't be good - much like their food,  in fact.  These people are con men,  not restaurateurs.  You can do far better,  and I only wish we had.

17.description: I can't find anything bad to really say, but I can't really find anything good to say either. It's pizza. Low quality compared to J.B.'s, but a good alternative when I'm in a pinch.

10.description: Ding-dong, the scam is dead. Currently shut down due to health code violations, if the neighborhood is lucky, this place won't reopen. While the pizza was fine when it showed up, they constantly lied to their customers about prices, were categorically rude, and absolutely disgusting - the last of which the City of Chicago will back me up on. I do not expect a lot from a fast and loose pizza joint. Rude - fine, as long as they're cheap. Expensive - ok, just get it here in a reasonable time. Late - as long as everything in my order arrived. Wrong items - it happens, as long as they make an effort to correct their error. Oh right -- I forgot about rude. Indignant and vile, does not a neighborhood favorite make. Good riddance, Papa Romeo's. Good riddance to your innumerable flyers littering the street, good riddance to your obnoxiously loud television blaring onto Clark until 4 am every morning, and good riddance to your apparently insect-laden, no-cooler-having, detritus-clogged establishment. May you go the way of the Wing Stop before you.

11.description: The customer service situation here is absolutely horrific. I walked in for my pick up and was glared at from all sides and ignored for a few minutes before someone deigned to speak to me. On top of that, they charged me for a side that, it turns out, was not in stock.The pizza is... fine. It's a greasy, late night pizza mess. But I'd suggest ordering from literally anywhere else. ANYWHERE. Especially now that you know they've been CLOSED FOR HEALTH CODE VIOLATIONS. Eeeeuuuggghhh.

26.description: I ordered a 12" deep dish with garlic and I was delivered a regular, maybe pan pizza, with NO garlic.  I spent $17 on this!?  When I called to let them know their error, the man on the phone insisted I was wrong.  I'm not a stickler for ass kissing customer service, I just want what's fair.  These jerks totally ripped me off.  The pizza I did get was way too bready and chewy and tasteless at that.  The $6 CAESAR salad was typical boring out of the bag garden salad with a package of premade dressing.  The soda I ordered was a 20 oz and they sent a 2 liter, which of course is nothing to complain about, it just goes more towards my point that these guys are terrible all around.

27.description: this is by far the worst pizza I have ever had, overly greasy, floppy crust, and stomach turning.  Pizza is by far one of my favorite foods if you ask my credit card statement or any of my friends.  In college I frequented all three places across the street from my apartment and was good with corporate papa johns pizza.  This place makes papa johns look gourmet.  I would recommend eating here if you want to try out bulimia for kicks.

35.description: I think this place is closed..has not been open in a week.

8.description: The pizza has no sauce...it's straight crust and cheese...and it cost $25....what the heck

0.description: The good here is pretty good. The pizza is pretty delicious, the side orders are solid, and the cheesy bread is really yummy. The problem is the prices. A couple of pizzas and the aforementioned cheesy bread will have you looking at at least a $50 dollar bill. While there are coupons available, every time I try to use one, I'm told that they've changed it and it's five dollars more expensive. The problem is that they leave coupons on my street about once a month, which is a little annoying. Plus, I've ordered a soda from them a couple of times, and it's never once been the right one. For a while, I only got Orange Crush. Last time, when I ordered Crush, I got Pepsi. You know, for the irony.

20.description: I'll never order from here again... When order was placed I was told it would take 40 minutes to receive.  It took An Hour and 45 mins to receive.  When I called back to complain that my pizza was COLD (Not warm, but Cold) they told me I lived too far (even though I was Clearly less than 3 miles away) and that there was nothing they could do about it.  The person that I spoke with who claimed to be a "manager" couldn't speak a lick of English and what I Was able to make out, wasn't very nice at all.  The ppl taking orders, the managers and the delivery drivers were unprofessional.

19.description: I tried this place with a friend and at first sight this is surely a place that I would skip over However, because I was with a friend who raved about the place I gave it a try. The price was great 3 topping personal pizza for 7 bucks with a soda. The pizza was so delicious I can't even tell you.

33.description: I was so disappointed in the food at this restaurant. The delivery was very quick but the quality was terrible. I ordered buffalo wings, which had NO buffalo sauce on them. But the biggest problem was the fact that there was also no chicken as it was just one big piece of chewy, rubbery fat one after the other. They were all like that, so I had to trash them. The mozzarella sticks were fine, but not great. My fiance attempted to salvage my terrible meal by offering me a slice of pizza. It could have been my frustration mixed with my expectation of further disappointment that led me to dislike the pizza as well. I wish I could get a refund, but it seems from other reviews on Grub Hub they don't seem to care. I will never order from them again. It's just a waste of money.

2.description: I ordered from this restaurant for the first time last night and spent $35 on a food that arrived cold. I also ordered buffalo wings and a Caesar salad. The wings seemed under-done and the salad left a little to be desired. As a trained chef, I was very disappointed with the food here and the service!!!

34.description: There are so many good choices in this neighborhood for pizza and we don't always try the new pizza places, but I was glad we ordered from PR recently.  The ordering itself over the phone took a long time and the lady seemed confused by my address even though I live literally 5 blocks from the place, but they're new so I guess it makes sense.  Five minutes later she was kind enough to mention a coupon/discount for a 3-topping large pizza, which was unexpected and nice.The pizza was good.  My favorite (pepperoni and green olive) on half and my wife's choice (ham and pineapple) on the other half.  We opted for the hand-tossed crust and it didn't disappoint.  With the savings from the coupon I added an order of oven-baked fries and those were good as well.  They weren't seasoned much, which I actually appreciated because I could add as much salt and pepper as I wanted and could get the right mix.Reasonably fast delivery.  We'll order again and try some other things.

32.description: I ordered thru grubhub.com yesterday. The delivery was on time, the hot wings were decent and the pizza was one of the worst pizzas I have ever had. The crust was very bland and the topping was nasty. I don't even feel like investing any further descriptions in this review. I just want to forget about the experience. I can get a frozen Celeste microwave pizza for a dollar that tastes better than this one did.

18.description: Worst place ever! I called and ordered a pizza for delivery. I gave my credit card number and then after receiving my pizza the guy ask for money. I told him I paid over the phone and he said ok. Ten mins later my phone rings and I'm being lectured on how I did not pay and screamed and cursed at. I was so overwhelmed I proceeded to pay again. In not happy with this interaction and will never order from here again!

13.description: I'll never order from here again... When order was placed I was told it would take 40 minutes to receive.  It took An Hour and 45 mins to receive.  When I called back to complain that my pizza was COLD (Not warm, but Cold) they told me I lived too far (even though I was Clearly less than 3 miles away) and that there was nothing they could do about it.  The person that I spoke with who claimed to be a "manager" couldn't speak a lick of English and what I Was able to make out, wasn't very nice at all.  The ppl taking orders, the managers and the delivery drivers were unprofessional.

4.description: Wow. Cheese pizza and 2.25 per topping. Very pricey and my 12 inch pizza came with exactly 10 pieces of pepperoni and 10 pieces of sausage. Parts of the pizza had zero toppings. The crust was quite good. Most the crust was good because there was no toppings like cheese or pepperoni or the sausage i ordered. Thus one has an unadulterated crust only experience. Paid on grub hub and gave a 15 percent tip. Never again. Driver called me and sounded like he was the knight rider in Mad Max. Yelling at me that he would be there in 2 minutes and i should come down because hee does not deliver. That really is insulting. Here the driver on the order get 4 bucks for deliver and almost 5 extra from my 15% tip and he calls yelling at me that he doesnt want to deliver. Second part of the order was a 5 piece Jumbo chicken wings. Well there are 4 pieces. And Jumbo must mean really small because these look like they come from a dwarf chicken. So if you feel like paying a premium for toppings you wont get , getting yelled at by drivers who dont appreciate 9 dollars worth of eelivery fee and tip, and dwarf chicken parts which someone left out the 5th piece.....then this is the restaurantfor you. The get one star for being open and delivering at 3:30 in the morning. But for 38 plus dollars including a GENEROUS tip i expected 1) pizza actually has toppings 2) the delivery person be appreciative and not scream at me he wont walk up the 8 steps to my door and 3 ) jumbo should be at least large and 5 pieces should not be 4. As a final insult i called the store who promptly left me on hold for 35minutes.I will never again order from the establishment and recommend no one else does either. Lastly for my JUMBO mini chicken legs of 4 not 5 pieces. I ordered hot and with sauce on the side. I got ZERO celery stick , bbq, and no sauce. Thank yoy for not delivering what i paid you for and for being rude on top of that.

24.description: I think Audrey C said it quite well. This place is totally fine for a hand tossed pizza. I live within an easy walk, and I certainly wouldn't go out of my way for it, but the pick-up prices are fair, the folks are friendly enough, and I haven't had any problems with the pick-up not being ready on time. It's not amazing, no, but it is quick and hot and perfectly decent. And, as noted, just across the street from a genius liquor store.

6.description: Ordered this pizza from grubhub, quick delivery but disappointing pizza. For charging 2.25 a topping they sure skimp on them. I maybe had three pepperoni and five black olives on my medium pizza. There's much better pizza in Chicago, but this place does deliver late so that's a plus.

22.description: I tried this place with a friend and at first sight this is surely a place that I would skip over However, because I was with a friend who raved about the place I gave it a try. The price was great 3 topping personal pizza for 7 bucks with a soda. The pizza was so delicious I can't even tell you.

15.description: unfortunately i have to give them at least 1 star. they would be a candidate for negative. by far the worst late night pizza place there is. ordered at 245 didnt recieve pizza until after 5 am. the pizza was nasty and cold and i decided not to tip the rude driver. for one i never signed any reciept for the charge, and also didnt leave a tip on the reciept. i check my bank statement and lo and behold the driver gives himself a $3 tip. this was 2 weeks ago im still disputing with them over 3 stupid dollars. as i can see with other reviews im not alone in my sentiment. Do not go here. the pizza stinks the service is worse and they just might steal from you...

7.description: Delivery to 4am?   Ordered pizza at midnight. Tried to call the restaurant after an hour to find out where my order was. There was no answer.Followed up with a few more calls. Gave up after 2 hours. Got a call at 3am saying that my pizza was outside.

36.description: Delivery was quick (30-45 minutes), but the food was not very great.  We ordered the tilapia dinner and chicken wings.  We specifically checked for tartar sauce and bbq sauce on grubhub.com, but they never included this with our order so our dinners were basically plain.  Tilapia dinner was just ok, and tasted like it was fried in very old oil that cooked many things - eeww.  The wings were just awful (do NOT recommend).  They were real greasy and contained lots of fat on them.  With no bbq sauce or blue cheese, we tossed them.  I would try this place again, but only for pizza orders.

30.description: When i first ordered from this place, I loved it...HOWEVER, they completely lost me as a customer. The pizza has gone downhill over 1 year and the service is even worse than the pizza. Every time we order, they manage to mess something up. One time we used the online ordering and they claimed they never got our order. Another time I ordered delivery and it took an hour & a half - even though I barely live across the street.If you have a good experience, don't expect it to be repeated.

3.description: Sadly, we like their food. It appears not too many do. Anyway, ordered pizza a couple weeks ago. Took two hours plus to get it. Called several times for updates, was lied to about new delivery time. Just as pizza arrived, dude on phone said he would credit us back for our charge.Of course, he lied. Charge still went thru. Tried to dispute with Chase but they suck and can't do anything "because we received service". That is debatable.  Anyway, the people answering the phones there ( at Papas, but some at Chase too) are complete morons and apparently the manager on duty doesn't arrive until 11 or 12pm. Quite the shift considering they close at 4.  Don't work took hard!!  Done with Papas, may they truly close permanently.

14.description: Horrible.  They messed up my order and the yelled AT ME! Never again.  The owner is a jerk.  Don't do it.

1.description: Armilla is a walk in treasure chest. I always find the perfect thing to elevate my home decor, and the prices are great. Little presents and big investment pieces abound. Can't wait to see what spring has in store at Armilla.

2.description: Walked in once.  Looked cute.  Slightly overpriced but some fun stuff.  Walk by with my boyfriend and see a perfect little christmas present in the window.  Call to purchase said Christmas present (Yea-uh for being quick on the present uptake.)  and apparently it was not for sale.  So, let me get this straight,  a antique decor store displays an item in their window that isn't for sale?  He said it was to "tempt me".  What?! It only tempted me to not go back.  So. Dumb.

0.description: This is a store has a little  bit  more  than antique  has a touch  of love  with a elegance.

1.description: Just bought a mattress from this place!  So happy I did! Eric provided me with great deals and was very knowledgeable. Great customer service and beautiful clean store. 5 stars. If you want a great bed and deal, COME TO THIS PLACE! Thanks Eric!

2.description: Just a few days ago, I purchased a new mattress from American Mattress. I am so satisfied with the store manager, Eric's extraordinary customer service in helping me select a firm mattress. The delivery to my home was free and timely. Thanks to Eric's diligent efforts, I received the product at a better price. Everything went so smooth!  I  would have no hesitation in recommending this store to anyone.

0.description: My first Yelp review that I have ever written, but I just had to do it! Stopped in to American Mattress with the husband just to look around, and we had the best experience. The guy working, James Bippes, was amazing. He made us feel comfortable, encouraged us to try all the beds, answered all of our questions, and never once made us feel pressured. We ended up purchasing a mattress on the spot, and James took his time to explain and explore different financing options so that we did not have to pull the whole cost out of savings. It was old fashioned customer service at its best--something that you rarely see these days. We were buying a big ticket item, however, we never felt that that was the sole reason for his attention. In fact, while we were there, a woman came in to buy a pillow, and James was just as thorough and attentive with her. I am a very satisfied customer.

3.description: Mmmm!  I think I might have a new favorite flavor here: Mamey.  Kind of like a fruit halfway between papaya and mango, it's sooo good in a paleta.

1.description: MEXICAN ICES. mango and cherry, made fresh everyday. Don't miss it!!I eat less on nights I want these Mexican Ices. As I said, fresh , with real fruit. Amazing!!

2.description: Great ice cream selection with generous serving sizes. Friendly workers as well. Looks like they have lots of interesting things here I will have to try over time.

5.description: This place is great! I was coming home from church and i decided to stop by here because i've always been curious about it and it was DELICIOUS!! I loved it because i got so much italian ice for the price i paid. I got a small and got what most places would call a large or JUMBO! It was great, and delicious, i have some left from the small i got yesterday and I have to go back tomorrow to get some more, make sure you try out their italian ice and make sure to try their tamarind and strawberry! :)

6.description: This is the hidden gem of Rogers Park. I had a hibiscus and pineapple ice sorbet. My husband got a lemon with fruit chunks. They were all so good and better than expected, really one of the best I had. Their small starts out at 12oz($2.59) and it a big heaping cup. It's equivalent to medium or large downtown. My husband got a medium which was more like a large/xlarge($3.19) and I think it was 16oz. It's a full ice cream shop and then some. Ice cream prices are very reasonable. I'm so excited that I should have started going last summer.

7.description: You can hunt down one of the bike-cart guys for a paleta or two (which is still the way to go if you're at the beach), or you can drive down Clark Street and stuff your freezer with an assortment. They always taste fresh (I'm assuming they're made pretty much with real fruit or fruit juice, maybe some sugar and not a whole lot more), and you can find bunches of familiar and more exotic tropical flavors. The coconut is like a suntan on a stick. Also your choice of water- or milk-based.  As others have pointed out, they have other frozen treats and snacks as well. They seem to be closed in winter.

8.description: I have to admit that I've only been here once and went in only because I was missing the taste of paletas (Mexican ice pops) from San Antonio.I was pleasantly surprised to find that they served much more than paletas at La Monarca.  There is a whole ice cream shop plus some snacks like nachos or fries. I will definitely go back the next time I'm craving a paleta (any flavor you can imagine) or a scoop of ice cream/ frozen yogurt.   I will update again when I taste the other items, but the paletas are definitely ok.

9.description: They have several types of paletas (both with and without milk). I tried one and we bought a few to take home. They make them on site which is a nice perk. My wife got a sunday which was great as well. Prices are very reasonable!Check it out you wont be dissapointed.

0.description: This place has the best Mexican ice palentas (ice cream pops). Mexican ice cream is one of the things I often miss about Mexico since American ice cream is just too superficial tasting and sweet for me. Monarca makes ice cream using real ingredients and you can taste it. Some of my favorites are: Nuez/Walnut (leche/milk), Arroz con leche/ mexican rice pudding (leche), Piña Colada (leche), Mamey (leche), Tamarindo (water). I like the milk paletas a little more because they have a very rich delicious flavor and the water paletas taste a little more simple.

4.description: Have loved these for years.  Flagged one of the bike cart vendor guys for my first Monarch of the year today--strawberry milk.  These are so, so good.  Yay summer!

1.description: Julia and Cindy designed and made my dream wedding dress!  I had a vision for a yellow wedding dress, and I knew that it was something that I wouldn't be able to find at a bridal boutique, so I started googling ways to have a dress made in Chicago.  This is how I found Crafty Broads, and I am so glad I did; a week later I had a consultation with them about what I was looking for, and that started the process.  A few weeks after the consultation they gave me some design drawings, and we discussed the finer points and details of all of the options.  It felt like I was on Project Runway!  At the next meeting they measured me, and showed me many fabric options.  A few fittings later, the dress of my dreams was a reality!  They understood exactly what I wanted, and had the skills to make it happen.The dress that Julia and Cindy made was much more special than anything I could have bought at a bridal shop.  I asked them to include a swatch of fabric from my great-grandmother's wedding dress, and was expecting something small... but Julia completely surprised me by using the fabric to embroider a special message on the inside of my dress!  On my big day I could feel the energy and love that went into making my dress, and it made me feel even more amazing.I loved all of my meetings and fittings with Cindy and Julia, they provided so much support in the 9 months leading up to my wedding.  The fittings felt more like hanging out with two close friends rather than an appointment.  They also gave me a lot of good information that helped us navigate the wedding planning process.  I asked about the wedding planning services too late, and they were already booked on our big day... but Cindy was able to coordinate our rehearsal dinner, which was SO HELPFUL!!!  She made sure everyone understood their role, where to stand, and how to get there.  She is so organized!  One of my favorite things about finding Crafty Broads is that I never had to step into a bridal boutique!

9.description: The Crafty Broads were, without question, the best money we spent at our wedding. We felt kind of stupid about it - in the scheme of Chicago weddings, ours was a pretty reasonably priced affair, and this was like 10% of our budget, and are we really the kind of people who need a wedding planner - but seriously, seriously, there is nothing else that could have been more worth our money. (And we definitely are the kind of people who needed a wedding planner. For the record.)First of all, they did all the alterations on my dress, which fit perfectly even after I ate an entire pizza at our wedding. They also did our day-of coordination plus some additional stuff (figuring out rentals and staffing, which boy do we not know how to do that), and it was just awesome. Cindy knows everything, and she also knows what's important - we had some vendors who seemed uncomfortable with the choices we made, but these ladies know that, at the end of the day, the goal is to get married. If we were omitting something that might be important she would let us know, but we never felt like she was judging us or the choices we were making, and that's really awesome, and not super common in the wedding industrial complex.They were incredibly helpful in the weeks leading up to the wedding, meeting with us and using Google Docs (hooray, FINALLY, everyone start doing this please) to manage every single detail, including a bunch of things we'd never have considered. On the day of, Cindy and her assistant handled everything, and I didn't hear about problems until they'd been fixed (or at least until the end of the wedding, ha), which is...pretty amazing actually, considering that our wedding had a lot of moving parts. Cindy also does a good job deflecting things you don't want to deal with (questions, complaints, surprise decorations). Everything went perfectly, as far as we could tell, and it is for sure because of the Crafty Broads.

23.description: We used Cindy as our stage manage (day of coordinator) for our wedding. She was so on top of things and had so many good suggestions. I never doubted for a moment that we were in the right hands. She'll make sure you cover things you didn't think of, keep your timeline on track, execute to perfection, and follow up with vendors who need extra prodding. Well worth the money and highly recommended.

12.description: I had given up looking for a replacement for my favorite jacket. I'd literally worn it to rags over a series of years and could not find anything like it on the market. I hired the gals at Crafty Broads to remake my jacket from scratch, and I am absolutely thrilled with the outcome. Cindy brought my finished jacket to me yesterday and I was literally shaking I was so excited at how it turned out. Exactly like the original but even better because she was able to move the waistband up about 3 inches, so the new one fits me even better.It's a miracle how great it turned out, and they are a joy to work with as well. Kudos, ladies! Thank you again and again!

21.description: I purchased a used dress from the Brides Against Brest Cancer sale, and knew it needed some tweaks.  If anything, it needed to be hemmed and taken in, but I also had dreamed of wearing a tea-length dress even though I couldn't find one. I also felt like it could use more personality.  So, I contacted Cindy and Julia at Crafty Broads, and they transformed my second-hand, David's Bridal dress into something unique and awesome.First they took in my dress, and then they hemmed it to just under my knees.  The hem looked better than I'd expected, because they had the brilliant idea to leave the lace layer slightly longer than the lining.  With all of the extra fabric from the hem, they suggested making matching cap sleeves for my dress, and a matching veil.  Each suggestion they made was carefully considered and well-thought out.  I loved listening to the two of them brainstorm ideas to come up with the best plan.  After I picked out some red shoes, they suggested adding a red sash, which turned out adorable.  They even made my groom a matching red tie!  Overall, the result was wonderful!Best of all, their prices were extremely reasonable, and Cindy and Julia were just so down-to-earth and easy to work with.  Highly recommend.

16.description: The Crafty Broads were just what the doctor ordered for our wedding!!  We had tons of home made elements that needed to be set up that they took care of as well as coordinating with all our other vendors!  These ladies are amazing and exactly what a bride needs on her wedding day!  Combining crafty stage managers and weddings sheer genius.  If you want to feel sane on your wedding day these are the women for you!

17.description: I first went to Crafty Broads desperate to get my mother-in-law dress altered. The bridal store where I bought it wanted more to alter than the dress cost! Plus, with a double mastectomy, I knew wearing the beautiful strapless dress would be a challenge. Cindy and Julia not only nipped and tucked, but came up with a boob alternative they fitted into the dress bodice so that I looked absolutely wonderful, even when having my Mother-Son dance! They were also able to make very good suggestions about a wrap and shoes, which I needed, being taste-challenged when not wearing jeans and a t-shirt. I went back a few weeks later to see if they could fix my favorite go-to formal dress. Surprise! They could, and they did! It looks brand new, and I cannot see where they sewed up the rather large, gaping problem. I have total respect for and confidence in these ladies!

10.description: 10 weeks before my wedding I went to these ladies for what I thought would be alterations and a bustle for my dress.  In the course of the consultation, Julia could tell that I really wasn't that crazy about my dress.  I had bought it ages ago at David's Bridal and had since fallen out of love with it.  Waste not, want not however, so I was determined to wear it.  I had acquired a beautiful handmade lace overblouse that I thought would reconcile me.  But Julia started asking what kind of dress would I prefer?  What did I not like about this one?  By the end of the meeting, Cindy and Julia had determined that we could use the structure of the dress to create brand new one over it- one made out of real silk this time!  The lines were simple and classic and they assured me that they could have it by 10 days before the wedding- time to make alterations if necessary.  End result- Cindy and Julia created the most beautiful dress that perfectly complemented my lace jacket.  They also did it in far less time than they said they would.  Love them!  I was thrilled to wear a dress I loved on that day :)

5.description: These gals rule!  I got engaged in early March, bought my wedding dress in April, and my wedding was August 23rd.  My initial search to find a tailor was a nightmare.  I was told there "wasn't enough time" to alter my dress, or they were too busy, or they would do it for way more money then I wanted to spend.  One woman actually chastised me for attempting to contact her 4 months before the wedding, stating she needed at LEAST 6-8 months (apparently having a short engagement is unheard of in the alteration world).  I was starting to panic when I found Crafty Broads.  Julia and Cindy were the exact opposite of what I had previously encountered.  They were so helpful from the first email I sent them.  I basically told them to make the dress presentable, but as comfortable as possible because my wedding was indoor/outdoor.  And they delivered that.  They gave me a really simple bustle that worked with the style of my dress.  They did very minimal alterations because that's all they thought I needed, and they were honest about that and didn't try to upsell me on things I didn't need.  My dress was ready four weeks before my date.  And they barely charged me anything!!!  I was truly shocked at how reasonable their prices were.  They also recommended a cleaner to use to press the dress before my wedding, which was helpful.  Overall, they were awesome and a pleasure to work with.  I would definitely recommend them to other brides!

11.description: I am so happy with the alterations I had done on my wedding dress.  I picked it up last night and the dress fits perfectly!  I'm even more smitten with my dress now than I was when I bought it.  Very easy to work with (the scheduling system is SUPER useful), very nice, and really reasonably priced.  I can't wait to get married in my perfect dress!!!!

22.description: The Wedding Stage Managers [part of Crafty Broads] did our wedding and I will be forever... I mean FOREVER.... grateful.  "Wedding" and "stage management" go together like peanut butter and jelly or champagne and brie.  These ladies not only can plan, organize, and successfully "liase" between diverse people, from vendors to wedding party, but they also have a real knack for reading their bride and knowing how much help she not only needs but wants.  Take, for example, my casual mention of my desire to have a DIY photo booth at the wedding. Cindy then casually researched a few different professional companies, talked to her connections, and emailed me two amazing deals she had come across.  Yeah, on further thought, who wants to be worrying about setting up a photo booth on her wedding day?  She knew it, she never said it, she left the decision up to me, but by going the extra mile to find a few other options, she made my wedding day 150% less stressful. On the day, they kept track of time and thanks to them, we could relax and enjoy.  By the good grace of heaven, Cindy, and Julia, we fit the whole thing into the 4.5 hours for which we had the venue.  CanNOT recommend the Crafty Broads highly enough.

0.description: This is a wonderful place. I got my wedding alterations done here...in fact, I just had my final fitting today. The alterations were done on time, and they were super flexible when I hurt my back and had to rearrange fitting times, etc. They are also extremely honest. They had to do less work than I was initially quoted for, and they charged me much less than planned without me having to kick and scream. I would definitely suggest people come here instead of go to one of the fancy downtown shops...this place is the best of Roger's Park.

20.description: Cindy was just wonderful to work with - as someone who produces theater herself, it was such a relief to have someone so detail-oriented and thorough on board in the months, weeks and days leading up to the wedding.  My mother was exceedingly impressed by her at the rehearsal, and her presence definitely allowed my entire Type A family to relax!  The day of our wedding she acted as a go between with us and the vendors and shielded us from having to answer questions every 10 seconds.  She pinned up my dress when I broke my bustle, and handled every little issue that cropped up in 8 hours.  Best hire of the wedding process for us!

19.description: Cindy was our day of coordinator (with assistance from Tamara) and was absolutely amazing. I am a complete type A, planner, organized to death girl who coordinates events as part of her job, but gave in and admitted we probably needed a DOC since it was not possible to clone myself and be in multiple places at once. Cindy and Tamara made our day run incredibly smoothly, making sure everyone was in the right place at the right time (my main request!) and taking care of all the little things I didn't want to task family and friends with (getting my dress bustled, packing up our decor and gifts at the end of the night, hailing cabs for guests--all of the small things you don't think about but can make or break a schedule). We were--get this--AHEAD of schedule the whole day, allowing us to make our cocktail hour while taking plenty of pictures with only an hour break between our ceremony and reception, five miles apart on Labor Day weekend in Chicago. Cindy was also great with our traditional-but-not wedding and understanding what we wanted (flowers? Yes! Bouquet toss? Noooope), as well as treating my husband like the equal participant in the process he was (something that is all too rare in the mainstream wedding industry). Despite having more than one wedding the weekend of ours, Cindy was extremely responsive to us, especially the week leading up to the wedding (when it was most needed!). One of our best vendor decisions!

2.description: Cindy and Julia are wonderful! They altered my wedding dress that was 4 sizes too big and made it fit me like a glove. They also gave it a magical touch by making the bottom half  (of a mermaid dress )zip off so that I can dance with ease. They essentially gave me two dresses in one! They also couldn't be nicer or gentler. I highly recommend Crafty Broads!

18.description: I purchased a used dress from the Brides Against Brest Cancer sale, and knew it needed some tweaks.  If anything, it needed to be hemmed and taken in, but I also had dreamed of wearing a tea-length dress even though I couldn't find one. I also felt like it could use more personality.  So, I contacted Cindy and Julia at Crafty Broads, and they transformed my second-hand, David's Bridal dress into something unique and awesome.First they took in my dress, and then they hemmed it to just under my knees.  The hem looked better than I'd expected, because they had the brilliant idea to leave the lace layer slightly longer than the lining.  With all of the extra fabric from the hem, they suggested making matching cap sleeves for my dress, and a matching veil.  Each suggestion they made was carefully considered and well-thought out.  I loved listening to the two of them brainstorm ideas to come up with the best plan.  After I picked out some red shoes, they suggested adding a red sash, which turned out adorable.  They even made my groom a matching red tie!  Overall, the result was wonderful!Best of all, their prices were extremely reasonable, and Cindy and Julia were just so down-to-earth and easy to work with.  Highly recommend.

13.description: Cindy was great! She was detailed oriented and patient with all my requests. She customized 2 blaze wedding dresses into the perfect ones for my wedding. I would reccomend her to anyone looking to alter/create anything clothing. She also created a veil and a flower crown for me. She is extremely skilled. All I had to do was send her my pinterest board and viola!

4.description: Hiring Cindy as our day-of wedding coordinator was one of the better life decisions I've made in recent memory--well, aside from deciding to marry my partner, of course. She was invaluable on the day of, and her organization and reliability took a load off in the weeks leading up to the wedding as well. She actually brought two assistants with her on the day of (who I barely met and so unfortunately don't remember their names), and between the three of them they arranged our somewhat complicated centerpieces, escort cards, guestbook table, etc. beautifully. Cindy ran our rehearsal like a boss, worked really well with our officiant, and made sure everyone was where they needed to be all day. The ceremony and reception went off without a hitch, and Cindy got everything packed up into the cars at the end. Basically, my partner and our parents and I didn't have to worry about a thing, except showing up and basking in all the love. SO worth it, and I would recommend her to anyone.

6.description: Planning a wedding is intimidating. But Cindy and her team are experts. EXPERTS. Not just at planning weddings (which they are), but also - somehow, miraculously - at planning and executing YOUR wedding, even though you've never done it before. Even if you're planning a Chicago wedding from Austin, Texas. Even if you're doing those things while you're also in graduate school. Cindy helped us make sure that our wedding was exactly what we wanted it to be - and then she made sure it ran flawlessly from start to finish. Always calm (and calming to me AND my mother - amazing) and warm and professional, she and her assistant were essential to our day being as beautiful as it could have been. I wouldn't even be surprised if she has some ins with the way higher ups - our wedding day was supposed to be 60 degrees and overcast; it was 74 and perfect.Bringing Cindy onto our team was - without question - the best decision we could have made in our whole planning process.

15.description: This "broads" are awesome. They altered my wedding dress beautifully and at an extremely affordable price. They do wedding planning as well which I didn't need however if I had, without a doubt they would have been fantastic.  Friendly, efficient and extremely organized. Great service, great quality...I would HIGHLY recommend to anyone.

7.description: Oh My Gosh.  What can I say about my experience with Crafty Broads??? I could not be happier.  It was one of my favorite experiences of wedding planning.  I was frustrated with the wedding industry -unable to find a dress that would be flattering and comfortable for me - let alone the style I wanted.  My mom and I came across Crafty Broads while looking for a seamstress and went in for a free consultation for a custom wedding dress.  Immediately Julia and Cindy made me feel comfortable and excited about a wedding dress for the first time.  They grabbed onto my vision immediately and my mom and I knew they were the people to make my dress.  Over the next year, we met sporadically to create sketches and designs, and then as my wedding date neared we met more often for the actual fittings.The two of them work so well as a team, helping each other (and me) find what I would be happiest and most comfortable with.  The whole process was just a blast, and a rather special way for my mom and I to spend time with the wedding.And...My Dress.  Oh my gosh - my dress! It turned out AMAZING! Better than anything I could've dreamed up!  I felt so special, and girly and pretty and absolutely amazing!  I never wanted to take it off!! They even made me a custom veil to match, finding a bead that would match my whole theme perfectly.  There were all these little personalized touches they added, that just made the whole thing even better! (like pockets, and our wedding date sewn in with blue thread - amazing!)If you are like me, and don't necessarily fit into, or want, a super traditional wedding dress (or even if you do - but can't find what you want) please consider Crafty Broads! It was money very well spent, and I HIGHLY recommend them for any sort of custom work! Love them and everything they were able to do for me! :)

8.description: We used the Crafty Broads for wedding day coordination and we couldn't be happier with how things turned out. They are really organized and professional leading up to the wedding, and really make things run smoothly on the day. Plus, they are just nice, friendly people, and really a reassuring presence during what can be a stressful time.If you're thinking about a day-of coordinator, I'd recommend hiring them, even if your venue has an on-site event coordinator. Now, with our wedding behind us, we are really glad we had the Crafty Broads helping us with our big day.

3.description: Cindy and Julia did a great job.  I paid a little less for my mass-produced wedding garments, and as a result they did not fit as well as they could have.  The Crafty Broads considered my input and took my concerns to heart when they were making the alterations to my dress and my dress "topper."  Everything came out beautifully, and I would definitely recommend them to any one else looking for a low stress, reasonable tailoring option.

14.description: I had my wedding dress altered by Crafty Broads and couldn't be happier. The alterations were finished ahead of schedule, and a last-minute fix (3 weeks before the wedding) only took a week. The dress fit perfectly, and Cindy and Julia were truly fantastic to work with. Thanks again!

12.description: Nice place. Understaffed, but the one guy who was working there was very nice! There's free wifi, but I don't think I would ever stick around long enough to use it. Iced drinks are on the expensive side, but their specialty drinks are usually worth it. (oatmeal latte is amazing!) The layout is really awkward, with the seating concentrated by the doors, and the register in the middle where the space is most narrow.  There's only 1 (tiny) trashbin tucked away in the far corner, where the sugar and stirrers are... but there's no milk or cream?Regardless my coffee was good enough, and the pasta salad was definitely worth the $7. Chock full of veggies and stuffed into the container, easily 2 lunches plus a snack worth of pasta in that 1 container.  Overall, good for a pit stop, but not the type of cafe you hang around in to do work or catch up with friends.

7.description: I was served by a very nice young man. I had a chai and sampled several flavors of gelato.  I went with the double chocolate.  I must say that I didn't care for it too much but that won't stop me from returning.

3.description: I have never seen another customer in this place. Once I walked in and was ignored although that might have been the day I was invisible but that was probably just how I felt. The other time I gave it another chance but no one ever came out of the kitchen. It's too bad because the paintings are cute and that block could use a cafe, but all I got out of my attempts to visit were two existential moments where, for once, I felt utterly present, alone, and okay with my own company, neither coming nor going. But there must be some residue of angst because I'm sitting across the street at Potbelly and bothered to entail my experiences. There is a help wanted sign in the Descartes window. The lights are on. Someone with an apron looks busy. One can be quite busy with the idea of customers even if one has no customers.

1.description: I came here to meet a friend/date and only tried the tea - which was fine of course - but had a strange experience worth mentioning.I arrived early for my meetup on a Sunday afternoon to get some work done, and I was one of three people to actually take a seat inside the cafe. I sat away from the other two people who were talking, so that I could concentrate - and I think it was pretty obvious that where I was sitting was a quiet space.So, then, two old gentleman came in and began a very loud conversation. A weird, loud, maybe English, maybe not, shouting match. They sat in the middle of the cafe at first, so I did my best to ignore them. But then they moved closer to me - for no apparent reason! - and continued their very loud conversation. After a while, as the time for my date to appear approached, I thought I should move to the other side of the cafe to find a quiet spot again. I did, and then received a free tea - because apparently it was the owner of the cafe who was being soo loud and decided to send me a drink to apologize after seeing me move!! What the h... why would the owner come in to his own cafe and nearly harass his customers with a shouting match?!?He definitely apologized, which was nice, but it was still a strange experience. Not a comfy, pleasant memory for me and I will not be returning. Also, the building is a cold, flat strip mall, and the employee who was working behind the counter actually left the building at one point - leaving me alone in the cafe! So strange. So strange. Two stars.

2.description: This review is for anyone considering working here. I see that the other employee who had written a review here had hers taken off, so I figure I would write one.I worked for Sony at Cafe Descartes about two years ago near the Loyola campus in Rogers Park. I was excited to have my first coffee job, and I'm grateful that this job gave me a gateway into what I have now crafted into a career. That being said, I probably would have been better off starting at Starbucks or Peets.First of all, as an employee I was treated very poorly. Sony rules his cafes by fear and anger. He would spy on me in the cameras and then call the cafe to interrogate me on what I was doing (which was either cleaning, making gelato or making people drinks) if he didn't understand through the camera. He would give me instructions that were impossible to follow through on because they were so unrealistic. His main way of talking to his employees is through coated threats, yelling and/or swearing. I had more than a few customers who had spectated the way he treated me and other employees make comments about how he would talk to us. I was never trained on how to use the espresso machine, and to my knowledge, there was no set pattern for drink consistency. I NEVER got paid on time and my checks were either short, weeks late or both. He was conveniently unavailable whenever I needed to talk about payment, but was always checking his camera to interrogate me on why I'm mopping the floors a certain way. He asked me to do ghost writing for him without any sort of payment, and would have me sit down after I had clocked out to write his emails and rewrite paragraphs he had written. The coffee quality at Cafe Descartes when I was there was absolutely awful. I don't think he cared too much about the quality of the beans. It was obvious that he had social motivation rather than artistic appreciate for coffee. Finally, the icing on the cake is how I was "fired." I was hospitalized for a small period of time and couldn't make it to work. I made various efforts during my time as a patient and after to communicate that I was unable to work and would be available after a few weeks and he never replied... Probably because he owed me money. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this place. There are so many better options for coffee in that area, like Metropolis, The Coffee Shop, and Growling Rabbit. Places with quality coffee, good management and happy employees.

9.description: Does Rogers Park need another coffee shop?  No, not really.  I've had the gelato, and it's okay, but I've skipped the coffee, tea, and sweets.  A little too pricey, especially for students at nearby Loyola University as well as some residents in the area. The place is never crowded, and it is clean.  But the way the place is configurated is not exactly welcoming.

10.description: One of the best options near Loyola's lakeshore campus, but that's not saying much.Atmosphere is comfortable and food looks good, but $5 for a medium chai latte? That's O'Hare prices in Rogers Park.

13.description: Good location to meet a friend or just read a book.   The atmosphere is nice.  Most of the tables face the window, so you could watch passersby, if that's your thing.  Coffee was OK.

16.description: I stumbled across this coffee shop when I was having Wi-Fi issues in my apartment. Not only do they have free Wi-Fi for their customers but their baristas can make an awesome cup of chai latte.

17.description: The place opened recently and it's an awesome location for Loyola students! Lots of great seating and nice atmosphere. Staff is friendly and the owner (who hangs out here a lot) is as well. Also super close to the Loyola redline stop, so very convenient to grab a coffee as you're coming/going to/from the area!

15.description: Needed coffee on the neighborhood & wasn't disappointed.  Great space for conversation, reading.  And gelato!

0.description: Newer joint. Quick service. Not very crowded for a Thur morning. Love all the philosopher art and the random james Dean portrait throw in. Great scone (from scratch?). Good americano, slightly, slightly bitter but classic, European roasted flavor

5.description: Went here on a Thursday around noon. Completely empty so no line to wait in! Received my coffee and usually i have to wait for it to cool but it was already luke warm- SCORE! No cream was out so the barista got some fresh stuff right from the fridge. Things really did work out well.

11.description: I love this place. Great atmosphere, clean, and welcoming.

8.description: I work near the university and every now and then we get tired of Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts. Sometimes we want something a little different, so we go to this location and sit, talk and eat. Their pastries are wonderful and I especially love the gelato, but the place is a little pricey.  I don.t go often, but when I do go, its worth it.

4.description: I had a bit of time to kill, and stopped in for a coffee, and it wasn't too bad.  Based on the no wifi, their iPad not having any battery power for a Belly check in (I mentioned it and I think she didn't understand), and the complete lack of customers, I wasn't all that impressed.  the coffee was hot and inexpensive, but that's really the highlight of my visit here.  Would I come back?? Probably not...

14.description: I stopped in to get some lunch on the go.  I had a chicken shwerma (sic) sandwich and a Mexican Mocha.  The sandwich was good.  Fairly consistent with what I have had at other places, and I was happy with that.  The Mexican Mocha was just mediocre.  To me it had a slight burnt taste compared with others that I have had.  Not something I really wanted.  And it all just seems overpriced.Atmosphere is about what I would expect in a coffee shop.  However, the layout just seems odd and most of the seating is window facing.  The rest is more centrally located.  Nothing really in corners except on table for large groups only.  I like little corner tables where I can watch others.  I don't want to watch people passing me by on the sidewalk.  It's sort of uncomfortable for me.  I feel like I'm in a zoo with people passing me by.  Needless to say, I won't eat-in here ever.I might return for the food as it's good.  Coffee and such...well, maybe I'll give it another try with something else like a zebra mocha maybe.

6.description: Espresso was good, gelato had slight freezer taste. Beware of aggressive owner who might make you feel uncomfortable (if you're like me). I won't go back. There are better options nearby.

58.description: So I had to try this place out seeing how I live right above it and I have to say that to my surprise I was completely dissatisfied. It was about  11pm somewhat towards the end of the night for this business, they were not busy at all. I came in for a simple slice to take home. I noticed to the right a woman cutting through a giant frozen dessert cake, I don't like sweets so while this information doesn't affect my meal it might yours, be afraid of frozen treats there never good. So the guy was nice I just want a slice of sausage to go that's it.  The guy open the door to warming unit and literally just looked at it for about 2 minutes. Don't know if he was confused what was sausage and what wasn't but honestly made me snicker. Get the piece l, wow 3.85$ this better be good. Nope terrible, luke warm at best. When I bit into it all the cheese just pulled off on the first bite cause it was congealed together, and the most dissapointing part was the crust. So hard that it was not eatible, and it cut my gums and made them bleed. I suggest you pass on this litte gem!

56.description: 2nd time here and I have to agree with Marcee and Maria. This place is fantastic!!! If there were 10 stars I would gladly give them! I thought the girl working the front was maybe the owners daughter or something because she really liked what she is doing. Customer service is very important these days, and she is perfect! Now.....on to the food! Being a regular "FOODIE" I go crazy for a good Philly, and this new concept really has the "BEST" I've ever had! Perfect amount of meat, and the the perfect size! You can seriously drop into a food-coma here! I can't wait until they open the bar. I see the beer taps ready to pour, but I don't think they have a license yet, but when they do forget about it!! Looks to me they will be a perfect place to eat!! Oh......I didn't mention the fry bar........OMFG!! It is fantastic!! I will be a LONG TIME customer here for sure. This place is really good!

29.description: We order delivery from Philly's Best at least once a month.  Since we eat Keto, we aren't able to try the full menu.  But, really, we don't have to to know the place is on point.  We definitely have our favorites.  The wings are really fantastic - the dipping sauce reminds us of ranch from a favorite college hangout in another city.  The wings are traditional bone-in, none of that namby pamby boneless breaded stuff.  But totally drenched in sauce but definitely not skimpy.  And the wings themselves are nice and meaty. My brother in law is from Philly, really appreciates the Tasty Kakes on the menu.  And you gotta love the outdoor patio for summer in our beautiful city!

42.description: Amazing pizza ! The workers there are all very friendly as well. We usually get half chicken half broccoli. I recently tried their "fry bar" that has over 30 toppings. I got gravy and diced chicken on my fries and it was phenomenal ! I just wish the restaurant wasn't so pricy so I could eat out here more often. I will be coming back to try their sandwiches though :) but as far as I know, their fries and pizza are both amazing.

23.description: I really wanna love Philly's best. As a matter of fact my boyfriend loves it. I m disappointed that I have to write this review. Today we ordered online for pick up. Got there to pick up then got home and the cheese basically exploded on my pretzels bites, don't understand why you would pack it like that and they forgot to give us my philly fries. I didn't make my boyfriend go back because parking is rough. The fresh cut fries that he got with his chicken Philly weren't good either, you can tell they haven't changed the oil. Tonight we used a $3 off coupon that we got from a previous order error on their behalf. Guess don't try their delivery/pickup option via their online ordering system. We usually have good service when we dine in. So disappointed, we'll be giving Philly's best a little break until they get their act together.

47.description: I had another delicious meal here last night! My family loves their Philly"s, we have been customers of the Evanston location for years and are so happy to have this right in our neighborhood!Last night I sampled the pizza(yum!) the broccoli bites (yum!) and the Bang Bang shrimp(Divine!!!). Our large group sat in the fireplace corner , it was cozy and comfy. the staff was super attentive and helpful as always.We'll be back, often!

8.description: How can you not love a place that sells pizza by the slice?  Great location in Roger's Park!  I'm a regular now and will most definitely remain one for this extremely comfortable Sports Bar!  Plenty of well placed TVs so no matter where you are you can always catch a game!  Great food and really tasty pizza...(try their amazing gyro pizza or veggie)!Staff here is extremely hospitable and very chill. Definitely gives off an inviting vibe.  Very friendly and makes your experience even better. And you wanna talk about comfortable??  There is a killer couched in spot at the back of corner of the restaurant. Sort of closed off so provides for nice privacy. THREE big screens in that corner and a working FIREPLACE. Personally, I could order grub and chill there all day! You all should definitely check out this gem of a spot. Great food, great prices great atmosphere and even better staff.  Definitely worthy of being an RP favorite!Mike

31.description: For you old timers, there once was a Friends episode where Joey was asked his favorite type of food, he said sandwiches.  I often feel the same.  Philly's Best makes an amazing sandwich.  That being said, the last two times I have ordered, items were missing from my order.  For $26 for 2 sandwiches and tip, I'd expect my free order of fries to come without having to call to notify them of the issue.  The previous time two drinks, a sandwich and chips were missing.  The first time I called, the manager did send the driver back out.  This time, I didn't bother with it.  To the owner:  You might want to have your manager check all orders prior to sending out your delivery person.  Its frustrating to your customers and a significant issue.  Too bad too, I would have given you a 5 for food quality.

34.description: Edit: I'm editing my review below because in the 24 hours between posting it and now, I was contacted by a PB manager to credit my order for the mistake. That has certainly never happened on any of my other reviews, so kudos for that! Also, my anger over my chicken tenders being plain resulted from my inability to distinguish between the tenders and the boneless wings, which won't happen again. It's a bit confusing on the menu, but the wings are tossed in sauce and the tenders are not. So, that one was my bad!For taking care of the customer, I will return when my next craving of buffalo chickeny goodness hits again. Thanks PB!----Argh.Look, I"m not one for greasy bar food - and if you are willing to travel out of RP (or even up to Grill Inn on Morse) you'll find better fare. But sometimes the proximity to my apartment and the greasy call of their buffalo sauce make me crave Philly's Best.It's a good place to catch games and, now that they have a liquor license, have a beer.However, their take out service leaves something to be desired. For instance: tonight I ordered boneless chicken tenders that are tossed and baked in their sauces. I requested the Buffalo sauce with ranch dressing to dip it in. For some reason, these greasy slices of chickeny goodness sounded awesome.
