Lo and behold my surprise when I got 1) plain chicken tenders with 2) BBQ sauce (not Buffalo) on the side and 3) Bleu Cheese, not Ranch. Was it fine? Yes. Did I eat it? Yes. Was it what I wanted, or what I even ordered? Nope. I mean, they got the very basics of the meal alright, but seriously, it was the exact opposite of what I ordered.

16.description: Great place! Having been a Rogers park resident for 2 years now... It's great to finally have a place like this. Full barHas 20 TVs Has a fire placeGreat open layout w/ lots of windows for daylightGreat foodVery nice ownerThe options in Roger park are slim. Coupled with limited places where you can sit and have a meal that isn't either Mexican, pizza, or Asian. This places is a great bridge to fill in that need.

13.description: I really wanna love Philly's best. As a matter of fact my boyfriend loves it. I m disappointed that I have to write this review. Today we ordered online for pick up. Got there to pick up then got home and the cheese basically exploded on my pretzels bites, don't understand why you would pack it like that and they forgot to give us my philly fries. I didn't make my boyfriend go back because parking is rough. The fresh cut fries that he got with his chicken Philly weren't good either, you can tell they haven't changed the oil. Tonight we used a $3 off coupon that we got from a previous order error on their behalf. Guess don't try their delivery/pickup option via their online ordering system. We usually have good service when we dine in. So disappointed, we'll be giving Philly's best a little break until they get their act together.

11.description: Stop for lunch today and had the Italian beef on garlic bread.Oh my gosh what a great Italian beef, best I've had in a long long time.more then a meal had to get half to go. the staff was great I asked for something to rap the rest of my sandwich, one of the guys took it from me and raped and put it in a bag. Thanks that's just over the top service..

39.description: Pizza by the slice should be quick, cheesy, hot and yummy. There was cheese and it was quick. I wish I could go back in time and stop myself.Learn from my mistake... don't get the pizza by the slice.

37.description: Came back here when we were hungry and didn't want to spend too much time waiting for food, and it was such a better experience than our first time here. The food was about the same, not the best food ever, but it's pretty good for a quick lunch/dinner. The biggest improvement was the people/service. There was a young lady at the counter who was so much friendlier and patient than the person we spoke to the first time. The food came out quicker, and they started offering fries instead of chips, which I'm a fan of because I think their fries are significantly better than their chips. We've really only had the Philly cheese steak and the cheeseburger. Both are pretty average overall, but for the neighborhood that doesn't have anything like it, it was great. I'm not certain I'll be a regular, but I'll definitely be back at least a few times since it's near by.

0.description: This is the restaurant that has forced my hand and made me get back to reviewing (Not that I had reviewed much in the first place). 1st IMPRESSION: Can hardly notice that anything is even open here at the corner of Sheridan and Pratt. Upon further attention, we can see that there are some window signs and even beer neons. Guessing it's a good fast-food joint with some "beer" (Miller, bud, etc). Well that's where the "meh" ends.INSIDE:To say that I was surprised upon walking in is an understatement. A wonderfully laid-out and spacious place with no shortage of t.v.s to wall-paper the almost-too-fancy-for-a-steak-sandwich-joint walls. The main eating area on the Sheridan side where there are plenty of table and booth seating but i head straight to the back on the Pratt side. A couch and comfy cushion chairs by a frickin' fireplace.  The atmosphere alone would bring me back here, assuming I would find something i found tasty (It is a fast-food joint after all, right?). Well... THE FOOD:The classic Philly Steak sandwich is as good as a steak sandwich can get which made it hard to try anything else but since It looks like i'll be coming here 2-4 times / week, I figured I'd try the Philly CHICKEN sandwich. I figured that if it's 75% as good as the steak, I would be happy. It turns out it's the best sandwich that I had ever had in my entire life and that's BEFORE adding any of the blue cheese sauce to it. I had never felt sorry for blue cheese in my life before this moment as blue cheese knows how tasty and loved it is.  But ... oh my goodness... I actually left off most of the cheese as the sandwich was so delicious and rich on it's own (can't possibly be health food).  8" Phillys are serves with Philly chips or very tasty fries. Unfortunately, there are too many fries served for my new Under-10,000-calorie/day lifestyle (I cut my teeth eating 2 burritos with 3 basket of chips per sitting back in the day at El Gallo De Oro on 63rd and St. Louis after closing out some bars). The fries are good enough to merit their own bar with a plethora (yep. I typed "plethora") of toppings. Speaking of bars...THE BAR:Yep. There's a bar on the way to the fireplace section. I'm on the couch having coffee and a pack of TastyKakes (Usually an east-coast-only item). Turning my head to the right , I can catch the end of the bar and see the bottles from the likes of Two Brothers, Bells, Great lakes, Sam Adams, Half Acre, and others. I do recall also having a fresh Revolution Anit-hero (beer was fresh, lines where clean) which I see is currently on tap along with Founders' breakfast stout, Gooses' Matilda, a couple handles I can't make out from here, and a few old standby's for those that like their beer the 90's way (Bud, Old Style, etc). I've been to proper BAR bars that don't have at least one stout or porter..The lack of outside signage is really a shame. I'm certain if it had more visibility that this place would do more business. All it takes is one visit. I'm tellin' ya. Can't wait to tear through the entire menu. PARKING: non-zone from 9:30am - 4:00pm on Pratt (looking at my car and open spots right now) Parking all morning till 4pm on Sheridan. Meter parking available as well. Was this a long-winded review or what? Sheesh. Okay now. Back to work.

38.description: Currently soaking in a hot bath sipping ginger root tea and trying to stop throwing up. I ordered the Buffalo chicken Philly and have an agonizing case of food poisoning... I'll be avoiding this place from now on...  I want to avoid feeling this miserable again if I can...

51.description: No atmosphere. Everyone working looks lost and unsure what type of restaurant they are in. The food is way too expensive.  Look inside anytime of the day and you will see more workers than customers.  When I ate there last night around 1030 pm on a Friday there was only one other costumer. The other locations are great. Listen to your customers. We want to like this place.  Increase your portion size (don't say it is the same size as the other locations because several reviewers will disagree with you), develop some sort of ambience that will invite us in. The place is so dark and dreary it always looks closed. Don't give semi rude responses if someone had a bad experience. Listen to what the customer is saying and learn to take constructive criticism. We want to give you our money but will take our money elsewhere if need be. Heat up the pizzas for us without having to ask (just like every other place I have had pizza from), and lastly and most importantly: teach your employees CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! The three times I've eaten there every worker looked at me while walking out the door without uttering a word. Even Applebee's tells it's patrons to have a nice day upon exit. Adieu!

27.description: The service is awful. The guys at the counter don't acknowledge you. They away while talking to other customers or between them. The pizza is cheap and blah... Just a place to have a beer. The sandwiches might be good, but that's it, if you eat bread...

32.description: If this is the same Philly's Best that was in Evanston, 2 thumbs down!!! I ordered the chicken Philly and a Caesar salad. Total was almost $24 with delivery. I had a coupon for $3 off but, they don't take it off until the food is delivered. And basically the delivery driver wants it back as a tip. This sandwich was so small, my 4 y.o. nephew would have demanded more. They're basically squeezing a sandwich into a hot dog roll.  Was supposed to be on garlic bread it wasn't. The salad was lettuce, Parmesan cheese and dressing. BLAND! Even the order taker was bland, almost like I was keeping her from something. Sorry guys, you get no more of my money.

54.description: This new outpost of the long established Belmont store is comfortable, casual, with great food, liquor and plenty of TV's to watch the game. I have two favorites, the stuffed pizza and the amazing burger bar. It is a must visit for any Rogers Parker wanting to go out to catch the game and have something tasty. It's the spot for someone look for a great stuffed pizza or a fantastic burger.

48.description: Philly's Best is a great addition to Rogers Park! I love the fry bar and it's the best philly I've had in the city. It has a laid back atmosphere. Good place to watch a game or get some work/studying done.

44.description: Sober me says this is fine for a quick bite and a pint... Drunk me says that everything is amazing and there's a fireplace where people bring me alcohol...This is definitely a post-party must if you are concerned about that hangover you're gona have if you don't eat before you go to bed.

24.description: My family and I have now had several items on their menu and I have to say I am thoroughly loving each one of them!

7.description: Oh great, now they're text spamming us even though we haven't ordered anything from them in more than a year. What the hell? Go away.

49.description: I was really looking forward to a new 'sports bar' as advertised being open in my neighborhood.   The owners should note that adding TVs all over the place does not make it so.  It's more like a sit down and bring your family restaurant,  not the place I would go to catch a game and have a few drinks.  Also note that no one served us, we had to go up and get our food and drinks, which is very un-sports-bar-like. However, the food was good and the lady taking was able to tell us several versions of how the Philly cheesesteak can be made.  There is a bar with alcohol, but off to the left and kinda hidden.  French fry bar looked interesting with all sorts of toppings to choose.

40.description: Disappointing buffalo wings.  Too expensive, and not really the taste I was hoping for.  No celery or carrots included with the order, despite a double order, and I'm not going to order from here again,

53.description: So it's my first time here and the food is amazing. I got the fry bar burger which allows you add all kinds of toppings (I got pulled pork and bacon). I also got the philly fries and chips. The philly fries are great because of the seasonings. My boyfriend got the philly cheese steak. It's made with garlic bread with mushrooms. He said it was pretty close to the Phillys he's had in Philly. Overall great atmosphere for watching the game , nice staff.

30.description: Been there twice, and seriously debated about bothering with a review. This will be long, so here is a summary:Food = 4 starsMenu = 3 starsService = 1 starAtmosphere = -3 stars4 + 3 + 1 + -3 = 5 divided by 4 = 1.25 rounds down to one star. there you have it.It is hard to tell what this place wants to be. Is it a lunchtime destination for a the business crowd (there isn't one in Rogers Park)? Is it a sports bar (not much sports)? Is it fast food place (too slow for that)? Is it a regular bar (no bartender)?It is hard tell, and therefore hard to judge. They may be succeeding when measured against their objectives, but I don't know what those are and don't really care. The place is always empty for a reason. When they close they will not be missed.=-=-=-=-=-=If you want more details keep reading. If you think I'm a blow hard; you are probably right, so go read another review.If you work for the restaurant and want to know how fix it; don't bother. Just close and let something interesting move into one of the better locations in the neighborhood.Let's start with the food: 4 starsMy cheese steak was good. Better than Pat's and Gino's in Philly, however (sorry Philly) those sandwiches aren't very good. Perhaps the best cheesesteak in the area, but not the best sandwich in the area; there are several better options to the north and south on Sheridan. Fries = Good. Better fries can be had west of the Red Line on Morse. For $10, they are pushing it. For only a few more dollars, I could be eating at real restaurant a few blocks away.The menu: 3 starsThe menu has a limited selection of "pre-defined" options. What is offered is good, but the process created by their menu is a pain in the arse. Instead, you are left with the ability to customize your culinary experience. This would be interesting, but proves to be cumbersome. Unless one is a regular, there is long period of time spent wading through a lengthy list of options prior to attempting to place an order.Options are good when interesting, but here we have a long list trivial variations. Why have 5 cheeses? If you know what makes the best cheesesteak sandwich, then suggest it with that. (perhaps it was 4 or 7, tough to tell because the menu was poorly formatted and tough to read). Then there is the fry bar with 35 optional toppings (priced by weight?). Fry bar? Why? I've never seen anyone bother with the effort. The sandwiches come with fries, so I am certainly not going to order more.The beer menu is not well planned. PBR. Some kind of generic "light" american lager (does it really matter which one?), 2 Brothers EPA (kinda light), something else light in flavor and color, and a Porter. Clearly not a menu planned by someone that cares about beer and has a desire to sell much of it.Service: 1 starHave to be careful here. The person that took my order was nice, but seemed to struggle as much as I did with the menu, couldn't really guide me through the process, and didn't have a suggestions. I don't really have any issues with that aspect of the service. It is what it is. All of the fast food restaurants within a mile have staff that are better at taking orders and moving transactions along that the staff here.The single star is for management and their offering. Perhaps more is deserved, as the restaurant roughly achieves it's service goal. The goal however appears to be to minimize staffing. I suspect that this will succeed, because it has a negative impact on service which appears to also minimize business.Place your order at the counter. Stand and wait (for 10 minutes on a slow day), or go find a seat? Not sure. Decided to sit.There is a place with a sign above it suggesting that there is "Booze here", however there is no bartender. Order your beer from the crack team at the counter.Atmosphere: -3 stars.A negative number, Is that allowed? Sure. The atmosphere seriously detracted from my experience.1. As mentioned above, there is a place labelled booze here, pretends to be a "bar". There is a counter (not a bar, a counter) with some stools in front of it. There is not a person working in this section, so all you are offering is a place with sigh above it.2. The chairs at the tables are non-padded, simple, wooden chairs. Fine for 20 - 30 minutes. I would never think about going there to watch a game.3. The "sports bar" does have several TVs. One a day with multiple baseball games, a NASCAR race, College Rugby 7s, golf, and more, we had: Tennis and a documentary on ESPN News that featured graphic pictures of the burns suffered by the subject prior to their road to recovery.The End.You may say, "It's about f'ing time". I may ask, "If you feel that way, why are you still reading this?".

46.description: I'm a local and just visited for the first time. Friendly server and owner, Mike. Never had a Philly steak b/4 but was tasty, not overwhelmingly seasoned and very generous portion. with chips.  Another local said the the chicken noodle soup was terrific and tasted "homemade". Bread also very good. This is a great place for a group gathering and owner said he's happy to work with larger groups and accommodate  same. There was a group of approx 35 guests having a great time while I was there. I'll go back as I can walk there. The price was right for food and drinks!

1.description: We are exclusive GrubHub customers of this restaurant, so cannot comment on the wait staff or the ambiance of the establishment.We love the food.  We have grown disenchanted with their terrible service.  We have had 2 orders in less than 2 months either up to 2 hours late or not delivered at all.  The first time, the manager on duty offered us a big "credit on file" and to just call.  When we called to use this credit, the manager was not there, and there was "no record of the credit."  Tonight, with the "lost"order (not delivered at all), they seemed not to care.The worst customer service I've seen in years.  Such a shame, because the food is actually good.

55.description: Great place! Having been a Rogers park resident for 2 years now... It's great to finally have a place like this. Full barHas 20 TVs Has a fire placeGreat open layout w/ lots of windows for daylightGreat foodVery nice ownerThe options in Roger park are slim. Coupled with limited places where you can sit and have a meal that isn't either Mexican, pizza, or Asian. This places is a great bridge to fill in that need.

9.description: I was excited that there was a new Loyola "sports bar" in the neighborhood! My first impression, however, is that this place is actually not really a bar. It felt more like a fast food restaurant with a lot of TVs, beer, and cafeteria trays.The customer service was also poor. First off, the cashier seemed disinterested and didn't even make eye-contact for several moments, as he was writing something down. Then he did not greet me with 'hello,' or 'welcome...,' but instead, his way of asking, 'how may I help you?' was with a blunt: "What's up?" I ordered a slice of pizza, which came out of a revolving display case under a heat lamp.The slice had three curled up, dry, pepperonis on it, the crust was hard, it was very greasy, and the cheese was off center when he peeled it away from the pizza, because the cheese had solidified. As I was dining-in, I guess I had expected it to be fresh--it wasn't. I was starving though, so I regretfully took it despite my better judgment.  I was only able to eat about half of it and then felt compelled to throw it away, and I left.The place was dirty and dead. Now I am literally in pain. My stomach is now hurting, and I'm running for the toilet from eating here. It's unlikely I will ever return.

26.description: originally we posted about some disappointing pizza we received early today and after leaving a review i was very pleased at the prompt response from phillys best and their effort to make our experience better. thank you! we really appreciate it and will be back for more. original review:we are frequent customers of phillys and we generally enjoy the food and keep coming back. today we ordered a 14' inch Philly cheese pizza for $20 to-go and after waiting at least 20 minutes for our food we were only able to eat a couple bites of the pizza due to the extremely greasy crust. there was a pool of grease on our plates and the bottom of the pizza was drenched in grease making it impossible to continue eating. we were really disappointed in the pizza but we. love the grinders sandwiches so we will still continue to support our neighborhood phillys best.

25.description: My son ordered a double cheeseburger from this place and they gave him a hamburger with 2 slices of cheese. Could go on with a litany of complaints but nuf said. Definitely skip this place.

12.description: This is probably my worst experience I ever had with a sports bar and I would never go there again. I would give zero stars if I could. The waiter wanted to take away our dish when we were not finished. And when they wanted to close up early, they don't even tell you, they just shut the TV you are watching right in front of you without even saying a word. This is just rude and impolite! You are a sports bar, people go there to watch games with friends and hang out, if you're gonna close the tv and shut down early, the least you can do is to tell your costumers so. At least now I know to never go back to this place. And for others that are considering going there, I sincerely suggest you go so where else.

59.description: First, the pros: the customer service is great, the space is great, and Rogers Park is in desperate need of a business to anchor this large corner space after so many failed attempts the last few years. Glad Philly's is in the neighborhood. The cons: after visiting the Belmont location for so many years I had some high expectations for getting a great cheesesteak here, but something is different. The sandwiches seem so much smaller and more expensive. The first time I ordered a cheese steak with mushrooms and was told it was over $11 I thought it had to be a mistake... and was further dismayed when I realized how tiny it was. The sandwiches (I've tried three now) are just not good enough to be worth it. If the price or portions change, I'll be back.

21.description: Don't order from here. Ordered food through grub hub. Came in missing items (my 3 year olds meal) and with replacements (on dessert items) without any notice that they were out of anything. I called grub hub to find out the procedure to get it fixed, they called Phillys and told them they were too busy and refused to provide a time for delivery to send it back out. Then I called them directly to find out the issue and they were rude, told me they don't force anyone to order from them and hung up on me. I paid for food I never got. Absolutely awful service. Do yourself a favor and just skip this place, honestly the food is greasy and not even worth it.Update: If I could give it zero stars I would. 2 attempts from grub hub and myself and they just didnt answer or just hung up on us and didnt send out the food. Grub hub refunded me for the missing items.

17.description: The location is beautiful and very spacious.  Unfortunately I took my meal to go so I couldn't really get the feel for the bar.  I enjoyed my sandwich to the fullest and taste exactly like the other locations.  The staff was extremely friendly and seemed eager to help . I will be back again and try the bar and give a bigger review.

10.description: I reached out to Philly's Best about helping to host a night out for football drafting, and the experience was absolutely astounding. The servers, Dan and John, were attentive and fun, and the entire experience was a delight.The decor is pretty par for the course for a bar, with a particular gem being the living room-esque section in the back with TVs, couches, and a fireplace (especially good during cold nights!), while the rest is standard tables and chairs for sitting and eating. The bar is not expansive, but it has beer, quick service, and really, REALLY decent prices.Finally, the food was phenomenally good! Like, look, if you want an actual, authentic Philadelphia cheesesteak in Chicago, THIS is where you go to get it. The bread is perfect, and the taste and presentation is spot on. Disclaimer: I lived in Philly for 10 years. I know my cheesesteaks. This is legit.As for the pizza? It's trash, but Philly eats trash pizza*, so it is an ENTIRELY authentic experience.*: Except Lorenzo's, Lorenzo's is legit, but it's also New York pizza, not Philly pizzaI'll be coming here for game nights this year, no doubt!

5.description: Don't order from here. Ordered food through grub hub. Came in missing items (my 3 year olds meal) and with replacements (on dessert items) without any notice that they were out of anything. I called grub hub to find out the procedure to get it fixed, they called Phillys and told them they were too busy and refused to provide a time for delivery to send it back out. Then I called them directly to find out the issue and they were rude, told me they don't force anyone to order from them and hung up on me. I paid for food I never got. Absolutely awful service. Do yourself a favor and just skip this place, honestly the food is greasy and not even worth it.Update: If I could give it zero stars I would. 2 attempts from grub hub and myself and they just didnt answer or just hung up on us and didnt send out the food. Grub hub refunded me for the missing items.

3.description: I wish I could like this place more than I do, but for whatever reason I keep coming back. I think it's the fries. Ok, it's definitely the fries.I've never eaten in the place, or gotten booze. It's always been take out for me. They're pretty slow. I recently discovered that through Eat24, you can order online (because calling on the phone is so 2006) and that's better than waiting in the uncomfortable tables while they take 10-15 minutes for a simple order. I couldn't imagine watching a whole game there.DO NOT get the chicken tenders. They are thin and whatever the opposite of juicy is. They are greasy. I didn't even know this was possible, but they soak the bag with grease. Does that happen by leaving them in the fryer too long? Is that why it always takes forever for my order?But the next level cheese fries, man. Bacon and cheese and sour cream. Yeah, that's why I keep going back.

35.description: 2 stars for the food. Food was decent but yet expensive. Service, forget about it. One of the most ridiculous and slow services that I have ever experienced. I don't know if I would ever recommend this place to anyone. And knowing how many of good places have come and gone at this location, I doubt if this place, given its pathetic service, would sustain at all. Tldr: make it your last option.

19.description: Best Philly in this area. A bit pricey but worth it.  They also have philly pizza! One downside is the stupid charge for refills on drinks. Definitely worth eating here.

28.description: i'm sure they have decent food for normal meals but unfortunately i swung in to just grab a slice on my way to the lake front and was unimpressed.  it was not the worst pizza i've ever had but the crust was really hard and boring.  i will give them another chance when i'm back in chicago as i stay just around the corner but for now that was sadly the only impression i was left with.

45.description: Nice ambience, chilled beer, delicious food, gracious waiters and a whole lot of fun. This is the best place to hang out with friends on a chilly Chicago weekend. It warms you up nice with a fireplace no less. I love this place.

33.description: Great food and the employees are super cool!

43.description: I've gone to Philly's best twice now. Each time I have left full...almost painfully full in all the good ways. The chicken Montreal was incredible; it was flavorful and the chicken was cooked very well! It did take a bit of time to get the food though, and the room is so large I had no idea if/when the food was ready. It might be good to invest in a pager system?  Beyond that, it's certainly work dropping in and giving it a try!

2.description: I have stopped into their Lakeview location before and recently realized that they now have a location on Sheridan.  This may cause in increase to my waist size as I enjoy their sandwiches and no longer need to leave my home to get one.I am a traditionalist so I get the cheese-steak with onions and cheese whiz...there is no other way to get it.  Most (possibly all) sandwiches comes with fries and a drink.  Delivery is quick, they consistently identify a 45 minute time frame but are often much quicker.

18.description: 2 stars for the food. Food was decent but yet expensive. Service, forget about it. One of the most ridiculous and slow services that I have ever experienced. I don't know if I would ever recommend this place to anyone. And knowing how many of good places have come and gone at this location, I doubt if this place, given its pathetic service, would sustain at all. Tldr: make it your last option.

41.description: We just ate here for the Packers-Seahawks game with a group of 9 of us and we were thoroughly impressed! The philly cheese on a garlic bun was delicious! Cheese fries and pretzel bites were some of the best I've had. The service was great. They kept bringing us drinks and free chips, clearing our tables, asking if we needed anything, etc. Buckets of 6 Miller Lites were only $14. We also sat in the back where there were couches and lounge chairs-it was perfect, comfortable like your own home with great grub. We all left stuffed and happy. I don't really have any complaints. The philly could have used a bit more melted cheese, and like most places, you will leave smelling like a restaurant/food if you're in there a while like we all were, but that's about it. We plan to check out their Super Bowl special since we had such a great experience! Highly recommend!

52.description: First time at Philly's Best Sports Bar. I had the Chicken Philly BLT. Was sure a delectable and yummy - flavors seasoning cheese all well blends together nicely. Portion size along with side of fries perfect. Not to Big or not too small just right is Goldilocks would say.

50.description: I thought the Philly cheese steak was really delicious. Fries were great. Had good beer. Lots of TVs. Solid.

4.description: I was new to this resturant but Hikmet and Dan hooked me up with an awesome meal! The food is amazing and the service was awesome! I was happy with their IPA selection which rarely happens in most resterantsts!

6.description: Good Philly cheese steak. Very greasy. Might come back here in the future. Fries are okay, a little too soggy.

22.description: Greasy and cold food , terrible cooks who can serve appetizers first and hot. Got served everything cold , Didnt enjoy it at all. I would like money back wasted $35.00 for this .

15.description: The food's okay, solid grinders.  I'm not sure that the bread shipped in from Philadelphia is really worth the trouble, but a schtick is a schtick.  On a lovely April night, after 10 pm, I have the choice of listening to the game or closing my windows and missing out on the fresh air.  My apartment is a short distance from the restaurant and more than five stories up.  Nevertheless, I can hear every word the sports announcer is saying, so that is one heck of a loud television they have.  (I phoned and politely asked that the volume be lowered.  They turned it down a bit, but I can still hear the announcer quite clearly.)  The following November:  I stopped in, ravenous, because I'd been at an event and hadn't had lunch.  I asked if they could add some fresh spinach to my sandwich.  No problem!  Opened the sandwich when I got home: chunks of frozen spinach -- not thawed -- on a sloppy mess.

57.description: I was excited to see this place open because I live right down the street and I have been working in restaurants the last 7-8 years. The first time I went was about three weeks ago and I ordered fries from the fry bar and the Cobb salad. I love Cobb salads, and when I was eating it I thought the eggs tasted kindof funky and my boyfriend even said they looked a little weird. Well the next day I got sick and was actually sick the entire day, and also the fries were extremely undercooked, pretty much raw. I decided to give them a second chance and got a grilled chicken sandwich which wasn't that bad (but it took only 2 minutes for me to get it so I thought that was a little strange because it was so fast) and I went for the third time tonight and got a salad to go and it had been sitting on the counter when it was finished for about five minutes and there were three people behind the counter on their phones/not doing anything while it was sitting there so I just grabbed it without a bag/salad dressing because I just wanted to get out of there. I'm sad that this place is so horrible and I will definitely not be returning now. Oh and they microwave all their chicken in a plastic bag. Yuck

20.description: This place is GREAT!!!  I'm not so wild about how the food comes when it is delivered, but when you have it there, it is great.  This location is a big upgrade from their old places, nice interior, couches, pool table, liquor, TVs, etc.....  It is quite a bit different than the old place in Evanston.  The food is still the same, which means good, but now it is actually a nice place to go.

36.description: So I came here a few months ago for wings and it was a disaster. So since I'm a culinary student I like to try many different things. So decided to give this place another chance yesterday. I walked in with only two people sitting down eating. I started to look at the menu waiting for someone to come to the register. I see this guy texting on his phone not paying any attention to me. I stood there for about 5-10 min waiting and he kept playing with his phone. I just ended up walking out and going to the place next door. I won't be going back to this place anymore.

14.description: Been there twice, and seriously debated about bothering with a review. This will be long, so here is a summary:Food = 4 starsMenu = 3 starsService = 1 starAtmosphere = -3 stars4 + 3 + 1 + -3 = 5 divided by 4 = 1.25 rounds down to one star. there you have it.It is hard to tell what this place wants to be. Is it a lunchtime destination for a the business crowd (there isn't one in Rogers Park)? Is it a sports bar (not much sports)? Is it fast food place (too slow for that)? I may ask, "If you feel that way, why are you still reading this?".

58.description: Tried it, but I'll never be desperate enough to return! There's not anything special or pleasant about this crowded strip-mall nail parlor with outdated artwork & a long wait!Acrylic nail fumes almost made me sick! I just crossed my fingers and prayed that I wouldn't get a fungal infection from their tools (luckily I didn't)...Afterward, I ran from the shop, never to return!

56.description: This is a hidden treasure. In a strip mall, tucked between a Subway and a Peruvian restaurant, I had never seen this salon before. I was in a time crunch and decided to try it. Based on the name, I thought it wouldn't be as pleasant of an experience as I had- proving once again not to judge a book by its' cover.  The place is clean, the staff was very friendly and there was no wait! My full set of gels and a pedi took just about an hour to get done and completely dry.

29.description: I have been coming to this nail salon for over a year. I am displeased with the OWNER Chris. Chris is very rude to his clientele, talks to customers in a condescending tone, nonchalant and not appreciative for the tips he receives. I disregarded this behavior for a year because of the designs I brought in he was able to create them. BUT NO ONE DESERVES to be treated the way he  treats his clientele. As of March 22,2014, I will no longer go to Chris. I think he needs an anger management course as well as a business course to improve himself. I recommend you do not go to this salon. If your spending your money, you deserve to be treated with great customer service and unfortunately this is not the nail shopsincerely,FED-UP-CUSTOMER

42.description: Very disappointed. I come here every week faithfully since I moved to RP. Yesterday I brought my boyfriend in for a mani and I got a gel refill. We left. Next day my nail broke and my girlfriend wanted a full set. I brought her with me cause she treated me to a pedi. The manager and nail tech were very nasty and rude. Made me pay to fix and refused to polish my nails from the previous day. They are nothing special here. Take your $ else where. I recommend Top Nails on Milwaukee ask for Cathy. These guys here are jerks and no nothing about customer service or value. $ hungry and will tax extra for everything!!!

23.description: Love this place!! I've been looking for a new salon to go to and this one is definitely it. Great atmosphere, huge tv, lots of colors to pick from, and a really friendly staff. On top of everything, their prices are really reasonable. Its typically busier during the day, so I like to go in the evening around 7 so it is not as hectic. I would definitely recommend this nail salon to anyone in a heartbeat!

47.description: There are now TVs in 3 locations, good addition!

8.description: I have been going here for years!  Owners are very nice, and recognize their repeat customers.  Best mani/pedi in the city for $30.  The pedi lasts FOREVER - I'm talking 3-4 weeks no chips, etc. This is a regular pedicure, not gel or anything else.  Regular mani usually looks great 5-7 days.   I have been getting gel manis lately, and they do a great job with that also.   If you are looking to get a great, long-lasting and professional-looking mani or pedi, I'd highly recommend.

31.description: This place was really sketchy! Although they have cheaper prices than other big spas, they add $2 charges for EVERYTHING (even things that aren't on the menu of services). When I questioned it, the man at the counter got RUDE. I will NOT be returning, and I urge you all to spend the $5 more up front somewhere else and enjoy!!

34.description: Must go see Anne.

16.description: Overall great spot to get your nails done. The nail techs were friendly, I was greeted when I walked in, and there's a nice selection of colors.  The price is decent and I didn't have a long wait time. I think that the place is clean but I didn't see them wash the bowl after my pedicure.  I would go back to this place though and recommend it to friends.

13.description: Visiting from out of town, three of us searched Yelp to find a nail salon near us in Rogers Park and found Princess. We called and made a reservation for three manicures. When we arrived, three empty chairs were waiting for us (with other patrons in the waiting area). I liked that they respected our reservation and didn't give our seats away to walk-ins. All three of us got wonderful, complete manicures with cuticle treatments...for only $12 apiece. I was in shock. That would have been $20 easy at home on Main Line Philadelphia.  Several big tvs keep customers occupied but other than that, you'll find few frills at Princess: there are no offers of tea or coffee or sneak attack wimpy neck/upper back rubs that always seem creepy and feel like extortion for even more tips.  Another bonus: a parking lot, much appreciated in a neighborhood where street parking is in short supply.

11.description: So I'm here the day b4 Thanksgiving for me and my daughter to get her nails done...we were told it would be a hour wait....no problem bcz it's the day b4 the Holiday. ..we both are told to go to nail stands and wait bcz we were next...well after an hour and half the nail artist that sits next to the owner nail bar two...tells my daughter she needs to move to take someone else...clearly racist I believe...it is for a white woman....it have always came here and tip very well....but this is the second time with princess nails with poor management and unprofessionalism.....PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE. ...THE SERVICE IS REALLY BAD ....the entire practice with the exception of ICE is terrible and need to ta k e a class on etiquette.

39.description: I love the fact that this place is literally down the alley from where I live. On weekdays after work I'll throw on my comfy clothes and a pair of flip-flops and walk on over for a pedicure. I love the message chairs. They actually work deep and make my back feel amazing. The nail technicians are very good with my short nails and weird pinky toes that I inherited from my mom. I don't have a favorite nail technician but I can recommend both the gals and guys. Prices are awesome.

37.description: Perfect neighborhood nail shop.  Newly renovated and clean.    $20 for a very good pedicure.   They even have free parking.   For me, this is perfect.

0.description: Chris did a fantastic job on my acrylic fill, and only charged me $17! He took his time and made sure the shape and length was what I wanted. You can tell he really knows what he is doing. The atmosphere was nice too, I don't know what other people were saying about it being dirty, it wasn't dirty at all. The customer service seemed fine too, perfectly polite. I am glad to have found a good, inexpensive, quality nail shop close to my house. Also there is TONS of free parking right outside. I will definitely be back!

38.description: If you're looking for a nail salon that can accommodate walk ins, then Princess Nails is standard.I recently went in for a mani/pedi ($30+ tax). There was a long wait (I was a walk in so not a big deal) but the staff did check in with me a couple times to let me know about how much longer it would be, which I appreciated.  The salon is not dirty, but not overly clean either (e.g. the carpet is pretty worn down, there are nail clippings in some places). I could see the waxing room from where I was sitting, which is fine, except that I could also see the person in the waxing room! Thankfully, nothing too personal was being waxed (phew!).The day I went in was very busy, and you could tell the staff were trying to get through people quickly. The leg and arm rub part of the mani/pedis was basically skipped over. The the polish job was alright, though. I asked for a cute but simple design and they definitely gave me something I was excited to wear out! I did not get a no-chip and it was chipping by the next day, however.In all, it's a place I will go to when I want a last minute pedicure, etc. without spending a lot of money (especially on Sunday when it's harder to find a place in this area that's open). If you're looking for a place to sit and feel relaxed, then I would recommend finding a different nail salon.

51.description: I have gone here to do my eyebrows and every time I have gone here, it's been very good customer service. Friendly environment and fast! Most importantly, my eyebrows have always looked amazing!

27.description: Very clean, friendly, affordable & great color choices. The space has been by the owners as well. Can't beat a spa pedi in a massage chair.

32.description: Ok I buckled down and went back. The guy who did my nails the first time is no longer there. which was smart on their part. I go to two ladies now, One of them is pregnant  and super awesome and other one has this cool necklace that she wears all the time (i haven't asked their name as I am deaf and can't hear through their mask) they do a good job..

54.description: I have no idea what Erin S. was smoking the day she wrote her review - but I can assure you that this place is good, cheap, fast and did not smell of any acrylic fumes whatsoever.  My only 'complaint' is that...hmmm..there's still Christmas decorations still up?  I dunno - don't really care.Pulled in around 5.15 on a Wednesday night and there were a few ladies getting pedicures.  I walked in, she asked what I wanted, told me to pick a color and have a seat in the chair.  No wait whatsoever and a decent amount of CURRENT color selections, as well as classic staples and airbrushing services.  Pricing was VERY cheap - $20 for a GOOD pedicure and $30 for a full set of gels ($20 for acrylic and no-chip is only $35! Working my way towards that..come on nails!!!).  I was more than satisfied with the work they gave for the price and everyone was very friendly and kept the speaking in their native tongue to a very bare minimum..  Am I the only one who finds that to be a reason to not go back to a nail salon?  I get very uncomfortable when 5 people are talking to each other while looking and giggling at customers and no one but them can understand what's going on.  Anyway; I digress...It's CLEARLY a no frills nail salon, a little 'low rent' if you please, but that's right up my alley.  You won't be getting a mimosa during your pedicure, no back rub with a hot stone while your nails are drying, no baby talk to your overpriced teacup Yorkie - GOOD.  I don't need to pay for that kinda crap when all I want is a good job for a good price. Princess Nails is just right for me.  Have fun at your fancy all day, taking forever spas, I'll be in and out at Princess.

48.description: This is my go to place for pedicures.  The price for a pedicure is very reasonable and the service is good.  Everybody there is very nice and they always have something good to watch on the TV.

44.description: I yelped before coming here, it had great reviews so I decided to try it. Over all they are ok. I walked in and it smelled like if they had smoked in the salon so the fumes where real strong. I did get attended right away. As I sat down the tub was filling up which I noticed had bugs in it. she had to drain it and clean it (she drained it, splashed water and bugs when down the drain)Service was done in a rush. But a thumbs up on not cutting me at all.Service was $20 so I can't complain job was done.

24.description: I've been here twice over the last month (just because of the convenient location), and I wold have to say, I would avoid this place at ALL Costs. The first time I went, it was an OK experience. I got a simple french manicure and just a quick toe polish change. The woman who helped me, literally didn't say a sentence to me at all. She was very quick, and hurt my cuticles a little bit. What ever- everyone is entitled to a bad day- and the nails came out OK, so who was I to complain? The second time I went- that was absolutely terrible. On the bright side- I was seated right away. and the woman (same woman from last time), sat across from me, and began texting on her phone. I mean literally for 6 minutes. She was even laughing at the text messages. OK- enough was enough. I grabbed my purse, and said I was leaving. Only then did she look up and said, "What?" Go to this place at your own discretion. Very unprofessional.

7.description: Chris has been doing my nails for over 10 years I tell you he is the best .... I recommend this place to everybody that like spoiling there self and having a relaxing time.... My gel nails last forever I love this place  Chris always listen to everything you want done to your nails his awesome

49.description: This is a badly decorated, low frills nail salon - but the prices are great and the quality of work is top notch.  I get my gel nails done here and I get compliments all the time!  I don't do pedicures there so I have no info on that, but as far gel nails go they can't be beat!

40.description: Never been treated so rudely before in my life. And I've worked in customer's service jobs for 6 years. Apparently you shouldn't go there if your No Chip Manicure chips, unless you'd like to get reemed out by their male employee because he says, you're nail broke, it didnt chip. He looked so angry the whole time, and made me search through the white no chip bottles to find the color they had used on me. "Nothing lasts forever!" he yelled at me because he said it broke, and that I, "changed stories" of how I said it'd happened. When I told him I wasn't complaining, it was a good job, but when they file my nails rougly with a rough file, they break after a couple dails of getting them done. I said I was a customer. He said it didn't matter if I was a customer or not and told me never to come there again. I wasn't even rude I just was nervous and didn't explain what had happened well at first.  I left crying, it was mortifying and he was so mean.

53.description: I passed Princess Nails on many occasions and finally went there on a desperate occasion when everything else was closing and could not take myself and my two friends that were with me. Since that day I went back to Princess Nails several more times and saw that same thing each time. Finally I thought enough is enough, I am not going back!  As other reviewers have noted the decor reminds me of the first nail shops that opened in the 90's, but I don't care about that. What keeps me from coming back is the fact that every time I have been there none of the nail technicians have every properly sanitized the pedicure basins. After each customer each technician runs water in the basin, scrubs the foot file with a brush, rinses the file, and swishes water around in the basin. That is it! I am sure thatt their sanitation practices are against the law. I don't think the nail techs are educated about the importance of proper sanitation. A cheap mani/pedi is not worth food fungus!

30.description: One of the few nail salons, at least that I've found, that does gel and acrylic nails. Not gel polish, gel nails, with the filling. They do a good job and my nails always look cute. I don't ask for things such as nail art so I wouldn't be able to comment on that. However I am the queen of messing up my nails while waiting for them to dry - they've always been good with fixing them when I bump them against something. Acrylics are $20, gel nails are $30, refills are $14. They do waxing as well but I'm too scared to let anyone touch my eyebrows.

46.description: Awesome pedicure!!!! Great price. Only $20.00. It's located in a strip mall so the parking is easy and convenient too.

1.description: Pros: The technician named ICE and fair prices.Cons: Unsanitary-BEWARE OF POSSIBLE FUNGUS CONTAMINATION, they do not sanitize properly!!! Rude service esp the male manager/maybe owner. I've only witnessed it but it was noted to self. Any day it could of have been me as luck of the draw. Just isn't worth it.

55.description: I am a dedicated customer to Princess Nails. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because the decor is horrible, but who cares if they give great service. Everyone who has served me there has been a nail technician for 5+ years, and anyone who gets acrylic sets knows that it's better to go to a slightly dingy place with experienced technicians then a trendy spot with people that don't know what they're doing. Princess Nails does get crowded on the weekends, especially Friday evening. I recommend going on a weekday. They're open late.

9.description: I was worried about all of the bad reviews but this is my third time here in 3 months. I'm always one that likes to give the benefit of the doubt.glad I did. I'm thinking there may have been some cultural differences with some folks. Get over it. They do good work.

26.description: horrrrible! mean workers

25.description: Horribly insane!!!!!Needs zero stars!!!!!i will no longer ever recommend princess nailsi I had before! I will never go here ever again, and it is a relief!!!!!!!More details to come after i make up for the wasted time and frustration that is princess nails!!!!!Pay attention to all the reviews on here that report that the owner(s) are extremely rude and horrible if you come in with a chip on a no-chip mani!!!! Also, pay attention when reviews say that they have horrible customer service and they are mean jerks. Also, pay attention to when a review says the owner yells at people (for example, for parking in his lot when it is early in the morning and ALL spots are VACANT, calling the person a cheap a**! How's that for a non-existent "zen" atmosphere; I have witnessed this happen more than once, so you KNOW it happens all the time then)!!! Also, pay attention to the reviews that report the horrible fumes. It is so overwhelming, it gives you an immediate headache the split second you walk through the door. it hits you like a BRICK WALL. it is even bad at 9:30 am when they open, even if you are the first and only customer because there is no ventilation so it still reeks from the day before and the day before that!Message to the owners: if you HATE your life THAT much, then do something about it! Do not take it out on others and run a horribly rude business that SHOWS you do not care about other human beings and that you are very unfeeling and SELFISH!

12.description: I thought since I came here b4 for a pedi then I could depend on this place. Went in today to get a Gel Full Set ... I wanted designs, stones, stiletto nails..(the works! Lol) I asked the guy doing my nails if he could show me the stones and if he does designs..he said didn't do the designs I wanted(but the ones he showed me weren't different from the picture I showed him((whatever))..(ignored my request to see the stones) I said ok, bc If he doesn't know how to do the designs I want, then he doesn't know how to do it and I wasn't about to wait for someone else to become available.& plus I don't mind a clean cut look.... (That should have been my cue to go elsewhere, but with so many nail shops in Chicago I opted for a familiar one)I told him I wanted my nails sharp(stiletto).. He said ok and said its a $5 charge. I wasn't expecting that but I obliged..I wanted to keep them pretty long, he said the length was another $5 charge...wasn't expecting that either so I just asked him to cut them shorter bc I didn't want to pay an extra $5 and I still wanted stones on my nails, so that unexpected charge wasn't in my budget. He shows me the stones (AFTER he cut my nails) and they didn't have any of the ones I wanted. That sucked bc I could have kept my nails long and at least partially have my nails look the way I wanted them to. My ankle is broken so it's pretty difficult for me to maneuver tight spaces, but he still asked me to get up and go wash my hands...he could have brought me a bowl....he was really annoying me bc I felt like he was rushing me and didn't care if he did a good job on my nails. When I come back from washing my hands he's doing someone else's nails... Why are you multitasking !? You're sucking at the ONE thing you have to do. The end result was a crappy full set with some sharp nails and some rounded nails, all of which are very short and very very disappointing.. I was worried about going to a new nail shop and them butchering my nails.. How Ironic

59.description: I would only suggest this if you live in the area and are in desperate need of a manicure.  The price is reasonable and the staff is very friendly, but they don't have a lot of newer colors and the smell of nail polish fumes is almost overpowering.

21.description: This nail salon I decided to give a chance. However when I walked in I was not greeted and a guy came to me and just asked "what do you want?"That was sign number one that I should've left. I sat down for a fill in which is very simple. He was extremely ruff with the file, which caused me to bleed a little. I let him know to be more careful and he just looked up and said "yeah yeah yeah". At this point I was extremely annoyed and in pain I paid for the fill in and never set foot back in this shop.

17.description: Unbelievable! Walked in the door and was barely acknowledged. Then we were sat down for a pedicure and left alone for 20 minutes. We decided to leave and asked for a towel to dry our feet off. A woman handed us a towel silently and no one spoke to us at all. Maybe we are ghosts? Never again EVER.

10.description: I really enjoyed my experience here. I have my usual spot, but they are closed on Mondays. So luckily that forced me to venture and try a new spot. I came here, due to reviews and convenience, and I'd have to say I am very pleased. The girl I had was very detailed and seemed to me a slight 'perfectionist' which I LOVE. I only got a pedicure today, although I'm sure the nails are done just as good. They are cheap, 20$ for a pedicure and I got a freehand design, which she did such a great job and was fast, for only 5$ extra. I definitely recommend this place. No wait and tons of space and spots. That's one downfall to my usual spot, only a few chairs and tables, so there can be a wait. Not here! Walk ins welcome and they do a good job at a good pace.

5.description: So I was just here to get my nails done for my birthday. Then one of the ladies who work there (but wasn't even doing my nails!!!) bitched at me infront of everyone because I asked my nail lady to remove the fuzz that I could clearly see on my nail. She was sarcastic, I said "I'm paying a lot for these" (college student) and she's like "seriously? 25 dollars is a lot for you? That's not worth the amount of our time you wasted." Um excuse me?? Honestly ruined my mood for the rest of my day. I still see fuzz on my nail & I even tipped the girl and everything-- I'm just so pissed off. I would never treat a customer that way. All I wanted was some pretty perfect nails otherwise I could've just done them myself. She was arguing back and forth with me I ended up walking out in tears. So yeah their customer service sucks. If you want an unfriendly, unprofessional nail experience, go here!!

3.description: This nail salon I decided to give a chance. However when I walked in I was not greeted and a guy came to me and just asked "what do you want?"That was sign number one that I should've left. I sat down for a fill in which is very simple. He was extremely ruff with the file, which caused me to bleed a little. I let him know to be more careful and he just looked up and said "yeah yeah yeah". At this point I was extremely annoyed and in pain I paid for the fill in and never set foot back in this shop.

35.description: Cheap, quick service. They did an awesome job with eyebrow waxing and mani/pedi. I live in the West Loop and get my nails done when I visit the BF in Rogers Park. Check this place out! you wont be disappointed.

19.description: So uv been living on the northside for 3 years and have been coming to this salon for 2.. At first the service and quality was great however within the last 6 months I am disgusted that I have been giving them my money... I went on Thursday for a fill in on yesterday (Friday) my nail broke in half.. I went in today first thing Saturday morning to get it fixed and was told I would have to pay the three dollars.. I explained I was just in here and all she could keep saying is that a fill in only covers the bottom of the nail.. I asked why the rest of my nails were in good condition.. I asked if every time I get my nails done I should I get a full set yet she said no.. I will not ever come back here!! I used them for all my services: nails, toes, and waxing however I would rather give my money to a shop who appreciates their clients!! HORRIBLE SERVICE!!

28.description: Very great service. I walked in on a Saturday it was people in every chair but I only waited 3 min. Nice color selection. Polite staff. A tv at the drying station. Fill in took less than an hr. I would def return and recommend.

45.description: WOW! First off I've NEVER taken part in writing Yelp reviews. I refer to Yelp almost on a daily basis to get ideas of great places since I'm newer to the area. I wasn't sure about Princess Nails due to only 18 reviews and some of them not so great. I called in the day before I made my appointment and was pleasantly surprised by the gentleman I spoke with. He was extremely knowledgable and took his time talking to me regarding the service I was looking for, which was acrylic nails. Going in this morning I was still skeptical on what I would walk out with...AND I walked out with by far the best set of acrylics I've ever had!! Chris is his name and he knows what he's doing and is willing to listen to you and will do what YOU want. He has an eye for it!! If you are having a hard time finding a nail specialist give Chris a shot. I'm extremely picky and a perfectionist on top of it and I couldn't be happier to find him!! As others have mentioned, it's not a pretty place BUT it is clean....and great prices!!  :)  I used to pay $35-$40 back in California for what I thought was a good job at a topnotch trendy place. I paid $20 today for a set of acrylics! Given the choice between that place if it were here and Princess Nails....no hesitation Princess Nails it is!!

33.description: Good prices and 90% of the time you will be getting quality service!I was just about to give them 5 starts, and then I realized the quality of work drops a bit if you get  there during a rush. They do the service too quickly, and you might end up with uneven shaped nails. Otherwise they do pretty good work.Even compared to fancier salons in Lakeview for example.Princess Nails no chip manicure, lasts at least 3 weeks. A bargain.I think the trick is, just get to know your manicurist, get their name, and stick with them.

43.description: I was a first-time walk-in to Princess Nails last week for a pedicure. Place was busy but I was waited on right away. Picked out my colors and 25 minutes later was all finished. The other reviews are correct in that this is definitely no frills but the staff was friendly, everything was clean and they had the Olympics on their 3 TVs!! Great Rogers Park establishment.

2.description: I have to say that PN is very pleasant, consistent and clean. I've been going for years and always happy with results. I get Mani with no chip, pedi and wax. The best. Won't go anywhere else.

18.description: Awesome I love this place!! Exactly what I wanted !! Will drive the 65 miles to have my nails done!!!

41.description: Being from out of town, I am very weary when I have to get my nails done at a place other than my regular spot. However, I had a great experience here. I arrived 15 prior to my appointment, but they took me right away. The selection of polish is impressive. The lady who did my nails didn't speak a word to me. That's okay. I was watching the news anyway. I came to get my nails done, not make friends. She did make very small talk towards the end. The only reason I did not give this place five stars is because they quoted me $14 for a fill over the phone and then was charged $17. Oh well. Not a big deal. If this place is around for my next years visit home to Chicago, I will definitely stop by for a fill.

52.description: After reading some of the crappy reviews, I had to put my two cents in!! I have been going to Princess Nails for 8 years. I even moved to West Town and still make the hike up north. Hands down they are the best nail place ever. The decor is not the best, but that is not what you are there for. The pedicures are only  20 . I have gone to other places that charge 35 and it is just not the same. I have acrylic nails and I am super picky. I always go to Chris. You will have to wait at times, but worth it. I have NEVER had any feet or nail problems.  The weekends are nuts, make an appointment or go during the week.

50.description: Been going to Princess Nails on a regular basis for about 2 yrs now. Nice polish color selection and they always have good movies on the big flat screen TV.I get my nails done by Chris. An acrylic overlay. When I first started going there, I had fake nails. Now my nails have grown long enough that I just get the overlay. I notice that whenever I get my nails done by someone else besides Chris - either another nail shop or just another manicurist - I get chips on my nails within a week. Yes, I'm rough on my nails. And Chris knows this and applies a thicker overlay on my right hand. (I'm right handed, these nails tend to chip first) He also gets a little offended when he notices I've been to another shop. Everyone is so nice there. And they keep it pretty clean too.

4.description: Today was my first time coming here! I thought the customer service was great. They also do quality work on your nails. They have a large selection of No chip colors and mood changing colors. Prices are also pretty good. I think I have found my permanent nail salon here in Chicago!!!

6.description: Worse service ever. Rudest staff ever. All they do is change prices as they feel each visit for the same thing. One day you pay $25 for a no-chip. Next time $30, and the next $45. Same exact thing done each time- no extras. And if you call to complain about anything that happened there, they don't want to hear it. They will hang up the phone on you and not answer if you try to call back. They had plucked my cuticle off with the cuticle cutter once. For that reason, I asked for a discount and they did not honor my request to have a discount. I was in pain for three good weeks. Couldn't effectively use my hand even with a band-aid on. They don't care about any of the customers all they care about is getting money.DON'T GO THERE!!!!!!!!!!

22.description: Horrible customer service!! As I was waiting to be seated, a mother came in to pay for her daughters manicure, pedicure, and eyebrow waxing; she handed the manager the money in his hand and he disrespectfully threw her change on the counter. When she asked for the money to be placed in her hand, he yelled and told her NO and demanded her to get out. He looked at me as if 'what was her problem', and as I disagreed with his actions, he then yelled at me and stated I could leave as well. I placed my polish down and left. Being new to the area, I would NEVER return to do business with them especially if that is how they treat paying customers.

15.description: This place is amazing every time I've been I've never had to wait for too long and my nails always come out amazing   I recommend this to everyone !

57.description: I started going to this place because I live less than a block away.  Service is great ... it can get pretty busy on weeknights but they manage to get everyone in and out within a reasonable amount of time.  Prices are GREAT!  I've gotten pedicures and waxing done here and both services have been good to great.  One recommendation - don't let one of the guys do the eyebrow waxing.  I don't think they do as good a job with shaping.  But the guys are great with the pedis.  Not sure about manis - I never get a manicure.  Overall I am pleased with this place.

20.description: Unbelievable! Walked in the door and was barely acknowledged. Then we were sat down for a pedicure and left alone for 20 minutes. We decided to leave and asked for a towel to dry our feet off. A woman handed us a towel silently and no one spoke to us at all. Maybe we are ghosts? Never again EVER.

36.description: Get ready to wait if coming on the weekend...i stopped here randomly and i didn't let them cut my cuticles... i'm staying away from all their cutting tools. i had my nail polish changed for which i think i overpaid. usually its $5 mani  and same for toes but she asked for $16. oh well,i was just ready to run from there since this baby wouldn't stop crying all the time...

14.description: Went to Princess Nails for the first time yesterday and overall had a great experience. Modern inside and several stations. It was a Saturday so was very busy with a short wait, so I'll prob come back on a weekday next time. Prices are comparable to other shops, $32 for standard main/pedi. The Nail Tech, Hannah, was nice, fast and efficient.

1.description: I was interested in their contest for a free wedding cake and this is the response I got when I inquired.  I will let you make your own decision about the rules of the "contest":Rules: Each contestant/couple must be fully registered using the registration form below. The one (1) contest winner/couple will be announced by midnight on July 2nd, 2009. The contestants will be posted on our photostream at: photobucket.com/jmlozada… to track current standings and placement until contest is finished. The top contestant to refer the highest quantity in PAID IN FULL orders to Sweet Jackie's Cake Boutique & Bakery between June 1st 2009 - July 1st 2009 will be the official contest winners. Every referral must state which contestant they are referred by during the ordering process to be counted toward the contestants runnings.

0.description: If I could give this "business" zero stars, I would.First, Sweet Jackie's is no longer in Rogers Park.  They have moved to the South Side, near Midway Airport.  That seems like important information to share with people, wouldn't you say?  Especially if you expect them to pick up the product...My fiancee wanted a custom-made cake for her bridal shower.  Sweet Jackie's had an impressive portfolio, the prices were reasonable, and the place was in our neighborhood, so she placed an order, 18 days before the event.  Jackie was pretty good about communicating while discussing the order process.But after the order... silence.  Phone calls go unanswered.  What's going on with this order?  Is it happening?  Should we talk to someone else?  Just quiet... About a week before, Fiancee finally gets Jackie on the phone.  Jackie says she has the order, and it's on her schedule.  She'll call a couple of days before the event, to confirm the order.  Sounds great!  Fiancee relaxes a bit.  Two days before the event.  Silence.  No calls, no emails.One day before the event.  Silence continues.  Fiancee calls Jackie.  Leaves a voicemail.  Calls again a couple of hours later.  Again a little later.  And again.  Nothing.  Zero. WHAT'S THE STORY WITH THE CAKE?!  5 PM, day before the bridal shower.  I say to Fiancee, "Forget it -- let's just get a cake at the bakery."  We send Jackie a "last chance" email, and head off to the bakery.  There, we check email from our phone, and -- wow! -- Jackie lives and she says our cake is in production... and we can pick up on the far South Side. (Me: "Where?! She's supposed to be in Rogers Park!")  Fiancee calls her -- you guessed it, no answer.  We figure, time to get a Plan B, and get two cakes at the bakery.  (We'd find a use for them, one way or another.)At home, we look at the order forms: did we miss the new address?  Err, no -- there is no address or phone number listed.  (Why?  Why on earth not?!)  With all the web references (including this one) saying the place is in Rogers Park, we had no reason to think otherwise. Oops. We write another email (phone calls being useless), saying that the location is a surprise, and could we maybe meet her downtown.  No answer.  No phone call.  No email.  Nothing.At 6:14 AM on the day of the shower (!!!) we get an email.  Jackie says she is sorry for the "misunderstanding" and that we were "not made aware" that their "main center" has been moved to the South Side.  (Let's unpack this load of b.s.: we were "not made aware" and the "misunderstanding" occurred because she didn't bother to tell us.  And the "main center" is a kitchen in her house.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, but talk about avoiding responsibility for her own incompetence!)It went on to say that the order was cancelled because of "a possibility of a no-call/no-show."  I was speechless: a "possibility"! Good thing we got those bakery cakes!Here's an irony -- our maid of honor lives 15 minutes from there.  We could have easily sent her to pick up the cake.  All Jackie had to do was CALL US THAT NIGHT; we would have figured it out and laughed it off.  Instead, she just sent an email saying our order was cancelled.  On the day of the bridal shower, without even the courtesy of a phone call.  In short: you can't rely on this outfit to be either courteous or even remotely professional.  Even if they charged nothing, it'd still be a ripoff.  Just stay away.

3.description: Great craft beer selections from the better breweries! Decent domestic beer selection, but I wish there were more options in domestic 12 pks. Oh well, can't win them all!Excellent wine and spirits selection too. Really, if you can't find something here to sip on, that's your problem. :-)All in all a great asset to the neighborhood!

1.description: I need to De- Stress, therefore I shall shop for Booze!If you are a Craft Beer Drinker you will Love this Place..I'm quite certain you will find the Craft Beer of your choice here!However, I hate Craft Beer, Love Miller Lite and I came in heretoday actually looking for a couple of my favorite alchoholic  beverages..So, yes, I am guilty of liking those frozen Daily Cocktails that comein plenty of great varieties, heck.. they even have a light lemonade/pink lemonade..so, I asked the owner person of Red Violin Wine/Spirits where Icould find my favorite daily cocktails and gasp... he informs me hedoes not carry Daily's..Oh, this is not looking good, however, I decide to go seeking my otherfavorite Sparkling Italian White Wine named Rustico and once again Iwas told they did not carry it..Excuse me, you carry like 10 zillion varieties of Craft Beers but noDaily's and No Rustico??This is so not happening....And, where's all the Miller Lite???So, unfortunately I left this store empty handed, and I was bummedbecause today was my day off and I wanted to feel my Happy Buzz....So, since I'm no Craft Beer Drinker and they don't have my Daily'sor Rustico don't think I'll be back anytime soon..It's a Binny's life for me...

2.description: Horrible.  Sure, maybe they have a decent selection but the guy here just tried to rip me off today and got mad when I called him on it.So I go back and grab a 6 pack of beer.  The sign underneath it in a bright yellow tag with black numbers says, "$8.99"Cool!  So I walk up to the register and notice he puts in $12.99.I asked why he was charging me $13 for a beer marked $9.  Barely speaking English the guys mumbles something about, "No.."  I walk back to the beer case because another guy who I assume works there since he's stocking the shelves is nearby, and I show him.  The CLOSEST tag besides the $8.99 one says $10.99 and that's on the opposite side of the beer under a 6 pack of the same brewery.The worker guy looks and then says something in whatever language these guys speak but the look on his face tells me he is saying, "Yep.  This guy is right."The guy at the counter insists that the $13 price is correct despite the fact that it's obvious the price is different on display, and I say, "Come on, man.  Don't be dishonest."Basically they were pulling a bait and switch and I assume that most people coming here might not even be aware of it.  I am pretty sure from my experience that this is nothing new.I walk back up and the guy is saying, "Nevermind, put it back."I say, "Whatever man.  You're dishonest and I wont be coming back."And he shouts, "Fine, don't come back!"If I were anyone in Rogers Park or nearby I would avoid this store like the plague.These guys not only are dishonest but they will defend their dishonesty.dnainfo.com/chicago/2013…I just noticed this too.  Apparently these guys have had a little trouble with the law for what?  Being dishonest.

5.description: A friendly, tidy and new bottle shop right around the corner? Sign me up! A very nice selection of craft beer, much of it refrigerated (always a plus). A nice wall off 22oz craft 'bombers' as well. Wine selection looked pretty decent as well, but I was there for the beer. Prices might run a buck or two higher than average in the area, but when I'm looking for something tasty and cold to get in my belly, I'll happily return to Red Violin.BTW, being just a few steps from Rogers Park Fruit Market makes this a nice one-two punch for beer, wine and dinner fixins.

6.description: I'm very happy to have a liquor store so near by.  The people that work there are very nice (although they don't seem to know anything about wine) and the store is clean.  They have a great selection of beers.  However, they never seem to have sales.  I love to pick up liquor and wine when it's on sale and I always end up buying non-sale items as well.

0.description: This place has craft beer and quick/easy street parking! It seems to be fairly new to the neighborhood and the staff is super friendly! My only complaint is that I wish they delivered! Ha ha. The store is clean, well lit and it has an amazing craft beer variety! I am so glad they moved into the neighborhood. We needed a classy liquor store and did I mention easy parking??

4.description: Convenient, open late, and a good selection. No widget cans of beer, including Guiness tho. Yup, you can't have it all.

58.description: Great beer selection.  Love the warm pretzel appetizer.  The live music is great!

56.description: SLOW service even when no one is in there.  Food was really good and it had a great menu.  I'd return.  It appears as though they have some great bands at night...wish I could have gone.

29.description: Love the food here :) It's close by our apartment so my husband and I go there for drinks or dinner sometimes and we're never disappointed by the food or beverage selection! Sometimes the service leaves something to be desired, and I wouldn't recommend holding an event there (the woman in charge of events never returned a message after I was trying to schedule our rehearsal dinner here for months, I finally gave up)... But for a low key Saturday night dinner, we're more than content with this place.

42.description: OMG they hosted a local spelling bee and it was so much fun. I was in the audience to cheer on a friend and I loved it. I had the best waiter, he brought me the most delicious glass of red wine. Yay for Act One.

23.description: My boyfriend and I have made this our new weekend place after the Heartland went downhill.What we love:- Sweet potato fries!- Great sandwiches- YOU CAN GET $5 OFF YOUR NEXT MEAL IF YOU DO THE ONE-QUESTION SURVEY...just keep your receipt and do it online. Seriously takes 30 seconds at most, and then you get $5 off your next meal of $25 or more. We take advantage of this EVERY TIME.- Bathrooms are super nice- Pickle and coleslaw with every meal- Everyone is super nice- Nice beer selectionWhat we're iffy about:- Service can be a little slow (they look understaffed)- Sometimes can be loud All in all, we're so lucky to have this place just two blocks from us.

47.description: Food has improved greatly.  Lots more options.  We eat here fairly often.  Rewards program is a nice add.  More food specials during the week would lure us in more often.

8.description: I must admit my expectations were low. We really went for the free band...which turned out to be the worst part of the night btw. But surprise surprise the food was so yummy!  We sampled a lot off things...calamari, nachos, steak, burgers, flatbread, pudding and apple crumble. The turkey burger was delicious!

31.description: Awesome pub in the neighborhood and really great music venue in the back. I've been here for the bottomless mimosa brunch for $20 and it's worth it! Mayne Stage/Act One Pub...I'm not rating you a 5 because of your bad service. I love this place and the service isn't terrible but it needs improvement. Our waitress for Sunday brunch was rude when we had to change an order and she was MIA for a long period of time.

34.description: Good brunch, GREAT BLOODY MARYs!! I'm pretty much a "regular". I love to have the bottomless Bloodies, then walk to the beach, which is 2 blocks east. Cool joint.

16.description: Great food and services. manny and Mary are the type of staff that keep business open

13.description: Great beer selection. Goat cheese burger delish!  Loved the French onion soup. Chopped salad too big to finish.

11.description: The staff is usually polite, the venue itself is good looking but the food does not seem vey well thought out.The flat bread seems to be put on top of a ultra thin deep fried cracker, it tasted OK, but for the price it lacked substance.
